--in the नर्मदा. M. १९४. 1.
--a तीर्थ, and its merits. M. १९१. ११८-25.
--a kingdom watered by the R. सीता. Br. II. १८, ४५.
--a sage of the तामस epoch. M. 9. १५.
--a son of खशा and a राक्षस: <F>1:  Br. III. 7, १३६; वा. ६९, १६७.</F> an Asura in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु. <F>2:  M. १६१. ८१.</F>
--a काद्रवेय na1ga. Br. III. 7. ३३.
--a class of पिशाचस्. Br. III. 7. ३७९.
--a son of तामस Manu. M. 9. १७.
--its significance in ओं; <F>1:  वा. २०. 8ff.</F> the source of ६३ varn2as; <F>2:  वा. २६. २८.</F> the primordial स्वर and its place in creation. <F>3:  वा. २६. २९ff.</F> [पगे१-002+ ३१]
--the house of, to the north of मातृका. Br. IV. ३६. २०.
--one who has not had tonsure: his death leaves pollution for one night; pollution after चूड is for three nights. M. १८. 3.
(I)--a ब्राह्मन् invited for the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर to officiate as a priest. भा., X. ७४. 9.
(II)--a पौराणिक. Learnt one of the four मूलसम्हितस् from the disciple of व्यास; <F>1:  भा., XII. 7. 5, 7.</F> a pupil of Roma- हर्षण; otherwise known as काश्यप. <F>2:  Vi. III. 6. १७.</F>
(III)--a sage. Br. II. ३५. ६३.

(IV)--the Brahman boy rescued by परशु- राम, his guru, from the jaws of a tiger. <F>1:  Br. III. २६. 3; ३०. २१; ३४, 8, २९; ३५. ३७.</F> Advised to take courage and console his mother; condoled with him on the loss of his parents. <F>2:  Br. III. ३७. १०; ३८, 2, ३५; ३९. १३; ४१. १५, १७; ४३, ३१; ४४. 1, ३०.</F> Accompanied परशुराम, to Mandira for a twelve years' penance and to Mahendra for another course of austerities. Helped परशुराम in his अश्वमेध and the penance after. <F>3:  Br. III. ४६. 3, २८; ४७. ३४, ५९.</F>
--the son of गम्भीर. Of his wife was born Brahman. भा. IX. १७. १०.

(I)--a Yadu prince; welcomed कृष्ण to द्वा- raka. <F>1:  भा. I. ११. १६; १४, २८.</F> The foremost of the sons of श्वफल्क and गान्दिनी; married a daughter of Ugrasena and had two sons, देववान् and Upadeva (Deva and Anupadeva-वि). <F>2:  भा. IX. २४. १५, १७, १८; Br. III. ७१. ११३; Vi. IV. १३. १२६; १४. 7, १०; वा. ९६. ११२.</F> Stayed in Madhu- रा (मथुरा) when the Yadus migrated. <F>3:  भा. X. 2. 4 [].</F> Once visited Brah- मःरद. <F>4:  भा. X. २८. १६.</F> कंस sent for him and asked him to take in his chariot कृष्ण and राम to the capital for the Dhanur- याग (‘festival of arms’) at which they were to be killed. Returned home with this message. <F>5:  भा. X. ३६. २७-40; Vi. V. १५, 9, १२.</F> When the night passed by, अक्रूर started for the व्रज of Nanda thinking all the way of the meeting and embraces of कृष्ण and राम who had made friends with people of ब्रिन्दावन्. Reached Gokula by evening. <F>6:  भा. X. ३८, 1-२४ Vi. V. १५. २४.</F> Saw राम and कृष्ण in fine deportment and form, milking cows: prostrated before them in divine ecstasy. Welcomed in the proper way by the brothers and Nanda, अक्रूर was lost in wonder, and did not feel the fatigue of the journey. <F>7:  भा. X. ३८. २५-43; Vi. V. १७. 2-२५.</F> Gopis who came to know of अक्रूर's mission called him क्रूर for taking away कृष्ण from their midst. <F>8:  भा. X. ३९. २१-26.</F> It was early morning when अक्रूर and the two brothers started after morning prayers. Reaching the यमुना, अक्रूर went to the river for a bath, asking the brothers to stay in the cha- riot. But he was surprised to see the brothers in the waters, and at the same time in the chariot also. He also saw Hari reclining on शेष. <F>9:  भा. X. ३९. ३२-57; Vi. V. १८. ११ and १९.</F> अक्रूर's praise of Hari. <F>१०:  भा. X. ४०. (whole).</F> Con- gratulating himself on his luck to have had a दर्शन् of Hari, he drove कृष्ण and राम to मथुरा before sunset. <F>११:  भा. X. ४१. 4-6.</F> Invited कृष्ण to his home, and the latter agreed to go to his place only after कंसवध. Informed कंस of [पगे१-004+ ४९] कृष्ण's arrival in the camp, and went back to his house. <F>१२:  भा. X. ४१. ११-18.</F> Attended the wrestling match. <F>१२: (a) Vi. V. २०. २८.</F> Gopis took Uddhava to अक्रूर. <F>१३:  भा. X. ४६. ४८.</F> Was visited by कृष्ण with राम and Uddhava to whom अक्रूर gave a royal welcome. <F>१४:  Ib. X. ४८. १२-28.</F> कृष्ण told अक्रूर that they looked to him for guidance, and that he was their गुरु। Was requested by कृष्ण to go to हस्तिनापुर to find out the exact position of the पाण्डवस्. <F>१५:  Ib. X. ४८. २९-35.</F> Visited हस्तिनापुर and returned to मथुरा after meeting Kunti and ascertain- ing the evil intentions of धृतराष्टृअ against the पाण्डवस्. <F>१६:  Ib. X. ch. ४९ (whole).</F> One of those stationed by कृष्ण to defend the western gate of मथुरा, <F>१७:  Ib. X. ५०. २०[4].</F> was consulted by कृष्ण on the eve of his attack on जरासन्ध. <F>१८:  Ib. X. [५०. (V). 8].</F> A member of the यादव sabha1. <F>१९:  Ib. X. [५२. (V). १५].</F> Satya- भामा refusing to part with the jewel Syamantaka (s.v.), अक्रूर suggested with कृतवर्मन् to शतधन्वन् Bhoja its seizure from सत्राजित as he had failed to keep his promise to marry his daughter to them. <F>२०:  Ib. X. ५७. 3; वा. ९६. ५७, ९७; Vi. IV. १३. ११५-26.</F> Asked by शतधन्वन् for help against कृष्ण, अक्रूर refused; Bhoja शतधन्वन् killed सत्राजित, the father of सत्यभामा, and secured the jewel but placed it in अक्रूर's custody. <F>२१:  भा. X. ५७. १४-18.</F> Became afraid, after शतधन्व's death at the hands of कृष्ण and बलराम, and left द्वारका. Evil portents in the city and cessation of rains. It was said that rain fell where अक्रूर lived. Was sent for by कृष्ण to return to द्वारका; gave his sister in marriage to कृष्ण who after duly honouring him, requested him to show the jewel in public, so that राम might not misunderstand him. He did so in the सभा of the सात्वतस् but कृष्ण placed Syamantaka back in his hand. <F>२२:  Ib. X. ५७. २९-41 [1-4]; Br. III. ७१. ५९ and ८३; Vi. IV. १३. ६७-90.</F> Was sent back to द्वारका after the राज- सूय for its defence. <F>२३:  भा. X. ७६. 7 [5] १४.</F> Visited स्यमन्तपञ्चक on the occasion of the solar eclipse. <F>२४:  Ib. X. ८२. 5.</F> Fought with Bhoja, deluded by कृष्ण. <F>२५:  Ib. XI. १२. १०.</F> Got killed in the यादव contest at प्रभास. <F>२६:  Ib. XI. ३०. १६.</F> [पगे१-005+ २६]
(II)--a काद्रवेय na1ga. Br., III. 7. ३६.
(III)--महासेन: a वरमूर्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ५०.
(IV)--a son of Jayanta, married रत्ना, शैब्य's daughter; father of eleven powerful sons. M. ४५. २७-8.
(I)--a son of त्वरितायु or simply आयु. M. ५०. ३७.
(II)--a son of अयुतायु and father of देवा- tithi. वा. ९९. २३२.

(I) <F>1:  भा. IX. 9. १७; M. २२०. 8; वा. ८८. १७४; Vi. IV. 4. ३७; Br. III. ६३. १७३.</F> --the game of dice. ऋतुपर्ण, an expert in it. Taught the game to Nala; to be avoided by a king. <F>2:  M. १५४. ५२०; २२०. 8.</F>
(II)--a दानव. Br. III. 6. ११.
(III)--a son of सत्यभामा and कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. २४७; वा. ९६. २३८.
--a son of सोमशर्मन्, the अवतार् of the Lord at प्रभास, contemporary with the २७थ् Vya1sa. वा. २३. २१६.
(I)--Father of सुयज्ञ. Br. III. ७०. २३.
(II)--an epithet of Hari--(ety.) <F>1:  M. २४८. ३९.</F> is Brahma. <F>2:  वा. ३२. 1.</F>
(III)--rises out of the neck of ब्रह्मा in the con- templation of creation. <F>1:  वा. २६. १४.</F> A system of letters formed by ब्रह्मा. <F>2:  भा. XII. 6. ४३-44.</F>
(IV)--a term for महान्. वा. १०२. २१.
--the highest yogi. वा. १९. ४३; २०, 4.
--given to वामन by Pulaha: adorns Agas- tya, (also अक्षमाला) (s.v.). M. ६१. ३६; २४५. ८७.
--one of the two sons of संहताश्व. वा. ८८. ६३.

--the third day of शुक्लपक्ष of the month वैशाख. It is all the more important if कृत्- तिका happens to be the नक्षत्र of that day. A prayer to जनार्दन on that day accompanied by fasting is equal to performing the राजसूय. M. ६५. 1-7. [पगे१-007+ २७]
--a daughter of रोहिणी and आनकदुन्दुभि. M. ४६. १२.
--a son of the elephant मृग. Br. III. 7. ३३२.

(अन्याङ्गनारति s.v.)--बृहस्पति tells Indra that intercourse with mother, sister, wife of pre- ceptor and uncle's wife is illegal. The last two could be atoned for by a कृच्छ्र of १२ and 6 years respectively. Simi- lar cases of forbidden intercourse and their respective प्रा- यश्चित्तस् given. Repetition of पञ्चदशाक्षरी 1008 times after worshipping पराशक्ति could remove all sins. Br. IV. 8. 1-३७.
--goes to the नरक शबल. वा. १०१. १५७.
--the forest in the Kuru country between the two mountains चन्द्रकान्त and सूर्यकान्त. वा. ४५. ३१.
(I)--a son of Pulastya and हविर्भू: he was Dahra-agni in his previous birth. भा., IV, 1. ३६.

(II)--a contemporary of कृष्ण and राम; and a resident of Mount Malaya. Visited by बलराम. <F>1:  भा., X. ७९. १७.</F> Came to स्यमन्तपञ्चक to see कृष्ण. <F>2:  Ib. X. ८४. 5.</F> Called on परीक्षित् prac- tising प्रायोपवेश. <F>3:  Ib. I. १९. १०.</F> [पगे१-008+ ४२]

(III)--born from a pitcher into which Mitra and वरुण dropped their वीर्य at the sight of the charms of उर्वशी: a brother of वसिष्ठ. <F>1:  भा. VI. १८. 5; Br. IV. 5. ३८ M. ६१. २१-31; २०१. २९; २०२. 1.</F> Dwarfed the Vindhyas, made a home in लङ्का: seeing the universe troubled by तारक and other Asuras caused the ocean to dry up by drinking the waters and brought relief to the Devas: performed तपस् seated on Mount Malaya with his wife लोपामुद्रा: white in colour, with four hands, अक्ष माला and कमण्डलु, narrated the story of अजामिल: <F>2:  भा., VI. 3. ३५; M. ६१. १७; ३६-41; Br. III. ५६. ५३.</F> pre- sent at राम's अभिषेक. <F>2: (a) Vi. IV 4. ९९.</F> Visited by परशुराम, initiated him to the कृष्णप्रेमामृतम् mantra which he heard from शेष, the नाग king. Spoke to him of the threefold भक्ति and its characteristics. <F>3:  Br. II, ३२. ११९; III. ३४. ५०; ३५. ३४, ४१, ४८; ३६, 1-५९; ३७, 2; ५६. २३.</F> A ब्रह्मिष्ठ, versed in वैखानस; a देवऋषि, versed in Vedic literature. <F>4:  M. १४५. ९३, ११४.</F> The guest of Ilvala who cooked वातापि for him. <F>5:  भा. VI. १८, १५.</F> Roaming about, he found all creatures engrossed in ignorance. Reaching काञ्ची, he prayed to कामाक्षि and एकाम्रशिव. Here हयग्रीव Vis2n2u appeared before him and pointed out ways to redeem the ignorant millions. Was entertained with the story of शक्ति by हयग्रीव. <F>6:  Br. IV. 5. 3-२९; 6. 1; ३९. 7.</F> Praised शिव out to ruin Tripuram. <F>7:  M. १३३. ६७.</F> He who worships Agastya becomes lord of the seven worlds. <F>8:  M. ६१. ४४-55.</F>

(IV)--married the first born daughter of King Malayadhvaja पाण्ड्य, and had a son दृढाच्युत. <F>1:  भा. IV. २८. ३२.</F> Cursed the पाण्ड्यन् king Indradyumna to become an elephant. <F>2:  Ib. VIII. 4. 9-१०.</F>
(V)--the constellation (Canopus) that moves fast above ध्रुवमण्डल. Br. II. २१. १०१; वा. ५०, १५५. [पगे१-009+ २६]
(VI)--a hill of that name. M. १२४. ९७.

(VII)--born of गर्भ; born later as दत्तालि; <F>1:  वा. २८. २२; Vi. I, १०. 9.</F> (Dattoli-वि।). residence (भवन) at महामलय; <F>2:  वा. ४८. २३.</F> relation of, to पोतृयण; <F>3:  वा. ५९. ९३, २०८.</F> Udayantaka Mt. brought by; and his wife. <F>4:  वा. १०८. ४४, ५३.</F>
--in the Udayantaka Mt.; here eight sages performed austerities and attained salvation. वा. १०८. ४५.
--see अगस्त्य। M. १६३. ७४.
--a group of राक्षसस्. Br. III. 7. १६२.
--a तीर्थ in the नर्मदा. M. १९१. १५-18.
--unfit for inter-dining. वा. ८३. ६२.
--Father of four sons and a daughter. Br. III. ७१. २५७.
--a queen of कृष्ण. Vi. V. २८. 3. [पगे१-010+ ५६]

(I)--the God of Fire also known as हुताशन, हव्यवाहन and Vahni. <F>1:  भा., I. १५. 8; Br., III. १०. २४-35.</F> A place sacred to Agni in the Sara- स्वती which Vidura visited. <F>2:  भा., III. 1. २२.</F> स्वाहा and her three sons are deities presiding over Agni. <F>3:  Ib. IV. 1. ६०.</F> One of the gods with power to confer boons or pronounce curse on the world, curse on elephants. <F>4:  Ib. IV. १४. २६-27; Br. III. 7, ३५२.</F> On the tail of शिशुमार. <F>5:  भा., V. २३. 5; Br. II. २३. १०४.</F> Invested by the माया of भगवान्, Agni does not sometimes understand his will and work. <F>6:  भा., VI. 3. १४. १५.</F> A guardian of the world. <F>7:  Ib., VIII. १०. २६.</F> The mouth of Hari as embodying all Vedas. <F>8:  Ib. VIII. १६. 9.</F> Is pleased with a devotee of Hari. <F>9:  Ib. X. ४१. १३.</F> Even the powerful Agni could not digest ब्राह्मन्'s property when misappropriated. <F>१०:  Ib. X. ६४. ३२.</F> Identified with Hari. <F>११:  Ib. XI. १६. १३.</F> Swallowed the seed of शिव borne by गङ्गा as a punishment for disturbing उमा's union with the Lord, and unable to digest it, he discharged it into a bush of reeds (शरकानन) where it became कुमार. <F>१२:  Ib. IV. 7. ६४[]; VI. 6. १४; Br. IV. १५. २१; २०. ४६; २६. ५३.</F> Goes round Dhruva. <F>१३:  भा., IV. 9. २१.</F> Pre- sented आजगव bow to पृथु. <F>१४:  Ib. IV. १५. १८.</F> Married a daughter of दक्ष. <F>१५:  Ib. IV. 1. ४८.</F> Worshipped in कुशद्वीप. <F>१६:  Ib. V. २०. 2.</F> His son was Manu स्वारोचिष. <F>१७:  Ib. VIII. 1. १९.</F> Fought with Puloma in a देवासुर war, <F>१८:  Ib. VIII. १०. ३१;</F> fol- lowed Indra's army against कृष्ण who took away पारिजात from heaven. Beaten by कृष्ण, he escaped alive from the field. <F>१९:  Ib. X. [६५ (V) ४०]; [६६ (V) २७-31].</F> His town visited by Arjuna in search of a dead child of a ब्राह्मन् of द्वारका. <F>२०:  Ib. X. ८९. ४४.</F>

(II)--a लोकपाल: Gold pleasing to Agni; worship of; <F>1:  M. २२५. १३; २६६. २०, ६३.</F> burning women and children in Tripura, he pleaded that he was not a free agent, but only carrying out orders. <F>2:  M. १८८. २९-57.</F> The वम्श of Agni. The succession of fires and their descendants detailed in Ch. ५१ of the मत्स्य पुराण। <F>3:  Cf. Mhb. Vana: २२०. 4.</F> The भागवत पुराण mentions ४९ Agnis. पावक, पवमान [पगे१-011+ २७] and शुचि and their ४५ sons together with स्वाहा. All invoked in sacrifices. <F>4:  भा. IV. 1. ६०-62; 7, १६.</F> Another classification of fires: दिव्यम्, भौ- तिकम् or अब्योनि, and पार्थिवम्। <F>5:  Br. II. २४. 6; २१. ५३. ५६; वा. ५३. 5.</F>
(III)--one of the eight Vasus, and a son of Vasu. Wife वसोर्द्धार. द्रविणक and others are sons. <F>1:  भा., VI. 6. ११, १३.</F> Identi- fied with Hari. <F>2:  Ib. XI. १६. १३; M. 8. 4.</F>
(IV)--married विकेशि. Father of ऊर्ज्ज clan of apsaras and also of Nala and अङ्गारक, who afterwards became a planet. Br. II. २४. ९१; III. 7. २१, २२९.
(V)--an आत्रेय, and one of the seven sages of तामस epoch. Br. II. ३६. ४७; M. 9. १५; वा. ६२. ४१.
(VI)--a son of आग्नेयी and ऊरु: His daughter Suc- छाया married शिष्ट, son of Dhruva: आर्षेय pravara. M. 4. ३८, ४३; १९६. 9.
(VII)--अलिअस् ऋत; son of Samvatsara; <F>1:  Br. II. १३. २३.</F> married स्वाहा, a daughter of दक्ष. <F>2:  वा. 1. ७६; Br. II. 9. ५६; १२. 1.</F>
(VIII)--a Marut gana of that name. M. १७१. ५२. [पगे१-012+ ३२]

(IX)--The eldest son and mindborn son of ब्रह्मा in स्वायम्भुव antara; <F>1:  वा. २९. 1; Vi. I. १०. १४.</F> of ब्रह्मा's tapas; <F>2:  वा. २१. ६३-4.</F> one of the eight तनुस् of महादेव, <F>3:  वा. २७. ३५.</F> hymns to; <F>4:  वा. २१. ७१ff.</F> gave rise to a family of ४९ fires. <F>5:  Vi. I. १०. १५-7.</F>

(X)--(भूतपति) one Agni made into three by Aila to attain the Gandharva loka in the त्रेतायुग. The Gandharvas presented him with a pot of Agni which he took to his city to perform sacrifices. He placed it on the अरणि when an अश्वत्थ appeared to his surprise. When Aila informed Gandharvas the latter asked him to turn the अश्वत्थ thrice and get three fires with which to sacrifice. वा. ९१. ४८: १०१. २१.
(XI)--see अनिल। Vi. I. १५. ११४.
(XII)--a महापुराण (also आग्नेय). Vi. III. 6. २२.
--see अग्नि। Vi. I. १०. १४.
--one of the three daughters of विक्रान्ता; origi- nator of the आग्नेय gan2a of the Gandharvas. वा. ६९. २१-23.
--the fire pot from which शिव appeared to दक्ष. <F>1:  वा. ३०. १७२.</F> Rise of तिलोत्तमा from ब्रह्मा's अग्निकुण्ड. <F>2:  वा. ६९. ५९.</F>
--from which सीता came. वा. ८९. १७. [पगे१-013+ २५]
(I)--a daitya in the fifth talam (महातलम्- वा।). Br. II. २०. ३६; वा. ५०. ३५.
--the name of a hell to which disturbers of hermitages go; <F>1:  Br. IV. 2. १४९, १७४.</F> those fallen from their आश्रम duties undergo torments in. <F>2:  वा. १०१. १४८, १७१.</F>
--on the southern bank of the यमुना. M. १०८. २७.
--a sage of the XI epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. ३१.
--a son of Bhautya Manu. वा. १००. ११६.
--one among the महापुराणस् comprises १५४०० s4lokas. See अग्नि। भा., XII. 7. २३; १३. 5.
--the custom of wife entering her hus- band's funeral pyre. Br. III. ४७. ८२.
--diarrhoea--ययाति caused his son Anu to be afflicted by it. M. ३३. २४. [पगे१-014+ २८]
(I)--one of the ten sons of स्वायम्भुव Manu. Br. II. १३. १०४; M. 9. 4.
(II)--one of the ten sons of Kardama. Br. II. १४. 9.
(III) (भार्गव)--a sage of the epoch of Bhautya Manu; <F>1:  Br. IV. 1. ११३.</F> a son of Bhautya (fourteenth) Manu. <F>2:  वा. १००. ११६.</F>
(IV)--a son of Priyavrata; <F>1:  Vi. II. 1. 7.</F> had no inclination for rule and was given to yoga; <F>2:  Vi. II. 1. 9.</F> a sage of the XIV epoch of Manu. <F>3:  Vi. III. 2. ४४.</F>
--an अमिताभ deva. Br. II. ३६, ५३.
--one of the fourteen sons of वसिष्ठ Praja1- pati in the चारिष्णव antara. वा. ६२. ४६.
(also अग्निमाठर)--a pupil of बाष्कल was instructed the second शाखा of the ऋग्वेद। वा. ६०. २६; Vi. III. 4. १८.
--one who keeps up the sacred fire. M. १६. २१.
--in होमस् to ward off calamities to the state. M. २३१. ११. [पगे१-015+ २४]
--a second disciple of बाष्कल, in charge of a शाखा of the ऋग्वेद। Br. II. ३४, २७.
(I)--the son of पुष्यमित्र S4un3ga and father of सुज्येष्ठ; <F>1:  भा. XII. 1. १६; Vi. IV. २४. ३४-5.</F> reigned for eight years. <F>2:  Br. III. ७४. १५१.</F>
(II)--a pupil of बाष्कल. भा., XII. 6. ५४.
--the name of an Asura who has his city in the third talam. Br. II. २०. २६.
--a sage of the epoch of the १४थ् Manu (Agni बाहु) (Burnouf). भा. VIII. १३. ३४.
--from its middle महेश्वर spoke out the लिङ्ग पुराण। M. ५३. ३७-8.
--a sage: <F>1:  Br. II. ३५. ६४.</F> a pupil of रोमहर्षण. <F>2:  Vi. III. 6. १७.</F>
--of the (कुश dynasty); the son of Sudar- शन, and father of शीघ्र(ga). भा. IX. १२. 5; Br. III. ६३. २०९-10; वा. ८८. २०९; Vi. IV. 4. १०८. [पगे१-016+ २८]

(I)--the son of Devadatta, was an incarnation of Agni. Was known also by other names--कानीन and जातूकर्ण. He was a great sage, and the originator of the ब्राह्मन् group of अग्निवेश्यायन. <F>1:  भा., IX. 2. २१-22; Br. III. ४७. ४९.</F> (Pravara-अङ्गिरस्). <F>2:  M. १९६. १२.</F>
(II)--a son of शूलि in the २४थ् dva1para. वा. २३. २०७.
--a मानस r2tvik at ब्रह्मा's याग, created five Agnis from his face. वा. १०६. ३४, ४१.
--the originators of कश्यप gotra. M. १९९. 7.
(I)--produced by ब्रह्मा. भा., III. १२. ४०.
(II)--a son of चाक्षुष Manu. Br. II. ३६. ७९, १०६; M. 4. ४२.
--a son of Manu चाक्षुष and नड्वला. भा. IV. १३. १६: Vi. I. १३. 5.

--origin of, from the first face of ब्रह्मा; <F>1:  Br. II. 8. ५०; वा. 9. ४९; Vi. I. 5. ५३.</F> performing अग्निष्टोमम् is equal to honouring पितृस्; done by वालि. <F>2:  Br. III. 7. २६८; ११, ४३; १५. ११.</F> Here the sacrifice of पशु is involved. <F>3:  M. ५३. ३३; ५८. ५३; २३९. ३०.</F>

--a पितृगण dwelling in the सोमपाद region in the direction of Vaivasvata. <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ६३; V. २६. 5; Vi. I. १०. १८; II. १२. १३; Br. II. १३. 6; वा. ७३. 2; ११०. १०.</F> पितृस् representing आर्त्तवस्, the name given to householders who do not per- form यज्ञस्। <F>2:  Br. II. १३. 6-7; २३. ७५-77; २८. 4, १६, १९, २० and ७३; वा. ३०. 6, २७f; ५२. ६७-8; ५६. १३-15, ६८; ७३. 2-4.</F> पितृस् in Viraja's kingdom. Their mind-born daughter पीवरी was married by शुक, son of व्यास. <F>3:  Br. III. १०. ७५-80.</F> Gave मेना their mind-born daughter to हिमवान्; <F>4:  वा. ३०. २७-9, ३१; ५६. १३ and ६८; Vi. I. १०. १९; Br. II. १३. ३१.</F> overlord of other पितृस्. <F>5:  M. १४. 2; १८. २१; १९. 5; १०२. २०; १२६. ६९; १४१. 4, १३ and १६.</F>
--a कन्या गण born of Manu from ऊर्जा. वा. ६९. ५४.

--personified as the son of पृश्नि and सविता; <F>1:  भा. VI. १८, 1.</F> a vedic sacrifice; <F>2:  Ib. III, १३, ३६.</F> performed by Bharata. <F>3:  Ib. V. 7, 5.</F> Its nature and effects. <F>4:  Ib. VII. १५, ४८.</F> Performers of Agnihotra live in पितृयान; <F>5:  Br. II. २१. १६०; ३०, १३; III. १४, 2; २६, १४; ३५, ४४; ४४, 5; ६६, 2; M. १२४. ९८.</F> per- formed by शुक्र, धूमिनी, the sonless wife of अजमीढ; <F>6:  M. ११, ५८; २५, ३४; ५०, १८; १०७, १६; १८३, ८१.</F> performed by पुरूरवस्; <F>7:  वा. ९१, 2; १०७, १८; ७७, 9.</F> the face of the personified Vedas. <F>8:  Ib. १०४, ८३.</F> As efficacious as hearing the विष्णुपुराण once. <F>9:  Vi. VI. 8, ३०.</F>
(I)--a नदीपुत्र and धिष्णि agni. Br. II. १२, २०. वा. २९. १८, २६.
(II)--(काश्यप)--a sage of the epoch of Bhautya Manu (XIVth Manu). Br. IV. 1. ११२; Vi. III. 2, ४४.
(III)--a son of स्वायम्भुव Manu. <F>1:  वा. ३१. १७.</F> Lord of जम्बूद्वीप. <F>2:  वा. ३३. 9, ११.</F> [पगे१-018+ ३०]
offered to Agni, Soma and Yama in the श्राद्ध; the पितृस्थानम् of places pre- scribed. M. १५. ३२; १६. ३३.
--an attribute of शिव, अग्नीषोमन् representing Brahman. Br. III. ७२. १८८; IV. ४३. ७६.
--Vedic rituals which are to begin on पर्वसन्धिस्। M. १४१. ३२.
--a region of the पाताल; the soil with the gold colour. Vi. II. 5. 2 and 3.

--an asura; friend of कंस. Appeared in the guise of a boa-constrictor in order to devour कृष्ण, his play- mates and cattle in बृन्दावन. Thinking it to be a part of the landscape of the बृन्दावन, कृष्ण's playmates and cattle entered his wide-open mouth. कृष्ण understood the situation, and after a little hesitation, he also went in and killed him by choking his throat. Agha, however, attained salvation. भा. X. १२. १३-38; १३. 4; १४. ६०.
(I)--a तीर्थ at the foot of the Vindhyas. Here दक्ष performed तपस् and praised Hari with the हम्सगुःय। भा. VI. 4. २१ & ३५.
(II)--a कौशिक and a sage. <F>1:  Br. II. ३२. ११७; M. १४५. ११२.</F> Not to have matrimonial alliance with विश्वामित्र and others. <F>2:  M. १९८. १२.</F> [पगे१-019+ ३६]
--a mother goddess. M. १७९. २८.
--the form of महेश्वर in the ३२न्द् कल्प, all black. वा. २३. २९, ७६.
--an account of, in the भविष्य। M. ५३. ३१.
a southern country. Br. II. १६. ५९.

(I) (मर्स्)--an inauspicious planet; tra- verses each of the signs of the zodiac once in three fortnights. <F>1:  भा. V. २२. १४.</F> The planet with Skanda as presiding deity; fed by सम्पद्- वसु ray of the sun, attains लौहितम् स्थानम् or the लोहित region. Consists of nine rays and looks in size equal to बृहस्पति: Placed above शुक्र at a distance of २००,000 योजनस्। Also known as लोहित and वक्र। <F>2:  Br. II. २४. ४८, ७०, ८२, ९५ & १०५; Vi. II. 7. 8-9.</F> The first of Planets, originally वीरभद्र who destroyed दक्ष's sacri- fice; son of mother Earth; fought with Soma. <F>3:  M. २३. ४०; ७२. १६ & २३; ९३. १३; १३३. २०.</F> Day sacred to. <F>4:  M. १९३. 8-9.</F> व्रतम् in honour of, conduces to health and prosperity; the शूद्रस् observe it; described by शुक्र in detail. <F>5:  M. ७२. 5-३६.</F> The तनु of शर्व (Agni) by विकेशि. <F>6:  Br. II. १०. ७८; वा. २७. ५१.</F> Born in आषाढ। <F>7:  Br. II. २४. ८२, १३३.</F>
(II)--a Rudra. Br. III. 3. ७०; वा. ६६. ६९.
(III)--a name of Skanda. वा. ५३. ३१; ११२. ५२.

(I)--the father of Vena; knew the power of कृष्ण's योग। <F>1:  भा. II. 7. ४३; Vi. I. १३. 6.</F> A son of Ulmuka (Kuru and आग्नेयी-- [पगे१-020+ ३८] वि। प्।). His wife was सुनीथा, the cruel-faced daughter of मृत्यु. Finding the son's conduct cruel and unbecoming, he departed from the city. <F>2:  भा. IV. १३, १७-18.</F> Once he performed the अश्व- मेध but the gods did not partake of the offerings. When he consulted the learned assembly, was advised by it that he could get a son by worshipping Hari. But the son born, Vena, was so mischievous that the king abandoned the king- dom in distress. Though messengers were deputed in search of him, his whereabouts remained untraced. <F>3:  Ib. IV. १३. २४-49.</F> Devoted to Hari, sought refuge with Him. <F>4:  Ib. IV. २१. २८; X. ६०. ४१.</F> According to the ब्रह्- माण्ड, मत्स्य and वायु पुराणस् he was the son of ऊरु and आग्नेयी. <F>5:  Br. II. ३६. १०८ & १२६; वा. ६२. ९२-3; M. 4. ४४.</F> A प्रजापति of the family of स्वायम्भुव Manu (of the Atri line. वा।) <F>6:  M. १०. 3-4; वा. ६२. १०७.</F>

(II)--A क्षेत्रज son of Bali: born of दीर्घत- mas. Father of खनपान (अनपान-वा।). <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. 5 & 6; M. ४८. २५ & 9; वा. ९९. २८, ८५; Br. III. ७४. २७, ८७.</F> After him was the अङ्गदेश. <F>2:  Vi. IV. १८. १३-14.</F> Father of दधिवाहन, born without अपान (anus). <F>3:  Br. III. ७४. १०२; वा. ९९. १००.</F> The last king of his line was वृषसेन. <F>4:  Vi. IV. १८. २९.</F>
(III) (च्)--An eastern kingdom. Its king got war elephants from Devas. Br. II. १६. ५१; १८. ५१; III. 7. ३४९; ७४. २१३; M. ११४. ४४; १२१. ५०; वा. ४७. ४८; ९९. ४०२.
(IV)--a son of हविर्धान. M. 4. ४५.
(V)--the son of विश्वजित् Janamejaya and father of कर्ण. M. ४८. १०२; वा. ९९. ११२. [पगे१-021+ ३१]
--a daughter of ब्रह्मा. M. 3. १२.
(I)--a son of लक्ष्मण. <F>1:  भा. IX. ११. १२; Vi. IV. 4. १०४.</F> Capital कारयन in the अङ्गद kingdom. <F>2:  Br. III. ६३. १८८; वा. ८८. १८७-8.</F> (कारपथ-वा।).

(II)--a son of वालि: married the eldest daughter of Mainda; father of Dhruva. <F>1:  Br. III. 7. २१९-20.</F> Present at राम's अभिषेक। <F>2:  Vi. IV. 4. १००.</F> Helped राम in his expedition to लङ्का. <F>3:  भा. IX. १०. १९-20.</F> Bore the sword when Bharata carried the पादुका of राम. <F>4:  Ib. IX. १०. ४४.</F>
(III)--a kingdom with its capital कारयन. Br. III. ६३. १८९.
(IV)--a son of बृहती. Br. III. ७१. २५६; वा. ९६. २४७.
--the capital of कारपथ des4a(?) वा. ८८. १८८.
--the residence of हृद्देवी and others. Br. IV. ३७. ४०.
--a part of जम्बूद्वीप inhabited by Mlecchas. वा. ४८. १४-18.
--wife of वामन, the elephant. Br. III. 7. ३३९.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ५१. [पगे१-022+ ३५]
--killed by Arjuna. Vi. V. ३८. ४७.
--kingdom of. M. १२१. ४३.
--A northern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ४९.
--name of a hell. Br. IV. ३३. ६१.
--sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ३५.
--a R. in the भद्राश्व continent. वा. ४३. २६.
--a place sacred to अङ्गारक on the R. नर्मदा. M. १९०. 9; १९१. ५९-60.

(I)--a मानस son of ब्रह्मा, born of his mouth. <F>1:  भा. III. १२. २२, २४; Br. II. ३२. ९६; M. 3. 6; 5. १४; १५. १६.</F> Married श्रद्धा, (पित्री-वि। प्।) a daughter of Kardama. <F>2:  भा. III. २४. २२; Vi. I. 7. 5, 7; १५. १३६.</F> Father of four daughters. His two sons were Utathya and बृहस्पति. <F>3:  भा. IV. 1. ३४-5; M. १०२. १९; १०६. १७.</F> Had not yet realised the Supreme Being. <F>4:  भा. IV. २९. ४३.</F> With his pupils visited भीष्म lying on his bed of arrows. <F>5:  भा. I. 9. 8.</F> Came to see परीक्षित् practising प्रायोपवेश। <F>6:  Ib. I. १९. 9.</F> Married two of the daughters of दक्ष. These were स्वधा and सती. His sons were पितृ and अथर्वान्गिरस्. A प्रजापति. <F>7:  Ib. VI. 6. 2, १९; Br. II. ३७. ४५; M. १६७. ४३; १७१. २७; वा. 1. १३७; 3. 3; २५. ८२; ३०. ४८; ६५. ९७-101.</F> Once [पगे१-023+ ३९] called on Citraketu, the king of शूरसेनस्, who was childless and blessed his first queen with a son. The jealous co-wives of the king administered poison to the baby and it died. Finding the king and queen weeping bitterly, अङ्गिरस् accompanied by नारद came to the palace. These two sages appeared there in अवधूत form. अङ्गिरस् consoled the king and cited the story of King Bhoja. <F>8:  भा. VI. १४. १४-30, ३७-61; १५. १०; १२, १७-26 [1-4].</F> Went back to ब्रह्मलोक with नारद. <F>9:  Ib. VI. १६. २६.</F> Was appointed by King Rathi- kara to produce sons on his wife. <F>१०:  Ib. IX. 6. 2.</F> The sage presiding over the month of नभ। <F>११:  Ib. XII. ११. ३७; M. १२६. १०.</F> Was present at the anointing of वामन. <F>१२:  भा. VIII. २३. २०.</F> Came to see कृष्ण at स्यमन्तपञ्चक. <F>१३:  Ib. X. ८४. 5.</F> Went to द्वारका to ask कृष्ण to go back to वैकुण्ठ. <F>१४:  Ib. XI. 6. 2.</F> Had another son named Samvarta (s.v.). <F>१५:  Ib. IX. 2. २६.</F> Cursed विद्याधर Sudars4ana (s.v.) to become a reptile for mocking at him. <F>१६:  Ib. X. ३४. १३-15.</F> Performed a sacrifice when शरयाति explained on the rituals of the second day. <F>१७:  Ib. IX. 3. 1.</F> Stood near the wheel of the chariot त्रिपुरारि in defence; served प्रयाग and lived in Benares; a महऋषि and मन्त्रकृत्। <F>१८:  M. १३३. २०, ६१, ६७; १४५. ९०, १०१; १४६. १७; १८४. १५; १९२. १०; वा. ५९. ९८.</F>
(II)--a son of Ulmuka. भा. IV. १३. १७.
(III)--author of अङ्गिरस् कल्प; a master of अथर्व सम्हिता। भा. XII. 7. 4.
(IV)--one of the sages who left for पिण्डारक. भा. XI. 1. १२. [पगे१-024+ ३५]

(V)--born in वारुणि यज्ञ by an oblation in the अङ्गार (fuel) from it, and hence the name. Agni there- fore claimed him to be his son, and so अङ्गिरसस् became आग्नेयस्. भारद्वाजस् and Gautamas belong to this line; performed penance at अमरकण्टक, praised Soma and spoke on the श्राद्ध कल्प to his son शंयु at दारुवन. <F>1:  Br. II. 9. १८, २३; III. 1. २१, ३९-40, १०१; १३. 5; २०. १९; IV. 2. ३३ and ४७; वा. ६४. 2; ७३, ६३; ७५. ५६; ७७. 5; ८८. 7; Br. II. २७. १०३.</F> Married सुरूपा, daughter of मरीचि and had ten sons. <F>2:  वा. ६५. १०५-8; M. १९५. 9; १९६. 1; २४५. ८६.</F>

(VI)--A son of कश्यप; married स्मृति and had two sons and four daughters; <F>1:  Br. II. ११. १७; 9. ५५; वा. २८. १४.</F> flourished in स्वायम्- bhuva antara; a देवऋषि. <F>2:  Ib. ३१. १६; ३०. ८६; Br. II. ११. १७; १३. ५३.</F>
(VII)--with the sun for the months Nabho- nabha (Nabha-वि। प्।). Br. II. २३. 9; Vi. II. १०. 9.
(VIII)--the name of व्यास in the fourth द्वापर; अवतार् of the lord Suhotri. वा. २३. १२६.

(IX)--one of the आत्रेयस् of the Raivata antara. <F>1:  Br. II. ३६. ६२.</F> Sprung out of charcoal in which ब्रह्मा offered a second oblation: adopted by Agni as his son and hence अङ्गिरस् called आग्नेयस्. <F>2:  Ib. III. 1. ४०-42.</F> See अङ्गिरस्। V.
(X)--a son of ऋषभ, the ninth अवतार् of महेश्वर. वा. २३. १४४.
(XI)--A son of Atharva: <F>1:  वा. २९. 9.</F> known as Atharvan. <F>2:  Ib. ६५. ९७; Br. I. 5. ७०.</F> [पगे१-025+ २५]
(I)--a son of आग्नेयि and ऊरु (Kuru-वि। प्।). M. 4. ४३; Vi. I. १३. 6.
(II)--the fourth part of अथर्व वेद। Vi. III. 6. १४.
(I)--the name of a देवगण. Br. III. 1. ५०.
(II)--the thirty-three sages, all मन्त्रकृत्स्। वा. ५९. १०२.
--name given to a portion of अथर्व वेद। Br. II. ३५. ६२ and ८२; वा. ६१. ५४.
--born of रथीतर's wife and अङ्गिरस्. Hence क्षत्रिय-चुम्-ब्राह्मण. भा. IX. 6. 3.
--a R. of प्लक्षद्वीप. भा. V. २०. 4.
--is eight times a यव। For other details see मत्स्य प्। १२ अङ्गुलस्: 1 वितस्ति। २१ अङ्गुलस्: 1 रत्नि २४ अङ्गुलस्: 1 हस्त Br. II. 7. ९६; IV. 2. १२१; M. २५८. १८-21; वा. 8. १०२; १०१. १२१ and १२२.
--rings to be presented in connection with वृक्षोत्सव। M. ५९. १४.
--gifts, receiving of gifts, होम, feeding, बलि offering, all to be done. वा. ७९. ८८.
(I) एत्य्।--immovable, hence a mountain. Br. II. 7. ११.
(II)--the name of Bhairava in the किरिचक्र। Br. IV. २०. ८२.
(III)--the son of महीनेत्र; ruled for ३२ years. M. २७१. २८.
--the wife of Manu. Br. III. 1. ८२.
(I)--a god of the Lekha group. Br. II. ३६. ७५.

(II)--an epithet for विष्णु, <F>1:  Br. II. ३६. १७८; IV. २९. ७१; ४३. ७०; VI. I. ११. ४३. एत्। सेq। M. ४७. 5; २४५. ४९. २४६. ३३, ६०.</F> एत्य्। One who does not fall from his place (न च्यवते)। <F>2:  M. २४८. ३५.</F>
(III)--the Lord of the western region and son of प्रजापति; also known as केतुमान्. वा. ७०. १७.
--the Agni at भुवस्थानम्. वा. २९. २८. [पगे१-027+ ३३]

--the name of a lake at the foot of Can- draprabha. <F>1:  वा. ४७. 5-7; M. १२१, 6-7.</F> Here अच्छोदा, the पितृ-kanya1, sprang up and was again born in Matsya-yoni; <F>2:  वा. ७७. ७६-7.</F> residence of the Apsaras अद्रिका. <F>3:  Ib. ७३. 3.</F>

(I)--the mind-born daughter of बर्हिषद pitr2s. After her name was the Acchoda lake. Without finding her own पितृस्, she took as her पितृ, another (अमा- vasu) and consequently lost her yogic powers. Then seeing her पितृस् in the form of त्रसरेणु, she prayed to them for succour. They said that she would be born on the earth on the २८थ् Dva1para as the daughter of Matsya and marry शन्तनु and be mother of two seers--विचित्रवीर्य as well as of king चित्राङ्गद. Afterwards she would attain the अष्टक place in the पितृ world. As the daughter of the fisherman, she was known as सत्यवती and Matsyagandhi. <F>1:  Br. III. १०. ५४-74; वा. ७३. 2-२१; M. ch. १४ (whole).</F> In the form of a river rising from lake Acchodam. <F>2:  M. १२१. 7.</F>
(II)--the R. from lake Acchoda. वा. ४७. 5-6, 7.
(II)--a son of प्रतिहर्ता and Stuti. भा. V. १५. 5.
(III)--a Rudra, and a son of भूत and सरूपा. भा. VI. 6. १७.

(IV)--the son of Raghu, and father of दशरथ. (Burnouf makes Aja, son of पृथुश्रवस्. But पृथुश्रवस् here is an adjective of Raghu meaning--highly renowned). भा. IX. १०. 1; Br. III. ६३. १८४; वा. ८८. १८३: Vi. IV. 4. ८५-6. [पगे१-028+ २५]
(V)--the son of ऊर्ध्वकेतु and father of Purujit. भा. IX. १३. २२.
(VI)--a तुषित god. Br. II. ३६. १०.
(VII)--a son of Uttama Manu. Br. II. ३६. ३९; वा. ६१. १८५; ६२. 9. ३४; Vi. III. 1. १५.
(VIII)--a कूष्माण्ड Pis4a1ca, one of the two sons of कपी. Had a daughter जन्तुधना. Br. III. 7. ७४-85.
(IX)--an attribute of कुमार. Br. III. १०. ४८.
(X)--a सुधमान god. Br. IV. 1. ६०.
(XI)--a horse of the chariot of the moon. M. १२६. ५२.
(XII)--the one god and goddess; mystery of; अजा, eight letters, sixteen hands, and feet, four faces, three knots of hair, one horned goddess--माया. वा. २०. २८-29.
(XIII)--a son of भृगु. वा. ६५. ८७.
(XIV)--a division of the night. वा. ६६. ४३.
(XV)--the name of a दानव. वा. ६८. ११. [पगे१-029+ २८]
(XVI)--the name given to Dhanvantari when he first appeared out of the churning of the ocean for nectar. वा. ९२. १०.
(I)--a son of बलाक and father of कुश. भा. IX. १५. 3-4.

(II)--the son of Sunaha (Suhotra-वा। प्।, and Sumantu-वि। प्।) and father of बलाकाश्व; <F>1:  Br. III. ६६. ३०; ७४-126; वा. ९१. ६०-61; Vi. IV. 7. 8.</F> ruled for २१ years (३१ ? वा।). <F>2:  वा. ९९. ३१३.</F>
(III)--the son of दिलीप. M. १२. ४८.
--a son of Maya. Br. III. 6. २९.
--an Apsaras. Br. III. 7. 8.
--the name of Siva's bow (also आजगवम्). M. २३. ३७; वा. ९०. ३१.

--a place fit for performing श्राद्धम्, noted for the tree विरजा; <F>1:  Br. III. १३. ४८.</F> the shadow of gods seen at the place in पर्वस्; the पाण्डवस् performed श्राद्धम् at. <F>2:  वा. ७७. ४८.</F>
(I)--the parent of Buddha. (अञ्जन-Burnouf). भा. I. 3. २४.
--the kingdom of ऋषभ, later known as भारत. भा. V. 4. 3; 7. 3; XI. 2. २४.
--a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५२.
--one of the nine sons of Ugrasena. M. ४४. ७५.

(I)--a son of Hastin. Had three queens of Kuru line; प्रियमेधा and other ब्राह्मन्स् belonged to his family. Father of कण्व and बृहदिषु. <F>1:  भा. IX. २१. २१-22; वा. ९९. १६६; Vi. IV. १९. २९-30, ३३; M. ४९. ४३-5.</F> By नलिनी he had a son नील. <F>2:  भा. IX. २१-30; वा. ९९. १९४; Vi. IV. १९. ५६.</F> ऋक्ष was another son of his. <F>3:  भा. IX. २२. 3; M. ५०. १९. Vi. IV. १९. ७४.</F> Sons born through the grace of भरद्वाज. <F>4:  वा. ९९. १६९.</F>
(II)--an अङ्गिरस and मन्त्रकृत्। A क्ष- triya-dvija. Br. II. ३२. १०९; III. ६६. ८७; M. १४५. १०३; वा. ९१. ११६; ५९. १००.
--a mindborn mother. M. १७९. २४.
--the son of Darbhaka and father of Nandivar- dhana. भा. XII. 1. 6, 7.

--on the back of the शिशुमार (s.v.) <F>1:  भा. V. २३. 5.</F> the southern course. Here are three kinds of sunrise, one in मूल and the other two in two आषाढस्; on its south was पितृयान: consists of three constellations--मूल and आषा- ढस्--पूर्व and उत्तर। <F>2:  Br. II. २१. ७६ & १५९; III. 3. ५१; M. १२४. ५३-8; वा. 1. ९३; ६६. ५१; Vi. II. 8. ८५.</F> [पगे१-031+ २८]
--a son of अङ्गिरस् and सुरूपा: a gotrakara. M. १९६. 4.
--born of यशोदा--माया (s.v); <F>1:  भा. X. 3. ४७; १३. ५२.</F> the energy of the Creator--through her, Hari is spoken of in nine forms. <F>2:  Ib., XI. 9. २८; XII. ११. ३१.</F>
--a place fit for श्राद्ध offering. M. १५. ३३.
--one of the ten sons of हृदीक: Father of three powerful sons: सुदम्ष्ट्र, सुनाभ and कृष्ण. M. ४४. ८२-4.
(I)--the son of विधिसार and father of Dar- bhaka (Arbhaka-वि। प्।). भा. XII. 1. 6; Vi. IV. २४. १४-15.
(II)--the son of भूमिमित्र. <F>1:  वा. ९९. ३१७.</F> His reign lasted for २५ (२७?) years. <F>2:  Br. III. ७४. १३१; M. २७२. १०.</F>
--one of Danu's sons. वा. ६८. 5.
(also अधोमुखस्)--a group of पिशाचस्. Br. III. 7. ३८१; वा. ६९. २६३, २६७.

--an old इतिहास of. A ब्राह्मण of कन्या- kubja, versed in शास्त्रस् and celebrated in आचार। Once when out to get कुश grass, he saw a दासी and fell in love. Then he abandoned all his duties and discarded his wedded wife. The दासी became his wife. She bore him ten sons. The last was named नारायण best loved of his parents. At [पगे१-032+ ३२] the time of his death, when the messengers of Yama were waiting to remove him to hell, he called out his last son by his name नारायण. On this, the messengers of वीष्णु were on the scene and prevented Yama's men from taking the ब्राह्मन् to hell. It was argued that pronouncing the name of Hari at his death redeemed him of all his sins, and that alone was the secret of Dharma. Yama heard this and approved it. अजामिल, thus rescued from Death, felt peni- tent, and while making तपस् at गङ्गाद्वार, he cast off his body and reached विष्णुलोक। भा. VI. 1. २०. to the end; Ib. VI. ch. 2 & 3.

(I)--a manifestation of Hari during the epoch of Manu चाक्षुष. In this period the क्षीरोद was churned and nectar was secured. <F>1:  भा. II. 2. 5; VIII. 5. 9-१०.</F> Praised by ब्रह्मा. <F>2:  Ib. VIII. 5. २५-50.</F> Advised gods to befriend Asuras and then get अमृत by churning the ocean, with their co-operation, to be able ultimately to prevail against them; <F>3:  Ib. VIII. 6. १८-25.</F> began to take part in अमृतमथन when the efforts of others produced no results. <F>4:  Ib. VIII. 7. १६; X. 2. २०; X. ५१. ४८.</F>
(II)--a पृथुक god. Br. II. ३६. ७४.
(III)--the name of Hari born in स्वारोचिष epoch from तुषिता. Br. III. 3. ११४.
(I)--the goddess following भवमालिनी. M. १७९. ७१.
(II)--the mother of devas known as Ajitas. वा. ६७. ३३. [पगे१-033+ ३०]
(I)--a group of gods with आयुष्मन्त formed १४ गणस् whose residence was Maharloka. From there they go to Janaloka. Br. III. 4. २७; IV. 1. १२२.

(II)--a देवगण; <F>1:  वा. १०. २१.</F> they are Asama, उग्रदृष्टि, Sunaya, शुचिश्रवस्, Kevala, विश्वरूप, सुदक्ष, Madhupa, Turiya, Indrayuk. <F>2:  Br. II. 9. ४६; १३. ९०.</F> Remembered by ब्रह्मा. <F>3:  वा. ३१. 4.</F>
(III)--sons of Ajita and Ruci in the स्वायम्- bhuva Manvantara. वा. ६७. ३३.
--a शुक्र deva. वा. ३१. 9.
--a sage who sold his second son शुनःशेफ to Rohita to be sacrificed in his place. भा. IX. 7. २०-21; IX. १६. ३०.
--a पारावत god; also a वैकुण्ठ god. Br. II. ३६. १४ and ५७.
--one of the eleven Rudras. M. १५३. १९.
(I)--a Rudra, and a son of भूत and सरूपा; the भूत chieftain <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. १८; Br. III. 3. ७१; वा. ६६. ६९.</F> one of the eleven Rudras. <F>2:  M. 5. २९.</F> [पगे१-034+ २७]
(II)--the agni at शालामुखि; see उपस्थेय। Br. II. १२. २५. वा. २९. २४.
(III)--a मुहूर्त of the night. Br. III. 3. ४२.
--a kingdom. Br. III. ७४. २१८; वा. ९९. ४०६.
(I)--the son of इरावति, the elephant of golden colour; belonging to the fold of वामदेव Sa1ma. Br. III. 7. २९२, ३२७ & ३३९.
(II)--a सामन्. Br. III. 7. ३४३.
(III)--Mt. a hill west of the Sitoda; <F>1:  वा. ३६. २८.</F> residence of the Uragas; <F>2:  वा. ३९. ५९.</F> famous for elephant forests. <F>3:  Ib. ६९. २३८.</F>
(IV)--a son of कृति. Father of Kurujit. Vi. IV. 5. ३१.
--a daughter of कुञ्जर and queen of Kesari. Loved by वायु, gave birth to हनुमान्. Br. III. 7. २२४-5.
--born of अञ्जन (elephant); two sons-- प्रथितायु and अजः; pleasant looking and well-formed animals. वा. ६९. २२७-28; Br. III. 7. ३४३-4.
--sons of Kallolaha. Br. III. 7. ४४२.
--the mother of हनुमान्. वा. ६०. ७३.
--a mode of worship with both hands. He who worships a god by raising only one hand is liable to have that hand cut off. भा. X. २२. १९[1-3].
--a god of the सुतार group. Br. IV. 1. ८९.

--of तमस् quality and the source of all dffi- culties; the enemy to knowledge; creates a thirst for desire (राग)। If not got rid of, one attains तिर्यक्-योनि। Br. IV. 3. ४१ and ४९; 4. २३. वा. १०२. ६२, ६९.
--the son of मेघस्वाति and father of अनिष्ट- karman. भा. XII. 1. २४-25.
--the अवतार् of the Lord in the २०थ् द्वापर when people are fond of अट्ठास in the अट्टहास hill of the हिमालयस् attended by Siddhas and चारणस् and yogins. वा. २३. १९०-1.
(II)--a Mt. in the Himalayas where was the अवतार् of अट्टहास. वा. २३. १९१.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८८.
--generally frequented by evil spirits. Br. III. 7. ४०५; IV. २१. १४.

(I)--an ऐश्वर्य, one of the eight kinds; <F>1:  Br. I. 2. ३९; II. २९. ८२; III. 3. ६५; ३६. १७; ६७. १६; वा. 2. ३९.</F> the first to be attained by the yogin; <F>2:  वा. १३. 3 and १०.</F> leading to siddhi. <F>3:  वा. ५७. ७६; ९२. १५.</F>
(II)--Siddhi देवी on the 9th parvan of Cakra- राजरथ; one of Uttama siddhis. Br. IV. १९. 4; २५. ५९; ३५. १०४; ३६. 5; ४४. १०८.
--a measurement of time. Two अणुस् make one परमाणु. भा. III. ११. 5.
(I)--the son of विभ्राज; wife कीर्ती, daughter of शुक; father of Brahmadatta. Vi. IV. १९. ४३-5.
(II)--Satyaka? The eldest of नीप's sons; married कृत्वी, the daughter of शुक; father of Brahma- datta. भा. IX. २१. २४-25.
(III)--Married कीर्तिमति, daughter of शुक. Father of Brahmadatta. Br. III. 8. ९४; १०. ८२; वा. ७३. ३१.
(IV)--son of विभ्राज; married कृत्वी, daughter of शुक. Husband of ऋची. M. ४९. ५६-7; वा. ९९. १७९. [पगे१-037+ ४४]
--the egg shaped universe; the व्यक्त-रूप of विष्णु described. See also पुरुष। Vi. I. 2. ५४-60.

--beyond आलोक. Here are the seven conti- nents and earth surrounded by a sea of clouds. <F>1:  Br. I. 1. ४३f; II. १९. १५४-5, १६०; २१. २४; III. ५९. २७; IV. 2. २३०-1.</F> The golden egglike अण्ड emerges from ईश्वर's seed and attains योनि (प्रकृति), the latter being the embodiment of नारायण, in a period of a thousand years. It became heaven and earth, आकाश being in the middle. <F>2:  M. 2. २९-32; २४७. ४३; २४८. 1.</F> The outside is covered with waters ten times the अण्ड-- covered by तेजस्,--successively covered by वायु, by आकाश, this by भूतादि; that by महत् and that in turn by अव्यक्त each ten times the mass of its predecessor. These are the seven प्रकृतिस्। अव्यक्त is क्षेत्र and ब्रह्मा क्सेत्रज्ञ। <F>3:  वा. 1. ५०-52; 4. ८२-9; १०१. २२७; Br. I. 3. २६.</F> ब्रह्मा born of. <F>4:  वा. 9. १२२.</F> Like the moon in कुम्भ राशि at the commencement of the शुक्ल पक्ष; there are several अण्डम्स्, each covered by seven characteristics of प्रकृति। <F>5:  वा. ४९. १४७-51.</F>

--consisting of भूर्लोक, भुवः, सुवर्, महर्, जन, तप and सत्य; all in the shape of an umbrella, each covered by ten प्रकृतिस् more than the preceding. <F>1:  वा. ५०. ७८-81.</F> A shell of egg encircling the dark regions beyond the लोकालोक; encircled by water ten times the earth in space; waters encompassed on the outer surface by fire, fire by air; air by sky; sky by Anger of elements; and that by intellect; the last girt by chief principle, अनन्त। <F>2:  Vi. II. 4. ९५: 7. २२-5.</F>

<F>1:  भा. II. 1. २७.</F> --a thigh of the cosmic पुरुष; is dependent on the loins of the पुरुष. <F>2:  Ib. II. 5. ४०.</F> An underworld, ruled by Bala, son of Maya. <F>3:  Ib. V. २४. 7 & १६.</F> The fourth world of pink (पीत) soil and resi- dence of daityas like कालनेमि. <F>4:  Br. II. २०. १२, १४, ३२-34.</F> [पगे१-038+ ३२]
--an underworld of dark earth; here is the house of Namuci, the Indra of the Asuras besides those of शङ्कुकर्ण, नागस्, राक्षसस्, etc. White soil. वा. ५०. ११, १३ and १५-19. Vi. II. 5. 2, 3.
--a son of ज्योतिष्मत्, after whom the kingdom got its name. Vi. II. 4. ३६.
--a राक्षस who was killed in the war at लङ्का. भा. IX. १०. १८.
--a son of बलराम. Br. III. ७१. १६७.
--a poetic metre. भा. XI. २१. ४१.
--poetic metre. भा. XI. २१. ४१.
--the name of divine गान्धर्वम् sung by हाहा and हूहू in Brahmaloka. Vi. IV. 1. ६८.
(I)--the son of कुश, रमा's son and father of निषध: a good looking monarch. भा. IX. १२. 1; Br. III. ६३. २०१; M. १२. ५२; वा. ८८. २०१; Vi. IV. 4. १०५.
(II)--a god of आद्य group. Br. II. ३६. ६९.

(III)--honouring the guest is a kind of याग। <F>1:  Br. III. १५. 8-२०; २१. ४६.</F> An imperative duty of a householder; <F>2:  Vi. III. 9. १५; ११. ५८-70; ७८, १०६-110; १५. २५.</F> to be entertained in श्राद्धस्। <F>3:  वा. ७९. 7-१९.</F> [पगे१-039+ २४]
--a वरमूर्ति। Br. IV. ४४. ४९.
--a great ब्राह्मन्. Br. I. 1. १३४.
--a sage of the epoch of the 3rd सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ८०.
--a Paulastya, and sage of the चाक्षुष epoch. Br. II. ३६. ७८; M. 9. २३; Vi. III. 1. २८.
(I)--a medicinal plant used in the first bathing of a deity. M. २६७. १४.
(II)--a king of the Gandharvas. वा. ६२. १८८.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १२.
--a son of कृष्ण and सत्यभामा. भा. X. ६१. १०.
--a son of स्वायम्भुव Manu. वा. ३१. १७.
--a Paulastya. वा. ६२. ६६.
--a son of भण्ड, and a commander. Br. IV. २१. ८४; २६. ४९. [पगे१-040+ ३१]
--the son of Satyakarman, found a son discarded by पृथा in a basket on the banks of the Ganges. Vi. IV. १८. २७-8.
(I)--a son of चाक्षुष Manu and नड्वला. भा. IV. १३. १६; Br. II. ३६. ७९ & १०६; M. 4. ४२.
(II)--a son of Manu and नड्वला. Vi. I. १३. 5.

--a sacred rite (यज्ञ) produced by the Creator. <F>1:  भा. III. १२. ४०; वा. 9. ५१; ६२. ६७ and ९१; ६७. ५०.</F> Done by कश्यप. <F>2:  Br. III. 5, 4; M. ४४. ६५; ५८, ५३.</F> Punarvasu born in the mid- dle of the ritual of अश्वमेध; <F>3:  वा. ९६. ११९; Br. III. ७१, १२०.</F> fruit of, by honey gift in ceremonies; <F>4:  वा. ७९. ११; Br. III. १५. ११.</F> from the face of ब्रह्मा. <F>5:  Br. II. 8. ५२; Vi. I. 5. ५५.</F>
the son of Khaninetra and father of Karam- dhama. Vi. IV. 1. २८-9.
--a poetic metre. भा. XI. २१. ४१.
--a मध्यमाध्वर्यु. Br. II. ३३. १५.
--a poetic metre. भा. XI. २१. ४१.
--a Janapada of the केतुमाल. वा. ४४. १२.
--आर्षेयप्रवर (अङ्गिरस्). M. १९६. 9.

(I)--a son of ब्रह्मा, born of his eyes. <F>1:  भा. III. १२. २२ & २४; M. 3. 6; 9. २७.</F> Father of Soma, born of his eyes. <F>2:  भा. IX. १४. 2-3; Br. III. ६५. 1 & ४७; वा. 1. १३८; 3. 3; ३०. ४८.</F> Married अनसूया, a daughter of Kardama (दक्ष-वा।). Their son was दत्तात्रेय (s.v.). Taught आन्वीक्षिकी to Alarka, प्रःलाद and others. <F>3:  भा. I. 3. ११; III. २४. २२. Br. II. 9. ५६.</F> Paid a visit to भीष्म who was in his death-bed. <F>4:  भा. I. 9. 7.</F> Came to see परीक्षित् practising प्रायोपवेश। <F>5:  भा. I. १९. 9.</F> A sage. <F>6:  Ib. II. 7. 4. वा. ९०. 1-8.</F> Was engaged with his wife in meditation at Mount ऋक्ष by प्राणायाम for the birth of a son. His praise of त्रिमूर्तिस् who appeared before him, and blessed him with three glorious sons, being their ओwन् अम्शस्. Accordingly Datta (विष्णु), दुर्वासस् (शिव), and Soma (ब्रह्मा) were born. <F>7:  भा. IV. 1. १५-33; Vi. IV. 6. 5-6.</F> Pointed out to पृथु's son, Indra running away with the consecrated horse twice and urged him to slay him. <F>8:  भा. IV. १९. १२-15 and २१.</F> Had not yet seen the Supreme Being. <F>9:  Ib. IV. २९. ४३.</F> A sage of the Vaivasvata epoch. <F>१०:  Ib. VIII. १३. 5; Br. II. ३८. २५.</F> Went with कृष्ण to मिथिला. <F>११:  भा. X. ८६. १८.</F> The sage who presides over the month of शुक्र <F>१२:  Ib. XII. ११. ३५.</F> and शुचि. <F>१३:  Br. II. २३. 5. वा. ५२. 6. Vi. II. १०. 7; III. 1. ३२.</F> A मन्त्रकार: took उत्तानपाद as his son. <F>१४:  Br. II. २७. १०४; ३२. ९६ & ११३.</F> Had a daughter, a Brahma- वादिनी. Visited परशुराम engaged in austerities. <F>१५:  Br. III. २३. 4.</F> Wor- shipped पितृस् by श्राद्ध and relieved Soma of the disease राजयक्ष्म। <F>१६:  Br. III. १०. १११; वा. ७३. ६३;</F> Appointed by ब्रह्मा for creation of the world he performed the तपस् called अनुत्तम when शिव saw him: acted as होता for Soma's राजसूय: <F>१६: (a) M. २३. 2-२०.</F> Hermitage in the Himalayas, visited by पुरूरवस्: <F>१७:  M. १०२. १९; ११८. ६२ & ७७; १२०. ४५; १२६. 7.</F> Praised शिव out to destroy Tripuram. <F>१८:  M. १३३. ६७.</F>
(II)--one of the sages who left for पिण्डारक. भा. XI. 1. १२. [पगे१-042+ ३३]
(III)--the third प्रजापति Of स्वायम्भुव epoch, created by ब्रह्मा from अहं तृतीय। Br. I. 1. ११७; 5. ७०; II. 9. १८, २३; वा. ३१. १६; ३४. ६२; ६५. ४५; Vi. V. 1. १७.
(IV) (च्)--a northern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ५०.

(V)--born in वारुणी यज्ञ from Agni's flames; <F>1:  Br. III. 1. २१ & ४४; 8. ७३; M. १७१. २७; १९२. १०; १९५. 9; वा. ६२. १७; ६४. २७; Vi. I. 7. 5, 7.</F> Had ten beautiful and chaste wives, all daughters of Bha- द्राश्व and घृताची. His ten sons were all known as आत्रे- yas, <F>2:  वा. ७०. ६७-76.</F> also स्वस्त्यात्रेयस्; a महऋषि and a मन्त्रकृत्। Tra यार्षेय with वसिष्ठ and जातूकर्ण: a contemporary of वृद्ध Garga. <F>3:  M. १४५. ९०, १०७-9; १९७. 1 & 4; २००. १९; २२९. 2 & 3; वा. ५९. १०४.</F> One of the १८ writers on architecture. Has a place in the विश्वचक्र। <F>4:  M. २५२. 2; २८५-6.</F>
(VI)--the अवतार् of the Lord in the १२थ् द्वापर in the Haimaka forest with sons with bath and ashes. वा. २३. १५५.
(VII)--a son of Gautama, an अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १६४.
--a special rite in the यज्ञस् after the cele- brated sage Atri. वा. ७०. ७३.
(I)--married शान्ति, a daughter of Kardama. It was he who spread यज्ञ in the world. <F>1:  भा. III. २४. २४.</F> His son was दध्यञ्च who had a horse's head. <F>2:  Ib. IV. 1. ४२.</F> [पगे१-043+ २९]
(II)--a ब्राह्मन् priest invited by युधिष्- ठिर to officiate in his राजसूय sacrifice. भा. X. ७४. 9.

--one of the four Vedas useful for kings. <F>1:  भा., X. ५३. १२; वा. 9. ५१; ६०. १५, २०.</F> Rearranged by Sumantu (s.v.) under the guidance of व्यास; in five parts. <F>2:  भा. I. 4. २२; XII. 7. 1; Br. II. ३४. १५; Vi. III. 4. 9 & १४; 6. 8, १३-14.</F> Part of विष्णु. <F>3:  Vi. V. 1. ३७.</F> मन्त्रस् connected with war. <F>4:  Br. IV. २०. १०४.</F> Twenty-one Atharvas from the face of ब्रह्मा. <F>5:  Br. II. 8. ५३.</F>

--name of the Veda personified, as the son of प्रजापति An3giras and Sati: <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. १९; वा. ६५. ९८.</F> Praise of Soma. <F>2:  Br. III. ६५. १२.</F> To be uttered in founding a temple. <F>3:  M. २६५. २८.</F>
--taught by व्यास to Sumantu. भा. XII. 6. ५३.
--a लौकिकाग्नि; is भृगु; father of दर्पहा. Belongs to दध्यङ्गाथर्वण category. वा. २९. 8, 9; Br. II. १२, 9.
--५०००+980 according to ऋषिस् like अङ्गीरस. वा. ६१. ७२.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २७. [पगे१-044+ ५०]

(I)--a daughter of दक्ष and a wife of कश्यप. <F>1:  भा. IX. 1. १०; VI. 6. २५; Br. II. ३३. १७; III. 3. ५६, ११७; ७१. २००; Vi. I. १५. १२४; III. 1. ४२.</F> Mother of वामन-Hari and other gods. <F>2:  भा. VIII. १३. 6; VI. 6. ३८-39; VI. १८. 9; X. 3. ४२; M. १७२. 5; १७८. २०; वा., ९६. १९६; ९७, २३.</F> Was much con- cerned at the evacuation of अमरावति by gods, and informed her husband of her grief. कश्यप consoled her saying that it was all Hari's माया and everything would be rectified by His aid. Asked to the means of approaching Hari, कश्यप taught her the पयोव्रत। Observed the व्रत for twelve days as directed. Hari heard her prayers, promised to be born in her womb to protect her sons, and desired that she should keep it a secret. She soon waited on कश्यप and became pregnant with Hari. Then Hari was praised by ब्रह्मा. <F>3:  भा. VIII. ch. १६ & १७.</F> Birth of the Lord described. <F>4:  भा. VIII. १८. 1-११; Br. III. ७२. २२; ७३. ७५.</F> Changed before her into a boy-ब्रह्मचारिन्. <F>5:  भा. VIII. १८. १२.</F> Worshipped for food and other things, while her sons the आदित्यस् are prayed to for attainment of heaven. <F>6:  Ib. VIII. १८. १३-19; II. 3. 4; M. १७१. ५५-8.</F> Her desire was fulfilled by वामन. Pleased with his anointing, gods sent their praises to Aditi on the exploits of वामन. <F>7:  Ib. VIII. २३. 4, २१, २७; M. २४४. 9-४८; २४५. ६३; २४६. ५८.</F> कृष्न took back the कुण्डलस् which had been taken away by Naraka, and सत्यभामा in her Lord's company bowed to Aditi and handed over the कुण्डलस्। At this Aditi embraced her daughter-in-law. <F>8:  भा. X. ५९. ३८; Ib. [६५ (v) 6-१०]; Vi. V. २९. ११, ३५; ३० (whole).</F> प्रजापति caused the तेजस् of the अण्डम् in her गर्भ, and removing it at the request of gods, made it into two pieces, and finding it weak, placed it on the lap of the Sun- god (मार्ताण्ड): given to dharma. <F>9:  Br. III. 7. २७७-94, ४६५.</F> A part of Mother Earth. <F>१०:  Br. III. ७१. २३८; M. 6. 1. 5; ११. 2; ४७. 9; १४६. १८; १५४. ३५१; १७१. २९.</F> A mother goddess. <F>११:  M. १७९. १५.</F> Worshipped in housebuilding. <F>१२:  M. २५३. २७.</F> Mother of the १२ A1dityas the former Jayadevas. <F>१३:  Br. III. 4. ३४; वा. ६६. ५५; ६०. ६५.</F> Known for strength. <F>१४:  वा. ६९. ९२. Br. II. १३. ७९.</F> [पगे१-045+ ३०]
(II)--born of दक्ष and son was विवस्वान्. Vi. IV. 1. 6.
--a son of Sahadeva and father of Jayatsena; a righteous soul. वा. ९३. १०; Vi. IV. 9. २७.
--the wife of शक्ति, and mother of पराशर. Br. I. 2. १२; III. 8. ९१; वा. 2. १२; ७०. ८३.
(I)--the name of Indra of the 9th manvan- tara of the Rohita epoch. भा. VIII. १३. १९-20; Br. IV. 1. ६१; Vi. III. 2. २२.
(II)--the son of सवनाग्नि (Sahasa-ब्र्।) and father of Vividha. वा. २९. ३८; Br. II. १२. ४१.
--see उत्पातस्। M. २२८. 2.
--a दानव. Br. III. 6. १०.
--an apsaras with whom अमावसु sported. <F>1:  Br. III. 7. 7; १०. ५७ & ६८.</F> Living in the Acchoda lake. <F>2:  वा. ६९. 6; ७३. 3.</F>

(I)--a son of ब्रह्मा, born of his back. <F>1:  भा. III. १२. २५.</F> Had for his wife म्र्षा. <F>2:  Ib. IV. 8. 2.</F> Three chief characteristics--pride, luxury and intoxication. <F>3:  Ib. I. १७. २४.</F> His son was Dambha and daughter माया, both of whom were adopted later on by the [पगे१-046+ ३३] childless निरृति. <F>4:  Ib. IV. 8. 2.</F> Five branches of: विधर्म, परधर्म, आभास, उपमा, and छल। <F>5:  Ib. VII. १५. १२-14.</F>
(II)--wife, हिम्सा; sons निकृति, अनृत. (daughter निकृती-वि। प्।). Br. II. 9. ६३; वा. १०. ३९; Vi. I. 7. ३२.
--कश्यप gotra-कारस्. M. १९९. 4.

--the name of a hell: also अधोमुखम्। He who receives bad gifts and from forbidden persons, who lives by astrology and those who do not request for sacrifice go to it. Br. IV. 2. १४८ & १६३; वा. १०१. १४७, १६१; Vi. II. 6, 4 & १८.
--a son of हृदीक. Br. III. ७१. १४१.
--a son of भृगु, and a deva. Br. III. 1. ९०; वा. ६५. ८७.
--the title earned by स्वायम्भुव Manu for his great character. M. 3. ४५.
--the intercalary month; <F>1:  वा. ५०. २०१.</F> fit for पिण्ड at गया. <F>2:  वा. ८३. ४२; १०५. १८.</F>

--the son of Satkarman (Satyakarman-म्।). Once playing on the banks of the Ganges, he found a male child in a box. It was born of Kunti and abandoned by her. Childless, he brought him up as his son; <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. १२-13.</F> also known as सूत. <F>2:  M. ४८. १०८.</F> [पगे१-047+ २६]
--in राजसूय, पृथु was anointed as. Br. III. 8. २५.
(also अधिवासम्) [See प्रतिमा]--preli- minary purification in connection with founding a new temple. M. २६५. ४९ & ५२; २६६. 1; २७४. ५७; २७५. 3; २८९. ११.

--the son of अश्वमेधादत्त. A great warrior ruling now--(साम्प्रतः)--Performed a long यज्ञ extending over three years at कुरुक्षेत्र on the दृषद्वती; a Paurava; father of Nicaknu. वा. ९९. २५८, २७०; Vi. IV. २१. 6-7.

--the son of शतानीक--‘the king now ruling’: performed three great sacrifices--one for three years at पुष्कर, the other two of two years' duration at कुरुक्षेत्र and दृषद्वती respectively-Father of विविक्षु. M. ५०. ६६, ७८.
--a son of ब्रह्मा with मन्त्रशरीर। वा. ६७. 6.
--a son of ब्रह्मा with मन्त्रशरीर। वा. ६७. 6.
--a god of आभूतरयस् group. Br. II. ३६. ५५.
--see अधश्शिरस्। Br. IV. 2. १६३.
--one of the two वृत्तिस् of महत्। वा. 4. ४६. [पगे१-048+ २७]
--a son of आप. Vi. I. १५. १११.
--an यज्ञ; fires in, described. वा. २९. ४१.

--one of the १६ R2tviks for an यज्ञ, issued from the arms of नारायण of परशुराम's sacrifice, was presented with the whole of the west: <F>1:  भा. IX. ११. 2; १६. २१; M. १६७. 7; २६५. २६.</F> भृगु was अध्वर्यु at Soma's राजसूय। <F>2:  M. २३. २०.</F>
(I)--the son of उपदानवी: The वैभ्राज king of पाञ्चाल: Father of Brahmadatta. M. २१. ११.
(II)--a Mauneya. वा. ६९. 1.
(III)--a son of Trasu. वा. ९९. १३३.
(IV)--a son of ऊर्ज and वसिष्ठ; a sage of XIth epoch of Manu. Vi. I. १०. १३: III. 2. ३१.
--a R. of शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २६.
(I)--a मध्यमाध्वर्यु। Br. II. ३३. १७.
(II)--another name of God of Love, after he was burnt to ashes by शिव. M. 7. २३; २३. ३०; १५४. २७२; २९१. ३२; वा. १०४. ४८. [पगे१-049+ २८]
--sacred to Hari: to be begun on Sunday when the star Hasta, पुष्य or Punarvasu was in the ascendant: duration being १३ months: originally com- municated by Indra. M. ७०. ३३-62.
--a शक्ति devi1 on the 7th parvan of the चक्रराजरथ. Br. IV. १९. २५; ४४, १२४.
--a शक्ति on the 7th parvan of the चक्रराजरथ. Br. IV. १९. २५; ४४, १२४.
--a शक्ति devi1 on the 7th parvan of the चक्रराजरथ. Br. IV. १९. २६.
--a शक्ति devi1. Br. IV. ४४. १२४.
--a शक्ति devi1. Br. IV. ४४. १२५.
--a शक्ति devi1 on the 7th parva of Cakra- राजरथ. Br. IV. १९. २५.
--the courtesan who observed the विभूति- द्वादशी-व्रतम् and became प्रीती, the co-wife with Rati, to the Lord of Love in her next birth. M. १००. १८ & ३२.
--a शक्ति devi1 on the 7th parva of चक्रराज- ratha. Br. IV. १९. २५. [पगे१-050+ ३६]
--was the Apsaras sent by Indra to ruin Hari's तपस्। M. ६१. २२.
--a शक्ति devi1 on the 7th parva of Cakra- राजरथ. Br. IV. १९. २५; ४४. १२५.
--a शक्ति devi1. Br. IV. ४४. १२५.

(I)--the तामसी Kala1 of Hari. Followers of सात्वत तन्त्र designate him सङ्कर्षण. He bears the Earth on one of his १००० hoods. From between his agitated brows came out Rudra exhibiting in eleven forms. The नाग princes make obeisance to him for his blessings. He wears the वैजयन्ती garland. His glory is sung by नारद and Tumburu in the court of the Creator. Also known as शेष. <F>1:  भा III. २६. २५; IV. 9. १४; V. २५. 1-११; VII. 7. १०-11; Vi. II. 5. १३-27; V. १८. ५४.</F> Identified with बलराम, the seventh son of देवकी. <F>2:  भा. X. 1. २४; 2. 5.</F> At the time of the deluge, withdraws the universe unto him- self. <F>3:  Ib. X. ६८. ४६.</F> Identified with Hari; <F>4:  Ib. XI. १६. १९.</F> a नाग; <F>5:  Br. IV. २०. ५३.</F> एत्य्। of; <F>6:  M. २४८. ३८.</F> बलराम, an incarnation of. <F>7:  Vi. V. २५. 3; ३५. 3; भा. I. १४. ३५.</F>
(II)--the sacred hill. Br. III. १३. ५८.
(III)--a king and the son of वीतिहोत्र (वीर- hotra-वा। प्।). Father of Durjaya. Br. III. ६९. ५३; वा. ९४. ५३.
--see गिरितनयाव्रतम्। M. ch. ६२. [पगे१-051+ २५]
--A भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. २०.
--a manifestation of Hari, as reposing on शेष. M. २७६. 8.
--the wife of स्वायम्भुव Manu. M. 4. ३३.
(I)--see दधिवाहन। Br. III. ७४. १०२.
(II)--the son of अङ्ग and father of Diviratha. Vi. IV. १८. १५; Br. III. ७४. १०३.
--an apsaras. Br. III. 7. 5.
(I)--a son of युधाजित्. Father of Nimna, and शिनि. A third son was वृष्णि. भा. IX. २४. १२-14; Br. III. ७१. २०.
(II)--a son of Nighna: went to the forest for penance. M. १२. ४७-8.
(III)--the youngest son of माद्री and वृष्णि (Sumitra-वि। प्।). Father of Nighna, शिनि, (Chini-वा। प्।) युधाजित्, वृषभ and क्षेत्र. M. ४५. 2-3, २२ & २५; वा. ९६. ९९; Vi. IV. १३. 9; १४. 1.
--a क्षेत्रम् in the नर्मडा. After a bath here, there is no need to fear a hell. M. १९३. 1-3; १९४. १७.
(I)--the son of Trasaddasyu and father of हर्यश्व (पृषदश्व-वि। प्।); killed by रावण in his दिग्- विजय। भा. IX. 7. 4; Vi. IV. 3. १७-18.
(II)--the son of सम्भूत, killed by रावण. Br. III. ६३. ७४; वा. ८८. ७५-6.
(III)--the son of Sarvakarman. M. १२. ४७.
--a follower of वृत्र in his battle with Indra. भा., VI. १०. १९, ३१.

(I)--a Vasava, (तेजस्) has a son कुमार through स्वाहा. शाख, विशाख, and Naigameya were other sons (see अग्नि). Married शिवा, daughter of Hari and had two sons born with qualities of fire. Father of Skanda and सनत्कुमार. Br. III. 3. २१; M. 5. २१-5; २०३. 3; Vi. I. १५. ११०, ११५; वा. ६६. २०, २४.
(II)--a chief monkey. Br. III. 7. २३५.
(III)--a hill of the राक्षसस्. वा. ३९. ५३. [पगे१-053+ ३०]

(IV) (अग्नि)--one became threefold at the instance of पुरूरवस्; <F>1:  Vi. IV. 6. ९४.</F> the presiding deity of स्वर्ण or gold; <F>2:  Vi. V. 1. १४.</F> different kinds of; <F>3:  वा 53. 5.</F> five kinds of, overcome by कृष्ण in बाण's war. <F>4:  Vi. V. ३३. २०.</F>
(V)--the son of निषध and father of Nabhas. Vi. IV. 4. १०६.
--an Apsaras. वा. ६९. ४८.
(बहव--s.v)--son of Cakora and father of शिवस्वाति. भा. XII. 1. २६.
--an Apsaras. वा. ६९. ४८.
--a कश्यप and a त्रयार्षेय. M. १९९. १२.

--the wife of the sage Atri (s.v.) and a daughter of Kardama (दक्ष-वा। प्। and वि। प्।). Mother of Datta, दुर्वासस्, and Soma; <F>1:  भा. I. 3. ११; III. २४: २२; IV. 1. १५; Vi. I. 7, 7, २५.</F> mother of five आत्रेयस् and a daughter श्रुति. <F>2:  वा. १०. २८, ३१; २८. १८-9; Br. II. 9. ५२ and ५६; ११. २२.</F>
--a राजऋषि; a brother of Vasudeva. वा: ९६. १४८; वा. ९९. १२७.
--a son of शूर and भोजा. Br. III. ७१. १४९ and १८९; M. ४६. 3.
--a daughter of दक्ष: a consort of कश्यप, and a mother goddess. Fond of eating. Br. III. 3. ५६; 7. ४६८; M. १७१. २९.
--Had Araru and other four sons; <F>1:  Br. III. 6. ३०.</F> mother of diseases. <F>2:  M. १७१. ५९.</F>
--a bath in the prescribed manner for a month in the प्र्याग; attained by (oneness with god- head). M. १०८. 2 & १४.
--those who do not perform यज्ञस्, as opposed to अग्निहोत्रिन्स्। वा. ३०. 6.

(I)--One of the four forms of Hari. <F>1:  भा. 1. 5. ३७; Vi. १६. १८; X. १६. ४५; ४०. २१; XII. ११. २१. M. २७६. 9.</F> In- voked as a principal divinity. Source of all sounds (शब्द- योनि); presiding over the mind as fourth in order. <F>2:  भा. III. 1. ३४.</F> The supreme ruler of all senses. <F>3:  Ib. III. २६. २८; IV. २४. ३६.</F> Created specially in the battle of ललिता with भण्ड. <F>4:  Br. IV. २९. १२८.</F>

(II)--the son of Pradyumna and Rukma- vati; carried away by air by चित्रलेखा, to the harem of the daughter of बणा at her instance. For him बाण had his arms reduced from thousand to two. Married रोचना, grand-daughter of Rukmin at भोजकट to which कृष्ण, बलराम and others went. Came back to द्वारका with his newly wedded wife. <F>1:  भा. X. ६१. १८. २३[9], २५-26 & ४०.</F> Seen in a dream by उषा. Picture of him drawn by चित्रलेखा, who made him enjoy उषा's [पगे१-055+ ४२] company at शोणितपुर. बाण came to know of this and imprisoned him to the great regret of his daughter. <F>2:  Ib. X. ६२. १२. २०-27, and ३५.</F> नारद communicated the news of Aniruddha's imprisonment to कृष्ण and वृष्णिस्. These departed to शोणितपुर, beseiged it, and humbled the pride of बाण. The latter agreed to set Aniruddha free and allow him to marry his daughter. Left for द्वारका with उष. <F>3:  Ib. X. ch. ६३ (whole).</F> Famous for his speed in battle. <F>4:  Ib. I. १४. ३०.</F> Unable to recover the dead child of the द्वारका Bra1h2man2a. <F>5:  Ib. X. ८९. ३१ and ४१.</F> Father of Vajra. <F>6:  Ib. X. ९०. ३३, ३६-7.</F> Went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for solar eclipse. <F>7:  Ib. X. ८२. 7.</F> Fought with सात्यकि at प्रभासा. <F>8:  Ib. XI. ३०, १६.</F> One of the five वम्शवीरस्. <F>9:  Br. III. ७२. 2.</F> मृगकेतन was a son of his: an authority on architecture. <F>१०:  M. ४७. २३; ९३. ५१; २४८. ४९; २५२. 3.</F>
(I)--The God of Wind invoked. <F>1:  भा. III. 6. १६.</F> A surname of वायु; <F>2:  Br. II. २५. १२.</F> father of भीमसेन. <F>3:  Vi. IV. १४. ३५; भा. IX. २२. २७.</F>
(II)--a वासव: married शिवा and had two sons --Manojava and अविज्ञतगति. See इशान। Br. II. १०. ८०; III. 3. २१; M. 5. २१; २०३. 3; वा. ६६. २०, २५; Vi. I. १५. ११०, ११४.
(III)--The वायु पुराण narrated by Wind-god with समास बन्धस् and rhythm; <F>1:  वा. 3. 8.</F> २३,000 stanzas. <F>2:  वा. १०४. 7.</F>
(IV)--a son of कृष्ण and मित्रविन्दा. भा. X. ६१. १६.
--son of अटमान and father of हालेय. भा. XII. 1. २५. [पगे१-056+ ३१]
--a son of first सावर्ण Manu Br. IV. 1. ६५.
--a son of Arka Agni. वा. २९. ४०; Br. II. १२. ४३.
--the continent lying round श्याम hill. M. १२२. २३.
--a son of देवानीक and father of पारियात्र. भा. IX. १२. 2.
(I)--a son of स्वायम्भुव Manu. Knows the power of the योग of Hari. भा. II. 7. ४४.

(II)--a son of ययाति and शर्मिष्ठा. Refused to part with his youth to his father. <F>1:  भा. IX. १८. ३३ & ४१; Br. I. 1. १३३; III. ६८. १६-17, ५१-79; IV. M. २४. ५४; ३२. १०; Vi. IV. १०. १०-15.</F> Became overlord of the north part of the kingdom. <F>2:  भा. IX. १९. २२. Br. III. ६८. ९०; ७३. १२६; वा. I. १५६: ९३. १७; Vi. IV. १०. ३२.</F> Had three sons सभानर, चक्षु and पराक्ष. <F>3:  भा. IX. २३. 1; Br. III. ७४. १२; M. ४८-10:</F> Cursed to die in youth suffering from diarrhoea. Originator of several mleccha groups. <F>4:  M. ३३. २१-24; ३४. ३०.</F>
(III)--the son of कुरुवश (कुरवश-Burnouf) and father of Puruhotra. भा. IX. २४. 5-6.
(IV)--the son of Kapotaroman and father of An- dhaka. His friend was Tumburu. भा. IX. २४. २०.
(V)--(alias Vaina) a pupil of लौगाक्षि. Br. II. ३५. ४१. [पगे१-057+ २८]
(VI)--the son of कुमारवम्श and father of Puru- mitra. Vi. IV. १२. ४२.
(VII)--a son of Viloma and friend of Tumburu and father of आनकदुन्दुभि. Vi. IV. १४. १३-14.
(VIII)--the son of Yadu and father of three sons. Vi. IV. १८. 1.
--a चरकाध्वर्यु. Br. II. ३३. १३.
--lie of territory under the नागस् <F>1:  Br. III. ७४. १९४.</F> and the Guptas. <F>2:  वा. ९९. ३८३.</F>
--divided into four, विपर्यय, शक्ति, तुष्टि, and सिद्धि; accounts for विवृत्त, and the वर्त्तमान (present) in cycle; this is the fifth सर्ग or creation. वा. 6. ५७, ६७-9; 9. ११७.
a वरमूर्ति। Br. IV. ४४. ५०.
--a god of the हरितगण. Br. IV. 1. ८४.
--officials (lit. dependents on the king)--rules for the personal conduct of. M. २१६. 1-३८.
(I)--another name for R. सुकुमारी of शाक- द्वीप. वा. ४९. ९१. [पगे१-058+ २७]
(II)--a R. in the प्लक्षद्वीप. Br. II. १९. १९; वा. ४९. १७; Vi. II. 4. ११.
--one of the ६१ sons of Danu. भा. VI. 6. ३१.
--the name of the तपस् performed by Atri (s.v.) for creation. M. २३. 2.
--one of the मरुत्गणस्. वा. ६७. १२९.
--a son of अक्रूर and उग्रसेनी. वा. ९६. ११२.
--the forest noted for पद्म class of elephants between the Lauhitya and Sindhu; the name of Yamavanam (s.v.). Br. III. 7. ३५९; वा. ६९. २४१.
--a daughter of वाका. Br. III. 8. ५६.
--a चरकाध्वर्यु. Br. II. ३३. १३.
(I)--a daughter of श्रद्धा and अङ्गीरस्. <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ३४.</F> Wife of धाता and mother of पूर्णिमा. <F>2:  Ib. VI. १८. 3.</F>
(III)--a शक्ति devi1 on the षोडशपत्राब्ज। Br. IV. ३२. १२.

(IV)--a time in the evening of प्रतिपद com- prising two लवस्। <F>1:  M. १३३. ३६; १४१. ३३, ४० and ५१; वा. ५६. ३५, ५५.</F> The day when one digit of the moon is deficient, fit for making gifts. <F>2:  Vi. II. 8. ८०.</F>
(V)--one of the भार्गव-gotraka1ras. M. १९५. २८.
(VI)--a daughter of स्मृति and अङ्गिरस्; <F>1:  वा. २८. १५; Vi. I. १०. 7.</F> the name of the first पूर्णिमा। <F>2:  वा. ५०. २०१; Br. II. ११. १८.</F>
--a god of आद्य group: <F>1:  Br. II. ३६. ६९; III. 3. १६.</F> a शाध्य. <F>2:  वा. ६६. १५.</F>
--an Apsaras. वा. ६९. ५०.
(I)--resides in the sun's chariot during the month of भाद्रपद। Vi. II. १०. १०.
(II)--The apsaras presiding over the month नभस्य। (नभो-नभ)। भा. XII. ११. ३८; Br. II. २३. १०; III. 7. १५.
--a Vasu, and a son of Dharma and सुदेवी. M. १७१. ४७. [पगे१-060+ ३२]
--see अहिर्बुध्न्य। Br. II. १२. २६.
--a Saimhikeya. वा. ६८. १९.
--देवावृध and his son Babhru belonged to this line. M. ४४. ५७.
--the chief of the 6th वातस्कन्ध, situated between the planets and the सप्तऋषिमण्डल. Br. III. 5. ८७.

--a prince of Avanti. Brother of Vinda and and मित्रविन्दा: Shared Vinda's (s.v) views and did not wish his sister to be married to कृष्ण as against Duryo- dhana. <F>1:  भा. X. ५८. ३०; Br. III. ७१. १५८.</F> Stationed at the south gate of मथुरा by जरा- सन्धा, <F>2:  भा. X. ५०. ११[3].</F> and also on the south during the seige of Gomanta. <F>3:  Ib. X. ५२. ११[9].</F> Son of राजधिदेवी according to the भागवत। <F>4:  Ib. X. ५८. ३१; वा. ९६. १५७; Vi. IV. १४. ४३.</F>
--a daughter of र्षा (र्षि-वा। प्।); gave birth to the class of मण्दूकस्, ऐनेय and शम्बक varieties. Br. III. 7. ४१४ and ४१८; वा. ६९. २९१, २९५.
(II)--the son of क्षेम, ruled for ६४ years. M. २७१. २५.
--a class of people in शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २७.

--the one after सृष्टिसर्ग; the second पाद of the पुराण; <F>1:  Br. I. 1. ३९; II. ३१. १२७; III. 1. 1; IV. 4. ४३; वा. 4. १३; ६५. 1-2.</F> equal to त्रेता; of ३०००; <F>2:  वा. ३२. ६१; वा. ५८. १२६; १०३. ४४.</F> ends with the ९९थ् chapter of the वायु। <F>3:  वा. १००. 2.</F>

--a poetic metre; <F>1:  भा. XI. २१. ४१; वा. 9. ५२.</F> a horse yoked to the sun's chariot; <F>2:  वा. ५१. ६४; Br. II. २२. ७२; M. १२५. ४७; Vi. II. 8. 5.</F> from the fourth face of ब्रह्मा. <F>3:  Br. II. 8. ५३. Vi. I. 5. ५६.</F>

--a son of कयाधु and हिरण्यकशिपु; wife सूर्म्या. Father of बाष्कल and महीष; <F>1:  भा. VI. १८. १३, १६: Br. III. 5. ३३.</F> also of वायु and सिनीवालि from whom the हालाहल गण came; <F>2:  M. 6. 9; वा. ६७. ७०, ७५; Vi. I. १५. १४२.</F> as asura of the Vitalam. His daughter was married by रजतनाभ, the यक्ष. <F>3:  Br. II. २०. २६; III. 7. ११९; वा. ५०. २५.</F>
--the kingdom got by सूत from पृथु. The people were अनूपस्, a Vindhya tribe. Br. II. ३६. १७२; १६. ६५; वा. ६२. १४७.
--(अरुण) a son of तार्क्ष्य and कद्रू. Cha- rioteer of the sun. भा. VI. 6. २२. [पगे१-062+ ३०]

(as opposite to सत्यम्) when falsehood is tole- rated. <F>1:  भा. VIII. १९. ३८-43.</F> Bali shrinks from it. <F>2:  Ib. VIII. २०. 2-5.</F> No पातक on five occasions: Jest or fun, speaking to women, for a marriage, when life is in danger, and when deprived of his wealth. <F>3:  M. ३१. १६.</F>
--son of हिम्सा and Adharma; father of Bhaya and Naraka. Br. II. 9. ६३; वा. १०. ३९.
--a son of Raucya Manu. Br. IV. 1. १०४.
--a son of Raucya Manu. वा. १००. १०९.
--a son of Anala. M. २०३. 6.
(I)--the son of Kakustha (पौरञ्जय-भा।) of पृथु. भा. IX. 6. २०; Br. III. ६३. २६; वा. ८८. २५; Vi. IV. 2. ३३.
(II)--a son of आयु and father of शुद्ध. भा. IX. १७. 2 and ११; Br. III. ६७. 2; Vi. IV. 8. 3.
--a Pravara. M. १९६. ३१.

--the wife of बाणासुर. Illtreated by mother-in-law and sister-in-law she was initiated into a मन्त्र by नारद to control them and to be ever pleasing to her husband. By this she left the strict path of chastity; offered gifts to the sage who refused them on the plea of his plenty. M. १८७. २५-52. [पगे१-063+ २७]
--१००० crores×niyuta (1 lakh). वा. १०१. ९८.
(I)--surname of Yama: milkman of पितृस् on the earth: एत्य्। भा. VI. १०. १५; Br. II. ३६. २०९; M. १०. १९; २१३. 6.
(II)--a surname of शिव. Br. III. 3. ८१.
(III)--a son of Vasumitra, ruled for 2 years. M. २७२. २९.
--the तामसिच् aspect of स्वयम्भू. वा. ६६. १०३.
--prescriptions for; <F>1:  भा. II. 1. १५-21;</F> yogic methods laid down. <F>2:  Ib. H. 2. १४-23.</F>
--the son of पृथुश्रवस्; in previous births the son of याज्ञ; also called उशनस्, performed १०० horse sacrifices as king. वा. ९५. २२, २३.
--reference to the deluge in the चाक्षुस antara. M. 2. 1 and १४.
--a western country; Narmada tribes. Br. II. १६. ६१; M. १४०. ५०.
--one of ४४ apsarases. वा. ६९. 4. [पगे१-064+ ३४]

(I)--a son of ऋषभ and Jayanti. Brother of Bharata. A भागवत and sage; <F>1:  भा. V. 4. ११; XI. 2. २१.</F> expounded to Nimi the nature of माया अन्द् mentions how the pure ज्ञान shines as threefold by the work of illusion. <F>2:  Ib. XI. 3. 2[1-4]-१६.</F>
(II)--a son of Mura (s.v.) who went to the field to attack कृष्ण who caused the death of his father. भा. X. ५९. १२.
(III)--the son of पुष्कर and father of Sutapas. भा. IX. १२. १२.
(IV)--the १३थ् Veda व्यास: <F>1:  Br. II. ३५. १२०. Vi. III. 3. १४.</F> Heard the पुराण from त्रिविष्ट, and narrated it to त्रय्यारुणि <F>2:  Br. IV. 4. ६२; वा. १०३. ६१.</F> (चर्षि- वा। प्।)
(V)--an आद्य god; a देवगण. Br. II. ३६. ६९; वा. ६२. ५९.
(VI)--the son of किन्नराश्व (Kinnara-वा। प्।); and father of सुपर्ण (सुषेण--म्। प्।). M. २७१. 9; वा. ९९. २८५; Vi. IV. २२. 5.

--the Bhuvarloka or the region between earth and heaven. <F>1:  वा. २३. १०७; २४. १८; ३०. ९८; ४७. २९; ६४. १०; १०१. १९; ११०. ४९.</F> One account is that ययाति made this his abode when he was sent away from heaven; <F>2:  M. ३५. 4; ३८. २०; ३९. ११; ४१. 8 & १०.</F> to be pro- pitiated as a deity in palace building. <F>3:  Ib. २६८. १२.</F>
--Peoples of an eastern country. Br. II. १६. ५३; वा. ४५. १२२. [पगे१-065+ २६]
(I)--a surname of विजिताश्व (s.v.); got from Indra the power of moving about, unseen by others. भा. IV. २४. 5.
(II) (अन्तर्द्धि)--A son of पृथु; wife शिखण्डिनी: father of हविर्धान, and मारीच. Br. II. ३७. २३; M. 4. ४५; वा. ६३. २२; Vi. I. १४. 1.
--R. originating from the Vindhyas. वा. ४५. १०३.
--harems, origin of. वा. 8. १००.
--Superintendent of the harem and his qualification. M. २१५. ४२; २१६. 9.
--an untouchable. Br. III. १४. ८८; वा. ७९. २४.
--a son of Yadu. M. ४३. 7.
(I)--the son of ज्वलना and Auceya; wife मनस्विनी. Father of two sons and a daughter गौरी, mother of मान्धतृ. M. ४९. 7-8.
(II)--the son of ऋतेषु and father of three sons, Sumati and others. Vi. IV. १९. 3-4.
--a son of भृगु, and a deva. Br. III. 1. ८९. [पगे१-066+ ३३]
--members of the fourth caste: home of. M. २०७. १९; २२७. ५४; २५५. १४.

--to follow the वृत्ति of their ancestors. Also known अन्तेवसायिन्स्: <F>1:  भा. VII. ११. ३०; १४. ११.</F> a low caste to be abandoned: <F>2:  Br. IV. 7. 3, 8, १९ and ६७; 8. १०.</F> also अन्त्ययोनि। <F>3:  Ib. II. ३१. ४०.</F>
--an untouchable. वा. ७९. २४.
--R. of भारतवर्ष. भा. V. १९. १८.

(I)--a son of सात्वत [सात्वती (Kausalya)]: suspected कृष्ण of having taken away Syamantaka. <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. 6; Br. III. ७१. 1. ३६, ५३; वा. ९६. 2; Vi. IV. १३. 1.</F> A महाभोज who married the daughter of कङ्क and was father of four sons, Kukura and others. <F>2:  M. ४४. ४८-61; Vi. IV. १४. १२.</F>
(II)--son of Anu and father of Dundubhi. भा. IX. २४. २०.
(III)--a son of Viloma, and a friend of Tum- buru: also known as Danodakadundubhi. Br. III. ७१. ११८.
(IV)--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८२.
(V)--the 8th among twelve incarnations, after the battle of that name. Here Trayambaka slew thou- sands of Asuras: <F>1:  M. ४७. ४४-50.</F> in the वराह Kalpa. <F>2:  वा. ९७. ७५.</F> [पगे१-067+ ४१]

(VI)--the asura killed by शिव: आडि and Baka were his sons; attempted to abduct the देवी in the presence of शिव in the महाकालवन of Avanti. Smitten by पाशु- pata, blood came out of his body, out of which were born numberless Andhakas (s.v.) who overpowered Rudra. The latter created a number of मातृस् who were not enough to meet them. वासुदेव was thought of, and he created one शुष्करेवति who drank off the blood of Andhakas. On his submission he was admitted to the group of गणेशस्. M. ५५. १६; १५६. ११-12; १७९. 2-४०; २५२. 5-१९.
(VII)--an elder यादव advised in the council to secure the return of अक्रूर; it was adopted. Vi. IV. १३. ११४-137.

(I)--a community of the यादव tribe <F>1:  भा. I. ११. ११; १४. २५; II. 4. २०; वा. ८६. २८.</F> defending द्वारका; at द्वारवती their overlord was Ugra- sena. <F>2:  भा. X. 1. ६९; ३९. २५; ४५, १५.</F> Praise the heroic deeds of Hari. <F>3:  भा. IX. २४. ६३.</F> Relieved by Kamsa's death. <F>4:  Ib. X. ४५. १५.</F> Ended their lives by fighting their kins- men. <F>5:  Ib. XI. २९. ३९; ३०. १८.</F> कृष्ण, an Andhaka. <F>6:  Br. III. ६१. २३; ७१. ८५ & १४३-144.</F> Kingdom of. <F>7:  M. ११४. ३६.</F> Their line; <F>8:  M. ४४. ६१. ८५; ४७. ३३.</F> fetch बलराम and कृष्ण to द्वारक. <F>9:  वा. ९६. ८४.</F>

(II)--the Asuras born of the blood of Andhaka Asura, hit by the पाशुपत of Rudra. To counter- act their evil propensities Rudra created a number of मातृस् who could not bring about the desired effect. Hence वासु- deva created a शुष्करेवती who brought about their des- truction by drinking off their blood. M. १७९. 7-३७.
(I)--a son of Dyutimat after whom the kingdom अन्धकार came to be known. Br. II. १४. २२, २५. [पगे१-068+ २७]
(II)--the eighth battle of Devas and Asuras. Br. III. ७२. ७५ & ८२; वा. ९७. ७५.
(I) (च्)--a kingdom of क्रौञ्चद्वीप: also a name of the hill in that region. Br. II. १४. २५; १९. ६७ & ७२; M. १२२. ८१, ८५; वा. ४९. ६१, ६७.
(II)--a Mt. in क्रौञ्चद्वीप. M. १२२. ८१; Vi. II. 4. ५०.
(III)--a son of द्युतिमान्; after his name a Janapada. वा. ३३. २१, २३; Vi. II. 4. ४८.
--a surname of शिव. Br. III. २५. १२.

--one of the २८ hells. Those who do not follow the prescribed course of life and who have no sym- pathy for the sufferings they inflict on others are subject to affliction in this hell. भा. V. २६. 7 and १७.
--one of २८ hells. Here the person who deceives the husband and robs him of his wife and property is made to suffer. भा. III. ३०. २८ & ३३; V. २६. 7 & 9.
--a hell. Vi. I. 6. ४१.
--one of the five देवीस् on the third parva of the किरिचक्र of ललिता. Br. IV. २०. 9 & ३८. [पगे१-069+ ३१]
(I)--born of दीर्घतमस् and Bali's wife. (Burnouf's reading--ओड्र). भा., IX. २३. 5.
(II)--the son of दृषदश्व (वृषदश्व-वा। प्।). Br. III. ६३. २७; वा. ८८. २६.
(III) (च्)--a Janapada under the देवरक्षितस्. वा. ९९. ३८५; Vi. IV. २४. ६४.

--a people of the southern country ruled for ३०० years; <F>1:  भा., XII. 1. २२; वा. ४५. १२७; ४७. ४४; ७८. ६९; ९९. २६८, ३६१.</F> a sinful tribe got purified by praying to Hari; <F>2:  भा. II. 4. १८.</F> defeated by Bharata. <F>3:  Ib. IX. २०. ३०.</F> See आण्ध्रस्। <F>4:  M. ५०. ७६.</F>
--the शुङ्ग, ruled for 2 years. वा. ९९. ३३९.
--succeeded the कण्व dynasty of kings. Thirty of them ruled for ४५६ years. Kingdom of: Br. III. ७३. १०९; ७४. १६०, १७०, १७८, १९७, २२९-30; वा. ९८. १०८; भा. XII. 1. २२-28.
--people of an eastern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ५३; वा. ४५. ११.
--gift of, the best of all; especially in a श्राद्ध: <F>1:  Br. III. १६. 3, ५२-5; ६८, ६६; वा. ८०. ५५-7 (cf. रामा। II. ch. १०३).</F> अन्नविक्रयम् condemned. <F>2:  Br. IV. 8. ४४-58.</F>
--a देवी in the चिन्तामणिगृह। Br. IV. ३६. २३.
(I)--a son of कृष्ण and मित्रविन्दा. भा. X. ६१. १६. [पगे१-070+ २५]
(II)--a son of Agni Arka. Br. II. १२. ४३.
(I)--a son of भृगु. वा. ६५. ८७.
(II)--a राजऋषि, becoming a ब्राह्मण. वा. ९१. ११६.
--one of the seven Maruts in the fourth मरुत्- गण। Br. III. 5. ९६-7; वा. ६७. १२७.
--one of the names in the fifth मरुत्गण। वा. ६७. १२८.
--a son of भृगु. वा. ६५. ८७.
--an Apsaras. वा. ६९. ४८.
--the ninth day in the latter half of the three (or four) months following the full moon in अग्रहायन, पौष, माघ, (फाल्गुन)। The fourth month is men- tioned in the पुराण. वा. ८१. 4, 5.
--the particular Agni from which वृत्र was born. भा. VI. 9. १२. [पगे१-071+ २६]
--a fire rite on the conjunction of the पर्वस्। Br. II. २८. ३७.
(I)--one of the ten branches of the Harita group of Devas. वा. १००. ८९.
(II)--water: variations in temperature explain- ed in relation to the solar rays. Br. II. २१. ५९-62.
--a daughter of मरीचि and सम्भूति. वा. २८. 9.
--Gandharvas in the हेमकक्ष hill; their ruler is राजराज Kapin5jala. वा. ३९. ५२.
--the people of a mountain kingdom. M. ११४. ५५.
--a hill tribe. Br. II. १६. ६७.
--one of the thirteen wives of वासुदेव. वा. ९६. १६०.
(I)--fought with Namuci in देवासुर war. भा. VIII. १०. ३०.
(II)--a son of कृष्ण and माद्री. भा., X. ६१. १५. [पगे१-072+ २६]
(III)--the horse on which ललिता rode to fight कुरण्ड. Br. IV. २२. ९४.
(I)--an elephant at one of the four cardinal points to maintain the balance of the worlds. भा. V. २०. ३९.
(III)--a mindborn mother; following माया. M. १७९. १३, ६९.
--when the sun passes three मुहूर्तस् from the मध्याःन। वा. ५०. ९६, १७३.
--a शक्ति of काल in the पञ्चकोण। Br. IV. ३२. १०.
--a northern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ४६; III. ६२. ३९; M. ११४. ५१; वा. ५८. ८१.
--the people of the western country. Vi. II. 3. १६.

(I)--one of the three daughters of मेना and Himavat. Seeing her severe penance houseless and food- less her mother said ‘सोम’, (उमा-वा। प्।) whence she became उमा and married शिव. Br. III. १०. 8-१३; वा. ७२. 7, ११-2. [पगे१-073+ २५]
(II)--a daughter of मेना: married जैगीषव्य. M. १३. 8-9.
--the final beatitude from सूक्ष्म, the latter to be realised by ज्ञान; cf. सन्ख्य क्। ४४. ज्ञानेन चापवर्गः। From this results व्यापक; from this comes पुरुष and from it the highest bliss. वा. १३. २२.
--a son of शम्श्य Agni. Br. II. १२. १३.
--Agni known as आस्थ. Br. II. १२. ३१.
--a group of evil spirits. भा. X. 6. २८.
--a son of ऊत्तानपाद and सूनृता. M. 4. ३५.
--a son of उत्तानपाद and सूनृता. M. 4. ३५.
--a son of शक्रजित् and a loveable man. वा. ९६. ५३.
--a ब्रह्मराक्षसी. Br. III. 7. ९९.
--a list of those unfit for interdining. वा. ८३. ६०-70.
(I)--a साध्य god. Br. III. 3. १६.
(II)--a तुषित god. Br. III. 3. १९; वा. ६६. १८.
(III)--an Ajita deva. वा. ६७. ३४.
--a Siddha chief, who could not compre- hend the माया of Hari. भा. VI. १५. १२; IX. 4. ५७.
--attribute of Agni. Br. II. २३. ५३.
--an attribute of वरुण, the lord of a दिक्। Br. III. 7. ३३१; वा. ६९. २१५.
--a son of भरताग्नि. वा. २९. 8.
--a god of the Harita गण। Br. IV. 1. ८४.
--the name of Rudra. Br. IV. ३४. ४२. [पगे१-075+ २७]
--a sage by तपस्। Br. II. ३२. ९९.
--a याग; <F>1:  वा. 9. ५१.</F> from the fourth face of ब्रह्मा. <F>2:  Br. II. 8. ५३.</F>
--a deva गण with Yama as their lord. Br. III. 1. ५२.
--son of श्रुतश्रवस्, ruled for ३६ years. M. २७१. २१.
--a son of Uttama Manu. Br. II. ३६. ३९; वा. ६२. ३४.
--the son of Diti; also known as अरिष्टनेमि. वा. ६५. ११२.
--a sage of the Xth epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. २७.
--the son of रन्तिभार (अन्तिमार-वि। प्।) and father of कण्व and ऐलीन. भा. IX. २०. 6; Vi. IV. १९. 4, 5, 8.
--a son of Buddhi. Br. II. 9. ६०; वा. १०. ३६.
--a hell under the earth; the fourth one below the earth; ever in motion. Br. IV. 2. १५० & १८२-4; वा. १०१. १४९, १७९ and १८१.

--Divine dancers born of Muni and कश्यप. Joined Gandharvas in milking the cow Earth; worship Barhi- षद् pitr2s. Love sports with Gandharvas over the Hima- [पगे१-076+ ५३] layas. <F>1:  M. 6. ४५; १०. २४; १५. 3; २२. ५९; १२०. 1.</F> A group of celestial women who often go to Mount कैलास. <F>2:  भा. II. 1. ३६; IV. 6. 9.</F> Thirty-four <F>3:  वा. ६९. 4; १०१. २८.</F> wait on Indra. <F>4:  भा. VI. 7. 4.</F> Joined the gods in offering prayers to Hari. <F>5:  Ib. VII. 8. ३८.</F> Take their origin from the sport- ful motion of Hari. <F>6:  Ib. VIII. 5. ४०.</F> Danced at the अवतार् of कृष्ण. <F>7:  Ib.
