X. 3. 6; 4. ११.</F> Went to द्वारक with gods and prayed for the return of Hari to वैकुण्ठ. <F>8:  Ib. XI. 6. 3.</F> Their association with the wise and the righteous. <F>9:  Ib. XI. १२. 3.</F> Welcome कृष्ण back to his own region. <F>१०:  Ib. XI. ३१. 2.</F> Were asked by Indra to obstruct the completion of मार्कण्- डेय's तपस्। <F>११:  Ib. XII. 8. १६.</F> Dance in front of the Sun god and move with him by turns. <F>१२:  Ib. XII. ११. ४७; Br. II. २३. २७ and ५०.</F> Live in Meru: कामदेव was their overlord; <F>१३:  Br. II. १५. ४९; III. 8. १५; 7. २५-26.</F> born on earth as १६००० gopis during कृष्ण's अवतार; <F>१४:  Ib. III. ७१. २४३-4; IV. 2. २६.</F> sprung from the churning of the ocean; <F>१५:  भा. VIII. 8. 7.</F> strew fired grain at the conquering tour of ललिता. <F>१६:  Br. IV. १८. 9.</F> Fourteen birth spots for them distinguished. <F>१७:  Ib. IV. ३३. १८-25.</F> Once when the Apsaras ladies, all daughters of Agni, were engaged in water sports in मानस, there came नारद. Without saluting him they asked him how to attain the Lord as husband. He gave them a व्रतम् but cursed that they would be sepa- rated from the Lord and become slaves of robbers; became the रेखस् on the body of वामन. <F>१८:  M. ७०. २१-5; २४६. ५४.</F>
--fourteen in number, the mindborn daughters of ब्रह्मा, daughters of Manu, etc. most of them were wives and mothers of gods and sages. वा. 9. ५५; ३०. ८७; ६९. ५३, ६२; ९६. २३५.
--a तीर्थम् in the नर्मदा. M. १९४. १६-17.
--a sister of दत्तात्रेय and दुर्वासास्; a ब्रह्मवादिनी. वा. ७०. ७६. [पगे१-077+ २४]
--a mindborn mother. M. १७९. २७.
--an attribute of ब्रह्मा. Br. IV. 5. ३१.
--is ब्रह्मा also known as पितामह; origi- nally narrated the विष्णु पुराण to दक्ष and other sages. Vi. I. 2. 8; IV. 1. ६७; 6. 5.
--an attribute of Agastya. Br. IV. ३१. ३६.
(I)--son of Dharma and दया: a sage. भा. IV. 1. ५०; M. १९८. 3.
(II)--one of the seven continents of प्लक्ष- द्वीप. (जम्बूद्वीप--Burnouf). भा. V. २०. 3.
--the son of Manasyu and father of Sudyu. Vi. IV. १९. 1.
(I)--a R. of क्रौञ्चद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २१.
(II)--the goddess enshrined in उष्णतीर्थ. M. १३. ४२.
--the name of a hell. Br. IV. 2. १५०.
--experts in astrology predicted परी- क्षित्'s future glory at the time of his birth. भा. I. १६. 1; cf. I. १२. १५-29.
(I)--an auspicious hour between 1--2 p.m. midday time: <F>1:  भा. III. १८. २७; VII. १०. ६७.</F> best for gifts. <F>2:  M. २२. 2.</F>

(II)--the २८थ् naks2atra on the right nostril of शिशुमार; <F>1:  भा. V. २२. ११; २३. 6; वा. ५०. १३०; ८२. १२; ९६. २०१.</F> the नक्षत्र of कृष्ण. <F>2:  भा. VIII. १८. 5; Br. III. ७१. २०५.</F> Identified with Hari. <F>3:  भा. XI. १६. २७.</F>
(III)--A son of Andhaka, (आनकदुन्धुभि- वि। प्।), and father of Punarvasu. Br. III. ७१. ११९; Vi. IV. १४. १४.
(I)--आर्षेयप्रवर (अङ्गिरस्). M. १९६. 6.
(II)--(Punarvasu) the son of Candanodaka- dundubhi; performed अश्वमेध. Father of twins, आहुक and आहुकि. वा. ९६. ११८, १२०; Br. III, ७१. ११९-122.
--technique of dancing started by Bharata. M. २४. ३०.
--the son of Durdama or Durmada: <F>1:  Br. III. ७१. १७१.</F> of the रोहिणि family. <F>2:  वा. ९६. १६९.</F> [पगे१-079+ ३२]

(I)--a son of Arjuna and सुभद्रा. Wife उत्तरा. Conqueror of अतिरथस्। <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. ३३. Br. III. ७१. १७८; M. ५०. ५६; Vi. IV. २०. ५१;</F> Famous for valour even as a boy. Father of परीक्षित्. <F>2:  भा. I. 4. 9. Vi. IV. २०. ५२.</F> द्रौणि wanted to destroy his seed in embryo. कृष्ण frustrated this attempt. Taken by कृष्ण to द्वारक. <F>4:  Ib. X. ६४ [११].</F> Slew बृहद्बल in the भारत war. <F>4: (a) Vi. IV. 4, ११२.</F> Went with कृष्ण to उपप्लाव्य to see the पाण्ड- vas. <F>5:  भा. X. ७८. [१६ (V) 4].</F> Killed by Saindhava. <F>6:  Ib. X. ७८. [३०].</F> A रथी; <F>7:  वा. ९६. १७६; ९९. २४९.</F> considered as god. <F>8:  वा. ३१. 7.</F> ^3) भा. III. 3. १७.
(III)--a sage of the second सावर्ण epoch. Br. IV. 1. ७१.
(IV)--a son of Manu and नड्वला. Vi. I. १३. 5.
--(Rudra) entered आत्मन् (अहङ्कार) of विराट् पुरुष। भा. III. 6. २५.
--one of the names in the second मरुत् गण। वा. ६७. १२५.
--one of the names in the third मरुत् गण। वा. ६७. १२६.
--a मरुत् of the third गण। Br. III. 5. ९५. [पगे१-080+ २६]
--a class of people in कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १६.
--a northern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ४८.

--The anointing ceremony: when Puru, the last son was recommended by ययाति, the people said that it was धर्म to anoint the eldest; defined the law that the faithful son alone was fit for the throne; Puru having fulfilled his father's wishes was to be regarded the faithful and dutiful; this was agreed to; further it was endorsed by शुक्र. वा. ९३. ७६-87; ९९. ४५१.
--of राम, described. Vi. IV. 4. ९८-99.
(I)--a son of Citraka. Br. III. ७१. ११५; वा. ९६. ११४.
(II)--a son of अश्विनि and अक्रूर. M. ४५. ३३.
--slightly different from प्रोक्षणम्; the former is for articles of diet, etc. and the latter for flowers, grass, etc.; details of the श्राद्ध। वा. ७९. ३३.
--the king of the elephants. Br. III. 7. ३५५. [पगे१-081+ ३१]
--an elephant and a daughter of Bhauvana-- mother of dig-gajas. Br. III. 7. ३२९.
--a queen of वर्ष-r2tu. Br. IV. ३२. २९.
--formation of clouds described: kinds of. Br. II. २२. २३-48.
(I)--a mountain kingdom. M. ११४. ५६.
--a place sacred to शिव. M. १८१. २६.

--(Mt.) the sacred hill at the top of माल्यवत्. Here अङ्गिरस् performed penance for fifteen crores of years; here is the R. विशल्यकरणी, forming a part of Kalinga; सिद्धिक्षेत्रम्, noted for श्राद्ध offering, <F>1:  Br. III. १३. 4-१६.</F> and पितृ पिण्ड; a क्षेत्र of the नर्मदा by name जलेश्वरा; sur- rounded by the hill रुद्रकोटि; superior to कुरुक्षेत्र; <F>2:  M. २२. २८; १८६. १२-34; १८८. ७९ and ८२; १९१. २५; १९३. ५४; १९४. ४४.</F> its crest lustrous as the प्रलयाग्नि; there were golden कुशस् touching the bank of the south नर्मदा; here अङ्गिरस्, once after Agnihotra saw the step to स्वर्ग or heaven; on the west is a tank, bordering on Kalinga another holy place. Sung even by शुक्र. <F>3:  वा. ७७. 4-१६; ११२. ३२.</F>
--on the western side of गन्धमा- dana. M. ११३. ४८. [पगे१-082+ २८]
--another term for Heaven whose lord was Indra. Br. IV. 6. ११ and ३२.

--Heaven noted for the pleasure-park Nan- dana. A description of the city, occupied for some time by Bali. <F>1:  भा. VIII. १५. ११-22 and ३३; वा. ७७. २६.</F> Though it was really the capital of Indra, the latter says that it belonged to कृष्ण. <F>2:  भा. X. [६७ (V) २६]; Vi. I. 9. २५.</F> When it is midday here, the sun rises at Samyamana. <F>3:  Br. II. २१. ३७; III. १३. २६ and ३०; M. १२४. २७.</F>
--the son of Susandhi and father of सहस्वान्. Vi. IV. 4. १११.
--a son of शुक्राचार्य. भा. VII. 5. 1, ४८.
--the son of Sandhi and father of Mahasvat. भा. IX. १२. 7.
--a देव गण with Yama as their lord. Br. III. 1. ५२.
--a ray of the sun. Vi. II. १२. 8.
--their irritation against king, a cause of internal dissensions; to be banished after being deprived of possession, for doing wrongs: Residence of. M. २२३. 9; २२७. १६०; २५४. २१-22. [पगे१-083+ ३१]

(I)--a son of Aila. Him अच्छोदा adopted as her पितृ and lost her yogic powers; son of पुरूरवस् and उर्वशी. Father of भीम. Br. III. १०. ५६ and ६८; ६६. २२; M. १४. 5, 7. वा. ९१. ५१. 2; Vi. IV. 7. 1 and 2.
(II)--the son of आयु; a Vasu passing through the sky loved by अच्छोदा. वा. ७३. 5.

--the time when पितृस् worship moon and when the sun, moon and constellations meet together in the same मण्डल; पितृस् drink the nectar of the moon (1/१५) part of it remaining; there is no moon, middle sun--half night half day. <F>1:  Br. II. १०. ६२. ६५; २१. १५३; २३. ७०; २८. 6; १७. १९; M. १७. 2; १२६. ६६. ७२; १४१. ४२-49; वा. ५२. ६४; ५३. ९२; ५६. 1, 6, ४२ and ४९</F> यज्ञस् with २१ सम्ज्ञस्। <F>2:  Br. III. ११. १४. वा. ७४. १३.</F> Only when two of its कलस् remain, the moon enters the orbit of the sun and stays in the ray called अमा and hence the period is अमावास्या, <F>3:  Vi. I. २०. ३८; II. 8. ८०; १२. 8; III. १४. 7-१०.</F> fit for श्राद्ध। <F>4:  Vi. III. १४. 7-१०.</F>

--a daughter of ऋषा: gave birth to four kinds of crocodiles. Br. III. 7. ४१४ and ४१६.
--a sage who had transcended the force of माया. (Burnouf makes this into two names अमूर्ति and Aya). भा. II. 7. ४४.

(II)--a son of अन्तिनार. M. ४९. 8.
(II)--a son of भरताग्नि. वा. २९. 8.
(III)--one of the seven divisions of प्लक्षद्वीप. भा. V. २०. 3.
(I)--the juice from medicinal herbs of the Candra hill of प्लक्षद्वीप. Br. II. १९. 8; २४. २७ and ३१.

(II)--nectar arising out of the churning of milk ocean by gods and Asuras. Others that came out of it were curds, liquor, Soma, लक्ष्मी, horse, Kaustubha, पारिजात, and lastly कालकूट. Then appeared Dhanvantari. Distri- bution of अमृतम् by मोहिनी, the form assumed by Hari to delude the Asuras. When राहु was seen, partaking of it, [पगे१-086+ २८] had his head cut off. Finding themselves deceived, the Asuras began war. M. 1. 9; २४९. १४ to the end; cha. २५० and २५१ (whole); वा. २३. ९०; ५२. ३७; ९२. 9; Vi. I. 9. ८०-111.
--gods of सावर्णि epoch. भा. VIII. १३. १२.

--the fourth देवासुर battle, in which Indra defeated प्रःलाद. <F>1:  Br. III. ७२. ७३ and ७९; IV. 6. 7.</F> Also the fourth of twelve incarna- tions of Hari by name Indra; with details of the battle. <F>2:  M. ४७. ४३ and ४८; २४९. ५१; वा. ९७. ७४. ७९.</F>
(I)--a शक्ति devi1; the goddess enshrined in a Vindhyan cave. Br. IV. ४४. ८४; M. १३. ४२.
(II)--the goddess enshrined at वेण. M. १३. ४९; १२२. ३३.
--R. of the प्लक्षद्वीप. Br. II. १९. १९; वा. ४९. १७; Vi. II. 4. ११.
(I)--a group of rain-giving नाडिस् with the sun. Br. II. २४. २७; वा. ५३. २०.
(II)--one of the fourteen clans of Apsaras, born of waters. Br. III. 7. १९; वा. ६९. ५६.

(see अमृतम्)--suggested by Hari- Ajita to secure immortality for gods. It was to churn the क्षीरोद with Mandara as stick and वासुकि as rope. The Asuras agreed to aid the gods in securing अमृत। Hari took hold at first of the head, and when the Asuras protested, of the tail of वासुकि. Seeing exhaustion on the part of gods owing to obstacle of विघ्नेश, Hari propped up the Mandara hill, assuming the form of a tortoise. With continuous effort, the churning went on. First appeared हालाहल which was consumed by शिव on an appeal from the प्रजापतिस् and with the permission of पार्वती. Then came out कामधेनु which sages appropriated for agnihotra; उच्चैश्श्रवस्, a horse which Bali took; then ऐरावत: कौस्तुभ gem appropriated by Hari, then पारिजात, अप्सरस् women and then स्री married to Hari. Then came out वारुणीदेवी whom Asuras seized, then Dhanvantari with a pot of अमृत। There was then a rush on both sides to get the अमृत first when Hari assumed the form of मोहिनी and arrested their attention. Moved by her beauty, both gods and Asuras agreed to let her distribute the अमृत to all of them. She began with the gods and was serving them first. Noticing this राहु took the guise of a god. On being pointed out by the sun and moon, Hari cut off his head with his चक्र। The Asuras found that they had been deluded by Hari and set their face against Him. See अमृतम्। भा. VIII. 6. २१-25, ३१-32. Ib. ch. 7-9 (whole); Ib. १०. 1.
--R. of क्रौञ्च dvi1pa. भा. V. २०. २१.
--goddess enshrined at विपाश. M. १३. ३५. [पगे१-088+ ३३]
--another name for ब्रह्मतीर्थम्: an elephant-like stone is established in the midst of waters here: fit for पिण्ड offering. M. १९१. १०५-7.
--१००० crores × नियुतम्। Br. IV. 2. ९८ and १०२.
(I)--an Asura follower of वृत्र in his battle with Indra. भा. VI. १०. १९.
(II)--sacred to विश्वकाय. M. १३. २७.

--R. from the slope of the Meru; flows through देवभ्राजम्, महाभ्राजम्, वैभ्राजम् enters सितोदा, the lake in the west, and then goes round the सुपक्ष hill, शिखिपर्वतम्, कङ्कम्, वैदूर्यपर्वतम्, Kapilam, गन्धमादनम्, पिञ्जरम्, Sarasam, कुमुदा- calam, Madhumanta, मुकुट, कृष्णश्वेतम्, सहस्रशिख- ram and पारिजात into the केतुमाल and falls into the western ocean. वा. ४२. ४४-57.

(I)--the son of नाभाग. A devotee of Hari. The curse of दुर्वासस् proved ineffective in his case. Though lord of seven continents, अम्बरीष knew that glory was perishable. He devoted himself to the service of Hari, and got to know the power of His योग। A saintly king. Performed the अश्वमेध in a desert region so as to compel R. Sarasvati flow back towards it. Pleased with him, Hari presented his चक्र to him. He observed the द्वादसी व्रत, for a year at the end of which he gave gifts to ब्राह्- मणस् and was preparing to feed them. There then came दुर्वासस् who agreed to be fed. He went to the यमुना for bath and was engaged in contemplating on Brahman. The time for breakfast came and the sage did not return. [पगे१-089+ ३३] So the king broke his fast with only water and waited food expecting the sage's arrival. The sage on his return found that the king had broken his fast, and grew angry and created a flaming goddess to attack him. Hari's चक्र burnt her, turned towards the sage who ran everywhere and to the त्रिमूर्तिस् in vain. <F>1:  भा. IX. 4. १३-71; II. 7. ४४; Br. III. ३४. ३९; वा. ८८. १७१.</F> Advised by Hari, the sage apologised to the king who prayed to the चक्र and set the sage at liberty. The king who had not taken food requested him to accept his hospitality which दुर्वासस् gladly did. Bless- ing the king, the sage went back to Brahmaloka. Later the king bestowed his kingdom on his sons and retired to the forest for a life of penance and prayer. <F>2:  भा. IX. 5 (whole).</F> Had three sons विरूप and others. <F>3:  भा. IX. 6. 1; Br. III. ६३. 6, १७०-172; Vi. IV. 2. 6, 7; 4. ३६.</F> A मन्त्रकृत् who made the १६ great gifts. <F>4:  M. १२. २०, ४५; १४५. १०२; २७४. ११.</F>
(II)--a son of मान्धातृ and बिन्दुमती. Adopted by his grandfather. Father of युवनाश्व. (not the युवनाश्व, father of मान्धातृ). भा. IX. 6. ३८; 7. 1; Br. III. ६३. ७२; वा. ८८. ७२; Vi. IV. 2. ६७; 3. 2.
(III)--an अङ्गिरस and मन्त्रकृत्। Br. II. ३२. १०८; वा. ५९. ९९.
(IV)--a काद्रवेय na1ga. Br. III. 7. ३६; वा. ६९. ७३.
(V)--a son of Pulaha and क्षमा. वा. २८. २६.
(I)--the name of the mahout of कुवलया- पीड killed by कृष्ण for leading it against him. भा. X. ४३. 2 and १४. [पगे१-090+ ३८]
(II) (च्)--kingdom: Capital of Suvrata: Its king failed in hitting the fish target in लक्ष्मणा's स्वयम्- वर। भा. X. ८३. २३; Br. III. ७४. २२; M. ४८. २१; वा. ९९. २२.
--a people; <F>1:  भा. X. ८३. २३.</F> country of. <F>2:  Vi. II. 3. १८.</F>
(I)--a daughter of the king of काशी noted for her beauty: and a queen of विचित्रवीर्य. भा. X. ६०. ४७; Vi. IV. २०. ३६.
(II)--the saviour of the world, with her पुरुष Sada1s4iva. Br. IV. 8. ३३; १९. ८१; ३३. १७.
(III)--the queen of वर्ष-r2tu. Br. IV. ३२. २९.

(I)--Wife of शिव. <F>1:  भा. III. १२. १३.</F> Daughter of दक्ष reborn of मेना. <F>2:  Ib. IV. 7. ५९.</F> Pacified by Citraketu. <F>3:  Ib. VI. १७. १७.</F> Surname of पार्वति and योगमाया. <F>4:  Ib. X. 2. १२.</F> Gave भिक्षा to वामन. <F>5:  Ib. VIII. १८. १७.</F> In her honour a festival was celebrated at a sacred spot called अम्बिकावन. In this Gopas participated. <F>6:  Ib. X. ३४. 1-3.</F> Represents Soma while शिव is Agni. <F>7:  Br. II. २७. ११२; IV. १४. 6; १५. ५२; ४४. ८६.</F> Worshipped in ceremonials before digging tanks. <F>8:  M. ५८. २६.</F>
(II)--a daughter of the King of काशि and wife of विचित्रवीर्य. <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. २४. Vi. IV. २०. ३६.</F> Mother of धृतराष्टृअ. <F>2:  भा. X. ४८. ३४.</F>

When he was there, [पगे१-091+ २५] Nanda was seized by a reptile, and was released by कृष्ण. <F>1:  भा. X. ३४. 1-१८.</F> Before her marriage रुक्मिणी went to worship in this shrine. <F>2:  Ib. X. ५३. ३९.</F>

--a son of ब्रह्मधान. Br. III. 7. ९८.

(II)--the name of the sun in the month of Saha (मार्गशीर्ष). <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ४१.</F> the आदित्य of the month Citra, possessing ७००० rays. <F>2:  Br. II. २४. ३४ and ३८.</F> An आदित्य. <F>3:  Br. III. 3. ६७; Vi. I. १५. १३१.</F>
(III)--one of the ten devas of the Harita गण। वा. १००. ८९.
(IV)--The son of Purumitra and father of Sat- vata. Vi. IV. १२. ४३.

(I)--son of असमञ्ज(sa)(s), devoted to grandfather Sagara. <F>1:  भा. IX. 8. १५; Br. III. ५१. ५१; ५२. 1; M. १२. ४३; वा. ८८. १६६; Vi. IV. 4. 7-३२.</F> Went in search of the consecrated horse of Sagara, met Kapila and belauded his greatness. <F>2:  भा. IX. 8. १९. २७; Br. III. ५४. १७ and ५१.</F> Pleased with him, Kapila sent back the horse, adding that the सागरस् would obtain release by the waters of the Ganges. <F>3:  भा. IX. 8. २८-29; Br. III. ५६. २९.</F> Succeeded Sagara as king. <F>4:  भा. IX. 8. २८, ३१.</F> Was engaged in penance to get the गङ्गा for the liberation of his uncles. Before he could achieve this, he died. His son was दिलीप. <F>5:  भा. IX. 9. 1-2; Br. III. ५६. ३०; ६३. १६५; Vi. IV. 4. ३४.</F> Anointing him, अंशुमत् retired to the forest.
(II)--one of the यादवस् deputed to go with कृष्ण's sacrificial horse with a view to its protection. भा. X. ८९. २२[3]. [पगे१-093+ ३२]
(III)--an आदित्य. M. 6. 4.
(IV)--the son of पञ्चजन; married यशोदा, mindborn daughter of हविष्मन्त Pitr2s: Father of दिलीप. M. १५. १८.
(V)--a son of कौशिक: in previous births born as चक्रवाक in मानस. M. २०. १८.
(VI)--a horse of the moon's chariot. M. १२६. ५२.
(I)--a son of वसिष्ठ, and a प्रजापति of the स्वारोचिष epoch. M. 9. 9.
(II)--a son of देवकी. वा. ९६. १७३.

--Six months constitute an अयन। Distin- guished as the southern and northern corresponding to the course of the sun towards the north and south of the equator; <F>1:  भा. III. ११. ११; Br. II. २१. १२६; २२. १०; २८. १७; वा. 3. १४; २३. १०६, etc.</F> suitable for श्राद्ध and दान। <F>2:  M. १७. 2; ८२. २५; ८३. 7; ९८. 2; १०१. ३८; १२४. ९२; १८४. ७२.</F> According to divine calcu- lation दक्षिणायन is the night and the उत्तरायण, the day of the Devas; <F>3:  Vi. I. 3. १०; II. 8. ३१, ३६.</F> the months of तप, तपस्य, मधु, मा- धव, शुक्र and शुचि are उत्तरायण and the months of नभ, नभस्य, इष, ऊर्ज, सह आन्द् सहस्य are दक्षि- णायन। <F>4:  Vi. II. 8. ८१.</F> [पगे१-094+ २६]
--a branch of the अङ्गिरस. वा. ६५. १०६.
--a hell. भा. V. २६. 7 and २९.
--a राक्षस of Bali's camp. M. २४५. ३१.

(I)--the सामग Bra1hman2a who officiated as उद्गाता in the पुरुषमेध: <F>1:  भा. IX. 7. २३.</F> An अङ्गिरस and मन्त्रकृत्। <F>2:  Br. II. ३२. ११०.</F>

--Ten thousand. वा. १०१. ९४.
(I)--son of भजमान. भा. IX. २४. 8; Vi. IV. १३. 2.
(II)--a son of उपवाःयक. Br. III. ७१. 5. [पगे१-095+ ३८]
(I)--the son of सिन्धुद्वीप, and father of ऋतुपर्ण. भा. IX. 9. १६-17; Br. III. ६३. १७२; Vi. IV. 4. ३७.
(II)--the son of श्रुतश्रवस् and father of Niramitra. भा. IX. २२. ४६; Br. III. ७४. १११; Vi. IV. २३. 4.
(III)--The son of आरधित; father of Akro- dhana; ruled for २६ years. वा. ९९. २३२, २९८; Vi. IV. २०. 4.
(IV)--a son of पुरूरवस्. Vi. IV. 7. 1.

--the capital of इक्ष्वाकुस्. The children of अयोध्या were cast into the सरयू by असमञ्- jasa and then restored to life by his yogic power. <F>1:  भा. IX. 8. १७-19.</F> Chief buildings were प्रासाद, गोपुर, सभा, चैत्य and देवगृह; <F>2:  Ib. IX. ११. २५-34; Br. III. ६३. २१;</F> one of the holy cities. <F>3:  Br. IV. ४०. ९१.</F> City of Rama and Sagara; <F>4:  Br. III. ३७. ३३; ४७. ७५; ४८. 1; ४९. १० and ५८; ५३. 5.</F> also known as शाकेत. <F>5:  Br. III. ५४. ५४.</F> Capital of मध्यदेश of King दिवाकर, famous for रामतीर्थम्; <F>6:  M. १९१. ९३; २७१. 5. Vi. IV. 4. ९७; वा. ९९. २८२.</F> in the nose por- tion of the personified Veda. <F>7:  वा. ८८. २०, ९४; १०४. ८१: १११. ६८.</F>
--a तीर्थम् on the नर्मदा: rids a man of rebirth. M. १९१. ६१.

(I)--a son of Danu; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ३०; Br. III. 6. 5; M. 6. १७; Vi. I. २१. 4.</F> followed वृत्र in his war with Indra; <F>2:  भा. VI. १०. १९.</F> took part in the देवासुर war between Bali and Indra. <F>3:  Ib. VIII. १०. १९.</F> [पगे१-096+ २५]
(II)--Mt. a hill with medicinal herbs. M. १६३. ७१.
(I)--a mother goddess. M. १७९. २९.
(II)--the wife of Vighna. Br. III. ५९. १३; वा. ८४. १३.
(I)--a piece of sacred wood to produce fire for sacrifice. भा. III. २७. २३; IV. १६. ११.
(II)--the wife of द्वैपायन and mother of शुक. Br. III. 8. ७२; १०. ७९-80; वा. ७०. ८४; ९१. ४३.
--father of Udaka and वारुणी. Br. II. ३६. १०४.
--forest deities in the Himalayas. Br. III. २२. २७.
--a measurement of length equal to a cubit. Br. II. १७. २६; III. ११. 7; वा. ४६. २६; ७४. 7.
--a son of अनायुषा and father of the great asura Dhundhu. Br. III. 6. ३१.

--described; <F>1:  Br. II. ३१. ९३-99; M. १०. 6; १४४. ६७.</F> on Vena's death; abundance of thiefs in the kingdom; plants, uncultivation of. <F>2:  Vi. I. १३. ३१, ६७; वा. ९३. ५०; भा. IV. १४. ३७-41.</F> [पगे१-097+ २५]
--आर्षेय pravara (अङ्गिरस्). M. १९६. १०.
--A विघ्ननायक. Br. IV. २७. ८२.
--the son of त्वष्टा. वा. ३३. ५९.
--a son of कृष्ण and भद्रा. भा. X. ६१. १७.
--the son of शिवस्वाति and father of गोमती- putra. भा. XII. 1. २६.
(I)--a son of श्वफल्क and गान्दिनी. भा. IX. २४. १६; Br. III. ७१. १११.
(II)--a son of Upamadgu. Vi. IV. १४. 9.
(III)--a son of Kuru वा. ६२. १२; ९९. २१८.
(I)--a son of गान्दिनी. वा. ९६. ११०.
(II)--a son of Upamadgu. Vi. IV. १४. 9.
--a बृहद्रथ king who ruled for ५० years; with him were ३२ kings commencing with बृहद्रथ altogether a १००० years of rule. Br. III. ७४. १२१; वा. ९९. ३०८. [पगे१-098+ ३२]

(I)--a son of Danu. <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ३०.</F> Took part with Bali in the देवासुर war. <F>2:  Ib. VIII. १०. २२.</F> A दानव with मनुष्य धर्म। <F>3:  वा. ६८. १५.</F> Known for music. <F>4:  वा. ६९. ७३.</F>
(II)--the son of Mitra and रेवती. भा. VI. १८. 6.

(III)--an asura friend of कंस. <F>1:  भा. X. 2. 1; Vi. V. 1. २४; 4. 2; १२. २१.</F> Came once to the व्रज of Nanda in the form of a terrific bull. Gopas and gopis got afraid as also the cattle there; attacked कृष्ण who vanquished him. <F>2:  भा. X. ३६. 1-१६; ४६. २६; II. 7. ३४; Br. III. ७३. १००; IV. २९. १२४; Vi. V. १४ (whole); १५. 1; २९. 4.</F>
(IV)--a son of Vaivasvata Manu. M. ११. ४१; Vi. III. 1. ३३.
(V)--a son of Bali; took part in the तारकामय war. M. १७३. २०; १७७. 7.
(VI)--one of the nine sons of Manu; killed by कृष्ण. वा. ८५. 4; ९८. १००.
--A son of अटमान [पटुमान् (वि। प्।)] and father of हालेय (हालाहल-वि। प्।) भा. XII. 1. २५. Vi. IV. २४. ४६.
(I)--the son of Purujit [Kurujit (वि। प्।)] and father of श्रुतायुस्. भा. IX. १३. २३; Vi. IV. 5. ३१. [पगे१-099+ २८]
(II)--an Asura resident of Tripura. Parti- cipated in the देवासुर war between Bali and Indra. भा. VIII. 6. ३१; १०. २२.
(III)--the Gandharva presiding over the month of पुष्य; <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ४२.</F> called on परीक्षित् practising प्रायोपवेश। <F>2:  Ib. I. १९. 9.</F>
(IV)--(Apratiman) ग्रामणि with the He- manta sun: married four daughters of दक्ष. Br. II. २३. १८; ३७. ४५; M. 5. १३; १४६. १६; वा. ५२. १८; ६३. ४२; ६५. ११२.
(V)--a प्रजापति: <F>1:  Br. III. 1. ५४; वा. ६३. ४२.</F> married the four daughters of दक्ष and became father of १६ children. <F>2:  Vi. I. १५. १०३, १३४.</F>
(VI)--a son of Citraka; daughter Sumati, wife of Sagara. Br. III. ७१. ११५; वा. ८८. १५६, १५९; ९६. ११४.
(VII)--the यक्ष who resides in the sun's chariot during the month of पौष। Vi. II. १०. १४.
--a second wife of Sagara by name Sumati (s.v.); sister of सुपर्ण. Br. III. ६३. १५५; वा. ८८. १५६, १५९.
--served as calf to milk the earth. Br. II. ३७. १७-18.
--a son of the elephant मृग. Br. III. 7. ३३३. [पगे१-100+ २६]
--the mother of eight apsaras. वा. ६९. ४८.

--a daughter of दक्ष, one of कश्यप's wives and mother of Kinnaras and Gandharvas; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. २५, २९; M. 6. 1 and ४५; १४६. १८; वा. ६६. ५५; Vi. I. २१. २५.</F> expert in music. <F>2:  Br. III. 3. ५६; 7. ४६७.</F>
--indicators of death; he who would not see अरुन्धती, Dhruva and the shadow of Soma would not live beyond ११ months; and so on; dreams, interpretation of. वा. ch. १९ (whole).
--one of the two अमिताभ गणस्। वा. १००. १६.
(I)--a son of Danu: <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ३०.</F> the राक्षस with the sun in the months नभ and नभस्य। <F>2:  वा. ५२. १०; Br. II. २३. १०.</F>
(II)--a sage of the eleventh epoch of Manu. भा. VIII. १३. २५.
(III)--The son of हर्यश्व, and father of Tri- bandhana. भा. IX. 7. 4.
(IV)--a son of Mura (s.v.). भा. X. ५९. १२.

(VI)--a hill near (on the other side of-वा। प्।) कैलास, the residence of गिरीश and full of medicinal herbs. At its foot is the शैलोदा lake from which rises the R. शिलोदा on whose bank is the forest सुरभी. Br. II. १८. १८-23; वा. ४७. १७-22.

(VII)--A son of विङता and brother of गरुड. <F>1:  Br. III. 7. २९; M. 6. ३४; १५०. १५१-2; Vi. I. २१. १८.</F> The charioteer of the Sun. He is said to yoke the seven horses bearing the names of metres (छन्दस्)। <F>2:  भा. V. २१. १५-16; वा. २८. ३२; Br. II. ११. ३७.</F> Came to see परीक्षित् practising प्रायोपवेश। <F>3:  भा. I. १९. ११. वा. ६९. ६६.</F> Married गृध्री (श्येनी-वा। प्।) who gave birth to सम्पाति and जटायु; <F>4:  Br. III. 7. ४४६; वा. ६९. ३२६.</F> A personification of Dawn: Image of. <F>5:  M. २६१. 7.</F>
(VIII)--a son of Raivata. M. 9. २१.
(I)--the sons of Dullola. Br. III. 7. ४४३.
(II)--of the क्षत्रियस् of शाल्मलि dvi1pa. Vi. II. 4. ३०.
(I)--R. of प्लक्ष dvi1pa. भा. V. २०. 4.
(II)--an apsaras. Br. III. 7. 5. [पगे१-102+ ३२]
(I)--a son of ब्रह्मा, who remained celibate: <F>1:  भा. IV. 8. 1; VI. १५. १३.</F> a sage. <F>2:  Br. III. ३६. 6.</F>
(II)--went with कृष्ण to मिथिला. भा. X. ८६. १८.
--R. of celestial mango juice flowing from the top of Mandara and irrigating the eastern part of इलावृत. In this river bathe यक्ष damsels, who are attendants of पार्वती. भा. V. १६. १७ and १८.
--a sacred lake in Meru (in the east-वा। प्।) (in इलावृत-वि। प्।). M. ११३. ४६; वा. ३६. १६; Vi. II. 2. २६.
--the son of Setu and father of गान्धार. Br. III. ७४. 7-9; वा. ९९. 7-9.
--a देव of हरित गण। वा. १००. ८८.

(I)--a daughter of Kardama, sister of Par- vata and नारद, (काश्यप) and wife of वसिष्ठ; <F>1:  भा. III. २४. २३; वा. 2. १०; १९. 2; ३०. ७३; ६९. ६५; ७०. ७९.</F> a sur- name of hers was ऊर्जा. Mother of seven sons, Citraketu and others, all sages of renown. <F>2:  भा. IV. 1. ४०.</F> Did not feed कुमार while the wives of other six sages fed him. <F>3:  Br. III. १०. ४०.</F> Mother of शक्ति. Goddess among Satis; meditated on the १०८ names of देवी as narrated to attain fruits of yoga. <F>4:  M. १३. ५३, ६१; १८७. ४५; २०१. ३०.</F> [पगे१-103+ २३]

(II)--a daughter of दक्ष, and one of Dharma's wives: gave birth to पृथिवी and all विषयस्; (gave birth to all earthly objects, वि। प्।). Br. III. 3. 2 and ३४; 7. २८; 8. ८६; M. 5. १५ and १९; २०३. 2; वा. ६६. 2 and ३५; Vi. I. १५. १०५, १०८.
--the people of a Janapada on the other side of the Vindhyas. (अनूपस्--वा। प्।)। M. ११४. ५४; वा. ४५. १३४.
--a daughter of रिष्ट. Br. III. 7. १३; वा. ६९. ४८.
--a son of दनायुष, had a son Dhundhu, killed by कुबलाश्व. वा. ६८. ३०-31.
--the goddess enshrined at वैद्यनाथ. M. १३. ४१.
(I)--a son of Vasu, and a Vasu. Wife वासना. Sons तर्ष and others. भा. III. २१. ५१; VI. 3. १४; 6. ११ and १३.
(II)--the son of Puruja, and father of Bhar- म्याश्व. भा. IX. २१. ३१. [पगे१-104+ २८]
(III)--the son of Vivici Agni; see विविध; he had a number of sons like अनीकवान्, etc. वा. 1. १४५; २९. ४०; Br. II. १२. ४२.
--a name of शनैश्चर. M. ९३. १०.
--a Mauneya Gandharva. Br. III. 7. 2.
--a गण of the पिशाचस्, resembling mon- keys, with residences in trees; short and pushing nature. Br. III. 7. ३८२ and ३९०; वा. ६९. २७१.
--see सूर्यवम्श। Ila was common ancestor. M. १२. १४.
--of kings: to collect taxes in proper seasons, as the sun's rays draw water for 8 months. M. २२६. ११.
--a युगादि for साधारण श्राद्ध। M. १७. 2, 5.
--(see सुवर्चला--Burnouf)

--of Hari. Worship of Hari's image is said to promote one's welfare. Some special places devoted to. This form is prevalent even in त्रेता युग; <F>1:  भा. VII. १४. २८-40.</F> to be worshipped in the पयोव्रत। <F>2:  Ib. VIII. १६. २८.</F> अर्चा is राजस। Mere idol worship condemned. When proper; <F>3:  Ib. III. २९. 9, २१-25</F> अर्चा may be of gold, silver, [पगे१-105+ ३२] of earth or water or other substance. <F>4:  Ib. IV. 8. ५६.</F> उपासना of, a means to concentration on the Absolute. <F>5:  Ib. XI. २०. २४.</F> Worship may be offer- ed on the ground, fire, sun, waters, ब्राह्मण or any other thing. Image of eight kinds including stone, wood and metal; may be moveable or immoveable. The mode in worship. Subsidiary worship to the ornaments, imple- ments and attendants on Hari. Founding a shrine, flower- garden and instituting festivals form part of the worship. <F>6:  Ib. XI. २७. 9-४३,</F> Only people of little तपस् are engaged in अर्चा, this being regarded inferior to worshipping Brahman. <F>7:  Ib. X. ८४. १०; ८६. ५५.</F>
--founding of shrines is a form of भक्ति to Hari. भा. XI. ११. ३८.

(I)--the female child born from the arms of Vena, churned by the sages. An अंश of लक्ष्मी, and a queen of पृथु. <F>1:  भा. IV. १५. 5-6.</F> Follows पृथु to the forest and at his death performs सति, evoking praise from goddesses. <F>2:  Ib. IV. २३. १९-28.</F>
(II)--Wife of क्र्शाश्व and mother of धूम्र- केश. भा. VI. 6. २०.
--a daughter of सारण. Br. III. ७१. १६८; वा. ९६. १६६.

(I) (कार्तवीर्य)--son of कृतवीर्य. Lord of seven islands and of हैहयष्, सम्राट् and चक्रवर्तिन्। By the grace of Hari he got १००० arms and enjoyed अष्ट- ऐश्वर्यस्। Learnt the merit of योग from दत्तात्रेय. Ruled in peace for ८५,000 years <F>1:  भा. IX. १५. १७-19; २३. २४-27; Br. III. ३०. 4. ७५; ६९. 9, ४९, ५६; Vi. IV. ११. ११-21; M. ४३. १५; वा. ९४. १०.</F> and was ambitious to have more territorial possessions. <F>2:  भा. XII. 3. 9; I. १२. २१.</F> Was engaged in water-sports with women wearing the garland of Vaijayanti. <F>3:  भा. IX. १५. २०.</F> Imprisoned रावण in his capital माहिष्मती and released him on an appeal from Pulasya. <F>4:  भा. IX. १५. २१-22; Br. III. ३३. ५०; M. ४३. ३७-40;</F> In the course of a hunting expedi- tion, he came to the hermitage of Jamadagni who enter- tained him with the help of his कामधेनु. The king, envious of the sage's prosperity, desired its possession, and on being refused by the sage, he took the cow by force. <F>5:  भा. IX. १५. २३-26; Br. III. २६. 7 whole chapter, chaps. २७ and २८; ३०. 4.</F> परसुराम who was away, heard the story on his return, went to Arjuna's capital, cut off his head with his axe after a terrible battle in which मत्स्यराज took part and recovered the cow and the calf. <F>6:  भा. IX. १५. २७-36; Br. III. ३०. 5-१५; ३२. ६१; ३८ 8, २७; ४०. १९; ४१, ३७, ३८; ४४. १४; ४७. ६३, ८८.</F> Jamadagni regretted his son's action as the king was a नरदेव, and killing him was an offence greater than ब्राह्मनिचिदे. <F>7:  भा. IX. १५. ३७-41; Br. III. ३८. 8.</F> Had १००० (?) sons, (१०० sons) all of whom except five died in battles. These sons killed Jamadagni when राम and his brothers were gone out. <F>8:  M. ४३. ४६-51;</F> These five were great warriors. <F>9:  भा. IX. १६. 9-१२.</F> His minister was the evil Candragupta and the पुरोहित, Garga. <F>१०:  Br. III. २८. ३१-63.</F> Incarnation of विष्णु Cakra; <F>११:  Br. III. ३७. २७-28; ४०. ६६.</F> to his family belonged तालजङ्घ; <F>१२:  वा. ९४. ५०.</F> performed thousands of यज्ञस् with golden यूपस् and वेदिस्, which were attended by gods. A राजऋषि, पशुपाल, क्षेत्रपाल. <F>१३:  M. ४३. १३-25.</F> Defeated कर्कोटक's son at माहिष्मती and established his city on the banks of the Nar- मदा. Could control the waters of the नर्मदा and the fury of the ocean: a terror to Asuras in पाताल as also to राक्षसस् and Uragas. Defeated रावण and released [पगे१-107+ ४०] him at the intervention of Pulastya: burnt down the Hema- तालवनम्, residence of आपव and was cursed that a भार्- gava and a ब्राह्मण would chop off his १००० hands. <F>१४:  M. ४३. २५-43; वा. ९४. 9-२४.</F> A गाथ in his honour by नारद. <F>१४: (a) Vi. IV. ११. १६.</F> Once आदित्य in the guise of a ब्राह्मण asked to be fed at the expense of all im- mobile things (स्थावर) in the world and it was granted. This included आपव's hermitage also. <F>१५:  Br. III. ७०. 3-१०; M. ४४. 3-१३.</F> Performed the सौभाग्यशयन-व्रतम् and made the १६ gifts. <F>१६:  M. ६०. ४९.</F>
(II)--a son of Raivata Manu. भा. VIII. 5. 2.

(III)--a पाण्डव, son of Indra and कुन्ती and father of श्रुतकीर्ति. Had a son इरावान् by उलूपि and another son बब्रुवाहन by the daughter of मणिपुरपति. Father of Abhimanyu by सुभद्रा. <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. २९-33; Br. III. ७१. १५४ and १७८; Vi. IV. १४. ३५; २०. ४०; V. १२. १७-24; ३५. २८.</F> Promised द्रौपदी to cut off अश्वथाम's head and place it before her for his killing her sons when asleep. अश्वथाम heard this and ran for escape. Arjuna pursued him. Unwilling to slay the son of his preceptor, he bound him with ropes and took him to his queen's presence. She requested Arjuna to release him on the ground that he was a ब्राह्मण, a son of the guru, and for the sake of his old mother गौतमी. भीम was not for the release. But Arjuna took the hint from कृष्ण, and after depriving him of his crest-jewel, banished him. <F>2:  भा. I. 7. १५-57.</F> Accompanied युधिष्ठिर to see भीष्म on the eve of his death. <F>3:  Ib. I. 9. 3.</F> A playmate of कृष्ण. <F>4:  Ib. X. २२. ३१.</F> Had a chariot with monkey standard. When he was once in the forest with कृष्ण, they met कालिन्दी, daughter of the Sun god anxious to marry कृष्ण. When Arjuna burnt खाण्डव, कृष्ण was his charioteer. Drove away the princes who attacked [पगे१-108+ ४६] कृष्ण returning with सत्या of कोशल. <F>5:  Ib. X. ५८. 4, १३-25, ५४.</F> Commended by Indra to कृष्ण's protection. <F>6:  Ib. X. [६७ (V) ३६]; Vi. V. १३. १७-18.</F> Consoled by कृष्ण when banished to the forest. <F>7:  भा. X. ६४. 9.</F> A great name among the Kurus. <F>8:  Ib. X. ६८. २८.</F> Joy at कृष्ण's visit to Indraprastha. By burning the forest he released Maya and enjoyed कृष्ण's company. Went to the eastern countries. Went again with कृष्ण and भीम disguised as a ब्राह्मण to Girivraja. Revealed himself before जरासन्ध who thought that he was not his equal. Returned after जरासन्ध's fall. <F>9:  Ib. X. ७१. २२-30, ४५-46; ७२. १३-16, २९ and ३२; ७३. ३१ and ३४.</F> Entertained elders at the राजसूय of Yudhisthira. On seeing the enemy's army in the battle-field, his teachers, kith and kin among them, he expressed to कृष्ण his reluctance to fight them. कृष्ण taught him the truth (गीता), showed him his विश्वरूप and roused him to action. He fought, कृष्ण serving as charioteer. <F>१०:  Ib. X. ७५. 5; [७८. (V), २१-25]; XI. १६. 6-8.</F> Victory due to कृष्ण. <F>११:  Ib. IX. २४. ६७.</F> Heard of Abhimanyu's death and vowed to kill Jaya- dratha the following day, which he did. <F>१२:  Ib. X. ७८. [३१-35].</F> Was taken by कृष्ण to कैलास where शिव blessed him. Took part in the स्वयम्वरम् of लक्ष्मणा. His arrow touched the fish target but did not hit it. <F>१३:  Ib. X. ८३. २४.</F> In the course of his pilgri- mage he heard at प्रभास that his uncle's daughter Subha- द्रा was being proposed by बलराम to Duryodhana. He wished to marry her, and with this object spent four months in द्वारक as त्रिदण्डी ascetic. At this time राम invited him one day for भिक्षा। When he and सुभद्रा met, both exchanged their love by their eyes. On a day of festive occasion सुभद्रा came out, when Arjuna carried her off in a chariot with the approval of कृष्ण. राम protested but कृष्ण pacified him. Finally राम sent presents to his sister. <F>१४:  Ib. X. ८६. 1-१२.</F> On a visit to स्यमन्तपञ्चक. <F>१५:  Ib. X. ८४. ५७.</F> Once a ब्राह्मण of द्वारक preferred a complaint during कृष्ण's अश्वमेध that his children died imme- diately after their birth. Arjuna offered to recover them [पगे१-109+ ४५] for him, though कृष्ण had his own doubt. Accompanying the ब्राह्मण, Arjuna guarded the delivery room. The child was born and soon died. At this Arjuna went to Indra's place, and Yama's, and to the abodes of all gods, with the resolution to fall in a fire in case he did not rescue the child. Unable to recover it, Arjuna was about to plunge into the flames when कृष्ण prevented him. He was taken to the abode of नारायण and all the children were recovered. Returned to द्वारका to attend कृष्ण's अश्वमे- ध, after bringing joy to the ब्राह्मण. <F>१६:  Ib. X. ८९. २२-64.</F> Other exploits of Arjuna were defeating Indra at खाण्डव, pleasing शिव in किरात's disguise, and vanquishing निवातकवचस्. <F>१७:  Ib. X. ८९. ३४ [4-5]; M. 6. २९.</F> Went once to Heaven to please Indra, when he slew single- handed ६०,000 दानवस् who obstructed यज्ञस्। <F>१८:  भा. VI. 6. ३६.</F> Went to द्वारका to see his relations. Was advised to take यादवस् to Indraprastha as द्वारका was about to be swallowed by the sea. Performed the last rites to the dead in द्वारका, and took the remainder to his place. Was defeated by rob- bers and आभिरस् after the departure of कृष्ण to Heaven. Informed युधिष्ठिर of कृष्ण's departure to Heaven and of his great sorrow, and also of the almost end of the यादव stock. Crowned Vajra king. <F>१९:  Ib. I. १२. ३६; १४, 1 and २२; १५. 5-२७ and ३२; XI. ३०. ४७-48; ३१. २१-25; M. ७०. १२. Vi. V. ३८. 5-6, १२-24, ३४-36.</F> Arjuna knew and realised the माया of हरि। <F>२०:  भा. II. 7. ४५.</F> Observed the आदित्यशयनम् vow. Visited the वामन temple at कुरुक्षेत्र during his तीर्थ- यात्रा and asked शौनक to narrate the circumstances of that अवतार् after वाराह. <F>२१:  M. ५५. ३२: २४४. 4.</F> Was asked by व्यास to per- form penance expelling death. <F>२२:  Vi. V. ३८. ३७-92.</F> Put down the prowess of कार्तवीर्य by the curse of आपव. <F>२३:  वा. ९४. ४५; ९९. २८०; Br. III. ६९. ४६.</F> Known as पार्थ, Dhanamjaya, जिष्णु.
--The reference is to both पाण्डव Arjuna and कार्तवीर्य Arjuna, both noted for military prowess. परीक्षित् is compared to them. भा. I. १२. २१. [पगे१-110+ ३१]
--a तीर्थ sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ४३.
--a son of शमीका and सुदामिनी. भा. IX. २४. ४४.
--(Arbuda, Wilson); a sacred place. (?) Vi. VI. 8. २९.
--four in number, पृथ्वी, अन्तरिक्ष, दिव्य and मह। वा. १०१. १३.

--born of धर्म and बुद्धि: <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ५१; I. 2. 9.</F> Its ills; <F>2:  भा. XI. २३. १७-21.</F> not to be earned by a king by illegitimate means and not to abuse it by giving it to undesirables. <F>3:  M. २२०. ११; वा. २३. ८१; ६१. १३०.</F>
--a Janapada. वा. ४५. १११.

--one of the १८ विद्यस्: <F>1:  Br. II. ३१. २३; ३५. ८९; वा. ५८. २३; ६१. ७९.</F> Science of Polity pleaded by Indra in extenuation of his destruction of Diti's गर्भ: <F>2:  M. 7. ६३; १०. ३२; Vi. III. 6. २८.</F> No regard for the शास्त्र during पृथु's reign: Budha learned in; <F>3:  M. २४. 2.</F> to be learnt by a prince. <F>4:  M. १४४. २३; २२०. 2.</F>
--the son of साध्य गण। भा. VI. 6. 7.

--from हिरण्यगर्भ: two parts, male and female; the male half divided into eleven parts called Rudras by crying and running (oozing); each became a गणेश्वर; the female half came to be divided into two, शुक्ल (right) and कृष्ण (left); from her came प्रज्ञा and श्री and these in turn spread over the whole world in thousand ways. वा. 9. ७५-98; ४१. ३६.
--शिव became this by worshipping शक्ति: <F>1:  Br. II. २७. ९८; IV. 5. ३०; ४४. ४८.</F> Image of; with details of dress and ornaments. <F>2:  M. ६०. २५; १९२. २८; २६०. 1-१०.</F>
--आत्रेय गोत्रकरस्। M. १९७. 3.
--one of the seven sons of वसिष्ठ. वा. २८. ३६.
--one of the four sons of the ३३र्द् Kalpa. वा. २३. ५९.
--one of the ten पीठस् for images. This yields one a number of sons. M. २६२. 7 and ११, १८.
--the द्विजस् of: became व्रात्यस् after Puram- jaya's days: <F>1:  भा. XII. 1. ३८.</F> a western kingdom sacred to ललिता. <F>2:  Br. II. १६. ६२; IV. ४४. ९४.</F>
--a tribe, of the south, fought with their kins- men and ended themselves. <F>1:  भा. XI. ३०. १८; M. ११४. ५१; वा. ४५. १३१.</F> Country of. <F>2:  Vi. II. 3. १६.</F> [पगे१-112+ ३५]
--the R. sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ३८.
--the son of अजातशत्रु and the father of Uda- yana. Vi. IV. २४. १५-16.

(I)--an आदित्य, and a son of Aditi: named मातृका: sons were चषणिस्. <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ३९-42; Br. III. 3. ६७; II. २४. ३३ and ४०; M. १२६. 3; १२७. २३; १७१. ५६; २२५. १२; वा. ६२. १८६; ६६. ६६; ११०. १०; Vi. I. १५. १३०.</F> Acted for one hundred years as the Lord of Death when Yama was cursed to be a शूद्र for that period. <F>2:  भा. I. १३. १५.</F> Identified with Hari; <F>3:  भा. XI. १६. १५.</F> to be worshipped in houses and palace buildings; <F>4:  M. २५३. ३०: २६८. २४.</F> one of the hinder legs of शिशुमार. <F>5:  Vi. II. १२. ३२.</F>
(II)--The name of the sun in the month of माधव (वैशाख)। भा. XII. ११. ३४; वा. ५२. 2, ९४; Vi. II. १०. 5; V. १८. ५६.
(III)--a chief पितृ who worships कूर्म- Hari in हिरण्मय। <F>1:  भा. V. १८. २९.</F> Served as calf for पितृस् to milk कव्य from the earth. <F>2:  Ib. IV. १८. १८.</F>
(IV)--represents the thigh of the शिसुमार planet; south of, is पितृयानम्। Br. II. २३. १०३: २५. १११.
--represented by the two फाल्गुनिस् and मघा. वा. ६६. ४९. [पगे१-113+ २५]
--the name of a मुहूर्त of a day. Br. III. 3. ४०; M. ७९. 6; वा. ६६. ४१.
--the son of Pulaha and क्षमा and one of the seven sages of the Svarocisa epoch. Br. II. ३६. १८; Vi. I. १०. १०.
--An आत्रेय and a sage. Br. II. ३२. ११३.
--the २५थ् Vedavya1sa. Br. II. ३५. १२३.
--the fifth world of शर्कर earth: resi- dence of Virocana and other daityas. Br. II. २०. १२ and १४. ३५ and ३८.
--Dhanvantri called such by विष्णु. वा. ९२. १४.
--the lower current, full of three qualities, eight stars, सिद्धिस् and men; this is known as तैजस सर्ग। वा. 6. ५३-6.
--one of the seven important rays of the sun; योनि of बृहस्पति. Br. II. २४. ६७; वा. ५३. ४५. ४९.
--a name of शिव. वा. ९७. १७२.
--a group of people defending द्वारका, and related to पाण्डवस्. भा. I. ११. ११; १४. २५. [पगे१-114+ ३२]
--An attendant on Hari. भा. II. 9. १४.
(I)--a king of Konka, Venka, and कुटक led astray by the teachings of ऋषभ. Gave up his स्वधर्म and adopted the path of heretics. भा. V. 6. 9.
(II)--a name of शिव. Br. III. ७२. १७३.
--the Asuras who performed penance on the नर्मदा, were deluded by विष्णु मायामोह to give up Vedic path and take to other non-Vedic doctrines. Vi. III. १८. १३.
--a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३३. 4.

--The R. in कैलास: a branch of गङ्गा issuing out of the city of ब्रह्मा descends the southern slopes of Meru. Her course can be traced from the Gan- धमादन. Traversing the हेमकूट and Himalayas as also the continent of Bharata and dividing itself into seven branches it enters the sea on the south. A bath in this stream is equal to performing अश्वमेधस् and other sacri- fices. A महानदी: borne by शिव on his head for more than a hundred years: Elevated Sagara's sons to heaven. भा. IV. 6. २४; V. १७. 5 and 9; IX. २९. ४२; Br. III. ४१. २१; ५६. १२; Vi. II. 2. ३४, ३६; 8. ११३-20; वा. ४१. १८. ४२. २५-35; १०८. ८०.

--the city of यक्षस् in कैलास. Capital of Kubera. <F>1:  Br. II. १८. 2; III. 7. १६३; वा. ४७. 1; भा. IV. 6. २३.</F> पुरूरवस् and उर्वशी sported here for a time; <F>2:  वा. ९१. 6; Br. III. ६६. 6; Vi. IV. 6. ४८.</F> as seen by भार्गव Ra1ma. <F>3:  Br. III. ४१. १८-23.</F> [पगे१-115+ २६]
--a daughter of इरा, and mother of trees. Br. III. 7. ४६०-1.

--depend on वर्ण, स्थानयोग and नाट्य: Three places of origin--neck, head and mind: 4 वर्णस्, eight विकल्पस्, and sixteen deities: Different kinds of, described: <F>1:  Br. III. ६२. 2-२३.</F> ३०० varieties distinguished. <F>2:  वा. ८७. 1-3, १०-21.</F>
--a mindborn mother. M. १७९. २२.
--an Apsaras. Br. III. 7. 6; IV. ३३. १८; वा. ६९. 5.
--the queen of तृणबिन्दु; <F>1:  Br. III. 8. ३७; भा. IX. 2. ३१.</F> an apsaras and mother of विशाल. <F>2:  Vi. IV. 1. ४८-9.</F>
(I)--a pupil of दत्तात्रेय: a sage who realised the force of हरिमाया। भा. I. 3. ११; II. 7. ४४.

(II)--a son of Dyumat, and father of Sannati. He retained his youth and ruled for ६६,000 years. The ब्र्। पुराण and the विष्णु पुराण make him the son respectively [पगे१-116+ २८] of Vatsa and Pratardana, and father of Sannati. <F>1:  Br. III. ६७. ६९, ७२; Vi. IV. 8. १६-18; भा. IX. १७. 6-8.</F> A राजऋषि of काशी; attained longevity through the grace of लोपामुद्रा. Killed the राक्षस Ks2emaka and recovered his capital. Two ancient verses in his praise. <F>2:  M. १८०. ६८-9; वा. ९२. ६६-8.</F>
--a deity. Br. IV. २७. ३८.
--gourds unfit for श्राद्ध। Vi. III. १६. 8.
--the gourd-vessel of the नागस् to milk the earth cow. Br. II. ३६. २१३; M. १०. १९.
--a काद्रवेय na1ga. Br. III. 7. ३५.
--the son of गोमतीपुत्र and the father of शान्तकर्ण. Vi. IV. २४. ४७-8.
--attained by वृत्र. भा. VI. १२. ३५; Br. II. १९. १५३.
--a god of Sumedhas group. Br. II. ३६. ५९.
(I)--a son of वृकदेवी and Vasudeva. M. ४६. १८.
(II)--a son of Citrasena. वा. ९६. २४८. [पगे१-117+ ३१]
--one of २८ hells, intended for those who confine beings in dark holes, granaries, etc. भा. V. २६. 7 and ३४.
--R. in भारतवर्ष. भा. V. १९. १८.
--of Hari, innumerable. कृष्ण is the Lord himself. Metaphysics of. भा. I. 3. २६ and २८, ३०-39.

--the friend who accompanied पुरञ्जन to the Saurabha kingdom, through the entrances Nalini and नालिनि. <F>1:  भा. IV. २५. ४८.</F> Allegorically sense of smell. <F>2:  Ib. IV. २९. ११.</F> Taught spiritual wisdom to Yadu. <F>3:  Ib. XI. 7. २४-9.</F>
--a Pratardana god. Br. II. ३६. ३०.
--a ceremonial in a श्राद्धा। M. १७. ४७.
--on the other side of the Vindhyas. वा. ४५. १३४.

--Here lived सान्दीपनि of काशी; <F>1:  भा. X. ४५. ३१; ५८. ३०; Vi. V. २१. १९.</F> also Avan- तिका; <F>2:  Br. IV. ४०. ९१.</F> one of the seven great cities. One of its kings married राजाधिदेवी and became father of Vinda and Anuvinda. <F>3:  Vi. IV. १४. ४३; भा. X. ५८. ३१; वा. ९६. १५७.</F> Capital of the sons of कार्तवीर्य Arjuna. <F>4:  वा. ९४. ५०.</F> The navel of the Veda पुरुष. <F>5:  वा. १०४. ७६.</F> [पगे१-118+ ३४]

(I) (च्)--a kingdom: Here there was a ब्राह्मण miser who lost all his wealth and the love of his kith and kin, and who became ultimately an ascetic. Though ill- treated by the public as a thief, he never took notice of it, and ever meditating on Hari, attained release. <F>1:  भा. XI. २३. 6-६२.</F> The dvijas of, became व्रात्यस् after Puramjaya's days. <F>2:  Ib. XII. 1. ३८.</F> The people of, were enlisted by जरासन्ध against the Yadus. <F>3:  Ib. X. [५० (V) 3]; XI. २३. 6.</F> Here is महाकालवन where Rudra vanquished An- dhaka who sought to abduct पार्वती; <F>4:  M. १७९. 5.</F> ruled by शूद्रस् and आभीरस्. <F>5:  Vi. IV. २४. ६८; भा. XII. 1. ३८.</F>
(II)--a R. from the पारियात्र, of the भारत- वर्ष. Br. II. १६. २९; वा. ४५. ९८; M. ११४. २४.
--a तीर्थ sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ३३.

--a Vindhya tribe: attacked परशुराम and were defeated; Jayadhvaja established at; one of the five गणस् of Haihayas; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ६५; III. ३९. ११; ६९. ५० and ५२; M. ४३. ४६; ११४. ५४.</F> a king of, married आहुकी, sister of आहुक. <F>2:  Br. III. ७१. १२८; M. ४४. ७०.</F>
--a son of Arjuna (कार्तवीर्य). M. ४३. ४६.
--the son of अङ्गिरस. वा. ६५. १००.
--the concluding bath of a sacrifice; <F>1:  Br. I. 2. २४; वा. १०३. ४०-42.</F> of of Soma. <F>2:  M. २३. २३; वा. ९०. २६.</F>
--the city of आभीरस्. भा. XII. 1. २९.
--a chief monkey. Br. III. 7. २३७.
--a Pratardana god. Br. II. ३६. ३०.
--one of the nine sons of सावर्णि. वा. १००. २१.
--a son of Gaya and गयन्ती. भा. V. १५. १४.
--a variety of रोहण Varn2a in music. वा. ८७. 7.
--A श्रुतर्षि. Br. II. ३३. 5.
--the Agni-अच्छावाक at भुवस्थानम्. वा. २९. २८.
--a mindborn mother. M. १७९. २६.
--the son of Karamdhama and father of Marutta. भा. IX. 2. २६; Vi. IV. 1. ३०-31. [पगे१-120+ २५]
--Marutta, different from Marutta of Turva- su's line. वा. ९९. 2.
--goats and sheep born of भद्रा. Br. III. 3. ७५.
--a son of Anila. Br. III. 3. २६.
--a Vasava, and a son of Ana(i)la-ईशान and शिव. M. 5. २५; वा. ६६. २५; Br. II. १०. ८०; Vi. I. १५. ११४.
--a territorial division of शाल्मलि-dvi1pa. (अभिज्ञातम्--Burnouf) भा. V. २०. 9.
--the son of Janamejaya; conquered the eastern region. वा. ९९. १२०.
--of five degrees--तामिस्र, अन्धतामिस्र, तम, मोह, and महातम। भा. III. २०. १८.
--पञ्चपर्व; precedes creation. वा. 6. ३७.
(I)--the seventh hell under the earth. वा. १०१. १७९.
(II)--a hell under the earth. Br. IV. 2. १८२ and १८६. [पगे१-121+ २६]
--हिरण्यकशिपु as. Br. III. 5. २१.
(I)--the name which Benares got after शिव and उमा made it their residence. In Kaliyuga his original form disappears. Br. III. ६७. ६० and ६३.
--भूतादि covered by शब्द; both by स्पर्श; the three by रूप, these four by रस and all the five by गन्ध। वा. 4. ५८.
--one of the २८ hells--a structure with no support to stand on. Here are punished false witnesses and wrong givers of gifts. भा. V. २६. 7 and २८.
--a hell. Vi. I. 6. ४१.
--the fifth hell under the earth; torture by machinery. वा. १०१. १७९, १८२; ११२. ११. [पगे१-122+ २९]

--another term for प्रकृति; shines like fire- fly; overlordship consisting of Brahma, विष्णु, सूर्य and शिव. These are to be worshipped with no difference, by means of fire and ब्राह्मणस्. <F>2:  Br. III. १०. ३७; M. ५२. २२.</F> One form of Brahman; also प्रधानम्, कारणम्। <F>3:  Vi. I. 2. १५, १८-22.</F> ^1 M. 3. १५; १४५. ७३; वा. ३४. ३७; १०१. ११५; १०२. ३१, ३४, ९५; १०३. ११-12, २८, ३६.
(I)--a son of भृगु, and a deva. Br. III. 1. ९०; M. १९५. १३.
(II) (पौलस्त्य)--a sage of the Raucya epoch. Br. IV. 1. १०२.
(III)--An Ajitadeva. वा. ६७. ३४.
(IV)--a sage of the XIIIth epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. ४०.
--the queen of Bali, and mother of बाण and other sons. भा. VI. १८. १७.
--creation of, by ब्रह्मा. वा. 9. ५२; Br. II. 8. ५४.
--a mother goddess. M. १७९. २९.
--८००० मण्डलस् traversed by the sun in a year. Its own मण्डल in one day. वा. ५२. ४६.

--offering worship to Hari sleep- ing with His consort in the milk ocean, on the black half of the श्रावण month, second day, with ritual, dancing and music. Gifts of bed, food, lights, etc., conduce to happiness in married life and the attainment of विष्णुलोक। M. ७१. 5-२०.
--a कुलपर्वत of the केतुमाल. वा. ४४. 4.
--In Tripuram. Here ययाति built a house for शर्मिष्ठा, servant maid of his queen देवयानी. M. ३१. 2 & १०; १३०. १६; वा. ३८. ६८.

--son of बिन्दुसार (वारिसार-भा।). <F>1:  भा. XII. 1. १३-14; Vi. IV. २४. ३०.</F> The Maurya king who ruled for ३६ years; २६ years (वा। प्।)। Father of सुयशस्. <F>2:  Br. III. ७४, १४५; वा. ९९. ३३२; Vi. IV. २४. ३०.</F>

--a क्षेत्रज son of कल्माषपाद (Mitrasaha- वि।) born of मदयन्ती, queen of सौदास, to वसिष्ठ, with the king's assent. The period of pregnancy lasted for seven years when वसिष्ठ bit the queen's stomach with a stone. Father of मूलक. भा. IX. 9. ३९-40; Br. III. ६३. १७७; वा. ८८. १७७; Vi. IV. 4. ७२-3.
--the people of a southern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ५८; M. २७२. १६.
--the mother of शूर. Br. III. ७१. १४५ & १८९. [पगे१-124+ २५]
--the goddess following भवमालिनी. M. १७९. ७१.
--a त्रयार्षेय; not to have marital rela- tions with विश्वामित्र and वञ्जुलि. M. १९८. १३.
--the chief minister of शन्तनु; made certain ascetics teach देवापि heretical doctrines (अश्मसारिओ --Cal. edn.). Vi. IV. २०. २१.
(I)--an अवतार् of Hari. भा. X. 2. ४०.
(II)--a Satya god, and a progenitor. Br. II. ३६. ३५; III. ११. ७६.
(III)--a son of खशा and a राक्षस. Br. III. 7. १३६.
(IV)--a horse of the moon's chariot. वा. ५२. ५३.
(V)--a son of Citraka. वा. ९६. ११४.
(I)--a class of people similar to चण्डालस्. भा. X. २४. २८.
(II)--created from the feet of the Lord; <F>1:  Vi. I. 5. ४९.</F> horses of ताम्रा line. <F>2:  Vi. I. २१. १७.</F> [पगे१-125+ ३२]
--a place fit for श्राद्ध offering. M. १५. ३३.
--music, with अश्विनि as deity. वा. ८६. ६४.
(I)--a दानव. Br. III. 6. १०.
(II)--a son of Citraka. Br. III. ७१. ११४; वा. ९६. ११३.
--son of Jayadratha. M. ४९. ४९.

(I)--a chief नाग of पाताल; a thousand hood- ed snake in the प्रजापतिक्षेत्र in प्रयाग on the banks of the यमुना; <F>1:  भा. V. २४. ३१; M. 6. २९; १०४. 5; १०६. २७; ११०. 8.</F> used in the chariot of त्रिपुरारि; <F>2:  M. १३३. २०.</F> presides over the month of ऊर्ज; <F>3:  भा. XII. ११. ४४.</F> A काद्रवेय Na1ga. <F>4:  Br. II. २०. २३; २३. २१; III. 7. ३३; Vi. I. २१. २१.</F> A नाग of the Sutalam; <F>5:  वा. ५०. २३.</F> resides in the sun's chariot during Phalguna. <F>6:  Vi. II. १०. १८.</F>
(II)--heard the विष्णु पुराण from Vatsa and narrated it to Kambala. Vi. VI. 8. ४६.
--created by ब्रह्मा from his feet. Vi. I. 5. ४९.
--sacred to पितृस् on the नर्मदा. M. २२. ७१; १९४. 3. [पगे१-126+ ३६]

(I)--the sacred tree under which कृष्ण is said to have sat in contemplation on the eve of his departure to Heaven. <F>1:  भा. III. 4. 3 & 8; Br. III. ११. ३५ & १०९; १३. २९; IV. ४३. १७; वा. ३५. ३३; ९१. ४४.</F> Growing out of शमि tree; by attrition पुरूरवस् created fire and made it threefold for sacrificial purposes. <F>2:  Vi. IV. 6. ८५-94.</F>
(II)--the तीर्थ sacred to वन्दनीय. M. १३. ५१.
(III)--a follower of माया. M. १७९. ६९.
--the Bodhi tree. वा. १११. २७.

(I)--son of द्रोण and गौतमी. (कृपि- वि। प्।). Killed the sons of द्रौपदी while asleep thinking that it would please his master. Fought with Arjuna, was defeated and taken prisoner. Roused द्रौपदी's pity in that state and was released after being deprived of his crown and hair. <F>1:  भा. I. 7. १४-52; Vi. IV. १९. ६८.</F> Hit the infant in the womb of Uttara with ब्रह्मशिरस्। कृष्ण's protection of परीक्षित् in the womb from अश्वथामन्'s arrow, and of Arjuna from अश्वथा- man's arrows. <F>2:  भा. I. 8. १२; १२. 1; १५. १६; १६. १५.</F> Destroyed the Kurus by his ब्रह्मास्त्र। <F>3:  भा. IX. २२. ३४.</F> In Duryodhana's army. Survived कुरुक्षेत्र war. <F>4:  भा. X. ७८. [९५. (V) १६]; ८०[2].</F> A sage of the first epoch of शावर्ण Manu <F>5:  वा. १००. १२; M. 9. ३२.</F> hurled ब्रह्मास्त्र when परीक्षित् was in his mother's womb. <F>6:  Vi. IV. २०. ५२.</F>
(II)--(द्रोणपुत्र) becomes a sage of the 8th manvantara. भा. VIII. १३. १५. [पगे१-127+ ३५]
(III)--a son of अश्विनी and अक्रूर. M. ४५. ३२.
--the king of Madras; issueless sacrificed to goddess सावित्री and was blessed with a daughter of that name. M. २०८. 5-११.
--a दानव. Br. III. 6. १५.
--a son of Citraka. वा. ९६. ११३.
--a horse-faced image on the figure of God of Love. M. २६१. ५३.
--a group of people, perhaps Gandhar- vas; <F>1:  Br. III. २२. ५६; M. 4. ५३; वा. ४७. ५७; ६९. ३१.</F> kingdom of. <F>2:  M. १२१. ५८.</F>

--Thrice performed by युधिष्ठिर. <F>1:  भा. I. 8. 6; १०. 2. [1]; १२. ३४.</F> One hundred performed by Bali; <F>2:  Ib. VIII. १५. ३४.</F> of अम्बरीष where वसिष्ठ and Gautama were present. <F>3:  Ib. IX. 4. २२.</F> Thrice performed by परीक्षित्. <F>4:  Ib. I. १६. 3.</F> Performed by अङ्ग when gods did not respond to his call. <F>5:  Ib. IV. १३. २५.</F> A hundred were performed by पृथु. But in the last Indra stole away the horse. <F>6:  Ib. IV. १६. २४; १९, 1.</F> Performed by Indra. <F>7:  Ib. VI. १३. १८-20; Br. II. ३०. १०; M. १४३. 6-२६.</F> Per- formed by कृष्ण at द्वारका. The sacrificial horse was sent out with a number of warriors to watch its course. All [पगे१-128+ ४०] kings including the पाण्डवस् attended the sacrifice. In the course of the sacrifice a ब्राह्मण complained of the death of his children immediately after birth. At this Arjuna (s.v.) offered to give succour and recovered them with कृष्ण's aid, from नारायण's abode. नारायण said that he took the children as a means to see कृष्ण and Arjuna in their human form. The अवभृत of the sacrifice was cele- brated in the यमुना. <F>8:  भा. X. ८९. २२-64.</F> A remedy for brahmicide. <F>9:  Ib. VI. १३. 6-9.</F> Per- formed by शूद्र kings in Kali age; <F>१०:  Br. II. ३१. ६७; M. १४४. ४३.</F> of other kings; <F>११:  Br. II. ३४. २४; III. 5. 7; 7. २६८; ११. १३-16; ६४. १७; ६८. २६; ७०. २४ and २७; ७१. ११९; ७२. २८; IV. १२. ३१.</F> of इक्ष्वाकु, of दक्ष, of सुयज्ञ, of Nala, of शतानीक of पुरू- ravas; <F>१२:  M. १२. १०; १२. १५; ४४, २३ and ६४; २४. १०; वा. १०५. १०. ३२; १११. १७, ५१; ११२. ३१-2.</F> equal to going to गया, bath in the प्रयाग and Ganges, कोटिहोम, ग्रहबलि, etc. <F>१३:  M. २२. 6; २८. 6; ५३. १५; ५८. ५४; १०६. २९; १८३. ७१ and ८०.</F> १०० of them performed by Somadatta; <F>१४:  Vi. IV. 1. ५६.</F> as efficacious as reading the विष्णु पुराण; <F>१५:  Vi. VI. 8. २८ & ३४.</F> performed by other sages. <F>१६:  वा. २०. १६; ३२. ५२; ३०. २९१; ५०. २२१; ५७. ५२; ६०. २३; ६७. ५०, ५३-8; ७१. ७७; ७५. ६०, ७५; ९९. ४५६; १०४. ८४; भा. IX. २२. ३९.</F>
--the son of सहस्रानीक and father of असीमकृष्ण. भा. IX. २२. ३९.
--the son of शतानीक and father of अधिसीमकृष्ण. Vi. IV. २१. 5-6; वा. ९९. २५७.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८९.
a मन्वन्तरादि for श्राद्- ध। M. १७. 6. [पगे१-129+ २३]
--a son of Citraka. Br. III. ७१. ११४.
--was taught to ऋतुपर्ण by Nala; also अश्वशिक्षा। भा. IX. 9. १७.
--the performer of it, becomes राजराज. M. १०१. ७१.
--the science of horses. M. २१५. 8.
(I)--the मन्त्र taught by the sage Dadhy- अङ्ग to अश्विन्स्. भा. VI. 9. ५२.
(II)--a follower of Bali. M. २४५. ३१.
--married Sutanu; father of Vajra. वा. ९६. २५१.
--a son of कृष्ण and सत्या (नाग्निचित्). भा. X. ६१. १३.
--Superintendent of horses and his quali- fications. M. २१५. ३८.
(I)--a son of पुरूरवस् and उर्वशी. M. २४. ३३.
--a देवी who killed उलूकजित्. Br. IV. २८. ३८ & ९९.
--a son of Citraka. Br. III. ७१. ११५.
(I)--the wife of अक्रूर, and mother of thirteen sons. M. ४५. ३२-3.
(II)--a नक्षत्र; as part of नागविथी; <F>1:  वा. ६६. ४८.</F> effect of श्राद्ध, performed in; <F>2:  Ib. ८२. १४.</F> as the presiding deity of musical melody अश्वक्रन्ता। <F>3:  Ib. ८६. ६४.</F>

--the gods of Vaivasvata epoch; sons of बदवा (सम्ज्ञा) and Vivasvat born through the nose and hence नासत्यस्; <F>1:  भा. VIII. १३. 4, १०; Br. III. ५९. ७४-76; M. 9. २९; ११. ३५-7; २५. ४३; Vi. I. 9. ६४; III. 2. 7; वा. ८४. २३-24,</F> fought with वृषपर्व in देवासुर war. <F>2:  भा. VIII. १०. ३०.</F> Were taught the अश्वसिरस् मन्त्र by the sage दध्यङ्ग. <F>3:  Ib. VI. 9. ५२; १०. १७.</F> Called on Cyavana. Being physicians they could not parti- cipate in सोम। Cyavana offered a share in सोम to them if they could give him a youthful form. He was made to look exactly like themselves so much so that सुकन्या was not able to distinguish her husband. On a prayer the [पगे१-131+ ५७] अश्विन्स् showed सुकन्या her lord and departed. <F>4:  भा. IX. 3. ११-17. वा. १०. ७१; ३०. ८४; ३९. ४९.</F> In the यज्ञ of शर्याति, were allowed to partake of सोम juice. <F>5:  भा. IX. 3. २४-26.</F> Parents of Nakula and Sahadeva through पाण्डु's queen माद्री. <F>6:  Ib. IX. २२. २८; M. ४६. १०; ५०. ५०; Vi. IV. २०. ४०.</F> Came to द्वारका to ask कृष्ण to go to वैकुण्ठ; <F>7:  भा. XI. 6. 2; वा. ९६. १५४; ९९. २४५.</F> wor- shipped for long life; <F>8:  भा. II. 3. 5.</F> form the nose of पुरुष; <F>9:  भा. II. 1. २९.</F> guard medi- cinal herbs in Candra hill of प्लक्ष for nectar; <F>१०:  Br. II. १९. 8; वा. ४९. 9.</F> born from the nostrils of प्रजापति; vanquished by रावण; <F>११:  Br. III. 1. ५७; 7. २५४.</F> present in the चन्द्रशाल of देवी. <F>१२:  Ib. III. ३५. ५७.</F> Fought with Devas against कालनेमि, being experts in चित्रयुद्धम्। <F>१३:  M. १४८. ८६, ९७.</F> Also अश्वि- कुमारकौ; worship of, in the ग्रहबलि। <F>१४:  M. ९३. १६; २४७. १०.</F> Born of ब्रह्मा; <F>१५:  वा. ६५. ५७.</F> the two forefeet of the शिशुमार (porpoise); <F>१६:  वा. II. १२. ३२; वा. ५२. ९३; Br. II. २३. १०३; M. १२७. २३.</F> inhabit the भुवर्लोक; <F>१७:  वा. १०१. २९; Br. IV. 2. २७.</F> stood on गयासुर, along with other gods; <F>१८:  वा. १०६. ५९.</F> presented their weapons on the occasion of the marriage of शिव with ललिता to the divine couple; <F>१९:  Br. IV. १५. २४.</F> came with other gods to pray to goddess ललिता for her victory against भण्ड; <F>२०:  Ib. IV. २०. ५२.</F> the ears of वामन अवतार <F>२१:  M. २४६. ५६.</F>
--a भार्गव-gotraka1ra. वा. ६५. ९६.

(I)--a श्राद्ध performed by इक्ष्वाकु, which led to the banishment of his son विकुक्षि (s.v.); <F>1:  भा. IX. 6. 6; Br. III. १७. 2-7; ६३. ११; वा. ८८. ११-19.</F> a युगाडि for साधरण श्राद्ध; <F>2:  M. १७. 2, 5.</F> the eighth day after full moon on which Manes are worshipped; three are distinguished, in the month of चैत्र, of पौष and माघ; <F>3:  वा. ८१. 2;</F> sacred to काव्य pitr2s. <F>4:  वा. ५६. १९.</F>

(II)--a son of विश्वामित्र by दृषद्वती and a sage; <F>1:  भा. IX. १६. ३६; Br. II. ३२. ११८; III. ६६. ६८-74; Vi. IV. 7. ३८; वा. ९१. ९६, १०३.</F> father of Lauhi; <F>2:  Br. III. ६६. ७५.</F> originator of the जःनुगण। <F>3:  वा. ९१. १०३.</F> [पगे१-132+ २६]

(III)--a राजऋषि who met ययाति falling from Heaven and discoursed with him on several points: A grand- son of ययाति by his daughter; a ब्रह्मिष्ठ, and त्रयार्षेय with विश्वामित्र and Lohita; goes to Heaven with all his relations including ययाति. M. ३५. 5; Ib. Chapters ३७-41; ४२. १४ & २८.
(IV)--a brother of Vasudeva. Vi. IV. १४. ३०.
--the name of अच्छोदा in पितृलोक after she went from the earth. In her honour a river is named. M. १४. १९-20; १४१. १७.
--the normal height of man, ८४ inches. Nava- ताल is superior man. Br. II. ३२. 9; वा. ५९. 8.
--an अम्श of Skanda. वा. १०१. २८०.
--the name of a book on medical science. M. २१५. ३४.
--action of vital airs in life. वा. १०२. ९०, ९१.
--consists of आसन, प्राणरोध, प्रत्या- हार, धारणा, ध्यान, समाधि, together with यमस् and नियमस्। Vi. १०४. २४-25. [पगे१-133+ ३०]

--the वैश्वदेव होम where eight obla- tions are offered to वैश्वानर; the five following to be done with स्वाहा; afterwards touch the heart with मन्त्र speci- fied; then touch all over the body--cf. यजुर्वेद: the obla- tion of rice offered in Agni is the food for devas and दानवस्. वा. १५. 5-१६.
--the १४ विद्यस् besides आयुर्वेद, ध- नुर्वेद, गन्धर्व and अर्थशास्त्र The fourteen विद्यस् are the six वेदाङ्गस्, four वेदस्, मीमाम्सा, न्याय, धर्म- शास्त्रस् and पुराणस्। वा. ६१. ७८-79.
--gaming board (द्यूतफलक) with which Baladeva beat Rukmi to death. Vi. V. २८. २३.

--a sage crooked in eight parts of the body; was performing penances with his body below the neck under waters. The nymphs who went to मेरुपृष्ट to see a festival beheld him and hymned him; pleased he asked them their wish. “पुरुषोत्तम for husband” they said. He agreed and when he came out of waters, seeing his form they laughed at him. Insulted, he imprecated that they would be the wives first of पुरुषोत्तम and then fall into the hands of robbers. They prayed fervently and he said that they would attain heaven afterwards. Vi. V. ३८. ७१-84.
--the period when Baladeva flourished. Vi. IV. 1. ७६.

--the daughter of वीरण Praja1pati and wife of दक्ष; १००० sons, lost by नारद's tricks; another १००० sons were brought forth, but they met with similar result (mother of ५००० Haryas4vas and १००० S4abala1s4vas-वि। प्।). वा. ६५. १२८, १३४, १४६-51 and १५४; Vi. I. १५. ८९-100.
--the son of युयुधान. M. ४५. २३.
--an Ajita deva. Br. II. १३. ९३.

--a काकुत्स्थ; the son of Sagara by केशिनी. Father of अम्शुमान्: In previous birth as a वैश्य he discovered a treasure. A spirit guarding it asked him to quench his hunger with cow's flesh and carry away the treasure. But he took it without providing food. So when born to केशिनी, the spirit entered him as wind and hence demented; used to throw his playmates into the सरयू; was banished by his father. He left the capital after bringing them back to life by his wonderful yogic powers. भा. IX. 8. १५-19; M. १२. ४२-43; Br. III. ५१. ३८-69; ६३. १६० & १६५; वा. ८८. १६०, १६५-66; Vi. IV. 4. 5-१०.
--the son of Kambalabarhis and father of Susamaujas. <F>1:  Br. III. ७१. १४२; वा. ९६. १४१.</F> [असामञ्जस् (मत्स्य प्।)] तमोजात was his son. <F>2:  M. ४४. ८३.</F>
--calculated by राशि and not by enume- ration. वा. १०१. १०८-9. [पगे१-135+ २४]
--a name for हव्यसूद. वा. २९. २२.
--a daughter of वाका and विश्रवस्. वा. ७०. ५०.
--the sword; particularly that of शिव. वा. ३०. १२४; १०१. २७२.
(I)--R. in भारतवर्ष. भा. V. १९. १८.

(II)--the daughter of पञ्चजन (विरण-वि। प्।) the wife of दक्ष <F>1:  भा. VI. 4. ५१; Vi. I. १५. ८९.</F> and the mother of हर्यश्वस् who were ten thousand in number (five thousand-वि। प्।) of शबलाश्वस् who were also a thousand in number <F>2:  भा. VI. 5. 1, २४; Br. III. 2. 5, २१-30; Vi. I. १५. ९०, ९७.</F> and of sixty daughters. <F>3:  भा. VI. 6. 1; Vi. I. १५. १०२.</F>
(I)--An अङ्गिरस् and मन्त्रकृत्। Br. I. ३२. १११.
(II)--a sage; the brother of बृहस्पति; wife, ममता. वा. ९९. ३६.

(I)--a siddha--called on dying भीष्म. <F>1:  भा. VI. १५. १२; I. 9. 7.</F> Invited for युध्ष्ठिर's sacrifice. <F>2:  Ib. X. ७४. 7.</F> Came to Syamanta-पञ्चक to see कृष्ण. <F>3:  Ib. X. ८४. 3.</F> One of the sages who left द्वारका for पिण्डा- raka. <F>4:  Ib. XI. 1. १२.</F> Went with कृष्ण to मिथिला. <F>5:  Ib. X. ८६. १८.</F> Acted as पुरोहित at कृष्ण's sacrifice in कुरुक्षेत्र. <F>6:  Ib. X. ९०. ४६ [2].</F> Identified with Hari. <F>7:  Ib. XI. १६. २८.</F> A place in the सरस्वती sacred to Asita. <F>8:  Ib. III. 1. २२.</F>

(II)--a gotrakara son of कश्यप, married Eka- पर्णा, daughter of हिमवान्: Father of Devala, the best among शाण्डिल्यस् and ब्रह्मिष्ठ (वा। प्।)। A Brahma- वादिन्. Not to marry with members of कश्यप and Devala. <F>2:  M. १९९. १९.</F> A योगाचर्य; एकपर्णा, his wife, gave birth to Devala by her mind. <F>3:  वा. ७२. १७.</F> ^1 Br. II. ३२. ११२; III. 8. २९; १०. १८. M. १४५. १०७; वा. ५९. १०३; ७०. २५.
(III)--the sacred hill fit for श्राद्ध; <F>1:  Br. III. १३. ३९.</F> the resi- dence of the sage Asita. <F>2:  वा. ७७. ३९.</F>
(IV)--the sage to whom the earth revealed the ignorance of worldly kings; this he reported to Janaka. Vi. IV. २४. १२७.
--same as कुसुमोत्करम्। M. १२२. २४.
--an apsaras. Br. III. 7. 7.
--a Bhairava on the sixth parva of गेयचक्र। Br. IV. १९. ७७-8.
--a lake in इलावृत. Vi. II. 2. २६. [पगे१-137+ ३०]
--a दानव. Br. III. 6. 5.

--one of २८ hells. Intended for those who leave the Vedic path to that of the पाखण्डस्; here their bodies are torn to pieces by the sharp edges of असिपत्र leaves (lit. forest where leaves are swords); <F>1:  भा. V. २६. 7 & १५; Br. II. २८. ८४; IV. 2. १४९ and १७३; ३३. ६१; M. १४१. ७१; वा. १०१. १७०; Vi. I. 6. ४१; II. 6. 3.</F> in it fall those who cut and deal in camels and hunters who cut off animals, besides those fallen from karma. <F>2:  वा. ५६. ७९; ११०. ४३.</F> Those that cut trees for no reason also fall into this. <F>3:  Vi. II. 6. 3 and २६.</F>
--an apsaras. Br. III. 7. 6.
(I)--a दानव, a son of Danu. Br. III. 6. 9; M. 6. २०; वा. ६८. 9.
(II)--a son of शम्भु. वा. ६७. ८१.
--the son of अश्वमेधज, and the father of Nemicakra; <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. ३९.</F> was king when the वायु पुराण was uttered. <F>2:  वा. 1. १२.</F>
--कश्यपगोत्रकरस्. M. १९९. 9.
--a deity personified; to be worshipped in house- buildings. M. २५३. २६; २६८. १६. [पगे१-138+ ४४]

<F>1:  भा. I. १३. 6; VII. 3. ३७; XII. 9. २८; Br. II. ३२. 1, 2. 6; M. ४७. १२; १३१. १०, ३९-41.</F> --The foes and cognates of Devas; <F>2:  भा. VI. 7. १८; वा. ३१. ११; Br. II. 8. 5; IV. 9. ६७-8.</F> born out of the जघन of प्रजापति; etymology of; <F>3:  वा. 9. 4-5; Br. II. 8. 4; Vi. I. 5. ३१.</F> could secure Hari's blessing by adorning him; <F>4:  भा. VII. 7. ५०.</F> opposed to यज्ञ; <F>5:  Ib. VIII. 1. १७.</F> the आसुर hour; <F>6:  Ib. X. २८. 2.</F> praise शेष; <F>7:  Ib. X. ३९. ४४-45.</F> abode down the earth. <F>8:  Ib. XI. २४. १३.</F> Ruled the earth for ten युगस् when it went back to the Devas on a curse by शुक्र after १२ wars; <F>9:  Br. III. ७२. ६९-93; वा. ९७. ६८-93.</F> worship बर्हिषद् Pitrs. <F>१०:  M. १५. 3.</F> Had three Indras--हिरण्यकशिपु, Bali and प्रःलाद; <F>११:  M. ४७. ५९.</F> lost their refulgence on the eve of वामन अवतार। <F>१२:  M. २४५. 1.</F> represent night and darkness and full of तमस्। <F>१३:  Br. II. 8. 4; Vi. I. 5. ३१-4.</F> Asura's killed in the wars with Devas are born as men in earth and create trouble in this world. <F>१४:  Br. III. ७१. २६३.</F>
--fought with Sumitra, deluded by कृष्ण. भा. XI. ३०. १६.
--a chief monkey. Br. III. 7. २३८.
--the name by which Danu's sons were known. Br. III. 6. १४.
--a son of मृत्यु. वा. १०. ४१.
--an यक्ष; a son of पुण्यजनी and मणिभद्र. Br. III. 7. १२४.
--A hill of शाकद्वीप. It was here that Bali who fell unconscious in the देवासुर war was treated with सञ्जीविनी विद्या। भा. VIII. ११. ४६; Br. II. १९. ८९; वा. ४९. ८३; Vi. II. 4. ६२. [पगे१-139+ ३२]
--Daughter of जरासन्ध and a queen of Kamsa. After her husband's death she went to her father's place and reported the circumstances in which her husband was killed. भा. X. ५०. 1-2; Vi. V. २२. 1.

--arranged alphabetically: Asiratnam, आग्नेयम्, Aindram, ऐषीकामम्, Kampanam, कापलम्, कालमुद्- garam, Kainkaram, क्रौञ्चम्, गान्धर्वम्, तापनम्, त्वाष्त्रम्, Nandakam, नारसिम्हम्, नारायणास्त्रम्, पाशु- patam, पैशाचम्, Pramathanam, प्रस्थापनम्, प्रस्वाप- nam, ब्रह्मशिरस्, ब्राह्मम्, भावनम्, Bhairavam, Matha- nam, महाबलम्, मायाधरम्, Mohanam, Mausalam, Rau- dram, वारुणम्, Vikampanam, वायव्यम्, शातनम्, शाम- nam, शैलम्, षोशदम्, Samvartanam, सार्पम्, सावित्रम्, सोमास्त्रम्, हयशिरस्; <F>1:  M. १५०. ११३, १६४, २०५; १५१. २४, ३१; १५३. ८३, ८७, ९०, ९७; १६२. २२-7; १७९. 6.</F> used by हिरण्यकशिपु against Nara- simha; arms used in भण्डासुर war. <F>2:  Br. IV. २९. ६२-74.</F>
--That relating to the use of अस्त्रस्। परसुराम learnt the four aspects from शिव; <F>1:  Br. III. २१. ७९; २५. ३९; ३२. ५९; ३४. ३४.</F> learnt by कृष्ण and राम. <F>2:  Vi. V. २१. २३.</F>
--the teacher of weapons of warfare: 4 kinds are mentioned; throwing by machines, by hands, thrown simply, and taking back after throwing away. M. २१५. ४१.
--of the दाक्षिणात्य country. वा. ४५. १२७.
(II)--the son अनादृष्टि. वा. ९६. १८६.
--unwashed cloths, to be given in श्राद्ध। वा. ८०. 4, ३७.
--one of the तत्वस्; description of. वा. १०३. ३८; Vi. I. 2, ३६-46.
--the son of सम्याति and the father of Rau- द्राश्व. भा. IX. २०. 3; Vi. IV. १९. 1.

(I)--the daughter of Mudgala, the wife of Gau- tama and the mother of शतानन्द. <F>1:  भा. IX. २१. ३४.</F> A तीर्थम् in her honour, as she performed तपस् and attained release there. <F>2:  M. १९१. ९०-1.</F>

(II)--a daughter of विन्ध्याश्व (बध्याश्व, वा। प्।) (हर्यश्व. वि। प्।) and मेनका; sister of दिवोदास, and wife of शरद्वत्; mother of शदानन्द; <F>1:  M. ५०. 7-8; वा. ९९. २०१; Vi. IV. १९. ६२, २००-2.</F> redeemed of her sins by राम. <F>2:  Vi. IV. 4. ९१.</F>
--on the नर्मदा. Here she performed तपस् and got salvation. By worshipping here, one becomes beloved of ladies. M. १९१. ९०-3. [पगे१-141+ ३५]

--of ब्रह्मा) one च्य्च्ले of a thousand चतुर्युगस्; at the end, when दाहकाल sets in वैमानिक devas come into existence, as also stars, asterisms, sun and moon, etc.; <F>1:  वा. 3. १४; 7. १४-16; २४. 2; ६१. ४२; १००. २२४-6; M. २३१. 2;</F> duration of in ordinary years; <F>2:  वा. १००. १३१; Br. II. 6. ५७f.</F> enters the waters in the evening; <F>3:  वा. ५३. १४-15.</F> created with the Devas; <F>4:  Br. II. 7. १९; 8. ११; १३. १४.</F> of the पितृस् is कृष्णपक्ष. <F>5:  वा. ५७. 9.</F>
--is सृष्टि or creation; at the end of this day occurs प्रलय। वा. 5. 1-6.
--an यक्ष--a son of देवजनी and मण्वर. Br. III. 7. १२९.
--to be worshipped in housebuilding. M. २५३. २६.
--वरुण as presiding deity. वा. ८६. ६१.
--the son of देवानीक <F>1:  वा. ८८. २०२.</F> and the father of Ruru. <F>2:  Vi. IV. 4. १०६.</F> (पारिपात्र-व।)

--one aspect of सनातन धर्म, largely observed in त्रेतायुग; <F>1:  Br. II. २९. ६९; ३०, ३५; III. २३. ५१, ६८ and ७२.</F> non-injury in thought, speech and action towards all beings prescribed for ascetics. <F>2:  वा. १८. १५-16; M. ६१. १५; १०६. ४८; १४३. १२-13 and ३०.</F>
--the performer becomes a king; con- sists in abstention from meat for a year and the gift of a cow at the end. M. १०१. ३५. [पगे१-142+ २०]
(I)--a division of the night. वा. ६६. ४३.
(II)--(see also अनुर्देश्य)--a name for ग्रहपति Agni. वा. २९. २६; Br. II. १२. २६.
--a Rudra, and son of भूत and सरूपा. भा. VI. 6. १८; Br. III. 3. ७१; M. 5. २९, ३२; १७१. ३९; वा. ६६. ६९.
--the son of Sahadeva. Father of Jayatsena. Br. III. ६८. १०.
--the son of देवानीक, and father of पारियात्र. Br. III. ६३. २०३-4; M. १२. ५४.
--more than ६००; thirty मुहूर्तस् or ६०२ कलस् make one day and one night; ६०५ कलस् according to the measurement of the sun. वा. ६६. ३८; १००. २१६, २२३.
--a day and a night; ३० मुहूर्तस्: For पितृस् --कृष्णपक्ष and शुक्लपक्ष (one month); for Devas one full year is one day. Br. II. १३. ११२; M. 1. १९; १४२. 5-6, 9; वा. ६५. ५९; ६६. ३७. [पगे१-143+ २९]
--the goddess following रेवती. M. १७९. ७२.
--a मुद्रा देवी. Br. IV. ४२. 6.
--the second face of the fourteen faced Deva, Manu स्वारोचिष born in white colour. वा. २६. ३३.
(I)--a god to be worshipped in housebuilding. M. २५३. २४; २६५. ३९.
(II)--with दिक्; a स्थान of Rudra; son, Sarga. Vi. I. 8. 7-११.
--the ether, stands uncovered, formless, devoid of रस, स्पर्श and गन्ध; its characteristic is शब्द। वा. १०२. १५, १७; M. 3. २३.
--R. that encircles अमरावती; <F>1:  भा. VIII. १५. १४.</F> that water which comes down without the cloud; bath in this is called celestial ablution. <F>2:  Vi. II. 9. १२ and १७.</F>

(I)--A daughter of स्वायम्भुव Manu (Vai- राज-वा। प्।) and शतरूपा. Wife of Ruci. From her Hari manifested himself for imparting धर्म and ज्ञान। Gave birth to twins--a son and a daughter by पुत्रिकाधर्म। These were यज्ञ and दक्षिणा. भा. I. 3. १२; III. १२. ५५-56; IV. 1. 1-4; VIII. 1. 5; II. 7. 2; Br. III. 3. ११३; वा. १०. १७-9; Br. I. 1. ५८; II. 9. ४२-43; Vi. I. 7. १८-19. [पगे१-144+ २४]
(II)--the queen of Sarvatejas and mother of Manu चाक्षुष. भा. IV. १३. १५.
(III)--the wife of पृथुसेन and mother of Nakta. भा. V. १५. 6.
(V)--the twenty-fourth kalpa. वा. २१. ५५.
(VI)--became twins in the आकूति कल्प। वा. २१. ५५-56.
(VII)--a son of Brahman with a मन्त्रशरीर वा. ६७. 4-5.
(VIII)--the mother of यज्ञ, the mindborn son in the first epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 1. ३६.
(I)--a progenitor, responsible for form and shape. Br. II. 9. 1 and 7.
(II)--a son of Babhru. Br. III. ७०. ३८.
--name of Indra. भा. III. ३३. २०. [पगे१-145+ ३४]

<F>1:  Vi. I. १७. ५८.</F>--the rules of; <F>2:  Br. II. ३०. १९ and २७; III. २१. ४६.</F> for digging wells, constructing tanks and gardens; <F>3:  M. ५८. ५५; १४३. १३.</F> cited for यज्ञस् where पशु was not involved and where बीज (seeds) served the purpose of the animal. <F>4:  वा. ५३. १२२; ५७. १००.</F>

--the ब्रह्मराक्षसस्--a clan moving about in the night; <F>1:  Br. III. 8. ५९ and ६२; वा. ६९. १९५-6.</F> of Surabhi forest; <F>2:  M. १२१. ६२.</F> summoned Kauberaka to live at हरिशृङ्ग. <F>3:  वा. ४७. ६०-1.</F>
--a son of Vasudeva and वृकदेवी a महात्मा। Br. III. ७१. १८०.
--a daughter of वृकदेवी. वा. ९६. १८०.
--कश्यपगोत्रकरस्. M. १९९. 8.
--a goddess, wife of दिक्पाल Agni. M. २८६. 7. [पगे१-146+ ३२]

(I)--a son of Priyavrata and बर्हिष्मती. Father of नाभि. Appointed lord of जम्बूद्वीप. <F>1:  भा. XI. 2. १५; V. 1. २५ and ३३.</F> Pro- tected the people like his children. Issueless, he performed तपस् when ब्रह्मा sent the divine damsel पूर्वचित्ति with whom आग्नीध्र enjoyed life for १००,000 years. After giv- ing birth to nine sons, she went back to the court of ब्रह्मा. He divided his kingdom among his sons, and rejoined his wife in another world. On his death, his nine sons married the nine daughters of Meru. <F>2:  Ib. V. 2. 1-२३; Br. II. १४. ४४-53; Vi. II. 1. 7, १२, १६-24.</F>
(II)--one of the ten sons of स्वायम्- bhuva Manu; <F>1:  Br. II. १३. १०४; M. 9. 4.</F> milked the Cow-Earth with स्वायम्भुव as calf. <F>2:  वा. ६३. १३.</F>
(III)--one of the ten sons of the daughter of Kardama, and Priyavrata. Br. II. १४. 9.
(IV)--one of the १६ ऋत्विक्स् for an यज्ञ; created from the hands of नारायण. M. १६७. १०.
--a sage of the epoch of the XIIth Manu. भा. VIII. १३. २८.
--a ब्रह्म-कुल originating from जातूकर्ण. भा. IX. 2. २२.
--the first गान्धार-ग्राम। वा. ८६. ४१.
(II)--a division of the night. वा. ६६. ४३.
(I)--the Gandharva followers of Kubera; <F>1:  वा. ४०. 8.</F> their residences on the southern peaks of मर्यादा Parvata. <F>2:  वा. ४०. 5.</F>
(II)--the अङ्गिरस् adopted by Agni when they sprung out of the sacrificial fire of वारुणी-यज्ञ। वा. ६५. ४२.
--one among the eighteen पुराणस्; <F>1:  भा. XII. 7. २३.</F> deals with ईशान कल्प; narrated by Agni to वसिष्ठ: of १६,000 verses; its gift and fruits thereof. <F>2:  M. ५३. २८-30.</F>
--of kings; ruin rebellious सामन्तस् by his valour. M. २२६. 7.
--given to Sagara by भार्गव (Aurva). वा. ८८. १२४ and १३५; Vi. IV. 3. ३७.
(I)--the city of Agni. भा. X. ८९. ४४.
(II)--the wife of हविर्धान, and mother of six children: also known as धिषणा. Br. II. ३७. २३; वा. ६३. २३; Vi. I. १४. 2; M. 4. ४५.
(III)--the wife of ऊरु. M. 4. ४३.
(IV)--the wife of Kuru and mother of six sons. Vi. I. १३. 6. [पगे१-148+ ३०]
--a पितृ ritual; offering of श्यामाक and sugar; <F>1:  Br. III. १४. 9; वा. ७८. 8.</F> the first सोम libation at the अग्निष्टोम sacrifice. <F>2:  वा. ७५. 6.</F>
--a teacher of Atharva Veda. (आङ्गिरस कल्प Burnouf). भा. XII. 7. 4.
--a sacrifice performed by ब्राह्मणस् near ब्रिन्दावन. भा. X. २३. 3.
--the wife of Vasu and mother of विश्व- karman. भा. VI. 6. १५.
--the mode and significance of; <F>1:  वा. ७९. ४२-47.</F> occasions for performing आचमनम्। <F>2:  Ib. ७९. ३७-42.</F>
--a Gandharva. Br. III. 7. ११.

--qualifications of; old, selfless, highly learned, humble, well disciplined, truthful, etc.; he who by himself follows the rules of good conduct and thus establishes the आचार and thinks of the truth of the शास्त्र by यमस् and नियमस्। Br. II. ३२. ३०-32; IV. 8. 5; M. १४५. २८-29; वा. ५९. २८-30.
--a व्रत followed by ऋषभ when he became a mendicant. भा. V. 5. ३२.

--a sage. प्रःलाद saw him one day lying on the bare ground on a cliff of the Sahya hills, and bowed to [पगे१-149+ २५] him. प्रःलाद asked the sage how he who had no com- forts was able to maintain a sound body. The sage replied that he had renounced all desires, learning renunciation from the bee and contentment from the serpent, while his mind was ever absorbed in Hari. भा. VII. १३. ११-18, २०-45.
--a nephew of हिरण्यकशिपु. M. 6. २७.
--a son of Aja and father of दशरथ. M. १२. ४९.
--the country noted for horses. Br. IV. १६. १७.
--शुनःशेप, the son of Ajigarta--(see अजि- गर्त, s.v.). भा. IX. १६. ३०; IX. 7. २०-21.
--कश्य्पगोत्रकारस्. M. १९९. 9.
--a heretic sect. Br. III. १४. ३९.
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १७. १९. [पगे१-150+ २९]
(I)--good to be seen first after rising from one's bed; <F>1:  भा. X. ७०. १२; वा. २९. ३०.</F> as a sacrificial offering. <F>2:  Br. IV. 1. ९८; वा. १००. १०३.</F>
(II)--one of the nine sons of सावर्णि. वा. १००. २२.
--four kinds of. Br. IV. 1. ९८-100.

--a class of Manes who reside in regions belong- ing to Kardama प्रजापति, descendants of Pulaha; विरजा, wife of नहुष was their mindborn daughter; largely wor- shipped by वैश्यस्. Br. II. २८. १९; III. १०. ९३-5; भा. IV. 1. ६३; M. १०२. २१; वा. ३०. १००; ५६. १७; ७३. ४३; १०१. ४३.
--the people of a southern country. Br. II. १६. ५७; M. ११४. ४८; वा. ४५. १२६.
--Instrument of war music. M. १३७. २९; १३८. 3.

--a son of Asura Andhaka; to wreak vengeance on शिव for having slain his father, he entered the harem of शिव in the guise of a snake, and assumed the guise of उमा before him. He could change his form twice as he liked owing to a boon from ब्रह्मा; but the second change would be followed by death. On close examination, शिव dis- covered the figure to be the Asura in disguise, threw the Vajra and slew him. M. १५६. १२-37. [पगे१-151+ ३०]

--the sixth war of gods and Asuras. <F>1:  Br. III. ७२. ७४.</F> In this Kakustha helped Indra; <F>2:  वा. ८८. २५.</F> the sixth of the twelve incar- nations of Hari. <F>3:  M. ४७. ३४-35 and ४४; वा. ९७. ८१.</F>

--comprised of sixteen विकारस् and eight प्रकृतिस्। ५० crores of योजनस् in breadth in the interior. Outside encircled by seven sheaths of the earth and other elements. भा. III. ११. ३९-41; २०. १५; II. 1. २५.
(I)--the son of सरूप्य. Father of पाण्ड्य, Kerala, Chola and Kulya. Br. III. ७४. 5-6.
(II)--the son of वरूथ. M. ४८. 4.
--Those who set fire to buildings, administer poison, lift their weapons to strike, or practise आभिचार or become talebearers or seditionists. M. २२७. ११६-9.
--a son of उषा and विभावसु. A Vasu. Father of पञ्चयाम. भा. VI. 6. १६.
--has no गुणस्। Twelve characteristics of. भा. I. १८. ५०; VII. 1. 7-9; 7. १९-20.
--a son of स्वर्भानु and प्रभा. वा. ९२. 2. [पगे१-152+ ३३]
--name of ब्रह्मा. भा. III. १२. २०.
--a मन्त्रकृत्; <F>1:  Br. II. ३२. १०४; M. १४५. ९८; वा. ५९. ९६.</F> the son of Cyavana भार्गव; married Ruci; Father of नहुष. <F>2:  वा. ६५. ९०-91.</F>
--the वेदान्त; <F>1:  M. २१५. ५४.</F> symbolical of देवी. <F>2:  Vi. I. 9. १२०.</F>
--that which is attained, which is taken away and that which is, and hence the ever present भाव। वा. 5. ३४-5.
--a Gupta शक्ति. Br. IV. १९. २०.
--a son of अङ्गिरस. M. १९६. 2.
--one of the three movements of creatures. वा. 1. १६१; १००. १३२.
--one division of Brahma kalpa. वा. १००. १३४.

--a pupil of सूत; <F>1:  Va. ६१. ५६.</F> the last reference is to the sage in the Raivatamanvantara. <F>2:  वा. ६२. १७, ५४.</F> Sage of the तामस man- vantara. <F>3:  वा. ६२. ४१.</F> आत्रेय S4aradvata one of the seven sages; <F>4:  वा. १००. ११.</F> आत्रे- यवारुनि, <F>5:  वा. १००. ८२.</F> निष्प्रकम्प, <F>6:  वा. १००. १०७.</F> सूतपूः. <F>7:  वा. १००. ९६; १०६. ३९.</F> [पगे१-153+ २८]
(I)--a deva गण of the पितृस्, like स्वस्त्यात्रेय, Br. III. 1. ५१; 8. ८१.
(II)--the five sons of Atri and अनसूया; Saty- netra, Havya, आपोमूर्टि, शनीश्वर and Soma. वा. २८. १८-20; Br. II. ११. २३-24.
(III)--a tribe. वा. ४५. ११९.
--pravara (अङ्गिरस्). M. १९६. १२.
--is Atharva Veda. Vi. VI. 5. ६५; वा. ७६. 1.
(I)--its use for dressing. देवहूती used it to dress herself; <F>1:  भा. III. २३. ३०.</F> auspicious to look at in the morning. <F>2:  Br. III. २८. १०; Vi. III. ११. २२; भा. X. ७०. ११.</F>
(II)--a son of the Third सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ८१; वा. १००. ८४.

--विष्णु; bore for the first time the गदा out of the bone of गदा-asura. He is व्यक्त, the whole universe appearing in him in the गया शिला; in praise of, by ब्रह्मा and शिव. वा. १०९. १३-17, २५, २७-31, ४१-42 and ४३-50; १११. १६.
