--created by ललिता to consume waters due to भण्ड's अर्णवास्त्रम्। Br. IV. २९. ९२. [पगे१-154+ ४७]
--a name of विष्णु. Br. IV. १५. १८.
(I)--patronymic of विधातृ. भा. VI. १८. 3.
(II)--a name of सूर्य (s.v.); <F>1:  Br. II. २१. 3; M. 2. ३१-4.</F> presented the jewel Syamantaka to सत्राजित्. <F>2:  Vi. IV. १३. ११.</F>
(III)--from आदान receiving waters and letting them off; कालाग्नि, पितामह and सोम, all प्रपितामहस्; <F>1:  वा. १२. ३७; ३१. २९-35.</F> same as Rudra; see रुद्र। <F>2:  Br. II. १०. २२.</F>
(IV)--a division of the night. वा. ६६. ४४.

--sons of Aditi and कश्यप, originally Vai- कुण्ठस् and साध्यस्; <F>1:  Br. II. ३८. 3; III. 1. ६१; 3. ५७-61, ६७-8; 4. ३४; M. १७१. ५५; वा. ३०. ८३, ९९, १६३; ३९. ४९; ६४. 2; ६६. ६०, ६६-7; Vi. I. १५. १२९.</F> Gods of the Vaivasvata epoch at the commencement of the first त्रेतायुग, known as Jayadevas; <F>2:  भा. VIII. १३. 4; VI. 7. 2; १०. १७; M. 9. २९.</F> twelve in number; were known as तुषितस् in the चाक्षुष epoch. <F>3:  वा. ६७. ४४; M. 6. 3; Vi. I. १५. १३२.</F> Names were इन्द्र, धातृ, भग, त्वष्टृ, मित्र, वरुण, यम, विवस्वत्, सवितृ, पूषन्, अम्शुमत्, and विष्णु। <F>4:  भा. XII. ११. ३०-45; Br. II. २४. ३३-4, ७५; २६-42; M. १३२. 3; २४७. १०; Vi. I. १५. १३०-1.</F> Born of विष्णु as their overlord. <F>5:  Vi. V. 1. १७-8; 4. 5; भा. XII. ११. ३०f; XI. १६. १३. Br. III. 8. 5.</F> Escorted Indra; vanquished Diti's sons, and vanquished by रावण; <F>6:  Br. III. 5. ४८; 7. २५४.</F> came with gods to द्वारका to request कृष्ण to leave for Vai- कुण्ठ. <F>7:  भा. XI. 6. 2.</F> One of the names of the first मरुत् गण। <F>8:  वा. ६७. १२३.</F> Born with Rudras. <F>9:  Ib. ६५. ६१.</F> Residents of Bhuvarloka. <F>१०:  Ib. १०१. ३०; Br. IV. 2. २८-9.</F> Offered pre- sents (उपायन) at the time of the marriage of कामेश्वर with ललिता. <F>११:  Br. IV. १५. २४.</F> Praised ललिता when भण्ड was killed. <F>१२:  Ib. IV. ३०. 8.</F> [पगे१-155+ २७]
--the right of being born as sons of Aditi. वा. ६६. ५९.
--the यजुस् returned to possession of सूर्य when याज्ञवल्क्य surrounded them. वा. ६१. २१.
--the solar race. M. ११. 1.
--by this the divine weapons of कृष्ण went to heaven. Vi. V. ३७. ५२.
--Sunday, fit for अनङ्गदेव व्रतम्; in- auspicious for housebuilding; <F>1:  M. ७०. ४६; २५३. 7.</F> devoted to worship of सूर्य, Candra and Agni. <F>2:  M. ९७. 3-२०.</F>

--a vow in honour of शङ्कर in the name of सूर्य; auspicious day is Sunday preferably with constellation हस्त; accompanied by gifts to ब्राह्मणस्: Relieves one from bondage of birth; practised by वसिष्ठ, Arjuna, Kubera, Indra in olden days. M. ५५. 3-३३.
--an उपपुराण। M. ५३. ६३.
--seven गणस् of which three are without form and four are with form; above them are three भावमूर्तिस् and below them four सूक्ष्ममूर्तिस्। वा. ७१. ५४-6.
--a name of विष्णु. वा. १०९. १५.
--Ten thousand and six hundred श्लोकस्। वा. १०४. 7.
--earlier पुराण literature. M. १६४. १६.
--is कामक्षी. Br. IV. ४०. ४६.
--origin of, <F>1:  Br. II. १०. 2.</F> described; <F>2:  Ib. II. Ch. 9.</F> the primary creation. <F>3:  M. 8. 1; ५२. 2.</F>
--a group of gods of चाक्षुष epoch, eight in number. Br. II. ३६. ६६ and ६९.
--the first servant maid of शिव with four arms and six white clothes; behind are other ladies to honour शङ्कर. वा. १०१. २७४-7.
--one of the seven sons of वसिष्ठ. वा. २८. ३६. [पगे१-157+ २९]
--Into this Hari enters. भा. XI. १२. १७.
--By this अविकारस् became विकारस्। Earth, etc., are विकारस्। Br. II. १९. १८१-2.
--a pupil of याज्ञवल्क्य. Br. II. ३५. २८.
--the knowledge of आत्मन् taught by Kapila to his mother देवहूति; also आन्वीक्षिकी। भा. III. २४. ४०; २५. 4, १३-15.
--१२००० छन्दस्; from यजुस्; uttered by the अध्वर्यु in an यज्ञ। वा. ५८. १५; ६०. १५-16; ६१. ६४; Vi. III. 4. १२.
(I)--a son of शूर and मारिषा. Married कन्का and had two sons--Satyajit and Purujit. भा. IX. २४. २८ and ४१.
(II)--a kind of divine musical instrument. भा. X. ८३. ३०; M. १३५. ८३. १४०-43; वा. ९६. १४५; Br. III. ७१. १४७.

--a previous name of Vasudeva. (s.v.) <F>1:  Br. III. ७१. १४६, १६४. २१७; M. ४६. 2 and ११; Vi. V. 2. 8 and १६.</F> When he was born दुन्दुभि and the आनकस् were sounded as in a festival in the house of शूर by the gods; <F>2:  वा. ९६. १४४-5; Vi. IV. १४. २९.</F> at नन्दगोपगृह. <F>3:  वा. ९६. २११.</F> Son of Anu. <F>4:  Vi. IV. १४. १४.</F> Entered fire after the departure of राम and कृष्ण to Heaven. <F>5:  Vi. V. ३८. 4.</F> [पगे१-158+ २४]
--divine musicians, played at the birth of Vesudeva. Vi. IV. १४. २८.
--a son of Ugrasena. Vi. IV. १४. २०.
(I) (च्)--a kingdom adjoining the Dundubhi hill in प्लक्षद्वीप. Br. II. १४. ३९; १७. १६.
(II)--a Satya god. Br. II. ३६. ३५.
(III)--The Lord of first kalpa consisting १०० lakhs of years by name भाव; this is the place of ब्रह्मा. वा. २१. २८.
(IV)--a son of मेधातिथि; a वर्ष after his name, in प्लक्षद्वीप. वा. ३३. ३२; Vi. II. 4. 4 and 5.
--a वर्ष centering round the Dundubhi hill of प्लक्ष. वा. ४९. १४.
--same as अनिचकम् वर्षम्। M. १२२. २३.
--a lake in the जातुध hill of pure and crystal waters; here lives चण्ड, the lord of the नागस्. वा. ४१. ६८-73. [पगे१-159+ ३३]
--is बिन्दुपीठम्. Br. IV. ३७. ४७.
--in honour of ब्रह्मा. M. १०१. ३२.

(I) (च्)--a western country; that of कृष्ण; <F>1:  भा. I. ११. 1.</F> on the way from द्वारक to Indraprastha. <F>2:  Ib. X. ७१. २१.</F> Its king went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for solar eclipse. <F>3:  Ib. X. ८२. १३; Br. II. १६. ६२; M. १२. २२.</F> Destroyed by Dvivida; <F>4:  Ib. X. ६७. 4.</F> named after शर्याति; its capital कुशस्थली. <F>5:  वा. ८६. २४; Vi. IV. 1. ६४.</F>

(II)--a son of शर्याति and father of Reva(ta). <F>1:  भा. IX. 3. २७; Br. III. ६१. १८; वा. ८६. २३-24; Vi. IV. 1. ६३-4.</F> रोचमान was his son; ruled over the kingdom of आनर्त from कुशस्थली. <F>2:  M. १२. २१-2.</F>
(III)--a son of वीतिहोत्र. M. ४३. ४९.

--people of आनर्त over whom Revata ruled. <F>1:  भा. I. १०, ३५; १४. २५; IX. 3. २८; X. ५२. १५; M. ११४. ५१.</F> Heard of कृष्ण going to मिथिला and met him on the way with presents; <F>2:  भा. X. ८६. २०.</F> of the south. <F>3:  वा. ४५. १३१.</F>
--the capital of आनर्त--द्वारक; from here कृष्ण went to Vidarbha in one night. भा. I. १४. २५; X. ५३. 6.
--a son of भृगु, and a deva. Br. III. 1. ८९. [पगे१-160+ ३९]
--swinging on the hands of friends and boxing; by कृष्ण and राम. Vi. V. 9. 8.
--a son of Vipracitti and सिम्हिका. Vi. I. २१. १२.
--a kingdom after the name of Andha- कार, <F>1:  Br. II. १४. २५.</F> near पीवर hill. <F>2:  Ib. II. १९. ७२.</F>

(I)--the kings of Andhra dynasty, thirty in number, ruled the earth for ४५६ years. Seven of them were contemporaries of seven कौशलस्, chiefs of विदूर and निष- dhas; <F>1:  भा. XII. 1. २२-28 and ३५.</F> According to मत्स्य पुराण, १९ members of the dynasty ruled for ४६० years. Kingdoms of आर्य and Mleccha existed side by side--आभीरस्, Gardabhilas, शकस्, Yavanas, तुषारस्, गुरुण्डस्, and हूणस्. <F>2:  M. २७२. ३७; २७३. १६-19, २५.</F>

(II)--a tribe purified by the worship of Hari. <F>1:  भा. II. 4. १८.</F> Enlisted by जरासन्ध against the Yadus; <F>2:  भा. X. [५० (V) 3].</F> a southern country unfit for performing श्राद्ध। <F>3:  Br. II. १६. ५९; III. १४. ८०; IV. २९. १३१.</F>
--seven in number. Vi. IV. २४. ५१.
--a राजऋषि becoming a ब्राह्मण. वा. ९१. ११६.

(अध्यात्मकी विद्या, s.v.)--Taught by Dat- तात्रेय to Alarka and others. <F>1:  भा. I. 3. ११; M. २१५. ५४; Vi. V. १०. २७.</F> Produced by ब्रह्मा. <F>2:  भा. III. १२. ४४; २५. 4.</F> Helps concentration on the Absolute. <F>3:  Ib. XI. २०. २४.</F> Learnt by राम and कृष्ण. <F>4:  Ib. X. ४५. ३४.</F> Symbolical of देवी. <F>5:  Vi. I. 9. १२१.</F> [पगे१-161+ ३०]
--the daily routine of duties. वा. ५३. ३९; Vi. V. १८. ३४.
(I)--a व्यापक। एत्य्। of; came out of Agni, when the latter was lost in the earth. Br. I. 5. १३१-5; II. 6. ५६-7; २०. 1 and 5; वा. 6. 1.
(II)--a राक्षस with the शरत् sun. Br. II. २३. १५; वा. ५२. १५.
(III)--a son of वसिष्ठ, and a प्रजापति of the स्वारोचिष epoch. M. 9. 9.

(IV)--is Bhava; hence do not commit nuisance in waters; nor bathe naked, nor have sexual intercourse in water; forsake colourless, tasteless and small waters; their source is the ocean and hence they must not be stopped in their progress to it. वा. २७. २१-7.
--certain ग्रहस् which cause fear to children. वा. ६९. १९१.
--a kingdom to which Puramjana went by the entrance मुख्या; allegorically व्यवहार। भा. IV. २५. ४९; २९. १२.
--a pupil of बाष्कलि. Br. II. ३५. 6.

(I)--a sage of the time of second सावर्ण Manu. <F>1:  Br. IV. 1. ७०.</F> Finding his hermit destroyed by कार्त- वीर्य's fire, cursed that he would be slain by परशुराम. <F>2:  Ib. III. ६९. ४४-5; M. ४४. 1. १२-14.</F> Resident of हेमतालवनम्. <F>3:  M. ४३. ४१.</F> [पगे१-162+ २४]
(II)--the son of वरुण; cursed कार्तवीर्यार्जुन who allowed his तपोवन to be consumed by चित्रभानु; for ages past he was performing penance at the place, living on water. वा. ९४. ४३; ९५. ११-13.
--to be worshipped in housebuildings. M. २५३. ३१; २६८. २०.
--acted as priest in the पुत्रेष्टि of Diti. M. 7. ३३-4; १९२. ६०.
--a भार्गव, of आङ्गिरसप्रवर. M. १९५. ३३; १९६. १८.
--the son of शातकर्णि, ruled for ३० years. वा. ९९. ३५१.
--Revelry and mirth in the assembly of कृष्ण with १६००० ladies; of Apsaras with Gandharvas. M. ७०. 4; १२०. ३१.
--आर्षेयप्रवर (भार्गवस्). M. १९५. ४१.
--son of Lambodara आन्ध्र, ruled for १२ years. M. २७३. 5.
(I)--the यक्ष who resides in the sun's chariot during the month of भाद्रपद। Vi. II. १०. १०.
--worshipped in क्रौञ्चद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २२-3.
--an आत्रेय; a sage of the epoch of the second सावर्ण Manu. Br. II. ११. २३; IV. 1. ७०; वा. २८. २०.
--the son of शान्तकर्णि; ruled for १२ years. Br. III. ७४. १६३.
--a sacrifice <F>1:  भा. III. १२. ४०.</F> created from the west face of ब्रह्मा. <F>2:  Vi. I. 5. ५६.</F> (north face-वि। प्।).
--a son of भृगु and a gotrakara; a pravara of भार्गव gotra; Father of Aurva. M. १९५. १५ and २९.
(II)--a particular period of the day. वा. ६६. ४०.
--one of the गणस् of the eight gods of the चाक्- षुष epoch. भा. VIII. 5. 8; Vi. III. 1. २७. [पगे१-164+ ३४]
--a territorial division of शाल्मलिद्वीप. भा. V. २०. 9.
--a particular offering to Agni, Soma and Yama in the श्राद्ध ritual. First to पितृस् and then to देवस्, as पितृस् are पूर्वदेवतस्। M. १५. ३२-41; १६. ३३; १७. ५८.
--a son of Cyavana; married ऋचि, daughter of नहुष: Father of Aurva, born from her thigh. Br. III. 1. ९३-5.
--of the earth; one crore in every direc- tion from Meru as centre; also calculated in another way. वा. ५०. ६९-70.
--from ब्रह्मा to grass. वा. ११०. २१, ६४.

--Incantations done by पुरोहित and ministers for defeating the enemy--according to भण्ड; <F>1:  Br. IV. २१. ९७.</F> Brhaspati did this on behalf of Indra to vanquish राजि's sons. <F>2:  Vi. IV. 9. १९.</F>
--a महारथ, and a commander of भण्ड's army. His riding vehicle was Simha. Br. IV. २९. २१-2.

--country of आभीरस्. <F>1:  भा. I. १०. ३५; Br. II. १६. ४६ and ५७; १८. ४८.</F> Dvijas of, became व्रात्यस् after Puramjaya's days. <F>2:  भा. XII 1. ३८.</F> Purified of sin by devotion to Hari. <F>3:  Ib. II. 4. १८.</F> Seven of this tribe ruled from अवभृति. <F>4:  भा. XII. 1. २९; वा. ९९. ३५९; Vi. IV. २४. ५१, ६८.</F> The ब्रःमाण्ड and वायु say ten of them ruled after the आन्ध्रस्; <F>5:  Br. III. ७४. १७४; M. ५०. ७६; ११४. ४०; १६३. ७२; २७३. १८.</F> for ६७ years. [पगे१-165+ ३०]

--a tribe of दक्षिणापथ saw Arjuna singly carrying much wealth and women and attacked him; he took up his गाण्डिव and found he had lost its secret and power; <F>1:  वा. ४५. ११५, १२६; ४७. ४६; ९९. २६९; Vi. II. 3. १६.</F> freebooters and shepherds of the पञ्चनद country who lived in villages; म्लेच्छस्; chief weapons of, staves and cudgels. <F>2:  Vi. V. ३८. १४-28, ५०-52.</F>
--observed the कल्याणिनी व्रतम् and became उर्वशी of the Heaven. M. ६९. ५९.
--gods of the Raivata epoch. M. 9. २०.
--a son of Bhadra. वा. ६९. २१३.
(I)--a son of घृतपृष्ठ. भा. V. २०. २१.
(II)--a son of कृष्ण and (सत्या) daughter of Nagnacit. भा. X. ६१. १३. [पगे१-166+ २४]
--पितृस् dead as small children. वा. ११०. ५३.
--the milking vessel of the यक्षस्. Br. II. ३६. २१५; वा. ६२. १८२.
--gift of uncooked food in a श्राद्ध, gene- rally by शूद्रस्; also आमश्राद्धम्; forbidden for yatis. M. १७. ७०; वा. १८. २०.
--a vighna नायक. Br. IV. २७. ८१; ४४. ६८.
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १८. १७.
--a son of कृष्ण. भा. I. १०. २९.
(I)--a place where हिरण्याक्ष was slain by वाराह Hari. M. १२२. १६.
(II)--a hill of the शाकद्वीपम्. वा. ४९. ८४; Vi. II. 4. ६२.
--the mango tree in Brahmasaras, in the shape of ब्रह्मा; he who waters the tree will lead the पितृस् to salvation. वा. ४३. 6; १११. ३५-36. [पगे१-167+ ३१]
--between विशाख and पतङ्ग hills. वा. ३८. १८-22.
--a तीर्थम् on the नर्मदा sacred to पितृस्, and to शिव. M. २२. ५१; १८१. २८; १९०. 5.
--a तुषित god. Br. II. ३६. ११.

--called दिव्यम् by the Veda, at the end of निरालोक and of आकाश or ether: Inaccessible to gods. <F>1:  Br. II. १९. १६८-9; III. ११. ३४.</F> Temples as places for श्राद्ध; construction of: description shows the वैष्णव and शैव shrines in the same com- pound. <F>2:  M. १७. ११; ५८. 2; ८३. 3; १०५. १५; २६८. ३५; २७०. ३४.</F> Shrines where पुराणस् were read. <F>3:  वा. 4. 7; ३०. १५०; ३८. ३१, ४८, ५८; ५४. 3; ७७. ६३; ९२. ५२.</F>

(I)--a daughter of Meru and धरणि, wife of धातृ (विधातृ-वा। प्।) and mother of मृकण्ड; <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ४३-44; वा. २८. 4; ३०. ३४; Vi. I. १०. 3.</F> mother of प्राण also. <F>2:  Br. II. ११. 5-6; १३. ३७.</F>
--the iron vessel sacred to Asuras. Br. II. ३६. २१०; M. १०. २०.
--a मन्त्रकृत् and of अङ्गिरस branch. वा. ५९. १०१. [पगे१-168+ २६]
(I)--a son of प्राण and ऊर्जस्वती: a Vasu; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. १२.</F> Father of वैतण्ड्य and others. <F>2:  Br. III. 3. २१, २४.</F>
(II)--the son of Puruhotra, and father of सात्वत. भा. IX. २४. 6.

(III)--one of the six sons of पुरूरवस् and उर्वशी; wife प्रभा, राहु's daughter; father of five sons, नहुष, वृद्धशर्मन्, राजु, Dambha, and विपाप्मन्, all of them expert warriors. भा. IX. १५. 1; १७. 1; Br. III. ६६. २२, ९०; ६७. 1; M. २४. ३३-5; वा. ९१. ५१; Vi. IV. 6. ७३; 7. 1; 8. 1-3.
(IV)--a son of कृष्ण and भद्रा. भा. X. ६१. १७.
(V)--The sage presiding over the month of पुष्य। भा. XII. ११. ४२.
(VI)--(शुचि Agni). Father of महिष. Br. II. १२. ३८-40.
(VII)--a चरकाध्वर्यु। Br. II. ३३. १३.
(VIII)--the Agni that lives in पशु। वा. २९. ३७.
(IX)--a son of अङ्गिरस; father of अमावसु. वा. ६५. १०५; ७३. 5.
--weapons of war, enumerated and described. Br. IV. २२. १०-14; M. १२९. ३५; १४९. 7-8; १७३. 5, १२, २९, etc.
--arsenal: meddling with it was punished with death. M. १६३. ५१; २१५. ४४; २१७. १६; २२७. १७४.
--a पारावत god. Br. II. ३६. १४.

--originated from Dhanvantari; <F>1:  भा. II. 7. २१; VIII. 8. ३५; IX. १७. 4; Br. III. ६७. १८; वा. ९२. १६; Vi. IV. 8. १०.</F> from the east face of ब्रह्मा; <F>2:  भा. III. १२. ३८.</F> one of the eighteen विद्यस्; <F>3:  Br. II. ३५. ८८; Vi. III. 6. २८; वा. ६१. ७९.</F> begins in द्वापर; <F>4:  M. १४४. २२; वा. ५८. २३; Br. II. ३१. २३.</F> भरद्वाज was the compiler of the आयुर्वेद and other sciences connected with medicine; it was divided into eight parts each of which was given to one of his disciples. <F>5:  वा. ९२. २२; Br. III. ६७. २४.</F>
--in honour of शिव. M. १०१. २२.
--the son of ऐड. वा. 1. १९२.
(I)--the father of ऋषभ-Hari by Ambu- धारा. भा. VIII. १३. २०.
(II)--a son of उत्तानपाद. Br. II. ३६. ८९. [पगे१-170+ २८]
(III)--a son of प्रःलाद. M. 6. 9; Vi. I. २१. 1.
--an apsarasa गण from सूर्य. वा. ६९. ५५.
--a गण of gods. Br. IV. 1. १२२.
--noted for horses. M. ४८. 7.
--a मध्यमाध्वर्यु; a प्रजापति and father of five deva गणस् of the चाक्षुष epoch. <F>1:  Br. II. ३३. १५; ३६. ६८.</F> Son of Atri. <F>2:  वा. ६२. ५८.</F>
--passages of the आरण्यक portion of the Vedas. Br. III. २१. ५५.
--the son of Setu and father of गान्धार. भा. IX. २३. १५; Vi. IV. १७. 3-4.
--a son of Jayatsena. वा. ९९. २३१.
--a son of Jayatsena and father of अयुतायु. Vi. IV. २०. 4.
--Laying out parks at the auspicious hour--also उद्यान; <F>1:  M. ५८. 1 and ५२.</F> in Tripuram; <F>2:  Ib. १३०. 5.</F> punishment for misuse of. <F>3:  Ib. २२७. ३०; वा. १०१. १६०.</F> [पगे१-171+ २३]
(II)--(आत्रेय) a sage of the epoch of the third सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ७९.
(IV)--the fifteenth व्यास, वेदशिरस्, the अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १६६.
(V)--a sage of the XIth epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. ३१.
(VI)--the first of the मध्यदेशस्. वा. ६१. 9.
--an आत्रेय gotraka1ra. M. १९७. 5.
--a pupil of बाष्कलि. Br. II. ३५. 6.
(I)--five sons of ब्रह्मा: represented by अग्निष्वात्तस्। Br. II. २१. १५२; २३. ७५-77; २८. १६ ff. [पगे१-172+ २७]

(II)--five sons of ऋतुस्: These are half months: Represent पितृस्; <F>1:  M. १४१. १४ and ५७; वा. ३०. १८, २२.</F> sections of the year; depend on the seasons. <F>2:  वा. ७०. १४; Br. II. १३. १९-25, १४९.</F>
--the father of धृति. Br. III. ७१. १२४.
--the name of a constellation. वा. ८२. 3.
sacred to भवानी sit- ting with महादेव: to be done for four months, once in every पक्ष: the performer enjoys the world of रुद्राणी. M. ६४ (whole).
(I)--opposite of Mleccha. वा. ४५. ९३; ४७. ४९; ९९. ४०४.

(II)--collective name of अङ्गिरस्' sons <F>1:  भा. IX. 4. 2; Br. II. १६. २४.</F> as oppo- sed to म्लेच्छ। <F>2:  M. २२७. १९८; ११४. २०.</F> Their country was भारतवर्ष; side by side with म्लेच्छ in Kaliyuga. <F>3:  M. १२१. ४६-51; २७३. २५; २७४. ३७.</F>
(I)--the father of Dharmasetu. भा. VIII. १३. २६.
(II)--a काद्रवेय na1ga. Br. III. 7. ३३.
--caste equal to ब्राह्मण in प्लक्षद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. १७. [पगे१-173+ २५]
--a R. in क्रौञ्च-dvi1pa. भा. V. २०. २१.
--does not accept the duties of पाखण्डस्। भा. V. १४. २९.
--one of the three disciples of रथीतर. वा. ६१. 3.
--द्वैपायनी--a R. visited by बलराम. भा. X. ७९. २०.
--twenty-five of इक्ष्वाकु's sons were rulers over this territory; given to उपद्रष्ट by परशुराम. भा. IX. 6. 5; १६. २२.
--a sage by तपस्। Br. II. ३२. ९९.
(I)--a form of marriage; girls to be given in the Ganges-Yamuna doab. M. १०६. 8; Vi. III. १०. २४.

(II)--origin of; when the whole world was in a state of चेतन-अचेतन knowledge like the fish in the water, the truth influenced by चेतन arises with गुण; कार्यम् is the result of कारण or reason; so also विषय is the result of विषयित्व and अर्थ of अर्थित्व; by this महत् and others function by degrees. वा. ५९. ६३-8.
--ऋषिस्, past and future. M. १४५. ६५. [पगे१-174+ २५]
--a pravara. M. १९६. ३१.
--a branch of अङ्गिरस. वा. ६५. १०७.
--the street with the constellations of पूर्व and Uttara Phalguni and Magha; in मध्यम मार्ग। Br. III. 3. ४९; M. १२४. ५६.
(I)--a chief Gandharva who sings राम's glory in किम्पुरुष; came to see परीक्षित् practising प्रायोप- वेश। Knew the योग-पोwएर् of Hari. भा. V. १९. 2; I. १९. १०; II. 7. ४५.
(II)--the son of शल. Br. III. ६७. 6; वा. ९२. 5.
(III)--a रजऋषि becoming a ब्राह्मण. वा. ९१. ११६.
(IV)--a मन्त्रकृत्--a पञ्चार्षेय Bha1rgava. Br. II. ३२. १०५; M. १४५. ९९; १९५. ३४.
--one of the six दर्शनस्। वा. १०४. १६.
(अर्हण--Bur.) a chief attendant on Hari. भा. II. 9. १४.
--a class of sages. M. २००. १७. [पगे१-175+ २९]
--see योग। Vi. VI. 7. ४२.
--a daughter of खशा, and a राक्षसी, after whom came the आलम्बेय गण। Br. III. 7. १३८; वा. ६९. १७०.
--a श्रुतऋषि: the chief author of the यजुर्वेद of the Eastern recension. Br. II. ३३. 6.
--of the प्राच्यस्; also त्रयोदश्यादयः। वा. ६१. 9.
--a राक्षस clan after आलम्बा। Br. III. 7. १४०.
--a cruel राक्षस गण from आलम्बा. वा. ६९. १७२.
--temple for इश्वर.--(see आयतनम्); <F>1:  वा. ३०. २७९; ९१. २९; १०१. २१४.</F> or a place of residence. <F>2:  Ib. ५०. १५, १७, २२ and ३५.</F>
--a भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. २५.
--the lokas which spring from अलोक। <F>1:  Br. II. १९. १५१-3, १८७; २१. १५५; M. १२३. ४७; १२४. ९३.</F> आकाश that seems to exist to our eyes. <F>2:  वा. ४९. १४५ and १७६.</F>
--a pupil of याज्ञवल्क्य. Br. II. ३५. २९.
--a ब्राह्मण pupil of Sukarman. Imparted in his turn the सम्हितस् to his pupils. भा. XII. 6. ७७-80.
--the two sons of Jayasena so called. भा. IX. २४. ३९.
--a son of Bharata and पाञ्चजनी. भा. V. 7. 3.
--clouds of the पक्षज class that rain copiously. Br. II. २२. ४०; IV. २८. ६३.
--An उपद्वीप to जम्बूद्वीप. भा. V. १९. ३०.
--a Haihaya clan. वा. ९४. ५२.
--a son of शम्स्य Agni. वा. २९. १२.
--the lower lip of the personified Veda. वा. १०४. ८४.

(I)--a wind that helps आग्नेय clouds to rain: <F>1:  Br. II. २२. ३४; III. 5. ८२; ७१. ११२.</F> one of the seven मरुत्स्; <F>2:  M. १६३. ३२.</F> controls the मूक clouds. <F>3:  वा. ५१. ३२, ४९; ६७. ११४.</F>
(II)--a son of गान्दिनि. वा. ९६. १११.
--a true son of his father in virtuous qualities. वा. ८६. 8.
--one of the eastern entrances of the city of Puramjana: allegorically the right eye. भा. IV. २५. ४७; २९. १०.
--an आत्रेय and sage. Br. II. ३२. ११४.

--a son of ऋषभ; a sage and a भागवत; asked as to the truth of कर्मयोग by Nimi, the sage in- structed the king that कर्म, अकर्म and विकर्म are वेद- वाद and not लौकिक which thesis he expanded. भा. V. 4. ११; XI. 2. २१; 3. ४१-55.
--a hell. Vi. II. 6. 4.
--a भार्गव gotra-kara. M. १९५. १८.
--an यक्ष गण। वा. ६९. ४०.
--the cause of कर्मस् which in turn lead to birth. वा. 8. ३०.
--an apsaras. वा. ६९. 5.
--the daughter of Bhaga and Siddhi. भा. VI. १८. 2.
--for father's death १० days for ब्राह्मणस्, १२ days for क्षत्रियस्, १५ days for वैश्यस्, and a month for the शूद्रस्. M. १८. 1-3. [पगे१-178+ ३४]

--four, ब्रह्मचर्य, गृहस्त, वानप्रस्थ and भिक्षुक; duties:--ब्रह्मचर्य: study by service to गुरु and begging food; गृहस्त: the source and strength of all आश्रमस्; those celibate do penance, sacrifice, give birth to sons, perform श्राद्ध, learn the Vedas and give gifts of food; दाराग्नि, guests, sacrifice and श्राद्ध; become देवपितृस्; वानप्रस्थ: bathe in morning and evening and on ceremonials; eating of fruits and roots, non-theft, purity, sympathy and non-injury--ten kinds of धर्म; भिक्षु: दण्डि, मेखलि, and lying in ground floor. <F>1:  भा. VII. १२. 1-३१; १३. 1-१०; १४. to the end; M. १४१. ६१-2; २४८. १६; वा. 8. १७७-88; २३. ८२; ३३. २७; ५६. ६८; ६१. १६७; Vi. III. 8. २०; ch. 9 (whole).</F> A reference to the fifth आश्रम; <F>2:  Br. II. १६. १५; III. १५. ३७-8.</F> will be lost at the end of Kaliyuga when anarchy prevails. <F>3:  M. ४७. २५७.</F>
--a group of sages of कश्यप gotra. M. १९९. 2.
--on the left hind foot of the शिशुमार। <F>1:  भा. V. २३. 6; Br. II. २४. १३५.</F> Its im- portance for श्राद्ध; <F>2:  Br. III. १८. 5.</F> the seventh नक्षत्र। <F>3:  वा. ८२. 5.</F>
--a son of सहिष्णु अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. २१३.
--a प्रवर of अङ्गिरस्. M. १९६. १३.
--कश्यपगोत्रकरस्. M. १९९. 6.
--a manvantara for श्राद्ध। M. १७. 7-8. [पगे१-179+ २८]
--sacred to अङ्गारक, and for performing श्राद्ध। Br. II. २१. ७६; २४. १३३; III. १८. १०; वा. ५३. १०८; ६६. ५१; ८२. १०.
--on the नर्मदा. M. १९४. ३०.
and अर्धासनम्--the sitting posture of the पाशुपत योग; <F>1:  वा. ११. १२-14.</F> a kind of धरणा। <F>2:  वा. १०४. २४.</F>
--the son of श्वफल्क and गान्दिनि. भा. IX. २४. १६.
--also पानम्; different kinds of; forbidden to ब्राह्मणस्, widows and girls. Br. IV. 7. ६३.
--the यक्ष presiding over the month नभस्य। भा. XII. ११. ३८.
--a form of marriage. Vi. III. १०. २४.
--a pupil of पाराशर्य Kauthuma. <F>1:  Br. II. ३५. ४६.</F> His descendants were कश्यपगोत्रकरस्. <F>2:  M. १९९. 3.</F>
(I)--the name of the entrance of the west of the city of Puramjana; allegorically the organ of procreation. भा. IV. २५. ५२; २९. १४. [पगे१-180+ ३५]

(II)--a pupil of Kapila from whom he learnt साङ्ख्य; a सिद्ध; <F>1:  भा. I. 3. १०; III. २४. १७; VI. १५. १४.</F> did not comprehend Hari's माया; <F>2:  भा. IX. 4. ५७.</F> was invited for the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर. <F>3:  भा. X. ७४. 9.</F>
(III)--the queen देवताजित् and mother of Deva- dyumna. (Asuri-Burnouf). भा. V. १५. 3.
(IV)--the chief author of the recension of the यजुर् वेद of the middle country; <F>1:  Br. II. ३५. १२.</F> a ब्रह्मऋषि. <F>2:  M. १०२. १८.</F>
(V)--a son of ब्रह्मा. वा. १०१. ३३८.
--part of night when Nanda entered the यमुना and was carried to वरुण by an Asura. भा. X. २८. 2.
--an अङ्गिरस and a मन्त्रकृत्: <F>1:  Br. II. ३२. १०९: वा. ५९. १००.</F> Father of उरुक्षव. <F>2:  M. ४९. ३८.</F>

--A son of Punarvasu and father of Devaka and Ugrasena and धृति (वा।); <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. २०-21; वा. ९६. १२०-123; Vi. IV. १४. १५-16; Br. III. ७१. १२०-121.</F> a prince who had thousands of sons. <F>2:  भा. I. १४. २८; X. ९०. ४२.</F> Hated by कंस. <F>3:  Ib. X. ३६. २४ [२८]; X[५० (V) 8].</F> Consulted by कृष्ण on the eve of attack on जरासन्ध. His defence in the third campaign [पगे१-181+ ३४] of जरासन्ध. <F>4:  Ib. X [५१ (V) २६].</F> Met कृष्ण at the council hall, and wel- comed him after the कुरुक्षेत्र war. <F>5:  Ib. X. [६७ (V) ४२]; ८०. [१३].</F> Went to Syamanta- पञ्चक for solar eclipse. <F>6:  Ib. X. ८२. 5.</F> An ideal ruler; married काशि king's daughter. <F>7:  Br. III. ७१. १२८; M. ४४. ७०.</F> Specialist in chariot war; <F>8:  वा. ९६. १२१-2; Br. III. ७१. १२२-3.</F> आहुकी was his sister, married to आहुकान्ध; <F>9:  वा. ९६. १२७; M. ४४. ६६-70.</F> had ८०० lakhs of horses, २१,000 elephants with silver and gold chains in east and west directions; equal to great Bhoja; <F>१०:  Br. III. ७१. १२३-127; वा. ९६. १२१-126; M. ४४. ६७-68.</F> informed of happenings in प्रभास. <F>११:  Vi. V. ३७. ५९.</F>
--the people of an eastern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ५२; वा. ४५. १२१.
--married sister of आहुक; father of two sons and a daughter. वा. ९६. १२७; Br. III. ७१. १२७.
--the daughter of Punarvasu and sister of आहुक (s.v.) the queen of the king of Avanti (आहुकान्ध)। भा. IX. २४. २१; Br. III. ७१. १२१ and १२७; M. ४४. ६६; वा. ९६. १२०, १२७; Vi. IV. १४. १५.
--a son of Vastu. वा. ९५. ३७.
--an Apsaras गण from ब्रह्मा. Br. III. 7. १८.
--one of the names in the third मरुत्गण। वा. ६७. १२६. [पगे१-182+ २५]
--from the third face of the fourteen faced deva came आदित्य, यजुर्मय and यजुर्वेद। वा. २६. ३४.
--a pupil of रथीतर. Br. II. ३५. 4.
(I)--a tree peculiar to हरिवर्ष. Br. II. १७. 7.
(II) (क्रतु)--a R. of शाकद्वीप, from the side of the Himalayas. Br. II. १९. ९६; M. १२२. ३२; वा. ४९. ९३; Vi. II. 4. ६५.
(III)--one of the seven oceans; see इक्षुरसोदा। Br. IV. ३१. १८; M. 2. ३४.
(IV)--a R. from the side of the हिमालयस्, in the भारतवर्ष. M. ११४. २२; वा. ४५. ९६.
(V)--a R. joining the नर्मदा; very holy. A bath here makes one lord of a देवगण. M. १९१. ४९-50.
--given by ब्रह्मा to कामेश्वर as a wedding present; also इक्षुधनुस्। Br. IV. १५. १९; १९. २६; १८. 1.
--sugarcane juice for श्राद्ध; one of the eight सौभाग्यम्स्। M. 7. ११ and २६; १५. ३५; ६०. 8; ८५. 6. [पगे१-183+ ४०]
--a R. from Mahendra hills. M. ११४. ३१.
(I)--a R. On its banks was the hermitage of Kapila. भा. V. १०. 1; Vi. II. १३. ५३.
(II)--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. १७.
--one of the seven seas surrounding प्लक्ष- द्वीप. भा. V. 1. ३३; २०. 7; Vi. II. 4, २०.
--a R. of the Mahendra hill. वा. ४५. १०६.

--one of the ten (nine-ब्र्। प्।) sons of Vaiva- svata Manu. Born of his sneezing. <F>1:  भा. VIII. १३. 2; IX. 1. 3 and १२; 2. 2; वा. ६४. २९; ८५. 4; ८८. 9; Vi. IV. 1. 7; Br. II. ३८. ३०; III. ६०. 2 and २०; ६३. 8; M. 9. ३०; ११. ४१.</F> Father of a hundred sons--विकुक्षि, Nimi, दण्ड and others. २५ of these sons ruled आर्यावर्त, २५, the western territory, three, the middle country and the rest all other provinces. Once in connec- tion with an अष्टक ritual, विकुक्षि was asked to secure some flesh. Accordingly he did. But feeling hungry he partook a part of hare's flesh. When the remainder was presented, the पुरोहित refused to take it on the ground that it was remain- der of that already tasted. विकुक्षि was therefore punished with banishment. It is said that he became a yogin and attained salvation. <F>2:  भा. IX. 6. 4-१०; Vi. IV. 2. १५-18.</F> A king known for his exemplary pro- tection of his subjects. परीक्षित् compared to him. <F>3:  भा. I. १२. १९.</F> Promi- nent kings of his line. <F>4:  M. १२. १५-56; वा. ९९. २८०-290.</F> Knew the power of Hari's योग, and in his line Hari incarnated. <F>5:  भा. II. 7. २३ and ४४; XII. 2. ३७;</F> Sumitra was the last क्षत्रिय king of this line. <F>6:  Br. III. ७४. २४४; M. २७३. ५३; वा. ९९. २६६ and ४३१.</F> Originator of the solar race; the genea- logy given down to शन्तायु of the भारत war. <F>7:  M. १२. १५-56.</F> Heard from वसिष्ठ of Ila's conversion to the other sex in the शर- वण forest and performed अश्वमेध by which Ila was [पगे१-184+ २७] turned into a किम्पुरुष. <F>8:  M. १२. 1-१५.</F> Was addressed by the पितृस् in कलाप forest on the effect of offering श्राद्ध at गया. <F>१०:  Vi. III. 1. ३३; १६. १७-18.</F> The line of. <F>११:  वा. 1. १४२; ८८. १७५-184; Vi. IV. २२. 1-१३.</F> Had १०० branches. <F>१२:  वा. ९९. ४५१.</F>
--one of the उत्तम सिद्धिस्। Br. IV. ३६. ५१.
--is श्रौत इज्या or sacrifice being one of the eight practices of शिष्टस्। Br. II. ३२. ४० and ४४.
--son of शतरथ; married the daughter of विश्वसहस्र. Br. III. ६३. १८०.
--the daughter of तृणबिन्दु: a queen of विश्र- vas, and mother of Kubera. भा. IV. 1. ३७; १२. 9.
(I)--a son of दक्षिणा and a तुषित god. भा. IV. 1. 7-8.
(II)--a name of Hari; पुरुष. भा. IX. 2. ३५.
--a daughter of तृणबिन्दु and wife of Pulastya, father of the sage वैश्रवस्. वा. ७०. ३१.

--Historical literature known to सूत; <F>1:  भा. I. 1. 6; M. ५७. १५; ५८. 4; ६९. ३३; ७२. 6; २४७. १७.</F> the fifth Veda; their origin; to be read or heard on days of fasting; <F>2:  भा. I. 4. २०, २२; III. १२. ३९; M. ९९. ११; वा. ५४. ११५; ५५. 2; ६०. १६; ७९. ५३; १०४. 2; Vi. I. २२. ८३; III. 4. १०; V. 1. ३८.</F> came in a personified form, to see Trivikrama Hari. <F>3:  भा. VIII. २१. 2; Br. I. 1. १७१; II. ३४. १६; III. १५. २५; IV. 4. ४७, ५६; 7. 9; वा. I. २५, ३२.</F>
(I)--see इडावत्सर। Vi. II. 8. ७२.
(II)--a name of the moon. वा. ५०. १८३; ५६. २०.

(III)--the third year in a five year cycle; <F>1:  वा. ३१. २७.</F> Soma according to पुराणिच् tradition; he is प्रपितामह ensuring prosperity. <F>2:  Br. II. १३. ११५, ११८, १२९; वा. ३१. ५५.</F> [पगे१-186+ २७]
(I)--the son of दृढच्युत and grandson of Agastya; a sage who came to see परीक्षित् practising प्रायोप- वेश। भा. IV. २८. ३२; I. १९. 9.
(II)--a son of Agastya; and the adopted son of Kratu; hence आगस्त्यस् are Kratus. M. २०२. 8-9.
--a son of Priyavrata and बर्हिष्मती. Appointed lord of प्लक्षद्वीप, which he divided into seven parts among his seven sons, and retired to practise auste- rities. भा. V. 1. २५ and ३३; २०. 2.
--a divinity invoked by cowherdesses to protect the neck of the baby कृष्ण. भा. X. 6. २२.
(I)--a surname of लक्ष्मी; a शक्ति bearer of fly whisk to ललिता. भा. X. ३१. 1; Br. IV. ३५. ९८.
(II)--the son of विश्वग. M. १२. २९.
(III)--Moon--married the २७ मानस daughters of दक्ष. वा. ६३. ४१. [पगे१-187+ ४३]
--the mother of दशरथ. Br. IV. ४०. १०० and १३७.
--also चन्द्रमौलि। Br. IV. ३०. ३८ and ६७.

(I)--(सहस्राक्ष, देवेन्द्र, etc.). A लोकपाल। He and three other लोकपालस् have their cities on the मान- sottara mountain in पुष्करद्वीप; <F>1:  भा. V. २०. ३०; M. २६६. १९.</F> worshipped for vigour of organs. <F>2:  भा. II. 3. 2.</F> Served as calf for gods to milk from the Earth. <F>3:  Ib. IV. १८. १५; M. १०. १८.</F> Presented पृथु with a crown. <F>4:  भा. IV. १४. २६; १५. १५.</F> Deprived पृथु of his sacrificial horse during the hundredth अश्वमेध। Urged by Atri, पृथु's son pursued Indra, when the latter aban- doned the house and disappeared. A second time Indra deprived पृथु of his horse; when the king's men pursued him, he left the horse and went away in disguise. This enraged पृथु, who aimed his arrow at Indra but was pacified by ब्रह्मा in the name of धर्म। A reconcilia- tion was effected when पृथु embraced him. <F>5:  Ib. IV. १६. २४; १९. १०-17, १९-22, २६-39; २०. १८.</F> Invested विजिताश्व with power of moving about unseen by others. <F>6:  Ib. IV. २४. 3.</F> Jealous of ऋषभ, refused rains for his kingdom अजनाभ. Bestowed जयन्ती on him. <F>7:  Ib. V. 4. 3 and 8.</F> During हिरण्यकशिपु's absence at Mandara hill, Indra captured his queen and took her to his heavenly abode. नारद intervened and set her at liberty. <F>8:  Ib. VII. 7. 6-११.</F> Took up his वज्र against Cyavana for allowing अश्विन्स् to partake of सोम juice. But Cyavana's तपस् tied down his arms, when Indra yielded. <F>9:  Ib. IX. 3. २५, २६.</F> Assumed the form of a bull over which Kakustha rode and defeated Asuras in a battle. Made the crying मान्- धात suckle his finger. <F>१०:  Ib. IX. 6. १२-15, ३१; Vi. IV. 2. २९-32.</F> Prevented Rohita from entering [पगे१-188+ ४६] his city for six years: Awarded हरिश्चन्द्र a golden chariot after his पुरुषमेध। <F>११:  भा. VII. 7. १७-20, २३.</F> Robbed Sagara's sacrifi- cial horse and left it near Kapila's hermitage. <F>१२:  Ib. IX. 8. 8 and १०.</F> Performed a sacrifice which was attended by वसिष्ठ. <F>१३:  Ib. IX. १३. 1 and 2.</F> Joined the gods in तारकामय war. <F>१४:  Ib. IX. १४. 7.</F> Asked Gandharvas to take back उर्वशी living with पुरूरवस्. <F>१५:  Ib. IX. १४. २६.</F> Helped by राजि, gave back his kingdom. After his death, his sons refused to give back the kingdom, and Indra slew all of them. <F>१६:  Ib. IX. १७. १३-16; Br. III. ६७. ८७-105.</F> Cursed by दुर्वास, he lost all fortune. The three worlds became empty. वरुण and other gods conferred with ब्रह्मा. Finding no means to restore their fortunes, they repaired to Hari Ajita when ब्रह्मा belauded Hari as महाविभूति। Hari advised them to secure Bali's alliance. <F>१७:  भा. VIII. 5. १६-50; 6. ३०-31.</F> When the देवासुर war broke out, the gods fought with Bali who defeated them. At that time Indra prayed to Hari for help. Encouraged by the latter, the war was renewed and Bali was defeated. At this Jambha offered to fight Indra and disabled his elephant. मातलि supplied a chariot and Jambha's head was cut off. Namuci, Bala and पाक attacked Indra. The latter two were slain. Namuci proved too much for Indra's वज्र। A voice from the sky told Indra that Namuci could not be crushed by a wet or dry thing. Then Indra used फेन (foam) and vanquished him. Bali in the meantime gathered strength and beseiged Indra. Indra sought counsel of बृहस्पति who cared for his welfare, and as advised by the latter, he abandoned the city. <F>१८:  Ib. VIII. १०. २४ and २८, ४१-53; ११. 1-४०; १५. २४-33; M. २२. ६०-61; २९. ११; ३१. १२.</F> Got back Heaven from वामन-Hari. He took him to his abode. <F>१९:  भा. VIII. २३. १९ and २४.</F> Defeated by Arjuna who got the सभा made by Maya. Arjuna for a short time shared his throne. Defeated by Arjuna at खाण्डव. His city visited by Arjuna in the course of a search for the dead children of the द्वारका Bra1hman2a. <F>२०:  Ib. X. ८९. ३४[4], ४४.</F> Was not able to defeat निवात [पगे१-189+ ४४] Kavacas. <F>२१:  Ib. X. ८९. ३४[5].</F> Afraid of Nara's superior powers, sent काम to spoil his तपस्; was struck with fear with the sage's great- ness; <F>२२:  Ib. XI. 4. 7 and १६.</F> sent nymphs to disturb मार्कण्डेय's व्रत but in vain. <F>२३:  Ib. XII. 8. १५-31.</F> Sheltered तक्षक and was about to be sacrificed when बृहस्पति luckily intervened. <F>२४:  Ib. XII. 6. १७-23.</F> Said to be afraid of the Kurus. <F>२५:  Ib. X. ६८. २८ and ३४.</F> Attended वरुण's sacrifice and युधिष्- ठिर's. <F>२६:  Ib. X. ७४. १३.</F> For his sake Hari went to Bali in the disguise of a ब्राह्मण. <F>२७:  Ib. X. ७२. २५.</F> Once he sat with इन्द्राणी in his सभा sur- rounded by all gods. In his pride he did not welcome his preceptor बृहस्पति in the proper way. The latter went away home at once and concealed himself from the gods. On this the Asuras attacked the gods. Indra repented and on ब्रह्मा's advice appointed विश्वरूप as his preceptor. Having been initiated into the विद्या वर्म नारायणात्म- कम्, he was enjoying his original prosperity. One day Indra discovered that a part of विश्वरूप's offerings went to the Asuras and therefore cut off his head in anger. Thus he incurred the sin of ब्रह्महत्या। After a year, in order to rid himself of it he divided his sin into four parts among (1) the earth with the boon that dug portion should get filled up, (2) the waters with the boon of increasing volume when mixed up, (3) trees with the boon that branches cut off grow again, and (4) women with the boon of ever cherishing the passion of love. The saline soil, bubbles and foam, gum and monthly discharges respectively represent the ब्रह्महत्या sin. <F>२८:  Ib. VI. 7. 2-४०; 8. ४२; 9. 4-११.</F> With वज्र made of दधीचि's bones (made by त्वष्ट्र् from sun's तेजस्--मत्स्य प्।), Indra attacked वृत्र as Rudra attacked Yama. The encounter took place on the banks of the नर्मदा in the first त्रेतायुग। Battle described. Seeing his friends escaping in fright, वृत्र en- couraged them to stand and fight. He also disabled Indra's ऐरावत, and addressed him at length. Indra cut off one of his arms. With the remaining arm वृत्र hit Indra while the वज्र slipped from his hands causing concern to the gods. [पगे१-190+ ४३] Encouraged by the straight speech of वृत्र, Indra took up his वज्र and cut off his other arm. वृत्र swallowed him; but Indra, the vanquisher of Bala, got out of his stomach and cut off his head. Indra's regret at the murder of another ब्राह्मण. The sin of brahmicide, says the legend, took the disguise of a चण्डाल woman and ran towards him in a terrific form when he entered the lake मानस and lived in the lotus stalks for a thousand years. Invited by ब्राह्म- णस्, he performed an अश्वमेध and got rid of his sins. <F>२९:  Ib. VIII. १०. १३-33; ११. १०-27; १२. 3-३३; १३. 4-२१.</F> Father of three sons Jayanta and others through Pau- लोमी. Getting to know that his mother Diti was observing a vow to get a child to slay him he offered to do service to her. Once he found her slack in her duty. He entered the womb and cut the child into seven pieces and each of these again into seven. At her request he offered to her to give them the rank of gods, by name मरुत्स्, <F>३०:  Ib. VI. १८. 7, ३७, ५४, ५६-77; M. 7. ५०-65; ६९. ६०; १४६. २०, २८-44, ४५-55; Br. III. 5. ५५-79; IV. २०. ४४.</F> who were allowed to share in the यज्ञस्। Diti thought of another son वज्रान्ग who bound Indra and placed him before her. Was released on mediation from ब्रह्मा and कश्यप. <F>३०: a) M. १४६. ४५-55.</F> Reported to कृष्ण the wicked deeds of Naraka. Got a gift of मणिपर्वत of Naraka from कृष्ण. <F>३१:  भा. X. ५९. 1 [1] and 2, २२[3]; Vi. V. २९. 1-१५.</F> Visited by कृष्ण and सत्यभामा. At the latter's wish, पारिजात was removed without any intimation. Indra, induced by इन्द्राणि attacked him with all gods. Kubera, वरुण and others were defeated. Indra himself offered resist- ance. गरुड disabled his elephant and Indra retreated. सत्यभामा made fun of him ‘Do not run, Lord of इन्द्राणी.’ Indra apologised. कृष्ण answered that Indra was not in the wrong as he (कृष्ण) took the offensive. Indra asked pardon and begged that his son बीभत्सु be protected. कृष्ण told him that पारिजात would go back to him when he left the mortal world. Returned to his city with all gods. <F>३२:  Ib. V. ३७. १६; भा. X. ५९. ३८-39; [६५ (V) 5], [३७-51]; [६६. (V)] whole; [६७ (V) 1-३७]; Vi. V. ३०. ५१-70; ३१. 1-१०.</F> The God of rain: Sent torrents of showers on Gokula when कृष्ण protected his friends by holding up the hill [पगे१-191+ ५०] Govardhana. At this Indra and Surabhi came to visit him. Indra asked for pardon. Told by कृष्ण that he was humi- liated for his own good. In the company of Surabhi, Indra got कृष्ण bathed with the waters of the गङ्गा and called him Govinda. Returned to his region. <F>३३:  भा. X. 3. ५०; २६. २५; २७. 1-१७. २२-28; Vi. V. chap. ११ & १२ whole.</F> Presented सुधर्म and पारिजात to कृष्ण for his new city. <F>३४:  भा. X. ५०-55; Vi. V. २१. १३-17.</F> Requested Mucukunda for aid against the Asuras. <F>३५:  भा. X. ५१. १५.</F> Went to द्वारका with gods to invite कृष्ण to go back to वैकुण्ठ्२अ. <F>३६:  Ib. XI. 6. 2; ३१. 1.</F> Place on the शिशुमार। <F>३७:  Ib. V. २३. 5.</F> Prayer to Narasimha. <F>३८:  Ib. VII. 8. ४२.</F> Devoid of energy. <F>३९:  Ib. VIII. 5. १९.</F> Pleased with the यज्ञ of Marutta. <F>४०:  Ib. IV. 2. २८;</F> Father of अर्जुङ. <F>४१:  Br. III. ७१. १५४; M. ४६. 9; ५०. ५०; IX. २२. २७; Vi. IV. १४. ३५; वा. ९२. ८२; ९६. १५३; १०३. ६०; १०६. २०, ५९; १०८. 4, ३१.</F> See इन्द्रयाग। With the sun for the months नभोनभसि: An आदित्य; represents a face of शिव; <F>४२:  भा. XII. ११. ३७; Br. II. २३. 9; २४. ३३, ३८; २६. ४०; २७. २३; III. 3. ६८, १०२; M. 6. 4; १७१. ५६; वा. ५२. 7; Vi. II. १०. 9.</F> also विश्वभुक्; introduced यज्ञ at the commencement of त्रेतायुग; <F>४३:  Br. II. ३०. 9, १६, २१; M. १४३. 5.</F> the seventh Veda- व्यास. Realm of. <F>४४:  Br. II. ३५. ९८ and ११८; IV. ३३. ५५; M. ८२. ३१; Vi. III. 3. १३.</F> Vanquished the sons of Varatri when they disturbed Manu's sacrifice. <F>४५:  Br. III. 1. ८०.</F> Sent Agni to disturb महादेव's enjoying उमा when the latter cursed him to bear the गर्भ। <F>४६:  Ib. III. 7. ७२, ३२६; १०. २३-28; २४. 2, 4.</F> Was born as गाधि, son of कुशिक. <F>४७:  Ib. III. ६३. २५; ६६. ३४-5.</F> As an अवतार् of विष्णु, defeated Prahlada who offered battle for a period of ३०० years and killed his son Virocana in तारकामय battle; obtained sovereignty over the three worlds. <F>४८:  Br. III. 5. ५५-79; IV. २०. ४४; M. 8. 4; २२. ६१; २४. ३८-49; २७. ३७; ४७. ४८-61.</F> Slew Jambha who had won the grace of शिव. <F>४९:  M. ४७, ७२.</F> Know- ing नारद on a mission to bring about the wedding of उमा [पगे१-192+ ४९] and शिव, sent the God of Love and the seven sages in its accomplishment. <F>५०:  M. १५४. १११-131.</F> Praised शिव on his conquest of Tripura: Cursed ययाति to fall from heaven; <F>५१:  M. ३४. 6; ३५. 3-6; ३६. 3-4; ६४. २७.</F> disturbed वरान्गि's penance by disguises of monkey, reptile, etc. <F>५२:  M. १४६. २३, ६३-70.</F> A friend of पुरूरवस्, offered half his seat when he visited him daily. <F>५३:  M. २४. १४, २६.</F> Addressed बृहस्पति on the nature and meaning of the bad omens he saw. <F>५४:  Br. IV. 4. ६०; 6. ३१-5.</F> Sacrifice on the banks of the Ganges and in the Gaura hill. Helped ललिता in her conquest of भण्ड; the place of his penance became Indraprastha. <F>५५:  Br. II. १८. २८; I. 1. १३०; IV. 6. २४; 8. ६१; १२. ३५. 9, ४३; १९. ८३; २६. ५३; ३०. 8.</F> Clipped the wings of mountains which flew into the sea. <F>५६:  Br. II. २२. ४१; M. १२१. ७८;</F> Gave boons to Sukarman, a manvantara Lord; <F>५७:  Br. II. ३५. ३४; ३६. 1.</F> Sent Apsaras as gopis to aid कृष्ण. Festival of, by cowherds; disapproved by कृष्ण, was discontinued; <F>५८:  Br. III. ६८. १७; ७१. २०१, २४४; Vi. V. १०. १६-26; भा. X. २४ (whole).</F> gifts of elephants and gems pleasing to. <F>५९:  M. ४७. ११४-122, १७१-9; २६६. ६२.</F> Sent his daughter जयन्ती to earn the good will of शुक्र and then disturb his penance. <F>६०:  M. १७२. 5; २४५. ८२.</F> Fight of, with गजासुर and Nemi; <F>६१:  M. १५३. ५९; १७७. ४७; २२३. 4. ११; २४४. 8. २६६. ४३.</F> made the six children into one कार्तिकेय. <F>६२:  M. १५९. 5.</F> Cursed Agni and Marut to be born in the world for failure to obey his orders in drying up the ocean and vanquishing the Asuras. <F>६३:  M. ६१. 3-१७;</F> Indra of Vaivasvata antara equal to other Indras. Lord of देवगणस्; <F>६४:  Br. II. १३. ९७; वा. ६६. १४.</F> Lord of the past, present and future; the thousand eyed; performer of १०० sacrifices; <F>६५:  वा. ६४. 5-8.</F> slew वरूत्रि's sons who rioted by eating the offerings intended for gods. <F>६६:  वा. ६५. ७९-81.</F> [पगे१-193+ २५]
(II)--the temple of, in विदर्भा (see इन्द्राणी). भा. X. ५३. ४९[1].
(III)--a son of वसिष्ठ, and प्रजापति of the स्वारोचिष epoch. M. 9. 9.
(IV)--a division of the day. वा. ६६. ४१.
(V)--one of Danu's sons. वा. ६८. 8.
--a mountain in भारतवर्ष. भा., V. १९. १६.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ५३.
--flags flying in the streets of द्वारका during कृष्ण's marriage with रुक्मिणि. भा. X. ५४. ५६.
--one of the उपयास् of a king. M. २२२. 2.
(I)--a son of रावण, killed in the Lanka war. भा. IX. १०. १८; Br. III. 6. 6.
(II)--a son of Danu. M. 6. १९; वा. ६८. 6.
(III)--a तीर्थम् near Garjanam on the Nar- मदा. M. १९०. 3. [पगे१-194+ २८]
--a दानव, in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु. Br. III. 6. 8; M. १६१. ८१.
--Indrahood, attained by Heti. वा. १०९. 9.
--a Kinnara with human face. वा. ६९. ३५.

--the son of Tejasa (Taijasa-वा। प्।). A द्राविड and a पाण्ड्यन् king. Devoted to Hari. While engaged in तपस् Agastya came to his hermitage. Finding him not extending a welcome, the angry sage cursed him to become an elephant. Indradyumna considered that to be the will of the Lord. He was born as the Lord of the ele- phants, and had reminiscences of his past life; <F>1:  भा. VIII. 4. 7-१२; Br. II. १४. ६४; वा. ३३. ५४; Vi. II. 1. ३६.</F> an account of, in the कूर्म पूराण। <F>2:  M. ५३. ४७-8.</F>
--a lake through which पावनि flows (नलिनी--मत्स्य प्।). Br. II. १८. ५६; M. १२१. ५५; वा. ४७. ५४.
--one of the nine divisions of भारतवर्ष: <F>1:  Br. II. १६. 9; वा. ४५. ७९; Vi. II. 3. 6; M. ११४. 8.</F> Here the R. नलिनी enters the sea. <F>2:  M. १२१. ५७.</F>
--a place where पावनी enters the sea. Br. II. १८. ५८; वा. ४७. ५५.
--the rainbow created by वामदेव. M. 4. २९; वा. 9. ५२; १९. 8; Br. II. 8. ५४. [पगे१-195+ ३०]
--a son of बाण. Br. III. 5. ४५.
--the fall of चाणूर, compared to the fall- ing of. भा. X. ४४. २३.
--a R. of the Bhadra country. वा. ४३. २६.
--a kingdom on the west, watered by the Sindhu; <F>1:  Br. II. १८. ४८.</F> in गया. <F>2:  वा. १०९. १९.</F>
--the son of बन्धुपालित, ruled for १० years. Br. III. ७४. १४७; वा. ९९. ३३४.
--a वासिष्थ and a ब्रह्मवादिन्; <F>1:  M. १४५. ११०.</F> a name of कुशि, son of वसिष्ठ. <F>2:  वा. ७०. ८८.</F>

--the sage and a वासिष्ठ who came to see परीक्षित् practising प्रायोपवेश। Learnt ऋक् सम्हित from Paila and taught it to the sage माण्डुकेय; (मर्कण्- डेय-वा।) <F>1:  भा. I. १९. 9; XII. 6. ५४-56; Br. II. ३२. ११५; ३३. 3; ३४. २५; वा. ६०. २५, २७; Vi. III. 4. १६, १९.</F> Also known as कुणि; <F>2:  Br. III. 8. ९६-7.</F> not to have marriage alliances with वासिष्ठस् and भगीवसु, a resident of Brah- मक्षेत्र. <F>3:  वा. ५९. १०५.</F>
--a sage; called on dying भीष्म. भा. I. 9. 7; १९. 9. [पगे१-196+ ३२]

--यादवस् of द्वारक taken to, by Arjuna, fearing erosion of the sea. See also हस्तिनापुरम्; <F>1:  भा. X. ५८. 1; XI. ३०. ४८; ३१. २५.</F> after Indra who performed penance here in honour of परा- शक्ति to vanquish भण्ड. <F>2:  Br. IV. १२. ४४.</F> Arjuna had Vajra crowned here. <F>3:  Vi. V. ३८. ३४.</F>
--a दानव with मनुष्यधर्म. Br. III. 6. १६; वा. ६८. १५.
--An आगस्त्य and ब्रह्मिष्ठ. M. १४५. ११४.
--the wife of बाण and mother of Lau- hitya. वा. ६७. ८५.
--the kingdom of. M. १२१. ४७.

--performed every year by Nanda and other gopas to please Indra, the Lord of rains and hence conducive to त्रिवर्ग। कृष्ण explained that rain was the work of nature, and that no credit went to Indra. So he persuaded them to worship cows, ब्राह्मणस् and hills. So it hap- pened. Indra who was thus deprived of his बलि grew wrath- ful and sent down a continuous heavy downpour of rain creating panic in the minds of gopas. कृष्ण took hold of the hill Govardhana and held it aloft as an umbrella steadily for seven days. Astonished at this, Indra withdrew his rains and Govardhana was planted in its place. भा. X. २४ (whole); ch. २५. 1-२८.
--the world of Indra. See also ‘Realm of’ under इन्द्र (footnote ४४). M. २७७. २२; २७८. २९; वा. ३४. ७६-7; ६१. ८८; १११. ५२. [पगे१-197+ २६]
--see Puramjaya. भा. IX. 6. १२.
--of a king; to create prosperity in the country, as Indra gives rains; <F>1:  M. २२६. १०.</F> leads to the world of Indra. <F>2:  Ib. १०१. ६९.</F>
--one of भण्ड's councillors. Br. IV. १२. १२.
--(Mt.) a hill north of महाभद्र lake. वा. ३६. ३१.
--the assembly of Indra. वा. 2. २९.
--Manu the fourteenth. Uru and others were his sons. During his period शुचि was Indra, while अग्निबाहु and others were sages. बृहद्भानु was a mani- festation of Hari. भा. VIII. १३. ३३-35.
--to be uttered in founding a temple. M. २६५. २५.
(I)--a boundary hill in प्लक्षद्वीप. भा. V. २०. 4.
(II)--a son of देवऋषभ. भा. VI. 6. 5.
(III)--a son of कूर्च (पूर्व-Burnouf) and father of वीतिहोत्र. भा. IX. 2. १९-20. [पगे१-198+ ३३]
(IV)--previously Bali. Received कृष्ण and राम with due honours to his region Sutala, and praised their glory; gave them back their brothers killed by कंस. भा. X. ८५. ३५-46, ५२.
(V)--a son of ब्रह्मिष्ठ and father of विन्ध्याश्व. M. ५०. 6.
--the wife of Mudgola and mother of बध्यश्व. वा. ९९. २००.
--a son of ऋषभ and जयन्ती. भा. V. 4. १०.

(I)--sat with Indra in his सभा। <F>1:  भा. VI. 7. 6.</F> Punished नहुष for his overweening pride. <F>2:  Ib. IX. १८. 3; VI. १३. १६.</F> Was the mother of Jayanta and two other sons. <F>3:  Ib. VI. १८. 7.</F> Welcomed कृष्ण and Satya- भामा to अमरावति. सत्यभामा aggrieved against her and thought her proud of her riches and of her Lord's prowess. <F>4:  Ib. X. ५९. ३८; [६५ (V) 5], [२८]; [६७ (V) १९].</F> A शक्ति. <F>5:  Br. IV. ४४. ८४, १११.</F>

(II)--The temple of--in Vidarbha. This was visited by रुक्मिणी on the day prior to her marriage for worship. इन्द्राणी and Indra were kuladevatas of Vidar- bhas. <F>1:  भा. X. ५३. ४९ [1 & 2], and ५०.</F> Image of. <F>2:  M. १३. ५२; २६०. ७०; २६१. ३१.</F>
--the rainbow appearing in cloudless sky or at night, a bad sign for a state. M. २३३. 7. [पगे१-199+ २७]
(I)--(इन्द्रियग्रामम्) Senses: Five, under the control of बुद्धि (ज्ञानम्) and five under कर्म। M. 3. १८-20; १८४. ५६; वा. ३१. ४३.
(II)--the devas of तामसमन्वन्तर, so called. वा. ६२. ३९.
--a शौनक sage who gave succour to Janame- jaya in his अश्वमेध यज्ञ। Br. III. ६८. २५; वा. ९३. २५.
(I)--a name of सरस्वती. भा. X. १३. ५७.

(II)--a daughter of दक्ष (गरुड (?)-वा। प्।) and one of the wives of कश्यप; mother of three daughters: लता (creeper), वल्ली (creeping plant) and वीरुधा (a plant which grows again after being cut); they became in turn mothers of trees, plants and shrubs; लता created flowerless wild plants standing in sandy regions and also trees with fruits and flowers; वल्ली, bushes and grass of all kinds and वीरुधा created वीरुध group as her issues. Br. III. 7. ४५९-63, ४६८; M. 6. 2 and ४६; १४६. १८; वा. ६९. ३३९-42; Vi. I. १५. १२५; २१. २४.
--a son of Danu. M. 6. १८.
--a son of Arjuna by उलूपि. भा. IX. २२. ३२; Vi. IV. २०. ४९.
(I)--a daughter of Uttara and wife of परीक्षित्. भा. I. १६. 2. [पगे१-200+ ३२]
(II)--one of the wives of Rudra. भा. III. १२. १३.

(III)--a R. from the हिमालयस्; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. २५; वा. ४५. ९५.</F> sacred to पितृस्; a river-consort of fire हव्यवाह; in the chariot of Tripu- रारि. <F>2:  M. २२. १९; ५१. १३; १३३. २३; Br. II. १२. १५; वा. २९. १३.</F>

(IV)--a daughter of क्रोधवश and wife of Pulaha: In her womb was placed the अङ्डकपाल by the progenitor and she gave birth to 4 kingly sons (elephants), ऐरावण, Kumuda, अञ्जन and वामन. Br. III. 7. १७२, २८९-292.
(V)--a daughter of क्रोधा and mother of ऐरावत. वा. ६९. २०५, २११.

--the eldest son of Vaivasvata Manu; born of पुत्रेष्टि; anointed by Manu going to Mahendra hill for तपस्; set out for दिग्विजय, when he reached शरवण gardens where उमा was sporting with शिव। There was a curse by which a male who entered the garden was turned into a female. So Ila became इला। Bewildered इला was wan- dering and was met by Budha, Soma's son. She agreed to be his partner and followed him. इक्ष्वाकु and his brothers were concerned at their missing Ila and were told by वसिष्ठ of his whereabouts. On वसिष्ठ's advice, इक्ष्वाकु per- formed an अश्वमेध, as the result of which Ila would be a किम्पुरुष for a month and इला for the next alternately. As इला, she gave birth to पुरूरवस्, the first of the lunar race. In a way Ila was responsible for the two dynasties--solar and lunar. M. ११. ४०-66; १२. 1-१४. [पगे१-201+ ३०]
--a मध्यमाध्वर्यु। Br. II. ३३. १५.
--the daughter of तृणबिन्दु. Br. III. 8. ३७; Vi. IV. 1. ४७.
(I)--Mother Earth; worshipped for gain of bodily strength. <F>1:  भा. II. 3. 5.</F> Waited on Hari; <F>2:  Ib. X. ३९. ५५.</F> saved by Hari in the form of Matsya. <F>3:  Ib. XI. 4. १८.</F>
(II)--one of the wives of Rudra. भा. III. १२. १३.
(III)--the daughter of वायु and one of the queens of Dhruva; her son was Utkala. भा. IV. १०. 2.
(IV)--one of कश्यप's wives. भा. VI. 6. २५, २८; वा. 1. १४१.

(V)--the daughter of Vaivasvata Manu, born of sacrificial ritual in his अश्वमेध। Seeing her father dis- pleased at her birth, वसिष्ठ converted her to a male by name Sudyumna. See इडा; again by शिव's curse he became a woman on whom Budha begot पुरूरवस्; after that she became again Sudyumna. भा. IX. 1. १६, २२; Br. III. ६०. 6; Vi. IV. 1. 9-१३; 6. ३४.
(VI)--the wife of Budha and mother of पुरूरवस्. (See इल). भा. IX. १४. १५; M. २४. 9-१०.
(VII)--one of Vasudeva's wives. Mother of Uru- valka and other sons. भा. IX. २४. ४५ & ४९. [पगे१-202+ २४]
(VIII)--(इडा): sprang out of a sacrifice of Vaiva- svata Manu in honour of Mitra and वरुण; the latter two adopted her as their daughter. वा. ८५. 7.
(IX)--the wife of Tapas in the विश्वशृज् sacrifice. वा. 2. 6.
--a surname of कृष्ण. Br. III. ३६. २९.
--the नाग with the sun in नभ and नभस्य (आवणि and पुरट्टाशि). वा. ५२. १०.
--see इलावृतम्। M. १२. १४.
--a son of ऋषभ. भा. V. 4. १०.
--a son of अग्नीध्र and apsaras पूर्वचित्ति; lord of इलावृतम् (Sumerumadhyama-वा। प्।) भा. V. 2. १९; Br. II. १४. ४६; वा. ३३. ३९, ४३; Vi. II. 1. १६ and २०.

--the central continent of जम्बू- द्वीप. To its north are mountains नील, श्वेत and शृन्ग- वान्, (सुपार्श्व-वि। प्।) and to its south are निषध, Hema- [पगे१-203+ ४३] कूट and Himalayas. To its east and west are माल्यवत् and गन्धमादन. (Mandara-वि। प्।). The abode of शिव. He who enters this region would be turned into a woman by the curse of पार्वति. Here शिव worships the Fourth form of विष्णु called सङ्कर्ष्ण by praises. <F>1:  भा. V. १६. 7-१०; १७. १५-24.</F> इलावृत (s.v.) was its first king. <F>2:  Br. II. १४. ४९; १५. २४, ३३-37.</F> Here there is no sun or moon; people eat wood apple fruits. <F>3:  Ib. II. १७. 9-१४, २२.</F> After Ila who spent here the evening of his life; Bali performed यज्ञस् here. <F>4:  M. ११३. १९ & ३०; ११४. ६९; १३५. 2.</F> Next to हरिवर्ष; <F>5:  वा. ३४. २९.</F> in shape like a bow and lotus coloured; people here eat of जंबू and live to १३,000 years. <F>6:  वा. ४६. ११-15.</F> The middle वर्ष of जम्बुद्वीपम् sur- rounding Meru in extent ९००० योजनस्; appears like a ball of smokeless fire; on each of the two sides are three वर्षस् or continents; <F>7:  वा. ३४. २२.</F> trees special to the region are कदम्ब, जम्बू, पिप्पल, and वट; lies between भद्राश्व and केतुमाल; the forests are चैत्ररथ, गन्धमादन, वैभ्राज and नन्- दन; there are besides four lakes. <F>8:  Vi. II. 2. १५-26.</F>
--a daughter of Yama, and a queen of अन्तिनार; mother of a number of sons; interested in ब्रह्मवाद। M. ४९. 9.
--the son of दशरथ and father of विश्वसह. Vi. IV. 4. ७५.

(I)--A Samhikeya Asura: a son of ह्राद and Dhamani. Cooked वातापि for his guest Agastya. A fol- lower of वृत्र in his battle with Indra. <F>1:  Br. III. 6. १९; भा. VI. १८. १५.</F> Got exhausted in अमृतमथन। <F>2:  Ib. VII. 2. 4; VIII. 7. १४.</F> Took part in देवासुर war between Bali and Indra and fought with the sons of ब्रह्मा. <F>3:  Ib. VIII. १०. २० & ३२.</F> Father of Balvala. <F>4: Ib. X. ७८. ३८.</F>
(II)--a son of Vipracitti. Vi. I. २१. ११. [पगे१-204+ २२]
(III)--a nephew of हिरण्यकशिपु. M. 6. २७.
--is Agastya. Br. IV. ३७. २५; ३८. 8.
(I)--a son of Vatsara and स्वर्वीथि. भा. IV. १३. १२.
(II)--the month sacred to त्वष्टा; ऐप्पशि, one of the two months forming the शरत्। भा. XII. ११. ४३; वा. ३०. 9; ५०. २०१; Br. I. १३. १०.
--a class of people in शाल्मलिद्वीप. भा. V. २०. ११.
--a queen of शरदृतु. Br. IV. ३२. ३४.
--a son of कम्सवती, and देवश्रवस्. भा. IX. २४. ४१.

अंकुशा: इषे त्वोर्जे त्वा वायवस्थ देवो वः सविता पुनः
-- beginning of यजुर्सम्हिता। वा. २६. २०.
(I)--bricks used for buildings. M. २५४. ४१; २६९. ४६.
--the red coloured Manu from the fourth face of the fourteen-faced deva the originator of क्षत्रम्। वा. २६. ३५.
--a northern country. Br. II. १६. ५०.
--a son of शावर्णि Manu. M. 9. ३३.
(I)--a name in fourth मरुत् गण। वा. ६७. १२७.
(II)--a name in the fifth मरुत् गण। वा. ६७. १२८.
(III)--a Marut. Br. III. 5. ९६-7.
(I)--(शिव) became Rudra through Lalita's grace. <F>1:  Br. IV. 6. 8, ७०; ३८. ४०.</F> --also ईशान: Image of; <F>2:  M. २६१. २३.</F> fourth मूर्ति as protecting आदित्य. <F>3:  M. २६५. ४१.</F>
--the bow of शिव broken by श्री Ra1ma. Br. III. ३७. ३२. [पगे१-206+ ३३]
(I)--a boundary hill of शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २६.

(II)--a name of शिव; <F>1:  Br. III. २४. 4; ७३. 1; IV. २०. ५१; ३४. ९१; ४१. 6; Vi. I. 8. 6.</F> lord of the N. E.; <F>2:  वा. १०८, ३२.</F> the fourth body of वायु or the five vital airs; wife शिवा; son, Manojava and अविज्ञानगति. <F>3:  वा. २७. १२, ३२, ५२; Br. II. १०. ११, ४१ and ७९.</F>
(III)--the name of the tenth Kalpa. M. २९०. 5.
--a name of Yoga माया; a शक्ति. भा. X. 2. १२; Br. IV. ४४. ८४.
--a सिद्धिदेवि। Br. IV. १९. 4.
(I)--one of उत्तम सिद्धिस्। Br. IV. ३६. ५१.
(II)--one of the eight सिद्धिस् of योग; by the division of योग one becomes ईश or God everywhere. वा. १३. 3, १५.

--also महेश्वर and शङ्कर; a Rudra: place of residence is शिवपुर in front of Brahmaloka; Lord of Trinity; <F>1:  Br. III. 3. ७१; IV. ३९. १२०; M. १७१. ३९.</F> the अधिदेवता for the planet सूर्य; <F>2:  M. ९३. १३.</F> the २६थ् तत्व on one view; <F>3:  M. 3. २८.</F> being a small atom is god of love for people; in him are ten characteristics--knowledge, वैराग्य, ऐश्वर्य, तपस्, सत्य, patience, courage, quality of being seen, kinship to self and dominion; is माया or illusory; <F>4:  वा. १०१. २१५, २१९; Br. IV. 2. २१७.</F> the Lord of all world. <F>5:  वा. 4. ३६ and ४२.</F> [पगे१-207+ १२]
--a कला of विष्णु. Br. IV. ३५. ९५.
(I)--a सुधामान god. Br. II. ३६. २८.
(II)--a son of Auttama Manu. M. 9. १२.
--the श्वेत पराश्र. M. २०१. ३६.
and राजस, opposites (dualities) com- ing out of the thighs of ब्रह्मा. This resulted in the union of the male and the female; food is the रस of the earth. वा. 8. ३९, ४८. [पगे१-208+ २८]
--the fourth face of ब्रह्मा whence came तामस Manu of copper colour. वा. २६. ३६.
--the son of Nemicakra and father of Citraratha. भा. IX. २२. ४०.
--born from the eastern face of ब्रह्मा. भा. III. १२. ४०.
--an यज्ञ from the south face of ब्रह्मा. (उक्तम्-ब्र्। प्।)। वा. 9. ५०; Br. II. 8. ५१; Vi. I. 5. ५४.
(I)--a Rudra; son of भूत and सरूपा; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. १७; Br. IV. ३४. ४१; Vi. I. 8. 6.</F> an अमिताभ deva. <F>2:  Br. II. ३६. ५३.</F>
(II)--a Marut of the third गण। Br. III. 5. ९४; वा. ६७. १२६.
(III)--a son of यातुधान; father of वज्रहा. Br. III. 7. ८९ and ९२.

(IV)--a manifestation of शिव, and the presiding deity of यजमान (अधिवास): <F>1:  M. २६५. ४१; वा. २७. १५.</F> wife दीक्षा and son San- तान; <F>2:  वा. २७. ५५; Br. II. १०. ८३.</F> the seventh name of महादेव. <F>3:  Br. II. १०. १६.</F> [पगे१-209+ २१]
(V)--an अवतार् of the lord in the गङ्गाद्वार in the eleventh द्वापर with four sons. वा. २३. १५२.
(VI)--an Asura. Vi. V. 1. २४.
--a councillor of भण्ड. Br. IV. १२. १२.
--a son of Gautama; an अवतार् of the १४थ् द्वापर। वा. २३. १६४.
--a daughter of Meru, wife of Harivarsa. भा. V. 2. २३.
--a deva (Ajita). वा. ३१. 7; Br. II. १३. ९३.
--one of भण्ड's councillors. Br. IV. १२. १२.
--a name of Rudra. भा. III. १२. १२.
--surname of सूत. His discourse on crea- tion to sages of नैमिष. भा. III. २०. 7. [पगे१-210+ ५१]

(I)--A son of आहुक of the Kukura family, father of Kamsa and other eight sons. Father of five daughters who were all married to the younger brothers of Vasudeva. <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. २१, २४-5; X. 1. ३०; Br. III. ७१. १२९-134, २१२-3, २३०; M. ४४. ७१-74; वा. ९६. २०६; Vi. IV. १४. १६-21.</F> King of सात्वतस्, वृष्णिस्, Bhojas, and दाशार्हस्. <F>2:  भा. III. 1. २९.</F> Hated by his son Kamsa who desired even to kill him and who eventually threw him into prison. <F>3:  Ib. X. ४४. ३३; 1. ६९; ३६. ३४; Vi. V. १५. १८; १८. 6.</F> Enthroned by कृष्ण, after performing Kamsa's funeral rites; <F>4: Ib. X. ४५. १२; Vi. V. २१. 9-१२.</F> got helpful service from कृष्ण and welcomed him to द्वारका. <F>5:  भा. III. 2. २२; I. ११. १६; Vi. V. २४. 7.</F> In कृष्ण's opinion Ugrasena was the proper person to wear the jewel Syamantaka; did not press it lest there should be a family feud. <F>6:  Vi. IV. १३. २७-28, १०७.</F> When जरासन्ध beseiged मथुरा, कृष्ण stationed Ugrasena to defend the northern gate; was pre- sented with spoils of war including jewels and ornaments. His part in defence against जरासन्ध's third attack on मथुरा. A member of the यादव सभा; was consulted by कृष्ण as to failure of rains in द्वारका. <F>7:  भा. X. ५०. २०[3] and ४१; [५० (V) ३२-33]; [५१ (V) २५]; [५२ (V) १५]; ५७. ३०[1].</F> वायु fetched from Indra the hall सुधर्मा for Ugrasena's use; <F>8:  Vi. V. २१. १३-17, ३२.</F> attacked पौण्ड्रक and laughed at his message. Heard of साम्ब's imprisonment and urged war on the Kurus, order being communicated through बलराम. According to the Kurus, a king only by sufferance. <F>9:  भा. X. ६६ [3]; ६८. १३, २१ and ३४; Vi. V. ३५. १०. १४, २३.</F> Ordered the मुसल born to साम्ब to be powdered and thrown into the sea. <F>१०:  Vi. V. ३७. ११-12.</F> Sent to द्वारका for defence after the राजसूय। <F>११:  भा. X. ७६. 7[5].</F> Welcomed बलराम on his return after a pilgrimage tour. <F>१२:  Ib. X. ७९. २९.</F> Went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for solar eclipse. <F>१३:  Ib. X. ८२. २३.</F> Honoured Nanda. <F>१४:  Ib. X. ८४. ५९ and ६८.</F> Heard of वृष्णिस् killing one another and of the decease of राम and कृष्ण and bemoaned their loss. <F>१५:  Ib. XI. ३१. १५; Vi. V. ३७. ५७.</F> Entered fire. <F>१६:  Vi. V. ३८. 4.</F>

(III)--a Gandharva, presiding over the month of नभस्य; आवणि and पुरट्टाशि (वा। प्।) <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ३८; Br. II. २३. १०; वा. ५२. १०.</F> A Mauneya Gandharva; <F>2:  Br. III. 7. 1; वा. ६९. 1.</F> in the sun's chariot in the भाद्र- पद month. <F>3:  Vi. II. १०. १०.</F>
--a wife of अक्रूर, and mother of देववान् and Upadeva. M. ४५. ३१.
--a daughter of Ugrasena and wife of अक्रूर (s.v.). वा. ९६. ११२.
(II)--a पिशाच kanya1. वा. ६९. १२७.
(I)--the son of नीप, and father of क्षेम. भा. IX. २१. २९.

(II)--the son of कृत (कार्ता the सामग- वा। प्।) of Paurava dynasty. Father of क्षेम; slew father of पृथुक, the पाञ्चाल Ni1la: Conqueror of नीपस्: was engaged in severe austerities for १८,000 years. Was served by Janamejaya, son of भल्लाट. They were both attacked by नीपस् who were unmoved by उग्रायुध's appeals for peace and protection; then उग्रा- yudha asked Lord of Death to destroy them. Soon he took pity and asked Yama to save them; and this led to a scuffle between Yama and the king who got salvation. M. ४९. ५९-78; वा. ९९. १८२, १९१; Vi. IV. १९. ५३-55. [पगे१-212+ २५]
--a गण of पिशाचस्. Br. III. 7. ३८३.
--one of the horses born to गान्धर्वी: king of horses; <F>1:  Br. III. 3. ७६; 8. १०; M. 8. 8; वा. ७०. १०.</F> horses born of भद्रा. <F>2:  वा. ६६. ७३.</F>
--(Mt.) a mountain in which are the temple of योगेश्वरि and the अश्रम of वसिष्ठ. वा. ७७. ५२.
--sacred to ललितापीठ। Br. IV. ४४. ९७.
--a hill in भारतवर्ष. Br. II. १६. २२; वा. ४५. ९२.
--the kingdom of. M. १२१. ५६.
--attained permanent fame. भा. X. ७२. २१.
--sacred to ललितापीठ। Br. IV. ४४. ९८.
(I)--a pravara (अङ्गिरस्). M. १९६. १४.
(II)--a surname of Soma. Vi. IV. 6. ३३.
--a surname of Soma. Br. III. ५१. ३६. [पगे१-213+ २८]
--a sage; knows the योग power of Hari. <F>1:  भा. II. 7. ४५.</F> Pleased by कुवलयाश्व killing Dhundhu. <F>2:  Ib. IX. 6. २२.</F>

(I)--the son of अङ्गिरस and सुरूपा and father of two sons, Vicitta and शरद्वान्; of the स्वरोचिष epoch. An incarnation; a contemporary of मान्धातृ. भा. IV. 1. ३५; Br. II. ३२. ९९; III. 1. १०५; ७३. ९०; वा. ६५. १००, १०१.
(II)--a मरीचि god. Br. IV. 1. ५९.
(III) a ऋषि by तपस्; and a मन्त्रकृत्; a gotra- कार; <F>1:  M. १४५. ९३, १०४; १९६. 4.</F> came to see परीक्षित् practising प्रायोपवेश। <F>2:  भा. I. १९. 9.</F>
(IV)--a son of गुहावार of the १७थ् द्वापर; <F>1:  वा. २३. १७७.</F> a मन्त्रकृत् of the आङ्गिरस branch. <F>2:  वा. ५९. ९०-101.</F>
(V)--the eldest brother of बृहस्पति; wife ममता; son, दीर्घतमस्. Vi. IV. १९. १६.
--the son of Vaccala and father of वज्रनाभ. Vi. IV. 4. १०६.
--a son of हिरण्याक्ष and भानु. भा. VII. 2. १८.
--a daughter of खश. वा. ६९. १७०. [पगे१-214+ २४]
--a राक्षस गण from Utkaca. वा. ६९. १७२.
(I) a son of Dhruva by इला; a जीवन्मुक्त; did not like the throne or the kingdom but gave himself up entirely to penance. भा. IV. १०. 2; १३. 6-१०.
(II)--an asura, and a follower of वृत्र in his battle with Indra. Took part in the देवासुर war between Bali and Indra, and fought with माटृस् or mother goddesses. भा. VI. १०. २०; VIII. १०. २१ & ३३.
(III)--a son of Sudyumna--इला: A Lord of दक्षि- षिणापथ (Utkala kingdom); a मन्त्रकृत्। <F>2:  M. १४५. १०३.</F> ^1 भा. IX. 1. ४१; Br. III. ६०. १८; M. १२. १७; वा. ६९. २४०; ८५. १९.
(IV)--a kingdom of मध्यदेश, noted for वामन elephants. <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ४२; III. 7. ३५८; ६०. १८; M. १२. १७.</F> The people were Utkalas. <F>2: M. ११४. ५२.</F>
--the Vindhya tribes. वा. ४५. १३२; M. ११४. ५४; Br. II. १६. ६३.
--the state over which Utkala ruled. वा. ८५. १९; Br. III. ६०. १८.
--the queen of सम्राट्, and mother of मरीचि. भा. V. १५. १५. [पगे१-215+ ३३]
--a son of हिरण्याक्ष. वा. ६७. ६७.
--a daughter of खश, after whom came the औत्कार्ष्टेय गण। Br. III. 7. १३८.
--an asura of the sixth tala or the श्रीतलम्. वा. ५०. ३८.

(I)--a ब्रह्मऋषि residing on the Meru slopes; appealed to बृहदश्व of इक्ष्वाकु line to vanquish Dhundhu (son of Madhu) residing near his hermitage and causing trouble to his peaceful avocations: कुवलाश्व at the bidding of his father बृहदश्व killed the asura and earned the title धुन्धुमार. Br. III. 6. ३२; ६३. ३४-60; वा. ६८. ३१; ८८. ३३-60.
(II)--the Purohita of मान्धातृ, the emperor and fifth incarnation of विष्णु. M. ४७. २४३.

(I)--a favourite son of Suruci and उत्तानपाद. Was embraced by Dhruva after his return from तपस्। It was predicted that he would be killed by an यक्ष in a hunt- ing expedition, and that his mother going in search of him would die by falling into a forest fire. So it happened. भा. IV. 8. 9 & १९; 9. २३ & ४८; १०. 3; Vi. I. ११. 2.

(II)--a son of Priyavrata, and a मन्वन्तर- अधिपति। He was Manu, the third. His sons were Pavana and others. In his epoch Pramada and other sons of वसिष्ठ were the seven sages. The gods were Satyas, वेदश्रुतस् and Bhadras. Satyajit was Indra. <F>1:  भा. V. 1. २८; VIII. 1. २३-24; Vi. III. 1. 6, २४.</F> According to ब्र्। प्। सुशान्ति was Indra; served as calf to milk the earth in that epoch. <F>2:  Br. II. ३६. 3 & २५, ३७ & ४१; ३७. १६; Vi. III. 1. १३-15.</F> [पगे१-216+ २२]
(III)--one of the seven hills of शाल्मलिद्वीप. Br. II. १९. ३६.
(IV)--the twenty-first वेदव्यास. Br. II. ३५. १२२.
(V)--a भार्गव, and a sage of the चाक्षुष epoch. Br. II. ३६. ७७.
(VI)--the father of Satyas. वा. ६७. ३६.
(VII)--a sage of the चाक्षुष epoch. Vi. III. 1. २८.
--a मरीचि god. Br. IV. 1. ५९.
--surname of Hari. भा. X. 1. 4; XII. 3. १५.
--the presiding deity पक्षिराज. वा. ८६. ६२.
(I)--stationed by जरासन्ध at the western gate of मथुरा. भा. X. ५०. ११[5].
(II)--a son of Manu सावर्न II. Br. IV. 1. ७१. [पगे१-217+ २९]
(III)--a son of ब्रह्मसावर्णि. Vi. III. 2. २८.
--the father of इरावति and father-in-law of परीक्षित्. भा. I. १६. 2.
--A tribe of the Vindhya regions. वा. ४५. १३२.
--a Pravara--sage. M. १९९. १७.

--traversed by the river भद्रा; a conti- nent adjoining Meru, in the hill of सुपर्श्व north of शृन्ग- vat and south of the sea. Here Hari revealed himself as वराह (मत्स्य, वि।) and mother Earth praised him by Upa- निषद् naming him यज्ञ and क्रतु। <F>1:  भा. V. १७. 8; १८. ३४, ३९; Br. II. १५. ५१, ७१-80; वा. ३४. ५७; ३५. ४४, ४७; ४१. ८५, ४२. ७७; ४९. १२०; Vi. II. 2, १४, ३८, ५०.</F> Conquered by परीक्- षित्. <F>2:  भा. I. १६. १३.</F> Full of milk trees; women-folk excel apsaras; people are born in pair (मिथुन) and love each other as चक्रवाक birds. Here Aila lived for some time with उर्वशी. <F>3:  Br. II. १९. १२४; III. ५९. ४६; ६६. 7; M. ८३. ३४; १०५. २०; ११३. ४४; १२३. २५; वा. ९१. 7.</F> A sacred तीर्थ। <F>4:  M. १३. ५०.</F>
--the kingdom of Lava. वा. ८८. २००.
--the kingdom to which पुरञ्जन went through the entrance देवहू; allegorically निवृत्तिशास्त्र। भा. IV. २५. ५१; २९. १३.
--the road to Heaven; also उत्तरापथ; also उत्तरमार्ग consisting of नागवीथि, गजवीथि, and ऐरावतीवीथि। Br. II. २७. १२४; ३५. ११२; III. 3. ४९.
--a loud but slow manner of singing; the presiding deity of this is Dhruva. वा. ८६. ४०, ५६.
--the kingdom of हरिण्मान्. वा. ३३. ४३.
--a sacred lake. M. १२१. ६९. वा. १११. 4.
--the lake beyond मानस; worship सूर्य god. M. १२१. ६९; वा. १११. 4.
--see उत्तरपन्था। Br. III. 3. ४९.
--a goddess following रेवती. M. १७९. ७२.
(I)--the name of an asterism. वा. ८२. 7. [पगे१-219+ २९]

(II)--the daughter of Matsya king विराट, and queen of Abhimanyu. Mother of परीक्षित्. <F>1:  वा. ९९. २४९; भा. I. १०. 9-१०; IX. २२. ३३; III. 3. १७.</F> अश्वथाम wanted to destroy the child in her womb, and sent out flaming arrows. Pursued by them, उत्तरा invoked कृष्ण's help, who protected her by his सुदर्शन to ensure the continuity of the Kuru line. <F>2:  Ib. I. 8. 8-१५; १२. 1; III. 3. १७;</F> One among the party that welcomed Vidura. <F>3: Ib. I. १३. 4; Vi. IV. २०. ५१-2.</F>

--the country, north of the Vindhyas; had कारूषस् as kings; <F>1:  भा. IX. 2. १६; Br. III. ६३. १०; वा. ८८. १०.</F> in charge of ५० sons of ईक्ष्वाकु begin- ning with शकुनि. <F>2:  Vi. IV. 2. १३; Br. III. ६३. ९०; वा. ८८. 9.</F>
--when moon is there the sun becomes नीच; commences with तप or the month of माशि; <F>1:  वा. ५०. १३५ and २०.; ५१. ७२; ५३. ७४; ६१. १०१.</F> auspicious for death. <F>2:  भा. I. 9. २९.</F>
--the sun at गया. वा. १०९. २१.
--an asterism. वा. ८२. ११.
--The name of the Lord enshrined and wor- shipped by the बाडवस्. वा. ६०. ७१. [पगे१-220+ ३३]

(I)--son of स्वायम्भुव Manu and शत- रूपा: Brother Priyavrata. Father of Dhruva, <F>1:  भा. III. १२. ५५; १४. 5; २१. 2; IV. 1. 9. Br. I. 1. ५७; II. 9. ४१; २९. ६३; ३०. ३९; M. 4. ३४; १४३. ३८; वा. I. ६६, १२३; १०. १६; ५२. ९२; ५७. ५७; १०४. १२२.</F> a devotee of Hari. अम्श of वासुदेव. <F>2:  भा. IV. 8. 7.</F> Had two queens सुनीति and Suruci. The former's son was Dhruva, and the latter's Uttama. Suruci and her son were more beloved of the king. Once when Dhruva ascended his father's lap, Suruci scolded him and asked him to propitiate god to be born of her. Heard that his child of five had gone to the forest with his mother, from नारद, and regretted his action. Was assured by the sage that he would return with glory to his line. <F>3:  भा. IV. 8. 8-१३, ६५-69. M. १२५. 5; १२७. २२. वा. ५१. 6.</F> Obliged to Hari. <F>4:  भा. IV. २१. २८; ३१. २६; V. १७. 2.</F>
(II)--a son of Atri in the चाक्षुष Manu line; wife सूनृता, a daughter of Dharma. Had four sons and two daughters. Br. II. ३६. ८४-90; वा. ६२. ७२.
--a son of शर्याति. भा. IX. 3. २७.
--is कृष्ण. Br. III. ३६. २८.
--on the part of a king could overcome even fate; दैव and काल supplement one's efforts. M. २२१. 3-१२.
--creation described. Br. II. १९. १८८-190.
--the goddess enshrined at सहस्राक्ष. M. १३. ३४.
--R. from the Malaya hill. Br. II. १६. ३६; M. ११४. ३०; वा. ४५. १०५.
--a तीर्थ sacred to लोला. M. १३. ४५.

--Evil portents, at birth of हिरण्याक्ष and हिरण्यकशिपु; <F>1:  भा. III. १७. 3-१५.</F> a list furnished; <F>2:  M. १६३. ३८-52.</F> may be of earth, atmos- phere or दिव्य; counteracted by propitiatory ceremonies. <F>3:  M. Chapters २२८-238.</F>
--a son of Mitra and रेवती Bha1. VI. १८. 6.
--a son of नारायण and श्री. वा. २८. 2.
--a son of बलराम. वा. ९६. १६४.
--a Bhavya deva. Br. II. ३६. ७१.
(I)--the son of अरण्य and brother of वारुणी; attained वरुणहोओद्. Br. II. ३६. १०४.
(II)--a measure of seven प्रस्थस्। वा. १००. २१५. [पगे१-222+ २५]
(III)--a sage insulted by Asura Dundhu whom कुवलयाश्व killed. Vi. IV. 2. ४०.
--a woman in her periods of any caste is con- sidered impure for four days. Br. III. १४. ८७-8; वा. ७९. २४.
--the son of भीम; wife विशाला; had three sons. वा. ९९. १६२.
--the son of विष्वक्सेन and father of Bhal- लाट. (भल्लाभ-वि। प्।). M. ४९. ५९; वा. ९९. १८१; Vi. IV. १९. ४६-7.
--(Burnouf--Udaksena) the son of विष्वक्- sena and father of भल्लाद. भा. IX. २१. २६.
--कश्यपगोत्रकरस्. M. १९९. 2.
--the son of Vasumitra and father of Pulindaka. Vi. IV. २४. ३५.
--a Mt. of शाकद्वीप, golden in colour. M. १२२. 8; १६३. ६९; वा. ४९. ७८.
--a Mt. the chief hill of शाकद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ६२. [पगे१-223+ २७]
(I)--the son of शतानीक and father of विही- nara. M. ५०. ८६; Vi. IV. २१. १५.
(II)--the son of Arbhaka and father of Nandi- vardhana. Vi. IV. २४. १६-17.
--(Mt.) a hill of शाकद्वीप; limit of पृथु's domain; <F>1:  भा. IV. १६. २०; Br. II. १९. ८४-5.</F> sacred to Agastya. <F>2:  वा. १०८. ४६.</F>
--the rising and setting of the sun; as determining the east and west directions. वा. ५०. १०३-7.
--the son of Darbhaka; ruled for ३३ years; founded the city Kusuma on the southern bank of the Ganges in the fourth year of his reign. (उदायि-व। प्।). Br. III. ७४. १३२; वा. ९९. ३१८-9.
--a son of देवकी killed by कंस. Br. III. ७१. १७५.
--a son of चारिष्णु-Vasis2t2ha. वा. ६२. ४६.
(I)--a vital air. भा. II. 2. २०; IV. 4. २५.
(III)--the name of the १३थ् कल्प। M. २९०. 6.
(IV)--a mindborn son of ब्रह्मा in the २१स्त् कल्प। वा. २१. ४७.
--a son of देवकी and Vasudeva, killed by कंस. Vi. IV. १५. २६-7.
--the son of प्राचिनगर्भ and सुवर्चा: In previous birth attained Indrahood by तपस्: wife भद्रा: Father of Divamjaya. Br. II. ३६. ९९ & १०१; वा. ६२. ८५.
--the son of Janaka, and father of Nandivar- dhana. भा. IX. १३. १४; Br. III. ६४. 6; वा. ८९. 6; Vi. IV. 5. २४-25.
--one of the seven Maruts. M. १६३. ३२.
(I)--a son of Vasudeva and देवकी; killed by कंस. M. ४६. १३.
(II)--the son of वंशक, ruled for ३३ years. M. २७२. ११.
--one of the ten सुपार devas. वा. १००. ९४. [पगे१-225+ २६]
--next to दक्षिणमानस in गया. वा. १११. 6.
--an eastern tribe which Kalki was to conquer. Br. III. ७३. १०७; वा. ५८. ८१; ९८. १०६.
--pupils of पौष्पिञ्जि. Vi. III. 6. 4.
--belong to कौशिकगोत्र. Br. III. ६६. ७०; वा. ९१. ९८.
--between शिशिर and पतङ्ग hills- the आश्रम of Kardama प्रजापति. वा. ३८. 2-7.
--belonging to कौशिक gotra. वा. ९१. ९८.
--a कौशिक and sage. Br. II. ३२. ११७.
--a sacrificial priest; created by विष्णु, <F>1:  भा. IX. १६. २१; Br. III. ७२. २९.</F> issued from the mouth of Hamsa नारायण; a सामग. <F>2:  M. १६७. 7; २४६. १२; वा. ६०. १७.</F>
(I)--the son of भूमन् and ऋषिकुल्या: Begot प्रस्ताव on देवकुल्या. भा. V. १५. 6; Br. II. १४. ६७; वा. ३३. ५६.
(II)--the son of Bhava. Vi. II. 1. ३७.
(III)--a son of Devaki, killed by कंस. Taken back by कृष्ण to द्वारका; after being seen by his parents went to heaven. भा. X. ८५. ५१-56.

(I)--a pupil of बृहस्पति, a friend of कृष्ण, and a minister of वृष्णिस्. Requested by कृष्ण, he took a mes- sage to Nanda and Gopis of Vraja, where he was duly wel- comed by Nanda. The latter said that he believed with Garga, कृष्ण and राम to be gods when यशोदा narrated कृष्ण's exploits as a child. The conversation lasted all night. After his morning prayers Gopis surrounded him and asked whether कृष्ण was well and remembered them. Uddhava was struck with their devotion and told them of कृष्ण's promised visit in the near future. After spending some months when Gopis entertained him on कृष्णलीला, Uddhava left for मथुरा. <F>1:  भा. X. ४६ (whole); ४७ (whole).</F> Went with कृष्ण to Sairan- dhri's house, and to अक्रूर's and returned home. <F>2:  Ib. X. ४८. 4, १२ and ३६.</F> Heard the secrets of कृष्ण's self from him and was a हरिदास। <F>3:  Ib. IX. २४. ६७; X. ४७. ५६.</F> Went with कृष्ण to द्वारका, and respected him by holding चामर। कृष्ण playing dice with. <F>4:  Ib. I. 8. 7; १०. १८; १३. १६ [1]; १४. ३२; X. ६९. २०.</F> Consulted by him as to the method to be adopted in vanquishing जरासन्ध; sug- gested the performance of राजसूय by युधिष्ठिर and the [पगे१-227+ ४७] defeat of जरासन्ध resulting in the release of imprisoned kings; <F>5:  Ib. X. ६९. २७; ७०. १५, ४५-7; ७१. 1-११; ७२. १५.</F> was sent in advance by राम to the Kurus to inform them of his visit. <F>6:  Ib. X. ६८. १६.</F> Went to see the पाण्डवस् at उपप्ला- vyam. <F>7:  Ib. X. ७८. [९५ (V) 3].</F> Honoured Nanda. <F>8:  Ib. X. ८४. ६८.</F> A member of the यादव सभा। Was stationed to defend the E. gate of मथुरा when it was beseiged by जरासन्ध. Consulted by कृष्ण on the right detachment of the army. <F>9:  Ib. X. [५२ (V) १५]; ५०. २० [2]; [५० (V) 8 & १२];</F> Met Vidura on the यमुना and was asked about the welfare of his kinsmen. Touched deeply by Vidura's query, Uddhava described how the Lord spent eleven years with बलराम, Gopas and Gopis, doing miracles and how he persuaded Nanda to perform गोसव। He narrated the heroic deeds of कृष्ण and the destruction of the wicked. Concluded by saying that he would reside at Badari after the यादवस् as it was the Lord's wish adding that Maitreya had been asked to be the गुरु of Vidura. <F>१०:  Ib. III. ch. 1-4 (whole); XII. १२. 8; Vi. V. ३७. ३१-37.</F> Narrated to Maitreya the story of शिव destroying दक्ष's sacrifice. <F>११:  भा. IV. 7. ६०.</F> Joined Yadus in defeating पौण्ड्रक. <F>१२:  Ib. X. ६६. [2].</F> Saw Yadus leaving for प्रभास, and understanding कृष्ण's mind, requested him to take him also to His eternal abode. कृष्ण warned him of the advent of Kali and asked him to go about always meditating on Hari. In the course of the dialogue कृष्ण related the conversation between a Yadu and a ब्राह्- मण ascetic, laying emphasis on how the ब्राह्मण learnt lessons from earth, hill, air, sea, archer, pigeon and others and regulated life by cultivating detachment. Listened to the Lord's discourses on various spiritual topics. After being thus well instructed he made Badari his home to spend the evening of his life. <F>१३:  Ib. XI. 6. ४०-49; XI. 7. 1-२९; ३०. 1.</F> As a lad of five he worshipped Hari without caring even for breakfast. <F>१४:  Ib. III. 2. 2.</F> He knew the योग power of Hari. <F>१५:  Ib. II. 7. ४५; Br. III. ३४. ४०.</F> Of superior भक्ति। [पगे१-228+ २५]

X. 6. २२ and २३;</F> Had a son बृहत्श्लोक through कीर्ति. <F>5:  Ib. VI. १८. 8.</F> Also known as Uru- krama. A son of Diti. <F>6:  M. १४६. २०; २४४. २६-8.</F> कृष्ण, crowned by Indra as the Indra of cows, urged by the speech of Gava; perhaps the cows of heaven like the कामधेनु; at that time the cattle delighted the earth with milk. <F>7:  Vi. V. १२. १२-15.</F>
