(I)--worshipped for a happy family. <F>1:  भा. II. 3. 7.</F> Her splen- dour. <F>2:  Ib. VIII. 7. ३३; VI. १७. ३६.</F> Also known as अम्बिका; also रुद्राणी. <F>3:  Ib. VIII. १८. १७; III. १२. १३.</F> In the forest of सुकुमार. <F>4:  Ib. IX. 1. २५; XII. १०. 4.</F> Consort of शिव, also गौरी; originally दाक्षायनी, daughter of मेना and हिमवान्. Original name अपर्णा. Her garden: a शक्ति: <F>5:  Br. II. २५. १७; २६. ४४; III 9. 1; १०. १३ and २६; ४१. १७ and ५५; ६०. २४ and २७; IV. ४४ 84; M. १३. १८-9; २३. 5; वा. ७१. 2-5.</F> The world of: अधिदेवता for the planet Soma. <F>6:  M. ८४. 9; ९३. १३; १३२. १८.</F> Festivities at her birth. <F>7:  M. १५४. ९३-108.</F> Going with her father to शिव's house, they met Rati weeping on the way. She said that शिव had burnt down her husband. On this उमा's father did not like the idea of giving his daughter to such an ill-tempered person. उमा requested permis- sion to do penance and was allowed. Indra at this time thought of the seven sages to bring about शिव's marriage with उमा. The sages were satisfied of her steadfast love to शिव and had his consent for the marriage; celestial women dressed उमा, as also the god शिव; amidst divine music, the couple went to the city of महागिरिनगर and ब्रह्मा officiated as priest: After the marriage they left for Mandaragiri. <F>8:  M. १५४. २७६-496.</F> Once उमा made a doll with elephant face and dropped it in the Ganges. It became a huge figure and was claimed as son by उमा and the Ganges respectively. <F>9:  M. १५४. ५०२-505.</F> Then उमा [पगे१-239+ ४१] grew a tender अशोक plant when बृहस्पति and others told her that she would have a real son and that trees and dolls were no satisfaction; <F>१०:  M. १५४. ५०६-510.</F> once she heard a yell of noise and was told of the play engaged in by गणस्, and then her eyes attracted वीरक. She expressed to शिव for a son like वीरक. शिव asked her to have him as her child. He was sent for and nursed by उमा. <F>११:  M. १५४. ५२२-555.</F> Touched by Goddess of Night, she became black in colour. शिव found fault with her and after reproaching him with his past deeds, she left him for penance. वीरक appealed to her when she said she would return as गौरी. She asked वीरक to see that no lady entered her harem. Meanwhile आडि, son of अन्धकासुर entered शिव's abode in the guise of उमा but was slain by शिव. Hearing from वायु that a lady entered her home, she cursed वीरक to be born on the earth; out of her rage came out a lion which ब्रह्मा gave to the Goddess of Night, who was asked to leave उमा for the Vindhya hills. Now उमा became गौरी and entered शिव's abode when वीरक stopped her, as he did not at first recognise her. Convinced of his mother's identity, he requested her to recall her curse and was assured of a place in देवगण. <F>१२:  M. १५४. ५८८; chap. १५५- ५८.</F> While उमा was sporting with शिव, Agni entered the harem in the form of a parrot. Noticing this उमा left the bed and शिव made Agni drink his वीर्य। Out of the scat- tered वीर्य, there sprang up a beautiful pond where the six Pleiades bathed and took water in a lotus leaf. Blessed by them the देवी got the गर्भ and out of her left side came out सुब्रह्मण्य. <F>१३:  M. १५८. २४-48; वा. ७२ (whole).</F> Going through the उद्यानम् again शिव spoke to her of the greatness of Benares. <F>१४:  M. १८०. २०-79; १८१. 6-8; १९१. ११३; १९३. ४६.</F> सती in previous birth. <F>१५:  वा. ३०. ७१; ५४. २०; ५५. ४२; Br. II. १३. ७७.</F>
(II)--the goddess enshrined at विङायक. M. १३. ४१. [पगे१-240+ ३३]
--a locality fit for performing श्राद्ध। Br. III. १३. ८७-88; वा. ७७. ८१-82.
--surname of शिव (शङ्कर); worship of; <F>1:  भा. X. ५२. ४३; M. १८५. २४; २७४. १५; Vi. V. ३३. ४० and ४५.</F> destroyer of दक्षयज्ञ। <F>2:  वा. २५. 2.</F>

--see नागपाश। Vi. I. २०. 4.

--a Janapada of the Bhadra. वा. ४३. २१.
--a son of Bhautya Manu. Br. IV. 1. ११४.
--a surname of Hari. See उपेन्द्र। भा. IV. १२. २८; VII. ११. 1; XI. 5. २६.
--the son of बृहद्रण and father of Vatsa- वृद्ध. भा. IX. १२. १०.
--the son of बृहद्बल; a sage; no marriage alliance with अङ्गिरस्. M. १९६. २९; २७१. 4.
--the son of आहार्य; wife विशाला; father of three sons. M. ४९. ३८-9. [पगे१-242+ २२]
--the क्षत्रिय sons of उरुक्षव, who be- came ब्राह्मणस्, and the best महऋषिस् among काव्यस्. M. ४९. ४०.
--a surname of Hari. भा. X. 6. २३; XI. 5. २६.
--a son of इन्द्रसावर्णि. भा. VIII. १३. ३३.
--a son of इला and Vasudeva. भा. IX. २४. ४९.
--the son of सत्यश्रवस् and father of Deva- datta. भा. IX. 2. २०.
--a boundary hill of शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २६.
--the son of Ripumjaya and father of Tigma. Vi. IV. २१. १३.
(I)--a son of Pulaha and क्षमा. Br. II. ११. ३१.
(II)--a son of सावर्णि Manu. Vi. III. 2. १९.
--the kingdom of. M. १२१. ४७. [पगे१-243+ ४७]

(I)--an apsaras born of नारायण; worshipped for success in love affairs. <F>1:  Br. III. 7. १६; भा. II. 3. 6.</F> While she was plucking flowers in Badari आश्रम Mitra and वरुण saw her, when she gave birth to Agastya and वसिष्ठ. <F>2:  भा. VI. १८. 6; IX. १३. 6; M. २०१. २५-29; Vi. IV. 5. ११-12.</F> सत्यधृति saw her, and she was mother of शरद्वत. <F>3:  भा. IX. २१. ३५; Vi. IV. १९. ६५.</F> Heard of the beauty of पुरूरवस् from नारद, when she came to the earth due to a curse of Mitra and वरुण, and gave enjoyment to him so long as he satisfied her two conditions--keeping her two sheep safe, and not showing himself naked before her except in sexual intercourse. When after ६४ years she saw him naked one day, she left him. He looked for her and saw her at the R. Sarasvati playing with her friends. At his request she promised a day's enjoyment with him every year. On her advice he prayed to Gandharvas, and got an अग्निस्थालि. Mother of six sons by पुरूरवस्. <F>4:  भा. IX. १४. १६-42; १५. 1; XI. २६. 4-5 and २५; Br. III. ६५. ४६; ६६. 4-5; वा. 2. १६; ९१. 4; Vi. IV. 6. ३५-78.</F> Returned to Heaven. <F>5:  भा. XI. 4. १५; Br. IV. ३३. १८.</F> The Goddess enshrined at Badari. <F>6:  M. १३. ४९.</F> When she danced before Indra, she forgot her अभिनय and was cursed by Bharata to become an invisible creeper for ५५ years on the earth. During that time पुरूरवस् was in the guise of पैशाच. After the lapse of the period she bore him 8 sons. <F>7:  Ib. २४. १२-33.</F> In the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु. <F>8:  Ib. १६१. २५.</F> Mother of six sons by Aila. <F>9:  वा. ९०. ४५.</F> Also ऊर्वशी (s.v.).

(II)--The Apsaras presiding over the month of सह। <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ४१; Br. II. २३. १८.</F> With the sun in the हेमन्त; <F>2:  Br. I. 2. १६; वा. ५२. १८; M. १२६. १९.</F> in the sun's chariot in the मार्गशीर्ष month; <F>3:  Vi. II. १०. १३.</F> a ब्रह्मवादिनी। <F>4:  Br. II. ३३. १८.</F>
(III)--An आभीर कन्या who observed the भीमद्वादशी, and became उर्वशी. M. ६९. ५९. [पगे१-244+ २६]
--A तीर्थ sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ६६.
--a क्षेत्रम् in प्रयाग. M. १०६. ३४.

--see भूमी or पृथ्वी; extent ५०० million योजनस्; foremost of all elements and mother of all beings; depth below the surface is ७०,000 योजनस् consisting of the seven regions of पाताल. Vi. II. 4. ९६-7; 5. 1-2.
--भारभूति; a वरमूर्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ४९.
(I)--the son of Bala, and a righteous person; Father of वज्रनाभ. Br. III. ६३. २०५.
(II)--a son of हिरण्याक्ष. M. 6. १४.
(III)--a son of सहिष्णु of the २६थ् द्वपर। वा. २३. २१३.
(IV)--a son of सोमशर्म; an अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. २१६.
(V)--a विद्याधर chief in the वेणुमन्त hill. वा. ३९. ३८.
--son of भासि, owls as children of शुकी; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. ४५५; M. 6. ३१; २३७. १२; २४०. १८.</F> of ताम्रा line. <F>2:  Vi. I. २१. १६.</F> [पगे१-245+ २७]
--a son of धूमिनी, sister of भण्ड; served as a commander भण्ड, and killed by a देवी of ललिता. Br. IV. २१. ८४; २८. 6, ३८ and १००.
--Life sucked out by infant कृष्ण. भा. II. 7. २७.
--a mindborn mother. M. १७९. १५.
(I)--the mortar; pregnant Diti not to sit on; <F>1:  M. 7. ३८.</F> child कृष्ण tied to by यशोदा. <F>2:  Vi. V. 6. १४ and १६.</F>
(II)--a लेख on this wooden mortar and the honouring of उदपात्र are details of the श्राद्ध connected with the आश्वलायनिन्स्. वा. ७५. २८.
a group of पिशाचस् (also उलू- खलिकस्)--Hidden eyes and long tongues; wearing उलूखल for ornaments. Br. III. 7. ३७८ and ३९३; वा. ६१. ४६; ६९. २७४.
--a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५२.
--see उलूखलस्। Br. III. 7. ३८२.
--a northern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ४८.
--the queen of Arjuna and mother of इरावान्. <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. ३२.</F> A नागकन्या. <F>2:  Vi. IV. २०. ४९.</F>
--a daughter of खशा and a राक्षसी. Br. III. 7. १३८.
--a राक्षस having his city in the third talam. (Vitalam-वा। प्।) Br. II. २०. २९; वा. ५०. २८.
--a mindborn mother. M. १७९. २४.
--one of the seven sons of वसिष्ठ and ऊर्जा. भा. IV. 1. ४१.
--womb of the अण्ड; became cloud. M. 2. ३३.
(I)--a son of चाक्षुस Manu and नड्वला. His queen was पुष्करिणी. Father of six sons. भा. IV. १३. १६-17.
(II)--a friend of जरासन्ध, who was station- ed at the eastern gate of मथुरा when it was beseiged. भा. X. ५०. ११[2].
(III)--a son of बलराम (Baladeva) and रेवती; fought with his kinsmen at प्रभास, deluded by कृष्ण. भा. XI. ३०. १७; Br. III. ७१. १६६; Vi. IV. १५. २०; V. २५. १९. [पगे१-247+ ३२]
--thrice for पितृस् and once for gods. वा. ७५. १६.
--the son of तितिक्षु, a famous king of the east. Br. III. ७४. २५; वा. ९९. २५.
(I)--a son of Dharma. Performed a hundred अश्वमेध sacrifices. Father of Rucaka. भा. IX. २३. ३४.
(II)--the son of Bhava and धात्री (ओषा-वा। प्।). Br. II. १०. ७७; वा. २७. ५०.
(III)--a son of सुयज्ञ, and a performer of १०० अश्वमेधस्; father of Marutta. Br. III. ७०. २३-4; M. ४४. २३.

(IV)--The preceptor of the Daityas and Asuras; <F>1:  वा. 3. 5; ६२. ८०; वा. ६५. ७४.</F> on शिशुमारचक्र; <F>2:  भा. V. २३. 7.</F> disciple of the father of बृहस्पति and leader of a side of Soma (पार्ष्णि); <F>3:  वा. ९०. ३०.</F> father of देवयानी; by his curse ययाती could not enjoy his youth to the full and hence requested his sons to give their youth in exchange for his old age. <F>4:  ६५. ८४; ९३. ३०; १०३. ५९.</F> Praised अमरकण्टकक्षेत्र; <F>5:  वा. ७७. १४.</F> a sage; <F>6:  वा. ३०. ८५; ५९. ९०.</F> see शुक्र।
(V)--a son of गोकर्ण, the अवतार् of the १६थ् द्वापर। वा. २३. १७३.
(VI)--the son of पृथुश्रवस्, performed १०० अश्वमेधस्। वा. ९५. २३. [पगे१-248+ ३१]
(VII)--the planet Venus above Budha; above is अङ्गारक. Vi. II. 7. 7-8.

(VIII)--the वेदव्यास of the third द्वापर; <F>1:  Vi. III. 3. १२.</F> an author on नीतिशास्त्र; <F>2:  Vi. I. १९. २६.</F> on the efficacy of तपस्; <F>3:  Vi. I. १२. ९८-103.</F> jealous of बृहस्पति joined Candra in the तारकामय war and acted as पार्ष्णिग्राह. <F>4:  Vi. IV. 6. १२.</F>
(IX)--the son of पृथुतम; he performed १०० अश्वमेधस्; father of शितपु. Vi. IV. १२. 8-9.
(रुशना-Burnouf)--one of the queens of Rudra. भा. III. १२. १३.
(I)--the son of कृति, and father of Cedi. भा. IX. २४. 2.
(II)--the twelfth कल्प। वा. २१. ३२.
--a name of Kavi located at नैष्- थीय. (उशीराग्नि-वा। प्।). Br. II. १२. ३०; वा. २९. २९.

(I)--a sage by तपस्; elder brother of बृहस्पति who had sexual intercourse by force with उशिज's wife when pregnant. Hence बृहस्पति cursed that son to be perpe- tually ignorant (दीर्घतमस्); <F>1:  Br. II. ३२. ९९; III. ७४. ३६-46; M. ४९. १७.</F> ममता was his wife. <F>2:  M. ४८. ३२; १९६. ११.</F> A pravara of अङ्गिरस्. [पगे१-249+ २७]
(II)--a son of अङ्गिरस; hence a branch of अङ्गिरस. वा. ६५. १००, १०६.
--a son of Atharvan अङ्गिरस्. Br. III. 1. १०५.

--Had शिबि, grandson of ययाति for son. A son of महामन; had five queens of राजऋषि families, each of whom bore a son; (four sons, शिबि and others, ब्र्। प्।). भा. I. १२. २०; IX. २३. 2-3; Br. III. ७४. १७; M. ४२. १९; ४८. १५-18; वा. ९९. १८-19; Vi. IV. १८. 8-9.
(I)--a sage who went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for solar eclipse. भा. X. ८२. १३.
(II)--a tribe of which सुयज्ञ was a king. भा. VII. 2. २८; X. ८२. १३.
--a mt. near Mandara hill; people here felt the influence of हिरण्यकशिपु. M. १६३. ८७.
(I)--the wife of विभावसु; mother of व्युष्ट and two other sons. भा. VI. 6. १६.
(II)--Night: a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २०; वा. ५०. १६१.
(III)--created by ब्रह्मा from his feet; <F>1:  Vi. I. 5. ४९.</F> camels belonging to the ताम्र line. <F>2:  Vi. I. २१. १७.</F> [पगे१-250+ २८]

--the daughter of बाण and granddaughter of Bali got enamoured of Aniruddha whom she saw in a picture and requested her maid to arrange for her marriage with him; she saw उमा dallying with शिव and asked of her marriage which उमा said will be to him whom she would see in a dream. So she saw Aniruddha in a dream on a वैशाख शुक्ल द्वादशी; by the aid of चित्रलेखा, he was taken to her chamber in secret. Also ऊषा (s.v.). Vi. V. ३२. 7-३०.
--and thirty-two other devas from the Sumanasa group. वा. १००. ९१-2.
--created by दक्ष. M. 4. ५३; 6. ३३.
(I)--a son of Dyutimat, with his kingdom by name उष्ण. Br. II. १४. २२ and २५; वा. ३३. २१-22; Vi. II. 4. ४८.
(II)--a region of क्रौञ्चद्वीप. Br. II. १९. ७२; M. १२२. ८५; वा. ४९. ६६.
(III)--the son of Nirvaktra. वा. ९९. २७२.
(IV)--the son of Nicaknu and father of Vicitra- ratha. Vi. IV. २१. 9-१०.
--at the Vindhyas sacred to अभया. M. १३. ४२. [पगे१-251+ १२]
--a कला that gives energy to Agni. Br. IV. ३५. ८३.
--a poetic metre; a horse of the sun's chariot. भा. III. १२. ४५; XI. २१. ४१; Br. II. २२. ७२; M. १२५. ४७; वा. ५१. ६५; Vi. II. 8. 5.
--a class of पितृस् to be given oblation after bath; <F>1:  M. १०२. २०; १४१. २०; वा. ३०. १००.</F> propitiated every new moon; to them कृष्णपक्ष a day and शुक्लपक्ष a night. <F>2:  वा. ५६. २१. ८७.</F>
--a class of sages. M. २००. 9. [पगे१-252+ २४]
--the fifth face of the fourteen faced god, चरिष्- णव Manu of the पीत colour. वा. २६. ३७.
(I)--a son of चाक्षुष Manu; wife आग्नेयी; father of six sons. Br. II. ३६. ७९, १०६-8; M. 4. ४१-3; वा. ६२. ६७, ९१, ९२; Vi. III. 1. २९.
(II)--a son of Bhauma Manu. Vi. III. 2. ४५.
(I)--a son of Vatsara and स्वर्वीथि. भा. IV. १३. १२.
(II)--month (कार्तिक) sacred to Hari; with इष forms शरत्। भा. XII. ११. ४४; वा. ३०. 9; Br. II. १३. १०; वा. ५२. १५; ६२. 16
(III)--a god of the Harita गण। Br. IV. 1. ८५.
(IV)--a son of Auttama Manu. M. 9. १२.
(V)--the originator of the Agnisambhava गण of Apsaras. वा. ६९. ५४. [पगे१-253+ २५]
(VI)--the son of सुधन्वा, the powerful. वा. ९९. २२५.
(VII)--one of the seven sages of श्वारोचिष epoch. Vi. III. 1. ११.
(VIII)--the son of शुचि and father of शतध्वज. Vi. IV. 5. ३०-31.
(IX)--a ग्रामणि with the sun in the spring. वा. ५२. 4.
--the son of Muni; father of सनद्वाज. Br. III. ६४. २०; वा. ८९. १९.
--a queen of शरदृतु. Br. IV. ३२. ३४.
(I)--a son of वसिष्ठ and a sage of the स्वारोचिष epoch. Br. II. ३६. १७.
(II)--one of the ten branches of the Harita group of devas. वा. १००. ८९.
--a sage of the स्वारोचिष epoch. भा. VIII. 1. २०.
(I)--a daughter of Priyavrata and बर्हिष्- मती; wife of शुक्र, and mother of देवयानि. भा. V. 1. २४ and ३४.
--a son of Bhautya Manu. Br. IV. 1. ११५. [पगे१-254+ २६]
--a सुधामन god. Br. II. ३६. २८.
--the sacred hill where was वसिष्ठ's आश्रम। Br. III. १३. ५३.
--the wife of दक्ष. Vi. I. 7. 7.

--a daughter of दक्ष and wife of वसिष्ठ; mother of Citraketu and six other sons besides a daughter पुण्डरीका. भा. IV. 1. ४०; X. ३९. ५५; Br. II. 9. ५२ and ५६; ११. ३९; वा. १०. २८, ३२; २८. ३४; Vi. I. 7. २५; १०. १२.
--wife of प्राण--a Vasu. भा. VI. 6. १२.
--one of the १४ गणस् of Apsaras, born of Agni. Br. III. 7. १९.
--a son of कार्तवीर्य Arjuna. भा. IX. २३. २७.
(I)--the यक्ष presiding over the month पुष्य। भा. XII. ११. ४२.
(II)--(च्) a mountain kingdom. M. ११४. ५६.
--a hill tribe. Br. II. १६. ६७.
(I)--the queen of Citraratha and mother of सम्राट्. भा. V. १५. १४. [पगे१-255+ २४]
(II)--had six sons through मरीचि. भा. X. ८५. ४७.
--one of Danu's sons. वा. ६८. 9.
--त्रयार्षेय pravara. M. १९७. 6.
--a Mauneya Gandharva with हेमन्त sun. Br. II. २३. १७; वा. ५२. १७; ६९. 1; Vi. II. १०. १४.
(I)--the son of सनद्वाज, and father of Aja. भा. IX. १३. २२.
(II)--one of the eleven Rudras. वा. ६६. ६९.
--a son and commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८१; २६. ४७.
--a svara शक्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ५६ and ८५.
--a son of कृष्ण and माद्री. भा. X. ६१. १५.
--the son of श्वेत the वानर, and father of व्याघ्र and others. Br. III. 7. १८०, २०५. [पगे१-256+ २६]
--a caste mark on the forehead. Br. IV. ३८. २२.
(I)--a sage of the Raivata epoch; a son of वसिष्ठ and ऊर्जा. भा. VIII. 5. 3; Br. II. ११. ४१; ३६. ६२; Vi. III. 1. २२.
(II)--a son of ऊर्ज and वसिष्ठ. Vi. I. १०. १३.
--above Brahmaloka 4 crores, ११ नियुतस्। वा. १०१. १४३.
--a region of the west watered by Sindhu. Br. II. १८. ४९; वा. ४७. ४६.
--a hill of कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १५.
--relates to creation of भौत सर्ग, after तिर्यक् स्रोतस्; the seventh मानुष सर्ग, the sixth being दैवत। Br. I. 5. ५७; III. 7. ४७४; वा. 6. ४८-51.
--a class of people in प्लक्षद्वीप. भा. V. २०. 4.
--an elephant. Br. III. 7. ३४६.
--the six ऊर्मिस् or waves as obstructing the knowledge of ब्रह्मन्--hunger, thirst, sorrow, stupefac- tion, decay and death. Vi. I. १५. ३७. [पगे१-257+ २८]
--a son of Soma. Br. III. 3. २३; वा. ६६. २३.

(I)--the son of पुरञ्जय; a sage who practised true ब्रह्मचर्य; put his thigh into the fire and churned it with कुश grass; out of that came the fire Aurva, which he gave to हिरण्यकशिपु as a weapon. M. ५०. ८५; १७५. २३-48, ६९-71.
--born out of the thigh of नारायण. (See उर्वशी). वा. ६९. ५१.

--(also उषा, s.v.) Daughter of बाण. Her compa- nion was चित्रलेखा. Dreamt one night that she was sleeping with Aniruddha. Informed her friend of the dream but could not give Aniruddha's name. चित्रलेखा drew pencil sketches of all gods and men and showed them to her one by one. Seeing Aniruddha's she identified him. At this, चित्रलेखा flew through air and brought Aniruddha to her room unnoticed by others. ऊषा was enjoying his company. The guards who got scent of this reported to बाण who imprisoned Aniruddha. In course of time she married Ani- ruddha and went to his home with the approval of बाण. भा. X. ६१. २३ [9]; ६२. 1-३५; ६३. ५०.
(I)--a पाराशार clan. वा. ७०. ८७.
--a class of पितृस्. Br. II. २८. २३.
--a पराशर clan. Br. III. 8. ९५.
--a son of श्वेत; an अवतार of the Lord. वा. २३. २०५.
--a portion of साम वेद। Br. II. ३५. ७२. [पगे१-259+ २६]
of the Vedas; <F>1:  भा. X. 7. १४; ५३. १२; XII. ११. ४७; १२. ६२.</F> learnt by the Asuras. <F>2:  Br. II. ३३. ३६; IV. १२. १७.</F>
--one of the names in the fourth मरुत् गण। वा. ६७. १२७.
--8th face of the fourteen-faced god; सावर्णि Manu from. वा. २६. ४०.

(I)--followed राम in his लङ्का expedition. Took the shield when Bharata carried the पादुक। <F>1:  भा. IX. १०. १९ & ४४.</F> A son of शुक; took विरजा as wife given by प्रजापति. रक्षा, mother of जाम्बवान्, was his sister. <F>2:  Br. III. 7. २१०-17; ५१. ११.</F>
(II)--a son of अजमीढ and धूमिनी, and father of सम्वरण; पञ्चार्षेय. भा. IX. २२. 3; M. ५०. १९; १९६. ५०; वा. ९९. २१४; Vi. IV. १९. ७४-5.
(III)--the name of व्यास in the २४थ् (२५थ्-वि। प्।) द्वापर; शूलि, the अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. २०६; Vi. III. 3. १८.
(IV)--the son of देवातिथि. वा. ९९. २३३.
(V)--a son of पुरञ्जय and father of हर्यश्व. Vi. IV. १९. ५७-8. [पगे१-260+ ३०]
(VI)--a son of देवातिथि and father of भीमसेन. Vi. IV. २०. 6-7.

(I)--the mount where Atri performed penance for the birth of a son; a कुलपर्वत of भारतवर्ष. <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. १७.</F> To this कृष्ण went in search of Prasenajit; also ऋक्षगिरि and ऋक्षपर्वत near the नर्मदा; <F>2:  भा. V. १९. १६; Br. II. १६. १८; III. ७०. ३२; ७१. ३९; वा. ४५. ८९; ९५. ३१; Vi. II. 3. 3.</F> rivers originating from. <F>3:  वा. ४५. १०१; ९८-101.</F>
(II)--a वानर tribe, born of मृगमन्दा and Pulaha. Br. III. 7. १७४. ३१९; २२. २२; २६. ३० & ३४.
--the region of stars. M. १२५. ३६; २४६. ५५.
--(simply ऋक्ष) is जाम्बवान्. Br. III. 1. ५८; ७१. ३५.
--Mt. occupied by ज्यामघ, son of Rukma- kavaca; a कुलपर्वत। M. ४४. २७-32; ११४. १७.
--all of the moon; the road of Rksas in the मण्डलम्। वा. ५०. १०२; ५३. ६९, ७३.

--imparted to Paila by व्यास. Paila arranged it in two parts and assigned them to Indrapramati and बाष्- kala. The latter divided that into 4 शाखस् which were imparted respectively to Bodhya, अग्निमातर, पाराशरि, and याज्ञवल्क्य. But Indrapramati gave it intact to his pupil [पगे१-261+ ३६] माण्डुकि who taught it to his son who in his turn to his son and so on. <F>1:  भा. 1. 4. २१; Br. II. ३४. १४-30; वा. ३२. 2; Vi. III. 4. 8, १३, १६-25.</F> Served as a horse for the chariot of Tripu- रारि. <F>2:  M. १३३. ३१.</F> Present with पद and क्रम in वारुणि यज्ञ। <F>3:  वा. ६५. २४.</F> One मात्र। <F>4:  वा. २६. १७.</F> Part of विष्णु. <F>5:  Vi. V. 1. ३७.</F>
(I)--the ब्रह्मऋषिस् superior to the clan of Praty- अङ्गिरस; one learned in र्क् becomes versed in the Vedas. वा. ६६. ७८.
(II)--from the first face of ब्रह्मा. Vi. I. 5. ५३.
(III)--the son of Pratyangirasa. Vi. I. १५. १३६.
(I)--the wife of अप्रवान. Br. III. 1. ९४.
(II)--the wife of अणुह. वा. ९९. १७९.

(I)--the son of नाहुषि (Aurva) and father of Jamadagni by सत्यवती; the sage who married गाधि's daughter by paying a price of a thousand white horses with one black ear. (See सत्यवती). A मन्त्रकृत् <F>1:  भा. IX. १५. 5-११; Br. II. १३. ९५; ३२. १०४; III. 1. ९५; २५. ८३.</F> com- pared to धिष्णि fire. Blessed his wife with a चरु and his mother-in-law with another for the birth res- pectively of a ब्राह्मण and a क्षत्रिय son. His wife wrongly took that intended for her mother. She gave birth to Jamadagni and became converted as कौशिकी river; <F>2:  Br. III. २१. १९-22: ६६. ३७-40; IV. 7. १३, ३४; वा. ६५. ९३; ९१. ६६-86.</F> father of two other sons शुनह्शेप and शुनह्पुच्छ; <F>3:  वा. ९१. ६६. ९२; Br. III. ६६. ६४.</F> had १०० sons who in turn had १००० sons--all भार्गवस्. <F>4:  वा. ६५. ९२-95.</F> [पगे१-262+ २६]
(II)--a son of शिखण्डि; an अवतार् in the eighteenth द्वापर। वा. २३. १८३.
(III)--a son of सुतार the lord of the second द्वापर। वा. २३. १२१.
--the sage presiding over the month of इष। भा. XII. ११. ४३.
--a son of देवकी and Vasudeva; killed by कंस. Vi. IV. १५. २६-7.
--the १८थ् Vedavya1sa. Br. II. ३५. १२१. भा. IX. २४. ५४.
--a son of देवकी killed by कंस. Br. III. ७१. १७५.

--is threefold for a द्विज--to gods, to पितृस् and to sages. <F>1:  वा. ७७. १०६; १०८. ७६ and ८९; ११०. ६०; १११. २९ and ३१.</F> Vasudeva is asked by sages to perform a sacrifice to please gods. <F>2:  भा. X. ८४. ३९-40.</F>
--a तीर्थ on the north of the यमुना, and south of प्रयाग. M. १०७. २०.
--a तीर्थ sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ६७.
--a sage, not to have marital alliance with विश्वामित्रस्. M. १९८. १९.
(I)--a son of चाक्षुष Manu and नड्वला. भा. IV. १३. १६.
(II)--the son of Vijaya and father of Sunaka (Sunaya-वि। प्।). भा. IX. १३. २५-26; वा. ८९. २२. Vi. IV. 5. ३१.
(III)--a तुषित god. Br. II. ३६. १२.
(IV)--a Sukha god. Br. IV. 1. १८.
(V)--the १२थ् Manu of the future. M. 9. ३६.
(VI)--a son of अङ्गिरस्. M. १९६. 2.
(VII)--one of the names of the third मरुत् गण। वा. ६२. ४३; ६७. १२६.
(I)--a Gandharva with the शिशिर sun. Br. II. २३. २३. [पगे१-264+ २६]
(II)--a Marut of the second गण। Br. III. 5. ९३; वा. ६७. १२४.
(III)--a ग्रामणी with the sun in the months of माशि and पङ्गुनि। वा. ५२. २२.
(IV)--an यक्ष, residing in the sun's chariot during माघ। Vi. II. १०. १६.
--the name of व्यास in the eighteenth द्वा- para. शिखण्डि, the अवतार् of the lord. वा. २३. १८१.
(शारद्वतस्)--after king शारद्वत, belong- ing to the family of Gautama. वा. ९९. २०५.
(I)--a name of Indra in the epoch of रुद्रसावर्णि. भा. VIII. १३. २८; Br. IV. 1. ९१.
(II)--a son of कङ्क and कर्णिका. भा. IX. २४. ४४.
(III)--the १३थ् Manu of the future. M. 9. ३६.
(IV)--Indra of the १२थ् or ऋतुसावर्न Manu. वा. १००. ९५.
(II)--a chief सिद्ध। Goes about the world to impart knowledge. भा. VI. १५. १५.
(III)--the name of Pratardana. Vi. IV. 8. १४.
--a name of the वर्षनाडि or ray of the sun. वा. ५३. २०.
(I)--a god of आभूतरयस् group. Br. II. ३६. ५५.
(II)--a name for सम्वत्सर, and ऋतुस् from ऋतम्। वा. ३०. २१.
--a R. of प्लक्षद्वीप. भा. V. २०. 4.
--an Angirasa and मन्त्रकृत्। Br. II. ३२. १०७.
--a class of people in शाकद्वीप। भा. V. २०. २७.
--the Gandharva who presides over the month of सह। भा. XII. ११. ४१.
(I)--a Sutapa god. Br. IV. 1. १४.
(II)--an अमिताभ god. Br. IV. 1. १६. [पगे१-266+ ४०]
(III)--wife समत्ती; with the sun in the हेमन्त वा. २८. ३१; ५२. १६.
(IV)--one of the twenty Sutapa गणस्। वा. १००. १५.

--six in number; <F>1:  वा. ३०. 4; Br. II. १३. 4.</F> due to the movements of the sun; <F>2:  वा. 3. १४; २३. १०६; ३१. २६; ६२. ४८; ६६. ३८; Br. II. २१. १२६, १५३; २४. ५७.</F> representation of पितृस् and पितामहस्, <F>3:  Br. II. १३. 8; २३. ७६; २८. १६-17; III. 1. ५९; ७२. ३०; वा. ३०. 7.</F> sons of ब्रह्मा; <F>4:  Br. II. १३. १२.</F> sons of Nimi; <F>5:  Br. II. १३. १८.</F> fathers of five आर्तवस्; considered as पितामहस् while आर्तवस् are पितृस्; <F>6:  Br. II. १३. १८, २०, २३; वा. ३०. १८, २४-25.</F> duration of each, two months; <F>7:  Br. II. १३. १७.</F> three ऋतुस् make one अयनम्; <F>8:  Br. II. १३. ११४.</F> their locale, मास and अर्धमास; <F>9:  वा. ३०. १२.</F> are Agni; <F>१०:  M. १४१. १४ and ५७.</F> prayed to in श्राद्ध; <F>११:  M. १६. ३९.</F> sang and danced at the marriage of उमा; <F>१२:  M. १५४. ४९२.</F> characteristics of. <F>१३:  M. २२९. १३-26.</F>
--the sixth kalpa. वा. २१. ३०.
--a R. of the Mahendra hill. वा. ४५. १०६.
(I)--Sujyoti Agni; in औदम्बरि। Br. II. १२. २४; वा. २९. २३.
(II)--Indra of the XIIth epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. ३३.
--a surname of Rudra. भा. III. १२. १२.

--the son of अयुतायुस्, and a friend of Nala. Taught Nala the secret of gambling and was in turn instruct- [पगे१-267+ २७] ed in अश्वविद्या। Father of सर्वकाम: called a second Nala, (learnt the secrets of dice from Nala. वि। प्।). भा. IX. 9. १७; Br. III. ६३. १७३; M. १२. ४६; वा. ८८. १७३-74; Vi. IV. 4. ३७-8.
--the five आर्तवस्। वा. ३१. ५०.
--a नदीपुत्र and धिष्णि Agni. वा. २९. १८. २६.
--the pleasure garden of वरुण in the त्रिकूट hill. भा. VIII. 2. 9.
--a name of सम्वत्सर; brought forth sons, ऋतुस्; the latter आर्तवस्--all पितृस् and पितामहस्; the five years are प्रपितामहस्। वा. ५६. १४-15.
--(सावर्णि) a son of Rudra, a son of the १२थ् period. वा. १००. ८६.
--a son of रौद्राश्व and father of रन्तिभार. भा. IX. २०. 4 & 6.
--a son of रौद्राश्व and father of अन्तिनार. Vi. IV. १९. 2-3.
--the कर्म performed with a view to attain fruits; the performer has a round of births and deaths (श्मशानम्); even sages were desirous of offspring in the द्वापर। वा. ५०. २१०-6. [पगे१-268+ ३२]
--a राजऋषि becoming a ब्राह्मण. वा. ९१. ११६.
(I)--the wife of Kubera; a ब्रह्मकला; mother of नलकूबर. Br. III. 8. ४६; IV. ३५. ९४; वा. ७०. ४१.
(II)--a deity attendant on विनायक. M. २६०. ५५.
--one of the five groups of gods of चाक्षुष epoch. M. 9. २४.

(I)--a son of ब्रह्मा; one of the first two created, the other सनत्कुमार; a सिद्ध who knows the माया of Hari. <F>1:  भा. II. 7. ४३; IV. 8. 1; VI. १५. १२; वा. 9. १०६; २४. ७९.</F> A resident of Tapoloka; <F>2:  Br. III. ३६. 6; IV. 2. २४, ३५ and २१४; वा. १०१. २६, ३७ and २१२; वा. २५. ९२.</F> teacher of निदाघ; im- parted to him the essence of true knowledge after partaking of meals with him; once again met निदाघ after १००० years; initiated him into the mysteries of अद्वैत and disappeared. <F>3:  Vi. II. १५. 2-३४; १६ (whole).</F>
(II)--heard the विष्णु पुराण from ब्रह्मा; communicated to Priyavrata. Vi. VI. 8. ४३.

(I)--a class of gods resident in Bhuvarloka <F>1:  वा. १०१. ३०.</F> specially created by भृगु to put down the प्रमथ and other गणस् in the sacrifice of दक्ष. Followers of Indra; <F>2:  भा. IV. 4. ३३; VI. 7. 2; १०. १७.</F> of चाक्षुष epoch. <F>3:  M. 9. २४.</F> [पगे१-269+ २९]
(II)--gods of the Vaivasvata epoch, came to द्वारका with other gods to ask कृष्ण to go back to Vai- कुन्ठ्२अ. भा. VIII. १३. 4; XI. 6. 2.
(I)--a sage about whose welfare Arjuna is asked by युधिष्ठिर. भा. I. १४. ३१.
(II)--a follower of वृत्र in his battle with Indra. भा. VI. १०. १९.
(III)--a son of Indra and पौलोमी. भा. VI. १८. 7.
(IV)--a manifestation of Hari in दक्षसावर्णि epoch. Born of आयुष्मत् and अम्बुधारा; engaged in ध्यानमार्ग। भा. VIII. १३. २०; वा. २३. १४३, १४६.
(V)--a son of कुशाग्र, and father of Satyahita. भा. IX. २२. 6-7. वा. ९९. २२३.
(VI)--a playmate of कृष्ण. भा. X. २२. ३१.
(VII)--identified with the sun. भा. XII. 6. ६८.

(VIII)--the son of नाभि and सुदेवी (Meru- देवी according to वि।, वा। & ब्र्। प्।) An अवतार् of विष्णु, eldest of all क्षत्र. A परमहम्स। Had a hundred sons of whom Bharata was the eldest. <F>1:  Br. II. १४. ६०-62; भा. II. 7. १०; XI. 4. १७; Vi. II. 1. २७; वा. ३३. ५०-51.</F> Nine of these became rulers of the nine द्वीपस् of the world. Eightyone [पगे१-270+ ३३] of them became addicted to कर्म तन्त्र, and the remain- der nine became sages. <F>2:  भा. XI. 2. १५-20.</F> Indra grew jealous of him and stopped rains in his kingdom अजनाभ. But ऋषभ, in- voked rains by yogic powers. <F>3:  Ib. V. 3 (whole); 4. 1-3.</F> As king, married जयन्ती, bestowed on him by Indra, who gave birth to १०० sons. Under ऋषभ, his kingdom flowed with milk and honey. Once he went to control ब्रह्मावर्त and proclaimed the importance of self-control and discipline to his sons and to the world at large. Installed Bharata on the throne, renounced life and became a wandering mendicant. Finding the world opposed to his yoga practice he adopted the vow of a python (आजगरम्) by which he ate, chewed, drank and passed water all lying down. By his yogic powers he wandered through कोङ्क, वेङ्क, कुटक, S. कर्नाट, and was consumed by forest- fire. By listening to his story, devotion to Hari was in- creased. His path was followed by Sumati; <F>4:  Ib. V. 4. 8-१९; chap. 5 (whole); 6. 6-१९; १५. 1; वा. ३३. ५१.</F> took to the third आश्रम at Pulaha's hermitage and lived there until his death. <F>5:  Vi. II. 1. २८-31.</F>
(IX)--a son of अङ्गिरस्, and a sage of the स्वा- रोचिष epoch; a मन्त्रकृत्। Br. III. ३६. १७; वा. ५९. १००.
(X)--a son of Sudhanvan. वा. ६५. १०२.
(XI)--a दानव with मनुष्य dharma. वा. ६८. १५.

(XIII)--a mountain on the north base of Meru but in भारतवर्ष; sacred to Hari and visited by Bala- राम; <F>1:  भा. V. १६. २६; १९. १६; X. ७९. १५; M. १६३. ७८; Vi. II. 2. ३०.</F> entered the sea. <F>2:  M. १२१. ७२; Br. II. १८. ७५.</F>
(XIV)--an elephant at one of the four cardinal points to maintain the balance of the worlds. भा. V. २०. ३९.
(XV)--स्वर (auspicious), when heard by a king starting on an expedition; the second of the seven notes of the Hindu gamut. M. २४३. २१; वा. २१. ३४; ८६. ३७.
(XVI)--the fifteenth कल्प; here came into being ऋषभस्वर। वा. २१. ३३-34.
(XVII)--another name for the सुमना hill of प्लक्षद्वीप. वा. ४२. १९; ४९. ११.
--a class of people in क्रौञ्चद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २२.
(I)--a R. from Vindhya hills. M. ११४. २७.
(II)--a R. from the केतुमाल country. वा. ४४. १९.
--a daughter of क्रोधवशा, and a wife of Pulaha. Had five daughters after whom came the मैन गण। Br. III. 7. १७२ & ४१३; वा. ६९. २८९-291. [पगे१-272+ ४२]

-- (ety.) got the मन्त्रस् by the pupil of the eye, by observation, by accident and by past and future events. Five groups are distinguished: अव्यक्तात्मा, महानात्मा, (also महात्मा), अहम्कारात्मा, भूतात्मा and इन्द्रियात्मा; also ब्रह्मऋषिस्, देवऋषिस्, राजऋषिस्, महऋषिस्, सप्तऋषिस्, ऋषिकस्--all मन्त्रवित्स्। <F>1:  Br. II. ३२. ७०-95; ३३. ३२, ३४; ३५. ८९ & ९५; M. १२३. २९; १४५. ८१-89. वा. ५९-87.</F> Milked the cow Earth when Soma acted as calf; बृहस्- pati was the milkman, the vessel being the Vedas and the essence तपस्; <F>2:  M. १०. १६-7.</F> cursed by महादेव in the स्वायम्भुव epoch and freed from it in the Vaivasvata. <F>3:  M. १९५. 3.</F>

ऋसिस् procreate for the world and establish धर्म in it; live in the पितृयान। गृहमेधि र्षिस्; ८८,000; live in the southern path of the sun till the end of the world; <F>4:  M. १२४. ९८-100, १०२-4.</F> quality of immanence in them; kinds of; <F>5:  वा. 5. ३५; ४९. १२६; ५९. ६३.</F> place of ८००० sages. <F>6:  Br. II. 7. १८०.</F>

अंकुशा: ऋषि--परमऋषि, ऋषिता, महऋषिस्, ऋषिकस्, ऋषिपुत्रकस्, श्रुतऋषिस्
and ऋषिजाति, ety. of. वा. ५९. ७९-87.

--blessed पृथु. <F>1:  भा. IV. १५. १९; १९. १८.</F> Divine ascetics. <F>2:  Ib. III. २०. ५२-3; VII. 8. ३७ and ४३; VIII. 5. ३९; १४. 8; X. ७२. 8; ७४. ३७.</F> Went to द्वा- रका to see कृष्ण. <F>3:  Ib. XI. 6. 3.</F> Sing in praise of the sun. <F>4:  Ib. XII. ११. ४७.</F> Born in the form of cows when Hari manifested himself as कृष्ण. <F>5:  Ib. X. 1. २३ [1].</F> (See ऋषि). The seven of the Vaivasvata epoch were विश्वामित्र, Jamadagni, भरद्वाज, शरद्वान्, Atri, वसुमान्, वत्सार- कश्यप. <F>6:  वा. ६४. २४-28.</F> Relations of, with gods and पितृस्. <F>7:  Ib. ६२. २१.</F>
(I)--a kingdom watered by ह्लादिनी. ^1 Br. II. १८. ५४; M. १२१. ५३. [पगे१-273+ २८]
--a तीर्थम् on the नर्मदा. M. १९४. १४.
--a R. originating from the शुक्तिमती. वा. ४५. १०७.
--a R. in भारतवर्ष from the शुक्तिमत् hill. (Mahendra--ब्र्।, म्। and वि। प्।). भा. V. १९. १८; Br. II. १६. ३७-38: M. ११४. ३१; Vi. II. 3. १३-14.
--a मन्त्रकृत्; son of सुरूपा and a गोत्रकार. M. १४५. १०५; १९६. 4.
--a place on the नर्मदा. Here तृणबिन्दु got rid of his curse. M. १९१. २२; १९३. १३-4.
--rearrange the Vedas as मन्त्रस् and ब्राह्मणस्, and स्वर and वर्ण। वा. ५८. १२: ५९. ८४ and ८६.

--sons of र्षिकस्--composers of ब्राह्मणस् and the कल्प; authors of धर्मशास्त्रस्; <F>1:  Br. II. ३२. ९३; ३१. १२, २२; M. १४५. ८७.</F> modify the Vedic texts by introducing changes. <F>2:  वा. ५८. १२; ५९. ८४-86.</F>
--three, ब्रह्मऋषि, देवऋषि and राजऋषि। वा. ६१. ८०; Vi. III. 6. २९. [पगे१-274+ ३१]
--a son of देवकी and Vasudeva; killed by कंस. M. ४६. १३.
--the son of देवातिथि, and father of दिलीप. भा. IX. २२. ११.
--the son of उपदानवी. M. ४९. १०.
--a hill in भारतवर्ष. भा. V. १९. १६.
--a mt. from which several rivers originate. M. ११४. २३-26.
(I)--a sage of the eighth मन्वन्तर। भा. VIII. १३. १५; Vi. III. 2. १७.

(II)--married शान्ता, the adopted daughter of रोमपाद. Superintended the इष्टि of दश- ratha to propitiate Indra and blessed दशरथ with issue. <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. 8-१०.</F> The son of a deer, became the plaything of dance, song, etc. <F>2:  Ib. XI. 8. १८.</F> Gave son चतुरङ्ग to लोम्पाद-Das4a- ratha. <F>3:  M. ४८. ९६.</F> Blessed his son with a son; <F>4:  वा. ९९. १०४.</F> one of the seven sages. <F>5:  वा. १००. ११.</F>
--the son of Raya. Bha. IX. १५. 2.
--the kingdom of. M. १२१. ५३.
--‘one umbrella’ of महापद्म. Br. III. ७४. १४०.
--a son of ब्रह्मा; came to see कृष्ण at Syaman- तपञ्चक. भा. X. ८४. 5.
--an attribute of विघ्नेश. Br. III. ४२. 8, ३९; IV. ४४. ६६.

--one of the three daughters of मेना and हिमवान्; wife of Asita (Sita--म्। प्।) and mother of Devala; performed penance under a banyan tree; lived on a single leaf once in every २००० years. वा. ७२. 7; Br. III. 8. ३२; 9. 3; १०. 8, ११; M. १३. 8-9; वा. ७०. २७; ७१. 4; ७२. 9, ११, १७.

--One of the three daughters of हिमवान् and मेना; wife of जैगीषव्य. Their mindborn sons were शन्- kha and Likhita. Performed penance under the wood of चेरसुस् पुद्दम्; lived on a पाटल once in every २००० years. Br. III. 9. 3; १०. 8 & २०, २१; वा. ७१. 4; ७२. 7-१०, १८-9. [पगे१-276+ ३२]
(I)--a Bhairava god. Br. IV. २०. ८२.
(II)--a name of विघ्नेश. Br. IV. ४४. ६८.
--a name of the king of the यक्षस्. वा. ४१. 8.
--in the शङ्कद्वीपम्. वा. ४८. ३१.

--one becomes such by reciting सप्तार्चिष in a श्राद्ध, also by princely gifts on that occasion. <F>1:  वा. ७४. ३०.</F> प्राचीन- barhis was one. <F>2:  Br. II. ३७. २५; III. १६. ५७; वा. ६३. २४.</F> सार्वभौम, son of Suvarman as: <F>3:  वा. ९९. १८६.</F> महापद्म as. <F>4:  Br. III. ७४. १४०.</F>

--King of निषदस्; was stationed by जरासन्- dha at the southern gate of मथुरा, and again on the southern gate during the seige of Gomanta; <F>1:  भा. X. ५०. ११[4]; ५२. ११[8]; Br. III. ७१. १९०.</F> brought up by hunters. <F>2:  वा. ९६. १८७.</F>
--thirteen in number; lords of minor kingdoms; (Wilson's मेकला). Vi. IV. २४. ५८.
--kings (thirty-two) contemporaneous with the ten शिशुनागस्. Br. III. ७४. १३७. [पगे१-277+ २४]
--the goddess enshrined at सःय hill; a mother goddess. M. १३. ४०: १७९. १७.
--a hill south of the मानस. वा. ३६. २४.
--the queen of शुक्र, formerly योगोत्पत्ति, the पितृ कन्या। Br. III. १०. ८६-87.
--a दानव with मनुष्य-धर्म। Br. III. 6. १५; वा. ६८. १५.
--a R. of the केतुमाल country. वा. ४४. २०.
--a mindborn mother. M. १७९. २५.
--the son of दशरथ, and father of शकुनि. Br. III. ७०. ४४; वा. ९५. ४३.
--observed by Nanda. भा. X. २८. 1.
--came to see कृष्ण and सत्यभामा return- ing from Indra's Court. भा. X. [६७ (V) ५०]. [पगे१-278+ ३०]

(of शिव)--is काञ्ची; during his separa- tion from पार्वती, शिव sat under the आम्र tree, and through ललिता's grace, was formally married to पार्वती, when he went to कैलास. Br. IV. 5. 7; ४०. ३७-45; ४४. ९४.
--a तीर्थ sacred to the goddess कीर्तिमति --sacred to पितृस्. M. १३. २९; २२. ५१.
--आर्षेयप्रवर (भार्गवस्). M. १९५. ४३.
--the ११थ् Manu from the ११थ् face of the fourteen faced deva of पिशङ्ग colour. वा. २६. ४३.

--a condition of deluge when ब्रह्मा emerges out of the waters, enveloping the universe. The Lord becomes अव्यक्त; now is the अवतार् of Hamsa-नारायण; <F>1:  Br. IV. 1. १७३, १८१, २३४; M. १६६. १७; १६७. 1 & ४८; वा. १००. १७९.</F> full of darkness; of १००० देववर्षस् or years. <F>2:  वा. २३. ११०; २४. 8; २६-7.</F>
--one of the eleven वसिष्ठ branches. वा. ७०. ९०.
--the final form attained in ब्रह्मलोक by विरजा, the mindborn daughter of आज्यप Manes. M. १५. २४.
--to be performed every year; for this only three पिण्डस् are prescribed; details of ritual. M. १८. 1 & २५; Vi. III. १३. २३, ४०.
--the grass growing on the seashore, supposed to be grown out of the particles of the मुसल given birth to [पगे१-279+ २०] by साम्ब and thrown into the sea by the order of the यादव king. भा. XI. 1. २२.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ५३.
(I)--a १००० headed नाग; living with the sun for a part of the year; in the month of नभ। भा. XII. ११. ३७; Br. II. २३. 9; M. 6. ४०; १२६. १०; Vi. II. १०. 9.
(II)--a काद्रवेय Na1ga. Br. III. 7. ३४.
--the नाग with the sun in नभ and नभ- स्य (आवणि and पुरट्टाशि). वा. ५२. १०.
--heard the विष्णु पुराण from Kambala and narrated it to वेदशिरस् who went to पाताल. Vi. VI. 8. ४७-8.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ५०.
--a reptile of पाताल. M. १६३. ५६. [पगे१-280+ ३०]
--the १२थ् face of the fourteen faced Manu; पिशङ्ग of ashy colour. वा. २६. ४४.
(I)--the queen of Jantu. Her son was शूर. M. ४४. ४५; ४६. 1.
(II)--married अनाधृष्टि. Her son was शत्- rughna. M. ४६. २४.
(III)--the wife of पुरूद्वह, son of Satva. वा. ९५. ४७.

--Born in the family of बृहद्बल and end- ing with Sumitra. Twenty-seven kings contemporaries of ten शिशुनागस्. <F>1:  Br. III. ७४. १०४ & १३६.</F> These are बृहद्बल, उरुक्षय, Vatsadroha, Prativyoma, दिवाकर, Sahadeva, ध्रुवाश्व, प्रतीपाश्व, सुप्रतीप, Marudeva, सुनक्षत्र, किन्नराश्व, अन्तरिक्ष, सुषेण, Sumitra, बृहद्राज, कृतम्जय, रणेजय, सञ्जय, शाक्य, Suddhaudana, सिद्धार्थ, Prasenajit, क्षुद्रक, Kulaka, Suratha and Sumitra. <F>2:  M. २७१. 4-१४.</F> Went with देवापी to कलापग्राम: the future founders of क्षत्र in the २९थ् Caturyuga. <F>3:  M. २७३. ५६-7.</F>
--a name for Kubera; the king of Paulastya राक्षसस्, यक्षस् and their sons and grandsons who were against Vedas and यज्ञस्। वा. ७०. ५४.
(I)--the son of दशरथ, and father of विश्वसह. भा. IX. 9. ४१.
(II)--a Paulastya राक्षस. Br. III. 8. ६०.
--a god of आभूतरयस् group. Br. II. ३६. ५५.
--a division of the day; <F>1:  वा. ६६. ४१.</F> the direction. <F>2:  वा. १११. ४०.</F>
--performed by युवनाश्व for the birth of a son. भा. IX. 6. २६.
--Indra's town; अमरावती. भा. X. ८९. ४४.
--on the नर्मदा; the confluence of the ऐरण्डी with the नर्मदा is deemed very sacred. M. १९१. ४२-7; १९३. ६५.

(I)--a species of white elephants with four tusks; <F>1:  भा., X. ५९. ३७.</F> the elephant of Indra. <F>2:  Vi. I. 9. 7, २५; २२. 5.</F> Lord of elephants; travelling in the sun's chariot during the month of कार्तिक; <F>3:  Vi. II. १०. १२.</F> Indra rode on, to see कृष्ण; <F>4:  Vi. V. १२. 2. १३ and २५; २९. 1.</F> defeated by गरुड in a fight between कृष्ण and Indra. <F>5:  Vi. V. ३०. ६६.</F> [पगे१-282+ ३८]

(II)--the नाग presiding over the month of तपस्य (फल्गुन); <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ४०; Br. II. २३. 3 and १४; III. 7. ३३ and ३२७; M. 6. ३९; १२६. १५.</F> with the sun in the शरत्। <F>2:  वा. ५२. १४; ६९. ७०.</F>

(III)--Bhauvana got hold of the sun's अण्ड- कपाल and sang the रथन्तर portion of सामगान when an elephant appeared given to इरावति as son. Hence ऐरावत the vehicle of Indra--the first king among elephants; <F>1:  वा. ६९. २०९-11; M. 8. 7.</F> fourteen tusks; <F>2:  भा. VI. ११. ११; M. १३३. १०; १७७. ४८.</F> Indra's mount; defeated by वृत्र; <F>3:  भा. VIII. 8. 4; X. २५. 7.</F> came out of the अमृतमथन; <F>4:  Ib. VIII. 8. 4.</F> sacred. <F>5:  भा. XI. १६. १७.</F>
--the उत्तरस्थानम्; has three roads or वीथिस्। वा. ६६. ४७-48.

--R. A beautiful stream originating from the Himalayas, likened to a lady; served daily by Indra; <F>1:  M. ११४. २१; ११५. १८-19; ११६. 1-२५.</F> the region surrounding its source described. <F>2:  M. ११८. 2-७०.</F>
--Here are the constellations पुष्य, आश्लेष and आदित्य (पुनर्वसु-वा। प्।); in the उत्तरमार्ग of the sun. Br. III. 3. ४८; M. १२४. ५२ & ५५; वा. ६६. ४८.
--a son of इरावती--the vehicle of Indra, also इरावत. Br. III. 7. २९२ & ३२६.

--surname of पुरूरवस्; son of Budha and grandson of Soma; got six sons through उर्वशी; Aila to क्षेमक, the last king of the lunar race; १०० branches of. भा. II. 7. ४४; Br. II. २८. 1-2; III. ७४. २४५. वा. 1. १०६; ८५. १७; ९०. ४५; ९१. १०; ९९. २६६, ४३२, and ४५१; Vi. III. १४. ११. [पगे१-283+ २२]
--another name for Kubera. Br. III. 7. ३३१; वा. ६९. २१६.
--a भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. २०.
--a son of Apratiratha; father of four sons, दुष्यन्त and others. Vi. IV. १९. 8-9.
--a परा gan2a god. Br. IV. 1. ५७.

--eightfold: अणिमा and others; of kings in त्रेतायुग; they are अनिमा, लघिमा, महिमा, प्राप्ति, प्राका- म्यम्, ईशीत्वम्, वशीत्वम्, and कामावसायिता (गरिमा); from these come three other kinds of ऐश्वर्य:--सावद्यम्, निरव्द्यम् and सूक्ष्मम्। Br. II. २७. १२७; M. १४२. ६८; वा. १३. 2-6; १०२. ९७; ५४. ५२.
--a गण belonging to Rohita प्रजा- pati. वा. १००. ६१. [पगे१-284+ २३]
--from the thirteenth face of the fourteen-faced deva of five colours; three अक्षरस्, three वर्णस्, त्रिदेवम्, three मात्रस्, three योगस्। वा. २६. १५, २२, २४, ४५; ३२. 1; ५४. 6.
(I)--son of प्रतीक. Had a son of the same name. भा. IX. 2. १८.
(II)--son of Oghavat I. भा. IX. 2. १८.
--daughter of Oghavat I; wife of सुदर्शन. भा. IX. 2.१८.
--a son of कृष्ण and माद्री. भा. X. ६१. १५.
(I)--created by ब्रह्मा from his mouth. Vi. I. 5. ४८.
(II)--the यक्ष presiding over the month of माधव। भा. XII. ११. ३४.
--a पृथुक god. Br. II. ३६. ७३.
--the kingdom of. M. १६३. ७३. [पगे१-285+ ३३]
--by protection; <F>1:  वा. 5. ३७; २५. ८४; ३०. २२९.</F> a yogi is said to be of ॐकार. <F>2:  वा. १९. ४३.</F>
--the symbol of Brahman; <F>1:  Br. II. २५. ६३; IV. ३६. १५.</F> served as a prop for the chariot of त्रिपुरारी. <F>2:  M. १३३. ३४-5.</F>

--characteristic of; this is त्रिमात्रा with consonant and vowel; ओम् placed in the head resembles the moving of ants in the body; प्रणव is bow, आत्मा arrow, ब्रह्म, the aim to be shot at, without faltering; ओम् is three Vedas, three worlds, three fires, the three steps of विष्णु; अकार is अक्षर, उकार is स्वरित, मकार is प्लुत; its head is heaven; more efficacious if performed monthly for many years than sacrifices like अश्वमेध; a hymn to Rudra. वा. २०. 1-9, ३२-33.
--a place sacred for performing श्राद्- धस्; <F>1:  Br. III. १३. ७०; वा. ७७. ६८.</F> a तीर्थम् on the नर्मदा. <F>2:  M. २२. २७; १८६. 2; १९५. 1.</F>
--the sixth face of the fourteen faced God giving rise to विजय। वा. २६. ३८.
--a goddess enshrined at Uttarakuru. M. १३. ५०.

kinds of corn; व्रीहि (a kind of rice), यव (barley), गोधूमा (wheat), अणु (a small grain), तिल (sesamum seeds), प्रियङ्गु (long pepper: saffron), उदार (a sort of grain), कारुष (a kind of sesamum), वीती- नक माष (beans), मुद्ग (a kind of kidney-bean), मसूर (kind of pulse), निष्पाव (a kind of pulse), कुलुत्- थिक (horse gram) etc. <F>1:  वा. 8. १५०; Vi. I. 6. २२-6.</F> [पगे१-286+ १५] Unsown and unploughed; १४ kinds; wild and good variety; when these got exhausted and the world was in a state of hunger and sadness, ब्रह्मा milked the earth with seeds; १७ good varieties except the १४; coming in of cultiva- tion and the name वार्ता; for names see the text. <F>2:  Br. II. 7. १२६, १२८, १३८, १४८; Vi. I. 5. ५०.</F> Same as the lord of. <F>3:  Br. II. १०. ६२.</F>
--a city on the Himalayas. Br. IV. ३०. ९६.
--the moon as the lord of the plants. M. २३. १३.
--the wife of Bhava; son was उशनस्. वा. २७. ५०. [पगे१-287+ २३]
--from the fourteenth face of the fourteen- faced सावर्णि Manu. वा. २६. ४६.
--आर्षेय pravara (भार्गवस्). M. १९५. ४३.
--a मन्त्रकृत् and of अङ्गिरस branch. वा. ५९. १०२.
--the daughter of Ugrasena, and wife of अक्रूर. Br. III. ७१. ११३.
--a R. sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ७१.
--a son of Bala. वा. ८८. २०५.
--a son of भद्राश्व. M. ४९. 5.
--a राक्षस clan after the name Utkaca. Br. III. 7. १४०.
--a राक्षस clan after उत्कृष्ट. Br. III. 7. १४०. [पगे१-288+ २७]
--on the left cheek of शिशुमार. Br. II. २३. १०२.
--a festivity connected with the child's first turning in bed; celebrated for कृष्ण. भा. X. 7. 4, 5-6.
--a place of ऋतुधामाग्नि. Br. II. १२. २४; वा. २९. २३.
--water fowls, of ताम्रा line. Vi. I. २१. १७.
--a son of अङ्गिरस. वा. ६५. १०५.
--a class of seers. भा. III. १२. ४३.
--the सामन्स् uttered by उद्गाता in an यज्ञ। Vi. III. 4. १२.
--the hill on shore of the river कृतमाला. Br. III. ३५. १७.
--name of Uddhava. भा. III. 4. २७. [पगे१-289+ ३५]
--propagated by the Lord for mislead- ing Asuras and other evil doers. भा. II. 7. ३७.
--a ऋत्विक् at the यज्ञ of ब्रह्मा. वा. १०६. ३९.
--a वासिष्ठ clan of sages. Br. III. 8. ९८; M. २००. ११.
--a tribe near the गान्धार region. M. १२१. ४६.

(I)--a son born of अप्रवाण (Apruvat-मत्स्य प्।) and ऋची, being born from her thigh. Father of ऋचीक. Jamadagni was his grandson; a मन्त्रकृत् and sage. <F>1:  Br. III. 1. ९५; II. ३२. १०५; ३८. २७; M. १९५. १५-16; वा. ५९. ९६; ६५. ९२.</F> Sagara who had no son visited his hermitage with his two wives and was blessed for sons. Present at Sagara's अश्वमेध and other sacrifices and taught him the path to salvation; <F>2:  भा. IX. 8. 8 & ३१; Br. III. ३४. 2; ५०. २९-58; ५१. 1-४१; ५२. ३७; ५५. 3; ६३. १२२, १३३-4; वा. ८८. १२३, १३२-4; Vi. IV. 3. २९, ३७.</F> spoke to Sagara on the mode of worshipping विष्णु; <F>3:  M. १२. ४०; Vi. III. 8. 6-१९.</F> on वर्ण- धर्म; <F>4:  Vi. III. 8. २०-40.</F> on आश्रमधर्म; <F>5:  Ib. ch. 9 (whole).</F> on rituals; <F>6:  Ib. ch. १० (whole).</F> on the duties of the householder; <F>7:  Ib. chapters ११-12.</F> on funeral rites; <F>8:  Ib. chapter १३ (whole).</F> on the श्राद्ध; <F>9:  Ib. chapters १४-16; १७. 1.</F> pre- [पगे१-290+ ३८] vented the pregnant queen of बाहु(ka) from committing सती, <F>१०:  भा. IX. 8. 3; Vi. IV. 3. २९-37.</F> and the posthumous son Sagara brought up in his hermitage to whom he did all सम्स्करस्। Was visited and revisited by परशुराम. <F>११:  Br. III. २१. ३५; २५. ८१; Vi. IV. 3. ३६.</F> Phalgutanta took refuge near his hermitage; <F>१२:  Br. III. ४७. ७९-87.</F> extinguished the तालजङ्घ line. <F>१३:  भा. IX. २३. २८.</F> Came to see परीक्षित् practising प्रायोपवेश। <F>१४:  भा. I. १९. १०.</F> A description of his hermitage. <F>१५:  Br. III. ५०. ३४-45.</F> A sage of the स्वारोचिष epoch, and one of the five Pravaras of भार्गव gotra. <F>१६:  M. 9. 8; १९५. २९.</F>

(II)--(सम्वर्तक, वडवामुख: s.v.). Hari took this form of fire and drank the waters of the sea; <F>1:  Br. II. १८. ८०; III. ७२. १७; M. 2. 5; वा. ४७. ७६.</F> ब्रह्मा fixed him in the वडवामुख ocean; celebrated for और्वीमाया (s.v). <F>2:  M. १२१. ७७; १७५. १८, ५८-72.</F>

--a son of पुरूरवस्, became king; father of नहुष; he was a धार्मिच् king and the sages performed a great sacrifice; the assembly looked like that of Indra when the Gandharvas sang, the Apsaras danced, the sages entered into debates and delivered sermons of all kinds. वा. 2. २३-36.
--used by Maya to dispel the darkness of तामसास्त्र; earned by हिरण्यकशिपु from Aurva in the तारकामय war. M. १७५. २०-71.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ३१.
--the hill noted for श्राद्ध and यज्ञ performance; here grow all trees which could be used for यज्ञस्। Br. III. १३. २९; वा. ७७. २९-31.
--a kingdom watered by ह्लादिनी. Br. II. १८. ५४. [पगे१-292+ २९]
(I)--the Lord of Creatures: The Great पुरुष. भा. II. 1. ३२; III. 6. १९; VIII. 5. ३९; वा. 4. ४३.
(I)--a hill of शाल्मलिद्वीप. Br. II. १९. ३९.
(II)--a son of Ugrasena. Br. III. ७१. १३३.
--a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३३. १०.
--a daughter of Ugrasena. Br. III. ७१. १३४.

(I)--the eldest son of Ugrasena <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. २४; Br. I. 1. १२५; III. ७१. १३२; वा. 1. १४८; ९६. १३१, १७३, २१६; Vi. IV. १४. २०; M. ४४. ७४; ४६. १३.</F> and brother (cousin-वा। प्।) of देवकी. Took part in the festivities con- nected with the marriage of देवकी and Vasudeva, when he heard a voice from air that her eighth son would kill him. He at once drew his sword to slay देवकी when Vasudeva entreated him to spare her life promising to give him all her sons. To this he agreed. He did not take notice even of the first boy. Subsequently नारद confirmed what he heard from the welkin. So he killed all her sons and put her and Vasudeva in jail. He waited for the seventh and was particularly afraid of the eighth. Being informed of the birth of a girl, and without listening to his sister's appeal to spare the baby, he dashed it against a stone. It flew heavenwards and said that the baby born to vanquish him [पगे१-293+ ४३] was safe. Disheartened, कंस let Vasudeva and देवकी free. Consulted his ministers who advised him to kill all infants in the kingdom, and to hurt all ब्राह्मणस् and cows, the root cause of Hari's धर्म। Messengers were sent out on this mission. <F>2:  भा. X. chap. 1-4; Br. III. ७१. १७५-235; ७३. ९९; वा. ९८. १००; Vi. IV. १५. २६-7; V. 1. 6-११, ६७-69; 3. 2; chap. 4.</F> An incarnation of कालनेमि. Threw his father Ugra- sena in prison and assumed regal administration. <F>3:  भा. X. 1. ६८-69.</F> Encouraged by his Asura friends such as Pralamba and Baka, as also by the मागधन् king, he tyrannized the Yadus who left the land for other countries like Kuru, पाञ्- चाल and others. The ब्राह्मणस् were afraid of him. <F>4:  Ib. X. 2. 1-4; २३. ५२.</F> Heard from नारद that कृष्ण and बलराम were Vasudeva's sons; when he went to slay Vasudeva, नारद prevented him from it. He then threw Vasudeva and his wife in prison. He summoned his councillors and asked the Mallas, चाणूर and मुष्टिक to get ready for a wrestling match with कृष्ण and राम; ordered his mahout to station the State Elephant at the gate of the enclosure (रङ्ग) and get कृष्ण and राम trampled under its feet; when he was asked why he was out to kill those two boys, he narrated the story of his mother once going in the garden thinking of her husband Ugrasena. Then a Gandharva Drumila per- sonated Ugrasena. Discovering that he was not her hus- band, she asked him in wrath who he was. He tried to console her saying that she would give birth to a heroic son. The chaste lady retorted that he would be cruel and un- righteous. Such being his birth, he hated his kith and kin. Then he commanded to commence the धनुर्याग। अक्रूर was sent for and ordered to take his chariot and bring कृष्ण and राम to the धनुर्याग with all gopas. He proposed to kill all of them and rule the kingdoms with the help of friends like जरासन्ध. Thanked by अक्रूर for an opportunity to visit कृष्ण and राम; अक्रूर reached the Vraja and was welcomed by the brothers and Nanda. Informed of their arrival by अक्रूर. Much concerned to know of the breaking of his bow by कृष्ण and further the killing of his guards. He had no sleep all night and had bad dreams, all in fear of कृष्ण. Next morning he drove [पगे१-294+ ३६] to the wrestling ground and occupied the royal seat with his ministers; was perturbed to learn of the death of Kuva- लयापीड and its guards. Became furious at the death of his five mallas and the running away of others. Ordered the banishment of the two brothers, robbing the gopas of their belongings, and imprisonment of Nanda, killing of Ugrasena and Vasudeva. कृष्ण attacked him direct, pull- ed him down from his throne and killed him. His eight brothers who offered fight were slain by राम. <F>5:  Ib. X. chap. ३६-44; M. ४७. 4, 6; ६९. 8; Vi. V. १२. २१; १५. 2-4; २०. २६, ८२-90.</F> Death welcomed by Gopis and अक्रूर. <F>6:  भा. X. ४७. ३९; ४८. १७.</F> Prevented Vasudeva go- ing to करवीरपुर. His oppression. <F>7:  Ib. X. ५७. २३; ६६. 9; ८२. २२; ८५. २८, ३३.</F> His queens were Asti and प्राप्ति, daughters of जरा- sandha. <F>8:  Ib. X. ५०. 1;</F> His death recalled by कृष्ण to Mucukunda; by कृतवर्मन् to युधिष्ठिर; by कुन्ती. <F>9:  Ib. X. ५१. ४२; ५२. [५६ (V) 6]; ५७. १३; I. 8. २३; II. 7. ३४; Vi. V. २९. 5.</F> Attained Hari through fear. <F>१०:  भा. VII. 1. ३०.</F> Of the Bhoja family. Funeral rites done by Ugrasena. <F>११:  Vi. V. २१. 7-१०; २९. 5.</F>
(II)--a दानव king; with the sun for two months--मधु and माधव। Br. II. २३. 3; IV. २९. १२३.
--a daughter of Ugrasena; married देवभाग. भा. IX. २४. २५ and ४०; Br. III. ७१. १३४; M. ४४. ७५; Vi. IV. १४. २१.
--is कृष्ण. Br. III. ३६. ३४.
--a daughter of Ugrasena. Married Deva- श्रवस्. भा. IX. २४. २५ & ४१; Br. III. ७१. १३४; M. ४४. ७५; Vi. IV. १४. २१. [पगे१-295+ २९]
(I)--the son of शशाद; rode on Indra in the form of a bull in the आडीवक युद्ध। Father of Anenas. वा. ८८. २४-25; Br. III. ६३. २५; Vi. IV. 2. ३२-3.
(II)--a surname of Puramjaya (s.v.); a son of विकुक्षि; lust of, after more territory; eldest of ११४ ruling south of Meru. भा. IX. 6. १२; XII. 3. १०; M. १२. २०.
--a मरीचि god. Br. IV. 1. ५८.
--a son of Satyaka and काशी king's daughter; his son, वृष्टि. वा. ९६. ११५-16.
--a brother of Vasudeva. Vi. IV. १४. ३०.
(I)--a Mt. of शाल्मलिद्वीप noted for pre- cious gems rained by वासव; a hill containing medicinal herbs, on the N. W. of the कैलास. Br. II. १९. ४१-2; M. १२१. १४; वा. ४९. ३८; Vi. II. 4. २७.
(II)--Mt. in कुशद्वीप. M. १२२. ६०.

--The eldest of Reva(ta)'s hundred sons. Father of रेवती (Surata-वा।) whom he took to ब्रह्मा for a suitable bridegroom. As ब्रह्मा was engaged in attending to music, the king waited, and afterwards the Creator laughingly said that it was past २७ × 4 युगस् since he came there. At that time was flourishing बलराम whose name was suggested for his daughter's husband. On return he found his country overrun by यक्षस्, and getting his daughter married to बलराम, he retired to Badari to [पगे१-296+ ३०] perform penance. <F>1:  भा. IX. 3. २९-36; M. १२. २३; वा. ८६. २६-30; ८८. 1.</F> Ruled from कुशस्थलि. During his sojourn at ब्रह्मा's residence, the राक्षसस् captured the capital and put to flight his younger brothers who established smaller states then and there. <F>2:  Br. III. ६१. २०-27; Vi. IV. 1. ६५-96.</F>
--a राक्षस in Sutalam. Br. II. २०. २३.
--a hill in भारतवर्ष. भा. V. १९. १६.
--a daughter of दक्ष and a wife of Dharma. Mother of संकट. भा. VI. 6. 4 & 6.
--a commander who aided विषङ्ग; killed by वन्हिवासा. Br. IV. २५. २८ & ९५.
--a commander of विषङ्ग--also केकिवा- hana. Was killed by महावज्रेश्वरी. Br. IV. २५. २८ & ९६.
(I)--a राजऋषि becoming a ब्राह्मण. वा. ९१. ११७.
(II)--a sage who called on भीष्म on his death bed. <F>1:  भा. 1. 9. 7.</F> An अङ्गिरस् and a मन्त्रकृत्; a क्षत्रोपेत- द्विज। <F>2:  Br. II. ३२. १११; III. ६६. ८८.</F>

(III)--the son born of दीर्घतमस् to Bali's slave girl: Followed his father Gautama afterwards to Giri- vraja (Giripraja-वा। प्।) and got engaged in तपस्। Attained [पगे१-297+ २८] Brahmahood at the place with his brother चक्षुस्. Father of १००० sons known as कूष्माण्ड Gautamas and कृष्णाङ्- gas. <F>1:  Br. III. ७४. ७१, ९५ & ९९; वा. ९९. ७०, ९३-7.</F> A मन्त्रकृत् and of the अङ्गिरस branch. <F>2:  M. १४५. १०५; वा. ५९. १०२.</F>
(IV)--a pupil of पौष्पिञ्जि. Vi. III. 6. 6.
(I)--a son of भद्राश्व. M. ४९. 5.
(II)--one of the ten sons of रौद्राश्व. वा. ९९. १२४; Vi. IV. १९. 2.
(I)--a son of Ugrasena, and brother of कंस; killed by बलराम. <F>1:  भा. IV. २४. २४; X. ४४. ४०-41.</F> His daughter was the queen of Andhaka. <F>2:  M. ४४. ६१ & ७४.</F>
(II)--a son of देवमीढ अलिअस् शूर, and मारिषा. His queen was कर्णिका and sons were ऋतधामन् and Jaya. भा. IX. २४. २७-9. & ४४.
(III)--the अवतार् of the Lord in the fifth द्वापर with four sons, all योगिन्स्। वा. २३. १२९.
(IV)--a ऋत्विक् at ब्रह्मा's यज्ञ। वा. १०६. ३६.
(V)--(Mt.) a chief hill of the शाल्मलिद्वीप. वा. ४२. ५०; ४९. ३६; Vi. II. 4. २७. [पगे१-298+ ३५]
(VI)--a Mt. in कुशद्वीप. M. १२२. ५७.
(I)--a royal dynasty of sixteen princes noted for their greed. See मौनस्। भा. XII. 1. २९.

(II)--a tribe defeated by Bharatas. Purified of sin by devotion to Hari. <F>1:  भा. IX. २०. ३०; II. 4. १८.</F> Heard of कृष्ण going to मिथिला, and met him there with presents. <F>2:  भा. X. ८६. २०.</F>
--a daughter of Ugrasena; wife of आनक and mother of Satyajit and Purujit. भा. IX. २४. २५ and ४१; M. ४४. ७६.

--the son of बृहस्पति; deputed by gods to learn सम्जीविनी विद्या from शुक्राचार्य; offered himself as a disciple and admitted as a pupil by शुक्र; conducted himself to the satisfaction of his teacher and his daughter देवयानी for a period of ५०० years. Once while out in the woods tending शुक्र's cows, the Asuras killed him and left his body to be devoured by dogs and jackals. The cows returned home but not Kaca. देवयानी suspected of foul play and reported his death. शुक्र brought him back to life. <F>1:  M. २५. १४-37.</F> On another occasion he went to the woods to gather flowers for देवयानी and this time the Asuras ground him to pieces and mixing them with सुरा offered it to शुक्र who drank it. Again देवयानी persisted wanting him back to life. This meant शुक्र's death for he had to come out by tearing open his belly. So he taught Kaca the सम्जीविनी विद्या so that he might restore him after his revival. Thus he did and so he learnt the विद्या। After a sojourn of ten hundred years he returned with due leave from his teacher. Now देवयानी offered to marry him but he pointed out that it was not proper to marry his preceptor's daughter. So [पगे१-299+ २५] she cursed that he would not get the fruits of his विद्या and he retorted that she would not find a ब्राह्मण husband but only a क्षत्रिय. Returned to the gods who gave him a share in their oblations; put to death by वृषपर्वन्'s men. <F>2:  M. २५. ३८-69; chap. २६ whole; भा. IX. १८. २२.</F>
--a western country. Br. II. १६. ६२.
--the नाग presiding over the month of माधव। भा. XII. ११. ३४.
(I)--a son of विश्वामित्र. Br. III. ६६. ६९; वा. ९१. ९७; Vi. IV. 7. ३८.
(III)--one of the eight निधिस् of Kubera. वा. ४१. १०.
--the सर्प who resides in the sun's chariot during the month of माधव। Vi. II. १०. 5.
--a western country. Br. II. १६. ६२.
--in the लिङ्ग देश of the personified Veda. वा. १०४. ७६.
--in the waist of the personified Veda. वा. १०४. ८०.
--a R. of the केतुमाल country. वा. ४४. १८.
<F>1:  भा. X. ५३. ४१[].</F> --followed रुक्मिणी going to देवी temple; also कञ्चुकधारि। <F>2:  Br. IV. ३२. 3; M. २५४. २३.</F>
--a part of death rituals. Vi. III. १३. १०.
--a maker of mats of reeds. भा. I. 3. १८.
--articles of, detailed. M. २१७. ६२-7.
--a mother goddess. M. १७९. २९.
--a तीर्थम् on the नर्मदा. M. १९१. ६३-4.
--a brother of Vasudeva. वा. ९६. १४८.
--a son of सोमशर्मन्, an अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. २१६.
--a northern tribe. M. ११४. ४२.
(I)--a son of अजमीढ and केशिनी; father of मेधातिथि. वा. ९९. १६९-170.
(II)--a son of Dhurya. वा. ९९. १३०.
--a श्रुतऋषि। Br. II. ३३. 5.
--the Mudgalas belonging to the branch of अङ्गिरस्. वा. ९९. १९९.
--(the text is confused). Apparently the four kings beginning with नवकण्ठायान are शुङ्ग- भृत्यस् and were known as कण्टायनद्विजस्। वा. ९९. ३४६-7. [पगे१-302+ २९]
--the minister of पञ्चाल Brahmadatta; remembered his previous birth as a son of कौशिक, left for the forest to practise योग with his brother minister. M. २०. २४; २१. ३१.
--a वाशिष्ठ and a sage. Br. II. ३२. ११६.

(I)--a sage engaged in austerities on the banks of the गोमती; had a daughter through प्रम्लोचा who aban- doned the child in the midst of trees and departed. Soma nourished it with nectar, and trees looked after her as their baby. To get rid of the sin कण्डु entered the temple of पुरुषोत्तम and meditated on केशव. भा. IV. ३०. १३-14; Vi. I. १५. ११-54.
(II)--a pupil of लाङ्गलि. Br. II. ३५. ४८.
--father of thousand snakes, moveable and immoveable having a number of heads, and flying in the air and having different names. वा. ६९. ६८.
(I)--a son of Apratiratha and father of मेधा- tithi; शकुन्तला was brought up in his आश्रम; performed birth and other सम्स्कारस् to the son born to her. भा. IX. २०. 6-१२ and १८; Vi. IV. १९. 5-6.
(II)--a sage and contemporary of कृष्ण with whom he went to मिथिला. Left द्वारका for पिण्डारक. Invited for युधिष्ठिर's राजसूय। भा. X. ८६. १८; XI. 1. १२; X. ७४. 7; Vi. V. ३७. 6 [पगे१-303+ २७]
(III)--the minister of देवभूति S4un3ga, whom he assassinated and usurped the throne. भा. XII. 1. १९.
(IV)--An अङ्गिरस and मन्त्रकृत्। A pupil of याज्ञवल्क्य. Br. II. ३२. १०९; ३५. २८; वा. ५९. १००; ६१. २४.
(V)--a son of अजामीढ and केशिनी and father of मेधातिथि. M. ४९. ४६; Vi. IV. १९. ३०-31.
(V)--a ऋत्विक् at the याग of ब्रह्मा. वा. १०६. ३५; १०८. ४२.
--a royal dynasty after शुङ्गस्; four kings in all, ruled for ४५ years. भा. XII. 1. १९; M. २७२. ३६; Vi. IV. २४. ३८, ४२.
--the family of ब्राह्मणस् originally from कण्व and his son मेधातिथि. (See Wilson, Note at p. ३२). Vi. IV. १९. 7.
--the predecessors of the आन्ध्र rulers; their reign of 4 kings lasted for ४५ years. Br. III. ७४. १५८ & १५९.
--a कौशिक and a sage. Br. II. ३२. ११८.
--a tribe conquered by Kalki. Br. II. ३१. ८४.
--a राक्षस living in Sutalam. Br. II. २०. २२.
--of काम and केशव to be narrated in मद- नद्वादशीव्रत। M. 7. १४.
--a pupil of बाष्कल. Vi. III. 4. २५.
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १७. ३४; २८. ६७.
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १७. ३४.
--a R. sacred to पितृस्. Once राम resided on her banks. M. २२. ५२.
--sons of Dullola. Br. III. 7. ४४३.

--a daughter of दक्ष, wife of तार्क्ष्या, and mother of नागस्, including कालिय: <F>1:  भा. V. २४. 8; VI. 6. २१-2; X. १७. 4, ७३.</F> according to बृअह्माण्ड वि।, वा।, and मस्त्य प्। Consort of काश्यप; <F>2:  Br. III. 3. ५७; 7. ३१, ४६७; M. 6. 2 & ३८; १४६. १९ & २२; १७१. २९ & ६३; वा. ६६. ५५; Vi. I. १५. १२५.</F> known for anger. <F>3:  वा. ६९. ९४.</F>
--Reference to तक्षक in Sutalam. Br. II. २०. २४.
--a son of Ugrasena. वा. ९६. १३२. [पगे१-305+ २६]
(I)--a संहिकेय Asura. Br. III. 6. २०.
(II)--a son of Durmada (Durdama-मत्स्य प्।); father of कृतवीर्य and three other sons, कार्तवीर्य, कृत- varma and कृत. Br. III. ६९. 8; M. ४३. १२; वा. ९४. 7-9.
(III)--a son of हृदिक. Br. III. ७१. १४१.
(IV)--a son of बृहति. Br. III. ७१. २५६.
(V)--a king who ruled over स्त्रीराष्ट्र, Bho- jaka and other kingdoms. Br. III. ७४. १९९.
(I)--enjoy kingdoms of त्रैराज्य and मूषिक. Vi. IV. २४. ६७.
(II)--two sons of कृष्ण. वा. ९६. १८९.
--a sacred place (तीर्थ); a bather here goes to heaven, relieved of all three ऋणस्; east of the मुण्डपृष्ट hill. Br. III. १३. ११३-5; वा. ७७. १०५.
--(Mt.) from the अण्ड; <F>1:  वा. २४. ७५.</F> ten thousand योजनस् in length, containing caves of red arsenic. <F>2:  वा. ३५. १०.</F> [पगे१-306+ २६]
--a son of Pulaha and क्षमा; wife यशो- धरा and son सहिष्णु. Br. II. ११. ३१.
--His wife was met by Agni, and Nala was their son. Br. III. 7. २२९-230.
--Raudram metal, dear to पितृस्. Br. III. 1. ६०; ११. 5.
--R. a महानदी, remembered by लोमश per- forming penance at the मुण्दपृष्ट hill; fit for performance of श्राद्ध। वा. १०८. ८०.
--ruled over स्त्रिराष्ट्र and भक्ष्यकस्. वा. ९९. ३८७.
--one of the forms of ब्रह्मा in the Gaya stone. वा. १०६. ५६; १११. ७२.
--a sacred place on the Ganges, where गरुड performed तपस्। Here शिव danced with a योगिनी. Bath here leads to Rudralokam. M. १८६. १०; १९२. ११; १९३. ६९-71; वा. ८३. २१.
--a तीर्थ in Gaya; on its right side is Dak- षिणमानस. वा. १११. 7. [पगे१-307+ २३]
--one of the five deva-गणस् of the १४थ् epoch of Bhautya Manu. These are the seven सामस् commencing with बृहत्। Br. IV. 1. १०६ & १०८; वा. १००. १११-2; Vi. III. 2. ४३.
--one of the ten sons of हृदीक. M. ४४. ८२.
--a chief वानर. Br. III. 7. २३४.
--the name of the 8th कल्प M. २९०. 4.
--an attribute of Manmatha. Br. IV. १९. ६७; ३०. ५४ and ८५; M. १५४. २५०.
--a game with balls indulged in by girls. मोहिनी played it. भा. VIII. १२. १८ & २३; M. १६०. 4.
--a son of मणिभद्र. वा. ६९. १५४.
--काश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 3.
--a name of योगमाया. भा. X. 2. १२.
(II)--daughter of Kardama and wife of Priya- vrata; mother of two daughters and ten sons. Vi. II. 1. 5.
(III)--shrine of, south of Malaya {??}ills, visited by बलराम. भा. X. ७९. १७.
--on the नर्मदा. M. १९३. ७६-7.
--the harem of a palace. Vi. V. २९. ३१.
--the deceitful battle waged during night by Asuras; also कूटयुद्ध। Br. IV. २६. 2-१०.
--an attribute of विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ६६.
(II)--a mindborn mother. M. १७९. २०.
--a name of शिव. वा. १०९. २३.
--one of the eleven Rudras. वा. ६६. ७०.
--शिव's begging bowl; shattered into १००० pieces at Benares by Hari's grace. M. १८३. ९१-100.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to शुद्धि <F>1:  M. १३. ४८.</F> of शिव at Banaras. <F>2:  Ib. १८३. १०१.</F>

--a name of शिव: a Rudra. <F>1:  Br. II. २५. ६८; III. 3. ७१; २५. 8.</F> A Bhairava god; <F>2:  Ib. IV. १९. ७९; Vi. I. १५. १२३.</F> killed गजासुर; <F>3:  M. १५३. १९-68; १७१. ३९.</F> शिव had to become कपालि for having destroyed the fifth face of ब्रह्मा, but released through Hari's grace. <F>4:  M. १८३. ८७-100.</F>
--a theophany of शिव. M. 1. 8.
--a mother goddess. M. १७९. १६.
(I)--Asura (?) vanquished by कृष्ण. भा. II. 7. ३४.
(II)--An अङ्गिरस and मन्त्रकृत्; a क्षत्रोपेत- द्विज; <F>1:  Br. II. ३२. १०९; III. ६६. ८६.</F> a भार्गव. <F>2:  M. १९५. ३३.</F>
(III)--had two sons पिसाचस् Aja and शण्ड, who were कूष्माण्डस् in the previous birth; their line described. Br. III. 7. ७४-88.
(IV)--a god of सुकर्मण group. Br. IV. 1. ८८. [पगे१-310+ २५]
(V)--a sage of the तामस epoch. M. 9. १५.
(VI)--a son of Raivata Manu. M. 9. २१.
(VII)--a राजऋषि becoming a ब्राह्मण. वा. ९१. ११५.
(VIII)--a son of विशाला. वा. ९९. १६३.
(IX)--a son of दुरुक्षय, became a ब्राह्मण (मत्स्य प्। speaks of three branches of Kavi ब्राह्मणस्). Vi. IV. १९. २५, २६.
(II)--the king of kings to the Gandharvas in the हेमकूट hill. वा. ३९. ५२.
(III)--a Mt.; between this hill and नाग S4aila are many fine orchards. वा. ३८. ६६-70; ४२. ६७.
--wife of वसिस्ठ, and mother of Indrapramati (Indrapratima--वा। प्।) Br. III. 8. ९७; वा. ७०. ८८.
--illustrative of the world which is compared to the shape of an egg. Vi. II. 7. २२. [पगे१-311+ ४९]
--a काद्रवेय Na1ga Br. III. 7. ३६.
--a त्रयार्षेय; अङ्गिरस् and गार्ग्य are Pravaras. M. १९६. ४८-49.
--कृष्ण Para1s4a1ras. M. २०१. ३५.

(I)--the fifth अवतार् of Hari. Born of Kardama and देवहूति. Had nine sisters. Taught the knowledge of Brahman to his mother. <F>1:  भा. I. 3. १०; II. 7. 3; VIII. 1. 6; Br. III. ६३. १४५ and १४८.</F> A सिद्ध। <F>2:  भा. VI. १५. १३; III. २४. १६-17.</F> Propounder of तत्त्वस्। Imparted to आसुरि the साङ्ख्य obscured by time. After Kardama left the family, Kapila lived with his mother at Bindusaras and instructed her on साङ्ख्य तत्त्वस्, तत्त्व- लक्षण, the distinction of प्रकृति and पुरुष, अष्टाङ्ग योग, भक्ति योग, काल, attachment and consequent hell, गर्भ and attachment to women and evils attending thereon, काम्य कर्म and ज्ञान योग; left his mother for north. Being worshipped by Samudra (sea) with अर्घ्य and resi- dence, he devoted his mind to योग। <F>3:  Ib. III. chapters २४-33; Br. IV. ४०. ६६; M. 3. २९; १०२. १८; १७१. 4 and १९.</F> Knew वासुदेव's glory but could not comprehend His माया। <F>4:  भा. I. 9. १९; IX. 4. ५७.</F> Served as calf for Vidyadharas to milk सिद्धि and विद्या। <F>5:  Ib. IV. १८. १९.</F> Attended पृथु's sacrifice. <F>6:  Ib. IV. १९. 6.</F> प्राचीनबर्हिस् who retired from kingly duties came to his hermitage to perform तपस्। <F>7:  Ib. IV. २९. ८१.</F> One of the twelve who knew the धर्म ordained by Hari. <F>8:  Ib. VI. 3. २०; 8. १६.</F> A sage who went about the world imparting knowledge; <F>9:  Ib. VI. १५. १३.</F> would find no fault with Hara's violation of धर्म। <F>१०:  Ib. VI. १७. १२.</F> King रहूगण went to visit him. <F>११:  Ib. V. १०. 1 and १६.</F> Near by his आश्रम was the consecrated horse of Sagara. The ६०,000 सागरस् who searched for it imputed the theft to the sage and attacked him, who in wrath burnt them down. Met by अम्शुमान्, he gave back the horse and said that the सागरस् would get redemption by the Ganges waters. <F>१२:  Ib. IX. 8. १०-29; XI. १६. १५; Br. III. १५. १५-43; ५३. १७-52; chap. ५४; Vi. IV. 4. १२-28.</F> The [पगे१-312+ २४] four who were not victims to the sage's curse were Barhi- ketu, Saketu, Dharmarata, and पञ्चवन. <F>१३:  वा. ८८. १४७-53.</F>
(II)--a son of Danu. Followed वृत्र in his battle with Indra. Took part in देवासुर war between Bali and Indra. भा. VI. 6. ३०; १०[20]; VIII. १०. २१; Br. III. 6. 5; Vi. I. २१. 4.
(III)--a son of ज्योतिष्मन्, after whom came कपिलवर्ष. Br. II. १४. २८ and ३०; वा. ३३. २४.
(IV)--a काद्रवेय Na1ga in the third talam. (Vitalam, वा। प्।). Br. II. २०. ३०; III. 7. ३६; M. 6. ४१; वा. ५०. २९; ६९. ७३, २१९.
(V)--an यक्ष who married the राक्षसि Kes4ini1. Br. III. 7. १४६; वा. ६९. १२.
(VI)--a chief of the वानरस् Br. III. 7. २३३.
(VII)--a son of Vasudeva and सुगन्धी; took to penance. Br. III. ७१. १८६; M. ४६. २१; वा. ९६. १८२-183.
(VIII)--a son of भद्राश्व. M. ५०. 3.
(IX)--a son of मही (Earth ?) M. १६३. ९०. [पगे१-313+ ३३]
(X)--a Gandharva. वा. ६९. २६.
(XI)--a son of ब्रह्मा; <F>1:  वा. १०१. ३३८.</F> of the eighth द्वापर। <F>2:  Ib. २३. १४१.</F>

(XII)--a sage; <F>1:  Vi. I. २२. 8.</F> hermitage of, on the इक्षुमती banks; <F>2:  Ib. II. १३. ५३.</F> King सौवीर went to him for consultation on the end of life; <F>3:  Ib. II. १४. 7.</F> a part of विष्णु; <F>4:  Ib. II. १४. 9.</F> विष्णु; in त्रेतायुग to impart knowledge. <F>5:  Ib. III. 2. ५६.</F>
(XIII)--Mt. of कुशद्वीप surrounding the base of Meru. भा. V. १६. २६; २०. १५.
(XIV)--a Mt. west of the Sitoda (Meru-वि। प्।). वा. ३६. २७; ४२. ५०; Vi. II. 2. २९.
(XV)--a Mt. north of the महाभद्र lake. वा. ३६. ३१.
(XVI)--an elephant born of the Rathantara. Br. III. 7. ३३५; वा. ६९. २१९.
--the ब्राह्मण caste of साल्मलिद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ३०.
--a Janapada of the केतुमाल. वा. ४४. ११.
--a kingdom in कुशद्वीप; <F>1:  Br. II. १४. ३०; १९. ५९.</F> a वर्ष after the name; <F>2:  वा. ३३. २६.</F> a वर्षपर्वत in कुशद्वीपम्. <F>3:  वा. ४९. ५५.</F> [पगे१-314+ २६]
(I)--a daughter of खशा and a राक्षसी; After her name came the कापिलेय gan2a. Br. III. 7. १३८; वा. ६९. १७०.
(II)--a goddess enshrined at महालिङ्ग. M. १३. ३३.
(III)--a R. on the south side of the नर्मदा, joining it. M. १८६. ४०.
(IV)--a R. in front of the वट in गया. वा. १०८. ५७.
(V)--brown cow, gift of which is equal to hear- ing ten chapters of विष्णु पुराण; <F>1:  Vi. VI. 8. ५४.</F> equal to the gift of the whole earth. <F>2:  M. १९१. ७२.</F>
(I)--a son of कुवलयाश्व, who survived the fire from Dhundhu's mouth. भा. IX. 6. २३-4; Br. III. ६३. ६३; M. १२. ३२.
(II)--one of the three sons of Dhundhu- मार. वा. ८८. ६१; Vi. IV. 2. ४२.
--the deity presiding over the river कपिला especially at the coming of अमा and सोम। वा. १०८. ५७. [पगे१-315+ २७]
--a son of खशा, and a राक्षस. Br. III. 7. १३४; वा. ६९. १६६.
--a son of Danu. M. 6. १७.
--a daughter of क्रोधवशा (क्रोधा-वा। प्।) and a wife of Pulaha. Gave birth to पिशाच groups; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. १७२ and २७४.</F> gave birth to कूष्माण्डस्. <F>2:  वा. ६९. २०५, २५७.</F>
--a dove, that attained permanent fame: <F>1:  भा. X. ७२. २१.</F> enter- ing houses forebodes evil. <F>2:  M. 6. ३२.</F>
(I)--the son of Viloman and father of Anu. भा. IX. २४. २०.
(II)--a son of वृष्णि (धृष्ट-वि। प्।) and father of Viloman. Br. III. ७१. ११७; Vi. IV. १४. १३.
(III)--a son of धृति and father of Taittiri. M. ४४. ६२.
--the category of phlegm. वा. ९७. ४८.
(I)--killed by श्री Ra1ma; an Asura in Tat- valam. भा. IX. १०. १२; Br. II. २०. १६; Vi. IV. 4. ९६.
(II)--a pupil of Sumantu of Atharvan fame. He imparted the Veda to two disciples Pathya and Deva- दर्श (वेदस्पर्श,-वा। प्।) dividing it into two. Br. II. ३५. ५६; वा. ६१. ५०; Vi. III. 6. 9.
(III)--an Asura chief in Atalam. वा. ५०. १६.

--the tortoise अवतार् of Hari, being the eleventh of incarnations. In this form the Mandara hill was supported on his back during the churning of the ocean by gods and Asuras. भा. I. 3. १६; VIII. 7. 8.

--of Budha; <F>1:  M. ११. ५५.</F> in possession of Agastya. <F>2:  Ib. ६१. ३६.</F> Given to वामन by वसिष्ठ; <F>3:  Ib. २४५. ८६.</F> of ब्रह्मा, as the source of गङ्गा; <F>4:  वा. ५५. १४; भा. VIII. २१. 4.</F> of शिव. <F>5:  वा. १०१. २७३.</F>
--a R. in भारतवर्ष. M. १६३. ६२.
--A व्रत in honour of the Sun god. M. ७४. 3; ७८ (whole).
(I)--ब्रह्मा's consort; see also लक्ष्मी, श्री। Br. IV. १५. ३७; ३९. ६७. [पगे१-317+ २३]
(II)--an Apsaras. वा. ६९. 7.
(I)--a दानव who entered the ocean. M. ६१. 4.
(II)--a तीर्थम् sacred to Mahotpala. M. १३. ३४.
(I)--a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३३. 6.
(II)--a name of विष्णु. Br. IV. १२. २०.
--a Laukikya Apsaras. Br. III. 7. १०.
(I)--a तीर्थम् sacred to कमला. M. १३. ३२.
(II)--an attribute of श्री. Vi. I. 8. २२.
--a name of ब्रह्मा. M. 1. १३; ६०. 4.
--a daughter of king रेणुक of इक्ष्वाकु line. Hence रेणुका; wife of Jamadagni; mother of परशुराम. Br. III. ६६. ६१.
--a goddess following माया. M. १७९. ७०. [पगे१-318+ ३०]
--is ब्रह्मा; narrated the विष्णु पुराण to ऋभु. Br. III. ५६. ३७; Vi. VI. 8. ४३.
--also कम्पातरन्गिणी--the sacred waters of काञ्ची. Br. IV. ४०. १७, ४०, ८५, १०२ and ११५.
--a mindborn mother. M. १७९. २४.

(I)--a chief of नागस् in पाताल, presides over the month of इष। <F>1:  भा. V. २४. ३१; XII. ११. ४३; M. 6. ३९; वा. ५०. २३; ६९. ७०.</F> According to the ब्रह्माङ्द and वायु पुराणस्, he was the resident of Sutalam; <F>2:  Br. II. २०. २३; III. 7. ३३.</F> in the प्रजापति- क्षेत्र; used in the chariot of त्रिपुरारी. <F>3:  M. १०४. 5; १०६. २७; ११०. 8; १३३. २०.</F> काद्रवेय Na1ga residing in the sun's chariot in the month of माघ; <F>4:  Vi. I. २१. २१; II. १०. १६.</F> in the month of तप and तपस्य। <F>5:  Br. II. २३. २१.</F>
(II)--heard the विष्णु पुराण from अश्वतर and narrated it to एलापुत्र. Vi. VI. 8. ४७.
(IV)--(Mt.) a Kulaparvata of the केतुमाल. वा. ४४. 4.
(II)--a son of Satyaka and the daughter of काशिराज. Br. III. ७१. ११६; वा. ९६. ११५.
(III)--a son of देवबाहु, (देवार्ह- वा। and मत्स्य प्।) and father of असमञ्जस्; a great scholar. Br. III. ७१. १४२; M. ४४. ८३; वा. ९६. १४०.
(IV)--(Kambalabarhi-वा। प्।). A son of Marutta. M. ४४. २५; वा. ९५. २४.
--a R. of the केतुमाल continent. वा. ४४. १७.
--नाग with the sun in the months of माशि and पङ्गुनि। वा. ५२. २१.
--a son of Raivata Manu. Br. II. ३६. ६४.
Its king was vanquished by कृष्ण. भा. II. 7. ३५.
--the daughter of जम्भा, and queen of हिरण्यकशिपु; mother of 4 sons. भा. VI. १८. १२.

(I)--(tax) not levied in शाकद्वीप; <F>1:  वा. ४९. १०३; ५९. १२४; १०८. ७०; Br. II. १९. १०६.</F> levied by Sagara over the conquered; <F>2:  Br. III. ४९. 7; ५२. ४१.</F> to be levied and taken in instal- ments; fresh taxes lead to discontent among peoples. <F>3:  M. २१७. 3; २२६. ११; २३८. १४.</F> [पगे१-320+ २४]
(II)--a measurement of length. M. २७४. २५.
--a small water vessel. In it Manu let the fish. M. 1. १८.
--attacked with four other commanders the शक्ति army using illusory सर्पिणी (reptiles). The शक्तिस् sent out नकुलिस् which put an end to all reptiles. Br. IV. २१. ७७; २३. 4-९८.
--a son of त्रयीसानु and father of Marutta. Vi. IV. १६. 3.
(I)--the son of Khaninetra. भा. IX. 2. २५-26.
(II)--the noble son of त्रिभानु (त्रिसानु ब्र्। and म्। प्।) and father of Maruta (Marutta-ब्र्। प्।). भा. IX. २३. १७; Br. III. ७४. 2; M. ४८. 2; वा. ९९. 2.
(III)--the son of अतिविभूति and father of आविक्षित्; lived at the commencement of the त्रेतायुग। वा. ८६. 7; Vi. 1. २९-30.
--a western kingdom. Br. II. १६. ६१.
--a Janapada of the केतुमाल. वा. ४४. १३.
--a holy spot on the नर्मदा. M. १९०. ११. [पगे१-321+ २५]
--a brother of बलाहक, and a commander of भण्ड; rode on वेताल. Br. IV. २४. १० and ५५.
--a R. of the भारतवर्ष. वा. ४५. १००.
--a son of ऋषभ, and a भागवत; described the forms of Hari worshipped by men in different युगस्। भा. V. 4. ११; XI. 2. २१: 5. २०. ४२.
--the daughter of Cedi king, married Na- kula, son of Niramitra. वा. ९९. २४८.
--a R. from the ऋक्ष hill. Br. II. १६. ३०.
--unfit for श्राद्ध। Vi. III. १६. 8.
--of Agastya family. M. २०२. 1.
(I)--the son of शकुनि. Father of देवरात; a bowman. Br. III. ७०. ४४; M. ४४. ४२; वा. ९५. ४३.
(II)--one of the ten sons of हृदीक. M. ४४. ८२. [पगे१-322+ २७]
--a Janapada of the केतुमाल. वा. ४४. ११.
--a hell for those fallen from कर्म। Br. II. २८. ८४; वा. ५६. ७९.
--a son of शकुनि, and father of देवरात. भा. IX. २४. 5; Vi. IV. १२. ४१.
--a काद्रवेय Na1ga. Br. III. 7. ३७.
--a chief of the वानरस्. Br. III. 7. २३४.
--a Janapada of the केतुमाल. वा. ४४. १२.
(I)--a काद्रवेय Na1ga. Br. III. 7. ३५.
(II)--a Mt. on the south of Meru. भा. V. १६. २७.
--sacred to महालक्ष्मि, and to पितृस्। M. १३. ४१; २२. ७६.

--at the foot of Gomanta hill and under a chieftain शृगालवासुदेव. The latter rose against कृष्ण and राम who occupied the city after killing him. Welcome by its citizens. Spoils and slaves sent to मथुरा. कृष्ण and राम lived here for four months. Pursued by जरा- sandha, the brothers fled to this city and after taking rest for the night got up the hill before daybreak. Not visited by Vasudeva by order of कंस. भा. X. [५२ (V) २८-42]; [५३. (V) २०-21]; ५२. ११ [1]; ६६. [9]. [पगे१-323+ २५]
--another term for शिव; a Bhairava. Br. II. २५. ६८; IV. २०. ८२.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ७८.
--a brother of बलाहक and a commander of भण्ड; rode on प्रेत। Br. IV. २४. १०, ५२.
--a mindborn mother. M. १७९. १७.
--the chariot in which ललिता rode at the starting of expedition towards भण्ड. Br. IV. १७. 8.
--the performer of, becomes king. M. १०१. ७२.
--a western kingdom. Br. II. १६. ६१.
--the prayer of भृगु to शिव. M. १९३. ४५.

--its king बृहच्चाप was placed on the west of the Gomanta hill in its siege by जरासन्ध; <F>1:  भा. X. ५२. ११[12].</F> appropriated [पगे१-324+ २७] the name वासुदेव and sent a दूत to कृष्ण to that effect; attacked कृष्ण with a गदा। <F>2:  भा. X. ६६. 1. ७८. 4.</F>

(I)--one of the ten sons of Vaivasvata Manu. His descendants were कारूषस्, all क्षत्रियस् and rulers of उत्तरापथ। Respected ब्राह्मणस् and धर्म। भा. VII. १३. 3; IX. 1. १२; 2. १६; Br. II. ३८. ३१; ६०. 3; Br. III. ६१. 2; M. ११. ४१; १२. २४; वा. ६४. ३०; ८५. 4; ८६. 2; Vi. III. I. ३४; IV. I. 7, १८.
(II)--adopted a son of कृष्ण, Sucandra by name. M. ४६. २५.
(III)--good for श्राद्ध। Br. III. १४. १८.
--a Vindhya tribe. Dantavaktra, as king of; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ६३; III. ७१. १५६; M. ११४. ५२; वा. ४५. १३२.</F> their territory was near सुप्रीतकवनम्, an elephant- forest. <F>2:  वा. ६९. २३९.</F>
--a daughter of Cedi king; queen of Nakula and mother of Niramitra. भा. IX. २२. ३२; M. ५०. ५५.
--a ऋत्विक् at the sacrifice of ब्रह्मा. वा. १०६. ३७.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ७८. [पगे१-325+ ३९]
--Cancer; when the sun enters this it is दक्षिणायन. Vi. II. 8. ३१.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ७९.

--the नाग presiding over the month of पुष्य। <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ४२; M. १२६. १८; वा. ५२. १७; ६९. ७०.</F> A काद्रवेय Na1ga. <F>2:  Br. II. २३. १७; III. 7. ३४; IV. २०. ५३; ३३. ३६; M. 6. ३९; Vi. I. २१. २२.</F> The सभा of, in माहिषमति. His son defeated by कार्तवीर्य Arjuna; <F>3:  Br. III. ६९. २६; M. ४३. २९.</F> used for त्रिपुरारी's chariot. <F>4:  M. १३३. ३३; १६३. ५६.</F> The assembly of, conquered by कार्तवीर्य Arjuna. <F>5:  वा. ९४. २६.</F>
--a तीर्थम् on the नर्मदा. M. १९१. ३६.

(I)--born of कुन्ती as a virgin and abandoned by her; brought up by Adhiratha; became a king and father of वृषसेन. <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. १३-14; X. ४९. 2; Vi. IV. १४. ३६; १८. २८-9; V. ३५. 5 and 7; ३८. १६.</F> पाण्डवस् defeated his army. Arjuna was saved from कर्ण's arrows by कृष्ण. Joined Duryodhana in insulting Vidura, and was his evil adviser. <F>2:  भा. I. १५. १५-16; III. 1. १४; 3. १३.</F> Resented साम्ब's action in carrying away लक्ष्मणा but vanquished by साम्ब. In charge of gifts in युधिष्तिर's राजसूय। Joined Duryodhana's army and succeeded द्रोण as com- mander for two days, but was killed by Arjuna. <F>3:  भा. X. ६८. 5 and 9; ७५. 5; ७८ [९५ (v) १६] & [३७].</F> Failed to hit the mark in the स्वयम्वर of लक्ष्मणा. <F>4:  Ib. X. ८३. २३.</F> Identified with Cakravarman, the son of Bala. <F>5:  Br. III. 6. ३२.</F> Was called son of सूत as he was brought up by Adhiratha the सूत. <F>6:  वा. ९९. ११८.</F> [पगे१-326+ २१]
(II)--a son of आण्डिर. M. ४८. 5.
(III)--born in after-birth as Cakravarma, the son of Bali. वा. ६८. ३२; Br. III. 6. ३३.
--an आत्रेय gotrakara. M. १९७. 3.
--country of, watered by नलिनी. Br. II. १८. ६०; M. १२१. ५८; वा. ४७. ५७.
--a mindborn mother. M. १७९. १५.
--Inhabitants of south कर्णा- टक. भा. V. 6. 7.
(I)--wife of कङ्क and mother of ऋतधा- man and Jaya. भा. IX. २४. ४४. [पगे१-327+ ३२]

(II)--the tendril of the world lotus; Atri regards it as १०० cornered, भृगु as १००० cornered, भा- guri, square, वार्षायणि Sa1mudra, गालव, tray-shaped, गार्- gya like braided hair and क्रोष्तुकि circle-like. Each had only partial knowledge; ब्रह्मा alone knows it entire. वा. ३४. ५८-69.
--a son of जटायु. M. 6. ३६.
