(I)--father of कपील. Married देवहूति. <F>1:  भा. II. 7. 3; IV. 1. १०.</F> A son of ब्रह्मा born of his shadow. A progenitor and a योगि; <F>2:  Ib. III. १२. २७ & ५६; chap. २१ to २४.</F> performed in कृतयुग austerities on the banks of सरस्वती for १०,000 years; when Hari appeared before him, he praised Him and asked for a suitable wife. देवहूति was suggested and the Lord disappeared. Manu came with his wife and daughter to his hermitage, and was suitably received. Kardama agreed to marry his daughter and lead a householder's life until the birth of children. After wed- ding, Manu and his wife returned home. Pleased at his wife's devotion, created an aerial car artistically built and furnished. Took his wife after her bath and dress round the earth for a hundred years. Nine daughters were born when according to original contract he was anxious to leave her for woods to practise योग। Noticing her anxiety at his departure, he consoled her that she would give birth to Hari who would bring solace to her. On the birth of Kapila, ब्रह्मा and other seers called on him; gave his daughters in marriage, took leave of his son and retired to a life of penance. [पगे१-328+ ३१]

(II)--a son of Pulaha and क्षमा; married Sruti; son शङ्खपद and daughter काम्या; a प्रजापति; a sage by तपस् and a देवऋषि; <F>1:  Br. I. 1. ६५; II. ११. २३ and ३१; ३२. ९९; ३५. ९४; III. 8. १८; १०. ९३; M. १४५. ९३; वा. 1. ८०; 3. 3; २८. २५-29; ३३. 7; ३८. 7; ५९. ९१; ६१. ८४; ६५. ५३; Vi. I. १०. १०.</F> a pravara. <F>2:  M. १९९. १६.</F>

(III)--a प्रजापति: wife of सिनीवली; had two daughters सम्राट् and कुक्षि, besides ten sons. <F>1:  Br. II. १४. 7; III. 1. ५३.</F> His wife left him for Soma. His world that of आज्य पितृस्। <F>2:  M. १५. २०; २३. २४.</F>
--a gotrakara of Atri family. M. १९७. 1.
--in the navel portion of गया; bath and श्राद्ध here to get rid of the debt to पितृस्. वा. ११२. ५७.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ७७.
--पाषण्डस् who live by sheer prowess. वा. ७८. ३०.
(I)--two-fold; प्रवृत्ति and निवृत्ति; <F>1:  Vi. I. 1. २७; VI. 4. ४१.</F> importance of; <F>2:  Vi. I. १८. ३२.</F> that which consists of यज्ञ is best. <F>3:  Vi. II. १४. १४.</F>

(II)--(Vedic) two-fold; प्रवृत्त and निवृत्त। <F>1:  भा. VII. १५. ४७-49.</F> There is another classification of Karma: वैदिक, तान्त्रिक, [पगे१-329+ ३६] and मिश्र (mixed). <F>2:  Ib. XI. २७. 7.</F> कृष्ण advised Uddhava to pursue निवृत्त and abandon प्रवृत्त path. <F>3:  Ib. XI. १०. 4.</F> Karma exalted as the source of all good and evil, and appropriate to four castes: is done due to मायामोहन्; <F>4:  Ib. X. २३. ५०; २४. १३-14 & १८-20.</F> does not lead to final destruc- tion of कर्मन्। <F>5:  Ib. VI. 1. ११.</F> Seven-fold: तपस्, ब्रह्मचर्य, यज्ञ, प्रजा, श्राद्ध, विद्या and दान। Bad कर्मस्--five-fold: killing, theft, in- jury, drinking and lust. <F>6:  Br. II. २८. ७५; III. 4. 5 & २४; २८. 9; IV. 5. २५; 6. ३७; वा. ५६. ७०.</F>
with Agni is काम्य, नैमित्तिक and अजस्र; should be done with detachment. <F>7:  वा. २९. ४४; १०४. ८६-96.</F> Rebirth after death is dependent on. <F>8:  वा. १४. 2-3, ३१-42; ६१. १०६.</F>
--son of बृहत्सेन and father of सृतञ्जय. भा. IX. २२. ४७.
--initiated according to अधिकार। वा. १०४. ८६, ९४.
--restraint of worldly duties. वा. १७. 6.
--a daughter of Ugrasena. वा. ९६. १३३.
--the earth as distinguished from Heaven. <F>1:  Br. IV. 9. १०.</F> भारतवर्ष as compared with others which are भोगभूमिस्। <F>2:  Vi. II. 3. २२.</F>

--Three-fold. Scriptural and not लौकिक। Intended for the attached and householders. आचार preli- minary to कर्म। कर्मकाण्ड an ocean. Three kinds of [पगे१-330+ ३४] worship--vedic, तान्त्रिच्, and mixed. Worship of image through a guru and according to established rules. <F>1:  भा. XI. 3. ४१-55; २०. 6-7; २१. १४-15; २७. 1 & 6-9.</F> Preach- ed by जनार्दन to Manu; greater than ज्ञान योग; as ज्ञा- नम् is the result of कर्म; origin of ब्रह्मा from: also क्रिया योग; five यज्ञस् and ३० सम्स्कारस् come under this. <F>2:  M. ५२. 3-११; २५८. 2.</F> Four of Karma category--अग्निहोत्र, silence, study and sacrifice, when not performed properly give fear. <F>3:  M. ३९. २५-7.</F>
--a son of Pulaha and गती. भा. IV. 1. ३८.
--leads to ब्रह्मण्यम्। वा. ५७. ११८.
--the Fifth tala or महातल. वा. ५०. ३६.
--a door-keeper of महाकाल. Br. IV. ३२. १८.
--a राक्षस; his city in the Atalam. वा. ५०. १८.
--sons of धृतराष्ट्रि and गरुड. Br. III. 7. ४५७.
(II)--a Janapada of the केतुमाल country. वा. ४४. १५.
(III)--Digits of Soma recovered by propitiating दक्ष: <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. २४; M. ३४. 9; १४२. 4.</F> one-sixteenth part.
(I)--a स्वर शक्ति। Br. IV. ४४. ५७.
(II)--a daughter of Kardama married to मरीचि; bore two sons, कश्यप and पूर्णिमन्. भा. III. २४. २२; IV. 1. १३.
(I)--a deva-gandharva. वा. ६८. ३८.
(II)--a forest where इक्ष्वाकु was addressed by पितृस्. Vi. III. १६. १७.

--on the East slopes of the Himalayas <F>1:  वा. 1. १८९; ४१. ४३-6; ४७, ४७.</F> noted for great sages. <F>2:  भा. X. ८७. 7.</F> Residence of Manu. Here देवापि [and Puru (Manu) वि। प्।] continued their योग practice. These yogins would start the course of वर्णाश्रम धर्म again at the end of Kali; <F>3:  IX. १२. 6; २२. १७; XII. 2. ३७-38; Br. I. 1. १६४; III. ६३. २१०; ६६. 7; M. १२१. ४९; २७३. ५६.</F> watered by the Ganges. <F>4:  Br. II. १८. ५०.</F> देवापि and Manu originate क्षत्रिय clans in कृत युग at; the race of Manu responsible for rulers throughout the three ages, कृत, त्रेता and द्वापर। <F>5:  वा. ८८. २१०: ९१. 7: ९९. ४३७; Vi. IV. २४. ११८-121.</F> Manu stands rooted to योग at. <F>6:  Vi. IV. 4. १०९.</F> [पगे१-332+ ३८]

(I)--born of Krodha and हीम्सा. Married Durukti who gave birth to Bhaya and मृत्यु. <F>1:  भा. IV. 8. 3.</F> Personified as king but शूद्र by birth, kicking a cow and bull. Vanquished by परीक्षित्. Kali fell at his feet when परीक्षित् asked him to leave ब्रह्मावर्त. Asked for a place to reside, परीक्- षित् appointed him to five unrighteous spheres--wine, dice, gold, women and slaughter. Father of अधर्म, heroic in the midst of children and cowardly before the valiant. <F>2:  Ib. I. १६. 4; १७. २९-40; १८. 6-8.</F> His rule in युगान्तर described. <F>3:  Ib. II. 7. ३८.</F>
(II)--a Mauneya Gandharva; a son of Brahma- dhana. Br. III. 7. 4; वा. ६९. 3, १३३.

(III)--a son of वरुण and शुनादेवी (सामुद्रि- वा। प्।); father of Jaya and Vijaya; one wife of Kali, सुरा, mother of Mada; other wives, त्वाष्ट्रि, हिम्सा and निकृति; other sons of Kali, all cannibals, नाक, Vighna, शद्रम and Vidhama. Br. III. ५९. 6; वा. ८४. 6-१०.
(IV)--a door-keeper of महाकाल. Br. IV. ३२. १८.

(I)--a क्षेत्रज son of Bali; after him came कलिङ्गस् (s.v.); <F>1:  Br. III. ७४. २८ & ८७; M. ४८. २५; वा. ९९. २८; Vi. IV. १८. १३-14.</F> a राक्षस in the Atalam. (Tatvalam- ब्र्। प्।). <F>2:  वा. ५०. १७; Br. II. १९. १८.</F>
(II)--(Mt.) a hill on the south of the मानस. वा. ३६. २२; ४२. २८.

(III)--a southern kingdom of मध्यदेश unfit for श्राद्ध; a Janapada of the दक्षिणापथ. Its king was stationed by जरासन्ध on the east gate of मथुरा, and on the same direction during the siege of Gomanta; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ४२ & ५७; III. १३. १३; १४. ३३ & ८०; ७४. १९८ & २१३; M. १६३. ७२; वा. ७७. १३; ७८. २३; ९९. ३२४, ३८६, ४०२.</F> present at [पगे१-333+ ४६] Pradyumna's marriage. Advised Rukmin to vanquish बलराम in dice, and laughed at the latter when he was defeated. His teeth were broken by राम. <F>2:  भा. X. ५०. ११[2]; ५२. ११[5]; ६१. २७-29; ३२[1] & ३७; IV. 5. २१; Vi. V. २८. १०, १५, २४.</F> Its ३२ kings. <F>3:  M. २७२. १६.</F> On its south flows the नर्मदा where the hill अमरकण्- टक is. <F>4:  M. १८६. १२.</F> In the कृतयुग, the first man appeared in this country <F>5:  वा. ५८. ११०.</F> under Guhas. <F>6:  Vi. III. 7. ३६.</F>

--a tribe born of दीर्घतमस् and Bali's wife; enlisted by जरासन्ध against the Yadus; <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. 5; X. [५० (V) 3]; M. ११४. ३६ and ४७; वा. ४५. १२५.</F> people of the दक्षिणापथ. <F>2:  वा. ४५. १२५; Vi. II. 3. १६.</F>
--the daughter of सम्ज्ञा. वा. ८४. ३६.

--the features of the युग, and its discontents. Removed by hearing the story of कृष्ण, as the ऋषिस् did in the नैमिष forest. The source of unrighteousness. <F>1:  भा. I. 1. १०, १६ & २१; १२. २६; १५. ३६-7; XI. 5. २०, ३१-42; वा. ५८. ३०-73.</F> Form of Hari worshipped in. <F>2:  M. १४२. १७-27; २७३. ४९; वा. ९९. ४२९.</F> Reflections on the conduct of castes and observance of धर्म by persons. कलि becomes कृत after the अवतार् of Kalki. When the सप्तऋषिस् traverse Maghas, and on the day when कृष्ण left the earth for Heaven then began Kali of १२०० divine years. Grows in strength commencing with Nanda. The actual beginning was when कृष्ण left for वैकुण्ठ; a description of the युग। Worship of Hari by कीर्तन। <F>3:  भा. XII. chap. 2 & 3.</F> Its advent was recognised by Mucukunda from the smallness of the men, plants, trees, etc., which he saw after he woke up from his long sleep. <F>4:  Ib. X. ५२. 2.</F> Deterioration of Vedic धर्म and rise of पाखण्डस्. Incarnation of Pramati in the form of a horse who puts down all heretics and the unrighteous. <F>5:  Br. II. २९. २३-34; ३१. 5-१०२; III. १४. ४६. ७४. २०७-241; M. १४४. ३०-88.</F> Predominance of here- [पगे१-334+ ३८] tics and शूद्रस् in; <F>6:  वा. ७८. ३६.</F> १०६,000 or ३६०,000-duration of; its सन्- ध्याम्श 1,००० years. <F>7:  वा. ३२. ६३; ९९. २६४; १०२. 4. M. २७३. २७-33, ४५. ५०.</F> Noted for theft; see तृष्यम्; <F>8:  Br. II. 7. ५९.</F> दानम् the chief act and तमस् the chief quality. <F>9:  वा. 8. ६६.</F> descrip- tion of the evils of: bad rule and decay of civilization and morality; age of man २३ years; began with परीक्षित् when the two first stars of seven ऋषिस् were in Magha; its duration according to the calculation of men ३६०,800. Then comes कृत। <F>१०:  Vi. IV. २४. ७१-96, ९७, १०९. ११४-15.</F>
--son of Soma. Br. III. 3. २३; वा. ६६. २३.
--a western kingdom. Br. II. १६. ६०.
--a degraded क्षत्रिय community. Br. III. ६३. १४०.
--Music; मारुत, the presiding deity. वा. ८६. ५२.

--the २१स्त् (१०थ् वा।) अवतार् of Hari, in कलियुग and emperor of the world by name पाराश्रय with याज्ञ- valkya as Purohita. Born of a ब्राह्मण Vis2n2uyas4as in शम्बलग्राम. His horse would be known as Devadatta. Riding on it, Kalki would rid the earth of the unrighteous and implant धर्म again. <F>1:  भा. I. 3. २५; XII. 2. १८-23; M. २७३. २७; २८५. 7; Vi. IV. २४. ९८-101.</F> Invoked; <F>2:  भा. VI. 8. १९.</F> destroyer of क्ष- triyas who became म्लेच्छस् by character. <F>3:  Ib. X. ४०. २२.</F> State of the world then. <F>4:  वा. ९९. ३९०-411; ४२४-29.</F> According to the ब्र्। पुराण, his name is विष्नुयाशस्, and son of पराशर: the tenth incarnation of Hari, with Purohita याज्ञवल्क्य. After rooting out [पगे१-335+ ३६] अधर्म with ब्राह्मण warriors he gives up his ghost at the confluence of the गङ्गा and the यमुना; in the pre- vious birth was Pramiti; would bring round all tribes and wander the world unseen; except vegetation; his life of २५ years' duration and of पराशर gotra; then again अधर्म, disease, etc., at the end of कलि and commence- ment of the कृत युग। <F>5:  Br. II. ३७. ४४; III. 2. ३१; 3. ५५; IV. 1. २०; 2. ३३. ४७; M. १४६. १६ & २५; १७१. ३०; १९९. 1, १४, १९; वा. ६३. ४१.</F> Married twelve (thirteen मत्स्य प्।) daughters of दक्ष, who were ब्रह्मवादिनीस् and लोक-मातस्। Married also पुलोमा and कालका on the advice of ब्रह्मा. Their sons were दानवस् distinguished for warlike qualities. ६०,000 of these were killed by Arjuna while in Heaven to please Indra. <F>2:  भा. --was observed by the girls of the व्रज early in the season of हेमन्त। After bathing in the यमुना, they made a figure of the देवी with sand, and worshipped it as the representation of the देवी for a month. Their object was to win कृष्ण as their husband. Prayers were also sent to भद्रकाली by rising early and bathing in the यमुना. To test their sincerity कृष्ण saw them one day playing in the river naked leaving their clothes on the banks. He removed these to the top of a नीप tree near by. The girls asked for the return of their clothes, and threatened to report to the king. कृष्ण asked them to receive their clothes from him. He said that their vow was fruitless as they bathed naked, and he returned their clothes on their saluting him with both their arms. He then blessed them and asked them to go back to the व्रज which they did. भा. X. २२. 1-२७.

--a class of snakes with several heads men- tioned in verses; <F>1:  वा. ५२. २०; ६२. १८०; ६९. ७४; Br. III. 7. ३१.</F> subject to गरुड; शेष, वासुकि and others belong to this group. <F>2:  Vi. I. २१. २०, २१.</F>
--a कश्यप and a त्रयार्षेय. M. १९९. १३.
--a fearful forest between the hills पुष्- पकशैल and महामेघ. वा. ३८. ७१-8.

--the son of Devadatta alias अग्निवेश्य. He was the sage जातूकर्णिज (जातुकर्ण-Burnouf). He was a mani- festation of Fire God. With him originated the Brahma- kula-आग्निवेश्यायन. भा. IX. 2. २१-22. [पगे१-348+ ३२]
--a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५३.
--one of the ten branches of the सुकर्मण group of devas. Br. IV. 1. ८८; वा. १००. ९३.
(II)--a Brahma कला. Br. IV. ३५. ९४.
--The sacred pool of, protected by किरातस्. Br. III. १३. ९५-7.
--leads to the world of विष्णु. M. १०१. ४५.
--a city of अजामिल. <F>1:  भा. VI. 1. २१.</F> Its citizens were van- quished by परशुराम; <F>2:  Br. III. ३९. ११; ४१. ३९; IV. ४४. ९४.</F> sacred to गौरी. <F>3:  M. १३. २९.</F>
--a heretical sect; <F>1:  Br. II. ३१. ६५; वा. ५८-64.</F> their yoga. <F>2:  Br. II. २७. ११६.</F>
--the Daitya-राक्षसस् from the Daitya king Kumbha. वा. ६९. १७७.
--addressed सूत to explain creation. Br. II. 6. 1.

(I)--God of Love (s.v.); born of ब्रह्मा's heart. Burnt by शिव, was reborn as Pradyumna, son of कृष्ण, an अंश of वासुदेव. <F>1:  भा. III. १२. २६; VIII. 7. ३२; X. ५५. [2]; Vi. V. २७. २८.</F> Sent by Indra to spoil Nara's penance; <F>2:  भा. XI. 4. 7.</F> [पगे१-349+ ३३] to induce शिव to marry उमा. <F>3:  M. १५४. २०९-239.</F> For having observed विभू- तिद्वादशीव्रतम्, अनङ्गवती the courtesan became co-wife with Rati, and her name was प्रीति. <F>4:  M. 7. १३; १००. ३२९.</F> Icon of. <F>5:  M. २६१. ५३-6.</F> Worshipped शिव in सिद्धेश्वरम् and attained divinity again. <F>6:  M. १९१. ११०.</F> His arrow afflicted ब्रह्मा who was made to love his own daughter, cursed by ब्रह्मा to be burnt by Rudra; when pointed out that he only discharged his duty, he modified the curse to be born as son of कृष्ण, then of Vasu in Bharata line, to get overlordship of विद्याधरस् and finally attain godhood; afflicted the nine देवीस्. <F>7:  M. 3. ३३; 4. १२-21; २३. २३.</F>
(II)--a son of Samkalpa. भा. VI. 6. १०.
(IV)--the son of श्रद्धा and Dharma and father of हर्ष (joy) through his wife Rati (सिद्धि-ब्र्। प्।)। Br. II. 9. ५८, ६२; वा. १०. ३४, ३८.
(V)--the Apsaras clan of Sobhayantya, originat- ed from. Br. III. 7. २४; वा. ६९. ५८.

(VI)--place of, in life; <F>1:  भा. I. 2. 9-१०;</F> does not end in spite of भोग or enjoyment, but grows like fire with oblation; cf. रामायण; notwithstanding old age desire to live and to amass wealth does not go. <F>2:  वा. ९३. ९५, १००.</F>
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १८. १६.
--also कामगिरि. A पिठम् sacred to कामाक्षी. Br. IV. ४०. 1; ४४. ९४.
--the deity residing in काञ्ची. भा. X. ७९. १४.
--gods of the eleventh epoch of Manu. भा. VIII. १३. २५; Vi. III. 2. ३०.
--a Mt. in भारतवर्ष; is काञ्ची, also कामाक्षिशिला. भा. V. १९. १६; Br. IV. ३९. १०५.
--is कामराज. Br. IV. ३८. १४.
--a daughter of रोहिणि gave birth to cattle kingdom; <F>1:  Br. III. 3. ७४-5.</F> had two sons. <F>2:  वा. ६६. ७२.</F>
--regions of सुष्वध Pitr2s. M. १५. १९.

(I)--the form in which Hari reveals him- self to लक्ष्मी in the continent of केतुमाल. <F>1:  भा. V. १८. १५.</F> Fought with दुर्मर्ष in a देवासुर war. <F>2:  Ib. VIII. १०. ३३.</F> Overlord of all Apsaras and ऋतुस् <F>3:  Br. III. 8. १५.</F> (see काम); as part of the gift of कल्पपादप। <F>4:  M. २७७. 6. वा. ७०. १४.</F> [पगे१-351+ २६]
(II)--the son of यशोधरा (यशोधारि- वा। प्।). Br. II. ११. ३५; वा. २८. ३०.
(I)--a goddess following रेवती; <F>1:  M. १७९. ७३.</F> gift of. <F>2:  Ib. २७९. 4; १०६. ७४.</F>
(II)--Jamadagni's cow providing hospita- lity to Haihaya hosts; bound by king's servants, she kicked off its shackles and flew in the air. Br. III. २६. ५४.
--in धेनुकारण्य of गया. वा. ११२. ५६.
--joined Yadus in defeating पौण्ड्रक. भा. X. ६६. [2].
--is ललिता. Br. IV. १८. १६.
--the eastern country; sacred to ललिता. Br. IV. ४४. ९३; Vi. II. 3. १५.
--a mindborn mother. M. १७९. २१.
--a goddess enshrined at कमलालय. M. १३. ३२.
--another name for रेणुका. वा. ९१. ९०.
--in honour of Pradyumna. M. १०१. १०.
--is कामेश्वर. Br. IV. १५. ४५.
--In Sairandhri's house there were pictures drawn according to prescriptions of कामशास्त्र: <F>1:  भा. X. ४८. [2]; M. २२०. 2.</F> a treatise by बाभ्रव्य, a पाञ्चाल. <F>2:  M. २१. ३०.</F>
--another name for कामेश्वर. Br. IV. १५. १६.

--the goddess enshrined in काञ्ची; आदिलक्ष्मी: said to possess one eye at काञ्ची and the other at कासि: also महालक्ष्मी; <F>1:  Br. IV. 5. 7; १३. 1; १५. ३५; ३८. ८१; ३०. 5, १४ & २१; ४०. 1, १६, ८५-105.</F> enshrined at गन्धमादन. <F>2:  M. १३. २६.</F>
--a goddess enshrined at Mandara hill. M. १३. २८.
--this seems to refer to पाशुपत- योगम्। Br. II. २७. १२७.
--a group of women who came from the mouth of Asura Bala when he yawned. भा. V. २४. १६.
--is श्रीपुरम्. Br. IV. ३१. २४.
(I)--a son of भ्रम्याश्व. भा. IX. २१. ३२.
(II)--a fifth son of Bheda. वा. ९९. १९६.
(III)--a son of हर्यश्व. Vi. IV. १९. ५९.
--the capital of Samara; <F>1:  वा. ९९. १७६.</F> the kingdom of. <F>2:  Vi. IV. १९. ४०.</F> [पगे१-354+ ३०]

--a northern kingdom noted for horses. <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ४९; IV. १६. १६; वा. ८८. १२२; Vi. V. २९. ३२.</F> Their king सुदक्षिण was an ally of जरासन्ध and placed on the East of the Gomanta hill, during its siege. <F>2:  भा. X. ५२. ११[7].</F> Took part in the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर. Their king went to Syamanta पञ्चक for solar eclipse. <F>3:  Ib. X. ७५. १२; ८२. १३.</F> Defeated by परशु- राम and by Sagara who had them fully shaved as punish- ment. <F>4:  Br. III. ४१. ३९; ४८. २२ & ४४; ६३. १२०, १३४ & १३८; Vi. IV. 3. ४२.</F>
--a daughter of Kardama and श्रुति; married Priyavrata; mother of ten sons equal to स्वायम्भुव and two daughtes by whom क्षत्रम् came into being. Br. II. ११. ३२-34; १४. ४४; वा. २७-9.
--a Pravara of the भार्गवस्. M. १९५. ३१.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to माता, पितृस् and to शिव. M. १३. ४८; २२-30; १८१. २६.
--a Pravara of अङ्गिरस्. M. १९६. १४.
--the lord who is निर्गुण and ब्रह्मा becomes कर्णात्मा after its conjunction with प्रकृति and a सगुण। वा. ४९. १५१. etc.
(I)--a term for जीव or प्राण। वा. १०२. १०१.
(II)--a name for अव्यक्तम्। Vi. I. 2. १९. [पगे१-355+ २५]
--the capital of अङ्गदिय des4a of लक्ष्मण's son अङ्गद. वा. ८८. १८८.
--the capital city of अङ्गद, son of लक्ष्- मण. Br. III. ६३. १८९.
--sacred for श्राद्ध। Br. III. १३. ९२.
--the kingdom of, unfit for श्राद्ध: a southern tribe. Br. III. १४. ३३ and ८०; M. ११४. ४९; वा. ७८. २३ and ६९.
--a कौशिक gotra. वा. ९१. ९९.
--of कौशिक gotra. Br. III. ६६. ७१.
--a Mt. of the भारतवर्ष. वा. ४५. ९२.
--unfit for श्राद्ध feeding. Br. III. १५. ४३; वा. ७९. ६९.
--the स्वदर्म of शूद्रस्. Vi. VI. 1. ३६.
--a surname of वृद्धशर्मन्, son of करूष, (who married श्रुतदेवा). भा. IX. २४. ३६.

--descendants of करूष, the son of Vaivasvata Manu <F>1:  भा. IX. 2. १६; Br. III. ६१. 2; M. १२. २४; ११४. ४८; Vi. IV. 1. १८.</F> and, kings of उत्तरापथ; a क्षत्रिय clan, the country of. <F>2:  Vi. II. 3. १७; IV. १४. ३९.</F>
--आर्षेय Pravara of अङ्गिरस्. M. १९६. 8.
--with the sun during the month of पौष। Vi. II. १०. १४.
--a prominent king of the lunar line. See अर्जुन। Vi. IV. 6. 4.
--नवमि and द्वादशी, as युगादिस् for श्राद्ध। M. १७. 4.

(I)--a god with his वाहन as peacock; conqueror of क्रौञ्च of Asuras; also कुमार; <F>1:  Br. II. २५. १६; III. १०. ४४; ३२. २३; ४१. ३२; ४२. 6; ४३. ३१.</F> brought up by the कृत्तिकस्; <F>2:  वा. ४१. ३८; ७२. ४३; Vi. I. १५. ११६.</F> delight to the mind of उमा; <F>3:  वा. ५४. १९.</F> overheard the report given by his father to पार्वति on the sub- ject of the colour of his throat, the नीलकण्ठ legend, when he was lying down on the lap of उमा on the top of the Kai- [पगे१-357+ ३०] लास hills. <F>4:  वा. ५४. २८f.</F> Took part in बाण's war with कृष्ण and dis- abled by गरुड and Pradyumna. <F>5:  Vi. V. ३३. २१ and २६.</F>

(II)--कुमार, being the son of कृत्तिकस्; narrates the महात्म्यम् of Nandi in नन्दीपुराण, <F>1:  M. 5. २७; ५३. ६१.</F> born in the full moon day of the चित्र month and Indra made sin into one on the fifth day and on the sixth anointed देवसेना- पति। All important gods gave him some present or other and praised him. <F>2:  Ib. १५९. 4. १८.</F> Promised to slay तारक and slew him. <F>3:  Ib. १६०. १०-26.</F> Image of; १२ hands in a city, four in a खर्वट and two in a village; one of the hands has a cock; others detailed. <F>4:  Ib. २६०. १९, ४५-51.</F>
(III)--(पावकि) a sage of the Rohita epoch. Br. IV. 1. ६२.
(IV)--a तीर्थम् sacred to याशस्करि. M. १३. ४५.
--a कश्यप gotrakara. M. १९९. 5.
(I)--a son of Kanaka. वा. ९४. 8.
--आर्षेय Pravara of भार्गवस्. M. १९५. ३४ & ४३.
--a heretical sect. Br. III. १४. ३९.
--२० bha1rams of cotton as the best gift. M. ८३. 5; ८८. 1-5.
--the colour of the १४थ् Manu सावर्णि. वा. २६. ४६.
--see धनुश्शाल. Vi. V. २०. १७.
--a भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. १८.
--a coin in common use; fines in terms of. M. २२७. ७९ & ९३, १९७.
--कृष्ण Para1sara. M. २०१. ३५.
--a राक्षस gan2a. वा. ६९. १७२.

(I)--time as the phase of the Universal Spirit. <F>1:  भा. I. 6. 4; ११. 6; १३. ४५; II. १०. ४३; VIII. १७. २७.</F> Is ईश्वर, and only रूपभेद। <F>2:  Ib. III. १२. १२; २९. 4, ३७ & ४५; X. ५१. १९.</F> Lord of creation and des- truction; fearful to look at. <F>3:  Ib. IV. १२. 3; वा. ३२. ११, २२.</F> Vanquished by कृष्ण; <F>4:  भा. III. 3. १०; Br. III. 3. ८२; वा. ३२. २९.</F> makes and unmakes things by keeping all things under control. <F>5:  Vi. V. ३८. ५५-64.</F> [पगे१-359+ ३२]

(II)--a name for मृत्यु: एत्य्। as Lord of Death; अधिदेवत for राहु the planet; <F>1:  Br. II. ३६. १२८; M. ९३. १४; २१३. 5 & १८.</F> described as having four faces each comprising a yuga. <F>2:  वा. ३२. 8-६७.</F> One origin of. <F>3:  Ib. २१. ५२, ७३.</F>
(III)--a son of Dhanva; a Vasava; a विश्वेदेव. Br. III. 3. २३, ३०; M. 5. २३; २०३. 4; वा. ६६. २१, ३१; Vi. I. १५. १११.
(IV)--a Bhairva god. Br. IV. २०. ८२.
(V)--one from ब्रह्मन्; see also Avyakta. Vi. I. 2. १४, १५ and २७.
(VI)--a Mt. west of the Sitoda lake. वा. ३६. २७.

(VII)--division of time--परमाणु defined: 2 परमाणुस् make 1 अणु 3 अणुस् make 1 त्रषरेणु 3 त्रसरेणुस् make 1 Truti १०० Trut2is make 1 Vedhas 3 Vedhas make 1 lava 3 lavas make 1 निमेष 3 निमेषस् make 1 क्षण 5 क्षनस् make 1 काष्ठ 15 काष्ठस् make 1 laghu १५ laghus make 1 नाडिक 2 नाडिकस् make 1 मुहूर्त 6 or 7 नाडिकस् make 1 Prahara or याम 4 यामस् make 1 day or night १५ days and nights make 1 पक्ष 2 पक्षस् make 1 मास or a day and night for पितृस् 2 मासस् make 1 ऋतु [पगे१-360+ २८] 6 months make 1 Ayanam 2 Ayanams make 1 year 1 day of ब्रह्मा make 1 period of १४ Manus 1 night of ब्रह्मा make 1 period of Pralaya 1 Yuga make 5 years. <F>1:  भा. III. ch. ११ (whole); Br. II. २४. ५८; १३. १०९; वा. ५०. १७९-82; ९७. ३०-31.</F> based on सूर्य. <F>2:  वा. ३१. २४; ५३. ३९.</F>
(I)--s son of Vijvara. Br. III. 6. ३३.
(II)--a son of विरक्ष. वा. ६८. ३३.
--see दुर्भगा. भा. IV. २७. २७.
--a daughter of वैश्वानर, and a wife of कश्यप; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ३३-34; M. 6. २२.</F> sons were कालकेयस्. <F>2:  Vi. I. २१. 8-9.</F>
--kings (२४) contemporaneous with शिसु- नागस् (१०). Br. III. ७४. १३६; वा. ९९. ३२३.
--one of the ten विश्वेदेवस्. M. २०३. १३.
--poison from the churning of ocean of milk by gods and asuras; swallowed by शिव. Br. II २५. ६०; III. २५-9; IV. २३. ३०; M. २५०. २०-60; वा. ५४. ५७-9, ६३ and ९५. [पगे१-361+ ३५]

--sons of मरीचि, a दानव; vanquished by रावण and by दुर्गा; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. २५५; IV. २९. ७६; M. 6. २३; Vi. I. २१. 9.</F> their mother is काला. <F>2:  M. १७१. ५९.</F> Asuras in the देवकूट hill. <F>3:  वा. ४०. १५.</F>
--country of, under मणिधान्य kings. (Cal. Edn. कालतोय). Vi. IV. २४. ६६.
--a वेश्य form of marriage. Br. IV. १५. 4.
(I)--a chief वानर. Br. III. 7. २३५.

(II)--is the solar system: relativity of its movement is illustrated by the Potter's wheel. The sun stands in relation to कालचक्र, midway between the Earth and Heaven. Placed on the right side of Meru, the twenty- eight नक्षत्रस् including अभिजित् are fixed on this cakra. <F>1:  भा. V. २२. 2-११; २३. 3; M. १६२, 1, १९; Vi. II. 8. 4.</F> The seat of महाकाल। <F>2:  Br. IV. ३२. 7. १८-20.</F>
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २३.

--Mt. on the north base of Meru. Here was born Bharata as deer; <F>1:  भा. V. १६. २६; 8-३०; Br. III. १३. १००; Vi. II. 2. ३०.</F> sacred to काली. <F>2:  M. १३. ३२.</F> Here were reborn the seven sons of कौशिक as deer; remembering their past birth, [पगे१-362+ ३२] they practised योग; <F>3:  Ib. २०. १५; २१. 9 and २८.</F> sacred to पितृस्; <F>4:  Ib. २२. २४; वा. ७७. ९३.</F> the best of hills where श्वेत took his अवतार् (कालम् जरयिष्यामी)। <F>5:  वा. २३. २०४.</F>
--the kingdom of. M. १२१. ५४.
--a northern kingdom; a tribe; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ४६; III. ७४. १९६; M. ११४. ४०.</F> a Janapada of मणिधान्य. <F>2:  वा. ९९. ३८४.</F>
--Yama aspect; रजस् and तमस् predominate; terminates the worlds; as dark as the sky (अञ्जन)। वा. 5. २८, ३१.
--an Asura who entered the ocean. M. ६१. 4.
--(कालानल-वा। प्।) the son of सभा- nara, and father of सृञ्जय. भा. IX. २३. 1; वा. ९९. १३.
--शिव assuming the form of Death. Br. IV. १६. १२.

(I)--a son of हिरण्याक्ष and भानू. A nephew of हिरण्यकशिपु. Took an active part in the देवासुर battle between Bali and Indra. Fought with Yama. A follower of वृत्र in his battle with Indra. <F>1:  भा. VII. 2. १८; वा. ६७. ६७; M. 6. २७; Br. III. 5. ३०; भा. VIII. १०. २० and २९; VI. १०. [२०]. Vi. I. २१. 3.</F> A संहिकेय asura. <F>2:  Br. III. 6. २०; वा. ६८. १९.</F>
(II)--a son of Vipracitti. Vi. I. २१. १२. [पगे१-363+ ३३]

--a son of Virocana and father of four sons. कंसा's previous birth as कालनेमी sent his शूल towards Hari who vanquished him with the same implement; <F>2:  भा. X. 1. ६८; VIII. १०. ५६; X. ५१. ४२; Vi. V. 1. २२, २३, ६५.</F> resid- ing in Atalam (IV tala or abhastalam). <F>3:  Br. II. २०. ३२; वा. ५०. ३१.</F> Killed by Hari in तारकामय, where he was a commander; rode on a chariot of elephants, used illusory powers and ब्रह्मास्त्रम् in the war; devas as prisoners of war but released by तारक; attacked Hari and fell dead slain by his cakra. <F>4:  Br. III. ७२. २१; M. १४८. ४२-51; १५०. १४०-189; १५४. 3; १६०. 3 & १८; १७६. ४९; chaps. १७७-78; वा. ९७. २२.</F> ^1 वा. ६७. ७६; ८०; Br. III. 5. ३९.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २२.
--an यक्ष गण। वा. ६९. ४०.
--a chief वानर. Br. III. 7. २३३.
--a servant of महाकाल. Br. IV. ३२. 5.

--the son of यवनेश्वर, black in colour and hard-hearted; after crowning him king, his father retired to the woods; full of prowess he asked नारद of some powerful heroes and being told about यादवस् he directed himself towards them with a big army of Mlec- chas; कृष्ण met him unarmed and was pursued; seeing him entering a cave where Mucukunda was sleeping, काल entered and thinking Mucukunda to be कृष्ण kicked him; on Mucukunda waking up and looking at कालनेमि he was [पगे१-364+ २४] burnt to ashes as there was a vow that he who would awake Mucukunda would meet with such an end. भा. X. ५०. ४४-9; ५१. 1-१२; Vi. V. २३. 5-8 and १७-23.
--a son of Anu. Br. III. ७४. १३.
--a वर्ण शक्ति। Br. IV. ४४. ६०.
--a kingdom noted for horses. Br. IV. १६. १७.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ७७.
--a nephew of हिरण्यकशिपु. M. 6. २८.
--Killed by Pradyumna (see also Sam- bara). Vi. V. २७. 3 and २०.
--a goddess from the back part of नृसिम्ह: a follower of वागीशी. M. १७९. ६८.
--a sacred तीर्थम् dear to कश्यप, fit for श्राद्ध and noted for देवदारुवनम्। Br. III. १३. ९८-9; वा. ७७. ८७. [पगे१-365+ ३१]

--one of the twenty-eight hells. Those who treacherously behave towards पितृस्, ब्राह्मणस्, etc., are sent to this; <F>1:  भा. V. २६. 7 & १४; वा. ११०. ४२; Vi. I. 6. ४१; II. 6. 4.</F> a hell under the earth: also महाही <F>2:  Br. IV. 2. १८१, १८४; ३३. ६०.</F> the third hell under the earth: also known as महाहविविधि; haunted by a fierce serpent. <F>3:  वा. १०१. १७८.</F>
(I)--a goddess enshrined at चन्द्रभागा. M. १३. ४९.
(II)--a daughter of दक्ष, and wife of कश्यप. <F>1:  M. १७१. २९; वा. ६६. ५४.</F> Mother of कालकेयस्. <F>2:  M. १७१. ५९.</F>
(I)--a son of सभानर and a पण्डित; and father of सृञ्जय. Br. III. ७४. १३; Vi. IV. १८. 2-3.
(II)--see सम्वर्ताग्नि। Br. II. २५. ४५ & ५६.
--a tree of भद्राश्व, the juice of its fruit protects the youthfulness of women; <F>1:  Br. II. १५. ५८ & ६१.</F> in the सालवनम्; the juice of which makes the drinker young. <F>2:  वा. ४३. 6.</F>
--a pupil of बाष्कल. Vi. III. 4. २५.
--the first प्राकार of श्रिपुरम्। Br. IV. ३१. ३४. ५०. [पगे१-366+ ३०]

--six according to months, aho-रात्र, ऋतुस्, अयनस्, and येअर्स्; also निमेष, कला, काष्ठा, मुहूर्त and दिनक्षप; <F>1:  वा. ३०. १०-14.</F> fivefold, day, half-month, month, ऋटु and अयनम्। <F>2:  Ib. ३१. २६.</F>
--a manneya. वा. ६९. 2.
(I)--a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५१; वा. ६१. ४४.
(II)--a son of Maya. Br. III. 6. २९.
(II)--R. sacred to पितृस्. M. २२-36.
(III)--a daughter of वैश्वानर; after her came the कालकेय asuras. Br. III. 6. २३-5; वा. ६८. २३.
--the kingdom of. M. १२१. ४५.

--the king of, present at the marriage of अनी- ruddha and advised Rukmin to invite राम for dice. Laughed aloud when राम failed, and supported Rukmin playing falsely. His teeth pulled out by राम. भा. X. ६१. २७-37.
--a ब्राह्मण friend of भीष्म hailing from Kalinga; narrated to भीष्म ways by which to be free from Yama's subjection. Vi. III. 7-३८. [पगे१-367+ ३६]
--sacred to शिव. M. १८१. २७.
--of the S. country. वा. ४५. १२८.
--a son of Caidyoparicara. M. ५०. २८.
--a kinnara गण; horse-faced. वा. ६९. ३२.

(I)--the daughter of the sun god; wandering in the forest in quest of कृष्ण, she expressed herself to Arjuna who was there with कृष्ण; the latter married her; welcomed by द्रौपदी to हास्तिनपुर, she narrated to her how she married कृष्ण. <F>1:  भा. X. ५८. १७-23, २९; ७१. ४३; ८३. ११; M. ४७. १४.</F> देवी and wife of कृष्ण; mother of श्रुत and other sons. <F>2:  वा. ९६. २३४; Vi. V. २८. 3; ३२. 4.</F>
(II)--a R. of the केतुमाल country. वा. ४४. २१.
(III)--a name for यमुना. Vi. V. 7. 2; १८. ३४; VI. 8. ३६.

(I)--a chief of the क्रोधवश group of ser- pents. Got into a pool of the यमुना, causing the death of people who drank of the waters. कृष्ण subjugated it and ordered it to go to the sea, thus making the waters drinkable. He assured कालीय of freedom from गरुड's hostility. Son of Kadru, कालिय originally lived in Rama- णक, and refused to give Bali to गरुड according to an agreement with him. In the fight that ensued, कालिय was vanquished, and he resorted to the कालिन्दि pool where गरुड could not come. But he was expelled by कृष्ण. <F>1:  भा. V. २४. २९; X. ch. १६ (whole); १७. 1-१२; X. ४३. २६.</F> In the Atalam region; <F>2:  वा. ५०. १८; ६९. ७२.</F> in Talvalam ? <F>3:  Br. II. २०. १९; M. १६३. ५६.</F> [पगे१-368+ २९]
(II)--a दानव king. Br. IV. २९. १२४.
--the serpents of महातलम्. भा. V. २४. २९.
(I)--one of the wives of भीमसेन, and mother of Sarvagata. भा. IX. २२. ३१.

(II)--a mother goddess, and a वर्ण s4akti; <F>1:  Br. IV. 7. ७२; ४४. ५९ & ७६.</F> a goddess enshrined at कालन्जर; took part in the तारका- maya and enveloped the whole in darkness. <F>2:  M. १३. ३२; १७२. १९.</F>
(III)--a doorkeeper of महाकाल. Br. IV. ३२. १८.
(IV)--the दाशेयी brought forth विचित्रवीर्य by शन्तनु. M. ५०. ४५.
(V)--a mind-born mother; <F>1:  M. १७९. १४.</F> from the bones of नृसिम्ह. <F>2:  Ib. १७९. २६, ६४.</F>
(VI)--the wife of पराशर and mother of कृष्ण- द्वैपायन. वा. ७०. ८४.
(VII)--R. a sacred river. M. २२. २०.

--the venomous serpent in a pool of यमुना; कृष्ण dived into it and was about to kill him when on an appeal from the wives of नाग and the नाग [पगे१-369+ २७] himself to do as he bade he set them free and sent them to the sea to live there for ever. See कालिय। Vi. V. 7. 3 to the end; १३. 4.
--an Asura who was exhausted in अमृतमन्- thana. भा. VIII. 7. १४.
--an आत्रेय, पुत्रिका पुत्र। M. १९७. 9.
--दानवस् and नागस् in रसातल. These took part in देवासुर war between Bali and Indra. They fought with Vasus. भा. V. २४. ३०; VIII. १०. २२ and ३४.
--famous for ललिता पिठ: a तीर्थम् on the नर्मदा. Br. IV. ४४. ९७; M. १९१. ८५.
--an eastern kingdom watered by ह्ला- दिनी; <F>1:  Br. II. १८. ५५.</F> peoples of. <F>2:  वा. ४७. ५२.</F>
--a wife of पराशर, and mother of कृस्ण dvaipa1- yana. Br. III. 8. ९२.

(I)--R. personified as one of the wives of हव्यवाहन (शम्स्य) fire; Sangamam in the नर्मदा, where Kubera attained सिद्धि by penance to शिव. Its great- ness described. Br. II. १२. १४; M. ५१. १३; १६३. ६१; १८९. 2-२०; वा. २९. १३०. [पगे१-370+ ३८]
(II)--the grand-daughter of युवनाश्व and wife of Janhu; mother of Suhotra. (Sunaha-ब्र्। प्।); made of one half of गन्गा. Br. III. ६६. २८-30; वा. ९१. ५८.
(III)--a R. of the Bhadra country. वा. ४३. २६.

(IV)--R. a महानदि (वा। प्।) in भारतवर्ष; <F>1:  वा. १०८. ७९.</F> takes its source in the Sahya (ऋष्यवत्) hills noted for Vai- nana elephants in द्राविड des4a (दक्षिण देश); <F>2:  भा. V. १९. १८; VII. १३. १२; XI. 5. ४०; Br. II. १६. ३५; III. 7. ३५७; वा. ४५. १०४; ७७. २८.</F> visited by बलराम; <F>3:  भा. X. ७९. १४; M. ११४. २३.</F> fit for श्राद्ध offerings, and sacred to पितृस्. <F>4:  Br. III. १३. २८; M. २२. २७.</F>

(I)--a son of भृगु and दिव्या; also शुक्र, उशन, the आचार्य for devas and asuras; Kavisuta and the name of a planet; wife गोनाम, had four sons, त्वष्ट, वरूत्री, शण्ड, and Marka; <F>1:  Br. III. 1. ७६; ६८. ८६; ७२. ९५; ७३. 1, ३७. वा. ५९. ९०; ६२. ४१; ६५. ७४-7.</F> the lord of भृगुस्; <F>2:  Vi. ७०. 4.</F> cursed ययाति. <F>3:  Vi. IV. १०. 7.</F> Asuras defeated by Indra appealed to काव्य and resolved to go to रसातल; काव्य encouraged them and said that rains, vegetation, etc., would stand completely with them and only (1/4) with the devas; at that time the devas appealed to him for help; but काव्य went to महादेव and learnt the मन्त्र for their success; in the meantime he asked them to keep quiet and perform austerities after lay- ing their weapons down. महादेव insisted on कुण्ड- धूम observance for a thousand years with their heads down; while so engaged the asuras got afraid of the devas and appealed to his mother and the wife of भृगु; she offered them shelter but finding them being killed by the devas she resolved to deprive Indra of his place; then Indra appealed to विष्णु whose body he entered; but she set on [पगे१-371+ ३६] fire the whole world of devas, when out of rage विष्णु killed her; भृगु cursed him to be born seven times among men; then by power of तपस् he restored his wife to life; शुक्र's religious observance so as to please him; penance over, महेश्वर granted him three things: non-defeat by others, lordship over wealth, and eternal life; on this he praised नीललोहित by many names; pleased, शिव disappeared; then शुक्र was attracted towards जयन्ती the daughter of Indra and promised to be with her for ten years unknown to the asuras by means of माया; when काव्य returned the asuras were pleased; but during the ten years बृहस्पति appeared before the asuras in the guise of काव्य and pretended to speak to them the मन्त्र he had heard; the asuras accepted him; ten years were over and a daughter देवयानि was born to शुक्र who appeared before the asuras; finding two काव्यस् the asuras became mystified and काव्य said that he was बृहस्पति in disguise; the asuras did not believe in the real शुक्र who left them in anger; soon they found out the mistake and approached शुक्र through प्रह्लाद and he became pleased; then he approached ब्रह्मा who said that after ten युगस् and in the स्वारोचिष Yuga the asuras would get back their kingdom; saying this he pointed out to two disciples सण्ड and Marka equal to बृहस्पति, and at last the devas were defeated. Seeing the success of the asuras विष्नु took different avatars to put them down. <F>4:  वा. ९७. ९४ to end and ch. ९८; Br. III, ७२. ९६ to the end; ७३. 1-६४.</F>
(II)--an अङ्गिरस, and one of the seven sages of तामस Manu; <F>1:  Br. II. ३२. ९८ and १०४; ३३. 7; ३६. ४७.</F> a मन्त्रकृत्। <F>2:  वा. ५९. ९६.</F>

--a group of पितृस् who drink Soma's स्वधा। Their mind-born daughter is Yogotpatti; other names are सम्वत्सरस्, पञ्चाब्दस्, आज्यपस्, being presiding deities of अष्तकस् and others. They drink ghee. Br. II. २३. ३९ and ७३-5; २८. 4, २३ and ७०; III. १०. ८५; M. १४१. 4-१६; वा. ५६. १३, १६.
--a son of शुनहोत्र (Sutahotra-वा। प्।) (Suho- tra-वि। प्।). Br. III. ६७. 4; वा. ९२. 3; Vi. IV. 8. 5.
--the kingdom of काश. वा. ९२. 6.
--a kind of grass (सच्चरुम् स्पोन्तनेरुम्) best for श्राद्ध purposes; significance of. वा. ७५. ४१.
--son of काश्य and father of राष्ट्र. भा. IX. १७. 4.
--R. from शुक्तिमन्त. M. ११४. ३२.
--a son of काश्य. Br. III. ६७. 7.
--the kingdom of, got rain by the presence of श्वफल्क; daughter of (गान्दिनी) married to श्वफल्क; <F>1:  वा. ९६. १०३-5; Vi. IV. १३. ११६.</F> a daughter Jayanti married to वृषभ. <F>2:  M. ४५. २६.</F>

(I) (च्)--a kingdom of मध्यदेश; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ४१; १८. ५१; III. ७४. २१३ and २६८.</F> a tribe; <F>2:  M. ११४. ३५; १६३. ६७; २७३. ७३.</F> a Janapada <F>3:  वा. ४५. ११०; ४७. ४८.</F> enlisted by जरासन्ध against the Yadus. <F>4:  भा. X. [५० (V) 3].</F> [पगे१-373+ ३८]

(II)--capital of पौण्ड्रक invaded by कृष्ण; पौण्ड्रक on the S. of the Gomanta hill during the siege by जरासन्ध. <F>1:  भा. X. ६६. [१२], १०; ५२. ११ [9].</F> The अभिचार Agni sent by सुदक्षिण returned and killed सुदक्षिण himself, while विष्णु's Cakra burnt down the whole city. <F>2:  Ib. X. ६६. ३०-42; ३७. १९.</F> Its king went to स्यमन्तपञ्- caka for solar eclipse having heard that कृष्ण was there. <F>3:  Ib. X. ८२. २५.</F> When the kingdom had no rains, its king gave his daughter गान्दिनी to श्वफल्क, and this resulted in plenty of showers. <F>4:  Ib. X. ५७. ३२. Br. III. ७१. १०४.</F> Likened to भागवत पुराण in its importance. <F>5:  भा. XII. १३. १७.</F> Sages of, visited द्वारका. <F>6:  Ib. X. ९०. २८ [3].</F> Residence of कामाक्षी <F>7:  Br. IV. ३७. १५; ४०. १५ and ८०, ९१.</F> the capital of कुशध्वज; <F>8:  वा. ८१. १८; ९९. ४०२.</F> in the brows of the Veda. <F>9:  Ib. १०४. ७५.</F>
(III)--the mother of Sarvaga (सर्ववृक-वा। प्।) by भीमसेन. M. ५०. ५४; वा. ९९. २४७; Vi. IV. २०. ४६.
--a दानव king. Br. IV. २९. १२२.

--see (काशिराज): king of कासि who went to aid पौण्ड्रक against कृष्ण and who was so struck that his head shot into the city; his son together with the priest prayed to शिव to avenge his father's murder; शिव granted the boon and sent a female created from fire to destroy कृष्ण whose discus was more than a metal; the dead ran to काशि followed by the discus which burnt the whole city. Vi. V. ३४. १४-43.
--the son of काश; king of कासी; father of राष्ट्र. Vi. IV. 8. 7.
--a ruling dynasty of २४ rulers. M. २७२. १५. [पगे१-374+ २९]
--father of सुपार्श्व. वा. ९६. २५२.

--became the possession of व्रात्यस् and Mlecchas; <F>1:  भा. XII. 1. ३९; Vi. IV. २४. ६९.</F> a kingdom of the West watered by the Sindhu. <F>2:  Br. II. १६. ५१. १८. ४७; III. ७४. २१३.</F> A तीर्थम् sacred to मेधा. <F>3:  M. १३. ४७.</F>
(I)--a son of Suhotra, and father of काशी. भा. IX. १७. 3-4.
(II)--a son of सेनाजित्. भा. IX. २१. २३; Vi. IV. १९. ३६.
(III)--a क्षत्रिय who became a द्विज। Br. III. ६६. ८७.
--a daughter of काश्य, and wife of आहुक; mother of Devaka and Ugrasena. M. ४४. ७०-1.

(I)--a सम्हिता-कर्ता: officiated as अध्वर्यु at परशुराम's sacrifice and got the whole earth as fee; <F>1:  Br. II. ३५. ६३ and ६६; III. 8. ८६; ४७. ४७ and ६०; IV. 9. 3.</F> a मन्त्रकृत् and a ब्रह्मवादिन्. <F>2:  M. १४५. ९८ and १०६; वा. ५९. १०२.</F>
(II)--a sage of सावर्णि epoch; a pravara. M. 9. ३२: १९९. १६.
(III)--a son of वालि, the avatar of the lord. वा. २३. १६०. [पगे१-375+ ३४]
(IV)--a son of गोकर्ण, the अवतार् of the १६थ् द्वापर। वा. २३. १७३.

(V)--(काश्यप Havis2ma1n); a son of Bhautya Manu; <F>1:  वा. १००. १०७, ११६; १०६. ३४.</F> of Vatsa gotra; <F>2:  Ib. ६२. १६; ६४. २८.</F> a pupil of सूत; <F>3:  Ib. ६१. ५५.</F> had three आदित्यस् as wives, and out of काम for देवकी took human birth as कृष्ण; <F>4:  Ib. ९६. २३०.</F> one of the seven sages; अ तपस्वी। <F>5:  Ib. १००. ८२. १००. ९६.</F>

(VI)--(see कश्यप) married thirteen daughters of दक्ष; <F>1:  Vi. I. १५. ७७ and १०३.</F> blessed दिती with a son capable of van- quishing Indra; <F>2:  Ib. I. २१. ३०-2.</F> a householder to perform rites in honour of him; <F>3:  Ib. III. 1. ३२; ११. ४३.</F> resides in the sun's chariot in the month of मार्ग- शीर्ष। <F>4:  Ib. II. १०. १३.</F>
(VII)--a son of Suhotra. Vi. IV. 8. 5.
(VIII)--a son of Parvasa. वा. २८. १३.

--the lines of kings commencing with Sannuhotra काश, ruled at काशी. Six of them were ब्रह्मवादिन्स्। Among them were ब्राह्मणस् and क्ष- triyas whose sons were righteous, powerful and strong. Br. II. ३२. ११२; III. ६७. ७९; वा. ९२. ७४.
--आर्षेय pravara of the भार्गवस्. M. १९५. ३७.
--one of the sages who heard the first part (sarga) of the पुराण asked सूत to speak on प्रतिसन्धि; <F>1:  वा. 7. 1.</F> a gotrakara. <F>2:  M. १९९. 9.</F>
--a daughter of सुपार्श्व and wife of साम्ब; had five sons. M. ४७. २४.
--pseudo-ascetics. Br. III. १५. ६२; वा. ७९. ९०.

--a measurement of length and capacity; ययाति versed in; <F>1:  M. ३४. 9; १४२. 4.</F> the intervening distance between two काष्ठस् and the distance between काष्ठ and लेख, north to south; both the outer and inner circumference in दक्षिणायन and उत्तरायण <F>2:  वा. 1. ९३; ५०. १२७, १३२ and १३३.</F> thirty form a कल। <F>3:  वा. ३०. १३; Vi. I. 3. 8; II. 8. ५९; VI. 3. 6.</F> Time equal to १५ निमेषस्। <F>4:  Br. II. 7. १९; १३. १६; वा. ५०. १६९; ५७. 6; ७०. १५; ९३. ७२; १००. २१४; Vi. I. 3. 8.</F>
--one of the कश्यप's wives, and mother of quadrupeds with cloven hoofs; a mother goddess. भा. VI. 6. २५ and २९; Br. III. 3. ५६; IV. ३२. १४.
--कश्यप gotrakaras. M. १९९. 9.
--a pupil of बाष्कलि. भा. XII. 6. ५९. [पगे१-377+ ३७]
--in Rama's अभिषेक। Vi. IV. 4. १००.
--a son of बाह्यक. Br. III. ७१. 4.
--a son of भजमान. भा. IX. २४. 7.
--a class of divinities. भा. XI. १४. 6.
--the son of सुनक्षत्र, and father of Anta- रिक्ष. वा. ९९. २८५; IV. २२. 4-5.

(I)--a group of divine singers. <F>1:  भा. II. १०. ३८.</F> Born of ब्रह्मा's shadow; these frequent कैलास; <F>2:  Ib. III. २०. ४५; IV. 6. 9; Br. II. २५. २८; III. 7. १७६; 8. ७१.</F> celebrate पुरुष, Indra and Hari. <F>3:  भा. IV. ३०. 6; VI. 7. 4; VII. 8. ३८; X. 3. 6; 4. ११.</F> Went to द्वारका to see कृष्ण, <F>4:  Ib. XI. 6. 3.</F> and learnt the dharma from the seven sages; <F>5:  Ib. XI. १४. 6; ३१-2.</F> worship पितृस्। <F>6:  Br. III. १०. ३८ and १११; २२. ५९; ३७. १९; IV. २०. ४९; ३३. २७; ३९. ५६.</F>
(II)--Born of अरिष्टा and कश्यप: Citra- ratha is their overlord. Live in हिमालयस्; help Indra; kingdom of. M. 6. ४५; 8. 6; १३. १६; २३. ३९; ११७. 8; १२१. ४८; १४८. ९२.

(III)--sons of अश्वमुखस्; had a number of गणस्, horse-faced and human-faced; famous for dancing and music; <F>1:  वा. ६९. ३१. ३६-7.</F> servants in शिवपुर; <F>2:  Ib. १०१. २५२.</F> live in the महानील hill; <F>3:  Ib. 9. ५६; ३८. 5; ३९. ३२; ४७. ४७.</F> hundred cities of, in कैलास. <F>4:  Ib. ४६. ४१.</F> [पगे१-378+ ३७]
--a son of सुनक्षत्र. M. २७१. 8.
(I)--a son of आग्निहोत्र and पूर्वचित्ति, and Lord of हेमकूट. भा. V. 2. १९; Br. II. १४. ४५ and ४८; वा. ३३. ३८, ४१; Vi. II. 1. १६ and १९.
(II)--a son of स्वारोचिष Manu. Br. II. ३६. १९; Vi. III. 1. १२.

(III)--a continent of जम्बूद्वीप and bounded by हेमकूट on one side. <F>1:  भा. V. १६. 9; M. ११३. २९; ११४. ५९, ६३-5; १२१. ४९; वा. ३४. २८; Vi. II. 2. १३.</F> Here हनुमान् worships राम as a friend of all including wild creatures, and as one who led all कोशल people to Heaven. <F>2:  भा. V. १९. 1-8.</F> Its king Dumna was an ally of जरासन्ध and placed on the west of the Gomanta hill during its siege; <F>3:  Ib. X. ५२. ११ [११].</F> conquered by परीक्षित्. <F>4:  Ib. I. १६. १३.</F> There is प्लक्ष- खण्ड like Nandana: People drink of प्लक्ष and live for १०,000 years and are of golden colour; note for मधुवह trees. <F>5:  Br. II. १७. 1-5; १८. ७४; वा. ४६. 2-6; ४७. ७१.</F>
(IV)--a kind of elf, an attendant on Kubera. Ila's conversion from womanhood into. M. १२. १०.

--a class of divinities, born out of Brahma's shadow just like Kinnaras. <F>1:  भा. III. २०. ४५.</F> Frequent कैलास hill. <F>2:  Ib. IV. 6. ३१.</F> Joined gods in singing नृसिम्ह's praise. <F>3:  Ib. VII. 8. ३८.</F> Learnt dharma from the seven sages. <F>4:  Ib. XI. १४. 6.</F> Belong to the line of क्रोधवशा. <F>5:  Br. III. 7. १७६; 8. ७१; ४१. ३०; IV. ३०. 9; ३३. २७.</F> [पगे१-379+ ३२]
--a branch of अङ्गिरस. वा. ६५. १०७.
--between hills वसुधार and Ratna- धार; here is the temple of the sun god where every month the sun descends. वा. ३८. २७-32.
--the story of. Br. IV. 7. १३; 8. 9.

--People of an eastern kingdom; a mountain kingdom; defeated by Bharata and purified of sin by the worship of Hari; <F>1:  भा. IX. २०. ३०; II. 4. १८; Br. II. १६. १२ and ५१, ६०. ६८; M. ११४. ५६; १२१. ४९; वा. ४५. ८२; १२०. १३६; ४७-48; ५८. ८३.</F> vanquished by Kalki; <F>2:  Br. II. १८. ५०; III. ७३. १०९; IV. २९. १३१ and १३५; वा. ९८. १०८.</F> a hill tribe. <F>3:  Br. II. १६. ६८; III. ४८-49; IV. 7. १९; M. ११४. ११ and ३५.</F> Defeated by Sagara, took caves and hills as residences; <F>4:  Br. III. ४८. २३-49.</F> reside on the east of भारतवर्ष; <F>5:  Vi. II. 3. 8.</F> co-habitation with किरात women by a ब्राह्मण; purification at the end of the twelfth day--rites cited. <F>6:  Br. IV. 8. 9.</F>
--of ललिता, described. Br. IV. २० (whole); २८. १५; २९. ३९; ३६. १३.
--a नाग with his city in the 5th Talam. Br. II. २०. ३७. [पगे१-380+ २६]
--the important kings after the गुण्डस्, वृष- las and Maunas; succeeded आभीरस्. Br. III. ७४. १७८; M. २७३. २४.
--The capital of Maunas and भूतनन्द. He and his successors reigned for १०६ years. These kings had thirteen sons, known by the common name बाह्लिकस्. भा. XII. 1. ३२-34.
--A दानव who took part in the तारकामय. M. १७३. २१; १७७. 7.
--a Janapada of the Ketu- माल. वा. ४४. १३.
--a Vindhyan tribe. Br. II. १६. ६४; M. ११४. ५२; वा. ४५. १३२.
--on the Kailasa. वा. ५४. ११६.
--the capital of वालि. <F>1:  Br. III. 7. २४७.</F> A mountain capital; a तीर्थम् sacred to तारा. <F>2:  M. १३. ४६.</F>
--a measure of length; two रत्निस् or ४२ अङ्गुलस्। Br. II. 7. ९६, ९९. M. १७३. १६. वा. 8. १०२; १०१. १२३.
--a Janapada. वा. ४५. ११०.
(II)--a son of संकट. His sons were god- lings, being the presiding deities of fortresses. भा. VI. 6. 6.

(III) (च्)--the land in which the Buddha was born; its people became purified by their devotion to Hari; <F>1:  भा. I. 3. २४; VII. १०. १९.</F> noted for the sacred गया and the garden park राजगृह, also for the आश्रम of Cyavana. Other sacred spots fit for श्राद्ध offerings were वैकुण्ठ, लोहदण्ड, गृध्रकूटा and शोणक. <F>2:  वा. १०८. ७३-4.</F>
--the mother of बलाहक and seven other sons, all commanders of भण्ड. Br. IV. २४. 6.
--a sacred place fit for श्राद्ध offerings. वा. ७७. ५६.
(I)--the son of Dharmatantra. वा. ९४. 5.
(II)--a daughter of दक्ष and wife of Dharma; son यशस्. Br. II. 9. ५०, ६२; १३. ८०. Vi. I. 7. २३ and ३१.
(III)--a daughter of शुक and wife of अणुह. Vi. IV. १९. ४४.
(V)--a देवी attending on Soma; <F>1:  Br. III. ६५. २६. वा. ९०. २५.</F> wife of Jayanta; left him for Soma; <F>2:  M. २३. २५.</F> in the गेयचक्र of ललिता Devi1. <F>3:  Br. IV. १९. ७१.</F>

(I)--the first son of Vasudeva and देवकी. He was not killed by कम्सा when Vasudeva brought the child to him; of the रोहिणि family. (Killed by कम्सा-वि। प्।). भा. X. 1. ५७-60; IX. २४. ५४; Br. III. ७१. १७४; M. ४६. १३; वा. ९६. १६८; Vi. IV. १५. २६, २७.
(II)--a son of उत्तानपाद. Br. II. ३६. ८९; M. 4. ३५; वा. ६२. ७६.
(III)--a son of शठ. Br. III. ७१. १७०.
(IV)--a son of अङ्गिरस्; wife धेनुका; sons, चरिष्णु and धृतिमान्. वा. २८. १५, १७; Br. II. ११. १८.
(I)--a daughter of शुक; husband अणुह (सत्वणुह-वा। प्।) and son Brahmadatta. Br. III. 8. ९४; १०. ८२; वा. ७०. ८६.
(II)--a goddess enshrined at एकाम्भेक. M. १३. २९.
--the son of Pratimbaka, (Pratitvaka-वा। प्।) father of देवमीढ. Br. III. ६४. ११-12; वा. ८९. ११.
--the valorous son of महाधृति. Father of महारोमन्. Br. III. ६४. १३.
--in honour of अश्वत्थ, सूर्य and गङ्ग. M. १०१. २४.
--a राक्षस living in Sutalam. Br. II. २०. २३; वा. ५०. २२.
(I)--the father of Vanhi. भा. IX. २४. १९.
(II)--a son of Satyaka (Andhaka-म्। प्।) and father of वृष्णि. (Ugrasena-वा। प्।). Br. III. ७१. ११६; M. ४४. ६१-2, ७६; वा. ९६. १३४.
(III)--an Asura follower of Bali. M. २४५. ३२.
(IV)--a son of Andhaka and father of धृष्ट; <F>1:  Vi. IV. १४. १२, १३.</F> descendants of. <F>2:  Ib. V. ३५, १६, ३७, ३९.</F>
--a tribe which defended द्वारका. Relieved by कम्सा's death; fought with their kinsmen and ended their lives; <F>1:  भा. I. ११. ११; X. ४५. १५; XI. ३०. १८.</F> kingdom of. <F>2:  M. १२१. ४३.</F>

--the banner of Skanda, presented to him by वायु: the standard of कुमार; a cock not to be fed with श्राद्ध पिण्ड; <F>2:  Br. III. 7. ४५५; १०. ४७; १२. ३४; १४. ४८; १९. ४४; M. २६०. ५०.</F> killer of, goes to hell. <F>3:  Br. IV. 2. १६५; २४. ५०; वा. १०१. १६३.</F> Cock crying in प्र- दोष time is bad to the place. <F>4:  M. २३७. 5.</F> ^1 वा. ७२. ४५.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १७.
--a commander of भण्ड; killed by Kula- सुन्दरिका in battle. Br. IV. २१. ७९; २५. २८ and ९७.
--a disciple of पौष्यञ्ति. Learnt a hundred सामसम्हीतस्. भा. XII. 6. ७९.
--a son of Bali. M. 6. ११.
--a son of Vasudeva and मदिरा. Br. III. ७१. १७१; वा. ९६. १६९.
(I)--a daughter of the Progenitor Kardama. Br. II. १४. 8.
(II)--a daughter of Priyavrata. वा. ३३. 8; Vi. II. 1. 5.
--a son of रौद्राश्व. भा. IX. २०. 4.
--a Janapada of the केतुमाल. वा. ४४. ११.
--a son of Vasu. Vi. IV. १९. ८१.

--a poor ब्राह्मण and class-mate of कृष्ण. Having many children and distressed by poverty, his wife advised him to meet कृष्ण. She begged some पृथुकतण्- डुल, and sent it as present to कृष्ण. When he came to द्वारका, कृष्ण recognised him and entertained him. Ruk- मिणी also honoured him. कृष्ण recalled their school days, and their loyalty to Guru सान्दीपनि, and how he recipro- cated it. Once when they went out and were caught in storm and rains, the Guru came in search of them with great anxiety. Kucaila gave कृष्ण the पृथुकतण्डुल which कृष्ण shared with रुक्मिनी and heartily ate of it. After spending a jolly night, the ब्राह्मण took leave of his friend and went home, ruminating on the way why कृष्ण did not offer any riches to him. When he neared his place, he found tall mansions lavishly built and furnished. His wife extended him welcome with servants. He knew it was all the work of his friend कृष्ण. Spent a righteous life ever meditating on Hari's lotus feet. भा. X. ८०. 6-४५; ८१ (whole).
(I)--vanquished by कृष्ण. भा. II. 7. ३४.
(II)--(3/4) of बृहस्पति in size. वा. ५३. ६७.

--a prominent Asura, present in तारक's coronation; a commander of तारक's army: Had a chariot of mules with demon faces: Fought with Kubera. M. १४७. २८; १४८. ४२-50; १५०. ७६-121; २४५. १२. [पगे१-386+ २८]
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८५.
--a svara शक्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ५६.
--a son of Bali. Br. III. 5. ४३.
--on the नर्मदा. M. १९४. 9-१०.

(I)--an Asura in Atalam (fourth tala or गभस्तलम्-वा। प्।) <F>1:  Br. II. २०. ३२; वा. ५०. ३१.</F> A commander of तारक with a cha- riot of horses; killed by कपालि and other Rudras after a terrific fight. <F>2:  M. १४८. ४२-50; १५३. २९-30, ५१-68.</F>
(II)--Father of अञ्जना, and father-in-law of Kesari; a नाग. Br. III. 7. २२३ and २३३, ३५०.
(III)--(Mt.) abode of Agastya. M. १६३. ७९.
--was placed on the East of the Gomanta hill during the siege of मथुरा by जरासन्ध. भा. X. ५२. ११ [5].
a kingdom through which ऋषभ passed. Arhat was king. भा. V. 6. 7 and 9. [पगे१-387+ २४]
--Mt. adjoining the कुटक country. भा. V. 6. 7.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १६.
--a class of ascetics. भा. III. १२. ४३.

--the commander-in-chief of भण्ड; sta- tioned troops on all sides of the city and got the army ready for action. Sent Durmada, कुरण्ड, करङ्क and others to the field, all being slain; attacked Cakraratha from the front and fled back in fear. Sent again ३० sons of भण्ड, and lastly went with भण्ड for the war. Br. IV. २१. ७७-100; २२-26 (all chapters); २७-10; २९. 8.
--a householder, fit for receiving दानस्। M. ५३. १९ and ४१; ७२. ३५; ७६. 3; ९६. १३; वा. ६१. ९६.
--a mother goddess. M. १७९. ३०.
--a R. sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ४६.
(I)--the son of Jaya (सञ्जय-वि। प्।). and father of Yugandhara. भा. IX. २४. १४; Vi. IV. १४. 3.
(II)--is Indupramati. Br. III. 8. ९७. [पगे१-388+ २४]
(III)--a son of वेदशिरस्; an अवतार् of the १५थ् द्वापर। वा. २३. १६९.
--a powerful ally of जरासन्ध; placed at the north gate of मथुरा during its siege, and of Gomanta during its siege: see कुलिन्द। Bha. X. ५०. ११ (7); ५२. ११ (१४).
--a son of वेदशिरस्; an अवतार् of the १५थ् द्वापर। (See also कुनी). वा. २३. १६९.
--a chief वानर. Br. III. 7. २४१.
--Five in प्रयाग, in the midst of which flows the गङ्गा; <F>1:  M. १०४. १३.</F> three fire कुण्डस् outside प्रयाग through which the Ganges flows. <F>2:  M. ११०. 4.</F>
(I)--a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३३. १०.
(II)--the son of क्षुद्रक and father of Suratha. Vi. IV. २२. 9.
--sons of Nidhruva and सुमेधा. Br. III. 8. ३१; वा. ७०. २७.
--(तुण्डिकरस्-Pargiter) a Haihaya clan. M. ४३. ४९.
(I)--a वासिष्ठ Brahmava1din. M. १४५. ११०; २००. १५.
(II)--a resident of ब्रह्मक्षेत्र. वा. ५९. १०६.
(III)--one of the eleven वसिष्ठ branches. वा. ७०. ९०.

(IV)--the capital of Vidarbhas; दमघोष arrived at; बलराम's arrival; Rukmi's resolve not to enter the capital without vanquishing कृष्ण. <F>1:  भा. X. ५३. 7. १५ and २१; ५४. १९-20, ५२; Vi. V. २६. 1.</F> Here शाल्व had a conference of princes to get rid of कृष्ण. <F>2:  भा. X. ७६. 2 [8-9].</F>
--a class of वासिष्ठ group. Br. III. 8. ९९.

--eight in relation to a श्राद्ध--middle noon, खड्गपात्रम्, Nepal shawl, silver, कुश ग्रस्स्, seasamum, cow, son of a daughter: एत्य्। कुत्सितम् पापम् तपन्ति; Of 5 and 6 are born of विष्णु's body and are by themselves enough to protect a श्राद्ध। M. २२. ८४-9.
(I)--a son of चाक्षुष Manu. भा. IV. १३. १६. [पगे१-390+ २७]
(II)--a भार्गव gotrakara. त्रिप्रवर। M. १९५. २२; १९६. ३७.
--a locality through which पावनी flows; <F>1:  Br. II. १८. ५७.</F> a mountain kingdom; <F>2:  M. ११४. ५६.</F> people of. <F>3:  वा. ४७. ५५.</F>
(I)--a son of जटामाल, an अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १८७.
(II)--one of the four chief disciples of Pau- ष्यञ्जि; had three sons. वा. ६१. ३६, ३८.
--a son of अशोक; ruled for eight years. वा. ९९. ३३३.
--a son of वेदशिरस्, an अवतार् of the १५थ् द्वापर। Cf. कुनि। वा. २३. १६९.
(I)--(स्वातिकर्ण) आन्ध्र king ruled for eight years. M. २७३. 8.
(II) (च्)--a kingdom of Madhya देश; a southern country. ^1 Br. II. १६. ४१ and ५९-60; १८. ४४. [पगे१-391+ २८]
--a people of southern country; <F>1:  M. ११४. ३५; वा. ४५. ११०, १२७; ४७. ४२.</F> were enlisted by जरासन्ध against the Yadus. <F>2:  भा. X. [५० (V) 3].</F>
(I)--the son of Dharmanetra and father of Sam- jaya (सोहञ्जि-भा। प्।), (Sahajit-वि। प्।). भा. IX. २३. २२. Br. III. ६९. 5; M. ४३. 9; Vi. IV. ११. 8.
(II)--the son of Kratha and father of धृष्टि(a) (वृष्णि-बुर्नोउf). भा. IX. २४. 3; M. ४४. ३८-9; वा. ९५. ३८; Vi. IV. १२. ४०-41.
(III)--a son of कृष्ण and सत्या. भा. X. ६१. १३.

--(Kunti-वा। प्।), went to स्यमन्तपञ्- caka for solar eclipse; <F>1:  भा. X. ८२. २५. Vi. IV. १४. ३२. 3.</F> adopted पृथा, daughter of शूर, as his daughter. (See Sorenson's इन्देx तो प्रोपेर् नमेस् इन् महाभारत, p. ४३६). पाण्डु married कुन्ती, daughter of Kuntibhoja. <F>2:  Br. III. ७१. १५१-2; M. ४६. 7; वा. ९६. १५०.</F>
--a commander of भण्ड, attacked by महामाया. Br. IV. २१. ८४; २८. ३९.

--daughter of शूर and adopted by Kuntibhoja as he was childless. दुर्वासस् taught her a मन्त्र by which she invoked the sun who returned after blessing her with a child. Being an unmarried girl, she abandoned her son in a box, and this was discovered by Adhiratha who [पगे१-392+ ४६] brought him up. This child was कर्ण; <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. १३-14; २४. ३१-36; Br. III. ७१. १५२-5; M. ४६. 7.</F> queen of पाण्डु: gave birth to युधिष्ठिर and four other sons by the favour of gods--Dharma, वायु and Indra and the अश्विन्स्; outlived her husband for the sake of their welfare. <F>2:  भा. IX. २२. २७; M. ५०. ४८-50. Br. III. 1. ४०. Vi. V. १२. २४.</F> Seen by अक्रूर: Narrated to Vidura her troubles after पाण्डु's death. Her affection and love for कृष्ण; addressed him on the difficulties encountered by the पाण्डवस्. कृष्ण comforted her and explained how it was not possible for him to go to हास्तिनापुर earlier. <F>3:  भा. X. ५८. 7. १०; X. ४९. 1-१५; I. 8. 3: 9. १३.</F> Her स्तोत्र of कृष्ण; <F>4:  Ib. I. 8. १७-43.</F> grieved at his departure from हास्तिनापुर. Her thoughts on the other world. <F>5:  Ib. I. १०. 9; १३. 3; १५. ३३; X. ८२ 24.</F> Heard of Drupada's defeat by her sons. Was met by कृतवर्मन् at हास्तिनापुर. At the news of the alleged burning of (पाण्डवस्, etc.), कुन्ती went to the Kurus accompanied by राम and कृष्ण, though the latter was aware of the fact of their living. <F>6:  Ib. X. ५२. [५६ (V) 2], [5], १०; ५७. 1.</F> Heard the story of the marriage of कृष्ण from his wives and was lost in wonder. <F>7:  Ib. X. ८४. 1.</F> Left for स्यमन्तपञ्चक, and complained to Vasudeva of his neglect of her sons. Vasudeva consoled her saying that oppression from कम्सा had scattered them in different directions. <F>8:  Ib. X. ८२. १८-22; ८४. ५७ and ६९ [3].</F> Joy at कृष्ण's visit to हास्तिनापुर. Taking leave of her कृष्ण went to द्वारका. <F>9:  Ib. X. 7 1. ३९; ७७. 7; १०. M. १०३. १२.</F> (See पृथा) Regret- ted with her sons the loss of Duryodhana and others.^10
--a R. from the पारियत्र hill. M. ११४. २४.

--a Yadu tribe who took part in the marriage festivities of कृष्ण and रुक्मिनी. <F>1:  भा. X. ५४. ५८.</F> They went to Syamanta- पञ्चक for solar eclipse. <F>2:  Ib. X. ८२. १३.</F> Heard of कृष्ण going to मिथिला and met him with presents. <F>3:  Ib. ८६. २०.</F> Fought with their kinsmen and ended their lives. <F>4:  Ib. XI. ३०. १८.</F> [पगे१-393+ ३८]
--a Mt. of शाल्मलिद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १०.
--a hill tribe; a mountain kingdom of the south. Br. II. १६. ६७; M. ११४. ४७. ५५; १२१. ३५.
--the kingdom of. M. १२१. ५६.
--Killed Dundhu, the son of अरूरु, on the advice of Uttanka. वा. ६८. ३१.

(I)--the son of विश्रवस् (वैश्रावण) and इडविडा. His father initiated him into a great विद्या। Father of three sons--विशाल and others. Lord of यक्षस्, and brother of शिव; <F>1:  भा. IX. 2. ३२-33; IV. 1. ३७; ११. ३३. वा. ४०. 8; ४७. 1; ७०. ३८. ९७. 2.</F> was pleased with Dhruva and blessed him though he killed his followers. <F>2:  भा. IV. १२. 1-9.</F> Presented a golden throne to पृथु. <F>3:  Ib. १५. १४.</F> With his नरवाहन attacked कृष्ण taking पारिजात, but defeated by सत्यभामा, retreated in fear. Presented to कृष्ण eight treasures and his new city. <F>4:  Ib. X. [६५ (V) ४५], [६६ (V) 4-२१]; ५०. ५६.</F> Attended by Guhyakas, he is compared to युधिष्ठिर attended by पाण्डवस्, कृष्ण and sages. <F>5:  Ib. I. 9. 3.</F> Lord of Alaka and son of Pulastya and resident of Kai- लास; <F>6:  Br. II. १८. 1-2; ३५. ९४; ३६. २१८; M. १२१. 2-3; १३७. ३२; वा. ६९. १९६.</F> vanquished by रावण; wife ऋद्धि and son Nala- कूबेर. <F>7:  Br. III. 7. २५४ and ३३१; 8. ४४; ७२. 2; IV. १५. २२; वा. ७०. ४१.</F> Man as his riding animal: followed by यक्षस् and राक्- षसस् with respective standards--उलूक and गृध्र; [पगे१-394+ ३५] fought with Jambha and Kujambha and was overwhelmed; fled to Indra helpless; beaten by तारक. <F>8:  M. १४८. ८४; १५०. ५०-108; १५३. १७९.</F> By residing in Benares, attained the status of a गणेश; <F>9:  M. १८०. ६२.</F> observed the आदित्यशयनवृअतम्; <F>१०:  Ib. ४७. ३०; ५५. ३२.</F> penance at the conflu- ence of the नर्मदा and the कावेरी and was blessed by शिव to be the Lord of यक्षस्; <F>११:  Ib. १८९. 4-११; १९१. ८५.</F> icon of; <F>१२:  Ib. २६१. २०-2.</F> defended the chariot of त्रिपुरारि. <F>१३:  Ib. १३३. ६३; १३८. २५; १४०. ४१.</F>

(II)--(Dhanada): the guardian of the north; <F>1:  M. ६७. १५; Vi. V. ३६. १२.</F> presents of, at उमा's marriage; <F>2:  M. १५४. ४८९.</F> in the army of deva's at तारकामय; riding animal of, man; <F>3:  M. १७४. १७-18.</F> हरिकेश got this status at Benares; became अन्नद and क्षेत्रपाल; Udbhrama and Sambhrama, two गणस् in his service. <F>4:  M. १८०. ९४-99.</F>
--Tripravara. M. १९६. ३३.

--a sacred place fit for श्राद्ध; near नन्दा in the N. E. direction; a सिद्धक्षेत्र; a temple of महादेव; the lord performed austerities standing on one leg in the देवी's temple for a युग (दिव्य)। Br. III. १३. ८०; वा. ७७. ७८-81.
--in the पिशाचक hill. वा. ३९. ५७.
--a Janapada of the केतुमाल. वा. ४४. १४. [पगे१-395+ ४०]
--got final release by सत्सङ्ग। भा. XI. १२. 6.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ६६.
--a people of the दक्षिणापथ। वा. ४५. १२५.

(I) (सुब्रह्मण्य)--born in शरकानन or शरवन and was nursed by the six कृत्तिकस्, hence कार्त्ति- keya: Sucking milk with six mouths, the child came to be known as षण्मुख. Appointed commander of the celes- tial army in the तारकासुर war and killed तारक. <F>1:  भा. IV. 7. ६४-5; Vi. I. १५. ११५. M. 5. २६-7; १६० (whole): २२५. १८; वा. ६६. २४.</F> शाख, विशाख and Naigameya were brothers. <F>2:  Ib. ६६. २४; M. 5. २६१७.</F> An अवतार् of Hari. <F>3:  भा. XI. 4. १७.</F> A son of Agni through स्वाहा, and the son of गन्गा by taking Agni's गर्भ due to Uma's curse. Hence son of शिव. <F>4:  M. १३५. ७९.</F> His birth was heralded by divine musicians, siddhas, चारणस्, यक्षस्, kinnaras and others. Fed with milk by the wives of the seven sages except अरुन्धती. Hari presented him two birds--fowl and peacock, सरस्वती the lute, ब्राह्मी a goat, and शिव a ram. <F>5:  Br. III. 3. २४; १०. ३५. -४८; M. २०३. 6; वा. ७२. ३५-46.</F> Married देवसेना, the daughter of Indra: also known as Skanda, Guha, and Deva- सेनापति. <F>6:  Br. IV. ३०. ३९, ९९ to the end; वा. ७२. ४८-50; Br. III. १०. ४८-51.</F> मयूर as the riding animal of. <F>7:  M. १३५. ७६.</F> Wounded by Maya in the battle of Tripuram. <F>8:  M. १९२. ३३.</F>

(II)--a सिद्ध who could not com- prehend the supreme Being and who would not find fault with Hara for violating धर्म। <F>1:  भा. VI. 3. २०; १५. १२; १७. १२ and ३२; VIII. २३. २०.</F> Learnt the भागवत from सन्कर्षण and imparted it to सान्ख्यायन. <F>2:  भा. III. 8. 3 and 7.</F> [पगे१-396+ २५]
(III)--a son of Havya, after whom कुमार- वर्ष was called. Br. II. १४. १७-18; वा. ३३. १६.
(VI)--an author of Architecture. M. २५२. 3.

(VII)--rose out of the contemplation of ब्रह्मा in the २९थ् कल्प; with white complexion and a resplendant fearful countenance and mouth; ब्रह्मा wor- shipped him as the Gods of Gods, पुराणपुरुष, the best of yogins and laughed a hearty laugh in wonder; also of red colour. वा. २२. १०-23.

(VIII)--at the commencement of the eighth कल्प ब्रह्मा got a son (नीललोहित) who was weeping; he asked ब्रह्मा to give him a name for which ब्रह्मा said रुद्र; again he cried for a second name and ब्रह्मा said, भव; the other names given in order were शिव, पशुपति, ईश, भीम, उग्र and महादेव। वा. २७. 4-१६.
(X)--a son of Bhavya of शाकद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ६०.
--a kingdom watered by ह्लादिनी; <F>1:  Br. II. १८. ५५.</F> a tribe. <F>2:  वा. ४७. ५२.</F>
--a celestial group. वा. ४७. ५२.

--the first offspring of ब्रह्मा when he was engaged in thinking of creation devoid of शब्द, स्पर्श, रूप, रस and गन्ध। ब्रह्मा pondered over a form which would be neither male nor female but with colours. Then अक्षर came out of ‘his neck; it was ओम्कार with one मात्र, then two मात्राक्षर, three अक्षरस्, then fourteen- faced deva and १४ Manus. वा. २६. 8-२८.
--a तीर्थ in the पालपञ्जर hill; sacred for श्राद्ध। वा. ७७. ३७.
--sages of, visited द्वारक. भा. X. ९०. २८[4].
--Here पुरूरवस् got separated from उर्वशी. M. २४. १९.
--the son of Madhu, and father of Anu. Vi. IV. १२. ४२. [पगे१-398+ २६]
--see तारकामय।
--a R. from the शुक्तिमत् hill. Vi. II. 3. १४.

(I)--a daughter of ललिता aged nine, and train- ed in military art. Attacked and slew all the sons of भण्ड to the joy of the शक्ति troops; <F>1:  Br. IV. २६. ७३-117.</F> goddess enshrined at माया- पुरी. <F>2:  M. १३. ३४.</F>
(II)--Cape Comorin, fit for श्राद्ध offerings. Br. II. १६. ११; III. १३. २८.
(III)--a R. from the शुक्तिमत् hill. Br. II. १६. ३८; M. १६३. ८६.
(V)--noted for चन्द्रतीर्थ. वा. ७७. २८.
--a part of an artificial fortress (कृत्- रिम)। Br. II. 7. १०३-4.
--Mt. king of hills, to the east of अरुणोद; <F>1:  वा. ३६. १८; ३७. 1.</F> eight cities of the दानवस् located in. <F>2:  Ib. ३९. २८-9.</F>
--a ऋत्विक् at ब्रह्मा's sacrifice. वा. १०६. ३४. [पगे१-399+ २९]
(I)--an attendant on Hari. <F>1:  भा. VII. 8. ३८-39; XI. २७. २८.</F> Attacked Asura followers of Bali. <F>2:  Ib. VIII. २१. १६.</F>
(II)--a disciple of Pathya. भा. XII. 7. 2.
(III)--a chief वानर. Br. III. 7. २४२.
(IV)--a son of इरावती. Br. III. 7. २९२.
(V)--a नाग from चान्द्रमस Sa1ma. Br. III. 7. ३४५.
(VI)--a son of मणिवर. वा. ६९. १६०.
(VII)--a son of बृहती. वा. ९६. २४७.

(VIII)--a Mt. on one side of Meru west of शितोद. Here is the celestial Banian Tree शतबलू's from which flow rivers to निलावृत. The tree would yield what- ever was desired of it. <F>1:  भा. V. १६. ११ and २४; वा. ३६. २८; ३८. ४५; ४२. ५१.</F> One of the seven hills of शाल्मलद्वीप. <F>2:  Br. II. १९. ३५; वा. ४९. ३२-3; Vi. II. 4. २६.</F> Residence of the Kinnaras. <F>3:  Vi. ३९. ५९.</F>
(IX)--a Mt. in कुशद्वीप. M. १२२. ५२.
(X)--a Mt. in Gomedaka. M. १२३. 3. [पगे१-400+ २५]
(XI)--a चक्रवाक in मानस; a son of Kau- शिक in previous birth. M. २०. १८.
(XII)--one of the eight निधिस् of Kubera. वा. ४१. १०.
--a Janapada of the Bhadra continent. वा. ४३. २१.
--a नाग from चान्द्रमस साम। Br. III. 7. ३४५.
--a region of भारतवर्ष; (कुश) described. वा. ४८. १४. ३४-5.
(I)--a name of योगमाय; the goddess enshrined in मानस. भा. X. 2. १२; M. १३. २७.
(II)--the wily sister of महादेव in the isle of Kumuda. वा. ४८. ३५.
(I)--an attendant on Hari. Attacked Asura followers of Bali. See कुमुदाक्षण. भा. VIII. २१. १६; XI. २७. २८.
(II)--an यक्ष and a son of देवयानि. Br. III. 7. १२९.
--a pupil of Pathya. Br. II. ३५. ५९; वा. ६१. ५२; Vi. III. 6. ११. [पगे१-401+ २६]
--a Janapada of the केतुमाल country. वा. ४४. १२.
--one of the four queens of भण्ड. Br. IV. १२. १३.
--see कुम्दाक्ष।
(II)--a R. from the Vindhyas. Br. II. १६. ३३; M. ११४. २७; वा. ४५. १०२; ४७. 2.
--(Mt.) a hill range on the east of Meru. Vi. II. 2. २७.
(I)--a Daitya king, originator of the कापि- लेयस्, दैत्यराक्षसस्; by his wife कपिला; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. १४४-6; वा. ६९. १७६-7.</F> killed in the लङ्का war. <F>2:  भा. IX. १०. १८.</F>
(II)--a son of मुण्डीश्वर, an अवतार् of the lord of the २५थ् द्वापर। वा. २३. २११.
(III)--helped Soma in the तारकामय war. Vi. IV. 6. १४.
(IV)--a palace in the shape of a pot, with 9 भूमिकस् and a तोरण of १६ हस्तस्। M. २६९. ३७-49.
--a son of विश्रवस् and कैकरी, killed by राम in the लन्का war; <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ३७; VII. 1. ४३; १०. ३६; IX. १०. १८; वा. ७०. ४१.</F> a brother of रावण. <F>2:  Br. III. 8. ४७; IV. २९. ११३ and ११६.</F>
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २२.
--a son of the मुण्डीश्वर अवतार् of the lord. वा. २३. २११.
--a R. of the केतुमाल country. वा. ४४. २२.
--a son of Bali. Br. III. 5. ४३.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८८.
--a name of Agastya. Br. III. ३५. ४२; IV. १७. ३५; ३०. 4.
(I)--a son of Bali. वा. ६७. ८३.
(II)--one of Danu's sons. वा. ६८. १०.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८८.

--a group of पिशाचस्, little in size, hairy, brownish in hue; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. ३७८ and ३८२, ३९५.</F> are invisible and live on the heads of ele- phants and camels. <F>2:  वा. ६९. २६३, २७४-5.</F> [पगे१-403+ ३१]
--a water vessel, being an adjunct of व्रतम्स्: to be given as gift. M. 7. १० and १८.
--a दानव. Br. III. 6. १०.
--a name of Agastya. भा. I. १९. १०.
--a name of Agastya. Br. IV. १७, ३२; २९. ५८.

(I)--a minister of बाण. His daughter चित्रलेखा, was a companion of ऊषा, बाण's daughter; <F>1:  भा. X. ६२. १४; Vi. V. ३२. १७.</F> was attacked by बलराम in the siege of शोणितपुर; defeated, ran away. <F>2:  भा. X. ६३, 8 and १६.</F> Sent to मथुरा for जरासन्ध's help. कृष्ण overcame his illusory warfare by विज्ञानास्त्र। Defeated by सात्यकि, he fell unconscious; was taken from the field in a chariot back to his city. <F>3:  Ib. X. [५१ (V) १८], [२८-30, ५९-63, ६५].</F>
(II)--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८९.
--a राक्षस with his city in the third Talam; <F>1:  Br. II. २०. २८.</F> a son of Bali. <F>2:  वा. ५०. २७. ६८. ३२.</F>
--a hell, for those fallen from Karma. वा. ८३. ८९.
(I)--a daughter of पुष्पोत्कट and विश्रवस्. Br. III. 8. ५५; वा. ७०. ४९. [पगे१-404+ २५]
(II)--a daughter of Bali, and sister of बाण; ill-treated बाण's wife. M. १८७. ४०-42.
--one of the २८ hells intended for those who deprive a ब्राह्मण of his property, and for flesh and meat-eaters. भा. V. २६. 7 and १३; X. ६४. ३८; Br. II. २८. ८३; III. १९. ६१; M. १४१. ७०.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८८.
--a Mt. on the base of Meru. भा. V. १६. २६.
--a commander of भण्ड expert in माया and skilled in चित्रयुद्ध or कूटयुद्ध; an elder brother of Durmada; killed by देवी. Br. IV. २१. ७७; २२. ७१-108.
--a Mt. on the base of Meru. भा. V. १६. २६.
--Mt. on hill range on the east of Meru. Vi. II. 2. २७.
(I)--one of the fourteen गणस् of Apsaras, born of Soma's rays. Br. III. 7. १९; वा. ६९. ५५. [पगे१-405+ ३७]

(II) (c)--the land of Kurus, part of हरिताश्व kingdom; also कुरुवम्श। <F>1:  M. १२. १८; ३५. 8; ६९. ११; १२१. ४९.</F> Situated between oceans and served by सिद्धस्; there is a मधुफल tree from which clothes and ornaments are taken; besides there is another tree क्षीरिण of six rasas, all the earth set with presious gems; people are born मिथुनस् and soon grow into lofty youthful men and women, loyal like चक्रवाक birds; they live १३,150 years. There are two kulaparvatas and a river भद्रशीम besides others flowing with honey, milk and ghee; there are gardens in it of तमाल, अगरु, sandal, etc., besides sporting grounds and creeper houses of different kinds and musical instruments of differ- ent varieties; men adorn themselves with beautiful jewels of all sorts. They are not troubled by disease or old age. <F>2:  वा. ४५. ११-50.</F>
(I)--a caste equal to क्षत्रिय in प्लक्षद्वीपा. Vi. II. 4. १७.
(II)--Thirty-six kings who were con- temporaries of ten शिसुनागस्. Br. III. ७४. १३७; M. २७२. १६; २७३. ७२.

(I)--a son of आग्नीध्र and पूर्वचित्ति; <F>1:  भा. V. 2. १९; वा. ३३. ४०; Vi. II. 1. १७ and २२.</F> Lord of शृन्गवटम्. <F>2:  Br. II. १४. ४७.</F> Kingdom north-east of शृङ्गवत्वर्ष. <F>3:  वा. ३३. ४४; Br. II. १४. ५१.</F>

(II)--a son of Samvarna and तपटी; occupied प्रयाग and established कुरुक्षेत्र; Lord of कुरुक्षेत्र. Had four (several-वि। प्।) sons--परीक्षित् and others. <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. 4; वा. ९९. २१४-7;; Vi. १९. ७६-8.</F> परीक्- षित्'s son Janamejaya was his grandson? At कुरुक्षेत्र he performed तपस् and <F>2:  Br. III. ६८. २१.</F> pleased Indra. Family members were known as Kauravas. <F>3:  M. ५०. २०-2.</F> [पगे१-406+ ५०]
(III)--a son of Manu and नड्वला; wife आग्नेयी; gave birth to six sons, अङ्ग and others. Vi. I. १३. 5, 6.
(IV)--(Uttara) country of the; famous for a forest शड्वल. वा. ८४. २३, ४८.
(V)--a continent bounded by शृन्गवन् on one side. Here Hari is worshipped in his Boar incarnation by पृथ्वि (Earth) with the Kurus. भा. V. १६. 8; १८. ३४-9.

(VI)--an eastern kingdom watered by the Ganges. Its king was enlisted by जरासन्ध, against Yadus, but was vanquished by कृष्ण. <F>1:  भा. I. १०. ३४. X. [५० (V) 2]; II. 7. ३५. Br. II. १८. ५०; III. ५९. 3 and ४६.</F> He took part in the festivities con- nected with the marriage of रुक्मिनी and कृष्ण. <F>2:  भा. X. ५४. ५८.</F> He praised कृष्ण's heroism and welcomed him. <F>3:  Ib. X. ७१. २९; ७२. 5; IX. २४. ६३.</F> Took part in the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर. <F>4:  Ib. X. ७५. १२.</F> He went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for solar eclipse; <F>5:  Ib. X. ८२. १३; ८४. ५५.</F> migration of Yadus to. <F>6:  Ib. X. 2.</F>

--founded by Kuru and sacred to हरी. <F>1:  भा III. 3. १२; VII. १४. ३०; Vi. VI. 8. २९.</F> Watered by the river सरस्वती. <F>2:  भा. IX. १४. ३३.</F> Capital city of the Kurus. <F>3:  Ib. IX. २२. 4.</F> Sages of कुरुक्षेत्र visited द्वारक. At कुरुक्षेत्र Kr2s2n2a performed sacrifices for twelve years. <F>4:  Ib. X. ९०. २८[3], ४६[1].</F> The battlefield where the पाण्डवस् fought with the Kurus led by Duryo- dhana. <F>5:  Ib. X. ७८. [९५ (V) 9], [१८].</F> Here परशुराम dug a lake called स्यमन्तपञ्- caka. <F>6:  Br. III. ४७. 2.</F> On the occasion of a sacrifice सूत narrated the ब्र्। पुराण here. <F>7:  भा. I. 1. १७.</F> पुरूरवस् met उर्वशी after their separa- tion at; the residence of सनत्कुमार and धर्मराज fit for श्राद्ध offerings, and sacred to पितृस्. Founded by Kuru, son of सम्वरण; <F>8:  III. १३. ६५ and ६८; ६६. १८; M. २२. १८; वा. ७७. ६४; ९१. ३१; ९९. २१५, २५९.</F> residence of sage कौशिक, and sacrifice of अधिसीमकृष्ण for 2 years at; sacred in द्वा- para; <F>9:  M. २०. 2; ५०. २० and ६७; १०६. ४९ and ५७; १०९. 3; १८०. ५५; १८४. १६.</F> धर्मक्षेत्र where a great sacrifice was per- [पगे१-407+ ३०] formed. <F>१०:  वा. 1. १४; ५९. १०७.</F> Residence at, leads to मुक्ति; no shaving or उप- वास required here. <F>११:  Ib. १०५. १६ and २५.</F> Noted for अम्भोजसरस् or lotus tank. <F>१२:  Vi. IV-१९. ७७.</F> R. सरस्वती flows here: noted for a temple of वामन. <F>१३:  M. १८६. १०; १९२. १२; २४४. 3.</F>
--the kingdom of परीक्षित्. Visited by शुक and Vidura; <F>1:  भा. I. ४६; १०. ३४; १६. ११; III. 1. २४; Br. III. १३. १००; वा. ७७. ९३.</F> a पाञ्चाल kingdom. <F>2:  M. २१. 9 and २८.</F>
--heard of कृष्ण going to मिथिला and met him with presents. भा. X. ८६. २०.
--the son of अञ्जन and father of अरिष्टनेमि. Vi. IV. 5. ३१.
--a kingdom of मध्यदेश; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ४०; Vi. II. 3. १५.</F> a tribe; a Janapada. <F>2:  M. ११४. ३४; वा. ४५. १०९.</F>
--the son of Madhu and father of Anu. भा. IX. २४. 5.
--kings of रसातल, vanquished by कृष्ण. Br. III. ७३. १०३. [पगे१-408+ २६]
(I)--a class of people in कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १६.
(II)--a son of क्षुद्रक and father of Suratha. M. २७१. १३.
--a part of पुराण samhita1. वा. ६०. २१.
--the kingdom of. M. १२१. ४४.

--on the day prior to the marriage it was then a custom for the bride to visit the temple of पार्- वती and offer worship. Rukmini suggested that कृष्ण might carry her off at that time. भा. X. ५२. ४२[1].
--Transgressors of Kuladharma are unfit for श्राद्ध purposes. Br. III. १४. ४१.
--seven in number. M. ११४. १७.
--a Pravara ऋषि. M. १९९. १७.

--the lofty hill to which the पाण्ड्यन् Malaya- dhvaja retired for तपस्। Traversed by rivers चन्द्रवसा, तम्रपर्णी, and वटोदक. Hermitages in. भा. III. १३. ४१: २३. ३९: IV. २८. ३३ and ३५: VIII. 4. 8. [पगे१-409+ २५]

--the potters’ wheel, likened to the wheel of सम्सार; the lump of clay becomes a full pot by the con- stant revolving of the wheel; <F>1:  वा. १४. १९, ३८; ५०. १४१.</F> the movements of the sun and moon compared to. <F>2:  M. १२४. ६९; १२५. ५२; Vi. II. 8. २७.</F>
--a chief नाग of पाताल. भा. V. २४. ३१.
--see Kuninda. भा. X. ५२. ११ [१४].
--people of a southern? kingdom; enlisted by जरासन्ध against the Yadus. Br. II. १६. ५९. ४८; १८. ४५; वा. ४५. ११६; भा. X. [५० (V) 3].
--a southern tribe. M. ११४. ४९.
--Vajra as the arm of India; to be wor- shipped in house-building. M. २५३. २४.
--a class of शक्तिस्. Br. IV. १९. ३५.
(I)--a disciple of पौष्यञ्जि; learnt a hundred साम samhitas. भा. XII. 6. ७९. [पगे१-410+ ३५]
(II)--a son of आण्डिर, after whom the Kulya देश was called. Br. III. ७४. 6.
(III)--one of the four sons of जनापीड; his country, कुलयाः. वा. ९९. 6.
--the people of a southern kingdom, <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ५६; M. ११४. ३५ and ४६.</F> a Jana- pada. <F>2:  वा. ४५. ११०, १२४.</F>
--the name of the horses of Pratardana. Vi. IV. 8. १५.

--the state elephant of कंसा. When कृष्ण came to the मल्लरङ्ग or the wrestlers’ arena, it was ordered that this elephant should be stationed at the gate of the arena to attack him. When कृष्ण entered the अरङ्ग, the mahout अम्बष्ठ led the animal against him, when कृष्ण took hold of its tail, and whirling it round and round, hit its front when it died with the keeper. He seized its tusks and entered the enclosure in glee. At this कम्सा was perturbed; its keeper was killed by राम. भा. X. ३६. २४ [1], २५; ३७. १५; ४३. 1-१८; Br. II. ७३. १००; वा. ९८. १०१; Vi. V. १२. २१; १५. ११, १७; २०. २३, ३२-42; २९. 5.

(I)--the son of बृहदश्व (श्रावस्त-म्। प्।). At the desire of sage Ut(t)anka, he slew an Asura by name Dhundhu and earned the title धुन्धुमार. In this encounter he was helped by his २१,000 (१०२१-वि। प्।) sons, (brothers) all of whom excepting three (धृढाश्व, Bha- द्राश्व and कपिलाश्व) were consumed by the fire issuing out of the Asura's mouth. <F>1:  भा. IX. 6. २१-23; M. १२. ३१; वा. ८८. २८, ४८-61; Vi. IV. 2. ३९-42.</F> Lust after more territory. <F>2:  भा. XII. 3. १०.</F> See द्युमत्। कुवलाश्व (s.v.) <F>3:  Ib. IX. १७. 6.</F> [पगे१-411+ २६]
(II)--a name for Pratardana. Vi. IV. 8. १५.
--see कुवलयाश्व. Br. III. 6. ३२; ६३. २९.

(I)--a son of राम, born in वाल्मिकी's आश्रम and brought up by the sage. Father of Atithi. <F>1:  भा. IX. ११. ११; १२. 1; M. १२-51; Vi. 4. १०४-5.</F> Ruled over Kosala kingdom from its capital कुशस्थली. <F>2:  Br. III. ६३. १९८; Vi. ८८. १९८-9.</F>
(II)--a son of Ajaka; father of four sons, कुशाम्बु and others. भा. IX. १५. 4.
(III)--a son of Suhotra and father of Prati. भा. IX. १७. 3, १६.
(IV)--a son of Vidarbha. भा. २४. 1.
(V)--the son of बलाकाश्व. Father of कौशाम्ब and three other sons. Br. III. ६६. ३१-2; Vi. IV. 7. 8.
(VI)--a son of Caidyoparicara (Vidyoparicara- वा प्।). M. ५०. २७; वा. ९९. २०२.
(VII)--a son of Gaya and father of four sons, all versed in the Vedas. वा. ९१. ६१-2. [पगे१-412+ ३४]

(VIII)--(कुशद्वीप, कुमुदद्वीपम्?)--thrice the Suroda in size surrounded by घृतोड (sea of Ghee) (milk ocean-म्।प्।). Its name comes from a shining divine cluster of grass in it. Its king was a son of Priyavrata, हीरण्यरेतस्, who divided it among his seven sons. Here Agni is worshipped. <F>1:  भा. V. 1. ३२; २०. १३-17; M. १२२. ४९; वा. ३३. १२; ४९. ४७-58.</F> ज्योतिष्मत्, its first king divided it among his seven sons. Their names, and the names of hills and rivers described. <F>2:  Br. II. १४. १२-30; १९. ५२-64.</F> A तीर्थम् sacred to कुशोदका <F>3:  M. १३. ५०.</F> in the neighbourhood of जम्बूद्वीप; <F>4:  वा. ४८. १४. ३४.</F> of different villages and the residence of Kumuda the wily sister of महादेव. <F>5:  Ib. ४८. ३४-35.</F>
(I)--the son of सीरध्वज and father of Dharmadhvaja; <F>1:  भा. IX. १३. १९.</F> overlord of सान्काश्य; <F>2:  Br. III. ६४. १९.</F> brother of भानु- मान्, lord of काशि. <F>3:  वा. ८९. 1. 8.</F>
(II)--the lord of साङ्काश्य and brother of सीरध्वज Janaka. Vi. IV. 5. २९.
(I)--one of the four sons of कुश. भा. IX. १५. 4; Br. III. ६६. ३२; वा. ९१. ६२; Vi. IV. 7. 8.
(II)--a son of Vaivasvata Manu. M. ११. ४१.
--the peoples of a hilly country. वा. ४५. १३६. [पगे१-413+ २२]
--On this Diti performed her penance. Br. III. 5. ५५-6.
--a son of वेदशिरस्, an अवतार् of the १५थ् dva1para. वा. २३. १६९.
--a son of Dyutimat after whom कौशल des4a came to be called. Br. II. १४. २२-24; वा. ३३. २१; Vi. II. 4. 48
--the name of the forest where Diti performed penance to get a son to slay Indra. वा. ६७. ९४.
--a class of people in कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १६.
--a son of बाष्कल. वा. ६७. ७९.
(I)--the Apsara clan. Br. III. 7. २२.
(II)--a R. of the केतुमाल continent. वा. ४४. १८.
(I)--a Mt. in कुशद्वीप, after which the island is named. Br. II. १९. १३९; M. १२३. ३७. [पगे१-414+ ३०]
(II)--(कुशनाभ): performed austeri- ties for १००० years for a son; Indra the १००० eyed offered himself to be born his son. वा. ९१. ६३-5.

--see द्वारका <F>1:  भा. I. १०. २७; Br. III. ६१. २०, ff; वा. ८८. १९९.</F> --capital of आनर्त (कोशल- वा। प्।) kingdom. Comparable once to अमरावती, dis- appeared; and in its place came द्वारका; finding Kakudmi, its king not returning from ब्रह्मलोक, राक्षसस् like पुण्यजनस् entered it and his ९९ brothers fled to different directions in fear, and established small kingdoms there. <F>2:  M. १२. २२; ६९. 9; वा. ८६, २४. ८८. 1-2.</F>
--a son of अशोक: ruled for eight years. Br. III. ७४. १४६.
--the son of बृहद्रथ and father of ऋषभ. (वृषभ-म्।प्।). भा. IX. २२. 6; M. ५०. २८; वा. ९९. २२३; Vi. IV. १९. ८२.
(I)--a son of Uparicara and a king of the Cedis. भा. IX. २२. 6.
(II)--a son of Vasu. Vi. IV. १९. ८१.

--a son of कुश and father of गाधि or कौशीक, who was Indra himself who offered to be his son when कुशाम्ब performed austerities to have a child equal to Indra. (कुशाश्व-वा। प्।). भा. IX. १५. 4; Br. III. ६६. ३२; Vi. IV. 7. 8, 9-११; वा. ९१. ६२.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ६९. [पगे१-415+ २५]
--a son of ऋषभ. भा. V. 4. १०.
--one of the four sons of कुश. वा. ९१. ६२.
--a son of Bali. वा. ६७. ८३.
(I)--the king who engaged himself in austeri- ties for a son for one thousand years when Indra himself was born his son गाधि by name. See कुसस्तम्ब। Br. III. ६६. ३३. 5.
(II)--a great sage (विप्रऋषि)। वा. 1. १५७.
(III)--a son of the Nakuli अवतार् of the lord. वा. २३. २२३.
(IV)--the thirteenth kalpa so-called. वा. २१. ३२.
--a son of the अट्टहास अवआर् of the lord. वा. २३. १९३.
--the १३ sages being descendants of कुशिक, father of विश्वामित्र mentioned. Br. II. ३३. ११८-19.
