--descendants of कुशिक; <F>1:  भा. IX. १६. ३६-37.</F> kingdom of: sages of. <F>2:  M. १२१. ५४; १९८. 8.</F> [पगे१-416+ २१]
--a son of Vasudeva and रोहिणी. Br. III. ७१. १६५; वा. ९६. १६३.
--one of the four chief disciples of पौष्यञ्जि. वा. ६१. ३६.
--(कुशीदि-ब्र्। प्।) a pupil of पौष्यञ्जि; learnt a hundred साम samhita1s. भा. XII. 6. ७९; Br. II. ३५. ४०.
--see कुशीद। Br. II. ३५. ४०.
--an asura who was attacked by लघुश्यामा. Br. IV. २८. ४०.
(I)--(Mt.) a hill of कुशद्वीप. Br. II. १९. ५५; वा. ४९. ५०; Vi. II. 4. ४१.
(II)--same as कङ्क. M. १२२. ५८.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ७६.
--a group of sages. Br. III. 1. ५५. [पगे१-417+ २३]
--a goddess enshrined at कुशद्वीप. M. १३. ५०.
--a group of पिशाचस् with no ears, hair or cloth; all skin; fond of flesh. Br. III. 7. ३७९ and ३८७.
--a group of पिशाचस्. Br. III. 7. ३७९ and ३८२.
--a daughter of सम्भूति and Marici. वा. २०. 9.
--an यक्ष, and a son of देवयानि. Br. III. 7. १२८.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३१.
--the city on the south bank of the Ganges founded by उदायि in his fourth year. वा. ९९. ३१९.
(II)--the city founded by उदायी on the south bank of the Ganges. Br. III. ७४. १३२.
--the विमान or flying machine. Br. IV. १५. २६. [पगे१-418+ २४]
--the presiding deity of the Himalayas who kept watch and ward over the harem of उमा until her return from तपस्। M. १५६. 1-7.
--a श्रुतऋषि: a pupil of पौष्यञ्जि. Br. II. ३३. 8; ३५. ४०.
--a continent round Somaka hill. M. १२२-24.
--a son of Havya, after whom Kusumot- tara वर्ष was named. Br. II. १४. १७-20.
--a region of शाकद्वीप, adjoining the Asta hill. B. II. १४. २०; १९. ९२; वा. ४९. ८७.
--a son of Bhavya of शाकद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ६०.
--one of eight सौभाग्यम्स्. M. ६०-9, २७.
--a son of मणिवस. वा. ६९. १५९.
--people of the kingdom watered by the Sindhu. Br. II. १८. ४७. [पगे१-419+ २७]
--a chief of the क्रोधवश group of serpents (नागस्). भा. V. २४. २९.
--a sacred place in Meru where व्यास per- formed austerities. वा. १०४. ६१.
(I)--a daughter of अङ्गिरस् and श्रद्धा. (स्मृति- वि। प्।). Wife of धात्री and mother of साय. भा. IV. 1. ३४; VI. १८. 3; Br. II. ११. १८; वा. २८. १५; ५०. २०१; ५५. ४२; ५६. 9, ४५ and ५३; Vi. I. १०. 7.
(II)--one of the nine devis serving Soma. Br. III. ६५. २६; वा. ९०. २५.
(III)--a शक्ति। Br. IV. ३२. १३.
(IV)--a daughter of Maya; wife of हविष्मन्त, left him for Soma. M. 6. २१; २३. २५.

(V)--the last phase of the new moon. It is the digit that disappears, and not the moon in कुहू, as seen from राम's words to रुक्मिणी fit for giving gifts; <F>1:  भा. X. ५४. ४७; Br. II. २६. ४४; २८. ११ and ५९; M. १३३. ३६; १४१. ४९, ५१; Vi. II. 8. ८०.</F> served by Aila. एत्य्। <F>2:  M. १४१. 9 and ४३, ४९, ५१; वा. ५६. ५३.</F>
(VI)--a R. from the Himalayas; of the भारत- वर्ष. Br. II. १६. २५; M. ११४. २१; वा. ४५. ९५. [पगे१-420+ २५]
(VII)--a R. of शाल्मलिद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १०.
(VIII)--the kingdom of. M. १२१. ४६.
--the hour in which the moon is not visible. In the same way infancy and boyhood, the eleven forms of the notion of ‘I’ are not distinctly seen. भा. IV. २९. ७२.
--a Malla friend of कम्सा. Killed by बलराम. भा. X. ४२. ३७; ४४. २६.
--a Mt. in भारतवर्ष. भा. V. १९. १६.
--a Janapada of the Ketu- माल. वा. ४४. १०.
--a group of नाडिस् of sun (fire) emit- ting rain. Br. II. २४. २७.
--crafty warfare; कुरण्ड was an expert in. Br. IV. २२. ७४; २५. ४६, ५५.
--(Mt.) a hill of भारतवर्ष. Br. II. १६. २३; वा. ४५. ९२.
(I)--one of the twenty Sutapa गणस्. वा. १००. १५. [पगे१-421+ २७]
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८२.

--a minister of बाण. Went with जरासन्- dha to assault मथुरा. Fought with माया as weapon which कृष्ण removed by use of विज्ञानास्त्र. Defeated by कृतवर्मन्. Seeing कुम्भाण्ड unconscious, fled towards the city. Was attacked by बलराम in besieging शोनित- pura, and was defeated. भा. X. [५१ (V) १८], [२८-30, ६४-65]; ६३. 8 and १६.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८२.
--a R. of the शुक्तिमत्. वा. ४५. १०७.
--the son of मीढ्वान् and father of Indrasena. भा. IX. 2. १९.
--a वर्ण S4akti. Br. IV. ४४. ६०.

--an अवतार् of Hari in the पातालम्. <F>1:  भा. II. 7. १३; M. २४९. १६, २०; Vi. I. 4. 8.</F> In this form He is worshipped in हिरण्मय. By His help the churning of the ocean was possible. Also कूर्म-कच्छप। <F>2:  भा. V. १८. २९; XI. 4. १८: X. 2. ४०.</F> Icon of. <F>3:  M. २५९. 2; २६०. ३९; २८५. 6.</F> [पगे१-422+ ३०]
--the age when वामन पुराण was com- posed. M. ५३. ४६.
--the flesh of tortoise for a श्राद्ध। M. १७. ३३; ५८. १९.

--a महा pura1n2a of १८००० s4lokas (१७००० s4lokas, भा., वा। प्।); <F>1:  भा. XII. 7. २४; १३. 8; Vi. III. 6. २३.</F> said in the presence of Indra containing anecdotes of Indradyumna and of लक्ष्मीकल्प. Gift of, with a golden tortoise on the अयनस् equals a gift of १००० cows. <F>2:  M. ५३. ४७, ४९; वा. १०४. 9.</F>
--the stone forming the lowest part of the base of an image. M. २६६. 5.
--the collective name for १००० sons of कक्षीवत्. Br. III. ७४. ९९.
--a सूक्त of the Yajur Vedins to be recited in tank rituals. M. ५८. ३५; २३९. १०.

--a kind of evil spirits. To this group Kapi's sons belonged; said to harass children; <F>1:  भा. VI. 8. २४; X. 6. २७; Br. III. 7. ३८४ and ४१. २९.</F> disturbed Dhruva's समाधि. <F>2:  Vi. I. १२. १३.</F> [पगे१-423+ ३१]
--the son of कपिश; gave birth to two पिशचास् of brown colour; they have no head, no hair; they are eaters of flesh and तिल। वा. ६९. २५७, २६८.
--a son of भजमान. Vi. IV. १३. 2.

--a cock given by Vivasvat to his son Yama who was cursed by छाया, that his leg be full of sores; <F>1:  M. ११. ११-17.</F> cries out in presence of poisoned food; <F>2:  Ib. २१९. १९.</F> an emblem of कौमारी. <F>3:  Ib. २६१. २८.</F>
--a mode of atonement for sins and crimes; प्राजापत्य, a form of it. M. २२७. ४१-3, ५२. वा. १८. २१.
--an expiation for यतिस् causing हिम्सा even inadvertently. वा. १८. १६.
(I)--the son of Jaya and father of Haryavana. भा. IX. १७. १७.
(II)--a son of Vasudeva and रोहिणी. भा. IX. २४. ४६.

(III)--a son of Sannati (म्।प्।); a pupil of Hira- ण्यनाभ; in yoga imparted twenty-four सम्हितस् to his disciples; <F>1:  भा. XII. 6. ८०; Br. II. ३५. ४९ and ५५; वा. ९९. १८९-90; Vi. III. १६. 7.</F> chief among the सामयस् by arranging साम वेद in २४ parts. <F>2:  M. ४९. ७५-6.</F> Father of उग्रायुध. <F>3:  Vi. IV. १९. ५०-3.</F> [पगे१-424+ २१]
(IV)--an यक्ष and a son of देवयानि. Br. III. 7. १३०.
(V)--married श्रुतदेवी; father of सुग्रीव. M. ४६. 5.
(VI)--a son of विश्वामित्र. वा. ९१. ९६.
(VII)--a son of Kanaka. वा. ९४. 8.
(VIII)--a son of हृदिक. वा. ९६. १३९.
(IX)--a son of Cyavana. वा. ९९. २१९.
(X)--a son of Vijaya; father of Haryadhana. Vi. IV. 9. २६-7.
(I)--a son of मदिरा and Vasudeva. भा. IX. २४. ४८; Br. III. ७१. १७२; Vi. IV. १५. २३.
(II)--a son of Cyavana and father of Uparicara- Vasu. Vi. IV. १९. ७९-80.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४१. [पगे१-425+ २५]
(I)--son of Barhi, and father of रणम्जय. भा. IX. १२. १३.

(II)--the eighteenth वेदव्यास. Heard the ब्र्। पुराण from Dhanamjaya and narrated it to तृणम्- jaya; <F>1:  Br. II. ३५. १२१; IV. 4. ६३.</F> heard the वायु पुराण from Dhanamjaya. <F>2:  वा. १०३. ६२.</F>
(III)--the son of Dharmi, <F>1:  वा. ९९. २८७.</F> and father of रणम्जय. <F>2:  Vi. IV. २२. 6-7.</F>
--a son (?) of विश्वामित्र. Br. III. ६६. ६८; Vi. IV. 7. ३८.
--the senior queen of Citraketu who got a son through the blessings of अङ्गिरस्. When the child died of poison, she lamented deeply. भा. VI. १४. २८-48.
(I)--a son of सम्कृति and a righteous man. Br. III. ६८-11; वा. ९३. ११.
(II)--a son of Dhanaka. Vi. IV. ११. १०.
--a son of Dharmadhvaja (Janaka-वि। प्।) and father of केशिध्वज. भा. IX. १३. १९-20; Vi. 6. 7-8. [पगे१-426+ ३९]
--a god of सुतार group. Br. IV. 1. ९०.
--a son of तामस Manu. Br. II. ३६. ५०.
--sets in when the sun, moon, तिष्य and बृहस्- pati (Planet Jupiter) are in the same mansion. Vi. IV. २४. १०२.

--a R. of द्राविड from Malaya hills in भा- रतवर्ष. In this Satyavrata offered water-rites to his पितृस्. Visited by बलराम. भा. V. १९. १८; VIII. २४. १२; XI 5. ३९; X. ७९. १६; Br. II. १६. ३६; III. ३५. १७; M. ११४. ३०; वा. ४५. १०५; Vi. II. 3. 13

(also कृत)--commences when the sun, moon and बृहस्पति are in one, and the same राशी। Its cha- racteristic features. <F>1:  भा. XII. 2. २४; 3. १८-19, २७.</F> Form of Hari as worshipped in this युग, and worship by contemplation. <F>2:  Ib. XI. 5. २१-23; IX. १०. ५२; XII. 3. ५२.</F> Etymologically people in this age are कृतकृत्यस्। Hari took the form of a वृष (bull) for the manifestation of धर्म। Hamsa was the caste name of men. <F>3:  Ib. XI. १७. १०-11.</F> Its duration; repeats at the end of Kaliyuga. पितृस् are worshipped. <F>4:  Br. II. १६. ६९; २९. २४-31; ३१. १०३. ११; III. १४. ४६-7; ७४. २२५; M. 1. ३४; १४२. १९ and २४; १४४. ९०; १४५. 6-7; १६५. 1.</F> Physical and moral state of world in; duration ४००० divine years; सन्ध्य, and सन्ध्याम्श १०८ years; ध्यान important in; सन्ध्याम्श ४०० = प्रक्रीयापाद; <F>5:  वा. 8. ३२-67.</F> after Kali with seven sages; at the beginning man in Kalinga; <F>6:  Ib. ५८. १०३, ११०.</F> pertain- ing to the Brahmanas; Vedas honoured. <F>7:  Ib. ७८. ३६-7.</F> People with no restrictions lived on roots and fruits enjoying sexual bliss; ज्ञानम्। <F>8:  Ib. ९९. ४१३. Br. II. 7. २१, ४५-59.</F> [पगे१-427+ ४१]
--the son of Pratika and father of देवमीढ. Vi. IV. 5. २७.
--the son of महाधृति and father of महा- roma. Vi. IV. 5. २७.
--a son of माद्री and वृष्णि. M. ४५. 2.
(II)--a son of Dhanaka. भा. IX. २३. २३.

(III)--was stationed to defend the East gate of मथुरा by कृष्ण. Defeated कूपकर्ण, a minis- ter of बाण; was sent to हास्तिनपुर by कृष्ण to find out whether पान्डवस् had captured Drupada. He went and met द्रोण, Vidura and others, when युधिष्ठीर made enquiries of कृष्ण. He returned to द्वारका after taking leave of them and narrated to कृष्ण as he saw and heard; joined with अक्रूर to set up शतधन्वन् to kill सत्राजित् and take the jewel Syamantaka (s.v.) as he did not give his daughter in marriage as promised. Refused to help शत- dhanvan who solicited for it. <F>1:  भा. X. ५०. २०[2]; [५१ (V) २५], [३०-31 and ६४]; [५६ (V) 2-१५]; ५७. 3-१८; Vi. IV. १३. ६७-83.</F> Was sent with the sacrificial horse of कृष्ण. <F>2:  भा. X. 8-9. २२ [2].</F> After the राजसूय, he was sent to द्वा- रका for its defence. <F>3:  Ib. X. ७६. 7[5].</F> Went to उपलाव्य to see the पाण्ड- vas, and to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for solar eclipse. <F>4:  Ib. X. ७८ [९५ (V) 3]; ८२. 7.</F> His son was married to चारुमती, a daughter of रुक्मिनी. <F>5:  Ib. X. ६१. २४.</F> Survived कुरुक्षेत्र war; <F>6:  Ib. X. ८०. [2].</F> Heard of शतधन्व's death at कृष्ण's hands, and left द्वारका in fear. <F>7:  Ib. X. ५७, २९.</F> Got killed in the general यादव contest. <F>8:  Vi. V. ३७. ४६.</F> [पगे१-428+ २९]
(IV)--a son of Kanaka. Br. III. ६९. 8; M. ४३. १३; वा. ९४. 8.

(I)--a son of Dhanaka (Kanaka-ब्र्। प्।, म्।प्। and वा। प्।) of Arjuna (कार्तवीर्य): <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. २३-4; Br. III. ६९. 8; M. ४३. १३; वा. ९४. 8; Vi. IV. ११. १०-11.</F> A king of the Hai- haya clan born in the कृतयुग of Vaivasvata epoch, वराह kalpa. His hundred sons died on account of a curse by Cyavana. He prayed to Sun god who taught him a व्रतम्, by observing which he got a long lived child. <F>2:  M. ६८. 6-१२.</F>
(II)--a Deva-gandharva. वा. ६८. ३८.
--a son of इडिविड. वा. ८८. १८१.

--the sacred spot where नृसिम्ह blessed the Mother Goddess: Here Rudra established his Raudri body in the midst of ‘seven mothers’. Here is अर्धनारीश्वर praying to नृसिम्ह; <F>1:  M. १७९. ८७-90.</F> a तीर्थम् sacred to सुङ्हिका। <F>2:  Ib. १३. ४५.</F>
--the Apsaras who presides over the month of मधु; <F>1:  भा. XII. ११-33.</F> coupled with घृताची. <F>2:  Br. III. 7. १५; IV. ३३. १९.</F>
(I)--a son of स्वारोचिष Manu. Br. II. ३६. १९; वा. ६२. १८.
(II)--a name of Yama. M. १४८. ३०.
--a वानर chieftain, and son of श्वेत. Br. III. 7. १८०.
(I)--a son of बहुलाश्व, and father of the great वशिन्--the last of the Maithilas (of the Janaka line). भा. IX. १३. २६; Br. III. ६४. २३; वा. ८९. २३; Vi. IV. 5. ३१-2.
(II)--a son of नहुष. भा. IX. १८. 1; Br. III. ६८. १२; Vi. IV. १०. 1.
(III)--a son of Babhru and father of उशिक. भा. IX. २४. 2.
(IV)--a son of चाक्षुष Manu. Br. II. ३६. ७९ and १०६.
(V)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४१.
(VI)--a Sutapa god. Br. IV. 1. १४.
(VII)--a son of Bhautya Manu. Br. IV. 1. ११४.
(VIII)--one of the two best सामगस्. वा. ६१. ४८; ६२. ६७. [पगे१-430+ २३]
(IX)--a son of मणिवर. वा. ६९. १६१.
(X)--a son of वसिष्ठ, one of the seven sages of ऋतु सावर्ण. वा. १००. ९६.
(XI)--a son of शतध्वज and father of अञ्जन. Vi. IV. 5. ३१.
(I)--a son of सन्नतीमत्. Learnt योग from हिरण्यनाभ, and sang the six early साम सम्हितस्। Father of नीप. भा. IX. २१. २८-29.
(II)--a son of Cyavana and father of Vasu Upa- ricara. भा. IX. २२. 5.
--a son of यवीनर and father of सत्यधृति. भा. IX. २१. २७.
--(कृतरथ-ब्र्। प्।) the son of प्रतीपक and father of देवमीढ. भा. IX. १३. १६.
--a son of महाधृति and father of महारोमन्. भा. IX. १३. १७.
(I)--(आकूति-ब्र्। प्।) the wife of विश्वकर्मन्. भा. VI. 6. १५. [पगे१-431+ ३०]
(II)--the queen of सम्ह्राद and mother of पञ्- cajana. भा. VI. १८. १४.
--one of the ten sons of रौद्राश्व. वा. ९९. १२४.
--a son of Dhanaka (Kanaka-ब्र्। प्।, म्। प्।). भा. IX. २३. २३; Br. III. ६९. 8; M. ४३. १३; Vi. IV. ११. १०.

--The Pleidas; a lunar mansion; personified. Six in number, nursed कुमार: wives of Soma, childless due to दक्ष's curse. <F>1:  भा. IV. 7. ६४; VI. 6. १४ and २३; Br. IV. ३०. १००; M. 5. २७; ५४. ११; ५५. १२; १५८. ४१; वा. ७२. ४३; Vi. I. १५. ११५; II. 8. ७६.</F> An important day for the श्राड्ध offerings, sacred to moon. <F>2:  Br. II. २१. ७७ and १४५; २४. १३०; III. १०. ४४; १८. 2.</F> A constellation containing six stars. <F>3:  वा. ६६. ४८. ८२. 2.</F>
--a पर्व; when the sun goes to the first अम्श, the moon is in the fourth अम्श of विशाख. वा. २३. १०७; ५०. ९६; ५३. १०५.
--see धिष्णि। Br. II. १२. १७.

--a name of शिव. सती who was created by ब्रह्मा was given to him and a number of sons were born who were of all shapes and crude forms and called generally Rudras; they were partakers of the offerings in शतरुद्र। On ब्रह्मा's request he did not procreate but became स्थाणु and महादेव। Br. II. 9. ६९; III. २५. १४: ७२. १८४; M. १८१. १४ ch. वा. २१. ५१. [पगे१-432+ ३२]
--a daughter of शुक and पीवरी, and mother of Brahmadatta; married the पाञ्चाल king अणुह; known also as Gau. भा. IX. २१. २५; M. १५. 8-9; ४९. ५७.

(I)--(कृपशारद्वत) the son of सत्यधृति (शरद्वत्-ब्र्। प्।), found in a forest by शन्तनु with the twin कृपी. <F>1:  भा. IX. २१. ३६; X. ८२. २४; वा. ९९. २०४; १००. ११; १०६. ३४; Vi. IV. १९. ६८.</F> Met by कृतवर्मन्, राम and कृष्ण; <F>2:  भा. X. ५२. [५६ (V) 4, १२]; ५७. 2.</F> invited for the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर. <F>3:  Ib. X. ७४. १०.</F> Joined Duryodhana's camp and survived the कुरुक्षेत्र war. <F>4:  Ib. X. ७८. [९५ (V) १६]; ८०. [2].</F> Went to स्यमन्तपाञ्- caka for solar eclipse. <F>5:  Ib. ८२. २४.</F> Supplied arms to शतानीक. <F>6:  Vi. IV. २१. 4.</F>
(II)--a son of शिष्ट and सुच्चाया. M. 4. ३९.
(III)--a sage of the eighth epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. १७.
--a deity. Br. IV. २७. ३८.
--a R. from the शुक्तिमत् (शुक्तिमन्त-म्। प्।). Br. II. १६. ३८; M. ११४. ३२.
--one of the ten branches of the Sukarma clan of devas. वा. १००. ९२.
--(गौतमी) the wife of द्रोण, and daughter of सत्यधृति, found by शन्तनु in the forest. Mother of अश्वत्थाम. भा. I. 7. ४५; १३. 4; IX. २१. ३६; वा. ९९. २०४; Vi. IV. १९. ६८. [पगे१-433+ २८]
(I)--the son of कृमि and उशीनर. His capital was कृमिला (क्रिमिला-वा। प्।). Br. III. ७४. २०-21; वा. ९९. २०, २२; Vi. IV. १८. 9
(II)--a son of Cyavana. M. ५०. २५.
--a place sacred to शिव. M. १८१. २९.
--a hell into which fall those who misuse gems (रत्न); see also कृमी. Br. IV. 2. १४७ and १६०; वा. १०१. १४७, १५८.
--one of २८ hells. He who eats without doing पञ्चयज्ञ, and does not share his food with others, suffers in this, a pit of worms. भा. V. २६. 7 and १८.
--a son of भजमान. M. ४४. ५०.
--capital city of कृमि. Br. III. ७४. २२; वा. ९९. २२.
(I)--one of the five queens of उशिनर; mother of कृमि. Br. III. ७४. १८-21; वा. ९९. १९.

(II)--a hell; also कीटलोहम्, and क्र्मिभक्ष; <F>1:  Br. IV. 2. १४७ and १५९; ३३. ६१.</F> here fall those who do wicked deeds, hate gods and ब्राह्म- nas and do not revere elders. <F>2:  वा. १०१. १४७, १५८.</F>
(II)--a son of कृशा and उशीनर; capital was वृषला. M. ४८. १८ and २१.
--the son of इड्विड, and father of दिलीप Khatva1n3ga. Br. III. ६३. १८१.
--one of the five queens of उशीनर. Mother of कृश. M. ४८. १६, १८.
--a daughter of सुयशा. वा. ६९. १४.
--an indefinite Agni in the second Vedi of the north. See सम्राडग्नि। Br. II. १२. २१; वा. २९. १९.

(I)--a son of संयम; married two daughters of दक्ष, Arcis and धिषना; and father of Somadatta and the देवप्रहरणस् are created and destroyed in every कल्प and मन्वन्तर। <F>3:  M. 6. 6-7.</F> ^1 भा. VI. 6. 2 and २०; IX. 2. ३४-35; M. 5. १४; १४६. १७; वा. ६३. ४२; ८६. २०; Vi. I. १५. १०४; IV. 1. ५५-6. ^2 वा. ६६. ७९.
(II)--the son of बर्हणाश्व, and father of सेनाजित्. भा. IX. 6. २५.
(III)--a चरकाध्वर्यु; married a daughter of दक्ष. Br. II. ३३. १३; ३७. ४६.
(IV)--a son of तामर Manu. Br. II. ३६. ५०.
(V)--a son of Sahadeva and highly righteous. Br. III. ६१. १५. [पगे१-435+ ३२]
(VI)--a son of सम्हताश्व. Br. III. ६३. ६५; वा. ८८. ६३.
(VII)--father of देवप्रहरण. Vi. I. १५. १३७.
(VIII)--a son of अमिताश्व and father of Pra- senajit. Vi. IV. 2. ४६-7.
--the pursuit of agriculture, a duty of the वैश्य; introduced by पृथु. Br. II. 7. १६२; वा. ७९. ७१; Vi. I. १३. ८४.
--a daughter of मरीची. Br. II. ११. १२.

(I)--twenty-three अवतार् of Hari; according to one version, the twentieth अवतार्। Went to द्वारका, bowed to his parents and entered the palace. <F>1:  भा. I. 2. १७; 3. २३; Chaps. १० and ११; M. 7. ६०.</F> His boyhood sports--sucked उलूकिक's life, kicked शकट to pieces and uprooted two Arjuna trees; brought solace to the Gopas of Vraja by expelling the serpent कालिय from the pool near by and protected their cattle from forest fire. In his mouth यशोदा saw the fourteen worlds. Rescued Nanda from fear of वरुण's noose and recovered the Gopas imprisoned by Vyoma Asura. Shielded the Gokulam from rains by holding up Govardhana Mt. as an umbrella; cut off the head of Kubera's attendant who tried to seize the Gopis engaged in रासकृईडा with कृष्ण. Vanquished several daityas and their wicked kings; manifested Himself through सत्यवती and divided the Vedas into many branches; <F>2:  भा. II. 7. २६-36.</F> Lord and goal of Andhakas, वृष्णिस्, सात्वतस्, etc. Supreme Brahman. <F>3:  भा. II. 4. २०; VII. १५. ७६-79.</F> [पगे१-436+ ४३] Just on the eve of the अवतार्, ब्रह्मा and other gods pray to him in the womb of देवकी. <F>4:  Ib. X. Chaps. 1-3; M. ४६. १४; वा. ९६. १७४.</F> Birth at the time of constellation रोहिणि, first new moon in winter, Abhijit Nak- षत्र, Jayanti night, Vijaya-मुहूर्त and festivities con- nected with it; enjoyed by Vasudeva and देवकी. Their prayer, and कृष्ण recalled their previous births. Taken to यशोदा's delivery room at Nandavraja, stupifying the guardsmen of the jail and crossing यमुना in floods at dead of night; योगमाया born to यशोदा taken back to the jail ward. <F>5:  भा. X. Chaps. (whole); Br. III. ७१. १९६-263; ७२. 7-१३; Vi. V. 1. ९८; 3. 1-२९.</F> योगमाया announced her birth to कंसा, <F>6:  भा. X. Chap. 4, वा. ९६. १९९. २१५.</F> His जातकर्मा. <F>7:  भा. X. 5. 1-१६.</F> Killed पूतना, when at कम्सा's instance, she attempted to poison him by nursing him; यशोदा warded off evil, (रक्षा) to कृष्ण by waving cow's tail round him, by placing cow's dung on the twelve points of his body and by purifying him with cow's urine, with prayers to Hari to protect him from evil spirits. <F>8:  Ib. X. 6; Vi. V. 5. १२-31.</F> The first turning in bed was celebrated with festivity. कृष्ण slept under cradle beneath the cart when he kicked the cart which capsized. This roused suspicion of गृहपीड in यशोदा's mind. शान्ति done when cows, food, etc., were given to Brahmanas. Once the demon तृणावर्त created a whirlwind which swept away all व्रज and took up baby कृष्ण high up in the sky to the embarassment of यशोदा and others. At that time कृष्ण took hold of his neck and strangled him. He fell dead. The child कृष्ण opened his mouth and showed his mother the whole universe. <F>9:  भा. X. 7; Vi. V. 6. 1-7.</F>

as वासुदेव. Boyish sports in व्रज, charged with eating mud; lived with Nanda and his wife who were the same द्रोण and धरा born as Nanda and यशोदा by the command of ब्रह्मा. When once यशोदा left the churning pot to mind the boiling milk overflowing in the oven, कृष्ण broke the curd pot and ran away with butter to feed a monkey. So he was bound with a rope to an उलूखल (mortar) but the rope always fell two inches [पगे१-437+ ४०] short in spite of bits being added. At last कृष्ण pitied her and allowed himself to be tied; with the mortar he passed between two tall Arjuna trees, when down fell the trees, out of which emerged two men Nalakubera and मणिग्रीव (sons of Kubera) who had been cursed by नारद. कृष्ण blessed them and sent them back to their abode. <F>१०:  भा. X. Chaps. 8, 9 and १०; Vi. V. 6, 8-१९.</F> Enjoyed the company of Gopis singing and dancing. Gifts on his जन्मनक्षत्र day. Noticed a Daitya in the guise of a calf and taking him by the tail, he whirled him to death and flung the body on the top of a कपिथ tree. On another occasion Asura Baka met him in the guise of a crane, when कृष्ण tore its jaws asunder. Once when in the forest with his playmates, Agha, an asura friend of कंसा took the form of a boa-constrictor with a view to devour the cattle and all boys together. All of them entered his open mouth with कृष्ण who took his life out of his body and came out to the wonderment of gods. The अजागर skin when dried was a cave for Vraja people. Agha, however, attained salva- tion. <F>११:  भा. X. Chap. II.</F> One day the boys sat and ate merrily when the cattle had gone far into the hill and dale and कृष्ण promised to bring them back. In the meantime ब्रह्मा had them hidden. So कृष्ण created duplicates of the cattle and the children that had been lost. These went home as usual and this continued for a year, when ब्रह्मा released the hidden cows which suckled their calves, and came to see the child, the one Brahman without a second, and belauded the baby Hari, and returned to his region. More boyhood sports. <F>१२:  Ib. X. Chaps. १३ and १४; Vi. V. 6. ३० to the end of Chap. 9.</F> In regularly tending cows, imitated voice of beasts and birds in ब्रिन्दावन just like a rustic. Once the cattle drank of the poisonous waters of the यमुना and became unconscious. After reviving them he found the reptile कालीय in the waters. He immediately jumped into the pool and was enclosed in its coils. At this Nanda and the whole Vraja moved to the banks of the river with great concern. [पगे१-438+ ३९] राम advised them to be cool. Slowly कृष्ण brought the reptile under his control, and getting on its hood, began to dance, when the कालीय acknowledged defeat. Finding his end near, कालीय's wives prayed to कृष्ण to spare him. The generous Lord allowed him to make his abode in the sea, thus purifying the यमुना once for all. <F>१३:  भा. X. Chaps. १५ and १६. Vi. V. 7 (whole).</F> After this incident the whole Vraja was encamped for the night in that vicinity. A forest fire attacked the camp, when कृष्ण swallowed it and protected its inmates. His dances and songs; other past-times. Among the games was one in which the victor rode on the back of the vanquished. कृष्ण carried श्रीदाम on his back. <F>१४:  भा. X. Chaps. १७ and १८.</F> Once again the cattle went astray in the thick forest, and surrounded by fire they bellowed in thirst and hunger. कृष्ण and his playmates found it impossible to reach the spot. So कृष्ण got upon a tree and called the cattle by names, and they responded. Asking his followers to shut their eyes, he swallowed the forest fire. When they opened their eyes, they found themselves in their homes. <F>१५:  Ib. X. १९. 1-१३.</F> कृष्ण filled ब्रिन्दावन with गान्धर्वन् music and played at times on flute. Hid the clothes of Gopis who observed कात्यायनि व्रत to get him as their husband, and returned them only when they saluted with their two hands over their heads as a penance for bathing naked during the period of a व्रत। It was a severe day in summer when some Gopas approached him for food. कृष्ण advised them to go to the neighbouring यज्ञशाल and ask for food, sing- ing the praises of बलराम and himself. The sacrificers were silent at their request. कृष्ण asked them to repeat their request to ladies in his name. The ladies took four kinds of food and in spite of protest by their male relations, they came to have दर्सन् of the Lord and placed before Him all the eatables. On कृष्ण's advice they went back to com- plete the sacrifice, and assured them of their being accepted by their relations and the world. Their male relations [पगे१-439+ ३९] regretted having missed a chance of meeting the Lord. Then food was distributed among his friends. <F>१६:  भा. X. Chaps. २१-23.</F> कृष्ण saw the Gopas worshipping Indra and as resi- dents of hills and forests, he suggested worship of mountains and cows. When this was accepted, Indra sent a heavy downpour which was warded off by कृष्ण, a boy of seven, <F>१७:  Ib. X. Chaps. २४-26; Vi. V. १०. २५-41; ११. १६-25; १३. 3-६२.</F> holding up the Govardhana for a week. A visit from Indra and Surabhi who anointed him, Indra, of Goloka and gave him a new name Govinda. Rescued his father Nanda from वरुण region and took him with other Gopas to Brahma- ःरद where the Vedas were praising Hari. Once when playing on a flute, the गोपीस् who were in the midst of house- hold duties stopped them and came to where he was in spite of protest from their male relations. कृष्ण advised them to go back to Vraja and be loyal to their husbands. They refused to return as their minds were fixed upon him and longed for मोक्ष, and insisted they were his दासिस् and should be accepted. After some time he disappeared for their peace and redemption. They indulged in गीतम्, when the Lord appeared in their midst and shone like पुरुष among शक्तिस्। After consoling them he engaged them in a रासक्रीड, and finding them wearied, he engaged them in watersports and sports in the उपवन on the river-bank. There was no carnal act of sin. The Lord who had no बन्ध, did all this in sport. <F>१८:  भा. X. Chaps. २७-33; Vi. IV. १२. १२.</F> Released Nanda from a reptile who turned out to be विद्याधर Sudars4ana. One day शन्खचूद a follower of कंसा seized some ladies of कृष्ण's party and ran away. They cried for succour. कृष्ण and राम followed. He left the women behind and ran. राम took charge of the ladies while कृष्ण pursued him, cut off his head and took the चूडामणि which he presented to राम. Killed अरीष्ट in the form of a bull who entered the Vraja and terrified the inmates. <F>१९:  भा. X. Chaps. ३४-36; Vi. V. Chap. १४.</F> [पगे१-440+ ३७] Killed केशिन् who came to the Vraja in the guise of a horse and became केशव; killed one Vyoma in the guise of a गोपाल; seen milking cows with राम by अक्रूर who came to द्वारका at the instance of कंसा; agreed readily to start for मथुरा at अक्रूर's message. With अक्रूर, the two brothers arrived at मथुरा. and asked their friend to go home. He requested them to visit his house to which they agreed only after vanquishing कंसा. Next day afternoon, the two brothers and their Gopa followers went round the city and the women from terraces enjoyed the sight of कृष्ण and राम. On the way he met a washerman and asked for good clothes. On his refusal, he was killed, and all his clothes taken and distributed to his Gopas. Then they met a garland-maker सुदाम who voluntarily offered flower- garlands. Him he blessed and went. Next he saw a hunch- back woman carrying unguents to कंसा. For the mere asking she offered the whole of it to them. So कृष्ण con- verted her to a handsome lady who invited him to her house. This was agreed after finishing his work. Then they went through the bazaar and were rewarded with betels, sandal, etc., by merchants. Lastly they entered the place where the bow festival was held. कृष्ण broke it easily. The guards who attacked them were put to death. It was evening when they returned to the camp outside the city. <F>२०:  भा. X. Chaps. ३७. ४२; Vi. V. १६. 7-१६, २३; Chaps. १८, १९.</F> On his way to the wrestlers' arena, कृष्ण vanquished कुवलयापीड with some effort. Taking its tusks, entered the enclosure with बलराम. Accepted challenge from the wrestler चानूर. The latter fell dead after fighting. The same fate met शल and तोशलक. Finding कंसा ready to attack his relations, कृष्ण overpowered him and killed him in a minute: condoled with the women of the dead and set his parents free; consoled his parents for their troubles and was embraced by them in love. Enthroned Ugrasena, as Yadus could not sit on the throne owing to a curse of ययाति. A regin of peace ushered in मथुरा. <F>२१:  भा. X. Chaps. ४३-44 and ४६. 1-१९; Vi. V. 9. 8-३३; Chap. २०.</F> [पगे१-441+ ३८] Nanda and Gopas were sent back to Vraja with honours. उपनयनम् of कृष्ण. With बलराम Kr2s2n2a went to सान्दीपनि and learnt all arts in ६४ days. Hearing that सान्दीपनि's son was washed away by the sea at प्रभासा, कृष्ण went to the spot and was told by the seagod that an Asura पञ्चजन carried him off. Then he went to Yama's abode, and recovering his son, handed him over to the गुरु as गुरुदक्षिण and came home. Requested Uddhava to go to Vraja with a message from him to Nanda and Gopis that he would be visiting them shortly. As promised he went to Sairandhri's house with Uddhava. It was decorated according to rules of कामशास्त्र, and after a brief stay, left it for अक्रूर's with Uddhava and राम. अक्रूर extended a royal welcome. कृष्ण praised him as their गुरु and requested him to go to हास्तिनपुर् and find out the position of the पाण्डवस्. Returned to their residence. <F>२२:  भा. X. ४५. २०-49; Chaps. ४६-48; Vi. V. २५. १९-31.</F> कृष्ण heard of the siege of मथुरा by जरासन्ध and was devis- ing a plan of attack when two chariots descended from heaven fully armoured. Also सुदर्शन, his चक्र and other weapons came down to him and to राम. राम took a chariot and the हल (plough), but was considered by जरा- sandha as a boy and not his equal. कृष्ण made defence arrangements at the four gates, and went out in his chariot of Garuda ensign by the northern gate to where Caidya and मागध were. Caidya's challenge and death; prevented राम from fettering जरासन्ध, and entered the city in victory and gave the spoils of war to Ugrasena, their king. Second and third defence of मथुरा. Prevented Kum- भाण्ड and कूपकर्ण from using माया in war by the application of विज्ञानास्त्र। Honoured after victory by the सभा of the Yadus. <F>२३:  भा. X. Chaps. ५०-52 (v).</F> He next desired to see Gomanta and the hill fortress. Left with राम towards the south crossing the यमुना, and many towns and villages. Saw on the way परशुराम engaged in austere तपस् and bowed to him. परशुराम [पगे१-442+ ३९] suggested killing श्र्गालवासुदेव, a wicked chieftain of करवीरपुर at the foot of the Gomanta. When they reached the place, शृगालवासुदेव offered fight, and his head was cut off by कृष्ण. Welcomed by the citizens of करवीरपुर, they spent there four months after sending the spoils of war to मथुरा. Got up the hill Gomanta where गरुड met कृष्ण and placing his crown on his head, left. Reached मथुरा with a large army. Finding Yavana besieging the city and जरासन्ध leading the eighteenth expedition,, कृष्ण in consultation with राम resolved to build a fortress of १२ yojanas in the sea to place their kith and kin in security. So a city was built according to वास्तु शास्त्र to which Indra sent सुधर्मा and पारिजात। वरुण supplied horses and Kubera the eight निधिस्। It became a यादव settlement. Attacked by (काल) Yavana, कृष्ण unarmed fled to the cave where Mucukunda was asleep. Here Yavana was burnt to ashes by Mucukunda's energy. Mucukunda's surprise to see कृष्ण and his prayer for salva- tion. कृष्ण spoke of his future birth as ब्राह्मण and final salvation. <F>२४:  Ib. X. Chap. ५३ (v) and ५०-51; Vi. V. Chaps. २२-3.</F> कृष्ण returned to Ugrasena at मथुरा, raised the siege of Yavana troops and went to द्वारका with his plunder. On the way जरासन्ध's army in मकर व्यूह attacked him but was broken by throwing a huge tree. Returned to द्वारका with spoils of war left by Yavanas. जरासन्ध's attack again when राम and कृष्ण fled to the Gomanta whose topcrest was burnt, while जरासन्ध thought they were dead they reached द्वारका safe. <F>२५:  भा. X. Chap. ५२; Vi. V. २४. 1-7.</F> Sent कृतवर्ण to ascertain from हास्तिनापुर whether पाण्डवस् had defeated Drupada. Married रुक्मिणि by the राक्षस form of mar- riage, defeating जरासन्ध and others of the Caidya party in battle. Received with due honours the ब्राह्मण mes- senger from रुक्मिणि and promised to do the needful. With the ब्राह्मण and राम, कृष्ण drove from आनर्तस् to Vidarbhas in a night. Was honoured by भीष्मक and allotted separate residence outside his capital. Ladies of [पगे१-443+ ३८] कुण्डिन said that कृष्ण was suitable to रुक्मिणि. Seeing रुक्मिणि returning from the Devi temple, he took her in his chariot in the midst of other kings and drove fast. जरा- sandha and others pursued but soon returned with dis- appointment. Rukmi's resolve to kill कृष्ण and then enter कुण्डिन. When he offered battle and was about to be killed, Rukmini appealed to the Lord to save her brother. At this he was tied to the chariot with his hair and moustache shaved. Advised by राम that punishment of रुक्मी was not in order. Married रुक्मिणि according to शाश्त्रस् amidst festivities in द्वारका. Owing to शिव's grace, got sacred sons of whom one was Pradyumna by Ruk- मिणी, being काम in a previous birth. Killed Sambara who stole the baby. Saw the lost Pradyumna and his wife रती in his residence, and hearing their account from नारद, embraced the couple. Present at Pradyumna's marriage. <F>२६:  भा. X. Chaps. ५३-55; Vi. V. २६. 2-११; Chap. २७; २८. 2-8.</F> Requested सत्राजित to give the Syamantaka gem for their king but he refused. Suspected by सत्राजित to be res- ponsible for his brother Prasena's disappearance in the forest; recovered the jewel from जाम्बवन् after fight- ing for २८ days, and got also his daughter जाम्बवती in marriage. The jewel was returned to सत्राजित in the public assembly. Married सत्राजित's daughter सत्यभामा, and when the jewel was offered, it was returned. Went with राम to the Kurus after the rumoured death of the पाण्ड- vas and Kunti; met the पाण्डवस् at पाञ्चाल city in the guise of ब्राह्मणस्; killed शतधन्वन्, the murderer of his father-in-law सत्राजित. Sent for अक्रूर and asked him to exhibit Syamantaka in his possession, and returned it to him afterwards. <F>२७:  भा. X. Chaps. ५६-57; Br. III. 7. ३०१; ३६. १५ and २१; ६८-28; ७१. ४६-96; M. ४५. ३४; Vi. IV. १३. ६४-98. १४२-157.</F> कृष्ण once went to हास्तिनापुर to see the पाण्डवस् and was heartily welcomed. Paid respects to युधिष्ठिर and भीम, embraced Arjuna and received respects from Nakula and Sahadeva. कुन्ती welcomed him also. When he was spending that winter there, he went to the forest [पगे१-444+ ४१] with Arjuna for hunting and there met an accomplished lady when Arjuna addressed. Hearing that she was the daughter of the Sun waiting to marry कृष्ण, the latter took her home. In the meantime कृष्ण asked विश्वकर्मा to build a city for the पाण्डवस्. Acting as Arjuna's charioteer, he caused the खाण्डव forest to be given over to fire. Returned to द्वारका and married कालिन्दी, Sun's daughter. Then he married मित्रविन्दा of Avanti, an aunt's daughter. Received सत्या, daughter of Nagnajit of अयोध्या by curb- ing the ferocity of seven bulls, with a large dowry of chariots, elephants and treasure. Jealous kings were driven away by Arjuna. Married another aunt's daughter भद्रा. Took लक्ष्मणा, daughter of the Madra king and thousands of maidens from Naraka's harem. <F>२८:  भा. X. Chap. ५८.</F> Indra came one day to द्वारका and reported to कृष्ण the mischief done to him by Naraka. Entering प्राग्ज्योतिष, कृष्ण pulled down ramparts and walls and cut off Mura's five heads. His seven sons attacked him led by पाठ in vain. Naraka also attacked and had his head cut off. कृष्ण entered the city welcomed by its people, saw मणिपर्वत of Indra and the umbrella of वरुण and gave them back to them. Earth, mother of Naraka came before कृष्ण and handed over the कुण्डलस् of Aditi, informing him that Naraka was her son by the touch of Hari in वाराह form. Then he entered the harem of the Asura and sent away १६००० (some १६१००) maidens to द्वारका and them he married, after distributing the spoils of war among his fellow companions. <F>२९:  भा. X. Chap. ५९; Vi. V. २९. १३-35; ३१. १४-20</F> Had by his wives १८००० sons. With सत्यभामा he visited Indra's abode and after giving the कुण्डलस् to Aditi, he came back with पारिजात against Indra's will, because his queen wanted it. He enjoyed the company of all his wives, taking a separate form for each wife. Indra's attack on कृष्ण with gods like वरुण, वायु, etc., for taking away पारिजात। Their defeat and Indra's apology. कृष्ण consoled him. Welcomed back in द्वारका. <F>३०:  भा. X. ५९. २२-45; Chap. ६५ (v) to ६७ (v); Vi. V. Chap. ३०; ३१. 1-१०.</F> [पगे१-445+ ३७] Love quarrel with his consort रुक्मिणी described. Once when कृष्ण was sitting at leisure, रुक्मिणि who was nearby fanned him. कृष्ण indulged in fun and asked her how she chose a poor fellow like him leaving princes of equal status with her, and added that he was willing to let her go and marry a powerful क्षत्रिय prince. This put out poor Ruk- मिणि who wept bitterly, speaking words showing her unflinching loyalty to him. Noticing her sincerity कृष्ण consoled her that he simply cut a joke. He said that she knew him to be Hari to whom राजऋषिस् like अङ्ग, नहुष and Gaya had dedicated their lives leaving their kingdoms, and that ब्रह्मा and शिव sang his praises. कृष्ण assured her of his loyalty to her. In this way he led a household life just like an ordinary mortal. Each one of his eight chief queens gave birth to ten sons, and each thought that कृष्ण was only living with her, as there was a कृष्ण by the side of each lady including the १६००० of Naraka's harem. He played with them blindman's buff, exchanging betels, scents, etc. The chief queens were Rukmini, सत्यभामा, जाम्ब- वती, सत्या, कालिन्दी, माद्रि, मित्रविन्दा, and भद्रा. Attended Aniruddha's marriage with रोचना at भोजकट. Heard from नारद of Aniruddha's imprisonment by बाण of १००० arms and besieged शोनितपुर. Defeated शिव who came on बाणा's behalf and at शिव's request, let बाण go with his four arms remaining. Returned to द्वारका with Aniruddha and उषा. <F>३१:  भा. X. Chaps. ६०-63; Vi. IV. १५. ३०-4; V. ३३. १२-53.</F> Heard from a ब्राह्मण of the externment of पाण्ड- vas to the forest, and riding on a chariot with सत्यभामा, met them and consoled them; came back with सुभद्रा and Abhimanyu. Heard a report of a huge lizard in a well, and lifting it up, he found it to be a divinity who revealed him- self as king नृग and who went to heaven. Taught the citizens of द्वारक on the invisilability of ब्राह्मणस्’ property. <F>३२: भा. X. Chap. ६४.</F> [पगे१-446+ ३७] कृष्ण heard of पौण्ड्रक's invasion of द्वारका in his absence. Had a message from him either to give up the title of वासुदेव or offer battle. Ugrasena and others laughed at this. कृष्ण went to काशी and had the heads of पौण्ड्रक and his ally cut off and their army destroyed. कृष्ण's return to द्वारक. An आभिचार Agni was sent by पौण्ड्- raka's son through the grace of शिव but was vanquished by Hari's चक्र। By his योग power कृष्ण appeared at the mansions of each of his १६००० wives, engaged in a normal domestic life. When नारद entered every house, he saw the same कृष्ण in each; got up early in the morning and meditated on Brahman; gave cows, etc., to the ब्राह्मणस्, saw first ghee, then mirror, cows, gods, etc. Heard from a messenger of the difficulties of kings imprisoned by जरा- sandha. Advised by Uddhava to vanquish जरासन्ध with the aid of भीम at युधिष्ठिर's राजसूय। कृष्ण's route to हास्तिनापुर where he was received by the पाण्डवस्. द्रौपदी welcomed his wives and, these were put up com- fortably. Hearing जरासन्ध still unconquered, कृष्ण with भीम and Arjuna went to Girivraja in ब्राह्मणस्’ disguise and asked for meals. They then threw off their disguise and called him to battle in which भीम won. After releasing prisoners, कृष्ण enthroned Sahadeva, son of जरासन्ध. <F>३३:  Ib. X. Chaps. ६७-73; M. ४७, १४; Vi. V. ३१. 4-२८.</F> The kings thus released after the fall of जरासन्ध were २०८००, praised the Lord and requested that they might ever remember Him. कृष्ण asked them to go back to their places and assume charge of governments by ruling righteously. Sahadeva arranged their bath, dress and meals, after which they left for where युधिष्ठिर and his family were. Received the first honour in the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर when शिशुपाल protested in a vilifying speech. His head was cut off. Lived in हास्तिनापुर for some months at the request of युधिष्ठीर and others. Attended to अर्घ्य and पाद्य for ब्राह्मणस् in the राजसूय। Welcomed नारद who informed him of the necessity of vanquishing शाल्व. Left for द्वारका hearing of its blockade by शाल्व [पगे१-447+ ३७] who applied illusory powers. कृष्ण broke his car and killed him. कृष्ण went as an ambassador of the पाण्डवस् to Dur- yodhana. He was sought to be made prisoner in vain; came back determined to declare war. In the war served as Arjuna's charioteer, and after the war कृष्ण condoled with धृतराष्ट्र and after anointing युधिष्ठीर, returned to द्वारका. One day there came Kucaila, a ब्राह्मण classmate of कृष्ण, a poor man with many children. Induced by his wife he visited कृष्ण who welcomed him with रुक्मिणि, indulged in talks of old school days, partook of the पृथुक rice which Kucaila's wife had sent, and sent him away after keeping him for a night. <F>३४: भा. X. Chaps. ७६-78; ८१. 1-१३.</F> Left for स्यमन्तपञ्चक for solar eclipse, met Gopis there and taught them the nature of the Absolute. Sages waited on him and praised his glory. His joy at Vasudeva's sacrifice. Honoured Nanda. Praised by his father, कृष्ण replied that आत्म is only one. At the request of देवकी to get back all her sons killed by कम्सा, कृष्ण entered Sutalam and with leave of Bali, took them to his mother who embraced them in affection. These children who were degraded gods gained their old form and went to heaven. <F>३५: Ib. X. Chaps. ८२-85.</F> सुभद्रा was his sister, and Arjuna carried her off with his knowledge and against the wish of बलराम. He went with sages to मिथिला where was his ब्राह्मण devotee श्रु- tadeva. The latter and the king मैथिला welcomed him and requested him to stay. कृष्ण did not like to disoblige them and so stayed in both houses taking two different forms, thus purifying Nimi line, and pleasing श्रुतदेव. <F>३६: Ib. X. Chap. ८६.</F> Performed अश्वमेध sacrifice in the course of which he had to go to वैकुण्ठ with Arjuna to recover the lost children of a द्वारका Bra1hman2a who preferred a complaint. After return with the lost boy, he had his अवभृत cele- [पगे१-448+ ३८] brated in the यमुना. Then he continued his righteous rule and spent a good time in द्वारका enjoying pleasures with his chosen wives. <F>३७: Ib. X. Chaps. ८८-90.</F> His service to the world was to kill Daityas and relieve the burden of the Earth. Resolved to destroy the Yadu race and reach his eternal abode; approved of the curse of the sages against the Yadu race. ब्रह्मा and other gods visited him, appealing to him to go back to वैकुण्ठ. He agreed. Uddhava expressed a wish to follow him but was advised by कृष्ण to lead a righteous life. Incidentally कृष्ण narrated to him the conversation of a certain अवधूत and Yadu. Insisting on यम and नियम, and duties incumbent on वर्ण and आश्रम। Then he described who was said to be in bondage, who was a free man and a righteous person, and he also explained the need and importance of सत्सन्ग। He proceeded to instruct Uddhava on the nature of the गुणस्, and their causes, laying emphasis on सत्व गुण। Then he explained भक्ति, ध्यान, सिद्धिस् and their nature. He afterwards narrated the विभूतिस् of Hari, described the dharmas of वर्ण and आश्रम, explained what was ज्ञान and विज्ञान, giving a list of duties to be observed by all. He further instructed on the three योगस्--ज्ञान, कर्म and भक्ति, on the Vedas, and on the principles of साङ्ख्य and साङ्ख्यविधि। He then narrated the story of an Avanti ब्राह्मण who turned out ascetic after being a miser. He enumerated the different characteristics of the three गुणस् and the evil effects of bad association, recapitulating क्रिया- योग, ज्ञान योग अन्द् भक्ति योग। Lastly Uddhava was advised to go to Badari. <F>३८: Ib. XI. XI. Chaps. 1-२८.</F> Advised his relations to go to प्रभास, and there deluded by him, they fought among themselves and died. बलराम also met his death. कृष्ण heard this while sit- ting under a पिप्पल tree. A hunter जरा by name aimed his shaft at his foot little thinking that it was the Lord. Coming to know that it was कृष्ण he regretted much. कृष्ण consoled him and permitted him to go to Heaven. [पगे१-449+ ४४] कृष्ण addressed his charioteer दामक to go to द्वारका, and advise the people there to leave for Hastinapura with Arjuna. Invited by gods कृष्ण entered his धाम, while his wives entered fire. <F>३९: Ib. XI. Chaps. ३०-31; Vi. V. ३७. 1-4; ४७-75.</F> It was the first day of Kali yuga. <F>३९: a)Ib. XI. Chaps. ३०-31; Vi. V. ३७. 1-4; ४७-75.</F> Resides in Sutalam; the मन्त्र sacred to; <F>४०: Br. II. २०. २१; III. ३४. 9 and ३४; ३६. ११४ and ४८; ४१. 8; ७१. १९६-7.</F> as पुरुष with लक्ष्मी as प्रकृति; the sacred Hari. <F>४१: Ib. IV. 6. ३०; 8. २८; 9. ४८-55; २९. १२६; ३९. ५९; ४०. 8.</F> One of the five वम्शवीरस्. <F>४२: Ib. III. ७२. 1.</F> After his great Decease Arjuna felt himself powerless even against आभिरस्; <F>४३: Vi. V. ३८. ४७-51; VI. 8. 3, 9.</F> help- ed Arjuna to overcome the arrow ब्रह्मशिरस् of अश्व- थाम; advised him to accept Draupadi's plea to release him and to treat him as a ब्रह्मबन्धु। Went with द्रौपदी and party to attend the funeral rites of her sons, on the Ganges; anointed युधिष्ठिर on the throne. When he was about to leave for द्वारका, उत्तरा ran to him for help to the child in her womb against a burning missile. This was granted. कुन्ती's praise of. Followed युधिष्ठिर to see the dying भीष्म who welcomed and praised him. Painful leave-takings. Praise by women of हस्तिनापुर. Escorted by युधिष्ठिर's army and passing through many lands reached द्वारका. Blew his conch as a sign of his arrival. Welcome in the city. Paid his respects to the wives of his father and enjoyed the company of his १६१०८ wives. <F>४४: भा. I. Chaps. 7-१२.</F> His feet marked with पद्म, वज्र, अङ्कुश and ध्वज। <F>४५: Ib. I. १६. १७ and ३४.</F> An able charioteer, councillor, friend, ambassador, soldier and protector of devotees. Remembered by शिव; called with राधा on the Lord and पार्वती, and spoke to the latter on the greatness of विनायक with whom he renewed his friendship. Praised परसुराम's heroism; no difference between कृष्ण and शिव. <F>४६: Br. III. ४२. १८-55; ४३. १२-24; ४४. २९; ७१. ३६ and ८५.</F> Married three daughters of भन्गकार and Vrata- [पगे१-450+ ३८] वती; also महादेव; a contemporary of हिरण्यकशिपु; <F>४७: M. ४५. २०-21; ४७. 1 and ३५.</F> महात्म्य of, in the Brahmavaivarta; prayed to by Aditi. <F>४८: M. ५३. ३४-5; ६०. 4; २४५. ३३-6; २५०. ४६.</F> on the very day he left this earth, Kaliyuga began. <F>४९: M. २७३. ४९; Vi. IV. २४. १११-3.</F> a वृष्णि; <F>५०: M. ४५. १०.</F> worship of, before gifts. <F>५१: M. १८१. १७; २४५. ६२; २४६. २०. ३६, ४४; २४८. ४४; २७४. १५.</F> When कृष्ण was born १६००० goddesses and १४ gan2as of Apsaras were reborn in the world to serve the Lord in his quest. <F>५२: वा. ९६. २३२ ff.</F>

III. 3. १९.</F> wife अरणि and son शुक; author of the पुराण शास्त्र; <F>2:  Br. III. 8. ९२; IV. 4. ५०.</F> father of धृतराष्ट्र, वीदुर and पाण्डु by the widows of विचित्रवीर्य and their female servant. Another wife पीवरि, by whom he got five sons and one daughter. <F>3:  M. ५०. ४६; १८५. ३०; वा. ९९. २४१; Vi. IV. २०. ३८; VI. 2. ३२.</F> Divided the Vedas into four parts: an अवतार् of नारायण; <F>4:  Vi. III. 4. 3-१०.</F> the compiler of the महाभारत।

(IV)--a planet with a chariot of 8 horses, all green; <F>1:  Br. II. २३. ९०; २४. १३६ and ३९; M. ९३. १०; १२७. ११; वा. ५२. ८२; १११. 5; Vi. II. १२. २३.</F> in size one-fourth less than बृहस्पति. <F>2:  M. १२८. ६४.</F> धूमकेतु, the first among the Ketus. <F>3:  वा. ५३. १११.</F>
(V)--a son of Danu. M. 6. १८.
(VI)--the second son of Druhyu. M. ४८. 6.
(VII)--one of the प्राणहिनस् of the king. वा. ५७. ६९.
(I)--a son of अम्बरीष. भा. IX. 6. 1.
(II)--the son of Dhanvantari and father of भीमरथ. भा. IX. १७. 5; Br. III. ६७. २५; वा. ९२. २३; Vi. IV. 8. ११.

(III)--(Rajasa-वा। प्।) a लोकपाल of लोका- loka; <F>1:  Br. II. ११. ४३; २१. १५७; ३६. ३१; III. 8. १९; वा. ५०. २०६; Vi. II. 8. ८३.</F> son of राजस (ब्र्। प्।) and मार्कण्डेयी and overlord of the west. <F>2:  M. 8. १०; १२४. ९५; वा. २८. ३७.</F> [पगे१-457+ ३३]
(IV)--any यक्ष; a son of पुण्यजनी and मणि- bhadra. Br. II. 7. १२५; वा. ६२. २८; ६९. १५६.
(V)--the son of क्षेम, and father of Suketu. Br. III. ६७. ७४.
(VI)--a son of सुतार, the lord of second द्वापर। वा. २३. १२१.
(VII)--king of the western region. वा. ७०. १७; Vi. I. २२. १३.
(I)--a son of आग्निध्र, and पूर्वचित्ति; <F>1:  भा. V. 2. १९; वा. ३३. ४०; Vi. II. 1. १७.</F> Lord of गन्धमादन vars2a. <F>2:  Br. II. १४. ४७ and ५२; वा. ३३. ४५. Vi. II. 1. २३.</F>

(II)--a continent bounded on one side by माल्यवत्, and traversed by the stream चक्षुस्. विष्णु reveals himself here as कामदेव when लक्ष्मी praises his glory. <F>1:  भा. V. १६. १०; १७. 7; १८. १५-23; M. ८३. ३३; ११३. ४४, ४९-50; Vi. II. 2. २४.</F> Conquered by परीक्षित्. <F>2:  भा. I. १६. १३.</F> Adjacent to Meru and noted for पनस tree; <F>3:  Br. II. १५. ५०-4; वा. ३४. ५७.</F> of Mlecchas; <F>4:  वा. ४२. ४७.</F> माल, thrown by Indra during the churning of the ocean, struck on a tree there and hence the name; description of; <F>5:  वा. ३५. ३६-40; ४१. ८५; ४३. 1-4; ४४. 1-२५.</F> विष्णु in the form of वराह. <F>6:  Vi. II. 2. ५०.</F>
--a son of दारुक and an अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १९६. [पगे१-458+ २४]
--a महावृक्ष of the Mandara hill with scented leaves and flowers. वा. ३५. २०-2, ४४.
--a son of तामस Manu. Vi. III. 1. १९.
--a दानव: a son of Danu. Br. III. 6. 6; M. 6. १८.
--a son of भृगु, an अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १४९.
(I)--a क्षेत्रम् in which वृक performed तपस् to शिव; a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस् and the goddess मार्ग- दायीनी. भा. X. ८८. १७; M. १३. ३०; २२. ११; १८१. २९.
(II)--one of the forms of ब्रह्मा in the गया stone. वा. १०६. ५६; १११. ७२.
(I)--a son of आण्डिर, after whom came the केरलदेश. Br. III. ७४. 6; M. ४८. 5.
(II)--one of the four sons of जनापिड; with him kingdom of Kerala came into being. वा. ९९. 6. [पगे१-459+ ३२]

(I)--of the दक्षिणापथ; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ५६; M. ११४. ४६; वा. ४५. १२४; ४७. ५२.</F> visited by बलराम; king of, went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for solar eclipse; <F>2:  भा. X. ७९. १९; ८२. १३.</F> people of, enlisted by जरासन्ध against the Yadus. <F>3:  Ib. X. [५० (v) 2].</F>
(II)--Pravara sages. M. १९९. १७.
--a son of ब्रह्मधान. Br. III. 7. ९८.
(I)--the son of Nara (Candra-वि। प्।) and father of Bandhumat. भा. IX. 2. ३०; Br. III. 8. ३६; ६१. 9; वा. ८६. १४; Vi. IV. 1. ४२-3.
(II) a deva (Ajita). Br. II. १३. ९४; वा. ३१. 7.
(III)--a pupil of याज्ञवल्क्य. Br. II. ३५. २९.
(IV)--the son of सुवृद्धि and father of सुधृति. Vi. IV. 1. ३८-9.
--(Ramya) (s.v.) a Mt. in शाकद्वीपम्. वा. ४९. ८४.
(III)--a तीर्थम् in Benares. M. १८५. ६८.
--an Asura. Vi. V. २९. 4.

--son of कृतध्वज and skilled in devo- tion; banished in hostility खाण्दिक्य from his kingdom; once a tiger slew his milch cow; to find out the प्रायश्चित्त he went to consult कशेरु who sent him to Sunaka and he commended the name of खाण्डिक्य. So he went to the forest clad in deer-skin like a religious student and demanded the form of penance. खाण्डिक्य thought at first that he had come there to kill him, took up his bow, but laid it aside; instruction was received and the penance was over. केशि felt that some fee was due to खाण्डिक्य and once more called on him; though his councillors advised him to take back the kingdom, his mind hankering after the other world; he requested for his fee for his instruction on the doctrine of soul; after imparting instruction on योग to खाण्डिक्य retired to a life of peace and attained liberation; father of भानुमत्. भा. IX. १३. २०-21. Vi. VI. 6. 5-५०; 7. १०१-06.
(I)--a son of Vasudeva and कौशल्य; the family of. भा. IX. २४. ४८.

(II)--an asura friend of कम्सा. Set up by him, केशिन् appeared in Vraja as a huge horse and attacked कृष्ण with his feet. Being thrown off by कृष्ण, he fell at a dis- tance. Recovering his consciousness, he once again attack- ed कृष्ण when the latter thrust his arm into his mouth until he was suffocated to death. भा. X. 2. 1; ३६. २०; ३७. 1-8, २५; ४३. २५; II. 7. ३४; वा. ९८. १००; Vi. V. 1. २४; 4. 1-2; १२. २१. [पगे१-461+ २५]
(III)--a दानव king; <F>1:  Br. IV. २९. १२४.</F> defeated and slain by पुरूरवस् when he was forcibly taking away चित्रलेखा and उर्वशी. The latter was handed over to Indra. <F>2:  M. २४. १२, २३-5.</F>
(I)--the mother of रावण. भा. VII. 1. ४३.
(II)--a queen of Sagara and mother of Asa- मञ्जस; a वम्शकर्त by Aurva's grace; the daughter of Vidarbha king. भा. IX. 8. १५; Br. III. ४९. 2 and ५९; ५१. ३७; ६३. १५४; वा. ८८. १५५-160; Vi. IV. 4. 1-5.
(III)--a daughter of खशा, and राक्षसी. Van- quished by कृष्ण. Br. III. 7. १३९; ७३. १००: वा. ६९. १७०.
(IV)--the wife of Suhotra, and mother of Janhu. Br. III. ६६. २५.
(V)--one of the queens of अजमीढ. M. ४९. ४४: वा. ९९. १६७.
(VI)--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २३.
--यक्ष-ra1ks2asas from यक्ष Kampana. वा. ६९. १७७.
--a class of पिशाचस्. Br. III. 7. ३८०. [पगे१-462+ २९]
--the Mt. from whose summits the सीता descends. भा. V. १७. 6.
--between hills Kumuda and अञ्जन; विष्णु's temple located at. वा. ३८. ४५-8.
(I)--an Asura in a city in in रसातलम् (VI tala or शूतल-वा। प्।). Br. II. २०. ३९; वा. ५०. ३८.
(II)--wife अञ्जन, whom वायु loved and gave birth to हनुमान्. Br. III. 7. २२३.
(III)--a Mt. of शाकद्वीप, having all medicinal herbs. Br. II. १९. ९०; Vi. II. 4. ६२.
--the husband of श्रुतकीर्ति. Br. III. ७१. १५७.
--Five in number born of धृष्टकेतु and and श्रुतकीर्ति. Its king was vanquished by कृष्ण. See केकयस्। भा. IX. २४. ३८; II. 7. ३५.
--कश्यप gotrakaras. M. १९९. 7.

--Daughter of मालिन्. Mother of रावण and others. <F>1:  Br. III. 8. ४० and ४७.</F> केकसी (रामायण) one of the four wives of विश्- ravas, and mother of three sons, रावण, कुम्भकर्ण and विभीषण and a daughter शूर्पणखा. <F>2:  वा. ७०. ३४, ४१.</F> [पगे१-463+ २५]
--a son of शिबि. His ten daughters were queens of सत्राजित्. भा. IX. २३. 3; M. ४५. १९.
--surname of भद्रा, a wife of कृष्ण. भा. X. ५७. ५६.
--the Yavanas; not duly crowned kings, rule after the Mauryas; chief among them was विन्ध्यशक्ति; nine kings rule for १०६ years. Vi. IV. २४. ५५-56.

(I)--an Asura (Daitya-वा। प्।) slain by Hari, <F>1:  भा. III. २४. १८; VI. १२. 1; X. ४०. १७; वा. २५. ३०, ५४.</F> born with Madhu, representing the qualities of तमस् and रजस्। <F>2:  M. १७०. 1; १७८. 6-१८.</F>
(II)--an Asura slain by दुर्गा. Br. II. ३७. 2; IV. २९. ७५.
(I)--a pravara sage. M. १९९. १६.
(II)--a kingdom noted for horses. Here मूक was vanquished by Arjuna. Br. III. 5. ३६; IV. १६. १८.
--sacred to लिलिता. Br. IV. ४४. ९७.

--the abode of शिव seated on a bani- yan tree and of यक्षस्, full of different plants, trees and flowers, birds and beasts. Here are the city of अलका, and the forest Saugandhika. <F>1:  भा. IV. 5. २६; VI. 8. ३३; IX. 4. ५५; X. १०. 2; ५५ [1]; M. ५४. 3; ६२. 2; वा. ३०. ८५; ३५. 9; ३६. २४; ३८. ३३; ४१. 1; ४२. ३२; ४७. 1; ५०. ४८; ५४. ३५-6; १०१. ३०३.</F> It is located on the south of Meru, <F>2:  भा. V. १६. २७; Vi. II. 2. ४२.</F> on the Himalayan slopes; the residence of Kubera. Describ- ed. <F>3:  Br. II. १८. 1-4; २०. ५०, २५. २४-40; III. १३. ३६; २२. ५६; २५. 9; ४१. १८; IV. 9. ३०; १०. २७.</F> North of Atri's hermitage. <F>4:  M. १२१. 2-5; १६३. ८५; १८३. 1.</F>
--a form of temple with 9 storeys and a तोरण with ४० हस्तस्। M. २६९. २८-31, ४७.
--a royal line (tribe?) established by विश्- वस्फाणि, kings of. Br. III. ७४. १९१; M. ५०. ७६; वा. ९९. २६८, ३७८; Vi. IV. २४. ६२.
--the state of becoming one with the Brah- man; one gets this at Benares; <F>1:  M. १४३. ३४; १८०. ५९.</F> arises from ज्ञानम्। <F>2:  वा. १०२. ७९. Ib. ५९. ११८.</F>
(I)--a son of Vidarbha; father of Cidi, after whom caidyas came to be known. Br. III. ७०. ३७; M. ४४. ३६-38; Vi. IV. १२. ३७.
--of seven रूपस्। वा. ८७. ३५ and ३६.
--said ‘कुह’, and the time came to be known कुहू। Br. II. २५. २९; २८. ५८.
--a kingdom through which ऋषभ passed; Arhat was king. <F>1:  भा. V. 6. 7 and 9.</F> A southern country; <F>2:  Br. II. १६. ५९.</F> unfit for श्राद्ध। <F>3:  M. १६. १६.</F>
--an evil spirit and mother of बाण. Appeared naked and with dishevelled hair before कृष्ण who had deprived बाण of his chariot. A वर्ण शक्ति। <F>2:  Br. IV. ४४. ५९.</F> ^1 भा. X. 6. २८; ६३. २०.
--the goddess enshrined at कोटितीर्थम्. M. १३. ३७.
(I)--a क्षेत्रम् in प्रयाग; sacred to कोटवी. M. १३. ३७; १०६. ४४; वा. ११२. ३२.
(II)--on the नर्मदा; the Lord enshrined here is कोटीश्वर. Here asuras were slain by शिव; a man who bathes there becomes king and a woman equal to गौरी. M. १९१. 7-१३.
--one of the three kinds of ग्रहबलि-- detailed. M. ९३. 6; ११९-139; २३९. 1, १७-40.
--a mother goddess. M. १७९. २८. [पगे१-466+ २२]
--is श्री Ra1ma created by ललीत in her battle with भण्ड. Br. IV. २९. ११४.
--the adopted son of वस्तावन. वा. ९६. १९०.
--a pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. २१.
--Nine kings of the name Megha ruled here. Then came नैषधस्. Br. III. ७४. १८८; वा. ९९. ३७५. ७६.
--a kulaparvata of the भद्राश्व. वा. ४३. १४.
--a कौशिक and a sage. Br. II. ३२. ११८.
--an asura who was slain by चण्ड Ka1li. Br. IV. २८. ४२.
--of the S. country. वा. ४५. १२८.
--city sacred to ललिता (perhaps Kolhapur). Br. IV. ४४. ९७. [पगे१-467+ २५]
(I)--(Mt.) a hill of भारतवर्ष; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. २१; वा. ४५. ९०; Vi. III. १८. ७३.</F> the place where गयासुर performed austerities. <F>2:  वा. १०६. 5.</F>
(II)--the १२थ् battle between Asuras and Devas. Here राजि vanquished the Asuras; also the १२थ् and last incarnation of Hari. Br. III. ७२. ७६ and ८६; M. ४७. ४५ and ५३.
(III)--a son of सभानर and father of सञ्जय. M. ४८. ११.
--a tribe to which विन्ध्यशक्ति belonged. वा. ९९. ३६५.
--Mt. in भारतवर्ष. भा. V. १९. १६.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८५.
--a class of people in कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १६.
--a mother goddess. M. १७९. ३०.
--a ब्रह्मवादिनी. Br. II. ३३. १९.
--one of the five sons of Yadu. वा. ९४. 2.

--the kingdom of राम and his son कुश. Its people celebrated राम's arrival by instituting a festival. They were taken to heaven by the grace of राम. <F>1:  भा. IX. १०. 4 and ४२; V. १९. 8; वा. ७७. ३६; ८८. १९९; ९९. ४०२; Vi. II. 3. १७.</F> Its people took part in the राजसूय of युधिष्- ठीर. <F>2:  भा. X. ७५. १२.</F> Their king went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for solar eclipse. <F>3:  Ib. X. 2. १३.</F> Migration of Yadus to. <F>4:  Ib. X. 2. 3.</F> Its people met कृष्ण on the way to मिथिला with presents. <F>5:  Ib. X. ८६. २०.</F> A kingdom of Madhya- देश in the Vindhyas. कुश ruled it with his capital at कुशस्थली. <F>6:  Br. II. १६. ४१ and ६४; III. ६३. १९९; ७४. १९७.</F> Its king was defeated by परशुराम; <F>7:  Ib. III. ४१. ३९; ४८. १५.</F> ruled by nine kings at a time. <F>8:  Vi. IV. २४. ५९.</F>
--a tribe; a kingdom of the Janapada on the other side of the Vindhyas. M. ११४. ३५, ५३; १६३. ६७; वा. ४५. ११०, १३३; ९९. ३८५.
--is अयोध्या. Vi. IV. 4. १०३.
--a name of राम. Vi. IV. 4. १००.
--a pupil of लान्गल. Br. II. ३५. ४८.
--a sage of the Auttama epoch. M. 9. १४. [पगे१-469+ २४]
--a pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. १४.
--a भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. २६.
--a भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. २६.
--the ब्राह्मण who was responsible for van- quishing the Nandas and anointing Chandragupta Maurya. Br. III. ७४. १४३; M. २७२. २२; वा. ९९. ३३०; Vi. IV. २४. २६-7.
--नील-pra1s4ara. M. २०१. ३४.
(I)--a Tripravara sage. M. १९६. ३३-34.
(II)--a भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. २५.
--a son of पराशर, in charge of a संहिता. Br. II. ३५. ४५-6.
--the city of, got into the hands of Mlecchas. भा. XII. 1. ३९.
--a sage living in हरिशृङ्ग summoned by आगस्त्यस्. वा. ४७. ६०-61.
--कश्यप gotrakaras. M. १९९. 7. [पगे१-470+ २९]

(I)--(वर्ष) came to be called after कुमार, son of Havya; <F>1:  Br. III. 8. ६२; ३७. ३१; ६६. ७४; वा. ६१. ४६; ६४. २५; १०६. ३५; Vi. IV. 7. ११.</F> a continent with नारद hill. <F>2:  वा. ८८. ९०.</F> Br. II. १४. १८; वा. ३३. १७; M. १२२. २२.
(II)--(sarga) the ninth sarga. Vi. I. 5. २५.
(III)--an अवतार् of Hari. भा. I. 3. 6.
(I)--a kingdom of शाकद्वीप, adjoining the Raivata hill. Br. II. १४. १८; १९. ९२; वा. ४९. ८६.
(II)--a वर्ष noted for कुमारी ti1rtham protected by नागस्; centring round Raivata hill; after कुमार, son of Havya. Br. III. १३. ८६; वा. ३३. १७; ४९. ८६.
(I)--राक्षसस् fearful to children. वा. ६९. १९१.
(II)--a group of planets which do ill to children. Br. III. 7. १६०.

(II)--a mind-born mother; image of; the chief implements and adornment follow that of कुमार; the peacock for the riding animal, clad in red robes and wielding शूल and शक्ति। M. १७९. 9, २२; २६१. २७. [पगे१-471+ २३]
--the bludgeon of विष्णु reached कृष्ण on the occasion of the siege of मथुरा. भा. VIII. 4. १९; २०. ३१; X. ५०. ११. [१३]; Vi. V. २२. 6.
--a Mt. inhabited by गारुडस्. Br. III. 7. ४५४.
--कश्यप gotrakaras. M. १९९. 3.
--a pravara of अङ्गिरस्. M. १९६. १७.
--a pravara (Angiras). M. १९६. १७.
--the १५थ् कल्प begun on the full moon day. M. २९०. 6.
--a Rahasya yogini देवी. Br. IV. १९. ४८; ४४. १४१.
--a भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. २६.
--given to वामन by अङ्गिरस्. M. २४५. ८६. [पगे१-472+ २५]
--a kingdom that took its name after कुशल, son of Dyutimat. Also कुशल, adjoining क्रौञ्च hill in क्रौञ्चद्वीप. Br. II. १४. २४; १९. ७१.
--seven in number, and contemporaries of seven आन्ध्रस्, and lords of विदूर; then निषधस्. भा. XII. 1. ३५.
(I)--see हिरण्यनाभ। Br. II. ३५. ३८.
(II)--an आर्ष्रेयप्रवर of अङ्गिरस्. M. १९६. 9.
(I)--a wife of Vasudeva and mother of केशिन्--see भद्रा। भा. IX. २४. ४८.
(II)--a queen of दशरथ and mother of राम. Br. III. ३७. ३१; IV. ४०. ११२.
(III)--a queen of सात्वत; mother of Bhaja- मान and others; four branches of the line from them are important. M. ४४. ४७. वा. ९६. 1-2.
(IV)--a queen of कृष्ण. M. ४७. १४.
--of Agastya family. M. २०२. 1. [पगे१-473+ २५]
--an आर्षेय pravara of भार्गव. M. १९५. ३७.
--the capital of Nemicakra (Nicakru-व्। प्।) after Hastinapura was washed by floods; of विविक्षु. भा. IX. २२. ४०; वा. ९९. २७१; Vi. IV. २१. 8. M. ५०. ७९.
--see Maitreya. भा. IV. १३. 1.
(I)--a sage who called on dying भीष्म. भा. I. 9. 7.

(II)--practised वर्म नारायणात्मकम् and gave up his body. When Citraratha, the Gandharva crossed on his bones, he fell down to the earth, and on वालखिल्यस्’ suggestion, he gathered them and throwing into the Saras- वती, went away to his home. भा. VI. 8. ३८-40.
(III)--a name of Indra. भा. VI. १८. ६४.
(IV)--a name of विश्वामित्र (गाधि-वि। प्।) helped the banished Satyavrata to get a place among the planets out of gratitude for his having helped गालव during the १२ year famine.
(V)--a नाग residing in Tatvalam. Br. II. २०. १९.
(VI)--a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५३. [पगे१-474+ ३३]
(VII)--a son of Vasudeva and सैव्या (वैशालि- वि। प्।) adopted by his brother वृक, <F>1:  Br. III. ७१. १७४-5; १९३; वा. ९६. १८२; Vi. IV. १५. २५.</F> born of a वैश्य wife. <F>2:  M. ४६. २०.</F>

(VIII)--a sage by tapas of the epoch of सावर्णि; <F>1:  M. 9. ३२; १४५. ९३.</F> a sage of कुरुक्षेत्र who had seven sons who, during famine, had their guru's cow killed and after offer- ing it for श्राद्ध, made a meal themselves; but after five rebirths they attained final beatitude. These five rebirths detailed. <F>2:  Ib. १९. १२; Ch. २०.</F>
(IX)--a son of Vidarbha and father of चिदी. वा. ९५. ३६, ३८.
(XI)--adopted son of वस्तावन. वा. ९६. १८९.

--got different pravaras from the विस्वा- mitras; <F>1:  भा. IX. १६. ३७.</F> about २५ among them mentioned: पार्थिवस्, Deva- rathas, याज्ञवल्क्यस्, समर्षणस्, Udumbaras, उदुम्लानस्, तारकस्, यममुञ्चतस्, लोहिण्यस्, रेणवस्, काञ्षवस्, Babhravas, पाणिनस्, ध्यानजप्यस्, शालावक्यस्, हिरण्- याक्षस्, स्यङ्कृतस्, गालवस्, Devalas, यामदूतस्, सालङ्का- यनबाषकलस्, ददातिबादरस्, etc.; marriage alliances only with other ऋषि gotras allowed. <F>2:  वा. ९१. ९७-102.</F>
--the kingdom of. M. १२१. ५०.
--the wife of Suhotra and mother of Janhu. वा. ९१. ५४. [पगे१-475+ २८]
--descendants of कौशिक. M. २०. 1 ff.

--R. in भारतवर्ष from the Himalayas visited by बलराम; <F>1:  भा. I. १८ 36; V. १९. १८; X. ७९. 9; M. ११४, २२; १६३. ६०. Br. II. १२. १५; वा. ४५. ९७; १०८. ८१.</F> सत्यवती, mother of Jamadagni be- came converted into this river; <F>2:  भा. IX. १५. १२ Br. II. १६. २६; III. 7. ३५५; ६६. ५९; वा. ९१. ८८.</F> sacred to पितृस्; one of the wives of हव्यवाहन fire. <F>3:  M. २२. ६३; ५१. १४; वा. २९. १४.</F>
--on the नर्मदा. M. १९४. ४०-2.
--a sacred place for श्राद्ध offerings. Br. III. १३. १०९.
(I)--a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३३. 8.
(II)--a son of जटमालि of the १९थ् द्वापर। वा. २३. १८७.
--a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३३. १०.
--an आर्षेयप्रवर of अङ्गिरस्. M. १९६. 6.
--the collective name of the sons of काक्- षीवत्. M. ४८. ८८.
--a भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. २६.
--of Hari; <F>1:  भा. II. 2. १०; VIII. 4. १९; X. 3. 9; XI. १४. ४०; २७. २७; XII. ११. १०.</F> the festival that came out of the churning of the milk ocean. <F>2:  Br. IV. 9. ७३; M. २५०. 4; २५१. 3.</F>
--an apsaras with the sun in the spring. वा. ५२. 4.

(I)--a son of ब्रह्मा born of his hand; Married क्रिया, daughter of Kardama. His sons were the वाल- khilyas. Had not realised the Supreme Being. <F>1:  भा. III. १२. २२-23; २४. २३; IV. 1. ३९; २९. ४३; M. 3. 7; १०२. १९; वा. 3. 3; २५. ८२.</F> Father of तुषित group of Devas: Born in वारुणिक्रतु and hence the name. <F>2:  Br. II. ३२. ७६; ३५. ९२; ३६. 8; III. 1. २१ and ४४; वा. ६५. ४४.</F> A प्रजापति. <F>3:  वा. १०१. ३५, ४९.</F>
(II)--a son of Ulmuka and पुष्करिणी. भा. IV. १३. १७.
(III)--the husband of हयशिरस्. भा. VI. 6. ३४.
(IV)--a son of कृष्ण and जाम्बवती. भा. X. ६१. १२.
(V)--a ब्राह्मण invited for the राजसुय of युधिष्ठिर. भा. X. ७४. 8.
(VI)--(ऋटु-ब्र्। प्।) the यक्ष presiding over the month of तपस्य (फाल्गुण). भा. XII. ११. ४०. [पगे१-477+ ३०]

(VII)--created from अपान of ब्रह्मा, as ancient as सनत्कुमार and a yogin; <F>1:  Br. II. 5. ७०, ७९; 9. १८ and २४.</F> son-in-law of दक्ष by marrying his daughter Saun(t)अती; <F>2:  Ib. II. 9. ५६; ११. ३६.</F> sons were वाल- khilyas, ६००० in number. <F>3:  Ib. II. १३. ५३.</F>
(VIII)--a याम deva. Br. II. १३. ९२; वा. ३१. 6.

(IX)--with the Hemanta sun; <F>1:  Br. II. २३. १६; २७. १०४.</F> a sage in दारु- vana; no wife or son in the Vaivasvata epoch; adopted इध्मवाक. Praised शिव out to destroy Tripuram. <F>3:  M. १३३. ६७; १४५. ९०; १७१. २७; २०२. 8.</F> ^2 Br. III. 8. ७२; २३. 4; वा. ६१. ८४; ६२. ९२; ७०. ६६.
(X)--a Pratardana god. Br. II. ३६. ३१.
(XI)--a son of भृगु and a deva. Lives in Bhuvarlokam. Br. III. 1. ८९; ३६. 5; IV. 2. ४८; M. १९५. १३; वा. ६५. ८७.
(XIII)--a son of Vijaya, and father of Sunaya. Br. III. ६४. २२.
(XIV)--a Sutapa god. Br. IV. 1. १४.
(XV)--a son of आग्नेयी and Uru (Kuru-वि। प्।). M. 4. ४३; Vi. I. १३. 6. [पगे१-478+ २३]
(XVI)--a sage of the स्वायम्भुव epoch. वा. ३१. १६.
(XVII)--an Ajitadeva. वा. ६७. ३४.
(XVIII)--a mind-born son of ब्रह्मा married to क्षमा; <F>1:  Vi. I. 7. 5 and 7.</F> travelling with the sun in the month of पौष. <F>2:  Ib. II. १०. १४.</F>
(XIX)--a R. of the प्लक्षद्वीप. वा. ४९. १७.
(XX)--a name for R. इक्षु. वा. ४९. ९३.
(XXI)--a R. from the रिक्ष hill. Br. II. १६. ३१.
(XXII)--the name of the seventh kalpa. वा. २१. ३०.
--a son of कालनेमि. Br. III, 5. ३९.
--Dhaiva, यश, वाम, Gopa, देवायत, Aja, दुरोण, आप, Mahanja, चिकित्वान्, all सोमपायिन्स्. वा. ६२. 9-१२.
--the वेदव्यास of the seventeenth द्वा- पर। Vi. III. 3. १५.
--of Agastya family. M. २०२. 2.

--the apsaras designated पञ्चचूडा; यक्ष loved her and wandered through the नन्दन to meet her; found her in the midst of other apsarases; assuming the guise of Gandharva Vasuruci he approached her; she yielded and gave birth to सम्सिद्धकरण (राजबुनाभ-ब्र्। प्।); then he showed her his real form; on this the angry and fearful Apsaras ran away; she became thence-forward Yak- षमाता; then she and her son went to यक्षा's house. <F>1:  Br. III. 7. १०१-17; वा. ६९. १३६-50.</F> Resides in the sun's chariot in the month of चैत्र Madhu. <F>2:  Vi. II. १०. 3.</F>
--a son of Vidarbha, and father of Kunti. भा. IX. २४. 1 and 3; Br. III. ७०. ३७; M. ४४. ३६-8; Vi. IV. १२. ३७, ४०.
--a son of खशा, and a राक्षस; an asura in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु. Br. III. 7. १३३; M. १६१. ८०.
--the city of a राक्षस in the Sutalam. वा. ५०. २२.
--one of the ten branches of the सुकर्मण group of devas. Br. IV. 1. ८८; वा. १००. ९३. [पगे१-480+ २६]
--a R. in the प्लक्षद्वीप. Br. II. १९. १९.
--a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३३. ११.
--one of the four forms of marriage; this is दासी। Br. IV. १५. 4.
--the profession of the वैश्यस्, not of the ब्राह्मणस्. वा. ७९. ७७.
--a son of क्षाम who consumes dead human beings. Br. II. १२. ३७; वा. २९. ३५.
--a class of Rurus (s.v.) in महारौरव hell. भा. V. २६. 2.
--pupils of कृत generally desig- nated as. Br. II. ३५. ५४.
--worms of the earth; 1/१००० of vegetable kingdom and also watery. वा. १०१. १९८.
--a hell, to which go those that hate their fathers, ब्राह्मणस् and Gods and those who speak ill of gems. Vi. II. 6. 3 and १५. [पगे१-481+ ३०]
--a hell, to which go those that practise magic art. Vi. II. 6. 3 and १५.
(I)--a daughter of Kardama married to Kratu. Mother of 6,००० Va1lakhilyas. भा. III. २४. २३; IV. 1. ३९.

(II)--a daughter of दक्ष, and a wife of Dharma; mother of Yoga and of Manus; <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ४९ and ५१; Br. IV. 1. २४.</F> also of Naya, दण्ड (Dama-ब्र्। प्।) and Samaya (शम-ब्र्। प्।), (Vinaya- वि। प्।). <F>2:  Br. II. 9. ४९, ६०; वा. १०. २५, ३५; ५५. ४३; Vi. I. 7. २३ and २९.</F>
(III)--the wife of Samanantara. भा. VI. १८. 4.
(IV)--a R. from the ऋक्ष hills. Br. II. १६. २९.
--rituals described. Br. IV. ४३. 8 to the end.

--a form of active worship of Hari; <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. 3; M. 1. 3; ५२. 7-११. २७-28.</F> Brahman becomes नारायण thereby; incumbent on householders; no ज्ञानम् without कर्म; consists of 8 आत्मगुणस्; is dharma. <F>2:  M. १३४. १७-18; १४५. २७-28; २५८. 1-3.</F>
--love sports of Gandharvas and Apsaras, described. M. १२१. 1-३०. [पगे१-482+ २८]
--a son of पौरुषेय Ra1ks2asa. Br. III. 7. ९३.

(I)--issue from the brows of ब्रह्मा. <F>1:  भा. III. १२. २६; M. 3. १०.</F> शुक्र's homily to देवयानी, when she was angry with शर्मिष्ठा, and her answer. <F>2:  M. २८. 1-१३.</F> वसिष्ठ on the folly of. <F>3:  Vi. I. 1. १७-19.</F>
(II)--born of Lobha and निकृति. भा. IV. 8. 3.
(III)--a Bhairava god. Br. IV. १९. ७८.
(IV)--a son of मृत्यु. वा. १०. ४१.
(I)--a son of Ayuta and father of देवातिथि. भा. IX. २२. ११.
(II)--one of the seven sons of कौशिक. M. २०. 3.
--श्याम Para1saras. M. २०१. ३७.
--a mother goddess. M. १७९. २९.
--a गण of कार्दवेय Na1gas inhabiting महातल, afraid only of गरुड. Fought with Rudras in देवासुर battle. भा. V. २४-29; VIII. १०. ३४. [पगे१-483+ २९]

--a daughter of दक्ष and one of कश्य- pa's wives, and mother of दन्दशूक and other serpents. <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. २६ and २८; वा. ६६. ५४.</F> Her twelve daughters were married to Pulaha. भूतस्, पिशाचस्, Kinnaras, वानरस् and others belonged to her line. <F>2:  Br. III. 3. ५६; 7. १७१, ४४४ and ४६७; 8. ७२; Vi. I. १५. १२५.</F> Some of her sons fell a prey to भीमसेन's sword. <F>3:  M. 6. 2 and ४३; १४६. १८.</F>
--a daughter of दक्ष and mother of राक्षसस् as पिशाचस् and others; <F>1:  M. १७१. २९ and ६१; Vi. I. २१. २४.</F> Her twelve daughters married Pulaha. <F>2:  वा. ६९. २०४.</F>
--a deity. Br. IV. २०. २५.
--आर्षेय pravara (अङ्गिरस्). M. १९६. 8.
--a son of Yadu, and father of वृजिनवत्. भा. IX. २३. २० and ३०.
--आर्षेय pravara of अङ्गिरस्. M. १९६. २२.
(I)--a son of Yadu and father of द्वजिनीवन्. Br. III. ६९. 2; M. ४३. 7; Vi. IV. ११. 5; १२. 1.
(II)--a son of कार्तवीर्य Arjun3a and राजऋषि; father of वृजिनीवत्. In this line was born वृष्णि. Br. III. ७०. १४-15; M. ४३. ४६; ४४. १४-5. [पगे१-484+ ४१]

(I)--a द्वीप, twice the घृतोद in size and surrounded by क्षीरोद (sea of milk) (milk of ghee-मत्। प्।). It takes its name from the क्रौञ्च hill. Greatly despoiled by the arms of Guha but protected by वरुण. Its ruler was घृतपृष्ठ, a son of Priyavrata. He divided it among his seven sons and retired to a life of meditation; Hari is worshipped here in the form of waters. <F>1:  भा. V. 1. ३२; २०. १८-23; M. १३. 7; १२२. ७८.</F> (Rudra-वि। प्।). Divided among seven Janapadas; twice in size to कुशद्वीप. Described. <F>2:  Br. II. १४. १३-26; १९. ६४-77; वा. ४९. ५९-73.</F> According to विष्णु प्। Dyutimat was the first king; the four castes here are पुष्कर, पुष्कल, धन्य and तीतिख्यस्। <F>3:  Vi. II. 1. १४; 2. 5; 4. ४५-57.</F>

(II) The hill in क्रौञ्चद्वीप, despoiled by the arms of Guha (कुमार): <F>1:  भा. V. २०. १८-19; Br. II. १९. ६६ and १३९; २५. १८; Vi. II. 4. ६०.</F> Son (brother-वा। प्।) of Mai- नाक hill. <F>2:  Br. III. १०. 7 and ४८.</F> The द्वीप takes its name from this. <F>3:  Br. II. १३. ३५; M. १२२. ८१; १२३. ३७; १६३. ८९; २१९. १९; वा. ३०. ३२.</F> Residence of शन्कर; <F>4:  वा. ३९. ४२; ४९. ६१.</F> Skanda sent his शक्ति against. <F>5:  Ib. ४१. ३९.</F>

(III)--(च्) a Janapada of the केतुमाल con- tinent; <F>1:  वा. ४४. १०.</F> द्युतिमान् first consecrated in; <F>2:  Ib. ३३. १३.</F> surrounded by ocean of ghee; <F>3:  Ib. ३०. ३२; ५४. २१; १११. ५३.</F> a वनम् surrounding the hill. <F>4:  Ib. ४१. ३७. ४९. ५९.</F>
(IV)--a son of Himavat; the क्रौञ्च hill and द्वीप take their name after him. M. १३. 7.
(V)--a pupil of शाकपूर्ण. Vi. III. 4. २४.
--a place in गया when the sage per- formed austerities in the form of a क्रौञ्च. वा. १०८. ७५, ८३; १०९. १६; १११. ४४ [पगे१-485+ २७]
--equal to ९०९० years of human calculation. वा. ५७. १८.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १९.
--a daughter of ताम्रा, wife of Garutmat. Br. III. 7. ४४६-8, ४५६.
--a chief R. of प्लक्षद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ११.
--a deity. Br. IV. २७. ३८.
--a measure of time. भा. III. ११. 7; Br. II. २४. ५६; III. ७२ 29; IV. 1. २११; ३२. १४.
(I)--a son of अनमीत्र. M. ४५. २५.

(II) <F>1:  वा. ९९. २६८.</F>--its dharma; <F>2:  Ib. ९९. २२७.</F> originated with the sons of काम्या and Priyavrata; <F>3:  Br. II. ११. ३४; वा. २६. ३५; २८. १९; ३२. ४६; ९३. 7.</F> powerful householders were appointed for the protection of the world and they were क्षत्रियस्; duties of; to serve in an army, to be king and to take part in war; <F>4:  Br. II. 7. १५४; १६१-66.</F> to protect the people and engage in righteous wars. <F>5:  Vi. VI. 7. 3.</F> [पगे१-486+ २६]
(I)--the son of अङेनस्, father of प्रतिपक्ष. His line ended with कृतधर्म. Br. III. ६८. 7 and ११.
(II)--a son of सम्कृति and the last of the क्षत्रवृद्ध line. Vi. IV. 9. २७.
--a son of कालनेमि. वा. ६७. ८०.

--the body of ब्रह्मा, while the ब्राह्मण is his heart. Both dependent on each other; <F>1:  भा. III. २२. 3-4; Br. II. ३६. २३.</F> created with the ब्राह्मण, and hence no obstacle to intermarriage between क्षत्रिय and ब्राह्मण; <F>2:  M. ३०. १९-20.</F> dharma of; no sin in killing men in war. <F>3:  M. ४३. १८; १०३. २१-22; ११४. १२.</F>
--a son of Raucya Manu. Br. IV. 1. १०४.
--a son of आयु, and father of Suhotra and प्रतिक्षत्र. भा. IX. १७. 1-2; Br. III. ६७. 2; Vi. IV. 8. 3; 9. २५.
--a name of Vidura. भा. XII. १२. 8.
(I)--the fourth Manu. वा. २६. ३५. [पगे१-487+ ४६]

(II)--created out of the breast of ब्रह्मा; <F>1:  Br. II. 5. १०८; वा. ३०. ८३, २३२; ४५. ११७; ५४. १११; ५७. ५२; १००. २४६; १०१. 5, ३५२. १०४. १३; Vi. I. 6. 6.</F> the ऐन्द्रस्थानम्. <F>2:  Vi. I. 6. ३४.</F> Distinctive traits; <F>: a)भा. VII. ११. १४-15, १७ and २२.</F> protection and other duties; <F>: b)X. २४. २०; Vi. III. 8. २६-29.</F> definition of; <F>3:  भा. XI. १७. १७.</F> destroyed by Kalki. <F>4:  भा. X. ४०. २२.</F> and by महा- padmananda. <F>5:  Ib. XII. 1. 8.</F> seven clans distinguished; become Brahma- nas by दान, यज्ञ and tapas. <F>6:  Br. II. २९१. ५५; III. १०. ८९; २८. ५६; ६३. १४१; ६६. ७७; ७१. २३१.</F> Their पितृस् are हविष्मन्तस्; observe pollution for १२ days for father's death; pray to Devi; <F>7:  M. १३. ६३; १५. १७; १८. 2.</F> can take to वैश्यकर्म and not to शूद्रकर्म. <F>8:  Vi. III. 8. ३९.</F>
--the Haihayas and the तालजन्- ghas, so called. वा. ८८. १२९.
--a son of Upamadgu. Vi. IV. १४. 9.

--Rathitaras, विश्वामित्रस् and others; <F>1:  Br. III. ६३. 7; ६६. ८६; वा. ८८. 7; Vi. IV. 2. १०.</F> शिबिस्, भरद्वाजस्, सम्कृत्यस्, काव्यस्, Maudgalyas and भार्गवस्; <F>2:  M. ४९. ३८ and ४१; ५०. 5 and १४.</F> of अङ्गिरस्; Saunakas and आर्ष्टिअषेणस्. <F>3:  वा. ८८. ७३ and ७९; ९२. 6.</F> गार्ग्यस्, शंयस् and Mandagolapas. <F>4:  Vi. IV. १९. २३, ६०.</F> विश्वामित्र, मान्- धाता, सम्कृति, Kapi, Purukutsa, Satya, आनृहवान्, ऋथु, आर्ष्तिषेण, अजमीढ, भागन्य, Anya, कक्षीव, शिजय, रथीतर, Runda, विष्णु, वृद्ध Ga1rgyas; all these राजऋषिस् who have become ब्राह्मणस्. <F>5:  वा. ९१. ११५-7; ९९. १६१ and १९८.</F>
--the son of क्षेमधर्म and father of विधिसार. Ruled for ४० years. Br. III. ७४. १३०. Vi. IV. २४. १२-13.
a southern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ५६. [पगे१-488+ २७]
--आर्षेय pravara (अङ्गिरस्). M. १९६. १०.
--a सुधामान god. Br. II. ३६. २७.
(I)--a ब्रह्मराक्षसी. Br. III. 7. ९९.
(II)--a शक्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ९१.

(III)--a daughter of दक्ष; wife of Pulaha प्रजापति; <F>1:  वा. १०. २८, ३१; २८. २५; Vi. I. 7. २५.</F> mother of sons Kardama, U(A)र्वरीवान्, सहिष्णु, कनकपीठ and daughter पीवरि. <F>2:  Br. II. 9. ५२; ११. ३०.</F>
(IV)--the wife of Kratu. Vi. I. 7. 7.
(V)--a R. from the ऋस्यवत् hills. M. ११४. २५.
--a son of बृहद्क्षय. वा. ९९. २८१.
--not to kill a woman. See also क्षत्रिय. वा. ९४. १४; ९६. २२४.
--the son of सहराक्ष, who burns down houses; <F>1:  वा. २९. ३४.</F> his son क्रव्यादग्नि. <F>2:  Br. II. १२. ३७.</F>
--the main stream of क्रौञ्चद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ५५. [पगे१-489+ २७]
--one of २८ hells. conceited men who disregard their superiors in birth, merit, learning, etc., are punished in this. भा. V. २६. 7 and ३०.
--a lac of योजनस् in extent encircling Jam- बूद्वीप. Vi. II. ३१. २८; 4. 1.
--a secondary divinity. भा. IV. १४. २६.
--a son of उपासङ्ग (उपान्ग-वा। प्।). Br. III. ७१. २५८; वा. ९६. २४९.
(I)--a R. from the Vindhyas, sacred to पितृस्. Br. II. १६. ३२; M. २२. २४; ११४. २७.
(II)--a R. from the पारियात्र hills. Br. II. १६. २९.

(क्षेमकस् alias निखुम्भ)--a राक्षस who invaded the city of काशि during the rule of दिवोदास and brought it to ruin; <F>1:  वा. ९२. ३८.</F> <F>2:  Ib. ९२. २४.</F> the head of a गण of महेश्वर. <F>3:  Ib. 9. ३६.</F>
--आर्षेय pravara (अङ्गिरस्). M. १९६. 6.
--sacred to ललिता. Br. IV. ४४. ९७. [पगे१-490+ ३२]
--the residence of Hari. <F>1:  भा. X. 1. १९.</F> see क्षीरोद (s.v.), क्षीरसागर, and क्षीराब्धि. <F>2:  Br. III. २८. 8; IV. 9. ५६ and ६४; ३१. १९.</F>
--one of the eight सौभाग्यम्. M. ६०. 9 and २७.
--the birth-place of श्री; <F>1:  Vi. I. 8. १६.</F> churned for nectar; <F>2:  Ib. I. 9. ७७ and १४८.</F> on its banks lived विष्णु. <F>3:  Ib. V. 1. ३२.</F>

--the milk ocean encircling शाकद्वीप; (क्रौञ्च-भा। प्।, कुश-म्। प्); churning of, for अमृत; <F>1:  भा. V. 1. ३३; २०. १८; X. [६५. (v) २४]. Br. II. १९. १०२; २१. ७१; २५. ४५. M. १२२. ४९; १२४. ४८; वा. ३५. ३७-41; ५४. ४९; Vi. II. 4. ७१.</F> cursed by ब्राह्मणस् to be deprived of all drinkable water; here lies Hari in yoganidra guarded by गरुड. विष्णु in the form of आदिकूर्म. <F>2:  भा. X. [५२ (v) 7; १०]; Br. II. २७. २५; III. ६९. ३२; ७२. २१; IV. 9. ४६ and ६०.</F> Encircles त्रिकूट; <F>3:  भा. VIII. 2. 1; 4. १८.</F> शुक to परीक्- षित् on the legend of the churning of ocean. <F>4:  भा. VIII. 5. ११-15.</F>
--a R. of the भद्रा. वा. ४३. २९.
--a son of Prasenajit and father of रणक. (कुण्डक-वि। प्।). (क्षुलिक-वा। प्।). भा. IX. १२. १४-15; M. २७१. १३; वा. ९९. २८९; Vi. IV. २२. 9. [पगे१-491+ २७]
--a son of Devaki killed by कम्सा. कृष्ण recovered him from Sutala, and took him to द्वारक. After being seen by his parents, went to heaven. भा. X. ८५. ५१-56.
--the insignificant राक्षसस् born of निला. वा. ६९. १७८.
--a son of कृष्ण and मित्रविन्दा. भा. X. ६१. १६.
--the father of विम्श. वा. ८६. 6.
people of a hilly country. वा. ४५. १३५.
--a भार्गव gotra. M. १७५. २२.
--a son of क्षुद्रक. His son was Suvrata. वा. ९९. २९०.
and क्षेत्रज्ञ are ब्रह्मा; the union of these two leads to the eternal being; also अविषय and विषय। Br. I. 3. ३७; वा. १०२. ३४-6, १११-14.
--क्षेत्र and Brahman or अविषय and विषय। वा. १०२. ३६.
(I)--the son of क्षेमधर्मन् and father of विधिसार. भा. XII. 1. 5. [पगे१-492+ ३२]

(II)--is पुरुष; <F>1:  Br.
