II. ३२. ८५; IV. 3. ८६-90, १०२ and १०८; 4. १९.</F> four powers of ज्ञानम्, वै- राग्यम्, ऐश्वर्यम् and धर्म; ety. <F>2:  M. १४५. ७२-8.</F> Lord of प्रकृतिस्; <F>3:  वा. १०१. २२३, २२८; १०२. ३३, १०८-9; १०३. २७.</F> called Mati by his knowledge of क्षेत्रा. <F>4:  वा. ५९. ७०; Br. I. 3. ३७.</F>

(III)--involuntary for his action and stands in its own natural place; when क्षेत्र and क्षेत्रज्ञ have equal गुणस् and no वैषम्य takes place; वैषम्य or excess or otherwise of these गुणस् when they take to the quality of भोज्य भोक्तृत्व; the २४ गुणस् from महत् to विशेष। वा. १०३. १५-19.
--attendants to शिव; <F>1:  Br. III. ४१. ३३; IV. १४. 7.</F> कार्तवीर्य known as. <F>2:  M. ४३. २७; वा. ९४. २४.</F>
--a son of श्वफल्क and गान्दिनी. भा. IX. २४. १६.
(I)--one of the seven divisions of प्लक्षद्वीप. भा. V. २०. 3.
(II)--born of Dharma and तितिक्षा. भा. IV. 1. ५२.
(III)--the son of शुचि and father of Suvrata; ruled for २८ years. भा. IX. २२. ४८; M. २७१. २५.
(IV)--a son of शान्ति. Br. II. 9. ६१; वा. १०. ३७.
(V)--a Satya god. Br. II. ३६. ३५. [पगे१-493+ २९]
(VI)--a son of ब्रह्मधान; <F>1:  Br. IV. 7. ९८; वा. ६९. १३२.</F> Ajita deva. <F>2:  वा. ६७. ३४.</F>
(VII)--the son of सुनीथ, and father of Ketumat. Br. III. ६७. ७३.
(VIII)--of बृहद्रथ line, ruled for २८ years. Br. III. ७४. ११६; वा. ९९. ३०२.
(I)--the son of Nimi, the last king of his line. भा. IX. २२. ४४-5.
(II)--a son of मेधातिथि, and founder of the kingdom क्षेमकम् in प्लक्षद्वीपम्. Br. II. १४. ३७ and ३९; वा. ३३. ३३; Vi. II. 4. 4-5.
(III)--a राक्षस who made Benares desolate. Br. III. ६७. २७.

(IV)--a son of निरामित्र; (Nimitta-वि। प्।), the last son of the Aila line (Paurava) (Kurus-वि। प्।); with him ends the source of the Brahma-क्षेत्र stock, the family honoured of gods and sages; the last dynasty consisting of २५ kings. Br. III. ७४. २४५; M. ५०. ८७-8; वा. ९९. २७७-79; Vi. IV. २१. १६-18.
(V)--a son of मणिवर. वा. ६९. १६०.
the country adjoining the वृषभ or सुर्मान hill in प्लक्षद्वीप; <F>1:  Br. II. १४. ३९; १९. १६; वा. ४९. १४; Vi. II. 4. 4-5.</F> same as the मैनाक vars2a. <F>2:  M. १२२. २५.</F> [पगे१-494+ २६]
--a son of क्षेमधर्म; ruled for २४ years. M. २७२. 8.
--son of पुण्डरीक and father of देवानीक. भा. IX. १२. 1-2; Br. III. ६३. २०२-3; M. १२. ५३; वा. ८८. २०२; Vi. IV. 4. १०६.
(I)--the son of काकवर्ण--ruled for २० (३६ (?) मत्। प्।) years; father of क्षेत्रज्ञ (क्ष- traujas-वि। प्।). भा. XII. 1. 5; Br. III. ७४. १२९; M. २७२. 7; Vi. IV. २४. ११-12.
(II)--(क्षेमधर्मा) a son of the third सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ८१; वा. १००. ८४.
--the son of Vikramitra; ruled for १० years. वा. ९९. ३४२-43.
--a वानर chieftain and son of श्वेत. Br. III. 7. १८१.
--ruled for twenty years. वा. ९९. ३१६.
--an Apsaras. Br. III. 7. 7.
--a son of Citraratha and king of मिथिला. भा. IX. १८. २३-24.
--a god of the epoch of the Uttama Manu. वा. ६२. ३२. [पगे१-495+ २६]
(I)--a son of उग्रायुध. Father of सुवीर. (सुधीर-वि। प्।). भा. IX. २१. २९; Vi. IV. १९. ५५.
(II)--a son of शुचि and father of Suvrata. Vi. IV. २३. 6.
--a श्याम Para1sara. M. २०१. ३७.
--was instructed in वारह पुराण by Hari. M. ५३. ३९.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २५.
--the son of वज्रनाभ and father of विधृति. भा. IX. १२. 3.

(I)--a son of विश्वसह, and चक्रवर्तिन्। Fought for the devas and slew Daityas in battle. Knowing he had an hour of life left he returned and devoted himself to नारायण in a detached spirit, and attained ब्रह्मलोक in a मुहूर्त। A राजऋषि who sought refuge in Hari towards the end of his life. His son was दीर्गबाहु. भा. IX. 9. ४१-49; II. 1. १३; XI. २३. ३०; IX. १०. 1; Vi. IV. 4. ७६-83.
(III)--A daitya. भा. XII. 3. 9. [पगे१-496+ २६]
--the son of दिलीप; descended from heaven and lived here for a मुहूर्त. वा. ८८. १८२.
--a योग सिद्धि। Br. IV. ३६. ५२.
--a name of गणेश. Br. IV. ४४. ७०.
--the son of Jambha. वा. ६७. ७८.
--a stage in which ईश्वर roamed like insect during night of ब्रह्मा. Br. II. २४. 9; ३२. ७८.
--one of the Eastern entrances of the city of पुरञ्जन, allegorically the left eye. भा. IV. २५. ४७; २९. १०.
--born of Anga and father of Diviratha. भा. IX. २३. 6.
--the son of Pramati, (प्रजापति-वि। प्।) and father of चाक्षुष (क्षुप-वा। प्।) (चक्षुष-वि। प्।). भा. IX. 2. २४; वा. ८६. 5; Vi. IV. 1. २४.
--the son of Rambha, (विवीम्श-Va1. P., Vi. P.) and a righteous king; father of Karamdhama (in Tre- तामुख-वा। प्।), (अतिविभूति-वि। प्।). भा. IX. 2. २५; वा. ८६. 7; Vi. IV. 1. २८.
(I)--vanquished by कृष्ण. भा. II. 7. ३४. [पगे१-497+ ३२]
(II)--शिव cursed to become Khara by the sages of दारुवन inadvertently--described. <F>1:  Br. II. २७. 5-२०.</F> Donkey born of सुग्रीवि. <F>2:  M. 6. ३३.</F>
(III)--a son of Vijvara. Br. III. 6. ३३.

(IV)--a son of विश्रवस् and पुष्पोत्कट; <F>1:  Br. III. 8. ५५; वा. ७०. ४९; ९९. ४०६.</F> a राक्- षस in the third talam (Vitalam); <F>2:  भा. IX. १०. 9; वा. ५०. २७.</F> in the तारकमाय; <F>3:  M. १७३. १७; १७७. 7.</F> killed by राम. <F>4:  Br. II. २०. २८; Vi. IV. 4. ९६.</F>
--a region through which पावनी flows; a kingdom. Br. II. १८. ५७; M. १२१. ५६; वा. ४७. ५४.

--a territorial division where the four-armed कुमार may be established; <F>1:  M. २६०. ४७; २८३. 3.</F> a village at the foot of the mountain; <F>2:  वा. ९१. ३०.</F> a mixed township. <F>3:  Vi. V. 2. १३.</F>
--one thousand crores. वा. १०१. ९६.
(I)--a daughter of भद्राश्व and घृताचि. वा. ७०. ६९. [पगे१-498+ ३४]
(II)--one of the ten daughters of रौद्राश्व. वा. ९९. १२६.
--(खालिय-Va1. P.). a pupil of शाकल्य. Br. II. ३५. 2; वा. ६०. ६४.
--धूम्र Para1s4aras. M. २०१. ३८.
--defeated by Bharata; <F>1:  भा. IX. २०. ३०.</F> a kingdom of the East watered by the चक्षुष् and गङ्गा. <F>2:  Br. II. १८. ४६ and ५०; ३१. ८३; M. १२१. ४३; १४४. ५७.</F>

--an inferior tribe purified of sin by devotion to Hari. <F>1:  भा. II. 4. १८: वा. ५८. ८३; ६२. १२४; ९८. १०८.</F> A Vindhyan forest tribe being a degraded क्षत्रिय clan, निषाधस्; <F>2:  Br. II. ३६. १४५; III. ६३. १२०.</F> a hilly country. <F>3:  वा. ४५. १३५; ४७. ४७.</F>

--a consort of कश्यप; mother of two sons, विकर्ण and Vilohita, one of four hands and four feet and the other of three hands and three feet, who were born in the evening and उष period respectively. The eldest wanted to make a meal of of the mother herself and this the younger prevented. The father who noted this, named the elder यक्ष, and the latter रक्ष and said ‘त्रि’: it is said a son serves his mother and a daughter her father; and that the sons take after their mother. Seeing them ever hungry, he blessed them to get strength in the night and weakness in the day time and eat meat and flesh and disappeared. They married ब्रह्मधना and जन्तुधना, daughters of two पिशचस्, Aja and शण्ड, and gave birth to a number of राक्षसस्, all given to fierceness; <F>1:  Br. III. 3. ५६; 7. ३७, १३२-42, ४६७; वा. ६९. ७४-126; Vi. I. १५. १२४.</F> mother of राक्षस [पगे१-499+ ३१] clans and of seven daughters who in their turn produced राक्षसस्. <F>2:  वा. ६९. १६४, १७०-2.</F>
--a son of Vipracitti. Vi. I. २१. ११.
--rhinoceros; flesh very good for श्राद्ध, but horn to be thrown away. वा. ८०. ५१.
--the place where कृष्ण, Arjuna and भीम met युधिष्ठिर after the fall of जरासन्ध. भा. X. ७३. ३२.
--forest burnt by Arjuna, and Maya was liberated from the fire. Here Arjuna defeated Indra. भा. I. १५. 8; X. ५८. २५-7; ७१. ४५-46; ८९. ३४ [4].
--an अर्षेय pravara of भार्गवस्. M. १९५. ४०.
(I)--the son of Mitadhvaja. He knew the truth of Karma. He was afraid of केशिध्वज. भा. IX. १३. २०-21.

(II)--(Janaka, Vasudeva) the latter of which name is explained by केशिध्वज in early times; <F>1:  Vi. VI. 1. ८१-7.</F> heard on yoga; son of Amitadhvaja and king; in hostility driven out by केशिध्वज came to him to consult on the form of expiation; after being instructed and after the penance, केशिध्वज called over again to pay the precep- tor's fee; खाण्डिक्य who had no more concerns in this life asked for instruction on the doctrine of the soul; heard of the nature of योग from केशिध्वज; making his son master of his belongings went to the woods for penance. <F>2:  Ib. VI. 6. 5-५०; 7. १०२-03.</F> [पगे१-500+ २६]
--not to have marital relations with विश्वा- mitra, etc. M. १९८. २१.
--presented dance, song and music to पृथु. भा. IV. १५. १९.
--a small village. वा. ९१. ३०.
--a rural territorial division. M. २८३. 3; वा. 8. ९९, ११६; Br. II. 7. ९३ and १११.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १७.
--a smaller division than a खर्वट. Vi. V. 2. १३.
(I)--a son of Ulmuka and पुष्करिणी. भा. IV. १३. 7.
(II)--a son of तामस Manu. भा. VIII. 1. २७; Br. II. ३६. ४९; Vi. III. 1. १९.
(III)--a son of ऊरु (Kuru-वि। प्।) and आग्नेयि. Br. II. ३६. १०८; M. 4. ४३; Vi. I. १३. 6.

(IV)--a daughter of Kardama, (दक्ष-वा। प्।, वि। प्।) married to भृगु. Mother of sons धातृ and विधातृ and daughter of श्रि. भा. III. २४. २३; IV. 1. ४३; Br. I. 9. ५२. ५४; ११. 1; III. २५. ७७; वा. १०. २७, ३०; ६२. ४३; Vi. I. 7. 7, २५. [पगे१-501+ ३८]
(V)--a daughter of भृगु; same as श्री; wife of नारायण; sons, Bala and उत्साह by him; others मानस, mind-born. See श्री. वा. २८. 1-3.
(VII)--(एत्य्।) knowledge; all known. वा. 4. ३५.
--नील Para1s4aras. M. २०१. ३४.
--a दानव; a son of Danu. Br. III. 6. १०: वा. ६८. १०.

(I)--a R. source of, sacred to Hari; <F>1:  भा. VII. १४. २९, VIII. 4. २३, Br. II. १६. ११, २४.</F> brought to the earth from Heaven; a महानदी from the Himalayas. <F>2:  वा. ४२. ३९-49: ७१. 5.</F> Originating from the foot of विष्णु and watering the region of the moon falls from heaven into ब्रह्मा's city; issuing from the nail of the great toe of Hari's left foot; Dhruva holds her in his crown; the seven sages perform austerities with her waters; issuing again from the moon she falls on Sumeru and thence to the four quarters of the earth; hearing of her, the desire to go to गन्गा, see, touch, bathe in her waters--all purify a person; falling in four directions, takes the names of शीता, अलकनन्दा, चक्षु and भद्रा. <F>3:  वी. I. 9. १०३: II, 2. ३३४: 8. १०८-13, १२०-2: III. १४. १८ IV. 4. २६-30: १८-28.</F> Effort made by अम्शुमान्, दिलीप and भगीरथ and hence her name भागीरथी. Held up by Hara and then let; flowed in seven streams through several territories in the four directions, sanctifying the regions and the people there. <F>4:  भा. IX. 9. 1-१३: Br. III. १३. ११८: ५५. ५१: ५६. ३८-54.</F> Its waters drunk by Janhu, and let out by his ears and hence called जान्हवी. <F>5:  भा. IX. १५. 3: Br. III. ६६. २५-6: ७३. ११७: M. १२. ४४: १२१. २६.</F> The seed cast off by शिव in the [पगे१-502+ ४८] sky was borne by गन्गा and was swallowed by Agni; phoetus left on the Himalayan slopes became gold, which was utilised in building the यग्ञशाल at नैमिष. At her confluence with यमुना (s.v.) was the अवभृत of the sacri- fice of प्रजापतिस्. On its banks Bharata performed horse- sacrifice. <F>6:  भा. IV. 7. ६३-4: वा. 2. १७-18: ७२. २८-32. Br. II. १६. ११ and २४. भा. VII. १४. २९; VIII. 4. २३ Va1. ४२. ३९-40: ७१. 5. भा. IX. 9. 1-१३. Br. III. १३. ११८: ५५.51: ५६. ३८-54. M. १५. 3. Br. III. ६६. २५. 6: ७३. ११७: M. १२. ४४: १२१. २६. भा. IV. 7. ६३-64. वा. 2. १७-18: ७२. २८-32. भा. IV. 2. ३५. IX. २०-25: २२. १९: X. १०. 4.</F> Here युधिष्ठिर had his अवभृत bath after राजसूय. <F>7:  भा. X. ७५. १९.</F> Here were done funeral rites of the dead children of द्रौपदी. <F>8:  Ib. I. 8. 1.</F> Here again परीक्षित् observed vow of fasting unto death. <F>9:  Ib. 3. ४३; 4. १०; १२. २८; १८. 3.</F> Visited by बलराम. <F>१०:  Ib. X. ७८. २०.</F> The Sagaras sent to heaven by the Ganges waters. <F>११:  Ib. IX. 9. १४.</F> गन्गा as देवी. <F>१२:  Ib. I. १९. १५.</F> Originally of three-fold path, the छायापथा being in the नक्षत्रमण्डल; <F>१३:  Br. II. १८. २६-42, ५०-52:</F> addressed by Agni to bear Rudra's गर्भ, गन्गा accepted the task and gave birth to कुमार. <F>१४:  Br. III. 7. ३५५: 9. 4: १०. ३०-5: १४. ८४: ३७. 5: ५४. ४९: IV. 9. ७८.</F> गन्गा refilled the ocean, after Agastya drank it dry. <F>१५:  Br. III. ६३. १६७.</F> Manu put the growing fish in; washed off the city of हस्तिनापुरम्; contains 3(1/2) crores of तीर्थस्; forms the cure for all ills; released in seven streams by शन्कर, three to the west, three to the north and one भगीरथी, sacred in Kanakhala. <F>१६:  M. 1. २३: १३. २५: ३६. 5: ५०. ७८: १०२. 5-6: १०६. ५७-8; ११४. २०: १२१. ३८-41; १३३. २३: १८३. १०७: १८६. १०; १९२. ११; २३९-18.</F> Wife of the ocean; <F>१७:  वा. १३. ३५: ३०. ३२ and ९२: ४५. ९५:</F> त्रिपथगा; <F>१८:  वा. 2. 7; ५१. २१, ४६; ५८. ८८.</F> a consort of शिव, served by Trayambaka and other gods. <F>१९:  वा. ४२. ३९-40: ७१. 5.</F> Fit for श्राद्ध; <F>२०:  वा. ७७. ६८.</F> the right side of the Veda; <F>२१:  वा. ९८. ११७: ९९. ६३: १०४. १३, २७, ७७: १०६. ६७: १११. १६.</F> particularly sacred at three spots--गन्गाद्वार, प्रयाग and गन्गा sa1gara-sangama. <F>२२:  M. १०६. ५३.</F> [पगे१-503+ २५]
(II)--(personified) a bearer of flywhisk to ललिता. Br. IV. ३९. ७४. गन्गाद्वार--a place sacred to पितृस्. भा. VI. 2. ३९: M. २२. १०: २४६. ९२.
--a तीर्थम् on the नर्मदा. M. १९३. १४-20.
(I)--the name of an asura. भा. XI. १२. 6.
(II)--a pupil of रथीतर. Br. II. ३५. 4.
(III)--a son of Uttama Manu. Br. II. ३६. ३९.
(IV)--a chief वानर. Br. III. 7. २४१.
(V)--a son of मृग (नाग). Br. III. 7. ३३२.
--city of, in atalam. <F>1:  Br. II. २०. ३२.</F> IV tala or Gabhastalam. <F>2:  वा. ५०. ३१.</F>
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस् in गया; ritual at. M. २२. ३८: वा. १११. ५५.
--a युगादि for श्राद्ध. M. १७. 3.
--a people, perhaps Gandharvas. Br. III. २२. ५६.
--see गणेश. Br. IV. ४४. ६६.
--residences of constellations in the N. path. Br. 3. ४८.
--a Mt. south of the मानस; <F>1:  वा. ३६. २४.</F> residence of the Rudras. <F>2:  Ib. ३९. ४७.</F>
--see हस्तिनापुर city built by Hasti. भा. I. 4. 6. M. ४९. ५२.
--the superintendent of elephants and his qualifications. M. २१५. ३६.
--the mahout of the state elephant; qualifica- tions of. M. २१५. ३७.

(I)--the legend of विष्णु freeing the ele- phant in trouble. While wandering in the hills, this lord of elephants felt thirsty and entered a lake in the त्रिकूट hill. While drinking water, a crocodile caught hold of its feet. Finding himself on the brink of death, Gajendra bestowed his thought on Hari on account of the वासन of the previous birth. Pleased with his prayer, Hari flew on गरुड with his cakra and released the animal from the crocodile. The elephant attained a form like that of Hari. This elephant was in his previous birth a पाण्ड्यन् king by name Indradyumna devoted to Hari but cursed by Agastya to be born as elephant. <F>1:  भा. III. १९. ३५: VIII. 1. ३०: 2. २०-33: 3 (whole): 4. 6-२५.</F> Hari blessed Gajendra who got मोक्ष by सत्सन्ग। <F>2:  इबिद्। X. ७१. 9: XI. १२. 6.</F> Hence गजेन्द्रमोक्ष. <F>3:  इबिद्। II. 7. १५-16.</F>
(II)--the ऐरावत which came out of the churning of the ocean of milk. It was taken up by Indra. M. २५१. 3.
--is गनेश. Br. IV. ४४. ६७.
--sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ७३.
--१८ stha1nas, mentioned for enumeration of numbers. Br. IV. 2. १०२: वा. १०१. १०२.
--also गणेश. Br. III. ४१. ४१.

(I)--of भूतस्; followers of शिव, of gods, of Pra- mathas; attacked कृष्ण at शोणितपुर; <F>1:  भा. II. 6. १३: X. [६५ (V) ४६], [४९]: [६६. (V) ४९]: ६३. 6 and १०: XII. १०. १४.</F> eleven celestial गणस् reckoned. <F>2:  M. 6. ४४-5: ५२. २१.</F> Twelve groups of seven living with the sun in different parts of the year; their functions. <F>3:  वा. ५२. २४-35.</F> Three clans of sages with twenty branches each. In the first epoch of सावर्णी; all of them sons of मारीच Kas4yapa, with Bali as their Indra. <F>4:  Ib. १००. १३f.</F>

(II)--five groups of; Yavanas, पारदस्, काम्- bojas, Pahlavas and शकस्; defeated by Sagara, these appealed to वैसिष्ठ who persuaded the king from further slaughter. Sagara changed their dharma and physical features; were degraded क्षत्रियस् and debarred from learn- ing Vedas. Br. III. ६३. १२७.
--is गणेश. Br. III. ४१. ४१.
--courtesans. Br. III. २७. १४ and ४१: ४९. २३.
--the science of computation (Algebra, Geome- try and Arithmetic). वा. ७०. १५.

--is विनायक (s.v.); sprung out of कामेश्वर, thought of by ललीता; destroyed भण्ड's <F>1:  भा. III. ४१. ३७-41: ४२. 2 and ३३: ४३. १८ and ३१: ४४. ७०. Br. IV. २७. ७२-104: ४४. ६७.</F> followers and filled the शक्ति host with enthusiasm. Killed गजासुर (s.v.). His riding animal was rat. ललिता honoured him as the first [पगे१-507+ ३५] to be worshipped among gods; <F>1:  भा. III. ४१. ३७-41: ४२. 2 and ३३: ४३. १८ and ३१: ४४. ७०. Br. IV. २७. ७२-104: ४४. ६७.</F> was Nikumbha in whose honour दिवोदास built a temple. <F>2:  Br. III. ६७. ५५.</F> The head of a शिव gan2a who sports in sidda-क्षेत्रस्, Rathyas, desolate gardens and places where there are children, the mad and others. Icons of; <F>3:  M. २३. ३८ and ८४: १५४. ५२४, ५३३-41: २५०. २५, २५९. २३.</F> origin in an ele- phant-faced doll made by पार्वती from the oil and dirt scraped off her body in the course of an oil bath; cast into Ganges where he grew in size and became गान्गेय. <F>4:  M. १५४. ५०२-5.</F>

--formerly men who by ब्रह्मचर्य and pil- grimages pleased शन्कर and attained this status; very dear to शिव; पार्वती's first view of them; their habits and food; वीरक, (s.v.) one of them attracted पार्वती's atten- tion. M. १५४. ५२२. to ४१.
--R. from the Himalayas visited by बलराम; <F>1:  भा. X. ७९. ११: Br. II. १६. २६: M. ११४. २२.</F> in the chariot of त्रिपुरारी; <F>2:  M. १३३. २३.</F> a महानदी. <F>3:  वा. ४५. ९६: १०८. ७९.</F>
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८२.
--apparently a town; to the East of माल्यवत्; on the slopes of the गन्धमाधन and the माल्यवत; in the first line केतुमालस्; and there is a महावृक्ष Janasa. M. ११३. ५१: वा. ४३. 1-4. [पगे१-508+ ३७]
--a son of शूर and a brother of Vasudeva; Issueless adopted चारूदेष्ण and साम्भ, sons of कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. १५० and १९१: वा. ९६. १४८, १८८. Vi. IV. १४. ३०.
--same as जलधारवर्षम्. M. १२२. २०-1.
--one of the six sons of पुरूरवस्. वा. ९१. ५२.
--a daughter of Kardama, married to Pulaha. Had three sons--कर्मश्रेष्ट, वरीयस् and सहिस्णु. भा. III. २४. २३: IV. 1. ३८.
--not to marry with विश्वामित्रस्, etc. M. १९८. १९.

(I)--a son of कृष्ण <F>1:  भा. I. १४. २८: II. 3. १९: III. 1. ३५: IV. २३. १२: X. ४१. ३२: ४७. ४०: ५२. ४०: ५९. १०: XI. ३०. १६.</F> who was stationed at the western gate of मथुरा for defence. <F>2:  Ib. X. ५०. २० [4].</F> Had a place on the left detachment of कृष्ण's army. When जरासन्ध attacked मथुरा for a third time, Gada played a heroic part. <F>3:  Ib. [५० (V) ११]: [५१ (V) २५].</F> Attacked Caidya party which pursued कृष्ण taking away रुक्मिणी. <F>4:  Ib. ५४. 6.</F> Went with वृष्णिस् to the city of बाण. <F>5:  Ib. ६३. 3.</F> Accompanied साम्ब and others to play and came across a huge lizard in a well and reported it to कृष्ण. <F>6:  Ib. ६४. १२ [1-4].</F> Took part in defending द्वारका against शाल्व and in expelling his forces. <F>7:  Ib. X. ७६. १४: ७७. 4.</F> Went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for solar eclipse. <F>8:  Ib. ८२. 6.</F> At प्रभास. <F>9:  Ib. XI. ३०. १६.</F>
(II)--a son of Vasudeva and रोहिणी. भा. IX. २४. ४६. [पगे१-509+ २७]
(III)--a son of Vasudeva and देवरक्षिता. भा. IX. २४. ५२.
(IV)--Art and science of, learnt by Duryodhana from बलराम; <F>1:  भा. X. ५७. २६: Br. III. ७१. ८४.</F> a war weapon. <F>2:  M. १४०. १४.</F>
(V)--an Asura, stronger than वज्रायुध, gave his bone to ब्रह्मा on the latter's request; विश्वकर्मन् made it a gada. वा. १०९. 3-4.
(VI)--a son of भद्रा and Vasudeva. Vi. IV. १५. २४.
(I)--a votary of कृष्ण. भा. III. 1. ३५: वा. ५५. १२. १०९. 4 and ११.
(II)--Mace of विष्णु. Vi. IV. १५. १३: V. ३४. २३.

--विष्णु as; the first narrator of the Matsya पुराण; in the तारकामय war; <F>1:  M. 1. १०: १७६. ३०: १७८. २३ and ४६ Va1. १०६. ५५.</F> boon to Dharmavrata after she became a stone. <F>2:  वा. ६०. ७७: १०७. ४७: १०८. ५२: १०९. १२, २०.</F>
--a महातीर्थ where Hari got the गदा cleaned after breaking Heti's head with it. वा. १११. ७५-6. [पगे१-510+ २४]
(I)--taught to Duryodhana by Baladeva. <F>2:  Vi. IV. १३. १०६.</F> ^1 वा. ९६. ८३.
--the wife of Yama. M. २८६. 8.
--a son of Upamadga (see gandhamodavaha). (Cal. Edn.). Vi. IV. १४. 9.
--the daughter of पितृस्, born in the परा- शर line and mother of व्यास; again born as Matsyayoni. After her came Acchoda lake. Br. III. १३. ७६-9: वा. ७७. ७४-5.
--said to be essence milked from cow-earth by the Gandharvas. M. 7. १४: १०. २४: १६. २६.
(I)--followed राम in his expedition to लन्का. भा. IX. १०. १९: Br. III. ७१. ११२.
(II)--a son of श्वफल्क and गान्दिनी. भा. IX. २४. १७.
(I)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३१.
(II)--a forest on the south of इलावृत. Vi. II. 2. २५. [पगे१-511+ ४३]

(III)--a mountain range to the East of इलावृत and to the W. of Meru and a boundary limit of Bha- द्राश्व. On its top falls the सीता. <F>1:  भा. V. १६. १०: १७. 6. Vi. II. 2. १८, २९ and ३९:</F> The abode of Nara and नारायण, visited by ब्रह्मा. <F>2:  भा. IV. 1. ५८: V. 1. 8. Vi. V. २४. 5.</F> To this Mucukunda (s.v.) repaired after leaving the cave in which he slept. <F>3:  भा. X. ५२. 3.</F> Location and length mentioned. Residence of वानरस्. Here उर्वशि stayed for some time with Aila. Here विष्णु performed तपस् as Dharmasuta and created उर्वशी. <F>4:  Br. II. १५. ४०: १७. १६: III. 7. १९४: २५. ६७: ६६. 7: IV. ३१. १६: M. ६१. २१: २४. १९.</F> One of the विष्- kambagiris round Meru. Here are केतुमालवर्ष and वैभाज forest; the crown of जम्बूद्वीप; full of celestial groups. <F>5:  M. ८३. २२, ३२-3: ११३. ४५: १५४. ४३४: १८३. 1.</F> A place of pilgrimage sacred to कामाक्षी. <F>6:  M. १३. २६.</F> On its south आनील and निषाधस्, and on its East माल्यवन्. <F>7:  वा. ३४. ३५: ३५. १६: ४२. २५: ४३. 1: ४६. १७: ९१. 7.</F> The place where the Bhadari आश्रम was situated and to which came Uddhava for penance. <F>8:  Vi. V. ३७. ३४ and ३७.</F>
--the kingdom of केतुमाल. Br. II. १४. ५२: वा 23. १५९: ३३. ४५.
--a division of जम्बूद्वीप. Vi. II. 1. २३.
--a son of Upamadga. Vi. IV. १४. 9.
(II)--a kingdom noted for horses; <F>1:  Br. IV. १६. १७: M. ११४. 8: १२१. ४८.</F> a divi- sion of the भारतवर्ष. <F>2:  वा. ४५. ७९: Vi. II. 3. 7.</F>
(III)--a god to be worshipped in house- building. M. २५३. २५. [पगे१-512+ ४५]
(IV)--the fourteenth kalpa; here गान्- धारस्वर and नाद came into being. वा. २१. ३२.

(I)--born of अरिष्टा and कश्यप; <F>1:  M. 5. 1: 6. २९ and ४५: Vi. I. 5. ४६: २१. २५.</F> worship- ped for personal beauty; <F>2:  भा. II. 3. 6.</F> sent by Indra to disturb मार्कण्- डेय's तपष्; <F>3:  Ib. XII. 8. १६.</F> killed in crores by Bharata; <F>4:  Ib. IX. ११. १३.</F> other references to. <F>5:  Ib. IV. 6. 9: V. 1. 8; VI. 7. 3; VII. 7. ५०; 8. ३८; X. 3. 6: 4. ११: २५. ३१: ५५. २३: ६२. १९; ८५. ४१; XI. 6. 3: १२. 3: १४. 5: १६. ३३: ३१. 2: XII. ११. ४७: Br. IV. 1. १५५: 2. २६: 4. 2: 9. ७७: १५. २४: २०. ४८ and १०१: ३३. १५: ३९. ५६.</F> A गण moving with the sun by turns praising him; <F>6:  Br. II. २३. २७ and ५०: ३२. 1-2: ३५. १९१.</F> sang साम in वारुणी yajn5a. <F>7:  Br. III. 1. २५.</F> Three steps inferior to gods; semidivine like यक्षस्, राक्षसस् and पिशाचस्; frequent Kai- लास; vanquished by रावण; Citraratha was their overlord. <F>8:  Br. III. 7. १६७-70, २५५: 8. १०: १०. ३७: २४. ५९. IV. ३६. १६: M. 8. 6.</F> milked the earth and preserved its essence Gandha (s.v.); worship बर्हिषद् manes; attended with Apsaras at the यज्ञ of Arjuna कार्तवीर्य; <F>9:  M. १०. २४: १३. १७; १५. 3; ३७. 2 and 4: ४३. २२.</F> world of; <F>१०:  M. ७८. ११: २४६. ६१: २४७. ११.</F> live in trees, <F>११:  Br. II. 7. ८४: वा. 9. ५५: २१. ३३: ३०. ८६: ३३. ६४: ३४. ५५.</F> एत्य्। from singing; <F>१२:  Br. II. 8. ४०.</F> according to वा। प्। sons of Bhadra. <F>१३:  वा. ६६. ७३.</F>
(II)--(Mauneya) in number ६० crores, overcame the नागस् of रसातल and deprived them of their jewels, etc.; ultimately defeated by Purukutsa, son of मान्धात. Vi. IV. 3. 4-9.
--an imaginary city compared to this माया-ridden universe; seen by the company of merchants (जीवस्) wandering in सम्सार. भा. IV. १२. १५. V. १३. 3 and 7.
--Bharata in charge of; killed three crores of them. Vi. IV. 4. १००.
--the name om rising from गान्धार. वा. २०. 3.
--the सभा of वायु on the sixth slope of Meru. वा. ३४. ८९.
--the quality of the earth eaten up by waters in प्रत्याहार. वा. १०२. 7.
--of pink red; here are cities of कालनेमी, गजकर्ण and other Asuras and नागस्. वा. ५०. १२, १४, ३१-33.
--a R. in शाकद्वीप; same as सुकृत. Br. II. १९. ९६: M. १२२. ३३. Vi. II. 4. ६५.
(I)--one of the nine divisions of भारत- वर्ष. भा II. १६. 9 M. ११४. 8: वा. ४५. ७९. Vi. II. 3. 6.
(II)--a region of the पाताल, and with brown soil. Vi. II. 5. 2-3. [पगे१-514+ २३]
--a son of प्रवीर; ruled for ३० years. Br. III. ७४. १८६.
(I)--(गभीर-ब्र्। प्।) a son of Rabhasa and father of Akriya. भा. IX. १७. १०.
(II)--a son of Bhautya Manu. Br. IV. 1. ११४.
(I)--a son of इन्द्रसावर्णि. भा. VIII. १३. ३३.
(II)--a son of Manu Bhauma. Vi. III. 2. ४५.
(I)--a sage who knew the power of विष्णु's yoga. भा. II. 7. ४४.
(II)--a son of Ulmuka and पुष्करिणी. भा. IV. १३. १७.

(IV)--a son of Nakta and Druti: A राजऋषि and an अम्श of Hari; a महापुरुष who ruled his kingdom righteously and with devotion to Hari. His name is sung in an ancient गाथा, as the upholder of धर्म, Vedas, ब्रह्मणस् and यज्ञस्. His queen was गायन्ती who was mother of three sons Citraratha and others. At the end of [पगे१-515+ २७] his rule, he renounced the throne and sought refuge with Hari. भा. V. १५. 6-१४: X. ६०. ४१: Br. II. १४. ६८: वा. ३३. ५७. Vi. II. 1. ३८.
(V)--though lord of seven द्वीपस्, he was not content. He wanted more territory. भा. VIII. १९. २३; XII. 3. १०.

(VI)--a son of (इला) Sudyumna and Lord of Dak- षिणापथ; <F>1:  भा. IX. 1. ४१. M. १२. १७.</F> king of the eastern kingdom with its capital Gaya; <F>2:  Br. III. ६०. १८.</F> a राजऋषि. <F>3:  वा. ८५. १९.</F> Performed a big sacrifice and gave lavish gifts to all ब्रह्मणस्; even gods were pleased and granted a boon perpetuating his name by a city गयापुरि; attained विष्णुलोक. <F>4:  वा. ११२. 1-6.</F>
(VII)--a son of Angirasa and ऊरु. M. 4. ४३.
(VIII)--a son of बलकाश्व. वा. ९१. ६१.
--(गायन्ती-ब्र्। प्।), wife of Gaya (s.v.) and mother of three sons. भा. V. १५. १४.
--sacred to Hari. भा. VII. १४. ३०.
(I)--a R. visited by बलराम. भा. X. ७९. ११. [पगे१-516+ ३५]

(II)--(च्) the kingdom of; sacred for श्राद्ध offering. धर्मपृष्ट, Brahmasaras, and गृध्रवट are chief places here; capital of Gaya; परशुरान performed श्राद्ध here. <F>1:  M. १२. १७. Br. III. १३. १०४: १९-11: ४७. १७: ६०. १९: वा. ८५. १९.</F> A पितृतीर्थम् being the residence of पितामह; a गाथा says that any one son may visit गया and satisfy all पितृस्. <F>2:  M. २२. 4-6 and २६: ११०. 2; १९२. ११: २०४. 8: २०७. ४०.</F> Fit for श्राद्ध; a man devoted to गयाश्राद्ध must dress himself in beggar's garments, circumambulate the ग्राम, and the next one with shaving and begging money; श्राद्ध in ब्रह्मकुण्ड and other places; going to Dhar- maranya after worshipping गदाधर; feed the Brahmans there without enquiring into their family, conduct or learn- ing; offer पिण्डस् in गयारूप, even for unknown cognates and names; पिण्ड for one's own self with तिल; by this even heinous crimes are mitigated; a superior तीर्थ; best in Makara, eclipses of the sun and moon, and Caitra and Preta- पक्ष (महालय); others are अधीमास, birthday, the even- ing of Guru and शुक्र, the stay of बृहस्पति in Simha which is once in twelve years. <F>3:  वा. ७७. ९७: ८०. ४५: ८३. १२-44.</F> The face of the Veda; <F>4:  Ib. १०४. ७७.</F> शम्भु, विष्णु and Ravi; sacred to Gaya. <F>5:  Ib. ११२. २०.</F>
(III)--six in number, गायागय, गयादित्य, गायत्री, गदाधर, गया, गयासुर, all tending to salva- tion. वा. ११२. ६०.
--the legend about गया. वा. ११२. ६२, ६७. [पगे१-517+ ३५]

--origin of; the austerities of गयासूर here bearing a stone on his head. Here गदाधर stood steadfast lest he should move; on this ब्रह्मा performed a sacrifice; shaving and fasting are prescribed in तीर्थस् but not for this place; measurement 2(1/2) क्रोश; गयाक्षेत्रम् 5 क्रोशस् and गयाशिर 1 क्रोश, the best of all तीर्थस्. वा. १०५. 4-४६.
--the north sun. वा. १०९. २१.
--after the name of king Gaya. वा. ११२. 5.

--pilgrimage to गया; preliminaries; per- formance of श्राद्ध, going round the village, travel to another village and so on, every day without begging food, etc.: purity and selflessness to be maintained; reaching गया, bathing and performance of श्राद्ध according to his Veda शाख; the next day visit to Pretaparvata, bath in ब्रह्मकुण्ड and the offer of पिण्डस् in other places. See गय। वा. ११०. 1-9.
--one क्रोश in extent; <F>1:  वा. १०५. २९.</F> श्राद्ध there lifts १०० generations. <F>2:  Ib. १०५. ३१.</F>
--one of the four means to mukti; <F>1:  वा. १०५. १६.</F> special वर्ण to mother; <F>2:  Ib. १०८. ३५: ११०. १७.</F> for पिण्ड; <F>3:  Ib. २३. ५९.</F> suitable occasions for. <F>4:  Ib. १०५. ४७-8.</F>

--had a stone over his head on which ब्रह्मा performed sacrifices; Gaya perforhmed याग in श्वेतकल्प- वाराह; after him the name for the place; the son who goes to गया, he who resides at गया for three पक्षस् [पगे१-518+ ४२] purifies seven descendants; or residence at least for १५, 7 or 3 days; one offers पिण्ड with तिल to forefathers and to oneself; the four heinous offences are expiated with the ritual at गया. Out of the navel of विष्णु came ब्रह्मा who created Asuras one of whom was Gaya, १२५ yojanas in length and ६० in breadth; a वैष्नव; performed तपस् at कोलाहल hill for १००० of years; <F>1:  </F> all gods went to विष्णु. गयासुर with whom विष्णु was pleased was granted his request, to be the best of all; Yamapuri became vacant; all went to ब्रह्मा and he went to विष्णु; on the latter's advice ब्रह्मा went to गया and wanted to perform याग on his body; a true devotee, Gaya agreed readily. But finding him un- stable ब्रह्मा ordered Dharma to place a stone on his head and the devas to stand to maintain balance; विष्नु was again approached who gave his मूर्ति and finding Gaya still un- stable गदाधर himself took his stand and made the stone motionless. Pleased, विष्णु gave him what he desired. It was that they should all live there and that the people who did rites there must reach Brahmaloka. See गया ti1rtham. वा. १०५. 5-१३. ch. १०६. (whole): १०८. 8: १०९. १३.
--a दानव. Br. III. 6. १६.

(I)--a son of तार्क्ष्य (काश्यप) and विनता (सुपर्णा), and vehicle of Hari. <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. २२: III. १९. ११. Br. III. 7. २९: 8. ११. M. 6. ३४: १४६. २२. वा. ४९. १०; ६९. ६६: ७०. ११: ७२. ४५. Vi. I. २१. १८.</F> Has abode in शाल्मलिद्वीप. <F>2:  भा. V. २०. 8.</F> Took कृष्ण to Madhuvana; <F>3:  Ib. IV. 9. 1.</F> Identified with Hari, and regarded as the embodiment of the Vedas. <F>4:  Ib. VI 8. २९. VIII. 3. ३१.</F> Attacked Asura followers of Bali, and knowing Hari's mind, he bound Bali with cords of वरुण. <F>5:  Ib. VIII. २१. १६ and २६.</F> Serves as a watch for क्षीरोद. When he saw Bali carrying away Hari's crown-jewel, he pursued him and recovered it after a fight. When he saw on his return from Gomanta, he placed it on His [पगे१-519+ ४६] head and belauded him, requesting him for opportunities of service to Him, who ordered him to go back and come whenever He thought of him. <F>6:  Ib. X. ५३ (V) १०-19.</F> His winning nectar is com- pared to कृष्ण winning वैदर्भी in स्वयम्वर। <F>7:  Ib. X. ५२. १७.</F> कालीय, the enemy of snakes, freed from fear of; entered into an agreement with snakes of रमणक to give him बलि every fortnight. कालीय failed to do this, and after a fight escaped to the river कालिन्दी where गरुड could not go, as he was under a curse. It happened once that गरुड took a king- fish from the river against the wish of the sage Saubhari who cursed that गरुड's coming again there would mean the end of his life. <F>8:  Ib. १६. ६३; १७. 1-११. Vi. V. 7. ७८.</F> Attacked by Mura, <F>9:  भा. X. ५९. 7-8.</F> killed all elephants of Naraka, <F>१०:  Ib. ५९. १९. Vi. V. २९. १४.</F> carried कृष्ण to Indra's city. Defeated वरुण attacking कृष्ण, flung शिव and his bull to a distance of a hundred धनुस्। Discomfited ऐरावत of Indra, and took कृष्ण and सत्यभामा safely to द्वारका. <F>११:  भा. ६५ (V) 1: ६६ (V) २२-25, ४८; ६७ (V) ११-14, ३८-39, M. १५०. २१९ Vi. V. ३०. ६४-70. XI. ३०. ४४.</F> गरुड standard of Hari. <F>१२:  Br. III. ७१. २४८.</F> Praise of Hari. <F>१३:  भा. IV. ३०. 6. XI. २७. २८.</F> Took nectar for mother's sake to Somaka hill of प्लक्ष; married five daughters of ताम्र and became father of birds in all the world. <F>१४:  Br. II. १९. ११-12: III. 7. ४४८-51: M. १२२. १५.</F> Younger brother of अरुण. <F>१५:  M. १५०-53.</F> Worship of, on the भी- मद्वादशि, and in the लक्ष homa of Grahabali. Icon of. <F>१६:  M. ५३. ४१; ६९. २६; ९३. ९९: २५८. ११ and १२.</F> In the तारकामय: in the war with कालनेमी: performed tapas at Kanakhala. <F>१७:  M. १५२. 6-7, ३६: १५३. १८१: १७१. ५०: १७८. ३२ and ५०: १९३. ७०: २४९. ३५</F> had a number of wives, sons and grandsons; the eater of all cruel snakes--his descendants spread over largely the whole of शाल्मलिद्वीप, and the mountains देवकूट, मणिमन्त, सहस्रशिखर, Parna- mala, सुकेश, and सतश्रुग, the five-peaked Kauraja, हेमकूट etc. <F>१८:  वा. ६९. ३२८-335.</F> [पगे१-520+ ३०]
(II)--a son of विश्वेशा. M. १७१. ५०.
--a महापुराण comprising १९००० s4lokas. भा. XII. 7. २३: १३. 8: Vi. IV. 6. २३.
--a goddess following भवमालिनी. M. १७९. ७१.
(I)--a son of (Bhuva) Manyu and father of शिनि, (Chini). M. ४९. ३६: Vi. IV. १९. २१-23.

(II)--the Purohita of यादवस्. Urged by Vasudeva, he went to the Vraja of Nanda who welcomed him as befitted a Guru, praising him as the great author of ज्योतिष s4a1stra. Requested by Nanda to do नाम सम्स्कार to कृष्ण and राम without कंश's knowledge, he did so and returned to his place. <F>1:  भा. X. 8. 1-२०. Vi. II. 5. २६: V. 6. 8. 9.</F> He held कृष्ण and राम to be divine incarnations. <F>2:  भा. X. ४६. २३.</F> He informed Nanda that कृष्ण was the son of Vasudeva and an अम्श of नारायण. <F>3:  Ib. २६. १५-23.</F> He officiated at उपनयन सम्स्कारस् of the two brothers. <F>4:  Ib. ४५. २६-29.</F> He had also informed Mucukunda that नारायण was to be born on [पगे१-521+ २६] the earth as कृष्ण. <F>5:  Ib. ५१. ४५.</F> He was invited for the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर. <F>6:  Ib. ७४. 8.</F>
(III)--an Angirasa and a मन्त्रकृत्. Br. II. ३२. १०७: M. १४५. १०१.
(IV)--the Purohita of Haiha. Br. III. २८. ३९.
(V)--a son of Pratardana. Br. III. ६७. ६९: वा. ९२. ६५.

(VI)--the preceptor of the seven sons of कौशिक who tended his cow, killed and made a meal of it in a famine. For this sin they were cursed to have five rebirths; no mar- riage alliance with बृहस्पति. M. २०. 3: १९६. २४.
(VII)--an author of architecture. M. २५२. 3.
(VIII)--a ऋत्विक् at ब्रह्मा's sacrifice. वा. १०६. ३५.
--the son of गार्ग्य; of Vatsa line. Br. III. ६७. ७८.
--a तीर्थम् on the नर्मदा. M. १९१. ८२. 3.
--a तीर्थम् near यन्त्रेश्वर on the Nar- मदा. M. १९०. 3. [पगे१-522+ ३१]
--a वर्ण s4akti. Br. IV. ४४. ६०.
--a son of वसिष्ठ and ऊर्जा. Br. II. ११. ४१.
--the asses of the तामस line. Vi. I. २१. १७.
--a son of Bali. वा. ६७. ८३.

--ten rulers of this line are distin- guished; see Maunas. <F>1:  भा. XII. 1. २९. Vi. IV. २४. ५१.</F> Seven of them ruled for ७२ years (९४, म्। प्।) after आभिरस्. <F>2:  Br. III. ७४. १७२ and 4: M. २७३. १८-20: वा. ९९. ३५९.</F>
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १८.
--a Pravara sage. M. १९९. १६.
(I)--a son of Turvasu. M. ४८. 1.

(II)--the child in embryo; <F>1:  भा. III. ३१. 1-१०. वा. ९७. ४६-57.</F> a union of शुक्र-- springing from मज्ज which is from bone which is due to मेदस्, which again results from flesh, that is due to शोणितम्, emerging from Rasa or waters, शुक्र constitutes of Soma and सोणितम् of अग्नी. The former resides in Kaphavarga and the latter in Pittavarga. The place of कफ is heart, and that of पित्त is the navel region. Stages in the गर्भ and formation described. <F>2:  Br. III. ७२. ४५-57. वा. १४. १८-26.</F> [पगे१-523+ २७]

(III)--the four central parts out of १६, into which a site (of a temple to be built) is divided; measure- ments of its foundations, walls, doorways, etc.; likewise other parts of temple bear specific relation to the गर्भ। M. २६९. 1-8.
--a son of गार्ग्य. वा. ९२. ७३.
--a ceremonial connected with preg- nancy; a सम्स्कार. Br. III. ४२. ४३: M. २७५. १६.
--restrictions to be observed by, laid down by काश्यप for Diti: Her failure to observe them gave Indra the loophole he was seeking to destroy her foetus; see Diti, Indra. M. 7. ३७, ४७: ५२. 4.
--a सुधर्मान god. Br. IV. 1. ६०.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३२.
--created by ब्रह्मा from his feet. Vi. I. 5. ४९.
--the father of Samjaya. भा. I. १३. ३०.
(I)--a दानव with मनुष्य dharma. Br. III. 6. १६: वा. ६८. १६.
(II)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४३. [पगे१-524+ २८]
(III)--a son of शम्भु. वा. ६७. ८१.
--a सूक्तम् of the साम Veda recited in tank ritual. M. ५८. ३७.
(I)--a दानव; in the सभा of Hiranya- कशिपु. Br. III. 6. 4: M. १६१. ७९.
(II)--a son of Angirasa. M. १९६. 2.
--an आत्रेय and a sage; a मन्त्रकृत् and gotrakara. Br. II. ३२. ११३: M. १४५. १०७: १९७. 7-8.
--an आत्रेय clan. Br. III. 8. ८५; वा. ७०. ७७.
--one of the ten horses of the moon's chariot. Br. II. २३. ५७.
(I)--a son of Citraka and father of two sons. Br. III. ७१. ११४, २५९: वा. ९६. ११३.

(II)--a son of Vasudeva and श्राद्धदेवि- (म्। प्।) adept in चित्र warfare. Father of भूरि and भूरीन्द्रसेन; <F>1:  Br. III. ७१. १८४: M. ४६. १९: ४७. २२: वा. ९६. २५०.</F> in a previous birth was Yama and created forests. <F>2:  वा 96. १८१-2.</F>
(III)--a son of अश्विनी and अक्रूर. M. ४५. ३२. [पगे१-525+ २५]
(I)--a son of Virocana, and father of three sons. वा. ६७. ७६-77.
(II)--one of Danu's sons. वा. ६८. 4.
(III)--a मानव with मनुष्य dharma. वा. ६८. १६.
--a chief वानर. Br. III. 7. २३५.
(I)--a daughter of काकुस्थ, and wife of Yati. Br. III. ६८. १३: वा. ९३. १४.
(II)--a name of सरस्वती. वा. २३. 5, ५५.
--a Gandharva. वा. ६९. २६.
--a pravara of Angiras M. १९६. १७.
--sacred to गणपति. Br. IV. ३८. 5.
--the abode of गणपति; <F>1:  Br. II. २७. १२३: IV. 7. ५९.</F> attained by the सूद्र who is not addicted to drink. <F>2:  वा. १०१. ३५४.</F> [पगे१-526+ ३८]
--the arrow of Arjuna; <F>1:  भा. I. 7. १६: 9. १५; X. ५८. १३.</F> the bow of Arjuna lost its power after कृष्ण's departure to heaven. <F>2:  Vi. V. ३८. २१, २३ and ४५.</F>
--a son of कृष्ण and माद्री (लक्ष्मणा-वि। प्।) भा. X. ६१. १५; Vi. V. ३२. 4.

--ancient popular songs; a feature of the पुरा- णस्; नारड on वालि's sacrifices; on पितृस्, on ययाति, on कार्- तवीर्य, on राम; <F>1:  Br. II. ३४. २१: III. 7. २७२: १९. 9: ६३. १९२: ६८. ९६: ६९. १९. IV. १५. ३२: M. ४३. २३: २०४. 2 and १९: Vi. III. 6. १५.</F> about गया and the नर्मदा; <F>2:  M. २२. 5: १८६. 5: २०७. ३९-40.</F> sung by divine ऋषिस् in खट्वान्ग's यज्ञ; <F>3:  वा. ६०. २१: ७३. ४१: ८३. १०: ८८. १९१: ९३. ९४: ९४. १९: ९६. १३.</F> by प्रह्लाद on Hari. <F>4:  Vi. I. १७. २९.</F>
--an आर्षेय pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. २२.

--(कौशिक) a royal sage who knew the yoga powers of Hari; <F>1:  भा. I. १९. 9: II. 7. ४४. वा. ९१. ६५-6.</F> the son of कुशाम्बु(a) (कुशनाभ- वा। प्।) Indra incarnate. His daughter was सत्यवती whom the ब्राह्मण R2ci1ka wanted to marry. गाधि thought him unsuitable and asked for a bride-fee of a thousand horses white like the moon and with one ear black. This condition was satisfied with the help of वरुण, and ऋचीक got her married. गाधि's wife took the consecrated चरु intended for her daughter and became the mother of a Brahmavit, by name विश्वामीत्र. <F>2:  भा. IX. १५. 4-१०: १६. २८ and ३२. Vi. IV. 7. ११-16.</F> He was desirous of more territory on the earth. <F>3:  भा. XII. 3. 9.</F> Son of कुशिक, wife Paurukutsi. <F>4:  Br. III. ६६. ३५. ५८.</F>

--a daughter of काशिराज, married श्वफल्क, mother of अक्रूर and other sons, used to present a cow every day to a ब्राह्मण (born after १२ years in the womb when her parents gave a gift of a cow everyday to a Brah- man-वि। प्। for three years). भा. IX. २४. १५: X. ४१. 6: ४९. 3: ५७. ३२: Br. III. ७१. ८२-110. वा. ९६. ९७, १०५, १०९: Vi. IV. १३. १२४-6; १४. 7.
--one of the nine divisions of भारतवर्ष. Br. II. १६. 9. M. ४८. 7.
(I)--a form of marriage by which कृष्ण married रुक्मिणी, and दुष्यन्त married शकुन्तला. Prin- cesses usually chose their husbands. भा. III. 3. 3; IX. २०. १५-16; Br. IV. १५. 5; Vi. III. १०. २४.

(II)--the science of music; a विद्या; मूर्- chanas and their लक्षणस् in; <F>1:  वा. ८६. २६, ३६-69. Vi. III. 6. २८.</F> the music displayed at the court of ब्रह्मा; also the music played upon by कृष्ण. <F>2:  भा. IX. 3. ३०; X. २१. 5[1]; Br. III. ६१. २१, २६-8.</F>
--attained by पुरूरवस्. Vi. IV. 6. ९३.
--music. भा. III. १२. ३८.
(I)--a daughter of Surabhi and कश्यप, and a sister of Rudras; mother of horses like उच्चैश्श्रवस्. Br. III. 3. ७३-7.
(II)--a daughter of Gandharvas. वा. ६९. १०. [पगे१-528+ ३३]
(III)--a R. from the lake विष्णुपदम्. Br. II. १८. ६८; वा. ४७. ६५.
(I)--the son of Aru(d)dha (आरब्ध-भा। प्।, वि। प्।). After him came the गान्धार country famous for horses. Father of Dharma. भा. IX. २३. १५; Br. III. ७४. 9-१०; वा. ९९. 9; Vi. IV. १७. 4.
(II) (स्वर)--an auspicious one; <F>1:  M. २४३. २१.</F> the third of the seven notes of music. <F>2:  वा. २१-32; ८६. ३७.</F>

(III) (च्)--a northern kingdom and tribe whose king contemporary of कृष्ण was शकुनि who was an ally of जरासन्ध. Hence his subjects were enlisted by जरासन्ध against the Yadus. शकुनि himself was placed on the east of Gomanta hill during its siege. Here Bharata's sons तक्ष and पुष्कर ruled; <F>1:  भा. X. ५२. ११ [6]; [५० (v) 3]. M. ११४. ४१; १२१. ४६; १४४. ५७. Br. II. १६. ४७; १८. ४७; ३१. ८३; III. ६३. १९०; ७३. १०८; ७४. 9-१०. वा. ८८. १८९.</F> noted for horses; <F>2:  वा. ९९. १०.</F> also gan- dhara.
--a son of शरद्वत् and a grandson of Druhyu, after whom was named the country गान्धार; had choice horses of the आरट्ट country. M. ४८. 6-7.
--a kind of sweet rice; unfit for श्राद्ध. Vi. III. १६. 8.
--of Agastya family. M. २०२. 2.

(I)--the wife of धृतराष्ट्र and mother of hundred sons--Duryodhana and others. <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. २६. M. ५०. ४७-8. वा. ९९. २४२. Vi. IV. २०. ३९.</F> Daughter of Subala. <F>2:  भा. X. ८४. 1.</F> Met by कृष्ण and राम after the burning of lac house. <F>3:  Ib. ५७. 2.</F> Heard of कृष्ण's marriage from his wives and was lost in wonder. <F>4:  Ib. X. ८४. 1.</F> Her grief at भीष्म's death; was consoled by युधिष्ठिर. <F>5:  Ib. I. 9. ४८.</F> Felt keenly कृष्ण's separation. Wel- comed Vidura to हस्तिनापुर. <F>6:  Ib. १०. 9; १३. 4.</F> Approved of the anointing of युधिष्ठिर. <F>7:  Ib. X. ८०[5].</F> Went with her daughter to स्यमन्तपञ्- caka for solar eclipse, and there met कृष्ण and वृष्णिस्. <F>8:  Ib. ८२. २४.</F> Settled on the banks of the Ganges with धृतराष्ट्र, follow- ing him to the Himalayas. As a chaste queen she ascended his funeral pyre. <F>9:  Ib. I. 8. 3; १३. २९ and ५७.</F>
(II)--one of the wives of धृष्टि. Father of Sumitra. Br. III. ७१. १८-19.
(III)--the wife of वृष्णि; gave birth to Sumitra. M. ४५. 1: वा. ९६. १७.
(IV)--a queen of कृष्ण. M. ४७. १३.
(V)--a daughter of Surabhi and कश्यप. वा. ६६. ७१.
--a सूक्तम् of the साम Veda to be recited in tank ritual; <F>1:  M. ५८. ३६; वा. 9. ४८.</F> from the first face of ब्रह्मा. <F>2:  Vi. I. 5. ५३.</F>
(II)--one of the seven horses yoked to sun's chariot; expiation for sin; in Sandhya worship. Br. II. २१. ११३; २२. ७२; २६. ४४; IV. 7. ६९. Vi. II. 8. 5; IV. 6. ८९.

(III)--a शक्ति; <F>1:  Br. IV. ४४. ८६.</F> mind-born daughter of ब्रह्मा, inseparable from him; a goddess enshrined in the Vedas; as the basis of dharma in the भागवत P. <F>2:  M. 3. ३२; 4. 7, 9 and २४; ५३. २०; १७१. २३.</F>
(IV)--रौद्री, contemplated by ब्रह्मा in the २१स्त् kalpa; गौः in Lohita kalpa. <F>2:  Ib. २३. ६९.</F>
--in गया; bathing at and offering of प्रातस्सन्ध्या or morning prayers. वा. ११२. २१.
--a भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. २३; वा. ८३. ६१.
--Unfit for श्राद्ध. वा. ७९. ६९.
--the १४थ् kalpa; an account of, in the गरुड Pura1n2a. M. ५३. ५३; २९०. 6.
--the पुराण of १९००० verses narrated by कृष्ण in the गारुड kalpa; the origin of गरुड from the mundane egg; a gift of, takes one to शिव loka, see गारुड Pura1n2a. M. ५३. ५३-4.
--सुग्रीव, the enemy of snakes in the Vai- कारिक hill. वा. ३९. ४०. [पगे१-531+ २७]
--a son of Bhuvamanyu. वा. ९९. १५९.
(I)--a contemporary of वासुदेव-Kr2s2n2a. Br. III. ७३. ९४.
(II)--a वीथी comprising स्रवण, धनिष्ठ and शतभिषक्. वा. ६६. ५१.
(I)--a son of शिनि. From क्षत्रियस्, ब्राह्- मण lines came into being. भा. IX. २१. १९.

(II)--a son of वेणुहोत्र and father of Gar- गभूमि, वंश and Vatsa--cursed Janamejaya; <F>1:  Br. III. ६७. ७७-8; ६८. २१. वा. ९२. ७३-4.</F> the curse led to the destruction of the chariot presented to Rudra by ययाति; his son Lokagandha was put to trouble by the wicked king Janamejaya; <F>2:  वा. ९३. २१.</F> a sage. <F>3:  Ib. ३४. ६३.</F>
(III)--an आर्षेय pravara of भार्गवस्. M. १९५. ३८.
(V)--a son of ऋषभ, the avatar of the lord. वा. २३. १४४. [पगे१-532+ ३०]
(VI)--a son of the avatar of the २८थ् dva1para. वा. २३. २२३.

(VII)--a pupil of भाष्कल; was childless and hence was ridiculed as impotent by स्याल; was engaged in penance for महादेव for a son by living on iron ore; was appointed to produce a child on the Yavana queen and the son was कालयवन. Vi. III. 4. २५; V. २३. 1-5.
--क्षत्रिय-Brahmans. वा. ९९. १६१. Vi. IV. १९. २३.
--a pravara. M. १९६. ३१.
--a भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. २३.
--one of the पञ्चार्षेयस् and a भार्गव. M. १९५. ३४.

--the sacrificial fire; Dharmavrata per- formed austerities standing in this fire; <F>1:  वा. ९७. २५, १११.</F> the face of the Veda. <F>2:  Ib. १०४. ८५; १०६. ४१.</F> Nirmathya agni; father of two sons, शम्स्य and शुक्र. <F>3:  Br. I. १२. ११; वा. २९. ११.</F>
--a भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. २३.

(I)--a sage of the VIIIth manvantara, a sage of सावर्णि epoch; a भार्गव gotrakara and a pravara sage. भा. VIII. १३. १५. Br. III. ६६-72; IV. 1. १०. M. 9. ३२; १९५. २२; १९६. ३१. Vi. III. 2. १७. [पगे१-533+ २४]
(II)--a sage who came to see कृष्ण at Syaman- तपञ्चक. भा. X. ८४. 4.

(IV)--a कौशिक; <F>1:  वा. १००. १०.</F> a son of विश्वामित्र, whose wife took him on her neck (gale baddha) to sell him for १०० cows. Satyavrata (Satyavrata त्रिशन्कु-ब्र्। प्।) releas- ed him and undertook to feed both of them so as to earn the gratitude and grace of विश्वामित्र. <F>2:  Br. III. ६३. ८९; वा. ८८. ९०.</F>
--of कौशिक gotra. वा. ९१. १००.
--an आर्षेय pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. २२.
--a group of नाडिस् of the sun pouring out heat. Br. II. २४. २९. वा. ५३. २२.
--a son of सारण. वा. ९६. १६५.
(I)--a son of श्वफल्क. भा. IX. २४. १६.
(II)--a son of बलराम. Br. III. ७१. १६७. [पगे१-534+ २६]

--worship of: Instituted by कृष्ण as a substitute for Indra worship among the Gopas. <F>1:  भा. X. २४. २५-32.</F> एत्य्। of; precious stones and herbs in. <F>2:  Br. II. 7. ११; १९. १३७; M. १०. २५-6.</F>
(I)--a son of बलराम. Br. III. ७१. १६७.
(II)--a son of सारण. वा. ९६. १६५.
--a R. sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ३९.
--the wife of Caidyoparicara (Vidyoparicara- वा। प्।). M. ५०. २६; वा. ९९. २२१.
--see Giri and क्षत्रोपक्षत्र. Vi. IV. १४. 9.
--a northern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ४७.
--sacred to उमा. भा. I. १५. १२. Br. IV. ३८. 7.
--represent Brahman. Br. IV. ४३. ७५ and ८६.
--sacred to उमा--performed for twelve months with different flowers for each month--also अमन्तऋईयव्रतम्. M. ६२. ३९. [पगे१-535+ ३०]
--a name of शिव. भा. II. 1. ३५.
--the best of six hill fortresses. M. २१७. 7.
--the place where कक्षिवान् attained Brah- manhood. वा. ९९. ९३.
--the cult of mountains; appropriate to the environment of cow-herds. Vi. V. १०. ३६; ३७-8, ४३-5.
--a son of गान्दिनी. वा. ९६. ११०.
--surname of उमा, पार्वती. Br. II. २५. ४०; वा. ५४. ४४, ९५ and ११५.
--sacred to ललिता. Br. IV. ४४. ९९.

--the capital of जरासन्ध, entered by कृष्ण, Arjuna and भीम disguised as ब्रह्मणस्. <F>1:  भा. X. ७०. २४; ७२. १६.</F> Here Gautama retired and कक्षिवत् attained Brahmanhood. Here too the बृहद्रथस् ruled. <F>2:  Br. III. ७४. ९५, ११० and १२८.</F> Capital of सोमाधि, son of Sahadeva killed in भारत war; capital of शिशुनाक after Nandivardhana while his son ruled from Benares. <F>3:  M. २७१. १९; २७२. 6.</F> Capital of the मागधेयस्. ^4 वा. ९९. २९६, ३१५.
--the name of शिव, the lord of भूतस् and पिशा- cas, having the trident in his hand. भा. II. 3. 7. Br. II. २७. ६३. M. ४७. १९०. वा. ६९, २८९; ७०. 8. [पगे१-536+ ३०]
--Mt. in the गयाशिला where Rudra sports with पार्वती. वा. १०८. ५१.

--of apsaras and Gandharvas; <F>1:  M. 7. १४; ६१. २३; ८२. २९; १०५. 6; १२०. ३१.</F> in connection with worship of trees and in founding new shrines. <F>2:  Ib. २३२. १५; २६५. 7 and ५१.</F> Kinnaras famous for; <F>3:  वा. ५४. 6; ६९. ३७.</F> five deities of. <F>4:  Ib. ८७. ३०.</F>
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १७. ४८.
--description of. वा. Ch. ८७.
--also गीतिचक्रनाथ, Cakraratha. Br. IV. १९. ७७; ३४. ५६; ३६. १२.
--assemblage of gods. Br. III. २४. ६२.
--with ghee for पिण्ड at Gaya. वा. १०५. ३४.
--a sugar-cow gift connected with विशोक- द्वादशिव्रतम्. Nine other धेनुस् are mentioned for this. Jaggery as one of the gifts, एत्य्। गुडाचल. M. ८१. २७; ८२. 2-३१; ८३. 5; ८५. 1.
--a name of Arjuna. भा. I. १७. ३१.

--three kinds of persons according to their nature; hence गुणत्रयम्; satva प्रकृति, राजस prakr2ti and तामस prakrti. Their different characteristics. A muni [पगे१-537+ ३२] serves satva and conquers rajas and tamas. <F>1:  भा. XI. २५. 9-३५.</F> If the three states are normal it is प्रकृति, प्रधान or avyakta. If in a condition of agitation, three deities Brahma, विष्णु and शिव are the result. <F>2:  M. 3. १४-6.</F> Twelve qualities; <F>3:  वा. ६२. २४.</F> twenty-six in num- ber; yoga, साम्ख्य, tapas, विद्या, vidhi, क्रिया, ऋतम्, satyam, अहिम्सा, ध्यानम्, सान्ति, अविद्या, mati, धृति, कान्ति, स्मृति, medha, लज्जा, शुद्धि, sarasvati, तुष्ति, पुष्ति etc., all in ब्रह्मा. <F>4:  Ib. २३. ५४.</F>
--the five senses and the five प्राणस् and the mind of the मुक्त leave him; a ज्ञानिन् does not take another body like the seeds burnt. वा. १०२. १०५-06.
--a वानर chief; son of श्वेत. Br. III. 7. १८१ and २४१.
--appellation for वैश्य. Vi. III. १०. 9.
(I)--a group of sixteen शक्तिस्. Br. IV. १९. १६ and २३.
(II)--rulers of the territory from गया to Pra- याग. Vi. IV. २४. ६३.
--ruled over states like प्रयाग, साकेतु, Magadha, etc. वा. ९९. ३८३.
(I)--a son of सम्कृति. भा. XI. २१. 2.
(II)--a son of Bhautya Manu. Br. IV. 1. ११४. वा. ११०. ५१. [पगे१-538+ ३३]

(III)--devotion to, praised by Kaca; his daughter cannot be married by a pupil, as she stands in relation of a sister. <F>1:  M. २५. ६९; २६. 6-8, १२-16.</F> Guru (शुश्रूष) service of the teacher pleases Hari. कृष्ण's discourse on service to guru, and his tribute to his teacher सान्दीपानि. It is said that guru's blessings make a man rise to his full stature. <F>2:  भा. X. ८०. २८-43.</F> Different kinds of guru--महागुरु, आचार्य, देशीक and others. <F>3:  Br. IV. 8. 3-6.</F> Implicit obedience to. Transgressing his orders leads one to be born an aerial spirit: fit to be honoured like a king and a god. <F>4:  Ib. ४३. ३७-59.</F>
(IV)--the planet बृहस्पति. M. ९३. १४.
--ten of them were kings; <F>1:  भा. XII. 1. ३०.</F> rule after तुषारस्, along with वृषलस्. These were mlecchas for ३११ years. <F>2:  Br. III. ७४. १७३ and 7; M. २७३. १९, २२-3.</F>
--defiler of the preceptor's bed; a heinous sin. वा. ६०. ७५; ७८. ३४; १०१. १५३; १०५. १३.
--the Preceptor's fee, offered by कृष्ण and राम; <F>1:  Vi. V. २१. २४.</F> by केशिध्वज to खाण्डिक्य. <F>2:  Ib. VI. 6. ३९, ४३ and ४८.</F>
--a son of सम्कृति. Vi. IV. १९. २२.
--a son of साम्कृति. वा. ९९. १६०.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३६.
--a son of Bali. M. 6. ११.
--a son of साराण. वा. ९६. १६५.

(I)--(God सुब्रह्मण्य, सेनापति) a son of अम्बिका (पार्वति) was born as साम्ब, son of कृष्ण. तीर्थ sacred to, in the सरस्वती visited by Vidura. <F>1:  भा. III. 1. २२. and ३०. Br. III. २४. 4; IV. ३०. १०४; वा. ३०. ३१५; ३९. ५५, ४१. ४०; Vi. V. ३३. २६.</F> Guha is said to hve shot arrows at क्रौञ्च hill. <F>2:  भा. V. २०. १९.</F> Fought with तारक in the देवासुर war and with Pradyumna at शोनितपुर. <F>3:  Ib. VIII. १०. २८; X. ६३. 7.</F> Relieved Mucukunda defending Heaven. <F>4:  Ib. ५१. १६.</F> With peacock as riding animal, defended त्रिपुरारि's chariot; birth of, in a शरवन, as a baby of seven days killed Asura तारक. <F>5:  M. १३३. ६४; १४०. ४०; १४६. १०-11; २६६. ४२.</F> Weapon शक्ति. <F>6:  Vi. III. 2. १२.</F> [पगे१-540+ २५]
(II)--the ruler of kingdoms Kalinga, महिष, Mahendranilaya, etc. Br. III. ७४. १९८; वा. ९९. ३८६.
--rule over Kalinga, माहिष, and Mahendra hill regions. Vi. IV. २४. ६५.

--cave (golden) in कुहरिणि in Meru where व्यास composed the four Vedas having conquered hunger, mind and आसन; after one hundred years of contemplation the Vedas came to him in their full form. वा. १०४. ६७-9.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८२.
--on the northern side of the निषध hill. वा. ४१. ५५.
--a ऋत्विक् at the sacrifice of ब्रह्मा. वा. १०६. ३९.

--the अवतार् of the Lord in the seventeenth द्वापर in the सिद्धक्षेत्र of the Himalayas; with four sons all ब्रह्मज्ञस्; each of the latter had a number of disciples, all engaged in महेश्वर yoga. वा. २३. १७५-7. [पगे१-541+ ३८]

--demons and followers of Kubera, <F>1:  भा. I. 9. 3; X. ३४. २८; II. १०. ३७; IV. 4. ३४.</F> who reside in Himalayan valley. <F>2:  Ib. IV. 5. २६; १०. 5.</F> Magic relating to; <F>3:  Ib. X. ५५. २३.</F> followers of शिव; <F>4:  Ib. ६३. १०.</F> attain heaven by association with the righteous; <F>5:  Ib. XI. १२. 3; १४. 5.</F> are यक्ष-ra1ks2as; <F>6:  Br. III. 7. १६७; IV. 2. २६. M. १३. १७; १२१. 2.</F> their habits and duties; <F>7:  M. १८०. 9; २४६. ५३.</F> born out of Deva- janani and मणिवर and their issue. <F>8:  वा. ६९. १६२; १०१. २८.</F> राक्षसस्. <F>9:  Br. II. 8. ३३; वा. 9. ३२; ३०. ८४.</F>
--symbolical of देवी. Vi. I. 9. २०.
--garlic unfit for श्राद्ध। Vi. III. १६. 8.
(I)--a sage who called on the dying भिष्म. आर्षेय pravara of भार्गवस्. भा. I. 9. 7; M. १५५. ४४-5.
(II)--a son of Suhotra (Sutahotra) and father of शुनक (Saunaka), <F>1:  भा. IX. १७. 3; वा. ९२. 3-4; Vi. IV. 8. 5.</F> a क्षत्रोपेतद्विज. <F>2:  Br. III. ६६. ८७; ६७. 4.</F>
--a son of कृष्ण and मित्रविन्दा. भा. X. ६१. १६.
--a daughter of तामृआ, gave birth to vul- tures. Vi. I. २१. १५, १६. [पगे१-542+ ३३]

--in the left hand of the शिला when sages performed tapas in the form of an eagle; visit to it leads to शिवलोक; <F>1:  वा. १०८. ६१-2.</F> in गया; <F>2:  Ib. १०९. १५; १११. २२, ४२.</F> fit for श्राद्ध. <F>3:  Ib. ७७. ३८, ९७.</F>
--a daughter of ताम्रा, wife of अरुण, and mother of सम्पाति and जतायु. Br. III. 7. ४४६-8; M. 6. ३०-32.
--the deity presiding over the गृध्रेश्वर hill. वा. १०८. ६२.
--a deity to be worshipped in house- building. M. २५३. २५; २६८. १३.
(I)--the Agni where Ahirbudhnya is located. M. १२. २६; वा. २९. २४.
(II)--the यजमान of the sacrifice. वा. 1. २३.

(III)--his duties; <F>1:  भा. VII. १४. (whole); M. १८. १६; ४०. 1 and 3.</F> to do five यज्ञस् and ३० samska1ras; by adopting a पाषण्ड as guru, that family will be ruined. <F>2:  M. ५२. १६; २६७. ३३.</F> duties of; good conduct; observance of daily duties and rituals; fasts, feasts, agnihotra, श्राद्ध, etc.; by observing them he goes to the world of प्रजापति.
--of mud becomes secure by mud plaster--illus- trative of body being nourished by vegetables and rice. Vi. II. १५. २९.
--of यादवस्, reckoned as ३८ millions in number engaged in teaching arms. Vi. IV. १५. ४५.
--a son of सावर्णि Manu. वा. १००. ८४.
--a Janapada of the east. वा. ४५. १२३.
(I)--the wife of Brahmadatta and mother of विष्- vaksena. भा. IX. २१. २५.

(II)--created from the belly and sides of the Lord; considered a part of Hari's body. As they supplied milk for हविस्, कंसा resolved to kill them. Nanda gave them as gifts to ब्राह्मणस् during कृष्ण's जातकर्मा. <F>1:  भा. X. 4. ३९-41; 5. 3; M. १३. ५८; Vi. I. 5. ४८.</F> In their stalls and in places cleaned by their dung श्राद्ध can be performed. Objects of worship. <F>2:  Br. III. १३. १२८-130; २८. ११, ५७ and ६०; IV. 6. ३८ and ४६; ४०. ११६.</F> गोरक्ष introduced by पृथु; <F>3:  Br. II. ३६. १९८.</F> their guru was the sun. <F>4:  Vi. V. 1. १४; १०. २६.</F> born of Surabhi, वृषभ their lord; dharmas pertaining to; <F>5:  M. 6. ४४; 8. 8; ४८. ५२; ५२. १८.</F> their stall (गोष्ठ) as fit for श्राद्ध offering; <F>6:  Ib. १५. ३३; १६. २२; १७. ११; ८३. १०.</F> their horn used for washing images, esp. of शिव. <F>7:  Ib. ५६. 6; ६०. ३३.</F>
(III)--सूर्य; see गा. Vi. V. 1. १४.
--dried cow dung placed on the head of afflicted children to remove evils; an ancient यादव practice. Vi. V. 5. १३. [पगे१-544+ ३३]

(I)--a place sacred to शिव, in extent half a yojana on the western sea; visited by बलराम. Sages of this place came to द्वारका; <F>1:  भा. X. ७९. १९; ९०. २८ [4]; वा. २३. १७२.</F> a तपोवनं, called धूतपाप- sthalam; sacred to Rudra. <F>2:  Br. III. १३. १९; IV. ४४. ९६.</F> Swallowed by sea, the sages left to the Sahya hill and reported of the erosion to राम on the Mahendra hill. Addressed by them, राम appealed to वरुण who at first did not turn up. When he grew wroth, वरुण promised to give back the land. <F>3:  Ib. III. ५६. 7-५६; ५७. १२ to the end and ch. ५८. whole.</F> Here Yama per- formed penance and became a लोकपाल and lord of पितृस्; sacred to पितृस्. <F>4:  M. ११. १८-20; २२. ३८.</F> Sacred to भद्रकर्णिका; <F>5:  M. १३. ३०; १८१. २५.</F> a sacred place for the performance of श्राद्ध; nearby is the R. ताम्रपर्णी; sacred to शन्कर. <F>6:  वा. ४८. ३०; ७७. १९-21.</F>
(II)--the avatar of the १६थ् dva1para in the holy गोकर्ण vana with four sons. वा. २३. १७२.
(III)--a ऋत्विक् at the sacrifice of ब्रह्मा. वा. १०६. ३९.
(IV)--a measurement by the ring finger. Br. I. 7. ९७; वा. 8. १०३.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २४.
--a Mt. in भारतवर्ष. भा. V. १९. १६.
--R. in भारतवर्ष; trembled at हिरण्- यकशिपु's reign. M. १६३. ६३.
--a pupil of शाकल्य. भा. XII. 6. ५७; Br. II. ३५. 2.
--‘raid for taking cows’; death in, leads to heaven. वा. १०५. १६.
--the slayer of cows; the other three heinous crimes are ingratitude, wine drinking and defiling of teacher's bed. वा. ६० 74; १०१. १५२.
(I)--one of Atri's ten wives. Br. III. 8. ७५.
(II)--a daughter of घृताची and भद्राश्व. वा. ७०. ६९.
--a measurement equal to (1/4) nivartanam. M. २८३. १५.
--an आत्रेय gotrakara M. १९७. 4.
--a son of ऊर्जा and वसिष्ठ. Vi. I. १०. १३.
--the seven ऋषिस्. वा. ६१. ९४.
--a Gandharva. वा. ६९. २६.

--R. from the Sahya hill, the northern part of the Sahya where the गोदावरि is a charming spot. Here was founded the town Govardhana, and was planted flower trees by भरद्वाज. <F>1:  भा. V. १९. १८; Br. I. १२. १५; II. १६. ३४-45; वा. ४५. १०४, ११२. Vi. II. 3. १२.</F> R. sacred to पितृस्, filled with Lingas; also जामदग्नीतीर्थम्; personified as a wife of हव्यवा- hana fire. <F>2:  M. २२. ४६ and ५७-8; ५१. १३; ११४. २९; १६३. ६१. वा. २९. १३.</F>
--banks of गोदावरी, whence sages visited द्वारक. भा. X. ९०. २८ [5].
--a Janapada of the केतुमाल continent. वा. ४४. १५.
--sacred to त्रिसन्ध्या. M. १३. ३७.
--a kingdom of मध्यदेश. Br. II. १६. ४२.

--(see दीर्घतमस्) law of the beasts, learnt by दीर्घतमस् from Saurabheya वृष and prac- tised by him on his younger brother Gautama's wife-- Surabhi was pleased as a result and restored health, beauty and vision to दीर्घतम्स् who becme Gautama thereafter. M. ४७. ४३-55; ८०-84; Br. III. ७४. ४७-55, ९१; वा. ४८-9; ९९. ४७-50.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४४.
--an eastern region. Br. II. १६. ५५; M. ११४. ४५.
--a tribe that came out of the ocean of milk when churning. M. २५०. ११.
--the daughter by wish (मानसि) of सोमपा Pitr2s, and wife of शुक्र. वा. ६५. ७५.
--a तुषित god. वा. ६२. 9.

--connected with Devas, lived in Vraja; <F>1:  भा. X. 1. ६२; 2-7.</F> their joy at the birth of कृष्ण. <F>2:  Ib. 5. १४.</F> Vanacaras with no settled home; left बृहद्वन for ब्रिन्दावन in view of certain ominous por- tents. They travelled in bullock carts accompanied by music of तूर्य। A residential construction was put up by [पगे१-548+ २८] arranging their carts in a semi-circle. <F>3:  Ib. ११. ३०-36; Vi. V. 7. १८; १०. २६, ३३.</F> Their concern at कृष्ण being caught by कालीय, and their joy at his escape. <F>4:  भा. X. १७. १४.</F> Pleased at Pralamba's (s.v.) death. <F>5:  Ib. १८. ३०.</F> While Arjuna was guarding कृष्ण's wives after his decease, the Gopas over- powered him. <F>6:  Ib. I. १५. २०-21.</F> Supplied butter and ghee to कंसा. <F>7:  Vi. V. १५-22.</F>
--the eighth daughter of रौद्राश्व. वा. ९९. १२६.
(I)--a name of the sun. Br. III. ५९. ६८.
(II)--the name of विष्णु in गया. वा. १०८. ५२.
(III)--माया, the वैष्णवी in गया worshipped by Rudra. वा. १०८. ५२.
--a तुषित god. Br. II. ३६. १०.
--आत्रेय gotrakaras. M. १९७. 3.
--an eastern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ५४.
--आभिरस् and Dasyus; <F>1:  Vi. V. ३८, २४ and ४९.</F> chief weapons of, staves and cudgels. <F>2:  Ib. ३८. ५०-5.</F>
--one of the five श्वेत Para1s4aras. M. २०१. ३३.

--(girls) see कात्यायनि vrata. The gopi women were enchanted by the music of कृष्ण, took to ब्रिन्दावन, and worshipped him. By singing his glories and through काम they became one with Him. <F>1:  भा. X. २१. 7-२०.</F> On another occasion they were so much moved by his music that they left their household work, children and male members and came to ब्रिन्दावन्. Though they were asked to go back they refused, and desired to attain His feet. While they were enjoying his presence, कृष्ण suddenly disappeared. They wandered all the forest in search of Him, addressing all trees and plants as to his whereabouts. During all this time each thought that every one of them was कृष्ण and imitated his boyish exploits. After vain search they came to the very place wherefrom they started and meditated on his great- ness. They praised him in the form of गीतम् looking for- ward to his arrival. Soon he was in their midst and con- soled them. They took part in the रास क्रीड where was seen a कृष्ण between every two women. They sang and danced unconscious of the loosening of their jewels, braid or clothes. When they sweated in fatigue, कृष्ण wiped off their sweat. They then enjoyed water-sports, and sports on the river-banks in the उपवन। By dawn they repaired to their homes. <F>2:  Ib. chaps. २९-33.</F> When some gopis were forcibly taken by शन्ख Cu1da, कृष्ण released them and killed him. <F>3:  Ib. ३४. २४-32.</F> When कृष्ण was away in the woods, the gopis who were at homes sang in praise of his वेणु गीता। <F>4:  Ib. ३५ (whole).</F> Gopis heard of कृष्ण going to मथ्रा with अक्रूर and characterised अक्रूर to be only a क्रूर as he brought about कृष्ण's sepa- ration from them. They turned their minds on the past deeds of कृष्ण, and stood motionless as pictures at his leav- [पगे१-550+ ३१] ing them. कृष्ण assured them of his return soon. <F>5:  Ib. ३९. १३-32.</F> Uddhava was sent by कृष्ण with a message to gopis and gopas. The gopis mistook his chariot for that of अक्रूर. They all sur- rounded him and enquired of कृष्ण and his attitude towards them. Uddhava brought relief to them by delivering कृष्ण's message while they recounted to him his deeds at ब्रिन्दा- van. Pleased at their attachment to the Lord, Uddhava took leave of them after spending some time there. <F>6:  Ib. ४६. ४८, and ch. ४७ whole.</F> They went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक and met कृष्ण who took them aside and consoled them so much so that they were all in contem- plation of Him. Left for मथुरा. <F>7:  Ib. ८२. ४०-49; ८४. ६९.</F> and attained salvation by सत्सन्ग। <F>8:  Ib. XI. १२. 6; VII. 1. ३०.</F>
--what gopis sang in honour of कृष्ण. भा. X. ३१ (whole).
--a name of कृष्ण--also गोपीश्वर. Br. III. ३३. 3 and १०; ३४. ४२; ३६. २९; ४२. १९.
--waving of cow's tail over child- ren to remove fear from their minds, an ancient यादव practice. Vi. V. 5. १२.
(I)--a son of Vanhi, and father of त्रिसानु. Br. III. ७४. 1; वा. ९९. 1.
(II)--a son of Garbha. M. ४८. 1.
(I)--a Pravara sage. M. १९९. १६. [पगे१-551+ २७]
(II)--a ऋत्विक् at the यज्ञ of ब्रह्मा. वा. १०६. ३७.
(I)--a son of शम्भु. Br. III. 5. ४०; वा. ६७. ८१.
(II)--a Mauneya Gandharva. Br. III. 7. 2.
(I)--a R. in भारतवर्ष from the Himalayas visited by बलराम; in the नैषमेय region. भा. V. १९. १८; X. ७९. ११; Br. I. 2. 9; II. १६. २६. M. ११४. २२; १६३. ६३. वा. 2. 9; ४५. ९५; Vi. III. १४. १८.
(II)--the capital of दिवोदास when काशी was destroyed by क्षेमक. Br. III. ६७. २९; वा. ९२. २६.
(III)--a goddess enshrined at Gomanta. M. १३. २८.
(IV)--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्; the birth-place of यज्ञवराह. M. २२. १३ and ३१.
(I)--(Gomatin-ब्र्। प्।) a king; son of Arindama and father of पूरींअत्. भा. XII. 1. २६.
(II)--a son of शिवस्वाति and father of Alimat. Vi. IV. २४. ४७.

--the hill fortress far south of मथुरा. कृष्ण and राम went on a visit to it. At its foot lay करवीर- pura. Its crest was प्रवर्षण. Besieged by जरासन्ध [पगे१-552+ २५] on all four sides, राम and कृष्ण ascended it and leapt off the hill into the plain to gain द्वारका unknown to the enemy. <F>1:  भा. X. [५२ (v) १६], [२८ and ३२]; [५३ (v) 1-5]; ५२. ११. [1 and 4], १२-13.</F> Sacred to गोमती. <F>2:  M. १३. २८.</F>
--cowdung as disinfectant. Br. III. 7. ४३१; १३. १३०.
--कश्यप gotrakaras. M. १९९. 4.
(I)--city of, in Sutalam. Br. II. २०. २२.
(II)--second Tala; Asura in. वा. ५०. २१.
(III)--a son of शम्भु. वा. ६७. ८७.
(IV)--a pupil of Vedamitra--शाकल्य. Vi. III. 4. २२.
--a Svara शक्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ५६.
--Mt. one of the seven hills of प्लक्षद्वीप; gives its name to गोमेदवर्ष. Br. II. १९. 7, १३८; M. १२३. २८; वा. ४९. 6; Vi. II. 4. 7.
--a pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. १६. [पगे१-553+ ३०]

--another name for the country शान्तभ- yam in the प्लक्षद्वीप; <F>1:  Br. II. १९. १५.</F> surrounding the sea of wine and surrounded by sugar-cane juice sea; <F>2:  M. १२३. 1-4; १२४. ५०.</F> encircles the Kumuda hill. <F>3:  Ib. १२३. 7.</F>
--in प्लक्षद्वीप; see Gomedam. Br. II. १९. 7.
--the cult of cattle appropriate to the profes- sion of a pastoral tribe; <F>1:  Vi. V. १०. ३६, ३७-8.</F> circumambulating of cows and bulls. <F>2:  Ib. V. १०. ४६.</F>
--introduced by पृथु. Vi. I. १३. ८४.
--a disciple of शाकल्य. वा. ६०. ६४.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४४.
--born of Pulaha--a वानर tribe. Br. III. 7. १७५.

--the residence of Surabhi; <F>1:  भा. X. २७. 1; Br. III. ३२. ४०; ४१. ५५; ४२. १९; ४३. २९; IV. 1. १५६; वा. १००. १५९; १०४. ५३-55.</F> bathers in Soma तीर्थम् and givers of presents of a cow with calf go to this region. <F>2:  M. १९१. ९९; २०५. 8.</F> [पगे१-554+ ३९]
--surname of कृष्ण. Br. III. ३३. २२.

(I)--Mt. a hill in भारतवर्ष, near Brin- दावन्, <F>1:  भा. V. १९. १६; X. ११. ३६; १३. २९.</F> held by कृष्ण for a week warding off rain; <F>2:  X. २५. १९; २७. 1; Vi. V. ११. १६-25; १२. 1; १३. 1 and 4, २८; १५. 1.</F> sacred to भरद्वाज who brought down heavenly trees and plants on behalf of राम; <F>3:  M. ११४. ३८.</F> worship of, with prayers and viands; sacrifice of goats to. <F>4:  Vi. V. १०. 8, ३८.</F>

(II)--a city founded on the गोदावरी by राम; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ४४.</F> a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्; <F>2:  M. २२-52.</F> established by Indra for राम's sake; भरद्वाज took his birth at. <F>3:  वा. ४५. ११३.</F>

(I)--the name given to कृष्ण by Indra the lord of Gokula; <F>1:  भा. X. २७. २३, २८; Br. III. ३३. 8.</F> the यादव king; went in search of मणि by tracing the steps of Prasenajit when he was supposed to have killed him for the sake of the jewel, and came upon a place where Prasena and his horses were dead; proceeding he saw a dead lion and further a cave of a bear in the Vindhyas and heard the talk of a muse fondling the son of the bear; overhearing he heard: “dont cry„ Syamantaka is yours”. Then he entered the mouth of the cave and saw जाम्बवान्, the king of bears; had hand-to-hand fight for २१ days; the followers of कृष्ण returned to द्वारवती and spread the news that कृष्ण was dead; defeating the bear he got the hand of his daughter जाम्बवती with the मणि and returned home; gave it to शक्रजित् in an assembly. <F>2:  वा. ९६. ३२-50.</F>
(III)--a hill of the क्रौञ्चद्वीप. M. १२२. ८०.
--the residence of the constellations--हस्तम्, चित्र, स्वाति; one in the Madhya मार्ग. Br. III. 3. ५०; M. १२४. ५७; वा. ६६. ४९.
--the overlord of humped animals (quadru- peds). Br. III. 8. ११; वा. ७०. १०.
--the Bull, the riding animal of शिव. वा. ५४. ४५; १०१. २३७, २४६.
--not a place for committing nuisance; <F>1:  Vi. III. ११. १२२.</F> the resi- dential quarters of cowherds; <F>2:  Ib. V. १०. ४९; ११. १४; १४. 1.</F> of काशि's king. <F>3:  Ib. V. ३४. ४२.</F>
--a भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. २४.
--a sacrifice performed by Nanda at the sugges- tion of कृष्ण; one produced by ब्रह्मा. भा. III. 2. ३२; १२. ४०.
--the seventh गान्धार gra1mika1. वा. ८६. ४३.
--a gift of cows, a thousand in number pro- perly adorned with bronze milking vessels and a bull in the midst, leads one to शिव's abode. M. २७४. 7; २७८. 1-२९.
(I)--the mind-born daughter of पितृस् and wife of शुक्र. Br. III. 1. ७७; M. १५. १५; वा. ७३. ३६. [पगे१-556+ २५]
(II)--technical name of the Earth first milked by पृथु, and then by others to get the essence each wanted. M. १०. 2-२८.
(III)--another name for कृत्वी, a daughter of शुक. M. १५. १०.
--noted for श्रावस्ति. M. १२. ३०.
--an एकार्षेय sage. M. २००. 5.
(I)--came to see भिष्म in his death-bed and called on परीक्षित् engaged in प्रायोपवेश. भा. I. 9. 7; १०. 9; १९. १०.
(II)--a siddha; his wife was अहल्या and son शतानन्द (Gotama-ब्र्। प्।); cursed Indra. भा. IX. २१. ३४; Br. II. २७. २३.
(III)--a sage of the Vaivasvata epoch; pre- sent at अम्बरीष's अश्वमेध. भा. VIII. १३. 5; IX. 4. २२; M. 9. २७.
(IV)--a name of कृप--invited for युधिष्- ठिर's राजसूय। Came to स्यमन्तपञ्चक to see कृष्ण on the occasion of a solar eclipse. भा. X. ४९. 2; ७४. 7; ८४. 3.
(V)--the sage who presides over the month तपस्। भा. XII. ११. ३९; Br. II. २३. १२. Vi. ५२. १२; ६१. ४४. [पगे१-557+ ३१]
(VI)--a son of Utathya; also known as शरद्- vat; a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५२; ३८. २८.
(VII)--the २०थ् Vedavya1sa. Br. II. ३५. १२१; Vi. I. 9. २१; III. 1. ३२; 3. १६.

(VIII)--officiated at परशुराम's sacrifice; <F>1:  Br. III. ३६. 5; ४७. ४८.</F> आश्रम near the town Jayanta; <F>2:  Br. III. ६४. 2; वा. ५९. 2.</F> after him was named a forest region. <F>3:  वा. २३. १६३.</F>

(IX)--originally दीर्घतमस्, became Gau- tama rid of the curse of बृहस्पति by Surabhi's favour. Heard the वायु पुराण from भरद्वाज and narrated it to नीर्यन्त्र. Br. III. ७४. ९४. IV. 4. ६३. वा. ९९. ९२; १०३. ६३; १०६. ३८.
(X)--the अवतार् of the Lord in the १४थ् dva1- para of the family of Angiras in the Gautamavana with four sons at the end of the yuga. वा. २३. १६३.
(XI)--a son of उशिज and brother of दीर्घ- tamas, (s.v.) Praised त्रिपुरारि. M. ४८. ५३; १२६. १३; १३३. ६७.
(XII)--a mind-born son of ब्रह्मा. M. १७१. २७; १९२. १०.
(XIII)--a son of सुरूपा and a gotrakara. M. १९६. 4-5.
(XIV)--(शरद्वत्) a son of Angiras by स्वराट्. वा. ६४. २६; ६५. ९७ and १००. [पगे१-558+ २७]
(XV)--in the sun's chariot in the month of आश्वयुज. Vi. II. १०. ११.
(XVI)--officiated as होत in Nimi's sacrifice. Vi. IV. 5. 6.
(I)--a collective name of the sons of काक्- षीवत्. M. ४८. ८८.
(II)--a clan of Angirasas. वा. ६५. ९७.
--शारद्वतस् or ऋतथ्यस्. वा. ९९. २०५.

--a daughter of सत्यधृति found in a bed of कुश grass; <F>1:  वा. ९९. २०४.</F> the mother of अश्वत्थाम; called also कृपी; one among the party that welcomed Vidura in हस्तिनापुर. <F>2:  भा. I. 7. ३३ and ४५-47; १३. 4.</F>
--an Andhra king; ruled for २१ years. Br. III. ७४. १६७; M. २७३. १२; वा. ९९. ३५५.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्, in the Nar- मदा; bath there leads one to Brahmalokam in a golden विमान. M. २२. ६८; १९३. ६०.
--Mt. a hill of the भारतवर्ष. वा. ४५. ९१.
(I)--a वैकुण्ठ god. Br. II. ३६. ५१.

(III)--a Mt. of gold to the north of the कैलास; with हरिताल trees; celebrated for golden crests; at its foot was lake Bindusaras where भगीरथ was engaged in austerities. Here Indra performed a number of sacrifices. Br. II. १८. २४-8; M. १२१. २४; वा. ४७. २३-5.
--a पारशर branch. वा. ७०. ८७.
--आत्रेय gotrakaras. M. १९७. 2.
--आत्रेय gotrakaras. M. १९७. 2.
--a sage not to have marriage alliances with Angiras and सम्कृति. M. १९६. ३२.
--a son of गौरी and an emperor also called मान्धाता (s.v.). वा. ८८. ६६.
(II)--a daughter of Antinara; the wife of Yuva- नाश्व; cursed by her husband, became the river बाहुदा; mother of Gaurika मान्धातृ. Br. III. ६३. ६७; M. ४९. 8; वा. ८८. ६५-6.
(III)--the wife of विराज; <F>1:  वा. २८. १२.</F> son, सुधाम. <F>2:  Br. II. ११. १४.</F>
(IV)--good to marry; for a son of such marriage would purify twenty-one generations of his and six on his mother's side. वा. ८३. १२, ४४.
(V)--a daughter of रण्ति and mother of मान्- धात. वा. ९९. १३०.
--the २८थ् kalpa is so called. M. २९०. १०.
--sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ३१.
--शिवलोकम् sacred to पार्वती. Br. III. ३२. 3; M. ६३. २८; १०१. १६.
--a vow in honour of गौरी. M. १०१. 8.
--a place sacred to ललिता. Br. IV. ४४. ९८. [पगे१-561+ २८]
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ७६.
--(Pratadvoca; Venkateswara, Ed.) a place in the यज्ञशाल where Nabha-agni is located. वा. २९. २१.
--the details of topical heads fur- nished. M. २९१. २८.
--the commander-in-chief of तारक's army; fought with Yama, Jambha and others; his head cut off by विष्णु's cakra. M. १४८. ३८; १५०. 1-४३; १५१. २६-36.
(I)--a परा god. Br. IV. 1. ५७.

(II)--planets, seven in number excluding राहु and Ketu; known as वैमानिकस् in the current epoch (Vai- vasvata)--राहु and Ketu are planets which tease the sun and moon; <F>1:  वा. 3. १४; 7. १६; ३०. १४६; ३१. ३५; ५१. 8; ५३. २९, १०९.</F> each ग्रह has three स्थानस्, दक्षिण, uttara and madhyama.^2
--for शक्ति worship, described. Br. IV. ४४. ७६-9.

--(also graha शान्ति)--propitiation to planets. Three kinds of, all distinguished--ayuta homa, लक्ष homa and कोटि homa. Ritual is like the shield against bows and arrows; to be performed for attaining wealth, longevity and prosperity, as also to get rid of troubles. Even the posses- sion of a copy containing the three forms of ग्रहबलि frees [पगे१-562+ ३१] the members of the household from all diseases. Also known as graha यज्ञ. M. १७. ५६; २४. ४६; ९३. 2. to the end; ९४. 1-2; २३९. 1 and 4-5.
--the sun so-called. वा. ५३. २९.

--burnt offering to the nine planets: Sun to be located in the centre; presiding deity is शिव; red colour; food pleasing to, is rice cooked with sugar. Moon in the south-east; presiding deity पार्वती; white rice with ghee and sugar pleasing to: Mars to be located in the south; presiding deity is Skanda; red; याव pleasing to: Mercury to be located in north-east; presiding deity is Hari; yellow; food pleasing to, is milk and rice. Jupiter in the north; presiding deity is ब्रह्मा; yellow rice and curds pleasing to: Venus in the east; presiding deity is Indra; white; food pleasing to, is coarse sugar and rice. Saturn in the west; presiding deity is Yama; black; rice, seasamum and pulses cooked in milk pleasing to: राहु south-west; presiding deity is काल; black; mutton food to: Ketu in north-west; presiding deity is Citragupta; smoke colour; coloured rice as food to: <F>1:  M. ९३. 5-२०.</F> Homa detailed; <F>2:  M. ९३. २१-84.</F> Icons of. <F>3:  M. ch. ९४.</F>
--interplanetary distances described. Br. IV. 2. १३१-4.
--a son of the third सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ८१. [पगे१-563+ २९]

(I)--a village; outside the खेट; between the village and खेट is (1/2) yojana; the limits of boundary are two क्रोशस् and of क्षेत्र (fields) four धनुस्; the roads of twenty धनुस् leading to twenty directions and also roads to ग्रामस् and roads on the limits, १० धनुस्; also राजपथ; four धनुस् for branch streets; two धनुस् between the houses. Br. II. 7. ९४ and १०५; वा. 8. १००; ६२. १७१; ७८. ५७; ८७. २८; ९४. ४०; ९८. ११९; १०६. ७३-75; Vi. 2. १३; ३६. 6.

(II)--as a present to learned men, as distinct from towns at the time of पृथु. ग्राम behind the forest and the forest behind the ग्राम explained by ययाति to अष्टक; reference to ascetics and sages who, as residents of village should not use forest produce, and as residents of forests should not use village produce; deserted during the time of anarchy. ^1 Br. II. ३४. ३९; ३६. १९७; III. 7. ३०८; M. १४३. 3; २४६. ४५. ^2 M. १०. ३२; ४०. 9-१३; ४१. 2; ४७. २५७.
--the kingdom to which Puramjana went by the आसुरि entrance of his city with his companion Durmada. भा. IV. २५. ५२.
(I)--a name of विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ६९.
(III)--a class of celestial beings in attendance in pairs on the sun God in each of the six seasons. वा. ५२. 1. [पगे१-564+ २४]
(IV)--resides in the sun's chariot in the months of Caitra and Madhu. Vi. II. १०. 3.
--a class of यक्षस्. भा. XII. ११. ४८; Br. I. 1. ८३; II. २३. 1 and १४.
--the village messenger, unfit for पन्क्ति भोजन। Br. III. १९. ३०; वा. ८३. ६१.

--cows, goats, men, sheep, horses, mules and horses at the commencement of त्रेता yuga; आरण्यस्, dogs, two-hoofed elephants, monkeys, birds, undakas and snakes; sapta ग्राम्य pas4ava, सप्ता aran2yakas (Tait. Samh.). Br. II. 8. ४७-49; वा. 9. ४६-8.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १५.

--१४ kinds of corn; vritri, yava, माष, गोधुमा, अणु, tila, priyangu, कुलत्थिका, स्यामक, निवारस्, jartila, gavedhuka, kuruvinda, वेणुयव (bamboo corn) and मर्कटक. They originally grew unploughed and un- sown, but in the त्रेतायुग they were raised by the plough and by seeds. Br. I. 7. १३८, १४३ff.; वा. 8. १४४. १४. १५३-55. [पगे१-565+ २४]
--from the feet of नारायण; one of the १६ Ritviks for a यज्ञ. M. १६७. १०.
--Summer; Mitra and वरुण, Atri and वसिष्ठ, तक्षक and Rambha, मेनका and सहजन्या, हहा and हहू, Rathasvana and Rathacitra, पौरुषेय and Vadha, all reside with the sun. वा. ५२. 6.
--an Asura in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु. M. १६१. ८१.
--a measurement of time. भा. V. २१. 4.
(I)--a member of शिव gan2a. Br. III. ४१. २७.
(II)--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८८.
(III)--an Asura in the सभा of हिरण्य- कशिपु. M. १६१. ८०.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १५. [पगे१-566+ २२]
--a region noted for horses. Br. IV. १६. १७.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २३.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ७०.
--three kinds described. वा. ५१. २८-33.

--the sea of clouds surrounding the अण्ड, supported by the ever-blazing energy (fire) of clouds (ghana- tejas) like the burning iron rod; outside is a vast region sup- ported by Ghana वात, which rests again on आकाश. The last is supported by महत्, प्रधान being a prop to महत्। Br. II. २१. २४-7; वा. ४९. १५३-55; ५०. ८२-4.
--sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ३५.
--a servant-maid of देवयानी. M. २७. २४-7.
(I)--a son of Vaidya (s.v.). Br. III. ५९. 7; वा. ८४. 7.
(II)--a sage of the XI epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. ३१.

--in previous birth, son of मरीचि and ऊर्ण, now born as a son of देवकी and killed by कम्सा. कृष्ण recovered him from Sutalam, took him to द्वारका to be seen by his parents. Afterwards he went to heaven. भा. X. ८५. ४७-56.
--a son of Dharma and father of Durdama. M. ४८-8; Vi. IV. १७. 4.
--fit for a gift during the विशोकद्वादशी- vratam. M. ८२. १८.
--taking of ghee, as purification for sin of killing worms in food, oil, fruits and flowers. M. २२७. ३८.
--a son of Priyavrata, appointed Lord of क्रौञ्चद्वीप. भा. V. 1. २५ and ३३; २०. २०. [पगे१-568+ २७]
--an ocean of, surrounding क्रौञ्चद्वीप. Br. II. १६. १२; IV. ३१. १८; M. १३. 7.
--leads to the world of ब्रह्मा. M. १०१. ६८.
--mountain of ghee, as a gift. M. ८३. 6; ८९. 1-2.
--an Apsaras. वा. ६९. ४९.

--an Apsaras, mother of ten sons through Rau- द्राश्व; (भद्राश्व-म्। प्।); presiding over the month of Tapas; <F>1:  भा. IX. २०. 5; XII. ११. ३९; Vi. I. 9. १०३; Br. II. २३. १३; Br. III. 7. १५. M. ४९. 4; वा. ६९. ४९; ७०. ६८.</F> in the sun's chariot in the आश्वयुज month; <F>2:  Vi. II. १०. ११.</F> with the शरत् Sun. <F>3:  Br. IV. ३३. १९; वा. ५२. १३.</F>
--a R. in कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १५.
--a sage moving with the sun. Br. II. २१. ११५.
--a son of पुरूरवस् and उर्वशी. Br. III. ६६. २३.
--one of the ten sons of रौद्राश्व. वा. ९९. १२४.
--sea surrounding the कुशद्वीप (see घृतम्). भा. V. 1. ३३; २०. १३; Br. II. १९. ६३-5; Vi. II. 4. ४५. [पगे१-569+ १९]
--the २५थ् kalpa. M. २९०. 9.
--the twelfth and last अवतार् of विष्णु in वराहकल्प. वा. ९७. ७६.
(I)--a son of Pulinda and father of Vajramitra; a शुन्ग king; ruled for three years. भा. XII. 1. १७. Br. III. ७४. १५३.
(III)--a small village hamlet. Br. III. ६९. ४०; ७०. १०. वा. ९४. ४०.
--a son of Pulindaka and father of Vajra- mitra. Vi. IV. २४. ३५.
(also चकोराक्ष)--a son and commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८०; २६. ४७.
--(स्वातिकर्ण) Andhra king ruled for 6 months; son of Sunandana. His son was Bahava? M. २७३. ११. भा. XII. 1. २६.
(I)--a son of सत्यभामा and कृष्ण. M. ४७. १७.
(III)--Mt. a hill of कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १५.
(IV)--a तीर्थ visited by बलराम. भा. X. ७८. १९.
(V)--a Mt. that entered the sea from fear of Indra--also Cakravat. Br. II. १८. ७८; M. १२१. ७२.
(VI)--the wheel of नक्षत्रस्, and planets. वा. ५०. ९३; ५८. २३; Vi. IV. १३. ८५ and ९८.
--a Marut of the first गण. Br. III. 5. ९१.
--took part in the देवासुर war between Bali and Indra. भा. VIII. १०. २१.
--R. near Pulaha's hermitage. भा. V. VII. १०.
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १८. १५.
--declared the law re. एकोद्दिष्ट; was asked to give up sleep for the churning of the ocean. M. १८. 1; २०. ३८; २४९. १४.
--one of the seven रत्नस् of a king. वा. ५७. ६८.
--symbols of cakra and matsya on the feet of a cakravartin. वा. ५७. ७९.
--see चक्रराजरथेन्द्र. Br. IV. १९. २८.

--श्रीचक्र? Nine sections are dis- tinguished. In the ninth पर्व (section) are ten presiding deities--the siddhi devis. In a part of this पर्व were stationed the eight शक्तिस्. Above them were the ten मुदा- devis or प्रकटशक्तिस्. In the eighth पर्व there were six- teen शक्तिस् named Guptas.
