In the seventh पर्व were six गुप्ततरास् with sugarcane bow, flower dart and flower balls. In the sixth पर्व were the twelve आज्ञाशक्तिस्. In the fifth were ten कुलोत्तीर्ण s4aktis. In the fourth were ten Nigar- [पगे१-572+ ३६] bhayogini शक्तिस्. In the third were the eight Rahasya- yogini शक्तिस्. In the second were her favourites three in number. Where this was, there was Geyaratha and where the latter was, there was किरिचक्र। These three looked like the three worlds or like the three mountains namely the Meru, Mandara and the Vindhyas. ललिता was चक्रराज. There were six charioteers. Ten yojanas in length, covered by an umbrella of that height as indication of ललिता's साम्- राज्यम्. In the other two, rather ordinary umbrellas were seen. विषङ्ग came from rear in disguise, protected by कामेश्वरी, the Nityas, अणिमस् and other deities in its ninth पर्व। कुतिलाक्ष attacked in front. The Nityas kill- ed all the १५ commanders of विषङ्ग who fled for life. This was directed towards the Mahendra hill, itself in the middle; on its left and right sides the chariots of दण्डिणि and श्यामल, rear Sarupadevi and front हयासन: at the gate were stationed २० aks2auhin2is with Stambhini alias Vighnadevi; one hundred अक्षौहिणिस् to guard the chariot; all the nine पर्व deities shook with fear seeing the great army following भण्ड; on its front was गेयचक्र and behind was किरिचक्र; there were other शक्तिस् riding on different animals--lion, camel, deer, elephant, etc. at the entrance was ज्वालामालिनिक; the fight began on the fourth day and ended in complete success; in the neighbour- hood of चिन्तामणिग्रह. Br. IV. १९. (whole); २५. ५४ to १०४; २६. 4 and ३७; २८. १७; २९. ३५. १४५; ३१. 3; ३६. 7.

--came into being in Treta and partook the अम्श of Hari to protect Dharma. Their seven रत्नस्-- cakra, ratha, मणि, sword, carma, Ketu, and nidhi (some include wife, horse and elephant and leave out sword and Ketu) and seven creatures: wife, purohita, सेनानि, rathakrit, mantri, अश्व and kalabha; had the attributes of विष्णु; they enjoyed trivarga, fame and success, ऐश्वर्य like अणिम and Prabhu शक्ति; learned and pure; entertained with their prowess sages, gods, devils, men, etc.; bodily characte- [पगे१-573+ २९] ristics of; legs with the symbol of wheel and fish, hands with conch and lotus. <F>1:  Br. I. 1. ९८; II. २९. ७१ ff.; M. १४२. ६४-75; वा. ५७. ६६-80.</F> Reigned for a long time with दण्डनीति. <F>2:  Br. III. 7. २७५.</F> वालि was a चक्रवर्ती. Arjuna (कार्तवीर्य) was another. <F>3:  Ib. ६९. २३.</F>
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १८. १६.
--an Angirasa and मन्त्रकृत्. Br. II. ३२. ११०.
--a son of Bala (Bali-वा। प्।) who was कर्ण in his previous birth. Br. III. 6. ३३; वा. ६८. ३२.

--birds noted for their staunch love; <F>1:  Br. II. १५. ७९; III. 7. ४५८; ५०. ४१; वा. ४५. १९; ५४. ३१.</F> the seven sons of कौशिक took their form in मानस; on the ऐरावदि. <F>2:  M. २०. १७; २१. 9 and २८; ११३. ७६; ११६. ११.</F>
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ४२.
--killed by कृष्ण. भा. X. ४३. २५.
--the sixth गान्धार gra1ma (music). वा. ८६. ४२.
--a goddess from the back of नृसिम्ह; a follower of वागीशी. M. १७९. ६८. [पगे१-574+ २३]
--a R. of the Bhadra continent. वा. ४३. २५.
(I)--an आर्षेय pravara of अन्गीरस्. M. १९६. २३.
(II)--a name of कृष्ण. Vi. IV. १३. ८५.
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १७. १९; १८. १५.
(I)--a son of व्युष्ट and पुष्करिणी; wife आकूति (वीरिणि-म्। प्।) and son Manu. भा. IV. १३. १५; VIII. 5. 7; M. 4. ४०.
(II)--a son of Anu. भा. IX. २३. 1; Vi. IV. १८. 1.
(V)--a Marut गण. M. १७१. ५२.
(VI)--a R. from the हिमालयस्. Br. II. १६. २७; १८. २२.

(VII)--a branch of the गन्गा, descending Mala- यवती and traversing the continent of केतुमाल, enters the western sea; flows through the countries of चीनमरु, ताला, मसमूलिक, Bhadra, तुषारस्, लाम्यक, बाह्लव, पारट and खश. भा. V. १७. 5 and 7; Br. II. १८. ४१, ४६-7; M. १२१. ४०; वा. ४७. ३९, ४४; Vi. II. 2. ३४, ३७; 8. ११३.
(I)--a son of Ripu and बृहति; his son was the great Manu born to his wife वारुणी. Br. II. ३६. १०२.
(II)--a son of Bali's slave girl through दीर्- ghatamas; <F>1:  Br. III. ७४. ७१; वा. ९९. ७०.</F> attained Brahmanhood with his brother कक्षि- vat. <F>2:  वा. ९९. ९४.</F>
(III)--a son of Khanitra, and father of वीम्श. V. IV. 1. २५.
--a consort of मार्ताण्ड Bhairava. Br. IV. ३५. ४७; ३६. १५.
--a R. from ऋष्यवत्. M. ११४. २६.
--a son of Harita and father of Vijaya and Sudeva (Vasudeva-वि। प्।). Br. III. ६३. ११७; वा. ८८. ११९, १२०; Vi. IV. 3. २५. [पगे१-576+ २२]
(I)--a son of बाष्कल. Br. III. 5. ३८; IV. २९. ७५.
(II)--a head of a शिवगण. Br. III. ४१. २८.
(III)--a Bhairava on the sixth पर्व of Geya- cakra; followed the army of ललिता. Br. IV. १९. ७८; १७. 4.
(IV)--a Rudra. M. १५३. १९.
(VI)--one of the seven प्रलय clouds. M. 2. 8.
(VII)--one of the two पिशाचस् who met यक्ष, the son of खशा. वा. ६९. ११३.
--killed कोलाट. Br. IV. २८. ४२.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८२. [पगे१-577+ २८]
--a commander of भण्ड to aid विषङ्ग; was killed by कुलसुन्दरीका. Br. IV. २१. ७९; २५. २८, ७९.
--one of the ten horses of the moon's chariot. Br. II. २३. ५६.

--the Lord of the Gandharvas, who had ३६० followers. These entered Puramjana's city and harassed the people. The superintendent of the city defended it. Allegorically ३६० stands for the year, while the Gandharvas represent the day time and their women the night. भा. IV. २७. १३-16.
--R. sacred to पितृस्, to be remembered on the occasion of a शाद्ध। M. २२. २८.
Andhra king, the son of Vijaya, ruled for ten years. M. २७३. १५.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १६.

--redeemed of their sins at Benares; <F>1:  M. १८४. ६७; २२७. ५४.</F> prohi- bited from seeing food offered at the श्राद्ध. <F>2:  Vi. III. १६. १२.</F> Satyavrata became a चण्डाल. <F>3:  Ib. IV. 3. २३.</F>

(I)--a name of योगमाया. <F>1:  भा. X. 2. १२.</F> Diti during the course of pregnancy was forbidden to take the remainder of offerings to the goddess. <F>2:  Ib. VI. १८. ४९.</F> Her shrine was known चण्डिका- गृह; <F>3:  Ib. V. 9. १४.</F> a mother-goddess; <F>4:  Br. IV. 7. ७२; १९. ७०.</F> enshrined at Makarandaka; an epithet of उमा. <F>5:  M. १३. ४३; १५८. १६.</F>
(II)--a servant-maid of पार्वती. Br. IV. ४०. २५.
--a पराशर clan. Br. III. 8. ९५.
(I)--an attendant on Rudra. Laid his hands on पूषन् at the destruction of दक्ष's sacrifice. भा. IV. 5. १७.
(II)--a Bhautika, a वरमूर्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ५०.
--the son of R(L)ओमपाद--दशरथ (Citra-ratha-वि। प्।), and father of पृथुलाक्ष (पृथालश्व- वा। प्।) through the grace of ऋष्यशृन्ग. भा. IX. २३. १०; M. ४८. ९५; वा. ९९. १०४-5. Vi. IV. १८. १८-19.
--the fourfold forces, of शूर; see Catu- rangini. Br. III. २६. 7; ४५. 1; ४६. १८; M. २४०. १९-21.
--fourfold forces sent by युधिष्ठीर to escort कृष्ण एन् रोउते to द्वारका. भा. I. १०. ३२.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८०. [पगे१-579+ २७]
--वैमानिक devas, etc., in. वा. 7. १७, १९.
--was शशबिन्दु. Vi. IV. १२. 3.
--four Vedas, six Angas, मीमाम्स, न्याय, धर्मशास्त्र and पुराणस्. वा. ६१. ७८.
--a name of ज्वालामालिनिका. Br. IV. २६. ३३.
--a son and commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८०; २६. ४७, ७२.

--ब्रह्मा (s.v.) as वेदराशी with गायत्रि and सावित्रि; acted as उद्गात for Soma's राजसूय and officiated as priest for उमा's marriage; <F>1:  M. 4. 7-१२; 6. २५; २३. २०; ५३. 7; १५४. ४८३.</F> three अवस्तस् of: as ब्रह्मा, काल and पुरुष, creating, destroying and as being indifferent; hence three गुणस्, three agnis, three Vedas and three worlds. <F>2:  वा. 5. १५-17.</F>
--a name of विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ६७.

--कृतम्, Treta, द्वापरम् and Kali. The section deals with the differences between them under the heads युगधर्म, युगसन्धि, अम्शक and युगसन्- धान। These are in भारतवर्ष; <F>1:  Br. II. २९. 1 ff. M. १४२. 2 and १७, २३.</F> According to the युगम्स् the height of men, birds, beasts and plants decreases [पगे१-580+ २६] or increases; <F>2:  Br. ३२. 8 ff.</F> Manu's height is अष्टताल and one whose height is नवताल is praised even by Gods. <F>3:  Ib. ३५. १७२.</F> कृत 4000 years sandhya ४०० sandhya1ms4a ४०० Treta ३००० years sandhya ३०० sandhya1ms4a ३०० Dva1para २००० years sandhya २०० sandhya1ms4a २०० Kali (तिष्यम्) १००० years sandhya १०० sandhya1ms4a १०० Thus on the whole the युगस् comprise १२००० divine years; <F>4:  वा. २३. १०५; २४. 1; ३२. ६५, ६७; ४५. १३७; ५७. 5 and २१-8.</F> described. <F>5:  Vi. VI. 1. 5-7; 3. ११-40.</F>
--a name of ब्रह्मा. Br. IV. 9. २३.
--the four stages of all creatures in the world; स्वेदजम्, अण्डजम्, उद्बिज्जम् and जरायुजम्। Br. IV. 9. २३.
--the पुरुष divided into four. वा. 5. ३४.
--also Sarvatobhadram; description of. M. २५३. ५१; २५४. 1-4.
--Mt. a hill of कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १५. [पगे१-581+ २५]
--a son and commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८०; २६. ४७.
--an अवतार् of Hari who imparted the lost knowledge of आत्मन् to ब्रह्मा. भा. II. 7. 5.
--a group of नाडिस् of fire (with sun) emitting rain. Br. II. २४. २७.
--a R. of the भारतवर्ष; a महानदि. वा. ४५. ९७; १०८. ७९.
--son of Revata and a friend of Tumburu. वा. ९६. ११७.

(I) (personified)--pointed out, in the अमृतम- thana, to Hari, राहु drinking nectar in the guise of a deva. Hence राहु is said to chase the moon in पर्वस्। Fought with राहु in a देवासुर war. भा. VIII. 9. २४-26; १०. ३१.
(II)--the son of विश्वसन्धि and father of Yuva- नाश्व. भा. IX. 6. २०.
(III)--a son of कृष्ण and सत्या. भा. X. ६१. १३.
(IV)--a son of Bali. M. 6. ११. [पगे१-582+ ३४]
(V)--one of Danu's sons. वा. ६८. 8.
(VI)--the son of Nara and father of Kevala. Vi. IV. 1. ४१-2.
(VII)--the son of Hemacandra, and father of धूम्राक्ष. Vi. IV. 1. ५१-2.

(VIII)--the moon who completes in two fort- nights the circuit which the sun makes in a year. He is the life of all living beings and occupies each of the twenty-eight con- stellations for thirty मुहूर्तस् (a day). <F>1:  भा. II. १०. ३०; V. २२. 8-१०.</F> Lord of plants, यज्ञस्, vratas and tapas; not going near Rohini, a bad omen; <F>2:  M. 8. 2; १६३. ४१; २४६. ५७.</F> the whitish dark spot in it appears like a शर; <F>3:  वा. ४७. ७७.</F> its मण्डलम् made of clouds and waters as of सूर्य; here is the स्थान of all deities, planets, etc., the size of the moon is twice that of the sun; is reckoned as Vasu in the Vaivasvata epoch; <F>4:  Ib. ५३. ५५-62, ८०.</F> grows through the effulgence of the sun and is known as Idvatsara; has १५ kalas and not १६. <F>5:  Ib. ५६. ३०-31.</F>
(IX)--a Mt. one of the seven mountains of Plak- षद्वीप touching the sea and medicinal plants gathered by the अश्विन्स् for nectar. Br. II. १८. ७६; १९. 8; वा. ४९. 7; Vi. II. 4. 7.
--a group of नाडिस् of sun (fire) with enough light. Br. II. २४. २९.
--Mt. a कुलपर्वत of the Uttarakuru country; <F>1:  वा. ४५. २५.</F> entered the sea from fear of Indra. <F>2:  M. १२१. ७३.</F> [पगे१-583+ २७]
(II)--a Janapada of the Bhadra country. वा. ४३. १९.
(I)--a son of लक्ष्मण; capital, Candra- cakra (Candravaktra-वा। प्।). Br. III. ६३. १८८; वा. ८८. १८७-8; Vi. IV. 4. १०४.
(II)--a Gandharva. वा. ६९. २६.
--the month reckoned from the new moon day to the new moon day; in some parts the month reckoned from the full moon day to the full moon day. वा. १००. २१७.
--a son of तारापीड. M. १२. ५५.
(I)--anointed first king of the Mauryas by the ब्राह्मण Kaut2alya who brought about the fall of Nandas; ruled for २४ years. भा. XII. 1. १३; Br. III. ७४. १४४; वा. ९९. ३३१; Vi. IV. २४. २८.

(II)--the unrighteous minister of Hai- haya who advised the king to get by peace or force the cow of Jamadagni so that he could ever have plenty. The king agreed and sent him to fetch the cow. Jamadagni argued that it was intended for religious purposes. The minister, without listening to those words had the animal bound. Jamadagni tied himself to the cow, and being beaten fell down dead. The cow kicked off her fetters and flew into [पगे१-584+ २९] heaven. The minister reported the matter to the king who returned to his city greatly dejected. Br. III. २८. ३१-7; २९. 8 ff.
(III)--a commander to aid विषङ्ग; was killed by दुह्शिला. Br. IV. २४. २९.
--the capital of Candraketu, son of लक्ष्- मण. Br. III. ६३. १८९.

--sages of this locality near Cape Comorin visited द्वारका; fit for श्राद्ध offerings. <F>1:  भा. X. ९०. २८ [4]; Br. III. १३. २८; वा. ७७. २८;</F> Bath here on the full moon day takes one to Candraloka. <F>2:  M. १९३. ७५-6.</F>
--a Kinnara with human face. वा. ६९. ३५.

--south of Uttarakuru where Gods live; १००० yojanas in circumference; in the midst is a hill contain- ing precious mines from which चन्द्रावर्ता takes its rise; it is the place of the moon God; people in it are righteous and live to an age of १०,000 years. वा. ४५. ५२-60.
--a sacred spot at गया. Br. III. ४७. १८.
--sacred to Lalita. Br. IV. ४४. ९५.
(II)--Mt. north-west of कैलास; here are lake Svacchoda, river Svacchoda, forest Caitraratham, residence of मणिभद्र, commander-in-chief of the यक्षस्. Br. II. १८. 5-8; M. १२१. 6; वा. ४७. 5.
(III)--a lake on the slopes of Meru Mt. Br. II. १८. ६८; वा. ४७. ६५.
(IV)--the name of Ila's horse which became a mare in the शरवन forest. M. १२. 3.

--adjoining the सूर्यबिम्बशाल. Here the moon born of Atri's eyes got his lustre. The presiding deity is called श्री Somana1tha surrounded by २७ stars, all शक्तिस्. Other शक्तिस् like तार live there besides the अश्विन्स्. Br. IV. ३५. ५१-58.
--an यक्ष; a son of पुण्यजनि. Br. III. 7. १२४.
--same as ह्लादिनी. M. ११२. ७२.

(I)--R. a महानदी near मानससरस् in भारतवर्ष, from the Himalayas; falls into western ocean; <F>1:  भा. V. १९. १८; Br. V. १२. १५; II. १६. २५; III. १३. १२१; वा. ४५. ९५; ७७. ११३; १०८. ७८.</F> sacred to काल; one of the १६ wives of हव्यवाहन fire; in the chariot of त्रिपुरारि. <F>2:  M. १३. ४९; ५१. १३; ११४. २१; १३३. २३; १९१. ६४. वा. २९. १३; Vi. II. 3. १०.</F> [पगे१-586+ २६]
(II)--the regions of, fell into the hands of व्रात्यस् and Mlecchas. भा. XII. 1. ३९; Vi. IV. २४. ६९.
--a son of कृष्ण and सत्यभामा. भा. X. ६१. ६०.
--contains the essence of the धाम of Vedas; progresses and degresses with शुक्ल and कृष्ण paks2as. M. २३. १४.
--the path of the पितृस्. वा. 8. १९८.
(I)--see Soma; the eighth तनु of महा- deva; wife रोहिणि and son Budha. Br. II. १०. ८३.
(II)--a दानव. Br. III. 6. 8.
--see शिव. Br. III. ४८. 9.
--attained by those who observe रोहिणी- चन्द्रशयन vratam. M. ५७. २६; १९३. ७६.
--the capital of Candraketu, son of लक्ष्- मण. वा. ८८. १८८.
--a Kinnara with human face. वा. ६९. ३६.
(also चन्द्रवशा)--R. in भारतवर्ष, belonging to कुलाचल hill. भा. IV. २८. ३५; V. १९. १८.
--the son of Vijaya and father of Salo- madhi. भा. XII. 1. २७.
--leads to Candraloka. M. १०१. ७५.
--an उपद्वीप to जम्बूद्वीप. भा. V. १९. ३०.
--the son of द्वियज्ञ and father of Puloma. Vi. IV. २४. ४८-9.
--the eclipse of the sun and moon fit for श्राद्ध. वा. १०५. १९, ४८.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २६.
(II)--a daughter of वृषपर्वन्. M. 6. २२. [पगे१-588+ २४]
--the king after सदाचन्द्र. Br. III. ७४. १८१.
--a son of Bali. M. 6. ११.
--a son of खश and a राक्षस. Br. III. 7. १३४.
--a R. of the केतुमाल. वा. ४४. १९.
--a R. of the चन्द्रद्वीप, the स्थान of the moon God. वा. ४५. ५६.
--a son of सहस्राश्व. M. १२. ५४.
--a son of दुन्दुमार. Vi. IV. 2. ४२.
(I)--a kala of the moon. Br. IV. ३५. ३२.
(II)--a mother goddess; enshrined at हरिश्- candra. M. १३. ४०; १७९. २८.
(III)--a R. sacred to Pitrs. M. २२. ६३. [पगे१-589+ २८]
--a son of मृग elephant. Br. III. 7. ३३३.
--a son of ऋषभ, and a भागवत; a sage who described to Nimi the nature of those who are not devoted to Hari. भा. V. 4. ११; XI. 2. २१; 5. 2-१८.
--were ten विश्वेदेवस् in Soma's राजसूय. M. २३. २२.
(I)--a son of Harita; he built चम्पापुरा. भा. IX. 8. 1.

(II)--the son of पृथुलाक्ष (पृथुलाश्व-वा। प्।) Under him the ancient city मालिनि became चम्पा; father of Haryanga through the grace of पूर्णभद्र; lived for ६०,000 years with the four वर्णस्। M. ४८-97; वा. ९९. १०५-7; Vi. IV. १८. २०-21.
--between विकङ्क and मणिशैल hills; consists of fruit and flower trees; the आश्रम of कश्यप Praja1pati. वा. ३७. १६-22.
(I)--built by Campa; a beautiful city; <F>1:  भा. IX. 8. 1; Br. III. ७४. १९७; Vi. IV. १८. २०.</F> the new name of the ancient मालिनी. <F>2:  M. ४८. ९७.</F>
(III)--a name of चम्पावती; <F>1:  वा. ९९. १०६.</F> a Janapada. <F>2:  Ib. ९९. ३८५.</F>
(I)--the capital of the नागस्, <F>1:  Br. III. ७४. १९४.</F> of चम्पा. <F>2:  वा. ९९. १०६, ३८२.</F>
(II)--a R. of the केतुमाल country. वा. ४४. २०.
--a son of Devajani, a यक्ष. Br. III. 7. १२८.
--a Paulaha and one of the seven sages of the period of तामस Manu. Br. II. ३६. ४८.
(II)--disciples of Vajina. वा. ६१. २३.
(III)--disciples of याज्ञवल्क्य. वा. ६१. २४.
--Brahmavadya practised by pupils of वैशम्पायन; the origin of the name; explained by सूत. वा. ६१. १०, १२-22.

--pupils of वैशम्पायन, known also as Carakas. They observed a vow on behalf of their गुरु in expiation of the sin of brahmicide. भा. XII. 6. ६१; Br. II. ३३. 7 and १२; ३५. १४, २६-7. वा. ६१. १०. [पगे१-591+ २६]
--the son of आर्ष्टिषेण. वा. ९२. 5.
--the fifth Manu. वा. ६२. ४४.
--Manu representing ऊकार; <F>1:  वा. २६. ३७.</F> father of five sons. <F>2:  Ib. ६२. ५५.</F>
(I)--a son of कीर्तिमान् and धेनुका. Br. II. ११. २१; वा. २८. १७.
(II)--one of the nine sons of सावर्णि Manu. M. 9. ३३; वा. १००. २२.
(III)--the father of Haraya devas. वा. ६७. ४०.
--by a manipulation of Raudra-वैष्णव offerings of राक, Jamadagni was born from वैष्णवाग्नि; <F>1:  Br. III. 1. ९६-7.</F> a ceremo- nial oblation. <F>2:  M. १६. २३ and ३२.</F>
--interchange of sacrificial cakes leading to birth of Jamadagni (s.v.). वा. ६५. ९३.
--a son of रुक्मिणि. वा. ९६. २३७.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ४२. [पगे१-592+ २५]
--R. a महानदि in भारतवर्ष, from the पारियात्र hill; sacred to पितृस्. भा. V. १९. १८; Br. II. १६. २८; M. २२. ३०; १६३. ६२; वा. ४५. ९८; १०८. ८१.
--(c) a northern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ४६.
--a jewel of the king. Br. II. २९. ७५.
--a son of Citraka. वा. ९६. ११४.
--a योगनाथ. Br. IV. ३७. २९.
--the wife of वरुण. भा. VI. १८. 4.
--sons of Aryaman and मातृका. They were the originators of human race. भा. VI. 6. ४२.
--a son of मदीरा. वा. ९६. १६९.
--one of the भार्गव gotrakaras. M. १९५. २७.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. ११.
--a mother Goddess. M. १७९. ३२. [पगे१-593+ २७]
--a name of लक्ष्मि. Vi. I. 7. २८.
--an आर्षेय pravara of the भार्गवस्. M. १९५. ३७.

(I)--the sixth Manu (s.v.) and son of Cak- षुष. पूरू and others were his sons. In his epoch Mantra- druma (Manojava-वि। प्।) was Indra. हविष्मत् and others were sages. Hari manifested himself as Ajita. <F>1:  भा. VIII. 5. 7-9; Br. I. 1. १०५; वा. ३०. ३७; ६२. 3; १०१. ३३.</F> There was a deluge in this Manvantara. <F>2:  भा. I. 3. १५; IV. ३०. ४९; VI. 6. १५; Vi. III. 1. 6, २६-9.</F> After him came Vaivasvata. <F>3:  Br. II. ३६. 3. ६६, १०७, २०२; ३७. १९ and ४६; III. 2. 1; ६०. 1; IV. 1. २६ and ५०.</F>
(II)--the son of Khanitra, and father of वीविम्शति. भा. IX. 2. २४.
(III)--a son of Anu. M. ४८. १०.
(IV)--a son of विश्वेश. M. १७१. ४८.
(V)--the king of चाक्षुषे antara, son of Prace- tasa and grandson of प्राचीनबर्हिस्; he will give birth to दक्ष from मार्षा, the daughter of शाखिन्स्. वा. ३०. ६०-61, ७४-5.
(VI)--the son of बृहति and Ripu; wife वारुनि (पुष्करिनि) and father of चाक्षुष Manu. वा. ६२. ८८-9; १००. २६; Vi. I. १३. 2. 3. [पगे१-594+ ३१]

--one of the five देवगणस् of the epoch of the १४थ् Manu (Bhautya); <F>1:  भा. VIII. १३. ३४; Br. IV. 1. १०६-7; वा. १११. १००; Vi. III. 2. ४३.</F> seven among them are distin- guished. <F>2:  वा. १००. ११२.</F>

--(the sixth): five देवगणस्, the first, past, future, पृथुकस्, and lekhas; each गण sub- divided into eight. <F>1:  वा. ६२. ५७.</F> दक्ष became son of Pracetas by the curse of शिव. <F>2:  Br. II. १३. ६८.</F>
--a ऋत्विक् at ब्रह्मा's sacrifice. वा. १०६. ३८.
--a राजर्षि who attained सिद्धि in शुक्ल ti1rtham of the नर्मदा. M. १९२. १४.

--an Asura friend of कम्सा, and a wrestler. Ready for a match with कृष्ण and राम, he took his seat in the arena and invited the brothers for a match. कृष्ण's challenge, and the concern of the citizens at the unequal match between a child and a trained athlete. After a pro- longed fight, चाणूर fainted and fell dead like Indradhvaja. भा. X. 2. 1; ३६. २१-24; ३७. १५; ४२. ३७; Chaps. ४३ and ४४; Vi. V. १५. 7 and १६; २०. १८, ५८-76.
--a दानव king. Br. IV. २९. १२३.
--a भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. २३.
(I)--sacrifice, performed by Bharata. भा. V. 7. 5.
(II)--(personified) born of सविता. Bha. VI. १८. 1.

--the four castes; विष्णु, their creator and protector; <F>1:  Br. II. ३७. 5; III. ७२. ३५; Vi. I. 6. 5-6, 8.</F> originated by the four sons of सुव्रता, daughter of दक्ष; <F>2:  वा. ३०. ६७; ९७. ३६; १००. ४४; Br. II. १३. ६५.</F> people observe स्वधर्म in कृत, attain change in Treta, become weak in द्वापर and lose all character in the Kali age; <F>3:  M. १६८. 8-१२.</F> fresh impetus by शौनक and by भार्ग- भूमि. <F>4:  Vi. IV. 8. 6, २०.</F>
--the four Vedas; <F>1:  Br. II. ३२. ६२; वा. ९७. ३७.</F> विष्णु as knowing them. <F>2:  Br. III. ७२. ३६.</F>
--from the Yajurveda; <F>1:  वा. ६०. १७.</F> the four orders of priests in an यज्ञ. <F>2:  Vi. III. 4. ११.</F>
--a sacrifice, description of; <F>1:  Br. II. ३२. ६२-6; ३४. १७.</F> followed by Bharata in his rites. <F>2:  भा. V. 7. 5.</F>
--the region of moon to which Soma sacrificers go; see Candraloka. भा. III. ३२. 3.
--were born elephants Kumuda and कुमुदद्युती. Br. III. 7. ३४५.
--a भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. २६. [पगे१-596+ २९]
--the son of विष्ट्राश्व and father of शावस्त. Vi. IV. 2. ३६-7.
--of कौशिक gotra. Br. III. ६६. ७०.

--a ritual lasting for a month to be prac- tised once, twice, thrice or four times according to one's capacity; <F>1:  वा. १६. १६-7; १८. १३.</F> an expiatory ceremony for a Brahmana taking liquor in मोहा; <F>2:  Br. IV. 7. ६९, ७९; M. 7. 4; १०१. ७५; १८८. ८८.</F> very efficacious if performed in सोमतीर्थ; penance for certain thefts, incestuous unions, etc. <F>3:  M. १८९. १८; १९१. ९६; २२७. ४२-56.</F>
--the science of arms. Vi. IV. १५. ४५.
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १८. १४.
(I)--a शक्ति on the 9th parva of चक्रराज- ratha. Br. IV. १९. 7; ३६. ५८; ४४. ८७ and १११.
(II)--a mind-born mother; image of, clothed in elephant skin. M. १७९. १०; २६१. ३७.

--the spy in different disguises to be sent over his kingdom and that of the enemy; king not to act on the report of a single चार; the source of the kingdom; चारचक्षु is the king. Br. IV. २१. ५१ and ६४; २५. १२. M. २१५. ९०-6; २२६. १२. [पगे१-597+ २३]
--spies employed by पृथु, also चारस् (s.v.). भा. IV. १६. १२.
--a Marut गण. M. १७१. ५४.
--a son of रुक्मिणि. Went out to play and saw a huge lizard with his brothers and reported to कृष्ण. भा. X. ६१. 9; ६४. 1-4; Br. III. ७१. २४६. वा. ९६. २३७. Vi. V. २८. 2.
--got killed in the यादव disturbance at Pra- भास. Vi. V. ३७. ४७.
--an Apsaras in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु. M. १६१. ७५.
--a son of रुक्मिणी and कृष्ण. भा. X. ६१. 8; M. ४७. १६; Vi. V. २८. 1.
--a son of रुक्मिणी. भा. X. ६१. 8.
--a R. of the Bhadra. वा. ४३. २९. [पगे१-598+ २८]

(I)--welcomed कृष्ण to द्वारका. A son of रुक्मिनी and votary of कृष्ण. <F>1:  भा. I. ११. १७; १४. ३१; III. 1. ३५; X. ६१. 8; Br. III. ७१. १९१ and २४५. M. ४७. १५. वा. ९६. २३७. Vi. V. २८. 1.</F> Took part in defending द्वारका against शाल्व; <F>2:  भा. X. ७६. १४.</F> went with कृष्ण's sacrificial horse. <F>3:  Ib. ८९. २२[2].</F>
(II)--a son of जाम्बवती and कृष्ण; <F>1:  M. ४६. २६; Vi. IV. १५. ३७.</F> a good archer, given to गण्डूष. <F>2:  वा. ९६. १८८.</F>
--a son of कृष्ण and रुक्मिणि. भा. X. ६१. 8; Vi. V. २८. 1.
--the son of Namasyu and father of Sudyu. भा. IX. २०. 2-3.
--a son of रुक्मिणी and कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. २४६; M. ४७. १६.
--a daughter of रुक्मिनी and कृष्ण; wife of Balin, son of कृतवर्मन्. भा. X. ६१. २४; Br. III. ७१. २४६; M. ४७. १६; वा. ९६. २३८; Vi. V. २८. 2.
--a daughter of the Gandharvas. वा. ६९. १०.
--a monkey chief. Br. III. 7. २३७.
--an important यादव; got killed in the disturbance at प्रभास after कृष्ण's departure to Heaven. Vi. V. ३७. ४७. [पगे१-599+ २४]
--a son of रुक्मिणि and कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. २४६.
--a son of रुक्मिणी and कृष्ण. M. ४७. १६.
--a monkey chief. Br. III. 7. २३८.
--one of कृष्ण's wives. Vi. V. १५. ३५.
--a son of सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. २२.
--a तुषित God. Br. II. ३६. ११.
--a राक्षस killed by ललिता. Br. IV. २९. ७६.
(I)--a Jayadeva. Br. III. 4. 2.
(II)--(एत्य्।) he who gathers the means for enjoy- ment. वा. 4. ३८.
(III)--the twins of प्रजापति in the २३र्द् kalpa; Cinta came out of contemplation. वा. २१. ५३. [पगे१-600+ २५]
--also चित्तकर्षणरूपा (nitya); a Gupta शक्ति. Br. IV. १९. १९; ३६. ७०; ४४. ११९.
--a mother-goddess. M. १७९. २८.
--a mother-goddess. M. १७९. २८.
(I)--another name for शान्ति (s.v.). भा. IV. 1. ४२.

--कामाक्षि the first cause, called also अन्ता; then became शुद्धपरा with two hands with योगमुद्र and book in them; the next was परापर with lotus in her right hand and the left placed on the left thigh. This is at काञ्ची. Br. IV. ३९. 9-१४.
(I)--a son of Vasudeva and मदिरा. Br. III. ७१. १७२.
(II)--a son of अगावत. Br. III. ७१. २५७. [पगे१-601+ २६]
(III)--a commander of भण्ड killed by चित्रा. Br. IV. २५. ९९.
(IV)--a son of Citrasena. वा. ९६. २४८.
--of different kinds on the walls and pillars of the houses erected by Jamadagni's cow. Br. III. २६. ६०.
--a son of वृष्णि; (पृष्णि-वा। प्।); father of a number of sons and daughters; brother of Svaphalka. Br. III. ७१. १०२, ११४; वा. ९६. १०१, ११३-14; Vi. IV. १४. 5-6, ११.

--a गणेश; a sculptor created a beautiful form out of the ashes left by Madana's body burnt down by शिव. Thus having been restored to life he was asked to meditate शतरुद्रिय in honour of Rudra. This was भण्ड who was blessed by शिव to rule for ६००० years. Br. IV. ११. ३०.
(I)--a hill in भारतवर्ष; sacred to सीता and to पितृस्. भा. V. १९. १६; Br. II. १६. २३; III. १३. ३८. M. १३. ३९; ५२. ६५.
(II)--a hill in कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १५.
(I)--one of the seven sons of वसिष्ठ. भा. IV. 1. ४०-41.
(II)--a son of लक्ष्मण. भा. IX. ११. १२.
(III)--a son of देवभागा and कम्शा. भा. IX. २४. ४०.
(IV)--a son of जाम्बवती. भा. X. ६१. १२.

(V)--a सार्वभौम and king of शूरसेनस्. His queen was कृताद्युति; though he had a number of wives he had no children. When he was brooding over this, there came the sage Angiras; getting to know his mind he per- formed a ritual in honour of त्वष्टा and the remnant of offer- ing was given to his eldest queen, कृताद्युती, who brought forth a son. Though the king was glad, his wives grew jealous and poisoned the child to death. The king, queen and others ceaselessly lamented. On this Angiras and नारद came on the scene and consoled them. Angiras addressed him on the instability of life, illustrating it by the story of Bhoja. नारद instructed him into a मन्त्रोप- निषद्। By meditating on this for seven nights, he was told, that he would see सन्कर्षन and get over the illusion relat- ing to duality. So he had his purificatory bath at the जमुना and was initiated into the विद्या by नारद. By meditating for seven days, the king became the lord of विद्याधरस्. He then praised Hari in the form of Ananta and had a दर्शन् of the Lord. Once he flew in the air and saw शिव sitting with पार्- वती on his lap in the presence of his attendants and others. He laughed at this, which enraged पार्वती who cursed him to be born an Asura. Citraketu alighted from his aerial car and begged for pardon. After he went away, शिव told पार्- [पगे१-603+ २७] वती that Citraketu was a devotee of Hari, and hence his devotee also. Therefore he deserved pardon. पार्वती was appeased, and Citraketu was born as वृत्र. भा. VI. Chaps. १४-17.
(VI)--a वालेय Gandharva. वा. ६९. २०.
--a son of कृष्ण and सत्या. भा. X. ६१. १३.
--an अधिदेवता of the planet Ketu; Icon of, near Yama. M. ९३. १५; १०२. २३; २६१. १४.
--a वालेय Gandharva. वा. ६९. १९.
--a Marut of the first गण. Br. III. 5. ९२.
--a son of धृष्ट. M. १२. २१.
--a son of कृष्ण. भा. X, ९०. ३४.
(I)--a warrior son of कृष्ण. भा. X. ९०. ३३.

(II)--a name of the sun; moves in the north of शाकद्वीप in श्रवण and उत्तराषाढ; <F>1:  Br. II. २१. ७३, १३६; वा. ५०. १२८.</F> begged of कार्त- वीर्यार्जुन, the seven islands as भिक्षा and burnt them all; father of वरुण (वसिष्ठ) famous as आपव who cursed the king; the sun-god in the guise of a Brahmana asked for [पगे१-604+ ३१] food all the immovable property of the king to which he agreed; आदित्य was pleased with him and gave him res- plendent and useful arrows; he ate all the eastern parts of the kingdom including the तपोवन। <F>2:  Br. III. ६९. ३८-47; वा. ९४. ३९; ९५. 3-१३.</F>
--कुरण्ड as expert in; <F>1:  Br. IV. २२. ७४; III. ७१. १८४.</F> अश्विन्स् and जनार्दन experts in. <F>2:  M. १५०. २०१; १५२. 3 and २७.</F>
(I)--a monkey. Br. III. 7. २३४.
(II)--one who does not fight a straight battle. वा. ९६. १८१.
(I)--a son of Gaya, and father of सम्राट्; wife ऊर्णा. भा. V. १५. १४.

(II)--a Gandharva who crossed the place where the bones of a certain कौशिक lay dropped down to the earth. After collecting and throwing them into the सरस्वती, he went to his home. <F>1:  भा. VI. 8. ३९-40.</F> He was seen sporting at the Ganges with अप्सरस् by रेणुका. <F>2:  Ib. IX. १६. 2-3.</F>
(III)--the son of सुपार्श्वक and father of क्षेमाधि. He was king of मिथिला. भा. IX. १३. २३.
(IV)--the son of Ukta and father of Kavi- ratha. भा. IX. २२. ४०. [पगे१-605+ २८]

(V)--the son of Dharmaratha, well known as रोमपाद. A friend of दशरथ. As he had no children, he adopted शान्ता, daughter of दशरथ. ऋष्यशृन्ग mar- ried her. Then he had a son Caturanga. भा. IX. २३. 7-१०; M. ४८. ९४; वा. ९३. १०३; Vi. IV. १८. १६-18.
(VI)--the son of रुशेकु (रुष्(s4)anku-म्। प्।, वि। प्।) and father of शशबिन्दु. भा. IX. २३. ३१; Br. III. ७०. १८; M. ४४. १७; Vi. IV. १२. 2-3.
(VII)--a son of वृष्णि and a grandson of Anamitra. Father of पृथु and other sons. भा. IX. २४. १५ and १८.

(VIII)--a Mauneya Gandharva; overlord of the Gandharvas, Kinnaras and विद्याधरस्; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. 3; 8. १०; IV. २०. ५०; M. 8. 6; वा. ६९. 2; ७०. 9.</F> served as the calf when the Gandharvas milked the earth in the lotus vessel along with the Apsaras. <F>2:  Br. II. ३६. २२१.</F>
(IX)--a son of अगावह. Br. III. ७१. २५७.
(X)--a son of भूरि. M. ५०. ८०.
(XI)--the son of रशादु; performed several sacrifices; became later known as शशबिन्दु; had १०,000 sons of whom six were famous with names beginning in पृथु. वा. ९५. १७-18, २०-21.
--a Marut गण. M. १७१. ५३.
--a mother-goddess. M. १७९. २०.
--a son of मेधातिथि of शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २५.

(I)--a companion of बाण's daughter, ऊषा; daughter of कुम्भाण्ड minister to बाण; heard from ऊषा of her dream about a certain prince, and being an artist drew pictures of gods and men. ऊषा identified Ani- ruddha as her lover. Citralekha travelled by air to द्वारका and carried Aniruddha to ऊषा's harem at शोणितपुर un- noticed by any. भा. X. ६१. २३[9]; ६२. १४-23; Vi. V. ३२. १७-30; ३३. 5.
(II)--an Apsaras in the सभा of Hira- ण्यकशिपु; rescued along with उर्वशी from the Asura केशिन् by पुरूरवस्. M. १६१. ७५; २४. २३.
(I)--a daughter of अगावह. Br. III. ७१. २५७.
(II)--the daughter of Citrasena. वा. ९६. २४८.
--a son of Citrasena. वा. ९६. २४८.
--a वालेय Gandharva. वा. ६९. २०. [पगे१-607+ २४]
--painting and pictures in Tripuram. M. १३०. १६.
--a Mt. in east half of पुष्करद्वीप. Br. II. १९. ११०; M. १२३. १३; वा. ४९. १०७.
(I)--a son of Manu देवसावर्णि. भा. VIII. १३. ३०.
(II)--the son of नरिष्यन्त and father of दक्ष. भा. IX. 2. १९.
(III)--a Gandharva with the Hemanta sun. Br. II. २३. १७; वा. ५२. १७. ९६. २४८.
(IV)--a son of अगावह. Br. III. ७१. २५७.
(V)--a son of the fourth सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ९४.
(VI)--a son of Ruci XIII Manu. Br. IV. 1. १०४; वा. १००. १०८; Vi. III. 2. ४१.
(VII)--a Mauneya Gandharva king in Kailasa; <F>1:  वा. ४१. २१; ६९. 1.</F> resides in sun's chariot <F>2:  Vi. II. १०. १३.</F> during मार्गशीर्ष month.
--the राक्षस presiding over the month of शुचि. भा. XII. ११. ३६. [पगे१-608+ २९]
(I)--a rock on the Himalayas near the river पुष्पभद्रा; sacred to ललिता. भा. XII. 8. १७; Br. IV. ४४. ९७.
(II)--a daughter of Vasudeva and रोहिणी; came to see कृष्ण and सत्यभाम returning from Indra's court. <F>2:  भा. X. [६७ (v) ५०]; M. ४६. १२.</F> ^1 Br. III. ७१. १६५; वा. ९६. १६३.
(III)--a name of a constellation; <F>1:  वा. ८२. 8.</F> श्राद्धम् on that day gets good children. <F>2:  Br. III. १८. 7.</F>
(IV)--a daughter of मदिरा. वा. ९६. १७०.
(I)--a क्षत्रिय son of शन्तनु and a fisher- woman सत्यवती; was killed in a battle by a Gandharva by name चित्रान्गद. भा. IX. २२. २०-21; Br. III. १०. ७०; M. १४. १७; वा. ७३. १९; Vi. IV. २०. ३४-5.
(II)--a Gandharva who killed चित्रान्गद, a son of शन्तनु. भा. IX. २२. २०; Vi. IV. २०. ३५.
--one of the four queens of भण्ड. Br. IV. १२. १३.
--a R. from the ऋक्ष (ऋष्यवत्). Br. II. १६. ३१; M. ११४. २५.
--a son of कौशिक after whom came the famous line, the Caidyas. Br. III. ७०. ३९; वा. ९५. ३८. [पगे१-609+ ३०]
--the Agni dug of चिन्तामणि gr2ha; it burns with no fuel; the होता and hotri are कामेश्वर and महा- देवी. Br. IV. ३६. २४.
--the twenty-third kalpa. वा. २१. ५३.
--came out when ब्रह्मा was in contemplation. वा. २१. ५४.

--of ललिता; by its side was one built by the architects to मन्त्रिनी when she visited ललिता; here the मातङ्गकन्यकास् sport and dance. <F>1:  Br. IV. ३१. ८६.</F> The abode of Cakra- राज and lying at a distance of seven yojanas to शृङ्गारशाल; surmounted by gopuras in hundreds on all sides. <F>2:  Ib. ३५. ७०, १०४.</F> On its different sides were Cidvanhi, चक्रराजरथ, Geyacakra, Kiricakra, Hari, गणपति, शिव, सरस्वती, महादेविस्, the residences of मन्त्रिनाथ and दण्डनाथ. In its midst was Binducakra with a number of शक्तिस्. There was also what is known as सर्वज्ञ yantara1. This चिन्तामणिगृह was located in the middle of श्रिपट्टण. Its walls and pillars, all of चिन्तामणि. <F>3:  Ib. ३६. 1, ३३.</F>
--the son of Lambodara and father of Megha- स्वाति. भा. XII. 1. २४.
--a queen of वर्षऋतु. Br. IV. ३२. २९.
--a monkey chief. Br. III. 7. २३४. [पगे१-610+ २७]
a northern kingdom; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. 7; १८. ४६; ३१. ८३.</F> unfit for श्राद्ध; <F>2:  M. १६. १६.</F> people of. <F>3:  वा. ४७. ४२; ५८. ८३.</F>
the kingdom watered by the R. चक्षु Br. II. १८. ४६; वा. ४७. ४४.
--the silk of the Shin country. M. १५४. २७६.
--of children. Vi. III. १३. 5.
--a दानव. Br. III. 6. 9.
(I)--was stationed by जरासन्ध on the East gate of मथुरा. भा. X. ५०. ११ [2].
(II)--a son of श्रुतकीर्ति. Br. III. ७१. १५७; वा. ९६. १५६.
--a daughter of तृणबिन्दु married to विश्- ravas and became mother of Kubera. भा. IX. 2. ३१-32.
--released by Indra in the sacrifice. वा. ६५. ८१.
--one of the names of the fifth मरुत्गण. वा. ६७. १२८.
(I) (च्) kingdom of; <F>1:  भा. VII. 1. १३; IX. २२. 6; २४. ३९; Vi. IV. १४. ४४.</F> the name of Vasu's kingdom. <F>2:  वा. ९३. २६; ९९. ११४.</F>
(II)--the son of उशिक; (कैशिक-वि। प्।). Father of Caidya and others. भा. IX. २४. 2; Vi. IV. १२. ३९.
--were enlisted by जरासन्ध against Yadus. भा. X. [५० (v) 2].
--a son of Uparicara and king of Cedi. भा. IX. २२. 6.
--a Pravara. M. १९६. ३०.
--a ब्रह्मराक्षसी. Br. III. 7. ९९.
(I)--funerary mound; found in अयोध्या; its trees as frequented by पिशाचस्; <F>1:  भा. IX. ११. २७; Br. III. 7. ४१५; Vi. III. १२. १३.</F> a householder to avoid Caitya. <F>2:  Vi. III. ११. १२२.</F>
(II)--a Marut of the first गण. Br. III. 5. ९२. [पगे१-612+ २९]
(I)--one of the nine sons of स्वारोचिष-Manu. Br. II. ३६. १९; Vi. III. 1. १२.
(II)--a Paulastya and a sage of the तामस Manvantara. Br. II. ३६. ४८.
--a मन्वन्तरादि for श्राद्ध, and good for व्रतस् like the मदनद्वादशि; best for military expedition. M. 7. १०: १७. 6: ५४. 8; ५६. 3; ६०. ३३; २४०. 5.

(I)--a pleasure garden of Devas and Indra to which went Kardama and देवहूति. <F>1:  भा. III. २३. ४०; V. १६. १४; IX. १४. २४; M. २७. 4; Vi. IV. 6. ४८.</F> In the Candra- prabha hill. Here उर्वशी met Aila. <F>2:  Br. II. १८. 7; III. 7. १०२; ६६. 6.</F> In the Mandara hill; <F>3:  M. ८३. ३१; १२१. 8; १३१. ४८.</F> in the east <F>4:  वा. ३६. ११; ४२. १५; ४७. 6; ६९. १३७; ९१. 6. Vi. II. 2. २५.</F> of इलावृत.
(II)--acted as calf when the Gandharvas and Apsaras milked the earth. M. १०. २४.
(III)--a तीर्थम् sacred to मदोत्कट. M. १३. २८.

(also बिन्दुमती)--the daughter of शश- bindu and wife of मान्धात; had १०,000 younger brothers; righteous, fair and chaste; mother of three sons Purukutsu, अम्बरिष and Mucukunda. Br. III. ६३. ७०; वा. ८८. ७०-2. [पगे१-613+ ३६]
--the wife of ज्यामघ; gave birth to Vidarbha. M. ४४. ३२ and ३६.
--आत्रेय gotrakaras. M. १९७. 2.
--a sage of the तामस epoch. Vi. III. 1. १८.

(I)--a son of युधिष्ठिर's aunt and Dama- घोष and brother of Dantavaktra. Both were once attend- ants on Hari and born on earth by the curse of Brahmanas. It happened thus. Once Sananda and other sons of ब्रह्मा went to विष्णुलोक and were prevented by them, as door- keepers, from entering वैकुण्ठ. Hence they were cursed to be born as Asuras. They were born as हिरण्यकशिपु and हिरण्याक्ष, then as रावण and कुम्भकर्ण, and now as Caidya and Dantavaktra. <F>1:  भा. VII. १०. ३५-46.</F> Hated कृष्ण, beaten by him in स्व्यम्वर। An ally of जरासन्ध, he was stationed at the eastern gate of मथुरा. कृष्ण directed his attack against Caidya. The fight and end of Caidya. <F>2:  Ib. I. १०. २९; X. ५०. ११ [2], २०-24. [1-१५].</F> His name was proposed by रुक्मिणि's elder brother for marriage. Went to कुण्डिन ready to marry रुक्मिणी; dis- tressed at her being taken away by कृष्ण and his friend Rukmi's defeat; he was consoled by जरासन्ध and returned to his city. <F>3:  Ib. ch. ५२. (whole); ५३. १४-16; ५४. १०-17.</F> An enemy of कृष्ण, he attained योग at the राजसूय. He attained Hariloka through hatred. (See शिशुपाल). <F>4:  Ib. III. 2. १९; VII. 1. १३-15 and ३०.</F> Married श्रुतश्रवस् who gave birth to Sunita. <F>5:  M. ४६. 6.</F>
--a son of Maitreya. M. ५०. १४. [पगे१-614+ २५]
--a son of कृमि. Known also as Vasu. His wife was गिरीका, mother of seven sons. M. ५०. २६.
--आर्षेय pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. 7.
--a disciple of श्रिन्गिपुत्र. वा. ६१. ४०.
--of the दक्षिणापथ. वा. ४५. १२६.
(I)--a son of आण्डिर after whom was named the the चोलदेश. Br. III. ७४. 6; M. ४८. 5.
(II)--one of the four sons of जनापीड; his kingdom चोलाः. वा. ९९. 6.
(I)--a degraded क्षत्रिय clan. Br. III. ६३. १४०; M. ११४. ४६.
(II)--(च्) a southern country. Br. II. १६. ५६.
--the dress covering the image of Sun god. M. २६१. 4.
an eastern country. Br. II. १६. ५१.
--of the दक्षिणापथ. वा. ४५. १२४.

(I)--a sage <F>1:  भा. VI. १५. १४.</F> who was invited for युधिष्ठिर's राजसूय. <F>2:  Ib. X. ७४. 7.</F> Came to see कृष्ण at स्यमन्तपञ्चक. <F>3:  Ib. ८४. 3.</F> Went with him to मिथिला. <F>4:  Ib. ८६. १८.</F> Came to see परीक्षित् practising प्रा- योपवेश. <F>5:  Ib. I. १९. 9.</F>

(II)--a son of शुक्र and Paulomi; <F>1:  Br. III. 1. ९२; वा. ८६. 2, २३.</F> when he was engaged in तपस् he was covered by an anthill. His eyes were seen through two holes therein. Once सुकन्या who came there with her father saw two luminous objects in the anthill and pierced them with a thorn. This resulted in blood flowing from the eyes. The king asked the sage's pardon and offered his daughter in marriage to him. Having married a princess, the sage requested अश्विन्स् who were on a visit to him, to make him a youth. They advised him to bathe in a सिद्ध lake nearby. He thus found himself thoroughly changed. With him सुकन्या enjoyed life. Her father came there some time after and was not aware of the change in the sage's form. He took him to be a paramour and scolded his daughter. When he came to know the fact he was much pleased. In the यज्ञ performed Cyavana offered सोम to अश्विन्स् who were so far denied a share, being physicians. Indra resented this and wanted to kill Cyavana. But the latter's act was accepted by all as a precedent. <F>2:  भा. IX. 3. 2-२६; Br. II. ३२. ९८; III. 8. ३१; २१-36; ६१. 2.</F> Father of आप्रवानम् and Dadhica. <F>3:  Br. III. 1. ९३.</F>
(III)--the son of Mitreyu and father of सुदास. भा. IX. २२. 1. वा. ९९. २०७. Vi. IV. १९. ७०-71. [पगे१-616+ २४]
(IV)--the son of Suhotra the righteous and father of कृतिन् (कृतक-वि। प्।). भा. IX. २२. 5; वा. ९९. २१७; Vi. IV. १९. ७९.
(V)--a राक्षस residing in the third तलम् (Vitalam-वा। प्।). Br. II. २०. २८; वा. ५०. २७.
(VI)--a ऋषि and मन्त्रकृत्, cursed that the hundred sons of कृतवीर्य would meet with death. M. ६८. 9; १४५. ९२ and ९९.
(VII)--a son of भृगु; a gotrakara, and a Pravara. M. १९५. १५ and २८, २९.
(VIII)--a son of Sudhanvan. M. ५०. २४.
(IX)--a son of गोकर्ण, an अवतार् of the १६थ् dva1para. वा. २३. १७३.
(X)--the father of Sumedhas. वा. ७०. २६.
(XI)--a son of देवापि. वा. ९९. २३७.
--in गया where are वैकुण्थ, Loka- दण्ड, गृध्रकूट and शोणक. वा. १०८. ७३. [पगे१-617+ ३१]
(I)--(Chagalas); one of the sixteen classes of पिशाचस्. Br. III. 7. ३७६.
(II)--a son of मुन्दीशर अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. २११.
(I)--the seven worlds, white in colour, are one above the other umbrella-like. Br. II. २१. १९; III. ४९. २३; ५५. १५; IV. ३७. ३५.

(II)--the white umbrella as insignia of royalty given to कामेश्वर by विष्णु; lofty as the sky. <F>1:  Br. IV. १५. २३; १७. 1; Vi. II. १३. ९६.</F> Kauravas threatened Ugrasena to deprive him of that. <F>2:  Vi. V. ३५. १४.</F>
--Vedic metres as steeds of the sun's chariot; <F>1:  भा. II. 6. 1; Vi. II. 8. 5.</F> as part of विष्णु. <F>2:  Vi. V. 1. ३७; Br. I. 5. १९.</F> Seven in number--names given.
--a kind of temple with a number of towers. M. २६९. ३२ and ४९.

(I)--are ३३ Devas, constituting three ganas, याम, अजीतस् and शक्तस् with their chief Indra; <F>1:  Br. II. १३. ९१.</F> drink the nectar of the moon until the चतुर्दशि, and on the पञ्चदशि the पितृस् drink of the rest. <F>2:  वा. ५६. २५.</F>
(II)--the gods of the चाक्षुष epoch; also known as साध्यस्. Br. III. 3. 9. [पगे१-618+ ३४]
--a group of ३३ Devas who drink the moon's कलस् in the dark half of the month. Br. II. २८. २६.

--the Vedas--ऋग्, Yajus and साम; <F>1:  वा. 3. १६.</F> गाय- tri and others, sons of Vinata; <F>2:  Br. II. 7. ३०.</F> created by वामदेव; <F>3:  M. २४७. 7.</F> served as vessel for sages milking the earth. <F>4:  Br. II. ३६. १०४.</F>
--a सामग; सामन्स् in connection with the rituals in founding a new temple. भा. XII. 6. ५३; M. ९३. १३३; २६५. २८; वा. ८३. ५४.
--a देवगण; ३३ are distinguished among them. वा. ३१. 5.
--an आत्रेय gotrakara. M. १९७. 5.
--the chanting of the Vedas, being prac- tised in a hermitage. Br. III. २१. ४६.
--the goat, as the riding animal of Agni; its flesh pleasing to पितृस्. M. १४८, ८३; १७. ३२.
--a peak on the top of the Himalayas where श्वेत the sage-lord appeared with four disciples in the वाराह kalpa. वा. २३. ११६.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to प्रचण्डा and to पितृस्. M. १३. ४३; २२. ७२.

(I)--a daughter of विश्वकर्मन्, <F>1:  भा. VIII. १३. 8 and १०. M. ११. 5-9; २४८. ७३; वा. ८४. ३९-77.</F> a servant- maid of सम्ज्ञा engaged by the latter for her husband. Hence [पगे१-619+ २९] wife of the sun God without his knowledge and mother of शनैश्चर and तपती during the absence of सम्ज्ञा as a horse. Her sons were श्रुतश्रव and श्रुतकर्म or सावर्णि Manu and Saturn respectively; illtreated सम्ज्ञा's children. Yama protested and was cursed to lose his legs. He reported to his father who said that they would be restored after some time. Then he asked छाया why she showed difference between her sons and she spoke the truth. The sun God flew into a rage and demanded त्वष्ता to give up his daughter. He showed the place where सर्वज्ञा was and त्वष्ता reduced his तेजस्। On seeing her, शुक्र came through his nostrils from which were born the अश्विन्स् or नासत्य and Dasra. <F>2:  Br. III. ५९. ३२-77; IV. ३५. ४७; भा. VI. 6. ४१.</F>
(II)--the mind-born wife of सृष्टि and mother of five sons. भा. II. ३६. ९७-98.
(III)--the wife of पुष्टि and mother of five sons, प्राचीनगर्भ, वृषक, वृक, वृकल and धृति. वा. ६२. ८३.
--sacred to ललितापीठ. Br. IV. ४४. १००.
--a son of कौशिक in previous birth, born as चक्रवाक in मानस. M. २०. १८.
--a son of Anamitra. वा. ९६. ९९.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८७. [पगे१-620+ ३७]

--the universe as issuing from the mind and body of ब्रह्मा; <F>1:  भा. III. १२. २७.</F> अग्निषोमात्मकम् <F>2:  Br. III. ७२. ५०; वा. ९७. ५१.</F> born of विष्णु and abides in विष्णु. <F>3:  Vi. I. 1. 4, ३१.</F> Spatial description of; its relation to ईश्वर and other creations. <F>4:  वा. ४९. १५६-86.</F>

--Evolution of Tattvas, etc. When the शक्तिस् did not attend to their function of creation, the Lord with शक्तिकाला entered into twenty-three तत्त्वस् by dividing him- self into three parts--अध्यात्म, आधिदैव, and आधिभौम with tenfold प्राण, Agni as his mouth, वरुण as tongue, अश्विन्स् as nostrils, etc. Then came the four वर्णस्। At first five varieties of अज्ञान were created, viz., अन्धतामिस्र, तामिस्र, महामोह, moha, and tamas. Ashamed of these sinful creations, ब्रह्मा created seers like Sanaka, Sananda, etc. They also did not proceed with the work of creation as was desired. So ब्रह्मा grew angry and down came Rudra from the midst of his eye-brows. He was assigned places and women. Finding his creation intolerable, ब्रह्मा sent him away for penance, and produced ten mind-born sons, मरिची, Atri and others, and a daughter सरस्वती. Then came the Vedas and other literature. Further the Creator's body got into two halves--one स्वायम्भुव and the other शतरूप. These were parents of two sons and three daughters. Their descendants filled up the whole of the earth. Another account of creation. भा. III. 5. २७-36; 6. (whole); १२. (whole); २०. १२ ff.

--a metre; <F>1:  भा. III. १२. ४५; XI. २१. ४१; M. १२५. ४७; वा. 9. ५०; ३१. ४७.</F> a horse of sun's chariot; <F>2:  Br. II. २२. ७२; Vi. II. 8. 5.</F> with गायत्रि Tr2s2t2ub; <F>3:  वा. ५१. ६४.</F> from the face of ब्रह्मा. <F>4:  Br. II. 8. ५२; १३. १४५.</F> [पगे१-621+ २७]
--a Devi. Br. IV. १२. ५९; ३०. 4 and ४४.
--an attribute of विष्णु. Vi. V. ३३. ४१.
a Janapada of the केतुमाल country. वा. ४४. १४.
--the अवतार् of the Lord of the १९थ् dva1para in the जटायु hill of the हिमालयस् with four sons, all engaged in महेश्वर योग। वा. २३. १८६-8.

(I)--a son of अरुण and गृध्रि (Syeni-वा। प्।) <F>1:  Br. III. 7. ४४७-48.</F> brought forth sons Kaka, गृध्र and अश्वकर्णि; king of vultures and younger brother of सम्पाति; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. ४४७-48.</F> father of कर्णि- कार and शतगामि; <F>2:  M. 6. ३५-6.</F> Dahanakriya of, done by राम; attained release by सत्सन्ग। <F>3:  भा. IX. १०. १२; XI. १२. 6; वा. ६९. ३२६-7.</F>
(II)--Mt. a hill in हिमालयस्, the birth-place of जटामालि of the १९थ् dva1para. वा. २३. १८६.
(I)--a group of heretics. Br. III. १४. ४०. [पगे१-622+ ३२]
(II)--a name of विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ७०.
--a Mt. on the East of Meru; <F>1:  भा. V. १६. २७; वा. ३५. 8; ४२. २०.</F> connects नील and नैषध hills. <F>2:  Vi. II. 2. ४१.</F>
--a son of Sudhanvan (Jantu.). Vi. IV. १९. ८२.
--the house of lac arranged by Duryodhana to burn down the पाण्डवस्. Vi. IV. १३. ७०.
--the son of a यक्ष and father of मणिवर. वा. ६२. १८३.
--see Bharata.

--the fifth लोक from where are born people; from root जनन; <F>1:  Br. II. १९. १५६; २१. २२; ३५. १५३ and २०६; III. 1. १५-16; M. ६१. 1; १८४. २३; वा. १००. १२७; १०१. १७.</F> two crores of yojanas from Maharloka. <F>2:  वा. १०१. १४०, २०८.</F>

(I)--(king of मिथीला) one of the twelve sages who knew the nature of the धर्म ordained by Hari. Son of Nimi, born by churning his dead body and hence known Mithila. He was Vaideha, born of a विदेह। He founded the city of मिथिला. His son was उदावसु. Father of सीता. <F>1:  भा. VI. 3. २०; IX. १३. १३-14; X. ७१. 9; वा. ८९. 2; Vi. IV. 5. २२-4; १३. १०३.</F> In his sacrifice याज्ञवल्क्य won a prize for learning while शाकल्य was humbled for pretended superiority. Father-in- law of राम. <F>2:  Br. II. ३४. ३३-68; III. ३७. २२; ६४. 2;</F> In the अश्वमेध Yajn5a of his, साकल्य was [पगे१-623+ ३५] ruined on account of his conceit by taking part in a disputa- tion; Janaka wanted to know the best among the learned assembled and set apart ११,000 crores, much gold, villages and servants to be given as present to him; in the disputa- tion each took part but याज्ञवल्क्य ultimately threw out the challenge. साकल्य questioned this and put to him a number of questions which were all answered. याज्ञवल्क्य in his turn put him a single question, a wrong reply to it inviting instantaneous death; साकल्य agreed, and unable to answer his question, was gathered to his ancestors; <F>3:  वा. ६०. ३२-62; ८९. 5; Vi. III. १८. ८५-90.</F> told by the sage Asita what the Earth narrated to him about the ignorance of kings who without subduing themselves, try to subdue others. <F>4:  Vi. IV. २४. १२७-136.</F>
(II)--king of Videhas, and an ally of बलराम. Welcomed बलराम to his capital. भा. X. ५७. २४-26.
(III)--a son of विशाखयूप and father of Nan- divardhana. Vi. IV. २४. 5-6.
(I)--get deserted and desolate in Kali; <F>1:  वा. ८८. १८७.</F> are left in a state of अराजक। <F>2:  Br. II. ३१. ५०, ९७; III. ५०. 5; IV. 5. 4.</F>
(II)--the seven of क्रौञ्चद्वीप viz., उष्ण, पीवर, अन्धकार, Muni, Dundubhi, कुशल and Manuja. वा. ३३. २३.

(I)--the first of the four sons of परीक्षित् and इरावती. <F>1:  भा. I. १६. 2; Br. III. ६८. २०.</F> Father of शतानीक. <F>2:  Vi. IV. २०. 1; २१. 2-3.</F> Finding that the death of his father was predicted to be by the snake तक्षक, he per- formed a सर्प याग to destroy all snakes. All except Tak- [पगे१-624+ ३२] षक came, the latter being sheltered by Indra. At this Tak- षक and Indra were invoked together. Advised by बृहस्- pati to refrain from the cruel याग, Janamejaya agreed; with the aid of Tura, the priest, he performed अश्वमेध and other sacrifices; <F>3:  भा. IX. २२. ३५-38; XII. 6. १६-28; M. 6. ४२.</F> cursed by वैशम्पायन he made याज्ञ- valkya his ब्रह्मा in a sacrifice. <F>4:  M. ५०. ५७-60.</F> Introduced वाजसने- yaka and became known as Trikharvi. <F>5:  वा. ९९. २२९, २५०-4.</F> Put to trouble Loha- gandha, the son of गार्ग्य out for mischief and was cursed by गार्ग्य. <F>6:  Ib. ९३. २१.</F> King of सुदेश and a Kaurava; highly righte- ous. After anointing his son on the throne he went into the woods for penance. <F>7:  M. ५०. ६१-5.</F>
(II)--the son of Sumati; with him ended the वैशाल line. भा. IX. 2. ३६.
(III)--a son of पूरु and father of Pra- चीन्वत्. भा. IX. २०. 2; M. ४९. 1; वा. ९९. १२०. Vi. IV. १९. 1.
(IV)--the son of सृञ्जय, and father of महामनस् (महाशिल-ब्। प्।). भा. IX. २३. 2.
(V)--the son of Somadatta, and father of Sumati (Prumati-ब्र्। प्।). Br. III. ६१. १६; Vi. IV. 1. ५७-8.
(VI)--a son of Puramjaya and a राजऋषि; <F>1:  M. ४८. १२-3; वा. ९९. १५.</F> father of महाशाल. <F>2:  Vi. IV. १८. 5-6.</F> [पगे१-625+ ३८]
(VII)--a son of बृहद्रथ, entitled विश्- vajit. M. ४८. १०२.

(VIII)--a son of भल्लाट; served उग्रा- yudha in his तपस्; saved नीपस् when they were led by Yama at the behest of उग्रायुध by fighting Yama, and earned his appreciation and मुक्तिज्ञान from him as a result. Wife धूमिनी and son यवीनर. M. ४९. ५९-70; वा. ९९. १८२.
--१०० in number; according to the म्। प्। and वा। प्। ८० in number. Br. III. ६८. २०-26; ७४. २६७; M. २७३. ७१-3; वा. ९९. ४५४.

--a divine world, <F>1:  भा. VIII. २०. ३४.</F> the world of वरुणा <F>1: a)वा. 7. २८; २३. ८४; २४. 3; ४९. १४९; ६१. १२९; ६५. १७.</F> as the face of विराट्, <F>2:  भा. II. 1. २८.</F> and a part of पुरुष्. <F>3:  Ib. 5. ३९.</F> Its inhabitants. <F>4:  Ib. III. ११. २९.</F> Here was in ancient times a discussion about ब्रह्मवाद, on the occasion of a sacrifice performed by ब्रह्मा; <F>5:  X. ८७. 8-9.</F> at a distance of 2 crores of yojanas from Maharlokam; <F>6:  Br. IV. I. १२३; 2. १३-15, १३९. Vi. II. 7. १३-14.</F> during Pralaya the Devas go from Maharloka to this. <F>7:  Br. I. 6. २८. Vi. VI. 3. २९.</F> (See also Jana).
(I)--the son of शान्तिदेवा and Vasudeva. Br. III. ७१. १८०.
(II)--a son of Tumba. वा. ९६. २४९.
--here राम vanquished a host of राक्- षसस्; <F>1:  Br. III. ६३. १९५.</F> and performed the work of gods. <F>2:  वा. ८८. १९४.</F> [पगे१-626+ ३७]
--a son of शरूथ; had four sons, पाण्ड्य, केरऌअ, Cola, and Kulya. वा. ९९. 5-6.

--a name of वासुदेव; <F>1:  वा. ९६. ५१; १०६. ५४.</F> विष्णु who took the form of हयग्रीव and appeared before Agastya at काञ्ची; <F>2:  Br. II. १९. १८०; २५. ५६-7; III. ७१. ७८ and ९३; ७३. ८७; IV. 5. 8, १४; 9. २८, ४७, ६४; १२. २१; १५. १४.</F> as brother of देवी put down the हिरण्यस् in the भण्ड-Lalita1 war; <F>3:  Br. II. २९. १०३, १३३.</F> as Kalki put down the हूणस्, Yava- nas, etc; <F>4:  Br. II. ३९. ४९.</F> in the form of पितृस् in गया; <F>5:  वा. १०८. ८५, ८९; १०९. २४ and ३४.</F> became black due to poison; <F>6:  वा. ५४. ५९.</F> becomes ब्रह्मा, विष्णु and शिव affected by the qualities of सत्व, रजस् and तमस्; <F>7:  Vi. I. 2. ६१-7.</F> manifestation and forms described. <F>8:  Vi. I. २२. २३-72; III. 8. ११; १८. ३५.</F>
--a Deva. Br. II. १३. ९५.
--one of the two पिशाचस्, who met यक्ष, the son of खशा. वा. ६९. ११३.
(I)--a son of Purudvat and भद्रसेना, the Vai- darbhi. Wife of ऐक्ष्वाकी, and son सात्वत. M. ४४. ४५-6.
(II)--a son of Somaka; was killed (before he got an heir? अजमीढ and धूमिनि had to start the line again). M. ५०. १६-19; वा. ९९. २०९.
--a daughter of यातुधान, <F>1:  Br. III. 7. ८५.</F> married by Aja? (यक्ष्-वा। प्।), one of the sons of खशा; originator of यातुधान clan; hairy in every part. <F>2:  वा. ६९. १२४.</F> [पगे१-627+ २९]
--birthday as, fit for गयापिण्ड. वा. १०५. १८.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ४२.

(I)--a great king, son of Hotraka, (Suhotra- वा। प्।) and केशिनी (कौशिका-वा। प्।); while he was performing a sacrifice the गन्गा flowed through his यज्ञवाट; enraged at it he drank the waters; so गन्गा became his daughter and came to be known as जाह्नवी; married कावेरी, the grand-daughter of युवनाश्व; and had a son Sunaha (Suhotra-वा। प्।) by her; father Puru, Sumantu-वि। प्।). भा. IX. १५. 3; Br. III. ६६. २५-30; वा. 1. १४२; ९१. ५४-60; Vi. IV. 7. 3-7.
(II)--eldest son of Somaka. भा. IX. २२. 1; Vi. IV. १९. ७२.
(III)--a son (descendant?) of Kuru, and father of Suratha. भा. IX. २२. 4 and 9; वा. ९९. २१७, २३०; Vi. IV. १९. ७८; २०. 2.
--originated from the son of अष्टक, son of विश्वामित्र. वा. ९१. १०३.
--a group of gods of Uttama epoch. Vi. III. 1. 4.
--for Brahmans only; <F>1:  वा. ५७. ५०.</F> for the wise. <F>2:  Ib. १६. २२.</F> [पगे१-628+ ४३]
--कृष्ण Para1s4aras. M. २०१. ३५.

(I)--a sage of the Vaivasvata epoch; (भार्गव); a son of ऋचीक and सत्यवती; to attain a son for himself and for गाधि, he made a चरु to be taken both by his wife and mother-in-law, the latter to get a क्षत्रिय and the former a ब्राह्मण; then he entered the forest for penance; by mistake the चरु intended for the mother was taken by the daughter and vice-versa; ऋचीक understood the mistake and told his wife that a cruel son would be born to her; she implored him to give her a good son; Jamadagni, born to her; produced by eating (जम) the वैष्णवाग्नि. <F>1:  भा. VIII. १३. 5; Br. II. ३२. १०५; ३८. २७; M. 9. २८; १२६. २१; वा. ३२. ४६; ६५. ९३; ९१. ६७ and ८५-86. Vi. IV. 7. ३२-6.</F> Entertained Arjuna (Haihaya) with the help of his काम- dhenu. The king desired to own her; but on being refused, he took her away by force. She was recovered by his son परशुराम who killed Arjuna. Regretted his son's action in killing the king and found fault with रेणुका his wife who saw Citraratha. He asked his other sons to kill their mother but they declined. परशुराम killed them and his mother to please his father but he requested that they might come back to life to which the sage agreed. But the sons of Arjuna took vengeance and slew the sage in the presence of रेणुका. Through the prowess of his son, Jamadagni got back his body and became the seventh in the ऋषिमण्- डल <F>2:  भा. IX. chh. १५ and १६.</F> Married रेणुका, daughter of रेणु the youngest son was राम. According to the वायु पुराण रेणुक is also known as कामलि and is said to be the daughter of the इक्ष्वाकु, सुवेणु. Vasumat and others were elders to राम. <F>3:  Ib. IX. १५. ११-13; वा. ९१. ८६.</F> Officiated in ब्रह्मा's place in the sacrifice of हरिश्चन्द्र; <F>4:  भा. IX. 7. २३.</F> a मन्त्रकृत्; <F>5:  Br. III. २१ 1; M. १४५. ९९.</F> a भार्गव gotrakara. <F>6:  M. १९५. १५ and २९.</F>
(II)--a मन्त्रकृत् and a sage; with the sun in माघ and फाल्गुन. <F>2:  Ib. ५२. २०; Vi. II. १०. १६; III. 1. ३२.</F> ^1 वा. ५९. ९६. [पगे१-629+ ३१]
(III)--a son of ऊरु and of भृगु gotra; <F>1:  वा. ६४. २५.</F> Jamadagni भार्गव, one of the seven sages. <F>2:  Ib. १००. १०.</F>
--a सुधर्मान God. Br. IV. 1. ६०.
--the tree at इलावृतम् in the हिमालयस्. Br. II. १७. १२; १९. २९; III. २२. ३७; २७. १७; IV. ४३. १७.
--a son of आप. वा. ६९. ३०.
--a commander of भण्ड to aid विषङ्ग; was killed by नीलपताका. Br. IV. २१. ८०; २५. २९, ९८.
--a R. of the भारतवर्ष. वा. ४५. १००.

--(जाम्बूनदम्) a river of juice of celestial roseapple tree flowing from the top of Merumandara into इलावृत. The earth on its two banks yields fine gold जाम्बू- nada from which jewels are made in heaven; source of जम्बु; <F>1:  भा. V. १६. १९-20; वा. ३५. २६-30.</F> R. from Candraprabha <F>2:  Br. II. १८. ६९.</F> in colour like a butterfly. <F>3:  वा. ४६. ३०.</F>

--occupies the central position of the globe in the form of a lotus leaf, in extent a १००,000 yojanas. There are nine continents demarcated by moun- tain ranges. In the middle is situated इलावृत, at whose middle portion stands Meru. Some say that eight extra [पगे१-630+ ३८] countries were attached to it by the sons of Sagara who dug into the earth on all sides in search of sacrificial horse. This द्वीप is surrounded by salt sea. <F>1:  भा. I. १२. 5; V. 1. ३२; १६. 5-7; १९. २९-30; २०. 2; M. ८३. ३२; ११३. 7; १२२. 2; २८४. 2; वा. ११. ८४; ३३. ११ and ४५; ch. ३४. Vi. II. 3. २८.</F> Contains many जनपदस्, cities, mountains, rivers, nine भुवनस्, salt ocean, six वर्षपर्वतस् and two oceans--east and west. Divided into nine parts among the sons of आग्नीध्र; <F>2:  Br. II. १७. २४, ३०; १५. 8 to the end; १४. ११, ४३ and ५२; Vi. II. 1. १२; 2. २३-25.</F> from the जम्बु tree. <F>3:  वा. ४६. २५.</F>
--people of, described. See जम्बू. वा. ४६. २५-37.
--R. of honey, containing gold. वा. ३५. २९; ४७. ६६.
--a तीर्थ with forest near चित्रकूट; <F>1:  Br. III. १३. ३८.</F> sacred to पितृस्, <F>2:  M. २२. २१.</F> fit for श्राद्ध; <F>3:  वा. ७७. ३८.</F> here was born Bharata. <F>4:  Vi. II. १३. ३३.</F>
--R. in इलवृतम्. (perhaps जम्बू, s.v.). Br. II. १७. २२.

(I)--father of कयाधू, and chief of Asuras. Took part in the 6th देवासुर war between Bali and Indra. Fought with वृषा-Kapi. Hearing that Bali had fallen dead Jambha riding on a lion attacked Indra and dis- abled his elephant. He then turned towards मातलि who brought a chariot to Indra's aid. But his head was cut off by Indra's वज्र। <F>1:  भा. VI. १८. १२; VIII. १०. २१-32; ११. १३-18; Br. III. 6. १०; ७२. ८१ and १०५; वा. ९७. १०३.</F> Led तारक's army in a chariot of १०० lions; fought with Yama, Kubera, जनार्दन and others but was finally killed. <F>2:  M. ४७. ७२; १४८. ४२-54; chh १५०-53; २४५. १२. Vi. IV. 6. १४; V. १४. १४.</F> [पगे१-631+ २७]
(II)--a son of भाष्कल. Br. III. 5. ३८.
(III)--a son of Virocana, and father of four sons. वा. ६७. ७६.
--also जृम्भण; a commander to aid विषङ्ग was killed by विजया. Br. IV. २५. २९.

(I)--an attendant in वैकुण्ठ cursed by Sanaka and others to be born as an Asura. The curse was confirmed by Hari, who, however, consoled him and Vijaya (s.v.). His fall. <F>1:  भा. III. १६. 2, २६-37.</F> In the देवासुर war with Bali, he attacked Bali's fol- lowers. <F>2:  Ib. VIII. २१. १६.</F>
(II)--a son of Vatsara and स्वर्वीथि. भा. IV. १३. १२.
(III)--a sage of the epoch of the tenth Manu. भा. VIII. १३. २२; २१. १६.
(IV)--a son of श्रुत (सुश्रुत-ब्र्। प्। and वा। प्।), and father of Vijaya. भा. IX. १३. २५; Br. III. ६४. २२; वा. ८९. २१; Vi. IV. 5. ३१.
(V)--a son of पुरूरवस् and ऊर्वशी, and father of Amita. भा. IX. १५. 1-2. [पगे१-632+ २५]
(VI)--a son of विश्वामित्र. भा. IX. १६. ३६.
(VII)--a son of सञ्जय and father of Krta. भा. IX. १७. १६-17; वा. ९३. 8. Vi. IV. 9. २६.
(VIII)--a son of सम्कृति and a great warrior. With him came to an end the क्षत्रवृद्ध line. (Burnouf makes क्षत्रधर्मन् his son. The term is only an epithet of Jaya). भा. IX. १७. १८.
(IX)--a son of Manyu. भा. IX. २१. 1.
(X)--a son of युयुधान and father of कुणि. भा. IX. २४. १४.
(XI)--a son of Kanka and कर्णिका. भा. IX. २४. ४४.
(XII)--a son of भद्रा. भा. X. ६१. १७.
(XIII)--a name of Arjuna (पाण्डव). भा. X. ७२. ४७.
(XIV)--a नाग of the fifth or महातलम्. Br. II. २०. ३७; वा. ५०. ३६.
(XV)--a वीकुण्ठ God. Br. II. ३६. ५७.
(XVI)--a son of जाम्बवान्. Br. III. 7. ३०२. [पगे१-633+ २६]
(XVII)--a son of Kali and grandson of वरुण. Br. III. ५९. 7; वा. ८४. 7.
(XVIII)--a son of Vijaya; father of हर्यश्वक. Br. III. ६८. 9; वा. ९३. 9.
(XIX)--a son of सृञ्जय, and father of Vijaya. Br. III. ६८. 8.
(XX)--a son of शिष्ट. M. 4. ३९.
(XXI)--a son of भद्राश्व. M. ५०. 3.
(XXII)--the वेदव्यास of the १८थ् dva1para. Vi. III. 3. १५.
--Jayadevas in the guise of हृअदस्; <F>1:  वा. ६७. ३२.</F> lakes in the Kuru country; <F>2:  Br. II. १८. ७२-73.</F> in the स्वायम्भुव epoch. <F>3:  Ib. III. 3. ६५.</F> See Jayadevas.
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १३. 2.
(I)--the son of Ahina, father of सम्कृति. Br. III. ६८. १०.
(II)--a son of सार्वभौम <F>1:  M. ५०. ३६; वा. ९९. २३१.</F> and father of आराधित. <F>2:  Vi. IV. २०. 4.</F> [पगे१-634+ २९]
(III)--a son of अदीन and father of सम्कृति. वा. ९३. १०; Vi. IV. 9. २७.
--a son of Manasyu. वा. ९९. १२१.

--are twelve in number created by ब्रह्मा, bodies of मन्त्र used in यज्ञस्; these are दर्श, पौर्ण- मास, बृहद्य, रथन्तरम्, वित्ति, विवित्ति, आकूति, कूति, विज्ञासा, विज्ञात, मनस् and यज्ञ। These were again born as Jitas in the Svayambhuva epoch. ब्रह्मा asked them to observe household duties and यज्ञस्, but they took to ज्ञान। The enraged creator cursed them to undergo seven वृत्तिस्। They were born in turn as Ajitas, तुषितस्, Satyas, Haraya, वैकुण्थस्, साद्यस्, and आदित्यस्. Br. III. 3. 5-7; 4 (whole).
(I)--the son of बृहद्काय and father of विशद. भा. IX. २१. २२-23.
(II)--the son of बृहन्मनस् and father of Vijaya. His wife was सम्भूति. भा. IX. २३. ११-12; वा. ९९. १११; Vi. IV. १८. २२-23.

(III)--the king of Sindhu and an ally of जरासन्ध; was stationed at the north gate of मथुरा, and on the east during the siege of Gomanta; served Duryo- dhana's army. भा. X. ५२. ११[6]; ५०. ११[7]; ७८. [९५ (v) १६]; Vi. V. ३८. १६.
(IV)--a son of the second सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ७२.
(VI)--a son of बृहदिषु. M. ४९. ४९.
(VII)--a son of बृहद्कर्मन् and father of विश्वजित्. Vi. IV. १९. ३४.

--a son of कार्तवीर्य Arjuna and father of तालजन्घ; <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. २७-28; वा. ९४. ५०; Vi. IV. ११. २१-22.</F> a महारथ who reigned at Avanti; <F>2:  Br. III. ४१. १३; ४७. ६६; ६९. ५०.</F> known also as Vaikarta. <F>3:  M. ४३. ४६.</F>
(I)--a son of Marutvati and Dharma; an अम्श of वासुदेव, otherwise known as Upendra. भा. VI. 6. 8.
(II)--a son of Indra and शची; attacked Asura followers of Bali. Identified with Hari. भा. VI. १८. 7; VIII. २१. १७; XI. 5. २६; Br. III. 6. २४; वा. ६८. २४.
(III) son of जाम्बवान्. Br. III. 7. ३०२.
(IV)--the city founded by Nimi near the आश्रम of Gautama. Br. III. ६४. 1-2; वा. ८९. 2.
(V)--one of the eleven Rudras. M. 5. ३०.
(VI)--a consort of कीर्ति and who left him for Soma (s.v.). M. २३. २५. [पगे१-636+ २८]
(VII)--a son of वृषभ and जयन्ती; father of अक्रूर. M. ४५. २६; भा. I. १४. २८.
(VIII)--a विनायक, to be worshipped in house- building. M. १८३. ६३; २५३. २३ and ४०; २५५. 8; २६६. ४३.
(IX)--Mt. a कुलपर्वत of the केतुमाल. वा. ४४. 4.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ७३.
--sacred to ललिता-pi1t2ha. Br. IV. ४४. ९७.
(I)--Bestowed by Indra in marriage to ऋषभ. Mother of a hundred sons among whom was Bharata. भा. V. 4. 8-9.
(II)--the night on which कृष्ण was born. Br. III. ७१. २०५; वा. ९६. २०१.

(III)--daughter of Indra, sent by her father for the service of शुक्र during his धूम्रव्रत for १००० years; rendered him services; pleased with her शुक्र lived with her for ten years, as her husband; <F>1:  Br. III. ७२. १५०, १५६; ७३. 3; वा. ९७. १४९; ९८. 3.</F> the result of this was the birth of देवयानी. <F>2:  M. ४७. ११४-88; Br. III. 1. ८६.</F>
(IV)--a goddess enshrined at हस्तिनापुर; a mother-goddess. M. १३. २८; १७९. १३; वा. 1. १५३. [पगे१-637+ २५]
(V)--the wife of वृषभराग and daughter of काशी. M. ४५. २६.

--made by विशुक्र to out- wit the hosts of ललिता; its effect was the stupefication of all the शक्तिस् and making them speak irrelevantly of the leaders and minister for war; destroyed by गणनाथ Gaja1nana. Br. IV. २७. २४ and ५४.
(I)--a son of Hina (अहीन B), and father of सम्कृति. भा. IX. १७. १७-18.
(II)--the son of सार्वभौम and father of राधिक. भा. IX. २२. १०.
(III)--married राजधिदेवी who became the mother of two sons, आवन्त्यस्. भा. IX. २४. ३९.
(I)--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १३.
(II)--a moat equal to १२ oceans. वा. ४७. ७०.
(III)--a companion of पार्वती. Br. IV. ४०. ३३.
(V)--a goddess enshrined at वराहशैल; a mother-goddess; <F>1:  M. १३. ३२; १७९. १३ and ७१.</F> Icon of; to be propitiated before building palaces. ^2 Ib. २६०. १९; २६८. १० and २१.
--an यक्ष; a son of देवयानी. Br. III. 7. १२८.
--a lake in the Kuru country; sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ४९; १२१. ७०.
(I)--a Deva. Br. II. १३. ९५.
(II)--a son of Vasudeva. Br. III. ७१. १८७. M. ४६. २२.
(III)--a son of मृत्यु. वा. १०. ४१.
(IV)--a Gandharva in कैलास. वा. ४१. २१.
(V)--a hunter who aimed a shaft at कृष्ण in ignorance. He was awarded heaven. भा. XI. ३०. ३३-38; Vi. V. ३७. ६८-73.
--a वीथी in the Madhya मार्ग. M. १२४. ५२ and ५७. [पगे१-639+ ३२]
--a daughter of सत्यभामा. वा. ९६. २४०.
--a son of सत्यभामा. वा. ९६. २३९.
--a son of कृष्ण and सत्यभामा. Br. III. ७१. २४७.
--a daughter of सत्यभामा. Br. III. ७१. २४८.
(I)--a राक्षसि who picked up the two parts of बृहद्रथ's son and gave them life--the future जरा- sandha (s.v.). भा. IX. २२. 8; X. ५०. २१; ७१. 3; ७२. ४२.
--a son of सत्यभामा. वा. ९६. २३९.

(I)--born to बृहद्रथ in two parts and cast away by the mother. जरा (s.v.) joined them together, saying in sport ‘Live, Live’. It was जरासन्ध. He was father of Sahadeva. <F>1:  भा. I. १५. 9; IX. २२. 7-8; M. ५०. ३१-32; २७१. १८; Vi. IV. १९. ८३-4; २३. 2-3.</F> King of Magadha and father-in-law of कम्शा who married his daughters Asti and प्राप्ति; acted as कम्शा's guru in his wicked plans. Heard of कम्शा's death from his widowed daughters and resolved to destroy all the यादवस्. He besieged मथुरा with twenty-three अक्षौ- हिनिस्, stationing at the four gates king of Kalinga and others. Drums were sounded as a call to arms. Told कृष्ण that he was a boy unfit to fight him and asked राम to meet him in battle. राम challenged him on the western gate. Finding all his army followers killed, जरासन्ध attacked राम. When the latter was about to bind him with ropes, कृष्ण asked that he be set free. जरासन्ध went home greatly distressed. Three months after, जरासन्ध collected [पगे१-640+ ४६] another huge army of twenty-three अक्षौहिनिस्, encamped at यमुना banks and slept that night. कृष्ण divided his army into three divisions and attacked the enemy on all sides by surprise. All जरासन्ध's followers took to flight leaving all their belongings which were presented to Ugra- sena. Then he called on बाण at his city शोणितपुर soliciting his help against the Yadus. बाण's welcome and offer to help; with this force he again besieged मथुरा. Fight between him and राम. Defeat of कुम्भाण्ड and retreat of कूप- कर्ण and other soldiers of बाण to their city. जरासन्- dha's return to the city. <F>2:  भा. X. ३६. ३५; ५० (whole); also ch. ५० Vijaya (whole); chaps. ५१-52 (V) Vi. V. ४८ (whole).</F> Felt angry at शृगाल's end and led another expedition to मथुरा. Defeat and return. In this way he led seven- teen expeditions. During the eighteenth expedition a cer- tain Yavana sent by नारद besieged the city. <F>3:  भा. X. [५३ (v) २२-24]; ५०. ४२-44; Vi. V. ch. २२.</F> जरासन्ध attacked the Yadus going to द्वारका after vanquishing the म्लेच्छस् by the formation of मकरव्यूह when कृष्ण destroyed it by throwing a big tree on it. राम also gave them mighty blows. Then he turned upon two brothers who were unarmed and who ran to प्रवर्षण hill. जरासन्ध followed them and burnt the hill by besieging it from all sides. The brothers leaped into the plains and regained द्वारका, but were taken by their enemies to be burnt dead. His defeat at कृष्ण's hands during the स्वयम्वर of Ruk- मिणी is mentioned. Arrival at कुण्डिन; went to शिशुपाल and comforted him that all was due to fate, and returned to his city. <F>4:  भा. X. ५२ (whole); ५३. १७ and [३४], ५७; ५४. 9-१७; [५६ (v) 6]; Vi. २६. 3 and 7; ३७. २६.</F> His defeats were recalled by कृतवर्मन्. <F>5:  भा. X. ५७. १३.</F> He had his capital at Girivraja, where thousands of kings were kept imprisoned. <F>6:  Ib. X. ६०. १८; ७०. २३-24, २९.</F> A preliminary to युधिष्ठीर's राजसूय was to kill जरासन्ध. Finding him unconquered and also devoted to ब्रह्मणस्, कृष्ण, भीम and Arjuna went to him in Brahmana's guise and asked for meals. जरासन्ध understood them to be क्षत्रियस् and still recalled Bali giv- ing the earth to Hari in a Brahmana's guise. So he offered to give his head. Then कृष्ण and his two friends revealed themselves and invited him to battle. He refused to fight a [पगे१-641+ २५] coward who left मथुरा for a sea-girt-city, nor with un- equal Arjuna. But he agreed to fight with भीम. Then battle continued for २७ days and भीम felt despondent. कृष्ण gave him a hint by tearing a twig behind. So भीम pulled him down and tore him to two pieces from head to foot. <F>7:  Ib. ७१. 2[1], 3-4; ७२. १५-47; ७३. ३१; ७६. 2; वा. ९३. २७.</F> One of those who failed to hit the fish in the स्वयम्- वर of लक्ष्मणा. <F>8:  भा. X. ८३. २३; Br. III. ६८. २८; ७४. १०८.</F>
(II)--a son of Nabhasa; a powerful con- queror of all क्षत्रियस्. वा. ९९. २२६-7.
(III)--of the family of Sahadeva, the बृहद्रथस् known as मागधेयस्. वा. ९९. २९४.
--a son of कृष्ण and सत्यभामा. Br. III. ७१. २४७.
(I)--a son of Havya, after whom came Jalada- वर्ष. Br. II. १४. १७-18; वा. ३३. १६.
(II)--an आत्रेय gotrakara. M. १९७. 4.
(III)--a son of Bhavya of शाकद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ६०. [पगे१-642+ २८]
--after the name of जलदा; <F>1:  Br. II. १४. १७-18. वा. ३३. १७.</F> centring round the Udaya hill in शाकद्वीपम्. <F>2:  Br. II. १९. ९१; वा. ४९. ८५.</F>
(I)--a Mt. of शाकद्वीप from वासव; draws water always from rain. Br. II. १९. ८५-86; M. १२२. 9; वा. ४९. ७९.
(II)--a continent of Udaya hill. M. १२२. २०.
--see वरुण, who gave garland to देवी on the eve of her war campaign. Br. IV. २९. ८४.
--a मागध measure of १३ palas; four of these water measures equal to one नालिकोच्चय or घट; peculiar to the मागध country. Br. IV. 1. २१७; वा. १००. २२०; Vi. VI. 3. 8.
--a goddess enshrined at शिवलिन्ग. M. १३. ३३.
--as a deity with its अधीदेवत Bhava; worship- ped in founding a new temple. M. २६५. ३९ and ४१.
--a son of कृष्ण and सत्यभामा. See जरन्धम। M. ४७. १७.
--a Pravara sage. M. १९९. १५.
--an epithet of Hari. M. २८५. 5. [पगे१-643+ २६]
--a Mt. of शाकद्वीप; perhaps जलधार (s.v.). Vi. II. 4. ६२.
--see Jalam; to be worshipped in house- building. M. २५३. २६.
--was मानवी. Br. II. ३३. १७.
--a son of स्वाहा. Vi. I. १०. १५.
--one of the ten sons of रौद्राश्व. भा. IX. २०. 4; वा. ९९. १२४.
--is वरुण. Vi. II. 8-9.

--a तीर्थम् in the अमरकण्टक hill of Kalinga, fit for पिण्डतर्पणम्। When शिव was burning Tripura ruthlessly, बाण appeared with a लिन्ग on his head when the Lord blessed him with life. Hence the sanctity of the place. M. १८६. १५-38; १८७. 3-५२; Ch. १८८ (whole).
--a son of रौद्राश्व. Vi. IV. १९. 2.
--a sage of the तामस epoch. M. 9. १६. [पगे१-644+ २७]
--a monkey chief. Br. III. 7. ४२.
--a भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. २०.
--a Deva. Br. II. १३. ९५.
--a son of भद्राश्व. M. ५०. 3.
--the God of Love with fish standard; also जषकेतु, Makaradhvaja. M. १५४. २०९ and २८३.
--a son of पुष्पवत्. भा. IX. २२. 7.
--a son of Kuru. M. ५०. २३.
a kingdom of मध्यदेश and a tribe. Br. II. १६. ४०; वा. ४५. १०९; M. ११४. ३४.

(I)--a disciple of Pathya. He is said to have attained सिद्धि at a certain place on the western sea. This spot the Pracetasas chose for their सिद्धि; <F>1:  भा. XII. 7. 2; IV. ३१. 2; वा. ६१. ५२.</F> a श्रुतऋषि. <F>2:  Br. II. ३३. 2; ३५. ५९; III. ३६. 5.</F>
--a monkey chief. Br. III. 7. २३९.
--one of the eight सौभाग्यम्स्. M. ६०. 8. [पगे१-645+ ३१]
--a ऋत्विक् at ब्रह्मा's याग। वा. १०६. ३४.

--the fire originating in waters; this exists in the men's bellies and cannot be put out by waters; burns without fuel; it has no ज्वाल or glow. <F>1:  Br. II. २४. १२; वा. ५३. 8, १०.</F> Father of विद्वान्- agni. <F>2:  Br. II. १२. ३४.</F>
--astrologers foretold the future of परीक्षित् at his birth. भा. I. १२. १९-29.

--birth-ceremonial, done by Nanda to कृष्ण; <F>1:  भा. X. 5. 1-१६; Br. III. ४२. ४३; ५०. २४; ६३. १३३; Vi. III. १०. 4-१५; १३. 2.</F> Buda's birth-ritual, as also of वामन-Kr2s2n2a; <F>2:  M. २४. 5-7; २४५. ६६; २७५. १८.</F> of Sagara. <F>3:  Vi. IV. 3. ३६.</F>
--a कश्यप and a त्रयार्षेय. M. १९९. १३.
--the region of अधर्म, and of Kali. भा. I. १७. ३८.
--the Agni born of अरणिस्, as son to पूरू- ravas. भा. V. २०. १६-17; IX. १४. ४६.
--near वृसकूप; a holy fire taking people to heaven. वा. ७७. ४३.
--a सूक्तम् of the Yajurvedins to be recited in tank ritual. M. ५८. ३५. [पगे१-646+ २९]
--the sage who narrated the dialogue between Yama and his servant to the कालिन्गक Brahmana. Vi. III. 7. 9 and १३.
(I)--the वेदव्यास of the २८थ् द्वापर। <F>1:  Vi. III. 3. १९.</F> Heard the विष्णुपुराण from Pramati (पराशर-वा। प्।). <F>2:  वा. १०३. ६६; Vi. VI. 8. ४९.</F>
(II) the purohita when Veda-व्यास was born. वा. ९८. ९३.
(III)--the grandson's son of वसिष्ठ. वा. 1. १०.
(I)--the name of व्यास of the २७थ् द्वा- पर; सोमशर्म, the अवतार् of the Lord. (See जातुकर्णि). वा. २३. २१४.

(II)--learnt the ब्र्। पुराण from परा- शर and in his turn taught it to द्वैपायन; <F>1:  Br. II. 1. १०-11; ३५. १२४.</F> a वेदव्यास; <F>2:  भा. III. ७३. ९३; वा. २३. २१४.</F> a contemporary of वेद्व्यास; <F>3:  Br. IV. 4. ६६.</F> exclusion of mutual alliances among जातुकर्णि, वसिष्ठ and Atri. <F>4:  M. ४७. २४६; २००. १९.</F>
(III)--(जातूकर्ण-ब्र्। प्।); see कानीन; a disciple of शाकल्य. Imparted the सम्हिता with nirukta to बलाक, Paija and others. भा. IX. 2. २१; XII. 6. ५८. [पगे१-647+ ३०]
--Mt. a divine mountain in the उत्तरदेश; the residence of सिद्धस् and साधुस्। वा. ४१. ६६; ४२. ७१.
--country people; treated with love by पृथु; <F>1:  भा. IV. १७. 2; २१. 6; M. २२०. १५.</F> were provided with seats in the wrestling enclosure of कम्सा. <F>2:  भा. X. ३६. २४.</F>
--a son of तामस Manu. Br. II. ३०. ४९. Vi. III. 1. १९.
--गन्गा, as the daughter of Janhu, the royal sage; <F>1:  M. १०४. १३; ११०. 7; १८३. ७३; वा. ९१. ५८.</F> wife of शम्तनु. <F>2:  वा. ९९. २३९.; Vi. IV. २०. ३३; VI. 2. 4.</F>
(I)--a pupil of याज्ञवल्क्य; <F>1:  Br. II. ३५. २९; M. १९८. 4.</F> of Pathya. <F>2:  Vi. III. 6. ११.</F>
(II)--visited परशुराम, performing penance. Br. III. २३. 4.
(III)--an अर्षेय pravara of Angiras. M. १९५. ३८.

(I)--the sixth human incarnation of विष्णु with विश्वामित्र as पुरोहित in the १९थ् Treta1yuga; <F>1:  Br. III. ७३. ९१; M. ४७. २४४; वा. ८८. १३५.</F> with the शिशिर sun; <F>2:  Br. II. २३. २०.</F> served the गोदावरी तीर्थम्। <F>3:  M. २२. ५८.</F> [पगे१-648+ ३०]
(II)--the भार्गव, who slew the Saimhi- keya गण. वा. ६८. २२.
--a तीर्थम् on the Narmada. Here Indra became lord of gods. M. १९४. ३५-6.
--one of the ten daughters of रौद्राश्व. वा. ९९. १२५.
--a daughter of दक्ष married to Dhama; her sons were नववीथिस् on the three paths. Br. III. 3. 2, ३३.
--a daughter of दक्ष, and one of the wives of Dharma. Mother of Svarga (नागविथि-वा। प्।). भा. VI. 6. 4 and 6; वा. ६६. ३४; Vi. II. १५. १०५-7.
--a तुषित God. Br. II. ३६. १०.
--a Mt. on the base of Meru; north of the महा- bhadra lake. भा. V. १६. २६; वा. ३६. ३२; Vi. II. 2. २९, ४४.

--the daughter of जाम्बवान् given in mar- riage to कृष्ण (वासुदेव). She claimed Syamantaka as her शुल्क। <F>1:  भा. X. ५६. ३२; ५७. ४१ [3]; 1. ११. १७. Br. III. 7. ३०१; ७१. ४९. २४२-50; वा. ९६. ४७, २३३; Vi. IV. १३. ५५, ६३; १५. ३५; V. २८. 4; ३०. ३५.</F> Mother of साम्ब and three sons and a daughter. <F>2:  भा. III. 1. ३०; X. ६१. १२; ६३. 1; M. ४६. २६; ४७. १४, १८; Vi. V. ३२. 2.</F> Welcomed by द्रौपदी to Indraprastha, she narrated to her how she married कृष्ण. <F>3:  भा. X. ७१. ४२; ८३. १०.</F> Mother of the daughters भद्रा- वती and सम्बोधिनी. <F>4:  वा. ९६. २४१.</F> [पगे१-649+ ३५]

--the son of रक्षा and प्रजापति (also जाम्बवत्)--The Lord of ऋक्षस् who celebrated वामन's victory over Bali. <F>1:  भा. VIII. २१. 8; Br. III. 7. ३००-4; Vi. IV. १३. ३२-58.</F> The same person is said to have been an ally of राम. <F>2:  भा. IX. १०. १९ and ४४.</F> Killed the lion that killed Prasena (s.v.) and took the स्यमन्तक (s.v.) to his child. कृष्ण and his citizens traced the footsteps of Prasena, which led them to the cave of जाम्बवान्. कृष्ण fought with the latter for twenty-eight days जाम्बवान् acknowledged his defeat and praised Hari. He bestowed his daughter जाम्ब- वती and the jewel on कृष्ण. <F>3:  भा. X. ५६. १४-32; Br. III. ७१. ३५; M. ४५. 7-8, १२-6; वा. ९६. ३४.</F> Attained salvation by सत्- सन्ग; <F>4:  भा. XI. १२. 6.</F> present at राम's अभिषेक। <F>5:  Vi. IV. 4. १००.</F>
--gold formed from the earth on the banks of the river जम्बू largely used by celestials. भा. V. १६. २०-21; Br. II. १७. ३०-31; Vi. II. 2. २३.
--a R. in जम्बूद्वीप famous for gold. Vi. II. 2. २१.
--consists of ज्येष्ठ, विशाख and Anu- राधा in the middle path. Br. III. 3. ५०; वा. ६६. ५०.
--a भार्गवगोत्रकर. M. १९५. २२.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to ललिता; <F>1:  Br. IV. ४४. ९५.</F> sacred to विश्वमुखी and the पितृस्. <F>2:  M. १३. ४६; २२. ६४.</F>
--in the breasts of the personified Veda. वा. १०४. ८०. [पगे१-650+ २५]
--a देवी and wife of कृष्ण. वा. ९६. २३४.
--one of the eight places sacred to शिव in Benares. M. १८१. २८.

--four classes born of स्वेद, अण्ड, उद्भिज and जरायु; and जीवात्म subject to इश्वर is one view. M. 1. ३१; 3. २८.
--a Rahasyayogini शक्ति. Br. IV. १९. ४८.

(I)--a son of Rucaka (पुरवृत्-वि। प्।) banished out of the land by his elder brothers who were kings; surrounded by Brahmans he lived in a fearful forest in peace; soon he set out with a chariot and a flag towards the kingdom on the नर्मदा single-handed and reached the hill ऋक्षवान्; his wife was Saivya, but they had no son. In the battle he won victory, and soon got a daughter, whom he called श्नुषा, (daughter- in-law) adding to his wife that the son to be born would be her husband; the son was वैश, the Vidarbha, who married स्नुषा, and got two sons, Kratha and कौशिक; <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. ३५-39. Br. I. 1. २२. III. ७०. २९-49; M. ४४. २८-36. वा. 1. १४४; ९५. २८-36. Vi. IV. १२. ११-36.</F> his line. <F>2:  वा. ९५. ३६-47.</F>

(II)--after the conquest of the three worlds by विष्णु, the Devas, including ब्रह्मा praised him; ब्रह्मा was the creator while विष्णु was the creator and destroyer of worlds; during their discussion there was a ज्वाला in the north which spread over all the worlds out of which came Linga which went on growing. To see its beginning and end both agreed to go above and below respectively; they went on for १००० years; it was beyond reckoning; hence both praised शिव for light; शिव said that ब्रह्मा was the right hand and विष्णु his left hand and disappeared. वा. ५५. १७-61.
--an अक्षर Devi; <F>1:  Br. IV. १९. ५९.</F> killed त्रीकर्णिक, a commander of भण्ड. <F>2:  Ib. २५. ९८; ३७. ३५.</F>

II. १७. ३४; २०. २४; III. 7. ३२; M. 6. ३९; 8. 7. वा. ३९. ५४; ५०. २३; ५४. ९१; ६९. ६९.</F> Caused the death of परीक्षित् in consequence of the curse of the ब्रह्मण's son. परीक्षित् was informed beforehand by शुक and was not afraid. <F>2:  भा. I. १२. २७; १८. 2 and ३७; १९. 4; IX. २२. ३६; XII. 5. १०; 6. 5.</F> Met the sage कश्यप on his way to परीक्षित्'s place. <F>3:  Ib. XII. 6. ११-12.</F> When Janamejaya began his सर्प सत्र (याग), तक्षक sought shelter of Indra, and this resulted in Indra's fall; <F>4:  Ib. II. २५. ८८; M. १५४. ४४४.</F> Shaken by हिरण्यकशिपु; <F>8:  M. १६३. ५६: ११४. ८३; १२६. 7; १३३. ३३.</F> lived in the निषध hill; <F>9:  वा. ४६. ३४; ५२. 6.</F> sent along with others to fight प्रह्लाद; <F>१०:  Vi. I. १७. ३८.</F> a काद्रवेय; <F>११:  Ib. I. २१. २१.</F> in the sun's cha- riot in the month of Suci. <F>१२:  Ib. II. १०. 7.</F>
(II)--the son of Prasenajit and father of बृहद्बल. भा. IX. १२. 8.

(I)--(Pauleya) a sage of the Raucya epoch. Br. IV. 1. १०२.

--a Janapada of the Bhadra country. वा. ४३. २१.

(II)--a धूम्र Para1s4ara. M. २०१. ३८.

--a son of Nandana. M. ४६. २७.
--one of the sons of कृष्ण given to Kanaka. वा. ९६. १८९.

--an attendant on सन्गीत yogini holding a वीण. Br. IV. १७. ४६.
--a कला of Rudra. Br. IV. ३५. ९६.
--‘rudimentary, undifferentiated, subtle ele- ments from which a gross element is produced.’ M. 3. २२-26; वा. 4. ५२.
--rajas, tamas and satva, differ- ent in different times; ब्राह्मि, पौरुषि and अन्तकारि; or Pra- जापत्य, Raudri and वैष्णवि. वा. ६६. ८६-102. [पगे२-005+ २५]
(I)--a part of Vibhu. Br. III. 4. २४.
(II)--one of the twenty Sutapa गणस्. Br. IV. 1. १४; वा. १००. १४.
(III)--a Sukha God. Br. IV. 1. १९.
(IV) a God of Rohita गण. Br. IV. 1. ८५.
(V)--a son of सतरूपा. M. 4. २५.
(VI)--the third kalpa. वा. २१. २९.
(VII)--one of the Mukhya गण. वा. १००. १८.
(VIII)--a son of Raucya Manu. वा. १००. १०८.

(IX)--(also Tapoloka) a celestial world, <F>1:  भा.
