II. 1. २८; VIII. २०. ३४; XI. २४. १४; M. ६१. 1; १८४. २३.</F> form- ing the forehead of विराट्पुरुष; the sixth loka, the resi- dence of ऋभु, सनत्कुमार and others, originators of Man- vantaras; each of them resides conjointly with yoga, tapa and satya; four crores of yojanas above Janaloka; the resi- dence of the celestial वैराजस्; above it, the Satyaloka or Brahmaloka. <F>2:  वा. १०१. १७, ३७, २११; १०१. २०८; Vi. II. 7. १४-15.</F> [पगे२-006+ २८]
(X)--the month of माशि, (Feb.-Mar.) sacred to पूष. भा. XII. ११. ३९; वा. ३०. 9; ५०. २०२.

(XI)--the essence milked by बृहस्पति from cow-earth in the vessel of the Veda; practised by ययाती; greater than sacrifices. <F>1:  M. १०. १७; ३५. १५-17; १४३. ३३-40; वा. ५७. १२१-5.</F> Fasting and restraint lead to vai- राग्य; other features are celibacy, prayer and silence. <F>2:  वा 57. ११६-17; ५९. ४१.</F>
(I)--a daughter of सूर्य and छाया. Married संवरण, and became the mother of Kuru; became the river. भा. VI. 6. ४१; IX. २२. 4; VIII. १३. १०; M. ११. 9, ३९; Vi. III. 2. 4.
(II)--a R. sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ३२.
--the Sun whose daughter is यमुना. M. १०८. २३; ११०. 5.
--a queen of शिशिर. Br. IV. ३२. ३९.
--one of the twenty-eight hells for misbe- haviour of man or woman. भा. V. २६. 7 and २०.
(I)--फाल्गुन, the month sacred to Kratu. भा. XII. ११. ४०; Br. II. १३. ११. वा. ३०. 9.
(II)--a son of तामस Manu. M. 9. १७. [पगे२-007+ २७]
--the third daughter of भन्गकार, married to कृष्ण. वा. ९६. ५५.
(I)--a sage of the epoch of the twelfth Manu. भा. VIII. १३. २८.
(II)--a son of चाक्षुष Manu. Br. II. ३६. ७९, १०६; M. 4. ४१.
(III)--is कश्यप; a sage of the epoch of the fourth सावर्ण. Br. IV. 1. ९२.
(IV)--a son of Manu and नड्वला. Vi. I. १३. 5.
(V)--a sage of the XII epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. ३५.
--an adopted son of वस्तावन. वा. ९६. १९०.
--a Deva of the Rohita group. वा. १००. ९०.
--a son of सुदरीद्र (s.v). M. २१. 3.
--a son of तामस Manu. M. 9. १७.
(I)--(Paulastya): a sage of the epoch of the 4th सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ९२.
(II)--a son of तामस Manu. M. 9. १७. [पगे२-008+ २४]
(III)--a sage of the XII epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. ३५.
(IV)--a son of भृगु, the अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १४९.
(I)--(भार्गव) a sage of the epoch of the 4th सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ९३.
(II)--a sage of the XII epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. ३५.
--a son of तामस Manu. M. 9. १८.
(I)--a sage of the epoch of the twelfth Manu. भा. VIII. १३. २८; Vi. III. 2. ३५.
(II)--(Angiras): a sage of the epoch of the 4th सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ९२.
(III)--a sage of the X epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. २७.
--a son of तामस Manu. M. 9. १७.
--a son of तामस Manu. M. 9. १८. [पगे२-009+ २५]
(I)--(Paulaha): a sage of the epoch of the 4th सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ९२.
(II)--a son of तामस Manu. M. 9. १७.
(III)--a sage of the XII epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. ३५.

--(तप्तकुण्ड-वि। प्।); a hell, into which fall disloyal government servants, dealers in horses, gaolers, and women, those who have sexual intercourse with sisters, preceptor's wife, incestuous offenders, murderers of क्षत्रियस् and वैश्यस् and slayers of royal emissary. Br. IV. 2. १४७, १५६; वा. १०१. १४६, १५४; Vi. II. 6. 2 and 9-१०.
--a hell into which fall those who deal in horses, guardians of prisoners, sellers of chaste ladies and those who abandon भक्तस् and companions. वा. १०१. १५४; Vi. II. 6. ११.
(I)--(लोकपृष्ठ): a kind of hell: persons fallen from वर्ण and आश्रमधर्म find this hell. Br. IV. 2. १५०, १७७-78; वा. १०१. १४९, १७९; Vi. II. 6. 4.

(II)--equated with अज्ञान or ignorance, bound by three fetters; to think that which is not eternal as eternal, to regard happiness in one's difficulties, to regard one's own [पगे२-010+ २७] self which is not his own, and to regard that as pure which is impure; <F>1:  Br. IV. 3. ३३-38.</F> fourfold, with तामसि vr2tti, the lowest. <F>2:  Ib. 3. ५३.</F>
(III)--the eleventh kalpa. M. २९०. 5.
--a शक्ति on the षोडसपत्राब्जा. Br. IV. ३२. ११.
--a son of असमञ्ज. M. ४४. ८३.
--the विमान with faces on all sides on which rode तिरस्कर्णिका. Br. IV. २४. ७५.
--an eastern country; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ५१.</F> a hill tribe. <F>2:  Ib. II. १६. ६७.</F>
--a war-musical instrument; others are Bheri, मिस्साण, and पणवानक. Br. IV. २४. १४.
--a son of शार्न्गदेवा and Vasudeva. वा. ९६. १७७, २४९.
--a forest tribe of the Vindhyas. Br. II. ३६. १४५. [पगे२-011+ २४]
--a R. flows through the Uttarakuru country and falls into the north ocean. वा. ४२. ७६-7.
--a Devagandharva. वा. ६८. ३९.
--a यादव; a son of साम्बा. वा. ९६. २५२.
--barks of trees to cover nakedness; applied to harassed subjects living in the mountain valleys in degenerate times. Vi. IV. २४. ९६.
(I)--came to see the Trivikrama form of Hari. भा. VIII. २१. 2.
--a son of Auttama Manu. M. 9. १२.
--a son of वासना and Arka; a Vasu. भा. VI. 6. १३.
(I)--a son of आन्ध्र Ha1leya, and father of पुरीषभीरु. भा. XII. 1. २५.
(II)--a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५१. [पगे२-012+ २८]
--slapping of arms in defiance by कृष्ण on seeing the असुर अरिष्ट as a bull. Vi. V. १४. 8.
--one of the ten daughters of रौद्राश्व. वा. ९९. १२६.

--an underworld, being the residence of Asura Maya who won the grace of शिव and moved about without fear of the सुदर्शन; <F>1:  भा. II. 1. २६; V. २४. 7 and २८.</F> residence of प्रह्लाद. <F>2:  Br. II. २०. १२-14, २५-31.</F>
--the two sides of the navel of the Veda. वा. १०४. ७२.
--wife of सुन्दा (मारिच-वा। प्।) and mother of मारीच; <F>1:  Br. III. 5. ३६; वा. ६७. ७२.</F> was killed by राम <F>2:  Vi. IV. 4. ८८.</F>
--exclusion of marriage alliances among Angiras and Maudgalyas. M. १९६. ४४.
--a mode of worship but different from the Vaidika or Vedic path; <F>1:  भा. VIII. 6. 9.</F> the तान्त्रिक concept of Hari. <F>2:  Ib. XII. ११ (whole); Br. IV. 2. १०८.</F>
--as different from the Vaidika, in the mode of prayer to Hari. भा. XI. ११. ३७; २७. 7. [पगे२-013+ २६]
--a western country. Br. II. १६. ६०.
--three pains; आध्यात्मिक (bodily and mental pain), आधिभौतिक (natural but incidental pain) and आधिदैविक (superhuman); each is multiplied in thousands. Vi. VI. 5. 1-9.
--a pupil of याज्ञवल्क्य. Br. II. ३५. २९.
--a southern tribe. M. ११४. ४९; वा. ४५. १२९.
--Here to the wonderment of a hunter, a deer which fell in water due to dread was taken to the world above. M. १९१. १०२-4.
--one of Danu's sons. वा. ६८. 8.
(I)--a R. in भारतवर्ष rising in the Vin- dhyas; <F>1:  भा. V. १९. १८; Br. II. १६. ३२; M. ११४. २७.</F> visited by बलराम. <F>2:  वा. ४५. १०२; भा. X. ७९. २०.</F>
(II)--a R. rises from the ऋक्ष hill. Vi. II. 3. ११.
--one of Atri's wives. Br. III. 8. ७६. [पगे२-014+ ३३]

(I)--a son of Priyavrata, and a Manvantara adhipati. <F>1:  भा. V. 1. २८; Vi. III. 1. २४.</F> The fourth Manu and brother of Uttama. He had पृथु and nine other sons. During this epoch the gods went by the name of Satyakas, Haris, etc. त्रिशिख was Indra. ज्योतिर्धामा and others were the seven sages. <F>2:  भा. VIII. 1. २७-28.</F> Brother of Raivata. <F>3:  Ib. VIII. 5. 2.</F> For different names of Gods, sages and Indra in this epoch; <F>4:  Br. II. ३६. 3, ४२-50; M. 9. १५.</F> represents उकार; <F>5:  वा. २६. ३६; ६२. 3.</F> twenty-seven गणस् of Gods mentioned in this epoch--सुपार, Haraya, etc. शिबि was Indra; Nara and ख्याति, his sons. <F>6:  Vi. III. 1. 6, १६-19.</F>
(II)--the quality of भूतादि swallowed by Mahat of which Buddhi is the गुण. वा. १०२. १९-20.
--four गणस्; each of २५ devas; sages; sons. वा. ६२. ३७-43.
--in this epoch were created sons of Himsa and of Adharma. वा. १०. ३८-45.
(II)--one of the three मात्रस् of Om, the प्रणव. वा. २०. 2.
(III)--a R. of the केतुमाला country. वा. ४४. १७. [पगे२-015+ ३७]
(V)--also known as पूतना; wife of Sadrama. वा. ८४. १२.
--that which is at the bottom; four-fold; no belief in the Veda, शिष्ताचार, non-observance of वर्णाश्रम and of धर्म शास्त्रस्। वा. १०२. ५४, ७०-73.
--a hell among the twenty-eight in number. Here are put to torments, those who lay hands on another's property, children and women. भा. III. ३०. २८; IV. 6. ४५; V. २६. 7-8; Vi. I. 6. ४१; III. ११. १०४.

--offered to Hari in Payovrata. <F>1:  भा. VIII. १६. ४१.</F> Offered by the merchants of मथुरा to कृष्ण and his brother; <F>2:  Ib. X. ४२. १३.</F> used by त्रिवक्रा before she met कृष्ण; <F>3:  Ib. X. ४८. 5.</F> offered to Brahmana ladies, who were not widows, in the Devi temple just before the marriage of रुक्मिणी; <F>4:  Ib. X. ५३. ४८; ६१. 6.</F> given by कृष्ण to Brahmanas; <F>5:  Ib. X. ७०. १३: ७३. २६.</F> offered to Kucela by कृष्ण; <F>6: Ib. X. ८०. २२.</F> offered to Hari by Indrasena; <F>7:  Ib. X. ८५. ३७; XI. २७. ४३.</F> to be offered to Tripurasundari during worship. <F>8:  Br. IV. ४३. १३.</F>
--an attendant on the king. M. २१५. १५.
(I)--a son of Mura (s.v.). भा. X. ५९. १२.
(II)--a monkey chief. Br. III. 7. २३४. [पगे२-016+ ३०]
(III)--a son of सत्यभामा and कृष्ण. M. ४७. १७; Br. III. ७१. २४७.
--a son of कृष्ण and रोहिणी. भा. X. ६१. १८.
--a son of रोहिणि and कृष्ण. Vi. V. ३२. 2.
(I)--the elephant of the साम fold. Br. III. 7. ३३७.
(II)--one of the nine divisions of भारत- वर्ष. M. ११४. 8; Vi. II. 3. 6.

(I)--a R. of the कुलाचल hill in भारत- वर्ष, <F>1:  भा. IV. २८. ३५; V. १९. १८.</F> and in द्राविड. <F>2:  Ib. XI. 5. ३९.</F> Visited by बलराम; <F>3:  Ib. X. ७९. १६.</F> from the Malaya Hills flowing through sandal wood regions; famous for pearls and conch; fit for श्राद्ध offerings; <F>4:  Br. II. १६. ३६; III. १३. २४-7; IV. ३३. ५२; Vi. II. 3. १३.</F> sacred to पितृस्; <F>5:  M. २२. ४९; ११४. ३०.</F> flows towards the southern ocean; at its confluence with the ocean are produced conches, shells and pearls. <F>6:  वा. ७७. २४-5.</F>
(II)--a daughter of सत्यभामा. Br. III. ७१. २४८; वा. ९६. २४०.
--(ताम्रम्) copper vessel for ceremo- nial purposes; fit for gifts. M. 7. १२; ५८. १३; ५९. 8; ६१. ४५; २०६. १५; २७९. 7; २८८. ११; वा. ७४. 1. [पगे२-017+ ३२]
--a daughter of रौद्राश्व. वा. ९९. १२६.

--the territory under King देवरक्षित; <F>1:  Vi. IV. २४. ६४.</F> an eastern country and tribe; a Janapada of the east. <F>2:  Br. II. १८. ५१; III. ७४. १९७; M. ११४. ४५; १२१. ५०; १६३. ७२; वा. ४५. १२३; ९९. ३८५.</F>
--a son of सत्यभामा. वा. ९६. २३९.
--a Mt. near Patanga in the southern direction. वा. ३८. 8.
(I)--a division of the भारतवर्ष. Br. II. १६. 9; वा. ४५. ७९.
(II)--a R. of the Malaya hills. वा. ४५. १०५.
(III)--name of an elephant; son of पुष्प- danta. वा. ६९. २२१.
--copper hall; of Lalita's श्रीपुर--square in shape spreading to seven yojanas. There was कल्पकवा- टिक between this and काम्श्यशाल full of beautiful and fragrant trees. Br. IV. ३१. ६६.

(I)--one of कश्यप's wives. Her progeny were hawks, vultures, eagles, curlews, geese, शुकीस् and others; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. २६-27; M. 6. 2 and ३०; वा. ६९. ३२५-26. Vi. I. १५. १२५; २१. १४-17.</F> daughter of Pulaha; <F>2:  Br. III. 3. ५६; 7. ४४५ to ४४८; ६९. ३२५.</F> mother of Apsarasas. <F>3:  M. १४६. १८; १७१. २९ and ६०.</F> [पगे२-018+ ३२]
(II)--Wife of Vasudeva; her son was Sahadeva. M. ४६. १६.
(III)--a daughter of दक्ष and wife of कश्यप. वा. ६६. ५४.
--Mt. south of the मानस; <F>1:  वा. ३६. २३.</F> the residence of काद्रवेय Taks2aka. <F>2:  वा. ३९. ५४.</F>
(I)--a monkey chief. Br. III. 7. २३१.
(II)--a God of the Harita गण. Br. IV. 1. ८५.

(I)--an Asura; took part in a देवासुर battle between Bali and Indra. <F>1:  भा. VIII. १०. २१.</F> Fought with Guha in a देवासुर war. <F>2:  Ib. VIII. १०. २८; M. ६१. ३८.</F> Lust after more territory. <F>3:  भा. XII. 3. ११.</F> Escaped to the ocean and gave trouble by coming out often. <F>4:  M. ६१. 4; १२९. 5; १३१. २२; १३६. ३४ and ६७.</F> Slain by Nandin. <F>5:  M. १३८. ४३-4.</F> City in the third तल named after him. <F>6:  Br. II. २०. २६.</F>
(II)--a son of Danu, <F>1:  Br. III. 6. 7; M. 6. १९; वा. ५०. २६; ६८. 7; Vi. I. २१. 5.</F> and a friend of भण्ड. <F>2:  Br. IV. ३०. ३९.</F>
(III)--from तारण or that which takes good men across to next world. M. १२८. ३४ and ५६. [पगे२-019+ ३३]

(IV)--a son of वज्रान्ग and वरान्गी who troubled the Devas and destined to be killed by a baby of seven days; relieved his mother (तारक) from sorrows and hence the name; एत्य्। was crowned king of the Asura world; did penance at the पारियात्र cave when ब्रह्मा granted his wish to be killed by a lad of seven days. All लोकपालस् served him. He wanted to vanquish Hari and set out with Grasana as commander. The flag of मकर was hoisted. Indra's report to बृहस्पति. <F>1:  M. Chh. १४६-149; १६०. २५-6; Br. IV. ११. 7.</F> The war in which he was killed by कुमार. <F>2:  Br. III. १०. ४९; IV. ३०. १०३; वा. ७२. ४७.</F>
(V)--of कौशिक gotra. वा. ९१. ९८.
--extent of, west to east five thousand yojanas; above it are the slow moving Saura, Angira and Vakra; under it are the Sun, Moon, Budha and भार्गव which revolve swiftly. वा. ५३. ७०-4.
--by worship of Mukti and वामन, the two boats to cross the ocean of सम्सार. वा. १०८. ३७.
--सुनीती, the mother of Dhruva, known as. Vi. I. १२. ९४.

(I)--A देवासुर battle in कृत yuga; तारा's (तारका, बृहस्पति's wife) abduction by Soma, was the ground for war between the Asuras and the Suras. शुक्र joined Soma while शिव and Indra took up बृहस्- pati's cause. <F>1:  भा. IX. १४. 4-7; Br. III. 5. ३२; M. १२९. १६; १७२. १०; वा. ६७. ६९; ७०. ८१; ९०. ३३.</F> Here विष्णु killed कालनेमि, and Indra, Viro- cana, son of प्रह्लाद; (Virocana was killed by विष्णु in the [पगे२-020+ २९] guise of Indra-वा। प्।). After the war there was a famine when वसिष्ठ helped the people with fruits and roots; <F>2:  Br. III. 8. ८८; ६५. ३४; ७२. २०-21, ७४; M. Chh. १७३- १७८.</F> the fifth battle in which Virocana was blessed with eternal life by शिव; <F>3:  वा. ९७. २१, ७४ and ८०.</F> ended with the intervention of ब्रह्मा who gave तारा back to बृहस्पति. <F>4:  Vi. IV. 6. १६-19.</F>
(II)--the fifth of the twelve कोलाहलस्. Indra killed Virocana, son of प्रह्लाद. M. ४७. ४३-9.
--above नक्षत्रमण्डल; below this Budha moves. वा. १०१. ३१, १३२.
--the high and low strains of a song; sung by कृष्ण. Vi. V. १३. १६, ५६.

(I)--the wife of बृहस्पति, and abducted by Soma. Of this union was born Budha. Through ब्रह्मा's influ- ence she was restored to her husband; (came back to बृहस्- pati after a battle between the Devas and the दानवस्). भा. IX. १४. 4-8, १३-14; Br. III. ६५. २९; M. २३. ३०-47; २४. 3; वा. ९०. २८-35, ४३. Vi. IV. 6. १०-33.
(II)--a ब्रह्मवादिनी. Br. II. ३३. १८.
(III)--a daughter of सुषेण and queen of वालि; her son was अङ्गद. Br. III. 7. २१९. [पगे२-021+ ३१]
(IV)--also तोरणेश्वरि and ताराम्बिका; a शक्ति living in the midst of waters that could be crossed only by boats of different sizes. Br. IV. ३५. १२-24, ५८; ३६. १६; ४४. ८०.
(V)--the goddess enshrined at किष्किन्धपर्वत. M. १३. ४६.
(VI)--one of the ten branches of the Harita group of Devas. वा. १००. ८९.
--Lord of the stars; the moon. वा. ४१. ५८.
--a son of चन्द्रावलोक of the सूर्यवम्श. M. १२. ५४.
--(तार्क्ष्य-वा। प्। and वि। प्।): सेनानि with the Sun in Hemanta. Br. II. २३. १८; वा. ५२. १८.

(I)--(also तार्क्ष)--see गरुड. <F>1:  भा. III. 2. २४; १७. २२.</F> Married four daughters of दक्ष. These were विनता, कद्रू, पतन्गी, and यामिनी, who were mothers of birds, snakes, etc. <F>2:  Ib. VI. 6. 2, २१-22.</F> तार्क्ष्यसुत inimical to serpents. <F>3:  Ib. VII. 8. २६. X. १७. 7; ३७. 4; ५९. 7.</F> Invoked for protection on the ground. <F>4:  Ib. X. 6. २३; १७. 7; M. १२६. १९; १६७. ५३.</F>

(II)--the यक्ष presiding over the month of Satra. (तार्क्षि ब्र्। प्।); <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ४१.</F> resides in the chariot of the sun during the month of मार्गशीर्ष. <F>2:  Vi. II. १०. १३.</F> [पगे२-022+ २७]

(I)--span, employed in describing measurement in iconography; nine तालस् generally for deities, दानवस् and kinnaras; measurement made usually by the middle finger. Br. I. 7. ९७; M. २५८. १६ and ७५; २५९. 1-2; वा. 8. १०३.
(II) (च्)--kingdom watered by the R. चक्ष. Br. II. १८. ४६.
(III)--a hell into which falls one, who murders a क्षत्रिय or वैश्य or Brahmana, or one who defiles a precep- tor's bed. Br. IV. 2. १४६; वा. १०१. १४६, १५३; Vi. II. 6. 2.
--a कौशिक gotra. Br. III. ६६. ७०.
--an आर्षेय-pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. २२.
(I)--a दानव with मनुष्य dharma; <F>1:  Br. III. 6. १६; वा. ६८. १६.</F> station- ed at the northern gate of the शून्यक city with ten अक्षौ- हिणिस्. <F>2:  Br. IV. २२. २५.</F>
(II)--the palm tree as the banner of Bala- deva. Vi. IV. 1. ९५.
--the Asura who was stationed at the western gate of the शून्यक city with ten अक्षौहिणि soldiers. Br. IV. २२. २४. [पगे२-023+ ३३]

(I)--the son of Jayadhvaja and father of one hundred sons (तालजन्घस्--वीतिहोत्र being the elder). The तालजन्घ line came to an end by Aurva's power. <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. २८; M. ४३. ४७; वा. ८८. १२२; ९४. ५०.</F> Afraid of परशुराम he escaped to the Himalayas and returned after peace was restored. Led an expedition to अयोध्या whose king Phalgutantra fled with his wife and child; <F>2:  Br. III. ६९. ५१; ४७. ६७, ७८.</F> defeated बाहु, but was defeated by his own son, Sagara. <F>3:  Vi. IV. 3. २६, ४०-1.</F>
(II)--a commander of कुटिलाक्ष. Br. IV. २९. १६-18.

--a class of क्षत्रियस् defeated by Sagara; <F>1:  भा. IX. 8. 5; २३. २८.</F> the collective name of the १०० sons of तालजन्घ and a Haihaya clan; of them five गणस् could be distinguished; वीतिहोत्र, Bhoja, Avantya, तुण्डिकेर and तालजन्घ. <F>2:  Br. III. ४८. २३-5; ६३. १२० and १३४; ६९. ५१-3; M. ४३. ४८; वा. ९४. ५१-2.</F>
--the Asura stationed at the eastern gate of the शून्यक city with ten अक्षौहिणि soldiers. Br. IV. २२. २२.
--the Asura stationed at the southern gate of the शून्यक city with ten अक्षौहिणि soldiers. Br. IV. २२. २३.
--a grove of palms near ब्रिन्दावन where lived the demon Dhenuka who was killed by राम and कृष्ण. Vi. V. 8. 1-3; 9. 1.
--a northern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ५०. [पगे२-024+ २५]
--articles of, detailed. M. २१७. ६८-74.
--the son of Urva and father of बृहद्रथ. Vi. IV. २१. १३.
--a son of Vatsara and स्वर्वीथी. भा. IV. १३. १२.
--a son of Urva. M. ५०. ८५.
--a शक्ति on the नाग patra. Br. IV. ३२. १७.
--a daughter of दक्ष and a wife of Dharma; gave birth to क्षेम. भा. IV. 1. ५० and ५२.

--the righteous; a son of महामन and father of रुशद्रथ. <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. 2 and 4; वा. ९९. १८; Vi. IV. १८. 8, ११; Br. III. ७४. १७ and २४.</F> (उशद्रथ: ब्र्। प्; बृहत्रथ: म्। प्।); a king of the East. <F>2:  M. ४८. १५, २२.</F>
--the शूद्र caste of क्रौञ्चद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ५३.
--an आर्षेय pravara of भार्गवस्. M. १९५. ३८. [पगे२-025+ २९]
(I)--one of the wives of कश्यप; gave birth to aquatic animals. भा. VI. 6. २६.
(II)--the son of दूर्व, and father of बृहद्रथ. भा. IX. २२. ४३.
--the God of night. वा. १०८. ३२.

--a दण्डनाथा, attacked बला- haka and his brothers; rode on Tamolipta विमान. Aimed at them the Mohana arrow which created darkness all round; wore on her neck a garland of the severed heads; <F>1:  Br. IV. २४. ७४, ९८.</F> (this दण्डनी) all शक्तिस् praised. <F>2:  Ib. IV. २४. १०३; ३६. २५.</F>
--the origin of the different creatures described. वा. ६९. २९८-303.
--one of the names in the first Marut गण. वा. ६७. १२३.
--sixfold; to take birth and undergo all diffi- culties. वा. १०२. ७२.

--at the beginning of creation and when the whole was enveloped in darkness a cross current passed in and resulted in a second universe: २८ parts, ११ senses, 9 udayas, 8 stars; light in as also out; this resulted in सात्विक. वा. 6. ४१-7, ५६.
--a daughter of क्रोधा, the wife of Pulaha. Br. III. 7. १७२. [पगे२-026+ ३७]
--a Janapada. वा. ४५. १११.
--one of the विष्कम्भ hills round Meru; con- tinent of Uttara Kurus and सावीत्र vanam. M. ८३. २३ and ३४.

--the Apsaras <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ४३; Br. II. २३. २२; III. 7. 6; IV. ३३. २०; M. १३. ५३; वा. ५२. २२; ६९. 5.</F> presiding over the month of इष (माघ and फाल्गुन-वा। प्।); born out of the fire altar of ब्रह्मा; <F>2:  वा. ६९. ५९.</F> resides in the Sun's chariot in the month of माघ; cursed by अष्तावक्र. <F>3:  Vi. II. १०. १६; V. ३८. ७३ and ७७.</F>
--the eleventh व्यास, the अवतर् of the Lord. वा. २३. १५१.
(I)--a constellation. Important for श्राद्ध. भा. XII. 2. २४; Br. III. १८. 4; वा. ८२. 5.
--a commander of भण्ड to aid विषङ्ग; <F>1:  Br. IV. २१. ८०; २५. २९.</F> was killed by सर्वमन्गलिकानित्या. <F>2:  Ib. IV. २५. ९८.</F> [पगे२-027+ ३७]
--a righteous person fit to receive a दान। वा. ९१. १११.

--a custom of going on pilgrimage. Vidura undertook one. <F>1:  भा. I. १३. 1.</F> Not fruitful to the unfaithful, <F>2:  Br. III. १३. १३५-6; ६६. ४३; IV. 9. 7.</F> of गाधि; rules that one should not ride in a vehicle but walk; <F>3:  M. १०६. 3; ११२. २०.</F> of Arjuna. <F>4:  Ib. २४४. 3.</F>
--the Lord of the holy waters; प्रयाग, to honour which is to honour the Lord of the waters. M. १०९. १५.
--a R. of क्रौञ्चद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २१.

--prescriptions for; <F>1:  वा. ११०. २८-66.</F> merits of; rituals at different sacred places of गया; could be done at any time in the presence of any with no आवाहन; the performer must observe celibacy, live on one meal a day, take bed on the earth and be truthful and pure to get full merits. <F>2:  Ib. १०५. ३७-41.</F>
--going on pilgrimage for sacred baths. Vi. III. 9. १२.

--sacred places of pilgrimage; as frequented by पिशाचस्; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. ४०५; 9. ४२; M. १७. ११.</F> श्राद्धस् at; enumeration of a number of them for श्राद्ध offerings. <F>2:  Br. III. १३ (whole); M. १५. १७.</F> First गुरुतीर्थम्, then ध्यान- तीर्थम्, and lastly ब्रह्मतीर्थम्, <F>3:  Br. III. २२. 6; २४. ३९.</F> परशुराम went about to purify himself; <F>4:  Ib. IV. 5. 4.</F> names of about १०० Ti1rthas given. <F>5:  M. Ch. २२; ८३. १०.</F> [पगे२-028+ २६]
--an अन्गीरस and मन्त्रकृत्. Br. II. ३२. १०९.
--Mt. a hill. Br. II. १६. २२.
--a R. in भारतवर्ष from the Sahya hill; sacred to पितृस्. भा. V. १९. १८; Br. II. १६. ३५; वा. ४५. १०४; M. २२. ४५; ११४. २९.
--(तुण्डकेश-वा। प्।); a राक्षस; son of खश. Br. III. 7. १३५; वा. ६९. १६७.
--a Vindhya tribe; one of the five classes (गणस्) of the Haihayas; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ६५; III. ६९. ५३; वा. ९४. ५२.</F> on the other side of the Vindhyas. <F>2:  वा. ४५. १३४.</F>
--a forest tribe of the Vindhyas; <F>1:  Br. II. ३६. १४५.</F> to be conquer- ed by Kalki. <F>2:  Ib. III. ७३. १०८.</F>
--a tribe, on the other side of the Vindhyas. M. ११४. ५३; वा. ४५. १३३.
--a son of Tumba; had two sons. Br. III. ७१. २५८.
--a Vindhyan tribe. M. ११४. ५३.
--a son of Tumba. Br. III. ७१. २५८.
--a निषाद tribe; on the other side of the Vindhyas. वा. ६२. १२४; ४५. १३३.

(I)--an expert in divine music; had two daughters मनोवती and सुकेशा; <F>1:  वा. ६९. ४७, ४९.</F> a friend of Candrodaka दुन्दुभी. <F>2:  Ib. ९६. ११७.</F> A Gandharva disciple of नारद, came with the sage to see युधिष्ठिर, and returned to heaven with him; <F>3:  भा. I. १३. ३७ and ५९.</F> sang with नारद the glories of Ananta; <F>4:  Ib. V. २५. 8.</F> praised हिरण्यकशिपु when he became the overlord of all worlds. <F>5:  Ib. VII. 4. १४.</F> Sang the praise of कृष्ण when he held the Govardhana; <F>6:  Ib. X. २५. ३२; २७. २४.</F> presiding over the months of Madhu and माधव. <F>7:  Ib. XII. ११. ३३; Br. II. २३. 4.</F> His two daughters were celebrated as पञ्चचूडस्; <F>8:  Ib. III. 7. 9; IV. २०. ५० and १०१.</F> residing in the Sun's chariot in the months of Caitra and Madhu. <F>9:  वा. ५२. 3; ३६. ४७; Vi. II. १०. 3.</F>
(II)--a friend of Anu, son of Kapotaroma. भा. IX. २४. २०.
(III)--a friend of Andhaka. Br. III. ७१. ११८.
--the son of कावष, and Purohita of Janamejaya. भा. IX. २२. ३७.
--a white horse came out of the churning of the ocean; claimed by the Sun god. M. २५०. 3; २५१. 3. [पगे२-030+ ३०]
--a horse of the Moon's chariot. वा. ५२. ५३.
--a people of the नर्मदा region. वा. ४५. १२९.
--a तीर्थम् on the नर्मदा. M. १९१. २९.
(I)--a name of ब्रह्मा (s.v.). भा. XI. १५. १६.
(II)--(Turiya Indrayuk?-ब्र्। प्।); a Deva (a- jita). Br. II. १३. ९४; वा. ३१. 8.
--frank incense of white colour for धूप of the पितृस्. Br. III. ११. ६९.
--(तुष्करस्-ब्र्। प्।; तुरुष्कार-वा। प्।)-- Fourteen kings among them, see Maunas. भा. XII. 1. ३०; Vi. IV. २४. ५३.

(I)--a son of ययाति and देवयानी; refused to part with his youth to his father; he was therefore cursed to have no issue and to live a king among the wicked and low tribes and Mlecchas; became overlord of the Mlecchas in the western part of the kingdom. His son was Vahni. <F>1:  भा. IX. १८. ३३ and ४१; १९. २२; २३. १६; M. २४. ५३; वा. ९३. १६.</F> His line became merged with the Paurava line, during the time of Marutta. <F>2:  Br. III. ६८. १६, ४०, ५०; ७३. १२६; ७४. 1 and 4; M. ३३. 9-११; वा. ९९. 1-4.</F> Equal to विष्णु; father of Garbha; Yavanas take their origin from him, <F>3:  M. ३२. 9; ३४. ३०; ४८. 1.</F> got the south-east of the kingdom, when his father retired to the forest. <F>4:  वा. ९३. ३९-44, ८९.</F> [पगे२-031+ २९]
(II)--a son of देवयानी and Yadu? Br. I. 1. १३२; वा. 1. १४१.
--equinox. वा. ५०. १९५.
--Weighing in balance; one of the १६ maha1- दानस्; rules detailed. The gift takes one to the world of विष्णु or Indra. M. २७४. (whole); २७५. 2.
--a son of लान्गली of the २२न्द् Dva1para. वा. २३. २००.
--a tribe belonging to the Vindhya region. वा. ६२. १२४.

(I)--a dynasty of १४ rulers, ruled for १०५ years [५०० years (वा। प्।)] after the Yavanas; reigned for ७००० years? Br. III. ७४. १७२-6; M. २७३. १९, २१; वा. ४५. ११८; ४७. ४४; ५८. ८३; ९८. १०८; ९९. ३६०. ३६२.
(II) (च्)--a northern kingdom; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ४७; १८. ४६; ३१. ८३.</F> १४ kings of it ruled for १०५ years after the Yavanas. <F>2:  M. १२१. ४५; १४४. ५७.</F>

--a class of Devas, sons of Kratu and तुषिता, twelve in number, being sons of दक्षिणा. Flourished in the [पगे२-032+ ३५] स्वायम्भुव epoch. <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. 8.</F> They were also Jayadeva gods of the स्वारोचिष epoch. <F>2:  Ib. VIII. 1. २०; Br. II. ३६. 7-१२; M. 9. 9. वा. ६६. 8; ६७. ३५; ९०. ३४.</F> They were the same as Jayadevas of the स्वायम्भुव. <F>3:  Br. III. 3. 8 and १९; 4. २८; ६५. ३५.</F> Thirty-three in number, belong to the Sumanasa group of the 4th सावर्ण Manu; <F>4:  Ib. IV. 1. ८७.</F> Gods also of the चाक्षुस epoch known as आदित्यस्. <F>5:  M. 6. 3-१२.</F> These are the twelve आदित्यस् of the Vaivasvata epoch; <F>6:  Vi. I. १५. १२७. १३१-32; Ib. III. 1. १०.</F> known as प्राणख्यस् in the यज्ञस्.
(I)--the wife of वेदशिरस् and mother of Vibhu. भा. VIII. 1. २१.

(II)--the wife of Kratu and mother of the तुषित gods in the स्वारोचिष epoch; <F>1:  Br. II. ३६. 8; वा. ६२. 8; ६७. ३५.</F> gave birth to विष्णु by name Ajita in that epoch. <F>2:  Br. III. 3. ११-15.</F>
(III)--the mother of यजिष in the स्वारोचिष epoch. Vi. III. 1. ३७.
--a son of Ugrasena. वा. ९६. १३२.
--a R. in शाल्मलिद्वीप. Br. II. १९. ४६.
(I)--a daughter of दक्ष, and a wife of Dharma, gave birth to मुद। (सन्तोष-वा। प्। and वि। प्।). भा. IV. 1. ४९ and ५१; Br. I. 9. ४९, ५९; वा. १०. २५. ३४: ५५. ४३; Vi. I. 7. २३ and २८.
(II)--a son of Vasudeva and मदिरा. Br. III. ७१. १७२. [पगे२-033+ २९]
(III)--a शक्ति on the fourth Parvan of the Geya- cakra. Br. IV. १९. ७१; ४४. ७१.
(IV)--a कला of the moon. Br. IV. ३५. ९२; M. २३. २४.
--a son of Ugrasena. भा. IX. २४. २४; Br. III. ७१. १३३.
--a Vindhya tribe. Br. II. १६. ६५.

--generally a war-musical instrument; employed on auspicious occasions, and in temples; <F>1:  भा. I. ११. १८; M. १४९. 2; १६३. १०५; १९२. २८.</F> sounding of bugles in a wrestling match; <F>2:  Vi. V. २०. ३०.</F> finding चाणूर declining, Kamsa stop- ped the sounding of the drum when the Devas sounded divine music. <F>3:  Vi. V. २०. ७१-3.</F>
--a Mleccha tribe. वा. ९९. २६८.
--A pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. १३.
--a Mauneya. वा. ६९. 2.

(I)--a king and the son of Bandhu. (Budha- वि। प्।). His queen was अलम्बुषा. Father of a number of sons and a daughter चेडवीडा. <F>1:  भा. IX. 2. ३०-31; Br. III. 8. ३६-7; ६१. १०; Vi. IV. 1. ४६-7.</F> (इलविला-वि। प्।). Lust after more territory. <F>2:  भा. XII. 3. १०.</F> Lived at the commencement of the third [पगे२-034+ २९] त्रेतायुग. His daughter was द्रविडा. Many kings of विशाल ruled by his grace. <F>3:  वा 86. १५-16, २२.</F> Begot an Apsaras, आलम्बुषा, a son विशाल who began the वैशाल line of kings which ended with Sumati. <F>4:  Vi. IV. 1. ४८-9, ५९.</F>
(II)--the २७थ् Veda व्यास, learnt the ब्र्। पुराण and the वायु पुराण from सोमशुष्म and narrated the former to दक्ष. Br. II. ३५. १२३; IV. 4. ६४-65; वा. १०३. ६४.
(III)--a sage who got freed from a curse at ऋसितीर्थम् on the नर्मदा. M. १९३. १३.
(IV)--the Veda-व्यास of the २३र्द् (२४थ्- वि। प्।) द्वापर; श्वेत, the अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. २०३; Vi. III. 3. १७.
(V)--the son of Dama and a king at the beginning of the third त्रेतायुग in the ११थ् Manvantara; had a daughter इडिविला, who was married to पौलश्त्य. वा. ७०. ३०-1.
--heard the ब्र्। and वायु पुराणस् from कृतम्जय and narrated the former to भरद्वाज. Br. IV. 4. ६३; वा. १०३. ६३.

--an Asura friend of Kamsa; created a whirl- wind which covered all Gokulam with dust and took the baby कृष्ण high in the sky. कृष्ण caught hold of his neck and the demon, unable to bear his weight, fell down dead to the wonder of all Gopas and गोपीस्. भा. X. 2. 1; 7. २०-32; २६. 6; ४६. २६; Br. IV. २९. १२४. [पगे२-035+ २८]
also तृषा--implications of, with regard to life and death; <F>1:  Br. III. ६८. १०१; IV. 3. ४२, ५९.</F> annihilation of, leads to मोक्ष; <F>2:  Ib. IV. 3. ७१.</F> no end of. <F>3:  Vi. IV. १०. २४.</F>
(I)--a son of Bala and grandson of नारायण. Br. II. ११. 4.
(II)--comes out of the subtle element, स्पर्श (touch) of वायु or wind; its qualities are sound, touch and form. M. 3. २४.
(III)--one of the twenty Sutapa गणस्. वा. १००. १५.
(IV)--of the burning universe in प्रलय; similes used for colour. वा. १००. १६१.
(V)--swallows the waters--all mouthed; its qua- lity is प्रकाशक or light which वायु eats up; vanishes like the flame in the wind. वा. १०२. १०-12.
--the son of Sumati and father of Indradyumna. Br. II. १४. ६४; Vi. II. 1. ३६.
--a son of Kuthuma. वा. ६१. ३८.
--a Sutapa God. Br. IV. 1. १४.
(II)--the name of the Agni सभा on the second inner slope of Meru, throwing effulgence on all sides; there live sages and seers bowing down to Agni. वा. ३४. ७८-85.
--a vow incumbent on kings; to behave like the different लोकपालस्. M. २२६. 9.
--a son of Sumati. वा. ३३. ५४.
--the fourth creation of the Arvaksrota. वा. 6. ५६.
--a son of कपोतरोमा and father of Nala, known as Nandanodara dundubhi. M. ४४. ६२.
--a southern tribe. M. ११४. ४९.

--Yajus-शाख; when याज्ञवल्क्य vomitted the Yajus due to a misunderstanding with his Guru, the other sages who were pupils of वैशम्पायन became transformed into तित्तिरा birds and received those portions of the Yajur- veda. Hence the name तैत्तिरीय. भा. XII. 6. ६४-5; Br. II. ३५. ७५; Vi. III. 5. १३; वा. ६१. ६६.
--an आत्रेय gotrakara. M. १९७. 4.
--धूम्र Para1s4ara. M. २०१. ३८.
--a Chandas in which बाणासुर prayed to शिव who blessed him with immortality. M. १८८. ६६ and ७२.
--an eastern hill tribe; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ५१; M. १२१. ५८; वा. ४५. १२०; ४७. ५६.</F> an eastern kingdom; <F>2:  Br. II. १६. ६८.</F> country of the, watered by the नलिनी. <F>3:  Ib. II. १८. ५९.</F>
(I)--a R. from the Vindhyas. Br. II. १६. ३३; M. ११४. २८; वा. ४५. १०३.
(II)--a R. of the शाल्मलम्. वा. ४९. ४२.
--see तारा. Br. IV. ३५. १२.
--a people on the other side of the Vindhyas. वा. ४५. १३३.
--a Malla friend consulted by Kamsa. He had his seat allocated in the arena; was killed by कृष्ण. भा. X. ३६. २१; ४२. ३७; ४४. २७; Vi. V. २०. ७९-80.
--a Vindhyan tribe. Br. II. १६. ६४. [पगे२-038+ ३८]
--a son of दक्षिणा and a तुषित God. भा. IV. 1. 7-8.
--an आर्षेय pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. 6.

--is to look on the useful and the useless equally; renunciation from affection, desire and difficulty; giving up of all Karmas and having an equal eye on good and evil; <F>1:  वा. ५९. ५३.</F> result of ज्ञान or knowledge; gives the result of Karma, but difficult to achieve; <F>2:  Br. IV. 3. ४५.</F> leads to वैराग्य. <F>3:  वा. १०२. ६६.</F>
--a son of भृगु. M. १९५. १३.
--group of three: वर्ण loka, etc. वा. ९७. ३३.

(I)--शिव; <F>1:  Br. II. २७. ६९; Vi. I. १५. १२२.</F> his riding animal वृषभ, <F>2:  Br. III. ७२. ८२; ७४. ५१.</F> followed by the नैऋऋत clan of राक्षसस्; <F>3:  Ib. III. 7. १४१.</F> one of the eleven Rudras; the eighth of twelve incarnations who slew Asuras in the battle of Andhaka; <F>4:  M. 5. २९; ४७. ५०; १९१. १२०.</F> sacrifice to, by पुरोडाश made in कपालस्; गायत्री, त्रिष्टुब् and Jagati are present as three means of the पुरोडाश; <F>5:  वा. ३१. ४६-8; ४०. २०.</F> with ten arms in शिवपुर; his weapons are पट्टिश, bow, trident, and sword; Gandharva leaders entertain him with music; the bull is there, and Skanda and others form the सभा; sculptures of Dig Devas in the columns of the palace. <F>6:  Ib. १०१. २५५. २९२, ३२३.</F> Ambakas are the yonis of Vanaspati, king of trees; <F>7:  Br. II. 9. 4.</F> curse of दक्ष to be born as प्राचेतस् in the चाक्षुष Manu epoch. <F>8:  Ib. II. १३. ४१, १४४.</F> [पगे२-039+ ३५]
(II)--Kubera whose followers were of the राक्षस gan2a नैऋऋत, many branches of which गण were worshippers of शन्कर; <F>1:  वा. ६९. १७३.</F> killed all in Tripura. <F>2:  वा. ९७. ८२; ९९. ५१.</F>
--the vow that leads to the world of शिव. M. १०१. ६७.
--a son of Vipracitti. Vi. I. २१. ११.
(I)--a daughter of सविता. भा. VI. १८. 1.

(II)--A विद्या; <F>1:  वा. ४९. ११८; ५९. ३६; ६१. १६७; ६७. २७; Vi. V. १०. २७.</F> symbolical of देवी; <F>2:  Vi. I. 9. १२१.</F> said to be the body of Hari; <F>3:  Ib. II. ११. ११; III. १८. १५.</F> forbidden to women, शूद्रस् and fallen Brahmanas; <F>4:  भा. I. 4. २५.</F> issued from ब्रह्मा; <F>5:  Ib. III. १२. ४४.</F> one Veda became three for पुरूरवस् at the commencement of the त्रेतायुग; <F>6:  Ib. IX. १४. ४८-49.</F> unknown to पुष्करद्वीप. <F>7:  Br. II. १९. १२२; ३२. ४०; ३५. १९५; III. 4. २४; Vi. II. 4. ८३.</F>
--the son of भानु, and father of Karan- dama. Vi. IV. १६. 3.
--a son of Uruksava and वीशाला; became a Brahmana. M. ४९. ३९.
--as a शक्ति resident in शोदसपत्राब्ज. Br. IV. ३२. १५. [पगे२-040+ २८]

--by the agitation of the गुणस् or qualities three gods with body came into being; the Rajas is ब्रह्मा, Tamas Agni and Satva, विष्णु; the first had the duty of creation, the second काल and the third उदासीन; these are three worlds, three Vedas and three fires, one dependent on the other; by their joint action the world progresses; (Advaita): three functions of प्रजापति as creator, destroyer and protector. वा. 5. १४-16 and ३०-31.
(I)--a son of दुरितक्षय (दुरितक्षय- वि। प्।) and a पौराणिक. भा. IX. २१. १९; XII. 7. 5; Vi. IV. १९. २५.
(II)--the Veda व्यास of the fifteenth द्वापर. <F>1:  Br. II. ३५. १२०; Vi. III. 3. १५.</F> Heard the पुराण from अन्तरिक्ष and narrated it to Dhanamjaya. <F>2:  Br. IV. 4. ६२.</F>
(III)--the son of त्रिधन्वा and father of Satyavrata. Br. III. ६३. ७६; M. १२. ३७; Vi. IV. 3. २०-1.
(IV)--a son of विशाला. वा. ९९. १६३.
--the son of अनरण्य. वा. ८८. ७६.
--the son of Purukutsa. वा. ८८. ७४.
(II)--(Trasadas-वा। प्।, ब्र्। प्।) son of नर्मदा and Purukutsa, and father of अनरण्य. भा. IX. 7. 4; Br. III. १०. ९८; वा. ७३. ४९; ८८. ७४; Vi. IV. 3. १६-17.
(III)--a मन्त्रकृत् and of the Angirasa branch. Br. II. ३२. १०८; वा. ५९. ९९.

(I)--an atom; <F>1:  भा. III. ११. 5.</F> the visible speck floating in the sun, seen as the sun shines through a window: a measure- ment. <F>2:  M. २५८. १७.</F> Padmarajas; <F>3:  वा. १०१. ११९.</F> eight times the परमाणु. <F>4:  Br. III. १०. ५९; IV. 2. ११९.</F>
--a son of Ranti and a great charioteer. वा. ९९. १२९.
--राक्षसस् fearful to children. वा. ६९. १९१.
--the son of शुचि; also known as Dharma- सारथि. Father of शान्तरय. भा. IX. १७. ११-12.

--a Mt. near Kakudman the collyrium of which is fit for पितृस् and श्राद्ध; in it are a burning pit जात वेदस्शिला as also a तीर्थ, where the seven seers had bathed and a temple with a Nandi invisible to the unrighteous; besides golden यूपस्. Br. III. ११. ६७; १३. ५८; M. १२१. १५; वा. ४७. १३; ७७. ५७-64. [पगे२-042+ २६]
--(त्रिकर्णक ?) a commander of भण्ड to aid विषङ्ग; <F>1:  Br. IV. २५. २९.</F> was killed by ज्वाला ma1linika1. <F>2:  Ib. IV. २५. ९८.</F>
--a name of शिव. वा. ३०. २१७.
--the whole universe is said to be pervaded by the three daughters of हिमवान्, अपर्णा, Eka- पर्णा and एकपाटला, all eternal youths and ब्रह्मवादिनीस्. Br. III. १०. १४; वा. ७२. १३-5.

(I)--a mountain on the base of the Meru, in भारतवर्ष; <F>1:  भा. V. १६. २६; १९. १६.</F> surrounded by क्षीरोद, and १०००० yojanas high with three shining crests of silver, iron and gold; served by Siddhas, चारणस् and others. In its valley was ऋतुमत्, the pleasure garden of goddesses, full of varied trees. <F>2:  Ib. VIII. 2. 1-१९.</F>
(II)--Here is लन्का in मलयद्वीप. वा. ४८. २६.
--one of the ten पीठस् for images, in the shape of a trident. M. २६२. 7, १२, १८.
--see Trigartas (s.v.) [पगे२-043+ २७]

--their king was सुशर्म (s.v.). He was not able to vanquish Arjuna, supported by कृष्ण. He was stationed by जरासन्ध at the Northern gate of मथुरा, as also during the siege of Gomanta. <F>1:  भा. I. १५. १६; X. ५०. ११ [7]; ५२. ११. [१४]; [५० (V) 3].</F> A hill tribe; <F>2:  Br. II. १६. ६८; १८. ५३.</F> a hilly country. <F>3:  वा. ४५. १३६; M. ११४. ५६.</F>
--a mountain kingdom of Trigartas visited by बलराम. भा. X. ७९. १९.
--a son of सुतीर्थ. वा. ९९. २७४.
--a Mind-born mother. M. १७९. १७.
(त्रिणाचिकेत-वा। प्।) the Brahmanas of the Yajur Veda, fit for श्राद्ध feeding. Vi. III. १५. 2; वा 79. ५८; ८३. ५३.
--a तीर्थ visited by बलराम. भा. X. ७८. १९.
(I)--a sage who called on the dying भीष्म; was invited for the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर; came to Syamanta- पञ्चक to see कृष्ण. भा. I. 9. 7; X. ७४. 7; ८४. 5.
(II)--a son of चाक्षुष Manu. A place sacred to him on the सरस्वती; a मन्त्रकृत्. भा. IV. १३. १६; III. 1. २२; M. १४५. १०१. [पगे२-044+ २६]

--a class of ascetics. In that guise Arjuna spent four months in द्वारक to marry सुभद्रा; <F>1:  भा. X. ८६. 3; Br. III. ११. 5-१२; १५. ६४.</F> wearing शिखा; specially fit for श्राद्ध; <F>2:  वा. ७९. ९०.</F> with three दण्डस् (res- traints) of वाक्, Karma and Manas. <F>3:  Ib. १७. 6.</F>
--a तीर्थम् on the नर्मदा. M. १९४. ११.
(I)--a R. from the हिमालयस्. Br. II. १६. २६.
(II)--a R. from the ऋक्ष. Br. II. १६. ३१.
(III)--a R. in the प्लक्षद्वीप. Br. II. १९. १९; Vi. II. 4. ११.
(IV)--(शिवेतिका) a R. of the भारतवर्ष rising from the Mahendra mountain. वा. ४५. १०१, १०६.
(V)--a R. of the शाकद्वीपम्. वा. ४९. ९३.
--a R. from the Mahendra mountain. M. ११४. ३१.
--a R. from the Mahendra mountain. Br. II. १६. ३७.
(I)--a son of सम्भूति. M. १२. ३६.
(II)--the son of Vasumata, a righteous king. वा. ८८. ७७.
(III)--the son of सुमना and father of त्रय्यारुणि. Vi. IV. 3. २०.
(IV)--a son of Sumati. Br. III. ६३. ७६.

--the name of व्यास in the tenth द्वापर; भृगु, the अवतर् of the Lord; <F>1:  Br. II. ३५. ११९; वा. २३. १४७; Vi. III. 3. १३.</F> heard the ब्र्। and वायु पुराणस् from सारस्वत and narrated the former to शरद्- वान्. <F>2:  Br. IV. 4. ६१; वा. १०३. ६१.</F>
--a son of खश, and a राक्षस. Br. III. 7. १३५.
(II)--the son of निर्वृति; ruled for २८ years. M. २७१. २७.
--the name of a horse of the Moon's chariot. M. १२६. ५२. [पगे२-046+ ३८]

--गन्गा (s.v.) descended at the Gaura hill; <F>1:  Br. II. १८. २७, २९, ३०.</F> fell on शिव's head; <F>2:  Ib. III. १३. ११८; २५. ११.</F> originating from the foot of Soma; <F>3:  M. १०२. 8; १०६. ५१; १२१. २८-9; १८३. 7.</F> came to be divided into seven streams; flows in अन्तरिक्ष, Divam and भूमि; शिव prevented her course by yoga, when she grew angry and on account of which drops of water fell on the ground and collected themselves into a lake, Bindusaras; she resisted this and wanted to enter the पाताल when ब्रह्मा consoled her and let her flow in seven directions, three to the east, three to the west and the seventh to the south; the last one is भा- गीरथी. <F>4:  वा. ४७. २६-41.</F> Stopped in the sky above मानस. <F>5:  Ib. ७७. १११.</F>
--a mark on the forehead. Br. IV. ३८. २२.

(I)--a city built by माया, of gold, silver and iron fortifications for the sake of Asuras. <F>1:  भा. IV. १७. १३; V. २४. २८; VII. १०. ५४ and ६८. VIII. 6. ३१; XI. १६. २०; Br. III. ७२. ८२. वा. ९७. ८२.</F> Really three towns under तारक, Maya and विद्युन्मालि; city described. Battle of Tripuram; march of शिव's army. First battle at तारकाख्यपुरम्; non-combatants visiting it; fight be- tween Nandi and विद्युन्मालि; तारक's fight with the गणस्; actual battle on the shores of the western sea, described; battle in the air and under water; तारक slain by Nandi, as also विद्युन्मालि; burning the city including women and children by शिव. <F>2:  M. Chh. १२९-130; Chh. १३५-140; १८७. 8, १४-6; १८८. 9-१०.</F>
(II)--an Asura having his city in the third Talam. Br. II. २०. २७; III. ३८. 4.
--the second charioteer of ललिता. Br. IV. २०. ९१. [पगे२-047+ २८]
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ४३.
--a name of ललिता; worship of. Br. IV. 5. ३१.
--(Tripuradhvamsa): see शिव. Br. III. २३. ३२; २५. १३.
--a mother Goddess, see ललिता. Br. IV. 7. ७२; ११. 1.
--an epithet of Rudra; शिव with १६ hands danced in joy at the ruin of the city, Tripuram (s.v.). M. १७९. ३८; २५९. ११.
--a Guptayogini. Br. IV. ३६. ७२.

--deals with the construction of Tri- pura by Maya; trouble to the world by the Asuras; Gods wait on Rudra; the war chariot of शिव; नारद's mediation; Maya gets ready for war; the war; the efforts of गणस्, especially Nandi's part in the battle; death of तारक; the second day of the battle; शिव's victory by burning the city. M. Chh. १२९-141.

(I)--near the दृषद्वती; <F>1:  Br. III. १३. ६९.</F> like श्यामक and इक्षु being created by Gods; <F>2:  Ib. १४. 8.</F> to be propitiated at the Parva and at the Tithis. <F>3:  Ib. १७. 6.</F> [पगे२-048+ २४]
--the son of अरुण and father of Satya- vrata. भा. IX. 7. 4-5.
--a R. from the Mahendra hills. M. ११४. ३१.
--the son of भानुमत्, and father of Karam- dhama. भा. IX. २३. १७.
--the Brahmanas of the साम Veda fit for feeding on the श्राद्ध occasions. Vi. III. १५. 2.
--a horse of the Moon's chariot. वा. ५२. ५३.
--is Om; प्रणव constituted by वैद्युती, तामसी and निर्गुणि Ma1tras. वा. २०. 1.
--a Pravara. M. १९६. ३०.
--(नियामिका) night, so called. Br. II. 8. 6, २३.
--progress of, depends on the sun without which there would be no reckoning of time and nothing would go on. वा. ५०. ६०; ५३. ३४-41. [पगे२-049+ ३७]
(I)--शिव known in Trayambaka क्षेत्र; meditation of. M. २२. ४७; १३१. ३५; २६६. ३६; Vi. V. ३३. 1.
(II)--a name of विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ६७.

--a hunchback maid who supplied unguents to Kamsa. For the mere asking she gave them away to कृष्ण and his brother. Pleased at this, कृष्ण converted her into a beautiful maid. She requested him to go to her house and honour her with his company. He promised to do so after his other engagements were over. <F>1:  भा. X. ४२. 1-१२.</F> Visited by कृष्ण with Uddhava. Her house was found filled with pictures drawn according to the कामशास्त्र. After spend- ing some time there, कृष्ण left. <F>2:  Ib. X. ४८. 1-१०.</F> Her son was विशोक. <F>3:  Ib. X. ९०. ३४[1].</F> Came to see कृष्ण and सत्यभामा returning from Indra's abode. <F>4:  Ib. X. [६७ (V) ५०].</F>
--(Cyavana?) son of अन्तिनार. M. ४९. 8.

--three ends of human endeavour, Dharma, Artha and काम; was taught to प्रह्लाद by his tutors. This did not appeal to him. It should be a means to realise Hari, according to प्रह्लाद. <F>1:  भा. VII. 5. ५२-53; 6. २६.</F> Even the householder, it is said, should not exert himself too much for Trivarga. But it is generally observed by householders. <F>2:  Ib. VII. १४. १०; VIII. १६. ११. Vi. III. ११. 6.</F> A भिक्षु is expected to discard it. <F>3:  भा. VII. १५. ३६; Br. III. ५०. ५२; ५१. १५.</F> To one devoid of Dharma, the other two, काम and Artha, are of one use. <F>4:  M. २९. 3; ५३. 4, ४५; २१२. 3-9.</F> [पगे२-050+ २९]
--the eleventh Veda-व्यास. Br. II. ३५. ११९.
--a group of mountains round मेरुमूल. वा. ३५. 7.

--an अवतार् of विष्णु who conquered the three worlds with three steps; the lustrous God with sword as weapon; <F>1:  Br. III. 3. ११८; IV. ३४. ७९; M. १७६. ५९; Vi. V. 5. १७.</F> महात्म्यम् of; in the वामन पुराण; icon of; <F>2:  M. ५३. ४५; २६०. ३६.</F> Brahma-पुरुषोत्तम. <F>3:  वा. १०८. ३८.</F>
--heard the ब्रह्माण्ड and वायु पुरणस् from शरद्वान् (शरद्वत) and narrated the former to अन्तरिक्ष. Br. IV. 4. ६१; वा. १०३. ६१.
--a साम; <F>1:  वा. 9. ४८.</F> created from ब्रह्मा's face. <F>2:  Br. II. 8. ५०.</F>
--from the first face of ब्रह्मा. Vi. I. 5. ५३.

--Satyavrata (s.v): the son of Tribandhana and father of हरिश्चन्द्र; became a चण्डाल by the curse of his Guru; three spikes meant for him by वसिष्ठ. Result of his three sins--displeasing his father, killing the Guru's cow and eating unconsecrated flesh; banished from the kingdom; seeing this विश्वामित्र consoled him and agreed to be his Guru; the latter had him crowned after a purifica- tion bath in the river, कर्मनाशा near the Vindhyas; this enabled him to go to heaven bodily and get a place among [पगे२-051+ ३१] the planets all in the presence of वसिष्ठ; though thrust down headlong from heaven, he was stopped and given a place in the sky. भा. IX. 7. 5-7; Br. III. ६३. १०८; वा. ८८. १०८-13. Vi. IV. 3. २१.
--the planet त्रिशङ्कु or Satyavrata in the moon's sphere, Cf. रामा. Yud., IV. ९०. वा. ८८. ११५-6.
--the territory north of the महा- नदी and south of वैकट (कैकट-वा। प्।) unfit for श्राद्ध. Br. III. १४. ३१-2; M. १६. १६; वा. ७८. २१. 2.
--also known as धान्यकम्. M. २५३. ५१; २५४. 4-7.
(I)--was Indra of the तामस epoch. भा. VIII. 1. २८.
(II)--the Veda-व्यास of the eleventh द्वापर, see त्रिवर्ष. Vi. III. 3. १४.
--a Mt. sacred to शिव. M. १८३. 2.

(I)--a son of त्वष्ट and यशोधरा; <F>1:  Br. III. 1. ८६; वा. ६५. ८५.</F> his mother was a sister of Virocana; <F>2:  वा. ८४. १९.</F> a राक्षस killed by राम. <F>3:  भा. IX. १०. 9; वा. ६९. १६७.</F> His city was in the third Talam. <F>4:  Br. II. २०. २६; वा. ५०. २६.</F> [पगे२-052+ ३०]
(II)--a son of खश and a राक्षस. Br. III. 7. १३५.
(III)--a son of विश्रवस् and वाका. Br. III. 8. ५६; वा. ७०. ५०.
(IV)--a son of प्रह्रादि and त्वष्टा ?. Br. III. ५९. १९-20.

--the trident of शिव; <F>1:  Br. III. ३२. १४; IV. १९. 6, ८५; २०. ८१; वा. १०१. २७१.</F> made from the वैष्- णव तेजस् of the sun filed off by त्वष्ट. <F>2:  M. 5. ३१; ११. २९; २१७. ३१ Vi. III. 2. ११.</F>
--a Mt. on the north of Meru; <F>1:  भा. V. १६. २७; M. १६३. ८६; Vi. II. 2. ४४.</F> west of the शितोद. <F>2:  वा. ३६. २९; ४२. ७२.</F>
--one who performs the three ablutions, at dawn, noon and sunset; fit for performing श्राद्ध. वा. ७४. १२.

--a poetic metre; <F>1:  भा. III. १२. ४५; XI. २१. ४१; M. १२५. ४७.</F> a Chandas serving as a horse in the Sun's chariot, <F>2:  Br. II. २२. ७२; वा. ५१. ६४; Vi. II. 8. 5.</F> with गायत्रि and Jagati forms the Tri- वर्णम् or प्रणव. <F>3:  Br. II. १३. १४५; वा. ३१. ४७.</F>
(I)--The goddess enshrined at गोदाश्रम. M. १३. ३७.
(II)--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ४६. [पगे२-053+ ३१]
--the son of गोभानु, and father of Karan- dhama. Br. III. ७४. 1; वा. ९९. 1.
--a R. in भारतवर्ष, from the Mahendra hill. भा. V. १९. १८; Br. II. १६. ३७; वा. ४५. १०६; Vi. II. 3. १३.
--a son of गोभानु. M. ४८. 1.
--the Brahmanas versed in सुपर्ण sec- tions; <F>1:  वा. ८३. ५३.</F> eligible for पार्वण S4ra1ddha. <F>2:  M. १६. 7; Vi. III. १५. 2.</F>
--of the lord--Divya, आन्तरिक्ष and Bhauma. वा. २३. १०४, १०७.
--a शक्ति resident of षोडशपत्राब्ज. Br. IV. ३२. १४.

--at the commencement of this Yuga, ब्रह्मा established the social polity of castes and orders; long life, learning, strength, beauty, health and righteousness were common; in course of time मोह made men irreligious and prejudiced; they appealed to Manu who created two sons, Priyavrata and उत्तानपाद through शतरूपा; they were the first kings of the earth; here was the division of the शम्हिता, Mantra, ऋषि and ब्राह्मण; the धर्म meant truth, जप, तपस् and दानम्; the kings were Cakravartins; <F>1:  वा. ३२. ५७-8; ५७. २५, ५४-60; ७८. ३६.</F> the धर्म of; <F>2:  Ib. ५७. ८१-125.</F> see त्रेतायुग.
--the beginning of the त्रेतायुग, before which, were one Veda, one God, one caste, and one fire. These were multiplied afterwards. भा. IX. १४. ४८-49. [पगे२-054+ ३२]

--Forms of Hari worshipped in the Yuga. <F>1:  भा. V. १७. १२; IX. १०. ५२; १४. ४३; XI. 5. २४-6.</F> Hari in the form of यज्ञ revealed the Vedas; <F>2:  भा. XI. १७. १२.</F> characteris- tics of the Yuga; <F>3:  Br. II 7. २१, ५९; भा. XII. 2. ३९; 3. २०-21, २८ and ५२. वा. 8. ६५-96; ९९. ४३९-444.</F> Duration of; श्रौत and स्मार्त dharmas begin to be observed: duties of kings in; <F>4:  M. १४२. १७, २३-5, ४०-77; १६५. 6.</F> origin of culture in; <F>5:  वा. 8. १४६-178.</F> see त्रेता.
--the seventh of the twelve incarnations of विष्णु. M. ४७. ४४. वा. ९७. ७५.
--a tribe on the other side of the Vindhyas. Br. II. १६. ६४. M. ११४. ५३. वा. ४५. १३३.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ४७.
--the story of शिव. Br. IV. 2. २६०.
--the son of Tridhanva and father of Satyavrata; <F>1:  वा. ८८. ७७.</F> heard the वायु पुराण from वर्ष. <F>2:  Ib. १०३. ६२.</F>
--a kingdom, under the Kanakas; (Cal. Edn. स्त्रिराज्य--Wilson's suggested identification with Malabar). Vi. IV. २४. ६७.
--Jana, Tapa and Satya lokas; durable worlds. Vi. II. 7. १९. [पगे२-055+ ३०]
--a goddess created by नृसिम्ह; a fol- lower of वागीश. M. १७९. ६७.
--a Kavaca given to परशुराम by शिव by the practice of which मन्त्र in honour of कृष्ण, he would get the fruits of राजसूय and वाजपेय and become a Cakravartin. Br. III. ३२. ५६; ३३ (whole); ४४. २१.
--a वर्ण S4akti. Br. IV. ४४. ५८.
--a metre; <F>1:  वा. 9. ४९.</F> from the second (southern face-वि। प्।) face of ब्रह्मा. <F>2:  Br. II. 8. ५१; Vi. I. 5. ५४.</F>
--an Asura. भा. VII. 2. 4.
--an अक्षरादेवी, killed पुण्ड्रकेतु, a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. १९. ५८; २५. ९७; ३७. ३४.
--a son of Bhauma. M. ५०. ३६.

--a son of Aditi, and an आदित्य. <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ३९; III. 6. १५; M. 6. 4; १७१. ५६; वा. ६६. ६६; Vi. I. १५. १३०.</F> Presented पृथु with a good chariot. <F>2:  भा. IV. १५. १७.</F> His wife was रचना, [पगे२-056+ ४९] and sons were Sannivasa and विश्वरूप (s.v.); <F>3: Ib. VI. 6. ४४.</F> when the latter was lost, he offered a sacrifice to destroy Indra. From the fire rose a dreadful figure known as वृत्र. The Gods were frightened and prayed to Hari. The lord revealed Him- self and asked them to meet the sage दध्यञ्ज with whose support वृत्र could be vanquished. दध्यञ्ज initiated them into नारायणवर्म; <F>4: Ib. VI. 9. (whole).</F> was propitiated by An- giras for blessing चित्राक्ष with a son. <F>5: Ib. VI. १४. २७.</F> His con- templation. <F>6: Ib. XI. १५. २०.</F> The name of the Sun in the month of इष (आश्विन). <F>7:  Ib. XII. ११. ४३. वा. ५२. २०; Vi. II. 1. ४०; १०. १६.</F> (माघ and फाल्गुन) (वा। प्। and वि। प्।) Fought with शम्बर in the देवासुर war. <F>8: Ib. XI. १२. 5; VIII. १०. २९.</F> Out of the तेजस् came विष्णु's cakra, Indra's vajra, and Rudra's शूलम्; all limbs except the feet of Vivasvan were operated upon, and hence feet अमन्गल and not to be worshipped; pre- sented कुमार with a hen that could assume any form at will. <F>9: M. ११. 3. २२-32; १५९. १०.</F>

(I)--one of the four sons of शुक्र; <F>1:  Br. III. 1. ७८, ८६; वा. ६५. ७७, ८५; Vi. I. १५. १२१.</F> married यशोधरा--वैरोचिनी, daughter of Virocana; father of त्रिशिर, विश्वरूप and विश्वकर्म; <F>2:  Br. III. १४. 6; ५९. १७.</F> प्रह्रादी, another wife; सम्ज्ञा, a daughter of his, was given in marriage to the Sun God; <F>3:  Ib. II. २४. ३४, ३९.</F> an आदित्य in the month of कार्त्तिक having ८००० rays; <F>4:  Ib. II. २३. २०.</F> with the शिशिर Sun; <F>4:  Ib. II. २३. २०.</F> reduced the Sun's तेजस्; <F>5:  Ib. III. ५९. ४४ and ६५.</F> made विष्णु's discus; <F>6:  Ib. III. ५९. ७१, ८२.</F> fell down on the earth for having drunk the Soma of शचिपति. <F>7:  वा. ७८. 6; ९४. ५६.</F>
(II)--a son of Manasyu. Vi. II. 1. ४०.
(III)--the son of Bhauvana and दूषणा. His queen was विरोचना, and their son विरजा. भा. V. १५. १५. Br. II. १४. ७०. वा. ३३. ५९. [पगे२-057+ २१]
(IV)--a name of वृत्र. भा. III. १९. २५. M. १७३. १८.
(I)--an architect of Gods; he built द्वारवति for कृष्ण. भा. X. ६९. 7.
(II)--a division of the night. Br. III. 3. ४३. वा. ६६. ४४.
--a wife of Kali. वा. ८४. 9.
--a daughter of मरीचि and सम्भूति. Br. II. ११. १२. वा. २८. 9.
--the mother of Budha, a planet. Br. II. २४. ८८-90.
--the son of Dharma; <F>1:  वा. ५३. ८०.</F> born of कृत्तिकस् in the चाक्षुष epoch; <F>2:  Ib. ५३. १०५.</F> of five rays. <F>3:  Ib. ५३. ८५.</F>
--a commander of भण्ड to aid विषन्ग; killed by शिवदूति. Br. IV. २५. २८, ९६. [पगे२-058+ ४७]

(I)--a Mind-born son of ब्रह्मा, born of his thumb, and father of मूर्ति. A progenitor and guardian of the world, born for the creation of worldly beings. <F>1:  भा. III. १२. २२-3; Ib. II. 6. ४२; 7. 6; Br. II. ३२. ९६; ३६. ८४; Ib. III. 3. ३०; ६५. २१; Ib. IV. 2. ३३, ४७; M. 3. 9; 8. 4; १५४. ३५३; १७१. २७, ४९; वा. २५. 2, ८२, ९०; Vi. I. २२. 4; IV. 1. 6.</F> Married प्रसूती, daughter of स्वायम्भुव Manu. Had sixteen daughters of whom he gave thirteen to Dharma, one to Agni, one to पितृस्, and one to शिव. <F>2:  भा. III. १२. ५६; Ib. IV. 1. ११, ४७-9; Vi. I. 7. १९-27; Br. I. 1. ५६-64; Ib. II. ३७. ३८-50;.</F> To the Satra of विश्वसृक् Daks2a came and was welcomed by all standing, except ब्रह्मा and शिव. On this दक्ष burst into anger against शिव and insulted him saying he had eyes like a monkey, was a breaker of law and convention, lord of the भूतस् and गणस्; he then cursed that शिव should have no more share in sacri- fices and went away. Nandi got enraged at this and im- precated a curse on दक्ष that he would lose all knowledge of आत्मन्, and assuming the face of a sheep, would become dull-witted. भृगु then pronounced a counter-curse that those propitiating शिव shall become पाखण्डस्. <F>3:  भा. IV. 2 (whole). M. १३. ११-55, ६०; १८३. २२-3.</F> Appointed by ब्रह्मा as the overlord of all प्रजापतिस्, दक्ष began the sacrifice of बृहस्पतिसव to which all gods went in groups. सती also expressed her desire to go and requested permission of शिव, who reminded her of the insult offered to him. <F>4:  Ib. IV. 3. (whole).</F> As she was persistent, she was allowed to attend. Going, she found that she was not properly welcomed by her father. The enraged सती sat facing the northern direction in yoga and cast off her body by means of the fire of समाधी to the distress of gods and others. On this the गण followers of सती attacked दक्ष, when भृगु created a class of gods, ऋभुस् who vanquished these गणस्. <F>5:  Ib. IV. 4 (whole).</F> Having heard of all this from नारद, शिव grew angry; out of his anger sprang वीरभद्र who was ordered to ruin दक्ष's sacrifice. The beard of भृगु was cut off, and दक्ष's head was severed from his body and thrown into the दक्षिणाग्नि. <F>6:  Ib. IV. 5 (whole). वा. ३० (whole).</F> The Gods waited upon ब्रह्मा who proceeded to कैलास. He conciliat- ed शिव and pleaded for the revival of दक्ष and continuation of his यज्ञ promising a share to him. <F>7:  भा. IV. 6 (whole).</F> शिव agreed but [पगे२-059+ ४३] said that दक्ष should have the face of the sheep, Bhaga, Mitra's eye, and भृगु the beard of a sheep. Agreeing to this ब्रह्मा went with शिव to the sacrificial hall of दक्ष. Now दक्ष began to praise शिव. When विष्णु's offering was poured to secure the continuation of the sacrifice, विष्णु presented himself in person when दक्ष, ऋत्विक्स्, Sadasyas, Rudra and others present, spoke in his praise. Pleased at this, Hari remarked there was no difference among the त्रिमुर्तीस्. दक्ष brought the यज्ञ to a successful end. <F>8:  Ib. IV. 7 (whole); २९. ४२.</F>

son of वर्क्षी (मारिषा-वि। प्।) and Pracetas (प्रा- चेतसष्-वि। प्।); a प्रजापति. He first created the Devas, Asuras, men and others inhabiting the sky, earth and water. Finding the creation incomplete, he went to the Vindhyas for तपस् by bathing in the Agha- मर्षण and propitiating Hari with the hymn of हम्सगुह्य। To him the Lord appeared and urged him to marry असिक्नी, daughter of पञ्चजन and thus increase the created beings. <F>9:  Ib. VI. 4 (whole); Vi. I. १५. १०, ८०-1.</F> Of असिक्नी he begot १०,000 sons called हर्यश्वस्. The latter proceeded to the western direction to the sacred lake नारायणसरस् at the estuary of the Indus. Purified by the bath and instructed by नारद on the bondage of सम्सार, these took to the path of ‘not returning’ (अन्वर्तन)। दक्ष lamented and begot by the same wife a thousand sons, शबलाश्वस्. These again followed the path trodden by their elder brothers, advised by नारद. The enraged दक्ष cursed that नारद, the corrupter of youth, was ever to be a wanderer and to have no settled home. The sage submitted to it without retaliating. <F>१०:  भा. VI. 5 (whole); Vi. I. १५. ८२-104.</F> Con- soled by ब्रह्मा, दक्ष further begot sixty daughters of असिक्नी (वैरिनी-म्। प्।). He bestowed ten on Dharma, twelve on कश्यप, twenty-seven on Soma, two each for भूत, Angiras, and कृशाश्व, and the remaining five, of whom only four seem to be named (in v. २१) on तार्क्ष्या. <F>११:  भा. VI. 6 whole; Ib. V. 5. २२; Br. III. 1. 8 and १२; 2. 1-३१; M. १४६. १५-7; भा. III. १४. १२-3; Br. III. 3. 3, 5-५५; 8-5.</F> Elsewhere it is said that thirteen daughters were given in marriage to कश्यप. [पगे२-060+ ३५] Went with ब्रह्मा to meet हिरण्यकशिपु; was present at the anointing of वामन; father of Aditi; <F>१३:  भा. VII. 3. १४; VIII. २३. २०; IX. 4. ५४; 1. १०.</F> cursed Moon god with consumption (यक्ष्म)। <F>१४:  Ib. X. ८८. ३२; XI. 6. ३६.</F> Wondered at मार्कण्डेय's vrata; <F>१५:  Ib. XII 8. १२.</F> had not yet seen the Supreme Being; identified with Hari. <F>१६:  Ib. IV. २९. ४२; XI. १६. १५.</F> Drank of the सौभाग्य from the thigh of Hari and brought forth a daughter सती married by शिव; <F>१७:  M. ६०. 6-7, १०-11; १४५. ९०.</F> a महऋषि; heard the पुराण from ब्रह्मा along with other sages; <F>१८:  Vi. I. 2. 8.</F> son of ब्रह्मा, married ऊर्जा. <F>१९:  Ib. I. 7. 5-7.</F> ^१२) M. २३. १५;

(II)--in previous birth son of ब्रह्मा, now born of मारिषा and Pracetasas. Was made a chief progeni- tor on the eve of the चाक्षुष epoch; <F>1:  भा. IV. ३०. ४९-51; Br. IV. 1. २४, ३९-44.</F> a grandson of Soma; created men with two feet and four feet, of different faces, ears, etc., also म्लेच्छस् and women; also produced १००० sons with पाञ्चजनि, named हर्यश्वस्. नारद asked them to go into the world over but they perished in their sojourn. So he begot another १००० of वैरिणी, and these were शबलस् set by नारद in quest of the whereabouts of their brothers. They also perished. <F>2: M. 4. ४९-55; 5. 2-१४.</F>
(III)--the son of Citrasena, and father of मीढ्वान्. भा. IX. 2. १९. [पगे२-061+ ३२]
(IV)--a son of उशीनर. भा. IX. २३. 3.

(V)--created from प्राण, half तेजस् of Pracetas and half of Soma; created creatures, two-legged and four- legged, in the Vaivasvata epoch; <F>1:  Br. I. 5. ७०; वा. ६३. ३५-48; ६५. १२१-158.</F> Lord of प्रजापतिस्. <F>2:  वा. ७०-5; १०१. ३५, ४९.</F> Got प्राचेतसत्वम् in the epoch of चाक्षुष by the curse of Trayambaka; father-in-law of the seven sages. <F>3:  Br. II. १३. ४०-69.</F>
(VI)--an Asura, and a son of बाष्कल. Br. III. 5. ३८.
(VII)--Heard the पुराण from तृणबिन्दु and narrated it to शक्ति. Br. IV. 4. ६५.
(VIII)--a son of देवातीथि. M. ५०. ३७.
(IX)--a son of भृगु; one of the twelve विश्वे- devas. M. १९५. १३; २०३. १३; वा. ६६. ३१.
(X)--a son of Angirasa; <F>1:  M. १९६. 2; वा. ६५. १०५.</F> through his daughter a son, प्रियाय. <F>2:  वा. १००. २४.</F>
(XI)--a pravara sage. M. १९६. ३०.
(XII)--with the sun in the months of माघ and फाल्गुन. वा. ५२. २३.
(XIII)--a son of Jambha. वा. ६७. ७८. [पगे२-062+ २६]
--given by स्वायम्भुव Manu to Atri. वा. ६२. ७३.
--bathed King Gaya with the waters. भा. V. १५. १०.

--the ninth Manu born of वरुण. <F>1:  भा. VIII. १३. १८.</F> Three groups of twelve gods in each of पार, मारीचिगर्भ and सुधर्मान. Their Indra was Adbhuta. Savana, Dyu- timan and others were seven sages. Father of धृतिकेतु and other sons. <F>2:  Vi. III. 2. २०-24.</F>
--a R. of the केतुमाला. वा. ४४. १९.
--a kingdom through which ऋसभ passed. भा. V. 6. 7.
--a R. of the South. वा. ७७. 8.
--the country to which पुरञ्जन went by the entrance of the पितृस्, allegorically प्रवृत्तिशास्त्र. भा. IV. २५. ५०; २९. १३.
--the southern route to the abode of Yama: the place for burial grounds. Br. II. २७. १२५; ३५. १४७; वा. ६१. १२३.
--(Taijasa bandha in other books). वा. १०२. ५९. [पगे२-063+ २४]
--a तीर्थ; from उत्तरमानस one should go to दक्षिणमानस in silence and thence to उदीची- तीर्थम् where there are three तीर्थस्. वा. १११. 6-8.
--of three streets, अजवीथि and the street of constellations श्रवण, धनिष्ठ and सतभिषक् and the street of वैश्वानरी, भाद्रपद and रेवती. Br. III. 3. ५३.
--generally the southern people. Vi. II. 3. १६.
--as sister and wife of यज्ञ and mother of १२ Ya1ma1 gods. Vi. I. 7. २१.

--a daughter of Ruci and आकूती; consort of सुयज्ञ, an अवतार् of Hari. Had twelve sons who were known as तुषित gods (यामस्) of the period of स्वायम्- bhuva Manu. भा. II. 7. 2; IV. 1. 5-8; Br. II. 9. ४४.
--represents the face of the Veda. वा. १०४. ८५.
--the Malaya hill; residence of Agastya. M. ६१. ४०. [पगे२-064+ ३५]

--a kingdom over which the three sons of Sudyumna ruled; <F>1:  भा. IX. 1. ४१.</F> includes the नर्मदा region; <F>2:  Br. III. १०. ९८; ६३. 9-१०; M. १५. २८; ११४. २९; वा. ४५. १२४.</F> ruled over by about twenty (forty-eight-वि। प्।) of इक्ष्वा- ku's sons. <F>3:  वा. ८८. ११; Vi. IV. 2. १४.</F> गार्ग्य's place of penance. <F>4:  Vi. V. २३. 2.</F>
--The sun moves fast in; <F>1:  वा. ५०. ९२, १३६; ५१. ७३.</F> moves in the midst of पुष्करद्वीप. <F>2:  Br. II. २१. ३५-6. Ib. II. २१. ६७.</F>
--the southern Sun at नैमिष. वा. १०९. २१.
--the Bay of Bengal. M. १२१. ४४.
(I)--one of the elder sons of इक्ष्वाकु. भा. IX. 6. 4. Br. III. ६३. 9; वा. ८८. 9; Vi. IV. 2. १२.

(II)--(see also दण्डनीति): the rod of punish- ment, unknown in शाकद्वीप; <F>1:  Br. II. १९. १०६; वा. ४९. १०३.</F> in पुष्करद्वीप; <F>2:  Br. II. १९. १२०.</F> the duty of a क्षत्रिय; <F>3:  Br. II. 7. १६१ and १६८; III. २८. ५६.</F> one of the उपायस् of a king; to be used if the first three fail; illegal punishments lead the king to hell; to be used according to time and the considered advice of men learned in ancient lore. <F>4:  M. १२२. ४४; १४८. ६६ and ७६; २२२. 2; २२५. 1-१८. २२७. २१७.</F>
(III)--a Bhairava in ललिता's army. Br. IV. १७. 4.
(V)--a son of कुवलाश्व. M. १२. ३२.
(VI)--a son of क्रिया. वा. १०. ३५.
(I)--the forest in the Deccan traversed by राम; <F>1:  भा. IX. ११. १९; Br. III. 5. ३६.</F> and visited by बलराम. <F>2:  भा. X. ७९. २०.</F>
(II)--in the दक्षिणापथ; the southern country; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ५८; वा. ४५. १२६.</F> noted for the sacred विशल्य Ti1rtham; <F>2:  Br. III. १३. १०७.</F> a southern tribe. <F>3:  M. ११४. ४८.</F>
--Manu, the wielder of दण्ड; also kings. वा. ५७. ५८; ८५. 8.
--a commander of ललिता's army. Br. IV. १७. १८; २०. १२; ३६. ३०.
--an attendant of शिव posted in Benares to oust sinners from its precincts. M. १८५. ४७-50, ६६.
--see श्री Dan2d2ana1tha1. Br. IV. १७. १२. [पगे२-066+ ३२]

--the Science of Politics; a विद्या, produced by ब्रह्मा; <F>1:  भा. III. १२. ४४; Br. II. २९. 8-9; ३२. ४०; ३५. १९५: Vi. V. १०. २९.</F> not seen in पुष्करद्वीप; <F>2:  Br. II. १९. १२२; Vi. II. 4. ८३.</F> for the establishment of orderly progress; <F>3:  M. १२३. २४; १४२. ७४; १४५. ३६; २१५. ५४.</F> for the preservation of self-respect and one's own duties; <F>4:  वा. ४९. ११८; ५७. ८२; ५९. २६; ६१. १६४.</F> symbolical of देवी. <F>5:  Vi. I. 9. १२१.</F>
(I)--the son of वहीनर, and father of Nimi (Nimitta-वि। प्।). भा. I. १७. ३५; IX. २२. ४३-44; M. ५०-87; Vi. IV. २१. १५.
(II)--the son of मेधावि. वा. ९९. २७६.

--the code of punishments includ- ing fines, mutilation, penance, death, impalement, etc. M. Ch. २२७ (whole). दण्डम्--the stick of the ascetic to be placed in विष्णु- पाद instead of in the पिण्ड. वा. १०५. २६.
--an आन्ध्र king; father of three sons. वा. ९९. ३५६.
--an आन्ध्र king; son of Vijaya, ruled for 3 years. Br. III. ७४. १६९.
--a R. of the केतुमाल country. वा. ४४. २२.
(I)--a Brahmana mendicant; the guise in which Budha approached इला. M. ११. ५५. [पगे२-067+ ३६]
(II)--a door-keeper to the Sun god. M. २६१. 5.
(III)--a भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. १७.
(IV)--performed तपस् at सिताद्रि in गया. वा. १०८. ५६.
--is श्री Dan2d2ana1tha1. Br. IV. २०. ६८-69.

(I)--the son of the sage Atri and Ana- सूया and an अवतार् of विष्णु according to पौराणिकस्; brother of दुर्वास; by worshipping him, the Yadus, Haiha- yas, etc., got knowledge of yoga. <F>1:  भा. II. 7. 4; IV. I. १५ and ३३; XI. 4. १७; Br. III. 8. ८२; IV. २८. ८९; वा. ७०. ७६-8.</F> He knew Hari yoga, <F>2:  भा. II. 7. ४५.</F> and followed Hari going to पृथु's sacrifice. <F>3:  Ib. IV. १९. 6.</F> A Siddha; <F>4:  Ib. VI. 8. १६; १५. १४.</F> worshipped by Arjuna (Haihaya), to whom he imparted yoga; <F>5:  Ib. IX. १५. १७; २३. २४; Br. III. ३०. ३५; ३४. 4; ३८. १४; ४०. ४३, ५७, ६६; ६९. १०; M. ४३. १५.</F> in the tenth त्रेतायुग the 4th incarnation with मर्कण्डेय as Purohita; <F>6:  Br. III. ७३. ८८; M. ४७. २४२; ९९. १४; वा. ९८. ८९.</F> was worshipped by Arjuna who got four boons from him one of which was १००० hands; <F>7:  वा. ९४. १०-11; Vi. IV. ११. १२.</F> श्यामस्, Mudgalas, गविष्ठिअस् and others belong to this वम्श. <F>8:  Ib. I. १०. 8.</F>
(II)--a sage of the स्वारोचिष epoch. M. 9. 8.
--a son of प्रीता and Pulastya; an Agastya in previous birth. वा. २८. २२; Vi. I. १०. 9.
(I)--a Paulastya and one of the 7 sages of the स्वारोचिष epoch. Br. II. ३६. १८.
(II)--given by Manu to Ahi as son; see उत्तान- पाद. Br. II. ३६. ८५; III. ४७. ६५.
--a Marici God. Br. IV. 1. ५८.
--a ऋत्विक् at ब्रह्मा's यज्ञ। वा. १०६. ३७.
--a sea that surrounds the शाकद्वीप. <F>1:  भा. V. 1. ३३; २०. २४.</F> (क्रौञ्चद्वीप ब्र्। प्।) also Dadhisindhu. <F>2:  Br. II. १९. ७७; IV. ३१. १९; M. १२२. ९२. Vi. II. 4. ५७.</F>
--a काद्रवेय Na1ga. Br. III. 7. ३५; वा. ६९. ७२.
--the son of Bali and king of Anga, born without अपान, due to the blunder of सुदेष्ण; hence अनपान; father of Diviratha (see सुदेष्ण). Br. III. ७४. १०२-3; M. ४८-91; वा. ९९. १००. [पगे२-069+ ३६]
(I)--a ऋषिक, who became a sage by सत्य; <F>1:  Br. II. ३२. १०२.</F> a मन्त्रकृट् <F>2:  M. १४५. ९८.</F> Heard the विष्णु पुराण from Stambhamitra and narrated it to सारस्वत. <F>3:  Vi. VI. 8. ४४.</F>
(II)--urged दक्ष to invite पशुपति to the sacrifice. वा. ३०. १०३-7.

(I)--(also दध्यञ्ज, Dadhyanga) the son of Atharvan and Citti. <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ४२.</F> A sage of much eminence. Taught अश्वाशिरस् मन्त्र to अश्विन्स् and नारायण वर्म to त्वष्ट्रि, who gave it to विश्वरूप. The Lord advised Indra to meet the sage whose bones would serve as best weapons to cut वृत्र's head. When the gods waited on him with this desire, he argued at first that no one would be willing to part with his life. But, he would agree for their sake to sacrifice his life. When he cast off his body, विश्वकर्म made it a Vajra for the use of Indra. <F>2:  Ib. VI. 9. ५१-55; १०. 2-१३; ११. २०.</F> दधीचि's is an example of one, who gave up life in service. <F>3:  Ib. VIII. २०. 7.</F>
(II)--the son of Cyavana भार्गव; married सरस्वती and father of सारस्वत; <F>1:  Br. III. 1. ९३-4; वा. ६५. ९०.</F> Sage by garbha; <F>2:  Ib. ५४. ९४.</F> a मन्त्रकृत्. <F>3:  Ib. ५९. ९६.</F>
(III)--the son of वैराज Manu. वा. २१. ४१; ३०. १०२.
--the son of Atharva Agni. Br. II. १२. १०; वा. २९. 8.
--had five sons; all powerful. वा. ६८. ३०. [पगे२-070+ ३१]
(I)--a son of काश्यप and Diti; appointed Purohita. Br. IV. 9. 3.
(II)--६१ days and nights. वा. ५०. १८६.
(III)--a son of Angirasa. वा. ६५. १०५.
(IV)--known for माया. वा. ६९. ९३.

(V)--one of कश्यप's wives and a daughter of दक्ष. Had द्विमूर्धा and sixty other sons; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. २५; २९-31; वा. ६६. ५५; Vi. I. 5. १२४.</F> मायाशिता; <F>2:  Br. III. 3. ५६; 6. 1-2; 7. ४६६.</F> also mother of १०० sons of whom Vipracitti was the chief; mother of the दानवस्; a mother-goddess. <F>3:  M. 6. 1 and १६; १४६. १८; १७१. २९ and ५८; १७९. १९.</F>

--the great Asuras, १०० in number, chief of them being Vipracitti; all resolute and bold; blessed after long and severe penance; truthful, powerful, cruel, magical; not performers of sacrifice; unbrahmanical; a list of the chief names; some of them took to human धर्म। वा. ६८. 1-१६.
--see Andhaka. Br. III. ७१. ११८.
--a son of उमा and महादेव. वा. ७२. १६.
--cleaning the teeth with sticks of six trees like the अश्वत्थ and the banyan; part of कृष्णाष्टमी vrata. M. ५६. 8. [पगे२-071+ ३५]
--an elephant. वा. ६९. २२१.

(I)--a son of युधिष्ठिर's aunt and brother of Caidya, (s.v.). <F>1:  भा. VII. 1. ३२-46; १०. ३८.</F> Helped जरासन्ध in his siege of मथुरा and Gomanta by guarding the eastern gate of the former, and the western gate of the latter with his brother. <F>2:  Ib. X. ५०. ११ [2]; ५२. ११ [११]. Vi. V. २६. 7.</F> Attended the conference summoned by शाल्व to defeat the Yadus, and got angry at शाल्व's death. <F>3:  भा. X. ७६. 2 [१०]; ७७. ३७.</F> Arrival at कुण्डिन; <F>4:  Ib. X. ५३. १७; ६०. १८.</F> was the king of Kalinga; when he heard that कृष्ण was returning from the यमुना to द्वारका, he waylaid him to discharge the debt he owed to his friends. He struck कृष्ण on the head but was himself hit on his chest; when he fell dead, a spark entered कृष्ण's body and he became one with the Lord. <F>5:  Ib. X. ७८. 1-१३; ३७. १९; II. 7. ३४; III. 3. ११; VII. 1. १७.</F>

(II)--(Dantavakra-वा। प्।)--a son of Diti, and cursed by a sage; was born of श्रुतदेवा; <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. ३७; Br. IV. २९. १२२; वा. ९६. १५५.</F> and वृद्धधर्म, the कारूष king. <F>2:  Br. III. ७१. १५६; Vi. IV. १४. ४०.</F>
--see गणनाथ. Br. IV. २७. ७७.
(I)--one of the २८ hells; the cruel and merciless are tormented here by reptiles and others. भा. V. २६. 7 and ३३.
(II)--the name of a serpant born of क्रोधवशा. भा. VI. 6. २८. [पगे२-072+ २६]
(III)--a follower of वृत्र in his battle with Indra. भा. VI. १०. [२०].
(I)--a son of Marutta, and father of राज्य- vardhana. भा. IX. 2. २९.
(II)--a son of क्रिया. Br. II. 9. ६०.
(III)--a सुधामान God. Br. II. ३६. ३७.
(IV)--a god of the आभूतरय group. Br. II. ३६. ५५.
(V)--a वैकुण्ठ God. Br. II. ३६. ५७.
(VI)--a son of नरिष्यन्त, a दण्डधर and father of विक्रान्त. (राष्त्रवर्धन-ब्र्। प्।; Rajavardhana- वि। प्।). Br. III. ६१. 8; वा. ८६. १२; Vi. IV. 1. ३६.
(VII)--an आर्षेय pravara of भार्गवस्. M. १९५. ३६.
(VIII)--a son of मणिवर. वा. ६९. १६०.
(IX)--a Mukhya गण. वा. १००. १८.

--a king of the Cedis; queen श्रुतश्रवा; <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. ३९. Br. III. ७१. १५९. Vi. IV. १४. ४४.</F> (पटुश्रवा and रुजकन्या) father of शिशुपाल (Caidya: <F>2:  भा. VII. 1. १७. वा. ९६. १५८.</F> s.v.), performed preliminaries to the marriage of his son with रुक्मिणी; when he went to कुण्डिन, he was entertain- ed by her father भीष्मक. <F>3:  भा. X. ५३. १४-16.</F> He was stationed on the south during the siege of Gomanta by जरासन्ध; <F>4:  Ib. X. ५२. ११ [8].</F> went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for the सोलर् eclipse. <F>5:  Ib. X. ८२. २६.</F>
(I)--a son of Vasudeva and रोहिणि. Br. III. ७१. १६५; M. ४६. १२. वा. ९६. १६३.
(II)--a commander to aid विषन्ग, killed by कामेस्वरी. Br. IV. २५. ३०, ४६, ९४.
(III)--a son of Angirasa. M. १९६. 2.
(IV)--the अवतार् of the Lord in the third द्वापर; had four sons, विशोक, विकेश, etc. वा. २३. १२३.
(V)--a ऋत्विक् at ब्रह्मा's sacrifice. वा. १०६. ३६.
--a sage; exclusion of marriage with the Angirasas. M. १९६. २९.
--the Brahmana caste of कुशद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ३८.
(I)--a son of Adharma. भा. IV. 8. 2. [पगे२-074+ २९]
(II)--a son of आयु. M. २४. ३५.
--a R. in कुशद्वीप. Br. II. १९. ६२.
--a daughter of क्रोधवश and a wife of Pulaha; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. १७२; वा. ६९. २०५.</F> gave birth to lions, tigers, elephants, etc. <F>2:  Br. III. 7. ४१२.</F>
--a Mind-born mother. M. १७९. २३.
--a monkey chief. Br. III. 7. २३३.
--a daughter of दक्ष, and a wife of Dharma; mother of Abhaya; <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ४९-50.</F> a शक्ति. <F>2:  Br. IV. ४४. ८९.</F>
(I)--a महारथ; was stationed on the southern gate of मथुरा, and on the western gate of Gomanta by जरासन्ध when he besieged them. भा. X. ५०. ११ [3]; ५२. ११ [१२].
--(Aridyota-ब्र्। प्।)--the son of Dundubhi and father of Punarvasu. भा. IX. २४. २०.
(II)--a son of बलराम. Br. III. ७१. १६७.
--born of Pulaha. Br. III. 7. १७८.
(I)--vanquished by कृष्ण. भा. II. 7. ३४.
(II)--a Mt. of the भारतवर्ष. वा. ४५. ९०.
(I)--born of Dharma and Unnati. भा. IV. 1. ५१.
(II)--a son of लक्ष्मी. Br. II. 9. 8; वा. १०. ३४.
--a looking-glass to be installed by the side of a deity. M. ५७. १८; २६५. १९; २८९. १०.
--a son of आन्गिरस. वा. ६५. १०४.
(I)--a son of अजातशत्रु and father of Ajaya. भा. XII, 1. 6.
(II)--ruled for ३५ years. Br. III. ७४. १३१.
--a R. of the केतुमाल country. वा. ४४. १७. [पगे२-076+ २६]
--a hill tribe; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ६७.</F> a mountain kingdom. <F>2:  M. ११४. ५६; वा. ४५. १३६.</F>
--one of the wives of उशिनर and mother of Suvrata. Br. III. ७४. १८ and २०. वा. ९९. १९.
(I)--the son of धाता and सिनीवालि. भा. VI. १८. 3.
(II)--a son of कृष्ण and कालिन्दि. भा. X. ६१. १४.
(III)--a son of ब्रह्मा and मन्त्रसरीर: a Jayadeva. Br. III. 3. 6; 4. 2; वा. ६६. 6; ६७. 5.
--a king of Magadha; ruled for २५ years. वा. ९९. ३१८.
--a यक्ष; son of पुण्यजनी and मणि- bhadra. Br. III. 7. १२५.
--a sacrifice performed by Bharata. भा. V. 7. 5.
--a name for the २७थ् Kalpa; here Soma became पौर्णमासि. वा. २१. ६७, ६९.
--one of the five queens of उशीनर; father of Suvrata. M. ४८. १६, १८. [पगे२-077+ २३]
(I)--a son of प्रत्युष and a देवऋसि. Br. II. ३५. ९४.
(II)--a son of परियात्र (पारिपात्र-वा। प्।) and father of Bala. Br. III. ६३. २०४: वा. ८८. २०४.
--one of Danu's sons. वा. ६८. 9.
--रावन killed by राम. भा. II. 7. २३-25.
--the याम gan2as who stand in ten parts in the वैराज. वा. १०१. ६४.
(II)--an Asura in the सभा of हिरण्य- कशिपु. M. १६१. ८१.
--the images of राम and Bali. M. २५९. 1.
--a northern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ४८.
(I)--a son of मूलक, and father of ऐड- विड. (इलीविल-वि। प्।). भा. IX. 9. ४१; V. IV. 4. ७५.

(II)--a son of Aja (पाल) and of इन्दुमती; and father of श्री Ra1ma (दाशरथि Ra1ma-वा। प्।) and three other sons, being the अम्शस् of Hari. <F>1:  भा. IX. १०. 1-2; Br. III. ६३. १८४; IV. ४०. १००; M. १२. ४९-50; वा. ८८. १८३-4; १११. ६४; Vi. IV. 4. ८६-7.</F> A friend of Roma- पाद to whom he gave his daughter शान्ता in adoption. <F>2:  भा. IX. २३. 7-8; Vi. IV. १८. १७-8.</F> King of अयोध्या. Having no sons worshipped त्रिपुरसुन्दरी at the capital and spent seven days at काञ्ची praying to कामाक्षी who blessed him with four sons. <F>3:  Br. III. ३७. ३१; ६३. १८४; IV. ४०. ८८.</F>
(III)--a son of Navaratha, and father of शकुनि (एकादशरथ-ब्र्। प्।). भा. IX. २४. 4-5; Br. III. ७०. ४३-4. वा. ९५. ४२; Vi. IV. १२. ४१.
(IV)--a son of Satyaratha (Citraratha: वा। प्।). (Known also as लोमपाद). M. ४८. ९४; वा. 9. १०३.
(V)--a Maurya king who ruled for eight years; son of सुयशा and father of Samyuta. M. २७२. २५; Vi. IV. २४. ३०.
--the bow of शिव with ten colours. वा. १०१. २७०. [पगे२-079+ ३३]
--a Vindhya tribe enlisted by जरासन्ध against the Yadus. भा. X. [५०. (v) 3]; Br. II. १६. ६४; वा. ४५. १३२.
--a R. in भारतवर्ष from the र्क्ष; sacred to पितृस्. Br. II. १६. ३०; III. १३. १००; M. २२. ३४; वा. ४५. ९९. M. १४४. २५.

(I)--the son of निर्वृत्(t)i, (निधृति-व्। प्।, वीदूरथ, म्। प्।), and father of Vyoma; <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. 3; X. ३६. ३३; M. ४४. ४०.</F> a man of much prowess. <F>2:  Br. III. ७०. ४१; Vi. IV. १२. ४१.</F>
(II)--a son of घर्मात्मा. वा. ९५. ४०.

--(also दशार्हकास्) a tribe related to the पाण्- डवस्. They defended द्वारका when attacked. <F>1:  भा. I. ११. ११; १४. २५; III. 1. २९.</F> Praised कृष्ण's heroism. <F>2:  Ib. IX. २४. ६३.</F> Felt relieved at Kamsa's death as they heard of his plan to vanquish them. <F>3:  Ib. X. ३६. ३३; ३९. २५; ४५. १५.</F> Followed बलराम to द्वारका and fought their own kinsmen. <F>4:  Ib. X. ६१. ४०; XI. २९. ३९; ३०. १८.</F>
--a तीर्थ on the नर्मदा; west of गन्गेश्वरम्. १९३. २०-2.
--a Tirtham in Benares; <F>1:  M. १८५. ६८.</F> fit for श्राद्ध. <F>2:  वा. ७७. ४५.</F> [पगे२-080+ ३०]
--a northern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ५०.
--the name of Budha, son of तारा and Soma who forcibly seized her from बृहस्पति; <F>1:  Br. III. ६५. ४१; वा. ९०. ३७.</F> called Budha after तारा revealed his real father. <F>2:  वा. ९०. ४३.</F>

--The आभिरस् and Mlecchas; unfit for श्राद्ध; <F>1:  Br. III. १४. ४३; Vi. V. ३८. १३; २५. २७. ४९७.</F> checked by ययाति; <F>2:  Br. III. ६८. ६७.</F> dharma of the; <F>3:  Ib. III. ६३. १९४; वा. ४९. ५५; ७८. ३४; ८८. १०५.</F> seized १६००० ladies of कृष्ण due to a curse by the Lord; <F>4:  M. ७०. 7.</F> cudgels as chief weapons of; <F>5:  Vi. V. ३८. ५१, ७०, ८२, ८४.</F> killing milch cows. <F>6:  वा. ९३. ६६.</F>
--an आन्गिरस and मन्त्रकृत्. Br. II. ३२. १०८.
--a son of मार्ताण्ड or the Sun; <F>1:  वा. ८४. २४. Br. III. ५९. २५;</F> one of the अश्विन्स्. <F>2:  वा. ८४. ७७.</F>
--one of the eleven Rudras. M. १७१. ३९.
--born as Agastya to Pulastya. भा. IV. 1. ३६.
--evil spirits injuring children. भा. X. 6. २७; ६३. १०.
--a काश्यप gotraka1ra. M. १९९. 5.
(I)--a son of दारुक, an अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १९६.

(II)--the previous अवतार् of उमा; stars regarded as her daughters; <F>1:  M. १३. १०; १२८. ५०; १९९. २०.</F> a daughter of दक्ष; <F>2:  Br. I. 1. ५९.</F> became हिंअवान्'s daughter by worshipping शिव. <F>3:  Ib. III. 7. ४७२; IV. ११. 2-5.</F>
--a sage; a त्रयार्षेय pravara. M. १९६. २५; १९७. 6.
--(द्राविडस्); southerners; <F>1:  Br. II. ३१. ८२; वा. ५८. ८२; ९८. १०७.</F> to be conquer- ed by Kalki. <F>2:  Br. III. ७३. १०७.</F>
--a Mukhya गण of the सावर्ण्य epoch; <F>1:  वा. ९४. ५६; १००. १८;</F> a Sukha God. <F>:  2) Br. IV. 1. १९.</F>
--a वैकुण्ठ God. Br. II. ३६. ५७.
(I)--a Sukha God. Br. IV. 1. १९. [पगे२-082+ ४१]
(II)--a Mukhya गण. वा. १००. १८.

--a dharma; <F>1:  वा. २३. १०१.</F> a शिष्टाचार; <F>2:  Br. II. ३२. ४१.</F> three kinds of; superior, middling and inferior; the first and last of which are called respectively ज्येष्ठ and कनिष्ठ; the lower and the higher not fit for one's own welfare; the middling is the equal dis- tribution among the deserving; the superior gift leads to मोक्ष and the inferior to one's own welfare; <F>3:  Ib. II. ३२. ५४-56; वा. ५९. ४९-50.</F> he who per- forms sacrifice by ill-gotten wealth does not attain the fruits thereof; his gifts are not for dharma but only for show; but well-earned money given to right men without expecting fruits, merits Bhoga while Satya leads to heaven; <F>4:  Ib. ६७. २७; ९१. १०६-12; १०४. १४.</F> the mak- ing of, in a श्राद्ध and the fruits thereof; <F>5:  Br. III. 4. २४; १६. 1.</F> one of the उपायस् of a king; even Gods are brought under control by gifts; sixteen kinds of; done by काम, अम्बरीष, पृथु, प्रह्लाद and others; <F>6:  M. २२२. 2; २२४. 1-4; २४६. २५-7; २७४ (whole).</F> the विधि of, enquired by Manu from the Matsya. <F>7:  Ib. 2. २३.</F> Incumbent on all castes <F>8:  Vi. III. 8. २२.</F> useless if given to a non- श्रोत्रिय; <F>9:  Ib. V. ३८. ३०.</F> conditions appropriate to. <F>१०:  वा. ९१. १०७-13.</F>
--a group of sages. M. २००. १७.

--a class of demons from Danu residing in रसातल; श्वेतपर्वत their abode; <F>1:  भा. II. 7. १३; V. २४. ३०. वा. ३९. २९; ४६. ३५; ६६. 1.</F> were fascinated by Hari but they hated him; <F>2:  भा. X. ४०. २२; ८५. ४१; XI. १४. 5.</F> Vipracitti was their overlord. <F>3:  Br. III. 7. २५५; 8. 7; २०. 3; IV. 4. 2.</F>
--a class of people in शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २७. [पगे२-083+ ३४]
--a son of प्रीति and Pulastya; Agastya in pre- vious birth; wife Sujanghi, had many sons known as Paulastyas. Br. II. ११. २६.
--a Sukha God. Br. IV. 1. १८.
--a सुधामान God. Br. II. ३६. २७.
--a Sukha God. Br. IV. 1. १८.
--कृष्ण; <F>1:  Br. III. ३६. ३९;</F> with the weapon पाश; <F>2:  Ib. IV. ३४. ८३.</F> around his belly यशोदा bound a rope and fastened him to a mortar. <F>3:  Vi. V. 6. २०; १३. ३४.</F>
--an Apsaras. वा. ६९. 4.
--(दारकस्-वा। प्।); a पाराशर clan. Br. III. 8. ९५. वा. ७०. ८७.

(I)--the charioteer of कृष्ण; <F>1:  भा. X. ५०. १६. २० [5]. [8]; ६४. [6]; ७१. १२. Vi. V. ३७. ५१.</F> went with कृष्ण to शाल्व's station, and drove the chariot when कृष्ण gained लक्ष्मणा by svayamvara; <F>2:  भा. X. ७७. 9-११; ८३. ३३.</F> took कृष्ण to मिथिला and the Videha country. <F>3:  Ib. ८६. १७; ५३. 4.</F> His son was the charioteer of Pradyumna. <F>4:  Ib. ७६. २७.</F> Stood before कृष्ण on the eve of His return- ing from the earth. कृष्ण asked him to inform the द्वारका people of the position of the यादवस् at प्रभास and advise them to go to Indraprastha with Arjuna. Returning to the city, दारुक informed Vasudeva and others accordingly. <F>5:  Ib. XI. ३०. ४१-50; ३१. १५-17; Vi. V. ३७. ५७-64.</F> [पगे२-084+ २८]
(II)--the अवतार् of the Lord in the २१स्त् Dva1- para with sons in the holy दारुवन. वा. २३. ९५.
--a Gandharva. Br. III. 7. ११.

--on the हिमालयन् crests; the abode of sages in कृतयुग engaged in severe austerities; शिव appeared before them naked and sometimes wept and some- times danced; the womenfolk were enchanted by him; the angry sages cursed him to become an ass and at- tempted to cut off his लिन्गम्; the Lord disappear- ed; finding the world beset with difficulties and dangers the sages appealed to ब्रह्मा and learnt that it was due to शिव; hence they made images of लिन्ग and offered worship for a year; the Lord appeared before them, and was praised by all; <F>1:  Br. II. २७. 2-९०;</F> the sages were treated by शिव on भस्मस्नानविधि. <F>2:  Ib. II. २७. १०५, १२८.</F>
--a degraded क्षत्रिय clan. Br. III. ६३. १४०.
--a disciple of Rathitara (s.v.). वा. ६०. ६६.
(I)--a sage of the Auttama epoch. M. 9. १४.
