(II)--the sage who initiated the fallen wives of कृष्ण in the अनन्गदानव्रतम् and thus rescued them. M. ७०. १०, १३. [पगे२-085+ २५]
--the country of, (दार्विक--Wilson) under the म्लेच्छस्। Vi. IV. २४. ६९.
--here were born as hunters the seven sons of कौशिक. But they remembered their previous births and refrained from cruel deeds. M. २०. १२-4; २१. 9 and २८.
--a name of राम, who destroyed रावन and his clan. वा. ७०. ४८.
--शतध्वज (s.v.) was their king; when they heard of कृष्ण going to मिथिला they met him with presents. भा. X. ५२. ११ [१२]; ८६. २५.
--see दशार्हस्. भा. XI. ३०. १८.
--the fisher-woman, who took birth as सत्यवती and begot विचित्रवीर्य by शन्तनु. M. ५०. ४५; वा. ७३. २१; ९९. २४०.
--servants entertained in a श्राद्ध; <F>1:  M. १७. ५७ and ६२; वा. ६०. ३७.</F> appellation of the शूद्रस्. <F>2:  Vi. III. १०. 9.</F>
(I)--Slaves as present to learned men. Br. II. ३४. ३९. [पगे२-086+ २९]

(II)--of four kinds, देवदासि, ब्रह्मदासि, स्व- तन्त्र and शूद्रदासिक; the first two occupy the status of a क्षत्रिय lady; the third enjoys the status of a dancing girl (वेशि), and the last that of a low caste (हीनजाति). <F>1:  Br. IV. 8. ११-12.</F> A synonym of परिचारिक or a servant-maid. <F>2:  M. २९. १७-23.</F>
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८५.
--the period at the end of a Kalpa. वा. 7. १५.
--a son of शतरूपा. M. 4. २५.
--the four elephants at the four quarters with clouds; thrown about during शिव's ताण्डव. Br. II. २२. ४७, ५१; वा. ५१. ४३-5. M. 1. 1; १२५. १७-21.
--a Satya God. Br. II. ३६. ३४; वा. ६२. ३१.

--the guardians of the quarters; Sudharman, शन्खपाद, केतुमान्, and हीरण्यरोमन्; destroy the enemies and protect the earth. Invoked in the ग्रहबलि; <F>1:  M. 8. 9-११; ९३. ५२.</F> worship of. <F>2:  M. ६७. 9-१६; ६९. ३८.</F>
--an attribute of शिव. Br. II. २७. ९८.
--These are ब्राह्मी, आग्नेयी, गादिनी, नैऋऋति, वारुणी, पताकिनी, शन्खिनि and माहेश्वरि. M. २८६. 5-११, १७. [पगे२-087+ ४२]
--Lords of the quarters; present at वरुण's sacrifice. Br. III. 1. २८.
--see Diggaja. Br. IV. 9. ७९.
--conquest of the quarters; of Sagara; <F>1:  Br. III. ४९. ४७; ५२. ४१.</F> of Ila. <F>2:  M. ११. ४३.</F>
--a तीर्थम् sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ७७.
--a war-musical instrument. M. १३८. ५६; मा. ४०. २४.

(I)--a daughter of दक्ष, and wife of कश्यप. <F>1:  भा. III. १४. 7; वा. ६६. ५४; Vi. I. १५. १२४, १४०.</F> Her sons generally known as Daityas. Mother of हिरण्याक्ष and हिरण्यकशिपु. <F>2:  भा. VI. 6. २५; १८. ११; VII. 1. ३९; Br. III. 3. ५६; M. 6. 1-8; वा. ६७. ४९.</F> Mother of Dantavaktra by the sage's curse. <F>3:  भा. IX. २४. ३७.</F> Her sons प्रह्लाद and Hari were devotees of Hari. <F>4:  Ib. VI. १८. १०.</F> Always set her mind on truth; <F>5:  Ib. VII. 2. ६१.</F> daughter सिम्हिका; <F>5: a) वा. ६७. ६०.</F> (आदित्य्-वा। प्।). Finding her sons slain by Hari to help Indra, she became enraged, and asked her husband to bless her with a child to kill Indra. The un- willing husband offered it on condition of her observing certain vows for १०० years. So she observed them and Indra came to assist her. One day he found her sleep- ing in an unorthodox posture and entering her womb cut the embryo into seven and then into ४९ pieces; but at her request he gave all of them the status of gods, known as Maruts. <F>6:  भा. VI. १८. २३-77; Br. I. 1. ११२; ch. 5 (whole); 7. ४६५; IV. 9. 3; M. 6. ४७; ch. 7 (whole); वा. ६७. ८६, १३५; Vi. I. २१. ३०-41.</F> Impelled by passion and desire for children she approached her husband one evening for sexual intercourse. कश्यप said that it was the hour when शिवगणस् moved about and for him, to offer the शन्ध्य-prayer. But she persisted and gained her object. She however requested to be redeemed of the sin. कश्यप [पगे२-088+ ३४] remarked that since she approached him at the wrong time, her sons would have पैशाच-character and would be killed by Hari. For her penitence she was blessed with a righteous child among her grandsons. <F>7:  भा. III. १४ (whole).</F> Held the तेजस् in embryo for a hundred years when darkness enveloped all directions. The two door-keepers of वैकुण्ठ cursed by seers for preventing them from having दर्सन् of Hari were born as her two sons, when there were evil omens. <F>8:  Ib. VI. १५. 1-१०; १६. ३५; १७. 2-१५.</F> Prayed for another son. This was वज्रान्ग who on his birth accord- ing to her orders bound Indra. The latter was released on the mediation of ब्रह्मा and कश्यप. <F>9:  M. १४६. १८-55; १७१. २९.</F> Mother of Daityas; a Mother Goddess to be worshipped in house and palace buildings <F>१०:  Ib. १७१. ५८; १७९. १५; २५१. २९; २५३. २७; २६८. १९.</F> योगनिद्रा addressed as; <F>११:  Vi V. 2. 9.</F> sons of, in the seventh तलम् or पातालम्. <F>१२:  वा. ५०. ४३.</F>
(II)--a Mauneya. वा. ६९. 2.
--a शुक्र deva. वा. ३१. 9.
--a name of the Sun God. Br. IV. २४. ६१.
--a Sakti in the षोडशपत्राब्ज. Br. IV. ३२. ११.
(I)--a sage who knows the yoga power of विष्णु. भा. II. 7. ४४. [पगे२-089+ २९]

(II)--a son of अम्शुमन् and of यशोदा; father of भगीरथ; tried to bring down the गन्गा but died with- out success. <F>1:  भा. IX. 9. 2. M. १२. ४४; १५. १९. वा. ७३. ४२. ८८. १६७. Vi. IV. 4. ३४-5.</F> After a long rule, he retired to the forest. <F>2:  Br. III. १०. ९२; ५६. २९, ३२; ६३. १६६.</F>
(III)--a son of ऋष्य and father of प्रतीप. भा. IX. २२. ११.
(IV)--(खट्वाङ्ग) the son of कृशशर्म; comes down from heaven and resides here for a मुहूर्त; a master of the three worlds by intelligence and honesty. Br. III. ६३. १८२.
(V)--a son of Raghu. M. १२. ४८.
(VI)--a son of भीमसेन and father of प्रतीप. M. ५०. ३८; वा. ९९. २३३; Vi. IV. २० 7-8.
(VII)--a son of विश्वमहत्. वा. ८८. १८२.

--Heaven; see also Suvarlokam; presiding deity is सूर्य, who is therefore known as Divaspati; here live Gandharvas, राक्षसस्, Apsarasas, यक्षस्, नागस्, and men; five-fold route to, from पातालम्; equal to earth in measure- ment of rotation or border. M. 2. ३२; १२४. २०. वा. ४७. 9; १०१. १९.
--a son of उदारधि and Bhadra; husband of वरान्गि and father of Ripu. Br. II. ३६. १०१; वा. ६२. ८७. [पगे२-090+ ३३]
--a कश्यप and a त्रयार्षेय. M. १९९. १३.
(I)--the Indra of the epoch of the १३थ् Manu (Ruci); a friend of योगेश्वर. भा. VIII. १३. ३१-32; Br. IV. 1. १०१; वा. १००. १०५. Vi. III. 2. ३९.
(II)--सूर्य, Lord of Bhavya. Br. II. २३. ५०; वा. १०१. २२.
(III)--a name of Dhruva. वा. ६२. ८१.
--a तुषित Deva. Br. II. ३६. १०.
--(दिवार्क ब्र्। प्।)--son of भानु and father of Sahadeva; leader of an army. भा. IX. १२. १०-11.

(I)--the Sun god, king of the planets; <F>1:  M. १५०. १५१; २६५. ३८ and ४१. २६६. ३८. २८१. १२. वा. २८. ३२.</F> is Agni; <F>2:  Ib. ५३. २९, ३०.</F> different positions of, in the sky in different lands; <F>3:  Br. II. २१. ३७-43.</F> struck by स्वभानु, fell on the earth; <F>4:  Br. II. २२. १२; III. 3. ११०; 8. ७६.</F> addressed by कार्त्तिकेय to whom he went as a Brahmana; <F>5:  Ib. III. ७०. 4.</F> at a distance of १०००×100 yojanas from the earth. <F>6:  वा. १०१. १२९.</F>
(II)--a son of Prativyoma (प्रतिव्यूह वा। प्।); his capital अयोध्या; (वा। प्।)। <F>1:  M. २७१. 5; वा. ९९. २८२.</F> Father of Sahadeva. <F>2:  Vi. IV. २२. 3.</F>

(III)--divided the earth into ten political divisions and distributed them among इक्स्वाकु and other [पगे२-091+ २८] cognates. Sudyumna in woman's disguise did not get any share; वसिष्ठ got him प्रतिष्टा and he in turn offered it to Pururavas. वा. ८५. २०-23.
--a class of पितृस् propitiated on every New- Moon Day; <F>1:  Br. II. २८. २३, ९३; वा. ५६. २१; ७३. ६२.</F> to them कृष्णपक्ष is day and शुक्लपक्ष is night. <F>2:  वा. ५६. ८७.</F>
--a class of Gods performing श्राद्ध. Br. III. १०. ११०.
--Mt. a hill of क्रौञ्चद्वीप. Br. II. १९. ६७; वा. ४९. ६२. Vi. II. 4. ५१.
--a Satya God. Br. II. ३६. ३५.
--Mt. a hill of क्रौञ्चद्वीप. वा. ४९. ६२.
(I)--the son of खनपान (अनपान ब्र्। प्। and वि। प्।) and father of Dharmaratha. भा. IX. २३. 6-7; Br. III. ७४. १०३; Vi. IV. १८. १५; वा. ९९. १०१.
(II)--the son of दधिवाहन; his son was Vidvan Dharmaratha. M. ४८. ९२.
(I)--a son of भीमरथ and father of Dyumat. भा. IX. १७. 6.
(II)--son of Mudgala and father of Mitreyu. भा. IX. २१. ३४; २२. 1. [पगे२-092+ ३०]
(III)--see प्रजेश्वर. Br. III. ६७. २६.

(IV)--a son of विन्ध्याश्व; <F>1:  M. ५०. 7.</F> a मन्त्रकृत् <F>2:  Br. II. ३२. १०६; वा. ५९. ९७.</F> and a राजऋषि; <F>3:  M. १४५. १००.</F> excluded from marital alliances with भृगुस्, etc. <F>4:  Ib. १९५. ४२.</F>

(V)--a name of भीमरथ, king of काशि; ruined by राक्षस Ks2emaka. दिवोदास established his head- quarters at the city of Gomati on the outskirts of the state; a राजऋषि, his wife सुयशा prayed to गणपति in the temple at the city of Nikumbha for a son and as the God was not pleased to grant her prayer even after a long time, दिवोदास had the temple demolished and hence cursed; defeated and slew the १०० sons of भद्रश्रेनि except the child Durdama; through queen दृषद्वति he got a son Pratardana. वा. ९२. २३-64; Vi. IV. 8. ११.
(VI)--the राजऋषि, son of बध्यश्व and Menaka. वा. ९९. २०१.
(VII)--the son of हर्यश्व and father of मित्रायु. Vi. IV. १९. ६२, ६९.
--a class of deities of the चाक्षुष epoch. M. 9. २४.
(I)--a son of सात्वत. भा. IX. २४. 6; Br. III. ७१. 1. Vi. IV. १३. 1.
(II)--a son of Uttama Manu. Br. II. ३६. ३९. [पगे२-093+ २५]
(III)--a God of सुतार group. Br. IV. 1. ८९.
(VI)--a son of कौशल्या. वा. ९६. 1.

--३६० days of human reckoning ac- cording to the सावन calculation; अहस् or day is उदगायनम् and रात्रि or night is दक्षिणायनम्; मासम्, ३० years of human calculation; three months and ten days equal to १०० years of human counting; सम्वत्सर = ३६० years of human years; १००० years = ३६०००० years. वा. ५७. १२, १९; १००. २२४.
--a पारावत God of the स्वरोचिष epoch. Br. II. ३६. १४.
--divine men, the ten sons of Vaivasvata Manu. M. ११. ४१.
(I)--a daughter of हिरण्यकशिपु and wife of भृगु, the first प्रजापति; son शुक्र; had also a daughter. Br. III. 1. ७४-6. ८८; वा. ६५. ७२.
(II)--an Apsaras. Br. III. 7. 7.
--a son of Uttama Manu. Br. II. ३६. ३९. [पगे२-094+ ३०]
(I)--one of the मरुत्गणस्. वा. ६७. १२९.
(II)--directions as the wives of भीम; आकाश तनु of the Lord; स्वर्ग as the sun. Br. II. १०. ८२; वा. २७. ५४.
--deities of quarters sculptured in the pillars of the palace. वा. १०१. २९०.
--a son of Vaivasvata Manu and father of नाभाग. भा. VIII. १३. 2; IX. 1. १२; 2. २३; Br. II. ३८. ३१; III. ६०. 3. Vi. IV. 1. 7.
(I)--wife of Ugra, (दीक्षित) son सन्तान. Br. II. १०. ८३; वा. २७. ५५.

(II)--in connection with ललिता's worship; शाम्- भवी Di1ks2a1 is the knowledge that comes at once by the Guru's look, speech or touch; मानसि Di1ks2a1 where the disciple is initiated by the Guru in secret being pleased with his conduct; first was क्रिया Di1ks2a1 which consists of purificatory bath and recital of देवीसूक्त and पुरुषसूक्त with १६ उपचारस्; offering of the पुष्पाञ्जलि with सहस्राक्षर विद्य; समाधि; the poor and disabled worship with भावनद्रव्यस् (i.e.) meditation in mind as if doing all of them; place of meditation or जपस्थान; thinking of भैत्ररी, then the श- ष-Sa group of ४२ letters, पञ्चाक्षर, चतुरक्षर, etc.; con- template on वरमूर्तिस् and then स्वरशक्तिस् and वर्ण- शक्तिस्; installation of चक्रेश्वरी and of Ananga Kusuma- देवी in the heart seeing the मुद्रा; meditation of Manuja- pam pleases देवी. Br. IV. ४३ (whole) and ४४, 1 to १५१. [पगे२-095+ २६]
(III)--as consort of a Brahmana Soma. Vi. I. 8. 8.
--with दिक्षा a स्थान of Rudra; son सन्तान. Vi. 1. 8. 7, ११.
--a याम Deva. वा. ३१. 6.
--performed by धरणी and got relieved of the distress caused by परशुराम. Br. III. ४७. ६१.
--a तीर्थम् on the नर्मदा (see व्यास Ti1rtha). M. १९१. ३८.
--a son of Uttama Manu. Vi. III. 1. १५.
--a son of दक्ष Sa1varn2i. भा. VIII. १३. १८; Vi. III. 2. २४.
(I)--an अमिताभ god; one of the twenty अमिताभ gan2as. Br. IV. 1. १७; वा. १००. १६.
(II)--the fruit of प्राणायाम; equal to the worship of planets of Sun, Moon, and able to know the past, present and future. वा. ११. 4, 9. [पगे२-096+ २४]
--a son of the first सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ६४.
(I)--one of the seven sages of the eighth Manvantara. भा. VIII. १३. १५. Vi. III. 2. १७.
(II)--a son of कृष्ण and रोहिणि (Satya- भामा म्। प्।). भा. X. ६१. १८; ९०. ३३; M. ४७. १७; Vi. V. ३२. 2.
(III)--(आत्रेय)--a sage of the first epoch of सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ११.
--a God of Sumedhasa group. Br. II. ३६. ५९.
--the gift of a light; leads to Rudraloka. M. १०१. ४१.
--a Mother goddess. M. १७९. २९.
--a Svara शक्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ५५, ७४.
--a commander of भण्ड to aid विषङ्ग; killed by भगमाला. Br. IV. २१. ७८; २५. २७. ९४.

--(Saunahotra and प्रकाशिरट्)--the son of काश (राष्ट्र वि। प्।) and the king of काशि; see काशिप; <F>1:  Br. III. ६७. 7. Vi. IV. 8. 7-8.</F> a मन्त्रकृत् and of the Angirasa branch. <F>2:  वा. ५९. १०२.</F> Performed penance for sons on account of which Arjadeva Dhanvantri became his son; father of Dharma and Dhanvantri. <F>3:  Ib. ९२. 6, १८-19.</F>
(I)--a son of रष्ट्र and father of Dhan- vantari. भा. IX. १७. 4.

(II)--a son of उशिज; cursed even in the womb to lose consciousness by बृहस्पति; learnt his धर्म from Saurabheya वृषभ; it was गोधर्म to do as they pleased; once embraced in sexual love his brother's wife; for this he was floated down the Ganges; <F>1:  M. ४८. ४१-57; वा. ९९. ३४-76.</F> met Vairocana Bali who engaged him for क्षेत्रज sons, five through Bali's queen and one through her servant-maid. This was काक्षीवत्. <F>2:  भा. IX. २३. 5; M. ४८. ५८-78; वा. ९९. ९२.</F> Surabhi warded him from the darkness clouding him; got the title Gotama; <F>3:  M. ४८. ७९-84.</F> with काक्षीवत् he went to Girivraja and after penance reached heaven; <F>4:  Ib. ४८. ८५-86.</F> a ऋषिक and a मन्त्रकृट्. <F>5:  Br. II. ३२. १०१, १११; M. १४५. ९५ and १०५.</F>
(III)--a sage by Garbha. वा. ५९. ९३; ९९. ३७.
(IV)--a son of Utathya and ममता; father of Anga and others. Half-brother of भरद्वाज. Vi. IV. १८. १३; १९. १६.
(I)--a son of खट्वान्ग (Dilipa) and father of Raghu. भा. IX. १०. 1; Br. III. ६३. १८३; वा. ८८. १८३; Vi. IV. 4. ८३-4. [पगे२-098+ २७]
(II)--a son of Aja. M. १२. ४९.
--alias विग्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ६६.
--a कला of विष्णु. Br. IV. ३५. ९५.
--the Asura who insulted the sage Udaka and met with death at the hands of कुवलयाश्व. Vi. IV. 2. ४०.
(I)--the son of Andhaka and father of Daridyota (Aridyota-ब्र्। प्।). भा. IX. २४. २०.
(II)--a son of द्युतिमान्; a Janapada in क्रौञ्चद्वीप called after him; दुन्दुभिदेश. Br. II. १४. २३, २६; वा. ३३. २१, २३. Vi. II. 4. ४८.
(III)--Mt. a hill of क्रौञ्चद्वीप; also a region, a वर्ष of the द्वीपम्. Br. II. १४. २६; १९. ६९, ७३; वा. ४९. ६३, ६८; Vi. II. 4. ५१.
(IV)--Mt. one of the seven hills of प्लक्ष- द्वीप where Dundubhi and the Asura चन्द्रमृत्यु were beaten by the Devas. Br. II. १८. ७५; १९. १०; Vi. II. 4. 7; वा. ४७. ७२; ४९. 9; ९६. १४५; M. १२२. १३.
(V)--one of the Danu's sons; a दानव. Br. III. 6. 4; वा. ६८. 4.
(VI)--a son of Maya and रम्भा. Br. III. 6. २९; वा. ६८. २८. [पगे२-099+ २५]
(VII)--a musical instrument whose sound causes death; used in the तारकामय. M. १७७. २६.
(VIII)--Mt. in शाकद्वीप; here the Devas once beat the drum, the sound of which caused death to Dundubhi and from thence took this name. M. १२२. १३-14.
(IX)--a son of सुतार, the Lord of the sacred द्वापर. वा. २३. १२१.
(X)--(Sata Dundubhi?) a son of Jambha. वा. ६७. ७८.
--a name of कुवलयाश्व, (s.v.). Vi. IV. 2. ४०.
--a son of Suhotri, the अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १२७.
--a son of महावीर्य and father of Tray- यारुणि and others; attained ब्रह्मणगति; see दुरुक्षय. भा. IX. २१. १९-20.
--born of Krodha and हिम्सा; sister and also wife of Kali. भा. IV. 8. 3-4.
--see दुरितक्षय. According to मत्स्य पुराण the name is उरुक्षय. Vi. IV. १९. २४. [पगे२-100+ ३५]
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८६.
--a R. from the Vindhyas. M. ११४. २८.

--fortified places unknown under पृथु; six kinds of: Giridurga is the best; described. <F>1:  M. १०. ३२; २१७. 6-८७; V. I. 6. १८.</F> also four kinds of; three natural and one artificial; contain different outways; कुमारिपुरम्, villages, towns surrounded by a moat, also mountains and rivers; <F>2:  वा. 8. ९८, १०८ ff.</F> desert, mountain and water; man left the tree home for this; last was artificial; made by man with ramparts, moats and कुमारिपुरम्; <F>3:  Br. II. 7. ९२, १०१ ff.</F> of the southern country. <F>4:  वा. ४५. १२८.</F>

(I)--one of the names of योगमाय propitiated by देवकी and others for कृष्ण's safe return from the cave of जाम्बवान्; <F>1:  भा. X. 2. ११; ५६. ३५.</F> worship of; <F>2:  Ib. XI. २७. २९.</F> a शक्ति; <F>3:  Br. III. ३२. २४, ४८ and ५९; IV. १९. ८१; ३९. ५७.; ४४. ७६.</F> worshipped in the ग्रहबलि: Icon of. <F>4:  M. ९३. १६; २६०. ५५-66.</F>
(II)--a R. originating from the Vindhya Moun- tains. Br. II. १६. ३३; वा. ४५. १०३.
--a commander of भण्ड; a son of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८३; २६. ४९.
--the superintendent of fortresses; his qualifications. M. २१५. ३९. [पगे२-101+ २७]
--a territory to the west of the Vindhya Mountains. Br. II. १६. ६०.
--a son of Dana. भा. VI. 6. ३१.
--a son of Ananta (आनर्त-म्। प्।); a soldier of great fortune. Br. III. ६९. ५४; M. ४३. ४९; वा. ९४. ५३.
(I)--(Durmada): a son of Vasudeva and रोहिणि and father of अभिभूत. Br. III. ७१. १६५, १७१; M. ४६. १२; वा. ९६. १६३; Vi. IV. १५-22.
(II)--the son of धृत and father of Pra- cetas. Br. III. ७४. ११. वा. ९९. ११.
(III)--a king and a son of रुद्रश्रेणि. M. ४३. ११.
(IV)--a son of सुहोत्री, the अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १२७.
(V)--the surviving son of भद्रश्रेणि out of his hundred sons, who were put to sword by दिवोदास. वा. ९२. ६३.
(VI)--the son of भद्रश्रेण्य and father of Dhanaka. Vi. IV. ११. १०.
(VII)--a son of घृत and father of Pracetas. Vi. IV. १७. 4. [पगे२-102+ ३१]
--the son of शतानीक and father of वही- nara. भा. IX. २२. ४३.
--a Deva. Br. II. १३. ९५.
--a Mountain in भारतवर्ष. Br. II. १६. २०.

(I)--a name of the daughter of काल (time); enjoyed पूरु and blessed him with a boon; offered herself to बृहद्रथ and on his refusal cursed him to be ever wan- dering. She then approached Bhaya, the Yavana Lord who adopted her as his sister; helped the Yavanas in over- coming the city of पुरञ्जन; <F>1:  भा. IV. २७. १९-30; २८. 1, 3 and १०.</F> allegorically “old age”; <F>2:  Ib. २९. २२.</F> a शक्ति. <F>3:  Br. IV. ४४. ७५.</F>
(II)--a Mind-born mother. M. १७९. १४.
(I)--a companion of पुरञ्जन, allegori- cally उपस्थ। भा. IV. २५. ५२; २९. १४.
(II)--a son of Bhadrasenaka (or Bhadra- sena) and father of Dhanaka. (Kanaka-ब्र्। प्।). भा. IX. २३. २३; Br. III. ६७. ६६; ६९. 7.
(III)--(see Durdama) a son of रोहिणी and Vasudeva. भा. IX. २४. ४६-47.
(IV)--a son of Vasudeva and पौरवी. भा. IX. २४. ४७. [पगे२-103+ २६]

(V)--an Asura commander of ten अक्षौ- हिणिस् was sent against ललिता accompanied by noisy पटह; rode on the camel, succeeded in taking a jewel from the crown of सम्पत्करी-Sarasvati, who being enraged struck him at the breast; he fell dead and his followers were mas- sacred. The rest fled to the सून्यक city in fear. Br. IV. २२. १९, २८, ४७.
(VI)--a name of विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ६८.
(VII)--a son of भद्रश्रेणि; (see Dur- dama). वा. ९४. 7.
(VIII)--of the रोहिणि family; see also Dur- dama; a son of रोहिणि and आनकदुन्दुभि. वा. ९६. १६९; Vi. १५. १९.
--the son of धृत and father of Pracetas. भा. IX. २३. १५.
--fought with कामदेव in the देवासुर war. भा. VIII. १०. ३३.
--a son of शृञ्जय and राष्ट्रपालि. भा. IX. २४. ४२.
--the son of पुष्पमिष्ट. भा. XII. 1. ३४.
(I)--a राक्षस killed in the लङ्का war. भा. IX. १०. १८. [पगे२-104+ ४८]
(III)--a son of खश and a राक्षस. Br. III. 7. १३६; वा. ६९. १६७.
(IV)--a विघ्ननायक. Br. IV. २७. ८१.
(V)--a son of सुहोत्री, the अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १२७.

--the eldest of the hundred sons of धृत- राष्ट्र and गान्धारि; <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. २६; X. ६४. [4]; M. ५०. ४८; वा. ९९. २४३; Vi. IV. २०. ३९.</F> सुभद्रा was intended by राम to be given in marriage to him; <F>2:  भा. X. ८६. 3.</F> was met by कृतवर्मन् and taken leave of; <F>3:  Ib. X. ५२. (५६. V. १२).</F> went from Balabhadra and learnt गदा from बलराम at मिथिला; <F>4:  Ib. X. ५७. २६; Br. III. ७१. ८४; वा. ९६. ८३.</F> mistook the colour of the flooring of the पाण्डव's सभा (built by Maya) for a sheet of water and had a nasty fall at which भीम and the ladies laughed. This enraged Duryodhana who was conciliated by युधिष्ठिर who sent clothes to him through कृष्ण. He did not accept them, but went home downcast; <F>5:  भा. X. ५८. २७; ७५. ३४-39.</F> kept under influence Vinda and Anuvinda of Avanti; <F>6:  Ib. X. ५८. ३०.</F> banished the पाण्डवस् and द्रौपदी to the forest for defeat in the game of dice; <F>7:  Ib. X. ६४. [4].</F> resented साम्ब's action in taking away his daughter लक्ष्मणा in स्वयम्वर and wanted to punish him; heard of राम's arrival and extended welcome to him; afraid of राम's prowess agreed to the marriage of his daughter to साम्ब and gave a rich dowry; <F>8:  Ib. X. ६८. (whole); Vi. V. ३५. 4-5, ११.</F> did not feel happy over the success of the राजसूय, where he was in charge of the treasury; <F>9:  भा. X. ७४. ५३; ७५. 2 and 4.</F> failed to hit the fish mark in लक्ष्मणा's स्वयम्वर; <F>१०:  Ib. X. ८३. २३.</F> Jealous of कृष्ण and द्रौपदी, his mind set on the latter; <F>११:  Ib. X. ७५. ३१-32.</F> ordered Vidura's banishment for offering good counsel, and insulted him as the son of a दासि; <F>१२:  Ib. I. 7. १४; III. 1. १४-15.</F> met the पाण्डवस् in war at कुरुक्षेत्र; arranged in व्यूह at Syamanta- [पगे२-105+ ३९] पञ्चक; fought with भीमसेन who killed him with his गद; lay in the battlefield with his thigh fractured, along with eleven अक्षौहिणिस्. <F>१३:  Ib. X. ७८ (१६ (V) १५, १८-19), ३९; ७९. २३; ८० [1]; III. 3. १३; M. १०३. 3-5.</F> Built a house of lac to get the पाण्डवस् consumed by flames. <F>१४:  Vi. IV. १३. ७०.</F>

--a son of देवयानि; cursed by his father for refusing to part with his youth. <F>1:  Vi. IV. १०. 6, १३.</F> Viceroy of south-east king- dom; <F>2:  Ib. IV. १०. ३१.</F> line of; father of Vanhi; got merged into Puru's line ultimately. <F>3:  Ib. IV. १६. 2-6.</F>
--(दूर्वाक्षी-ब्र्। प्।) the queen of वृक. भा. IX. २४. ४३.

(I)--a son of Atri and an younger brother of दत्तात्रेय; <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. १५; Br. III. 8. ८२; वा. ७०. ७६.</F> an अम्श of शिव; <F>2:  भा. IV. 1. ३३.</F> appeared before अम्बरीष who was about to break his द्वादसि fast; agreed to accept his hospitality, went to the river for bath and tarried there; finding the मुहूर्त for पारण (break-fast) drawing to a close, the king broke his fast with some water. Coming to know of this on his return, the sage produced a flaming spirit to attack him. But Hari's चक्र burnt it down and turned towards the sage, who ran for succour to ब्रह्मा, शिव and विष्णु. All of them were unable to help; but Hari advised him to meet अम्बरीष and apologise to him. <F>3:  Ib. IX. 4. ३५-71.</F> This he did and was set at liberty. After partaking the meals with him, he returned to Brahmaloka; <F>4:  Ib. IX. 5. 1-२२.</F> blessed पृथ with secret मन्त्रस् to summon gods. <F>5:  Ib. IX. २४. ३२; XI. 1. १२.</F> Through him Duryodhana planned to destroy the पाण्डवस् by inciting him to go to them and ask for a feast. But कृष्ण protected them on the occasion. <F>6:  Ib. I. १५. ११.</F> In the course of his sojourn he met a विद्या- [पगे२-106+ २३] dhara maid with a garland given to her by the देवी; took it from her and presented it to Indra who put it on his elephant, who in turn threw it on the ground and trampled upon it. Enraged at this, the sage cursed him to be lost to all fortune. <F>7:  Ib. VIII. 5. १६; Br. IV. 5. १६-20; 9. ३१; ४०. १२०.</F>
(II)--a Siddha. भा. VI. १५. १३.
(III)--one of the Sages who left for पिण्डा- raka. भा. XI. 1. १२.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८७.
--a son of सरमा: had four sons. Br. III. 7. ४४१.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८७.

--of the Paurava line, adopted as son by Marutta; father of सरूप्य. Br. III. ७४. 3-5.

(पूरण); one of the १६ classes of पिशाचस्. Br. III. 7. ३७७.

(I)--a son of Raibhya and उपदानवी; a king; while out for hunting came to कण्व's hermitage, saw the beautiful शकुन्तला, married her by the गान्धर्वविधि and left for his capital the next day. A son Bharata was born to शकुन्तला and he was brought up by कण्व. शकुन्तला came to his palace with the boy but दुष्यन्त had forgotten her. A voice from the air asked him to accept them, his wife and son, which he did; <F>1:  भा. I. १२. २०; IX. २०. 7-२२ [1-2]; M. ४९. १०-11; Br. III. 6. २५; वा. ६८. २४; ९९. १३३-6.</F> removed from hell by the son. <F>2:  Vi. IV. १९. 9-१०.</F>

(II)--of Puru's line, was adopted by Marut(t)a as his son; returned to the line of Yadu, the eldest son of ययाति; <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. १७-18; वा. ९९. 3; वी. IV. १६. 5-6.</F> through ययाति's curse the Turvasu and the Paurava dynasties became commingled. <F>2:  M. ४८. 2-3.</F>
--sorrow: born of वेदना. Br. II. 9. ३५.

--a messenger: to report as he has been told and to be skilled in languages of different countries; one who can adjust according to time and place; <F>1:  M. २१५. १२-4; २५४. २४.</F> of Indra to तारक [पगे२-108+ २६] to get him ready for war after the birth of कार्त्तिकेय; <F>2:  M. ३८. १९; १५९. २४.</F> of पौण्ड्रक. <F>3:  Vi. V. ३४. 6.</F>

(II)--a queen of सम्हताश्व. Br. III. ६३. ६५; वा. ८८. ६४.

(IV)--the wife of विश्वामित्र and mother of अष्टक. Br. III. ६६. ७५. वा. ९१. १०३.

(III)--one of विश्वामित्र's sons. वा. ९१. ९६.

IV. १४. १६-17.</F> देवकी was one of his seven daughters, all of whom were married to Vasudeva. Father of four sons देववान् and others. <F>2:  भा. IX. २४. २१-23; वा. ९६. १२८-9; Vi. IV. १४. १८-19; V. 1. 5.</F> Gave rich presents to his daughter देवकी when she was married. <F>3:  भा. X. 1. ३२.</F>
(II)--a son of युधिष्ठिर by पौरवी (Yau- धेयी-वि। प्।). भा. IX. २२. ३०. Vi. IV. २०. ४४.

(I)--(देवकभोजपुत्री Suna1ma1) a Bhoja princess; a daughter of Devaka, one of the wives of Vasu- deva and mother of eight sons of whom कृष्ण was one, all of them comparable to the eight Vasus; <F>1:  भा. I. 1. १२; III. 1. ३३; 2. २५; IX. २४. २३, ४५, ५३; X. 1. 8 and २९; ३६. १७; Br. I. 1. १२५; M. ४४. ७३; ४६. १३-15; ४७. 2; वा. 1. १४८; ९६. १६३, १७२-4; Vi. IV. १४. १८; १५. १८. २६-30.</F> oppressed by Kamsa and relieved by कृष्ण; was about to be murdered by Kamsa who heard a divine voice that her eighth child would be the cause of his end; on Vasudeva's assurance to give up the babies as they were born she was allowed to go. Her first child कीर्तिमत् was taken to Kamsa who returned the baby. She was imprisoned with Vasudeva to watch over the birth of her sons. During her seventh pregnancy the धाम of Hari in her womb was transferred by योगमाया to that of रोहिणी and it was said that देवकी aborted. Then the अम्श of Hari entered her womb and she grew beautiful every day. ब्रह्मा, शिव and other Gods waited on her on the eve of कृष्ण's birth and said that her son was to kill [पगे२-114+ ३८] Kamsa: addressed the new-born कृष्ण. In the स्वायम्- bhuva epoch she was पृश्नि and Vasudeva was Sutapa. In another epoch she was Aditi and Vasudeva was कश्यप. यशोदा's daughter exchanged for देवकी's son and Kamsa was told of the birth of a girl; was released from prison along with Vasudeva; forgave and advised Kamsa; was saluted by कृष्ण and राम. <F>2:  भा. X. Chh. 1-4; ४४. ५०-51; ४५. 1-१२; भा. I. 8. २३. ३३; ११. २८; X. ३६. २०; ४३. २४. Vi. V. 2. 2; 4. १४; १८. 7-8.</F> युधिष्ठिर asked Arjuna about her welfare. <F>3:  भा. I. १४. २७.</F> कृष्ण's respects to, after his return from Indra's abode. <F>4:  Ib. X. [६७ (V) ४८].</F> देवकी came to रुक्मिणी's palace with Vasudeva and कृष्ण; <F>5:  Ib. X. ५५. ३५.</F> felt concerned at कृष्ण not returning from the cave of जाम्ब- वान् and aided by others prayed to दुर्गा for कृष्ण's return; <F>6:  Ib. X. ५६. ३४-5.</F> wondered at the discourses between Nimi and the sages, sons of ऋषभ; <F>7:  Ib. XI. 5. ५१.</F> embraced यशोदा at स्यमन्तपञ्चक and enquired after her welfare; <F>8:  Ib. X. ८२. ३७.</F> praised कृष्ण and राम and desired to see her sons who had been killed by Kamsa; saw them with joy when taken back from Sutala by कृष्ण; in her presence they left for heaven. <F>9:  Ib. X. ८५. २७-33, ५२, ५६-70.</F> Her grief at the decease of राम, कृष्ण and others; entered fire. <F>१०:  Ib. XI. ३१. १८; Vi. V. ३८. 4.</F>
(II)--a goddess enshrined at मथुरा. M. १३. ३९.
(III)--the mother of Yaudheya by युधिष्ठिर. M. ५०. ५६.

(III)--the horse of Kalki. भा. XII. 2. १९.
--a pupil of Kabandha; he divided the Sam- hitas into four among his four pupils. Br. II. ३५. ५७; Vi. III. 6. 9-१०.
--a sacred place in कालसर्पी; <F>1:  Br. III. १३. ९९.</F> on the slopes of the मुण्डपृष्ठ; <F>2:  वा. २३. १९५; १०८. ६६.</F> a तीर्थम् sacred to पुष्टि. <F>3:  M. १३. ४७.</F>
--musicians in heaven; were overjoyed at the देवी's starting for war. Br. III. ६३. ५३; IV. २०. १००.
--see महेश्वर. Br. IV. 2. २५७.
--the son of देवताजित् and आसुरि; husband of धेनुमती and father of परमेष्ठी. भा. V. १५. 3.
--the city of Indra on the मानसोत्तर, east of Meru. भा. V. २१. 7.
(I)--the son of देवक्षत्र, a true क्षत्रिय; father of Madhu. Br. III. ७०. ४५; वा. ९५. ४४.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २२.
--wives of the Devas. वा. ६५. २९.
--eight in number; general description of. वा. ४१. ७३-80.
--animals intended for temples and other religious purposes. M. २२७. २७.
--a boundary hill of शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २६.
--see बृहस्पति. Vi. II. 7. 8.
--rules relating to the consecration of the Devas; see Pratima. M. २६६. ६९.
--a playmate of कृष्ण. भा. X. २२. ३१.
--a group of Gods, sons of the sage कृशाश्व. They appear and disappear in each Kalpa and Manvantara. M. 6. 6-7; वा. ६६. ७९; Vi. I. १५. १३७.
(I)--a son of हृदीक, and father of Kam- बलबर्हिष. भा. IX. २४. २७; Br. III. ७१. १४१. [पगे२-119+ २४]
(II)--the second son of प्रीती and Pulastya. Br. II. ११. २७; वा. २८. २२.
(III)--a Paulastya and a sage of the Rai- vata epoch. Br. II. ३६. ६१. M. 9. १९.
(I)--a son of देवमिढ and मारिषा; husband of कम्सा and father of Citraketu and बृहद्बल. भा. IX. २४. २८, ४०.
(II)--a son of शूर; father of महाभाग. Br. III. ७१. १४९. १८८.
(III)--the father of Uddhava. M. ४६. २३.
(IV)--a brother of Vasudeva. वा. ९६. १४७. Vi. IV. १४. ३०.
--the milkman who milked the cow-earth in the epoch of Uttama Manu. वा. ६३. १५.
--the son of भागवत the last of the शुन्- gas; killed by his अमात्य Vasudeva. भा. XII. 1. १८-20. Vi. IV. २४. ३६-7, ३९.
(I)--a शुङ्ग ruler and son of भागवत, ruled for १० years; killed by his minister Vasudeva who became king. (क्षेमभूमि-वा। प्।). Br. III. ७४. १५५. वा. ९९. ३४४. [पगे२-120+ २४]
(II)--the son of समाभाग, ruled for ten years. M. २७२. ३१.
--a forest. वा. ४२. ४६.
--the sixty daughters of दक्ष collectively known as. M. 5. १५; वा. ६५. २९.
--the goddess enshrined at सरस्वती. M. १३. ४४.
--(देवमीदुष) a daughter of शूर. वा. ९६. १४३.
--a son of सूर and भोजा. M. ४६. 2.
(I)--a pupil of मण्डूकेय; taught the सम्हिता to Saubhari and other disciples. भा. XII. 6. ५६.
(II)--a name for शाकल्य (s.v.). वा. ६०. ३२, ६३.
(I)--son of कृतरथ and father of Vibudha. Vi. IV. 5. २७. [पगे२-121+ ३४]
(II)--the son of कृतिरथ and father of विस्तृत (Vibudha-ब्र्। प्।). भा. IX. १३. १६; Br. III. ६४. १२; वा. ८९. १२.

(III)--alias शूर (father of शूर-भा। प्।) the son of हृदीक, husband of मारीषा who gave birth to ten good sons, Vasudeva and others; had five daughters पृथा and others; gave पृथा in adoption to कुन्ती, his friend who had no children. भा. IX. २४. २७-31.
(II)--the son of शूर and माषी. वा. ९६. १४३.
--a festival being celebrated at द्वारका when Arjuna carried off सुभद्रा. भा. X. ८६. 9.

--as opposed to पितृयान; the north road of the sun, situated to the north of नागवीथि and south of the सप्तऋषिश्; here live Siddhas and they have no rebirths; <F>1:  वा. ५०. २१६; Vi. II. 8. ९०-7.</F> reached through the पिन्गल passage (on the right side of the body); <F>2:  भा. II. 2. २४ [2]; Br. II. २१. १६९.</F> four roads to and the door of the sun leading to them; <F>3:  Br. I. 7. १८३.</F> शिबि's lavish gifts to attain देवयान. <F>4:  M. ४२. १९-20.</F>
--कश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 4.

(I)--the daughter of शुक्र and ऊर्जस्वती (यजनी, जयन्ती); accompanied शर्मिष्ठा, the Asura king's daughter to water-sports; when शर्मिष्ठा clothed herself [पगे२-122+ ३७] with देवयानी's dress by mistake, देवयानी treated her as a slave, she being the daughter of a Brahmana Purohita. The Princess became enraged, stripped her and cast her into a well and went away; when she was crying helpless there came ययाति who was on a hunting expedition. He gave her his upper cloth to wear and lifted her up. देवयानी request- ed him to be her husband, saying that she had been cursed by Kaca, बृहस्पति's son, to marry only a क्षत्रिय. ययाति agreed and departed. देवयानि reported शर्मिष्ठा's con- duct to her father शुक्र who left the palace in disgust. The king implored him on his knees, when शुक्र agreed to stay on if शर्मिष्ठा would be appointed as servant of his daughter. This was agreed upon, and शर्मिष्ठा became her servant. When देवयानी was married to ययाति, शुक्र presented शर्मिष्ठा as his daughter's maid. She had two sons Yadu and Turvasu. Learning of her husband's connec- tion with शर्मिष्ठा during her own pregnancy, देवयानी left for her father's house. ययाति followed her and was cursed by शुक्र to fall a prey to old age. ययाति appealed to him to mitigate the curse as his desire for enjoyment with his daughter was still keen. Then शुक्र said that if anyone would give him his youth and take up old age then he could regain his youth. His son पूरु agreed and once more the king enjoyed the company of देवयानी; <F>2:  भा. IX. १८. 7-५१; M. २५. 7; Chh. २६ to ३२.</F> heard the story of an ewe loved by a ram from ययाति, and thought it was an allusion to her; became detached and cast off her body with her mind on Hari. <F>3:  भा. IX. १९. (whole); Br. III. 1. ८६; ६८. १५; वा. ९३. १५-16.</F> ^1 भा. V. 1. ३४; M. २४. ५२-3; वा. 1. १५५; ६५. ८४; ९८. २०; Vi. IV. १०. 4, २०.
(II)--a daughter of जयन्ती and a grand- daughter of Indra. M. ४७. १८६.
--four; गन्धर्वास्, आध्यस्, पिशाचास् and अन्तास्; their relative positions and powers. वा. ६९. २०३.
--a son of Devaka. Br. III. ७१. १३०; M. ४४. ७२. Vi. IV. १४. १७.

--one of the seven daughters of Devaka and a queen of Vasudeva; mother of nine sons and a daughter; <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. २३ and ३२; Br. III. ७१. १३१, १६२, १८१; वा. ९६. १३०; Vi. IV. १४. १८.</F> उपासन्गधर was one of her sons. <F>2:  M. ४६. १६.</F>
--the rulers of Kosala, आन्ध्र, पुण्ड्र, ताम्रलिप्त and समतट (Campa-वा। प्।). वा. ९९. ३८५. Vi. IV. २४. ६४.
--a son of Devaka. वा. ९६. १२९.

(I)--a name of सुनस्शेप as he was given back by the Gods to विश्वामित्र; (s.v.) father of याज्ञ- valkya; a कौशिक and a sage; <F>1:  भा. IX. १६. ३०, ३२, ३६; XII. 6. ६४; Br. II. ३२. ११७; III. ६६. ६७; वा. ९१. ९५; Vi. IV. 7. ३७.</F> a ब्रह्मिष्ठ. <F>2:  M. १४५. ११३; १९८. 3.</F> [पगे२-124+ ४१]
(II)--the son of Karambhi(a); (Karam- bhaka-ब्र्। प्।, वा। प्।) and father of देवक्ष(e)tra. भा. IX. २४. 5; Br. III. ७०. ४४; M. ४४. ४२-3; वा. ९५. ४३; Vi. IV. १२. ४१-2.
(III)--a son of Suketu; a great warrior. <F>1:  वा. ८९. 8.</F> father of बृहद्रथ. (बृहदुक्थ. <F>2:  Vi. IV. 5. २५. भा. IX. १३. १४-15; Br. III. ६४. 8.</F> ब्र्। प्।).
(IV)--father of देवश्रव. वा. ९६. १८५.
--the kings after देवरात--सुनस्शेप: of कौशिकगोत्र. Br. III. ६६. ७०; वा. ९१. ९८.
--also देवव्रातपुरम्: town built by the wood-cutter in honour of his Purohita in the latter's name. Br. IV. 7. ३४, ३७.
--a pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. १५.

(I)--a Siddha, and a son of धिषणा and कृशाश्व, and identified with Hari; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. २०; १५. १२; XI. १६. २८.</F> came to see परिक्षित् practising प्रायोपवेश; <F>2:  Ib. I. १९. १०.</F> knew the yoga power of विष्णु; <F>3:  Ib. II. 7. ४५.</F> told शुक्र the story of Citraketu; <F>4:  Ib. VI. १४. 9.</F> cursed हूहू to be born a crocodile; <F>5:  Ib. VIII. 4. 3.</F> did not comprehend Hari's माय, <F>6:  Ib. IX. 4. ५७.</F> came to see कृष्ण at स्यमन्तपञ्चक; <F>7:  Ib. X. ८४. 3.</F> a ब्रह्मवादिन्; <F>8:  M. १४५. १०७.</F> exclusion of marriage alliances with कश्यपस् and Asitas. <F>9:  Ib. १९९. १९.</F>
(II)--a son of प्रत्यूष and father of two sons; <F>1:  Br. III. 3. २७; वा. ६६. २६; Vi. I. १५. ११७.</F> a Vasava. <F>2:  M. 5. २७; २०३. 7.</F> [पगे२-125+ २७]

(III)--a son of Asita and एकपर्णा; <F>1:  Br. III. 8. ३२; १०. १९; वा. ७०. २७; ७२. १७.</F> a Brahma- वादिन् and the best among the शाण्डिल्यस्. <F>2:  Br. II. ३२. ११३; III. 8. ३२; वा. ५९. १०३; ७०. २८.</F>
(IV)--a son of Vasudeva and उपदेवी; (शिशिरा- वती-ब्र्। प्।). Br. III. ७१. १८२; M. ४६. १७.
(V)--father of Sannati, a queen of Brahmadatta, the पाञ्चाल king. M. २०. २६.
(VI)--a son of the श्वेत अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. २०५.
(VII)--the son of पारियात्रक and father of वच्चाल. Vi. IV. 4. १०६.
--of कौशिक gotra. Br. III. ६६. ७२. वा. ९१. १००.
--people living in म्लेच्छ regions and ineligi- ble for श्राद्धा purposes. M. १६. १५.
--seven in number--भू, Bhuva, Sva, Maha, Jana, Tapa and Satya; sacred to इन्द्राणी; residences of देवऋषिस्. M. १३. ५२; ६१. 1-2; वा. ६१. ८८.
--a daughter of बृहस्पति (grand- daughter: वा। प्।), one of the wives of विश्रवस् and mother of वैश्रवण or Kubera and others. Br. III. 8. ३९-40; वा. ७०. ३३.
--a son of Devaka. भा. IX. २४. २२.
--a Maurya king, who ruled for seven years. Br. III. ७४. १४७; वा. ९९. ३३४.
--a territorial division of शाल्मलिद्वीप. भा. V. २०. 9.
(I)--a son of Rudra (putra) सावर्णि (ऋथुसा- वर्ण-वा। प्।) Manu. भा. VIII. १३. २७; Br. IV. 1. ९४; वा. १००. ९८; Vi. III. 2. ३६.
(II)--a son of अक्रूर and उग्रसेनी. भा. IX. २४. १८; Br. III. ७१. ११३; M. ४५. ३१; Vi. IV. १४. १०.
(III)--a son of Devaka. भा. IX. २४. २२; Br. III. ७१. १३०; M. ४४. ७२; Vi. IV. १४. १७.
--a daughter of Meru and queen of केतुमाला. भा. V. 2. २३.
--a name of भीष्म (s.v.); knew the yoga power of विष्णु; <F>1:  भा. I. 9. 1; II. 7. ४४.</F> son of शन्तनु and जाह्नवी. <F>2:  M. ५०. ४५.</F>

--the chief among the Brahmanas who in appreciation of the wood-cutter's charities renamed him [पगे२-127+ २५] Dvijavarma and his wife शीलवती; for this the wood-cutter had a town founded in the Brahmana's name, the Purohita who honoured him with a high status. Br. IV. 7. ३१, ३७.
(I)--a son of शोणाश्व. M. ४४. ७९.
(II)--a disciple of Rathitara (s.v.). वा. ६०. ६६.
(I)--a son of देवमीढ and मारीषा; husband of कम्सवती and father of two sons. भा. IX. २४. २८, ४१. Vi. IV. १४. ३०.
(II)--a कौशिक and a Sage. Br. II. ३२. ११८.
(III)--a son of शूर and भोजा. Br. III. ७१. १४९; M. ४६. 2.
(IV)--the son of देवरात according to the learned. वा. ९६. १८५; Br. III. ७१. १८८.
--a son of Manu रुद्रसावर्णि (ऋथुसा- वर्ण, वा। प्।). भा. VIII. १३. २७; Br. IV. 1. ९४; वा. १००. ९८; Vi. III. 2. ३६.

--is वैकृत: different species: Gods, पितृस्, Asuras, Gandharvas, Apsarasas, Siddhas, यक्षस्, राक्षसस्, [पगे२-128+ ३१] चरणस्, भूतस्, Preta-पिशाचस्, विध्याधरस्, Kinnaras, etc. <F>1:  भा. III. १०. १६, २६-8.</F> The sixth sarga. <F>2:  वा. 6. ६३.</F>
--the thirteenth Manu; father of Citra- sena, and others; Divaspati is Indra. Nirmoka and others were sages; योगेश्वर is Hari's manifestation. भा. VIII. १३. ३०-32.
--a class of पितृस् among whom four divi- sions are distinguished; the past, the future, the elder and the younger. वा. ७१. १५-16.
--a daughter of Indra, married to कुमार. Br. IV. ३०. १०५; M. १५९. 8.
--is Skanda; <F>1:  Br. III. १०. ५०; ७३. ११०.</F> anointed by all the Devas and their गणस्; <F>2:  वा. ३९. ३३; ७२. ४९.</F> as विष्णु. <F>3:  Vi. I. 8. २८.</F>

(I)--heaven, etc. for वर्णाश्रमिस्; eight places beginning with ब्रह्मा and ending with पिशाच; here are अणिमा and seven other ऐश्वर्यस्; there are three गुणस् pervading here--Satva, etc.; realised not by eyes, but by experience. वा. १०२. ९६-8.
(II)--पैशाच, राक्षस, गान्धर्व, Kau- bera, Aindra, Saumya, प्राजापत्य, and ब्राह्म; a yogi must give up all these स्थानस् to attain the Brahmanhood. वा. १२. ३९-42; ६१. १७०; १०२. ९६-8.
--a Pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. १५. [पगे२-129+ ३७]
--bathing a deity; described. M. २६७. 1-३५.
--the entrance on the north side of the city of पुरञ्जन, <F>1:  भा. IV. २५. ५१; २९. १२.</F> allegorically the left ear.

(I)--a daughter of स्वायम्भुव Manu, and sister of Priyavrata and उत्तानपाद; wife of Kardama and mother of Kapila; <F>1:  भा. II. 7. 3; III. १२. २७, ५५-6; २१. 3; २२. 9; VIII. 1. 5.</F> heard of Kardama's greatness from नारद and fixed her mind on him; accepted by Kardama; seeing her playing with balls in her mansion विश्वावसु fell down in a fit of stupour; married Kardama with gifts from her parents; devoted herself to her husband's service like पार्वती to शिव; enjoyed his company in an aerial car well furnished with new cloths and ornaments after her bath in the सरस्वतिसरस्, where she was attended by many maids; roamed in all lovely parks throughout the earth. After a hundred years of enjoyment देवहूती gave birth to nine daughters at a time, when Kardama told her of his depar- ture for yoga; देवहूती requested means for protection of herself and the new-born ones; was told that विष्णु would be born in her womb and he would bring comfort to her. Soon she gave birth to Lord Kapila when ब्रह्मा and other seers called on Kardama. After they left, Kardama got his daughters married, and after praising Kapila, and with his permission he went away for penance. Heard all relating to the साङ्ख्य शास्त्र from Kapila and spoke in praise of him. Following the path prescribed by Kapila she attained निर्- वाण। The place where she attained siddhi became known as शिद्धपद। <F>2:  Ib. VIII. Chh. २२ to २४ (whole); ३३. 1-३१; IV. I. 1 and १०.</F> From her, Hari manifested Himself for imparting धर्म and ज्ञान। <F>3:  Ib. VIII. 1. 5.</F>
(II)--the wife of पुरूरवस्. वा. 2. १६. [पगे२-130+ २२]
--the father of योगेश्वर. भा. VIII. १३. ३२.
--in the सालग्राम; here नागराट् takes the पिण्ड of the deserving and rejects that of the undeserving. Br. III. १३. ९०.
--playing grounds of the Devas--four; Caitraratha,^8 Nandana, वैभ्राज and Saviturvana (garden of the Sun). वा. ३६. १०.
--abodes of the Devas; meddling with, was punished by death. M. २२७. १७४.
(I)--a son of Krodhana and father of ऋष्य. भा. IX. २२. ११. Vi. IV. २०. 5.
(II)--a son of Akrodhana. M. ५०. ३७; वा. ९९. २३२.
(I)--a Mt. in कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १५.
(II)--a son of क्षेमधन्व and father of अनीह (अहीनगु-ब्र्। प्।, अहीनक-वि। प्।). भा. IX. १२. 2; Br. III. ६३. २०३; M. १२. ५३; वा. ८८. २०३; Vi. IV. 4. १०६. [पगे२-131+ ३२]
(III)--a son of (Dharma) सावर्ण Manu. वा. १००. ८४. Vi. III. 2. ३२.
--a son of Auttama Manu. वा. ६२. ३४.
--a son of कालनेमि. Br. III. 5. ३९; वा. ६७. ८०.

(I)--a son of प्रतीप and brother of शन्तनु; renounced the home and turned मुनि; requested by शन्तनु to take up the throne; he spoke impeaching the Vedas. He took to yoga living in कलापग्राम. He was to establish the Lunar race in the कृत Yuga; Purohita of the Devas; <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. १२-18; XII. 2. ३७; वा. ९९. २३४.</F> un- acceptable to the people as he suffered from leprosy. <F>2:  M. ५०. ३९-41; २७३. ५६.</F> A राजऋषि and a gotrapravartaka of the Treta yuga <F>3:  वा. ३२. ३९.</F> and a Paurava.

(II)--a Paurava king who continues to live in Kali in कलापग्राम; क्षत्रप्रणेतार in the २४थ् Catur- yuga. Originator of क्षत्रियस् in the कृत. <F>1:  वा. ९९. ४३७-8; Vi. IV. २४-118.</F> A son of Pra- तीप. Even as a child retired to forest. The famine in his brother Santanu's (s.v) kingdom was said to be due to his elder brother देवापि having been passed over for succes- sion. Infected with heretical views through the minister of शन्तनु by means of ascetics in the forest; thus disquali- fied for the throne. <F>2:  Vi. IV. २०. 9-३०.</F>
--a Mt. with a Janapada on it; afraid of Hira- ण्यकशिपु's prowess. M. १६३. ८८. [पगे२-132+ २८]
--a son of Uttama Manu. Br. II. ३६. ३९.
--a great forest on the banks of the लौहित्या lake. वा. ४७. ११.
--one of the ten sons of हृदीक. Father of कम्बलबर्हिष. M. ४४. ८२-3; वा. ९६. १३९; Vi. IV. १४. २४.
--a Mt. of क्रौञ्चद्वीप. M. १२२. ८२.

(I)--a son of सात्वत and father of Babhru; equal to Gods; <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. 6-१०; Vi. IV. १३. 1-3.</F> sonless he performed penance on the banks of the पर्णाशा (s.v.) which became transformed into a maid, married him and became mother of Babhru. <F>2:  Br. III. ७१. १६-15; M. ४४. ४७-59; वा. ९६. 6-१५.</F> The वायु पुराण says that when he made austerities, he touched the waters of the सवऋणा when सावित्री appeared as a lady, received his तेजस् and brought forth a good son in the ninth month. This was Babhru. <F>2:  Br. III. ७१. १६-15; M. ४४. ४७-59; वा. ९६. 6-१५.</F> Belonged to the Anu line and was much praised by poets and scholars. ६६०८ disciples of his, obtained immortality. <F>3:  Vi. IV. १३. 6.</F>
--the homes of the nine planets; <F>1:  Br. II. २३. ९५; वा. ५२. ८५.</F> temples visited by परशुराम; <F>2:  Br. III. २४. ४१; २७. ११; IV. ३८. ५७; M. ९६. २५; २५७. 6.</F> see also देवगृहस्.
--building of temples, an act of cha- rity. Br. IV. 7. ३३.

--consequent on the Asuras not obtaining अमृत for all their labours in the अमृतमथन, war broke out. It was on the seashore and mainly a hand- to-hand fight; description of; at last Indra invoked Hari, who appeared on the scene and on him कालनेमि flung his शूल; with the same weapon Hari flung him down; so also माल्य- van, मालि and सुमालि were put to death. Fight continued till नारद stopped it. <F>1:  भा. VIII. १०. (whole); ११. 1-४४; वा. ९२. ७६.</F> Twelve in number, after which the whole earth and यज्ञ came over to the Devas. <F>2:  Br. III. ७२. ७०, १०६.</F> Hearing the Asuras slain by Hari, Diti went to the earth and performed मदनद्वादशि व्रतम् to get able bodied sons to kill Indra; <F>3:  M. 7. 2-7.</F> one, of three hundred years between Indra and प्रह्लाद. Indra with the help of Raji, a son of आयु vanquished him. <F>4:  M. २४. ३७-8; ७०. २६-32.</F> Asuras under ह्राद vanquished the Gods after the battle which continued for a hundred divine years. The gods withdrew to the north of the milky ocean and prayed to विष्णु for suc- cour. The latter deluded the Asuras in मायामोह form and the Asuras were defeated. <F>5:  Vi. III. १७. 9-४४; १८. ३४-36.</F>
--the brother of Vasudeva. वा. ९६. १४७. [पगे२-134+ २५]
(II)--a sacred तीर्थ, where there is a well by name वृष; <F>1:  Br. III. १३. ४१; वा. ७७. ४१.</F> on her banks was वीरनगर. <F>2:  Vi. II. १५. 6.</F>
--a तीर्थम् sacred to नन्दिनी. M. १३. ३८.
--sacred to ललिता-pi1t2ham. Br. IV. ४४. ९६.
(I)--the first charioteer; a शक्ति. Br. IV. 6. १७; २०. ९१.
(III)--an Apsaras. वा. ६९. 6.
--the observance of this vow leads to the world of लक्ष्मी. M. १०१. ५९.
--utterance of, in दीक्षा। Br. IV. ४३. ११.
--Gods of prime importance, of secondary importance; share in sacrifices; they are Gurus, Lords, Kings and Forefathers; protect the subjects. वा. ६४. २१-23.
--वैभ्राज, Surabhi, Caitraratha, विशोक, Sumana and Nandana gardens. Br. III. 7. १०१-2.
--in सिद्धिक्षेत्र; here ईश्वर performed austerities standing on one leg. वा. ७७. ८१.
--regions different from राष्ट्रस् and Janapadas. Br. III. ५०. 6.
--a provincial or District Governor; acquainted with the produce of the देश and expert in con- trolling officials and keeping accounts. M. २१५. १७.
--ordinary teachers. Br. IV. 8. 5.
--Guru. Br. IV. ४३. 7.
(I)--human body; as a temple; philosophical interpretation of. Br. IV. ४३. ५३-54 ff. [पगे२-136+ २४]
(II)--one of the twenty अमिताभ gan2as. वा. १००. १७.
--a Yogasiddhi. Br. IV. ३६. ५३.
--an अमिताभ God. Br. IV. 1. १७.
--the Asuras from Diti; <F>1:  वा. ६६. 1.</F> one of the Marut गणस्. <F>2:  वा. ४६. ३५; ६७. १२९.</F>
--astrologers, residences of. M. २५४. २६.
--a Vasu; husband of शर्वरी and father of शिम्- शुमार; a कला of विष्णु. भा. VI. 6. ११-14.
--a queen of पुष्पार्ण and mother of प्रदोष, निशिथ and व्युष्ठ. भा. IV. १३. १३-14.
--in honour of दुर्गा. Br. IV. ३८. 5.
--to be worshipped in house-building. M. २५३. २६. [पगे२-137+ २४]
--palace officials. M. २१५. ३०.
--is Bharata (s.v.) noted for his sacrifices and love of people; परीक्षित् compared to him. भा. I. १२. २०.
--a सुधर्माण God. Br. IV. 1. ६१.
(II)--(वसिष्ठ): a Sage of the 4th सावर्ण epoch; <F>1:  Br. IV. 1. ९१.</F> of the १२थ् epoch of Manu. <F>2:  Vi. III. 2. ३५.</F>
(III)--one of the २० Sutapa गणस्. वा. १००. १४.
(I)--a Sage of the ninth Manvantara. भा. VIII. १३. १९; Vi. III. 2. २३.
(II)--a यक्ष; a son of पुण्यजनी and मणिभद्र. Br. III. 7. १२५; वा. ६९. १५६.
(III)--a Mt. in कुशद्वीप; same as बलाहक. M. १२२. ५५; Vi. II. 4. ४१.
(IV)--a son of प्राण and father of राजवन्. Vi. I. १०. 5. [पगे२-138+ २६]
(V)--a son of Priyavrata; became king of क्रौञ्चद्वीप. Vi. II. 1. 7, १४.
--a son of द्युतिमान्. वा. २८. 7.
(I)--a son of प्राण (पाण्डु-वा। प्।) and पुण्डरीका; father of two sons. Br. II. ११. ४०; वा. २८. 7, ३५.

(II)--one of the ten sons of Kardama and king of क्रौञ्चद्वीप which he divided among his seven sons कुशल, Manomaya, उष्ण, पावन, अन्धकार, Muni, and Dundubhi; ruled kingdoms after their names. Br. II. १४. 9, १३, २२-23; वा. ३३. 9.
(III)--Mt. a hill of कुशद्वीप. Br. II. १९. ५५; वा. ४९. ५०.
(IV)--a God of the आभूतरय group. Br. II. ३६. ५६.
(V)--(Angiras); a Sage of the Rohita epoch. Br. IV. 1. ६३.
(VI)--a God of the सुतारा group (सुपार: वा। प्।). Br. IV. 1. ८९; वा. १००. ९४.
(VII)--a son of स्वायम्भुव Manu. M. 9. 5; वा. ३१. १८. Br. II. १३. १०४.
(VIII)--Mt. a hill in यमद्वीप. वा. ४८. १९. [पगे२-139+ २८]
--left her consort विभावसु and loved Soma with eight other Devis. M. २३. २४.
(I)--one of the seven sons of वसिष्ठ; <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ४१.</F> a friend who accompanied पुरञ्जन when he went to Vibh- राजित. <F>2:  Ib. IV. २५. ४७.</F>
(II)--a son of स्वारोचिष Manu. भा. VIII. 1. १९.
(III)--a son of दिवोदास and father of Alarka and others; (also known as Pratardana, शत्रुजित्, Vatsa, ऋतध्वज, and कुवलयाश्व). भा. IX. १७. 6.
(IV)--the minister of शाल्व, hit Pradyumna with his गद, but killed by the latter. भा. X. ७६. २६. २७; ७७. 1-3.
(I)--दृढसेन-ब्र्। प्।) the son of शम, and father of Sumati. भा. IX. २२. ४८.

(II)--father of सत्यवान्; losing his eye- sight and consequently his kingdom, took to forest life; got back his sight due to the grace of the God of death at the request of सावित्री. M. २०८. १४-16; २१४. १०.
(III)--a son of Trinetra; ruled for forty- eight years. M. २७१. २७. [पगे२-140+ २६]
(I)--a son of चाक्षुस Manu. भा. IV. १३. १६.
(II)--one of the ten branches of the Sukar- मान group of Devas. Br. IV. 1. ८८; वा. १००. ९२.
--son of Asanga. M. ४५. २३.
--gambling; an अधर्म and of Kali; <F>1:  भा. I. १७. ३८;</F> of Bala- deva and Rukmin. <F>2:  Vi. V. २८. १२.</F>
--one of the twenty Sutapa Gods. Br. IV. 1. १५; वा. १००. १५.
--sky; presented flowers to पृथु on his accession. भा. IV. १५. १८.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८५.
--a सुधर्माण god. Br. IV. 1. ६०.

(I)--the kingdom of Malayadhvaja पाण्ड्य; the country in which there is वेन्कट; <F>1:  भा. IV. २८. ३०; VIII. 4. 7; X. ७९. १३.</F> praise of Hari pre- valent here in Kali; <F>2:  Ib. XI. 5. ३९.</F> conquered by Kalki. <F>3:  Br. III. ३५. १०; ७३. १०७.</F> [पगे२-141+ २४]
(II)--a son of कृष्ण and जाम्बवती. भा. X. ६१. १२.
--people of Dravida; S. India; see दक्षि- णात्यास्; <F>1:  Br. II. ३१. ८२; वा. ५८. ८२; ९८. १०७.</F> ineligible for श्राद्ध; <F>2:  M. १६. १६.</F> country of. <F>3:  Ib. १४४. ५६.</F>
--a daughter of तृणबिन्दु and mother of विश्रवस्. वा. ८६. १६.
--see Satyavrata. भा. VIII. २४. १३; IX. 1. 2.
(I)--a son of पृथु and Arcis; was entrusted with the northern kingdom by his elder brother. भा. IV. २२. ५४; २४. 2.
(II)--Mt. a hill of कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १५.
(III)--a तुषित God. Br. II. ३६. १०.
(IV)--a son of Dhara, a Vasava. Br. III. 3. २२; M. 5. २३; २०३. 4; वा. ६६. २१.
(V)--a son of Dharma. Vi. I. १५. ११३. [पगे२-142+ ३१]
--a class of people in क्रौञ्चद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २२.
--a son of वसोर्धारा and Agni; a Vasu. भा. VI. 6. १३.
--Mt. in the west that entered the sea for fear of Indra. M. १२१. ७५.
--a वर्ण S4akti; <F>1:  Br. IV. ४४. ५८;</F> on the third parva of the Geyacakraratha. <F>2:  Ib. १९. ६५.</F>
--a मुद्रा; here are अष्ट S4aktis commencing with Kusuma praying to ललिता. Br. IV. ३६. ७३.
--the wife of Nakta and mother of Gaya. भा. V. १५. 6.

--a son of पृषत and father of द्रौपदी, धृष्टद्युम्न and others; king of the पाञ्चालस्; <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. 2; X. ५२. ११ [8]. वा. ९९. २१०; Vi. IV. १९. ७३.</F> stationed by जरासन्ध at the northern gate of मथुरा; <F>2:  भा. X. ५०. ११ [7].</F> stationed at the southern gate during the siege of Gomanta; <F>3:  Ib. X. ५२. ११ [8].</F> had been bound by the young पाण्डवस्; <F>4:  Ib. X. [५६ (V) 2].</F> in the स्वयम्वर he held, Arjuna hit the mark in the form of a fish and won Drau- पदी; <F>5:  Ib. I. १५. 7.</F> joined the पाण्डवस् in the कुरुक्षेत्र battle; <F>6:  Ib. X. ७८ [(९५ V) १०].</F> went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for solar eclipse. <F>7:  Ib. X. ८२. २५.</F> [पगे२-143+ ४२]

--the king of the किम्पुरुषस् and Kinnaras (s.v.) stationed on the west during the siege of Gomanta; <F>1:  भा. X. ५२. ११ [११]. वा. ४१. ३०.</F> stationed by जरासन्ध at the western gate of मथुरा; <F>2:  Ib. X. ५० 11 [5].</F> attended the conference at कुण्डीन summoned by शाल्व. <F>3:  Ib. X. ७६. 2 [9-१०].</F>

--a Gandharva and a son of ऋषभ and a sage who was a भागवत; in the guise of Ugrasena became the father of Kamsa; <F>1:  भा. V. 4. ११; XI. 2. २१; X. ३६. २४ [१०-26].</F> discoursed to Nimi on the अवतार्स् of Hari with different purposes. <F>2:  Ib. XI. 4. (whole).</F>

--a son of ययाति and सर्मिष्ठा and father of Babhru and Satu; <F>1:  भा. IX. १८, ३३ and ४१; २३. १४; Br. I. 1. १३३; वा. 1. १५६; ९३. १७; ९९. 7; Vi. IV. १७. 1.</F> after being refused by Yadu and Turvasu approached by ययाति; he also declined to part with his youth to his father and was therefore cursed to have no pleasures in life and to be wandering about the countries and oceans with no settled kingdom; <F>2:  M. २४. ५४; ३२. १०; २३. १६-20; वा. ४५. ५०; Vi. IV. १०. 6, १३.</F> became over-lord of the south-eastern (west ब्र्। प्।, वा। प्। and वि। प्।) part of the kingdom; <F>3:  M. ३४. ३०; वा. ४५. ९०; Vi. १०. ३१.</F> from him begins the Bhoja line. <F>4:  M. ४८. 6.</F>

(I)--married कृपी, and was the father of अश्वत्थाम. <F>1:  भा. I. 7. २७; IX. २१. ३६. Vi. IV. १९. ६८; V. ३५. 5, २७.</F> Taught Dhanurveda to the पाण्डवस् but served Duryodhana's army, succeeding भीष्म as com- mander, and after a five days' battle was killed by धृष्टद्- yumna; <F>2:  भा. I. १५. १५-16; X. ७८ [(९५ (V) १६], २९-36.</F> met by कृतवर्मन्, कृष्ण and राम. <F>3:  Ib. X. ५२. [५६ (V) 4], १२; ५७. 2.</F> Informed by Uddhava of राम's visit to हस्तिनापुर; invited for the [पगे२-144+ २५] राजसुय of युधिष्ठिर. <F>4:  Ib. X. ६८. १७ and २८; ७४. १०.</F> Went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for solar eclipse and met there कृष्ण and the वृष्णिस्. <F>5:  Ib. X. ८२. २४; ८४. ५७, ६९ [1].</F> आचार्य of the पाण्डवस् and the Kurus. <F>6:  M. १०३. 5.</F> Baladeva's respect for. <F>7:  Vi. V. ३५. ३६; ३८. १६, ४७, ६४.</F>
(II)--Mt. in भारतवर्ष, touching the sea; <F>1:  भा. V. १९. १६; Br. II. १८. ७६.</F> entered the waters for fear of Indra. <F>2:  M. १२१. ७३.</F>
(III)--a Vasu born as Nanda; his wife was अभिमती, and sons were हर्ष, शोक, Bhaya and others. भा. VI. 6. ११; X. 8. ४८-50.

(IV)--Mt. a hill of शाल्मलिद्वीप (कुशद्वीप- म्। प्।) noted for great medicinal plants, विशल्यकरणी and मृतसन्जीविनि, capable of bringing back the dead to life. Br. II. १९. ३८-39; वा. ४९. ३५; Vi. II. 4. २६; M. १२२. ५६.
(V)--one of the seven Pralaya clouds. M. 2. 8.
(VI)--a measure of grain. M. ८३. १२; ८४. 2.
(I)--(also द्रौणि) the future Veda व्यास in द्वापर yuga. Br. II. ३५. १२५; Vi. III. 3. २१; वा. ६१. १०४. [पगे२-145+ ३९]
(II)--a Sage of the 8th epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. १७.
--an आर्षेय pravara of भार्गवस्. M. १९५. ४१.
--see द्रोणि. Br. IV. 1. १२.

--the daughter of यज्ञसेन-Draupada, queen of the पाण्डवस् and mother of five sons born to five brothers: Prativindhya to युधिष्ठिर, श्रुतसेन to भीम, श्रुतकीर्ति to Arjuna, श्रुतानीक to Nakula and श्रुतकर्म to Sahadeva; <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. 2, २८; M. ५०. ५१; वा. ९९. २४६; Vi. IV. २०. ४१-2;</F> paid respects to कृष्ण; being newly married was bashful; <F>2:  भा. X. ५८. 5.</F> consoled by कृष्ण and सत्यभामा when banished to forest with her husbands; <F>3:  Ib. X. ६४. १०.</F> joy at कृष्ण's visit to Indraprastha; welcomed रुक्मिणी and the other wives of कृष्ण; served food, etc., in the राजसूय; performed अवभृत with युधिष्ठिर after the राजसूय; Duryodhana's mind on; laughed at Duryodhana's fall in the सभा of Maya; <F>4:  Ib. X. ७१. ४१-3; ७५ (whole).</F> asked कृष्ण's wives about their marriage when all met at Syaman- तपञ्चक and was lost in wonder. <F>5:  Ib. X. ८३. 6-7; ८४. 1;</F> Her sons were killed while asleep by अश्वत्थाम; when the murderer was brought before her, she ordered his release as he was a Brahmana and the son of the preceptor; followed the funeral party to the Ganges for the cremation of her dead sons; <F>6:  Ib. I. 7. १४ to the end; 8. 1 and 3, १७; १०. 9;</F> was one among the party that welcomed Vidura; <F>7:  Ib. I. १३. 4.</F> out of devotion to वासुदेव attained His lotus feet. <F>8:  Ib. I. १५. ५०.</F> Felt sorry for the loss of Duryodhana and others. <F>9:  M. १०३. १२; ११२. 1; २४४. 4.</F>
--name and form; a vain अर्थवाद. भा. XI. २८. ३७. [पगे२-146+ ४७]
--an epithet of the Sun god. Br. III. ५९. ७६; IV. ३४. ७५.
--Those who medidate on the १२ letters are not re-born. Vi. I. 6. ४०; १२. ९७.
--the day of the birth of वामन--Hari. भा. VIII. १८. 6.
--अम्बरीष observed this vow for a year and ended it in the month of कृत्तिक by bathing in the यमुना. भा. IX. 4. २९-30.

--Its nature; worship of Hari by ser- vice; <F>1:  भा. XII. 2. ३९; 3. २२-52.</F> form of Hari as worshipped in; <F>2:  Ib. XI. 5. २७-31.</F> पराशर taught भागवत to his son in this yuga; <F>3:  Ib. 1. 4. १४; II. 1. 8.</F> a वैश्य among the yugas; a period of wars. <F>4:  वा. ७८. ३६-7.</F> Here Vyasa incarnates; duration of; <F>5:  M. ५३. 9; १४२. १७, २३ and २६; १४४. 1-5; वा. 3. २१; ३२. ६१.</F> यज्ञ the chief thing besides war; a combination of रजस् and तमस्; <F>6:  Br. II. 7. २१; वा. 8. ६६.</F> in the second द्वापर Dhanvantari took birth as a man; <F>7:  Ib. ९२. १७.</F> Dharma's state of anxiety; श्मृति and श्रुति quoted as authorities; but different opinions advanced. Rise of the शाखस्, and the Angas. <F>8:  Ib. ५८. 3-२९.</F>

--(also द्वारवती and कुशस्थली). Capital of कृष्ण, built for him by Revata in the midst of sea 1(1/2) miles in circumference according to वास्तु rules and well furnish- ed, for fear from कालयवन; <F>1:  भा. I. 8. १०-27; ११. २५; १२. ३६; १३. १६; १४. 1-6; X. ५०. ४९-57; IX. 3. २८; Br. III. ७१. ६२-85; M. 4. १८; २४६. ८९; Vi. IV. 1. ९१; १३. १९; V. २३. १३-15.</F> sacred to Hari. <F>2:  भा. VII. १४. ३१.</F> कृष्ण releas- ed नृग in; <F>3:  Ib. X. ३७. १७-20.</F> कृष्ण carried the spoils of war with the Yava- nas to that place; <F>4:  Ib. X. ५२. 5;</F> return of कृष्ण and राम to, after being besieged by जरासन्ध at Gomanta. <F>5:  Ib. X. ५२. १३-14 [1]; [५६ (V) 7].</F> Left by अक्रूर, when the city had no rains; hence कृष्ण sent for him; <F>6:  Ib. X. ५७. २९-34.</F> कृष्ण and [पगे२-147+ ५७] सात्यकी returned from हस्तिनापुर to; <F>7:  Ib. X. ५८. २८.</F> here were sent १६००० maidens of Naraka's harem and ६४ elephants of the ऐरावत line; <F>8:  Ib. X. ५९. ३६-7.</F> reached by कृष्ण and सत्यभामा after the fight for the पारिजाता; <F>9:  Ib. X. [६७ (V) ३८-40].</F> arrival of Aniruddha's marriage party from भोजकट; <F>१०:  Ib. X. ६१. ४०.</F> visited by चित्रलेखा; <F>११:  Ib. X. ६२. २२. ६४ [११]; Vi. V. ३२. २८-30.</F> besieged by पौण्- ड्रक; <F>१२:  भा. X. ६६. [1 and १३].</F> described when visited by नारद, as containing ९००,000 houses; <F>१३:  Ib. X. ६९. 3-7;</F> शम्ब and others reached द्वारका after युधिष्ठिर's राजसूय. <F>१४:  Ib. X. ७५. २९.</F> Blockaded by शाल्व, and defended by Pradyumna and others; <F>१५:  Ib. X. ७६. 8-१४.</F> reached by कृष्ण after the कुरुक्षेत्र war; city described; <F>१६:  Ib. X. ८०. [8-१२]; ८२. 1.</F> reached by कृष्ण and his party after a long stay at स्यमन्तपञ्चक; <F>१७:  Ib. X. ८४. ७०.</F> कृष्ण per- formed the अश्वमेध here; <F>१८:  Ib. X. ८९. २२. [1]; ९०. 1.</F> visited by sages from पिण्डा- raka, कुरुक्षेत्र and other places and filled with Brahma- घोष; <F>१९:  Ib. X. २८. 1-१३.</F> नारद lived there for a time to worship कृष्ण; <F>२०:  Ib. XI. 2. 1.</F> visited by ब्रह्मा and other gods to invite कृष्ण to go back to वैकुण्ठ; <F>२१:  Ib. XI. 6. 1-4.</F> evil omens in the city; people, advised by कृष्ण, left for प्रभासा. <F>२२:  Ib. XI. 6. ३३-35; ३०. 1, 5, १०.</F> दारुक informs Vasudeva and others of कृष्ण's condition and राम's entry to his धाम; <F>२३:  Ib. XI. ३१. १५-17.</F> swallowed up by the sea excepting कृष्ण's mansion; <F>२४:  Ib. XI. 7. 3; ३१. २३; XII. १२. ६०; Vi. V. ३७. ३६; ३०. 9-१०.</F> a पितृ Ti1rtham; <F>२५:  M. २२. ३८.</F> represents the neck of the Vedas. <F>२६:  वा. ९६. ६०; १०४. ७६.</F> पारिजात of heaven taken to. <F>२७:  Vi. V. ३१. १०-11.</F>

--a description of, on the gate-way to शिव's abode; tiger's skin as clothing and holding त्रिशूल and पट्टिश; <F>1:  Br. III. ३२. १२-16.</F> eight of them invoked in tank rituals. <F>2:  M. ५८. ११-12.</F> [पगे२-148+ ३०]

(I)--(द्वारका s.v.); a great city of वासु- deva inhabited by Bhoja, वृष्णि and the Andhakas; <F>1:  Br. III. ६१. २३; वा. ८६. २७; ९६. ४६.</F> capital of कृष्ण; <F>2:  Br. III. ७१. ४८; M. १३. ३८; ६९. 9. Vi. V. ३३. १० ff.</F> and abode of रुक्मिणी.
(II)--the wife of भन्गकार. वा. ९६. ५४.
--the duration of the New Moon day when पितृस् drink सुधामृत. वा. ५२. ३८; ५६. २७.
--a son of Surasena. वा. ९९. ११२.
--the birth place of पुरूरवस् as a Brah- mana in his previous birth. As a result of द्वादशीव्रत and prayer to जनार्दन he attained a kingdom in the next birth. M. ११५. १०-12.
--(Brahmabandhu); debarred from त्रयी; exempt from capital punishment; subject to punishment of Vapana, confiscation of property and banishment, but not corporal punishment. भा. I. 4. २५; 7. ५३-57.
--one of the three sons of Hastin and father of यवीनर. V. IV. १९. २९, ४८; वा. ९९. १६६. [पगे२-149+ २९]
--the name given to the wood-cutter by the Brahmanas for his great charities. Br. IV. 7. ३५.

--the first three castes socalled for following the common and special धर्मस् ordained. <F>1:  वा. ५९. २१.</F> Insult among themselves and to members of other castes punished; <F>2:  M. २२७. ७२.</F> also ruled as kings. <F>3:  Vi. IV. २४. ६८.</F>
--came to see कृष्ण at स्यमन्तपञ्चक. भा. X. ८४. 5.
--a name of विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ६६ and ६९.
--a period of ब्रह्मा's life. भा. XII. 4. 5.
--a name of विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ६८.
--a son of Hastin and father of यवीनर. भा. IX. २१. २१, २७; M. ४९. ४३; वा. ९९. १६६.
--a स्वरशक्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ५६.

--an Asura, and a son of Danu; a follower of वृत्र; his battle with Indra; took part in the देवासुर war between Bali and Indra; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ३०; १०. १९; VII. 2. 4; VIII. १०. २०. वा. ६८. 4; Br. III. 6. 4; Vi. I. २१. 4.</F> milkman of the Asuras to milk the cow-earth; assisted in the churning of the ocean. <F>2:  M. 6. १७; १०. २१; २४९. ६७.</F> [पगे२-150+ २७]
--a son of यज्ञश्री and father of चन्दश्री. Vi. IV. २४. ४८.
--Mt. a hill. वा. ४२. ७०.

--the New Moon day; two लवस् with Anumati in the evening and with राक in the afternoon; the moon touches the sun for two लवस् in one full day and that period is fit for sacrificial rituals; the समुद्र of Kuhu and सिनिवालि. Br. II. २८. १०, ३८, ६०. वा. ५६. 9, ३५, ५२, ५५ and ५७.
(I)--an Asura, and a friend of Kamsa; vanquished by कृष्ण. भा. III. 3. ११; X. 2. 1; ३६. ३५; Br. III. ७३. ९९; वा. ९८. १००.

(II)--a वानर friend of Naraka; a minister of सुग्रीव and brother of Mainda; wanted to avenge his friend's death; went about destroying आनर्तस् and cities belonging to कृष्ण and met राम at the Raivata hill. There he offended him by grinning, breaking his wine pot and insulting his fair companions. This resulted in battle in which after a bold stand Dvivida fell dead. भा. X. ६७. 2-२६; Br. III. 7. २४२. Vi. V. Ch. ३६ (whole).
(III)--Mt. a hill in क्रौञ्चद्वीप. Br. II. १९. ६८.

--Island, as the cause of the देवासुर war; thousands in number, but seven are distinguished; <F>1:  Br. III. ७२. ७१; M. ११३. 4-5; १२३. ३५.</F> ety. water on both sides. <F>2: M. १२३. ३५; वा. ४९. १३२.</F>
--seven in number; प्लक्ष, शाल्मली, कुश, क्रौञ्च, शाक, पुष्कर and Jambu; description of. भा. IV. २१. १२; VIII. १९. २३; V. २० (whole); Br. II. १९. १३६.
--born of Hari and Pulaha; a वानरजाति. Br. III. 7. १७६, ३१९.

--(कृष्णद्वैपायन) the name of व्यास in the २८थ् Dva1para; also कृष्ण by the sixth अम्श; the अवतार् of the Lord. योगात्म; the son of पराशर; <F>1:  M. १६४. १७; १७१. ६४; २०१. ३१; वा. ६०. ११.</F> called his son शुक when he renounced the world at an early age; <F>2:  भा. I. 2. 2; १९. १०; II. 1. 8; VI. 8. १९; १४. 9.</F> invited for the राजसूय; <F>3:  भा. X. ७४. 7.</F> came to स्यमन्तपञ्चक to see कृष्ण and left the place; <F>4:  Ib. X. ८४. 3 and ५७.</F> heard the ब्र्। पुराण from जातु- कर्णि and narrated it to सूत; <F>5:  Br. I. 1. ११-14; II. ३५. १२४; ३४. ११; IV. 4. ६६.</F> the Purohita of Buddha, the ninth incarnation of Hari. <F>6:  M. ४७. २४७; ६९. 8.</F>
--a Pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. १९.
--(कौलीनस्)--belonging to two castes like the Brahmanas and क्षत्रियस्; a gotra. M. ४९. ३३; १९६. ५२. [पगे२-152+ ३२]
(I)--a son of Drumada and father of कृत- वीर्य and others. भा. IX. २३. २३.
(II)--a Sage of the तामस epoch. Vi. III. 1. १८.
(III)--a son of Durdama, and father of four sons. Vi. IV. ११. १०.
(I)--a name of Arjuna, son of Indra and पृथा, equal to शक्र in prowess. भा. I. 7. ५०; Br. III. ७१. १५४; M. ४६. 9; वा. ९६ 153; ९९. २४५; Vi. V. ३८. २७.

(II)--a काद्रवेय; an eminent नाग of पाताल, presiding over the month, Tapas; <F>1:  भा. V. २४. ३१; XII. ११. ३९; वा. ६९. ७०; Vi I. २१. २२.</F> in Tatvalam; <F>2:  Br. II. २०. १८; २३. १४; III. 7. ३४.</F> used for horses for त्रिपुरारि's chariot; shaken by हिरण्यकशिपु <F>3:  M. 6. ३९; १२६. १५; १३३. ३३; १६३. ५६.</F> in the Atalam <F>4:  वा. ५०. १८.</F> with the Sun in the शरत्. <F>5:  वा. ५२. १४; Vi. II. १०. ११.</F>

(III)--a कौशिक and a Sage; the १६थ् Veda व्यास: <F>1:  Br. II. ३२. ११८; M. १४५. ११३; Vi. III. 3. १५.</F> Heard the ब्र्। पुराण from त्रय्यारुणि and narrated it to कृतम्जय; <F>2:  Br. II. ३५. १२०; IV. 4. ५२.</F> heard the वायु पुराण from त्रय्यारुणि. <F>3:  वा. १०३. ६३.</F> [पगे२-153+ २५]
(V)--a son of विश्वामित्र. Vi. IV. 7. ३८.
(I)--Kubera (s.v.) son of विश्रवा. भा. IX. 2. ३२. Vi. III. 2. ११.
(III)--a Marut of the III गण. Br. III. 5. ९४.
--the third king after नखवान् of विदिश. Br. III. ७४. १८१; वा. ९९. ३६८.
--wealth, acquired by industry and labour stays long; a windfall should be spent righteously. Br. IV. 7. २१; M. ३१. २२.
--a name of Kubera. Br. III. २४. 4.
(I)--see Kubera <F>1:  M. १४८. ८५; १५०. १२; १५९. 9.</F> (s.v.); the king of the यक्षस्; <F>2:  वा. ४१. 4.</F> गडा, his weapon; in charge of eight निधिस्। <F>3:  Ib. ४१. १०-11.</F>
(II)--Treasury officer. M. २१५. ३२. [पगे२-154+ २७]
--a son of पुरूरवस् and उर्वशी. M. २४. ३३.

--the constellation on the सिम्शुमार <F>1:  भा. V. २३. 6; वा. ६६. ५१; ८२. १२.</F> in the Dhruva मण्डल; good for श्राद्ध offering; <F>2:  Br. II. २४. १३४; III. १८. ११; Vi. III. १४. १६.</F> inauspicious for house-building. <F>3:  M. २५७. 1.</F>
(I)--a son of सृन्जय, brother of Vasudeva. Br. III. ७१. १९३.
(II)--a son of शमीक. M. ४६. २७.
--a son of शम्भु. वा. ६७. ८१.
--one of six kinds of fortresses; others are महीदुर्ग, Naradurga, वार्क्षदुर्ग, Ambudurga and Giri- durga. M. २१७. 6.
--equal in measurement to yuga and नालिक; four हस्तस्। वा. 8. १०२, १०६; १०१. १२५.
--Festival of arms--arranged by Kamsa to destroy कृष्ण and राम. Vi. V. १५. 8 and १५. [पगे२-155+ ३१]
--(also Dhanurmakha) A sacrifice of the bow in honour of शिव; conducted by Kamsa at मथुरा, visited by कृष्ण and राम; Kamsa's. bow broken and the guards killed. भा. X. ३६. २६-37; ४२. १५-20.

--the science of war; taught by द्रोण to the पाण्डवस्; <F>1:  वा. ६१. ७९. ९१. ९१. Vi. III. 6. २८; IV. १९. ६०. भा. I. 7. ४४; III. १२. ३८. M. 4. ४७; ५०. 9.</F> सत्यधृति well versed in; <F>2:  भा. IX. २१. ३५; M. २१५. 8.</F> learnt by कृष्ण and राम; <F>3:  भा. X. ४५. ३४; Br. II. ३५. ८८; ३७. २७.</F> personified, <F>4:  Ib. IV. १७. ३८-41; M. २२०. 2.</F> knowledge of, essential to a king; प्राचेतसस् was an expert in; <F>5:  Vi. I. १४. 6.</F> variety and detail of. <F>6:  Ib. V. २१. २१.</F>
--a son of सत्यधृति. M. ५०. ३०.
--the end of a bow; <F>1:  वा. ६२. १६९.</F> used by वैण्यपृथु to level the earth by removing mountains and make it habitable. <F>2:  Br. II. ३६. १९५; M. १०. ३१.</F>
--a pole from the term धनुर्दण्ड, ९६ angulas in measurement. Two of them measure one नालि, and ८००० one yojana. Br. I. 7. ९६, १००; IV. 2. १२४-6; वा. १०१. १२४.
(I)--a monkey chief. Br. III. 7. २४४.
(II)--an epithet of Kubera. Vi. V. ३०. ६१. [पगे२-156+ २६]
--a Goddess of wealth. भा. VI. १९. २६.
--a R. rising on the हिमालयस्. M. ११४. २२.
(I)--the वैश्य caste of क्रौञ्चद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ५३.
(II)--a daughter of Manas; wife of Dhruva; gave birth to a son शिष्ट. M. 4. ३८.
(I)--a son of दीर्घतपस्. Br. III. ६७. 7.
(II)--the place with water at all times, suit- able for fortresses. वा. 8. ९८.
(III)--a country, the people of which met कृष्ण with presents on his way to मिथिला. भा. X. ८६. २०.
--a Rudra on the षोडश cakra. Br. IV. ३४. २६.
--a R. rising on the ऋष्यवत् hill. M. ११४. २४.

(I)--an अवतार् of विष्णु; a son of दीर्घत- m(p)as, the originator of the आयुर्वेद, and the father of Ketuman. <F>1:  भा. I. 3. १७; II. 7. २१; IX. १७. 4-5; M. ४७. ३०.</F> According to one account he appeared during the अमृतमथन, when Hari called Dh. Abja (Aja-वा। प्।). [पगे२-157+ २८] who wanted to be his son and blessed him to be a teacher of आयुर्वेद and be born as the son of काशि's king दीर्घ- tapas; was king of काशि and cured all diseases. <F>2:  भा. VIII. 8. ३५; M. २५१. 1 and 4: Br. III. ६७. 7-१०: ७२. 3: IV. 9. ७४-5; १०. 3-5; २०. ५२; वा. ९२. 7-२२; ९७. 3; Vi. I. 9. ९८-108; IV. 8. 8-११.</F>
--a son of तामस Manu. M. 9. १७.
--a son of शिवदत्त. Br. III. ३५. १२.
--the queen of ह्राद and mother of वातापि and Ilvala. भा. VI. १८. १५.
--a pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. १४.

--one of the eight Vasus; a Vasava; father of three sons. द्रवीण, Hutahavya and Raja; (द्रवीण and हुतहव्यवाह वा। प्।); <F>1:  Br. III. 3. २१-22; वा. ६६. २०, २१.</F> according to म्। प्। he had two sons by कल्याणि and three by मन्धरा. <F>2:  M. 5. २१-14; २०३. 3 and 4.</F>
--Earth as the wife of Dhruva and the mother of celestials; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. १२.</F> visits Meru and complains to gods of her tri- bulations from the asuras. <F>2:  Vi. V. 1. १२-28; २९. ३०.</F>
(I)--the wife of Vasu द्रोण and born as यशोदा. भा. X. 8. ४८-50.
(II)--earth; one of the five elements; resultant of the five elements. Janapadas, cities, etc., are found here. Br. II. २०. 2.
(III)--the neck of the Veda. वा. १०४. ७३.
--vow in honour of the earth; gift of golden image of earth above २० palas in weight leads to Rudraloka. M. १०१. ५२.
--a शक्ति. Br. IV. 8. १०.
--one of the names in the third Marut गण. वा. ६७. १२६.

(I)--with one foot in Kali (truth), the others are austerity, purity and compassion which have dis- appeared; <F>1:  भा. I. 3. 9; १६. १९; १७. २४-5.</F> dialogue with Earth in the guise of a bull; <F>2:  Ib. I. १६. २०-36; १७. 7-१६.</F> con- fusion of, due to different schools of metaphysics. <F>3:  Ib. I. १७. १९-20.</F> The force of Dharma in administration; <F>4: Br. III. ५०. ५३-7.</F> सनातनधर्म lost in Kali. <F>5:  M. 9. २८-31; २०१. 6-8.</F> Vyavastha done by sages in different periods of Manus. <F>6:  भा. VII. ११. 8-१२.</F> Thirty characteristics of.
(II)--the father of Nara, married मूर्ती. भा. II. 7. 6; XI. 4. 6. [पगे२-159+ ३८]

(III)--a son of ब्रह्मा, born of the right side of his chest; one of the first five created things for the propagation of people; the first devata who married the thirteen daughters of दक्ष or the दाक्षायणिस् (ten: वा। प्।): each of whom had sons; they were श्रद्धा, लक्ष्मी, धृति, तुष्टि, पुष्टि, मेधा, क्रिया, Buddhi, लज्जा, Vasu, शान्ति, Siddhi and कीर्ति; <F>1:  भा. III. १२. २५; IV. I. ४८-50; Br. II. 9. 1, ४९-50; IV. 1. ४०; M. 3. १०; 4. ३४ and ५५; 5. १३; १४६. १६; Va. 1. ६९; १०. २६; १००. ४३; Vi. I. 7. २४, २८-31; १५. ७७, १०३. वा. ६३. ४१; ६६. 2; ७६. 3.</F> in the Vaivasvata epoch had for his wives दाक्षायणी and अरुन्धती; <F>2:  M. २०३. 1-2.</F> father of काम and लक्ष्मी; <F>3:  Ib. १७१. ४२.</F> presented पृथु with a garland of fame. <F>4:  भा. IV. १५. १५; VI. 6. 2.</F>
(IV)--a constellation which goes round Dhruva keeping him to the right. भा. IV. 9. २१; V. २३. 5; Br. II. २१. १७६.
(V)--married सूनृता and had sons like Satya- sena and others. भा. VIII. 1 २५.

(VI)--The god of righteousness and appointed father of युधिष्ठिर; <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. २७; M. ४६. 9; ५०. ४९; १७१. २६; वा. ९६. १५३; Vi. IV. १४. ३५; २०. ४०.</F> father of धर्मव्रता, the future शिल at गया; <F>2:  वा. १०७. 2. १११. २३.</F> did not comprehend Hari's माय। <F>3:  भा. IX. 4. ५७.</F>
(VII)--the son of गान्धार and father of धृत (घृत: वि। प्।). भा. IX. २३. १५; Br. III. ७४. १०; M. ४८. 8; वा. १९. १०; Vi. IV. १७. 4.
(VIII)--a son of Haihaya, and father of Netra. भा. IX. २३. २२.
(IX)--a son of पृथुश्रवस् and father of उशनस्. भा. IX. २३. ३४. [पगे२-160+ २९]
(X)--चतुर्मूर्ति in Benares. M. १८३. ४१.

(XI)--a देवऋषि and the १४थ् Vedavya1sa; wife लक्ष्मि and daughter सूनृता; married ten daughters of दक्ष; father of १२ Sa1dhyas, 8 Vasavas, १० Vis4vedevas, of Maruts, of भानुस्, of मुहूर्तस् and so on. Father of युधिष्ठिर; cursed by माण्डव्य the sage. वा. १०. २६; ६३. ४१; ६६. 2; ७६. 3. Br. II. 9. 1, ४९-50.

(XII)--manifold and subtle; to understand the truth is difficult; hence it is not possible to give a definite lead in the Vedic laws; hence sages do not attach weight to दानम् and यज्ञम् but to सनातनधर्म which leads to svarga; is knowledge of the श्रौत Sma1rta dharma and following of वर्णाश्रम for attainment of heaven; इष्टप्रा- paka dharma introduced by the आचार्यस्. <F>1:  वा. ५७. ११२-8; ५९. २१, २८.</F> Consists of ten things: begging food, non-theft, purity, disinterestedness, activity, sympathy, non-injury, avoidance of anger, service of the guru, truthfulness; <F>2:  Br. II. 7. १७८; वा. 8. १८६.</F> of four पादस्; <F>3:  Ib. २३. ८१-2.</F> course of, in the four yugas. <F>4:  Ib. ५८. 5.</F>
(XIII)--a son of दीर्घतपस्. वा. ९२. 7.
(XIV)--one of the ten Sutapa गणस्. वा. १००. १५.
(XV)--a son of Suvrata, and father of शुश्रवस्. Vi. IV. २३. 6. [पगे२-161+ २४]
(XVI)--a Sutapa god. Br. IV. 1. १४.
(XVII)--a son of Raucya Manu. Br. IV. 1. १०४.
(XVIII)--a Vasu; wife मनोहरा; father of a number of sons. Vi. I. १५. ११०, ११३.
(XIX)--a son of Haihaya, and father of Dhar- manetra. Vi. IV. ११. 8.
--a son of Suketana (Suketu, ब्र्। वा। and वि। प्।) and father of Satyaketu.
--also सुनाभ, was set in motion and the place where its spokes were thrown out was spotted as the sacred place fit for seers; it fell in the नैमिष region. Br. I. 2. 8; वा. 1. १८३; 2. 8.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३७.
--a daughter of दक्ष, given to कश्यप. वा. ६६. ५५.
--the ब्राह्म form of marriage. वा. ७६. 3.
--a son of Haihaya and father of कीर्ति. वा. ९४. 4. [पगे२-162+ २६]
--a son of Upamadgu. Vi. IV. १४. 9.
--a son of Raucya Manu. वा. १००. १०८.
--(Janaka) a son of कुशध्वज and father of कृतध्वज and Mitadhvaja (Amitadhvaja वि। प्।). भा. IX. १३. १९; Vi. VI. 6. 7-8.
(I)--a son of Haihaya and father of Kunti. Br. III. ६९. 4; M. ४३. 9.
(II)--(बार्हद्रथ) ruled for 5 years. Br. III. ७४. ११७; वा. ९९. ३०३.
(III)--the son of Dharma and father of Kunti. Vi. IV. ११. 8.
--the wife, wedded according to prescribed rites. वा. १०७. १४.
(I)--Manu II सावर्ण of the tenth पर्याय. Br. IV. 1. ६६-72.
(II)--see under युधिष्ठिर. Heard the नर्मदा ma1hatmya from मार्कण्डेय. M. ११२. 3; १८६. 4-5.
--the three गणस् of the साध्यस्, Vasus and the विश्वेदेवस् collectively called. वा. ६४. 3.
--son of विश्वकर्मा, the father of Sil- पशास्त्र. वा. ८४. १७.
(I)--a son of अक्रूर. M. ४५. ३०.
(II)--a son of गान्दिनी. वा. ९६. १११.

--a king in the बृहत्कल्प; a friend of Indra. His wife was भानुमती. He had the prowess to vanquish even the Asuras. Asked as to the reason of his strength, his Purohita, वसिष्ठ explained that in the previous birth he was a goldsmith in the service of a शैविते courtesan, लीलावती. She performed the gift of लवनाचल when he helped her in making up the salt mountain in gold without receiving anything as wages. The present position was its consequence. Then he made gifts of ten Merus to वसिष्ठ. M. ९२. १७-33.
--the भुत, सर्प, and पिशाच गणस् collectively called as: their daughter पीवरी. वा. ७३. २६.

--finding the Brahmanas avaricious, ब्रह्मा cursed them to become debtors, watery rivers, stony hills therein, mudhouses and earn their living at the sacred places of pilgrimage. वा. १०६. ७८-83. [पगे२-164+ ३०]
--no sin in waging this war. भा. I. 8. ५०.

(I)--a son of Diviratha and father of Citraratha; <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. 7. Vi. IV. १८. १६-7.</F> king and scholar; <F>2:  Br. III. ७४. १०३.</F> performed यज्ञ at the विष्णु Pada hill with शुक्र; <F>3:  M. ४८. ९२-3.</F> drank soma with Indra at the विष्णु Pa1da. <F>4:  वा. ९९. १०१-2.</F>
(II)--a son of Sagara. Br. III. ६३. १४७; वा. ८८. १४९.
(I)--a name of युधिष्ठिर. भा. I. १२. 4 ff; Vi. V. ३८. ९०.
(II)--Yama with residence in Kuruk- षेत्र; <F>1:  Br. II. २९. ६५; III. १३. ६७; ५९. ७९; वा. १०८. 5, १०६. ४४; १११. ३८.</F> son of सूर्य. <F>2:  वा. ८४. ८०; Vi. III. 7. १९ and ३५.</F>
--on the western side of the यमुना. M. १०८. २७.
--a sacred spot in कुरुक्षेत्र for performing श्राद्धस्. वा. ७७. ६५.
(I)--a son of अक्रूर. M. ४५. ३०.
(II)--a son of रामचन्द्र and father of Vanga. Vi. IV. २४. ५६. [पगे२-165+ ३५]
--is Sagara, who conquered the whole earth. Br. III. ६३. १४२.
(I)--a son of अक्रूर; <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. १६.</F> of श्वफल्क. <F>2:  Br. III. ७१. ११२.</F>
(II)--a son of स्वर्भानु. वा. ९२. 2.

--a daughter of Dharma and विश्वरूप, performed tapas; मरीचि noticed her and desired to marry her; she asked him to request her father Dharma; he went, and on Dharma agreeing, marriage was celebrated; she lived happily; after a sojourn in the woods, मरीचि returned home tired and wanted her to massage his legs during his sleep; while she was so engaged, down came her father-in-law whom she honoured; finding that she was not doing what he desired her to do, the husband cursed her to become a stone, and despitc her severe austerities the curse became true. वा. १०७. 3-३१.
--a disciple of Rathitara (s.v.). वा. ६०. ६६.

--a विद्या; Law books to be learnt by a Prince; <F>1:  M. ५३. 6; २१५. २४; २२०. 2; २२५. 2 and 4. Vi. III. 6. २७.</F> known to सूत; <F>2:  भा. I. 1. 6.</F> learnt by कृष्ण and राम; <F>3:  Ib. X. ४५. ३४.</F> refer to three तनुस्, प्राजापत्या, रौद्रा and वैष्णवी; <F>4:  Br. II. ३३. ३१; ३५. ८८; III. 3. ८८; १९. २३.</F> said to be पुरातन or ancient. <F>5:  वा. ६१. ७८; ६६. १०९; ८३. ५३.</F> [पगे२-166+ ३०]
--the sons of Dharma and the thirteen daughters of दक्ष. वा. १०. ३८.
--the eleventh Manu. भा. VIII. १३. २४-6; Vi. III. 2. २९-32.
--the name of विष्णु engaged in perform- ing tapas at गन्धमाधन. M. ६१. २१.
--a son of Suvrata and father of शम. भा. IX. २२. ४८.
--a son of आर्यक and वैधृता; an अम्श of Hari in the epoch of the eleventh Manu. भा. VIII. १३. २६.
--a son of मान्धात. M. १२. ३५.
--judges, generally Brahmanas. M. २१५. २४ and ३०; २१७. ११.
--in गया, <F>1:  वा. ८३. २३.</F> here Dharma performed sacrifice. <F>2:  Ib. १११. २३.</F>

--served by पुरूरवस्: <F>1:  M. २४. १५-21.</F> expounded with मोक्ष in the लिङ्ग and कूर्म पुराणस्; <F>2:  Ib. ५३. ३७ and ४७; ११४. १३; १२१. ६४-81; वा. 8. २६, ff.</F>of the Asuras in Tripuram. <F>3:  M. १३१. १६.</F> [पगे२-167+ २७]
(I)--a son of भरद्वाज. वा. ९९. २८६.
(II)--a son of बृहद्भाज and father of कृतम्- jaya. Vi. IV. २२. 6.
(I)--eighth son of रौद्राश्व and the apsaras, घृताची. भा. IX. २०. 4; वा. ९९. १२५.
(II)--a son of भद्राश्व. M. ४९. 6.
--near the well in ब्रह्मतीर्थम्. वा. १११. २६.
--a son of रौद्राश्व. Vi. IV. १९. 2.
--the व्यास of the १३थ् dva1para; वालि अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १५८.

(II)--(धातुकि-वि। प्।) a son of Savana, after whom came धातकिखण्ड. Br. II. १४. १५-6; वा. ३३. १४-15; Vi. II. 4. ७३.

(III)--(खण्ड) a division of पुष्करद्वीप: encircles Sumana hill on the southern side; <F>1:  Br. II. १४. १६; १९. ११७-25: M. १२३. 5-१०, २६. वा. ४९. ११३, १२१.</F> named after धातकि, son of Savana. <F>2:  Ib. ३३. १५.</F> [पगे२-168+ २८]
(I)--a son of भृगु and ख्याती, wife नियती, (आयति-वि। प्।) son मृकण्डु (प्राण-वि। प्।). Br. II. ११. 5. वा. २८. 1, 4, 5. Vi. I. 8. १५; १०. 2-4.
(II)--a devata in the sun, in the spring season. वा. ५२. 2.
--a Marut of the III गण. Br. III. 5. ९४.
(I)--an आदित्य--Icon of <F>1:  M. 6. 4; १२६. 3; १७१. ५६; २६१. 6; वा. ६६. ६६. Vi. I. १५. १३०.</F> in the sun's chariot in the months of Caitra and Madhu. <F>2:  Vi. II. १०. 4; V. १८. ५६.</F>
(II)--deserted by his wife तुष्टि for Soma: created order in the Universe. M. २३. २४; ३८. 9.
--the १०थ् of the twelve incarnations of विष्णु. M. ४७. ४५.

(III)--a son of Aditi. Had four wives, each of whom brought forth a son; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ३९; १८. 3.</F> an आदित्य of the Vaivasvata epoch. <F>2:  Br. III. 3. ६७-69.</F>
