--a king of मेरुदान to be given away as gift. M. ८३. 4 and १२-13; ९२. ३२.
--the १२थ् अवतार् of Hari. भा. I. 3. १७.
(I)--came out of the eyes of Atri: her son was Soma. M. २३. 6-8. वा. ६२. ४१. [पगे२-170+ ३३]
(II)--an अमिताभ God. Br. II. ३६. ५३.
(III)--a sage of the तामस epoch. Vi. III. 1. १८.

--a son of Candra. वा. ६६. २३.
--on the northern bank of the नर्मदा. M. १९०. 6.

--a form of Yoga in which the mind is con- trolled; ध्यान; seeing in himself, the characteristic of Siddhi; the time and place for doing it; not near fire, forest, river-bed, burial place, Caitya; the performer should not be hungry, careworn or be anxious; else the doer becomes mad, deaf and dumb or blind; hence pure धारणा is requir- ed; one engaged in this Yoga could take curds and Yava paste; enables वायु to go up and stand in its place; other branches of; thinking. of the upper worlds, mountains and oceans in his heart; eating mud from dried beans; १००० pots of water for bath; <F>1:  Br. I. 2. ४२-3; III. 4. २६; २२. ७५; वा. ११. २२-64; Vi. VI. 7. ७५-8.</F> the dharma of the Yoga destroys sins; <F>2:  वा. १०. ७६, ९३.</F> ८०० times in the head; <F>3:  Ib. १२. १७; १९. ४१; १०४. २४.</F> धारण Agneyi1 a special form of समाधि practised by Sati, the daughter of दक्ष. <F>4:  Ib. ३०. ५४.</F>

--a पितृकन्या, a daughter of स्वधा; <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ६४.</F> mind- born daughter of बर्हिषदस्, became the wife of Meru; son Mandara, and three daughters, वेला, नियती and आयती; <F>2:  Br. II. १३. ३०ff; वा. ३०. २८; ३३. 4; ६२. १९२.</F> a ब्रह्मवादिनी। <F>3:  Vi. I. १०. १९.</F> [पगे२-171+ २६]
--a tribe; <F>1:  M. २७३. ७२.</F> a dynasty of १०० kings; per- formed अश्वमेध. <F>2:  वा. ३२. ५१; ९९. ४५४.</F>
--^1 १००० of dvipadas; those who go to heaven. वा. १०१. २०३.
--the क्षत्रम् of धृष्ट; of ३००० Ks2atriyas with the गणस्. वा. ८८. 4-5.
--a race of warriors descended from धृष्ट; attained Brahmanhood. भा. IX. 2. १७.
--a son of हृदीक. वा. ९६. १४०.
--an expert in divine music. वा. ६९. ४६.
(I)--the wife of कृशाश्व and mother of वेदशिरस् and others. भा. VI. 6. २०.
(II)--the wife of Havirdhana Agni^1 and the mother of प्राचीनबर्हिस् and five other sons.^2 Br. II. ३७. २३-24; M. 4. ४५; Vi. I. १४. 2.

--a Pratardana God. Br. II. ३६. ३०.
(I)--a son of महावीर्य. Br. II. १४. ६९; वा. ३३. ५८.
(II)--one of the six sons of पुरूरवस् and उर्वशी. Br. III. ६६. २२; वा. ९१. ५१.
(III)--a sage of the तामस epoch. M. 9. १६.

--a kingdom watered by ह्लादिनी. Br. II. १८. ५४; M. १२१. ५३; वा. ४७. ५१; ६२. १२३.
(II)--one of the names of the third Marut गण. वा. ६७. १२६.

(I)--a son of पीत्रायुध; an Asura; killed by कुवलयाश्व (s.v.) aided by his २१,000 sons. भा. IX. 6. २२; Br. III. 6. ३१; M. १२. ३१; ४९. 3.
(II)--a son of Madhu the राक्षस, caused trouble to peaceful citizens; on Uttanga's request बृह- दश्व's son vanquished him. Br. III. ६३. २९.
(III)--a son of अरूरु, killed by कुवलाश्व. वा. ६८. ३१.

(IV)--a son of Manu and an Asura who entered into sandy deserts near the आश्रम of the sage Uttanka and performed a cruel penance for the ruin of the world; once a year he breathed and the breath shook the earth for seven days with dust enclosing the sun's rays. He was killed by कुवलाश्व who became धुन्धुमार. वा. ८८. २८-59.
(V)--a son of Jayada. वा. ९९. १२२.
--a दैत्य, his greed for more territory. भा. XII, 3. 9.
--a son of Pratiratha. वा. ९९. १३०. [पगे२-174+ २४]
--the अपर after पर above Brahmaloka. वा. १००. १४४.
(I)--a R. from the हिमालयस्. Br. II. १६. २६.
--a R. from the ऋष्यवत् mountain. M. ११४. २६.

--a Mind-born mother. M. १७९. २४.
(I)--a sister of विशुक्र and दुष्टशेखर, the Asura brothers. Br. IV. १०. ८१.

(III)--a queen of अजमिढ; <F>1:  M. ४९. ४४; वा. ९९. १६७.</F> offered prayers and oblations to Agni and performed other austerities day and night on a कुश seat for a son; her colour was dusty and smoky; son, ऋक्ष also of smoky colour; from the tip of धूर्व grass. <F>2:  Ib. ९९. २११-14.</F>

(IV)--the ninth Manu from लृ-ka1ra, the ninth face of the fourteen faced deva; of the colour of the smoke. वा. २६. ४१.
(I)--a son of Bharata and पाञ्चजनी. भा. V. 7. 3.

--the wife of मार्कण्डेय and mother of वेदशिरस्. Br. II. ११. 7.
--an asura killed by ललिता. Br. IV. २९. ७५.
--father of सृङ्जय. वा. ८६. १८-9.
(I)--a Kala. Br. IV. ३५. ८७.
(II)--a Mind-born mother. M. १७९. १७.

(I)--a son of Dharma and father of Durmanas (Durmada, भा। प्।) and (Durdama, ब्र्। प्।). भा. IX. २३. १५; Br. III. ७४. १०; वा. ९९. १०. [पगे२-178+ २९]
(II)--a son of Raucya Manu. Br. IV. 1. १०४.

--a daughter of Devaka; queen of Vasudeva and mother of विपृष्ठ. भा. IX. २४. २२-23, ५०; Br. III. ७१. १३१, १६२.
--a Pratardana god. Br. III. ३६. ३१.

(I)--an eminent नाग of the पाताल; <F>1:  भा. V. २४. ३१; Br. III. 7. ३४; वा. ६९. ७१.</F> used in milking the cow-earth and as a rope in the chariot of त्रिपुरारि. <F>2:  M. 6. ४०; १०. २०; १३३. २५ and ३०.</F> Heard the विष्णु पुराण from नारद and narrated it to वासुकि. <F>3:  Vi. VI. 8. ४५-6.</F>

(III)--a son of Bali and a दानव. Br. III. 6. 8; M. 6. ११.

(I)--the son of धृति and father of Sat- karma (सत्यकर्मा, वि। प्।, वा। प्।). भा. IX. २३. १२; वा. ९९. ११६; Vi. IV. १८. २५-6.

(II)--a son of Vijaya and father of धृतव्रत. भा. IX. २३. १२; वा. ९९. ११६; Vi. IV. १८. २४-5.
(III)--a daughter of दक्ष; wife of Dharma and mother of a son Niyama; <F>1:  Br. II. 9. ४९, ५९; वा. १०. २५, ३४; Vi. I. 7. २३, २८.</F> one of nine devis serving Soma. <F>2:  वा. ५५. ४३; ९०. २५.</F>

(VI)--a son of सृष्ति (पुष्टि-वा। प्।) and छाया. Br. II. ३६. ९८; वा. ६२. ८३-4.
(VII)--a son of ब्रह्मधान. Br. III. 7. ९८.

(XIII)--same as महती; left her consort Nandi for Soma. M. २३. २६; १२२. ७४.

(IV)--a son of Sudaridra (s.v.) of पाञ्चाल- देश. M. २१. 3.

--observance of this vow described; the performer becomes a king in the next Kalpa. M. १०१. ३३-4.
--a son of भद्राश्व. M. ४९. 5.
--a son of रौद्राश्व. Vi. IV. १९. 2.
(I)--(धृष्टि-ब्र्। प्।), a son of हिरण्याक्ष. भा. VII. 2. १८.

(II)--a son of Vaivasvata Manu; an ancestor of the धार्ष्ट race of warriors, ३००० in number; <F>1:  भा. VIII. १३. 2; IX. 1. १२; 2. १७; Br. II. ३८. ३०; III. ६०. 2; ६३. 4; वा. ६४. २९; ८८. 4; Vi. III. 1. ३३; IV. 1. 7.</F> father of three sons धृतकेतु, Citraratha and रणधृष्ट. <F>2:  M. ११. ४१; १२. २०-1.</F> [पगे२-183+ ३३]
(III)--a son of Kunti and father of Nirvrti. Br. III. ७०. ४०; M. ४४. ३९; वा. ९५. ३९.
(IV)--a son of Kukura and father of Kapota- रोमा. Vi. IV. १४. १३.
(V)--a son of Kunti. वा. ९५. ३९.
(I)--a son of सुधृति and father of हर्यश्व. भा. IX. १३. १५; Br. III. ६४. १०; वा. ८९. १०; Vi. IV. 5. २७.
(II)--a son of Satyaketu and father of सुकुमार. भा. IX. १७. 9.
(III)--a son of धृष्टद्युम्न and the last पाञ्चाल. भा. IX. २२. 3; वा. ९९. २११; Vi. IV. १९. ७३.

(IV)--a king of the Kaikayas and a vassal prince of युधिष्ठिर; married श्रुतकीर्ति and had five sons Santardana and others; <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. ३८.</F> joined the पाण्डवस् against the Kurus; <F>2:  Ib. X. ७८. [(९५. V.) १३].</F> went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse. <F>3:  Ib. X. ८२. २५.</F>
(V)--a son of सुकुमार and father of वेणुहोत्र; a righteous king. Br. III. ६७. ७६; Va. ९२. ७२.

--a son of Drupada and father of धृष्टकेतु, last of the पन्चालकस्; <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. 2-3; वा. ९९. २११; Vi. IV. १९. ७३.</F> joined the पाण्डवस् against the Kurus and was the commander of the पाण्डव hosts; killed द्रोण. <F>2:  भा. X. ७८. [(९५. v.) १०-36].</F> [पगे२-184+ ३१]
--a son of अक्रूर. M. ४५. ३०.
(I)--a son of Kunti and father of निर्वृति (निधृति-वि। प्।). भा. IX. २४. 3; Vi. IV. १२. ४१.
(II)--a son of भजमान. भा. IX, २४. 7.
(III)--a son of बाह्यथ; गान्धारी and माद्री were his wives. Br. III. ७१. 4, १८.
--a son of Atharva Angiras Br. III. 1. १०५.
--the brown cow fit for gift in honour of the sun; the giver attains Golokam--details described. M. ९३. ६०. ८०; १०५. १६; २०५. 1-7.

--an Asura friend of Kamsa; in the form of an ass jealously guarded the palmyra forest near ब्रिन्दा- vana. At the desire of his cowherd friends to eat the fruits of that palm grove, बलराम entered it and brought down fruits; the Asura came down and kicked him in his chest; he caught hold of him and whirled him to death; his kith and kin, other asses came and were dashed against trees; killed by कृष्ण. <F>1:  भा. X. 2. 1; १५. २२-38; ४३. २५; ४६. २६. Vi. V. 1. २४; 4. 2. ch. 8. (whole).</F> A दानव king, <F>2:  Br. IV. २९. १२४.</F> with मनुष्य धर्म। <F>3:  वा. ६८. १५; Vi. V. 8. 2.</F>
(I)--the wife of कीर्तिमन्; <F>1:  वा. २८. १७.</F> mother of two sons चरिष्णु and धृतिमन्. <F>2:  Br. II. ११. २०.</F> [पगे२-185+ ३०]
(II)--(मृता); a R. of the शाकद्वीप. वा. ४९. ९४. Vi. II. 4. ६५.
--in गया; a place for offering पिण्ड to पितृस्. वा. ११२. ५६.
--the wife of Devadyumna and mother of परमेष्ठिन्. भा. V. १५. 3.
--the performance of this vow leads to salvation. M. १०१. ४९.
--the deity over the स्वरमध्यम। वा. २१. ३९.

(I)--was invited for युधिष्ठिर's राज- सूय; <F>1:  भा. X. ७४. 9.</F> followed युधिष्ठिर on a visit to the dying भीष्म; <F>2:  Ib. I. 9. 2.</F> grieved at कृष्ण's departure from हस्तिनापुर. <F>3:  Ib. I. १०. १०, १२-3</F>
(II)--मध्यमाध्वर्यु Kas4yapa. Br. II. ३३. १५.
--of कौशिक gotra. Br. III. ६६. ७१. वा. ९१. ९९.
--a dharma of the yoga, kills unrighteous qualities; <F>1:  वा. १०. ७६ and ९३; १०४. २५.</F> described by कृष्ण to Uddhava. <F>2:  भा. XI. १४. ३२-46.</F>
--a son of शन्खन and father of विश्व- saha. वा. ८८. २०६. [पगे२-186+ ४१]

(I)--a son of उत्तानपाद and सुनीति (भा। प्। & वि। प्।) (म्।, ब्र्। & वा। प्। speak of सूनृता as his mother). A grandson of स्वायम्भुव Manu; hated by his father's more beloved wife, Suruci, took leave of his mother to go to the forest; met नारद and was blessed, advised and initiated by the sage; as a child of five went to Madhuvana on the bank of the यमुना; continued to meditate on the Lord's glory for a period of १०,000 years, sometime eating roots and fruits, and sometime fasting; sought refuge in विष्णु, standing on one foot to the great consternation of gods. <F>1:  भा. IV. ch. 8. (whole); Br. II. ३६. ८८-95; M. 4. ३५-36; १४३. ३८; वा. ६२. ७५-78.</F> Hari appeared before him, and touching his baby cheeks, conferred on him divine speech; his praise of the Lord; assuring him a place in the mansion of the luminaries, Hari asked him to go home and rule righteously which he did for ३६,000 years. Dhruva's return was welcomed by the king and his queens; bowed to his parents and embraced उत्तान; was welcomed by the citizens; getting old, the king anointed Dhruva and retired to forest. <F>2:  भा. IV. ch. 9. (whole).</F> Had two queens: one was भ्रमी who gave birth to Kalpa and Vatsara; the other इला whose son was Utkala. (According to ब्र्। प्। one wife was भूमी who gave birth to सृष्टि and Bhavya; accord- ing to म्। प्। धन्या, the daughter of Manas was one of his queens and her son was शिष्ट.). Heard the death of his brother Uttama at the hands of a यक्ष and led an expedition to the city of the यक्षस्: In the war innocents also were killed, whereupon his grand- sire, Manu came to the spot and advised to desist from it, especially as it would irritate Kubera. On this, he met Kubera who praised his valour and his sense of duty and offered some boons. Dhruva asked that he must ever remember the feet of the Lord. <F>3:  Ib. II. 7. ४३; IV. chh. १०, ११. (whole); Ib. II. 7. ४३; IV. २१. २८.</F> Ruled the kingdom for ३६,000 years, performed यज्ञ, appointed his son on the throne and retired to विशाल (बदरिकाश्रम). Meditating on the Lord for 3,००० years, was taken to his eternal abode in the world of luminaries [पगे२-187+ ४०] in a divine car. By tapas he set his foot on Yama when he saw his mother going before him to Heaven; was obliged to हरी, the power of whose yoga he knew. <F>4:  Ib. IV. ch. १२. (whole); ३१. २२. [3-4]; M. 4. ३६-8.</F> नारद narrated to प्राचेतस् the story of Dhruva and sang his praise. The Pole-star: earned a place in विष्णुपद: at the end of the tail of सिशुमार: <F>5:  भा. V. १७. 2; २०. ३७; २१. १४; २३. 1; Br. I. 1. ८५; II. २१. ९४, १७५; २२. 6-१०, ५८-9; २३. ९२; २४. १२२; २९. १८; III. ६१. ४९; IV. 2. १३५; M. १२४. ७५-83; १२५. 5-7; वा. 1. १०१; ५१. 6-१०; १०१. ४१, १३५; Vi. I. chh. ११ and १२; II. 7. १०-12; 8. ३९; १२. २४-34.</F> with Indra, Agni and other deities, and in front of the सप्तऋषिस्: <F>6:  Br. III. 5. ८१; M. १२८. ७४; वा. 1. ९७; १९. 2; ५०. १४८, २२२; ५१. 6, १०; ५२. ९७-8; ५३. ९७, ११२.</F> Helps the planets in their movements: responsible for the days, nights and seasons of the year: aids in the formation of clouds and fall of rains: <F>7:  M. १४२. १४.</F> the year of Dhruva: In praise of. <F>8:  Ib. ch. १२७. (whole).</F>

(II)--a Vasu, <F>1:  M. 5. २१-3; २०३. 3-4.</F> married धरणी and gave birth to several cities. <F>2:  भा. VI. 6. ११-12; Br. III. 3. २०-2.</F> Father of Bhava, काल and Loka- प्रकालन. <F>3:  वा. ६६. १९; Vi. I. १५. ११०-11.</F>
(III)--a son of रन्तिभार (Ranti, the righteous-वा। प्।). भा. IX. २०. 6. वा. ९९. १२९.
(IV)--a son of Vasudeva and रोहिणी. भा. IX. २४. ४६.
(V)--a son of मेधातिथि and founder of the kingdom, Dhruvam, in प्लक्षद्वीप; attained heaven by tapas. Br. II. १४. ३७-9; ३०. ३९; वा. ३३. ३३; Vi. II. 4. 4-5.
(VII)--a God of Lekha group. Br. II. ३६. ७५.
(VIII)--a son of Angada. Br. III. 7. २२०.
(IX)--one of the eleven Rudras. M. १५३. १९.
(X)--a son of Dharma and सुदेवी. M. १७१. ४६.
(XII)--the presiding deity on Uttiramandira etc. (music). वा. ८६. ५६.
(XIII)--a son of विश्वामित्र. Br. III. ६६. ६८; वा. ९१. ९६.
(XIV)--a son of अन्तीनर. Vi. IV. १९. 4.
--a god of the Lekha group. Br. II. ३६. ७५.
--the unchanging place obtained by the little boy, Dhruva for his tapas. भा. II. 7. 8.
(I) (च्)--adjoining the वैभ्राज hill in प्लक्षद्वीप. Br. II. १४. ३९; १९. १६; वा. ४९. १४. [पगे२-189+ २७]
(II)--a Sukha god. Br. IV. 1. १९.
(III)--same as महाद्रुम. M. १२२. २५.
(IV)--a mukhya गण. वा. १००. १९.
--a son of पुष्य and father of सुदर्शन. भा. IX. १२. 5; Br. III. ६३. २०९. वा. ८८. २०९; Vi. IV. 4. १०८.
--a son of Sahadeva. M. २७१. 6.
(II)--the 9th battle where Dhvaja was killed by Mahendra विष्णु. Br. II. ७२. ७५; वा. ९७. ७५, ८५.
--a son of क्रोष्तु and father of स्वाति. Vi. IV. १२. 1-2.
--a सुधामान god. Br. II. ३६. २७.
--a goddess enshrined at शन्खोद्धार. M. १३. ४८.
--one of the names in the third Marut गण. वा. ६७. १२६. [पगे२-190+ ३१]
--a son of हृदीक. वा. ९६. १४०.

--born to माद्री (माद्रवती) through the favour of the अश्विन्स्: father of शतानीक and Niramitra, the latter by करेणुमती; <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. २८-9, ३२; Br. III. ७१. १३५; M. ४६. १०; ५०. ५०; वा. ९६. १५४; ९९. २४५; Vi. IV. १४. ३८; २०. ४०.</F> felt joy at कृष्ण's visit to Indra- prastha; was sent to the northern countries, for gathering provisions for युधिष्ठिर's राजसूय; <F>2:  भा. X. ७१. २७; ७२. १३; ७५. 4.</F> approved of Drau- पदी's desire to release अश्वथाम; <F>3:  Ib. I. 7. ५०; १०. 9.</F> consoled by कृष्ण while in forest; <F>4:  Ib. X. ५८. 4; ६४. 9.</F> heard from भिष्म the secret of the cycle of births and deaths. <F>5:  Vi. III. 7. 8-१३.</F>

--(नकुलेश्वरी)--Mind-born daughter of ललिता, riding on गरुड to vanquish सर्पिनी, was attacked by the five commanders of भण्ड: नकुली cut off Karanka's head when the army retreated in fear to सून्यक city; <F>1:  Br. IV. २३. ५२-93; २८. ३९.</F> an अवतार् of the Lord. <F>2:  वा. २३. २२१.</F>
--sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ७७.
--a son of पृथुसेन (पृथु-ब्र्।, वि।, and वा। प्।) and father of Gaya. भा. V. १५. 6. Br. II. १४. ६८; वा. ३३. ५७; Vi. II. 1. ३८. [पगे२-191+ ३६]
--the author and a master of Atharva- सम्हिता; <F>1:  भा. XII. 7. 4; वा. ६१. ५४.</F> a portion of Atharva Veda. <F>2:  Br. II. ३५. ६१. Vi. III. 6. १३.</F>
--a vow in honour of नारायण-- detailed. M. ५४. 7-३०.

--one lac of Yojanas from the moon; <F>1:  वा. १९. २२; ५३. ९६; १०१. १३०.</F> the orbit of lunar constellation above the moon; above that at a distance of 2 lacs of Yojanas is Budha. <F>2:  Vi. II. 7. 6-7.</F>

--stars as sons of दाक्षायणी <F>1:  Br. II. २४. ९१; M. 2. 7; वा. 1. १०१; 7. १६; २४. ७७; ३०. १४६; १०७. ४५.</F> do not shine in इलावृत; <F>2:  Br. II. १७. १०.</F> living by them (astrology) leads one to hell; <F>3:  Ib. IV. 2. १६३; वा. १०१. १६१.</F> the मण्डलम् of, १०,000 Yojanas from the moon; <F>4:  वा. Br. IV. 2. १३०.</F> २७ daughters of दक्ष married to Soma; <F>5:  M. 4. ५५; 8. 3; १७१. ३१; वा. ६६. ३७, ५३; ९०. २१.</F> lord of; <F>6:  Ib. ३४. ९०; ५३. २९.</F> ety. <F>7:  Ib. ५३. ५०.</F>
--the king after चन्द्राम्शु; the second king of विदिश. Br. III. ७४. १८१; वा. ९९. ३६७.
(I)--(वासिष्ठ) a sage of the epoch of III सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ७९.
(II)--a Mt. surrounding the back portion of the शिला at गया; here the पितृस् give bali to यमराज and Dharmaraja. वा. १०८. २८. [पगे२-192+ २७]
(II)--a son of Manyu, and father of सम्कृति. Vi. IV. १९. २१-2.
--Towns: shape of; round, vajra and long condemned. Square commended; half विष्कम्ब beyond खेट and पाणम् beyond that. Br. II. 7. ९४, १०८-111.
--of देवी; described. Br. IV. १४. 9.
--a ऋषिक who became a ऋषि by satya. Br. II. ३२. १०१; M. १४५. ९५; वा. ५९. ९२.

--a heretic: conquering, the senses and control- ling self; <F>1:  Br. II. २७. १०५ and ११९; III. १४. ३५-40.</F> unlettered in Veda; <F>2:  Vi. III. १६. १२; १७. 5.</F> Dialogue between वसिष्ठ and भीष्म regarding Nagna; <F>3:  Ib. III. १७. 7.</F> Asuras became so by the delusion of मायामोह Vis2n2u; <F>4:  Ib. III. १८-36.</F> caste men who neglect their svadharma become a Nagna. <F>5:  Ib. III. १८. ४८ and ५२.</F>

(I)--a King of Kosala, had a daughter सत्या; established a convention that he who would curb the ferocity of seven bulls in his possession would be the proper husband for his daughter; all tried in vain; कृष्ण went to अयोध्या and offered to pass the test; seeing his feat Nagnajit gave [पगे२-193+ ३१] him his daughter with a large dowry; <F>1:  भा. X. ५८. ३२-52; III. 3. 4; Br. III. ७१. २४२.</F> went to Syamanta- पञ्चक for the solar eclipse. <F>2:  भा. X. ८२. २५.</F>
(II)--one of the eighteen authors on architec- ture. M. २५२. 2.
--a देवी and wife of कृष्ण; a Kosala princess and daughter of Nagnajit. वा. ९६. २३३; भा. X. ७१. ४३.

--devoid of the three outer coverings of the body--unfit for श्राद्ध occasions; पाषण्डस् also termed Nagnas as also others who pretend to be तपस्विन्स् and ascetics, proceed on wrong lines, murder Brahmanas, prove ungrateful friends, defile the teacher's bed and also robbers; they are to be abandoned. वा. ७८. २४, २७-34.
--a R. from विष्णुपद lake. वा. ४७. ६५.

--the queen of चक्षुस Manu and daughter of the progenitor Virajas; <F>1:  भा. IV. १३. १५; Br. II. ३६. ८० and १०७.</F> (वैराज-वि। प्।) mother of ten sons, all heroic and pure. <F>2:  M. 4. ४०-1; Vi. I. १३. 4.</F>
--a भार्गव gotrakr2t. M. १९५. १७.
--a R. of the केतुमाला country. वा. ४४. २२.
--father of ten sons. वा. ६२. ६८, ९१. [पगे२-194+ ४६]

(I)--an attendant on पुरुषोत्तम Vis2n2u (Hari); <F>1:  भा. II. 9. १४; X. ३९. ५३; ८९. ५७; VIII. २२. १५.</F> praised Dhruva; <F>2:  Ib. IV. १२. २२.</F> went with Hari going to पृथु's sacrifice; <F>3:  Ib. IV. १९. 5; VI. 4. ३९.</F> attacked the Asuras, the followers of Bali. <F>4:  Ib. VIII. २१. १६.</F>
(II)--a Mt. of क्रौञ्चद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २१.
(III)--a son of मदिरा and Vasudeva. भा. IX. २४. ४८; Br. III. ७१. १७१; वा. ९६. १६९; Vi. IV. १५. २३.

(IV)--In previous birth the Vasu, द्रोण; <F>1:  भा. X. 8. ४८-50; Br. III. ७१. २३९.</F> connected with the Devas, married यशोदा; <F>2:  भा. I. 8. २१; X. 1. ६२; 2. 9; Vi. IV. १५. ३१.</F> celebrated the birth of कृष्ण as his son by inviting Brahmanas, Gopas and गोपीस् and making rich presents to them, the Gopas and गोपीस् threw balls of turmeric on the baby and sprinkled butter, curds and milk on one another, a folk custom; <F>3:  भा. X. 5. 1-१६; chh. 5. 6, 7 and 8 (whole),</F> went to मथुरा to pay the annual tribute to Kamsa; was met by Vasudeva who advised him to leave at once for his place as he expected some उत्पातस् there: Nanda thinking Vasu- deva's words to be true turned his thoughts on the way to Hari; heard of पूतना, the demon killed by कृष्ण and felt greatly surprised; embraced कृष्ण in joy; performed शान्ति for कृष्ण for kicking the cart; was surprised at कृष्ण's taking the lap of तृणावर्त and believed more and more in Vasudeva's words; welcomed Garga and had नामकरण done to his sons; became pleased at Garga's service; <F>3:  भा. X. 5. 1-१६; chh. 5. 6, 7 and 8 (whole),</F> Nanda and his friends bewildered at the fall of the Arjuna trees and released कृष्ण from his fetters; planned to leave Vraja for ब्रिन्दावन; <F>4:  Ib. X. ११. 1-2; Vi. V. 5. 1-२१; 6. 6 and २१; 7. २२ and ३४; १०. १८ and २५.</F> his fortune in enjoying Hari at close quarters; <F>5:  भा. X. १४. ३२.</F> was much concerned at the bad omens at कृष्ण's fight with कालिय; was stopped by बलराम from entering the port of कालिय; joy at कृष्ण's escape from कालिय; gave presents of gold and cows to Brahmanas on the occasion. <F>6:  Ib. X. १६. १२-22; १७. १५-18.</F> [पगे२-195+ ४३] Prepared for the इन्द्रयाग; but gave it up and prayed to the mountains instead, as advised by कृष्ण; Indra's anger towards Nanda; was surprised at कृष्ण holding the Govar- dhana; when the Gopas wondered at the exploits of the boy, कृष्ण, Nanda said that he heard from Garga that he was Vasudeva's son and an अम्श of नारायण; after fasting on एकादशि, Nanda went to यमुना for bath for the द्वादशि; it was आसुर time and not the time for bath; so an Asura follower of वरुण took hold of him and placed him before वरुण; seeing Nanda missing, the Gopas got frightened and appealed to कृष्ण who went to वरुण; pleased at seeing him वरुण said that it was a mistake committed by his servants in ignorance and set Nanda free; then he returned to Vraja to the great joy of all the Gopas; taken to Brahmah- rada; <F>7:  Ib. X. chh. २४, २५, २६, २७ and २८ (whole).</F> when once he went to अम्बिकावन he was seized by a reptile and was released with कृष्ण's help. <F>8:  Ib. X. ३४. 4-१८; ३६. २४. (३१).</F> Extended a hearty welcome to अक्रूर and enquired of Kamsa; became afraid of अक्रूर's message; got ready with all the Gopas to start for मथुरा with presents to Kamsa; followed अक्रूर's chariot with all his carts and men; came in advance and waited for कृष्ण's arrival; took his seat along with the other Gopas in the gallery of the wrestling ground; Kamsa desired to imprison him; duly honoured by कृष्ण, Nanda and the Gopas returned to Vraja after Kamsa's death; <F>9:  Ib. X. ३८. ४१-43; ३९. १०-12, ३५; ४१. 8; ४२. ३८; ४४. ३२; ४५. २०-25; Vi. V. ११. 3; १५. १८; २०. २८ and ८३.</F> welcomed Uddhava with due honour; exhibited his deep love for कृष्ण; Uddhava revealed the real nature of कृष्ण to him. <F>१०:  भा. X. ४६. १४ to the end.</F> Came to स्यमन्तपञ्चक and met कृष्ण and others; embraced and enquired after by Vasudeva and others; <F>११:  Ib. X. ५२. ३२-35.</F> was honoured by कृष्ण, राम, Ugrasena and Vasudeva; spent three months unwilling to be away from the Yadus, left for मथुरा; <F>१२:  Ib. X. ८४. ५९-69.</F> chief of सात्वतस् and vassal of कृष्ण: went with वृष्णिस् to बाण's city. <F>१३:  Ib. I. १४. ३२; II. 7. ३१; X. १३. 3.</F> [पगे२-196+ २५]

(V)--a king of the Nanda dynasty; <F>1:  भा. XII. 1. 9.</F> from परीक्षित् to Nanda the period was १११५ years; At the time of Nanda the सप्तऋषिस् moved from Magha to पूर्वाषाढ. <F>2:  Ib. XII. 2. २६-7, ३२.</F>
(VI)--the fourth son of मेधातिथि and founder of the Nanda Kingdom. Br. II. १४. ३६-9.
(VII)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३४.
(VIII)--a son of शूर and भोजा. M. ४६. 3.
(IX) city; Uragapati, in the third Tala or Vitalam. वा. ५०. २९.
(X)--an Ajitadeva. वा. ६७. ३४.

--the Royal dynasty preceding the Mauryas; <F>1:  भा. XII. 1. 8-१०.</F> commence their line when the Seven ऋषिस् reach पूर्वाषाढ, and after १०६५ years from परीक्षित्. <F>2:  Vi. IV. २४. १०४ and ११२.</F>
(I)--विष्णु's sword; reached कृष्ण during जरासन्ध's siege of मथुरा. भा. X. ५०. ११. [१४]. [पगे२-197+ २४]
(II)--a नाग chief with his city in the third Talam. Br. II. २०. ३०.
(III)--a son of वृकदेवी and Vasudeva. M. ४६. १८.
(IV)--a disciple of ब्रह्मा. वा. २२. १६.
--the residence of Nanda and other Gopas. भा. X. 2. 7; 3. ४५ [1].
--see Nanda. Br. III. ७१. २१२; वा. ९६. २०६.
(I)--a यक्ष: a son of पुण्यजनी and मणिभद्र. Br. III. 7. १२२; वा. ६९. १५४.
(II)--a son of Madhu. Br. III. ७०. ४६; वा. ९५. ४६.
(III)--a son of शिव; father of रन्ती and रन्तिपाल (Tanti and तन्तिपाल-वा। प्।). Br. III. ७१. १४९ and १९२; M. ४६. २७.
(IV)--a younger brother of चन्द्रहास. Br. IV. २९. ११३.
(V)--a temple with several peaks; the तोरण is of ३० hastas. M. २६९. २९, ३३, ४८. [पगे२-198+ २९]
(VI)--a disciple of ब्रह्मा. वा. २२. १६.
(VII)--one of the eight निधिस् of Kubera. वा. ४१. १०.
(VIII)--a brother of Vasudeva. वा. ९६. १४८.
(IX)--a son of Vanga and father of Sunandi. Vi. IV. २४. ५६.

--a pleasure garden of gods and Indra, noted for पारिजात; <F>1:  भा. III. २३. ४०; V. १६. १४; M. ३८. १८; वा. ३६. ११; ४६. 4; ४७. 3; ६९. १३६; ९१. 6; ९३. ६९.</F> visited by कृष्ण and सत्यभामा; <F>2:  भा. X. [६५ (v) १२-21]; [६७ (v) ३४].</F> in the Kai- लास on the north of इलावृत destroyed by Daityas; <F>3:  Br. II. १८. 4; III. 7. १०२; ६६. 6; IV. 9. ३९; M. १८३. 2; २१२. 9; Vi. II. 2. २५; V. 7. ६६; ३०. ३०; ३६. १२.</F> on the banks of मन्दाकिनी. ^4 M. १२१. 5; १३१. ४८; १३३. 9.
--a R. from the पारियात्र hill (ऋष्यवत्). Br. II. १६. २८; M. ११४. २५.
--another name for Nala, son of Taittiri. M. ४४. ६३.
--is Nanda gokula. Br. III. ३६. १३.
(I)--a celestial R. of शाल्मलिद्वीप, and sacred to Hari; <F>1:  भा. IV. 6. २४-27; V. २०. १०; VII. १४. ३२; VIII. 4. २३.</F> sacred to पितृस्. <F>2:  M. २२. १०.</F> [पगे२-199+ २७]
(II)--north of Vedi, sacred to महादेव. Br. III. १३. ८२-3.
(III)--a शक्ति; a goddess enshrined at the हिमा- layan slopes. Br. IV. ४४. ७२; M. १३. ३०.
--one of the three disciples of Rathitara. वा. ६१. 3.
(I)--a son of Svarga. भा. VI. 6. 6.
(II)--the वाहन of शिव; <F>1:  वा. ५४. ७६ and १०८; १०१. २६५.</F> harnessed the steeds of बाण's chariot. <F>2:  Vi. V. ३३. २८.</F>
(III)--a consort of धृति; was deserted by her for Soma. M. २३. २६.
(IV)--a गण attending on महादेव seated on the peak of the हिमालयस्. M. १९२. 6.
(V)--a son of Nandivardhana; with him the Pradyota line came to an end; was the fifth of the line. All the five ruled for a period of १३८ years. Vi. IV. २४. 7-8. [पगे२-200+ २७]
a तीर्थम् on the Nar- मदा. M. १९१. 6 and ३७.
--the place where Bharata lived during राम's exile. भा. IX. १०. ३६.
(I)--a शक्ति: the goddess enshrined at देवी- कातट; a Mother-goddess. Br. IV. ४४. ८४; M. १३. ३८; १७९. १४ and २५.
(II)--a R. of the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. २०.
--an उपपुराण; contains the माहात्म्य of Nandi described by कार्त्तिकेय. M. ५३. ६१.
(I)--the younger brother of भूतनन्दि (Madhunandi-वा। प्।); a king. Br. III. ७४. १८२.
(II)--a son of Nandana and brother of Sunandana. Vi. IV. २४. ५६.
(I)--a son of उदावसु and father of Suketu. भा. IX. १३. १४; Br. III. ६४. 7; वा. ८९. 7. Vi. IV. 5. २५.
(II)--a son of राजक (विशाखयूप) and the last of the five Pradyotanas, who ruled for १३८ years. भा. XII. 1. 4. [पगे२-201+ ३३]
(III)--a son of Ajaya (Ajaka-ब्र्। प्।) and father of महानन्दि; ruled for २० years (४०)? भा. XII. 1. 7. Br. III. ७४. १२६ and १३३.
(IV)--a palace with seven storeys; the तोरण is of ३२ hastas. M. २६९. २९, ४८.
(V)--a son of सूर्यक: was succeeded by शिशुनाक; ruled for thirty years. M. २७२. 5.
(VI)--the son of उदासि, and a शैसु- नाग ruled for ४० years. (४२ years ब्र्। प्।). M. २७२. ११; वा. ९९. ३२०.
(VII)--a son of Manivara; a यक्ष and a Guhyaka. वा. ६९. १५८.
(VIII)--a son of Janaka and father of Nandi of the Pradyota dynasty. Vi. IV. २४. 6-7.
(IX)--a son of Udayana and father of महानन्दि of the शैसनाभ dynasty. Vi. IV. २४. १७-8.
--one of the eighteen authors on architecture. M. २५२. 3.

--the god attendant on शिव; <F>1:  वा. ७७. ६३.</F> the vehicle of Rudra; <F>2:  भा. X. ६३. 6.</F> भगवान् with सूल; <F>3:  वा. ३०. ९१, ३१५.</F> cursed दक्ष for his hatred of शिव; <F>4:  भा. IV. 2. २०-26.</F> caught hold of Bhaga on the occasion of the destruction of Daksa's sacrifice; <F>5:  Ib. IV. 5. १७.</F> his permission to see [पगे२-202+ २९] शिव; temple of, at स्वर्गमार्ग Prasa1da. <F>6:  Br. III. ३२. २३; १३. ६३-4; IV. ३०. ७५; ३४. ८९; ४१. २६ and ३०; ४३. ३०.</F> Observed the vow सौभाग्यशयनम्; lord of a गण, versed in महेश्वर dharma; advised नारद to take to प्रयाग; the standard of शिव. <F>7:  M. ६०. ४९; ९५. 3; ११२. २१; १३२. १८; १३३. ६०-5.</F> Fought with विद्युन्मालि in Tripuram; <F>8:  Ib. १३५. ४८ and ५३; १३६. ६८; १३८. ४४. १४०. २०-1.</F> related to सनत्कुमार about the स्थानुत्वम् of शिव at Benares. <F>9:  Ib. १८१. 2; १८३. ६४; २४५. ८०. २६६. ४२. २७८. 9.</F>
--ruled for १०० years. वा. ९९. ३३०.
(I)--a son of निषध, and father of पुण्डरीक. भा. IX. १२. 1.
(II)--a month sacred to Indra. भा. XII. ११. ३७.
(III)--see प्रथक्वान्य; <F>1:  Br. II. १२. २३.</F> fourfold अग्नि in ग्र- तद्वोच स्थानम्। <F>2:  वा. २९. २१.</F>
(IV)--a son of Nala and father of पुण्ड- रीक of the dynasty of कुश, son of राम, (नभा-ब्र्। प्। and वि। प्।). Br. III. ६३. २०२; M. १२. ५२. वा. ८८. २०२. Vi. IV. 4. १०६.
(V)--a son of स्वारोचिष Manu. M. 9. 7
(VI)--a son of Auttama Manu. M. 9. १२. [पगे२-203+ २९]
(VII)--a Pravara ऋषि. M. १९९. १५.
(VIII)--a मन्त्रकृत्. वा. ५९. ९७.
(IX)--a son of Vipracitti. Vi. I. २१. ११.
--a son of Vaivasvata Manu and father of नाभाग. भा. VIII. १३. 2; IX. 1. १२; 4. 1. Br. III. ६३. 5; वा. ८८. 5.
--a queen of वऋषऋतु. Br. IV. ३२. २८.
--a son of ऊर्ज; from him were born two pieces which were combined by old age (जरा) and hence जरासन्ध. वा. ९९. २२५-26.
(I)--the month sacred to विवस्वान्. भा. XII. ११. ३८; Br. II. १३. 9; वा. ३०. 8, ५०, २०१; ५२. ११.
(II)--one of the four sons of स्वारोचिष Manu. M. 9. 7.
(III)--a son of Auttama Manu. M. 9. १२.

(IV)--(name of a month and tithi) (Trayo- दशि)--a युगादि for श्राद्ध. Trayambaka to be worshipped in कृष्णाष्तमि व्रत; <F>2:  Ib. ५६. 4.</F> austerity to be observed in सौभा- gyasayana व्रत in this month. <F>3:  Ib. ६०. ३४.</F> ^1 M. १७. 4. [पगे२-204+ ३६]
--a queen of वऋषऋतु. Br. IV. ३२. २८.
--a son of Mura (s.v.), attacked कृष्ण under direction from Naraka. भा. X. ५९. १२-14.
--a queen of अन्तर्धान and mother of हविर्धान. भा. IV. २४. 5.
--a son of प्रवीर and father of चारुपद. भा. IX. २०. 2.

--a son of Vipracitti. Lord of the Asuras, hostile to Indra; <F>1:  Vi. I. २१. ११.</F> a resident of the first talam or atala; <F>2:  वा. ५०. १५; ९८. ८१.</F> a nephew of हिरण्यकशिपु; married सुप्रभा, the daughter of स्वर्भानु; <F>3:  भा. VI. 6. ३२; Br. III. 6. १९; M. 6. २७.</F> followed वृत्र against Indra; <F>4:  भा. VI. १०. १९-31; Br. II. २०. १६.</F> took part in the देवासुर war between Bali and Indra; fought with अपराजित; heard of Bali's and Jambha's fall and fought with Indra; resisted with success Vajra on account of the fact that he could not be killed either by a dry or wet thing; Indra who came to know of this by a voice in the air used फेन (foam) and killed him to the satisfaction of all gods; <F>5:  भा. VII. 2. 4; VIII. १०. २० to the end; ११. १९, २३, २९-40; M. २२. ६१.</F> entertained desire for more territory; <F>6:  भा. XII. 3. ११.</F> taken to पाताल by वामन. <F>7:  Br. III. ७३. ८१; M. २४९. ६७.</F>
(I)--is politics; according to प्रह्लाद, it must be a means to realise Hari; <F>1:  भा. VII. 6. २६.</F> persons versed in Naya praise भेद उपाय। <F>2:  M. २२३. 4 and १६.</F> [पगे२-205+ ३२]
(II)--a son of Uttama Manu. Br. II. ३६. ३९.
(III)--a son of Raucya Manu. Br. IV. 1. १०४.
(IV)--a son of क्रिया. वा. १०. ३५.
(VI)--one of विश्वामित्र's sons. वा. ९१. ९६.
(VII)--one of the २० Amita1bha गणस्. वा. १००. १७.

(I) (नारायण)--an अवतार् of विष्णु, born of Dharma and मूर्ती, a daughter of दक्ष; आदिशेष form of Hari, distinguished for tapas; <F>1:  भा. I. 2. 4; 3. 9; II. 7. 6-7; XII. 8. ३२, ३५. Br. II. ३५-93; M. 1. 2.</F> a friend and associate of नारायण said to have performed tapas at बदरी; <F>2:  भा. III. 4. २२; IV. 1. ५२; VII. 6. २७.</F> seeing the sage's penance Indra got afraid and sent the God of Love and the Apsarasas to disturb his contemplation. Nara invited him and was hospitable by creating a number of beautiful women who served them; Nara asked them to choose one among them as an ornament of Heaven. So they took ऊर्वशि and narrated to Indra the superior powers of the sage; <F>3:  Ib. XI. 4. 6-१६; 7. १८.</F> was seen with नारायण by मार्कण्डेय and was praised by him. <F>4:  Ib. XII. 8. ३२, ३५, ४०-49; 9. 1.</F>
(II)--a son of तामस Manu. भा. VIII. I. २७; Br. II. ३६. ४९. Vi. III. 1. १९. [पगे२-206+ २८]
(III)--a son of सुधृति and father of Kevala (Candra वि। प्।). भा. IX. 2. २९. ३०; Br. III. 8. ३५; ६१. 9; Vi. IV. 1. ४०-1; वा. ८६. १३-14.
(IV)--a son of Manyu and father of सम्कृति. भा. IX. २१. 1.
(V)--a son of Gaya and father of विरात्. Br. II. १४. ६८; Vi. II. 1. ३८; वा. ३३. ५८.
(VI)--one of the ten horses of the moon's chariot. Br. II. २३. ३५; M. १२६. ५२.
(VII)--a साध्य; is satya in the स्वारोचिष epoch. Br. III. 3. १६-7; M. २०३. ११; २५१; २४-5; वा. ६६. १५; Br. II. ३६. ५०.
(VIII)--a son of Bhuvamanyu. M. ४९. ३६; वा. ९९. १५९.
(IX)--the riding vehicle of नैऋति and drawer of Kubera's chariot. M. २६१. १५ and २२.
(X)--a son of तामस Manu. वा. ६२. ४३.
--a son of अनृत; another name of Raurava. Br. II. 9. ६४; वा. १०. ३९.

--a nephew of हिरण्यकशिपु and son of the Earth and Vipracitti; lived in प्राग्ज्योतिष; <F>1:  M. 6. २७; १६१. ७८; १६३. ८१-2; २४५. १२. Vi. I. २१. १२८; V. 1. २४; १२. २१.</F> took away a [पगे२-207+ ४१] number of women belonging to sages and kings to his palace, robbed Mandara of its crest jewel, Aditi of her ear- rings and वरुण of his umbrella; demanded the ऐरावत from Indra; at Indra's request was cut in twain by कृष्ण in his own city प्राग्ज्योतिष; <F>2:  Ib. V. २९. 8-२१.</F> spoils distributed among his fol- lowers while all women were appropriated to कृष्ण's harem. <F>3:  Ib. V. ३१. १४-15.</F> Friend of वानर Dvivida who was killed by Baladeva. <F>4:  Ib. V. ३६. 2-२१.</F>
--a दानव with मनुष्य धर्म; <F>1:  वा. ६८. १५.</F> a Saimhi- keya; <F>2:  Ib. ६८. १९.</F> killed by कृष्ण. <F>3:  Ib. ९८. १०२.</F>
--is bhaumam (earth). M. ३९. 4, 7-8; ४१. 6.

--२७ hells under Yama; to them go the un- righteous according to their respective sins; after a certain period they are born as low beings according to their कर्म। <F>1:  Br. IV. 2. १४६-150.</F> Seven under the earth below the शेषलोक-- Raurava, शीतस्तप, कालसूतु, अप्रतिष्ठ, अवीची, लोहपृष्ठ, and Avidhya. <F>2:  वा. १०१. १४४-92; Vi. II. 6. 1. (whole).</F>

--(Naraka, s.v. Bhauma); Born of Hari in his Boar manifestation when he touched and raised the Earth, <F>1:  भा. X. ५९. ३०[1]; [६५ (v) 1].</F> hence son of Earth, <F>2:  Ib. X. ५९. ५९. [1] and 2.</F> an asura friend of Kamsa; <F>3:  Ib. X. 2. 2; ३६. ३६.</F> a friend of the वानर Dvivida; <F>4:  Ib. X. ६७. 2; ६९. [3] 1.</F> ran away with the umbrella of वरुण, कुण्डल of Aditi and contested the position of Indra. <F>5:  Ib. X. ५९. [1] and 2.</F> Fought with सनैश्चर in the देवासुर war; <F>6:  Ib. X. ७३. २०; ८३. ४०; Br. III. 6. १५; ७३. १०२; IV. २९. १२५.</F> find- [पगे२-208+ ३३] ing Mura and his sons dead, came out with elephants, which were all killed by गरुड; fought with कृष्ण till his head was cut off and the ladies of his harem married by Him (कृष्ण); <F>7:  भा. VIII. १०. ३३.</F> lost his kingdom through pride of power. <F>8:  Ib. X. ५९. १४-22; ३७. १६; I. १०. २९.</F>
--one of the 6 kinds of fortresses. M. २१७. 6.
--the eighteenth, out of the अवतार्स् of विष्णु; did heroic deeds, subduing the sea and so on. भा. I. 3. २२.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४३.

--The two sages comprising the fourth अवतार् of विष्णु and born of मूर्ती; universal joy and good omens at their birth; गन्धमादन their abode; <F>1:  भा. I. 2. 4, २६; 3. 9; IV. 1. ५२-57; Vi. V. २४. 5; ३७. ३४ and ३७.</F> born later as कृष्ण and अर्जुण; <F>2:  Ib. IV. 1. ५९.</F> worshipped by नाभी; <F>3:  Ib. V. 4. 4.</F> wor- shipped in भारतवर्ष; <F>4:  Ib. V. १९. 9.</F> praised by नारद. <F>5:  Ib. V. १९. १२-15.</F> To their आश्रम the sages repaired for a visit; <F>6:  Ib. IX. 1. ३१.</F> shrine of, at Badar- याश्रम. <F>7:  Ib. X. ५२. 4.</F>
--one of the births of the जयादेवस्; these are विपश्चित्, Indra, Satya and Hari. वा. ५४. ७५; ६६. १४.
--the belly of the personified Veda. वा. १०४. ८४. [पगे२-209+ २९]
--an attribute of Kubera. M. १७४. १८.

--The अवतार् of Hari to kill हिरण्यकशिपु by the nails neither wet nor dry; <F>1:  Br. III. 5. २६-27; ५७. ५७; ७३. ७४; वा. ६७. ६६; ९७. ७३; ९८. ७३; १११. ७२; Vi. I. २०. ३२.</F> on ब्रह्मा granting the request of हिरण्यकशिपु, Narasimha was approached by the gods; Narasimha promised to slay him and left for the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु; प्रह्लाद alone knew Him to be the Lord; all the Asuras attacked him from all sides; finally Narasimha killed him by tearing him with his teeth. <F>2:  M. ५३. ५०. chh. १६१, १६२ and १६३; २८५. 6.</F>
--the daughter of सुयग्ञ (श्वफल्क, वा। प्।) and wife of भन्गकार; had two sons शत्रुघ्न and Ban- धुमान्, whom अक्रूर killed. Br. III. ७१. ८७. वा. ९६. ८६.
--a son of कालनेमि; <F>1:  Br. III. 5. ३९; वा 67. ८०.</F> was killed in the लन्का war. <F>2:  भा. IX. १०. १८.</F>

(I)--a son of Vaivasvata Manu and father of Citrasena and Suca; his line ends with जातूकर्ण्य. भा. VIII. १३. 2; IX. 1. १२; 2. १९, २२; Br. III. ६०. 3; M. ११. ४१; १२. २०; वा. ६४. २९; ८५. 4; Vi. III. 1. ३३; IV. 1. 7.
(II)--(नाभाग) a son of स्वायम्भुव Manu. Br. II. ३८. ३१. वा. ८५ 4. [पगे२-210+ ४३]
(III)--a son of Marutta and father of Dama. Br. III. 8. ३५; ६१. 7; वा. ८६. १२; Vi. IV. 1. ३४-5.
--is Candragupta Maurya. Br. III. ७४. १४३.

(I)--a महानदि of the भारतवर्ष; a R. from the ऋक्ष or ऋष्यवत् hills: (Vindhyan ranges) on its northern bank was भृगुकच्छ: a sacred river that sur- vived the अन्तरक्षय, sacred to पितृस् and for श्राद्ध; in the neighbourhood of the Haihaya kingdom. <F>1:  भा. V. १९. १८; VIII. १८. २१; Br. II. १२. १४; १६. २९; III. १०. ९७; M. 2. १३-15; २२. २५; ११४. २३; वा. ४५. ९९; ७७. ३२; ९४. २८; १०८. ८२; V. II. 3. ११.</F> The scene of battle between वृत्र and Indra; here Rukmi challenged कृष्ण when the latter was crossing the stream with रुक्मिणी; its current was stopped by कार्त- वीर्य. <F>2:  भा. VI. १०. १६; X. ५४. २३[1]; Br. III. १३. 8, ३२; २६. १० and ३८; ३८. 3 and 7; ४१. १५; ४५. 2; ६९. २८; M. ४३. ३१; ४४. ३१; ४४. ३१; १६३. ६३; Vi. IV. ११. १९.</F> The महात्म्य of; just like मार्कण्डेय this river does not get lost in the time of the deluge; in Kalinga, near the अमरकण्टक hill; has a number of तीर्थस् like जलेश्वर, रुद्रकोटि, अम्रकण्टक, Kapila and विशल्य Karan2i. The devotee bathing in any तीर्थ on the नर्मदा gets the benefit of performing an अश्वमेध sacrifice. <F>3:  M. ch. १८६.</F> The Lord enshrined here is महेश्वर who devised plans to vanquish बाणासुर of Tripura with the help of नारद. The Lord was much concerned about virtuous ladies in Tripura and नारद undertook to delude them by proclaiming ordinances to ladies to give gifts to poor and deserving Brahmanas. <F>4:  Ib. ch. १८७.</F> शिव got ready for war here and attacked Tripura with incendiary materials. Out of the three cities comprising Tripura, (s.v.) two fell down reduced to ashes. The first city became converted into the श्रि S4aila hill, and the second अमरकण्टक hill, both adorned by the Siddhas, Gandharvas and so on. The Lord enshrined at the latter is ज्वालेश्वर. The third city was left unconsumed. <F>5:  Ib. ch. १८८.</F> [पगे२-211+ ३८] It is said that at the confluence of the नर्मदा with कावेरी, Kubera practised tapas in honour of शिव and be- came the Lord of the यक्षस्. A bath here is equal to that at the confluence of the गन्गा and the यमुना. <F>6:  Ib. ch. १८९.</F> To the north of the नर्मदा are a number of तीर्थम्स् like मन्त्रेश्वर, गर्जना, अम्रातक, करन्या, कुण्डेश्- vara and others. A bath in each of them rids one of all sins. Then follows other तीर्थस्, all equally sacred, includ- ing रावणेश्वर, the shrines of Kubera, अहल्यातीर्थ, and the shrine of जनार्दन. Here Agni, धर्मराज and वायु practised asceticism and attained emancipation. A visit to शुक्लतीर्थम् sacred to राजऋषि Ca1n2akya washes off all the sins of a life time. Any gift given here bears rich fruits. <F>7:  Ib. chh. १९०-192.</F> Among the other sacred places can be mentioned the भृगुतीर्थम्, Kankhala, where गरुड once was in austereties, कन्यातीर्थ, पितामहतीर्थ, and स्वर्गद्वार- तीर्थम्; He who reads or listens to the glory of the नमदा has his wishes fulfilled whatever be his caste. <F>8:  Ib. chh. १९३-194.</F> On its banks Purukutsa heard the विष्णु पुराण from the sages. <F>9:  Vi. I. 2. 9; IV. 3. 7-१६.</F> Penance here by Asuras, who became converted into Arhats. <F>१०:  Ib. III. १८. 1 and १३.</F> मरुभूमीविषय on the N. ruled by शूद्रस् and other castes. <F>११:  Ib. IV. २४. ६८.</F>

(II)--the मानसकन्या of शुकाला Pitr2s; given in marriage to Purukutsa by her brother Uraga; and mother of Trasadasyu; she took him to रसातल where he killed some bad Gandharvas to the satisfaction of the नागस्: <F>1:  भा. IX. 7. 2-3; Br. III. १०. ९७; वा. ७३. ४८; ८८. ७४.</F> Heard the विष्णु पुराण from him and narrated it to धृतराष्ट्र the नाग and आपूरण. <F>2:  Vi. VI. 8. ४५.</F> [पगे२-212+ २७]
(III)--the wife of युवनाश्व, son of Amba- रीष. Br. III. ६३. ७३.
(IV)--a mind-born daughter of Somapa पितृस्: one of the १६ wives of हव्यवाहन: turned into a river of दक्षिणापथ. M. १५. २५, २८; ५१. १३; वा. ७७. ३२.
--sages of, visited द्वारका. भा. X. ९०. २८. [5].
--on the नर्मदा. M. १९४. 2.
(I)--a son of Yadu. भा. IX. २३. २०; Vi. IV. ११. 5.
(II)--a Vanara son of Agni born by the wife of Kanakabindu. Br. III. 7. २२९.
(III)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३४.
(IV)--a nephew of हिरण्यकशिपु. M. 6. २६.

(V)--the son of निषध, hence नैषध; with the son of वीरसेन he made the two Nalas in the कश्यप line; <F>1:  M. १२. ५२, ५६; वा. ८८. २०२.</F> taught the game of dice to King ऋतुपर्ण. <F>2:  भा. IX. 9; १७; Br. III. ६३. १७३ and २०२, ७४. १९०; वा. ८८. १७४; Vi. IV. 4. ३७.</F> Learned in अश्वविद्या. [पगे२-213+ २८]
(VI)--a son of वीरसेन. M. १२. ५६.
(VII)--also known as Nandanodaradundubhi, son of Taittiri, performed अश्वमेध, and in the middle of the अतिरात्र rite Punarvasu appeared and became his son. M. ४४. ६३-5.
--a people of the southern country. वा. ४५. १२७.

--a son of Kubera and ऋद्धि; as an attendant of Rudra became very proud and with his brother मणिग्रीव enjoyed maidens' embrace on the Ganges, all naked. नारद saw this when the ladies put on their dress while नलकूबर and his brother continued to remain nak- ed owing to their drunkenness. The sage cursed them to become trees for a hundred divine years without losing the पूर्ववासन। So they stood till कृष्ण redeemed them by bringing down the trees; their prayer to कृष्ण; set out to the north, permitted by कृष्ण. भा. X. 9. २२. २३; १०. (whole); Br. III. 8. ४६. वा. ७०. ४१.
(I)--one of the eastern entrances of the city of पुरञ्जन <F>1:  भा. IV. २५. ४८.</F> allegorically the nostrils. <F>2:  Ib. २९. ११.</F>
(II)--one of the wives of अजमीढ and mother of नील. भा. IX. २१. ३०. Vi. IV. १९. ५६.
(IV)--digging of lakes at the auspicious hour; the same prescription as for the excavation of तदाग; is also पुष्करणि. M. ५८. 1, ५१.

(V)--a name for the Ganges; <F>1:  M. १०२. 6.</F> a stream of the गन्गा, flows east through the countries of Tomara, Hamsa- मार्ग, Haihaya, कर्णप्रावरण, अश्वमुख, शिकता- parvatamaru, विद्याधर, and नागमण्डल and reaches the salt ocean; <F>2:  Br. II. १८. ४०, ५८-61; वा. ४७. ३८ and ५६.</F> one of the seven streams, and one of the three going towards the western direction. <F>3:  M. १२१. ४०.</F>

--a measurement in connection with the chariot of Maya; <F>1:  M. १७३. 2; Br. IV. 2. १२५; ३६. ४९.</F> the seat of हिरण्यकशिपु in his सभा was १० nalvas in measurement; <F>2:  M. १६१. ७१.</F> a furlong in distance; ३०० dhanus. <F>3:  वा. ८३. ४९; १०१. १२५.</F>
(I)--a son of स्वारोचिष Maru. Br. II. ३६. १९.
(II)--a son of नवा and उशीनर; chief of Nava- राष्ट्र. Br. III. ७४. १९ and २१; M. ४८. १८ and २१; वा. ९९. २०, २२. Vi. IV. १८. 9.

--see Ayutahoma: the nine planets are the Sun, Moon, अङ्गारक, Budha, शनैश्चर, शुक्र, Guru, राहु and Ketu: इश्वर, उमा, श्कन्द, Hari, ब्रह्मा, Indra, Yama, काल, and Citragupta are अधिदेवतस्; Agni, Waters, Earth, विष्णु, Indra, Aindri, प्रजापति, नागस् and ब्रह्मणस् are प्रत्यधिदेवतस्। M. ९३. 6, १०-16. [पगे२-215+ २८]
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४४.
--a measurement; for the figures of विष्णु and देवी; <F>1:  M. २५८. १६, ७५.</F> honoured even by gods. <F>2:  वा. ५९. 9.</F>
--one who preaches neo-dharma; applied to Yadu by ययाति. वा. ९३. ३७.
--महापद्म and his eight sons, who ruled for १०० years. भा. XII. 1. १२.
--rulers of the city of चम्पावती. वा. ९९. ३८२.
--fit for gift during the विशोकद्वादशी- vrata. M. ८२. २१.
--भृगु, Pulastya, Pulaha, Kratu, आन्गिरस, मरीचि, दक्ष, Atri, and वसिष्ठ; according to the पुराणस्। वा. 9. ६८-69.
--the son of भीमरथ (Rathavara-ब्र्। and वा। प्।) and father of दशरथ (दृधरथ-म्। प्।). भा. IX. २४. 4; Br. III. ७०. ४३; M. ४४. ४१-42; वा. ९५. ४२; Vi. IV. १२. ४१.
--the name of both the Kingdom and capi- tal of Nava, the son of उशीनर. Br. III. ७४. २१; M. ४८. २१; वा. ९९. २२. [पगे२-216+ ३०]
--the land of nine continents: जम्बूद्वीप. वा. ३४. 9.
--sons of जामा and Dharma dependent on three paths: दक्षिण, Uttara and Madhyama respectively वैश्वानर, ऐरावत and जारद्गवी. Br. III. 3. ३३-51.
--one of the five queens of उशीनर and mother of Nava. Br. III. ७४. १८-19; M. ४८. १६. १८; वा. ९९. १९-20.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४०.

(I)--the first of the five sons of आयु (स्वर्भानु) and प्रभा; married विरजा, a mind-born daughter of the आज्यपपित्र्स्; had by her six (seven म्। प्।) sons, comparable to Indra in efflulgence namely, Yati, ययाति, सम्याति, आयाति and two others; ruled heaven in the absence of Indra in the मानस lake; due to an offence he gave to इन्द्राणि on account his own overweaning pride he lost his place, fell down and was condemned to be an अजागर (serpent); <F>1:  भा. IX. १७. 1; १८. 1-2; VI. १३. १६; X. ७३. २०; Br. II. २७. २४; III. 6. २४; १०. ९५; ६७. 2; ६८. ११; M. १५. २३; २४. ३४, ४९; वा. ६८. २४; ७३. ४६. ९२. 2; ९३. १२-3. Vi. IV. 8. 3; 9. २८; १०. 1.</F> was succeeded by ययाति; <F>2:  भा. IX. १८. 3.</F> divisions of more territory on earth. <F>3:  Ib. XII. 3. 9.</F>
(III)--a काद्रवेय Na1ga. Br. III. 7. ३७; वा. ६९. ७४.
(IV)--one of the nine sons of Manu. वा. ८५. 4.
(V)--a son of Yadu of the lunar line. Vi. IV. 6. 4; ११. 5.
--a son of Kali: had no body: married सकुनी; <F>1:  Br. III. ५९. १०; वा. ८४. १०, १३.</F> a man-eater. <F>2:  वा. ८४. ११.</F>
--a name of heaven. वा. ३४. ९४.
--a कश्यप and a त्रयार्षेय. M. १९९. १२.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २५.
--a R. from the lake विष्णुपद. Br. II. १८. ६८.
--a measurement according to stars and their movements. Br. II. २१. १३७; वा. ५०. १८८.
--measurement of time of ६२५ Kalas. वा. १००. २२३.
(I)--Mt. north of the महाभद्र lake; <F>1:  भा. V. १६. २६; वा. ३६. ३१.</F> on the north of Meru. <F>2:  Vi. II. 2. ३०.</F> [पगे२-218+ ४०]
(II)--as the यज्ञोपवीत of शिव, as a source of मूर्छन (Music). Br. III. ३२. १९; ६१. ५३.

(I)--creatures born with human forms above the naval and of snakes below; born of कश्यप and Kadru; their capital was भोगवती; their chief was Ananta; <F>1:  भा. I. ११. ११; II. 6. १३; III. २०. ४८; XI. १६. १९; २४. १३; M. २६१. ४७-50.</F> came to द्वारका with the gods; <F>2:  भा. XI. 6. 3; १२. 3; १४. 6.</F> attacked the chariot of the Lord; <F>3:  Ib. XII. ११. ४८.</F> residents of the नैषध Hill, of all talams and especially पातलम्; capital माहिष्मती, renowned for Karko- टक sabha1; worship पितृस्; <F>4:  Br. II. १६. 9, २१; १७. ३४; २०. ४५; III. ६९. २६; IV. 2. २६; 6. ७२; 9. ७२; Vi. II. 5. 4.</F> वासुकि, as their overlord; <F>5:  M. 8. 7.</F> when milking the cow-earth तक्षक was the calf; <F>6:  Ib. १०. १९-20.</F> celebrated the marriage of शिव and उमा; <F>7:  Ib. १५४. ४६२.</F> to be worshipped in Palace buildings. <F>8:  Ib. २६६. ४६; २६८. १७; २७३. ७१.</F>

(III)--nine in number ruled from चम्पावती (पद्मावती-वि। प्।) seven ruled from मथुरा for ३८३ years the territory surrounding the गन्गा and प्रयाग. साकेत and Magadha were under their control. Br. II. ७४. १९४-5, २६७; वा. ९९. ४५३; Vi. IV. २४. ६३.

(IV)--elephants; created for use in the देवासुर wars; other names are Dvirada, Hasti, Kari, वारण, Danti, Gaja, कुञ्जर, मातन्ग, द्वीप, सामज: turning of the tongue due to the curse of Agni and two tusks and enormous strength by curse of the Gods; see also दिग्नागस्. Br. III. 7. ३४, ३३४-5. [पगे२-219+ २३]
(V)--elephants born of साम. Br. III. 7. ३३४-5.
--the communities of नागस् in रसातल. Vi. IV. 3. 4.
--a hill of Indra. Br. II. १६. २१.
--sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ३३.
--Presiding deity, नागस्. वा. ८६. ६०.
--one of the nine divisions of the भारत- वर्ष. Br. II. १६. 9; M. ११४. 8; वा. ४५. ७९. Vi. II. 3. 7.
--a R. of the Bhadra country. वा. ४३. २८.
--वरुण's wedding present to कामेश्वर. Br. IV. १५. २०.
--fit for श्राद्ध. वा. ७७. ८९.
--the giver of Kanaka--कल्पलता goes to; <F>1:  M. २८६. १५; वा. १००. १५७.</F> is रसातल <F>2:  Vi. IV. 3. 7.</F> one who bathes in the तीर्थ on the नर्मदा attains नागलोक. <F>3:  M. १९१. ८४.</F>
--East of अञ्जन; otherwise एकमूल; also between the Vindhyas and the Ganges; also the country of करूषस्. वा. ६९. २३८.

--the northern course; three periods of sunrise here in अश्विनि, कृत्तिका, and याम्या (भरणि) as also रोहिणि, आर्द्रा and मृगशिरस्; <F>1:  Br. II. २१. ७६-7; III. 3. ४७; M. १२४. ५३, ५५; वा. ६६. ४८.</F> north of this was Deva- यान; <F>2:  Br. II. २१. १६८.</F> the northern path of Abhijit; its preceding नक्षत्र, स्वाति. <F>3:  वा. I. ९२; ५०. १२९, १५६, २१६; Br. I. 1. ७७.</F>
--a daughter of यामी (जामि-वि। प्।) and Dharma. M. 5. १८; Vi. I. १५. १०७.
--the son जाम्य, containing the three paths. वा. ६६. ३४.
--a Mt. the region between this and कपिञ्जल hill described. वा. ३८. ६६, ७०; ४२. ६७.
--with the sun in the months of शुचि and शुक्र. Br. II. २३. 7. [पगे२-221+ २७]
--हस्तिनापुर washed by the Ganges; कौशाम्बि became the capital under Nirvaktra son of Adhi- साम Kr2s2n2a (also गजसाह्वयम्). M. ४९. ४२; ५०. ७८; वा. ९९. २७१. Vi. V. ३५. 8 and १९.
--the temple of, in सुपक्ष hill. वा. ३९. ६३.
--hearing of the chapters on the गजेन्द्रमोक्ष (s.v.) described in the भागवत पुराण mitigates the evil effects of bad dreams. M. २४२. १७.
--a class of sages. M. २००. १७.
--a तपोवन and a तीर्थ near गर्गेश्व- ram on the नर्मदा, bath in, leads one to नागलोक. M. १९१. ८३-84.
--a sage; a महासिद्ध. Br. III. ३६. 5.

--(सत्या s.v.) a daughter of नाग्नजित्; mar- ried by कृष्ण in a स्वयम्वर after curbing the seven bulls with noses unbored; had two sons, one of whom was Bha- dravinda. भा. III. 3. 4; X. ५८. ३२; ६१. १३; M. ४७. १३, १९; Vi. V. ३२. 3.
--connected with वागीशी. Br. IV. ३७. 8.
--the science of नाट्य or dancing of which Vararuci, the Gandharva was an expert. M. १०. २५. [पगे२-222+ २४]
--a pupil of लौगाक्षी. Br. II. ३५. ४१.
--definition of; <F>1:  भा. III. ११. 8; Br. II. २१. १३०; III. 3. ४४.</F> is १५ kala1s, ascertained by a measure of water. <F>2:  Vi. VI. 3. 7.</F>
--a वैकुण्ठ God from the root meaning, pro- tection. Br. II. ३६. ५७; वा. ६४. १९.
--a sage of the चाक्षुष epoch. M. 9. २२.
--an अमिताभ God of the स्वारोचिष epoch. Br. II. ३६. ५३.
--one of the twelve शक्तीस्. Br. IV. ४४. ८७.
--a kind of श्राद्ध for propitiating the पितृस्. Vi. III. १३. 6.
--all auspicious ceremonies to be per- formed after this ceremony. M. १७. ६९.
--a Marut of the sixth गण. Br. III. 5. ९७. [पगे२-223+ २८]
--a son of शम्भु. वा. ६७. ८१.
(I)--the son of श्रुत and father of Sindhu- द्वीप. भा. IX. 9. १६.
(II)--one of the ten sons of हृदीक. M. ४४. ८२.
--the son of Vaivasvata Manu (नाभा- नोरिष्ठ). वा. ६४. २९.
(I)--a son of Vaivasvata Manu and father of अम्बरीष. भा. VIII. १३. 2; Br. III. ६०. 3; M. ११. ४१; १२. २०; वा. ६४. २९; ८८. 5-6; Vi. III. 1. ३३; IV. 1. 7.
(II)--a son of दिष्त and father of Bhalan- dana (Balamdhana-वि। प्।) became a वैश्य by profession. भा. IX. 2. २३; Br. III. ६१. 3; Vi. IV. 1. १९.

(III)--the last son of Nabhaga and a bachelor; saw his father's property divided among his other brothers and himself left with nothing; on his father's advice he went to the sacrifice of अन्गीर's descendants and explained the sixth day rituals relating to विश्वेदेवस्. When the sacri- ficers went to Heaven their unspent wealth was presented to him. At this time appeared a person of dark complexion who was Rudra and who claimed all the property as his own; when Nabhaga was consulted he said that on a certain occasion, all the remainder in a sacrificial hall was left to Rudra. So नाभाग apologised and gave away all that [पगे२-224+ ३१] wealth. With this Rudra was pleased and initiated him into the knowledge of the Brahman. After making a present of all that wealth to the prince, he disappeared. भा. IX. 4. 1-१३; Br. III. ६३. 5.
(IV)--is नरिष्यन्त. Br. II. ३८. ३१.
(V)--the grandson of भगीरथ, son of श्रुत: and father of अम्बरीष. Br. III. ६३. १७०; M. १२. ४५; वा. ८८. १७०; Vi. IV. 2. 5-6; 4. ३६.
(VI)--(काश्यप) a sage of the II सावर्ण epoch. Br. IV. 1. ७०.
(VII)--a sage of the X epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. २७.
--one of the nine sons of Manu; <F>1:  वा. ८५. 4.</F> his son, Bhalandana. <F>2:  Ib. ८६. 3.</F>
--a royal dynasty. Br. II. ३५. ९६.

(I)--the eldest of अग्नीध्र and of the country, हिमाह्व; married मेरुदेवी; performed a sacrifice for the birth of a son; the Lord appeared in the course of the sacrifice and promised to be born as his son; this was ऋषभ the eighth अवतार् of विष्णु <F>1:  भा. I. 3. १३; II. 7. १०; V. 2. १९; 3. 1-2, १७-20; 4. 1-3; XI. 2. १५; Br. II. १४. ४५, ५९-60; वा. ३३. ३८, ४१, ५०; Vi. II. 1. १६ and १८, २७.</F> after he came of age, नाभि had ऋषभ installed on the throne, and left with his queen for विशाला for tapas and having propitiated नारायण became a जीवन्मुक्त। <F>2:  भा. V. 4. 3-5.</F> [पगे२-225+ ३३]
(II)--a pupil of कुशुमि. Br. II. ३५. ४३.
--a son of हिरण्यरेतस् of कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १४.
--a सम्स्कार done to Vasudeva's sons by Garga. <F>1:  भा. X. 8. ११-14.</F> a कर्म on the tenth day after birth. <F>2:  Vi. III. १०. 8-११.</F>
--a gupta शक्ति. Br. IV. १९. १९; ३६. ७०.
--an army leader; ten in तारक's army; their names, ensigns, chariots, etc., detailed. M. १४८. ४३-56.
--a Pravara (Angiras). M. १९६. १७.

(I)--the beloved tenth son of ब्रह्मा, born of his lap; one of the twelve, who knew the धर्म ordained by Hari; a celibate; an attendant of Hari; was taught the भागवत by the father; and he gave it in his turn to व्यास; guru of विशोक (s.v.) author of सात्वततन्त्र; wor- shipped नारायण in भारतवर्ष by following the course of सान्ख्य and yoga; did not comprehend Hari's माया; faith in Kriyayoga which he expounded; in previous births, he was a Gandharva by name उपबर्हण and a son of a दासि. <F>1:  भा. I. 4. ३२-33; II. 9. ४०-44; III. १२. २२-3; IV. 8. १५; १३. 3-4; V. १९. १०-15; VI. 3. २०; 4. ३९; VII. 1. 5; ११. 3; १५. ६९-73; X. 1. ६१ [1], ६४; ३९. ५४; ९०. ३४ [1]; XI. २७. 2; XII. 4. ४१; १३. १९; M. 3. 8; वा. 1. १३०; ६५. १३५, १४२; Br. I. 1. १११; M. 5. 5-११; वा. ६५. १३९, १४६-50, १५६.</F> A देवऋषि holding the वीणा in his hand; called on व्यास and complimented him on having produced the भारत and asked him why he looked uneasy; when he admitted his inability to explain the cause, the sage treated him to a dis- [पगे२-226+ ५०] course on devotion to Hari and incidentally gave an account of his own past; how in a previous birth he was a son of a ser- vant-maid in the service of seers and Brahmanas, how he was brought up by the latter with affection, how their asso- ciation helped him to cultivate devotion to Lord, how after their departure he wandered aimlessly with his mother who soon died, how he was sitting in the forest meditating on the Lord when He appeared in his mind; in a later Kalpa he was born of ब्रह्मा as नारद; <F>2:  भा. I. chh. 5 and 6; वा. ५२. 3.</F> advised हर्यश्वास् on the path of ‘not returning’ (अनिवर्तन) which they adopted; with his mind set on ईश्वर-Brahman he advised again their brothers शबलाश्वास् in the same way and they followed it too; for so advising his sons, he was cursed by दक्ष to be always a wanderer with no settled home; <F>3:  भा. VI. 5 (whole); Vi. V. 1. ६७; १५. 3.</F> accompanied Angiras to the court of Citraketu lamenting his child's death; instructed him in मन्त्रोपनिषद् to realise the presence of सन्कर्षण; showed the king and his relations the जीव of the dead child but pointing how the आत्मन् alone is eternal; the text of the विद्या imparted to Citraketu; went back to Angiras in Brahmaloka; could not find fault with Hara for violating Brahmaloka धर्म; told शुक the story of Citraketu; could not comprehend the Great Being; <F>4:  भा. VI. १४. 9-६१; chh. १५, १६ and १७.</F> could not comprehend Hari's माया; <F>5:  Ib. IX. 4. ५७.</F> cursed नलकूबेर and मणिग्रीव, sons of Kubera, for their intoxicated pride; his view on the merits of poverty as contrasted with wealth; went to Nara-नारायण's abode after cursing Kubera's sons; <F>6:  Ib. X. 9. २३; १०. 8-१८, २३.</F> welcomed ब्रह्मा while with Priyavrata and his father Manu; <F>7:  Ib. V. 1. 6-9, ३८.</F> called on प्राचीनबर्हिस् and imparted अध्यात्मतत्व by narrat- ing the story of पुरञ्जन and explaining by it the relation of जीव to परमात्म; then he went back to Siddha- loka; met प्राचेतसस् performing austerities on the western sea and advised the quick path to reach Hari; departed to Brahmaloka; sang the praise of Ananta in Brhmasabha; <F>8:  Ib. IV. chh. २५-31; V. २५. 9.</F> advised हरिश्चन्द्र to pray to वरुण for a child; <F>9:  Ib. IX. 7. 8.</F> spoke to ऊर्वशी of पुरूरवस् as a handsome person; <F>१०:  Ib. IX. १४. १६.</F> [पगे२-227+ ४९] informed हिरण्याक्ष of विष्णु's residence in रसातल; spoke of Kardama's greatness and personality to देवहूती who from that time fixed her mind on him; came with and went with ब्रह्मा to see Kapila born of Kardama; <F>११:  Ib. III. १८. 1; २२. १०-12; २४. २०.</F> told शिव about Sati's self-immolation in दक्ष's यज्ञ; <F>१२:  Ib. IV. 5. 1.</F> met Dhruva coming out of his father's city and advised him as to the way of worshipping विष्णु by initiating him into the secret मन्त्र; met उत्तानपाद and encouraged the distressed king that the boy would soon return and add glory to his line; praised Dhruva; <F>१३:  Ib. IV. 8. २५-69; १२. ४०-30.</F> learnt from Hari the true knowledge which he imparted to प्रह्लाद; saw Indra taking हिरण्यकशिपु's queen and asked him to set her at liberty which he did; then he placed her under safe custody as she was pregnant until her hus- band's return; taught to प्रह्लाद a मन्त्र sacred to Hari. <F>१४:  Ib. IV. १९. 6.</F> Spoke of Jamba's death to Namuci and others. Deputed by ब्रह्मा, नारद went to Gods requesting them to no more fight the asuras; <F>१५:  Ib. VII. 6. २७-28; 7. 7-१६.</F> informed Kamsa of the divinity of Vasudeva, वृष्णिस्, Nandas, and went with Gods to encourage देवकी; <F>१६:  Ib. VIII. ११. १९-43.</F> induced Yavana to lay siege to मथुरा; <F>१७:  Ib. X. 1. ६१[1]; 2. २५; Vi. V. 1. ६७.</F> narrated the story of Pradyumna to his parents; inform- ed मायावती that the child discovered in the fish was Pra- dyumna, काम reborn, and hence her husband; revealed Pradyumna's identity to the doubters of द्वारका; <F>१८:  भा. X. [५०. ४४]; ५१. 5.</F> sang the praise of कृष्ण when he lifted the Govar- dhana; informed Kamsa that राम and कृष्ण were the sons of Vasudeva who had kept them in secret and prevented Kamsa from starting out to kill Vasudeva; told Kamsa his story of his birth; visited कृष्ण and spoke to him in secret what he was destined to do beginning with the day after when he would kill Kamsa and others and left for his place; <F>१९:  Ib. X. ५५. 6-३६; Vi. V. २७. 9-१३, २५.</F> informed कृष्ण of imprisonment of Aniruddha by बाण and शाम्ब by the Kurus; visited द्वारका desirous of seeing कृष्ण in the house of each of his numerous wives at the same time and saw that ब्रह्मण्यदेव who was [पगे२-228+ ४९] engaged in different things at the different houses, was wel- comed separately in every house; left the place pleased; called on कृष्ण to inform him of युधिष्ठिर's desire to perform राजसूय; the purpose of his visit was accom- plished; <F>२०:  भा. X. २७. २४; ३६. १६-19 [२७]; ३७. 9-२४; ३९. 9.</F> narrated in the राजसूय sacrifice of युधिष्ठिर, how Caidya the hater of Hari entered into Him, the Supreme Being, as well as the previous history of दमघोष and Dantavaktra. <F>२१:  Ib. X. ६३. 2; ६८. १३; ६९ (whole); ७०. ३२-44; ७१. ११, १८; Vi. V. ३३. १०; ३७. 6.</F> Came to see भीष्म on his death-bed; <F>२२:  भा. VII. 1. १२-43.</F> addressed by युधिष्ठिर, नारद said that everything was the work of time and the will of God; informed युधिष्- ठिर that धृतराष्ट्र was in the हिमालयस् engaged in the penance and would die within five days; and went back to heaven; <F>२३:  Ib. I. 9. 6.</F> came to see परीक्षित् practising प्रायोपवेश; <F>२४:  Ib. I. १३. ३७-59.</F> welcomed by कृष्ण, युधिष्ठिर and others, नारद, drew the attention of कृष्ण to the necessity of vanquishing शाल्व who was out to cut the root of the यादवस्; knew of कृष्ण's glory and greatness and told लक्ष्मणा of it; praised Vasudeva for his question on Karma; left for Sya- मन्तपञ्चक; <F>२५:  Ib. I. १९. १०.</F> went with कृष्ण to मिथिला, heard स्रुतिगीता from नारायण at नारायणाश्रम; visited श्वेतद्वीप during Brahmasatra; called upon व्यास and communicated to him what he heard from नारायण; advised by वृत्र to worship शिव as the most easily pleased among the Gods; <F>२६:  Ib. X. ७६. 2 [2-१०]; 3-7 [1-4]; ८३. १७; ८४. 3, ३०-33, ५७.</F> left with other sages for पिण्डारक; visited द्वारका and met Vasudeva; questioned by him on भागवत धर्म, he related the conversation that took place between Nimi, the Videha King, and the nine sages, the sons of ऋषभ; <F>२७:  Ib. X. ८६. १८; ८७. 4-5, १०, ४७-8; ८८. १४-16.</F> views of, on thirty characteristics of धर्म, on the वर्णस् and women; on a ब्रह्मचारि, वानप्रस्थ, a Yati, and a गृहस्थ; <F>२८:  Ib. XI. 1. १२; chh. 2-5 (whole).</F> enquired of ब्रह्मा the knowledge lead- ing to the realisation of आत्मन्; a महाभागवत who attained Hari through devotion. <F>२९:  Ib. VII. chh. ११-14 (whole).</F> Sang a गाथ in honour of कार्तवीर्य Arjuna: compiled the नारदीय धर्म; told the रामायण to वाल्मीकि; <F>३०:  Ib. II. 4. २५; 5. 1-8; VII. 1. ३०; XI. २७. 2.</F> [पगे२-229+ २४] learnt the details of the vow नक्षत्रपुरुष from महा- deva and of माहेश्वरव्रतम् from नन्दिकेश; on the lat- ter's advice took a bath at प्रयागा. <F>३१:  M. ४३. २३; ४७. ३०; ५३. २३ and ७२.</F> Informed Maya at Tripuram of the preparations of gods to attack his city; visited इलावृतम् sacred to Bali; arranged, at the request of Indra, the marriage of उमा with शिव; <F>३२:  Ib. ५४. 2-4; ९५. 4; १०२. १९; ११२. २१.</F> His sister was अरुन्दती, wife of वसिष्ठ; informed सावित्री's father of the short lease of life of the bridegroom chosen; <F>३३:  Ib. १३४. 3-२३; १३५. 1; १५४. १११-207; १८७. १४-52; १९२. ११; २०१. ३०</F> cursed दक्ष's sons. <F>३४:  Ib. २०८. १२-13.</F>
(II)--a Mauneya Gandharva presiding over the month of माधव. भा. XII. ११. ३४; Br. III. 7. 4; वा. ३०. ८६; ६९. 3; Vi. II. १०. 5.
(III)--a mountain on the base of Meru. भा. V. १६. २६; Br. II. १८. ७७.
(IV)--a Mt. in प्लक्षद्वीप; a citadel in itself; Here were born नारद and Parvata. Br. II. १९. 9; वा. ४९. 8; Vi. II. 4. 7. [पगे२-230+ २६]
(V)--a Mt. that entered the sea for fear of Indra; of शाकद्वीप. M. १२१. ७४; १२२. ११; वा. ४७. ७४.
(VI)--an author on architecture. M. २५२. 2.

(VII)--a son of कश्यप; <F>1:  वा. ६१. ८५; ८६. ४८; ९४. १९; १०५. 2; १०८. 1 and ४१; ११०. 1 and ६१. १११. २३, ३८ and ५७; ११२. २७.</F> gave his sister Arun- धती to वसिष्ठ and was cursed by दक्ष. <F>2:  Ib. ७०. ७९.</F>
(VIII)--a son of प्रजापति. वा. ६९. ६४.
--a Gandharva on the वादित्रक hill. वा. १०८. ४८.
--one among the महापुराणस् com- prising २५००० s4lokas. भा. XII. 7. २३; १३. 5.

--the पुराण of २५,000 (२३००० वा। प्।) श्लोकस्; narrated by नारद and treats of the बृहद्कल्प; he who makes a gift of it on the पञ्चदशि of the अश्विनि month, has no rebirth. M. ५३. २३-4; वा. १०४. 8; Vi. III. 6. २१.

(I)--(also Narasimha and नृसिम्ह) the fourteenth among the अवतार्स् of विष्णु; the first among the twelve अवतार्स्; vanquished the Asura king with the help of ओम्कार bearing him like a mat-maker tearing the reeds. भा. I. 3. १८; Br. I. 1. १२८; III. ७२, ७३ and ७६; M. २२. १७; ४७. ४२, ४६; १६१. ३७; वा. I. १५१; Vi. IV. १४. ४७; १५. 4.
(II)--the image of; with eight hands, with the Asura below vomitting blood. M. २५९. 2; २६०. ३१.
(III)--the १६थ् kalpa. M. २९०. 7.
(I)--a तीर्थम् sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ४३.
(II)--the उपपुराण of १८,000 verses be- longing to the पाद्मम्. M. ५३. ६०.
--a mind-born mother. M. १९७. ११.

(I)--an अवतार् with Nara; as the Supreme Being; as पुरुष and महापुरुष; Protector of the प्राणस्; is कृष्ण; <F>1:  भा. I. 2. 4; 3. 9; II. 5. १५-16; 7. 6; १०. ११; IV. 1. ५२; V. २६. ३८; X. 6. २४; ६९. ४४; Br. II. ३५. ९३; III. 3. ६२; ३३. १६; ३५. 3, ३६-40; वा 104. ५८; १०९. २३.</F> identified with Veda; <F>2:  भा. VI. 1. ४०-41.</F> reincarnated as अदिती's son; <F>3:  Ib. VI. 6. ३८.</F> मन्त्र sacred to; <F>4:  Ib. VI. ch. 8. (whole).</F> the sage of sages; <F>5:  Ib. XI. १६. २५; XII. 8. ३२ and ४७; 9. 1.</F> the आश्रम of; <F>6:  Ib. VII. १४. ३२.</F> born of धर्म in the चाक्षुष epoch. <F>7:  Br. III. ७१. १९६-7; ७३. ७२.</F> The Lord without birth; same as विष्णु, brother of Indra; the last resort of the sages. <F>8:  Ib. II. ३५. २०८; III. 3. १०२; M. 1. 2-3; १५४. ३५२; १६४. २७; १७२. 3-5; Vi. I. 3. 3, 8. १५; 9. ४१; २२. ८६.</F> The one who came out of the darkness of महा- प्रलय and created the world in its different aspects; his serpent couch on the dark waters described; approach of ब्रह्मा into नारायण's stomach, and coming out by way of the lotus; <F>9:  Br. II. ३५. १७०; IV. ३४. ७६; M. 2. २७-37; १७८. 1.</F> permeates the whole universe and pervades the three worlds; <F>१०:  वा. 1. २०४; 5. ३८; २४. 8-३५.</F> approached by शिव to redeem the sin of [पगे२-232+ ३१] brahmicide; <F>११:  M. १८३. ८८.</F> the वारह अवतार् of; <F>१२:  Br. I. 4. २७; 5. 3-5; M. २४७. 6; वा. 6. 3-७८; २१. ८१; १०३. 9.</F> is प्रजापति, is Brah- man; <F>१३:  M. २४७. ३५; Br. II. 6. ६१.</F> is साध्य with श्री as wife; <F>१४:  वा. ३०. ७२.</F> a compound of क्षेत्रज and प्रकृति for the welfare of the world; <F>१५:  Ib. १०१. २२८.</F> to be remem- bered in श्राद्धस्; <F>१६:  M. १६. ४५.</F> encouraged the Asuras and Devas in the churning of the ocean; praised by ब्रह्मा; <F>१७:  Ib. १५४. ३५९; १६३. १०४; २४८. ४३; २४९. 1, 3-4, ८१; २५०. 1; २८२. 5.</F> represents the planet Budha; उर्वशी born of. <F>१८:  Br. II. २४. ४९; III. 7. १६.</F>
(II)--the name of the last son of अजामिल. भा. VI. 1. २४.
(III)--the son of भूमिमित्र Kan2va; ruled for १२ years: <F>1:  भा. XII. 1. २०; Br. III. ७४. १५८; M. २७२. ३४; वा. ९९. ३४५.</F> Father of सुशर्मन्. <F>2:  Vi. IV. २४. ४०-1.</F>
(IV)--the sage who taught the भागवत पुराण to नारद who in turn taught it to व्यास. भा. XII. 4. ४१; १३. १० and १८.
(V)--a साध्य and overlord of the साध्यस्; the Hari of the स्वारोचिष epoch. Br. III. 3. १७; 8. 6; M. २०३. ११.
--sought by those who seek मोक्ष. भा. I. 2. २६.
--a sacred lake situated at the place where the Sindhu joins the sea; हर्यश्वस् and शबलाश्वस् performed tapas at this place. भा. VI. 5. 3 and २५.

--the place sacred to Hari where He lives for the welfare of the world; <F>1:  भा. VII. १४. ३२; X. ८७. 5-6.</F> visited by नारद (s.v.) after cursing the sons of Kubera; <F>2:  Ib. X. १०. २३; ८७. 5-6.</F> the sages of कलापग्राम also lived there. <F>3:  Ib. X. ८७. 7.</F>
--a Pravara. M. १९६. ३१.
--a name of योगमाया; ललिता; <F>1:  भा. X. 2. १२; Br. IV. १३. 3.</F> the goddess enshrined at सुपार्श्व. <F>2:  M. १३. ३६.</F>
--a daughter of Meru and queen of Kuru. भा. V. 2. २३.
(I) (पादिकस्)--reckoned from four perforated golden माषस् of four inches each; <F>1:  वा. १००. २२०.</F> reckoned from the move- ment of the moon. <F>2:  Ib. ६६. ४५.</F> [पगे२-234+ २८]
(II)--a measure equal to dhanus. Br. II. 7. १००; वा. 8. १०६.
(III)--a measure of time. वा. ५०. १८१.
--the coconut as illustrating the rela- tion between Brahman and the Universe. Vi. I. 2. ६०.
--a measurement (Jalaprastha) equal to four overflowing मागध measure. Br. IV. 1. २१८.
--equal in measurement to धनुर्दण्ड. वा. १०१. १२५.
--one of the Eastern entrances to the city of Puranjana; allegorically the nostrils. भा. IV. २५. ४८; २९. ११.
--a son of मार्ताण्ड or सूर्य; one of the अश्विन्स्. वा. ८४. २४, ७७.
--a deva गण. वा. ३१. १२.

--the Twins (अश्विन्स्) born of the nostrils of सम्ज्ञ as mare on the earth; father of Nakula and सहा- deva; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ४०; 7. 3; IX. २२. २८; M. ११. ३७.</F> visited the hermitage of Cyavana; <F>2:  भा. IX. 3. ११; Br. III. ५९. २५.</F> propitiated during the श्राद्ध. <F>3:  Vi. III. १४. 1; IV. १४. ३८; V. 1. ५८.</F> [पगे२-235+ २९]
--a western kingdom. Br. II. १६. ६१.
--the people of the southern country. वा. ४५. १३०.
--the patronymic of ययाति (s.v.) knew the power of the yoga of विष्णु. भा. II. 7. ४४; X. ६०. ४१.
--a son of आत्मवान् and father of ऋचीक, born from the thighs. वा. ६५. ९१-2.
--a राक्षस clan, like the Bhadrakas. वा. ६९. १८९.

(I)--the son of हर्यश्व and father of बर्हणाश्व <F>1:  भा. IX. 6. २४-25; M. १२. ३३; Vi. IV. 2. ४५.</F> (सम्हताश्व-वा। प्।: अमिताश्व-वि। प्।); killed in the राम-Ra1van2a war; <F>2:  भा. IX. १०. १८; Br. III. ६३. ६४.</F> deep in क्षत्रिय धर्म। <F>3:  वा. ८८. ६२-63.</F>
(II)--a ब्रह्मराक्षस and son of स्फूर्ज residing in Sutalam. Br. II. २०. २१; III. 7. ९५; वा. ५०. २१; ६९. १३०.
(III)--a son of Bala. Br. III. 6. ३३.

(IV)--a गणेश who appeared in a dream to a Brahmana in King दिवोदास's time and asked his wor- ship to be conducted at the city gate; conferred benefits on all except the queen who wanted a son. सुयशा, the queen of दिवोदास propitiated Nikumbha with rich offerings; [पगे२-236+ २७] the enraged king destroyed the temple and the deity cursed the city to be ruined, informed शिव of this; from that time the temple became that of the Lord Avimukta. Br. III. ६७. २८ to the end; वा. ९२. २५-59.
--a son of Bali. M. 6. ११.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २६.
--कश्यप gotraka1ra. M. १९९. 6.
(I)--(निष्कृति-भा प्।) born of Dambha and माया; <F>1:  भा. IV. 8. 3.</F> the first wife of Kali. <F>2:  वा. ८४. 9.</F>
(II)--a daughter of हिम्सा and Adharma; mother of Bhaya and Naraka. Br. II. 9. ६३; वा. १०. ३९.
--a son of शोणाश्व. M. ४४. ७९.
--dwellings built at the end of कृतयुग in Marudhanva, Nimna, Parvata, Nadi and Dhanva; the latter fortresses to protect from the sun and rain. वा. 8. ९६-97.
--a पुष्करणि; he who takes bath here and performs श्राद्ध in क्रौञ्जपद and lives here for three days, leads all पितृस् to heaven though subjected to five sins. वा. १०८. ८०, ८३-4. [पगे२-237+ २४]
--deposit; loss of, must be made good; failure to return deposit and false claim to it to be punished like theft with a fine of twice the amount involved. M. २२७. 1-2.
--ten thousand crores. वा. १०१. ९६.
--a hilly country. वा. ४५. १३५.
(I)--a son of Anamitra (Animitra-वा। प्।) and father of two sons Prasena and सत्राजित्. (Saktisena-?) शक्- rajit, वा। प्।). Br. III. ७१. २०; M. ४५. 3; वा. ९६. १९-20. Vi. IV. १३. 9-१०.
(II)--a son of अनर्ण्य. M. १२. ४७.
--the son of अधिसीम Kr2s2n2a and father of उष्ण. Finding हस्तिनापुर ruined by the floods of the Ganges, founded कौशाम्बी. Vi. IV. २१. 7-9.
--a R. in शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २६.
--a deity on the यन्त्र of विशुक्र. Br. IV. २७. ३८. [पगे२-238+ २५]
--a region of पाताल, of red soil. Vi. II. 5. 2-3.
--(Nitundakas-वि। प्।); a class of पिशाचस् with bulging bellies, long noses, hanging abdomen, short stature and so on; eaters of तिल। Br. III. 7. ३८०, ३८९; वा. ६९. २७०.
--one of the fifteen अक्षरदेवीस्; Her city was नित्यक्लिन्नापुरी. Br. IV. १९. ५७; ३१. २४; ३७. ३३.
--(श्राद्धम्) nothing of अर्घ्य and आवा- हनम्। M. १६. 5.
--an अक्षर devi1. Br. IV. १९. ५९.
(I)--a Pravara sage. M. १९९. १७.
(II)--a mind-born son of ब्रह्मा in the १५थ् kalpa. वा. २१. ३५.
--a son of शूर. वा. ९६. १३७.
(I)--a Sukha God. Br. IV. 1. १८.
(II)--the Goddess enshrined at वैश्रवनालय. M. १३. ५१.
(III)--one of the seven रत्नस् of the king. वा. ५७. ६८.
(IV)--a mukhya गण. वा. १००. १८.
(V)--wealth; eight kinds of; wealth of Kubera; Padma, Mahapadma, Makara, Kacchapa, Kumuda, शन्ख, Nila and Nandana. वा. ४१. १०-11.
(VI)--jewels; तातण्क, <F>1:  Br. II. २९. ७५; IV. ३३. ७६.</F> कण्ठसूत्र, Keyura, and नूपुर. <F>2:  Ib. IV. १५. २१; III. २७. 6.</F>
--son of धृष्टि and father of दशार्ह. Vi. IV. १२. ४१.
(I)--a son of वत्सार, married सुमेधा, daughter of Ayavana (Cyavana-वा। प्।) and सुकन्या and mother of कुण्डपायिन्स्. Br. III. 8. ३०; वा. ७०. २५-7.
(II)--one of three कश्यप groups. Br. III. 8. ३३.
--one of the ten लक्षणस् of a ब्राह्मण. वा. ५९. १३४. [पगे२-240+ ३४]
--words that do not derive from roots like अरम् (quick). वा. 7. ५७.
--a group of पिशाचस् with hanging ears, eye- brows and noses; are of dark brown and move visibly and invisibly. Br. III. 7. ३८०, ३८३, ३९५-6; वा. ६९. २६४, २७४-5.
--a son of Kratu; one of the ten branches of the Sukarma group of devas. वा. ६२. १०; १००. ९३.

(I)--one of the elder sons of इक्ष्वाकु; solicited the service of वसिष्ठ for performing a sacrifice; वसिष्ठ asked Nimi to wait until he returned from Indra's sacrifice to which he had been invited earlier. But Nimi thinking of the mutability of things got it done with the help of other sages; finding that Nimi had finished his sacrifice the sage cursed ‘Let his body fall’. The king cursed the sage in his turn and cast off his body. After preserving the body in a balm for seven days the sages requested the gods to restore him to life; Nimi refused to enter again the bondage of the physical body; then the gods said, ‘let him live in the eyelids of all living beings’. But the sages were afraid of anarchy and churned the body of Nimi for a son and this was Janaka Vaideha; <F>1:  भा. IX. 6. 4; १३. 1-१३; X. ८६. ३६; Br. III. ६३. 9; ६४. 1; Vi. IV. 2. १२; 5. 1-२३.</F> performed a सत्र at which the nine sages, the sons of ऋषभ were present. These enlightened the king on भागवत धर्म। <F>2:  भा. XI. 2. १४; २५-26; chh. 3 to 5: Br. III. ७४. २४४ and २४८; वा. 1. १४२.</F> For a slightly different version of the incident regarding the curse see मत्स्य। <F>3:  M. ६१. ३२-5; २०१. 1-२०.</F>
(II)--a son of दण्डपाणि and father of क्षेमक. भा. IX. २२. ४४. [पगे२-241+ ३६]
(III)--a son of भजमान. M. ४४. ५०. Vi. IV. १३. 2.

(IV)--a commander of तारक's army; had a cha- riot of elephants; <F>1:  M. १४८. ४२, ५१.</F> found out the trick of the Sun God in mak- ing Asuras appear like Devas and causing their slaughter; he reported this to कालनेमि; threw darts on जनार्दन; <F>2:  Ib. १५०. १६१; २२४.</F> sent चक्र against विष्णु; <F>3:  Ib. १५१. १२, ३१.</F> fight of, with जनार्दन; <F>4:  Ib. १५२. ३३.</F> fight with दिक्पालकस् and कृष्ण and Indra; Indra wounded by Mudgara. <F>5:  Ib. १५३. ५५, ६२.</F>
(V)--the younger brother of विकुक्षि; established the city of Jayanta near Gautama's आश्रम. वा. ८९. 1-2.
(VI)--a son of बाह्यक. वा. ९६. 4.
(VII)--the father of six ऋतुस्. Br. II. १३. १८.
--the son of दण्डपाणि and father of क्षेमक. Vi. IV. २१. १५-6.

--science of astrology; <F>1:  M. २१५. 9.</F> throbbing of limbs on the right, auspicious, and on the left, inauspicious; the results of such movements; <F>2:  Ib. २४०. १५; २४१. 1 ff.</F> gifts of सुवर्णम् to the Brah- mana; <F>3:  Ib. २४१. 4-१२.</F> a list of things that must not come against or cross the path when the king goes on a march; if seen, prayer to केशव, mitigates effects; <F>4:  Ib. २४३. 2-3.</F> in connection with the installa- tion of images. <F>5:  Ib. २६४. 9.</F> [पगे२-242+ २९]

--a small unit of time measured by the wink of the eye; <F>1:  Br. II. २१. ११६, १२६; २९. 6; २४. १४३.</F> from Nimi: १५ of them equal a काष्ठ्२अ <F>2:  M. ६१. ३५; १४२. 3; २०१. १९; वा. ५०. १७९; Vi. I. 3. 8; VI. 3. 6.</F> the same मात्र for लघ्वक्षर such as {#a, Qa, u#} some equal to a लघ्वक्षर। <F>3:  Br. II. १३. १६ and १११; वा. ३१. २४; ३०. १३; ५३. ११५; ५७. 6; १००. २१३; १०४. ३३.</F>
(वैष्णव)--equal to १०० S4aiva years; when विष्णु wakes up, the world is active and when he sleeps the world is sleepy. M. २९०. २१-2.
--the son of Anamitra and father of two sons, सत्राजित and Prasena. भा. IX. २४. १३.
--the city of वरुण on the west of Meru. भा. V. २१. 7.
--the Apsaras with the sun in the months of Nabha and Nabhasya. वा. ५२. ११.
(I)--a son of भजमना. भा. IX. २४. 7.
(II)--a son of भाह्यक. Br. III. ७१. 4.
--a daughter of Meru and धारणि; wife of विधात (धात-वा। प्।) and mother of मृकण्डु. भा. IV. 1. ४३-44; Br. II. ११. 6; १३. ३७; वा. २८. 4; ३०. ३४. Vi. I. १०. 3. [पगे२-243+ २३]
(II)--a god of आभूतरय group. Br. II. ३६. ५५.
(III)--a mukhya clan. वा. १००. १९.
(IV)--a Sukha God. Br. IV. 1. १९.
--a consort of Rudra. भा. III. १२. १३.
--a hundred thousand. वा. १०१. ९४.
--the wife of प्रस्ताव and mother of Vibhu. भा. V. १५. 6.
(I)--a तीर्थम् sacred to आदित्य, on the north of the यमुना. Br. IV. ४४. ६६.
(II)--the state of separation due to Kaivalyam; it makes one a शुद्ध or Pure man, when there is nobody to guide him. वा. १०२. ७९, ११८. [पगे२-244+ २५]
--a मध्यमाध्वर्यु। Br. II. ३३. १७.
(I)--the son of अयुतायु and father of सुनक्ष्त्र (Sunetra-वि। प्।). भा. IX. २२. ४६-7; Vi. IV. २३. 4.
(II)--a son of दण्दपाणि and father of क्षेमक. M. ५०. ८७.
(III)--a son of Apratipi, ruled for ४० years. M. २७१. २१.
(IV)--a son of रेणुमती and Nakula. Vi. IV. २०. ४८.
(V)--a son of Nakula by करेणुमती. भा. IX. २२. ३२.
(I)--a son of Bhaya and मृत्यु. भा. IV. 8. 4.
(II)--one of the seven seers of the स्वारोचिष epoch. Vi. III. 1. ११.
--like सावद्यम् is योगैश्वर lying embedded in the five elements; it relates to इन्द्रियस् and अहन्कारस्। वा. १३. 6. [पगे२-245+ २७]
--the son of व्याघ्र, a destroyer of sacri- fices. Br. III. 7. ९६; वा. ६९. १३१.
(I)--a son of I सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ६४.
(II)--a son of दक्षसावर्णि. Vi. III. 2. २४.
(I)--a son of Raivataka Manu. Br. II. ३६. ६४; वा. ६२. ५५.
(II)--of the बृहद्रथ line; <F>1:  Br. III. ७४. ११२.</F> ruled for one hundred years. <F>2:  वा. ९९. २९८.</F>
(III)--a son of the III सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ७२.
(IV)--a son of भृगु, the अवतार् of the Lord वा. २३. १४९.
(V)--a son of दण्डपाणि. वा. ९९. २७७.

--a dark territory, at the end of which is the world of Lord. Divyam, above the seven created worlds. <F>1:  Br. II. १९. १५१, १६७-9; २१. १०६; III. 7. २९४; IV. 2. १८८; वा. ४९. १४५-159; ५०. १६०.</F> The region above आलोक. <F>2:  M. १२३. ४७; १२४. ८३-84.</F>
--a mountain kingdom. M. ११४. ५५. [पगे२-246+ ३५]

--the commentary of जतुकर्ण्य: Its author was रथ्२इतर; <F>1:  भा. XII. 6. ५८; Br. II. ३५. 3.</F> rearranged by a pupil of शाकपूर्ण under his guidance; <F>2:  Vi. III. 4. २३.</F> part of विष्णु; <F>3:  Ib. V. 1. ३७.</F> said to be the fourth सम्हित; <F>4:  वा. ६१. 2; ६५. २८.</F> authorship of, attributed to Rathitara. <F>5:  Ib. ६०. ६५.</F>
(I): (भार्गव)--a sage of the Raucya epoch (XII epoch-वि। प्।). Br. IV. 1. १०२; Vi. III. 2. ४०.
(II)--a son of Raivata Manu. M. 9. २१.
--a daughter of खशा and a राक्षसि. Br. III. 7. १३८; वा. ६९. १७०.

(I)--childless, adopted the twins of Adharma; <F>1:  भा. IV. 8. 2; Vi. 3. १४.</F> with his vehicle drawn by men went against कृष्ण taking पारिजात; but soon felt he could not fight कृष्ण and went away quietly; <F>2:  Ib. X. [६५ (v) ४२]; [६६ (v) ३६].</F> his town was visited by Arjuna in search of the dead child of the द्वारका Brahmana. <F>3:  Ib. X. ८९. ४४.</F>
(II)--one of the western entrances to the city of पुरञ्जन, leading to the country of वैशस; allegorically गुद। भा. IV. २५. ५३; २९. १४.
(III)--a मुहूर्त of the day. Br. III. 3. ४०, ७०; वा. ६६. ४१; १११. ४०.

(IV)--one of the eleven Rudras with sword; <F>1:  M. १७१. ३८; वा. ६६. ६९.</F> lord of a दिक् and a राक्षस who came and worshipped ललीता, along with others. <F>2:  Br. IV. २६. ५३; ३०. 9.</F> [पगे२-247+ २८]

(V)--found Kubera overwhelmed by Kujambha and took his sword for war; when he was about to be vanquished, वरुण tied down with noose the two hands of Kujambha; महिष defeated both निरृति and वरुण, releas- ed Kujambha; reported to Indra; <F>1:  M. १५०. ८६, १२६-8, १३०-3.</F> beaten by तारक. <F>2:  Ib. १५३. १८०.</F>
(VI)--a Vasu; a son of Dharma and सुदेवी. M. १७१. ४७.
(VII)--as a लोकपाल. M. २६६. २२.
(VIII)--the God of the South-west. वा. १०८. ३१.
--worshipped for the destruction of the foe; issued from the arms of ब्रह्मा. भा. II. 3. 9; III. १२. २६.
--a third मात्र of ओम्। वा. २०. 2.
--a heretical sect of ascetics putting on mon- kish dress in Kali. Br. II. ३१. ६५; III. १४. ३९; वा. ५८. ६४; ७८. ३०.
--a son of Raucya Manu. Br. IV. 1. १०४; वा. १००. १०९.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २५.
--a sense of detachment takes a man of वैराग्य; with ripe experience sees all life as sorrow. वा. १०२. ८४-5. [पगे२-248+ २९]
--a son of मनुसावर्णि; a sage of the epoch of the XIII Manu. भा. VIII. १३. ११, ३१; वा. १००. २१; Vi. III. 2. १९; Br. IV. 1. २२.
(I) (कश्यप)--a sage of the Raucya epoch. Br. IV. 1. १०३.
(II)--a son of Raivata Manu. M. 9. २१.
(III)--a sage of the XII epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. ४०.
