--(Nirjatara Niryantara-वा। प्।) heard the पुराण from Gautama and told it to वाजश्रवस्; <F>1:  Br. IV. 4. ६३-4.</F> heard the वा। प्। from Gautama. <F>2:  वा. १०३. ६३.</F>
--son of अधिसामकृष्ण. वा. ९९. २७१.
--a blind citizen of the पुरञ्जन city aiding him in his work; allegorically the hands. भा. IV. २५. ५४; २९. १५.

--is मोक्ष; <F>1:  भा. III. २५. २८-29; VI. 4. २८; IX. 7. २७; Br. III. ५६. १०. Vi. I. २०. २८ and ३४; II. 8. ११९; III. १८. १७; 8. 6.</F> gained by doing the विभूतीद्वा- दशिव्रत on the Ganges; <F>2:  M. १००. ३३.</F> प्रह्लाद blessed with निर्वाण; <F>3:  Vi. I. १९. ४६.</F> of शतानीक; <F>4:  Ib. IV. २१. 4.</F> Mucukunda's request to कृष्ण for निर्वाण. <F>5:  Ib. V. २३. ४७; VI. 7. २१. 2.</F> [पगे२-249+ २८]
--the gods in the epoch of the III शावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ७३, ७५.
--Gods of the eleventh epoch of Manu. भा. VIII. १३. २५; Vi. III. 2. ३०.

--a R. from the Vindhyas; <F>1:  M. ११४. २७. वा. ४५. १०२.</F> in the ऋक्ष Mt. in भारतवर्ष; <F>2:  भा. IV. 1. १८; V. १९. १८; Br. II. १६. ३२; Vi. II. 3. ११.</F> visited by बलराम. <F>3:  भा. X. ७९. २०.</F>
(I)--the son of धृष्टा(i) (वृष्णि-ब्र्। प्।) the righteous, and father of दशार्ह. भा. IX. २४. 3; Br. III. ७०. ४०.
(II)--the son of Sunetra, ruled for ५८ years. M. २७१. २६.
--a son of धृष्ट and father of विदूरथ. M. ४४. ३९-40.

--a game of the Gopas in which the Gopas put on the guise of thieves, watchmen, and goats; Vyoma an Asura entered it in disguise and carried away almost all the Gopas to a cave near by; seeing only few left, कृष्ण discovered the Asura and killed him at once. भा. X. ३७. २६-32.
--३० dan2d2as by a दण्ड of 7 hastas. M. २८३. 3, १४. [पगे२-250+ ३३]

--the sons of सम्ह्लाद; could not be slain by the Gods, Gandharvas, नागस् and राक्षसस्; <F>1:  M. 6. २८-9.</F> Flourished in the age of प्रह्लाद; <F>2:  Vi. I. २१. १४.</F> A दानव group of रसातल, resident in हिरण्यपुर; <F>3:  भा. V. २४. ३०; X. ८९. ३४ (5)</F> took part in the देवा- sura war between Bali and Indra: fought with the Maruts; <F>4:  Ib. VIII. १०. २२, ३४.</F> defeated by Arjuna. <F>5:  Ib. X. ८९. ३४. (5); Br. III. 5. ३७.</F>
(II)--a शक्ति. Br. IV. ३५. ९८.
--a son of Vasudeva and रोहिणी. वा. ९६. १६२.
--a son of बलराम. Br. III. ७१. १६६; Vi. V. २५. १९.
(I)--same as सीता; a R. of the कुशद्वीप. M. १२२. ७१.
(II)--a daughter of क्रोधा. वा. ६९. २०५.

--is Soma; <F>1:  Br. II. २८. ४३.</F> full of ambrosia, the origin of Tithi, Parvasandhi, and ऋग् and Yajur metres; <F>2:  वा. ३१. ४०.</F> १००० Yojanas beyond the sun. <F>3:  Ib. १०१. १२९.</F> [पगे२-251+ २७]
--a son of बलराम. वा. ९६. १६४.
--a son of दोष and पुष्पर्णा; <F>1:  भा. IV. १३. १४.</F> stationed to defend the E. gate of मथुरा; <F>2:  Ib. X. ५०. २० [2];.</F> fought with his kinsmen at प्रभास. <F>3:  Ib. XI. ३०. १७.</F>

--the son of गवेष्ठि; <F>1:  वा. ६७. ७७.</F> took part in the देवासुर war between Bali and Indra; <F>2:  भा. VIII. १०. २१, ३१.</F> fought with Bhadra- कालि and was killed; <F>3:  Br. IV. २९. ७६.</F> killed by योगनिद्रा. <F>4:  Vi. V. 1. ८२.</F>
--a sage of the epoch of the III सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ७९.
--a son of Atri, and one of the seven sages of the स्वारोचिष epoch. Br. II. ३६. १८.
--a R. of the भारतवर्ष. वा. ४५. ९६.
--a sage of the स्वारोचिष epoch. M. 9. 8. [पगे२-252+ ३३]
--seventh note of the gamut; <F>1:  वा. ८६. ३७.</F> origin in निषाद kalpa. <F>2:  Ib. २१. ४६.</F>
(I)--a son of Atithi and father of Nabha. (Anala-वि। प्।). The ब्र्। प्। makes him father of Nala. <F>2:  Br. III. ६३. २०१-2.</F> ^1 भा. IX. १२. 1; M. १२. ५२; वा. ८८. २०१; Vi. IV. 4. १०५.

(II)--a वर्षपर्वत; <F>1:  Br. I. 1. ६९; M. ११३. १२, २२; १२१. ६६; १८३. 1; वा. 1. ८५. Vi. II. 2. २८ and ३९.</F> a mountain range on the base of Meru and to the south of इलावृत and a boundary of हरिवर्ष; <F>2:  भा. V. १६. 9, २६; वा. ३४. १४ and २५.</F> migration of the Yadus to; <F>3:  भा. 2. 3; Br. II. १५. १५ and २८.</F> residence of the वानरस् and नागस्; <F>4:  Ib. II. १७. ३४; III. 7. १९४; IV. ३१. १६.</F> location of the विष्णु temple in. <F>5:  वा. ३५. 8; ३६. १९; ३७. २८; ४१. ४८.</F>
(I)--(also नैषधस्) contemporary rulers of the आन्ध्रस्, कौशलस्, and विदूरपतिस्. भा. XII. 1. ३५.
(II)--a Janapada of the मणिधान्य. <F>1:  वा. ९९. ३८४.</F> On the other side of the Vindhyas. <F>2:  Ib. ४५. १३३.</F>
--a Marut गण. M. १७१. ५३.
--a R. from the Vindhyas. Br. II. १६. ३२; वा. ४५. १०२.
--an ally of कार्तवीर्य, killed by Para- शुराम. Br. III. ३९. 2, 8. [पगे२-253+ ३३]
--a son of Kuru. भा. IX. २२. 4.
(I)--the black and dwarfish man who came out of the churning of the thigh of the dead Vena by the sages; the ancestor of the नैषदस्, the Vindhyan tribe. भा. IV. १४. ४५-46; Vi. I. १३. ३५-6.
(II)--a son of Vasudeva; the first bowman; <F>1:  वा. ९६. १८४, १८७.</F> hunter. <F>2:  Ib. ४७. ५१.</F>

(III)--२०थ् kalpa; प्रजापति Nis2a1da performed austerities controlling the senses for a thousand divine years; seeing the son getting wearied by penance ब्रह्मा said: “refrain from it,” hence the name, निषाद. Out of him came निषादवान्स्वर। वा. २१. ४३.

--the dwarfed black male arising out of the churning by the sages of the left hand of Vena; the residuals of the Vindhyas belonged to this; <F>1:  Br. II. ३६. १४४-6.</F> born of him were धीवर and others. <F>2:  वा. ६२. १२३.</F>

--a gold coin for gifts; <F>1:  M. ७७. ११; वा. ८०. १६.</F> sin, a fine for wounding or hurting; <F>2:  M. २२७. ८६; वा. १०१. १६०.</F> necklace? <F>3:  भा. III. २३. ३१.</F> Bala staked १००० at the first game of gambling, another १००० at the second and one crore at the succeeding one. <F>4:  Vi. V. २८. १३-14, १८.</F>
--groves as frequented by पिशाचस्. Br. III. 7. ४०४. [पगे२-254+ २३]
--an asura who has his city in Tatvalam. Br. II. २०. १७.
--the city in the first tala; of an Asura chief. वा. ५०. १६.
--a class of ascetics. भा. III. १२. ४३.
--a king who ruled for २५ years. Br. III. ७४. १६४.
--a R. from the हिमालयस्. Br. II. १६. २६.
--in the पाणिग्रहण मन्त्र in the seventh पाद; known to Satyavrata. वा. ८८. ९७.
--a मन्त्रकार and an आत्रेय. वा. ५९. १०४.
--a R. of the प्लक्षद्वीप. वा. ४९. १७.
--one of the eight सौभाग्यम्स्। M. ६०. 8, २७.
--(आत्रेय) a sage of the Raucya epoch (XIII epoch वि। प्।). Br. IV. 1. १०३; Vi. III. 2. ४०. [पगे२-255+ ३०]
--a son of ह्राद; had two sons Sunda and Upa- sunda. Br. III. 5. ३४; वा. ६७. ७१.
--of ब्रह्मा; the period twice the thou- sand of १००० yugas and all अन्तरस्। वा. १००. २१२.
--a sage of the XI epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. ३१.

--the policy taught by शुक्र to the Asuras and sought by him from महेश्वर; <F>1:  M. ४७. ७४, ७५; वा. ९७. १०५.</F> according to बृहस्पति, it commences with साम for a conquering monarch; other अन्गस् are bheda, दान, and दण्ड; but the application depends on the place, time and resources of the enemy; in the case of Asuras only दण्ड can be recommended. <F>2:  M. १४८. ६५-71.</F>
--a भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. २०.

--son of Pulastya; initiated into ज्ञान by ऋभु. Engaged himself in austerities for a thousannd years in a grove in वीरनगर on the banks of the देविका. After this period at the time of taking meals, ऋभु appeared before him, but was not recognised. Being requested for meals, ऋभु agreed on condition that he would be served with sweet viands. After meals, he found that he was his old master, and was overjoyed. He went away, and नीदाघ continued his austerities for another १००० years. At the end [पगे२-256+ ३३] of this period ऋभु appeared and saw him standing aloof from a crowd witnessing the king riding on his elephant. ऋभु asked him who was the king and who was the elephant. निदाघ said that the man above was king and that below the elephant. ऋभु asked him what he meant by above and below. Little knowing that he was his master, नीदाघ jumped on him and remarked he was above and ऋभु below. Finding that नीदाघ had not attained full maturity in अद्वैत, ऋभु once again initiated him and departed. From that day नीदाघ looked upon anything without any distinc- tion. Vi. II. chh. १५ and १६.

(I)--a son of पार (Paura-म्। प्।) wife कृत्वी; father of १०० sons, नीपास्; अणुहसत्यक? was the eldest; among the others were स्रीमान् who was well known and was destroyed by Ugrasena (उग्रायुध-वा। प्।) for the sake of Janamejaya; Brahmadatta was another son. भा. IX. २१. २४-25; M. ४९. ५२, ५९; वा. ९९. १७४-5.
(II)--the son of कृतिन् and father of उग्रायुध. भा. IX. २१. २९.
--१०० sons of नीप, among whom स्रीमान् was the most celebrated; destroyed by उग्रायुध for the sake of Janamejaya; <F>1:  M. ४९. ५३, ५९; Vi. IV. १९. ५४.</F> a tribe. <F>2:  M. २७३. ७३.</F>
--is ललिता. Br. IV. १७. ३४.
--a son of Nakuli by करेणुमती. M. ५०. ५५.
--(waving of lights) taken by the Apsarasas at the marriage of कामेश्वर and देवी; one way of honour- ing deity. Br. IV. १५. ३३; M. २६७. १९. [पगे२-257+ ३१]

(I)--a mountain range in भारतवर्ष and to the north of इलावृत; formed the boundary limit of Ramyaka; <F>1:  भा. V. १६. 8; १९. १६; M. ११३. २२; वा. ३४. २०, २५; ३५. 8.</F> one of the six वर्षपर्वतस् in जम्बूद्वीप; diamond like; <F>2:  Br. I. 1. ६९; II. १५. २२, २८; १७. ३५; वा. 1. ८५; ४२. ६७; ४६. ३४.</F> residence of the monkey tribes; <F>3:  Br. III. 7. १९४; IV. ३१. १७.</F> the residence of Brahma- ऋषिस्.
(II)--a monkey chief, a friend of राम; followed राम in the लन्का expedition. भा. IX. १०. १६, १९.
(III)--a राक्षस resident in Sutalam. Br. II. २०. २२; वा. ५०. २२.
(IV)--one of the five sons of Yadu. Br. III. ६९. 2; M. ४३. 7; वा. ९४. 2.

(V)--a king of पाञ्चाल, slain by उग्रायुध; <F>1:  M. ४९. ७८; वा. ९९. १९२.</F> son of Ajamidha and नीलिनी; by great austerities सुशान्ति (शन्ति- भा। प्।) was born. <F>2:  भा. IX. २१. ३०; M. ५०. 1; वा. ९९. १९४; Vi. IV. १९. ५६-7.</F>
(VI)--a भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. १९.
(VII)--one of the eight निधिस् of Kubera. वा. ४१. १०.
(VIII)--a Kulaparvata of the भद्राश्व; <F>1:  वा. ४३. १४; ४८. 8; Vi. I. 4. २६; II. 2. ३९.</F> border- ing on जम्बूद्वीप. <F>2:  Ib. II. 1. २०; 2. ११.</F> [पगे२-258+ २९]
(IX)--a son of पार; father of a hundred sons. Vi. IV. १९. ३८-39.
(X)--of वानरजाति, born of Hari and Pulaha. Br. III. 7. १७६, ३१९.
(XI)--a पराशर clan. Br. III. 8. ९५; वा. ७०. ८७.
--the name of the राक्षसस् in the Vajraka hill. वा. ३९. ३१.

--the God enshrined in कालञ्जर hill; an epithet of शिव; <F>1:  M. २०. १५; १५७. २३.</F> narrated to पार्वती that at the request of ब्रह्मा and other gods he devoured the कालकूट poison that came out of the churning of the ocean; <F>2:  Br. II. २५. ९०; वा. ५४. 3-९४.</F> praise of, by राम; <F>3:  Br. II. २४. २५-31.</F> by gods. <F>4:  वा. ५४. ९७-101.</F>
--a तीर्थम्; sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. २२.
--is Rudra. Br. IV. ३४. २७.
--an अक्षरादेवी; killed जम्बुकाक्ष a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. १९. ५९; २५. ९८, ३७. ३४.
--a तीर्थम् sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ७०; १२१. ६८.
(II)--to be uttered in installing an image. M. २६५. २८.
--a kingdom of the East watered by the ह्लादिनी; <F>1:  Br. II. १८. ५४; M. १२१. ५३.</F> a tribe. <F>2:  वा. ४७. ५१.</F>
(I)--(शिव, महादेव); <F>1:  Br. III. ७२. १०९; ७३. 1; वा. २१. 4; ३१. ३२ and ५९.</F> praised by शुक्र by as many as ३०० names for His blessings on him. <F>2:  M ४७. १२७-169.</F>
(II)--the second kalpa. M. २९०. 3.
--(नीलमौलेय) a Janapada of the Bha- dra continent. वा. ४३. १९.
--a son of अन्जना, an elephant. Br. III. 7. ३३९.
--a daughter of केशिनी, and a low type of राक्षसी; gave birth to क्षुद्र Ra1ks2asas called after her the Naila clan. Br. III. 7. 7. १४७. वा. ६९. १७८, १८१.
(I)--one of the queens of अजमीढ. M. ४९. ४४; वा. ९९. १६७.
(II)--mother of नील. वा. ९९. १९४.
--a kind of corn for श्राद्ध; <F>1:  M. १५. ३५.</F> used as food by foresters and offered by शकुन्तला to दुष्यन्त. <F>2:  भा. IX. २०. १४.</F>
--the place where elephants of the four quar- ters throw out the waters in different ways. Br. II. २२. ५२.
--a hill tribe. Br. II. १६. ६७.
--the name of the वर्षनाडि or ray of the sun. वा. ५३. २०.
--a R. from the पारियात्र. Br. II. १६. २८.
(I)--a son of श्राद्धदेव and श्रद्धा and father of a son Sumati by name. भा. IX. 1. १२; 2. १७.

(II)--a son of इक्ष्वाकु; liberal in his gift of cows, silver, etc. Once a cow of a certain Brahmana got mixed up with his herd, and ignorant of this he made a gift of it to another Brahmana. The owner charged him, and when both went to the king, the owner was not prepared to take anything in its place and he who got the gift would not part with it for anything; when he went to Yama's abode he sent him as a lizard for this unrighteous act; in that form he lived in a well until कृष्ण lifted it up when it became transformed into a celestial, and blessed by कृष्ण rode in an aerial car to heaven; <F>1:  भा. X. ६४. १०-30, ४३ and ४४ [1].</F> release of, by कृष्ण at द्वारका; <F>2:  Ib. X. ३७. १७.</F> his lust after more territory. <F>3:  Ib. XII. 3. १०.</F> [पगे२-261+ २६]
(III)--a son of Vaivasvata Manu. Br. II. ३८. ३०; III. ६०. 2; Vi. III. 1. ३३; IV. 1. 7.
(IV)--a son of उशीनर and नृगा (भृशा, म्। प्।); his capital, Yaudheya; became lord of the Kekayas. Br. III. ७४. १९, २१; M. ४८. १८, २०, २०; Vi. IV. १८. 9.
--one of the wives of उशीनर and mother of नृग. Br. III. ७४. १८-9.
--a son of सुनीथ and father of सुखीनल. भा. IX. २२. ४१; M. ५०. ८२.
--dancing; part of विशोकद्वादशिव्रत; <F>1:  M. ८२. २९.</F> in con- nection with tree rituals; <F>2:  Ib. २३२. १५.</F> in connection with वास्तु for palace building. <F>3:  Ib. २६८. ३४.</F>
--the father of Pramati, God incarnate. M. १४४. ५९.
--son of Sunitha and father of Sukhibala. Vi. IV. २१. १२.
(I)--the son of मेधाविन् and father of दूर्व. भा. IX. २२. ४२.
(II)--a son of Sunitha (सुवीर-वा। प्।). M. ४९. ७९; वा. ९९. १९३.
--the daughter of हम्सकील. वा. ६६. ७३. [पगे२-262+ ३७]
--a R. in प्लक्षद्वीप. भा. V. २०. 4.

--(नृहरि and Narahari Narasimham (s.v.) half man and half lion अवतार् of विष्णु, worshipped as such in हरिवर्ष; <F>1:  भा. II. 7. १४; V. १८. 7-१४; VII. 8. १५-16; X. 2. ४०; Vi. V. 5. १६.</F> came out of a post which हिरण्यकशिपु knocked with his fist; a description of his form and how he killed the demon; <F>2:  भा. VII. 8. १५-31; XI. 4. १९.</F> still his anger was not appeased; praised by ब्रह्मा, Rudra, Indra, Sages, पितृस्, Siddhas, विद्याधरस्, नागस्, progenitors, Gandharvas, चारणस्, यक्षस्, Kimpuru- षस्, वैतालिकस्, Kinnaras, and विष्णु's attendants; <F>3:  Ib. VII. 8. ३४ and ४०-56.</F> श्री was afraid to go near him; <F>4:  Ib. VII. 9. 2.</F> at the request of the Gods प्रह्लाद praised the God for the welfare of the universe; offered boons to प्रह्लाद and advised him to rule his father's kingdom with his mind devoted to Hari until the time came for him to cast off his body; <F>5:  Ib. V. १८. 7-१४; VI. 8. १४; VII. 9 (whole); १०. ११-14.</F> ब्रह्मा's praise of the Lord's disappearance. <F>6:  Ib. VII. १०. २६-31; Br. III. ३३. २६.</F> God incarnate of विष्णु remembered by शिव for vanquishing मातृगण; <F>7:  M. १७९. ४४-52, ७६.</F> created from out of his limbs a number of goddesses who overcame the Rudra, मातृगणस् and were blessed with divinity. <F>8:  Ib. २४५. २१.</F>
--a goddess following भवमालिनी. M. १७९. ७१.
--one of the भार्गव gotraka1ras. M. १९५. २७.
--a son of Dharma and father of Kunti. भा. IX. २३. २२.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४४. [पगे२-263+ २४]
--sacred to ललिता and hence to be included in the चक्र। Br. IV. ४४. ९३.
--one of the eyes of the Veda personified. वा. १०४. ७९.
--fit for श्राद्धम्. M. २२. ८६.
(I)--a राक्षस was asked by Bali to refrain from battle with वामन. भा. VIII. २१. १९.
(II)--a Sutapa God. Br. IV. 1. १४.
(III)--one of the sons of इक्ष्वाकु; a righteous king cursed by वसिष्ठ to lose his body. वा. ८८. 9; ८९. 3-4.
--a son of आपादबद्ध; ruled for २५ years. वा. ९९. ३५२.
--the son of आसीमकृष्ण and father of Ukta; हस्तिनापुर being washed away he changed his capital to कौशाम्बी. भा. IX. २२. ३९-40.
--one of the १६ R2tviks for यज्ञ; created from the thighs of नारायण. M. १६७. 9. [पगे२-264+ २७]
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २७.

--the hump-backed Kubja in the employ of Kamsa for preparing perfumes. कृष्ण got some for the mere asking. Pleased, कृष्ण cured her deformity and made her a lovely damsel. She requested कृष्ण to go to her residence, which he promised to do sometime later. Vi. V. २०. 4-१३.
--born of Nila; belong to a branch of the आलम्बेयस्; invincible and bold. वा. ६९. १७९.
--a son of Agni and brother of कुमार; an अम्श of Skanda. Br. III. 3. २५; M. 5. २६; वा. ६६. २४. १०१. २८०. Vi. I. १५. ११५.
--a पिशाच clan. वा. ६९. 264
--a गण of पिशाचस्. Br. III. 7. ३८३, ३८९.

--a form of Pralaya, which is dissolution of the universe after a kalpa; <F>1:  भा. XII. 4. 4, ३८; Vi. VI. 3. 1; 4. 7.</F> one of the three kinds of सम्चार (movements of creatures). <F>2:  वा. 1. १६१; १००. १३२.</F> [पगे२-265+ ३६]
--a division of the ब्राह्मकल्प. वा. १००. १३३, १९६.
--one of the three kinds of श्राद्ध. M. १६. 5.
--a R.: a fit place for performing श्राद्ध. Vi. III. १४. १८.
--the southern sun; <F>1:  वा. १०९. २१.</F> a तीर्थ for performing श्राद्ध. <F>2:  Ib. १०६. ६७</F>
country of: under मणिधान्यक kings. Vi. IV. २४. ६६.

--(also नैमिषालय s.v.) sacred to विष्णु; here शौनक and other sages performed a सत्र extending over a thousand years; <F>1:  भा. I. 1. 4 and २१; III. २०. 7; VII. १४. ३१; Br. IV. 4. ४५.</F> visited by बलराम who was honoured by all except शूत Romahars2an2a; बलराम killed the शूत in anger thus committing brahmicide; then at the instance of the sages and as an expiation for the offence he killed Asura Balvala here; <F>2:  भा. X. ७८. २०-32; ७९. 5.</F> revisited by बलराम who took part in the sacrifices; <F>3:  Ib. X. ७९. ३०-32.</F> sages of, visited द्वारका. <F>4:  Ib. X. ९०. २८. [6]. Br. I. 1. ३७; III. १३. १००; IV. 2. १११ and २४६; 4. ४१.</F>

--a क्षेत्र and forest; a तीर्थ where Goddess लिन्गधारिणी is enshrined; <F>1:  M. 1. 4; १३. २६.</F> best in कृतयुग; <F>2:  Ib. १०६. ५७; १०९. 3; ११०. 1; १८०. ५५; २४६. ९३.</F> sacred to the पिट्र्स्; here the spokes of Haricakra (Dharmacakra- वा। प्।) fell to pieces; here is the image of विष्णु in वाराह form; <F>3:  Ib. २२. १२, १४; वा. 1. १५.</F> the sage पिप्प्लाद living there was questioned by [पगे२-266+ ३०] युधिष्ठिर about अङ्गारकव्रत; <F>4:  M. ७२, 2, Br. I. 2. 8; वा. 2. 8; २१. 1; २३. २०६; ७७. ९३; १०८. ४० and ४२.</F> the forest where the seers performed sacrifices.^5
--here सूत expounded the भागवत to the sages and seers at the request of शौनक and others. See नैमिषा. भा. XII. 4. ४३.
--the sages and performers of penance in नैमिषा forest. वा. ६७. 1; १०१. १११, २९२, ३०९; १०३. ४०, ४२ and ४६.
--a राक्षस Gan2a from निरृति; the followers of Kubera; hence देवराक्षसस्. वा. ६९. १७३.

--one of the four राक्षस clans after नैरृत, moving about during nights: followers of Trayambaka: देवराक्षसस्, heroic and valourous, with their leader वीरूपाक्ष: अलकाधिप was their king; <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ४८; Br. III. 7. १४१-4, १६३; 8. ६२.</F> sons of रेवती and पूतना: overlord Skanda: gave trouble to babies. <F>2:  Ib. III. 7. ४३९; वा. ८४. १४.</F>
(I)--a town of निरृति; <F>1:  भा. X. ८९. ४४.</F> बलि to be given to निरृति in श्राद्ध. <F>2:  वा. १११. ४०.</F>
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १०. [पगे२-267+ ३०]
--a southern country. वा. ४५. १२७.
--a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३३. 4.
--a राक्षस clan of low type, born of नील. Br. III. 7. १४८.
--the name of a garden in वैकुण्ठ. भा. III. १५. १६.
--Nala of the कश्यप family entitled as N. Lust of, after more territory. M. १२. ५६; भा. XII. 3. १०.
--a kingdom of हरिवर्ष; <F>1:  Br. II. १४. ४९; १५. ३२; १८. ५३. वा. ३३. ४२.</F> a division of जम्बूद्वीप; <F>2:  Vi. II. 1. १९.</F> also निषध. <F>3:  Ib. II. 2. ११.</F>

(I)--a tribe whose ancestor was निषाद and who made mountains and forests their home; <F>1:  भा. IV. १४. ४६; Br. III. ७४. १८९ and १९६; M. ११४. ५३.</F> a Vindhyan tribe; <F>2:  Br. II. १६. ६५.</F> kingdom of. <F>3:  M. १२१. ५२.</F>
(II)--the kings of the family of Nala; <F>1:  वा. ९९. ३७६-7.</F> nine kings of, under मणिधान्यक line. <F>2:  Vi. IV. २४. ६०, ६६.</F>
--the place of Kavi Agni (उशीर). वा. २९. २९. [पगे२-268+ ३६]
--the boat in the Ocean; in the river; <F>1:  वा. 6. २७; ५२. ८६; १०८. ३७.</F> illustrative of the earth floating on waters. <F>2:  Vi. I. 4. ४६.</F>

--(महीमयी) the divine boat given to Manu (Vaivasvata) by विष्णु in the shape of a fish to be tied to its horn; <F>1:  M. 1. ३०-32; भा. I. 3. १५.</F> in the deluge it rescued the sun, moon, ब्रह्मा, नर्मदा, sage मार्कण्डेय, शिव, the Vedas, पुराणस् and other Vidyas from ruin; <F>2:  M. 2. १०-15.</F> Druhyu to ply the ocean with. <F>3:  Ib. ३३. २०.</F>
(I)--a son of Ugrasena; <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. २४; Br. III. ७१. १३३; M. ४४. ७४; वा. ९६. १३२; Vi. IV. १४. २०.</F> and brother of Kamsa killed by बलराम. <F>2:  भा. X. ४४. ४०-41.</F>
(II)--a son of कृष्ण. भा. X. ९०. ३४.

(III)--the banyan tree of रमणक; of the shape of a lotus after which पुष्करद्वीप is named; <F>1:  Br. II. १५. ६३-4; १९. १४०; III. ११. ३६, १०९; IV. ४३. १७; M. १२३. ३९; Vi. I. १२. ६५; II. 4. ८५; IV. 3. २३.</F> during the deluge, Lord नारायण in the form of a baby slept on a leaf of the tree. <F>2:  M. १६७. ३१.</F>
--the city of the यक्षस्. Br. III. 7. ११८; वा. ६९. १४९.
--१० times the अर्बुद। वा. १०१. १०१.

--in connection with the installation of an image; eg. रत्नन्यास for the eight directions: diamond, pearl, वैडूर्य, conch, स्पटिक, पुष्पराग, इन्द्रनील and नील; pastes of eight kinds: तालक, शिलावज्र, collyrium, श्याम, कञ्जि, काशि, माक्षिकम्, and gairikam; grains of eight kinds: wheat, barley, seasamum, mudga, नीवार, श्यामक, सर्षप, and व्रीहिरिचे, scents like sandal, red sandal, agaru, अञ्जनम्, उशीरम्, वैष्णवी sahadevi1, and लक्ष्मण; metals of eight kinds: gold, vidruma, copper, bronze, आरकूटक, silver, पुष्पम् and iron. Then the worship of the लोखपालस् with न्यासमन्त्रस्। M. २६६. 9-२९.
--a Saimhikeya. वा. ६८. १८.
(I)--a lunar period of १५ days; शुक्ल (white) and कृष्ण (dark). Br. II. २१. १२५; २४. ५६; २८. ३३; III. 1. ५९; वा. ३०. १५; ४९. १३०; ५०. १७८; ५६. 3 and ३०.
(II)--a मणिवर Yaks2a and son of देवजनी. Br. III. 7. १२९.
(III)--of भार्गव gotra. वा. ६५. ९७.
(IV)--a son of Anu. वा. ९९. 13
--a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३३. 4.
--a species of birds vanquished by रावण; the name of a मूर्छन after their name. Br. III. 7. २५६, ३०७; ६१. ५२; IV. 4. 2.
--a शक्ति on the षोडश--पत्राब्ज. Br. IV. ३२. ११.

--the name of a sacred forest; here is पाण्डुशिला fit for the performance of श्राद्ध; युधिष्ठिर performed श्राद्ध at the place; pleased at it पाण्डु blessed his son to rule the kingdom and go to heaven. वा. ११२. ४३-49.

--Persons eminently fit to eat with; learn- ed in six अन्गस्, given to ध्यान and योग; learned in तन्त्रस्, and यायावर: Also सौपर्णस्, पञ्चाग्नेयस्, सामगस्, त्रिनाचिकेतस्, त्रयीस्, learned in बार्हस्पत्यशाश्त्र; <F>1:  Br. III. १५. २८-30.</F> unfit: अनाश्रमि, अयति, मोक्षवादि, चित्रवादि, heretics, atheists, सान्ख्यस्, मुण्ड, जटिल, कापाऌइकस्, कारुकस्, Songsters, sellers of Veda etc., persons not conforming to the rules of वर्ण and आश्रम. <F>2:  Ib. III. १५. ३९-55, ९४; वा. ७९. ५३-59; ८३. ५१-57.</F>
--a royal line established by विश्वस्फाणि. वा. ९९. ३७८.
--कामराज, Kandarpa, Manmatha, Maka- radhvaja, and Manobhava; all decked with कस्तूरि तिलक and pearls. Br. IV. १९. ६९.
--a Mt. inside कैलास; <F>1:  वा. ३८. ३३.</F> the residence of the दानवस्. <F>2:  Ib. ३९. ५३; ४२. ३२.</F>
--the यज्ञ leading to Devas; तपस् to वैराग्य; कर्मसन्न्यास to ब्राह्मण्य; वैराग्य to Laya; ज्ञान to Kaivalya. वा. ५७. ११७-18.

--a mixture of 5 secretions of the cow for purifying the body; <F>1:  M. ५६. 6; ५७, 5; ६०. १७; ६२. 8.</F> milk, curd, ghee, urine and dung of the cow, constituents; <F>2:  Ib. २६६. 6; २६७. 5-6; वा. ११०. १५.</F> a panacea for stealing eatables, fruits and flowers, vehicles and beds; <F>3:  M. २२७. ४४.</F> ablution of image to be installed by. <F>4:  Ib. २६५. 8.</F>
--these are शब्द, स्पर्श, रूप, रस and गन्ध। वा. 4. ६८. [पगे२-272+ २९]
--an Apsaras. Br. III. 7. १४.

(I)--an asura in the form of a conch in the प्रभास. Son of सम्ह्राद and कृती, and father of Asikni. He seized the son of सान्दिपन (or सान्दीपनी) and devour- ed him. कृष्ण plunged into the sea and killing him, remov- ed the conch which covered his body. <F>1:  भा. III. 3. 2; VI. 4. ५१; १८. १४; X. ४५. ४०-42. Vi. V. २१. २७-8.</F> Killed in प्राग्- ज्योतिष. <F>2:  Ib. V. २९. १९.</F>
(II)--a son of Sagara. Br. III. ६३. १४७.
(III)--the father of अम्शुमान् and father- in-law of यशोदा. M. १५. १८.
--the daughter of विश्वरूप and queen of Bharata. भा. V. 7. 1.
--an उपद्वीप to जम्बूद्वीप. भा. V. १९. ३०.
--the name of a तीर्थ in काञ्ची. Br. IV. ४०. ६०; ७१, ११५.
--a svara variety of a साम। Br. II. 8. ५१, ५२; वा. 9. ४९.
--to be repeated १००८ times to get rid of sins; of the मन्त्रशास्त्र, non-Vedic. Br. IV. 8. ३६, ५८. [पगे२-273+ ३०]
(I)--the fifteenth day of the माघ month fit for performing साधारण s4ra1ddha; <F>1:  M १७. 2, 4.</F> of the आषाद month for making gift of a cow. <F>2:  Ib. ५३. २४.</F>
(II)--the day when the पितृस् drink the rays of the moon. वा. ५२. ६९; ५६. ५९.
--the five modes of training horses for war. Br. IV. १६. २०.

--the sacred place for the performance of श्राद्ध, at the confluence of the Sindhu and the ocean; <F>1:  Br. III. १३. ५७; वा. ७७. ५६.</F> Arjuna halted here on his way to Indraprastha from द्वारका. <F>2:  Vi. V. ३८-12.</F>
--stationed by जरासन्ध at the southern gate of मथुरा. भा. X. ५०. ११. [4].
--a सूक्त of the साम Samhita to be recited when a tank is dug. M. ५८. ३६.
--a reference to २५ truths (tatvas) (in श्लोक 33) which arose out of the union of देवी with पुरुष. Br. IV. 8. २९.
--a R. in शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २६.
--the five great sinners. वा. १०८. ८४; १११. ५४. [पगे२-274+ २५]
--a name of the God of love. M. २०. २९.
--is ललिता. Br. IV. १५. 9.
(I)--a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५१.
(II)--outside the pale of the four आश्रमस्: a mixed caste. Br. III. १५. ३७.
(III)--the twenty-first Kalpa; consisting of प्राण, अपान, समान, उदान, and व्यान; mind-born sons of ब्रह्मा. वा. २१. ४७.
(IV)--the fifth note in music. वा. २१. ४९. ८६. ३७.
(V)--a pupil of हिरण्यनाभ's son; a सामग. वा. ६१. ४४.
--a name of ललिता; a शक्ती. Br. IV. १७. १८; ३६. २५.

--a name of ब्रह्मा: for saying that, he saw the beginning of an effulgence of light in the form of a sthambha, which Mahesvara assumed; for not seeing it, Siva--Bhairava removed one of ब्रह्मा's faces; hence Caturmukha from that day onwards. Br. IV. ४०. ४८, ५६. [पगे२-275+ २९]
--a son of आतप and grandson of the Vasu, विभावसु; it is on account of him that all creatures perform their functions. भा. VI. 6. १६.
(I)--a monkey chief. Br. III. 7. २३९.
(II)--a monkey chief. Br. III. 7. २३५.
(II)--a title conferred on able warriors as Surasena and others. Br. III. ४६. १७.
(I)--of a पुराण: Sarga, Pratisarga, Manvantara, वम्श and वम्शानुचरित. M. ५३. ६५. ७०; वा. 4. ११.
(II)--शब्द, रूप, rasa, gandha, and स्पर्श; incidents relating to. वा. 8. ४५.

--a gift of five ploughs and cattle both in wood and gold as well as १०० nivartanas (or ५० or even a small area enough for a house to stand on) of land on an auspicious day leads one to heaven; rules relating to the performance of. M. २७४. 9; ch. २८३ (whole).
--(कौशिकि tank): here is the तीर्थ of पाण्डुविशल. वा. ७७. ९९, १०१.
--one of Sagara's sons who survived Kapila's तेजस्। वा. ८८. १४९. [पगे२-276+ २६]
--a R. of the Bhadra country वा. ४३. २७.
--Saptavindhyas excepting हृईन्कार and प्रणव। Br. II. ३३. ३९.
--the Lord made of २५ truths (tatvas). M. २७४. ६२.
--the sons of साम्ब and काश्या. M. ४७. २४.
--an epithet of the God of love; his dart is the twig of the mango, and his standard, the fish; his wife, रती and his friend, Madhu or the spring; also पञ्चबाण and Madana. M. १५४. २०७-9, २१२.
(I)--a ब्रह्मऋषि <F>1:  M. १०२. १८.</F> of the eighth द्वापर. <F>2:  वा. २३. १४१.</F>
(II)--a son of ब्रह्मा. वा. १०१. ३३८.
--a mountain peak in साल्मलिद्वीप. Br. III. 7. ४५४.
--a Siddha. भा. VI. १५. १४.
--a Mt. south of the Meru. वा. ३६. २४. [पगे२-277+ २८]
--a son of दक्षसावर्णी. Vi. III. 2. २४.
--sacred to शिवा. Br. IV. ३६. १८.

--five fires eligible for पार्वण s4ra1ddha; <F>1:  वा. ८३. ५३; M. १६. 7.</F> performance of penance by ययाति for a year in the midst of five fires; <F>2:  Ib. ३५. १६.</F> created by अग्निशर्मन् from his face. These are दक्षिणाग्नि, गार्हपत्य, आहवनीय, Sabhya, and आवसथ्य. <F>3:  वा. १०६. ४१. 2.</F>
--a kind of austerity performed by परसुराम standing in the midst of five fires. Br. III. २२. ७२.
--fit for श्राद्ध. Br. III. १५. ३०.
--sacred to Hari; visited by बलराम Bha1. X. ७९. १८.
--पितृस् and sons of ब्रह्मा <F>1:  Br. II. २८. १७, २१; M. १४१. १५, १९.</F> limbs of the five year yuga; <F>2:  Ib. १४१. ५७.</F> known as काव्यस्. <F>3:  वा. ५२. ६८.</F>
--a sacred place on the नर्मदा. M. १९१. 6. [पगे२-278+ २७]

(I)--(च्) on the way from द्वारका to Hasti- नापुर; <F>1:  भा. IV. २५. ५०; २७. 8; X. ७१. २२.</F> migration of the Yadus to; <F>2:  Ib. X. 2. 3.</F> the territory divided among the five sons of Bheda. <F>3:  वा. ९९. १९२.</F>
(II)--a यक्ष sent by ब्रह्मा with the God- dess of Night to the Vindhyas to serve her as servant. M. १५७. १८.
--the २५ kings who were contemporaries of the ten शिशुनागस्. Br. III. ७४. १३६.
--see बिन्दुपीठ. Br. IV. ३७. ४७.
--a तीर्थ fit for performing श्राद्ध. वा. ७७. ४५.
--the painting canvas frame on which portraits were drawn. चित्रलेखा drew a good number of portraits for उष's choice of a husband. Vi. V. ३२. २२-5.
--a musical instrument. वा. ४०. २४; M. २६१. ५५.
a kingdom of मध्यदेश; name of a tribe. Br. II. १६. ४१; M. ११४. ३५.
--a war musical instrument. M. १३७. २९; १३८. 3. [पगे२-279+ २६]
--a king of the शातकर्नि line; ruled for twenty-four years. Br. III. ७४. १६४.
--the son of मेघस्वाति and father of अरिष्ट- karman. Vi. IV. २४. ४५-6.
--an Andhra line of rulers. Vi. IV. २४. ५८.
--a son of दमघोष and श्रुतश्रवा. वा. ९६. १५९.
--a plate or cloth or other substance to be pre- sented with prescribed मन्त्रस् as gift during an eclipse. M. ६७. २१.
--a माहिषी line of १३ kings. वा. ९९. ३७४.
--mode of wearing the tilaka on the forehead. Other modes are ऊर्ध्व pun2d2ra, त्रिपुण्ड्र and अगस्त्यपत्राकार. Br. IV. ३८. २२.
--a commander of भण्ड; <F>1:  Br. IV. २१. ८३.</F> a son of भण्ड. <F>2:  Ib. IV. २६. ४९.</F>
--one of the weapons of शिव. वा. ५५. ४५; १०१. २७०.
(I)--a son of बाह्यक. वा. ९६. 4.
(II)--a musical instrument. वा. ४५. ४०; भा. V. 9. १५.
--the smallest coin. Vi. VI. 1. २२.
(I)--a priest in a काऌइ temple; the reference is to the पणि of the वृषल chief. भा. V. 9. १५-16.
(II)--a दानव group of रसातल. भा. V. २४. ३०.
--of Galava gotra. Br. III. ६६. ७१.
--in the पाण्डुकुल and near the sea; a place fit for श्राद्ध. वा. ७७. ३७.
(I)--a Mt. on the base of Meru; <F>1:  भा. V. १६. २६. Vi. II. 2. २८.</F> on the south of the मानस. <F>2:  वा. ३६. २२; ३८. 2.</F>
(II)--a class of people in प्लक्षद्वीप. भा. V. २०. 4.
(III)--a son of देवकी killed by Kamsa; taken to द्वारका from Sutala by कृष्ण, and after having been seen by his parents, went to Heaven. भा. X. ८५. ५१-6. [पगे२-281+ २७]
(IV)--the helpmate of the वालखिल्यस्; <F>1:  वा. २८. ३२.</F> the Sun God. <F>2:  Br. II. २१. ६७. वा. ५२. ४८; ५४. 8.</F>
--the wife of तार्क्ष्य and mother of birds. भा. VI. 6. २१.
(II)--a pupil of पराशर्य Kauthuma. Br. II. ३५. ४६; वा. ६१. ४१.
--a R. of the Bhadra continent. वा. ४३. ३०.
--a शक्ती of the वायुदिक्; her riding animal मृग। M. २८६. 9.

--a fallen person from the path of righteousness, पिण्ड to be given in the evening and no pollution; whoever he be, even the guru, he must be abandoned; but the fallen mother must not be abandoned. M. २२७. ५९, १५०.
--conjugal fidelity; the greatness of, illus- trated by the story of सावित्री and सत्यवान्; husband is the lord, God, partner and not others. M. २१०. १६ff.
--ruled after the Andhra king हाल, for five years. Br. III. ७४. १६६. [पगे२-282+ २४]
--(likhitam) written message sent by रुक्मिणी to कृष्ण; text of the letter. भा. X. ५२. ३६ [1 and 2]; ३७-43.
--a Mauneya Gandharva. Br. III. 7. 2.
--a medicinal plant. M. २१८. ३१.
(I)--learnt the Atharva सम्हिता from a pupil of Sumantu; Kumuda and others were his disciples. भा. XII. 7. 1 and 2.
(II)--a disciple of Kabandha; he had three dis- ciples; जाजलि (जाबालि-वि। प्।), कुमुलादि and शौनक. Br. II. ३५. ५६, ५९; वा. ६१. ५०; Vi. III. 6. 9-११.
(III)--of भार्गव gotra. वा. ६५. ९६.
--a daughter of Maru and wife of Atharva An- giras; father of १०१ sons of whom were अयास्य, वामदेव, Utathya, उशिति, and धृष्णि. Br. III. 1. १०३-5; वा. ६५. ९८.
--a tribe of the Vindhya region. M. ११४. ५३.
(I)--a यक्ष; a son of पुण्यजनी and मणि- bhadra. Br. III. 7. १२४; वा. ६९. १५५. [पगे२-283+ २७]
(II)--the name of the 7th kalpa. वा. २१. १२.
(III)--a son of Bhadra; gave birth to eight kinds of elephants; <F>1:  वा. ६९. २१३, २१७.</F> vehicle of Ailavila. <F>2:  Br. III. 7. ३२९. ३३१.</F>
(IV)--the forest of Padma between the Lau- hitya and the Sindhu. Br. III. 7. ३५८.
(V)--a नाग (serpent) chief. Br. IV. २०. ५३.
--a palace with three भूमिकस् and sixteen sides; <F>1:  M. २६९. ३९, ४३.</F> also श्रिवृक्षक; the तोरण is of २० hastas. <F>2:  Ib. २६९. ४९.</F>
--a goddess following रेवती. M. १७९. ७३.
--a son of मृग elephant. Br. III. 7. ३३२.
--the vessel of the lotus leaf wherein the Gandharvas milked the cow-earth. M. १०. २४.
--a snake used as बलबन्धम् for Tri- पुरारि's chariot. M. १३३. ३३. [पगे२-284+ २५]
(I)--also जनार्दन; the God who per- vades all the worlds; lustrous as the sun and with bow as weapon. Br. II. १९. १७७-80; III. ३३. १७; IV. ३४. ८१.
(II)--a यक्ष; a son of देवजनी and मणिवर. Br. III. 7. १३०; वा. ६९. १६१.
--the Gandharvas and the Apsarasas milked the earth making Citraratha the calf; milkman शुची Vis4vavasu. वा. ६२. १८७.

--ब्रह्मा; a thousand leafed lotus came out of the navel of the Lord on the eve of the creation of the universe; it resembled the earth in form; in it were found all the countries, mountains, peoples, etc. M. 4. 1; १६८. १५; १६९. 3 to १८.
(I)--१००० billions; ten times the शन्कु. M. २३. ३९; वा. १०१. १०१.
(II)--one of the eight निधिस् of Kubera. वा. ४१. १०.
--see ब्रह्मा. Br. II. २५. ६२. Vi. VI. 4-9.
--a यक्ष; a son of देवजनी and मणि- vara. Br. III. 7. १२९; वा. ६१. १९०. [पगे२-285+ २६]
--in the यज्ञस् after the world lotus of the Lord. M. १६९. १६ and १८.
(II)--one of the ten पीठस् for images; with sixteen corners, a little short at the bottom; gives one good luck (सौभाग्य). M. २६२. 7, १६, १८.
(I)--the city of पुरञ्जय the capital of the नागस्. भा. XII. 1. ३७. Vi. IV. २४. ६३.
(II)--a daughter of भङ्गकार, who was given in marriage to कृष्ण. M. ४५. २१.
--a kind of आसन in yoga, once practised by परशुराम; of Kapila. Br. III. २४. १६; ५३. १७.
--a son of मृग elephant. Br. III. 7. ३३२.
--a Devagandharva. वा. ६८. ३९.
--A वानर, whose daughter was रुमा; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. २२१, २३१.</F> fol- lowed राम in his expedition to लन्का. <F>2:  भा. IX. १०. १९.</F> [पगे२-286+ २६]
--a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३३. 4.
--semi-divine beings, see सर्पास्। Br. II. ३२. 1, 2.
--a sage; one of the three disciples of रथी- tara. M. २००. १२; वा. ६१. 3.
--a tribe who were defeated by Sagara and deprived of their क्षत्रिय right of Vedic study and sacrifice; became Mlecchas and were allowed to have long hair. Vi. IV. 3. ४२, ४७-8.
(I)--a R. sacred to Hari; visited by बलराम. भा. VII. १४. ३१; X. ७९. १२.
(II)--a R. of the Bhadra country. वा. ४३. २७.
--sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ५०.
--a R. of the Bhadra country. वा. ४३. २७.
--(Gavya) cow's milk for श्राद्ध; <F>1:  M. १७. ३४.</F> not to be taken during nights. <F>2:  M. १३१. ४३.</F>
--a R. flowing in द्रविड in the भारत- वर्ष. भा. V. १९. १८; XI. 5. ३९. [पगे२-287+ २९]
--a monkey chief. Br. III. 7. २४०.
--a lake in the नील hill. Br. II. १८. ६९.
(I)--a R. from the lake Payodam. Br. II. १८. ७०. वा. ४७. ६६.
(II)--a R. rising on the western side of the Meru mountain. वा. ४७. ६७.
--see क्षीरोद. Br. II. २५. ५४.

--(also called सर्वयज्ञ, सर्वव्रत) a votive offering of the essence of तपस्, in honour of Hari to be observed for twelve days and in which Hari is represented in an image or in any other form; originally told about it by ब्रह्मा, कश्यप suggested to his wife Aditi to observe it; अदिती observed it as instructed by कश्यप, when Hari manifested Himself and promised to be born of her womb; <F>1:  भा. VIII. १६. २५-60; १७. 1-१८.</F> observed by श्रद्धा. <F>2:  IX. 1. १४.</F>

--a R. from the ऋक्ष hill in भारतवर्ष <F>1:  भा. V. १९. १८; Br. II. १६. ३२; वा. ४५. १०२; Vi. II. 3. ११.</F> visited by बलराम; <F>2:  भा. X. ७९. २०.</F> sacred to पिन्गलेश्वरी and the पितृस्. <F>3:  M. १३. ४४; २२. ३३. ६४; ११४. २७.</F> [पगे२-288+ २६]
(I)--that which is पूर्व in the परार्ध becomes Para in अपरार्ध; <F>1:  वा. 7. १३.</F> ety. the best. <F>2:  Ib. 5. ३७.</F>
(II)--one of the three sons of Samara of Kampili. वा. ९९. १७७.
--a tribe living in the नर्मदा region. वा. ४५. १२९.
--of the तैत्तिरीयस्. वा. ६१. ६६.
--is ललिता. Br. IV. १०. ८९.
--a son of Anu. वा. ९९. १३.
--the best of पुरुषस्; worshipped by one who has no desires and by one who desires everything includ- ing मोक्ष। भा. II. 3. 9, १० and १२.
--is ललिता. Br. IV. १०. ९०.

(I)--twice the number of पराऋध; <F>1:  Br. IV. 2. ९०; वा. १०१. ९२ and ९९.</F> it is ब्रह्मा, knowledge, wealth and everything desirable; <F>2:  Br. IV. 2. ९९-102.</F> [पगे२-289+ २५] according to one mode of computation Para is itself परार्- dha which means anything above परार्ध, and is incal- culable. <F>3:  Ib. IV. 2. १०५-7, १४३.</F>
--etymology of. M. १४५. ८२.

--(परमाणु): (1/१०) more than भूतादि; is सूक्ष्म and cannot be ascertained by भाव; that which could not be consolidated; the first परमाणु of प्रमाणस् is the particle of dust seen through the inner window by the sun's rays. भा. III. ११. 1; XII. 4. 1; वा. १०१. ११६-18. Br. IV. 2. ११७, २२७-9.
--illustrated by the life of निदाघ, a pupil of ऋभु. Vi. II. १४. १६ and ३१; chh. १५ and १६.

--the fourth आश्रम or सन्न्यास; to be with guru for a year and then to go about the country; leav- ing off congregation, subduing anger, eating light food, con- trolling the senses, and living in deserted places, forests, caves and banks of rivers. वा. १७. 1-8. [पगे२-290+ २८]
--a son of Anu. M. ४८. १०. Vi. IV. १८. 1.
(I)--an attribute of ब्रह्मा worshipped for overlordship. भा. II. 1. ३०; 2. २२; 3. 6; Br. IV. 9. २७.
(II)--a son of Devadyumna; his queen सुवर्चला; father of Pratiha. भा. V. १५. 3.
(III)--a son of Indradyumna. Br. II. १४. ६५; Vi. II. 1. ३६. वा. ३३. ५५.
(IV)--married the daughter of दक्ष and became the father of नारद. Br. III. 2. १३-18.
--a son of तामस Manu. M. 9. १७.
--a son of Rukmakavaca and father of five sons. Vi. IV. १२. १०-11.
(I)--a son of Uttama Manu. Br. II. ३६. ३९; Vi. III. 1. १५.
(II)--also परश्वध: axe; the weapon presented to राम by शिव to put down the Asuras. Br. III. २४. ७४, ८१; ३२. ५८; ३९. २१, ३१; ४०. १३; IV. १९. ८४.
(III)--a son of रुक्मिणी and कृष्ण. M. ४७. १६.

(I)--a Siddha: the १६थ् अवतार् of विष्णु; a foe of the Haihayas; rid the world of the क्षत्रियस् twenty one times; and made three pools of blood at Syamanta- पञ्चक; <F>1:  भा. I. 3. २०; II. 7. २२; VI. १५. १३; X. ४०. २०; ८२. 3; XI. 4. २१.</F> defeated by Rama <F>2:  Ib. IX. १०. 7; chh. १५ and १६ (whole).</F> spoke highly of the valour of भीष्म, <F>3:  Ib. IX. २२. २०.</F> while in तपस् was met by कृष्ण and बलराम on their way to Gomanta; he asked them to kill the king of करवीरपुर at its foot and thus clear the way uphill; <F>4:  Ib. X. [५२ (V) १८-30].</F> was met by बलराम; <F>5:  Ib. X. ७९-12; Vi. IV. 4. ९४.</F> son of Jamadagni with an अम्स of नारायन; a Bhargava; <F>6:  वा. ९४. ३८; वा. IV. 7. ३६.</F> killed कार्तवीर्य Arjuna. <F>7:  Vi. IV. ११. २०.</F>
(II)--a Purohita of कृष्ण in his यज्ञस् at कुरुक्षेत्र. भा. X. ९०. ४६[2].
(I)--a गण. Br. IV. 1. ५५.
(II)--a सावर्ण Manu, with a गण of १२, of which six names are mentioned. Br. IV. 1. ५५, ५७. [पगे२-292+ २६]
(III)--a शक्ति. Br. IV. ३५. ९९.
(IV)--the fourth stage of कामाक्षी, of four arms with पाश, अङ्कुश, इक्षुकोदण्ड, and पञ्चबाण, in this form ललिता got established at काञ्चि. Br. IV. ३९. १३; ४४. १४१.
(V)--a R. rising from the ऋक्ष hill of the भारतवर्ष. वा. ४५. ९८.
--a son of Anu. Br. III. ७४. १३.
--a Janapada of the Bhadra. वा. ४३. २०.
--is ललिता. Br. IV. १३. 1 and 5.
--the third stage of कामाक्षी, the second being सुद्धपरा. Br. IV. ३९. ११.
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १८. १४.
--the preceding kalpa as opposed to अपरार्धकल्प of which the first one is the present वराहकल्प. वा. 7. ११. [पगे२-293+ ५१]

--measurement of ten अन्तस्, (Vedic): two परार्धम्स् constitute ब्रह्मा's life (first प्रजापति); <F>1:  वा. १००. २४०. Vi. I. 3. 5.</F> The present वराहकल्प is the second परार्ध; <F>2:  Ib. I. 3. २७-8; VI. 3. 4.</F> of ब्रह्मा; <F>3:  Br. I. 4-३१.</F> a crore of १००० crores. <F>4:  वा. १०१. ९२, ९९.</F>
(I)--the Gandharva who sang the glory of Indra for defeating Namuci: with the शरत् sun. भा. VIII. ११. ४१; Br. II. २३. १३; वा. ७९. १३.
(II)--an asura who entered the ocean. M. ६१. 4.
--one of the seven Maruts. M. १६३. ३२.
--is माया; <F>1:  वा. १०४. ३३.</F> worship of, to get rid of Raurava hell and of other sins. <F>2:  Br. IV. 7-७५; 8. ५७-8; १०. ९०; १२. ४१-66; १४. २२; १५. ४६.</F>

(I)--the son of शक्ति and अदृश्यन्ती; wife काल्या (सत्यवती, Acchoda Matsya Gandhi) and son कृष्णद्वैपायन; <F>1:  भा. I. 3. २१; 4. १४; VI. १५. (१४); IX. २२. २१; XII. 6. ४९, ५५; Br. I. 1. 9; 2. १२; III. 8. ९१; M. १४. १५; ४७. २४६; २०१. ३१; वा. ७०. ८३.</F> a ऋषिक became sage by satya; <F>2:  Br. II. ३२. १०२.</F> a pupil of याज्ञवल्क्य; <F>3:  Ib. II. ३५. २९; वा. ७७. ७४; Vi. III. 4. १८.</F> of बाष्कल, a वासिष्ठ; <F>4:  Br. II. ३२. ११५.</F> a श्रुतऋषि; <F>5:  Ib. II. ३३. 3; M. १४५. ९६, १०९.</F> a Veda- व्यास <F>6:  Br. II. ३५. १२४; वा. २३. २१२.</F> of the २६थ् dva1para; heard the ब्र्। पुराण (वायु प्।) from शक्ति when in embryo and narrated it to जातु-- कर्णि; <F>7:  Br. IV. 4. ६५-6; वा. ६१. ४७; १०३. ६५; १०६. ३५.</F> praised शिव, out to destroy Tripura; <F>8:  M. १३३. ६७.</F> invited for the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर, <F>9:  भा. X. ७४. 8.</F> came to see परीक्षित् preaching प्रायोपवेस; <F>१०:  Ib. I. १९. 9; वा. 1. १३८; 2. १२.</F> questioned by Maitreya on the origin of the world etc: narrated the भागवत to the sage; <F>११:  भा. III. 8. 8; Vi. I. 1. 1-१०.</F> recollected वसिष्ठ's narration to him of his father's death at the hands of a राक्षस set up by विश्वामित्र: his anger and the sacrifice he performed for the extinction of the राक्षसस्; <F>१२:  Ib. I. 1. ११-14.</F> The advice of वसिष्ठ, his grand-father, to abate his anger [पगे२-294+ २८] because fate must run its course and anger was unworthy of the wise: his compliance; <F>१३:  Ib. I. 1. १५-21.</F> the arrival of Pulastya the son of ब्रह्मा, who granted P. boons comprising knowledge of the सास्त्रस्, authorship of विष्णु पुराण and correct know- ledge of the truth about Gods and Karma: the conformation of the boons by वसिष्ठ: states that the Universe is born of विष्णु, depends on him and is सहिष्णु अवतार् of the Lord; <F>१४:  वा. २३. २१२; Vi. I. 1. २२-31.</F> praise of Hari having realised the Yoga power of Hari. <F>१५:  भा. II. 7. ४५; Vi. II. 2. 7.</F>
(II)--the son and pupil of कुशुमि. Br. II. ३५. ४२.
(III)--a son of ऋषभ अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १४४.
(IV)--a Mantra-ब्राह्मण-ka1raka and resident of ब्रह्मक्षेत्र. वा. ५९. १०५.
--the great Vedic dictum. वा. १८. 3.
--people constituting the cavalry forces of ललिता. Br. IV. १६. १६.
--from the region of planets to that of ऋषिस् or sages; the sixth skandha. वा. ६७. ११९. [पगे२-295+ २५]
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २४.
--a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५२.
--of the तैत्तिरीय of the Yajur Veda. Br. II. ३५. ७५.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८६.
--a son of Rukmakavaca, appointed over Videha region with his brother Hari. M. ४४. २८. २९; वा. ९५. २८; Br. III. ७०. २९.
--service being the sacrifice for शूद्रस्. वा. ५७. ५०.

--पृथ्वी, Ap, and Tejas, are Paricchinnas-- that could be distinguished; this is generally because of अमूर्तत्वम्; while वायु and आकाश are Aparicchinnas on account of अमूर्तत्वम् or सूक्ष्म, the characteristic of being everywhere. वा. ४९. १७५.
--a Mauneya Gandharva. Br. III. 7. 3.
--a thousand परार्धस्. वा. १०१. १००.
--the son of सुखीनल and father of Sunaya. भा. IX. २२. ४२.
--the son of सुखीबल. वा. ९९. २७५.
--a Bhavya God. Br. II. ३६. ७२.
--one of the seven seers of the स्वारोचिष epoch. Vi. III. 1. ११.

(II)--the second year of the five year युग, <F>1:  वा. ३१. २७; ५०. १८३; Br. II. १३. ११४, ११७, १२६-7; Vi. II. 8. ७२.</F> युग of five years: Samvatsara, Parivatsara, Idvatsara, Anuvatsara, and Vatsara; <F>2:  भा. III. ११. १४; V. २२. 7; M. १४१. १८-19.</F> Agni, Surya, Soma, वायु and Rudra respectively of the five years.
(I)--a variety of wind controlling the Parjanya clouds. वा. ५१. ४५.

(II)--the sixth of the seven Maruts helping, the Parjanya and Diggajas to rain dew; <F>1:  Br. II. २२. ५०; M. १६३. ३३; वा. ६७-120.</F> the chief of the seventh वातस्कन्ध situated between the planets and Druva. <F>2:  Br. III. 5. ८९; वा. ६७. १२०.</F> [पगे२-297+ ३३]
--a Janapada of the Bhadra country. वा. ४३. २०.
--an unmarried man, when his younger brother is married; ineligible for श्राद्ध. M. १६. १५.
--a daughter of ऋषा brought forth oyster, conch, ऐणेय, शम्बूक and different kinds of poison like कालकूट. Br. III. 7. ४१४, ४१९-20; वा. ६९. २९१, २९६.
--the circle round the sun and moon indi- cates danger to the Kingdom. M. २३३. 8.
--an Agni. Br. II. १२. २२.
--a son of सुखीबल. M. ५०. ८३.
--a son of देवकी killed by Kamsa; taken to द्वारका from Sutala by कृष्ण, and after having been seen by his parents, went to heaven. भा. X. ८५. ५१-6.

(I)--a son of उत्तरा and Abhimanyu; birth of; जातकर्म by युधिष्ठिर by gifts of cows, gold and lands; named विष्णुरत as was born of विष्णु's grace; blessed by Brahmanas to be like इक्ष्वाकु, राम, शिबि, Arjuna, and so on; <F>1:  भा. I. 4. 9-१०; 7. १२; १२. 7-३०; Br. III. ६८. २१; वा. ९९. २४९.</F> a great conqueror; <F>2:  M. ५०. ५७.</F> with his capital at हस्तिनापुर was a सार्वभौम, a सम्राट्, and the foremost of the भागवतस्; <F>3:  भा. I. chh. १६ and १७ (whole).</F> ruled the earth guided by Brahmanas; married इरावती, daughter of Uttara and had four sons Janamejaya and others; performed three अश्वमेधस् with कृप as preceptor; conquered भद्राश्व, केतुमाला, and other coun- [पगे२-298+ ४०] tries and took tributes from them; heard stories of कृष्ण's heroic deeds in those places; overheard conversation between Dharma moving on one leg and the weeping Goddess of Earth on the advent of Kali and at the departure of कृष्ण to Heaven; reached सरस्वती where it flows towards the east; saw a वृषल in royal robes beating a white bull totter- ing on one foot and a cow bereft of calf shedding tears; promised security of life to them; appreciation by Dharma and परीक्षित्'s answer; Kali in वृषल's garb fell at his feet and was asked to leave ब्रह्मावर्त. But on request the King permitted him to live in five unrighteous regions; dice, wine, women, slaughter-house, and gold; <F>4:  Ib. ch. १८ whole.</F> once when he went ahunting he felt thirsty and hungry and entered the hermitage of a sage in meditation; As he was not welcomed he threw a dead serpent on his neck and returned home; the sage's boy got offended and cursed that the King be dead by the bite of तक्षक in a week; the sage who came to know of it regretted his son's conduct as it was a great punishment for a small offence; <F>5:  Ib. ch. १९. 1-१६, ३२. ३८; II. 8. 1-२६; VIII. 1. ३३.</F> the King regretted his deed, knew that the Brahmana's curse would come true and was in a state of प्रायोपवेश, when he was visited by sages and kings to whom he bowed; thither came शुक whom the king enquired as to the beneficial course to seek मोक्ष; requested शुक to narrate the stories of कृष्ण; <F>6:  Ib. XII. 6. 1-7.</F> heard the whole of भागवत पुराण from शुक and thanked him for enlightening him on निर्वाण; <F>7:  Ib. II. 4. 2; XII. 6. 9-१५; १२. 5-6.</F> knew of his coming death at the hands of तक्षक and prepared calmly to cast off his body into गन्गा to attain Hari's feet; sat in contemplation in a detatched spirit; bitten by तक्षक, his body was reduc- ed to ashes by the poison; universal surprise and benediction at the occurrence; <F>8:  Br. III. ७४. २२७, २३०; M. २७३. ३६; Vi. IV. १९. ७८; २०-1.</F> from P. to Nanda's accession was a period of १५०० years (१०५० years वि। प्।: १०१५ Wilson). Father of Janamejaya and three other sons. <F>9:  वा. ९९, २२९, ४२३; Vi. IV, १९. ७८; २०. I.</F> [पगे२-299+ २९]
(II)--a son of Kuru, childless. भा. IX. २२. 4, 9; M. ५०. २३; वा. ९९. २१८.
(III)--a son of तामस Manu. Br. II. ३६. ४९.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८४.
--between the hills शम्कु, कूट and वृषभ; Kinnaras, चरणस् etc. live there. वा. ३८. ६३-5.
--a son of Anu. भा. IX. २३. 1.

(I)--a name of Indra: God of rain (or simply rain); created by वामदेव; <F>1:  भा. I. १०. 4; II. 6. 7; IV. १४. २६. VI. १४. ३५; X. २०. 5; XII. 4. 7; M. 4. २९.</F> to be worshipped in house building. <F>2:  Ib. २५३. २४.</F>

(II)--An आदित्य and लोकपाल; the name of the sun in the month of Tapasya (फाल्गुन): father of हिरण्यरोम. भा. XII. ११. ४०; Br. II. २१. १५७; २३. १२; ३०. ४०; III. 3. ६८; 8. २०; वा. ५०. २०६; ६६. ६६; Vi. II. १०. १२.

(III)--one of the important clouds raining dew for the growth of corns; <F>1:  Br. II. २२. ४९.</F> overlords of seas, rivers, clouds, rains besides आदित्य; <F>2:  Ib. III. 8. १४; वा. ७०. १३.</F> they are under the control of wind, Parivaha; they also carry the heavenly गन्गा. <F>3:  Ib. ५१. ४३-6.</F> [पगे२-300+ २७]
(IV)--a Parivaha and sage of the Raivata epoch; <F>1:  Br. II. ३६. ६२; M. 9. १९; Vi. III. 1. २२.</F> attained heaven by तपस्। <F>2:  M. १४३. ३९.</F>
(V)--same as Hiranyaroma. M. १२४. ९५.
(IV)--a son of Agni and सम्हूति; <F>1:  वा. २८. १६.</F> his wife मानु and son हिरण्यरोम. <F>2:  Br. II. ११. १९.</F>
(VII)--a deity with the sun in the शरत् season. वा. ५२. १२.
(IX)--a Mauneya. वा. ६९. 3.
--leaves as dress of mountain residents. Vi. IV. २४. ९६.
--a Mt. in the साल्मलिद्वीप: one of the haunts of the गरुड family. Br. III. 7. ४५३.
--a त्रयार्षेय Pravara. M. १९७. 6.
--a R. from ऋष्यवान्; <F>1:  M. ११४. २३.</F> got transformed into a girl and became the wife of देववृद्ध. <F>2:  Br. III. ७१. 7, १२.</F> [पगे२-301+ २४]
--an apsaras coupled with पुञ्जिकस्थला. Br. III. 7. १४; वा. ६९. 4, ४९.
--१००० hooded serpent shedding golden lustre as bed of the Lord. वा. २४. ११, १७.
--one of २८ hells for house-holders who do not properly receive guests. भा. V. २६. 7, ३५.
--earth, equal to द्यौस् in size. वा. ५०. ७४-75.
--one who performs ceremonials intended for festivals on ordinary days for gain. वा. ८३. ६४.
(I)--called on भीष्म lying on his death-bed. भा. I. 9. 6.
(II)--a son of कश्यप; brother of नारद and a देवऋषि; <F>1:  Br. II. १९. 9; वा. ६१. ८५; ७०. ७९.</F> a sage born in नारद hill in प्लक्ष. <F>2:  Br. II. ३५. ९५; III. 7. २७; 8. ८६; वा. ३०. ८६; ४९. 8.</F>
(III)--a god of the हरिता gan2a. Br. IV. 1. ८४.
(V)--the son of पौर्णमास. Vi. I. १०. 6.

--hills sprang out of the scatterings of the प्रलयाग्नि after the earth was rescued by the वराह; for having sat firm (अचलास्); Parvatas with slopes (Parvas) swallowed in and hence giri; stony and hence शिल. वा. 6. ३०-32.
--one of the ten branches of the हरिता group of devas. वा. १००. ८९.
--used by the Matsya King against परशुराम. Br. III. ३८. ४४.
--a shrine near Benares. M. १८३. ६२.

--a son of पूर्णमास and सरस्वती; the lord of all गणस्; his wife, पर्वशा; had पुण्या and सुमती as daughters-in-law; <F>1:  वा. २८. १०-12, ३३.</F> father of यजुर्धाम and Stambha काश्यप. <F>2:  Br. II. ११. १३.</F>
--the wife of पर्वश; <F>1:  Br. II. ११. १५.</F> mother of यजुर्धाम and Stambha काश्यप. Br. II. ११. १५. वा. २८. १३.
--the last day of the कृष्ण and Sukla पक्षस्; <F>1:  M. १४१. २८, ३२.</F> fit for the rituals of अग्निआधान. <F>2:  वा. ५६. ३४.</F> [पगे२-303+ २६]
--a measurement: thirteen palas make one मागध measure, (jalaprastha-वा। प्।): [न्।ब्। ४० palas make at present one Madras measure.] Br. IV. 1. २१७; वा. १००. २१९; Vi. VI. 3. 8.
--a son of हालाहल and father of Pulindasena; a King. Vi. IV. २४. ४७.
--a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३३. 6.
--a R. of the केतुमाला country. वा. ४४. १८.
--a R. of the शुक्तिमत्. Br. II. १६. ३८; वा. ४५. १०७.
--a southern tribe. M. ११४. ४०; Br. II. १६. ४७.
<F>1:  वा. ८८, १२२; १३६; ४५. ११८; ५८. ८२, ९३, १०७.</F>--defeated by Sagara; allowed to escape with moustaches. <F>2:  Br. III. ४८. २६, १९, ४४.</F>
(I)--a Mt. on the west of Meru भा. V. १६. २७.
(II)--a name of वायु; <F>1:  भा. VI. 3. १४; Vi. V. २१. १६.</F> in इन्द्रश् host, with अन्कुश for his weapon. <F>2:  M. १४८. ८३.</F> [पगे२-304+ २५]
(III)--a son of Uttama Manu. भा. VIII. 1. २३.
(IV)--a son of वसिष्ठ and ऊर्जा. Br. II. ११. ४१.
(V)--the पार्थिव Agni. Br. II. २४. १०.
--description of; here are द्वादशार्कस् Va1lukes4vara, eleven Rudras, हनुमान् and four कुण्डस्; a तीर्थ; bath in which rids one of ब्रह्महत्ति दोष। वा. ५९. ११०.-३०; ६०. ६८.
--the performer of it becomes a राज. M. १०१. ७८.
--a tribe. Br. III. ७३. १०८.
--Hanuman, वायुपुत्र. वा. ६०. ६९; ७२.
--a son of स्वाहा and a Lauki- काग्नि; thought of as निर्मन्थ्य by poets; it is the गार्ह- पत्य। भा. IV. 1. ६०. Br. II. २४. १५. वा. २९. 2, १०. Vi. I. १०. १५.
(II)--a son of विजिताश्व and an Agni in  previous birth born thus because of वसिष्ठ's curse. भा. IV. २४. 4.
(III)--a son of मेधातिथि of शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २५. [पगे२-305+ ३०]
(I)--जयिनी: a शक्ति on शर्वरोहहरचक्र. Br. IV. ३७. 6.
(II)--the right feet of the Veda. वा. १०४. ७२.
--a R. in क्रौञ्चद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २१.
(I)--Gods of the epoch of १४थ् Manu. भा. VIII. १३. ३४; Vi. III. 2. ४३.
(II) (परित्रस्)--one of the five देवगणस् of the १४थ् Bhauta Manu: are the seven worlds. Br. IV. 1. १०६, १९८. वा. १००. १११-2.
(II)--a main stream of कुशद्वीप. Vi. I. 4. ४३.

--born of सविता: ग्राम्य and आरण्य; killing of except in यज्ञस् considered as हिम्सा; sacrifice of, for preta, भूत, and गणस् irreligious and sinful; <F>1:  भा. VI. १८. 1; VII. १५. 7-१०; XI. १०. २८; २१. २९-30; Vi. I. 5. ५१-2.</F> the sages finding many heads of cattle for sacrificial purposes by Indra com- plained about the हिम्सा and said that हिम्सा must be remov- ed from the sacrifices and that they could be performed only with seeds and corns; there was a difference of opinion and the sages referred the question to king Vasu; he called it हिम्सा and was punished; final conclusion that in killing पशु in a यज्ञ there was no हिम्सा; <F>2:  वा. ५७. ९२-114.</F> fourteen kinds dis- tinguished. <F>3:  Br. IV. 6. ५४; II. ३२. ११-2, १६.</F> [पगे२-306+ २८]
--attacked by Rudra. वा. ८८. १३५.

(I)--fourth name of शिव; the fifth तनु of Agni; has पचिकशक्ति; wife स्वाहा and son Skanda; <F>1:  Br. II. १०. ८०; वा. २७. ११, ५३; ३०. ८९.</F> hence fire to be kept clean. <F>2:  Br. II. १०. १३ and ४५.</F>
(II)--see Rudra; <F>1:  M. १५४. ४८५. Vi. I. 8. 6; V. १८. ५६.</F> the presiding deity of fire. <F>2:  M. १६२. 9; २६५. ४०.</F>
--a name of कार्तवीर्य. M. ४३. २७; वा. ९४. २४.
--Vedic sacrifices; <F>1:  M. २४६. ६४.</F> in the chest of the personified Veda. <F>2:  वा. १०४. ८३.</F>
--sacrifice incumbent on house-holders. Br. IV. 6. ७३.
--a sacrifice performed by Bharata. भा. V. 7. 5.
--in यज्ञ condemned by sages but justified by Indra. Br. II. ३०. १७-18.

--प्रजापति after creating the eight deva- yonis with four kinds of serpents and of spirits, proceeded to create birds and beasts; sheep from face, crows from breast, cows from belly, and sides; from feet, horses, elephants, शरभ, gavaya deer, camel, etc., from hairs, vegetables, fruits and roots. वा. 9. ४१-5.

--defeated by परशुराम; <F>1:  Br. II. ३१. ८३; III. ४१. ३९.</F> attacked by बाहु and defeated by Sagara; <F>2:  Ib. III. ६३. १२०, १३४.</F> punished with wearing moustaches; <F>3:  Ib. III. ७३. १०८.</F> kingdom of <F>4:  M. १२१. ४५; १४४. ५७; वा. ४५. ११८; ५८. ८२.</F>
--an Asura; resisted Indra and मातलि in देवासुर war and was slain. भा. VII. 2. 4; VIII. ११. १९, २२ and २८.
--विधान of: to be observed by the husband in his fire offerings in the Pumsavana (s.v.) vratam, <F>1:  भा. VI. १९. २२: वा. २९. ३८.</F> prescribed for शूद्रस्. <F>2:  Vi. III. 8. ३४; VI. 2. २३.</F>

--Indra, the lord of rains; <F>1:  Br. III. ६३. ९९; ६६. ३५; M. 7. ५१. वा. ८८. ८५.</F> fought with the Asuras and got the full share of यज्ञस् for devas and deprived them of their place. <F>2:  Ib. ९७. ९३.</F> [पगे२-308+ ३९]

--deities of: kites, vul- tures, cranes, and banyan trees, not accepted by आर्य reli- gion; <F>1:  भा. V. १४. २९.</F> Shine in Kali and oppose Vedic religion; <F>2:  V. २०. 8 and २३.</F> created by Indra; followers of शिव according to the curse of भ्२ऋगु. Two kinds, one naked and the other wearing red clothes; <F>3:  IV. 2. २८ and ३०; १९. २४-25, ३५-36.</F> वृद्धश्रावक, Nirgrantha, शाक्य, आजिवक and कार्पट are some sects: vanquished by Pramati in a देवासुर war. <F>4:  Br. II. ३१. ५३, ६६ and ८०; III. १४. ३९; ७४. २०७.</F>
--a son of नहुष. M. २४. ५०.
--one of the wives of दक्ष who bore him १००० sons, हर्यश्वस् (s.v.). M. 5. 4.
--the conch of कृष्ण, blown by him at the siege of मथुरा by जरासन्ध. Vi. V. २१. ३०; भा. VIII. 4. १९; X. ५०. २४[1-2]; ५१ (v) २७; ५९. 6; XI. २७. २७.
(I)--(च्) a kingdom of the north. भा. I. १०. ३४. Br. II. १६. ४६. M. १२१. ५०.
(II)--a common name for the five sons of भर्म्याश्व (हर्यश्व वि। प्।) and who were capable of ruling five kingdoms. भा. IX. २१. ३२-33; २२. 3; Vi. IV. १९. ५९.

--their king was Drupada; <F>1:  भा. X. ५२. ११[8].</F> enlisted by जरा- sandha against the Yadus; placed on the south by जरा- sandha in his siege of Gomanta, <F>2:  Ib. X. [५० (v) 2]; ५२. ११[8].</F> स्वयम्वर of द्रौपदी at their capital; <F>3:  Ib. X. ५७. १०[1-2].</F> कृष्ण met the पाण्डवस् in disguise at their capital; <F>4:  Ib. X. ५८. 9. [1 and 2].</F> heard of कृष्ण going to मिथिला and met him with presents. <F>5:  Ib. X. ८६. २०.</F> [पगे२-309+ २९]
--married कृत्वी daughter of शुक; <F>1:  M. १५. 9.</F> नील subdued by उग्रायुध. <F>2:  Ib. ४९. ७९. ७८.</F>
--the पान्चाल line of kings, २७ in number. M. २०. २०; २७२. १५; २७३. ७३.
(I)--the goddess enshrined at पुण्ड्रवर्धन. M. १३. ३५.
(II)--a तीर्थ sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ३३.

--the chief function in a marriage; Deva- यानी claims that this happened to her by ययाति when he rescued her from the well; <F>1:  M. ३०. २१.</F> reference to the marriage between शिव and उमा; <F>2:  Ib. ६०. १५.</F> according to fire rite; <F>3:  Ib. १५४. ४८४.</F> of शिव at काञ्चि. <F>4:  Br. IV. ३९. ६१.</F>
(I)--a १००० hooded snake. M. 6. ४१.
(II)--of the कौशिक gotra. वा. ९१. ९९.
--a class of पिशाचस् eating bali with heads of the elephants, camels and raised napes. Br. III. 7. ३७९, ३८३, ३९४; वा. ६९. २६४. [पगे२-310+ ३४]
--of the भार्गवगोत्र. वा. ६५. ९६.
--a hill west of the शितोद. वा. ३६. २८; ३८. ४९.

--The five sons of पाण्डु (s.v.); rumour that they were burnt in the house of lac built by Duryodhana; their escape in the disguise of Brahmanas; met by कृष्ण in a Potter's hall in पाञ्चाल city; <F>1:  भा. X. ५७. 1, १०[2-4]; Br. III. ७१. ६५.</F> married Draupadi; <F>2:  वा. ९९. २४०, २४६.</F> कृष्ण sent अक्रूर to हस्तिनापुर to find out their position; seen by अक्रूर; अक्रूर pleaded their cause with धृतराष्ट्र and reported his designs to कृष्ण and राम; <F>3:  Ib. X. ४८. ३२-25; ४९. 2, १९ and ३१.</F> praised the heroic exploits of कृष्ण; <F>4:  Ib. IX. २४. ६३; वा. ७७. ४८.</F> कृष्ण who heard them burnt down, performed obsequies to. <F>5:  Ib. ९६. ६३.</F>
--a तीर्थम् on the नर्मदा. M. १९१. ६१-2.

(I)--a राजऋषि: one of the three sons of Vicitra- वीर्य; (कृष्णद्वैपायन--वा। प्।) born to व्यास; married two wives, Kunti alias प्र्था, sister of Vasudeva and माद्रि; father of the five पाण्डवस्, who were born to Kunti by favour of Gods, himself being prevented by a curse from having sexual intercourse; on his death पृथा with the young children underwent a lot of difficulties. भा. I. 4. 7; IX. २२. २५, २७; २४. ३६; I. 9. १३. M. ४६. 8; ५०. ४७-9; वा. ९६. १५०; ९९. २४२-3; ११२. ४५; Vi. IV. १४. ३४; २०. ३८-42.
(II)--an आर्षेय Pravara (आन्गीरस्). M. १९६. 9.
(III)--a son of विधात and आयती; married पुण्डरीका and had a son द्युतिमान्. वा. २८. 5, ३५. [पगे२-311+ २७]
--in the पिण्डारकतत noted for श्राद्ध offerings. Br. III. १३. ३७.
--the earth in the second talam. Br. II. २०. १४, २५.
--a Mt. in the भारतवर्ष; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. २१; वा. ४५. ९१.</F> residence of the वीद्याधरस्. <F>2:  Ib. ३९. ६०.</F>
--a नाग having his city in the third talam. Br. II. २०. २९; वा. ५०. २८.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २२.
--a तीर्थ in the पञ्चवनम्. वा. ७७. ९९.
--on the slope of the हिमालयस्; sporting ground of Skanda. वा. ४१. ४२; ११२. ४४.
(I)--a son of आन्दिर and chief of the पाण्ड्य- देश. Br. III. ७४. 6; M. ४८. 5.
(II)--one of the four sons of जनापीड; his state, पाण्ड्यदेश. वा. ९९. 6.
--a राजऋषि who attained heaven by तपस्। Br. II. ३०. ४०.
--to kill one to advance one's own interest is sin; but not so, if done for the sake of many. वा. ६२. १६१-2.
--the Asuras whom कार्तवीर्य defeated by crossing the ocean; seeing him the great Uragas stood dumb-founded like the plantain stem tossed about by the winds. वा. ९४. ३०-4.

--(Sutalam): the nether-world where live the Lords of नागलोक with their hoods of jewels; at the bottom of this region lives शेष; <F>1:  भा. II. 1. २६; 5. ४१; V. २४. 7 and ३१; २५. 1; M. १५४. १९७; १६३. ९१; २४९. १६; वा. ४९. १६४; ९७. १८; ९८. ८० and ८६; १००. १५७; Vi. II. 5. १३; VI. 8. ४८.</F> of golden colour, residence of Bali having been given by वामन as also of Mucukunda, Daityas and Asuras; women of; <F>2:  Br. II. १९. १७२; २०. १३-15; ४२. 5; III. ३६. 4; ५३. ११; ५४. १२; ६९. ३०; IV. 1. १५३; ३८. ३५. M. ४३. ३३; २४६. ६९; वा. ५०. १२; ४१ ff.</F> sacred to परमेश्वरी; <F>3:  M. १३. ३९.</F> when शुक्र wanted to go to the camp of the Devas the Asuras threatened to leave for P.; <F>4:  Ib. ४७. ६८. Vi. I. 9. १११. IV. 4. १९.</F> of seven regions below the earth; <F>5:  Vi. II. 5. 1-१२; IV. 4. १९; V. 1. ७२;</F> destroyed by Rudra's flame in the dissolution. <F>6:  Vi. VI. 3. २४-5.</F>
--abode of शेष. वा. ५०. ४५.
--a Mt. of the भारतवर्ष. वा. ४५. ९१.
--a kind of fish used in the श्राद्धस्. M. १५. ३४. [पगे२-313+ ३३]

--(वृक्षोत्सव): dedication of trees and shrubs; same as तडागविधि; further oblations to Loka- पालस् and Vanaspati, decoration of trees with golden fruits, etc., to be given away to Brahmanas at the end; a festival in honour of trees and plants; lasts four days; he who does it attains heaven and is rarely returned to earth. <F>1:  M. ५९. 1-१८.</F> If trees laugh or weep or flower in a wrong season they should be propitiated. <F>2:  Ib. ch. २३२ (whole)</F>
--the time of the night, calculated from the moment of the moon. वा. ६६. ४५.
--sandals to be given in वृक्षोत्सवम्; to be given as gift along with light, umbrella, seat, etc. M. ५९. १४; ७०. ४८; २७५. २५.
--a name of ब्रह्मा. भा. I. १८. १९.
--succeeds ब्राह्म kalpa, then the lotus comes out of Hari's navel. भा. II. १०. ४७; III. ११. ३५; Vi. I. 3. २७-8.

--(पाद्मम्): one of the १८ Pura1n2as and comprising ५५००० s4lokas; <F>1:  भा. XII. 7. २३; १३. 4; वा. १०४. 9. Vi. III. 6. २१.</F> he who copies and presents it with a golden lotus in the month of ज्येष्ठ (आडि) attains the fruit of an अश्वमेध sacrifice; <F>2:  M. ५३. १४-15.</F> contains a description of Narasimha in १८००० slokas; <F>3:  Ib. ५३. ६०.</F> to be read every parva. <F>4:  Ib. २९०. १७.</F>
--the region of अधर्म and of Kali; drinking liquor by a king is to be avoided. <F>2:  M. २२०. 8.</F> ^1 भा. I. १७. ३८.
--the hamlet next in rank above kheta Br. II. 7. ११०.
--a R. of the शाल्मलिद्वीप. वा. ४९. ४२.
--a pupil of बाष्कलि. Br. II. ३५. 6.
--a son of Brahmadhana. वा. ६९. १३२.

--kinds of sins; निर्यासम् (drinking of the milk of trees) Kalamjam (taking opium), Kalingam, गृम्य्जनम् (eating garlic), छत्राकम् (eating of mushroom?), महा- कोशातकी, Mallika (dealing in jasmine), use of the nut of the tree कतकम्, and Umbaram (felling of fig trees), Kaya- kam? वार्ताकम् (eating brinjal), taking of pot-herbs, of बिम्बि fruits, of लम्बिक, misappropriation of public funds (पुरग्रामन्ग), misuse of the special वैश्य funds, resi- dence in a कुग्राम, profession of a physician, trafficing in women, living by arms, sale of oily foods, eating food from cowherds, <F>1:  Br. IV. 8. ४१-49.</F> and eating without guest; <F>2:  Ib. IV. 2. १६१; Vi. II. 6. 6-२९.</F> brahmicide and teach- ing of Vedas for money; <F>3:  Br. III. १४. ४३; १५. ४८.</F> threefold, arising from speech, mind and body. <F>4:  वा. १८. 2.</F>
--the customs of barbarians; Asura विशुक्र spoke of Deva's आचारस्. Br. IV. २१. ३२. [पगे२-315+ ३२]
--a clan of पिशाचस् having hands above, as also hairs, and throwing out dust from their body. Br. III. 7. ३७९, ३८३, ३९. वा. ६९. २७२.
--a class of पिशाचस्. Br. III. 7. ३७९.
(I)--a son of रुचिराश्व and father of नीप and पृथुसेन. भा. IX. २१. २४-25.
(II)--one of the three sons of Samara M. ४९. ५४; वा. ९९. १७७; Vi. IV. १९. ४१.
(III)--a son of पृथुषेण, and father of नील Va1. ९९. १७४; Vi. IV. १९. ३७-8.
--Gods of the ninth Manvantara. भा. VIII. १९. १९. Vi. III. 2. २१.
--त्रयार्षेयष्: no marriage alliances with पौर्णमास and Agastya. M. २०२. 4.

(II)--a kingdom of the east watered by the Ganges; <F>1:  Br. II. १८. ५०; M. १२१. ४५; १४४. ५७.</F> noted for horses; <F>2:  Br. II. ३१. ८३; III. ४८. २६, २९.</F> defeated by Sagara; <F>3:  Ib. III. ७३. १०८; IV. १६. १६; Vi. IV. 3. ४२.</F> attacked by बाहु; <F>4:  Br. III. ६३. १२०.</F> punished with shaving of hairs <F>5:  Ib. III. ६३, १३४. १३९.</F> and allowed to have their beards; deprived of their क्षत्रिय rights of Vedic study and sacrifice; became Mlecchas. <F>6:  Vi. IV. 3. ४७-8.</F> [पगे२-316+ २५]
--Kauthuma: composed of six samhitas. वा. ६१. ४१.
--kings among the Mlecchas. M. ५०. ७५.
--the kingdom of. Vi. II. 3. १८.
--a R. from ऋष्यवान्. M. ११४. २४.

(I)--also परावतास्: a deva गण of Manu स्वारोचिष; १२ in number, Praceta, विश्वदेव, Samanja, Ajihma, Arimardana, आयुर्दान, महामना, दिव्यमान, Ajeya, यवीयम्, होता and Yajva; these are all वासिष्ठस् and drinkers of the soma juice. Br. II. ३६. 8, १४.
(II)--pigeons born of गृध्री. M. 6. ३२.
--sacred to मता. M. १३. ४४.
--a disciple of भाष्कलि who gave him the third शाखा of the ऋग् Veda. Br. II. ३४. २७. वा. ६०. २६.
--a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५४.
--an आर्षेय Pravara. M. १९६. १०. [पगे२-317+ ३१]

(I)--a heavenly plant; सत्यभामा saw it in Indra's Nandana and asked कृष्ण to take it home; कृष्ण refused as it was once taken from the milk-ocean and by the consent of the gods given to Indra and to remove it was to face a war with him; still सत्यभामा persisted and कृष्ण yielding to her placed it on the गरुड; took it to the earth against Indra's will and placed it in सत्य्भामा's garden; the watchmen objected and reported to Indra; war about the पारिजात between the Gods and कृष्ण; a compromise to be returned after कृष्ण's decease; <F>1:  भा. III. १५. १९; IV. 6. १४; ३०. ३२; VIII. ११. १०; X. ३७. १६, ६८. ३५; ५९. ३९-40; [६५ (v) २१-36], [३७-51]; ६६ (v); [६७ (v) 1-१६, २६], [३४,] [४५,]; Ib. X. ६८. ३५. Vi. V. ३०. ३२, ८०; ३८. 7.</F> rejoiced by द्वारका ci{??}izens. <F>2:  Ib. V. ३१. 1-११; ३५. २५:</F> The tree in शिवलोक, that came out of the churn- ing of the ocean. <F>3:  Br. III. ३२. 6; IV. 9. ७०; वा. १०६. ७४; Vi. I. 9. ९५.</F>
(II)--a monkey chief and son of श्वेत. Br. III. 7. १८१ 236.
(III)--(परियत्र) a Mt. west of the शितोद. वा. ३६. २९; ४२. ५४.
--of Mahendra, in शीतान्त Mt.; descrip- tion of. वा. ३९. १०-26.
--a son of अहीनग. वा. ८८. २०४.
--the son of शुखीबल and father of Sunaya. Vi. IV. २१. १२. [पगे२-318+ २९]
--a territorial division of शाल्मलिद्वीप. भा. V. २०. 9.

(I)--Mt. a hill in भारतवर्ष and on the west of the Meru; a Kulaparvata; <F>1:  भा. V. १६. २७; १९. १६; Br. II. १६. १९. M. ११४. १८; १४८. 7-१०; वा. ४५. ८९; Vi. II. 2. ४३; 3. 3.</F> the place where तारक performed penance; <F>2:  M. १६२. 6; १६३, ८०.</F> gives rise to many rivers. <F>3:  वा. ४५. ९८.</F>
(II)--son of अनीह and father of Balasthala (Bala भा। प्।). भा. IX. १२. 2.
(III)--a monkey chief. Br. III. 7. २३३.
(IV)--the son of अहीनग and father of Dala. Br. III. ६३. २०४.
--the kingdom of. Vi. II. 3. १७.
--the son of रूरु and father of Devala. Vi. IV. 4. १०६.
--Arjuna; <F>1:  Br. III. ७१. १७८; M. ५०. ५६; २४६. ९३; Vi. V. १२. १९ etc.</F> married सुभद्रा and got by her Abhimanyu. <F>2:  वा. ९६. १७६; ९९. २४९.</F>
--is कृष्ण. Br. III. ३६. ३८.
(I)--an आर्षेय Pravara. M. १९६. 9. [पगे२-319+ ३०]
(II)--one of the three fires; it was so called when (1/4) of the night of ब्रह्मा was remaining. वा. ५३. 5-7.
--the shadow of the earth. वा. ५३. ६३.
--also Pavana; a kind of fire. Br. II. २४. 6.
--vow of kings to support all kinds of their people. M. २२६. 8.
--of कौशिक gotra. वा. ९१. ९८.

--done in Parvas without the invocation of deities; three fold; those eligible and those in- eligible to be fed on the occasion; of the eligibles the family and gotra must have been known; they must be well behaved and going in the path of virtue; friends and pre- ceptors, grandsons, sons-in-law, uncles and other relations, सोमयाजिन्स्, वैयाकरणस्, मीमाम्सकस्, सामग Brahma- चारिस् are eligible; the ineligibles include the unrighteous, the diseased, bastards, अश्वपालस्, the mad, the self-conceited, the deceitful, the hypocritical, temple priests, etc., also Mlecchas, Lingins, त्रिशङ्कुस्, Barbaras, द्राविडस्, etc. They must be informed a day previous to the श्राद्ध; other details; <F>1:  M. १६. 5-५१.</F> a dead person is entitled for share in the पार्वण after सपिण्डीकरणम्। <F>2:  Ib. १८. १६.</F>

(I)--उमा, wife of शिव, attained half body of शिव by virtue of the १०८ names of the देवी; <F>1:  M. १२. 9; १३. ५१ and ६०; ८५. 6; १८३. १४; १८७. ४४; वा. ५४. २०; १०८. ५१; ११२. ३५; Vi. V. ३२. ११-15.</F> (अम्बा), the family deity of the Vidarbhas; present when शिव gave his missile to Arjuna; <F>2:  भा. I. १५. १२; X. ५२. ४२.</F> conceived true love even as a girl; <F>3:  Ib. X. ६०. ४७.</F> went with शिव to have a look at the मोहिनी form of विष्णु; <F>4:  Ib. VIII. १२. 2 and २५.</F> once when she was sitting unclad on the lap of शिव there came some sages to see the Lord; ashamed she got herself clothed; to please her शिव said that any male who entered that place thereafter would become a female; <F>5:  Ib. IX. 1. २९-32.</F> presented पृथु with a sword शतचन्द्र; <F>6:  Ib. IV. १५. १७; VI. १७. ११-12.</F> prayed to by रुक्मिनी to get कृष्ण for her husband; to her shrine रुक्मिनी went by foot and offered worship for the hand of कृष्ण; <F>7:  Ib. X. ५३. २५, ३९-40 and ४४-49.</F> वृक's aim to take her after killing शिव; <F>8:  Ib. X. ८८. २३.</F> prevented the enraged शिव from killing भृगु; <F>9:  Ib. X. ८९. 7.</F> saw मार्कण्डेय engaged in तपस्। <F>१०:  Ib. XII. १०. 3 and ३५.</F> A शक्ति; <F>११:  Br. II. २५. २३; III. ४१. ३८, ५०; ४२. 7, १७; ४४. २८; IV. 6. 8, ३०, ३८; १०. ४१, ४२.</F>felt for विनायक losing his teeth through परशुराम and appealed to शिव who remembered कृष्ण. The latter came with राधा and consoled her by addressing on गणेश's greatness.
(II)--a name of the R. नन्दा. वा. ४९. ९२.
(III)--(अलिअस् विजया); wife of सहादेव and mother of Suhotra. भा. IX. २२. ३१.
--is शिव. Br. IV. १०. २९.
--applied by Maya who noticed the showers of snow and waters by moon and वरुण in the तारकामय; warded off by गदाधर; to the solace of all devas. M. १७६. २५, ३४.
--a tribe; enlisted by जरासन्ध against the Yadus. भा. X. [५० (v) 4]. वा. ५८. ८१.
--a son of सारण. वा. ९६. १६४.
--a son of बलराम. Br. III. ७१. १६६.
(I)--a son of बलराम. Br. III. ७१. १६६.
(II)--a son of सारण. वा. ९६. १६४.
--शिवगणस् with awkward forms; fought with तारक and माय in the battle of Tripuram. M. १३५. ५१, ७३.

--the neighbour in the rear of the king's enemy; attacking him gives a good occasion to the king to start aggression; a king whose rear is not clear is not to engage in an aggressive expedition; <F>1:  M. २४०. 2, 4;</F> शिव was to बृहस्पति during the तारका war; <F>2:  Br. III. ६५. ३२.</F> विशन्ग in भण्ड's war; <F>3:  Ib. IV. २५. १४.</F> उशन acted to Soma, as in the तारकामय war. <F>4:  Vi. IV. 6. १२.</F> [पगे२-322+ ३१]
(I)--the son of पृअद्योत and father of विशाख- yupa. भा. XII. 1. 3.
(II)--a son of बालक, ruled for २८ years (२४ वा। प्।). Br. III. ७४. १२५; M. २७२. 3. वा. ९९. ३१२.
--Mt. where there is a place of pilgrimage known as कुमार Kos4ala. वा. ७७. ३७.
--Mt. the hill with सम्पारक तीर्थ। Br. III. १३. ३७.
--the vessel of पलाश wood used by the trees for milking the cow-earth. M. १०. २७.
--a son of पृथु. वा. ६३. २२.

(I)--(Agni) a son of स्वाहा; <F>1:  भा. IV. I. ६०; Br. III. 8. 5; वा. ५३. ९७, ३०; Vi. I. 9, ६३; १०. १५.</F> as husband of गन्गा; <F>2:  वा. 2. १७.</F> Lord of Vasus; <F>3:  Ib. ७०. 5; Vi. I. २२. 3.</F> also known as Vaidyuta. <F>4:  Br. I. 2. १७; II. १२ 2 and ३३.</F>
(II)--a son of विजिताश्व and an Agni in pre- vious birth born thus through वसिष्ठ's curse. भा. IV. २४. 4. [पगे२-323+ २५]
(III)--an elephant. Br. III. 7. ३३२; वा. ६९. २१६.
(I)--a son of कृष्ण and मित्रविन्दा. भा. X. ६१. १६.
(II)--a son of द्युतिमान् and king of पावन des4a. Br. II. १४. २२, २५.
--a Mt. of the क्रौञ्चद्वीप. M. १२२. ८१. ८५.
--नन्दा, one of the three branches of the गन्गा going to the east; <F>1:  Br. II. १२. १६; १८. ४०, ५६-7; M. १२१. ४०; १२२. ३१; वा. ४७. ३८ and ५३.</F> wife of हव्यवाहन. <F>2:  Ib. २९. १४.</F>
--a son of स्वाहा. Br. II. १२. 2.
--the मन्त्र of the ऋग् Vedins, to be recited in tank ritual relating to the digging of tanks. M. ५८. ३४.
--a R. from the पारियात्र. Br. II. १६. २८. [पगे२-324+ ३६]
--a R. from शुक्तिमन्त. M. ११४. ३२.
(II)--a तीर्थ on the पार्वतीका, sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ५६.

--the earliest form of yoga established; even Gods like Indra practised this and got wealth consti- tuting अणिमा, महिमा, लघिमा, प्राप्ति, गरिमा, प्राकानुजम्, ईशित्वम्, वाशित्वम्, and अमरत्वम्; <F>1:  Br. II. २७. ११६, १२८; वा. 1. १९५.</F> one who practises it at Benares is rid of the cycle of births and deaths. <F>2:  M. १८२. १२.</F>
--ordained for all आश्रमस्. वा. ३०. २९५.
--followers of the पाशुपत yogam. Br. III. ३२. 5.
--cattle raising and tending not in पुष्क- द्वीप; <F>1:  Br. II. १९. १२१; वा. ४९. ११७.</F> duty of the वैश्यस्. <F>2:  Br. II. 7. १६२; Vi. III. 8. ३०.</F>

--heretics in Kali; <F>1:  Br. IV. ३३. ६०; M. ९९. १४; १४४. ४०; Vi. III. १८. २२.</F> came out of the देवाशुर war--Nirgranthas, कार्पटस् and Nagnas; <F>2:  वा. ७८. ३०.</F> not fit for ritual purposes; <F>3:  M. ५७. 6; ६९. ३४; Vi. III. १८. ७०-103; VI. 1. ३७ etc.</F> one connected with temple worship must not be a member of the पाषण्ड family; <F>4:  M. २६५. 3.</F> their deities not to be honoured; <F>5:  Ib. २६७. ३४.</F> quelled by Pramati, God incarnate; <F>6:  Ib. १४४. ५४.</F> put down [पगे२-325+ २८] by Kalki; <F>7:  Ib. ४७. २४९; २७३. २७.</F> sell Vedas and तीर्थस्; <F>8:  वा. ५८. ४०, ५२, ६५.</F> should be given up by a तीर्थयात्रि. <F>9:  Ib. ९९. ३९६; १०५. ४२.</F>
(I)--a मध्यमाध्वर्यु. Br. II. ३३. १६.
(II)--Tripravara. M. १९६. ३३.
(I)--one of the eleven Rudras. M. १५३. १९; १७१. ३९.
(II)--a door-keeper of the Sun God. M. २६१. 5.
(III)--a Mt. west of the शितोद. वा. ३६. २७.

(I)--an aged prostitute of the Videha city; her story as narrated by अवधूत to Yadu is as follows; she spent her life as a public woman living by earning money every day from one paramour or other; one night she did not get a paramour though she waited to the middle of the night; she then grew disgusted with her life and turned her thought on Hari which resulted in her restful sleep; <F>1:  भा. XI. 8. २२-44.</F> her view of life cited by the Gopis to Uddhava. <F>2:  Ib. X. ४७. ४७.</F>
(II)--an elephant (नाग). Br. III. 7. ३४६. [पगे२-326+ २५]
(III)--a शक्ति of श्रि Ma1rutesvara. Br. IV. ३३. ७०.
(IV)--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २३.

(V)--gave birth to महापद्म and ऊर्मि- मालि; husband, candra or moon; these families were fond of elephant fighting; some of them were used in the war between the Devas and Asuras. वा. ६९. २२९ and २३१.
--a follower of शिव. Br. III. ४१. २७.
--a तीर्थम् of the नर्मदा; good to give away a cow or to die there. M. १९१. ३२-36.
--a Goddess enshrined at पयोष्णी. M. १३. ४४.
(I)--a यक्ष; a son of पुण्यजनी and मणि- bhadra. Br. III. 7. १२३.
(II)--a son of लान्गली, an अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. २००.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. ११.
--a काद्रवेय na1ga. Br. III. 7. ३३. [पगे२-327+ ३८]
--a mother Goddess. M. १७९. ३२.

--a ceremonial of the श्राद्ध; the mode of offering three to पितृस्, पितामहस् and प्रपितामहस् with the respective मन्त्रस् to be uttered at that time; <F>1:  Br. III. ११. १९. ५८, ९७; वा. ७४. १७; ७५. ४१; ७६. ३१-5; Vi. III. १५. ३४.</F> पिण्डम् may also be offered to fire, cows, crows, fowls, with their respective effects to the giver. <F>2:  वा. १२०. ३१-41.</F>

--rice balls given on ceremonial occasions to पितृस्: three to be given; like the calf in search of the cow lost in the stall, मन्त्र takes them to the पितृस्; to be given in the name of the gotra of the person; <F>1:  Br. III. २०. १०-16.</F> can be given to cows, Brahmanas, females, crows, hen or thrown into fire or water; the middle पिण्ड can be eaten by the wife which leads to increase of सन्तानम्; <F>2:  M. १६. २१, ३५, ५३-54; वा. ७१. १०; ७५. २५, ३६.</F> पिण्डदानम् on the १२थ् day after death is supposed to be the पाथेयम् or food for the way to heaven; <F>3:  M. १७. ४६. ५५.</F> seven पिण्डस् for seven generations; <F>4:  Ib. १८. 5 and २९.</F> giving of, in the तीर्थस् of the नर्मदा; <F>5:  Ib. १८६. १५. ३९; २३९. ३४.</F> at गया with tila. <F>6:  वा. १०५, १२, ३३; १०८. १५, २१; ११०. २३-59.</F>
(I)--a son of Vasudeva and रोहिणी. Br. III. ७१. १६५; M. ४६. १२; वा. ९६. १६३.

(II)--a तीर्थ sacred to धृति; <F>1:  M. १३. ४८.</F> sacred to पितृस्; <F>2:  Ib. २२. ६९.</F> Here the sages cursed the extinction of the Yadu family, when the यादव youths played a joke on them by dressing up साम्ब as a woman and asking them to say what child he would bring forth. <F>3:  Vi. V. ३७. 6-१०.</F> [पगे२-328+ ३६]

--city of: its sages visited द्वारका; <F>1:  भा. X. ९०. २८[3].</F> the sages who knew of कृष्ण's advent to वैकुण्ठ left for this place; <F>2:  Ib. XI. 1. ११.</F> noted for पाण्डुकूपतीर्थ. <F>3:  Br. III. १३. ३७.</F>
--of an image, to be purified with पञ्चगव्य. M. २६६. 6.
--the fruit of ingudi tree offered with ghee as पिण्ड (see रामा. Ayo. १०२. २९: १०५. ३५). वा. १६. १४.
--a son of ब्रह्मधान. वा. ६९. १३२.
--the portion of the body, a man gets from his father; this part of Vena's body yielded पृथु, a virtuous King armed with bow, arrow, mace, shield and armour. M. १०. 8-9.

(I)--a class of celestials belonging to the group of sacred fires; <F>1:  भा. I. 2. २७; IV. 1. ६३; वा. ६५. ४९-52.</F> worshipped for continuity of family line; <F>2:  भा. II. 3. 8; वा. ७५. 7-३५; ८१. 8-२०.</F> married jointly a daughter of दक्ष, <F>3:  भा. IV. 1. ४९.</F> blessed ज्यामघ with a son; <F>4:  Ib. IX. २३. ३९.</F> drink the स्वधा of the moon and worship him on the new moon day: groups of--Saumya, काव्य, अग्निष्- वात्त and बार्हिषद; <F>5:  Br. II. २३. ३९, ५८, ७१; १३. 6, ३१; 8. १४-15.</F> their role in the universe. <F>6:  वा. ७१. १५-34, ४५-67.</F>
(II)--sons of Angiras and स्वधा. भा. VI. 6. १९; १०. १७. [पगे२-329+ ४०]

(III)--पूर्वदेवतस्; are of three categories; पितृस्, पितामहस् and प्रपितामहस् of the forms of Vasus, ऋउद्रस् and आदित्यस् according to sacred tradition; <F>1:  M. १७. ३६; १९. 3.</F> milked the cow-earth in a silver vessel; Antaka acted as milk-man and Yama, the calf; the essence was स्वधा; <F>1:  Ib. १०. १८-19.</F> Yama king of their loka. <F>3:  Ib. ११. २०.</F>

(IV)--general account of; <F>1:  वा. ch. ५६.</F> created out of the सत्व element and their active time was सन्ध्या: married स्वधा: drink the last कला of the moon: of three classes-- Saumyas, बर्हिषदस् and अग्निष्वात्तस्; <F>2:  वा. ५६. 8; Vi. I. 5. ३५-6; 7. २७; II. १२. and १३.</F> from विष्णु; <F>3:  Ib. V. 1. १७.</F> their relations with gods and sages. <F>4:  वा. ६२. २१.</F>
--same as कुहू; the ३०थ् and last Kalpa. M. २९०. ११.
--more important than देवकार्यम्. वा. ७३. ५५-73.
--a son of अर्काग्नि. वा. २९. ४०.

--seven, in heaven, three without form and four with form; the formless are वैराजस्; their mind-born daughter is the wife of हिमवान् whose sons are क्रौञ्च and मैनाक; <F>1:  M. १३. 1-7; १५. ४२; वा. ७२. 1-5.</F> two classes of Devas and Laukikas; to them one full day is equal to our one month, our dark half being their day and bright half their night; our १०० years their 3 years; <F>2:  M. १३२. 3; १४१. ५७, ६०; १४२. 6-8.</F> the places prescribed for स्राद्ध offerings are said to be fire, the hand of a Brahmana, water, cattle-shed, and ears of goat or horse; always southern direction preferred; <F>3:  Ib. १५. ३२-33.</F> to be worshipped in house building. <F>4:  Ib. २५३. २५.</F> [पगे२-330+ ३०]
--fit to be remembered on the days of ceremony. M. २०४. 3-१८.
--ceremonial for पितृस् whose overlord is Yama; list of offerings particularly pleasing to the पितृस्. M. 1. १७; 8. 5; १५. ३४-5.
--one of the four forms of marriage; this is the wedded wife. Br. IV. १५. 4.
--thirty months of human reckoning; sam- vatsara is ३६० months of human reckoning; वर्षाणि=three or four months of पितृस् equal to १०० years of human reckon- ing. वा. ५७. 9.
--an afternoon मुहूर्त। Br. III. 3. ३९.
