--done chiefly in the dark half of the month (इन्दुक्षय). M. १६. २१; १७. 4.

--north of Agastya and south of अजवीथि and outside वैश्वानरपथ; <F>1:  Br. II. २१. १५९; ३५. १११; M. १२४. ९७; वा. ५०. २०८; ६१. १००; Vi. II. 8. ८५-7.</F> residence of Agnihotrins, Vedic Karmins and पितृस्; attained through इड passage (on the left side of the body) <F>2:  भा. II. 2. २४.</F> in all four doors with a common door- way in candra or moon. <F>3:  वा. 8. १९८.</F>

--reached by the southern part of Aryaman; <F>1:  भा. III. ३२. २०; V. 2. 1-2 and २२.</F> आग्नीध्र wanted to attain this; <F>2:  M. १९४. 7.</F>a bath in the Manoharam तीर्थम् of the नर्मदा leads one to.

--one of the seven sons of कौशिक; suggested that the cow of their guru be offered in a स्राद्ध and then shared by his brothers; accordingly two of the brothers were made Devas, three पितृस् and one अतिथि in the स्राद्ध; cakra- वाक in मानस became desirous of being a king, seeing the पाञ्चाल King in a pleasure garden; became son of विभ्राज by name Brahmadatta and his wife Sanniti was the cow of Garga offered in श्राद्ध, born as a daughter of Devala. M. २०. 3-२६.
--performed in honour of पितृस् and includes gifts of milch cows; the performer becomes a राजराज. M. १०१. २९-30.

--once the whole world was covered with darkness; there were no air, no earth, no planets, no direc- tions, no sun, no moon, no days or nights; the single ब्रह्मा out of tapoyoga created worlds of Vedas and other devas; there were seven classes of which three had no form and four had forms: Devas and earth and rains; then श्राद्धस्. वा. ७१. ३७, ५७ and ६५.
--आकाश and southern directions. वा. ७६. ३४.
--the southern entrance of the city of पुरञ्जन who reached दक्षिणपाञ्चाल through it with श्रुतधर; allegorically the right ear. भा. IV. २५. ५०; २९. १२. [पगे२-332+ २७]
--a Janapada of the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. १५.
--the category of bile; the place in the body round the region of the navel in the bowels; Pitta is agni and शोणितम् belongs to this category. Br. III. ७२. ४७f. वा. ९७. ४८.
--an asura in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु. M. १६१. ८०.
--the bow of शिव; hence शिव is पिनाकि. वा. २५. 2; ५४. १०८; १०१. ३१७.

--one of the eleven Rudras; an epithet of महेश्वर; <F>1:  M. 5. ३०; 6. १३; १२. 8; २३. ३६, ४१; ९५. ३८; १५४. ११८, १९४, ३९५, ४१०.</F> married सती; has the bull for the riding animal and is the guardian deity for the N. E. <F>2:  Ib. ६०. ११; ६७. १६.</F>

--the love quarrels between two ants, husband and wife, the husband having given pieces of मोदक to some other she ant, the wife ant resented, the husband repented and promised to behave better in future; <F>1:  M. २०. ३९.</F> march- ing north they forebode evil. <F>2:  Ib. २३८. 7.</F>
--a son of Mitra and रेवती. भा. VI. १८. 6. [पगे२-333+ २७]
--a R. of the भारतवर्ष from the ऋक्ष hill. Br. II. १६. ३०. वा. ४५. १००.

(I)--a pupil of देवदर्श; the sage who communicated the अङ्गारव्रतम् to युधिष्ठिर, narrating an old सम्वाद between शुक्र and Virocana; <F>2:  M. ७२. 1, 5-6, ४५.</F> came to see परीक्षित् practising प्रायोपवेश; knew the Yoga power of विष्णु. <F>3:  भा I. १९. १०; II. 7. ४५:</F> ^1 Br. II. ३५. ५७; Vi. III. 6. १०.
(II)--a disciple of वेदस्पर्श. वा. ६१. ५१.
--a son of र्षभ, a sage and a भागवत; called the attention of Nimi to नारायण as Brahman. भा. V. 4. ११; XI. 2. २१; 3. ३५-40.
--a pupil of वेदादर्श. भा. XII. 7. 2.
--a Pravara sage. M. १९९. १५.
--a तिर्थम् on the नर्मदा. M. १९०. १३-4.
--the son of Lambodara and father of Meghas- वाति. Vi. IV. २४. ४५.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १३. [पगे२-334+ २९]
--an आर्षेय Pravara (भार्गवस्)। M. १९५. ३७.
(I)--a यक्ष; a son of Devajani. Br. III. 7. १२८.
(II)--a Mt. to the south-west of the कैलास Mountain. वा. ४७. 9.
--from the ऐकार; of the ash colour. वा. २६. ४४.
--the colour of the ११थ् Manu. वा. २६. ४३.
--the son of मणिवर. वा. ६९. १५९.
--a son of जाम्बवान्. Br. III. 7. ३०३.

--a kind of semi-divine beings governed by शिव; <F>1:  Br. II. ३२. 1-2; ३५, १९१; M. 8. 5; वा. 9. ५५; ३०. ९०; ३१. १२.</F> three steps inferior to the राक्षसस्; <F>2:  Br. III. 3. ९७; 7. १६८.</F> born of कपिश; descend- ents of क्रोधवशा; sixteen kinds of, two distinguished among them; their forms and features, harassing children; seeing their awkward forms the creator blessed them with the powers of assuming any form and hiding themselves, moving about at both the sandhya times, frequenting deserted houses and waters, men devoid of आचार and सम्स्कार, royal roads, termini of roads, doors and doorways, trees on roads; deities for those professionalists who earn their livelihood by unrighteous means; bali offerings at the termini of the पर्वस् to them with liquor, flesh, sesamum, incense, black cloth, [पगे२-335+ ३३] etc.; <F>3:  Ib. III. 7. ३७६-411: 8. ७१; भा. I. १५. ४३; II. 6. ४३; १०. ३८; VI. 8. २५; X. 6. २७; ४५. २३; ६३. ११; ८५. ४१.</F> ruin the श्राद्ध, <F>4:  Br. III. ११. ८१.</F> vanquished by रावण; <F>5:  Ib. III. 7. २५६.</F> people in Kali look like them; <F>6:  भा. XII. 3. ४०.</F> create trouble to disputants in religion. <F>7:  वा. ६६. ११८.</F>
--a Mt. south of the मानस; <F>1:  वा. ३६. २४.</F> abode of Kubera. <F>2:  Ib. ३९. ५७; ४२. ३१.</F>

--sixteen in number; ब्रह्मा took pity on them and granted them a boon--to be invisible to men and to be able to take desirable forms; to wander at will at nightfall, to resort to deserted places and those frequented by few men, unclean residences, etc., royal roads, highways, doors, bolts, तीर्थस्, rivers, caitya trees, residences of अजीवस्, of mixed castes, artisans, the dishonest and ungrateful; money earned unworthily; here they live, to get rid of them bali is to be offered on the Parvas with honey, flesh, curds, तिल, wine, black cloths, incense, etc. वा. ६९. २६२-64, २८६-88; १००. १५९; १०१. २८.
--a R. of the भारतवर्ष, from the ऋक्ष hill. Br. II. १६. ३०. वा. ४५. १००.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १६.
--aerial beings with hands and feet on the back; live on the blood, shed in the field of battle. वा. ६९. २७८.
--one of the seven sons of कौशिक. M. २०. 3. [पगे२-336+ ३०]
--the commander of Mura's forces; killed by कृष्ण. भा. X. ५९. १२-14.

--a pedestal (base) on which the image is installed; here must be provided a प्रणालक to let water flow; ten kinds of पीठिकस् distinguished; श्थण्डित, वापी, यक्षी, वेदी, मण्डला, पूर्णचन्द्रा, वज्रा, पद्मा, Ardha- शासी, and त्रिकोण, <F>1:  M. २६२. 1-7.</F> these may be made of stone, earth, or wood according to the Linga. <F>2:  Ib. २६२. १९-20; २६९. 8.</F>
--a son of खश and a राक्षस. Br. III. 7. १३५.
--the earth of the fourth talam; atalam. Br. II. २०. १४.

--the ३१स्त् Kalpa; ब्रह्मा attained पीत colour; a son of that colour came out of his contemplation; even the यज्ञोपवीत was of that colour; from his medita- tion of महेश्वरी, ब्रह्मा saw गाअन्द् Viru1pa dropping out of the mouth of महेश्वर with four feet, four faces, four hands, four breasts, four eyes, etc. She was रुद्राणि sur- rounded by sons who lived for १००० years for the welfare of the Brahmanas and attained Rudrahood. वा. २३. 1-२१.
--the वैश्य caste of शाल्मलिद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ३०.
--yellow cloth worn by Budha at birth. M. २४. 1; वा. १०४. ४७.
--a son of Manasyu. M. ४९. 2. [पगे२-337+ २८]
--a R. from र्ष्यवान्. M. ११४. २५.
(I)--A वासिष्ठ and one of the seven sages of तामस Manu. Br. II. ३६. ४८; Vi. III. 1. १८.
(II)--a son of द्युतिमान्; after his name a Jana- pada पीवरम् in the क्रौञ्चद्वीप Va1. ३३. २१, २२; Vi. II. 4. ४८.
--a region of क्रौञ्चद्वीप (also पावन). Br. II. १९. ७२.
(I)--a daughter of Pulaha and क्षमा. Br. II. ११. ३१; वा. २८. २६.
(II)--the mind-born daughter of अग्निष्वात्त- पितृस्; becomes the wife of शुक in the २८थ् dva1para. Br. III. १०. ७७-78.

(III)--a mind-born daughter of बर्हिषद् manes who performed severe austerities and earned the title of योगमाता. The Lord blessed her to be the wife of शुक, the son of व्यास and after giving birth to four sons and a daughter she would attain salvation; <F>1:  M. १५. 5-११.</F> wife of शुक. <F>2:  Br. III. 8. ९३.</F>
(IV)--the wife of वेदशिरस्; <F>1:  वा. २८. 6.</F> sons, मार्कण्- डेयस्. <F>2:  Br. II. ११. 8.</F>
(V)--a R. of the केतुमाला country. वा. ४४. २२. [पगे२-338+ २६]
(VI)--the mind-born daughter of पितृ Dharma- मूर्तिधरस्; becomes the wife of शुक and mother of कीर्ति- मती. वा. ७३. २६.

--a distinguished Apsaras engag- ed in playing with balls and presiding over the months of Madhu and माधव; was sent to disturb मार्कण्डेय's penance; but only in vain. भा. XII. 8. २६; ११. ३४; Br. II. २३. 4; III. 7. १४; IV. ३३. १९; वा. ५२. 4; ६९. ४९; Vi. II. १०. 5.
(I)--the son of Nabha and father of क्षे- madhanvan. भा. IX. १२. 1; Br. III. ६३. २०२; वा. ८८. २०२; Vi. IV. 4, १०६. M. १२. ५३.
(III)--an elephant born of Rathanthara. Br. III. 7. ३३५; वा. ६९. २१९.
(IV)--a sacred तीर्थ fit for श्राद्ध. Br. III. १३. ५६; वा. ७७. ५५.
(V)--the name of a याज्ञ or sacrifice. M. ५३. २७; वा. ७१. ७७.
--a तीर्थम्, sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ७७.
--Mt. a chief hill of क्रौञ्चद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ५१.
(I)--the eldest daughter of वसिष्ठ and ऊर्जा; wife of प्राण (पाण्डु, son of विधात and आयती- वा। प्।) and mother of द्युतिमान्. Br. II. ११. 9, ४०; वा. २८. 7, ३४-5.
(II)--a R. from the lake पयोदा. Br. II. १८. ७०.
(IV)--an Apsaras. Br. III. 7. 8; वा. ६९. 7.
(V)--a R. rising on the western side of the Meru Mountain. वा. ४७. ६७.
--the brother of श्रीदेवी; <F>1:  Br. IV. ३९. ४८.</F> Lord of all sacrifices; <F>2:  M २३९. ३८.</F> an attribute of विष्णु. <F>3:  Vi. I. 9. ६८.</F>
(I)--a क्षेत्रज son of Bali, born of दीर्घ- tamas and Bali's wife; a बालेयक्षत्र. भा. IX. २३. 5; M. ४८. २५; वा. ९९. २८, ८५.
(II)--a pupil of याज्ञवल्क्य. Br. II. ३५. २९.
(III)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३७. [पगे२-340+ २६]
(IV)--a son of सुगन्धी and Vasudeva; became king. Br. II. ७१. १८६; वा. ९६. १८२.
(V)--a son of Vasudeva, became जरा, a hunter; <F>1:  M. ४६. २१-22.</F> became king. <F>2:  वा. ९६. १८२.</F>
--a commander of भण्ड to aid विषन्ग, killed by त्वरिता. Br. IV. २१. ७९; २५. २८, ९७.
--a city between हेमकूट and हिमालय which is snowfed; <F>1:  Br. II. २२. ५३; वा. ५१. ४८.</F> under देवरक्षित. <F>2:  Vi. IV. २४. ६४.</F>
--sacred to पाटला. M. १३. ३५.
--a R. of the कुशद्वीप. M. १२२. ७३.
(I)--a tribe; a Janapada of the East. M. ११४. ४५.
(II) (च्)--an eastern country named after Bali's son, पुण्ड्र. Br. II. १६. ५४; III. ७३. १०९; ७४. ३३, ८७, १९७; IV. २९. १३१; Vi. II. 3. १६.

--(यक्षस्): sons and grandsons of पुण्य- जणी who married मणिभद्रा; <F>1:  वा. ६९. १५७; ८८. 1.</F> worshipped for protection. <F>2:  भा. II. 3. 8; Br. III. 7. १६२,</F> Sacked कुशष्ठली during the absence of Kakudmi in Brah- maloka. <F>3:  Ib. III. ६८. 1; Vi. IV. 2. 1.</F>
--the wife of मणिभद्र; gave birth to २४ sons, who in their turn gave birth to a number of sons and grandsons. Br. III. 7. १२१, १२६; वा. ६९. १५३.
--a son of वृषभ. M. ५०. २९.
--a name of युधिष्ठिर. भा. I. 8. ३२.
--a daughter of Kratu and Sannati and daughter- in-law of पर्वश. Br. II. ११. ३८; वा. २८. ३३.
--preliminary to religious obser- vances; (see ब्राह्मणवाचनम्). M. २७५. 3.
--a son of भद्राश्व. M. ४९. 6.

(I)--a R. aerial river, springing from the moon; circumambulates Meru and flows in four directions; one goes round the Mandara and the Caitraratha hills and enters the अरुणोद lake. वा. ४२. 3, 8, १५. [पगे२-342+ २५]
(II)--a R. of the केतुमाला. वा. ४४. १९.
(I)--one of the seven sons of वसिष्ठ Va1. २८. ३६.
(II)--a son of स्वायम्भुव Manu. वा. ३१. १८.
(III)--a son of Priyavrata given to yoga: had no inclination for ruling the kingdom. Vi. II. 1. 7-9.
--a son of Kuru. वा. ९९. २१८.
--a son of स्वर्भानु. वा. ९२. 2.
--another reading (पुरीकषेण): an Andhra king; ruled for २१ years. वा. ९९. ३५२.
--an Apsaras. वा. ६९. 5.

--a son-less father generally gives his daughter in marriage and takes a promise from the son- in-law that the son of them would be counted as his own. [पगे२-343+ २७] Though स्वायम्भुव Manu had a son, he adopted आकूति's son. भा. IV. 1. 2 and 5.
--the son-in-law by पुत्रिका; <F>1:  वा. ७९. ७८.</F> unfit for श्राद्ध. <F>2:  Br. III. १५. ५२.</F>
--a sacrifice performed by Diti when आपस्- tamba acted as priest; <F>1:  M. 7. ३३-34.</F> performed by Vaivasvata Manu who got Ila. <F>2:  Ib. ११. ४०.</F>
(I)--a नक्षत्र: Importance of श्राद्ध on. भा. V. २३. 6; वा. ६६. ४८; ८२. 4. Br. III. १८. 4.
(II)--a son of Daridyota. भा. IX. २४. २०-1.

(III)--the son of Abhijit; performed अश्व- medha for the birth of a son; born in the middle of the यज्ञ, अतिरात्र portion; he had twins आहुक and आहुकी. Br. III. ७१. ११९, वा. ९६. ११८. Vi. IV. १४. १४-5.
(IV)--a son of Nala. M. ४४. ६४-6.
--the २१स्त् Kalpa. M. २९०. 8.

(I)--a व्रत of a year's duration im- posed on दिती by कश्यप for the birth of a son capable of [पगे२-344+ २८] killing Indra; details of the व्रत are given; generally begun by a woman with the permission of her husband on the bright fortnight of मार्गशीर्ष; worship of लक्ष्मीनारायण with the हविस् शेष; १२ Ahu1tis made to Agni; this is to con- tinue for twelve months; on the last day of कार्तिकै she should keep fast; next day the husband offers twelve oblations according to the rule of पाकयज्ञ; Brahmanas to be fed and the remnant of the चरु to be offered to his wife; by this one is said to attain desired objects; it can be observed by an unmarried girl or married woman or mother for the sake of auspiciousness. भा. VI. १८. ४७-54; १९. 5-२८.
(II)--here वायु met अञ्जना who gave birth to हनुमान्. Br. III. 7. २२४.
--a class of women who came from the mouth of Asura Bala when he yawned भा. V. २४. १६.
--killed by शिव. M. ५५. १६.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८३.

(I)--a King of extensive learning, had a friend whose name and behaviour were not known; went in search of a suitable place for the realisation of various pleasures; this he found in a city of nine entrances resembling [पगे२-345+ ३८] भोगवती on the southern side of the हिमालयस्. By accident he met a charming lady protected by a serpent and followed by a number of ladies and men; moved by her charms he requested her to be his wife and she agreed; For a hundred years they continued to enjoy pleasures; पुरञ्जन used to visit the kingdoms, विभ्राजित, Saurabha, दक्षिण and Uttara पाञ्चालस्, ग्रामक, वैशस and others through the different entrances of the city guarded by the Superintendent; influenced by her charms he came com- pletely under her control; mad with desire for hunting, once he left his queen and went to the forest and after killing many a game, he returned home and desired to meet the queen whom he found lying on the bare ground in misery; he consoled her and once more yielded to her love and influence at the cost of his youth; he had ११०० sons and ११० daughters for whom he found worthy wives and suitable bridegrooms; he was then engaged in animal sacri- fices, when the followers of चण्डवेग, a Gandharva, attack- ed the city of पुरञ्जन and the Superintendent defended it single-handed for १०० years. This placed the citizens and the kinsmen in misery. A daughter of काल, once in the company of पूरु went to Bhaya, the Lord of the Yavanas to marry him; he adopted her as his sister; with her and his brother प्रज्वार he set out to wander in the world; in his tour the Yavanas attack- ed the city of पुरञ्जन; प्रज्वार burnt it down; पुरञ्- jana was seized and taken to the Yavana camp; the sacrificial animals tore him to pieces; was born as the daughter of Vidarbha राजसिम्ह; married by Malayadhvaja पाण्ड्य and gave birth to a daughter and seven sons, all kings of the द्राविड country. When the पाण्ड्य left for penance she went with him and served him; she wailed at his death; and when about to give up her own life, a Brahmana who called himself her friend consoled her by saying that he and she were once the two Hamsas of मानस and that she took to a household life and underwent all miseries; instructed thus she recollected her old status and remained calm; <F>1:  भा. IV. chh. २५-28 (whole).</F> an allegory [पगे२-346+ ३४] for जीव and परमात्मन्; पाञ्चालस् are the five senses while the nine entrances to the city refer to the nine द्वारस् of the body; sometimes the जीव is a male sometimes a female, and sometimes God, and sometimes man or beast in accordance with Karma. <F>2:  Ib. IV. २९. 2-9, २९.</F>
(II)--an Asura having his city in the third talam. Br. II. २०. २७.

--the wife of पुरञ्जन; a charming woman protected by a serpent with five hoods and followed by ten servants each in turn followed by a hundred; married पुरञ्- jana at his request and lived with him for years together; <F>1:  भा. IV. २५. २०-24, ४३-44.</F> felt annoyed at his going for hunting and was consoled by him on his return after which he completely surrendered himself to her; <F>2:  Ib. IV. २६. 4 and १३-26.</F> mother of ११०० sons and ११० daughters; <F>3:  Ib. IV. २७. 6-7.</F> allegorically she is the बुद्धि or intellect. <F>4:  Ib. IV. २९. 5.</F> (See पुरञ्जन).

(I)--alias इन्द्रवाह; also Kakustha: son of विकुक्षि father of Anenas; in a देवासुर war he became पार्ष्णिग्राह to the Devas when Indra assumed the form of a bull over which he rode and discomfited the Asuras by his भल्ल weapons; hence known as Kakustha; a राजऋषि. भा. IX. 6. १२-20; Vi. IV. 2. २०-32.

(II)--a King of the मागधस् including Pulindas Yadus and Madrakas among the castes; will establish anti-Brahmana subjects, will exterminate the क्षत्रियस् and rule from पद्मावती, the country along the गन्गा as far as प्रयागा. भा. XII. 1. ३६-37. [पगे२-347+ ३४]
(III)--the last of the बार्हद्रथ line; was killed by his minister शुनक who placed his own son on the throne. भा. XII. 1. 2-3.

(IV)--the son of सृञ्जय, (Sanjaya-म्। प्।) a hero equal to Indra, and whose glory was sung in heaven; <F>1:  Br. III. ७४. १४-15; M. ४८. १२; वा. ९९. १४.</F> father of Janamejaya. <F>2:  Vi. IV. १८. 4-5.</F>
(V)--a son of मेधावि. M. ५०. ८४.
(VI)--the son of सुशान्ति and father of ऋक्ष. Vi. IV. १९. ५७.
(VII)--the son of विन्ध्यशक्ति and father of Ramacandra. Vi. IV. २४. ५६.
(II)--Indra observed आदित्यशयनम्; <F>1:  M. ५५. ३२; १७८. ६५; २४६. ६९; २४८. १४.</F> one of the authors on architecture; <F>2:  Ib. २५२. 2.</F> the abode of. <F>3:  Ib. २७४. ७८.</F>
--a Northern tribe. M. ११४. ४०.

--city; began with पृथु; <F>1:  Br. II. ३६. १९७; III. ५०. 9; ५६. २४; ६३. १६५; ६९. ४०; IV. ३८. ४४; Vi. I. 6. १८-19; V. ३६. 6; वा. ३४. १०; ४८. 7.</F> its evacuation by the people for the woods during periods of anarchy. <F>2:  M. 6. १३, १०. ३२; ४७. २५७; १४३. 3.</F> [पगे२-348+ ४५]
--a son of Madhu and father of पुरुद्वान्. M. ४४. ४४.
--in शतशृङ्ग hill of the यक्षस्. वा. ३९. ५४.
--(ety.) one of the ten लक्षनस् of the ब्राह्मण. वा. ५९. १३७.
--a son of भण्ड. Br. IV. २६. ४९.
--on measurement of time. Br. II. २१. १३७.

--Persons well-versed in the पुराणस् speak of eight-fold characteristics of Karmayoga; <F>1:  Br. I. 2. ४५. वा. 1. ३०; 2. ४५; ७०. ७७; ८८. ६९; ९६. १३; ९९. ४१७; १०१. ७०. M. ४४. ५७; ५२. ११.</F> speak of the vow, आदित्यशयनम्; <F>2:  Ib. ५५. 3.</F> and the time between परीक्षित् and महापद्म is १०५० and that between महापद्म and आन्ध्रपुलोमा is ८३६. <F>3:  Ib. २७३. ३८.</F>
--the Supreme Being or विश्वात्मा, revealed the पुराणस्; <F>1:  M. ५३. 2; ६१.</F> is नारायण; <F>2:  वा. २१. ८१; २२. १३.</F> is कुमार. <F>3:  Ib. २२. १३.</F>

--originally one: १०० crores of verses reduced to four lakhs by व्यास; <F>1:  Br. I. 1. ३९-40, १७३; II. २१. 9, ३७; २८, ९६; ३५. ६३, ८८; III. १९. २३; ४२. ३१; M. 3. 3; ५३. 3-4, 9; वा. 1. ११, ६०; 9. ६९.</F> eighteen in number; ब्राह्म, पाद्म, वैष्नव, शैव, Linga, गारुद, स्कान्द, नारदीय, भागवत, आग्नेय, भविष्य, Brahmavaivartha, मार्कन्- deya, वामन, वाराह, मात्स्य, कूर्म and ब्रह्मान्ड; total content of these ४००,000 verses; <F>2:  M. ५३. ६४-72; वा. ९५. २२; १०४. 2, ११, ८५, १०८; Vi. III. 6. २०-25. भा. XII. 7. २२-4; १३. 9.</F> known to सूत; <F>3:  Ib. I. 1. 6; III. १२. ३९.</F> speak of places where Hari worship is offered; <F>4:  Ib. VII. १४. २९; X. ६९. २८.</F> the essence of the पुराणस् in the श्रुतिगीत; <F>5:  Ib. X. ८७. ४३.</F> Interpreters of the पुराणस्; <F>6:  Vi. V. २०. ४९.</F> of four पादस्; <F>7:  वा. १०. ७०; २१. 3; ३१. ३०; ३२. ६७, १०३. ४४-5.</F> [पगे२-349+ ३८] from ब्रह्मा to व्यास and then to सूत, <F>8:  Br. IV. 2. १९; 4. ४३-4, ५८-67.</F> पुराणकथस्, the first of all शास्त्रस् remembered by ब्रह्मा, and after- wards the Vedas issued from his faces <F>9:  M. 1. 5; 2. १३; १७. ३७; वा. ५६. 7; ६१. ५५, ७८; ८३. ५३; १००. ३३ ff.</F> originally one and १०० crore slokas; treatise on Trivarga, during the disaster of the world by fire God हयग्रीव saved the पुराणस् among other sciences; again as मत्स्यजनार्दन; in every द्वापर Vya1sa gives १८ versions of 4 lacs in verses, a summary ac- count of the original now preserved in heaven; the names of १८ as given by ब्रह्मा to मरीचि in olden days; <F>१०:  M. ५३. 3-१२ and १३.</F> five limbs: sarga, pratisarga, वम्श, manvantara and वम्श्यानु- carita; description of deities and gods, of caturvarga; to be divided into सात्विक where विष्णु is much extolled; राजस where ब्रह्मा is much extolled and तामस where Agni and शिव are much extolled; in others शरस्वती and पितृस् are given (सङ्कीर्ण); <F>११:  Ib. ५३. ६५-69.</F> hearing of; <F>१२:  Ib. ७५. 6; ९३. 3 and 7; २७४. ३८; २८०. १२.</F> भविष्य the most ancient of the पुराणस्; <F>१३:  Ib. ५८. 4, ५०; ६९. १८.</F> the पुराण version of वराह Avata1ra attributed to ब्रह्मा; <F>१४:  Ib. २४७. 1, 5.</F> the पुराण in general partakes the character of the epoch in which it is composed; <F>१५:  Ib. २९०. १५.</F> recital of, during स्राद्ध. <F>१६:  Ib. १७. ३७.</F>
--the ten characteristics of a पुराण; some speak of five characteristics only; the ten characteris- tics described. भा. XII. 7. 8-२१; Br. I. 1. ३८.
--eligible for पार्वण s4ra1ddha; also पुरा- णज्ञ, पुराणविद्. M. १६. 9; ४४. २२. ५७. 2; ६०. 1: २८९. 9. [पगे२-350+ ३४]

--a reference to the मत्स्यपुराण; superior to all the शास्त्रस्; a road to Dharma, Artha and काम; <F>1:  M. २९०. २०, २५, २९१. 1, ३६.</F> the last chapter is an appendix dealing with rules as to how the पुराण must be worshipped, read or heard. If they disregard the rules they would not only not get the fruits there of, but will be born as dogs, pigs, crows, etc. The वाचक must be honoured as व्यास and अङ्गिरस्; <F>2:  Ib. Ch. २९२ (whole).</F> con- sists of आख्यान, उपाख्यान, गथस् and कल्पज (ब्र्। प्।) (Kulakarmas-वा। प्।); <F>3:  Br. II. ३४. २१; वा. ६०. २१. Vi. III. 6. १६-17.</F> Reference to पराशर and विष्णु Pura1n2a; <F>4:  Ib. I. 1. २६; VI. 8. 2-3.</F> follows Vedic tradition. <F>5:  Ib. VI. 8. १२.</F>
--personified: came up to see Tri- vikrama Hari. भा. VIII. २१. 2.
--ety. of पुराण; {#‘purAhianatIdaM’#} this lived before. Br. I. 1. 7; वा. 1. 8, २०३.
--towns; triangular, round, short or long, con- densed; but a square type is celebrated; the chief house, (Palace) measuring ८०० Kis2ku. Br. I. 5. ९९; 7. ९३ and १०५; वा. 8. ९९, ११३ff.
--an incarnation of शिव. M. 1. 8; २३. ३७.
(पुराणस्)--a पिशाच gan2a; big faces, hanging brows, abnormal noses, residents of deserted places. वा. ६९. २६३, २७६.
--a son of Mandulaka (आन्ध्र). M. २७३. १०. [पगे२-351+ २६]
--a King and son of Gomatiputra and father of मेदशिरस्. भा. XII. 1. २६. 7.
--a king and son of Talaka and father of Sunandana: ruled for २१ years. भा. XII. 1. २५. Br. III. ७४. १६६.

--faeces; to be discharged at a distance from the house in the S.W. direction, without touching the head with the hand; other details connected with cleansing follow; he who discards these rules becomes a म्लेच्छ; शौच leads by itself to मोक्ष। वा. ७८. ५९-67 and ७४-5.
--produced by ब्रह्मा. भा. III. १२. ४०.
--Agnis born of क्रीया and Samanantara. भा. VI. १८. 4.
(I)--a son of चाक्सुष Manu; his race was known as Pauravas; a son of Manu (also Maru) and नड्वला. भा. IV. १३. १६; III. 1. 2; 3. १७. Vi. I. १३. 5.
(II)--a son of Vasudeva and सहदेवा. भा. IX. २४. ५२-53.
(III)--a son of ययाति and शर्मिष्ठा; his anoint- ment by ययाति on account of his faithfulness to his parents. Br. III. 6. २५; वा. ६८. २४; ९३. १७, ५५-88.
(IV)--married बृहती. Br. III. ७१. २५५. [पगे२-352+ ३१]

--a राजऋषि and a son of मान्धात and Bindu- मती; An अन्गीरस and मन्त्रकृत्; married नर्मदा; father of Trasadasyu; went to रसातल where he killed undesirable Mauneya Gandharvas on behalf of the Nagas; a क्षेत्रोपेत- dvija; <F>2:  Br. III. ६३. ७२; ६६. ८७.</F> not to marry with the अन्गीरस् and सादस्युस्; <F>3:  M. १९६. ३७.</F> Heard the विष्णु पुराण from भृगु and the other sages on the banks of the नर्मदा and narrated it to सारस्वत. <F>4:  Vi. I. 2. 9; VI. 8. ४५.</F> ^1 भा. IX. 6. ३८; 7. 2-3; Br. II. ३२. १०८; III. १०. ९८; M. १२. ३५; १४५. १०२; Vi. IV. 2. ६७; 3. 6-१६; वा. ९३. ४९; ९१. ११६.
--the son of सुशान्ति and father of Arka. भा. IX. २१. ३१.
(I)--(Purajit ब्र्। प्।) the son of Aja and father of अरिष्टनेमि. भा. IX. १३. २२-23.
(II)--a son of Rucaka. भा. IX. २३. ३५.
(III)--a son of आनक and कन्का. भा. IX. २४. ४१.
(IV)--a son of कृष्ण and जाम्बवती. भा. X. ६१. ११.
(V)--a vassal of युधिष्ठिर who went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse. भा. X. ८२. २५.

--the son of Puruvasu (पुरुवश-वा। प्।); the best among men; his wife was भद्रावती and son पुरूद्वह; <F>1:  Br. III. ७०. ४७; वा. ९५. ४६.</F> (Father of Janhu by भद्रसेनी, the Vidarbha princess-म्। प्।). <F>2:  M. ४४. ४४-5.</F>
--the son of Anu and father of अम्शु, a king. Vi. IV. १२. ४२-3.
--a son of Hasti; childless. भा. IX. २१. २१, ३०; M. ४९. ४३; Vi. IV. १९. २९.
--a son of Madhu. वा. ९५. ४६.
--a son of Madhu and father of पुरुद्वान्. Br. III. ७०. ४६.
--a son of Vasudeva and सहदेवा. भा. IX. २४. ५३.

(I)--as विराट्; subject of meditation; ety. of; <F>1:  भा. I. 3. 1; II. 1. २५-39; वा. ५९. ७६.</F> the invisible principle; <F>2:  भा. XI. १६. ३७; २२. १४; २४. 4-5.</F> as dwelling in हृदाकाश; <F>3:  Ib. II. 2. 8-१३; वा. 4. ४४.</F> as issuing from the primordial अण्ड (egg); <F>4:  भा. II. 5. ३५-42.</F> as यज्ञ; <F>5:  Ib.
