II. 6. ४१. वा. 5. २०, २९, ३२.</F> अवतार्स् of पुरुष; <F>8:  भा. II. 6. ४१-5.</F> as वराह; <F>9:  Ib. II. 7. 1; १०. १०; Ib. III. २६. २१-22; VI. १३. १८.</F> His energy; <F>१०:  Ib. XII. 4. २२.</F> identified with सुपर्ण; <F>११:  Ib. XII. ११. १९.</F> invoked by cowherds; <F>१२:  Ib. X. 6. २३.</F> perso- nated as कृष्ण and राम; <F>१३:  Ib. X. ३८. १५ and ३२.</F> celebrated by अक्रूर. <F>१४:  Ib. X. ४०. (whole).</F> शिव according to the सान्ख्यस्; <F>१५:  Br. II. 9. ३६, ३९.</F> primaeval male from whom the universe was evolved; supposed to be the २५थ् तत्व according to one school and the २६थ् including ईश्वर accord- ing to the other; <F>१६:  M. 3. २७-8.</F> constitutes twenty-five truths; <F>१७:  Ib. ६०. 3; २६६. ५२; २७४. ६२.</F> descrip- tion of. <F>१८:  वा. 7. ६२-7.</F> [पगे२-354+ २५]
(II)--one of the names in the fifth Marut गण. Br. III. 5. ९७. वा. ५९. ७६; ६७. १२८; १०२. ११७.
(III)--a दानव, killed by सम्पदीश. Br. III. 6. १६; IV. २८. ३८ and १०१.
(IV)--a son of अञ्जनावती an elephant. Br. III. 7. ३४३.
--sacrificed to भद्रकालि for the sake of children. भा. V. 9. १२.
--an offence leading to रक्षोगणभो- jana hell; of हरिश्चन्द्र with शुनश्शेप as पशु। भा. V. २६. ३१; IX. 7. २१.
--ब्रह्मा praised Hari by this; <F>1:  भा. X. 1. २०; Br. IV. ४३. १२.</F> to be uttered while installing a new image. <F>2:  M. २६५. २६.</F>
(I)--a class of people in क्रौञ्चद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २२.
(II)--minor officials to be appointed in places according to qualifications. M. २१५. ४५.
--four in number; <F>1:  Vi. I. १८. २१.</F> realised by the study of विष्णु पुराण। <F>2:  Ib. VI. 8. 3.</F> [पगे२-355+ ३०]
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८४.
(I)--a name of भागवत; of कृष्ण. <F>2:  Ib. X. ५८. 1; Vi. VI. 4. ४२ and ४५.</F> ^1 भा. VII. 4. 2.

(II)--a तीर्थ sacred to विमला and the पितृस्;^1 temple of; कण्डु offered prayers and got rid of the sin of living with the Apsaras, प्रम्लोचा by the Japa, ब्रह्मपार. M. १३. ३५; २२. ३८; Vi. I. १५. ५२; V. १७. 6 and ३३; ३८. ४५, ७८-82.
--a Goddess enshrined at पुष्कर. M. १३. ३०.
--a son of Anu and father of आयु. भा. IX. २४. 6.
--a son of चाक्षुष Manu. Br. II. ३६. ७९. १०६.
--a son of पुरुद्वान् and भद्रवती; mar- ried ऐक्ष्वाकी (a daughter of इक्ष्वाकु) and had a son, Satva. Br. III. ७०. ४७; वा. ९५. ४७.
--one of the three sons of Hasti. वा. ९९. १६६.

(I)--(Aila) son of Budha and (Sudyumna in female form) इला; anointed king of प्रतिष्ठान (Pra- यागा) by Sudyumna when he retired to forest; <F>1:  भा. IX. 1. ३५, ४२; Br. III. ६५. ४५-6; ६६. 1-2, १९-22; M. १२. १५; वा. 1. १०६; Vi. IV. 1. १२ and १६.</F> eager for territory; <F>2:  भा. XII. 3. 9.</F> having heard of his beauty from नारद, ऊर्वशी [पगे२-356+ ४७] desired to marry him; she met the king and offered to be with him under two conditions, that he would undertake to protect the two sheep in her custody, and never to show himself naked except at their sexual intercourse; agreeing to the conditions he enjoyed her company, going round the earth, and frequenting Caitraratha and other gardens; miss- ing ऊर्वशि, Indra asked his Gandharvas to fetch her back; at midnight they stole the sheep, and hearing their noise she induced पुरूरवस् to recover them; the king who was then naked, went as he was and fetched them back; but ऊर्वशी seeing him naked left him; mad in love with her he followed her naked begging her to stay on; he found her playing in the सरस्वती waters with five friends; on an appeal from him she agreed to sleep with him one day every year; but he was all anxious to have her for ever; on her advice he prayed to the Gandharvas who gave him accom- modation and an अग्निस्ठाली; he left it on the way in a forest and went home; meanwhile त्रेतायुग had commenced; he went to see his स्थाली but found an अश्वत्थ instead; there in order to get at ऊर्वशी he cut off a couple of branches (अरणि) and churned them; fire, जातवेदस् came with the three Vedas who all became his sons; by this one Veda became three; <F>3:  Ib. IX. १४. १५-49; वा. ९१. 1-५२; Vi. IV. 6. ३४-93.</F> had six sons आयु and others by ऊर्वशी; <F>4:  भा. IX. १५. 1; १७. 1; वा. ९१. ४८; Br. I. 1. ८९; 2. १४.</F> finding she had gone once for all, he repented his action, got ashamed of his position as king and devoted himself to Hari; worshipped the Fire which was his son and reached the Gandharva world; the story given as an example of the evils of bad association; <F>5:  भा. XI. २६. 3-३५.</F> meets पितृस् every New Moon day; a क्षत्रिय mantrava1din; आचार्य of सामगस्; originator of three sacred fires <F>6:  Br. II. २८. 1-9, ९७; ३२. १२०; ३३. 9; M. १४५. ११५; वा. ५६. 1, २२; ९१. ४८.</F> of the इक्ष्वाकु line but originator of the lunar race and a राजऋषि; the Ailas came into prominence in the त्रेतायुग and declined in the Kali. <F>7:  M. १२. १५; १३. ६२; २७३. ५२-3, ६५.</F> By meditating on the १०८ names of the देवी scored success over his enemies; <F>8:  Ib. १३. ६२.</F> as a result of तपस् at the हिमालयस् in honour of जनार्दन, became the lord of the seven द्वीपस्; slew केशी and other Asuras; was offered अर्धासनम् by Indra, going to see him every day; paid more attention to Dharma [पगे२-357+ २९] and incurred the displeasure of Artha and काम; Initiated in भरतनाट्य शास्त्र <F>9:  Ib. २४. १०-33.</F> in द्विजग्राम, became the king of मद्रदेश in the चाक्षुष Manvantara; <F>१०:  Ib. ११५. 4, 7-8, १०-18.</F> served कूहु and सिनीवालि to obtain nectar from the moon for per- forming rituals to the पितृस्; gained his wish by the blessings of Atri <F>११:  Ib. १४१, 1, 8-२०.</F> and by तपस् in the हिमालयस्. <F>१२:  Ib. chh. ११६-17, ११९; १२०. ४८.</F>
(II)--a विश्वेदेव. Br. III. 3. ३१.
--a name of Indra; his city is said to have a १००० gates. M. ३८. १५.
(I)--a son of मेधातिथि of शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २५.
(II)--a son of प्राण. भा. VI. 6. १२.
(III)--a son of Anila, a Vasava. M. २०३. 7.

--the sacrificial offerings to Devas; <F>1:  Br. III. ६७. ९७; वा. ३१. ४८; ९२. ९२; Vi. IV. 9. १८.</F> made of burnt flour; <F>2:  M. २३९. ३२.</F> symbol of Trayambaka Rudra. <F>3:  Br. II. 9. 6; १३. १४६.</F> [पगे२-358+ ५१]
--see Purohita. <F>1:  Br. III. १०. १०१; IV. 9. ११; वा. ९९. ३७. १११. ८१.</F> खाण्डिक्य's पुरोदास् fol- lowed the banished king to the forest. <F>2:  Vi. VI. 6. ११.</F>
--sacred to ललितापीथम्. Br. IV. ४४. १००.
--a son of the third सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ८०.

--of the Asuras; <F>1:  भा. VII. 5. 1.</F> versed in the Atharvan rites; performed होम prior to रुक्मिनी's marriage; <F>2:  Ib. X. ५३; १२.</F> of the king; <F>3:  Br. II. २९. ७६; III. २६. २२; २७, ३०; वा. ५७. ७०; ९०, ७२; १०१. ८१; Vi. V. ३४. २९; VI. 6. २६.</F> does expiatory ceremonies to ward off evils to the state. <F>4:  M. २२९. १२; २३०. 9-११; २३१. 9.</F>
--killed the king बृहद्रथ and installed his son, बालक on the throne. M. २७१. ३०; २७२. 1.

--a mind-born son of ब्रह्मा born of his ears in वारुणी यज्न; married Kardama's daughter Havir- भू; father of Agastya (ध्राग्नि in another birth) and विश्रवस्; <F>1:  भा. III. १२. २२ and २४; २४. २२; IV. 1. ३६; Br. II. ३२. ९६; III. 1. २१ and ४५; M. 3. 6; वा. २५. ८२; ६१. ८२; ६५. ४२; ९४. ३६; १०१. ३५, ४९.</F> a महऋषि; sage presiding over the month of Madhu; <F>2:  भा. XII. ११. ३३; M. १४५. ९०; वा. ५२. 2; Vi. II. १०. 3.</F> आश्रम of; near Pulaha's; <F>3:  भा. V. 8. ३०.</F> requested पराशर to impart भागवत to Maitreya; <F>4:  Ib. III. 8. 9.</F> not seen the Supreme Being; <F>5:  Ib. IV. २९. ४३.</F> came to स्यमन्तपञ्चक to see कृष्ण; <F>6:  Ib. X. ८४. 4.</F> a देवऋषि of दारुवन; <F>7:  Br. II. ३५. ९२; २७. १०४; III. 1. २१, ४५.</F> married the twelve daughters of Krodha, whose sons were उरगस् and नगस्; <F>8:  Ib. III. 7. १७१; 8. ७०; II. ३५. ९२.</F> father of Kubera and रावण and appealed to कार्तवीर्य Arjuna to release रावण; <F>9:  Ib. III. ६९. ३६; M. ४३. ३८.</F> his sons are the groups of यक्षस्, राक्षसस्, etc., who worship the बर्हिषद् manes; <F>१०:  Ib. १५. 1-4.</F> praised शिव, out to des- troy Tripuram; <F>११:  Ib. १०२. १९; १२६. 3; १३३. ६७.</F> from the केश of fire to which ब्रह्मा's शुक्रम् was offered; <F>१२:  Ib. १७१. २७; १९५. १०.</F> gave वामन white cloths. <F>१३:  Ib. २४५. ८७.</F> [पगे२-359+ ४७]

(II)--created from उदान; <F>1:  Br. I. 1. ११७; 5. ७०; वा. I. १३८; 3. 3.</F> a son of ब्रह्मा and the elder brother of Pulaha; <F>2:  Ib. २५. ८२; ३६. ४८; Vi. I. 1. २२-3.</F> of the स्वायम्भुव epoch; <F>3:  वा. 9. १०२; २८. २२.</F> married प्रीती, daughter of दक्ष; <F>4:  Br. II. 9. १८, २४, ५५.</F> father of three sons, of whom दत्तालि was one; <F>5:  Ib. II. ११. २६; १३. ५३; वा. ३१. १६.</F> married to भूति; <F>6:  Vi. I. 7. 5 and 7.</F> by his gift पराशर remembered the विष्णु पुराण। <F>7:  Ib. VI. 8. ५०.</F>

(I)--one of the ten mind-born sons of ब्रह्मा, born of his navel; married Kardama's daughter, गती and had three sons; born from the केश of fire to which ब्रह्मा's शुक्रम् was offered; presiding over the month of माधव; <F>1:  भा. III. १२. २२, २४; २४. २३; IV. 1. ३८; XII. ११. ३४; M. 3. 7; १७१. २७; १९५. १०; २०२. 7 and 9.</F> a महऋषि; his hermitage, sacred to Hari; visited by बलराम; Bharata spent his last days in it; <F>2:  भा. VII. १४. ३०; X. ७९. १०; V. 7. 8; 8. ३०; M. १४५. ९०; वा. ५२. 2; Vi. II. १०. 5.</F> had not realised the Supreme Being; <F>3:  भा. IV. २९. ४३.</F> his descendants became आज्यप manes; <F>4:  M. १५. २१.</F> praised शिव out to destroy Tripura; <F>5:  Ib. १०२. १९; १२६. 3; १३३. ६७.</F> gave अक्षसूत्र to वामन; <F>6:  Ib. २४५. ८७.</F> younger brother of Pulastya, mar- ried सम्भूति; <F>7:  Vi. I. 1. २३; 7. 5 and 7.</F> King ऋषभ spent his last days in his hermitage. <F>8:  Ib. II. 1. २९.</F>

(II)--created from व्यान of ब्रह्मा; out of the वारुणि यज्ञ with hairs hanging from his body; <F>1:  Br. I. 5. ७०; II. 9. १८ and २४; वा. 3. 3; 9. १०२; ६१. ८२ and ८४.</F> son of ब्रह्मा; <F>2:  Br. II. 9. ५५; १३. ५३; वा. २५. ८२.</F> प्रजापति of the स्वायम्भुव period; <F>3:  Ib. २८. २५; १०१. ३५ and ४९.</F> son-in-law of दक्ष; <F>4:  Ib. ३०. ४८.</F> wife क्षमा; <F>5:  Ib. ३१. १६.</F> father of four sons and a daughter, पीवरी. <F>6:  Br. II. ११. ३०.</F> [पगे२-360+ ३१]
--a kingdom on the हिमालयस्. M. १२१. ४४.
--the son of Bhadraka and father of घोष of the शुन्ग dynasty. भा. XII. 1. १७.

--a tribe of दक्षिणपथ formed into a caste by पुरञ्जय; purified of sin by the worship of Hari; <F>1:  भा. XII. 1. ३६; II. 4. १८; वा. ४५. १२६; ४७. ४८; ९८. १०८; ९९. २६८ and ३७८.</F> kings of the; <F>2:  M. ५०. ७६.</F> kingdom of the, established by विस्वफाणि; <F>3:  Br. II. १६. ५८; III. ७३. १०८; ७४. १९१; M. ११४. ४८; १२१. ४९.</F> elevated to royalty by विश्वस्फटिक. <F>4:  Vi. IV. २४. ६२.</F>
(I)--a son of Antaka, ruled for three years. Br. III. ७४. १५३. M. २७२. २९.
(II)--son of Udanka and father of घोष- vasu. Vi. IV. २४. ३५.
--the son of Palelaka and father of Sun- dara. Vi. IV. २४. ४७.
--women of Pulindas. भा. X. २१. १७; ८३. ४३.
--a tribe of the southern country. वा. ४५. १२९.
--at first a वैश्य by caste, became the queen of पुरुहूत by observing the कल्याणिव्रतम्। M. ६९. ६०. [पगे२-361+ ३०]

(I)--An Asura; a son of Danu; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ३१; VII. 2. 5; वा. ६८. 7; Vi. I. २१. 5.</F> followed वृत्र in his battle with Indra; fought with Anila or Agni in the देवासुर war; <F>2:  भा. VI. १०. २० and ३१; VIII. १०. ३१.</F> residing in रसातलम्; <F>3:  Br. II. २०. ४९; III. 6. 7 and २४; वा. ५०. ३७.</F> father of शची. <F>4:  M. 6. २०-1.</F>
(II)--a son of Prahati; the राक्षस. Br. III. 7. ९१; वा. ६९. १२९.
(III)--a son of गौतमीपुत्र, ruled for २८ years. M. २७३. १३.
(IV)--an Andhra King, who ruled for seven years; The period from महापद्म to Puloma is ८३६ years. M. २७३. १५, ३७.
(V)--name of the lord of the विद्याधरस्. वा. ३८. १६.
(VI)--a Mauneya. वा. ६९. 2.
--a daughter of वैश्वानर and a wife of कश्यप (मारीच); after her, were called Paulomas. भा. VI. 6. ३३-4; Br. III. 6. २५; M. 6. २२; वा. ६८. २३; Vi. I. २१. 8-9.
--the son of चन्द्रश्रि; the last of the Andhras, who ruled for ४८६ years (४५६ years: ब्र्। प्।). Vi. IV. २४. ४९-50. [पगे२-362+ २६]
--an Andhra King, who ruled for 7 years. Br. III. ७४. १६९.
--the father of Pulomi and father-in-law of भृगु, the sage. Br. III. 1. ७५.
--ruled for 7 years; with him are ३० Kings of the Andhra line who ruled for ४११ years in all; twelve branches are distinguished among them. वा. ९९. ३५७-9.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ७९.

--are purified of sin by the worship of Hari: got released from bondage by hearing the name of Hari once; <F>1:  भा. II. 4. १८; VI. १६. ४४.</F> Rantideva gave the drink which he had for himself, to a certain Pulkasa. <F>2:  Ib. IX. २१. १० and १४; XI. २९. १४.</F>
(I)--see पुष्करद्वीप. भा. V. 1. ३२.
(II)--the son of सुनक्षत्र and father of अन्तरिक्ष. भा. IX. १२. 12
(III)--a son of दुर्वार्क्षी and वृक. भा. IX. २४. ४३.
(V)--a son of Bharata founded पुष्करावती as his capital in गान्धार. Br. III. ६३. १९०; वा. २९. 8; ८८. १८९.
(VI)--कृष्ण (black) पराशर. M. २०१. ३५.
(VII)--a Kingdom watered by the सीता; fit for श्राद्ध. <F>2:  Br. III. १३. ४०.</F> ^1 Br. II. १८. ४५; वा. ३३. १४; ४२. ६९; ५०. ११९.
(I)--clouds of the पक्षज variety. Br. II. २२. ४०.
(II)--the Brahmana caste of the क्रौञ्चद्- वीप. Vi. II. 4. ५३.
--an elephant at one of the four cardinal points to maintain the balance of the worlds. भा. V. २०. ३९.
--a son of विशाला. वा. ९९. १६३.

--the island twice the दधिमण्डोद in size, and surrounded by sea of fresh water: named after a huge lotus with golden petal intended to be ब्रह्मा's throne: called after the King पुष्पवाहन of Rathantara- kalpa; here is the hill चित्रसानु. There is only one moun- tain मानसोत्तर in the middle of this द्वीप, dividing it into portions East and West. On it in the four directions are the cities of gods like Indra. On its top rotates the wheel of the Sun's chariot which makes the year of men and the day of gods. वीतिहोत्र, a son of Priyavrata was the ruler who divided it among his two sons. ब्रह्मा is worshipped [पगे२-364+ ३७] here; <F>1:  भा. V. 1. ३२; २०. २९-33; M. १००. 4; १२३. १३; २४८. १३; वा. ४९. १०१-141.</F> here people live for १०००० years. No caste or Vedas: worship banyan tree: कश्यप performed his अश्वमेध and वालि defeated रावण; <F>2:  Br. II. १४. १४; १९. १०८-26, १४०-1; III. 5. 7; 7. २६७.</F> visited by परशुराम; <F>3:  Ib. III. ३२. ६०; ४४. २२; Vi. II. 4. ७२-86, ९२.</F> one of the seven continents of which Savana was the first King. His sons महावीर and धातुकि divided it between them. <F>4:  Ib. II. 1. १५; 2. 5.</F>
--a hill in भारतवर्ष: felt the influence of हिरण्यकशिपु. M. १६३. ८८.

--a place sacred to Hari. Sages of पुष्कर visited द्वारका; <F>1:  भा. VII. १४. ३०; X. ९०. २८[3]; XII. १२. ६०.</F> sacred to Indra and पितृस् in the त्रेता- yuga; <F>2:  M. १३. ३०; २२. ६२; १०६. ५७; १०९. 3; ११०. 1; १८०. ५५; १८४. १६; १९२. ११.</F> a तीर्थ; here was अधिसामकृष्ण's sacrifice for three years; <F>3:  Ib. ५०. ६७.</F> here कश्यप performed the अश्वमेध; <F>4:  वा. ६७. ५३; Vi. VI. 8. २९.</F> fit for श्राद्ध. <F>5:  वा. ७७. ४०; १०६. ६९.</F>
--abode of पुष्कर, a wonderful lotus moving at will, gained by पुस्पवाहन's self denial in his previous birth. M. १००. ३०.
--a son of विश्वशा. M. १७१. ४९.
--the son of सृचन्द्र; an able charioteer; used वायव्यास्त्रम् against परशुराम who attacked him with ब्रह्मास्त्रम् and cut him into two with the परशु. Br. III. ४०. 1.
(I)--the capital of पुष्कर, son of Bharata. Br. III. ६३. १९१; वा. ८८. १९०.
(II)--a Goddess enshrined at प्रभास. M. १३. ४३.

--a group of rain-bearing clouds, born of the wings of the mountains shorn by Indra; description of; rain at the commencement of Pralaya and are instru- mental in putting an end to them also. M. १२५. ११-15; वा. ५१. ३७-40.
--the son of उरुक्षव and विशाला, became a Brahmana, and one of the three best महऋषिस् among the काव्यस्. M. ४९. ३९.
--a son of दुरुक्षय. Vi. IV. १९. २५.
(I)--the queen of व्युष्ट, and mother of चक्षुष्. भा. IV. १३. १४.
(II)--the queen of Ulmuka. भा. IV. १३. १७.
(III)--see वारुणी--daughter of progenitor वीरण; wife of चाक्षुष. Br. II. ३६. १०२. Vi. I. १३. 3.
--a son of Bharata. भा. IX. ११. १२; Vi. IV. 4. १०४.
(I)--a group of clouds. Br. IV. २८. ६३.
(II)--the क्षत्रिय caste of क्रौञ्चद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ५३.
--R. of the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. २०.
(I)--a daughter of दक्ष, and a wife of Dharma: gave birth to Smaya (लाभ-वा। प्।). भा. IV. 1. ४९ and ५१; वा. 9. ४९, ५९; १०. २५, ३५; Vi. I. 7. २३ and २८.
(II)--one of the nine देवीस् attending on Soma. Br. II. २६. ४५; III. ६५. २६; वा. ९०. २५.
(III)--a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५२.
(IV)--a son of Vasudeva and मदिरा. Br. III. ७१. १७२; वा. ९६. १७०.
(V) अन्गिरस्--a sage of the epoch of the third सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ७९.
(VI)--a God of the Rohita गण. Br. IV. 1. ८६.
(VII)--a Brahmana कला. Br. IV. ३५. ९४. [पगे२-367+ २८]
(VIII)--a शक्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ७१.
(IX)--a Goddess enshrined at देवदारु forest. M. १३. ४७.
(X)--a son of Dhruva. वा. ६२. ८२.
--the son of हिरण्यनाभ and father of Dhruva- sandhi. Br. III. ६३. २०९.
(I)--the aerial car in which राम flew to अयोध्या; <F>1:  भा. IX. १०. ४५.</F> of Kubera; <F>2:  M. १७४. 1-7; १९१. ८८; १९३. १०; वा. ४१. 6-7.</F> constructed by शिव. <F>3:  M. १३०. १२.</F>
(II)--the मण्टप with ६४ pillars. M. २७०. 3, 7.
(III)--a Mt. north of the महाभद्र; <F>1:  वा. ३६. ३२; ३८. ७१.</F> the residence of sages. <F>2:  Ib. ३९. ६२.</F>
--a Mt. in भारतवर्ष. Br. II. १६. २२; वा. ४५. ९२.
--a R. from the Malaya hill. M. ११४. ३०.
--a R. originating from the Malaya hills. Br. II. १६. ३६; वा. ४५. १०५.
(I)--attacked the Asura followers of Bali. भा. VIII. २१. १७. [पगे२-368+ २३]
(II)--a यक्ष; a son of देवजनी. Br. III. 7. १२८.
(III)--the elephant of the साम fold (बृहत्साम) with six tusks; his sons are ताम्रपर्ण and others roaming in groups. Br. III. 7. ३३७; वा. ६९. २२१.
(IV)--a काद्रवेय na1ga; a serpent. वा. ६९. ७१.
(V)--to be worshipped before the com- mencement of house and palace building operations. M. २५३. २६; २५५. 9; २६८. १५.
--गया-s4ila1 known as. वा. १०८. ४८.
(I)--a काद्रवेय Na1ga. Br. III. 7. ३५.
(II)--a thousand-hooded snake. M. 6. ४०.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४३.
--the God of love; see Madana. M. १५४. २४५.
--a मण्टप with ६२ pillars. M. २७०. 3, 7. [पगे२-369+ २४]
--a pleasure garden to which went Kardama and देवहूती. भा. III. २३. ४०.
--R. (also पुष्पवहा)--on its banks in the हिमालयस्, मार्कण्डेय performed तपस्। भा. XII. 8. १७; 9. १० and ३०.

(I)--the commander-in-chief of the Mauryan King बृहद्रथ; did away with his master and became King; ruled for six (sixty वा। प्।) years; had eight sons, of whom the first ruled for seven years. Br. III. ७४. १५०; वा. ९९. ३३७-8.
(II)--a King of the महिषस्, ruled for six years. Br. III. ७४. १८७; वा. ९९. ३७४.
--a royal dynasty after the बाह्लिकस् in the Kingdom of Magadha. Vi. IV. २४. ५८.
--(पुष्पमित्र-ब्र्। प्।) a क्षत्रिय King after the बाह्लिकस्. भा. XII. 1. ३४.
--a son of मणिवर. वा. ६९. १५९.
--a R. see पुष्पभद्रा. भा. XII. 9. ३०.
(I)--the son of Satyahita, and father of Jahu. भा. IX. २२. 7.
(III)--same as द्रोण. M. १२२. ५७.
(IV)--the righteous son of ऋषभ (वृषभ- वि। प्।) Father of Satyahita. वा. ९९. २२४; Vi. IV. १९. ८२.

--a King of Rathantara Kalpa; ब्रह्मा was pleased at his तपस् and gave him a golden lotus; after him came the 7th द्वीप, पुष्करद्वीप (s.v); he got a vehicle of पुष्पवाहन which took him to any place; his wife was लावण्यवती; once he met the sage प्राचेतस् and asked him the reason for his wealth etc. He said that in the previous birth he was a hunter and owing to a distressing famine, he could not get anything to eat; so he plucked some lotus flowers and went to the वैदिश city for selling them; none offered to buy; soon he heard a musical sound near by; going in that direction he saw a courtesan engaged in विभूतिद्वादशि व्रतम्; there, he gave all flowers needed for the performance of the vow and did not take gold or food offered in return; he felt no thirst or hunger; and be- came changed at that sight; for that service he became King and the courtesan प्रीती, wife of the Lord of love. M. १००. 1-३२. [पगे२-371+ २२]
--a R. in भारतवर्ष: felt the prowess of हिरण्यकशीपु. M. १६३. ६४.
--a Pravara (आन्गिरस्). M. १९६. १४.
--विष्णु's wedding present to कामेश्वर. Br. IV. १५. १९.
--a son of Vatsara; had two queens, प्रभा and दोषा. Each of them had three sons. भा. IV. १३. १२-13.
--a daughter of माल्यवान् and one of the four wives of विश्रवस्; her sons, Mahodara, महापार्श्व, (महापाम्शु-वा। प्।) Prahasta, and Khara; daughter Kum- भीनसी. Br. III. 8. ३९ and ५५; वा. ७०. ३४, ४९.
(I)--a नक्षत्र in ऐरावति vi1thi. भा. V. २३. 6; वा. ६६. ४८.
(II)--a son of हिरण्यनाभ and father of Dhruvasandhi. भा. IX. १२. 5; वा. ८८. २०९; Vi. IV. 4. १०८.
(III)--the month sacred to Bhaga, etc. भा. XII. ११. ४२. [पगे२-372+ २९]
--a term for Kali-yuga, evils of. M. १४४. ३०-48.

--Commander-in-chief of बृहद्रथ, the Mauryan King; killed his own master and usurped the throne. He was a शुन्ग and his line was therefore called the शुन्गस्. Father of Agnimitra; <F>1:  भा. XII. 1. १५[1], १६. Vi. IV. २४. ३४.</F> ruled for ३६ years. <F>2:  M. २७२. २७.</F>

(I)--a demoness and a friend of Kamsa; was deputed by him to kill all infants. Once she came to Vraja and changing her form to that of a fascinating lady, entered Nanda's house and began to suckle the baby कृष्ण. He understood the purpose and sucked her life out to the wonderment of the गोपीस् and Gopas. Her body was cre- mated and she reached heaven; <F>1:  भा. X. 2. 1; 6. 2-१७, २८ and ३४-38; १४. ३५; २६. 4; ४३. २५; Br. IV. २९. १२४; III. ७३. १००; वा. 9. ९७; ९८. १००; Vi. V. 4. 1; 5. 7-११, २३; 6. २३; १५. 2; २९. 5.</F> to be propitiated at the commencement of building operations of palaces. <F>2:  M. २६८. २९.</F>
(II)--a daughter of Bali; <F>1:  Br. III. 5. ४३; वा. ६७. ८४.</F> mother of the भूतस् and a ग्रह। <F>2:  Br. III. 7. १५८ and १६१.</F>
(III)--a वर्ण s4akti. Br. IV. ४४. ५९.
(IV)--a राक्षसी and wife of Bhadra: Her sons are called नैऋर्तस्. Br. III. ५९. १२-4. [पगे२-373+ २१]
--a class of fearful राक्षसस्. वा. ६९. १९०.
--is कृष्ण. Br. III. ३६. २४.
--a Marut गण. M. १७१. ५४.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८९.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८९.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८९.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८९.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८९.

--the name of a hell into which fall those who deal in milk, wine, meat, लाक्ष, salt, scents, oils, rasa, sesamum, etc., as also those that fetter or deal in hen, cats, pigs, birds, animals and vegetables, astrologers, etc. Br. IV. 2. १४८. १६४, १६५; वा. १०१. १४७, १६२, १६३; Vi. II. 6. 4, १८-9. [पगे२-374+ २९]
--one of the twenty-eight hells. Debauchees associating with unchaste women are subjected to torments here. भा. V. २६. 7 and २३.
(I)--a कौशिक and a sage; a son of विश्वामित्र. Br. II. ३२. ११८; III. ६६. ६९; M. १९८. ११५; वा. ९१. ९७.
(II)--a गण of the पिशाचस्; plumpy and lovers of deserted residences; eyes cast downwards, little in size. Br. III. 7. ३८१, ३९७.
--the capital of शिशिक. Br. III. ७४. १८३.
(I)--a son of चाक्षुष Manu. Loved and blessed by the daughter of काल. भा. VIII. 5. 7; IV. २७. २०; Vi. III. 1. २९. M. 4. ४१; वा. ६२. ६७, ९१.
(II)--the son of Janhu and father of बलाक. भा. IX. १५. 3.

(III)--a son of ययाति and शर्मिष्ठा; agreed to exchange his youth for his father's old age for a stipulated period of १००० years; got back his youth and was anointed king; progenitor of the Paurava वम्श; father of Janame- jaya; in his line were Brahmanas, क्षत्रियस् and the Bha- ratas; blessed by ययाती to have good sons; a legal point was raised by the members of the Assembly as to the legality of his succession to the throne when there was the eldest, Yadu, the grandson of शुक्र; ययाति explained that mere birth was no qualification for it was character that counted; the conduct of the eldest son was unsatisfactory and hence the youngest was chosen; this was approved by the Paura- [पगे२-375+ ३०] जानपदस्; <F>1:  भा. IX. १८. ३३-45; १९. २१ and ३३; २०. 1-2; वा. 1. १५६; M. २४. ५४, ६५-71; ३२. १०; ३३. २५-31; ३४. 9-१३, १५-28, ३१; Vi. IV. १०. 6, १५-6, ३०; १८. ३०.</F> as an obedient son his consecration was accepted by the people though he was young; his kingdom was the territory between the Ganges and the यमुना; his brothers were the lords of the frontiers. <F>2:  M. ३५. ११; ३६. 4-5.</F> His line ends with Bahu- ratha. <F>3:  Vi. IV. १९. 1, ५५.</F>
--a son of चाक्षुष Manu. भा. VIII. 5. 7.
--a son of क्रोधा and a Deva-gandharva. Br. III. 6. ३८.
--the पीठ in the face of the Veda per- sonified. वा. १०४. ७९.
--one of the ten पीठस् for images; with two Mekhalas in the middle; gives what he or she desires. M. २६२. 7, १०, १७.
--a tribe of the North. वा. ४५. १२१.
(I)--the sage who blessed Campa with a son, Haryanga. M. ४८. ९८; वा. ९९. १०७.

(II)--the यक्ष whose son was Hari- केश and who was a devotee of शिव from boyhood, and who hated the cruel habits of the यक्षस्; hence banished the son who went to Benares for penance. M. १८०. 5-१४. [पगे२-376+ २३]
(III)--a son of मणिवर. वा. ६९. १५८.
--a class of यक्षस्. Br. III. 7. १६२; IV. ३३. ७८.
(I)--born of धात्री and Anumati. भा. VI. १८. 3.
(II)--a son of कृष्ण and कालिन्दी. भा. X. ६१. १४.
(III)--a son of मरीचि and सम्भृती; (सम्भूती-वा। प्।); wife सरस्वती. Br. II. ११. ११; वा. २८. 9.
(IV)--a यक्ष; a son of देवजनी. Br. III. 7. १३०.
(V)--a son of मणिवर. वा. ६९. १६१.
--a hill sacred to ललिता. Br. IV. ४४. ९४.
--a कला of the moon. Br. IV. ३५. ९२.
--a कला of the moon. Br. IV. ३५. ९२.
--a son of क्रोधा and a Deva-gandharva. Br. III. 6. ३८. [पगे२-377+ २६]
--a son of मरीचि and कला; had two sons Viraja and विश्वग, and a daughter देवकुल्या. भा. IV. 1. १३-14.
(I)--a शक्ति on the षोडश-patra1bja1. Br. IV. ३२. १२.
(II)--the meeting of the night at the Full Moon day; here both the Devas and पितृस् see it; <F>1:  वा. ५६. ३९, ४३.</F> एत्य्। <F>2:  M. १४१. ३९.</F>
--one of the भार्गव gotraka1ras. M. १९५. २८.
--the son of श्री Mallakarn2i (शान्तकर्णि- वि। प्।) who ruled for १८ years. Father of शतकर्णि. M. २७३. 3; Vi. IV. २४. ४५.
--a svara शक्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ५५.
--a Pravara ऋषि. M. १९९. १६.

--a divine damsel sent by ब्रह्मा to serve अग्नीध्र as his spouse. After giving birth to nine sons she went back to ब्रह्मा. Apsaras presiding over the month of पुष्य. भा. V. 2. 3-5, १९-20; XI. १६. ३३; XII. ११. ४२; Br. II. २३. १८; IV. ३३. १९. Vi. II. १०. 14
--the first two created, ऋभु and Sanat- कुमार; in the वैराज Ya1ga they were engaged in yoga- dharmas; they had twelve families, all with divine qualities. वा. 9. १०६-10.
--a मन्त्रकार and an आत्रेय. वा. ५९. १०४.
--constitutes सत्यम्, जपम्, तपस् and दानम्। M. १४२. ५८.
--a commander of भण्ड; <F>1:  Br. IV. २१. ८३.</F> a son of भण्ड. <F>2:  Ib. IV. २६. ४९.</F>
--कश्यप, सावर्णी, साम्शपायन and सामिका, constitute the authors of सम्हितास्. वा. ६१. ५८.
--a R. in भारतवर्ष; felt the prowess of हिरण्यकशिपु. M. १६३. ६३.
--a kind of punishment for one, who would not return at the promised time the loan taken. (See the chapter for other details regarding administration.) M. २२७. 4.
--an आत्रेय and a sage; <F>1:  Br. II. ३२. ११४; M. १९७. 8.</F> a मन्त्रकृत् and a गोत्रकार. <F>2:  Ib. १४५. १०८.</F>
(I)--the name of the god of a division of the day; a Vasu. वा. ६६. ४३; १०६. ५९; Br. III. 3. ४२.
(II)--a son of अदिती; childless. Laughed at शिव, enraged at दक्ष and was deprived of his teeth. भा. VI. 6. ३९ and ४३.
(III)--the name of the sun in the month of Tapas (माघ); <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ३९; Br. II. २३. १२; २४. ३३.</F> an आदित्य. <F>2:  Ib. III. 3. ६८.</F>

(IV)--the god on the brows of the वामन अवतार् of the Lord when He showed His true form to Bali; <F>1:  M. २४६. ५८</F> all gods find their places in Him. <F>2:  Vi. I. 9. ६३.</F> Worshipped by दण्डिन्स्. <F>3:  M. २५५. १२.</F>

(V)--an आदित्य; a son of Diti; <F>1:  वा. ६६. ६६; M. 6. 4; १४६. २०; १७१. ५६.</F> legend says that during दक्ष's sacrifice in a rage शिव gave a slap to the Sun-God when all his teeth fell down; <F>2:  Ib. २५३. २५; १५६. 7; Vi. I. १५. ३०; V. १६. 7.</F> to be worshipped in house-building; <F>3:  M. २६८. १३.</F> also पूष्ण.
(VI)--a deity with the sun in the शरत् season. वा. ५२. १२. Vi. II. १०. ११.

--a god who helped दक्ष in his sacrifice, was seized by चन्डीश. His teeth were pulled out by वीरभ- dra for laughing at शिव enraged at दक्ष; when शिव was reconciled, he agreed to eat the offering with the teeth of the sacrificer. भा. IV. 5. १७ and २१; 6. ५१; 7. 4.
--a कला of the moon. Br. IV. ३५. ९२.
--a son of Raucya Manu. वा. १००. १०९.

--a वीरमात; surname of कुन्ती (s.v.). A sister of Vasudeva. Became the adopted daughter of the child- less Kuntibhoja who was a friend of her father, शूर. She pleased दुर्वास by service and obtained some मन्त्रस्; just to test their efficacy, she invoked the Sun-God who was before her. She requested him to return. But he con- ferred on her a son, when she was yet a maiden, and went away. Afraid of scandals, she abandoned the child in the river and later became the wife of पाण्डु; <F>1:  भा. I. 8. 3, १७, ४४; १३. 3; १५. ३३; III. 1. ३९-40; IX. २४. ३०-36; X. ४९. 1; ५८. 7; ७१. ३९; Br. III. ७१. १५०-51; Vi. IV. १४. ३१-4.</F> gave birth to three famous sons, all devaputras and equal to Indra. युधिष्ठिर from Dharma, भीम from मारुत, and Arjuna from Indra. <F>2:  M. ४६. 4, 7-9; वा. ९६. १४९-153; ९९. २४३; Vi. IV. १४. ३५-6.</F>

(I)--adopted as daughter by the first king पृथु; mother of all creatures, of different janapadas, cities, castes, mountains, rivers, etc.; <F>1:  M. १०. 1, ३५; वा. ४२. ७८-81; ५०. 2-4; ६३. 3-4. ७४. ३०.</F> ५० (१००(1/2) crores-म्। प्।) crores of yojanas in extent; its बाधविस्तार begins with योजनाग्र which is one crore in every direction from Meru in the middle; three crores of yojanas in all the four direc- tions; the inside circumference of the earth; the पर्यास equal to the extent of the नक्षत्र मण्डलम्; <F>2:  Ib. १२४. १२; वा. ५०. ६८-75.</F> comprising seven islands and being tributary to the sons of स्वायम्- bhuva Manu. <F>3:  M. १६६. 6; २५८. ११. वा. ३३. 4-5.</F>

(II)--various essences extracted from, by differ- ent classes of beings, following पृथु's example; <F>1:  भा. IV. १८. १३-27.</F> also [पगे२-381+ ३८] धरा; first milked by ब्रह्मा; in the Vaivasvata epoch, Prthu milked her. <F>2:  Br. II. २०. 1-4; २१. १२; ३७. 3, १२-20; III. 3. ३४; 5. ७९; IV. 2. ११ and १८.</F>
--otherwise known as Lokapadma of which Meru forms the tendril; from this lotus came the four- faced ब्रह्मा; the earth, lotus shaped. वा. ३४. ३७, ४४; ४१. ८६.

(I)--(Vainya) the son got out of Vena by the churning of his right arm by the sages to save him from falling into hell: is considered the ninth incarnation of Hari. The first king who introduced agriculture. <F>1:  भा. II. 7. 9; III. 1. २२; IV. १३. २०; I. 3. १४; M. 4. ४४; 8. 2-१२; वा. ६२. १२६-182; ch. ६३; Vi. I. १३. ३९.</F> Pane- gyrised by the Gandharvas, and Siddhas playing on different musical instruments. For his coronation, presents came from Indra, ब्रह्मा, Yama, Rudra and other gods; praised by सूत, मागध and Bandin. Though these were dis- couraged, yet they continued to praise him for his righteous administrative policy. His sway extended to the Udaya hills. <F>2:  भा. IV. chh. १५-16 (whole).</F> Due to scarcity of supply, people complained of hunger, when पृथु aimed his arrow and threatened to vanquish her. The earth let herself be milked. With स्वा- yambhuva Manu for the calf and his own palms as pail; he milked the essence of all plants. This was followed by the sages, gods, asuras and others. Hilly tracts were levelled, and different kinds of villages, cities and towns were orga- nised for the first time. <F>3:  Ib. IV. chh. १७-18 (whole) Vi. I. १३. 9, ४०-43.</F> Consecrated himself to perform one hundred अश्वमे- dhas on the सरस्वती. When ९९ were over, jealous Indra ran away with the sacrificial horse. Advised by Atri, the king's son pursued him as the kite did रावण and recover- ing the animal, earned the title विजिताश्व. Again Indra stole the horse, and विजिताश्व pursued him and recovered it. पृथु saw marks of sin on the part of Indra behaving like [पगे२-382+ ४२] a miscreant and aimed his arrow at him. Persuaded by ब्रह्मा, he controlled his rage and became friendly to Indra. On advice from विष्णु, he cast off his enmity to Indra and embraced him. Asked of the Lord to be ever devoted to him. <F>4:  Ib. IV. १९ (whole); २०. 1-३१.</F> On his return to the capital, the citizens accorded him a welcome. Made the middle country between गन्गा and यमुना his home. Advised his subjects, who praised him, to conduct themselves righteously. Was visited by सनत्कुमार with three other sages who taught him आत्मग्ञान। <F>5:  Ib. IV. २०. ३८; २१ (whole); २२. 1-४८.</F> His queen Arcis gave birth to five sons, all rising to his ideal. He followed the path of the लोकपालस्, and his fame as of सोमराज reached the ears of women as that of राम the ears of the virtuous. <F>6:  Ib. IV. २२. ५३- ६३.</F> Finding himself aged, he entrusted the kingdom to his sons and left with his queen to the forest. Launched on a course of severe penance until his last breath went out of his body. In the funeral pyre which the queen lighted for her husband's cremation, she threw her- self and ascended to heaven, praised by the wives of the gods. <F>7:  Ib. IV. २३ (whole).</F> Thus पृथु, the lord of seven द्वीपस्, still thirsting to have more territory, renounced his kingdom and sought refuge with Hari. <F>8:  Ib. VIII. १९. २३; XII. 3. 9; X. ६०. ४१.</F> A मन्त्रकृत् of the चाक्षुस Manu line. The first क्षत्रिय to be a राज. By him the earth became known as पृथ्वि. <F>9:  Br. II. ३६. ८३.</F> His accession was the occasion of a प्रतिसर्ग when rulers were appointed over several classes of beings; got the grace of विष्णु and milked the cow-earth, got grains and eatables and made the earth flow with milk and honey; there was no need for the application of the अर्थशास्त्र maxims; he levelled the ground from Cape Comorin to the हिमालयस् and cleared the forests; <F>१०:  M. १०. १०-35.</F> made it safe and secure; made the १६ gifts. <F>११:  Ib. २७४. १२.</F> [पगे२-383+ २९]
(III)--the son of Anenas and father of Visva- randhi (विश्वगन्धि ?). (विष्टराश्व-वि। प्।). भा. IX. 6. २०; Br. III. ६३. २६; Vi. IV. 2. ३५.
(IV)--a son of Rucaka. भा. IX. २३. ३५.

(V)--a son of Citraratha, of the वृष्णि tribe; sta- tioned by कृष्ण to defend the northern gate of मथुरा; was on the right detachment of कृष्ण's army; got killed in the Yadava contest at प्रभास. <F>2:  Vi. V; ३७. ४६.</F> ^1 भा. IX. २४. १८; X. ५०. २० [3]; [५० (v) १२].
(VI)--the son of अनीनस् and father of पृष- दश्व. वा. ८८. २५.
(VII)--the son of Vibhu. Br. II. १४. ६७. वा. ३३. ५७.
(VIII)--a son of Supratika the elephant. Br. III. 7. ३४१.
(IX)--a son of शिवदत्त. Br. III. ३५. १२.
(X)--a son of Citraka. Br. III. ७१. ११४; वा. ९६. ११३; Vi. IV. १४. ११.
(XI)--a son of Suyodhana. M. १२. २९. [पगे२-384+ २५]
(XII)--a son of अश्विनी and अक्रूर. M. ४५. ३२.
(XIII)--a son of पार. M. ४९. ५५.
(XIV)--a son of पुरुजानु. M. ५०. 2.
(XV)--the सूत sprang from the sacrifice of; <F>1:  वा. 1. ३३-4.</F>a मन्त्रकृत्. <F>2:  Ib. ५९. ९७.</F>
(XVI)--Father of Antardhi (अन्तर्धान) and वादि. वा. ७०. २१; Vi. I. १३. ९३; १४. 1; २२. 1.
(XVII)--the son of Vibhu. Vi. II. 1. ३८.
(XVIII)--a son of परावृत्. Vi. IV. १२. ११.
(XIX)--the son of सुपार and father of सुकृति. Vi. IV. १९. ४२.
(I)--fried grains taken by Kucela to कृष्ण as present. भा. X. ८०. १४; ८१. 5-9, ३५.
(II)--his father, नील of पाञ्चल, was slain by उग्रायुध. M. ४९. ७७. [पगे२-385+ २५]
--a group of gods in the चाक्षुष epoch (6th epoch); eight in number: आजिष्ट, शाक्यन, वानपृष्ट, शान्कर, सत्यध्रिष्णु, विष्णु, Vijaya and Ajita. Br. II. ३६. ६६, ७४; वा. ६२. ५७, ६२. Vi. III. 1. २७.
--a son of शशबिन्दु. Br. III. ७०. २२. Vi. IV. १२. 6.
--a son of शशबिन्दु (grandson? म्। प्।). Br. III. ७०. २२; M. ४४. २१; वा. ९५. २२; Vi. IV. १२. 6.
--a son of शशबिन्दु. Vi. IV. १२. 6.
--the son of पृथुश्रवस् and father of उशनस्. Vi. VI. १२. 7-8.
--a son of शिबि. M. ४८. १९.
--a son of शशबिन्दु. Vi. IV. १२. 6.
(I)--a son of शशबिन्दु. वा. ९५. २१.
(II)--a grandson of शशबिन्दु. M. ४४. २१.
--a grandson of शशबिन्दु. M. ४४. २१.
--a son of शशबिन्दु. वा. ९५. २२.
--a son of सशबिन्दु (grandson? म्। प्।). Br. III. ७०. २२; M. ४४. २१; वा. ९५. २१; Vi. IV. १२. 6.
--a son of Varatrina (वरूत्रिन वा। प्।). Br. III. 1. ७९; वा. ६५. ७९.

--a son of Rukmakavaca, followed his brother and King रुक्मेषु; <F>1:  Br. III. ७०. २९.</F> was dependent on the King who exiled ज्यामघ; <F>2:  वा. ९५. २८.</F> appointed to help his brother in his administration. <F>3:  M. ४४. २८-9.</F>
--a son of शशबिन्दु. Br. III. ७०. २२.
--the son of Caturanga, and father of बृहद्रथ and two other sons. (Read तत्सुतास् with ब्।); <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. १०-11; M. ४८. ९६.</F> father of Campa. <F>2:  Vi. IV. १८. १९-20.</F>
--a son of Caturanga. वा. ९९. १०५.
(I)--a son of शशबिन्दु and father of Dharma (पृथुतम वि। प्।); <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. ३३; Br. III. ७०. २२. वा. ९५. २१; Vi. IV. १२. 6-7.</F> (grandson? म्। प्।). <F>2:  M. ४४. २२.</F>
(II)--a son of the first सावर्ण Manu (दक्षसावर्णि वि। प्।). Br. IV. I. ६५. Vi. III. 2. २४. [पगे२-387+ २७]
(I)--a son of Vibhu and Rati, married आकूति, and had a son Nakta. भा. V. १५. 6.
(II)--a son of पार (रुचिराश्व, भा। and म्। प्।); <F>1:  भा. IX. २१. २४; M. ४९. ५१.</F> According to विष्णु पुराण--son of रुचिराश्व and father of पार. <F>2:  Vi. IV. १९. ३७.</F>
--the six important sons of शशबिन्दु: पृथुश्रवस्, पृथुयशस्, पृथुधर्म, पृथुम्जय, पृथुकीर्ति and पृथुम्दाता. वा. ९५. २१-2.
--a son of वृषसेन. M. ४८. १०२.
--a तीर्थ sacred to the पितृष्; <F>1:  M. २२. ५२.</F> visited by बलराम. <F>2:  भा. X. ७८. १९.</F>

(I)--first milked by ब्रह्मा; Calf वायु; In स्वायम्भुवमन्वन्तर by Agnidhara--Calf स्वायम्- bhuva. In स्वारोचिष by Caitra--Calf स्वारोचिष Manu. In Uttama by Devabhuja--Calf Uttama Manu. In तामस by बालबन्धु--Calf तामस Manu. In चारिष्णव by पुराण--Calf चरिष्णव Manu. In चाक्षुष by पुराण-- Calf चाक्षुष Manu. In Vaivasvata by Vainya--Calf Soma. वा. ६३. १२-19. [पगे२-388+ २७]
(II)--the first seven वातस्कन्दस्; also known as आहव। वा. ६७. ११४.
--born of अरुन्धती and Dharma. M. 5. १९.
--to be worshipped in house-building. M. २५३. ३०, ३९; २६८. २३.
--the son of माध्रि's son, युधाजित्; had two sons श्वफल्क and Citraka. वा. ९६. १०१.
--a manifestation of Hari born of पृश्नि and Sutapas during the श्वायम्भुव epoch. भा. X. 3. ४१.
--a class of gods doing श्राद्ध. Br. III. १०. १०९; वा. ७३. ६१.
--a god of Sumedhasa group. Br. II. ३६. ५९.
(I)--the wife of सविता, and mother of शावित्री, व्याहृती and others. भा. VI. १८. 1.

(II)--देवकी in the epoch of स्वायम्भुव Manu: Married Sutapas the progenitor: was engag- ed in तपस् with her husband for १२००० divine years. To them was born Hari by name पृश्निगर्भ. भा. X. 3. ३२-41; 6. २५.
--Indra of the XI epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. ३०. [पगे२-389+ ३४]
--the last son of Somaka अजमीढ and father of Drupada. भा. IX. २२. 2; वा. ९९. १९२; Vi. IV. १९. ७३.
--a son of शिबि. Vi. IV. १८. १०.
(I)--A son of विरूप, and father of Rathi- tara; <F>1:  भा. IX. 6. 1; Br. III. ६३. 6; वा. ८८. 6; Vi. IV. 2. 8-9.</F> a मन्त्रकृत्. <F>2:  M. १४५. १०३.</F>
(II)--the son of पृथु and father of आन्ध्र; <F>1:  वा. ८८. २६.</F> a मन्त्रकृत् and of the Angirasa branch. <F>2:  Ib. ६९. १००.</F>
(III)--the son of अनरण्य and father of हर्यश्व. Vi. IV. 3. १८.
--a mixture of ghee and curds as a sacrificial offering. Br. IV. 1. ९८; वा. १००. १०३.

(I)--a son of Vaivasvata Manu. Being appointed by his teacher to be in charge of cattle he attend- ed to it zealously. During nights he kept awake in वीरासन posture. On a dark rainy night a tiger entered the stall and caught hold of a cow, when the other cows ran pell-mell. At this the prince drew the sword, and in the darkness he cut off the head of a cow and the ear of the tiger. Next morning he reported the sad news to the preceptor, who cursed him to become a शूद्र. He however continued to live a life of celibacy, and detachment to things mundane, ever con- templating on Hari. He reached ब्रह्मा by entering the forest-fire in the course of his wanderings. भा. VIII. १३. 3; IX. 1. १२; 2. 3-१४; Br. III. ६०. 3; M. ११. ४१; १२. २५; वा. ६४. ३०; ८६. 1; Vi. III. 1. ३४; IV. 1. 7, १७. [पगे२-390+ २८]
(II)--a son of स्वायम्भुव Manu; <F>1:  Br. II. ३८. ३१; वा. ८५. 4; ८६. 1.</F> killed his preceptor Cyavana's cow and was cursed to become a शूद्र. <F>2:  Br. III. ६१. 1.</F>
--one of the seven seers of the स्वारोचिष epoch. Vi. III. 1. ११.
--one of the ten branches of the सुकर्माण clan of Devas. Br. IV. 1. ८८; वा. १००. ९२.
--a daughter of मरीचि and सम्भूति. वा. २८. 9.
--one of the two blind citizens of the city of पुरञ्जन, aiding the पुरुष in his work; allegorically feet. भा. IV. २५. ५४; २९. १५.
--पिण्डस् or rice balls to be offered thrice for पितृस् and once for gods. वा. ७५. २०.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २५.
--a pupil of जातूकर्ण्य. भा. XII. 6. ५८.
--in the नर्मदा. M. १९४, 4-5.
--a weapon of war. M. १६२. २०. [पगे२-391+ २९]
--of प्रजापति; gave rise to sages and men, the latter with रजस्। वा. 9. १६.

(I)--a pupil of व्यास, पराशर्य and in charge of the ऋग् Veda; <F>1:  भा. I. 4. २१; वा. ६०. १३; Vi. III. 4. 8.</F> was taught बह्वृच (ऋग् Veda). He taught it to Indrapramati and to बाष्कल; <F>2:  भा. XII. 6. ३६, ५२ and ५४. Vi. III. 4. १६.</F> was invited for the राज- सूय of युधिष्ठिर. <F>3:  भा. X. ७४. 8.</F> A श्रुतऋषि. <F>4:  Br. II. ३३. 2; ३४. १३.</F> He took the flating ऋक्स् and classified them into two parts each of which was given to two disciples, Indrapramati and बाष्कल. <F>5:  वा. ६०. १९, २४-25.</F>
(II)--a disciple of पराशर. भा. IX. २२. २२.
(III)--a pupil of रथीतर. Br. II. ३५. 4.
(IV)--a भार्गव gotrakr2t. M. १९५. १८; १९६. १८.
--कश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 6.
--one of the five pupils of व्यास. वा. १०८. ४२.
--one of the eight forms of marriage. Vi. III. १०. २४. [पगे२-392+ २६]
--one of the १६ R2tviks for a यज्ञ; created from the belly of नारायण. M. १६७. 9.
(I)--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १७. १४ and १९.

(II)--(दण्डनायिका): on the first parva of the Kiri cakraratha; <F>1:  Br. IV. २०. 5.</F> just in front of her lay the lion--चण्डोश्- चण्ड with four hands and three eyes, wearing शूल, खड्ग and पाश. <F>2:  Ib. IV. २४, ३१ ff; २८. ४८.</F>
--a name of ललिता; also पोत्रिणी. Br. IV. १७. 6. १४.
--Agni, or हव्यवाहन; known as. वा. २९. २७.
--an अमिताभ god. Br. IV. 1. १७.
--a Janapada. वा. ९९. ३८५.
--a sacrifice whose fruits are attained by going round अमरकण्टक. M. १८८. ९३.
(I)--the kingdom named after the people. M. १६३. ७३. [पगे२-393+ ३२]
(II)--a son of Bali, after whom came the name of the kingdom. Vi. IV. १८. १३-14.

(I)--(also पौण्ड्र): King of काशि; son of Vasudeva, and Sutanu, daughter of काशिराज. When he became king, he asserted that he was the real वासुदेव, and married देवकी the youngest sister of Kamsa. Besieged द्वारका during कृष्ण's absence at night, and being put to defeat by बलराम and सात्यकि, went back to his capital. Sent a messenger to कृष्ण saying that he was the real वासु- deva and that कृष्ण was either to give up the title or offer battle. कृष्ण invaded काशि and killed him and his allies; <F>1:  भा. X. ६६. [1-१२], 1-२३. २७. Vi. V. २६. 7; ३४, 4-२८.</F> was stationed by जरासन्ध during the siege of मथुरा on its southern gate, and also during the siege of Gomanta on the southern gate. Arrived at कुण्डिन. <F>2:  Ib. X. ५०. ११ [4] and [9]; ५३. १७.</F> Father of सुदक्षिणा. <F>3:  Ib. X. ७८. 5.</F> Attained मोक्ष by hatred of Hari. <F>4:  Ib. II. 7. ३४; X. ३७. १९; XI. 5. ४८; Br. IV. २९. १२२.</F>
(II)--a son of third सावर्न Manu. Br. IV. 1. ८१. वा. १००. ८४.
--a क्षेत्र sacred to ललिता. Br. IV. ४४. ९३. वा. १०४. ७९.
--a पुत्रिकापुत्रि of Atri. M. १९७. १०.
--a दक्षिणात्य des4a. वा. ४५. १२७.
(II)--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २०.
(III)--a kingdom after पृथुदर्भ, son of शिबि. M. ४८. २०.
--an आन्गिरस and मन्त्रकृट्. Br. II. ३२. १०२.

--citizens and people of country parts; agreed to Puru's coronation by ययाति in preference to his elders on account of his discipline; <F>1:  M. ३४. २८.</F> of अयोध्या; <F>2:  Br. III. ४९. १६.</F> in the royal सभा of Sagara; <F>3:  Ib. III. ५५. २३.</F> abandoned Lohagandhi Janamejaya for bad conduct. <F>4:  Ib. III. ६८. २३; वा. ९३. २३.</F>
(I)--treated with respect by पृथु; <F>1:  भा. IV. १७. 2; २१. 6.</F> were pro- vided with seats in Mallaranga; <F>2:  Ib. X. ३६. २४.</F> also Paurajanas. <F>3:  Br. III. ५१. ३४ and ३६.</F>
(II)--a पराशर clan. Br. III. 8. ९५.
--the line beginning with Puru, son of ययाति. M. २४. ७०; ३४. ३१; ch. ४९. (whole).
--a queen of युधिष्ठिर, and mother of Devaka. भा. IX. २२. ३०. [पगे२-395+ ३१]

(II)--one of Vasudeva's wives, and mother of सुभद्रा and eleven sons. <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. ४५ and ४७.</F> A daughter of वाल्मीकि and sister of बाह्लिक. <F>2:  Br. III. ७१. १६१, १६३; M. ४६. ११; वा. ९६. १६०-61; Vi. IV. १५. १८.</F>
--a southern country. Br. II. १६. ५८.
--a मन्त्रकृत् and of the आन्गिरस branch. वा. ५९. ९९.
--wife of गाधि; <F>1:  वा. ९१. ६६-7.</F> gave birth to विश्वा- mitra taking the caru of ऋचिक intended for her daughter सत्यवती. <F>2:  Br. III. ६६. ३६.</F>
--see उत्थानम्. M. २२१. 2.
--the fourth पुरुषार्थ, the other three being धर्म, अर्थ and काम। वा. ६७. १२.
--पुरुष su1kta of the ऋग् Veda to be recited before digging a tank. (See पुरुष Su1kta, स्।व्।) M. ५८. ३४. ३६.
(I)--the राक्षस presiding over the month of शुक्र and शुचि <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ३५; Br. II. २३. 6.</F> with the sun in the summer. <F>2:  वा. ५२. 8; Vi. II. १०. 7.</F>
(II)--one of the sons of यातुधान, had five sons, all man-eating ones, क्रूर, विकृत, etc. Br. III. 7. ८९, ९३-4.
--‘not a profession to be coveted’, was the remark of विश्वरूप to the gods, who requested him to be their आचार्य, (see Purohita). भा. VI. 7. ३५-36.
--the office of Purohita; बृहस्पति for the Devas and शुक्र for the Asuras; the low status of, as viewed by सर्मिष्ठा, the daughter of वृषपर्वन. M. २५. 9; २७. 9-११.
(I)--son of श्रीशान्तकर्ण, and father of Lambodara. भा. XII. 1. २३-24.
(II)--the Full Moon day. (See also पौर्णमासी.) ^1 Br. II. २३. ६३; Vi. I. २०. ३८.
(III)--a Jayadeva; a मन्त्रशरीर and a son of ब्रह्मा; <F>1:  Br. II. २३. ६६; वा. ६६. 6; ६७. 5.</F> his अमृत was drunk by ३३ crores of gods. <F>2:  Br. III. 3. 6.</F> [पगे२-397+ २६]
(IV)--the son of मरीचि and सम्भूति. Father of Viraja and Parvata. Vi. I. १०. 6.
--त्रयार्षेयस्; no marriage alliance with पारण an Agastya. M. २०२. 4.
(I)--the देवी of the २७थ् Kalpa became a twin. वा. २१. ६२, ६८.

(II)--the Full Moon day; the Moon has a full white मण्डल by the अप्यायित of the sun; <F>1:  वा. ५०. २००; ५२. ५९; Vi. II. 8. ८०.</F> at the end of the कृष्ण and शुक्ल paks2as. <F>2:  वा. ५६. ३०, ३६.</F>
(I)--a name of रावण. Br. III. ६३. १९६; वा. ८८. १९५.
(III)--a Deva in the ११थ् antam. वा. ६२. १७.
(IV)--one of the seven sages. वा. १००. ८३; ९७, १०६, ११६.
(I)--a देवगण; one of the निशाचर Ra1k- षस clans; <F>1:  Br. III. 1. ५०; 7. १६२; 8. ५७ and ६२.</F> of Agastya family. <F>2:  M. २०२. 2.</F> [पगे२-398+ २८]
(II)--a राक्षस clan; <F>1:  वा. ६९. १९५.</F> sons of दानाग्नि and सुजम्घी. <F>2:  Br. II. ११. २९.</F>
--a प्रजापति; <F>1:  वा. ६२. १७. and ४२.</F> father of the पितृस्, अग्निष्वात्तस्. <F>2:  Ib. ७०. ६४; ७३. २५.</F>
--one of the seven sages of the ११थ् antam; <F>1:  वा. १००. ८३.</F> a तपोशयान; <F>2:  Ib. १००. ९७.</F> a तत्वदर्शि. <F>3:  Ib. १००. १०७.</F>
--a hundred in number. Br. III. ७४. २६८; वा. ९९, ४५५.
--an आर्षेय Pravara (अङ्गिरस्). M. १९६. २२.
--a western country. Br. II. १६. ६०.
--an Asura, who got exhausted in अमृत- mathana. भा. VIII. 7. १४.

--a class of Asuras, who took part in the देवासुर war between Bali and Indra, and fought with विश्वेदेवास्; <F>1:  भा. VIII. १०. २२, and ३४.</F> sons of मारिच, a दानव, <F>2:  M. 6. २३; Vi. I. २१. 9.</F> and of पुलोमा. [पगे२-399+ ३३]

--a daughter of Puloma and wife of भृगु the sage; <F>1:  Br. III. 1. ७५; वा. ६५. ७३.</F> mother of twelve sons, भृगुस्, Gods; their younger brothers विप्रास्; <F>2:  M. १९५. १४.</F> son पृचेतास्च्यवन or Cyavana having aborted in the eighth month attacked by a राक्षस. <F>3:  Br. III. 1. ९१.</F>
--a name of इन्द्राणी. भा. VI. १८. 6; Vi. V. ३०. ४९.
--a month. On the एकादशि day is to be per- formed मन्वन्तरादि s4ra1ddha; on the अष्टमि शम्भु is to be worshipped. M. १७. 7; ५६. 2; ६०. ३५.
--an अर्षेय Pravara (अङ्गिरस्). M. १९६. 7.
--the blue colour; of विष्णु (प्रादुर्भाव). M. १७१. ६४ and ७०.
--the मन्त्रस् of the Atharvavedins recited in tank ritual. M. २४. ४६; ५८. ३७.
--आर्षेय Pravaras (भार्गवस्). M. १९५. ३८.
(I)--one of the two best सामगस्. वा. ६१. ४८.

(II)--(पौष्पिन्जि-वि। प्।) a disciple of Sukarma among the disciples of the North given by Indra; taught the five hundred Samhitas; लन्गाक्षि and Mangali were some of his disciples; <F>1:  भा. XII. 6. ७७ and ७९; वा. ६१. ३३.</F> a स्रुतऋषि and the chief among the सामगस्; <F>2:  Br. II. ३३. 7; III. ६३. २०७.</F> his disciples; <F>3:  वा. ६१. ३६; Vi. IV. 6. 4.</F> Udicya Samagas. [पगे२-400+ ३१]
--(see मुद्रा devi1s): a group of शक्तिस्. Br. IV. १९. १५.
--a son of Raivata Manu. M. 9. २१.

(I)--Matter as opposed to पुरुष; could be conquered by one's योगबल; <F>1:  भा. I. 8. १८; III. 5. ४६; Br. II. १९. १७३, १९५-7; III. ४२. ४७; ४३. 3.</F> has the three गुणस्--सत्व, रजस् and तमस्। <F>2:  भा. VII. 1. 7.</F> Eight kinds of; <F>3:  Ib. VII. 7. २२; XI. २२. १८-24.</F> the seven principles leading to pralaya; <F>4:  Ib. XII. 4. 5; Br. IV. 2. २३१; 6. 6; १५. 7; ४३. ७६.</F> also known as प्रधान and अव्यक्त; makes and unmakes the universe; created by the unborn इश्वर; <F>5:  M. 3. १४; १५४. ३५६; Vi. I. 2. १९.</F> is योगनिद्रा। <F>6:  Ib. V. 2. 7; VI. 4. ३४-5.</F>

(II)--the subjects of a king; पृथु treated them with respect; <F>1:  भा. IV. १७. 2; Br. III. ४९. १७; M. ३४. २६; २२६. 6; २४०. ११.</F> acquiesed in selecting पूरु and also Dyumatsena. <F>2:  Ib. ३६. 5; २१४. १६.</F>
(I)--seven kinds, which support the monarch. भा. VI. १४. १७-18.

(II)--usually eight, the eight places of gods, from ब्रह्मा to पिशाच, eight-fold ऐश्वर्य, the eight रूपस्, etc. <F>1:  Br. IV. 3. २७ to ७३.</F> regarded as truth and their opposite as false. <F>2:  Ib. IV. 3. ८५.</F> [पगे२-401+ ३१]
(III)--seven अव्यक्त, waters, तेजस्, वायु, आकाश, भूतादि and महत् enter gradually and bring about प्रत्याहर; <F>1:  वा. १०२. २६; ४९. १८५.</F> also eight kinds. <F>2:  Ib. १०२. ९५.</F>
--Brahmam, the first प्रवृत्ति of ईश्वर. वा. 3. 9; ६१. III.

--(also प्रक्रियापाद) the first part of the पुराण; <F>1:  Br. I. 1. ३८; IV. 4. ४३; Va. 7. 1.</F> contains the contents of the पुराण; <F>2:  Ib. 4. १३; १०३. ४४.</F> is of ४००० s4lokas and represents the कृतयुगम्. <F>3:  Ib. ३२. ५९.</F>
--an Asura follower of Bali. M. २४५. ३२.
--a god of the Lekha group. Br. II. ३६. ७५.
--a son of कृष्ण and माद्री (लक्ष्मणा). भा. X. ६१. १५.
--a goddess enshrined at छागलाण्ड. M. १३. ४३.
--the son of Janamejaya and father of Pra- वीर. Vi. IV. १९. 1.

(I)--the son of Durdama; had a hundred sons who went to the North as lords of the म्लेच्छस्। <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. १५-16; Br. III. ७४. ११-12; वा. ९९. ११.</F> Father of शतधर्म. <F>2:  Vi. IV. १७. 4-5.</F> [पगे२-402+ २३]
(II) (प्रशान्ति): a name of शन्ति Agni. Br. II. १२. २९; वा. २९. २७.
(III)--a मन्त्रकृत्; see Cyavana. Br. II. ३२. १०४; III. 1. ९२; वा. ६५. ५४, ८८.
(V)--a god of प्रसूत group. Br. II. ३६. ७०.
(VI)--a god of the Lekha group. Br. II. ३६. ७५.
(VII)--one of the Mind-born sons of ब्रह्मा; a मन्त्रकृत्. M. 3. 7; १०२. १९; १४५. ९८; वा. ५९. ९६.
(VIII)--the son of विदुष; had १०० sons, all chieftains of the म्लेच्छ countries of the northern regions. M. ४८. 8-9.
(IX)--the father of the यक्षस्. वा. ६९. ११.
--a प्रजेश्वर. Br. III. 1. ५४.

--the collective name of the ten sons of प्राचीनबर्हिष and सामुद्री; commanded by their father they engaged themselves in penance in the [पगे२-403+ ३६] midst of the ocean and meditated on the teachings of शिव given to them; leaving their home they proceeded to the west and in a park near a great lake heard the divine music; when listening to it, there appeared शिव who on request initiated them in the meditation on विष्णु (रुद्रगीता); when शिव left they meditated under the waters for १००० years. विष्णु appeared before them and promised them a son by asking them to marry the daughter of कण्डु and प्रम्लोचा; pleased with seeing the God they praised Him; after his disappearance they came out of the waters and seeing the earth filled with wild growth they began to burn the trees by breathing spiritual fire and wind from their mouth. ब्रह्मा (Soma) interceded then and prevented them from further destroying the trees by offering वार्क्षि (मारिषा) the daughter of the trees in marriage to them; they married her and she gave birth to दक्ष on the eve of the चाक्षुष epoch. <F>1:  भा. IV. २४ (whole); २५. 1-2; ३० (whole) VI. 4. 4-१७; Br. II. १३. ४०; ३७. २७; M. 4. ४७-9; वा. ६३. २७-9.</F> After a long period of enjoyment of life they placed their wife under their son दक्ष and went away to the western sea where Jajali attained siddhi; seeing them steadfast in devotion नारद came there, and was welcom- ed by them; requested by them to be instructed to get rid of सम्सार, नारद advised them to worship and contemplate on विष्णु directly, and than departed; they did so and attain- ed the world of विष्णु; <F>2:  भा. IV. ३१. 1-२५.</F> sacrifice of, when नारद sang praises of Dhruva; <F>3:  Ib. IV. १२. ४०; १३. 2.</F> worshipped for treasure. <F>4:  Ib. II. 3. 7.</F>
--a son of हविर्धान. Br. II. ३७. २४.
(I)--a son of Kuru. M. ५०. २३.
(II)--an Asura in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु. M. १६१. ८१. [पगे२-404+ ३१]
--a मध्यमाध्वर्यु. Br. II. ३३. १६.
--the father of Khanitra. वा. ८६. 4.

(I)--a title of honour earned by Manu and the mind-born and other sons of ब्रह्मा; <F>1:  M. 1. ३३.</F> describes the creator; <F>2:  Ib. 4. 8.</F> anointment of the दिक्पालस् by; <F>3:  Ib. 8. 9.</F> दक्ष a प्रजापति; <F>4:  भा. II. 6. 7; IV. 5. १७; VII. १२. २६; V. २३. 5; X. ५४. ४९.</F> Nine in number, worshipped for the sake of progeny. <F>5:  Ib. I. 3. २७; II. 3. 2; VII. 8. ३८.</F>
(II)--the lord of वैराजक Kalpa; wife गायत्री; son Snigdhasvara. वा. २१. ४१-2.
(III)--the Veda-व्यास of the second द्वापर. Vi. III. 3. ११.
(IV)--the son of प्राम्शु and father of Khanitra. Vi. IV. 1. २३.
--प्रजेश्वरस्; they are Kardama, कश्यप, शेष, विक्रान्त, सुश्राव, Bahuputra, कुमार, विवस्वान्, शुचिश्रवस्, Pracetas, अरिष्टनेमि and Bahula. वा. ६५. ५३-54.
--a तीर्थ between प्रयागा, प्रतिष्- ठान and the वासुकिहृअदा. M. १०४. 5. [पगे२-405+ २८]
--a Mt. felt the prowess of हिरण्यकशिपु's arms. M. १६३. ८८.
--स्वायम्भुव came out of him. वा. २१. ६०.
--the सप्तऋषिस् as दाराग्णिहोत्रिन्स्. वा. ६१. १००.

--the son of भीमरथ: was a दिवोदास, lord of वारणासि; क्षेमक ruined the city and Nikumbha cursed it to be desolate when the king established himself at Gomati; killed the १०० sons of Bhadrasena and took his kingdom leaving Durmada a son of Bhadrasena to escape as a baby; <F>1:  Br. III. ६७. २६.</F> father of Pratardhana by दृषद्वती; his wife सुयशा had no son in spite of her worship at Nikumbha's temple. <F>2:  Ib. III. ६७. ४७-67.</F>
--an अमिताभ god of the स्वारोचिस epoch. Br. II. ३६. ५३.
--the brother of Bhaya, Lord of the Yavanas; consumed the city of पुरञ्जन to flames; allegorically the two forms of fever. भा. IV. २७. ३०; २८. ११; २९. २३.
(I)--an अमिताभ god. Br. II. ३६. ५३.
(II)--(ety): all the senses came out of ईश्वर. वा. 4. ३७.

--the top मन्त्र; glorifies ईश्वर; यज्ञ glori- fies प्रणव; मनस् यज्ञ in the form of Rudra; hence [पगे२-406+ ३२] Paramampadam; ओम्कारम्, अक्षरम्, ब्रह्मा and three वर्णस्; <F>2:  Ib. ३२. 1.</F> प्रणवात्मक is ब्रह्मा; <F>3:  Ib. २४. ५१.</F> is Rudra. <F>4:  Br. II. १३. १३७.</F> ^1 M. ८५. 6; वा. २०. ३८.
--भूह, Bhuva, and Sva. वा. ६१. १०८.
(also प्रणालक)--the water-vent on the पीठ of an image; facing the North. M. २६२, 5 and १६.
--a मरीचि god. Br. IV. 1. ५८.
--an अग्नि named Nabha. Br. II. १२. २३.
--a hell. Br. IV. ३३. ६१.
(I)--see Dyumat. भा. IX. १७. 6.

(II)--a son of दिवोदास; father of Vatsa and Garga; <F>1:  Br. III. ६७. ६७-9; वा. ९२. ६४, ६५.</F> earned the title, शत्रुजित् by destroying the line of भद्रश्रेणीय; known as Vatsa, so called by his father out of love, and as ऋतध्वज by being truthful. For posses- sing a horse by name कुवलायश्व, he came to be known by that name. Alarka was the son of Vatsa. <F>2:  Vi. IV. 8. ११-16.</F>

(III)--a grandson of ययाति by his daughter who with अष्टक, शिबि and Pratardana was engaged in a sacrifice; <F>1:  M. ३५. 5.</F> discoursed with ययाति on different worlds and [पगे२-407+ २५] promised to give those worlds to which he was entitled to; went to heaven with the above. <F>2:  Ib. ३८. २२; ४१. १३-14; ४२. १४, २६ and २८.</F>
--a group of gods, twelve in number, of the epoch of Uttama Manu. Br. II. ३६. २७, ३१. वा. ६२. २४; Vi. III. 1. १४.
--a follower of Bali. M. २४५. ३२.
--a son of उद्गीथ. वा. ३३. ५६.
--the son of कुश and father of सञ्जय. भा. IX. १७. १६; Br. III. 3. ३५.
--the son of Manu and father of कृतरथ. Vi. IV. 5. २७.
--the son of भानुमत् and father of सुप्रतीक. भा. IX. १२. ११.
--one of the names of the fourth Marut गण. वा. ६७. १२७.
(I)--the son of शमि and father of Svayam- bhoja. Br. III. ७१. १३९; M. ४४. ८०; Vi. IV. १४. २३.
(II)--a son of क्षत्रव्र्द्ध and father of Samjaya. Vi. IV. 9. २५-26. [पगे२-408+ २६]
--a son of शमि. वा. ९६. १३७.
--a son of प्रतिक्षत्र and father of Bhoja. M. ४४. ८०.
--a son of Maru and father of कीर्तिरथ. वा. ८९. ११.
--one of the names of the Marut गण. वा. ६७. १७८.
--a son of दिलीप, and father of three sons: देवापि, शन्तनु and बाह्लिक. वा. ९९. २३४.
--a son of क्षत्रधर्म and father of शृञ्जय (सञ्जय वा। प्।). Br. III. ६८. 7; वा. ९३. 7.
--the first among the तिथिस्; <F>1:  Br. II. २४. १४२.</F> the first day after the two पर्वस् in the month fit for अन्वाधानक्रिय। <F>2:  Ib. II. २८. ३७.</F>
--one of the sixteen ऋत्विक्स् for यज्ञ; issued from the back of नारायण. M. १६७. 8.
(I)--a son of श्वफल्क. भा. IX. २४. १७.
(II)--the son of Vajra and father of सुबाहु (सुचारु वि। प्। and वा। प्।). भा. X. ९०. ३८; वा. ९६. २५१; Vi. IV. १५. ४१-2. [पगे२-409+ ३९]
--characteristics of; विद्या, काव्यम्, शिल्पम्, etc. वा. १२. 6-8.
--a son of कृष्ण and सत्यभामा. भा. X. ६१. ११.
--a sage of the second सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ७०.

--rules relating to the carving of different sizes of images and of gods to be worshipped in houses: relative proportions of a नवताल image; <F>1:  M. २५८. 4-२५, २६-57.</F> Speciali- ties of feminine forms; <F>2:  Ib. २५.8; ५८-74.</F> Images of other sizes including राम, वराह, Narasimha, of शिव with ten arms, four or eight arms: defective forms to be condemned; <F>3:  Ib. ch. २५.9.</F> Specialities of अर्धनारीश्वर or उमामहेश्वर; <F>4:  Ib. २६०. 1-२०.</F> of शिवनारायण; <F>5:  Ib. २६०. २१-27.</F> of ब्रह्मा and कार्त्तिकेय; <F>6:  Ib. २६०. ४०-55.</F> of कात्यायनी; <F>7:  Ib. २६०. ५६-65.</F> of Indra; <F>8:  Ib. २६०. ६६-69.</F> images of Mother goddesses. <F>9:  Ib. २६१. २४-49.</F> Pedestals of different images--A pedestal is divided into १६ parts; ten kinds of pedestals described: made of stone, earth, wood or a mixture according as the देवत is made of; <F>१०:  Ib. ch. २६२.</F> The symbol of शिव in the shape of a phallus, the size depending on the size of the temple: made of ruby, diamond, earth, wood, gold and stone according to one's choice and means. <F>११:  Ib. ch. २६३.</F>
--a god of Sumedhasa group. Br. II. ३६. ६०.
--a son of Maru; father of कीर्तिरथ, Br. III. ६४. ११. [पगे२-410+ २६]
--a daughter of Maru and wife of किम्पुरुष. भा. V. 2. २३.
(II)--a son of Upamadgu. Vi. IV. १४. 9.
--a १०० kings; ruled after the Bhojas. Br. III. ७४. २६७; M. २७३. ७१. वा. ३२. ५०; ९९. ४५३.
--the son of वत्सव्यूह and father of दिवाकर. वा. ९९. २८२.
(I)--a son of वत्सवृद्ध and father of भानु. भा. IX. १२. १०.
(II)--a son of Vatsadroha. M. २७१. 5.
(III)--the son of वत्सव्यूह and father of दिवाकर. Vi. IV. २२. 3.
--a Rudra on the १२थ् cover of the षोडश Cakra. Br. IV. ३४. ३३.
--a son of शान्तिदेवा and Vasudeva. भा. IX. २४. ५०. [पगे२-411+ ४०]

(II)--a description of the consecration of the लिन्ग in temples; <F>1:  M. ch. २६३.</F> माघ, फाल्गुण, Caitra, वैशाख, and ज्येष्ठ are auspicious months. The auspicious asterisms, planets and लग्नस् are also mentioned; <F>2:  Ib. २६४. 3-१२.</F> the मण्टप should lie on the east or north of the temple, of different measure- ments. An altar to be located in its centre. It is a temporary structure for performing the consecration ceremony, मन्त्रस् and music form part of the ritual. The image to be then installed. The qualifications of the स्थापक: the details of the ceremony of worshiping the idol, offerings to the भूतस् in all the three parts of the day: worship in the night time; should have dancing and singing as part of the ritual. <F>4:  Ib. ch. २६३.</F> The image of शिव to face North only; <F>5:  Ib. २६६. 4.</F> then Loka- पालस् to be consecrated, and appeased with शान्ति। <F>6:  Ib. २६६. १९-65.</F> The constituents of अर्घ्य and how it is to be offered; <F>7:  Ib. २६७. 2-२२.</F> offering of ४० lights. <F>8:  Ib. २६७. २४-28.</F> ^3 Ib. २६४. १३-35.
(I)--the capital of Aila पुरूरवस्; <F>1:  वा. ९१. १८.</F> origi- nally given to Sudyumna by Manu. <F>2:  Vi. IV. 1. १६.</F>

(II) (प्रतिष्ठा)--capital of Sudyumna and पुरूरवस् on the northern bank of the यमुना, and near प्रयागा; <F>1:  भा. IX. 1. ४२; Br. III. ६०. २१; ६६. २१; M. १२. १८; १०४. 5; १०६. ३०.</F> offered to Sudyumna and by him to the पुरूरवस्. <F>2:  वा. ८५. २२.</F>

--intermediate creation, description of; interval between two cosmic ages; <F>1:  Br. II. ३१. ११३; M. १४४. १०१; वा. 7. 2-3; ५८. ११२; ६१, १४५ and १४८.</F> no Pratisandhi between [पगे२-412+ ३३] one Kalpa and the other; but there is one between the different Manvantaras. <F>2:  Br. II. 6. 2, 3 and १०.</F>

or deluge of all creatures, three kinds: नैमित्तिक, प्राकृतिक and आत्यन्तिक; <F>1:  वा. १००. १३२; Vi. I. 2. २५; 3. २२-5.</F> the विष्णु पुराण adds a fourth kind--नित्य also called दैनन्दिनि। <F>2:  Ib. I. 7. ४१-4; VI. 3. 1-3; 4. 7; 8. 1.</F>

(I)--secondary creation, three-fold; <F>1:  Br. IV. 3. ३१, ११०, ११३; वा. १०२. ४६, ५३; Vi. VI. 8, 2 and १५.</F> done by the ten sons, seven sages and यामदेवस् of the epoch of स्वायम्भुव Manu; <F>2:  M. 8. 1.</F> one of the five characteristics of the पुराण। <F>3:  Ib. ५२. 2; ५३. ६५; Br. I. 1. ३७; 3. २६.</F>

(II)--a topic of the पुराण: at the evening of the day of ब्रह्मा, प्रलय sets in, when the whole universe appears like an oven with blazing fire. Then come different clouds pouring in torrents everywhere (एकार्- णव) <F>1:  वा. 4. १०; १००. १३३-79.</F> Lord's sleep in the waters. <F>2:  Ib. १००. १८५-9.</F>
(I)--a Marut of the sixth गण. Br. III. 5. ९७.
(II)--the son of प्रतिहार. वा. ३३. ५५; Vi. II. 1. ३७.
(III)--a son of प्रतीह, versed in sacrificial lore and father of Aja and भूमन्, by स्तुती. भा. V. १५. 5; Br. II. १४. ६६.
(IV)--one of the sixteen ऋत्विक्स् for यज्ञ; from the belly of नारायण. M. १६७. 9. [पगे२-413+ ३०]
--the son of Vasu and father of Oghavan and ओघवती; <F>1:  भा. IX. 2. १८.</F> the गोदावरि split herself, out of fear of him. <F>2:  M. २२. ५८.</F>
--a ऋ. in the द्रविड country. भा. XI. 5. ४०.
--a tribe of the western regions. वा. ५८. ८१.
--the son of भानुरथ; <F>1:  वा. ९९. २८४.</F> father of Supra- तीक. <F>2:  Vi. IV. २२. 4.</F>
(I)--a son of दिलीप and father of three sons, देवापि and others. भा. IX. २२. ११-12; M. ५०. ३८. वा. ९९. ४१८; Vi. IV. २०. 8-9.

(II)--the first day of the पक्ष; in the bright half, the moon leaves the सूर्यमण्डल and takes the middle place between that मण्डल and that of the moon; the time for sacrifices and oblations; <F>1:  वा. ५६. ३६, ४७.</F> first of तिथिस्। <F>2:  Ib. ५३. ११४.</F>
--a son of Maru and father of कृतिरथ. भा. IX. १३. १६.
--a son of ध्रुवाश्व. M. २७१. 7.
--a son of परमेष्ठि and सुवर्चला (वर्चला- ब्र्। प्।) had three sons through his wife सुवर्चला; an adept in आत्मविद्या. भा. V. १५. 3-5. [पगे२-414+ २८]

--a door-keeper of the king's palace; काल- nemi's arrival is announced to तारक by the door-keeper kneeling and with mouth shut by his hand; <F>1:  M. १५४. 1, 4.</F> वीरक for शिव; <F>2:  Ib. १५४. ३८३, ३८६.</F> characteristics of; skilled, of good personality, speak- ing agreeably, and not overbearing. <F>3:  Ib. २१५. ११.</F>
--of the family of परमेष्ठि. Br. II. १४. ६५; Vi. II. 1. ३६.
--a गण of the पिशाचस्. Br. III. 7. ३८२.
--a class of पिशाचस्. Br. III. 7. ३७८.
--a son of दक्षिणी; a तुषित god. भा. IV. 1. 7-8.
--adding salt to food in the presence is forbidden to the Yatis. वा. १८. २०.
--(Pratyagraha-वा। प्।) a son of Uparicara Vasu and a Cedipa. भा. IX. २२. 6. वा. ९९. २२२; Vi. IV. १९. ८१.
--of the Brahma veda. Br. III. 1. २६.
--a son of Caidyoparicara. M. ५०. २७.

(I)--the stage of the dissolution or with- drawal of creation on the commencement of प्रलय at the end of Kali; then the primordial spirit (अव्यक्त) swallows that which is manifest (व्यक्त): waters swallow the गन्- ध quality of the earth thus plunging the earth in waters; then the रस quality of the waters gets merged in fire which spreads in all directions; the रूप quality of fire is in turn eaten away by wind; this permeates all the ten directions, both above and below; the स्पर्श quality of wind is swal- lowed by आकाशा; the शब्द (sound) quality of which is over- whelmed by भूत and other gross elements; the great souls absorb these (महा); seven प्रकृतिस् one covering the other. Br. II. 6. १४; IV. 3. 1-२१; वा. १०२. 1-2, 5.

(II)--a dharma of the yoga, ruins all विषयस् or sense pleasures. <F>1:  M. १८३. ५४. वा. १०. ७६ and ९३. Vi. VI. 7. ४५.</F> The yogin sees God in himself. <F>2:  वा. ११. १८-9, ३०; १०१. २११; १०४. २४.</F>
(I)--a देवऋषि. Br. II. ३५. ९२.
(II)--one of the eight Vasus; (a Vasava); father of Devala the sage. Br. III. 3. २१, २७; M. 5. २१, २७; २०३. 4; वा. ६१. ८४; ६६. २०. Vi. I. १५. ११०, ११७.
(III)--a शक्ति of काल in the पञ्चकोण. Br. IV. ३२. १०.
--an Asura residing in Sutalam. Br. II. २०. २१; वा. ५०. २०. [पगे२-416+ ३०]
--see पूर्व साहसम्; for being a pseudo-physician one deserves punishment. M. २२७. ६५, १७७.
--a वानर born of Pulaha. Br. III. 7. १७९.
--a measurement; ten अन्गुलस् in length. वा. 8. १०२.
--the index finger used for measuring अन्गुलस्। वा. 8. १०३.
--a son of दोष and पुष्पार्ण. भा. IV. १३. १४.
--a शक्ति on the सोडशपत्राब्जा. Br. IV. ३२. १२.

(I)--the eldest son of कृष्ण by रुक्मिनी; in his previous birth the God of Love (काम, Smara); <F>1:  Vi. IV. १५. ३७; V. २६. १२ to the end; ch. २७ (whole); २८. 6-7; ३२. 1 and 6; भा. I. १०. २९; ११. १७; १४. ३०; X. ४०. २१; ६१. 7 and 9; ९०. ३५; Br. III. ७१. २४५; ७२. 1; IV. २९. १२८; वा. ९६. २३७.</F> within ten days of his birth शम्बर stole him and threw the babe into the sea; was swallowed by a fish; fishermen who caught the fish presented it to शम्बर who asked the cooks to cook it; when cut open there was the child inside and नारद asked मायावती in charge of the kitchen to take care of the child after telling her the truth about it; that it was the re-incarnation of her husband काम; she brought up the child more as a lover; asked by Pradyumna why she was not behaving as a mother but as a wife she explained that she was रती and himself काम, and also as to how he came there by शम्बर's act; taught मायावती the विद्या of [पगे२-417+ ४६] महामाया: he invited शम्बर to battle and cut off his head; then मायावती took him by air to द्वारका the resi- dence of रुक्मिणी and कृष्ण; in कृष्ण's palace, women found the likeness of कृष्ण in him and रुक्मिनी thought of her lost son; to their wonder and joy नारद related the life story of Pradyumna; the couple were embraced by all of them and the whole द्वारका was filled with satisfaction. <F>2:  भा. X. ch. ५५ (whole); M. ४७. १५, २३; ९३. ५१; १०१; १०; २४८. ४८.</F> Won his wife रुक्मावती (वैदर्भी) in a स्वयम्वर after vanquishing his rivals; father of Aniruddha; <F>3:  भा. X. ६१. १८, २२, २३ [8]; ९०. ३६. Vi. IV. १५. ३९.</F> attended his son's marriage at भोजकट; <F>4:  भा. X. ६१. २६.</F> Picture drawn by Citra- lekha; <F>5:  Ib. X. ६२. २०; Vi. V. ३२. २४.</F> one among the वृष्णिस् who went to attack बाण's city; <F>6:  भा. X. ६३. 3.</F> fought with Guha; <F>7:  Ib. X. ६३. 7.</F> went along with his brothers to play and seeing a huge lizard in a well reported the same to कृष्ण; <F>8:  Ib. X. ६४. 1-4.</F> defended द्वारका with other Yadus when शाल्व besieged it; defeated शाल्व's commander-in-chief and did other feats of valour; had a hit in the chest by शाल्व's minis- ter Dyumat and was taken out by his charioteer, whom he chided for his action; the charioteer defended his action under the ethics of war; attacked and vanquished Dyumat; <F>9:  Ib. X. ७६. १३-33. ७७. 1-3.</F> went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse; <F>१०:  Ib. X. ८२. 6.</F> went with कृष्ण's sacrificial horse; <F>११:  Ib. X. ८९. २२. [2].</F> unable to recover the dead son of the द्वारका Brahmana; <F>१२:  Ib. X. ८९. ३१ and ४१; ९०. ३३.</F> fought with साम्ब at प्रभास deluded by कृष्ण; <F>१३:  Ib. XI. ३०. १६.</F> at his death his wives burnt themselves in fire. ^१४ Ib. X. ३१. २०; Vi. V. ३३. १२; ३७. ४६.
(II)--a son of चाक्षुष Manu. भा. IV. १३. 16

(I)--a son of शुनक, the minister of पुरञ्- jaya; when पुरञ्जय was killed by शुनक, Pradyota became king; father of पालक; founder of the line of Pra- dyotanas, five in number and who ruled for १३८ years. भा. XII. 1. 3-4.
(II)--a यक्ष; a son of पुण्यजनि and मणि- bhadra. Br. III. 7. १२४; वा. ६९. १५६.

(III)--the son of Munika, killed his master Ripumjaya and ruled for २३ years; a प्रणतसामन्त, his four successors ruled for १३८ years; शिशुनाक slew him and became king. Father of बलाक. वा. ९९. ३१०-4; Vi. IV. २४. 2-3.
--five beginning with Pradyota and end- ing-with Nandivardhana: they ruled the earth for १३८ years. भा. XII. 1. 4.
--ruled for २३ years with the सामन्तस् sub- dued. Br. III. ७४. १२३.
--an अनन्त and अव्ययात्म; covers the महत्। Br. II. २१. २८; III. ४३. 4; IV. 4. १२ and २०. [पगे२-419+ २६]
and सत्व; प्रधान appears at the time of creation from सदसदात्मकम्. Br. I. 4. 1; वा. 5. 7-8, २२.
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १७. ३३.
--कालात्म, and the origin of the ऋग्, साम and Yajur Samhitas. वा. ३१. ३३; १११. ८४.
--नील (blue) पराशरस्. M. २०१. ३४.
(I)--an attendent of Hari; attacked the Asura followers of Bali. भा. II. 9. १४; VIII. २१. १६.
(II)--a son of कृष्ण and माद्री. भा. X. ६१. १५.
--brought forth १० Deva-gandharvas, all best songsters. वा. ६८. ३७.
--a son of ऋषभ; a भागवत; advised Nimi how to get rid of the माया by means of going to a गुरु and following the path of devotion to Hari. भा. V. 4. ११; XI. 2. २१; 3. १८-33. [पगे२-420+ ३१]
(I)--God of the wind; <F>1:  भा. II. २५. 7.</F> narrator of the वायु पुराण। <F>2:  वा. 2. 2.</F>
(II)--a monkey chief. Br. III. 7. २३३.
--a R. in the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. १८.
(I)--a son of भृगु and a deva. ^1 Br. III. 1. ९०. ^2 M. १९५. १३.
(I)--a queen of पुष्पार्ण, and mother of प्रात, माध्यन्दिन, and सायम्. भा. IV. १३. १३.

(II)--a daughter of स्वर्भानु; wife of आयु and mother of नहुष and four others; <F>1:  Br. III. 6. २३-4; ६७. 1; M. 6. २१; वा. ६८. २२, २४; Vi. I. २१. 7.</F> one of the nine Devis serving Soma; <F>2:  वा. ९०. २५.</F> wife of स्वर्भानु. <F>3:  Ib. ९२. 1.</F>

(I)--a son of ज्योतिष्मत् after whom the वर्ष was named. Br. II. १४. २८-29; वा. ३३. २४. Vi. II. 4. ३६.
(II)--the father of Soma through मद्रा. Br. III. 8. ७६.
(III)--one of the २० Sutapa गणस्. Br. IV. 1. १४; वा. १००. १४.

(IV)--the Sun and consort of प्रभा who left him for Soma; image of; one wheel and seven horses; दण्डि and Pingala are the door-keepers; धाता with the pen in his hand; the charioteer, अरुण. M. २३. २५; २६१. 1-8.

(V)--an आत्रेय; when सूर्य was beaten by स्वर्भानु and was falling down to the earth, the whole world became dark when the sage by his words was able to prevent his falling down and thus giving light in the place of darkness. वा. ७०. ७०-4; ९९. १२७.

--the eighth Vasu who had for his wife Yogasiddhi (वरस्त्री) the sister of बृहस्पति; their son was विश्वकर्मन्; [see रामा; बाल्. खान्. २७-35 where he is named सावित्र]. Br. III. 3. २१; ५९. १६; M. 5. २१, २७; २०३. 4; वा. ६१. ८२; ६६. २०, २७-8; ८३. २०; ८४. १६. [पगे२-422+ ३७]
--a son of कृष्ण and सत्यभामा. भा. X. ६१. १०.

(I)--a तीर्थ sacred to Hari and famous for the west flowing सरवती. <F>1:  भा. VII. १४. ३१; XI. ३०. 6; Br. III. १३. ४०; वा. २३. २१५; ७७. ४०.</F> Sages of this place visited द्वा- रका. <F>2:  भा. XI. 6. ३५-8.</F> Here सान्दिपानि's son was drowned, and Vidura cast off his body. <F>6:  Ib. X. ४५. ३७-8; III. 1. २०; I. १५. ४९; Vi. III 3. २५-8.</F> On कृष्ण's sugges- tion the Yadus left द्वारका for good and went to this place, where they drank heavily induced by कृष्ण, and fighting with one another, all of them died. <F>8:  Ib. XI. ३०. १०-19. Vi. V. ३७. ३०, ३८-9.</F> Sacred to पुष्करावति <F>9:  M १३. ४३.</F> the intervening space between the cheek and neck of the personified Veda. <F>१०:  वा. १०४. ७८.</F>

(IV)--a Vasu; married the sister of बृहस्- pati. Father of विश्वकर्मन्. Vi. I. १५. ११०, ११८-19. [पगे२-423+ २७]
--is शिव, the God who came out as a little finger of the शिला at गया; by cutting through the प्रभास hill. वा. १०८. १४, २३.
--the performer of it becomes a राजराज. M. १०१. ५४.

--at sunset the rays of the sun enter fire and hence the latter is seen in the night; when the sun rises in the morning, fire enters the sun's rays and hence the light of fire is not seen in the day; when the sun is in the middle of the earth night enters the waters and hence they are of the copper colour. In the night day enters the waters and hence waters take the white colour. Thus अहोरात्रस् enter waters. वा. ५०. ११२-17.
(I)--a son of Bhaga and Siddhi. भा. VI. १८. 2.
(III)--see Maru. Br. III. ६३. २११.
(IV)--one of the अमिताभ gan2a. Br. IV. 1. १६; वा. १००. १६.
