(II)--the son of नृदेव, of the gotra of the Moon; vanquished the म्लेच्छस् and अधर्मिच् kings; took the form of an अश्व। Br. II. ३१. ७६; ८९; M. १४४. ५१, ६३.
(III)--a son of Janamejaya; <F>1:  Br. III. ६१. १७.</F> heard the विष्णु पुरान from वेदशिरस् and narrated it to जातुकर्ण. <F>2:  Vi. VI. 8. ४८-9.</F>
(IV)--an incarnation of विष्णु. Br. III. ७३. १११; M. १४४. ६०.
(VI)--an Asura in the सभा of हिरण्य- कशिपु. M. १६१. ७९.

--a class of भूतस् who constituted the गण of शिव; <F>1:  भा. IV. 2. १५; V. 5. २१; वा. ३९. ४३; ७२. ५०.</F> evil-eyed spirits; <F>2:  Br. III. १६ 51; ४२. ३३; भा. VI. 8. २५.</F> followers of Rudra and of दक्षिण Agni; <F>3:  Ib. X. ६३. 6; ६६. ३०.</F> of animal and other cruel faces; <F>4:  M. १३५. ३३.</F> fight of, under the leadership of Nandi, against the Asuras; <F>5:  Ib. १३६. १९, ३४, ६७; १३७. 1; १३८. १०, ५५.</F> defended the chariot of त्रिपुरारि; <F>6:  Ib. १३३. ६६ and ६९.</F> put down by कृष्ण; <F>7:  भा. X. ३७. १३; ८५. ४१; Vi. V. ३३. १३, २४ and २७, ३४. ४०.</F> at बाण's capital.
--a sacrifice in honour of Pra- मथनाथ (महाभैरव) conducted by जरासन्ध with kings who were taken captives. भा. I. १५. 9. [पगे२-425+ २४]
--a son of अञ्जनावति; an elephant. Br. III. 7. ३४३.
(I)--a son of वसिष्ठ, and one of the seven sages of the epoch of Uttama Manu. भा. VIII. 1. २४.
(II)--a दानव. Br. III. 6. १०.
--a son of वीरव्रत and Bhoja. भा. V. १५. १५.
(I)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३९.
(II)--an elephant born of साम. Br. III. 7. ३३५; वा. ६९. २१९.
--the eight प्रमाणस्। M. 3. 4.
--the experts in the measurement of time. वा. १००. २१९.

(I)--(Pramati-ब्र्। प्।) (Atreya): of Candra- masa gotra; killed the म्लेच्छस् and the पाषण्डस्; the [पगे२-426+ २८] अवतार् of the Lord in the Kali age; has an अम्श of माधव; went about the earth for २० years surrounded by armed Brahmanas; having killed many a tribe attained समाधि in the midst of the Ganges and the यमुना. Br. I. 1. ९९; वा. ५८. ७६-88.
(II)--the previous birth of Kalki. वा. ९८. ११०.
(II)--born out of the neck of ब्रह्मा. M. 3. ११.
(III)--a son of दृढाश्व. M. १२. ३३.
--a mother-goddess. M. १७९. २७.

--the Apsaras, who bore a daughter मारिषा to कण्डु, and left the child among the trees and went away. Presides over the months of Nabho-नाभ; with the sun in the Nabhasya; <F>1:  भा. IV. ३०. १३; XII. ११. ३७; Br. II. २३. १०; III. 7. १५. M. १२६. ११; वा. ५२. ११; ६९. ५०; Vi. II. १०. 9.</F> in the months आवणि and पुरट्टाशि (Aug.- Sept.-Oct.); in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु. <F>2:  M. १६१. ७४.</F>

(I)--a तीर्थ sacred to Hari. Sages of this place visited द्वारका; was visited by बलराम; <F>1:  भा. VII. १४. ३०; X. ९०. २८ [3]; XII. 1. ३७; X. ७९. १०; M. २२. 8.</F> capital of [पगे२-427+ ४२] the Aila पुरूरवस् on the north bank of the यमुना. <F>2:  Br. III. १३. १००; ६६. २१; IV. ४४. ९८; वा. ९१. ५०.</F> ललिता enshrined at; <F>3:  M. १३. २६.</F> fit for श्राद्ध; <F>4:  वा. ७७. ९२.</F> occupied by the Kurus, <F>5:  Ib. ९९. २१५.</F> represents the nose of the personified Veda; <F>6:  Ib. १०४. ७६; १०६. ६९.</F> a Janapada of the Gupta emperors. <F>7:  Ib. ९९. ३८३; Vi. IV. २४. ६३; VI. 8. २९.</F>

(II)--(माहात्म्यम्): मर्कण्डेय to युधिष्ठिर on; here is प्रजापतिक्षेत्र; people who bathe here go to heaven and who die here are liberated from सम्सार; guarded by Indra; there are five deep channels in प्रयागा with the Ganges flowing in their midst. Sins are washed off by entering its boundary. The goddess यमुना, the daughter of the Sun God is ever present: It is a place haunted by the Gods, Asuras, ऋषिस् and Siddhas; <F>1:  M. ch. १०४.</F> one who remembers प्रयागा from his own native home or from a foreign place on the eve of his death goes to the world of ब्रह्मा. Leaving the heaven, he is reborn as a King of जम्बूद्वीप; gifts of cows, jewels and gold here attain great merit: The giver is born in Uttara Kuru regions and enjoys long life. <F>2:  Ib. ch. १०५.</F> One should not drive to the place in a conveyance drawn by bullocks lest the virtue of bathing should be lost. Giving daughters in mar- riage, and death near the अक्षयवट helps one in going to the world of शिव. One should go and do charities with utmost faith. Here are ६० crores and १०००० holy spots; well- known for a शिव shrine: प्रतिष्ठान lies to the east of the Ganges, and to its north lies the Hamsaprapatana तीर्थ। There are again ऊर्वशीरमण, Sandhya वट, कोटी तीर्थ, and others, all holy; <F>3:  Ib. ch. १०६.</F> by merely listening to the greatness of प्रयागा a man gets liberated. To the south of प्रयागा there is a ऋणमोचन तीर्थ where by residing for a night and by bathing, one never runs into debts. A pilgrimage to P. gives the benefit of an अश्वमेध sacrifice: relieves his मनेस् for ten generations: its circumference is five yojanas [पगे२-428+ ३५] and every step is sacred: the greatness of the यमुना described; <F>4:  Ib. chh. १०७-8.</F> a man dying at P. gets the benefits of a Yogin: the king of all तीर्थस्: P. is again the place where both Kambala and अश्वतर reside. It is the altar of प्रजा- pati. It is more sacred, being situated on the banks of the Ganges. It is the giver of heaven, the personification of bliss and truth: Reading the महात्म्य takes one to heaven; <F>5:  Ib. chh. १०९-110.</F> Here ब्रह्मा, विष्णु and शिव are all present. ब्रह्मा stands on the Northern part of the तीर्थ to protect it: विष्णु is represented as वेणी Ma1dhava, while शिव is present in the shape of a banyan tree. In addition to them, the gods, oceans and mountains also live there. It is known as प्रजापति Indraks2etra. One who remembers this every day attains heaven. After hearing this, युधिष्ठिर is said to have bathed in प्रयागा. <F>6:  Ib. chh. १११-112; १८०. ५६; १९२. ११; १९३. १९.</F>
--a यामदेव. Br. II. १३. ९२.
--a Mauneya Gandharva. Br. III. 7. 2.

--An Asura friend of Kamsa; <F>1:  भा. II. 7. ३४; X. 2. 1; Br. III. 6. १५; IV. २९. १२३; Vi. V. 1. २४; 4. 1-2; १५. 1.</F> in the guise of a gopa, was admitted to the games by कृष्ण's playmates, as कृष्ण had decided on his death. In a game राम was to carry on his back the Assura. While doing so, the Asura grew to a huge size to defeat राम. By the fist of his hand, राम broke his head and killed him. <F>2:  भा. X. १८. १७-30; २०. 1; ४३. ३०; ४६. २६; ५१. ४२; Vi. V. 9. १३ to the end; वा. ६८. १५.</F>

--the deluge: destruction; after Manvantaras; <F>1:  M. 2. २२; १४२. ३६.</F> two kinds--one at the end of a Kalpa or the day of ब्रह्मा and the other at the end of the life of ब्रह्मा. <F>2:  Vi. VI. 1. 3.</F>
--the top hill of Gomanta. Pursued by जरासन्ध, राम and कृष्ण fled to this. Besieged by जरासन्ध. भा. X. [५३ (v) 5]; ५२. १०-11 [3], [१६].

--one of the seven Maruts; <F>1:  Br. II. २२. ३९; M. १६३. ३२.</F> the kind of wind that helps Brahmaja clouds to rain: the chief of the second वातस्कन्ध; <F>2:  Br. II. २३. ९८; III. 5. ८३; वा. ६७. ११५.</F> the clouds controlling जीमूत clouds. <F>3:  Ib. ५१. ३६.</F>
--a sage of the Auttama epoch. M. 9. १४.
--Agni (धिष्णि). Br. II. १२. २०.
--a son of the मुण्डीश अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. २११.
--a tribe; <F>1:  M. ११४. ४५.</F> an eastern Janapada. <F>2:  वा. ४५. १२३.</F>
--one of Danu's sons. वा. ६८. 7.
(I)--a son of प्राचीनवत्, and father of Namasyu (Manasyu वि। प्।). भा. IX. २०. 2; Vi. IV. १९. 1. [पगे२-430+ २५]
(II)--a son of विन्ध्यशक्ति and a great hero: capital at कान्चनक: performed the वाजपेय and other यज्ञस्, father of four sons: ruled for 6 years. Br. III. ७४. १८४-6; वा. ९९. ३७१-2.
(III)--a son of उपदानवी. M. ४९. १०.
(IV)--a son of Trasyu. वा. ९९. १३३.
(V)--a king of the dynasty of विन्ध्यशक्ति. Vi. IV. २४. ५६.
--a ruler of किलिकिला. भा. XII. 1. ३३.

--at the time of creation men full of रजस् attain the भूतस् and इन्द्रियस् through the favour of gods; by the meditation of the Lord the three गुणस् get their respective गुणस् defined; all of common धर्मस् attain विकार for creation; happiness and misery, धर्म and अधर्म, truth and untruth reach each according to his inclination; separation of गुणस्। वा. १०३. २५-33.
--Agni Pracetas. Br. II. १२. २९.
--(प्रसुश्रुत-भा। प्।) a son of Maru and father of Susandhi. Vi. IV. 4. १११. भा. IX. १२. 7. [पगे२-431+ २५]
--born of Dharma and हृई. भा. IV. 1. ५२.
--a son of भृगु. वा. ६५. ८७.
(I)--born of मैत्री. भा. IV. 1. ५०.
(II)--a fruit of प्राणायाम; control of the five winds by the senses. वा. ११. 4, १०.
--a son of Manu and father of Susandhi. वा. ८८. २११.
--a group of eight gods of the चाक्षुष epoch. श्येनभद्र, पश्य, Pathyanetra, Sumana, Suveta, Revata, and Dhyuti, and Supracetas so-called. Br. II. ३६. ६६, ७१; Vi. III. 1. २७. वा. ६२. ६०.

(I)--a daughter of स्वायम्भुव Manu, married to दक्ष: gave birth to sixteen (Twenty four ब्र्। प्।) daughters; was afraid of वीरभद्र and his party in the sacrificial hall of her husband. भा. III. १२. ५५-56; IV. 1. 1 and ११, ४७-48; 5. 9. Br. I. 1. ५९; II. 9. ४२-7; वा. 1. ६६ and ६८; Vi. I. 7. १८-19, २२-27.
(II)--an elephant daughter of the दिग्नागस्. Br. III. 7. ३५४.

(III)--a daughter of वैराज; was given in marriage to दक्ष; दक्ष to be conceived as प्राण and [पगे२-432+ २८] Maru as सङ्कल्प; to them were born २४ daughters, all विश्वमातरस्। वा. १०. १७, २२-3; ६७. २७-8.
(IV)--a wife of वसिष्ठ. Vi. I. 7. 8.

--a son of Nighna (Nimna-भ। प्।) and brother of सत्राजित् (सक्राजित्-वा। प्।): went out ahunting with the Syamantaka jewel and was killed by a lion and the jewel was taken by it: his death wrongly ascribed to Govinda: was stationed by कृष्ण (s.v.) to defend the western gate of मथुरा. भा. IX. २४. १३; X. ५०. २० [4]; ५६. १३-14; Br. III. ७१. २१-52; M. ४५. 3-१८; वा. ९६. २०, ३०, ३१, ३३ and ३५; Vi. IV. १३. १०, २९-39, ७७.
(I)--a son of विश्वसाह्वन्, and father of तक्षक. भा. IX. १२. 7-8.
(II)--a son of लान्गल and father of क्षुद्रक. भा. IX. १२. १४.
(III)--a son of सिद्धार्थ. M. २७१. १३.
(IV)--a son of हैमवती (कृशाश्व-वि। प्।) and father of युवनाश्व. वा. ८८. ६४; Vi. IV. 2. ४७-8; Br. III. ६३. ६६.
(V)--a son of राहुल. Father of क्षुद्रक. वा. ९९. २८९; Vi. IV. २२. 8-9.
--one of the four sons of स्वारोचिष Manu. M. 9. 7. [पगे२-433+ २५]
--a Brahmana line from मेधातिथि. भा. IX. २०. 7.
--a class of पिशाचस्. Br. III. 7. ३८०.
--a son of उद्गीथ, married नियुत्सा, and father of Vibhu. भा. V. १५. 6.
--one of the १६ R2tviks for यज्ञ; issued forth from नारायण. M. १६७. 8.
--a measure of capacity. भा. III. ११. 9; Br. IV. 1. २१२; वा. १००. २१५.
--a son of तामस Manu. Br. II. ३६. ४९.
--a tribe: a northern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ५०; वा. ४५. ११९; M. १४४. ४३.
--a son of उद्गीथ. Br. II. १४. ६७.
--a measure of time. भा. III. ११. 8.
--a son of कृष्ण and भद्रा. भा. X. ६१. १७.
(I)--a राक्षस who was killed in the लन्का war. भा. IX. १०. १८. [पगे२-434+ ४४]
(II)--a son of पुष्पोत्कट and विश्रवस्. Br. III. 8. ५५; वा. ७०. ४९.
--a son of सुप्रतीक the elephant. Br. III. 7. ३४१.
--a son of खश and a राक्षस. Br. III. 7. १३४; वा. ६९. १६६.

--a partisan of वृत्र: took part in the देवा- sura war between Bali and Indra and fought with Mitra; <F>1:  भा. VI. १०. २०; VIII. १०. २० and २८.</F> the राक्षस presiding over the month of माधव; <F>2:  Ib XII. ११. ३४.</F> a son of यातुधान and father of माल्यवन् and others: a राक्षस in the Vaidyuta hill; <F>3:  Br. II. १८. १६; २३. 4; III. 7. ८९ and ९१.</F> with the sun in the spring; <F>4:  वा. ५२. 5; Vi. II. १०. 5.</F> father of Puloma. <F>5:  Ib. II. १०. 5; वा. ६९. १२७.</F>
--a wife of विश्वकर्मन्. वा. ८४. १९.

(I)--(also प्रह्राद): son of हिरण्यकशिपु and कयाधु, a दानवी; <F>1:  भा. VI. १८. १२, १३. VII. 1. ४१; Br. III. 5. ३३; 8. 6; M. 6. 9; वा. ६७. ७०; Vi. I. १५. १४२.</F> a devotee and attendant of Hari; of Narasimha and कृष्ण in हरिवर्ष, <F>2:  भा. I. 3. ११; १२. २५; IV. २१. २९; V. १८. 7; VI. १८. १०, १६; VII. 1. ४१-43; X. ३९. ५४; ६३. ४७-9; Vi. I. १५. १४३-52.</F> Lord of the Daityas and दानवस्; <F>2: a) M. 8. 5; वा. ७०. 6.</F> most righteous of हिरण्यकशिपु's sons, a महा- भागवत and a महात्म, <F>3:  भा. VII. 4. ३०-43.</F> दत्तात्रेय was a tutor: सण्ड and Marka, sons of शुक्र, were his tutors to teach him kingly policy and Trivarga; <F>4:  Ib. VII. 5. 1-3.</F> served as calf for the Asuras to milk liquor from the earth; <F>5:  Ib. IV. १८. १६.</F> one of the twelve, who knew the धर्म ordained by Hari; <F>6:  Ib. VI. 3. २०.</F> at the repeated tests of his father he spoke of the nine ways of devotion to Hari; was ordered to be killed, by being trodden by elephants, or to be done to death by poison, fire or water; all these were of no avail; he was then bound by noose; प्रह्लाद once lectured to his playmates and classmates on the importance of devo- [पगे२-435+ ३६] tion to Hari even from childhood as it is rare to be born a man, and even as a man one half of the life is wasted in sleep and one quarter in old age; once one got into the groove of सम्सार it was not possible to get out of it; so he asked them to aim at knowledge following the pure भाग- वत धर्म; asked by the Daitya boys how and when he got that knowledge, he narrated how when his father went out to Mandara for penance, his mother was taken captive by Indra who set her at liberty on the advice of नारद, who kept her in custody until his father's return. As she was pregnant she prayed to the sage for the welfare of the child in the womb; thus he earned the grace of नारद. He there- fore looked upon आत्मन् as the only thing eternal and all other things unreal; to attain Hari there were several ways, such as listening to his stories, or singing his praise; सम्सार and other objects of desire were to be discarded and any- body of any caste or creed could attain salvation by worship- ping Hari; when this was reported to his father by the tutor, प्रह्लाद was sent for and threatened with death if he persisted in his devotion to Hari. प्रह्लाद was defiant in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु; found in Narasimha the Lord वासुदेव and spoke to those in the सभा, but in vain; tak- ing up his sword हिरण्यकशिपु asked him to show Hari at the post near by which he knocked with his fist; out came Narasimha and destroyed हिरण्यकशिपु in the midst of portents; universal rejoicing and praise of Hari; the Gods found Narasimha still raging in anger and requested प्रह्लाद to praise Him; his praise; pleased, the Lord prompt- ed him to ask for boons; प्रह्लाद said that desires were the seeds of सम्सार and therefore he did not want them; he only wanted to be ever devoted to him; Narasimha asked him to be king and at the same time be devoted to him; and when the time came for him he could cast off his body and get himself merged into Hari; then प्रह्लाद requested for the pardon and purification of his father which were grant- ed; after the funeral ceremonies of his father, प्रह्लाद [पगे२-436+ ५५] became king; then he worshipped ब्रह्मा, शिव and other Gods who all blessed him; obliged to विष्णु; <F>7:  Ib. VII. 5. 5-५०; chh. 6 to 9 (whole) १० 1-२४, ३२-4; IV. २१. २९ and ४७; M. १६१. ७९; १६२. 2.</F> father of आयुष्मान्, शिबि, बाष्कल and Virocana; <F>8:  भा. VI. १८. १५, १६; M. 6. 9.</F> Indra afraid of; <F>9:  भा. IX. १७. १४.</F> a boon to प्रह्लाद not to kill any of his race; <F>१०:  Ib. X. ६३. ४७.</F> praise of by Bali who belonged to his family; arrived when Bali bound by ropes was addressing Hari; and was bowed to by him; addressed Hari; कृष्ण who had promised प्रह्लाद not to slay princes of his line allowed बाण to escape; blessings to Bali; <F>११:  Ib. VIII. २२. 8, १२-14, १६-17, X. ६३, ४७-9; VIII. १५. 6-7.</F> his request to Hari before leaving for Sutala; left Sutala or the great cave; attained final release by सत्सन्ग। <F>१२:  Ib. VIII. २३. 6-8, ११-12; Br. II. २०. २५.</F> परीक्षित् compared to for his pure devotion; <F>१३:  भा. I. १२. २५; Br. III. ३४. ३९.</F> प्रह्लाद compared to the moon shining in the sky. <F>१४:  भा. VIII. १९. 4.</F> One of the three Indras of the दानवस् and Asuras; <F>१५:  Br. III. ६७. ८८; ७२. ७९; ७३. ४१-2; M. 8. 5; ४७. ७७.</F> fought for ३०० years with Indra, but was finally defeated by Raji son of आयु; defeated by Indra in the churning of the ocean for nector (an अवतार् of विष्णु); <F>१६:  Ib. २४. ३८-42; ४७. ४८.</F> duration of rule, as long as that of Bali; <F>१७:  Ib. ४७. ५८.</F> deceived by बृहस्पति begged excuse of शुक्र; <F>१८:  Ib. ४७. २०७, २१०.</F> ब्रह्मा was purohita to God incarnate, <F>१९:  Ib. ४७. २३६.</F> made the १६ gifts, <F>२०:  Ib. २७४. १२.</F> asked by Bali why the Asuras lost their effulgence Prah- लाद found out by Yoga the Lord in the womb of Aditi and predicted evil to the Asuras; Bali poohpoohed and spoke of his prowess. प्रह्लाद predicetd that he would be ruined with his kingdom for having insulted the Lord. <F>२१:  Ib. २४५. 1-५०.</F> Indra of the Asuras <F>२२:  Va. ९२. ८३;</F> of the Vitalam; <F>२३:  Ib. ५०. २५.</F> Maitreya's question on the career of; <F>२४:  Vi. I. ch. १६;</F> tormented by his father for thinking of God विष्णु in different ways; <F>२५:  Ib. I. ch. १७;</F> was administered poison and other means to kill him; शम्बर's hand in; <F>२६:  Ib. I. chh. १८-19.</F> his father killed by Narasimha <F>२७:  Ib. I. ch. २०.</F> becomes the lord (Indra) of the Daityas, and दानवस्. <F>२८:  Ib. I. २१. १४; २२. 4; IV. 9. 8.</F> [पगे२-437+ २१]
(II)--a काद्रवेय Na1ga. Br. III. 7. ३६; वा. ६९. ७३.
--a wife of त्वष्ट and sister of Virocana; mother of त्रिशिरस्. Br. III. ५९. १९.
--the creation of महत्, भूत and ऐन्द्रियक; <F>1:  वा. 6. ६२; Vi. VI. 2. ४०.</F> eight प्रकृतिस् covering this अण्ड at the time of creation. <F>2:  वा. 4. ९०; Vi. VI. 3. 1; 4. ११, ३०.</F>
--the name of Pralaya. भा. XII. 4. 5-6. वा. १०४. ११०.
--is भवानी. Br. III. 9. 1.
--कश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 6.
--an eastern tribe. M. ११४. ४५. Br. II. १६. ५४. [पगे२-438+ ३३]

--an eastern kingdom; the city of of Naraka surrounded by nooses (पशास्); entered by कृष्ण and सत्यभामा; its fortress pulled down; invited by its citizens, कृष्ण entered the city and found मणिपर्वत and the umbrella of वरुण there; then entered the palace; was left by कृष्ण. M. १६३. ८१; भा. X. ५९. 2-5; २२ [1-3], ३२; [६५(v)1]; Vi. V. २९. 8, १४, १६-7.
--a country noted for horses. Br. IV. १६. १८.
--a R. sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ६५.
--son of Janamejaya made the प्राची (east) direction. M. ४९. 1.
--a son of सृष्ति (पुष्टि-वा। प्।) and छाया; wife सुवर्चा and son उदारधि (धीय-वा। प्।). Br. II. ३६. ९८-100; वा. ६२. ८३, ८५.

--(बर्हिषद्); a son of हविर्धान and धिषणा; a प्रजापति and एकराट्, etc.; married सामुद्री (सवर्णा), daughter of the ocean (Samudra) of the same caste; had ten sons named प्राचेतसस्, all versed in the Dha- nurveda; performed तपस् for १०,000 years when even the wind could not blow; out of their anger came fire and burnt down trees, etc.; taking soma; द्रुमक्षय represented their case to these Pracetasas and offered their daughter मारीषा in marriage to them; their son was दक्ष; <F>1:  भा. VI. 4. 4; Br. II. १३. ३९, ६९; ३०. ४०; ३७. २४-41; M. 4. ४६-7; वा. ६३. २३-25; Vi. I. १४. 4-7.</F> knew the power of विष्णु's योग; <F>2:  भा. II. 7. ४३; IV. २४. १३.</F> a राजऋसि; <F>3:  वा. ५७. १२२.</F> it was he, who made the कुश [पगे२-439+ २७] grass rest eastward and earned the name, प्राचीनबर्हिस्; always devoted to यज्ञ। <F>4:  भा. II. 7. ४३; IV. २४. १३; Vi. I. १४. 2-4.</F>
--the ten sons of सामुद्रि, also known as Pracetasas versed in Dhanurveda. वा. ३०. ३६.
--a disciple of श्रिन्गिपुत्र; author of a Samhita. His son was a pupil of Kauthuma. वा. ६१. ४०; Br. II. ३५. ४५-6.
--a Kauthuma शाखा. वा. ६१. ४२.
--a son of Janamejaya and father of Pra- वीर. भा. IX. २०. 2.
--the east सरस्वती, the place where the Gandharva, Citraratha got his redemption after his bath. भा. VI. 8. ४०.
--in गया; bath and offer of evening prayers lead one to विष्णुलोक. वा. ११२. २३.
--the sage who revealed the previous birth of king पुष्पवाहन to him. M. १००. 7; वा. ६२. ७२.

--(see Pracetasas); the surname of the ten sons of प्राचीनबर्हिस् and शतद्रुती; their history; per- formed tapas as directed by Rudra for १०,000 years. Hari revealed himself before them; entrusting their house to their [पगे२-440+ २९] son, दक्ष and following नारद's precepts attained मोक्ष; when they rose from the sea they saw the earth covered with trees; <F>1:  भा. IV. २४. १३-18; २५. 2; chh. ३० and ३१; IX. २३. १५-16. Vi. I. १४. 6.</F> wife मारीषा, the daughter of plants given in mar- riage by Soma, king of plants, became the mother of दक्ष. <F>2:  भा. VI. 4. 4-5; Vi. I. १५. 1-१०, ७१-4.</F> Father ordered them to worship Govinda and increase the world's population. The prayer was granted by Govinda. Burnt down trees and uprooted them as they were hin- drances to the growth of population. <F>3:  Vi. I. १४. १०-48.</F>
--कश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 8.
--of six Samhitas, attributed to कृत. भा. IX. २१. २८-9; Br. III. ६३. २०७. M. ४९. ७६.
--disciples of हिरण्यनाभ. Vi. III. 6. 5-२४; IV. १९. ५२.
--the driver of vehicles; if he is unskilled, for injury caused by him, his master will be punished; if skilled, he himself will be punished. M. २२७. ९५-6.
(I)--a sacrifice which युधिष्ठिर per- formed as a preparation to cast off his mortal body. भा. I. १५. ३९; III. १२. ४२; वा. ८१. 3. [पगे२-441+ २८]

(II)--a मुहूर्त of the day and the night; <F>1:  Br. III. 3. ४०, ४२; वा. ६१. ७५; ६६. ४१.</F> in the month of पुष्य, the eighth day in the dark half of the month; <F>2:  Ib. ६६. ४३.</F> the tenth गान्धर ग्रामिक। <F>3:  Ib. ८६. ४३.</F>
(III)--a form of marriage; others are ब्रह्मा, Daivata, आर्ष, आसुर, गान्धर्व, राक्षस and पैशाच. Vi. III. १०. २४.
--the performance of the vow leads to the world of शङ्कर. M. १०१. ६६.
--a Janapada of the east. वा. ४५. १२३.
--a judge, to be banished for miscarriage of justice. M. २२७. १६०-1.
(I)--a son of विधात्रि and नियती (आयति-ब्र्। प्।)। His wife was पुण्डरीका and द्युतिमान् was his son. भा. IV. 1. ४४-45; Br. II. ११. 6-9, ४०.
(II)--a Vasu and a son of Dharma; married ऊर्जस्वती. Father of Saha and two other sons. भा. VI. 6. ११-12; Vi. I. १५. ११३.
(III)--a भार्गव and a sage of the स्वारोचिष epoch. Br. II. ३६. १७; M. 9. 8. [पगे२-442+ ३२]
(IV)--a son of Dhara; <F>1:  M. 5. २४.</F> a साध्य. <F>2:  Ib. २०३. ११; Br. III. 3. १६.</F>

(VI)--the अन्तरात्म; it is अन्नम् or food; अन्नम् is ब्रह्मा, etc.; from this grows creatures. (cf. उपनिषद्; also Yajur Veda); <F>1:  वा. १५. १४.</F> one of the वायुस् which determine the कर्म of people; <F>2:  Ib. २१. ४७; ३१. ४१.</F> is जीव। <F>3:  Ib. १०२. १०१.</F>
(VII)--a son of धातृ and father of Dyutimat. V. I. १०. 4-5.
(VIII)--one of the seven seers of the स्वारोचिष epoch. Vi. III. 1. ११.
(I)--One of the २८ hells where those who indulge in the hunting and killing of animals are punished. भा. V. २६. 7 and २४.
(II)--control of the breath, one of the aids to deep meditation. वा. १०४. २४.
--the purohita to be consulted by the king. M. २१५. ३५.

(II)--three-fold: its utility; a mode of penance. <F>1:  भा. IV. 8. ४४; २३. 8; Br. III. २२. ७४; M. २२७. ३७.</F> one of the constituents of महेश्वर yoga; एत्य्।, the control of प्राण or wind; three ways are distinguished; मन्ध, मध्य and उत्तम; the प्रमाण of प्राणायाम is १२ मात्रस्; मन्द is of १२ मात्रस् as also उद्घाता; मध्- यम इस् twice उद्घाता or २४ मात्रस्; उत्तम is three उद्घा- तास् or ३६ मात्रस्; उत्तम produces स्वेद, कम्प and विषाद; प्राण is like the cruel wild animal which if tamed becomes soft; if approached direct by yoga, प्राण becomes disciplined in course of time; having controlled the वायु one can live as he pleases; there is no sin in his body; प्राणायाम is equal to all penances and fruits of यज्ञ; all दोषस् become burnt as it were by this practice. <F>2:  वा. १०. ७८-92.</F> fruits of; शान्ति, प्रशान्ति, दीप्ति, and प्रसाद; <F>3:  Ib. ११. 4; १८. १७-19.</F> practice of:--द्रw in ॐ, pray to sun and moon, and sit in स्वस्तिक or पद्म posture; half- shut eyes; look at the tip of the nose a little raising the head, neck and the body; hence तमस् and रजस् look on सत्व; attaining this yoga, प्रत्याहार to be begun, मात्र--निमि- षोन्मेष--१२ मात्रस्। <F>4:  Ib. ११. १२-29; २२. १९; ११०. १३.</F>
--the सप्तान्गस् of kings; wife, purohita, सेनानि, charioteer, minister, horse and elephant. Br. II. २९. ७६; वा. ५७. ७०.
(I)--a son of पुष्पार्ण and प्रभा. भा. IV. १३. १३.
(II)--morning; born of धात्रि and राका. भा. VI. १८. 3.
(III)--a राक्षस with the sun in आवणि and पुरट्टशि (Sep-Oct.). वा. ५२. १०. [पगे२-444+ २९]
--when the sun passes three मुहूर्तस् com- mencing with the लेख, that time is the fifth part of the day; <F>1:  वा. ५०. १७०.</F> the first six नालिकस्। <F>2:  Ib. ५६. ४६.</F>
--a ब्रह्मवादिनि. Br. II. ३३. १९.
--eight अन्गुलस् by the index finger, ताल by the middle finger and गोकर्ण by the third finger and विदस्ति by the little finger; <F>1:  वा. 8. १०३.</F> ten angula parvas. <F>2:  Br. II. 7. ९६.</F>
--five kings from Pradyota to Nandivar- dhana; ruled for १३८ years. Br. III. ७४. १२७.
--creation from प्रधान or माया (सान्- khya). वा. १०२. १३३.
--noted for horses. Br. IV. १६. १८.
--an Asura. Br. III. 6. 7.
(I)--a daughter of जरासन्ध and queen of Kamsa. After Kamsa's death she went to her father's house and reported the circumstance under which he was killed. भा. X. ५०. 1-2; Vi. V. २२. 1.
(III)--one of the eight योगैश्वर्यस् Va1. १३. 3, १३.
(IV)--one of the ten branches of the सुपार group of Devas. वा. १००. ९४.
(I)--a son of वत्सप्रीति and father of Pramati (प्रजापति-वि। प्।). भा. IX. 2. २४; Vi. IV. 1. २१-2.
(II)--one of the nine sons of Vaivasvata Manu. Br. II. ३८. ३१; III. ६०. 3; वा. ८५. 4. Vi. IV. 1. 7.
(III)--a son of Bhalandana; had a son प्रजानि who was taken to Heaven by Samvarta. Br. III. ६१. 4; वा. ८६. 3-4.
--expiation: of no use to one not devoted to नारायण. भा. VI. 1. ११, १८.
--vow of fasting unto death pratcised by परीक्षित् contemplating on विष्णु; <F>1:  भा I. १९. 7.</F> undertaken by सुकर्मा when Indra killed his pupils. <F>2:  वा. ६१. २९. Br. II. ३५. ३४.</F>
--the हिमालयस्, Lord of the hills. M. ८६. २५, ५७, ५९.
--Pravara Angiras. M. १९६. १३.
--Pravara (Angiras). M. १९६. १६.
--an eastern country. Br. II. १६. ५४.
--ब्रह्मा as, in the fights of Madhu and Kai- tabha and विष्णु and जिष्णु. वा. २५. ४१.
--ety. that which pleases the mind; generally a palace. वा. 8. १२७; ३५. 4; ३९. ३६; ४०. 9.

--of विष्णु; offering of बलि to deities as a pre- liminary to building; varieties of buildings descrbied--मेरु, मन्दर, कैलाश, कुम्भ, सिम्ह, मृग, विमान, छन्- दक, चतुस्र, अष्टास्र, षोडशास्र, वर्तुल, सर्वभद्रक, सिम्हास्य, नन्दन, नन्दिवर्धनक, हम्स, वृष, सु- वर्णेश, पद्मक and समुद्रक; with तोरणस् and arch- ways of wood, stone or brick. Br. IV. 7. २८; M. chh. २६८-9.
--a कश्यप gotrakara. M. १९९. 8.
--a son of उद्गीथ. Vi. II. 1. ३७.

--(also प्रह्लाद) defeated by Indra in war; <F>1:  वा. ९७. ७९.</F> was regarded as the Indra of the Asuras; <F>2:  Ib. ९७. ९०.</F> came after Hira- ण्यकशिपु and Bali. <F>3:  Ib. ९८. ४१, ८१.</F> [पगे२-447+ ३९]
--a name of ललिता; मन्त्रिनी. Br. IV. १७. ३४, ४३; ३१. १०५.
--a Bhavya god. Br. II. ३६. ७२.
--a son of तामस Manu. Br. II. ३६. ४९; वा. ६२. ४३.
--an Apsaras. वा. ६९. 4.
--a Brahmana belonging to the अजमीढ family. भा. IX. २१. २१.

(I)--one of the two sons of स्वायम्भुव Manu and an अम्श of Vasudeva; <F>1:  भा. III. १२. ५५; २१. 2; IV. 1. 9; XI. 2. १५; IV. 8. 7; M. 4. ३४; वा. ३३. 6; ५७. ५७; Vi. I. 7. १८.</F> married two wives Bar- हिष्मती daughter of विश्वकर्मन् and another; had ten sons and a daughter through his first wife; among whom were two sons आग्निध्र and Manu Uttama; through the second wife he had three sons, all rulers of Manvantaras; though a भागवत and devoted to नारद, in obedience to his father's wishes remained a house-holder and administered his king- dom; three of the ten sons by the first wife महावीर, Kavi and Savana remained bachelors all through life; ruled for eleven अर्बुद years; possessed superhuman powers; he fol- lowed the sun by making seven circuits, determined to make night also day; these seven circuits resulted in the formation of seven seas and seven continents of which his sons became rulers; gave his daughter to उशनस्; following the foot- steps of नारद he classified the land fixing rivers, moun- tains and forests as boundaries; <F>2:  भा. V. 1. (whole); १६. 2; VIII. 1. २३; XI. 2. १५;</F> founder of a glorious line; his descendents; <F>3:  Ib. V. 6. १४; ch. १५ (whole).</F> obliged to विष्णु; <F>4:  Ib. IV. २१. २८; ३१. २६; Br. II. १४. 6; २९. ६३; ३०. ३९; ३६. ६५; Vi. III. 1. २४-5.</F> went to heaven by तपस्। <F>5:  M. १४३. ३८; Vi. I. ११. 1.</F> Married the daughter of Kardama and had two [पगे२-448+ २४] daughters, सम्रात् and कुक्षी besides ten sons; to this line belong the Manus, स्वारोचिष, Uttama, तामस and Raivata. <F>6:  Ib. II. 1. 3-6.</F>
(II)--a son of शतरूपा. Br. I. 1. ५७; वा. ६२. ५९.
(III)--a son of वैराज Manu; <F>1:  Br. II. 9. ४१; वा. 1. ६६; १०. १६.</F> married काम्या; <F>2:  Ib. २८. २८.</F> had ten sons and two daughters. <F>3:  Br. II. ११. ३३.</F>
(IV)--a god of the आद्या group. Br. II. ३६. 69
(V)--heard the विष्णु पुराण from ऋभु and narrated it to भागुरि. Vi. VI. 8. ४३.
--the dynasties of Priyavrata; स्वारो- चिष, Uttama, तामस, and Raivata Manus. वा. ६२. ५६.
--a daughter of दक्ष. वा. 1. १२२.
(I)--a कला of the moon. Br. IV. ३५. ९२.
(II)--a कला of विष्णु. Br. IV. ३५. ९५.
--a vow in honour of Hari. M. १०१. 6.
(I)--a wife of the God of Love, the other being Rati; was in her previous birth a courtesan, Anangavati who observed विभूतिद्वादशीव्रतम्। M. १००. ३२.

(II)--a daughter of दक्ष and wife of Pulastya; <F>1:  वा. १०. २७, ३१; २८. २२; Vi. I. 7. २५.</F> mother of three sons, दानाग्नि, देवबाहु and Atri; <F>2:  Br. II. 9. ५२, ५५; ११. २६.</F> also son Dattoli (वि। प्।). <F>3:  Vi. I. १०. 9.</F>
(III)--a wife of Angirasa. Vi. I. 7. 7.
--death pollution for ten days for Brah- manas, १२ for क्षत्रियस्, १५ for वैश्यस् and one month for शूद्रस्. Vi. III. १३. १८-19.
--funeral rites described. Vi. III. १३. 7-१६.
--महालय lasting for fifteen days. वा. ८३. ४१.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १९.

--is Yama: once he asked a certain merchant to take all his wealth and spend (5/6) of it at गया for श्राद्ध in his name; and (1/6) for himself for doing the Karma; so he did and the Preta got released from the bondage of सम्सार। वा. ११२. १५-20; Vi. V. २३. ४४.
--the world of the dead. वा. ११०. ४४.
--a part of the शिला at गया where पिण्ड is offered to the dead; here is प्रेतकुण्ड; <F>1:  वा. १०८. १५, ६७.</F> here Pretas receive offering; on the head of गया. <F>2:  Ib. ११०. ६६.</F>
--spirits harassing children. भा. II. 6. ४३; १०. ३८; VI. 8. २५; X. 6. २७; ६३. ११; XI. १०. २८.
--is शिव: he who finds his abode among the graves. वा. ३०. १४१.
--the form taken by अच्छोदा- matsya गन्धी; on the earth she is known as सत्यवती and in the पितृलोक As2t2aka1; <F>1:  M. १४. १८-9.</F> the month of प्रौष्ठपद. <F>2:  Ib. ५३. ५२.</F>

(I)--the lord of forest trees; acted calf for trees to milk the cow-earth; sticks of this tree to be used in ceremonies connected with the कृष्णाष्टमिव्रतम् and the digging of tanks. <F>2:  Ib. ५६. 7; ५८. १०.</F> ^1 M. 8. 8; १०. २८; [पगे२-451+ ३३]
(II)--a son of दारुक; an अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १९६.
(III)--a continent; a part of किम्पुरुष equal to Nandana; there is a प्लक्ष tree here. वा. ३३. ११; ४६. 4.
--a sacred tank in कुरुक्षेत्र where played the Apsarasas; and ऊर्वशी was found by पुरूरवस् among them. वा. ९१. ३२-3.

--twice as broad as the जम्बूद्वीप and thrice its width and in circumference; Agni, the God of fire shines there; its first ruler Idhmajihva divided it among his seven sons after whose names the countries became known; there are several rivers and (seven वा प्।) mountains; people are engaged in sun worship; surrounded by the sea of sugar-cane juice (salt ocean वा। प्।); people here live to an age of ५००० (0) years and enjoy always the felicities of the त्रेतायुग wealth, health, etc; in its midst is the प्लक्ष tree sacred to शिव. <F>1:  भा. V. 1. ३२; २०. 1-7; Br. II. १४. ११-15; १९. 1-३१, १३८; वा. ४९. 1-२८.</F> Another version--one of the nine continents, मेधातिथि being the first king. Divided it among his seven sons, named as शन्तहय, शिशिर, Sukhadeya, आनन्द, शिव, क्षेमक, and Dhruva. Gomeda was one of its seven mountains. The four castes are named अर्यक, कुररा, विदिश्य and भाविन। विष्णु resides here as Soma. <F>2:  Vi. II. 1. १२; 2. 5; 4. 2-२०.</F>
--a sacred spot for श्राद्ध; on the सरस्वती. Br. III. १३. ६९.
--an eastern country. Br. II. १६. ५३.
--ducks born of शुचि. M. 6. ३२.
--नागकन्यस्. Br. IV. ३८. ३५.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ७८.
--the observance of the vow leads one to the world of विष्णु M. १०१. ६२.
--in the सप्तमी of the मार्गशीर्ष month in honour of the Sun God; he who does this goes to the world of सूर्य. M. ७६. 1.
--a Pravara (Angiras). M. १९६. १६.

--a king of अयोध्या, defeated by ताल- jangha: settled in the forest near Aurva's hermitage follow- ed by his pregnant wife. After his death was born the future Sagara in the hermitage. Br. III. ४७. ७६. [पगे२-453+ २९]
--the name of an asterism. वा. ८२. 6.
--a brother of बलाहक and a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २४. 9 and ४८.
(I)--the अमावास्य in the month of, (March- April); a मन्वन्तरादि for श्राद्ध. M. १७. 7.
(II)--(also फल्गुण) sacred to Hari; visited by बलराम. भा. VII. १४. ३१; X. ७९. १८.
(III)--another name of Arjuna. Vi. V. ३७. 2; ३८. ३५.
(I)--sacred to the planet Guru: श्राद्ध per- formed that day, gives one beauty of form. Br. II. २४. १३२; III. १८. 6; वा. २३. १०७; ५३. १०७.

(II)--the month of, good for the gift of the लिङ्ग पुराण; <F>1:  M. ५३. ३८.</F> महादेव to be worshipped in the month of, by the person who observes कृष्णाष्टमीव्रत; <F>2:  Ib. ५६. 2.</F> पन्च- गव्य to be taken in this month while observing सौभाग्य- शयनव्रत। <F>3:  Ib. ६०. ३६.</F>
--a class of seers; <F>1:  भा. III. १२. ४३.</F> भार्गव-gotraka1ras. <F>2:  M. १९५. २१.</F> [पगे२-454+ २०]

(I)--an Asura; a son of Andhaka and brother of आडि; <F>1:  M. १५६. १२.</F> friend of Kamsa; seized कृष्ण in the guise of a crane; was torn to death. <F>2:  भा. X. 2. 1; ११. ४८-52; १२. १४; २६. 8; ४३. ३०; ४६. २६.</F>
(II)--a son of मणिवर. वा. ६९. १६०.
--sons of वृत्र and who became followers of Mahendra. Br. III. 6. ३६.
--one who practises a deceitful vow. M. ९५. ३०.
--sister of Baka, the asura. भा. X. १२. १४.
--a R. from the Sahya hills. Br. II. १६. ३४. [पगे२-455+ ३१]
(I)--a R. from the ऋक्ष hill. Br. II. १६. ३१.
(II)--a R. from the Mahendra hill. Br. II. १६. ३७.
--a tribe that attained kingship by the efforts of विश्वस्फतिक. Vi. IV. २४. ६२.
--a wife of the Sun god; mother of the अश्विन्स्. भा. VIII. १३. 9, १०.

--आश्रम at, sacred to Nara-नारायण in Gan- धमादन; the place where Hari is said to perform तपस् for the welfare of the world; visited by कृष्ण; as directed by कृष्ण on the eve of his departure to Heaven, Uddhava made it his abode; <F>1:  भा. III. 4. 4, २२, ३२; VII. ११. 6; X. ६६[13]; XI. 4. 7; २९. ४१, ४७; XII. 9. 7; Br. III. २५. ६७; Vi. V. ३७. ३४.</F> Kakudmi spent the evening of his life at that place. <F>2:  भा. IX. 3. ३६</F> See बद्रिका. Here Mucukunda performed तपस् meditating on Hari. <F>3:  Ib. X. ५२. 4.</F> See बदरियाश्रम. A तीर्थ sacred to ऊर्वशी; <F>4:  M. १३. ४९.</F> sacred to the पितृस्; <F>5:  Ib. २२. ७३.</F> आश्रम where Mitra and वरुण performed penance. <F>6:  Ib. २०१. २४.</F>
--the sages of, visited द्वारका. भा. X. ९०. २८[5].
--see Badari; <F>1:  भा. X. ५२. 4.</F> in the the ब्रह्मरन्ध्र of the personified Veda. <F>2:  वा. १०४. ७८.</F> [पगे२-456+ २६]
--the name of the द्वीप where बादरायण was born. M. १४. १६.
hence called so. वा. १०२. ७६.
--a Mt. which entered the sea for fear of Indra. M. १२१. ७४.
--(also बन्ध्यश्व) the first son of Mud- gala and a ब्रह्मिष्ठ through इन्द्रसेना; his wife मेनका, gave birth to a मिथुन, दिवोदास and अहल्या. वा. ९९. २००-1.
--the place of Budha in the मण्डलम्. वा. ५३. ७४.
--three, प्राकृत, वैकारिक and दक्षिण, which have their origin in ignorance. वा. १०२. ५९, ६०.
--jail; escaping from and letting one to do so will be punished; <F>1:  M. २२७. २०८-10.</F> also बन्धस्थानम्। <F>2:  Ib. २५६. ३५.</F>
--the guardian of prisons. वा. १०१. १५४.
(I)--the son of Vegavat and father of तृण- bindu. भा. IX. 2. ३०. [पगे२-457+ २७]
(II)--a God of one of the ten branches of the रोहीता gan2a. Br. IV. 1. ८५. वा. १००. ९०.
--son of कुशाल (कुनाल-वा। प्।) (Mau- rya)--ruled for 8 years. Br. III. ७४. १४६. वा. ९९. ३३३.
(I)--a son of Kevala and father of Vegavat. भा. IX. 2. ३०; Br. III. 8. ३६; ६१. 9; वा. ८६. १४; Vi. IV. 1. ४३-4.
(II)--a son of भन्गकार and नरा; <F>1:  Br. III. ७१. ८६-88.</F> killed by अक्रूर. ^2 वा. ९६. ८५.
--a disciple of शौनक; <F>1:  वा. ६१. ५३.</F> of कौशिकगोत्र. <F>2:  Ib. ९१. ९९.</F>
--काश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 7.
(I)--one of the two sons of Druhyu and father of Setu (Ripu-ब्र्। प्।) भा. IX. २३. १४; Br. III. ७४. 7; वा. ९९. 7; Vi. IV. १७. 1-2.
(II)--a son of रोमपाद; (लोमपाद-ब्र्। प्।) and father of कृति. भा. IX. २४. 2; Br. III. ७०. ३८; Vi. IV. १२. ३९.
(III)--a disciple of शुनक (शौनक-ब्र्। प्।, वि। प्।) who taught him a सम्हिता. भा. XII. 7. 3; Br. II. ३५. ६०; Vi. III, 6. १२. [पगे२-458+ २८]

(IV)--a son of देववृध and गान्धिनी; the best among men; righteous and truthful; a महारथ of the सात्वतस्; through his precept and that of his father, several thousands attained immortality; <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. 9-११; वा. ९६. १५; Vi. IV. १३. 3-6, १०७; M. ४४. ५६-60.</F> performed sacrifices and lavished gifts; got the jewel Syamantaka and gave it to कृष्ण, to be returned by the latter. <F>2:  Br. III. ७१. १३, ८१-2, ९६ and ९८.</F>
(V)--a son of सम्पाति. M. 6. ३५.
--of कौशिक gotra. Br. III. ६६. ७१.
(I)--a son of Arjuna and उलूपि, the daughter of the king of मणिपुर; became a पुत्रिकापुत्र. भा. IX. २२. ३२; Vi. IV. २०. ५०.
(II)--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८५.
--a tribe to be conquered by Kalki. Br. III. ७३. १०८.

--people of the northern kingdom; a forest tribe; defeated by the Sagaras; <F>1:  भा. IX. 8. 5; Br. II. १६. ४९, ६५; १८. ४४; ३१. ८३; M. १२१. ४७; १४४. ५७; वा. ४५. ११८; ४७. ४२; ५८. ८३; ९८. १०८.</F> ineligible for श्राद्ध. <F>2:  M. १६. १६; १२१. ४३, ४५.</F> [पगे२-459+ २६]
--a son of अट्टहास, an अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १९३.
--(Barbaras) the kingdom of. M. १२१. ४७; १४४. ५७.
--(वर्हनाश्व-ब्र्। प्।); son of Nikumbha and father of कृशाश्व. भा. IX. 6. २५.
--the son of बृहद्राज and father of कृतम्जय. भा. IX. १२. १३.
--a son of Sagara. Br. III. ६३. १४७; वा. ८८. १४९.
--a group of islands in the south of भा- रतवर्ष. वा. ४८. १२.
--a bunch of peacock's feathers as paraphernalia of a naked ascetic; विष्णु-Ma1ya1moha appear- ed in this form before the Asuras. Vi. III. १८. 2.
--काश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 4.

(also प्राचीनबर्हिष)--a son of हविर्धान; married शतद्रुती, a well accomplished daughter of Samu- dra under directions from ब्रह्मा; Agni conceived a passion for her as he conceived for शुकी; by शतद्रुती, Bar- हिषद् had ten sons who were collectively known as प्राचे- tasas; being versed in the Vedic lore he continued to per- [पगे२-460+ ३१] form Vedic sacrifices always; <F>1:  भा. IV. २४. 8-१३.</F> नारद called on him and in imparting आत्मतत्व by saying there was no use of killing animals in sacrifices, narrated to him the legend of पुरञ्- jana; the interpretation of the legend of पुरञ्जन by नारद himself and the relation between जीव and पर- मात्म which it conveyed; नारद's return to Siddhaloka; the sage-king appointed his sons to be in charge of the admi- nistration and withdrew for तपस् to Kapila's hermitage where he attained मोक्ष। <F>2:  Ib. IV. २५. 3-६२; chh. २६-29.</F>
(I)--a sacred fire. भा. IV. 1. ६३.

(II)--a group of पितृस् in the सोमपदा world; such of the householders who perform sacrifices and are dead become this class of पितृस्; are मासास्; perform sacri- fices; agnihotrins; represent the ऋतुस् or months; their mind- born daughters अच्छोदा and धारणी; in the वैभ्राज region. ^1 Br. II. १३. 6, २८, ३२; III. १०. ५३-66; II. २३. ७५; २८. १५, ७२; वा. ३०. 6, 7; ५६. १३, ६७; ५२. ६७; ११०. १०; Vi. I. १०. १८; II. १२. १३. ^2 M. १५ 1; १२६. ६९.
--Pravara (Angiras). M. १९६. १३.
(I)--the capital of ब्रह्मावर्त and of स्वायम्भुव Manu. भा. III. २२. २९.
(II)--a daughter of विश्वकर्म and queen of Priyavrata. भा. V. 1. २४. [पगे२-461+ २७]
--in the वैभ्राज regions; house-holders and यज्विन्स् become बर्हिषद्स्. M. १५. 2; १०२. २१; १४१. 4, १३, १६.

(I)--a son of Maya residing in Atala; created ९६ magical performances some of which are practised even now; when he yawned, out of his mouth came three groups of women--स्वैरिणी, कामिनी, and पुम्श्चल्या who adminis- tered हाटकरस to frequenters of those regions and made them enjoy like Siddhas; resisted Indra in the देवासुर war and was slain. भा. V. २४. १६; VIII. ११. १९-21, २८.
(II)--a son of रोहिणी and Vasudeva; <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. ४६; Br. III. ७१. १७१; Vi. V. 8. 1; ३३. १२.</F> attacked the Asura followers of Bali; <F>2:  भा. VIII. २१. १६.</F> see बलराम.
(III)--a son of कृष्ण and माद्री. भा. X. ६१. १५.
(IV)--a son of अनायुष and father of Nikumbha and Cakravarman. Br. III. 6. ३१.
(V)--a son of शुकी and गरुड. Br. III. 7. ४५०.
(VI)--a son of Dala and father of Aunka. Br. III. ६३. २०४; वा. ८८. २०४.
(VII)--a son of हविर्धान. M. 4. ४५. [पगे२-462+ २६]
(VIII)--a कौशिक Brahmis2t2ha. M. १४५. १११.
(IX)--a son of नारायण and श्री; <F>1:  वा. २८. 2.</F> father of Tejas. <F>2:  Br. II. ११. 3.</F>
(I)--a यक्ष; a son of देवजनी. Br. III. 7. १२९.
(II)--one of Danu's sons. वा. ६८. 9.
(III)--a son of Pradyota and father of विशा- खयूप. Vi. IV. २४. 3-4.
--a son of Ajaka. वा. ९१. ६१.
--see बलराम (also Balabhadra) married सुव्रता, daughter of Kakudmi. भा. IX. 3. ३३-6; वा. ८६. २९.
(I)--a son of Raivataka Manu. Br. II. ३६. ६४; Vi. III. 1. २३.
(II)--a monkey chief. Br. III. 7. २३९.
(III)--a son of भृगु, the अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १४९; ६२. ५५; ६३. १६. [पगे२-463+ ३८]
(I)--a boundary hill of शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २६.
--a name of Indra. भा. VI. १२. ३२.
--a Mother Goddess. M. १७९. ३०.
--a son of नाभाग and father of Vatsa- प्रीती. Vi. IV. 1. २०.

--a son of Vasudeva <F>1:  भा. IX. 3. ३३-6; X. 1. 8; 2. 8 and १३; 8. ११-13; Vi. IV. १३. ९९; १५. १९; V. 8. ११; 9. ३४; १७. २३; १८. ११ and ३६.</F> and रोहिणी and an अम्श of Hari; (also Baladeva, Balabhadra, सीरायुध); the धाम of Hari in the womb of देवकी transferred to that of रोहिणी by योगमाया; on account of this he is Sankar- षण; also राम on account of his pleasant personality and Bala on account of his strength; his नामकरणम्; <F>1:  भा. IX. 3. ३३-6; X. 1. 8; 2. 8 and १३; 8. ११-13; Vi. IV. १३. ९९. १५. १९; V. 8. ११; 9. ३४; १७. २३; १८. ११ and ३६.</F> was bewildered at Baka seizing कृष्ण; became glad at his escape; entered the palmyra grove, vanquished the Asura Dhenuka and his kin and gladdened the cow-herds; advised Nanda and others to keep cool when कृष्ण was enclosed in the coils of the reptile, and stopped their getting into the pool of कालीय; his joy at कृष्ण's escape from कालीय; was carried by Pralamba on his back when he won in a certain game; but finding him to be an Asura in the guise of a gopa, he knocked his head with his fist and killed him for which the Devas praised him; <F>2:  भा. X. ११. ४९, ५३; १५. २८-38; १६. २२; १७. १५; १८. 3, २४-32; २६. ११.</F> his surprise at कृष्ण's holding aloft the Govardhana; was in charge of the women rescued by कृष्ण from शन्ख- चूड and was presented with the चूडामणि of शन्खचूड. <F>3:  Ib. X. २५. ३०; ३४. २०, ३०-32.</F> [पगे२-464+ ४२] अक्रूर's expectation of बलराम engaged in milking; अक्रूर's prostration before him; welcomed अक्रूर in the proper way and fed him on choice preparations; followed कृष्ण to the मथुरा city where he was honoured by its womenfolk; saw कृष्ण's exploits in the city and returned with him to the camp. <F>4:  Ib. X. ३८. २३, २८, ३२, ३४, ३७-40; १२. १०; ४१. १९, २४, २९; ४२. २३; XI. १२. १०.</F> Entered the wrestling arena with the tusk of कुवलयापीड; praised by the public of मथुरा; challenged Malla मुष्टिक; fought according to the rules and killed his opponent as also कूट another Malla; killed the eight brothers of Kamsa with his परिघ; embraced Nanda going back to Vraja; his उपनयन and other सम्स्कारस्; गुरुकुलवास; accompanied कृष्ण in his tour to bring back the dead son of his guru; defeated पौण्ड्रक; while once enjoying music and drink, at Raivataka hill, he killed Dvivida (s.v.) who offended him; returned with the blessings of the Gods. <F>5:  Ib. X. ४३. १६, ३०, ४०; ४४. 1, १२, १९, २४-5, २६, ४०-41; ४५. २०, २६-36; ३७-49; ६६ [११]; ch. ६७; Vi. V. २४. 8, २१.</F> When the Yadus decided war with the Kurus, राम did not like it and thought he could bring about peace; went to Hastinagara and was welcomed by Duryodhana and others; he communicated to them Ugrasena's command to release साम्ब; the Kurus laughed and said that slippers would sometimes usurp the place of crown; Ugrasena was only a king by sufference and hence he could not send a command; enraged at their inordinate pride, he decided to lift up the city and throw it into the Ganges; the Kurus prayed for mercy and promised to send लक्ष्मणा with साम्ब together with a large dowry of horses, elephants, etc.; with these राम returned to द्वारका; <F>6:  भा. X. ६८. १४-53.</F> was con- sulted by कृष्ण; कृष्ण took leave of him to go to हस्तिनापुर; did not like the war between the पाण्डवस् and the Kauravas and went on a pilgrimage; after visiting प्रभास, सरस्वती, यमुना, and गन्गा he reached Nai- मिष where he was welcomed by all the sages; Romahar- षण the सूत did not rise up to honour him at which राम got angry and fatally hurt him; seeing this the sages called it अधर्म and ब्रह्महत्य and called upon राम for [पगे२-465+ ४१] expiation; रोमहर्षण's son was blessed; the sages asked राम to kill the Asura Balvala and go on a pilgrimage for a year when he could be purified; after killing Balvala, and receiving from the sages presents of वैजयन्ती, clothes, and jewels, he went to कौशिकी, Sarayu, प्रयागा, the hermitage of Pulaha, गोमती, गण्डकी, वीपाशा, शोण, पम्पा, गया, Mahendra where परशुराम was, Sapta- गोदावरी, वेणा, भीमरथी, and श्रीशैल; went to वेङ्कट, काञ्ची, श्रीरङ्ग on the कावेरी, and other sacred places; met Agastya in Malaya and came back to प्रभासा by the west coast; went to युधिष्ठिर and was honoured; later went to द्वारका; went again to नैमिष and took part in many a sacrifice; <F>7:  Ib. X. ६९. ३१; ७१. १३; ७८ [९५ (v) २६-7)], १७-40; ७९. 5-३२.</F> welcomed कृष्ण after the कुरुक्षेत्र war; helped him in relieving the earth of the burden of the Daityas; went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse; joy at Vasudeva's sacrifice; honoured Nanda; <F>8:  Ib. X. ८०. [१३]; XI. 1. 1; X. ५२. 1-2; ८४. ५०, ५९ and ६८.</F> is said to have extracted the teeth of the Kalinga king, just as वीरभद्र extracted पुषन्'s teeth; <F>9:  Ib. IV. 5. २१.</F> was killed by his own men, deluded by कृष्ण; his wives entered the fire after his death; was said to have disappeared in the form of a reptile into the sea; <F>१०:  Ib. IV. 1. ९१-6; V. ch. २५.</F> went with कृष्ण in pursuit of Satadhanus for the sake of the Syamantaka; <F>१२:  Ib. V. २८. 9-२६.</F> was drawn in a picture by चित्रलेखा; <F>१६:  Ib. V. ३२. २४.</F> besieged the Kaurava capital when शाम्ब was liberated. <F>१७:  Ib. V. ३५. 4-३८.</F> [पगे२-466+ २५]
--a Saimhikeya. वा. ६८. १८.

--a son of पारियात्र and father of वज्रनाभ (ब्र्। प्। reads this as two names Bala and Sthala, making Bala, son of पारीयात्र and Sthala, son of Bala). भा. IX. १२. 2.

(III)--a medicinal plant; <F>1:  M. २१८. २३.</F> used in the first bathing of the deity. <F>2:  Ib. २६७. १४.</F>
--a son of पूरु and father of Ajaka; a pupil of जातूकर्ण्य (शाकपूर्ण वि। प्।). भा. IX. १५. 3; XII. 6. ५८; Vi. III. 4. २४.
--clouds of the आग्नेय class. Br. II. २२. ३६.
--a son of Ajaka and father of कुश. Br. III. ६६. ३१; Vi. IV. 7. 8. [पगे२-467+ २६]

--eight रथरेणुस्। वा. १०१. १२०.
(I)--the name of one of the four horses of कृष्ण's chariot. भा. X. ५३. 5; ८९. ४९.
(II)--Mt. of the शाल्मलिद्वीपम्; <F>1:  Br. II. १९. ३७; वा. ४९. ३४; Vi. II. 4. २६.</F> drowned itself into the sea for fear of Indra. <F>2:  Br. II. १८. ७८; M. १२१. ७२; १२२. ५५; वा. ४७. ७५</F>

(VI)--the first seven sons of कीकस, and all commanders to lead ३०० aks2auhin2is; started against ललिता's army, rode on the great eagle, सम्हारगुप्त, followed by his brothers who rode on different animals; all of them were [पगे२-468+ ३१] sun worshippers and obtained the vow that whoever would see them would be dragged by their bright eyes and would not see them straight; so they created confusion among the ranks of the शक्ति; ललिता ordered दण्डनाथ Tiraskaran2ika1 to create darkness so that the दानवस् might not see; it was done, but its effect was short-lived; and when they were blinded, their heads were chopped off. Br. IV. २४. 4-९२.
(VII)--one of the seven प्रलय clouds. M. 2. 8.
(I)--a tax payable to the king for the protcction given. भा. I. १३. ४०-41; Br. II. ३१. ४८.
(II)--(बलिविङ्ध्य ब्र्। प्।) a son of Raivata Manu. भा. VIII. 5. 2.

(III)--a son of Sutapa (Hema-वा। प्।) wife सुदेष्ना; a great yogin; had five क्षेत्रज sons by sage दीर्- ghatamas; these were अङ्ग, वङ्ग, Suhma, पुण्ड्र and Kalinga; they were also his kingdoms; these together were called बालेय Brahmanas. Bali got a great many boons from ब्रह्मा. भा. IX. २३. 4-5; Br. III. ७४. २५-100; IV. ३३. ३७; M. ४८. २३-28, ५८, ६८-78; वा. ९९. २७-34; Vi. IV. १८. १२-13.

(IV)--offerings to spirits and in the श्राद्ध; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. ४१०; ११. ३४.</F> incumbent on house-holders; propitiating with, in cases of building of houses, temples and so on; <F>2:  M, ५२. १४; ५८. ४७; ५९. 9; १७९. ८०, २५७. २३; २६४. २९.</F> intended for भूतस्। <F>3:  Vi. III. 9. १०.</F> [पगे२-469+ ५०]

(V)--a son of Virocana and the grandson of Prah- लाद; <F>1:  भा. V. २४. १८; VI. १८. १६, १७; X. [५१ (v) 1]; VIII. 6. २७; २०. १६; X. ६२. 2-3; Br. III. 5. ३१-4; ७२. 9; M. 6. १०; वा. ६७. ८२-85; Vi. I. २१. 1-2.</F> married विन्द्यावली and अशना; had one hundred sons of whom बाण was the eldest; all of them were kings; king of the Asuras; <F>1:  भा. V. २४. १८; VI. १८. १६, १७; X. [५१ (v) 1]; VIII. 6. २७; २०. १६; X. ६२. 2-3; Br. III. 5. ३१-4; ७२. 9; M. 6. १०; वा. ६७. ८२-85; Vi. I. २१. 1-2.</F> other chief sons were कुम्भनाभ, Garda- भाक्ष, and कुशि; two daughters were शकुनी and पूतना; <F>1:  भा. V. २४. १८; VI. १८. १६, १७; X. [५१ (v) 1]; VIII. 6. २७; २०. १६; X. ६२. 2-3; Br. III. 5. ३१-4; ७२. 9; M. 6. १०; वा. ६७. ८२-85; Vi. I. २१. 1-2.</F> carried away the crown of Hari inlaid with gems; was pur- sued by the warder of the city, गरुड who recovered it after a fight. <F>2:  भा. X. [५३ (v) 8-१२]; M. ४७. ३६, ५७-9, ७२, २४०.</F> Indra on the advice of Hari-Ajita sought an alliance with him and it was concluded; they also agreed to churn the ocean in a co-operative spirit; got exhausted in the अमृतमथन; appropriated उच्चैश्रवस् which came out of the अमृतमथन; in the देवासुर war following the अमृतमथन, Bali became the commander and was riding in an aerial car with the Asuras; finding it difficult to fight Indra and the Gods openly he took to illusory methods by resorting to creating fire, storms, rains, etc.; encouraged by Hari's presence, Indra again called him to battle and Bali fell down unconscious after a strenuous fight; taken to Asta- giri where by सञ्जीविनि Vidya1, शुक्र brought him back to life; the भृगु Brahmanas aided him in the completion of his विश्वजित् sacrifice and anointed him with महाभिषेक; receiving gifts from all quarters Bali marched to the city of Indra on a chariot given by भृगु and besieged it; on Indra and the Gods vacating the city on the advice of बृहस्पति, Bali took possession of it and performed १०० As4vamedhas with the aid of the भृगु Brahmanas; <F>3:  भा. VIII. 6. २७-33; 7. १४; 8. 3; १०. १६-52; ११. 2-१२, ४६-8; १३. १२; १५. 3-११, २३, ३३-4.</F> once Bali was engaged in performing the अश्वमेध in the भृगुकच्छ on the northern bank of the नर्मदा. Tither came the वामन Hari in the form of a dwarf and ब्रह्मचारिन्, whom Bali welcomed and requested to accept some gift; pleased with his speech वामन asked for 3 feet of ground, and though Bali offered to give more he declined it; शुक्र knew that he was Hari and dissuaded Bali from agreeing to his request; Bali's resolve to keep his word resulting in his being cursed by शुक्र to lose all श्री; gift to वामन helped by his wife विन्ध्यावली; वामन's विश्वरूप and his [पगे२-470+ ४९] measuring the Earth and Heaven by two feet; seeing the Asuras beaten by Hari's attendants, Bali asked them not to fight; knowing Hari's mind गरुड bound Bali with वरुण's cords; on the sutya day of the sacrifice Bali thought of प्रह्लाद; asked by वामन to show room for placing his third foot, Bali was unable to find any space except his head and was doomed to hell; Bali's prayer to Hari; प्रह्लाद's arrival and prayer to the Lord; appeal of विन्द्यावली and ब्रह्मा; humbled by वामन; blessed by Hari to be the Indra of the सावर्णि epoch and in the meantime king of Sutala; attained permanent fame. <F>4:  Ib. VIII. १८. २१-32; १९. 2-२७, ३०-43; २०. 2-१५, १६-34; २१. १४-24, २८-34; २२. 2-१७, २०-3, ३१-6; I. 3. १९; V. २४. १८; X. ६२. 2-3; ७२. २१, २४-5; XI. 4. २०; Br. III. ३४. ३९; ७२. ६८, ७७ and ९०; M. १३५. 2; १६१. ७८; वा. ७८. १३; ९७. ६९, ८९-90.</F> After taking leave of Hari and praising him duly, Bali and प्रह्लाद entered the cave Sutala; the lordship of the worlds had no charm for him; moved by his devotion, विष्णु once acted as his door-keeper; got the grace of Hari and attained permanent fame and final release by सत्सङ्ग; <F>5:  भा. VIII. २३. 2-१२; V. २४. २३-7; X. ३८. १७; ४१. १४; XI. १२. 5.</F> a devotee of Hari; was obliged to विष्णु and knew his योग- माया; one of the twelve, who knew the धर्म ordained by Hari; <F>6:  Ib. II. 7. १८, ४४; IV. २१. २९; VI. 3. २०; १८. १०; X. ७२. २१.</F> परीक्षित् compared to, for his courage. <F>7:  Ib. I. १२. २५.</F> His queen was अशना. <F>8:  Ib. VI. १८. १७; Br. III. 7. ३२७; १४. २३; ७३. ५२, ७५.</F> A resident of पातल; <F>9:  Br. II. २०. ४३; M. ४७. ४६; वा. ५०. ४१, ४६; ५५. 3, 7; ९८. ५२.</F> anointed his five sons in the seventh yuga of the Treta, and wandered unseen by others; <F>१०:  वा. ९९. ७४, ९८-9.</F> a servant of हिरण्यकशिपु. <F>११:  Vi. I. १९. ५२.</F> Bali asked प्रह्लाद the reason for the loss of refulgence on the part of the Asuras; he discovered the Lord in the womb of Aditi and spoke of his incarnation and the conse- quent ruin of the Asuras; Bali spoke of his prowess and insulted the Lord when प्रह्लाद cursed him to lose all his kingship. He consulted शुक्र as to what should be done if the Lord should visit his यज्ञ; शुक्र said he must be given some choice gift. The Lord appeared and wanted space for three steps. Bali consented. The first and second was placed in heaven and the earth and the third on his head. The Lord asked Bali to reside in the पाताल region and made Indra the king of the three worlds. Bali to occupy the place of Indra in the सावर्णि epoch; until then he was to receive the gifts not given properly, ceremonies [पगे२-471+ २०] done with non-श्रोत्रियस्, insincere यज्ञस्, giftless यज्ञस्, irregular कर्मस् and improper study of the Vedas; <F>१२:  M. २४४. 2; chh. २४५ and २४६ (whole); २४९. १५, ३२, ६७.</F> image of. <F>१३:  Ib. २५९. 1.</F>
(VI)--a त्रयार्षेय pravara. M. १९७. 6.
(VII)--an Asura in the seventh tala or पाताल. वा. ५०. ४१.
(VIII)--a मन्त्रकृत् and of the Angirasa branch. वा. ५९. १००.
(IX)--a son of दनायुष; had two sons, Kumbhila, and Cakravarma; the latter was कर्ण in the previous birth. वा. ६८. ३०.-३२.
(X)--Indra of सावर्ण epoch. Vi. III. 2. १८.
(XI)--an Asura followed by विजयश्रि, king of Amarapura. Br. IV. 6. ३०. [पगे२-472+ ३२]
--a son of कृतवर्मन्, married चारुमती, a daughter of कृष्ण. भा. X. ६१. २४.

--पलाशम् (बुतेश from दोष), अश्वत्थ (ficus religiosa), प्लक्ष (ficus infectoria), न्यग्रोध (banyan), काश्मरि (plant gmelina arborca), मधुक (jonesia asoka ?) फल्गु (ficus oppositi folia), बिल्व (the wood apple tree), वेणु (bamboo); he who gives the libation of first fruits in these vessels gets the benefit of all यज्ञस्। वा. ७४. ३२; ७५. 1-6; Br. III. ११. ३४-40.
--(Balin-भा। प्।) a servant of the कण्व king सुशर्म and an Andhra; killed his master and assumed royalty; after him succeeded his brother कृष्ण. Vi. IV. २४. ४३-4; भा. XII. 1. २२.
--a son of जाम्बवती. Br. III. 7. ३०३.
--the taxes due to the State; taken by kings who offer no protection in Kaliyuga. वा. ५८. ४८.
--a मन्त्रकार and an आत्रेय. वा. ५९. १०४.

--(Kalkala and Valkala-ब्र्। प्।), son of Ilvala; <F>1:  भा. VI. १०. [२०].</F> a follower of वृत्र in his battle with Indra; vanquished by कृष्ण; <F>2:  Ib. II. 7. ३४; III. 3. ११.</F> ruined the sacrifices at नैमिष by pouring down wine and blood; was killed by बलराम at the request of the sages. <F>3:  Ib. X. ७८. ३८-9; ७९. 1-6.</F> [पगे२-473+ २४]
--(Anavarma-ब्र्। प्।); son of Cakora. भा. XII. 1. २६.
--a monkey chief. Br. III. 7. २४४.
--son of Sudyu and father of सम्याति. Vi. IV. १९. 1.
--a son of Sudyu and father of सम्याति. भा. IX. २०. 3.
--a son of Dhundhu and father of सञ्जाति. वा. ९९. १२२.
--a तीर्थ on the नर्मदा, to be seen on the त्रयोदशी। M. १९१. १४.
--a प्रजापति, who married two daughters of दक्ष and had four sons. Br. III. 1. ५४; II. ३७. ४५; वा. ६५. ५३; ६६. ७७; Vi. I. १५. १०४, १३५.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १९.
--a son of Citraka. Br. III. ७१. ११५; वा. ९६. ११४.
--a reptile in the प्रजापतिक्षेत्र. M. १०४. 5. [पगे२-474+ २७]
--a son of रिपुञ्जय; <F>1:  भा. IX. २१. ३०.</F> with him ends the Paurava line. <F>2:  Vi. IV. १९. ५५.</F>
(I)--a son of मेधातिथि of शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २५; Vi. 1. १५. १२२.
(II)--one of the eleven Rudras; son of भूत and सरूपा. भा. VI. 6. १८. M. 5. २९.
(II)--a thousand-hooded snake. M. 6. ४१.

--a king of Videha ruling from मिथिला; son of धृति and father of कृति; a devotee of कृष्ण; felt that the line of Nimi was purified by their stay. भा. IX. १३. २६; X. ८६. १६, २४-37; Br. III. ६४. २३; वा. ८९. २३; Vi. IV. 5. ३१.
--a son of Dhundhu and father of सम्पाति. M. ४९. 3.
--आर्षेय pravara (अङ्गिरस्). M. १९६. २२.
--a kingdom to which Puramjana went by the entrance, Mukhya; allegorically food. भा. IV. २५. ४९; २९. १२.
--(Lekhas:?) पितृदेवस्; to them कृष्ण- पक्ष is day and शुक्लपक्ष is night. वा. ५६. ८७.
--a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३३. 2.
--a class of ascetics. भा. III. १२. ४३.
--the Brahmanas of the ब्रह्मक्षेत्र. वा. ५९. १२४.

(I)--the eldest of the one hundred sons of Bali; wife लोहिनी and son Indradhanvan; had one thousand arms and was ruling from his capital शोणितपुर; pleased शिव by praise; was a devotee of शिव; and became the head of the गणस्; in return for his services, the Lord शिव guard- ed his city; <F>1:  भा. VI. १८. १७-18; X. ६२. 2; ८८. १६; Br. III. 5. ४२-4; ७३. १०१; IV, २९. १२३; M. 6. १०, १३; वा. ६७. ८३; Vi. I. २१. 2; V. 1. २४.</F> took part in the देवासुर war between Bali and Indra; fought with सूर्य and was helped by his ९९ brothers; a friend of Kamsa and जरासन्ध; he welcomed जरासन्- dha, and offered to help him and sent his two ministers and a vast army with जरासन्ध. <F>2:  भा. VIII. १०. १९, ३०; X. 2. 2; ३६. ३६; [५१ (v) 1-१८].</F> Once addressed शिव that he found no use for his thousand arms for there was none to fight him, and even the elephants at the quarters ran away in fear of him; शिव replied that soon there would be some- body equal to him who would put down his pride of power. <F>3:  Ib. X. ६२. 2-११.</F> The marriage of his daughter उषा was the cause of a battle between शिव and कृष्ण; the guards of the harem once reported to बाण that they suspected the presence of some male in उषा's palace; soon he found Aniruddha there and imprisoned him to the distress of his daughter; was attacked by सत्यकी when शोणितपुर was besieged by the वृष्णिस्; found his army scattered and rushed towards कृष्ण leaving [पगे२-476+ ३१] सत्यकी, when his charioteer and horses were killed; कोटरा his mother appeared before कृष्ण naked and with dis- hevelled hair, while बाण entered his city; once again attacked कृष्ण who chopped off his arms when शिव praised कृष्ण as ब्राह्मण and pleaded for his devotee, बाण, being left with his four arms remaining; deprived of all except two on account of Aniruddha; release of Aniruddha. <F>4:  Ib. X. ६२. 1 २८-35; ६३. 8, १७-21 ३०-49; ६१. २३ (9); III. 3. ११; XI. १२. 5. Vi. V. ३२. 7-8; ३३. 1-५०.</F> Capital Tripura. The gods appealed to Rudra and in the meantime नारद made बाण's wives leave the path of strict chastity and prepared the way for the Asuras' ruin. Rudra put the city to flames; appealing with a लिन्ग on his head, he was blessed. Attained मोक्ष by सत्सङ्ग; <F>5:  M. Chh. १८७-188.</F> killed by कृष्ण. <F>6:  वा. ९८. १०२.</F>
(II)--a son of Danu and महासेन. M. 6. २०; २४५. १२.
--शिव gan2as. Br. III. ४१. २७.
--of कौशिक gotra. Br. III. ६६. ७३.
--व्यास; an incarnation of Acyuta; and who arranged the one Veda into different parts. भा. I. 1. 7; M. १४. १६.
--a surname of शुक. भा. I. 7. ११.
--the गण consisting of the grandsons and great- grandsons of हिरण्याक्ष; killed in thousands in the तारका- maya. वा. ६७. ६९.
--a मन्त्रकृत्. Br. II. ३२. १०६.
--the author of a कामशास्त्र; see सुबालक. M. २१. ३०; १९८. 4.
--ruled for १००० years; as kings of Maga- dha; the last of them was रिपुञ्जय. भा. IX. २२. ४९; Vi. IV. २३. १२-13.
--a division of the night. वा. ६६. ४४.
--of बृहस्पति; <F>1:  वा. ७९. ५९.</F> those learned in, fit for श्राद्ध. <F>2:  Br. III. १५. ३२.</F>
(I)--a son of Gargya, put to trouble by Janame- jaya. Br. III. ६८. २२.
(II)--a son of विश्वेशा; a sage. M. १७१. ५०; २००. १४.
(III)--a son of मणिवर. वा. ६९. १६०.
--a son of Pulaka; an unrighteous king; but still overlord of all सामन्तस्; ruled for २३ years. M. २७२. 2-3. [पगे२-478+ २६]
--Pravara (Angiras). M. १९६. १५.
--child education of प्रह्लाद at the hands of his Guru. Vi. I. १७. १०.
--the आर्षेय pravara of the भार्गवस्. M. १९५. ३८.
--a daughter of प्रजापति, fell down upon the earth while going across the sky. वा. ७५. ४०.
--भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २०.
--a class of पिशाचस् short in stature and with eyes facing the earth and who resort to places of confine- ment of women. Br. III. 7. ३८० and ३९८; वा. ६९. २७७.
--a pupil of बाष्कलि. भा. XII. 6. ५९.
--a son of Maya. वा. ६८. २९.
--the goddess following रेवती. M. १७९. ७३.
--Pravara Angiras. M. १९६. १२.
(I)--पुत्रिकापुत्रस् of Atri. M. १९७. 9.
(II)--the descendants of Bali. Br. III. 5. ४४.
(III)--श्वेत Para1s4aras. M. २०१. ३६.
--the क्षेत्रज sons of Bali through the sage दीर्घतमस्. M. ४८. २५.

(I)--a son of अनुह्राद and सुर्म्या; disciple of पैऌअ; learnt the ऋग् Veda and taught it to Bodhya and others; rearranged the सम्हितास् into four parts with the help of his four disciples, Bodhya, अग्निमाढक, याज्ञ- valkya and पराशर; arranged three more सम्हितास् and entrusted them to कालायनि, गार्ग्य, and कथा japa, all his pupils. भा. VI. १८. १६; XII. 6. ५४-5; Vi. III. 4. १६-18, २५.
(II)--the father of Jambha and three others. Br. III. 5. ३९.
(III)--a son of प्रह्लाद. M. 6. 9; Vi. I. २१. 1.
(IV)--the son of Virocana; father of four sons. वा. ६७. ७६, ७९. [पगे२-480+ ३३]
--of कौशिक gotra. Br. III. ६६. ७२; वा. ९१. १००.
(I)--a son of बाष्कल; author of the वालखिल्य। सम्हिता; imparted it to बालायनि and others. भा. XII. 6. ५९.

(II)--an Angirasa and a मन्त्रकृत्; a श्रुतऋषि; a pupil of पैऌअ in charge of the ऋग् Veda; he arranged it into four सम्हितास्; his disciples were Bodhya, अग्निमाठर, पराशर and याज्ञवल्क्य. Br. II. ३२. १०७; ३३. 4, १३; ३४. २५; M. १९६. १२; वा. ५९. ९८; ६०. २५-26; ६१. 2.
(III)--(भरद्वाज) a pupil of Satyasuja author of three सम्हितास् which were imparted to his dis- ciples आपनाप and others; <F>1:  Br. II. ३४. ३२; ३५. 5.</F> a शाख Pravartaka. <F>2:  वा. ६०. २९.</F>
(I)--son of वृक; driven away from his kingdom; retired with his wife to the forest; gave birth to Sagara. भा. IX. 8. 2-4; Br. III. ६३. ११९. M. १२. ३८.

(II)--a son of धृतक (वृक-वि। प्।); was attacked and deprived of his kingdom by the Haihayas and the तालजन्घस् with the help of the शकस्, Yavanas, काम्- bojas, पारदस्, and Palhavas, the five tribes; hence the king abdicated and took to a life of penance with his wife in the forest as an old man. Once he went to bring water when he slipped into the waters and died; his wife यादवी followed him though she was in the family way; she had been poisoned by her co-wife to prevent pregnancy; she got into the funeral pyre. Aurva, the भार्गव withdrew her from the fire; she was in his आश्रम and brought forth Sagara (Saha Gara). वा. ८८. १२१-33; Vi. IV. 3. २५-35. [पगे२-481+ २८]
--married two daughters of दक्ष. M. १४६. १७; वा. ६३. ४२.
--R. in भारतवर्ष originally गौरी, wife of युवनाश्व; sacred to the पितृस्; rises in the हिमालयस्. Br. III. ६३. ६७; M. २२. ५५; ११४. २२; वा. ४५. ९६; ८८. ६६.
--a clan belonging to Rohita प्रजापति. वा. १००. ६१.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २५.
--a son of भजमान. वा. ९६. 3.
--a son of भजमान, married the two sisters who were the daughters of सृम्जय and brought forth a number of sons. वा. ९६. 3-4.
--a daughter of भजमान. Br. III. ७१. 3.
--a Northern tribe. वा. ४५. ११८.
--snow-making rays of the sun. वा. ५३. २१.
--a R. from the Sahya Mountains. Br. II. १६. ३५.

(I)--a son of Pratipa and father of Soma- datta; <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. १२ and १८; ४९. 2; वा. ९९. २३४; Vi. IV. २०. 9; V. ३५. १२, २७, ३०.</F> father of seven sons, kings of बाह्लि Kingdom; <F>2:  M. ५०. ३९.</F> the [पगे२-482+ ३७] foremost among the Kurus; <F>3:  भा. X. ५२. ११ [9].</F> was stationed by जरासन्ध at the southern gate of मथुरा; <F>4:  Ib. X. ५०. ११ [4].</F> placed on the south dur- ing the siege of Gomanta; <F>5:  Ib. X. ५२. ११ [9].</F> informed by Uddhava of राम's visit to हस्तिनापुर; <F>6:  Ib. X. ६८. १७.</F> his sons took active part in युधिष्ठिर's राजसूय and in Duryodana's army; <F>7:  Ib. X. ७५. 6; [९५ (v) १६].</F> could not vanquish Arjuna, supported by कृष्ण; <F>8:  Ib. I १५. १६.</F> went with his sons to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse where he met the वृष्णिस्; left स्यमन्तपञ्चक; <F>9:  Ib. X. ८२. २६; ८४. ६९. [1].</F> sisters, रोहिणी and पौरवी, married to Vasudeva. <F>१०:  Br. III. ७१. १६३.</F>
(II)--(च्) a Northern Kingdom; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ४६; १८. ४६.</F> after the son of बाह्लीक. <F>2:  M. ५०. ३९; ११४. ४०; १६३. ७२.</F>

(I)--a name given to the thirteen sons of the Kings of किलिकिला; <F>1:  भा. XII. 1. ३४.</F> took part in the राजसूय of युधिष्- ठिर; <F>2:  Ib. X. ७५. 6.</F> three of the thirteen sons were of the Nandana family; Ekalas or lords of small regions. <F>3:  Vi. IV. २४. ५७. ५८.</F>
(II)--a class of पितृस्. Br. II. २८. ९३.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १२.
--a Pravara of the भार्गवस्. M. १९५. ३०. Bindu (I)--a son of Danu. M. 6. २०. [पगे२-483+ २६]
(III)--a Kinnara with human face. वा. ६९. ३६.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३८.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४०.
--in the middle of चिन्तामणिग्रह: des- cribed. Br. IV. ३६. ४४; ३७. ३९-46.
--described. Br. IV. ३७. ४४-84.
--a son of मरीचि: his queen was सरघा and his son was Madhu. भा. V. १५. १५.
(I)--the Queen of मरीचि and mother of Bindumat. भा. V. १५. १५.

(II)--a daughter of शशबिन्दु (शतबिन्दु- वी। प्।) and queen of माम्धाता also known as Caitrarathi (s.v.) and mother of three sons, Mucukunda, अम्बरीष and पुरुकुत्श. भा. IX. 6. ३८; Vi. IV. 2. ६६; वा. ८८. ७०-2. [पगे२-484+ ३१]
--a तीर्थ at Benares. M. १८५. ६८.

--a तीर्थ (lake) encircled by the R. Saras- वती at the foot of the Gaura hill; विष्णु let flow drops of joy- ful tears at the place and hence the name; here Kardama awaited Manu and his daughter; its trees, plants and birds; <F>1:  भा. III. २१. ३३-44.</F> Kapila's residence; <F>2:  Ib. III. २५. 5.</F> sacred to Hari; <F>3:  Ib. VII. १४. ३१.</F> visited by बलराम; <F>4:  Ib. X. ७८. १९.</F> celebrated for भगीरथ's penance; <F>5:  Br. II. १८. २५ and ३१.</F> the seven streams of the गङ्गा originate here: formed of drops (bindu) of गङ्गा fallen in anger from the locks of शिव where she was im- prisoned; Indra performed many sacrifices here. <F>6:  M. १२१. २६-42; वा. ४७. २४, ३० and ४१.</F>
(I)--a Kinnara with a human face. वा. ६९. ३६.
(II)--the son of Candragupta Maurya, and father of अशोकवर्धन. Vi. IV. २४. २९-30.
--a son of Bali. M. 6. ११.
--a son of Vasudeva and भद्रा. Br. III. ७१. १७३; वा. ९६. १७१.
--a तीर्थ sacred to the पिट्र्स्. M. २२. ७०.
--the goddess enshrined at Bilvala. M. १३. ३१. [पगे२-485+ २२]
--a place to be attained by pure ज्ञानम्। Vi. I. 6. १३.
--a place sacred to the Goddess बिल्वपत्रिका. M. १३. ३१.
--a place between the hills समूल and Vasu- धार; inhabited by Siddhas, नागस्, Brahmanas, etc. वा. ३८. २३-6.
--a Goddess following भवमालिनी. M. १७९. ७१.
--a भार्गव and a पञ्चार्षेय. M. १९५. ३३.
--from ईश्वर and Yoni; from प्रकृति; from नारा- यण. वा. १०१. २२८.
--a gupta शक्ति. Br. IV. १९. २०; ३६. ७१.
--a follower of माया. M. १७९. ६९.
--an आत्रेय gotraka1ra. M. १९७. 7.
(I)--the son of वेघवान् and father of तृण- bindhu. Br. III. 8. ३६; ६१. १०; Vi. IV. 1. ४५-6; वा. ८६. १५.
(II)--a वानर chieftain, and a son of श्वेत. Br. III. 7. १८०.
(III)--one of the twenty Sutapa Gods. Br. IV. 1. १५; वा. १००. १५.

(IV)--one of the nine planets; son of Soma (moon) [त्विषि (वा। प्।)] and तारा wife of बृहस्पति; known as राजपुत्र; of brown colour; has a lustrous white chariot drawn by ten horses of different colours; originator of the हस्तिशास्त्र; and learned in the अर्थशास्त्र; got the kingdom on the earth; <F>1:  M. २४. 3-१०; ९३. १०, १७; ११५. 1; १२७. 1-3; वा. ५२. ७२; Vi. I. 8. ११; IV. 6. ३२-34.</F> occupies a position above (below वि। प्।) that of शुक्र; generally good and benevolent; but when separated from the sun preced- ing him, he causes showers or draughts; <F>2:  भा. V. २२. १३; M. २६४. 8; Vi. II. 7. 8.</F> enamoured of the figure of इला (इला converted into the other sex at शरवण); in the guise of a Brahmana, he approached her; she consented to be his wife on his saying that he was Budha; father of Pururavas; Rajaputraka Aila; <F>3:  भा IX. 1. ३४-5; १४. १४-15; Br. II. २४. ४९-134; III. 3. २३; ६५. ४४; ६६. 1; M. ११. ५४; १२. १४.</F> in the chariot of Tripura; <F>4:  Ib. १२८. ४८, ६५; १३३. २०.</F> at the bottom of all ताराग्रहस्; <F>5:  वा. १०१. १३२.</F> with the प्रकृति of नारायण; in extent three-fourths of Kuja and Saura; has eight rays; lies above the नक्षत्रस्; <F>6:  Ib. ५३. ३१, ६७, ८७ and ९७.</F> above २००,000 yojanas from the constellar regions; <F>7:  Vi. II. 7. 7.</F> chariot of, made of wind and fire and drawn by eight horses; <F>8:  Ib. II. १२. १८.</F> Sudhyumna, son of Manu, cursed by शिव, became a woman on whom Budha begot Pururavas. <F>9:  Ib. IV. 1. ११-12; वा. ८५. १७.</F> [पगे२-487+ ३०]
(V)--a son of महादेव and रोहिणी. वा. २७. ५६; ६६. २२.
--a son of खश and a राक्षस. Br. III. 7. १३४; वा. ६९. १६६.
--a gupta शक्ति. Br. IV. १९. १७; ३६. ६९.

(I)--the २०थ् अवतार् of विष्णु after the advent of Kali; born of Ajana (अञ्जन-भा। प्।) in the land of कीक- टस्; <F>1:  भा. I. 3. २४; VI. 8. १९.</F> Hari addressed as; <F>2:  Ib. X. ४०. २२.</F> according to म्। प्। the 9th incarna- tion. <F>3:  M. ४७. २४७; ५४. १९; २८५. 7.</F>
(II)--a son of Bautya Manu. Br. IV. 1. ११४.
(III)--one of the names of शिव. वा. ३०. २१६; ५४. ७१; ९७. १७२; Br. III. ७२. १७७.
--the condition of ध्यान। वा. १०१. ८५.

(I)--a daughter of दक्ष and a wife of Dharma; gave birth to Artha; <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ५०-51. Br. II. 9. ५० and ६०; वा. १०. २५.</F> mother of Budha (Bodha- वि। प्।) and अप्रमाद. <F>2:  Ib. १०. ३६; Vi. I. 7. २३ and ३०.</F>
(II)--a तुषित god. Br. III. 3. १९; वा. ६६. १८.
(III)--a son of शतरूपा. M. 4. २५. [पगे२-488+ ३१]
(IV)--a deity, attendant on विनायक. M. २६०. ५५.
(V)--is four-fold; ज्ञानम्, वैराग्यम्, ऐश्- वर्यम् and धर्म। वा. 4. ३४; ५९. ७४.
(VI)--a term for mahat. वा. १०२. २१.
--a मण्टप with ५४ pillars. M. २७०. 3 and 9.
--the ear, the skin, the eyes, the tongue and the nose; to attain knowledge. वा. 4. ६०, ६२.
--a R. from the हिमालयस्. Br. II. १६. २६.

--the Gopas left बृहद्वन and settled here as it was quite suitable for their cattle; nearby was Govardhana as also the यमुना; <F>1:  भा. X. ११. २८, ३६.</F> Agha's form as a boa- constrictor mistaken for the landscape of बृन्दावन by the cowherd boys; his skin used as an artificial cavern by the cowherds; <F>2:  Ib. IX. १४. 4; M. २३. ३०, ४७; २६. 3; वा. ६५. १०३; ७०. 4; ७६. 1 and २५; Vi. IV. 6. १०.</F> had sexual [पगे२-501+ ५२] intercourse with Mamata (brother's wife), when she was pregnant; cursed the baby in the womb for obstructing the entry of his semen. भरद्वाज was born who was brought up by the Maruts; <F>4:  भा. IX. २०. ३६-9; M. ४८. ३३-41; ४९. १५. Vi. IV. १९. १६; वा. ९९. ३७; १०३. ५९; १०६. ५०.</F> appointed Purohita of the Gods and got back to life the Gods killed by the Asuras; <F>5:  Ib. XI. २७. 2.</F> served as calf for the sages (milked the cow- earth-वा। प्।) to milk the Vedic lore from the earth and got the essence of tapas; saciva of Indra; caused illusion for ^7 Ib. IV. १८. १४; M. १०. १७; वा. ६२. १३८ and १७७. Rajo's sons and got back the place for Indra; <F>8:  भा. V. २४. २४; M. २९. ११; वा. ५३. ६७; Vi. IV. 9. १७-22.</F> wielded over- lordship over Indra and was the cause of his योगक्षेम; <F>9:  वा. ८४. १५; ९२. ९१.</F> master of Mantras; <F>१०:  M. ४७. ८१.</F> finding शुक्र engaged for ten years with Jayanti, Br. took the guise of शुक्र and acted as शुक्र to the Asuras; when शुक्र spoke of the deceit, they would not listen to him and hence were cursed; बृहस्पति threw off his guise and went to his place; <F>११:  Ib. ४७. १८१-205.</F> appeared before the Asuras in the guise of काव्य; <F>१२:  वा. ९७. १०६, १२१.</F> fought with उशनस् or शुक्र in the देवासुर war; <F>१३:  भा VIII. १०. ३३.</F> advised Indra besieged by Bali, to abandon the city and await better times <F>१४:  Ib. VIII. १५. २८-31.</F> was not accorded due welcome by Indra in his pride and hence बृहस्पति abandoned the Devas when the Asuras rose up in arms against them; after consulting him on तारक's advance, Indra resolved on war; <F>१५:  Ib. VI. 7. ७९ and १६-19; M. १४८. ६२-76.</F> blessed उमा with a son; blessed the Deva host in the तारकामय. <F>१६:  Ib. १५४. ५०७; १७४. ५२.</F>

(II)--a planet; three-fourth of शुक्र (भार्- gava वा। प्।) in size; possesses १२ rays; <F>1:  Br. II. २३. ८५; M. १२८. ४८, ६४; वा. ५३. ८७.</F> has a golden chariot drawn by 8 white (red-वा। प्।) horses; <F>2:  M. १२७. 5; वा. ५२. ७७-9; Vi. II. १२. १९.</F> traverses each sign in one full year; generally favourable to the Brahmanas; a good ग्रह; <F>3:  भा. V. २२. १५; XII. 2. २४; M. २६४. 8.</F> on the right a bad omen; <F>4:  Ib. १६३. ३९.</F> his place above [पगे२-502+ ३१] Budha; <F>5:  वा. ५३. ९७.</F> in Simha, every twelve years; <F>6:  Ib. ८३. ४२.</F> stands above अन्गा- raka at a distance of २००० yojanas and below शनि. <F>7:  Ib. १०१. १३३; Vi. II. 7. 9.</F>

(III)--a ऋषि; <F>1:  M. १४५. ९२.</F> heard the भागवत from सान्खायन; <F>2:  भा. III. 8. 8.</F> teacher of Uddava; <F>3:  Ib. III. 1. २५; IV. 7. ६०.</F> went to स्यमन्तपञ्- caka to see कृष्ण, <F>4:  Ib. X. ८४. 4.</F> went with कृष्ण to मिथिला; <F>5:  Ib. X. ८६. १८.</F> advised Jana- mejaya to give up Sarpasatra; by doing this he honoured the sage. <F>6:  Ib. XII. 6. २३-28</F>
(IV)--an author of a work on architecture; even he cannot speak fully on iconography. M. २५२. 3; २६१. ५७.
(V)--a son of गोकर्ण, an अवतार् of the sixteenth द्वापर. वा. २३. १७३.
(VI)--the fourth Veda व्यास. Vi. III. 3. १२.
--a sacrifice performed by दक्ष and disturbed by वीरभद्र. भा. IV. 3. 3; 7. ५५.
--a Pravara of the भार्गवस्. M. १९५. ३०.
(II)--(च्) a kingdom in मध्यदेश called after the people inhabiting it. Br. II. १६. ४१.
--the क्षेत्रज्ञ sleeps with knowledge. वा. ५९. ७७.
--the bodhi tree, the king of trees. वा. १११. २७.
--a Siddha, and a disciple of बाष्कल (च्): in charge of the first ऋक् S4a1kha. भा. VI. १५. १४; XII. 6. ५५; Br. II. ३४. २७; वा. ६०. २६; Vi. III. 4. १८.
--the descendants of भूति. वा. ९६. १००.
--a pupil of याज्ञवल्क्य and a वागिन्. Br. II. ३५. २८.
--a Saimhikeya. वा. ६८. १९.

--the seven chief sages of whom भृगु was the chief; <F>1:  भा. IV. २१. १३; VIII. 4. २३; XI. १४. 4.</F> वालखिल्यस् are ब्रह्मऋषिस्; <F>2:  XII. ११. ४९.</F> heard the वेदस् from ब्रह्मा; <F>3:  Ib. XII. 6. ४५; Br. II. ३५. ८९-91, ९७.</F> obtained सायुज्य at Benares; <F>4:  M. १८५. १२.</F> ety. see ब्रह्मा; <F>5:  वा. ६१. ८०-1.</F> got established in the Brahmaloka. <F>6:  वा. ६१. ८८.</F> [पगे२-504+ ३२]
--the Goddess enshrined in चित्त or wisdom. M. १३. ५३.
--the period when ब्रह्मा was born. भा. II. 8. २८; १०. ४६; III. ११. ३४.
--a महातीर्थ founded by ब्रह्मा in olden days in कुरुक्षेत्र; famous as the place of origin for the वायु पुराण: the home of the seven sages. वा. ५९. १०६-7; ९७. 5.
--the Purohita of वासुदेव. वा. ९८. ९४.
--Vedic chanting; <F>1:  M. २५६. 8.</F> in connection with the founding of temples. <F>2:  Ib. २६४. ३४.</F>

--the disciplined life of celibacy; follow- ed by Kara; <F>1:  M. २५. २३.</F> greatness of; <F>2:  Ib. १७५. ३३, ३६-41; वा. ४९. १३८; ५६. ६९; ६७. २७; १०४. २३.</F> observers of it at Benares attain salvation. <F>3:  M. १८२. 8-११.</F>
--a son of क्रोधा and a Devagandharva. Br. III. 6. ३९; वा. ६८. ३८.

--duties of: with a दण्ड and tuft, bed on the earth over skin, service to Guru, learning and living on alms; <F>1:  भा. VII. १२ (whole), XI. १८. ४२-3; Br. II. 7. १७५; ३२. २४; III. 9. ७०; M. ४०. 2; वा. ५९. २३; Vi. III. 9. 1-7.</F> may remain so throughout life by taking to वैखानस or परिव्रताश्रम. <F>2:  Ib. III. १०. १४-15.</F> [पगे२-505+ २५]

--clouds out of the breath of ब्रह्मा; they cause thunder and lightning; by them the earth attains youthhood; chief among them are the जीमूत which rain from a distance of a Yojana and a half. वा. ५१. २८, ३४-7.
--a son of कालनेमि. वा. ६७. ८०.
--(see वसुर्धाम): Vasu, located at ब्रह्मस्थानम्. Br. II. १२. २५. वा. २९. २१.
--one of the four means of attaining मुक्ति। वा. १०५. १६.
--a काद्रवेय Na1ga. Br. III. 7. ३६.
--the sages who were born of ब्रह्मा's heart, ears, eyes, breath etc. वा. 9. १००-3.
--to be worshipped for increase of ब्रह्मवर्चस्। भा. II. 3. 2.
--eligibility for पार्वणश्राद्ध. M. १६. १०.
--Pravara (Angiras). M. १९६. १५. [पगे२-506+ ३१]
--also Amohakam; <F>1:  M. १९१. १०४-5.</F> visited by Bala- राम; <F>2:  भा. X. ७८. १९; Br. III. १३. ५६.</F> fit for श्राद्ध. <F>3:  वा. ७७. ५५; १११. २६ and ३०.</F>

--(ब्रह्मतुङ्गहृद वा। प्।) a sacred तीर्थ near यमुना: Here वसिष्ठ performed तपस् standing like a pillar; <F>1:  Br. III. १३. ७३.</F> fit for श्राद्ध; bathing once here makes a man a ब्रह्मा; there is a तुला (balance) at the place to measure one's righteousness or sins. <F>2:  वा. ७७. ७१-3.</F>
--the rod of punishment of the creator; <F>1:  M. २४५. 2; २४९. ६५.</F> the punishment to the Sagaras; they live in hell. <F>2:  Br. III. ५३. ४५; ५४. 8, २५; ५६. ३५.</F>

(I)--the son of नीप and कृत्वी daughter of शुक; a Yogi; wife Go and son विष्वक्सेन; <F>1:  भा. IX. २१. २५; M. १५. १०.</F> king of साल्व (s.v.); <F>2:  भा. X. ५२. ११[8].</F> killed by कृष्ण. <F>3:  Ib. X. ५२ [५६(v)8].</F>

(III)--the son of विभ्राज, the पाञ्चाल king; in previous birth पितृवर्ति (s.v.), a son of कौशिक; his queen Sannati, daughter of Devala, being in one of her previous births the cow of Garga, was killed by कौशिक's sons during a famine; was anointed the पाञ्चाल king, and his two brothers in his previous birth, became his ministers; [पगे२-507+ २९] both king and queen once visited the pleasure garden and were taken by surprise at the sight of the love quarrels between two ants who were husband and wife; the wife accused the husband of taking pieces of मोदक (sweet- meat) to a neighbouring lady-love, an ant; the husband confessed that it was offered so thinking that she was her- self, his own wife and that he would behave more carefully in future; B. understood this as he could follow the language of all insects by divine grace; when Sannati thought that the king laughed at her and took it seriously, he took a vow for seven days and at the sight of Sudaridra, the Brahmana, remembered his past and became a Siddha him- self having anointed his son विश्वक्षेन on the throne. M. २०. २३-38; २१. १६, २४-35.
--a royal line of १०० warriors cf. जातकस्: वायु प्। ३७६ (Car. Lec. १९१८. p. ५६). M. २७३. ७२; वा. ९९. ४५४.
--a R; a महानदी in भारतवर्ष. वा. १०८. ८१.
--the ninth Gandharva ग्रामिका. वा. ८६. ४३.
--the day of ब्रह्मा the creator, at the end of which the वैराजस् are born as ब्रह्मवादिन्स्. M. १३. 5.
--sages of, visited द्वारका. भा. X. ९०. २८[6].
--the son of a family of hereditary Vedic teachers. वा. ८३. ५४. [पगे२-508+ २७]
--a son of Brahmadhana. वा. ६९. १२५.
(I)--a daughter of ब्रह्मदान, married by शण्ड. Br. III. 7. ८४-7.
(II)--married a यक्ष, one of the two sons of खश; the hair-less. वा. ६९. १२३.
--a राक्षस on the Vaidyuta mountain. M. १२१. १८.
--one of the three राक्षस clans moving about in the day as against the निशाचरस्. Br. III. 8. ६१.

--the nature of, explained; <F>1:  वा. ६१. १०७-12.</F> प्रणव form; three-fold nature of ऋक्, साम and यजुस्; <F>2:  Vi. III. 3. २३-30.</F> with or without form and also पर and अपर; three-fold भावन of Brah- man--ब्रह्मा, कर्मसम्ज्ञ and of both; <F>3:  Ib. VI. 7. ४७-8.</F> worshipped by Sakarmaka-karman in पुष्करद्वीप. <F>4:  भा. V. २०. ३२-3.</F>
--Bharata, son of लौकिकाग्नि. वा. २९. 7.
