--the son of Prahetu and a राक्षस, living in the वैभ्राजवन on the Sarayu; a follower of Kubera. वा. ४७. १६.
--the स्थान of ब्रह्मा in the northern portion of the निषध hill; here is the temple of Agni. वा. ४१. ५९-61.
--the पुराण containing १०, ००० stan- zas. वा. १०४. 6.
(I)--a श्रुतऋषि: a pupil of देवदर्श; <F>1:  Br. II. ३३. १०; ३५. ५७.</F> an एकार्षेय. <F>2:  M. २००. 6.</F>
(II)--a disciple of वेदस्पर्श. वा. ६१. ५१.
--a pupil of वेददर्श. भा. XII. 7. 2; Vi. III. 6. १०.
--a R. of the Bhadra continent. वा. ४३. २८.
--the sacrifice leading to मोक्ष or salva- tion. वा. १४. 5. [पगे२-510+ ४३]

--a class of demons: Agastyas and विस्वामित्रस् come under this group; <F>1:  भा. X. ६३. ११; Br. I. 2. ३३; III. 7. १००; 8. ५९; ४१. २९; वा. 2. ३३.</F> live in the Surabhi forest; <F>2:  M. १२१. ६२.</F> born in the family of ब्रह्मराक्षसिस्; generally reside in श्लेष्मातक trees. <F>3:  वा. ६९. १३४-5.</F>
--the period before dawn when after रासक्रीड (s.v.) the Gopis went back to their Vraja. भा. X. ३३. ३९.

--the abode of ब्रह्मा; the eternal world; <F>1:  M. ८६. 6; १७८. ७६; भा. IV. ३१. २३; XI. २३. ३०; वा. १०१. २७.</F> thirteen crores and fifteen niyuktas of yojanas from the भूलोक and one crore and ५०० niyuktas above the Satya- loka; <F>2:  Ib. ६१. ८७; १०१. ११२, २२०; ६५, १४१; १०६. २०; १०८. १२; १११. ३३, ४९.</F> baths in Agastyesvaram and देवतीर्थम् lead one to; <F>3:  M. १९१. १६, २४.</F> Viraja became एकार्ष्टक here; <F>4:  Ib. १५. २४.</F> hearing of the legend of Brahmadatta takes one to; <F>5:  Ib. २१. ४१.</F> ययाति went from Devaloka to; <F>6:  Ib. ३६. 2.</F> the giver of हिरण्यगर्भ enjoys the world of; <F>7:  Ib. १९४. २८; २०५. 8; २७५. २६.</F> the giver of the ब्रह्मवैवर्त पुराण on the Full Moon day of माघ reaches this; <F>8:  Ib. ५३. ३४-6.</F> residence of the ब्रह्मऋषिस्; <F>9:  Br. II. ३५. ९७; वा. ६१. ८७.</F> fire reduced to ashes would not become fire again; so also the person reaching this loka would not have rebirth: अद्वैत मोक्ष; <F>१०:  Ib. 7. ३२; २१. ७०; २२. २०.</F> ब्रह्मा, Purohita at; <F>११:  Ib. ६५. ६८ and ७७.</F> the last place where वैता- trika Devas went and became one with God during the Pralaya. <F>१२:  Br. I. 5. ११०; II. 6. ३१.</F>
--Residents of Brahmaloka. वा. १०२. ४३; Br. IV. 2. ८२. [पगे२-511+ २७]
--here is a ब्रह्मवृक्ष (tree). वा. 9. ११६.
--an account of, in the ब्रह्मवै- वर्त। M. ५३. ३५.
--He who realises the one God in the Trinity. वा. ६६. ११४; १०१. ११२.
--born of five gotras, कश्यप, वसिष्ठ, बृगु, Angiras and Atri. वा. ६१. ८१.
--the father of याज्ञवल्क्य. वा. ६०. ४१.
--is ललिता. Br. IV. १२. ७१.
--in Brahmaloka; only one tree; the शरिर or body is tree and the जीव is ईश्वर. वा. 9. ११६, ११८-19.
--(Atharva) personified in the वारुनी यज्ञ; <F>1:  Br. III. 1. २६-30.</F> with cruel कृत्यविधि; with Pratyangarasayoga and with a head with two bodies. <F>2:  वा. ६५. २७.</F>

--Brahmavaivartam, one among the महापुराणस् and comprising १८,000 श्लोकस्; deals with [पगे२-512+ ३१] the Rathantarakalpa, कृष्णमाहात्म्य, and ब्रह्मवराह; narrated to नारद by सावर्णि; he who gives it on the Full Moon day of the माघ month reaches Brahmaloka. भा. XII. 7. २४; १३. 6; M. ५३. ३४-6; वा. १०४ 4. Vi. III. 6. २२.
--the observance of this vow leads to निर्वाणम्। M. १०१. ४८.
--an अस्त्र applied by अश्वत्थाम against Arjuna; <F>1:  भा. I. 7. १९ and २७; 8. १५; १२. 1.</F> used in the तारक war. <F>2:  Br. III. ६५. ३३.</F>
--the stone between the कूर्मशिला and the पिण्डिक of an image. M. २६६. 5.
--a deadly weapon discharged by Rudra against Soma. M. २३. ४३.
--ब्रह्मा honoured in this यज्ञ; <F>1:  वा. ३०. ११९.</F> in Janaloka. <F>2:  भा. X. ८७. 9.</F>
--White, eternal, never failing, all per- vading (वेदान्त); <F>1:  वा. १०१. ८६.</F> enjoyed by देवऋषिस्. <F>2:  Br. IV. 2. ८४.</F>
--Here गन्गा divides into four branches: the abode of ब्रह्मा. भा. V. १७. 4-5; Br. IV. 9. २०.
--a तीर्थ sacred to the पिट्र्स्, and fit for श्राद्ध. M. २२. १२; वा. ७७. ५१. [पगे२-513+ ४०]

--the tenth Manu; son of उपश्लोक; भूरिषेण and others were the ten sons; हविष्मत् and others were the sages: श्रीमूर्ति was the name of the manifestation of Hari in this epoch; शम्भु [शान्ति (वि। प्।)] was Indra. भा. VII. १३. २१-3. Vi. III. 2. २५-28.
--a part of the place where Linga or image is installed to the left of it. M. २६३. 3 and 6.
--a place in the Vedi where ब्रह्म- ज्योति अग्नि is located; <F>1:  वा. २९. २१.</F> here is विश्वव्यच अग्नि। <F>2:  Br. II. १२. २४.</F>
--the property of a Brahmana which should not be confiscated by a king; Haihaya paid a penalty for taking Jamadagni's cow. Br. III. २८. ३८-50, ६८; २९. 1; ३०. 2.

--killing of a Brahmana; will burn even Indra; <F>1:  M. २५. ४८; वा. ५०. २२१; ६१. २२; १०१. १५३; १०५. १३; १०८. ५५.</F> incurred by बलराम when he killed रोमहऋषण and expiated by his destruction of Balvala at the request of the sages; <F>2:  भा. X. ७८. २३-40.</F> by वैशम्पायन and by शिव; <F>3:  Br. II. ३५. १६; III. २३. ६२.</F> drinking of spirituous liquor equal to; <F>4:  M. २५. ६२.</F> released from, by observing नक्षत्रपुरुषम्; <F>5:  Ib. ५४. ३०.</F> released from, by vow of शुभसप्- tami; <F>6:  Ib. ८०. १२.</F> by offering गृहबलि; <F>7:  Ib. ९०. ११; ९३. १३९.</F> got rid of at Benares; सीव cut off the fifth head of ब्रह्मा, but expiated the sin by his stay at Benares; <F>8:  Ib. १८२. १५; १८३. १०१.</F> to be got rid of by a bath in the नर्मदा; <F>9:  Ib. १८६. ५६; १९२. १६; २२७. २१५.</F> expiation for; वैशम्पायन guilty of. <F>१०:  Vi. III. 5. १४.</F> [पगे२-514+ ३१]
(I)--a son of वृष. Br. III. 6. ३४.
(II)--a son of विष. वा. ६८. ३३.
(III)--a killer of Brahmanas. वा. १०१. १५२; ११२. १०.
--one who fails to satisfy a woman's love when requested to do so in secret, incurs the sin of; was urged by ययाति in defence of his marrying शर्मिष्ठा. M. ३२. ३३.
--near व्याससरस् once visited by अक्रूर; कृष्ण took नारद and the Gopas to this place where they saw the वेदस् chanting the praise of कृष्ण. भा. X. २८. १६-17; Br. III. १३. ५२.

(I)--पितामह, (लोकपितामह)--appeared on the lotus from the navel of Hari at the end of the Kalpa; the Lord with four faces: origin of five faces connected with his daughter and wife शतरूपा; <F>1:  भा. I. 3. 2; III. 8. १३-16; IX. 1. 8-१०; XI. 4. 5; XII. 5. 1; M. 1. १४; 2. ३६; 3. 1, ३७, ४०.</F> Born of Hari's grace: expression of रजस्: By Yoga saw the one पुरुष lying on शेष: Praised Him, who instructed him in the art of creation: nine-fold creation from प्रकृति; created the वेदस् and human society: created also a mind-born son to शम्भु who attained Brahmalokam: a second son of his, was Bhuva, who was sent to the mother--earth: the third son भूर्भुव and his son became Gopati. From his body was created गायत्री, who became his wife: then came प्रजा- patis, oceans. etc. <F>2:  भा. I. १८. १४. III. 8. २२-32; 9. 1-२४, २९-44; १०. 3-6, 8, १३-26; १२. ३७-56.</F> [पगे२-515+ ६८] Known for impartiality, परीक्षित् compared to him; <F>3:  M. १७१. 8-१४, १७, २१; १८३. ८४.</F> obliged to विष्णु; <F>4:  भा. III. १२. २३.</F> knew the धर्म of Hari; a परमेष्ठिन्; <F>5:  Ib. IV. २१. २९; २९. ४२.</F> resident at गया and guards Benares; <F>6:  Ib. VI. 3. २०.</F> his golden city being in Meru; <F>7:  Ib. IV. 8. २०.</F> his curses and blessings moderate. <F>8:  M. २२. 4; १८४. २८.</F> A day of, is a thousand cycles of the 4 yugas; Pralaya, the night of ब्रह्मा; period of his life is द्वीपरार्ध. All the fourteen Manus flourish during his day. <F>9:  भा. V. १६. २८.</F> Author of the Atharva mantras; learnt the Veda from Hari and taught it to Manu; <F>१०:  Ib. X. ८८. १२.</F> his sons were मरीचि and Atri whose son was Soma. The last was made the lord of Brahmanas, stars, etc. Influenced Soma to restore तारा to बृहस्पति. Found out that Budha was Soma's son. Punished Soma as a sinful planet for enjoying तारा. <F>११:  Ib. XII. 4. 2-5; Vi. I. 3. १५-24; IV. 1. 5; VI. 3. ११-12.</F> Made दक्ष the overlord of the प्रजापतिस्; <F>१२:  भा. XI. १४. 3-4; Vi. III. 4. १२.</F> called on कैलास. <F>१३:  भा. IX. 1. 8-१०; १४. 2-3, 8, १२ [1] and १३. XII. 8. १२; M. २३. १०, ४४-6.</F> Presented पृथु with armour and prevented him from slaying Indra. <F>१४:  M. २०१. १७; २२५. १२; २४९. १३, ५८.</F> Visited Manu and Priyavrata and addressed her on home life. <F>१५:  भा. IV. 3. 2.</F> gifts to माय. <F>१६:  Ib. IV. 6. 2.</F> Did not help दुर्वास pursued by the चक्र of विष्णु; <F>१७:  Ib. XI. १३. १६-41.</F> was unable to answer the question of his son, Sanaka and others on the subtlity of yoga; remembered Hari who explain- ed it in the form of a Hamsa. <F>१८:  M. १७८. ५६, ६४, ७९.</F> Praised विष्णु for killing काल- nemi. <F>१९:  भा. VIII. 5. १८-50; 6. 1-१५.</F> Met Hari-Ajita to restore the fortune of Indra; cursed by दुर्वास and his prayer. <F>२०:  Ib. X. ८७. 9.</F> Performed यज्ञ in Janaloka; <F>२१:  Ib. X. ८९. 3-4.</F> was displeased at भृगु's behaviour; <F>२२:  Ib. VII. 3. १४-38; 4. 2-3; 8. ४०; १०. २६-29, ३३; M. १६१. १७.</F> went with भृगु and दक्ष to हिरण्यकशिपु engaged in austerities; granted boons to him and disappeared. Was present at प्रह्लाद's coronation; <F>२३:  Ib. १६१. १८-23.</F> when petitioned by the gods to show a way to get rid of हिरण्यकशिपु, suggested Hari for it. Took the form of a calf, <F>२४:  भा. VII. १०. ६२, ७०.</F> when Hari in the guise of a cow went to drink the immortalising fluid in श्रीपुर; praised शिव who burnt the Tripura; <F>२५:  M. १३३. ५२.</F> charioteer of त्रिपुरारि. <F>२६:  भा. VIII. २१. 1, 3 and 5; २२. २१-3; २३. २४, २६-7.</F> Came to see वामन measuring the world with his two steps; washed his feet with waters; and with other Gods worshipped Him with tributes; addressed वामन-Hari; with his approval वामन was taken to Indra's capital; praised वामन's deeds and also Aditi. <F>२७:  Ib. X. 1. १७-35; 2. २५-42; १३. ४०-64; १४. 1-४०.</F> [पगे२-516+ ३१] On an appeal from Mother-Earth that she had to bear a heavy burden of the Asuras, ब्रह्मा went with शिव to the shore of the milk ocean and eulogised Hari by Puru- षसूक्त; they were told of the incarnation of कृष्ण at Vasu- deva's residence; encouraged देवकी on the eve of कृष्ण's birth; came to see Hari at बृन्दावन्; was staggered at the potency of his माया and praised the Lord. <F>२८:  Ib. IX. 3. ३३-4; X. ५२. १५ [3-११].</F> Suggested to Raivata that बलराम was a suitable husband for रेवती and asked him to give his daughter in marriage to him; <F>२९:  Ib. X. ७४. १३.</F> attended the sacrifices of वरुण and युधिष्ठिर. <F>३०:  Ib. XI. 6. 1, २१-27; 7. 1-2.</F> Went with all the Devas to द्वारका first to remind कृष्ण to go back to his eternal abode; addressed the Lord on the purpose and fulfilment of the अवतार्। <F>३१:  Ib. XII. 8. १२.</F> Wondered at मार्कण्डेय's व्रत; <F>३२:  Ib. XII. १३. १० and १९.</F> heard the भा- गवत पुराण from Hari. <F>३३:  Ib. II. 5. 9 to the end.</F> narrated to नारद the legend of the creation of the universe; <F>३४:  Ib. I. 7. १८.</F> allusion to his fear of Rudra; <F>३५:  Br. III. 7. २७०; २४. 4.</F> worshipped by वालि with fire rite.
(II)--a division of the night. वा. ६६. ४४.
(III)--son of Brahmadana. वा. ६९. १३२. [पगे२-517+ ३१]
(IV)--one of the १६ R2tviks for a यज्ञ; issued from the mouth of नारायण. M. १६७. 7.
(V)--one of the authors on architecture. M. २५२. 3.
(VI)--image of; four faces and sitting on a lotus; on the swan; on either side सावित्री and सरस्वती. M. २६०. ४०; २६६. ४२; २८५. 6.
--the manifestation of the energy in the पुरुष. वा. ६६. ९३.
--the image of; four faces and four hands with the swan for riding. M. २६१. २४.

--(पुराणम्) one among the महा- पुराणस्; comprises १२,000 (१२, २०० म्। प्। and १२,100 वा। प्।) श्लोकस् dealing with the future kalpas; narrated by ब्रह्मा; contains a description of ब्रह्माण्ड; he who gives it with two yellow woollen garments and a golden cow in the व्यती- पात attains the merit of performing a thousand राजसूयस्. भा. XII. 7. २४; १३. 8. M. ५३. ५६; वा. १०४. 5; Vi. III. 6. २३.

(I)--the whole universe; above this are मानस worlds of सोमपा-manes. <F>1:  M. १५. २५; २४९. २९; २६६. २८; २८९. १३.</F> ईश्वर entered into; <F>2:  वा. १०३. २०-1; १०४.</F> was split by भण्ड. <F>3:  Br. IV. १०. ८२.</F>

(II)--a दानम् of the image of the uni- verse in gold weighing not less than २० palas and up-to १००० according to capacity with 8 guardian elephants, Vedas and Angas, and all the deities beginning from ब्रह्मा; then [पगे२-518+ ३६] worship of the different manifestations of विष्णु--Ananta- शयन, Pradyumna, सम्कर्षण, Aniruddha, वासुदेव; the giver enjoys in heaven with the heavenly damsels. M. २७४. 7.
--the राक्षस presiding over the month of ईष; a son of ब्रह्मदान. भा. XII. ११. ४३; Br. II. २३. २२; III. 7. ९८.

(I)--(च्) a kingdom; <F>1:  भा. I. १०. ३४.</F> the land of परीक्षित् where धर्म and सत्य were practised and यज्ञस् per- formed; <F>2:  Ib. I. १७. ३३.</F> residence of स्वायम्भुव Manu, to which he returned after the marriage of his daughter; <F>3:  Ib. III. २१. २५; २२. २६.</F> the land of Manus as also of पृथु; the place where the R. Sarasvati flows eastward; <F>4:  Ib. IV. १९. 1.</F> visited by ऋषभ. <F>5:  Ib. V. 4. १९; 5. २८.</F>
(II)--a son of ऋषभ and जयन्ती. भा. V. 4. १०.
(III)--a तीर्थ sacred to the पितृस्; near the धारातीर्थ on the नर्मदा; here ब्रह्मा resides always. M. २२. ६९; १९०. 7-8; १९१. ७०.
--परशुराम was sitting in this posture while performing penance. Br. III. ५७. 6.
--in Janaloka; given to परशुराम by शिव; <F>1:  Br. III. ३२. ५७.</F> employed by अश्वत्थाम against परीक्षित् in his mother's womb. <F>2:  Vi. IV. २०. ५२.</F>
(I)--a son of Mudgala. Br. ५०. 6.
(II)--a son of Asita. वा. ७०. २७. [पगे२-519+ ३३]
--a king; his dependant, पृथु- rukma. वा. ९५. २९.
--a kingdom of the East. M. १२१. ५०; वा. ४५. १२३; ४७. ४९.
--the son of Laukika Agni, also known as Bharata; father of वैश्वानर. Br. II. १२. 8; वा. २९. 7.
--the initiation ceremony in Upa- nayana. Br. IV. 8. 4.
--the राक्षस who resides in the sun's chariot during the month of माघ। Vi. II. १०. १६.
--a मुहूर्त, early in the morning of the day. वा. ६६. ४०; Br. III. 3. ३९; Vi. III. ११. 5.
--when ब्रह्मा was known as शब्द- brahman. भा. III. ११. ३४.

(I)--came out from the face of the पुरुष; ब्रह्मवादिन्स्; a portion of Hari's body; <F>1:  भा. II. 1. ३७; VIII. 5. ४१; X. 4. ३९; Vi. I. 6. 6, ३४.</F> considered to be equal to Gods, spoken so by विष्णु; views of कृष्ण on; none equal to their greatness; <F>2:  भा. III. १६. 4-११; VII. १४. ४२; X. ८१. ३९, ४१; V. 5. २३.</F> an embodiment of the Vedas and deserving of veneration and worship; the mouth of Hari as embodying all the Vedas; disregard to them would result in the defacement of the Vedic teachings and Vedic Gods; <F>3:  Ib. III. १६. २३-4; VIII. १६. 9; X. ६४. ३२-43; ८६. ५३-57.</F> characteristics of; by birth a ब्राह्मण is a guru; to live by studying the Vedas; some devoted [पगे२-520+ ५२] to कर्म, some to तपस्, some to Vedic studies, some to teaching and others to ज्ञान and योग; <F>4:  Ib. VII. ११. २१; १५. 1; X. 8. 6; २४. २०; XI. १७. १६.</F> कृष्ण on the need for keeping them contented; <F>5:  Ib. X. ५२. ३०-34.</F> कृष्ण on their property; however small it should not be touched, but should be considered poison since its enjoy- ment leads to shortness of life and hell; <F>6:  Ib. X. ६४. ३२-43.</F> their words always become true; <F>7:  Ib. V. 3. १७.</F> showed to नाभि Yajn5es4a himseslf; <F>8:  Ib. V. 4. 7.</F> helped ऋषभ in his administration; <F>9:  Ib. V. 4. १६.</F> Kamsa decided to kill all of them and ordered his men to that effect. <F>१०:  Ib. X. 4. ३९-45.</F> Prohibited from agriculture, trade, tending of cattle and from selling the Vedas; from taking liquor but may take meat in times of danger. <F>११:  Br. II. २९. ५५; III. १५. ४५.</F> in Kali, in the service of शूद्रस् and Mlecchas and become शिवसूलस्; <F>१२:  Ib. II. ३१. ४०-50.</F> adopt शूद्र practices. <F>१३:  वा. ५८. ४१.</F>

(II)--superior to all castes; anger of, more troublesome than even a venomous serpent and all burning fire and more dreadful than a firearm; for, it results in whole- sale destruction; <F>2:  M. ३०. २३-25. ३०.</F> to honour ब्राह्मणस् is useful; to dis- honour them is dangerous; <F>3:  Ib. ९३. ८०.</F> warriors with Pramati god in- carnate of Kali; <F>4:  Ib. ११४. १२; १४४. ५३.</F> observe ten day's pollution for father's death; <F>5:  Ib. १८. 2.</F> created from face; <F>6:  Br. I. 5. १०८.</F> those who spoke the truth became ब्राह्मणस्; teaching, sacrifice, receiving and mak- ing of gifts, their chief duties; go to the abode of ब्रह्मा; <F>7:  Ib. II. 7. १५५, १६१ and १६५.</F> can take to वैश्य and क्षत्रिय duties; <F>8:  Vi. III. 8. २२-5, ३९.</F> established in the kingdom of माघद. <F>9:  Ib. IV. २४. ६२.</F> ^1 वा. २७. १९; ३०. २३२; ४५. ८३; ५४. १११; ५९. १४१; १००. २४६; १०१. 5, ३५२; १०४. १३.
--a branch of the Vedic literature with ten विधिस्; <F>1:  Br. II. ३१. १४; ३३. 1, १२; ३५. ७३; वा. ५९. १३२-9; ६८. १२-14.</F> starts in द्वापर. <F>2:  M. १४४. १३.</F> [पगे२-521+ ३२]

--the purificatory ceremonial popu- larly known as पुण्याहवाचनम् done in any auspicious karma; <F>1:  M. ५४. 8; ५८. 5; ६६. 5; ६७. 3.</F> preliminary to गृहबलि; <F>2:  Ib. ९३. 4.</F> in the course of palace building; <F>3:  Ib. २६८. ३४.</F> to be uttered in making all the १६ gifts. <F>4:  Ib. २७४. २५.</F>
--Vaisvadeva Agni; <F>1:  Br. II. १२. २९.</F> one of the १६ R2tviks of यज्ञ। <F>2:  M. १६७. 8.</F>

--also ब्राह्मम्; one of the eighteen महापुराणस्; comprises १०,000 श्लोकस्; <F>1:  भा. XII. 7. २३; १३. 4.</F> with ३०,000 श्लोकस्; he who writes this and makes a gift of it in the वैशाक, Full Moon day, attains Brahmaloka; <F>2:  M. ५३. १३; २९०. १७.</F> the First पुराण। <F>3:  Vi. III. 6. २०.</F>
(II)--one of the six दर्शनस्. वा. १०४. १६.
(III)--a form of marriage. Vi. III. १०. २४.
--a deluge during the reign of Satyavrata of द्रविडदेश; this was the epoch of the मत्स्यावतार of the Lord. भा. VIII. २४. ३७. [पगे२-522+ ३०]
--oneness with the Supreme Being. वा. ७७. १२३.

(I) (सन्ख्या)--creatures and worms (1/१०००) of स्थावर; (1/१०००) of the above result in watery animals. (1/१०००) of the above become birds; (1/१०००) of birds become four-footed animals; (1/१०००) of these become two-footed animals including men; (1/१०००) part of these go to heaven; (1/१०००) of these attain salvation; others fall into hells. Br. IV. 2. १९९-210.
(III)--a mind-born mother; in the kalpalata gift. M. १७९. 9; २८६. 6.
(IV)--a R. of the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. २१.
--the Vedic injunction. M. २१५. ५८.
--in the Brahmarandhra of the personified Veda. वा. १०४. ८१.

--selfless devotion; leads one to self-realisation; methods and results of; destroys रजस् and तमस् qualities; roots out sorrow, illusion and fear; redeems the sinners; <F>1:  भा. I. 2. १२-21; 5. २८; 7. 7; VI. 1. १५.</F> superior to कर्म; <F>2:  Ib. X. २३. ३९-50</F> one of the five means of concentrating the mind on Hari, (i.e.) (1) काम as in the case of the Gopis; (2) fear and hatred as in the case of Kamsa and शिशुपाल; (3) relationship as in the case of the वृष्णिस्; [पगे२-523+ ४३] (4) friendship as in the case of युधिष्ठिर and (5) devo- tion as in the case of नारद; वेन does not come under any of these heads; <F>3:  Ib. VII. 1. २९-31.</F> but nine-fold according to प्रह्लाद: hearing of Hari, praising of, remembering, serving His holy feet, अर्चन, prostrating, service, friendship and surrender of self; <F>4:  Ib. VII. 5. २३.</F> women more devout than men. <F>5:  Ib. X. २३. ३८, ४१-43.</F> Three-fold--उत्तम as that of नारद and शुक: middling as that of वसिष्ठ, and inferior; <F>6:  Br. III. ३४. ३७-8; ३६. 3.</F> another classification: three-fold, शाङ्ख्य, योग, and ज्ञानम्; a pure man can meditate on the Supreme Being by means of प्रत्याहार finally leading to the supreme knowledge; <F>7:  M. १८३. ४९-55.</F> मार्ग to. <F>8:  वा. १०४. १५.</F>

--disinterested devotion: <F>1:  भा. XI. १४. 2.</F> of different kinds--तामस, राजस, सात्विक, निर्गुण, आत्यन्तिक; <F>2:  Ib. III. २९. 7-१४.</F> greater than the वेद, तपस्, and gifts; purifies even श्वपाकस्; <F>3:  Ib. XI. १४. २०-21; २०. 6, 8, २९ and ३३.</F> its relation to सान्ख्य S4a1stra; <F>4:  Ib. III. २९. 2.</F> recapitulation of. <F>5:  Ib. XI. २९. 8-३४.</F>
--a Janapada. वा. ९९. ३८७.

(I)--a son of Aditi; an आदित्य; married Siddhi; father of Mahiman and others; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ३९; १८. 2; M. 6. 4; १५५. 7; वा. ६६. ६६; Vi. I. १५. १३१.</F> seized by Nandi; his eyes were pulled out by वीरभद्र (Rudra) as he made a sign with his eyes to दक्ष when he insulted शिव; शिव ordered him to see with the eye of Mitra; <F>2:  भा. IV. 5. १७, २०; 6. ५१; 7. 3; Br. II. २४. ३३; III. 3. ६७.</F> to be worshipped before building a palace. <F>3:  M. १७१. ५६; २६८. १९.</F>
(II)--the name of the sun in the month of पुष्य (तिष्य) (Hemanta-वा। प्।). भा. XII. ११. ४२; Br. II. २३. १६; वा. ५२. १६; Vi. II. १०. 4. [पगे२-524+ २७]
(III)--a मुहूर्त of the day. Br. III. 3. ४०.
(I)--was presented with an elephant (of the ऐरावत breed) सुप्रतीक by कृष्ण; <F>1:  भा. X. ५९. ३७.</F> in the army of Duryodhana. <F>2:  Ib. X. ७८. [९५ (v) १६].</F>
(II)--a King of the किन्णरस्. वा. ४१. ३०.
--also Bhaganetrahara and भगनेत्रान्- taka, an attribute of शिव. Br. II. २७. ३१; वा. २५. १४; ३०. १७९, २५३.
--an आत्रेय gotraka1ra. M. १९७. 4.
--one of the १५ Aks2aradevis, killed दीर्घ- jihva, a commander of भण्ड; <F>1:  Br. IV. १९. ५७; २५. ९४.</F> city of. <F>2:  Ib. IV. ३१. २४.</F>

--a celestial stream (गन्गा) which en- tered ब्रह्माण्ड from outside by its being pierced by the tip of the toe of Trivikrama's left foot; in course of time she reached the celestial region known as विष्णुपद; held sacred by Dhruva and the seven sages; crossing the region of the [पगे२-525+ ३३] moon she reaches the city of ब्रह्मा; there she divides into four branches and falls into the western and eastern seas. भा. V. १७. 1-9.

(I)--The principal and eternal god;^1 the sum and substance of the three Vedas; भ।-- cherisher and supporter of the universe; ग,--the leader or creator; भग indicates six properties, dominion, might, glory, splendour, wisdom and detachment; व, elemental spirit in which all beings exist and which exists in all beings; thus it is the name of वासुदेव. Vi. VI. 5. ६९-79.
(II)--a तुषित God. Br. II. ३६. १०.
(III)--the quality of भग and सद्भाव। वा. 5. ३६.
(IV)--one of Danu's sons. वा. ६८. 5.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. ११.

--the son of दिलीप and father of श्रुत (Suhotra वि। प्।); by penance on the banks of the Bindusaras he succeeded in bringing the Ganges; was asked how she was to dispose of the sins of men discharged into her waters; भगीरथ said that साधुस् and others among whom was Hari would take off the sins from her: was asked to pray to शिव to check her course; so he prayed to शिव and it was heard; by this he was able to shake off the sins of his ancestors; <F>1:  भा. IX. 9. 2-१३ and १६; Br. II. १८. २५; M. १२. ४४; १५. १९; १२१. २६; वा. ८८. १६७; Vi. IV. 4. ३५-6.</F> a राजऋषि; went to the forest of the Gaura hills in search of गन्गा; <F>2:  वा. ४७. २४.</F> his lust after more territory; <F>3:  भा. XII. 3. १०.</F> after him [पगे२-526+ २३] गन्गा became the भागीरथी; so-called after the seventh branch of the Ganges. <F>4:  Br. III. ५४. ४८-51; ६३. १६६-8; वा. ४७. ४०.</F>
--not to marry with the members of the वसिष्ठ and Indra Pramati groups. M. २००. १३.
(I)--An आन्ध्र chief: wife नरा, daughter of सुयग्ञा. Father of two sons. भन्गकार and his sons were killed in battle by अक्रूर. Br. III. ७१. ८७-8.

(II)--the eldest of the १०१ sons of सत्राजित् (शक्रजित्-वा। प्।); his wife was व्रतवती (द्वारवती-वा। प्।); she gave birth to three daughters, सत्यभामा, व्रतिनी and पद्मावती; these were given in marriage to कृष्ण, killed by शतधन्वा for the jewel Syamantaka taken from him and handed over it to अक्रूर. M. ४५. १९-21; वा. ९६. ५२-5, and ५८. Br. III. ७१. ५५.
--an Asura of Bali. M. २४५. ३१.
--near the नर्मदा. M. १९१. ५२-3.
--a son of सात्वत. Vi. IV. १३. 1. [पगे२-527+ २५]
(I)--(Bhajina) a son of सात्वत: had two sons by one wife and three others by another wife (six sons by two wives वि। प्।). भा. IX. २४. 6-8; Br. III. ७१. 1-3. M. ४४. ४७; Vi. IV. १३. 1-2.
(II)--the son of शूर and father of शिनि. भा. IX. २४. २६.
(III)--a son of Satyaka and the daughter of the King of काशी; father of a son Viduratha. Br. III. ७१. ११६; वा. ९६. ११५, १३५. भा. IX. २४. १९.
(IV)--a son of Andhaka and father of विदूरथ, a great charioteer. M. ४४. ६१, ७७; Vi. IV. १४. १२, २२.
(V)--a son of कौशल्या; through his wife शृञ्जय्या, he got two sons, बाह्य and बाह्यक. वा. ९६. 1, 3.
--a son of सात्वत. भा. IX. २४. 6; Br. III. ७१. 1.
--(भजमान): a son of सात्वत and कौशल्या. M. ४४. ४७; वा. ९६. 1.
--a pupil of बाष्कलि. भा. XII. 6. ५९.
(I)--a son of दक्षिणा and a तुषित God. भा. IV. 1. 7-8.
(II)--a son of पौरवी and Vasudeva. भा. IX. २४. ४७. [पगे२-528+ २५]
(III)--a son of Vasudeva and देवकी. भा. IX. २४. ५४.
(IV)--a son of कृष्ण and कालिन्दी; and full of prowess; went with the वृष्णिस् to बाण's city, शोणितपुर. भा. X. ६१. १४; ६३. 3.
(V)--a kingdom in मध्यदेश. Br. II. १६. ४२.
(VI)--a northern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ४८; १८. ४६.
(VII)--a दानव. Br. III. 6. 6.
(VIII)--an elephant; the vehicle of Bali. Br. III. 7. ३२८.
(IX)--(also सुप्रतीक) a नाग and a vehicle of वरुण (विष्णु-वा। प्।). Br. III. 7. ३३०; वा. ६९. २१२, २१४.
(X)--a son of जाम्बवती and कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. २४९; वा. ९६. २४१.
(XI)--a son of रुक्मिणी and कृष्ण. M. ४७. १६.
--the Gods of Uttama epoch. भा. VIII. 1. २४.
(I)--a son of Vasumitra and father of Pulinda: ruled for two years. भा. XII. 1. १७; Br. III. ७४. १५२. [पगे२-529+ ३४]
(II)--a son of शिबि. M. ४८. १९.
--a kingdom after Bhadraka, son of शिबि. M. ४८. २०.
--(च्) a kingdom in the मध्यदेश. Br. II. १६. ४१.
--a Goddess enshrined at गोकर्ण. M. १३. ३०.
--a son of शठ, of the रोहिणी family. Br. III. ७१. १७०; वा. ९६. १६८.

--a name of योगमाया; <F>1:  भा. X. 2. ११.</F> bestows good on children when propitiated with human sacrifice; when the Goddess found the man sacrificed was a virtuous Brahmana like Bharata she became fiery and cut off the heads of the वृषल chief and his attendants who offered him to her; <F>2:  Ib. V. 9. १२-18.</F> fought with निशुम्भ and शुम्भ in the देवासुर war; <F>3:  Ib. VIII. १०. ३१.</F> worshipped by the गोपीस् at the end of their व्रत। <F>4:  Ib. X. २२. 5.</F> Lion as her riding animal; having three eyes and a trident: praised by परशुराम; <F>5:  Br. III. ३९. ३३, ४४ to ५३.</F> came out of the wrath of उमा for the destruction of the दक्ष's यज्ञ। <F>6:  वा. ३०. १४०, १६५.</F>
--a तीर्थ sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ७४.
--a son of जाम्बवती and कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. २४९; वा. ९६. २४१. [पगे२-530+ २६]
--a son of शठ, of the रोहिणी family. Br. III. ७१. १६९; वा. ९६. १६७.
--a son of जाम्बवती and कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. २४९.
--of the रोहिणी family. वा. ९६. १६८.
--a तीर्थ sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ५०.
--a son of देवकी and Vasudeva, killed by Kamsa. Br. III. ७१. १७५; Vi. IV. १५. २६-7.
(I)--a son of शठ, of the रोहिणी family, Br. III. ७१. १७०; वा. ९६. १६८; Vi. IV. १५. २२.
(II)--a son of जाम्बवती and कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. २५०.
--a sacred lake in Meru. M. ११३. ४६.
--a son of Kali and a cannibal: wife तामसी- पूतना. Br. III. ५९. १०.
(I)--a son of हर्यङ्ग, and father of बृहद्रथ. M. ४८. ९९; वा. ९९. १०९; Vi. IV. १८. २२. [पगे२-531+ २४]
(II)--a son of शठ, and of the रोहिनी family. Br. III. ७१. १७०; वा. ९६. १६८.
(I)--R. a branch of the Ganges. Br. III. ५६. ५२.
(II)--wife of पुरूद्वत (पुरुद्वान्-वा। प्।). Br. III. ७०. ४७; वा. ९५. ४७.
(III)--a daughter of जाम्बवती and कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. २५०.
--(भद्रबाहु): a son of Vasudeva and पौरवी. भा. IX. २४. ४७.
--a son of देवकी and Vasudeva; killed by Kamsa. M. ४६. १३; वा. ९६. १७३.
--of the रोहिणी family. वा. ९६. १६७.
--a son of कृष्ण and नाग्नजिती. Vi. V. ३२. 3.
--a son of जाम्बवती. वा. ९६. २४१.
--a son of शठ and of the रोहिणी family. Br. III. ७१. १६९. [पगे२-532+ २७]
--He brought down trees and plants to Govardhana to please राम. वा. ४५. ११४.
--one of Vasudeva's wives: mother of four sons. Br. III. ७१. १६१ and १७३.
--a son of Dharma after whom came the continent of भद्राश्व; a devout worshipper of हयग्रीव. भा. V. १८. 1.

--the son of महिस्मान्, a man of great prowess; king of वाराणसि, father of Durdama and ९९ other sons, all able archers, whom दीवोदास slew except Durdama; <F>1:  वा. ९२. ६१; ९४. 6; Vi. IV. ११. १०.</F> the family was destroyed by Pratardana. <F>2:  Ib. IV. 8. १२.</F>
--a Maurya who ruled for २५ years. Br. III. ७४. १४५; वा. ९९. ३३२.
--a R. of the Uttarakuru country. वा. ४५. २५.
--a Goddess enshrined at विकूट. M. १३. ३६.
(I)--a son of ऋषभ. भा. V. 4. १०.
(II)--a son of देवकी and Vasudeva killed by Kamsa. भा. IX. २४. ५४; Br. III. ७१. १७५; M. ४६. १३; वा. ९६. १७३; Vi. IV. १५. २६-7. [पगे२-533+ २७]
(III)--a playmate of कृष्ण; he carried वृषभ on his back being defeated in a certain game. भा. X. १८. २४.
(IV)--a king of काशी and son of महिष्- मान्: Had a hundred sons whom दिवोदास killed and took the kingdom, leaving a baby son, unhurt (see भद्रश्रेण्य). भा. IX. २३. २२-3; Br. III. ६७. ६५-66; ६९. 6-7.
--the वैदर्भी queen of पुरुद्वान्. M. ४४. ४५.

--R. rises from the Meru, passes through सविता's forest, शन्खकूट, वृषपर्वतम्, Vatsagiri, नाग- शैल, नीलम्, कपिञ्जलम्, इन्द्रनीलम्, महानीलम्, हेमशृङ्- gam, श्वेत, Sunaga, शतशृङ्ग, पुष्करम्, द्विराजम्, वरा- haparvatam मयूरम्, जातुधि, त्रिशृङ्गम्, मर्यादपर्व- tam, वीरुधम् and falls into the western ocean. वा. ४२. ६१-74.
(I)--a daughter of Meru (घृताची) and queen of भद्राश्व; gave birth to Soma. भा. V. 2. २३; वा. ७०. ६८. ७०.

(II)--a branch of the गन्गा issuing out of the city of ब्रह्मा and descending the शृन्गवन् hills, traverses the continent of the Uttarakurus and falls into the north sea. भा. V. १७. 5 and 8: Vi. II. 2. ३४; 8. ११३.
(III)--अलिअस् कौशल्या: one of Vasudeva's wives; mother of केशिन् and three other sons. भा. IX. २४. ४५, ४८; वा. ९६. १६०. १७१; Vi. IV. १५. १८, २४. [पगे२-534+ २६]

(IV)--a daughter of श्रुतकीर्ति of Kekeya; married by कृष्ण with the approval of her brothers Santar- dana and others; <F>1:  भा. X. ५८. ५६; ६१. १७.</F> welcomed to हस्तिनापुर by द्रौपदी; narrated to द्रौपदी how she was married to कृष्ण. <F>2:  Ib. X. ७१. ४२; ८३. १२.</F>
(V)--a wife of उदारधी. Br. II. ३६. १०१.
(VI)--a daughter of रोहिणी: gave birth to goats and sheep; <F>1:  Br. III. 3. ७४-5.</F> brought forth the Gandharvas and वाजिन्स् known as उच्चैश्र्वस्. <F>2:  वा. ६६. ७२-3.</F>
(VII)--one of the ten wives of Atri. Br. III. 8. ७५.
(VIII)--a वर्ण S4akti. Br. IV. ३२. १३; ४४. ५९ and ९०.
(IX)--a Goddess enshrined at भद्रेश्वर. M. १३. ३१.
(X)--the daughter of अनुह्राद, the daitya; married रजतनाभ, the यक्ष. वा. ६९. १५१.
(XI)--a wife of गरुड. वा. ६९. ३२८.
--the island of वायु; to the west of चन्द्रद्वीपम्; people here live to an age of ५०० years, and are righteous. वा. ४५. ६२-6.
--R. of the केतुमाला country. वा. ४४. १८.
--a daughter of जाम्बवती. वा. ९६. २४१.

(I)--a son of आग्नीध्र and lord of माल्य- vanta: had ten daughters (apsaras) through घृताची; <F>1:  भा. V. 2. १९; Br. II. १४. ४७, ५१; III. 8. ७४; वा. ३३. ४१, ४४. ७०. ६८.</F> placed in charge of the kingdom east of Meru. <F>2:  Vi. II. 1. १७ and २२.</F>

(II)--a continent of Mandara hill east of Meru; bounded on one side by गन्धमादन; traversed by the stream सीता; the capital of भद्राश्वस्, son of Dharma, engaged in the worship of हयग्रीव with due praises; <F>1:  भा. V. १६. १०; १७. 6; १८. 1-6; M. ८३. ३१; ११३. ४४, ५२; वा. ३४. ५७; ३५. २३; Vi. III. 2. २४.</F> coun- try conquered by परीक्षित्; <F>2:  भा. I. १६. १३.</F> people residing here are white in colour and women excell in beauty living for thousands (१०,000-वा। प्।) of years; non-injury and truth prevalent here; people here worship शङ्कर and गौरी; <F>3:  Br. II. १५. ५०, ५७-60; वा. ४२. २४; ४३. 5-9, ११-38.</F> विष्णु in the form of हयशिरस्. <F>4:  Vi. II. 2. ५०.</F>
(III)--a son of कुवलयाश्व who survived the fire from Dhundhu's mouth. भा. IX. 6. २३-24; Br. III. ६३. ६३. [पगे२-536+ २७]
(IV)--a son of शठ, of the रोहिणी family. Br. III. ७१. १६९; वा. ९६. १६७; Vi. IV. १५. २२.
(V)--a son of Rahmavarca and father of १० sons through an Apsaras, घृता (धृता). M. ४९. 4.
(VI)--a son of पृथु and father of five sons, who were residents of the पञ्चालदेश. M. ५०. 2-4.
(VII)--one of the three sons of Dhundhu- मार. वा. ८८. ६१.
--a तीर्थ sacred to भद्रा and the पितृस्. M. १३. ३१; २२. २५, ३२.
(I)--a son of Kali and दुरुक्ती. भा. IV. 8. 4.

(II)--Lord of the Yavanas: adopted the daughter of काल as his sister; his brother was प्रज्वार; <F>1:  भा. IV. २७. २३ and ३०.</F> when attack- ing the city of पुरञ्जन he captured पुरञ्जन himself; <F>2:  Ib. IV. २८. २२-23.</F> allegorically death; the Yavanas represent mental worries. <F>3:  Ib. IV. २९. २२, २३.</F>
(III)--a son of द्रोण, a Vasu. भा. VI. 6. ११.
(V)--a son of तामस Manu. वा. ६२. ४३.
--a कला of Rudra. Br. IV. ३५. ९६.
--a son of Vasudeva and सहदेवा. वा. ९६. १७७.
--a नक्षत्र: fit for performing श्राद्ध. Br. III. १८. १४; वा. ८२. १४.

(I)--(जड): the eldest of the hundred sons of ऋषभ (नाभि) and जयन्ती; was devoted to नारायण; <F>1:  भा. V. 4. 9; 7. 3; XI. 2. १७.</F> a महाभागवत; married पाञ्चजनी, daughter of विश्वरूप and she gave birth to five sons; was installed on the throne; protected his subjects righteously and performed यज्ञस् by the method of चातुर्होत्र; having spent a million years thus he divided his property among his sons and placed Sumati on his throne; he left for the hermitage of Pulastya as a hermit and became constant in the worship of Hari; gave up his kingdom and sought refuge in Hari; <F>2:  Ib. V. 5. २८; 7. (whole); X. ६०. ४१; वा. ३३. ५१-3.</F> a sage; <F>3:  Ib. ४१. ४४.</F> one day when sitting on the bank of the river चक्रनदी he saw a deer coming to the river and quenching her thirst; hearing a lion roar near by the deer took a leap when the young one slipped from her womb into the water and the deer herself fell dead; seeing this helpless one of a deer, Bharata loved it and brought it up as his own son; out of strong attachment to it he was born as a deer when he remembered his past life and was full of remorse; gave up his body by falling into the waters; <F>4:  भा. V. 8. (whole); Vi. II. chh. १४-16, २०.</F> next he was born as the son of a Brahmana of the Angirasa line and with उपनयन the father taught him Vedic literature; on his parents' death his brothers found him mad and unpractical and appointed him to work in the fields; once a certain वृषल chieftain wanted to offer human sacrifice to भद्रकाली and finding that the victim had escap- [पगे२-538+ ३८] ed, his attendants took this जडभरत by force for sacrifice; at the point of his being sacrificed, काली who knew the Brahmana's spiritual virtue appeared in a ferocious form and cutting off the heads of all, rescued Bharata; <F>5:  भा. V. 9. (whole).</F> once on his way to sage Kapila, King रहूगण felt the need for a palanquin-bearer and seeing Bharata the dull-witted at a distance on the banks of the इक्षुमती, asked him to bear his palanquin; finding it carried irregularly causing in- convenience to him the haughty king chastised the Brahmana and threatened him with punishment; to this Bharata made a learned reply that all his remarks were true and nothing would harm one who had realised himself; on this the king free from haughtiness, thought that he was a yogin, and perhaps Kapila incognito; so he asked him who he was; Bharata spoke on mind and its eleven courses modified by माया as obstacles to the dawn of knowledge; he continued to say that what was important was ज्ञान or knowledge which could be acquired by association with great and detach- ed men; in his own case he got defeated in his purpose by attachment to a deer. <F>6:  Ib. V. chh. १० and ११. (whole); and १२. 5-१६.</F> Bharata described in metaphysical language सम्सार as a forest, and the जिवस् as a company of travelling merchants now meeting a Gandharva and now devils, now gathering wealth and now robbed of it; he then explained the implica- tions of सम्सार in plain language and said that the quest after desires and pleasures led one to acquire more कर्म and sow the seeds for a further cycle of births and deaths; <F>7:  Ib. V. १३. 1-२०; १४. 1-४१.</F> was succeeded as king by his son Sumati, <F>8:  Ib. V. १५. 1.</F> Manu so-called for sustaining the people; after him the वर्ष came to be known as भारत; <F>9:  Ib. V. 4. 9; 7. 3; XI. 2. १७; Br. II. १४. ६०-63; वा. ४५. ७६; Vi. II. 1, २८, ३२-4.</F> desirous of the territory on earth. <F>१०:  भा. XII. 3. 9.</F> [पगे२-539+ ३९]

(II)--a son of दशरथ; <F>1:  भा. IX. १०. 3; वा. ८८. १८४, १८९; Vi. IV. 4. ८७.</F> had two sons तक्ष and पुष्कल who had गान्धार for their kingdom; <F>2:  भा. IX. ११. १२; Br. III. ६३. १८५; Vi. IV. 4. १०४.</F> wore bark of wood and ate food dressed with गोमूत्र, took bed on the bare earth during राम's exile, when he was at Nandi- ग्राम meditating on the पादुका of राम he took his place on the शिला; his आश्रम, where holy men congregated; return- ed to अयोध्या with all royal paraphernalia on hearing of राम's arrival; embraced by राम; <F>3:  भा. IX. १०. ३४-40, ४३; वा. १०८. २४, ३३-5.</F> was present at राम's coronation; <F>4:  Vi. IV. 4. १००.</F> killed a number of Gandharvas. <F>5:  भा. IX. ११. १३.</F>

(III)--a son of दुष्यन्त and शकुन्तला; an- nounced to दुष्यन्त as such by a voice from the air; an अम्श of Hari; brought up in his early age by the sage कण्व; became चक्रवर्ति after his father; anointed अधिराट्; per- formed ५५ horse sacrifices on the banks of the Ganges and the यमुना with the aid of Purodha मामतिय; he tied to the sacrificial post ३३०० horses and distributed liberally cows and elephants to priests; he brought under his subjection the किरातस्, हूणस्, Yavanas, आन्ध्रस्, and all the Mlecchas; he recovered the celestial women from रसातल; he ruled righteously for २७००० years; he had three wives of Vidarbha origin; as they did not resemble their father the nine sons born to these were killed by their mothers who feared that they might be set aside; to perpetuate his line, Bharata per- formed Marutsoma when the Maruts presented him Bharad- वाज, son of बृहस्पति whom he adopted as his son; <F>1:  भा. IX. २०. १७-35; M. ४९. ११-5, २८-31; वा. ९९. १३४; Vi. IV. १९. १०-16.</F> made the १६ gifts; <F>2:  M. २७४. १२.</F> again performed Marutsoma for getting a son; Bha- रद्वाज was born as Vitatha to Bharata when Bharata died. ^3 वा. ९९. १५२-8.
(IV)--a name of ब्रह्मन्दनाग्नि Br. II. १२. 8; वा. २९. 7. [पगे२-540+ २९]

(V)--also भारतवर्ष--a country adjacent to Meru: north of the sea and south of the हिमालयस्: nine divisions of; S. to N. १००० Yojanas, from कुमरी to the Ganges' source: E. to W. ९००० Yojanas: the किरातस् were on the East and the Yavanas on the West: slowly the four castes grew; seven Kulaparvatas; was peopled by the Aryas and the Mlecchas and fed by a number of rivers of ever flowing waters like the Ganges, Sindhu: contains a number of kingdoms and tribes: four Yugas in. Br. II. १५. ५०; १६. 4-६९; २९. २३; वा. ३४. ५७; ४१. ८५.
(VI)--a kingdom in the east, watered by the Ganges. Br. II. १८. ५०.
(VII)--born from the middle of the hand of ब्रह्मा. M. 3. ११.

(VIII)--the famous author of the नाट्यशास्त्र; got मेनका, ऊर्वशी and रम्भा to enact लक्ष्मीस्वयम्वर before Indra and पुरूरवस् when ऊर्वशी fell in love with the latter and forgot her अभिनय, for which Bharata cursed her. M. २४. २७-33.
(IX)--a son of Karandhama. M. ४८. 2.
(X)--a son of तालजन्घ and father of वृष. Vi. IV. ११. २४-5.
--the family of Bharata, who was the first of the line. M. 4. १९, २३. [पगे२-541+ ३५]
--an Apsarasa and a daughter of सुयशा. वा. ६९. १४.
--a son of Angiras; wife सद्वती, and son, Parjanya. वा. २८. १५; Br. II. ११. १८.
(I)--in the हिमालयन् forests; fit for श्राद्ध offering; here is the foot print of Matanga; <F>1:  Br. III. १३. १०५; वा. ७७. ९८.</F> a तीर्थ sacred to लक्ष्मीरन्गना. <F>2:  M. १३. ४६.</F>
(II)--the hermitage of Bharata in गया. वा. ११२. २४.
(I)--a वासिष्ठ Brahmava1din. Br. II. ३२. ११५; M. १४५. ११०.
(II)--a resident of ब्रह्मक्षेत्र. वा. ५९. १०५.

(I)--also called Vitatha: a Siddha; <F>1:  भा. VI. १५ [१४].</F> be- came a son of Bharata; when ममता, the wife of the brother of बृहस्पति was pregnant, बृहस्पति had sexual inter- course with her; the foetus obstructing him, he cursed the child in embryo; fearing divorce by her husband, ममता abandoned the child when Gods said “भर द्वाजम्” i.e. ‘rear the child born of two’, and hence he became Bharad- वाज; still she abandoned him; nourished by the Maruts he was given over to Bharata; <F>2:  Ib. IX. २०. ३५-39.</F> father of Manyu; <F>3:  Ib. X. २१. 1.</F> a sage of the Vaivasvata epoch; <F>4:  Ib. VIII. १३. 5.</F> invited for the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर; <F>5:  Ib. X. ७४. 7.</F> called on the dying भीष्म; <F>6:  Ib. I. 9. 6.</F> came to स्यमन्तपञ्चक to [पगे२-542+ ४१] see कृष्ण; <F>7:  Ib. X. ८४. 3.</F> came to see परीक्षित् practising प्रायोपवेश; <F>8:  Ib. I. १९. १०.</F> officiated in परशुराम's sacrifice. Heard the पुराण from सृञ्जय and narrated it to Gautama. <F>9:  Br. III. ४७. ४६; IV. 4. ६३.</F>

(II)--a sage of the Vaivasvata epoch; a योगि; son of बृहस्पति arisen out of the sexual fluid at the refusal of ममता to receive it; abandoned by his parents, was brought up by the Maruts who gave him to Bharata who wanted him; hence two castes Brahmanas and वैश्यस् sprang from him; became a क्षत्रिय; <F>1:  M. 9. २७; ४९. १५-33; Br. II. ३८. २७; वा. ९९. १३७, १४८, १५०, १६९.</F> residence at Govardhana where he planted flowers and trees; lives with the sun for part of the year; <F>2:  M. ११४. ३९; १२६. १३; Br. II. १६. ४५.</F> a ऋषिक; a मन्त्रकृत्; <F>3:  M. १४५. ९५, १०१; Br. II. ३२. १०१ and १०७.</F> a पञ्चार्षेय; dva- यामुष्यायन gotra; <F>4:  M. १९६. ५०, ५२.</F> no marital relations among the बृहस्- pati, गार्ग and भरद्वाज lines. <F>5:  Ib. १९६. २०, २४.</F> Praised शिव for burn- ing Tripuram; <F>6:  Ib. १३३. ६७.</F> the १९थ् Veda-व्यास; जटामालि, the अवतार् of the Lord. <F>7:  Br. II. ३३. 7; ३५. १२१; वा. २३. १८५; Vi. III. 3. १६.</F>

(III)--a son of बृहस्पति and मरुत्ता; born when दीर्घतमस् was already in the womb; brought by the Maruts to Bharata and became his son Vitatha; <F>1:  वा. ९९. १४०-156; Vi. IV. १९. १६-19.</F> father of Manyu. <F>2:  Ib. IV. १९. २०.</F>

(IV)--son of बृहस्पति; a branch of Angi- ras; <F>1:  वा. ६५. १०३, १०७.</F> a मन्त्रकृत् of the Angirasa branch; <F>2:  Ib. ५९. १०१.</F> the father of आयुर्वेद which he compiled in eight parts and imparted them to his pupils; <F>3:  Ib. ९२. २२.</F> one of the seven sages. <F>4:  Ib. १००. १२; १०३. ६३.</F> [पगे२-543+ २७]
(V)--a sage presiding over the month of Tapasya; <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ४०. वा. ५२. १२.</F> in the sun's chariot in the month of कार्त्तिक. <F>2:  Vi. II. १०. १२.</F>
(VI)--a northern kingdom; a tribe. Br. II. १६. ५०; M. ११४. ४३.
(VII)--a son of Amitrajit and father of Dharmi. वा. ९९. २८६.
(VIII)--the Veda-व्यास of the १२थ् dva1- para. Vi. III. 3. १४.
--a son of Vijaya and father of वृक. भा. IX. 8. 2.
(I)--a son of वीतिहोत्र and father of भार्ग- भूमि. भा. IX. १७. 9.
(II)--a son of Vanhi and father of भानुमन्. भा. IX. २३. १६.
(III)--enabled Arjuna to conquer the निवात- kavacas; <F>1:  M. 6. २९.</F> a Devata. <F>2:  वा. १०८. ३२.</F>
--a Pravara sage. M. १९९. १७. [पगे२-544+ २६]
--a son of Arka and father of five sons, Mudgala and others; as the five sons were fit to rule five countries भर्म्याश्व called them by the common name, the पाञ्चालस्. भा. IX. २१. ३१-33.
--a वैश्य Mantrakr2t. M. १४५. ११६.
(I)--a son of नाभाग Aris2t2a and father of वत्सप्रीति (प्राम्शु-ब्र्। प्। and वा। प्।) भा. IX. 2. २३. Br. III. ६१. 3. वा. ८६. 3-4.
(II)--a वैश्य Mantrakr2t. Br. II. ३२. १२१.
(III)--an आत्रेय gotraka1ra. M. १९७. 7.
--to be worshipped in house and palace building. M. २५३. २७; २५५. 9; २६८. १८.
--(भल्लाट-म्। प्।) son of Udaksvana (Udak- sena-ब्र्। प्।, म्। प्।, and वा। प्।); with him ends the line of बार्हदीषवस्. भा. IX. २१. २६; M. ४९. ५९; वा. ९९. १८२.
--a son of Udaksena. Vi. IV. १९. ४७.

--(गिरीश, शन्कर, महेश्वर); one who first appeared himself; an epithet of शिव; other names of; pre- siding deity of the waters; a resident of the Aruna hill; wife [पगे२-545+ ३५] ओषा; son उशन; made the रुद्रकुन्टसरस् in the Kuru country; <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ४९; M. ११. १६; १२९. 3; १३२. १८, २१; १५६. १०; १८४. 4, 7, १२; १८५. १२; २५०. ५१; २६५. ४१; Br. II. १८. १९, २१, ३२ ff and ७२; वा. 4. ४३; २१. 7; २७. 8; १००. ४३; १११. २९.</F> the तामसि aspect of Svayambhu; destroyer; <F>2:  Br. III. 1. १५; 3. ८५.</F> ordered Indra and Hari to take up the first lead in Tripuram; his part in the war; burnt the God of Love; <F>3:  M. १३७. ३६; १३८. ३९-41; १५४. २५१.</F> worshipped by the भूतस्; <F>4:  Br. III. 7. ३७२-3.</F> favoured Jambha with the boon of immunity from being hurt by weapons; <F>5:  Ib. III. ४२. १७; ६५. ३१; ७२. ८०; IV. 2. २४७; 1. ४०.</F> ety. hence waters to be kept pure; <F>6:  Ib. II. १०. 8, ३० ff; १३. ४२ and १३६.</F> married सती, दक्ष's daughter; was disobedient to his father-in-law; <F>7:  Ib. II. 9. ५४; वा. ३०. ३८.</F> cursed the seven ऋषिस्, who spoke on behalf of सती, daughter of दक्ष. <F>8:  Ib. ६५. २०.</F>
(II)--a Rudra; the son of भूत and सरूपा; wife सती. भा. VI. 6. १७; Br. IV. ३४. २६; Vi. I. 7. २६; 8. 6-7.
(III)--a son of Raucya Manu. Br. IV. 1. १०४; वा. १००. १०८.
(IV)--a son of Vasudeva. M. ४६. २२.
(VI)--the first kalpa where भगवान् is known as आनन्द. वा. २१. २८.
(VII)--the fourth kalpa. वा. २१. ३०. [पगे२-546+ २७]
(VIII)--the son of प्रतिहर्ता. Vi. II. 1. ३७.
(IX)--a son of Dhruva, a Vasu. वा. ६६. २०.
--a कश्यप gotraka1ra. M. १९९. 5.

--house; the time for the building of houses; वैशाख, आषाढ, श्रावण, कार्त्तिक, मार्गशीर्ष, फाल्गुण are recommended; Citra, ज्येष्ठ, भाद्रपद, आश्वयुज, पौष, and माघ are not recommended; the नक्षत्रस् अश्वि- ni, रोहिणि, मूलम्, the three Uttaras, स्वाति, Hasta and अनू- राध are commended; excepting Sundays and Wednesdays all days are good; the respective position of सूर्य and Can- dra must be considered; this also applies to the making of wells and tanks; the examination of the ground is differently mentioned for different castes; सामाहिक va1stu is to be installed; details as regards the kind of wood, the position and other technique are also given in the chapter; the fol- lowing chapter (२५४) gives a description of चतुस्शाल, tri- शाल, द्विशाल and एकशाल. That of the king (palace): consists of five प्राकारस्; of युवराज, etc., of the four castes and then of performers of penance. M. Chh. २५२-4.
--a शक्ति created from नृसिम्ह's guhya. M. १७९. ६४.
--an Apsarasa clan from the earth. वा. ६९. ५७.
--the vow in honour of शिवा. M. १०१. ७७.

--one among the महा- पुराणस्; comprises १४,500 श्लोकस्; narrated by ब्रह्मा to Manu containing the माहात्म्यम् of the sun, and the account of Aghora kalpa with the characteristics of भूतग्राम; he who makes a gift of it with a कुम्भ on the Full Moon day of the पुष्य month gets the fruits of the अग्निष्टोम; लोमहर्षण revealed it to the sages. भा. XII. 7. २४; १३. 6. M. ५०. ६८, ७३-77; ५३. ३१-33. वा. १०४. 3; Vi. III. 6. २२.
(I)--a son of Dhruva and father of शम्बु. Vi. I. १३. 1.
(II)--a son of Priyavrata; <F>1:  Vi. II. 1. 7.</F> became king of शाकद्वीप. <F>2:  Ib. II. 1. १४.</F>
(III)--a sage of the IX epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. २३.
--a group of gods of the चाक्षुष epoch. Vi. III. 1. २७. [पगे२-548+ ३५]

--sacred ash supposed to be the वीर्य of शिव who is Bhasmasamcchannadeha; <F>1:  Br. II. २७. १० and ९२, १०५-28; III. २८. १२.</F> स्नानम् of, makes one pure: amulet for places of confinement. <F>2:  Ib. II. २७. १०५-115.</F>

--Mt. on the right side of the शिला, where Yama, and Agastya with his wife are residing; <F>1:  वा. १०८. ५३, ८५.</F> here for self and others पिण्ड is offered, <F>2:  Ib. १०९. १५; ११२. ५३.</F> after worshipping Bhasma- नाथ enshrined here.
--the deity at भस्मकूट in गया. वा. ११२. ५३.
--a branch of Angiras. वा. ६५. १०७.
--a राजऋषि, becoming a Brahmana. वा. ९१. ११६.
--a son of Vajramitra and father of Deva- भूति: ruled for ३२ years. भा. XII. 1. १८; Br. III. ७४. १५४; Vi. IV. २४. ३५-6.
--Detachment (Virakti) and devotion (Bhakti) are the main planks. भा. XI. 2. 7, ११, ३१, ४२; 3. ३३.

--(also भागवतम्) a महा- पुराण recited by कृष्ण to ब्रह्मा at the beginning of the creation; <F>1:  भा. III. 4. १३; XII. 7. २३; Vi. III. 6. २१.</F> as sacred as and equal to the Veda; the sun to the darkness of Kali; <F>2:  भा. II. 1. 8; XII. 4. ४२; I. 1. 3; 3. ४०, ४५.</F> a compendium of the Lord's glories; the essense of all वेदाङ्गस्, the first among the पुराणस् and just like काशि in importance; <F>3:  Ib. II. 7. ५१; XII. 4. १५-17.</F> contains १८००० वेर्सेस्; abstract of the contents:--an exposition of the गायत्री and [पगे२-549+ ३८] the incident of the killing of वृत्रासुर; a composition of the शारस्वत Kalpa, the heyday of it; <F>4:  Ib. II. १०. 1-१७; XII. १२. 1-४५; १३. 5, 9; M. ५३. २०-22.</F> fruit of studying it; <F>5:  भा. XII. १२. ४६-68.</F> the पुराण Samhita1 was taught originally to नारद by the sage नारायण; नारद told it to व्यास who told it to शुक in the beginning of the द्वापर Yuga; <F>6:  Ib. XII. 4. ४१-3; I. 7. 8; II. 1. 8.</F> सन्कर्षण taught it to सनत्कुमार who instructed सान्ख्यायन; he in turn imparted it to पराशर and बृहस्पति; requested by Pulastya, पराशर taught it to Maitreya; <F>7:  Ib. III. 8. 2-9.</F> narrated to परीक्षित् by शुक; <F>8:  Ib. II. 8. २८.</F> expounded by सूत at नैमिषालय to the sages and seers. <F>9:  Ib. XII. 4. ४१-43.</F> पुराणदशलक्षणम्; <F>१०:  Ib. II. 9. ४३.</F> one who makes a gift of it with a golden lion on the Full Moon day of प्रौष्तपद would reach the heaven of bliss; <F>११:  M. ५३. २०-22.</F> contains १८००० stanzas. <F>१२:  वा. १०४. 5.</F>
--those who had dedicated themselves to the service of God by singing in His praise. वा. १०४. १४.
--above Brahmaloka and at a distance of a crore of yojanas and ५० niyuktas; here are प्रकृतिस्, सूक्ष्म, prolific depending on each other. वा. १०१. २२१-6.
--one devoted to Hari; attributes of. भा. XI. 2. ४५-55.
(I)--an आऋसेय Pravara (भार्गव). M. १९५. ३७. [पगे२-550+ ३५]
(II)--a son of Kuthumi. वा. ६१. ३८.
--an आर्षेय Pravara of the भार्गवस्. M. १९५. ३७.

--(गङ्गा): so-called on account of भगी- ratha having brought her; a sacred river; <F>1:  Br. II. १८. ४२; III. १३. १००; ५४. ५१; ६३. १६८-9; M. १२. ४४; १६३. ६०; वा. ८८. १६९; Vi. III. १८. ५७; IV. 4. ३५; V. ३५. ३०.</F> Indra worshipped ललिता on the banks of the; <F>2:  Br. IV. १२. ४४.</F> to its east lay Hamsaprapatanam. a sacred spot; <F>3:  M. १०६. ३२.</F> the seventh stream of the गङ्गा flowing towards the south in हिमाह्ववर्ष; <F>4:  Ib. १२१. ४१; वा. ४७. ४०.</F> fit for स्राद्ध. <F>5:  Ib. ७७. ९२.</F>
--a seer; <F>1:  वा. ३४. ६२.</F> heard the विष्णु पुराण from Priya- vrata and narrated it to Stambhamitra. <F>2:  Vi. VI. 8. ४४.</F>
(भाजिरस्)--one of the five Deva गणस् of the १४थ् Bhauta Manu; are seven rivers. वा. १००. १११, ११२.
--a banyan tree whose shade is fit for play- ing games; near बृन्दावन. भा. X. १८. २२; १९. १३.
--in the vicinity of बृन्दावन where lived Pralamba, the demon; <F>1:  Vi. V. 9. 2.</F> the sporting ground of the cow- herds. <F>2:  Ib. V. 9, 3-१५.</F>

(I)--a daughter of दक्ष and one of the ten wives of Dharma; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. 4-5; M. 5. १५; वा. ६६. 2; Vi. I. १५. १०५.</F> her sons were भानवस् of whom Deva- ऋषभ was one. <F>2:  Br. III. 3. 2, ३२; M. 5. १८; Vi. I. १५. १०६.</F>
(II)--a son of Prativyoman and father of दिवा(r)ka. भा. IX. १२. १०.

(III)--a son of कृष्ण and सत्यभामा; <F>1:  भा. X. ६१. १०; ९०. ३३; Br. III. ७१. २४७-48; M. ४७. १७; वा. ९६. २३८; Vi. V. ३२. 1.</F> went out with his brothers for sport and seeing a huge lizard on a wall reported it to कृष्ण; <F>2:  भा. X. ६४. 1-4.</F> got himself killed in प्रभासा. <F>3:  Ib. XI. ३०. १७.</F>
(IV)--a son of क्रोधा and a Devagandharva. Br. III. 6. ३९.
(V)--one of the २० Sutapa gods. Br. IV. 1. १५; वा. १००. १५.
(VI)--one of the four sons of स्वारोचिष Manu. M. 9. 7.
(VII)--the father of भानवस्. M. २०३. 8; वा. ६६. ३३.
(VIII)--a daughter of सत्यभामा. वा. ९६. २४०.
(IX)--a son of भार्ग and father of त्रयीसानु. Vi. IV. १६. 3. [पगे२-552+ २६]
--the people of the south. वा. ४५. १३०.
(I)--the son of बृहदश्व and father of प्रतीकाश्व. भा. IX. १२. ११.
(II)--the son of केशिध्वज and father of शतद्युम्न; <F>1:  भा. IX. १३. २१.</F> brother of शीरध्वज. <F>2:  Br. III. ६४. १८.</F>
(III)--a son of Bharga and father of Tri- भानु. भा. IX. २३. १६-17.
(IV)--a son of कृष्ण and सत्यभामा. भा. X. ६१. १०.
(V)--a son of सीरध्वज Maithila; his brother कुशध्वज, lord of काशि. वा. ८९. १८. Vi. IV. 5. ३०.
(I)--the wife of Sagara and mother of Asa- manjasa. M. १२. ३९, ४२.

(II)--the chief among the १०,000 queens of धर्ममूर्ति, the king of बृहत्कल्प; wife of the goldsmith, शौण्ड in previous birth; was born again as queen for her services in connection with a gift of लवणाचल by लीलावती (s.v.). M. ९२. १९-24. [पगे२-553+ २६]
--the son of बृहदश्व and father of Pra- तीताश्व. वा. ९९. २८४; Vi. IV. २२. 4.
--the world of the sun. M. २८०. १०.
--took part in the defence of द्वारका from शाल्व. भा. X. ७६. १४.
--the observance of the vow leads to the world of the sun. M. १०१. ६०.
--a son of Candragiri. M. १२. ५५.
--brought forth tigers, lions, elephants, etc. वा. ६९. २८९.
--an आख्यान by व्यास; the essentials of the Vedas are introduced for the use of women, शूद्रस् and others. भा. I. 4. २५, २९; 5. 3.
--belonging to the line of पूरु; after the name of Bharata son of दुष्यन्त; <F>1:  M. २४. ७१; ४९. ११.</F> kingdom of the. <F>2:  Ib. १२१. ४९.</F>

--after king Bharata, son of ऋषभ; विष्णु in the form of कूर्म; south of the हिमालयस् and north of the sea; <F>1:  भा. V. 4. 9; 6. १३; १६. 9; M. ११३, २८, ४४; ११४. ११; Vi. II. 3. 1-२२.</F> a कर्मभूमि; <F>2:  भा. V. १७. ११.</F> ९००० yojanas in extent; <F>3:  Br. III. ५३. १४; ५६. 2; II. १४. ६२, ७२; १७. 1; २१. 6.</F> the seven chief mountains in it are the Mahendra, Malaya, Sahya, शुक्तिमत्, ऋक्ष, Vindhya and पारियात्र; divided into nine divisions. इन्द्रद्वीप, कशेरु, ताम्रपर्ण, Gabhas- timat, नागद्वीप, Saumya, Gandharva, and वारुण (च्। Aruna ?), besides the present land; a १००० yojanas from north to south; on the east are the किरातस् and on the west the Yavanas; in the middle, men of the four castes; then rivers are mentioned; <F>4:  भा. V. १७. 9; १९. 9-२८; वा. २४. 1; ३३. ५२, ६१; ३४. २८; ४१. ३२; ४५. ७५, ८९, ९४-5; ५७. २०.</F> here time reckoned as four yugas; the best of all territories in जम्बूद्वीप; original name was Aja- नाभ; <F>5:  भा. V. 7. 3.</F> conquered by परीक्षित्; <F>6:  Ib. I. १६. १३.</F> described. <F>7:  वा. ४५. ७२-137.</F>
(I)--is भारतवर्ष. Br. II. १४. ७२.
(II)--(वाणी and सरस्वती); wife of प्रजापति; served ललिता with चामर; gave the flywhisk to गन्गा and entered the face of ब्रह्मा. Br. IV. ३९. ७०-71; M. 4. 8.
(III)--a R. in the केतुमाला country. वा. ४४. २१.
(I)--with the sun in the शरत् season. Br. II. २३. १२; ३५. ६४.

(II)--a son of बृहस्पति; <F>1:  वा. ६६. 1 and 2, ५५; ६४. २६.</F> a branch of An- girasa; <F>2:  Ib. ६५. ९७ and १०६.</F> a sage by Garbha; <F>3:  Ib. ५९. ९२.</F> a मन्त्रकृत्; a Mantra ब्राह्- माण ka1raka. <F>4:  Ib. ५९. ९८, १३१.</F> [पगे२-555+ २९]

(III)--performed श्राद्ध at कश्यपपद and found two hands black and white protruding, and feeling a doubt asked his mother who said the black hand was his father; but the white hand contested that he was the Pro- creator; the black said, that he was the owner of क्षेत्र; भारद्वाज found her of bad character. वा. १११. ५८-63.
--a तीर्थ on the नर्मदा, where Lord विरूपाक्ष is enshrined; its merits detailed. M. १९४. १८-30.
--a measure of weight. M. ८२. 5; ८५. 2.
--the महाभारत containing the cssence of the Vedas in a lakh of verses. M. ५३. ७०.
--(of Broach); a tribe. M. ११४. ५०.
--to be uttered in founding a new temple. M. २६५. २८.
(I)--a son of वीतिहोत्र, and father of भार्ग- भूमि. Vi. N. 8. २०.
(II)--a son of Vanhi and father of भानु. Vi. IV. १६. 3.
--a son of भार्ग. The line of कश्य ends with him; <F>1:  भा. IX. १७. 9-१०.</F> did propaganda for the spread of वर्ण धर्म। <F>2:  Vi. IV. 8. २०.</F> [पगे२-556+ ३७]
(I)--an eastern country. Br. II. १६. ५४; वा. ४५. १२३.

(II)--a श्रुतऋषि; <F>1:  Br. II. २४. ८९, १०४; ३३. 2.</F> got wealth by meditating on the १०८ names of the देवी; <F>2:  M. १३. ६२.</F> made the १६ gifts; <F>3:  Ib. २७४. ११.</F> got siddhi at Benares. <F>4:  Ib. १८४. १५.</F>

(III)--(Jamadagni, Unnata, वेदश्री): a sage of the first epoch of सावर्ण Manu; drank Soma; killed by the साम्हिकेयस् and their groups of Asuras; <F>1:  Br. III. 6. २२; IV. 1. १०. वा. ६२. १६ and ४१, ५४, ६५; ६४. २५; ८६. ४९.</F> of the family of भृगु; <F>2:  Ib. ६४. 2; १००. ८२, ९७, १०७ and ११६; १०६. ३५.</F> भार्गवम् Vapus2ma1n; one of the seven sages; Tapomati, निरुट्साक, अग्निबाहु.

(IV)--(planet: शुक्र); in size (1/१६) of the moon; <F>1:  M. १२८. ४७ and ६३; वा. ५३. ६६; १११. 5.</F> chariot of, drawn by eight steeds (म्। प्।); drawn by ten horses (ब्र्। प्। and वा। प्।) of different colours--श्वेत, पिशन्ग, सारन्ग, नील, पीत, vilohita, कृष्ण, harita, पृषत and पृश्नि; <F>2:  M. १२७. 7; Br. II. २३. ८१; वा. ५२. ७४.</F> stood near the wheel of the chariot of त्रिपुरारि in defence; <F>3:  M. १३८. २०, ६१.</F> has sixteen rays; <F>4:  वा. ५३. ८६.</F> born of तिष्य in the चाक्षुष epoch; the first of ताराग्रहस्. <F>5:  Ib. ५३. १११.</F>
(V)--the name of व्यास in the third द्वा- para. The Lord takes the अवतार् of Damana with four sons. वा. २३. १२३.
(VI)--a son of ऋषभ, the अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १४४. [पगे२-557+ २८]
(VII)--(शुक्राचार्य); priest of the Asuras; <F>1:  वा. ५३. ८०.</F> conversation of, with Virocana on the origin of अन्गार- व्रत। <F>2:  M. २४. ५२; ७२. 6.</F>
(VIII)--राम--is परशुराम created by ललिता in her war with भण्ड. Br. IV. २९. ११०.
--a देवगण. Br. III. 1. ५०.
--Vatsa, विश्व, अश्विषेण, पाण्ड, Pathya, शौनक, पक्षस् are collectively called as. वा. ६५. ९६.
--an आर्षेयप्रवर (Angiras). M. १९६. 7.

--seven Devas who live in the midst of three worlds for ७१ yugas; leave for Maharloka at the end of the Manvantara and the three worlds become unsupported; stars, planets, etc., become lost to their places; here these Devas become १४ gan2as commencing with Jita and leave for Janaloka at the time of सङ्कलन; all creatures are destroy- ed when a new creation sets in. वा. १००. ११९-32.
--a क्षेत्रम् sacred to विष्णु who defeated a number of Asuras. M. १९२. 1-2.
--a क्षत्रिय who became a dvija. Br. III. ६६. ८७. [पगे२-558+ २५]
--a name of विनायक. Br. III. ४२. ३६.
--the २७थ् kalpa; Agni became मण्डलि and shone over भुव and देव; after the end of १००० years came the सूर्य man2d2ala. वा. २१. ६१-7.
--impure mind, spoils the effects of good deeds (dharma). वा. 8. १९०-2.
--a son of भृगु, and a Deva. Br. III. 1. ८९; वा. ६५. ८७.
--the Devas of the Auttama epoch. M. 9. १३.
--are said to be eight flowers; such as clemency, self-restraint, tenderness, patience, resignation, devotion, meditation and truth (Cf. Wilson). Vi. V. 7. ६९.
--three-fold, Brahma भावन, Karma भावन and Ubhaya भावन, according to the comment- ator. Vi. VI. 8. 7.
--a caste equal to शूद्र in प्लक्षद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. १७.
--a Janapada of the Bhadra country. वा. ४३. २२.
--a group of Gods in the चाक्षुष epoch; they are Vijaya, Sujaya, Mana, उद्यान, Sumati, Supari and Arthapati. Br. II. ३६. ६६, ७२; वा. ६२. ६०-1.
--the wife of शूर; mother of देवमीधुष and ten other sons. वा. ९६. १४३.
--one who knows the भाष्य; perhaps महा- भाष्य of पतञ्जलि. वा. ८३. ५२.
--the knowledge of, starting in द्वापर. Br. ११. ३१. २४; M. १४४. १३. २३.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४२.
--sons of भासी and गरुड; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. ४५५.</F> kites of ताम्रा line. <F>2:  Vi. I. २१. १६.</F>
--one of the २० Sutapa gods. वा. १००. १५.
(I)--a daughter of ऋषित. Br. III. 7. १३. [पगे२-560+ ३५]

(II)--a daughter of ताम्रा and कश्यप; mar- ried गरुत्मान्; mother of भासस्, उलूकस्, Crows, Hens, Cuckoos, Kalavinkas, Doves, लावतित्तिरस्, Sparrows, Par- tridges, Owls, Vultures, काककुक्कुटस्, etc. Br. III. 7. ४४६-448, ४५५; M. 6. ३०-31; वा. ६९, ३२५, ३२८, ३३५-36; Vi. I. २१. १५-16.
(III)--an Apsaras. वा. ६९. ४८.
--a तुषित god. Br. II. ३६. १०.

--(आदित्य, सूर्य): an epithet of the Sun; <F>1:  M. ११. १०; ९३. १३; वा. ३१. ३५, ३७; Vi. II. 8. 2; VI. 7. 3 and २०.</F> creator of days and therefore of time; is Samvatsara; <F>2:  Br. II. १३. १२४, १२६; २१. 6.</F> van- quished by रावण; <F>3:  Ib. III. 5. ७९; 7. २५४; IV. 9. ३५.</F> devotees of, reach शिवालयम् by dying at Benares; <F>4:  M. १८३. १०४.</F> the मण्डलम् of, ९००० yojanas in extent, twice that of the Moon; <F>5:  वा. ५०. ६१, ६३.</F> द्वादशात्म। <F>6:  Ib. ५३. ४२.</F>
--see सूर्य. Vi. IV. १४. ३६.
(I)--(मार्ग) taught by नारद to the children of दक्ष; <F>1:  भा. VI. 5. ३६.</F> duties of. <F>2:  M. ४०. 1, 5.</F>

(II)--(see also Yati) main व्रतस् five; and sup- plementary, five; main:--ध्यानम्, समाधि of the senses, begging at seven houses, silence and release from sangha. Supplementary:--Purity in conduct, discipline (vinaya) शौचम्, non-retaliation and सम्यक्दर्शनम्, besides non theft, Brahmacarya, non-covetousness, ahimsa, non-anger, service to the Guru, medicated food, daily study, alms, resig [पगे२-561+ २९] nation, generosity, etc., becomes one with ब्रह्मा for observing such dharma. Br. II. 7. १७९; वा. 8. १८६-7; १६. १८-9; ५९. २५; १०५. २५; Vi. III. 9. २४-42.

--those who could not find the one in the three but think of them as separate and even as superior to one's own. Some call the one God ब्रह्मा, प्रजापति, शिव and विष्णु; these will be troubled by यातुधानस् and पिशाचस्. वा. ६६. १११-8.
--as against तत्वदर्शि--sectarians in reli- gion. Br. III. 3. ८९-90. ९७.
--a son of मणिभद्र. वा. ६९. १५५.
--a tribe. Br. IV. 7. १९.
--a son of हृदिक. Br. III. ७१. १४१.
--a son of हृदिक. वा. ९६. १३९.
--the son of Vijaya and father of काञ्चन. भा. IX. १५. 3.

(II)--शिव with आकाशस्थानम्; wife, Diks and son Svarga; <F>1:  Br. II. १०. ८१; वा. २७. १४, ४५, and ५४.</F> the sixth name of महादेव, with the आकाश element predominating; hence nuisance should not be com- mitted nor conjugal union in the open. <F>2:  Br. II. १०. १४, ५०.</F> [पगे२-562+ २७]
(III)--a वैकुण्ठ God; <F>1:  Br. II. ३६. ५७.</F> with the sun in the months, Madhu and माधव. <F>2:  Ib. II. २३. 3.</F>
(IV)--a Marut of the third गण. Br. III. 5. ९४; वा. ६७. १२६.
(V)--a Mauneya Gandharva. Br. III. 7. 3.
(VI)--a son of खशा and a राक्षस. Br. III. 7. १३३; वा. ६९. १६५.
(VII)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३५.
(VIII)--a king; the son of अमावसु, and father of काञ्चनप्रभ; <F>1:  Br. III. ६६. २३; Vi. IV. 7. 2-3.</F> a विश्वजित्. <F>2:  वा. ९१. ५२.</F>
(IX)--(भीमसेन) the पाण्डव, who killed जरासन्ध and gave his chariot to कृष्ण. Br. III. ६८. २८; Vi. V. ३५. २८.
(X)--one of the eleven Rudras; a son of भूत and सरूपा; <F>1:  M. १५३. १९; भा. VI. 6. १७; Br. IV. ३४. ४१. Vi. I. 8. 6.</F> the presiding deity of आकाश। <F>2:  M. २६५. ४२.</F>
(XI)--an Asura of the Atala region. वा. ५०. १७.
(XIII)--a son of महावीर्य. वा. ९९. १६२.
--a minister of भण्ड who advised him to fight Indra. Br. IV. १२. ५६.
--once called कल्याणिनी; preached to भीम by Lord कृष्ण; once observed by ऊर्वशी, Satya- भामा and others to attain status; worship of गरुड, Govinda, शिव, विनायक, दिक्पालस्. M. ६९. १९-57.
--one of the seven pralaya clouds. M. 2. 8.
(I)--son of Ketuman and father of Divo- दास (प्रजेश्वर-ब्र्। प्।); himself known as दिवोदास in वा। प्।; king of वाराणसि. भा. IX. १७. 5-6; Br. III. ६७. २६; वा. ९२. २३; Vi. IV. 8. ११.
(II)--a son of विकृति, and father of Nava- ratha (Rathavara-ब्र्। प्।) भा. IX. २४. 4; Br. III. ७०. ४२; वा. ९५. ४१; Vi. IV. १२. ४१.
(III)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३८.
(IV)--a son of Vimala and father of Nava- ratha. M. ४४. ४१. [पगे२-564+ ४२]

--a R. in the Sahya hill in दक्षिणापथ; <F>1:  वा. ४५. १०४; Vi. II. 3. १२.</F> in भारतवर्ष; visited by बलराम from the Sahya hill; <F>2:  भा. V. १९. १८; X. ७९. १२; Br. II. १६. ३४.</F> sacred to the पितृस्. <F>3:  M. २२. ४५; ११४. २९.</F>
--a kingdom through which the गन्गा flows. M. १२१. ४७.
--a Tripravara. M. १९६. ३४.
--the observance of the vow leads to the world of विष्णु. M. १०१. ५१.

(I)--(also भीम); a पाण्डव son of कुन्ती; father of श्रुतसेन; had another son घटोत्कच by हिदिम्बा, and a third Sarvagata by काली; <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. २९-31; Vi. IV. १४. ३५; २०. ४०.</F> failed to hit the fish in लक्ष्मणा's स्वयम्वर; <F>2:  Ib. X. ७१. २७; ५८. 4; ६४. 9.</F> joy at कृष्ण's visit to Indraprastha and कृष्ण's respects to him; was consoled by कृष्ण when banished to forest; <F>3:  भा. X. ८३. २३.</F> sent to the western terri- tories with the Matsyas, Kekayas and Madrakas. <F>4:  Ib. X. ७२. १३.</F> Advised by Uddhava to go in Brahmana's disguise to जरासन्ध and vanquish him; went with कृष्ण and Arjuna to Girivraja. After killing जरासन्ध, भीमसेन returned to हस्तिना- pura. <F>5:  Ib. X. ७१. 7; ७२. ३२-46; ७३. ३१.</F> Declined to follow बलराम's advice not to fight; fought with Duryodhana at कुरुक्षेत्र and felled him with his गदा; <F>6:  Ib. X. ७८ [९५(v)३९]; ७९. २३ and २८; I. 7. १३.</F> was in charge of cooking in the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर; <F>7:  Ib. X. ७५. 4.</F> fed धृतराष्ट्र; advocated killing of अश्वत्- थाम and felt sorry at कृष्ण's separation; <F>8:  Ib. I. १३. २२; II. 7. ३५; I. 7. ५१ and ५४; 9. १५; १०. १०.</F> put an end to the राक्षसस् born of क्रोधवशा: propagator of भीमद्वा- दशीव्रत; <F>9:  M. 6. ४३; ६९. १२-3.</F> gave पिण्ड sitting on his left leg to जनार्धन, [पगे२-565+ २४] and attained Brahmaloka with his brothers; <F>१०:  वा. ८६. ४८; १०८. ९१.</F> strength of; depended on the good will of कृष्ण. <F>११:  Vi. V. ३८. ३३.</F>
(II)--a son of परीक्षित्. भा. IX. २२. ३५; Vi. IV. २०. 1; २१. 2.
(III)--a Mauneya Gandharva. Br. III. 7. 1.
(IV)--an author of a treatise on Music. Br. III. ६१. ४२.
(V)--a son of दक्ष. M. ५०. ३८.
(VI)--a son of Suratha. वा. ९९. २२९.
(VII)--a son of ऋक्ष, and father of दिलीप. वा. ९९. २३३; Vi. IV. २०. 7.
(I)--a mother-goddess; <F>1:  M. १७९. २२.</F> enshrined in हिमाद्रि. <F>2:  Ib. १३. ४७.</F>
(II)--a R of the केतुमाला country. वा. ४४. १८.
--a तीर्थ on the नर्मदा; sacred to the पिट्र्स्. M. २२. ४६, ७५; १९१. 5. [पगे२-566+ ३७]
--one of the १४ gan2as of Apsarasas, born of मृत्यु. Br. III. 7. २०.
--a यक्ष, son of पुण्यजनी and मणिभद्र. Br. III. 7. १२३.
(I)--a वानर born of Pulaha. Br. III. 7. १७९.
(II)--a son of हृदीक. M. ४४. ८२.
--a Goddess following रेवती. M. १७९. ७३.

--son of शन्तनु; Grandsire of the पाण्डवस् and गन्गा. The best of Bharatas, the foremost of the Vasus, and versed in dharma: Learned, self-controlled, and devoted to Hari. His prowess was praised even by परशु- राम. Leader of a thousand legions, called सहस्राणी; <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. १९-20; I. 9. 4-6, ३०; M. १०३. 5. वा. ९९. २४०. Vi. IV. २०. ३३; V. ३५. 5 and २७.</F> Informed by Uddhava of बलराम's visit to हस्तिनापुर: was invited for the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर; <F>2:  भा. X. ६८. १७ and २८; ७४. १०.</F> went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse and there met कृष्ण and the वृष्णिस्. Left it for his home. <F>3:  Ib. X. ८२. २४; ८४. ५७, ६९ [1].</F> Joined Duryodhana's army and was commander for ten days when he was mortally wounded; while on his death- bed he welcomed the sages and the royal guests, who visit- ed him; <F>4:  Ib. X. ७८. [९५(v)१६], [२८]; I. 9. 8-१०; १५. १०.</F> told the पाण्डवस् that they were safe under the guidance of कृष्ण; <F>5:  Ib. I. 9. ११-14.</F> युधिष्ठिर addressed B. lying on a bed of arrows on the various aspects of dharma and especially मोक्ष धर्म। The discourse was over when it was उत्तरायन, B. cast off his mortal coil with his mind fixed on कृष्ण Va1sudeva. His praise of कृष्ण; <F>6:  Ib. I. 9. २५-42; XI. १९. ११-12.</F> was [पगे२-567+ ४०] seen among others by अक्रूर, कृतवर्मन्, कृष्ण and बलराम; <F>7:  Ib. X. ४९. 1; ५२. [५६(v)4, and ११]; ५७. 2.</F> one of the twelve, who knew the धर्म ordained by Hari; <F>8:  Ib. VI. 3. २०. </F> gave पिण्ड in विष्णुपद; <F>9:  वा. १११. ६९.</F> Baladeva's respect for; <F>१०:  Vi. V. ३५. ३६; ३८. १६, ४७, ४९ and ६४.</F> narrated to Nakula what he heard from his Brahmana friend कालिन्गक, on the mystery of birth and death; <F>११:  Ib. III. 7. 8.</F> the best of the Kurus; <F>१२:  Ib. III. 7. ३५.</F> heard a legend from वसिष्ठ as to who was a नग्न। <F>१३:  Ib. III. १७. 7.</F>

--the invincible king of Vidarbha, capital of कुण्डिन (Berar); <F>1:  भा. III. 3. 3; Vi. V. २६. 1.</F> had five sons (Rukmi one of them) and a daughter, known as वैदर्भी and रुक्मिणी. Agreed to his son, Rukmi's wish to give रुक्मिणी in marriage to शिशुपाल: on the eve of the day of marriage, the city was decorated; prayers were offered to पिट्र्स् and Devas; प्रेसेङ्त्स् were given to Brahmanas to exalt मन्गलम्। दमघोष and other friends of the Cedi King were welcomed. Housed राम and कृष्ण in comfortable lodgings. But कृष्ण won her in the स्वयम्वर; <F>2:  भा. X. ५२. १६, २१-22; ५३. 7-३५; Vi. V. २६. 3-6.</F> was stationed by जरासन्ध on the northern side during the siege of Gomanta; <F>3:  भा. X. ५२. ११[15].</F> went to the स्यमन्तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse. <F>4:  Ib. X. ८२. १५.</F>
--a place near Benares. M. १८३. ६२.

--served as a rope for Manu to tie the divine boat to the horn of the fish; <F>1:  M. 2. १८; 4. 6.</F> Indra took the guise of, to disturb the तपस् of वज्रान्गी; <F>2:  Ib. १४६. ६५.</F> born to ward off poison. <F>3:  Ib. २१९. 6.</F> [पगे२-568+ २८]
--see नागस्; vanquished by रावण. Br. III. 7. २५५.
--a Pravara ऋषि. M. १९९. १६.

--of five elements: पृथ्वि, वायु, आकाश, आप, and ज्योति; each has its own function; the body is of the earth, प्राण of मारुत or wind, the आकाश of water, and तेजस् of ज्योत्स्न; by their virility, सन्ग्रामस् and visayas do their respective work. वा. ९७. ५५.
--the राक्षसस्, being the destroyers of यज्ञस् as also निकरस्। वा. ६९. १८९.
--a सुधामान god. Br. IV. 1. ६०.
--a weapon. वा. ३०. २३६.

(I)--also अन्तरिक्ष--the second of the seven created worlds: वायु is its presiding deity: burnt down by प्रलय fire; <F>1:  Br. II. १९. १५५; २१. २१; IV. 1. १५६; 2. १४-17, २७-30.</F> residents: Marut, मातरिश्व, Rudras, अश्विन्स्, आदित्यस्, साध्यस्, Pitrs, Angirasa sages etc., intervening between the earth and the sun; the residents here drink सोम and ghee. <F>2:  वा. १०१. १९, २९, ४०, ४३.</F>
(II)--the second kalpa. वा. २१. २९. [पगे२-569+ २१]
(III)--the eleventh kalpa. वा. २१. ३१.
(IV)--a son of उन्नेता. वा. ३३. ५६.
(V)--the seventh son of देवकी. वा. ९६. १८१.
--a son of क्षेम, a बृहद्रथ: ruled in Magadha for ६४ years. वा. ९९. ३०३.
(I)--a son of भृगु and a Deva. Br. III. 1. ८९; M. १९५. १२; वा. ६५. ८७.
(II)--(भुवनेश्वर) a Rudra. Br. III. 3. ७१; वा. ६६. ७०.
--the sister of बृहस्पति and wife of प्रभात, the 8th Vasava. Br. III. 3. २८.
--Lord of the Universe; ब्रह्मा. M. 8. १०.
--a son of Vitatha, and father of four powerful sons, बृहद्क्षत्र and three others. M. ४९. ३५; वा. ९९. १५८-59. [पगे२-570+ ३०]

--from Bhuvana according to निरुक्तञ्ज; <F>1:  Br. II. ३८. १६; वा. २३. ८४; ४९. १४८; ६४. १४; १००. १६०.</F> that world between the earth and the sun; burnt by the flame of Rudra in the dissolution. <F>2:  Vi. II. 7. १७; VI. 3. २६ and ३९.</F>
--the place of अच्छावक agni. वा. २९. २८.
--is वायु, lord of Bhuva. Br. IV. 2. २०; वा. १०१. २२.
(I)--a weapon of war used in the Kubera Jambha war; <F>1:  M. १५०. ७३.</F> used by Kujambha; <F>2:  Ib. १५०. १०६.</F> तारक defeated Yama with. <F>3:  Ib. १५२. २८; १५३. १९५; १७७. 9.</F>
(II)--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १६.

(I)--Earth: (भूमि, s.v.) one of the seven worlds; released from रसातल by Hari in वराह form, this, देवी worships Hari in that form in Uttara-Kuru; <F>1:  भा. IV. १७. ३४; M. ६०. 2.</F> when पृथु wanted to punish her for scarce supply of food, she trembled and appealed to him to make the ground level plain and milk her with a calf and a pail; was milked by the King, sages, Gods, asuras and others; hilly tracts got levelled, and cities and villages were founded. <F>2:  भा. IV. १७. १३-36; १८. 2-३२.</F> भू is said to have given योगिच् पादुकस् to पृथु. <F>3:  Ib. IV. १५. १८.</F> presiding deity is Agni; [पगे२-571+ २९] burnt by प्रलय fire; <F>4:  Br. II. १९. १५५; २१. २१; IV. 1. १५६; 2. 9-१९, ४१, २२३.</F> the measurement of the earth (Pra- माणम्) attempted by हर्यश्वस् (s.v.). <F>5:  M. 5. 6.</F>

(II)--(Samiti) a कृतलोक, the first world; first was said भू and then came this world; <F>1:  वा. २३. १०७; २४. १८. १०१. ११, ३५-36.</F> is पार्थिव loka; <F>2:  Ib. १०१. १८.</F> these lokas are burnt by the flames of the seven suns; <F>3:  Ib. १०१. २०.</F>  मरीचि, कश्यप, दक्ष and other प्रजापतिस् live here; <F>4:  Ib. १०१. ३४.</F> people here live on rice and juice. <F>5:  Ib. १०१. ४०, ४२.</F>
(I)--a sage who married two daughters of दक्ष --भूता and सरूपा. Had sons; eleven Rudras, besides crores of their attendants. भा. VI. 6. 2, १७-18.
(II)--a son of पौरवी and Vasudeva. भा. IX. २४. ४७.
(III)--a name for प्रजापति. वा. १००. २३९.
(IV)--a member of the रोहिणी family. Vi. IV. १५. २२.
--a son of दक्ष sa1varn2i. भा. VIII. १३. १८.

--the group of five भूतस्; <F>1:  Br. II. ३७. 6; III. 1. ३२; M. 1. १५; १६५. २३-24.</F> beings are of four kinds; viviparous, अण्डज (egg-born), udbhijja (sprout- ing as plant) and svedaja (sweat produced); <F>2:  वा. २३. ८२; ३०. १०१ and २२७; ६३. 5; ६५. १२२.</F> worshipped in ceremonies prior to the construction of tanks, etc. <F>3:  M. ५३. ३१; ५८. २६; १६६. 5-8.</F> Born of the sacrifice of वरुण clothed with तमस्, रजस् and सत्व। <F>4:  वा. ६५. ३३.</F>
--son of Sumati, and father of Vasu. भा. IX. 2. १७.
--a mother-goddess. M. १७९. ३१.
--भूत and others. <F>1:  वा. 4. ४९.</F> elementary creation proceeding from तामसिच् अहम्कार; see पुरुष. <F>2:  Vi. I. 2. ४६.</F>
--a prince who ruled from किलिकिला after the Maunas ceased to reign. भा. XII. 1. ३२.
--a वर्ण s4akti. Br. IV. ४४. ५८.
--a group of १३ gods of the Raivata epoch. भा. VIII. 5. 3; Br. II. ३६. ५१ and ५६; Vi. III. 1. २१.
--is पृथ्वी. Br. III. 2. २१.
--the residence of different भूतस् and गणस् of Trayambaka; description of. वा. ४०. २०-6; १०१. २०८.
--as different from भूतानुवादि; is also प्रवाती. Br. III. 3. १२५-6.
--leaders of भूतस् and attendants on Rudra. भा. VI. 6. १८.
--an Asura who took part in the देवा- sura war between Bali and Indra. भा. VIII. १०. २०.
--a son of हिरण्याक्ष. A follower of वृत्र in his battle with Indra. भा. VII. 2. १८; VI. १०. [२०]; Br. III. 5. ३१; M. 6. १४; वा. ६७. ६८; Vi. I. २१. 3.
--the period when the planets, seers, Manus and other gods cease their work and seek their abode in Maharloka. Br. II. २१. १५६-64; २४. ८५; २५. १०६; ३२. ६३; ३५. १६८, १९८ and २०३. [पगे२-574+ ३३]

(I)--(also भूतपतिस्)--fierce, and abandoned by those who seek मोक्ष; spirits harassing children; <F>1:  भा. I. 2. २६; II. 6. १३; IV. 2. १५; VI. 8. २४; IX. १४. 6; X. 6. २७; ६६. ३४; XI. १०. २८.</F> follow- ers of Rudra (शिव) some born of sexual union; and some mind-born; belong to the line of क्रोधवशा; vanquished by रावण; <F>2:  Br. II. २५. ३९; III. 7. २५६, ३५९-74; ४४०; 8. ७१; M. 8. 5.</F> sons of भूति and followers of Rudra and निशा- caras; described. <F>3:  वा. ५४. ३७-43; ६९. २४२-56.</F>
(II)--five elements--पृथ्वी, वायु, आप, आकाश and ज्योति। Br. III. ७२. ५४; IV. 2. ११६.
(I)--a wife of भूत and a daughter of दक्ष. Her sons were the एकादश Rudras. भा. VI. 6. १७.
(II)--a daughter of क्रोधवशा (क्रोधा- वा। प्।), and a wife of Pulaha. Br. III. 7. १७२; वा. ६९. २०५.
--creation; first is महत् सर्ग, second भूत सर्ग, third ऐङ्द्रियक सर्ग; this is प्राकृत सर्ग। वा. 4. ५०; 6. ५८-62.
--(अहम्कार); of the 6th sarga; the five भूतस्: earth, waters, fire, wind and ether; each is ten times greater than the preceding one. Br. I. 5. ५३-8; II. ३२. ७६. M. १२३. ५२; वा. १०१. ११६.

--three-fold movements; नैमित्तिक, प्राकृतिक, and आत्यन्तिक; नैमित्तिक is ब्रह्मा; in the dissolution of creatures lies the natural destruction of all beings; आत्यन्तिक is due to knowledge, not as a result of action; from these ब्रह्मा again begins the work of creation after he wakes [पगे२-575+ २८] up from his sleep; during his sleep there is no continuous rain; rivers are with little or no waters; the sun's seven rays scorch the earth and draw away even the little water; every- thing is burnt down; no trees or plants; the heat penetrates the पाताल and the वायु लोकस्; all the worlds are burnt down; everywhere is to be seen one flame of fire; then set in clouds in different hues and in different shapes, pour down rains and appease the fire which enters into waters, result- ing in the condition of एकार्णव out of which emerges ब्रह्मा, the first progenitor and पुरुष; the seven sages see him; then, are gradually born all the kings one by one; simi- larly sages, men, gods and other things. Br. IV. 1. १२८ to २०७.
(I)--a son of युयुधान and father of Yugan- dhara. Br. III. ७१. १०१; वा. ९६. १००.
(II)--the mother of Bhautya. Br. IV. 1. ५१.
(III)--a शक्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ७४.
(IV)--a son of Bhautya; the future Manu. M. 9. ३५; वा. १००. ५५.
(V)--a साध्य; destroyer of all Asuras. M. १७१. ४४.
(VI)--gave birth to भूतस्, followers of Rudra. वा. ६९. २४२.
(VII)--the wife of Pulastya. Vi. I. 7. 7. [पगे२-576+ ३४]
--the king after Dhanadharma. His brother was नन्दियश; the fifth ruler of विदिश. Br. III. ७४. १८२; वा. ९९. ३६८.
--the son of नवकण्ठायन, a शुन्ग ruled in Maghada for २४ years. वा. ९९. ३४५.
--as calf for the यक्षस् and the राक्षसस्, भूतस् and others, to milk आसव in a skull from the earth as cow. भा. IV. १८. २१.
(I)--a son of Pratihartu and स्तुती; wife ऋषि- कुल्या, and son उद्गीथ. भा. V. १५. 5-6.
(II)--a son of उन्नेता. Br. II. १४. ६६.

--(also भू) Earth personified; <F>1:  भा. III. 3. 6.</F> a शक्ति; <F>2:  Br. IV. ४४. ७४; M. 2. ३२.</F> equal to दिवम् in measurement; १५० crores of yojanas; extends in all directions from Meru; wife of Dhruva and mother of सृष्टि; milked as cow by पृथु with चाक्षुष Manu as calf, by बृहस्पति for the sages, by the sun for the gods, by Antaka for पितृस्, by Diti's son for the Asuras, by वासुकि for the नागस्, by रजतनाभ for the यक्षस्, by the राक्षसस् and पिशाचस्; ५०० crores in extent. <F>3:  Br. II. २१. 3, १२-17; ३६. ९६; २०२. २७; IV. ३७. ९०.</F> Felt the heavy weight of the Asuras and reported to ब्रह्मा in the assemblage of Gods at Meru with special reference to Kamsa,. विष्णु per- formed an अवतार् as कृष्ण to do away with him. <F>4:  Vi. V. 1. १२-66.</F> On the death of Naraka, she appealed to कृष्ण to forgive his inequi- ties and liberate him. <F>5:  Ib. V. २९. २३-30.</F> [पगे२-577+ २६]
--the name of a यक्षगण. वा. ६९. ४०.
(I)--the son of Vasudeva कण्व, and father of नारायण; ruled for २४ years (१४ years म्। प्।). भा. XII. 1. २०; Br. III. ७४. १५८; M. २७२. ३४; Vi. IV. २४. ४०.
(II)--a son of Vindhyasena, ruled for १४ years. M. २७२. 9.
--sons of विकचा and विरूपक; infe- rior in status to the राक्षस clan, <F>1:  Br. III. 7. १५३-5:</F> move about in different guises unobserved both in air and on earth. <F>2:  वा. ६९. १८४-7.</F>
--a God of Sumedhasa group. Br. II. ३६. ५९.

(I)--a son of Somadatta of the बाह्लिकस्; resent- ed साम्ब's action in seizing लक्ष्मणा; took active part in the राजसूय of Yudhisthira. भा. IX. २२. १८; X. ६८. 5; ७५. 6; वा. ९९. २३५; Vi. IV. २०. ३२; V. ३५. २७.
(III)--the eldest son of विवक्षु. M. ५०. ८०. [पगे२-578+ २५]
--a son of the first सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ६५ and ७२.
(I)--a son of Somadatta; was stationed on the west of Gomanta during its siege by जरासन्ध, and also of मथुरा. भा. IX. २२. १८; X. ५२. ११ [११]; ५०. ११ [5]; वा. ९९. २३५; Vi. IV. २०. ३२; V. ३५. २७.
(II)--a मध्यमाध्वर्यु. Br. II. ३३. १४.
(III)--a son of शुक. Br. III. 8. ९३; वा. ७०. ८५.
--a son of शुक. Br. III. १०. ८१; वा. ७३. ३०.
(I)--a sage who knew the yoga power of Hari; son of ब्रह्मसावर्णि. भा. II. 7. ४५; VIII. १३. २१.
(II)--a son of शर्याति. भा. IX. 3. २७.
(I)--a son of सावर्ण Manu II and one of the ten मानवस्. Br. IV. 1. ७१.
(II)--a son of ब्रह्मसावर्णि. Vi. III. 2. २८. [पगे२-579+ ४०]
--a northern country. Br. II. १६. ५०.

(I)--born from fire; one of the ten mind-born sons of ब्रह्मा; born of his skin; married Kardama's daugh- ter ख्याती and had two sons and a daughter; married the daughter of Puloma and brought forth twelve sons besides Cyavana and आनुवन्; married two daughters of दक्ष; a sage of the चाक्षुष epoch; <F>1:  भा. III. १२. २२-23; २४. २३; IV. 1. ४३; M. 3. 8; 5. १४; 9. २२; १९५. 8; Vi. I. 7. 5, 7, २६, ३७; 8. १५.</F> a महऋषि; a मन्त्रकृत्; a Pra- vara; accompanied ब्रह्मा going to हिरण्यकशिपु; was present at the anointing of वामन Hari and praised the Lord and Aditi; learnt the क्रिययोग from ब्रह्मा; <F>2:  M. १४५. ९०, ९८; १७१. २७; १९५. २९.</F> and the Vedas from Manu. <F>3:  भा. VII. 3. १४; VIII. २३. २०-27; XI. २७. 3; १४. 4.</F> Deputed by the sages to find out the greatest of the Gods, went to his father's court without invoking him in praise; ब्रह्मा grew angry but restrained his anger. Then he went to शिव, who embraced him. भृगु told him that he did not like his behaviour when शिव grew angry and started to attack him with his trident. He was stopped by पार्वती's intervention. Next he called on Hari and kicked him while sleeping, on His chest.
