Hari coolly bore it, bowed to him and said that only then he became purified and united with लक्ष्मी. भृगु wondered at his patience and concluded that he was the greatest of all the gods. <F>4:  Ib. X. ८९. 2-१९.</F> Wonder- ed at मार्कण्डेय's व्रत; took part in crowning Vena to avoid the evils of anarchy; did not find fault with Hara violating धर्म। <F>5:  Ib. XII. 8. १२; IV. १४. 1; २९. ४३; VI. १७. १२.</F> Officiated at विश्वसृज यज्ञ when he cursed the followers of शिव to become पाखण्डिस्; created [पगे२-580+ ३२] ऋभुस् to put down the Pramathas and others who disturb- ed दक्ष's sacrifice; was bound by मणिमन् and the beard cut off. It was शिव's wish that the beard of a sheep be substituted for his original one. <F>6:  Ib. IV. 2. २७-8; 4. ३२; 5. १७ and १९; 7. 5.</F> Was born again of चर्षणि and वरुण <F>7:  Ib. VI. १८. 4.</F> acted as अध्- वर्यु in Soma's राजसूय; <F>8:  M. २३. २०.</F> cursed विष्णु to take the form of a human being seven times for slaying his wife to protect Indra. <F>9:  Ib. ४७. ३९, १०५.</F> Praised शिव out to burn Tripura. <F>१०:  Ib. १०२. १९; १२६, १०; १३३. ६७.</F> Performed penance on the नर्मदा but was not free from anger; cursed शिव's riding animal when it was sent to examine his mind; but still he prayed to the Lord who blessed a तीर्थ at that place in his honour.
(II)--a sage and a contemporary of कृष्ण; came to see कृष्ण at स्यमन्तपञ्चक; one of the sages who left for पिण्डारक; came to see परीक्षित् practising प्रायोपवेश. भा. X. ८४. 4; XI. 1. १२; I. १९. 9.
(III)--a ऋषि presiding over the month of Nabha- sya; <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ३८.</F> in the Sun's chariot in the month of भाद्रपद. <F>2:  Vi. II. १०. १०; वा. २९. 9; ५२. 9.</F>
(IV)--the father of अथर्वण Agni. Br. II. १२. १०.
(V)--one of the eighteen authors on architec- ture. M. २५२. 2. [पगे२-581+ २४]
(VI)--in the विश्वचक्र. M. २८५. 6.
(VII)--the teacher of व्यास. वा. 1. ४२; 3. 2; १०. २९.
(VIII)--the author of १०३८० R2ks and १००० मन्त्रस्। वा. ६१. ७१.
(IX)--heard the विष्णु पुराण from सारस्वत and narrated it to Purukutsa. Vi. VI. 8. ४५.
--Divine seers and teachers. Helped Bali in his अश्वमेध। शुक्र, a भृगु. भा. VI. 7. २४; VIII. १८. २०-21; IX. १८. १४. वा. १०. ७१.
--a place on the northern bank of the नर्मदा. Here Bali performed his अश्वमेध। भा. VIII. १८. २१.
--sages of, visited द्वारका. भा. X. ९०. २८. [4].

--the place where the sage भृगु perform- ed austerities until he was covered by an ant-hill; उमा asked शिव to bless him; the Lord replied that he was not free from anger; and tested it by sending धर्म as a bull to ruin the ant-hill; seeing it, the sage cursed the animal. But later finding that it was the Lord's act uttered the prayer, [पगे२-582+ २५]
and was blessed with a तीर्थ on the नर्मदा; <F>1:  M. १९३. २३-49.</F> merits of the place. <F>2:  Ib. १९३. ५०-60.</F>

--a place fit for श्राद्ध; sacred to the पिट्र्स्; <F>1:  Br. III. १३. ८८; M. २२. ३१; वा. २३. १४८; ७७. ८२.</F> ययाति spent the evening of his life there. <F>2:  Br. III. १४. ८३; ६८. १०४; वा. ९३. १०२.</F>
--sacred to ललितापीठ. Br. IV. ४४. ९५.
--in the ears of the personified Veda. वा. १०४. ८१.
--a bird; <F>1:  वा. ३६. 2.</F> a god to be worshipped before building houses and palaces. <F>2:  M. २१९. १९; २५३. २५; २६८. १४.</F>
(I)--the head of a शिव gan2a. Br. III. ४१. २८; IV. ३०. ७५; ३४. ८९.
(II)--an image of, in attendance on शिव. M. २५९. २४; २६६. ४२.
--one of the ten branches of the Rohita group of devas. वा. १००. ९०.

--servants engaged for service, those who do not do properly or neglect, are liable to be punished with a fine of 8 कृष्णलस् besides being deprived of their wages; <F>1:  M. २२७. 9.</F> conduct of, reported by चारस्; <F>2:  Ib. २१५. ८९; वा. ११०. ५४.</F> not loyal in the kaliyuga. <F>3:  Ib. ५८. ४२.</F>
--to be worshipped in house-building, with fish. M. २५३. २४; २६८. १२.
--a queen of उशीनर and mother of नृग. M. ४८. १६-17.
--a दानव. Br. III. 6. 5.
--a वैकुण्ठ God. Br. II. ३६. ५७.

(I)--one of the उपायस्; to be used against the wicked, the insolent and the proud; makes the enemy afraid of himself and brings him under his control; this उपाय is praised by statesmen; the king must endeavour to practise this against the enemy through his cognates. M. २२२. 2; २२३, 1, 4, १५. [पगे२-584+ ३१]
(II)--a son of ऋक्ष; had five sons, Mudgala and others among whom were distributed the kingdom later known as पाञ्चाल. वा. ९९. १९५.

--drums beaten in rituals for tank digging; <F>1:  M. ५८. २२.</F> a war- musical instrument; <F>2:  Ib. १३५. ८३; वा. ३७. १२; ४०. २४.</F> sounded by the Asuras and Devas in the battle of Tripuram; <F>3:  M. १३६. २७, ५३.</F> a call to arms; <F>4:  Ib. १४८. ३९.</F> in the तारकामय. <F>5:  Ib. १४९. 2; १७७. २४.</F> in राम's अभिषेचन। <F>6:  Vi. IV. 4. ९९.</F>
--a bird, born of जटायु. M. 6. ३६.

(II)--An epithet of Rudra; the form assumed by शिव when गौरी returned from penance; She became भैरवी; <F>1:  M. १५८. २४; १७९. 1.</F> Image of, to be placed in each temple but not in मूलायन्तन। <F>2:  Ib. २५२. १०; २५९. १४.</F>
(I)--a तीर्थ on the banks of चर्मन्वती sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ३१.
(II)--तपस् performed by ब्रह्मा. वा. २६. १०. [पगे२-585+ २८]
--an incarnation of शिव (Bhairava s.v.). M. 1. 8.
--an Apsarasa clan from मृत्यु. वा. ६९. ५७.
--an epithet of उमा; when शिव is Bhairava, उमा is भैरवी; <F>1:  M. १५८. २५.</F> a mother-goddess. <F>2:  Br. IV. 7. ७२; ४४. २२.</F>
(I)--the capital of the नागस्, compared to the city of Puramjana; <F>1:  भा. I. ११. ११; IV. २५. १५.</F> north of वासुकिह्रद, a sacred spot of प्रयागा. <F>2:  M. १६३. ८०.</F>
(II)--the name of गन्गा in पाताल. भा. X. ७०. ४४.
--the people of the southern country. Br. II. १६. ५८; वा. ४५. १२७.
--son of शेष, the नाग king. Br. III. ७४. १८०; वा. ९९. ३६७.
--a Rahasya योगिनी Devi1. Br. IV. १९. ४८.

(I)--a Yadu prince. He once dreamt that he ate the remnants of the food of his enemy, and that his enemies deprived him of his wives, and kingdom. This caused deep misery in his mind. He left his home and bestowed all his thoughts on परमात्मन् from that day: entered ब्रह्मनिर्वाण। Fought with अक्रूर at प्रभासा. भा. X. ३६. ३३; VI. १५. २६ [1-4]; XI. ३०. १६. Br. III. ६१. २३. [पगे२-586+ ४१]
(II)--a king noted for his large elephant forces. Br. II. ७१. १२६-7.
(III)--a son of Bali. Br. III. 5. ४३.
(IV)--a son of जाम्बवती. Br. III. 7. ३०३.
(V)--a son of प्रतिक्षेत्र and father of हृदीक. M. ४४. ८०.

(I)--a Vindhya clan; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ६४; वा. ४५. १३२; ८६. २८.</F> in द्वारवती: one of the five clans (गणस्) of the Haihayas beginning with Druhyu, son of ययाति; <F>2:  Br. III. ६९. ५२; ७४. २६५; M. ३४. ३०; ४३. ४८; ४४. ६९; १६३. ७२; वा. ९४. ५२.</F> had two hundred branches; <F>3:  Ib. ९९. ४५२.</F> all of them क्षत्रियस्; <F>4:  Ib. ३२. ४८.</F> कश्यप gotraka1ras. <F>5:  M. १९९. 2.</F>

(II)--a यादव tribe to which Kamsa belonged: were related to the पाण्डवस्; <F>1:  भा. X. 1. ३५, ३७ and ६९; IX. २४. ११ and ६३; I. १४. २५; M. ११४. ५२; २७३. ७०.</F> defended द्वारका against the enemies and praised the heroic deeds of कृष्ण; <F>2:  भा. I. ११. ११; IX. २४. ६३.</F> Kamsa planned in vain to vanquish them. Fought with their kith and kin and ended their lives; <F>3:  Ib. X. ३६. ३३; ३९. २५; XI. ३०. १८.</F> line of the, traced from महा- bhoja; kings of मृत्तिकावर Pura; hence मार्त्तिकावरस्: killed सात्वत S4atrughna and left द्वारका with अक्रूर. <F>4:  Vi. IV. १३. 7, ११.</F>

--the capital of Rukmin: the city founded by him for his residence, as he wanted to keep his word not to enter कुण्डिन without killing कृष्ण. Here was celebrat- ed the marriage of Aniruddha and which बलराम and others attended and then left for द्वारका; <F>1:  भा. X. ५४. ५२; ६१. १९ and २३ [5]; ६१. २६ and ४०.</F> the स्वयम्वर of Pradymna's daughter took place at. <F>2:  Vi. V. २८. 9.</F> [पगे२-587+ ३१]
--usually a title of a monarch; <F>1:  Br. III. ७१. १९४, २२३; वा. ९६. १९०.</F> शमीक, abandoned this title being a राजऋषि. <F>2:  M. ४६. २८.</F>
--Mt. of क्रौञ्चद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २१.
(I)--the queen of Viravrata: mother of Manthu and Pramanthu. भा. V. १५. १५.
(II)--the wife of शूर; mother of ten sons and five daughters. M. ४६. 1.
--कश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 3.
--see Vaidyuta--one of the three fires originating in waters. Br. II. २४. 6; वा. ५३. 5.

--the १०थ् Manu (१४थ्. वा। प्।) of the future; son of भूति and कवी; <F>1:  Br. IV. 1. ५१; M. 9. ३५; वा. ६२. 4; १००. ५५, ११०.</F> the १४थ् Parya1ya: under him the Kalpa comes to an end. <F>2:  Br. II. ३६. 4; IV. 1. १०५-7, ११६.</F>
(I)--a name of the Asura, Naraka (s.v.) a सैंहिकेय Asura. भा. I. १०. २९; XII. 3. ११; Br. III. 6. २०.

(II)--Mars: one of the nine planets; also called अन्गारक and कुमार; of red colour; <F>1:  Br. II. २३. ८४; M. ९३. १०; Vi. II. १२. १८.</F> his chariot drawn by eight horses. <F>2:  M. १२७. 4.</F> [पगे२-588+ २६]
(III)--a son of Rucira. M. ५०. ३६.
(IV)--the XIV Manu; शुचि is Indra; five groups of gods; अग्निबाहु and others are sages; ऊरु, गम्भीर and others, his sons. Vi. III. 2. ४२-5.
--a name of Budha. वा. १११. 5.
--of the पराशर family; (white). M. २०१. ३३.
--a son of सत्यभामा. वा. ९६. २३९.
--a daughter of सत्यभामा. वा. ९६. २४०; Vi. V. ३२. 1.
--Tuesday; unfit for commencing house building. M. २५३. 7.
(I)--a son of Manthu and सत्या. His queen was दूषणा and son त्वष्ट. भा. V. १५. १५.
(II)--a son of महान्, married इरावती: father of ऐरावण, the vehicle of Indra; sang the रथन्- तर। Br. II. १४. ६९; III. 7. ३२४-6; वा. ३३. ५९.
(IV)--see ऐरावत. वा. ६९. २०९.
--of Siddhi: to go about as if aimlessly and with an absent mind induced by the inner soul. वा. १२. 7, ११ and १२.
--a Mauneya. वा. ६९. 3.
--a daughter of शिशुमार and wife of Dhruva; mother of Vatsara. भा. IV. १०. 1; १३. ११.
--a गण of the epoch of Bhautya Manu: these are the seven rivers; <F>1:  Br. IV. 1. १०६-8.</F> a group of gods of the XIV epoch of Manu. <F>2:  Vi. III. 2. ४३.</F>
--a son of घृतपृष्ठ of the प्लक्षद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २१.
--resides in the वैभ्राज hill of प्लक्ष. Br. II. १९. १३.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २४.
--an आर्षेयप्रवर; (Angiras). M. १९६. २१.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १९.

--(abortion): a person guilty of, gets released by performing शुभसप्तमि; <F>1:  M. ८०. १२; वा. १०१. १५२.</F> relieved by गृअह- bali; <F>2:  M. ९३. १३९.</F> common in Kali. <F>3:  Ib. १४४. ५५; १९२. १६.</F> [पगे२-590+ २५]
(I)--a Mt. to the north of Meru. भा. V. १६. २७.
(II)--a sea monster; gift of a golden one in the ceremony of digging tanks, etc. M. ५८. १९.
(III)--one of the eight निधिस् of Kubera. वा. ४१. १०.
(IV)--the Tamil month, Tai; with सूर्य, <F>1:  वा. १०५. ४८.</F> in the Capricornus; the sun entering which, उत्तरायण com- mences. <F>2:  Vi. II. 8. २८, ६८.</F>
--the sons born to the daughters of ऋक्ष. Br. III. 7. ४१५.
--is Madana, God of Love with the fish standard. Br. IV. ११. २८; १९. ६७; ३०. ५६; M. १५४. २४४; २६१. ५३.
--sacred to चण्डिका M. १३. ४३.
--जरासन्ध arranged his army in this व्यूह and attacked the Yadus; but it was broken by कृष्ण with trees as missiles. भा. X. ५२. 6[1-4]. [पगे२-591+ २४]
--is Pluta, consonant and svarloka; the third मात्रा is प्लुतवती, protracted as a vowel. वा. २०. 9, १०, १४.
--a R. of the भारतवर्ष. वा. ४५. १०१.
--do not sit on poisoned food. M. २१९. १७.
--same as यज्ञ; <F>1:  M. 7. ६२; वा. ९७. २६.</F> a share of it was rescued to the Maruts. <F>2:  M. 7. ६५.</F>
--got by churning the अरणि of the शमी wood. वा. ११२. ५१.
--a commander and son of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८१; २६. ४८.
--the राक्षस presiding over the month of ऊर्ज. भा. XII. ११. ४४.
--a son and commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८१; २६. ४८.
(I)--the kingdom of जरासन्ध (s.v.), see also मागध. भा. III. 3. १०; Br. III. ३९. 2, 8. [पगे२-592+ ३९]

(II) (च्)--a Janapada; an eastern kingdom; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ५५; १८. ५१; वा. ४५. १११. ४७. ४८; ६२. १४७; ९९. २९४; Vi. II. 3. १६.</F> got from पृथु by मागध; kingdom of the मागधस्; <F>2:  Br. II. ३६. १७२; M. ५०. २७.</F> kings of; <F>3:  भा. IX. २२. ४४-5.</F> sometimes ruled by the नागस्; <F>4:  Br. III. ७४. १९५.</F> kingdom of महा- ratha बृहद्रथ; <F>5:  वा. ९९. २२१.</F> under the Guptas. <F>6:  Ib. ९९. ३८३; Vi. IV. २४. ६३.</F>
(III)--king विश्वस्फाटिक pulled down क्ष- triyas and established new वर्णस्; people of, like Kaivartas, बटु, Pulinda and Brahmanas. Vi. IV. २४. ६१.
--a Janapada of the East. वा. ४५. १२३.

(I)--another name of Indra; <F>1:  भा. I. १६. २१. Br. II. १३. ७९; वा. ६४. 7.</F> served as calf when the Gods milked the earth; <F>2:  Br. II. ३६. २०६.</F> as वायु he mixed up the garments of girls playing in a pleasure garden especially those of शर्मिष्ठा and देवयानी; <F>3:  M. २७. 3-4; १३८. 1.</F> wife शचि. <F>4:  वा. ३०. ७२.</F>
(II)--a दानव. Br. III. 6. 5.

or मघस्--a constellation attached to शिशु- मार; <F>1:  भा. V. २३. 6; VII. १४. २२; XII. 2. २८-9. वा. ६६. ४९; ८०. ४४; ८१. २५; ८२. 6; ९९. ४२३.</F> श्राद्ध in, marks the rise in social status. <F>2:  Br. III. १७. २१; १८. 5; M. १७. 3; ५४. १८; ५५. १४; २०४. 5.</F>

--Nikumbha appeared in the disguise of a barber of this name in a dream to दिवोदास before the ruin of the city and asked him to find his abode in the outskirts of the kingdom. वा. ९२. ३८. [पगे२-593+ २४]
(I)--the Matsya king, slain by परशुराम. Br. III. ३८. ४९, ५१.
(II)--a commander of भण्ड, vanquished by स्वप्नेशी. Br. IV. २१. ८५; २८. ४१.
--a Mt. in भारतवर्ष. भा. V. १९. १६.
(I)--a servant maid of पार्वती. Br. IV. ४०. २५.
(II)--a goddess enshrined at गन्गा; a mother goddess. M. १३. ३५; १७९. २१.
--done by women to भण्ड's sons march- ing against ललिता's host. Br. IV. २६. ६२.
--a वर्ण s4akti. Br. IV. ४४. ५९.
--an Apsarasa. Br. IV. ३३. १९.
--public halls in the city of Tripura; <F>1:  M. १३९. २०.</F> institu- tions of. <F>2:  Br. IV. ३८. ५७.</F>
(I)--a jewel of the king. Br. II. २९. ७५; IV. २१. १२; वा. ५७. ६८; ७८. ५३.
(II)--a काद्रवेय Na1ga. Br. III. 7. ३७; वा. ६९. ७४.
(III)--gems as ornaments of नागस्. Vi. II. 5. 6.
--a big water vessel into which Manu threw the growing fish. M. 1. २०.
--one of the five principal तीर्थस् at Benares; a person dying here will have his desires fulfilled. M. १८२. २४; १८५. ६९.
--a boundary hill in प्लक्ष. भा. V. २०. 4. [पगे२-595+ २६]
--a son of Kubera (see नलकूबर). भा. X. 9. २२-23; १० (whole).
--a son of Havya. वा. ३३. १६.
--a वर्ष round the स्याम hill of शाक- द्वीपम्. वा. ३३. १८; ४९. ८६.
--a R. of the भद्रा country. वा. ४३. २९.
--a son of मणिभद्र. वा. ६९. १५४.
--a यक्ष living in the (हेमशृन्ग म्। प्।) Lohita hill; son of रजतनाभ. Br. II. १८. १२; ३६. २१६; M. १२१. १३.
--enjoyed the नैषध, Naimi- षक, कालकोश and कञ्जनपदस्. Vi. IV. २४. ६६.
--members of the मणिधान्य royal family who ruled over the निषधस्, Yadukas, शैशितस् and कालतोयकस्. वा. ९९. ३८४; Br. III. ७४. १९६.
--the नाग residing in the third Talam. Br. II. २०. ३०.
--the crest jewel of Mandara stolen by Naraka; कृष्ण removed it from प्राग्ज्योतिष, after killing him. Vi. V. २९. १०. ३४; ३०. 1. [पगे२-596+ २९]
--a city; Arjuna married the daughter of the king of मणिपुर. भा. IX. २२. ३२; Vi. IV. २०. ५०.

--a son of रजतनाभ, (भद्रा-वा। प्।) married पुण्यजनी who was the mother of a number of यक्षस्; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. १२०; वा. ६९. १५२, १५७.</F> the commander of the army of the यक्षस् living in चन्द्रप्रभा; lived on the hill adjoining Caitraratha; <F>2:  Br. II. १८. 7-8; M. १२१. 8-9.</F> devoted to ललिता; <F>3:  Br. IV. ३३. ७८.</F> यक्ष sena1pati. <F>4:  वा. ४७. 7.</F>
(also मणिमन्)--a Yaksa devoted to ललिता; followed सती going to her father's sacrifice; <F>1:  भा. IV. 4. 4; Br. IV. ३३. ७८.</F> seized भृगु at दक्ष's sacrifice. <F>2:  भा. IV. 5. १७.</F>
--a R. sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ३९.
--a son of मणिवर. वा. ६९. १५८.
(I)--a यक्ष; a son of पुण्यजनी and मणि- bhadra. Br. III. 7. १२३.
(II)--a Mt. in शाल्मलिद्वीप. Br. III. 7. ४५३.
--a नाग of the Vitalam. वा. ५०. २९. [पगे२-597+ २७]
--a son of Havya, after whom was called the मणिवकवर्ष. Br. II. १४. १७-9.
--a son of आप. M. 5. २२.
--a R. of the भद्रा country. वा. ४३. २८.
(I)--a son of रजतनाभ, his wife, Deva- जनी <F>1:  Br. III. 7. १२०; ७२. 2.</F> a यक्ष king in कैलास; <F>2:  वा. ४१. २५.</F> resides in the Lohita hill. <F>3:  Ib. ४७. १२.</F>
(II)--a son of भद्रा; his wife, देवजनी or देवजननी; gave birth to a number of sons, known as Guhyakas. वा. ६२. १८३; ६९. १५१; ९७. 2.
--the place where three crores of its inha- bitants were slain by Arjuna. वा. ६७. ७३-4.
--one of the sons of Vidyoparicara. वा. ९९. २२२.
--a Mt. to the east of अरुणोद. वा. ३६. १८; ३७. १६.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २१.

--three kinds of, superior, middling and in- ferior; the different varieties are पुष्पक, पुष्पभद्र, Suv- rata, अमृतनन्द, कौशल्य, बुद्धिसम्कीर्ण, गजभद्रा, जयावह, श्रीवत्स, Vijaya, वास्तुकीर्ति, श्रुतिन्जय, यज्ञ- bhadra, विशाल, सुश्लिष्ट, शत्रुमर्दन, भागपञ्च, Nan- dana, मानव, मानभद्रक, सुग्रीव. Harita, Karni- कार, शतर्धिक, Simha, श्यामभद्र, Subhadra, all total- ling २७; these may be triangular, circular, semi-circular, eight cornered, sixteen cornered, etc.; generally ten kinds of doorways are furnished avoiding वेध; fruit and flower trees are to be grown all round; a pool of water must be maintained; on the south a tapovanam, on the north a देवी temple, on the north-east a kitchen and on the south-east a विनायक shrine and then यज्ञशाला; these constitute a temple; the bell near the gateway. M. २७०. 1-३६.
(I)--a mountain kingdom. M. ११४. ५६.
(II)--(Vartula): a palace in the form of a circle; the तोरण is twenty हस्तस्। M. २६९. ३६, ४९.
(III)--of the sun; the place of all planets, stars and the moon. वा. ५३. २८.
(I)--(ब्राह्मणम्) to be selected for reci- tation at श्राद्ध. M. १७. ३९. [पगे२-599+ २७]
(II)--a place near प्रयागा protected by Hari; <F>1:  M. १०४. 9.</F> five yojanas in extent; <F>2:  Ib. १०८. 9.</F> every step there, is equal to an अश्वमेध. <F>3:  Ib. १११. 8.</F>
--one of the ten पीठस् for images; round in shape with a number of मेखलस्। M. २६२. 6, 9, १७.
--to be uttered in installing an image. M. २६५. २६.
--provincial heads. Br. III. ३८. २०.
--the hill for performing श्राद्ध. वा. ७७. ५६.
--a यक्ष; son of पुन्यजनी and मणिभद्र. Br. III. 7. १२३.
--gift of a copper one in ceremonials con- nected with the digging of tanks. M. ५८. १९.
(I)--the queen of रावण; heard of राव- ण's death, and went to the battlefield and bewailed the fate of all राक्षसस्. भा. IX. १०. २४-28.
(II)--a daughter of Maya and रम्भा. Br. III. 6. २९. [पगे२-600+ २८]
--a sage of great repute; father of मातन्ग; <F>1:  Br. IV. ३१. ९०.</F> footprint of, seen in the भरताश्रम. <F>2:  वा. ७७. ९८.</F>
--the आश्रम of Matanga, the sage, at गया where the performance of पितृ s4ra1ddha is an act of merit. वा. १०८. २५.
--fit for performing श्राद्ध offerings. Br. III. १३. १०६.
--a sacred place for performing श्राद्ध in the Kosala country; <F>1:  वा. ७७. ३६.</F> in गया sacred to Matanga. <F>2:  Ib. १११. २४.</F>
--a goddess enshrined at पारावारतट. M. १३. ४४.
(I)--a याम deva; <F>1:  Br. II. १३. ९२; वा. ३१. 6.</F> addressed as, by ब्रह्मा. <F>2:  Ib. २३. 8.</F>
(II)--an आभूतरय god. Br. II. ३६. ५५; वा. ६२. ४८.
(III)--a Bhavya god. Br. II. ३६. ७२.
(IV)--भगवान् so-called because the क्षेत्रज्ञ has a knowledge of क्षेत्र. वा. ५९. ७७.
--an attribute of विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ६९. [पगे२-601+ ३८]
--a Janapada of the केतुमाला country. वा. ४४. १५.

(I) (च्)--in the मध्यदेश, on the way from द्वारका to हस्तिनापुर; <F>1:  भा. I. १०. ३४; X. ७१. २२; Br. II. १६. ४१; १८. ५१; M. १२१. ५०.</F> visited by Vidura; <F>2:  भा. III. 1. २४.</F> king of, van- quished by कृष्ण. <F>3:  Ib. II. 7. ३५.</F>

(II)--an अवतार् of विष्णु; <F>1:  भा. I. १५. ३५; X. 2. ४०; XI. 4. १८; Br. III. 7. ४३३; २२. ६६; ५७. ६१; IV. 4. २२; २९. १३६; M. २६०. ३९; २८५. 6; २९०. २३; Vi. I. 4. 8.</F> once during a Pra- laya an Asura, हयग्रीव, carried off the Vedas when Hari took the form of a fish with one horn and fell into the palm of the द्रविड king Satyavrata, performing ablutions; find- ing that it outgrew the size of his palm he took it to a pond; it outgrew the size of the pond when it was taken to a lake; it was also too small to hold it; hence after many trials it was taken to the sea; addressed by the king the fish revealed to him his true form and warned him of the Pralaya coming in a week and prepared him to get into a boat to be sent by him and have it tied to its horn; the deluge came and Satyavrata did as was directed; when they were all floating on the sea, Matsya Hari narrated to him the मत्स्य पुराण; after the deluge Matsya killed the demon, हयग्रीव and recovered the Vedas; through his blessings Satyavrata became Vai- vasvata Manu; <F>2:  भा. VIII. ch. २४ (whole).</F> appeared to Vaivasvata Manu during deluge; protected Manu and others; <F>3:  Ib. II. 7. १२; XI. 4. १८; M. २२. ९२.</F> the form of विष्णु wor- shipped in Ramyaka. <F>4:  भा. V. १८. २४.</F>
(III)--a Vasu; a son of Uparicara and a Cedipa. भा. IX. २२. 6; M. ५०. २८.
(IV)--gift of a silver one during the ceremo- nial relating to the digging of tanks. M. ५८. १९. [पगे२-602+ ३५]
(V)--the image of. M. २५९. 2.
(VI)--the disciple of शाकल्य. वा. ६०. ६४.

(VII)--also मत्स्य पुराण; a महा पुराण consisting of १४००० श्लोकस्, <F>1:  Vi. III. 6. २३; भा. XII. 7. २४; १३. 8.</F> styled as पुराण Samhita with details of सान्ख्य, Yoga and Karma narrated by Matsya Hari to king Satyavrata during the deluge. <F>2:  Ib. VIII. २४. ५४-5.</F>

--a trible; country of the; <F>1:  M. ११४. ३५.</F> placed on the East of the Gomanta hill by जरासन्ध; <F>2:  भा. X. ५२. ११[7].</F> enlisted by जरासन्ध against the Yadus; <F>3:  Ib. X. ५२. ५० (V) 2.</F> followed भीम in his conquests; <F>4:  Ib. X. ७२. १३.</F> rose against शिशुपाल; <F>5:  Ib. X. ७४. ४१.</F> heard of कृष्ण going to मिथिला and met him with presents; <F>6:  Ib. X. ८६. २०.</F> their king was विराट; <F>7:  Ib. X. ५२. ११[7].</F> he went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse. <F>8:  Ib. X. ८२. १३.</F>
--a son of Vidyoparicara. वा. ९९. २२२.
--an आर्षेय Pravara (भार्गव). M. १९५. ४३.
--not to marry with Angiras or Mudgalas. M. १९६. ४२.
--a R. sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ४९.
--for manes. Vi. III. १६. 1. [पगे२-603+ ३०]
--the birth of पितृकन्या Acchoda1 in the २८थ् dva1para; wife of पराशर and mother of व्यास. M. १४. १३; वा. ७३. १६.
--was Mangala, (s.v). Br. III. ३८. ४२; ३९. 1.
--a Pravara (Angiras). M. १९६. १६.

--a commander of तारक's army; the special arm was the noose; <F>1:  M. १४८. ४३, ५४.</F> threw darts on विष्णु; <F>2:  Ib. १५०. २२४.</F> on horse back; <F>3:  Ib. १५१. 5.</F> गरुड was ordered to break his chariot; overpowered by the गदा of माधव, Mathana fell dead when महिष appeared on the scene. <F>4:  Ib. १५२. 7-१४.</F>
--the divine union of शक्त and शक्ति resulting in २५ truths. Br. IV. 8. २९, ३३.
(I)--born of Pulaha. Br. III. 7. १७९.
(II)--an आर्षेय Pravara. (भार्गव). M. १९५. ३६.
(III)--a son of भरताग्नि. वा. २९. 8.

(I)--founded by शत्रुघ्न after killing लवण; <F>1:  भा. IX. ११. १४; Br. III. ६३. १८६; IV. ४०. १९; वा. ८८. १८५-6; Vi. IV. 4. १०१.</F> capital of सुबाहु and शूरसेन; here was celebrat- ed the marriage of Vasudeva and देवकी when the couple [पगे२-604+ ४६] were the recipients of rich presents of elephants, horses, दासिस् and others; Kamsa joined in the festivities when a voice in the sky said that her eighth son was to kill him; <F>2:  भा. X. 1. २७-34; 2. 4.</F> visited by Nanda to pay his annual tribute; left by Nanda; <F>3:  Ib. X. 5. १९, ३२; 6. ३१.</F> capital of the Yadus, besieged by जरासन्ध and his followers; defended by the यादवस् on all the four sides; entered by कृष्ण after defeating जरासन्ध; second attempt of जरा- sandha on the city with बाण's army; entered by कृष्ण after a third success over जरासन्ध; <F>4:  Ib. X. ५०. 4. ११ [1-9], २० [1-5], ३६-40. ५० (V) 6, [५१ (V) २१-3], [५२ (V) 9].</F> राजमार्ग and सभा of; <F>5:  Ib. X. ५०. १०-13.</F> with a huge army कृष्ण and राम returned to; besieged by Yavana; abandoned by कृष्ण in fear, for द्वारका; <F>6:  Ib. X. ५३ (V) २१-2, ५०, ४५, ५३; ७२. ३१.</F> reached by राम, कृष्ण, अक्रूर and others; Gopa's camp outside the city; entered by the brothers and Gopas; the city describ- ed; joy of the women at the sight of the brothers; <F>7:  Ib. X. ch. ४१ (whole); ४२. २३.</F> left by अक्रूर for Vraja by chariot, as also by Uddhava; Gopis' enquiry about कृष्ण. Uddhava's return to मथुरा from Vraja. <F>8:  Ib. X. ३८. 1; ४७. २१, ६८.</F> reached by Nanda, Gopas and Gopis after Vasu- deva's sacrifice at स्यमन्तपञ्चक; <F>9:  Ib. X. ८४. ६९.</F> Vajra anointed king of, by युधिष्ठिर; <F>१०:  Ib. I. १५. ३९.</F> sometime ruled by seven नाग kings; <F>११:  Br. III. ७४. १९४.</F> sacred to देवकी. <F>१२:  M. १३. ३९.</F> Vasudeva's residence in; <F>१३:  Vi. V. 3. १६.</F> left by अक्रूर in a chariot as directed by Kamsa to fetch कृष्ण from Vraja; कृष्ण's visit to, which travelling by chariot took one day; <F>१४:  Ib. V. १५. २४; १८. 9ff.</F> ruled by Kamsa and then Ugrasena; <F>१५:  Ib. V. १९. 8 ff.</F> evacuat- ed for fear of कालयवन and migrated to द्वारका, <F>१६:  Ib. V. २१. ३२; २३. १५.</F> temple of Hari at. <F>१७:  Ib. VI. 8. ३१.</F>
(II)--(दक्षिण) visited by बलराम. भा. X. ७९. १५. [पगे२-605+ २१]
(III)--the capital of the नागस् of whom seven are distinguished. वा. ९९. ३८३.
--is कृष्ण. Br. III. ३६. ३१.
--in the neck of the personified Veda. वा. १०४. ८०.
(I)--followed सती going to दक्ष's sacrifice. भा. IV. 4. 4.
(II)--a son of Kali and सुरा. Br. III. ५९. 9; वा. ८४. 9.
(III)--born out of the अहन्कार of ब्रह्मा. M. 3. ११.
(IV)--an आभूतरय god. वा. ६२. ४८.
--a lake of कैलास. Br. II. १८. 3.
--a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३३. ११.

(I)--a name of काम, God of Love: also Makaradhvaja (s.v.); <F>1:  भा. XI. 4. 8.</F> created by ब्रह्मा when he looked at महालक्ष्मी after praying to जनार्दन; was given the flower dart and the sugarcane bow; Hari blessed him with all con- quest and no defeat; <F>2:  Br. IV. 8. २४-9; ११. 7.</F> performed सौभाग्य--शयनम्; <F>3:  M. ६०. ४९.</F> at the request of the Devas and persecuted by तारक, Madana took courage and secretly entered शिव's abode; the latter grew angry and burnt him with his third eye; <F>4:  Br. IV. ११. २८.</F> remembered by Indra, went to him and was ordered to create sexual desire in शिव; he got frightened at शिव's third eye, but pressed by Indra he agreed to meet the Lord and sent his arrow of Mohana when Siva's third eye burnt him down; Rati wept with Madhu or Spring and both went to शिव; Rati praised him for grace; शिव replied that Madana would attain fame as Ananga in the world sometime hence. <F>5:  M. १५४. २१२-51, २६०-70.</F>
(II)--the seventh son of देवकी. M. ४६. १९.
--a commander of भण्ड sent to aid विषन्ग. Br. IV. २१. ७८; २५. २७.
--the vow observed on the १२थ् day of the bright half of Caitra, with the object of attaining sons; observed by दिती. M. 7. 7-२६; २९१. 3.
--an apsarasa. वा. ६९. ४८.
--the queen of सन्दास; gave birth to अश्मक through वसिष्ठ with the assent of the King; prevented her husband from returning the curse on वसिष्ठ. भा. IX. 9. १८, २४ and ३८; Vi. IV. 4. ५६, ६७-72.
(I)--one of Vasudeva's wives and mother of Nanda and other sons. भा. IX. २४. ४५, ४८. Br. III. ७१. १६१, १७१-2. वा. ९६. १६०, Vi. IV. १५. १८, २३.
(II)--came out of the churning of the ocean of milk. <F>1:  M. २५१. 2.</F> बलराम indulged in. <F>2:  Vi. IV. १३. १५७.</F>
(III)--an epithet of वारुणि. Vi. V. २५. 3.
--also सुरासिन्धु, सिन्धुराज, सुराम्- budhi, सुधाम्बुधि: a deity in the Kiricakraratha. Br. IV. २०. ७३; २८. ५७, ६२, ८७-8.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८८.
--a goddess enshrined at Caitraratha. M. १३. २८.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २२.
--Liquor: Brahmanas forbidden to take it: प्रायस्चित्त for it: used in the worship of the mother goddess and the शक्तिस्. Br. IV. 7. ६६, ७३-6; 8. ४१.
--an ancient tribe: enlisted by जरासन्ध against the Yadus, their king went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse M. २०८. 5; भा. X. [५४ (V) 4] ८२. १३.
--a son of शिबि; Kingdom of, माद्रकस्. भा. IX. २३. 3; Br. III. ७४. २३; Vi. IV. १८. १०. वा. ९९. २३-24.

--a tribe; turned into a ruling caste by पुरञ्जय; <F>1:  M. ११४. ४१; भा. XII. 1. ३६.</F> followed भीम in his conquests; <F>2:  Ib. X. ७२. १३.</F> established by विश्वस्फाणि. <F>3:  Br. III. ७४. १९१.</F>
--ruled by पुरूरवस् in the चाक्षुषमन्- vantara. M. ११५. 7; ११८. ४८ and ७७.
--a sacred hill. Br. III. १३. ५२, ५७.
(I)--one of the ten wives of Atri: mother of Soma. Br. III. 8. ७५.
(II)--a R. originating from the Vindhyas. वा. ४५. १०२.
(III)--a daughter of घृताची and भद्राश्व. वा. ७०. ६८. [पगे२-609+ ३२]
(IV)--one of the ten daughters of रौद्राश्व. वा. ९९. १२५.
--in Duryodhana's army: went to Syamanta- पञ्चक for the solar eclipse. भा. X. ७८. [९५ (V) १६]; ८२. २६.
(I)--a son of बिन्दुमान् and सन्घा; his son was वीरव्रत. भा. V. १५. १५.
(II)--the father of Asura लवण; <F>1:  भा. IX. ११. १४.</F> killed by Hari. <F>2:  Ib. VII. 9. ३७; X. ४०. १७. Br. II. ३७. 2; III ६३. ३८; IV. २९. ७५.</F>
(III)--a son of कार्तवीर्यार्जुन; he had a hundred sons of whom वृष्नि was the eldest. भा. IX. २३. २७, २९; Vi. IV. ११. २१.
(IV)--a son of देवक्षत्र (देवक्षेत्र म्। प्। and वि। प्।) and father of कुरुवश (Puravasa म्। प्।) (कुमारवम्श-वि। प्।). भा. IX. २४. 5; M. ४४. ४४; Vi. IV. १२. ४२.
(V)--a son of कृष्ण. भा. X. ९०. ३३.

(VI)--a month sacred to धाता; <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ३३; M. ५३. ४१.</F> good for the gift of the वराह प्।; <F>2:  Ib. १५४. २११.</F> the king of seasons; generally spring, a kin of the God of Love; <F>3:  Ib. १५४. २५६; वा. ३०. 4; ५०. २०१.</F> the month of Citra (Veda), the first of the six ऋतुस्. <F>4:  Br. II. १३. 4, 9; वा. ३०. 8; ३१. ४९; ४५. २७; ५०. २०१; ५२. 5.</F> [पगे२-610+ २९]
(VII)--an आत्रेय and a sage of the चाक्षुष epoch. Br. II. ३६. ७८; वा. ६२. ६६.
(VIII)--a son of Praheti: a राक्षस. Br. III. 7. ९१; वा. ६९. १६५.
(IX)--a son of खशा and a राक्षस. Br. III. 7. १३३.
(X)--a son of Devana and father of Nandana, Puruvasu Manu, and मनुवश. Br. III. ७०. ४६; वा. ९५. ४५.
(XI)--a मरीचि god. Br. IV. 1. ५८.
(XII)--a son of Auttama Manu. M. 9. १२.
(XIII)--a राक्षस who attacked नारायण; was slain by विष्णु. M. १३५. ४९; १७८. 6, १८.

(XIV)--a mind-born son of Lord विष्णु born with कैटभ representing रजस् and तमस् qualities; <F>1:  M. १७०. 1.</F> with कैटभ shook the lotus stand of ब्रह्मा in the navel of विष्णु lying in waters after interview with Rudra; then ब्रह्मा appealed to विष्णु in fear; भू, Bhuva and Suva entered ब्रह्मा; विष्नु and जिष्णु fought with Madhu Kaitabha when ब्रह्मा acted as arbitrator; the battle con- tinued for thousands of years; ब्रह्मा entered into con- templation when Mohini or विष्णुमाय appeared to the great grief of the Asuras; both were killed when ब्रह्मा asked for permission to create four kinds of creatures; with [पगे२-611+ ३७] a view to this he performed austerities when he was filled with rage and tears out of which came wind, bile and kapha besides poisonous serpents; ब्रह्मा's grief knew no bounds, and he swooned and lost his life; when Rudra appeared in eleven forms out of his face, revived him and helped him in his creation as his son. <F>2:  वा. २५. ३०-80.</F>
(XV)--a son of विश्वेशा. M. १७१. ४९.
(XVI)--honey fit for ceremonies; <F>1:  M. २०४. 5 and 7.</F> used for the ablution of deities; <F>2:  Ib. २६६. ५१, ५५.</F> fit for पिण्ड at गया. <F>3:  वा. ३०. १५१; ५६. १२; १०५. ३४.</F>
(XVII)--a son of लान्गली, the अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. २००.
(XVIII)--a son of वृष; had a hundred sons of whom वृष्णि was the eldest. Vi. IV. ११. २६-7, २९.
(XIX)--a son of चाक्षुष Manu. Vi. III. 1. २८.

--a tribe whose Lord was कृष्ण; <F>1:  भा. I. 8. ४२; १०. २६.</F> related to the पाण्डवस्; <F>2:  Ib. I. १४. २५; IX. २४. ६३.</F> defended द्वारका; <F>3:  Ib. I. ११. ११.</F> relieved by Kamsa's death; <F>4:  Ib. X. ४५. १५.</F> heard of कृष्ण's going to मिथिला and met him with presents; <F>5:  Ib. X. ८६. २०.</F> their praise of the heroic deeds of विष्णु; <F>6:  Ib. IX. २४. ६३.</F> fought with their kinsmen and ended themselves. <F>7:  Ib. XI. ३०. १८.</F> [पगे२-612+ २९]
--a भार्गव and मध्यमाध्वर्यु. Br. II. ३३. १६.
--the १४ s4aktis attached to वासन्त cakra. Br. IV. ३२. ५३.

--the middle one of the १०१ sons of विश्वामित्र; <F>1:  भा. IX. १६. २९; Vi. IV. 7. ३८.</F> invited for the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर; <F>2:  भा. X. ७४. 9; वा. ९१. ९६.</F> a sage; <F>3:  Br. II. ३२. ११७; III. ६६. ६८.</F> a कौशिक Brahmis2t2ha. <F>4:  M. १४५. ११२.</F>
--a goddess following माया. M. १७९. ७०.
--fit for gift during विशोकद्वादशि व्रतम्। M. ८२. १९.
--a king; among the Angas after Nandana, he succeeded. His brother was नन्दियशस्. वा. ९९. ३६९.
--an Ajita deva. Br. II. १३. ९४; वा. ३१. 7.
--an offering of milk and honey; <F>1:  M. २३०. ११.</F> Para- शुराम was treated with it by Agastya. <F>2:  Br. III. ३५. ५२.</F>
--a wedding present of Indra to कामेश्- vara. Br. IV. १५. २२. [पगे२-613+ २७]
--sacred to Hari; <F>1:  भा. VII. १४. ३१.</F> the capital of the Yadus. <F>2:  Ib. X. 1. १०.</F>
--a mythical tree in Uttarakuru yielding clothes, jewels, etc. Br. II. १५. ७२; वा. ४५. १२.
--to be recited in a श्राद्ध. M. १७. ३९.
--a Mt. west of the शितोद. वा. ३६. २८.
--an आर्षेय Pravara (Angiras). M. १९६. २२.
--an epithet of कृष्ण. Vi. IV. १३. ४८.
--a son of घृत Pr2s2t2ha. भा. V. २०. २१.

--the region of Asura Madhu and his son लवण; <F>1:  Br. III. ६३. १८६; वा. ८८. १८५.</F> sacred to Hari on the bank of the यमुना; here अम्बरीष offered prayers to Hari by अभिषेक according to महाभिषेक विधि: Here शत्रुघ्न killed लवण and founded the city of मधुरा. <F>2:  भा. IX. 4. ३०-31; ११. १४; Vi. I. १२. 2-4.</F> [पगे२-614+ ३१]
--the fifteen शक्तिस् attached to वासन्त cakra. Br. IV. ३२. ४९-53.
--a queen of Vasanta ऋतु. Br. IV. ३२. २३, ४६.
--a name of Hari. भा. X. 6. २३.
--(Madhuvana s.v.); the forest of Madhu; reference to the city of मथुरा on the यमुना; the place where Dhruva performed तपस्; was visited by Hari to see Dhruva. भा. I. १०. २६; IV. 8. ४२ and ६२; 9. 1.
--a Janapada of the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. १४.
--a Gandharva. Br. III. 7. ११.

--the middle country to be con- quered by Kalki; a kingdom of इक्ष्वाकु; <F>1:  Br. III. ७३. १०७. M. १२. १९; वा. ५८. ८१; ९८. १०६.</F> under दिवाकर its capital was अयोध्या; <F>2:  M. ११४. ३६; २७१. 5.</F> one of the three divisions of India. <F>3:  Br. II. ३१. ८१; ३५. ११; Vi. II. 3. १५.</F> [पगे२-615+ २७]
(I)--the eighteenth kalpa; the beginning of मध्यम स्वर। वा. २१. ३८.
(II)--a name of a svara sacred to Dhaivata. Va. २१. ३९.
--the middle scale in music; consists of शार्ङ्गि, पावनि and दृष्टाक--२० different kinds in it. वा. ८६. ३८, ४९.
--the middle path consisting of आर्ष- भि, गोवीथि and जारद्गवि। Br. III. 3. ५१.
--a pupil of याज्ञवल्क्य. Br. II. ३५. २८.
(II)--१२ to १८ na1likas; <F>1:  वा. ५०. ९९; ५६. ४६.</F> when the sun passes three मुहूर्तस् from सम्गव। <F>2:  Ib. ५०. १७२.</F>
--a R. from the lake जया. M. १२१. ७१.
(I)--the eleventh organ partaking of the character of कर्म and ज्ञान; proceeds to create induced by a desire to produce. Br. II. 9. 1, 7; IV. 3. २२; M. 3. २१.
(III)--a साध्य god. Br. III. 3. १६; वा. ६६. १५.
(IV)--a तुषित god. Br. III. 3. १९; वा. ६६. १८.
(V)--a शाला adjoining Sahasrastambha शाला in श्रीपुरम्; reputed for its अमृतवापिक; by drinking its water yogis and siddhas became strong in body. Br. IV. ३५. 2-२४.
(VI)--a son of शतरूपा. M. 4. २५.
(VII)--twenty-sixth kalpa; शङ्करी became twins. वा. २१. ५९.
(VIII)--another term for महान्. वा. १०२. २१.
--twelve sons of ब्रह्मा with मन्त्रशरीरस्। वा. ६७. 6. [पगे२-617+ २३]
--the lake of the south. वा. ३६. १६.
--a Bhavya deva. Br. II. ३६. ७१.
(I)--a son of प्राचीत्वत. M. ४९. 2.
(II)--a son of Aviddha. वा. ९९. १२१.
(III)--a son of महान्त. Vi. II. 1. ३९.
(IV)--a son of प्रवीर; father of Abhayada. Vi. IV. १९. 1.
(I)--R. from lake Varcovan. (सायन- वा। प्।). Br. II. १८. ६६; वा. ४७. ६३.
(II)--a daughter of उत्तानपाद and the wife of अन्तिनार. Br. II. ३६. ९०; M. ४९. 7; वा. ६२. ७६.
(III)--the wife of मृकण्डु and mother of मार्कण्डेय. वा. २८. 5; Br. II. ११. 7. [पगे२-618+ २८]
(I)--a son of धिषणा and कृशाश्य. भा. VI. 6. २०.
(II)--a Pravara. M. १९६. ३०.
(III)--a साध्य god. M. २०३. ११.
(IV)--the author of a धर्मशास्त्र; grass cut for cow is not punishable; so also flowers plucked from gardens other than those of temples for the worship of god. M. २२७. २७, ३२, ११३.
(V)--approached by वरूत्रि's sons to ruin the offerings to Gods but interrupted by Indra. वा. ६५. ७९.
(VI)--a son of बाष्कल. वा. ६७. ७९.
(VII)--a son of शिघ्रक; established himself in कलापग्राम by yoga. वा. ८८. २१०.
(VIII)--one of the sons of Madhu. वा. ९५. ४५.

(IX) (रैवत)--the fifth Manu; son of Priya- vrata and brother of तामस; Bali and others were his sons. Vibhu was Indra; भूतरयस् were the gods of the epoch; वैकुण्ठ was the manifestation of Hari in this मन्वन्तर। <F>1:  भा. V. 1. २८; VIII. 5. 2-5.</F> देवबाहु and others were the seven sages; served as calf to milk the earth. <F>2:  Br. II. ३६. 3, ५१. ६४; ३७. १७. 8.</F> [पगे२-619+ ४३]
(X)--(चाक्षुष)--a son of विश्वकर्मन् (विश्- वेश-म्। प्।) and कृती। Father of विश्वस् and साध्यस्. भा. VI. 6. १५; M. १७१. ४८.

(XI) (सावर्णि)--the eighth Manu. A son of छाया and विवस्वान्. Father of Nirmoka and other sons. In this epoch Sutapas, Virajas अमिताभस्, Mukhyas were the gods. Bali was Indra. गालव, कृप, राम and others were the sages. Hari manifested himself as सार्वभौम। <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ४१; VIII. १३. ११-7; २२. ३१; Vi. III. 2. 4; १३-19.</F> Ini- tiated in the mystery of Lord's glories by नारद, worship- ping नरनारायण; <F>2:  भा. V. १९. १०.</F> originally श्रुतश्रवस्; performs aus- terities on the slopes of Meru even to-day. <F>3:  Br. IV. 1. २८; III. ५९. ४९ and ८०.</F>

(XII) (स्वायम्भुव)--the first son of ब्रह्मा and the first king (सम्राट्) also विराट्. Ruled the earth, girt by seven seas, occupying ब्रह्मावर्त with बर्हिष्मती as capital. A विप्रराजऋषि. Learnt the Veda from his father, who asked him to rule according to Dharma. Wife शत- रूपा; sons Priyavrata and उत्तानपाद besides eight more through अनन्ता and a daughter, देवहूती. Other daughters were आकूति and प्रसूति <F>1:  भा. VIII. 1. 1, 5 and 7, XI. १४. 4; III. २०. 1 and १०; २१. 1-3, २५-26; २२. २६-9; VI. 1. 1; 8. 6; Br. II. १३. १०५; M. 3. ४४-5; 4. ३४; १४५, ९०; वा. 3. 2, ३६; २३. ४७; ५९. ५६-7; Vi. I. 7. १४-19; III. 1. 6.</F> who married दक्ष and Ruci res- pectively. Met Kardama on the सरस्वती, spoke of inter- dependence of the क्षत्रिय and the Brahmana, and offered his daughter देवहूती in marriage to that sage. <F>2:  भा. III. २१. ४५; २२. 3-१४.</F> Another daughter धन्या became the wife of Dhruva. Seeing Dhruva fighting with the यक्षस् in utter wrath, Manu asked him to cease slaughtering the innocents and to ask pardon of Kubera, their chief. <F>3:  Ib. IV. ११. 6-३४; M. 4. ३८.</F> Appointed Priyavrata in charge of the kingdom and retired to तपस्। Spent ७१ yugas meditating on विष्णु, and gave Him the name, Hari. Did not take objection to Hara's violation of धर्म, though he was one of the twelve who knew the धर्म ordained by Hari. <F>4:  भा. V. 1. २१-2; XI. 2. १५; III. २२. ३१-6; II. 7. 2; VI. १७. १२; 3. २०; IV. २१. २८.</F> Served as calf for पृथु to milk the earth. <F>5:  Ib. IV. १८. १२; २९. ४२.</F> Formed one half of the Creator [पगे२-620+ ३८] and the other was शतरूपा. Asked ब्रह्मा for the earth being lifted out of the waters to form an abode for him and his subjects, when a वराह issued from ब्रह्मा's nostrils to do the work. <F>6:  Ib. III. १२. ५३-4; १३. 3-१८.</F> Renouncing the world, Manu stood on one leg medi- tating on the glory of Hari on the bank of the सुनन्दा for a hundred years; when the Asuras tried to attack and devour him, Hari in the form of यज्ञ slew them. <F>7:  भा. VIII. 1. 7-१०.</F> The first to give out स्मार्त धर्म, वर्णाश्रम धर्म and the first to practice शिष्टाचार; requested by Brahma to protect the वेदस् and consequently the यज्ञस्। Divided the Vedas into four sections. <F>8:  Br. II. २९. ४६, ६१-4; ३०. ३४; ३२. ३५-8, ९६; ३४. 2-8; ३५. १७५; ३६. 3; ३७. १४; IV. 1. ३२ and १०९; M. १४२. ४२.</F> An आदिपुरुष. From him were born वैराजस्. <F>9:  Ib. 3. ४५-6; १७१. २७; १९२. १०; २२७. ३२.</F>

(XIII)--(स्वारोचिष)--the second Manu, and son of Agni. Father of Dyumat and others. In this epoch Rocana was Indra, तुषित and others were gods, ऊर्ज्जस्तम्ब and six others were the seven sages. भा. VIII. 1. १९-20; Br. II. ३६. 3, २३; ३७. १५.

(XIV)--(वैवस्वत)--the seventh Manu, also known as ‘श्राद्धदेव’. <F>1:  भा. VIII. १३. 1-9; Br. II. ३६. 4, ८१; III. ५९. २२ and ३८; ६३. २१५; IV. 1. 6-२८; वा. ८४. २२; Vi. IV. 1. 6-7.</F> Son of सम्ज्ञा and Vivasvat (सुरेणु and विवस्वान् वा। प्।): wife श्रद्धा: father of ten sons of whom इक्ष्वाकु was the eldest; <F>2:  Br. II. ३८. 1.</F> in this epoch Puran- dara was Indra: कश्यप, Atri and others were sages: आदित्- yas and Vasus were gods: वामन was the manifestation of Hari; <F>3:  भा. VIII. १३. 1-9.</F> a क्षत्रिय मन्त्रवादिन्: His sacrifice was disturbed by sons of वरूत्रि who were burnt by Indra in the वेदि: [पगे२-621+ ४१] a प्रजापति: king and दण्डधर. <F>4:  Br. II. ३२. १२०; ३८. २६ and ३२; III. 1. 3 and 6; 8. २१; १०. ९८; ६०. 7; M. १४५. ११५; २४८. १५.</F> Saved by the Matsya Hari during the deluge. After anointing his son on the throne, M. performed penance on the Malaya Mt. for a lac of years when ब्रह्मा blessed him as protector of the universe after the प्रलय। Once in making a water oblation to his manes, a fish fell into his hand which he put into his water vessel. Finding its rapid growth he placed it in a well, tank, Ganges and the sea respectively. From its abnormal growth he suspected it to be an asura or वासुदेव; on questioning it he found it to be the Lord and was asked to use it (the fish) as the life boat when the whole world went down in the deluge, saving at the same time some lives; <F>5:  Ib. 1. ११ to the end; 2. १६; 9. 1; १६. 1; ५२. 3.</F> performed तपस् on the यमुना for one hundred years with a view to get progeny; <F>6:  भा. I. 3. १५; VIII. २४. ५०; IX. 1. 3-१२; 2. 1; 6. 4.</F> see Satyavrata; celebrated an अश्वमेध in honour of Mitra and वरुण; out came इला who went to them; <F>7:  Br. III. ६०. 1-१०.</F> the Lord of men, and seven worlds with towns; <F>8:  वा. ७०. १८.</F> divided the Vedas into four for the pro- gress of the world; <F>9:  Ib. ६०. 8.</F> in order to get sons he performed the मित्रावरुण ritual; owing to the होत'स् carelessness a daughter इला came out; she became again a male Sudyumna by name; by an imprecation of शिव he again became a woman near Budha's hermitage. Budha got by her a son by name पुरूरवस्; <F>१०:  Vi. IV. 1. 8-१२.</F> interpretation of शब्दब्रह्म by. <F>११:  Ib. VI. 5. ६४.</F>

(XV) (दक्ष सावर्णी)--the ninth Manu. Born of वरुण; father of भूतकेतु and other sons. पारस् and others were gods of his epoch, and Adbhuta was Indra; Dyu- timat and others were sages. During this period Hari mani- fested himself as ऋषभ. भा. VIII. १३. १८-20. [पगे२-622+ ३५]

(XVI) (रुद्रसावर्णि)--the twelfth Manu; father of देववान् and other sons. ऋतधामन् was Indra. हारित and others were gods. तपोमूर्ति and others were sages. स्वधाम was Hari manifesting in this epoch; <F>1:  भा. VIII. १३. २७-29.</F> the fourth सावर्ण Manu in the १२थ् पर्याय। <F>2:  Br. IV. 1. ८२-93.</F>

(XVII) सावर्ण(इ)--the second Manu in the epoch of the Vaivasvata Manvantara; son of सावर्ण; <F>1:  Br. IV. 1. ५१-5, ७३-81.</F> in his age Bali was to reign over the whole world. <F>2:  Ib. II. ३६. 4; III. ७३. ५२.</F>
(XVIII) (रौच्य)--a सावर्ण Manu of the XIII पर्याय; three groups of gods, all addicted to Soma and ghee through यज्ञस्। Br. IV. 1. ९५-116.

(XIX)--(चाक्षुषान्तरम्)--भृगु and other sages lived in this epoch. <F>1:  M. 2. १४; 6. 3; 8. १२.</F> There were five classes of devas, Lekha, ऋभव, ऋभाद्य, वारिमूल, and Divaukasa; चाक्- षुष had ten sons commencing with Ruru; <F>2:  Ib. 9. २२, २५.</F> King पुरूरवस् flourished in the same line in this epoch. <F>3:  Ib. ११५. 7-8.</F>
(XX) (औत्तम)--the third Manu; <F>1:  M. 3. ४७.</F> father of ten sons; the devas of the epoch are भावनस् and there were also seven sages, कौकुरुण्डि, etc., all engaged in yoga. <F>2:  Ib. 9. ११.</F>
(XXI) (चाक्षुष) (VI)--the son of चक्षु and वीरिणी; married a royal princess नड्वला and had ten sons. M. 4. ४०; Vi. I. १३. 4.
(XXII)--the son of हर्यश्व and father of Pra- tika. Vi. IV. 5. २७. [पगे२-623+ २९]

--worshipped with Devas for kingdom; their duties in different epochs described. <F>1:  भा. II. 3. 9; VIII. १४. 2-१०</F> Fourteen in number; went to Maharloka when their duties were over; <F>2:  Br. IV. 2. 2 nad 5.</F> in order: स्वायम्भुव, स्वारोचिष, Auttama, तामस, Raivata, चाक्- षुष; these six are past ones; the future are eight; सावर्ण, पञ्चरौच्यस्, Bhautya and Vaivasvata. <F>3:  वा. ६२. 3-4.</F>
--the whole period of the fourteen Manus covering a कल्प of one thousand yugas--the fourteen man- vantaras. भा. VIII. १३. ३६; १४. ११.
--a son of द्युतिमान् after whose name is a Janapada. वा. ३३. २१.
--a तीर्थ visited by बलराम. भा. X. ७९. २१.
(मनुत्त or मरुत्त)--a king equal to a cakravartin, went to heaven with Samvarta, a sage; father of नरिष्यन्त. वा. ८६. 9.
--a daughter of Tumburu. Br. III. 7. १३.
--an अवतार् of Hari. भा. II. 7. २०. [पगे२-624+ २३]
--a son of Madhu. वा. ९५. ४५.
--created out of the रजस् element; <F>1:  Vi. I. 5. २३, ३७-8; 6. 1.</F> four वर्णस् of. <F>2:  Ib. I. 6. 5.</F>
--are Laukikas (s.v.). Br. II. २८. ७१, ७८, ९५.
(I)--a son of मेधातिथि of शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २५.
(II)--a son of ईशान and शिवा. Br. II. १०. ७९; वा. २७. ५२.
(III)--a Lekha god. Br. II. ३६. ७५.
(IV)--the Indra of the चाक्षुष epoch. Br. II. ३६. ७६; Vi. III. 1. २६.
(V)--a son of Anila (Anala-म्। प्।) a Vasava. Br. III. 3. २६; M. 5. २५; वा. ६६. २५; Vi. I. १५. ११४.
(VI)--a god of one of the ten branches of the हरीत gan2a. Br. IV. 1. ८४; वा. १००. ८९.
--restraint of mind. वा. १७. 6.
(I)--a son of द्युतिमान् after whom the kingdom, मानोनुग took its name. Br. II. १४. २२, २४.
(II) (च्)--a region of the क्रौञ्चद्वीप adjoining the वामन hill. Br. II. १४. २४; १९. ७१; M. १२२. ८४.
(III)--a वर्ष of the hill, वामनक. वा. ४९. ६६.
--an Apsarasa. Br. III. 7. 7.
(I)--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २६.
(II)--an Apsarasa. वा. ६९. 6.
(I)--the सभा of ब्रह्मा on the first inner- slope of Meru in which reside ईशान and Indra besides sages and seers. वा. ३४. ७२-7.
(II)--a daughter of Tumburu. वा. ६९. ४९.
--a तीर्थ on the नर्मदा sacred to पितृस्. M. १९४. 7. [पगे२-626+ २८]
(I)--a wife of Dhara. M. 5. २४.
(II)--the wife of Dharma, the Vasu. Vi. I. १५. ११३.
--the form of a Brahmana assumed by गणेश Nikumbha when he appeared in a dream to दिवोदास. Br. III. ६७. ४२.
--a R. from the ऋक्ष hill. Br. II. १६. ३१.
--Indra of the चाक्षुष epoch. भा. VIII. 5. 8.

--also मन्त्रिणी, <F>1:  Br. IV. १७. २२, २७; २७, ५८; १९. ६१.</F> and मन्त्रिणीश्यामा; war master of ललिता; residence at कदम्बवनवाटिका; <F>2:  Ib. IV. ३१. ८२, ८९.</F> helped कुमारी in vanquishing भण्ड's sons; rode on Kiri- cakra; consulted दण्डनाथा; <F>3:  Ib. IV. २६. 2, ८३, ११३; २७. ५८.</F> invoked मदीरासिन्धु (s.v.). <F>4:  Ib. IV. २८. १४, ४८, ९२, १०३.</F>
--a branch of the Vedic literature. वा. ५८. १४.

(I)--(also मन्त्रस्थानम्, Council Cham- ber) consultation to be held with many and individually and with people in whom the king has confidence; at least one expert must be consulted; generally with people learned in the three Vedas, elders who have the ability to correct the erring king; <F>1:  M. २१५. ४८-52.</F> kingdom rests on mantra; <F>2:  Ib. २२०. ३३.</F> king not to decide alone nor to consult too many; <F>3:  Ib. २२०. ३७.</F> भण्ड's War Council. <F>4:  Br. IV. २१. २१; २५. 3</F>
(II)--a portion of the पूर्व samhita1. वा. ६१. ६५.

--take the food offered in sacrifices to the पितृस् as the calf finds out its mother among the lost cows; <F>1:  Br. II. २८. ९१; वा. ५९. ६१.</F> came out of discontent, fear, difficulties, happiness and misery of ऋषिस्; later put into form and order by sages; differences in मन्त्रस् as many as twenty-four; <F>2:  Br. II. ३२. ६८; ३३. ४२; वा. ५९. ३५-61; M. १४५. ६२-3.</F> the two major divisions --ग्राम्यम् and आरण्यकम्; <F>3:  Br. II. ३५. ७३, ८५; IV. 8. ५१-3, ५७.</F> Veda mantras, विष्णु mantra, दुर्गा mantra, गाणपत mantra, etc.; <F>4:  Ib. IV. ३८. 4.</F> ety of. <F>5:  वा. ५९. १४१.</F>
--a R. in कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १५.
--a son of सत्यभामा. वा. ९६. २३८.
--a son of सत्यभामा and कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. २४७.
--the १२ sons who came out of ब्रह्मा's face. वा. ६७. 4. [पगे२-628+ २८]
--a वर्ण s4akti. Br. IV. ४४. ५८.
(I)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३८.

(II)--the chief counsellor of the king; <F>1:  वा. ५७. ७०.</F> looks after the kingdom in the absence of the king; <F>2:  M. ११५. १७; २१७. १८.</F> to be consulted before undertaking an expedition; <F>3:  Ib. २२३. 9; २४०. २७.</F> residence of. <F>4:  Ib. २५४. २०.</F>
--the ministry which ruled the king- dom in the absence of king, Sagara. Br. III. ५०. ३२.
--a secret mantra in honour of Sankar- षण, taught to king Citraketu by नारद; its text. भा. VI. १५. २७; १६. १८-25.
--a son of वीरव्रत and भोजा; his wife was सत्या, and son Bhauvana. भा. V. १५. १५.
--a son of Abhramu elephant; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. ३३०.</F> also Padma; the vehicle of Kubera. <F>2:  वा. ६९. २१४, २१६.</F>
--a son of श्रीदेवा and Vasudeva. Br. III. ७१. १८१. [पगे२-629+ ३६]
--the शूद्र caste of शाकद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ६९.
--a R. from the Suktimat hill. Br. II. १६. ३८.
--a मूर्छन; the presiding deity of the विश्- vedevas. वा. ८६. ६३.
--a Marut गण. M. १७१. ५४.
--a son of बलराम. Br. III. ७१. १६७.

(I)--(Mt.) on one side of Meru; one of विष्- kambhagiris round the Meru; sacred to शिव; in its valleys हिरण्यकशिपु performed austerities; used in churning the milk ocean; lest it should sink in the sea Hari in the form of कूर्म supported the mountain; was lifted up with great difficulty by the Gods and Asuras, who could not carry it to the ocean, when Hari asked गरुड to bear it on his back to the sea and which he did. <F>1:  Br. IV. 9. ५१, ५६, ६०; भा. I. 3. १६; III. २८. २७; V. १६. ११; VII. 3. 2; 7. 2; VIII. 5. १०; 6. ३३-9; X. ४०. १८; XII. १३. 2; M. ६९. 1; २४९. १५; २५०. २६; २५१. ३५; Vi. I. 9. ७७, ८४.</F> Recipient of mango fruits as large as hill-tops falling from a divine mango tree, ११०० yoja- nas high (see अरुणोदा). <F>2:  भा. V. १६. १६.</F> Here पृथु died and was cre- mated. <F>3:  Ib. IV. २३. २४.</F> (Also known, Mandaragiri and मन्दराचलम्). भद्राश्व vars2a and Caitraratha park in; <F>4:  M. ८३. २०, ३१.</F> शिव spent his honeymoon here with उमा after marrying her; उमा's delights in the woods. <F>5:  Ib. ११३. ४५; १५४. ४९६, ५७३; १६३. ८७; १८३. 1.</F> [पगे२-630+ २६]

(II)--a Mt. of कुशद्वीप, from waters called मन्दस्; <F>1:  Br. II. १३. ३६; १९. ५६; वा. ३६. १९; ४२. १४; ४५. ९०; ४९. ५१; १०१. २८८.</F> a son of Meru; <F>2:  Ib. ३०. ३३.</F> on the other side of गन्धमा- dhana; its महावृक्ष is केतुराट्. <F>3:  Ib. ३५. १६.</F>
(III)--a Mt. in भारतवर्ष. Br. II. १६. २०; III. २७. २८.
(IV)--a तीर्थ sacred to कामचारिणी. M. १३. २८; १८४. १८.
(V)--same as ककुद्मान्. M. १२२. ६१.
(VI)--a palace of १२ floors; three-fourths of Meru; the तोरण is ४५ हस्तस्। M. २६९. २८, ३२, ४७.
(VII)--a Mt. in मलयद्वीप. वा. ४८. २३.
(VIII)--a hill on the east of इलावृत. Vi. II. 2. १८.
--a son of मणिभद्र. वा. ६९. १५५.
--an उपद्वीप to जम्बूद्वीप. भा. V. १९. ३०.
--a chief hill of कुशद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ४१. [पगे२-631+ ३१]
--a son of सारण. वा. ९६. १६५.
--a son of Bhavya of शाकद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ६०.

(I)--a R. in भारतवर्ष; गन्गा in Deva- loka; <F>1:  भा. V. १९. १८; X. ७०. ४४; वा. ४५. ९९.</F> R. of the कैलास hill. Here Aila and उर्वशी lived for sometime. <F>2:  Br. II. १८. 3; III. ६६. 6; M. १२१. 4; वा. ४१. १४-17; ९१. 6.</F> Other rivers in कैलास are अलकनन्दा and नन्दा. <F>3:  Ib. ४१. १८; ४७. 3.</F>
(II)--a R. sacred to the पितृस्; <F>1:  M. २२. २३.</F> rises from ऋष्यवान्; <F>2:  Ib. १०५. १०; ११४. २५.</F> water for bathing a deity. <F>3:  Ib. २६७. २०.</F>
--कश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 3.
--a R. from the ऋक्ष hill. Br. II. १६. ३०.
--a शिव gan2a. Br. III. ४१. २७.
--a division of श्रीपुरम्. Br. IV. ३२. ३३.
--the performance of, on the fifth day of the bright half of the month of माघ in honour of the Sun God, gets one the desired objects. M. ७४. 3; ७९. 1. [पगे२-632+ २८]
--an Andhra king who ruled for five years. M. २७३. १०.

(I)--three crores of राक्षसस् who attack the rising sun and who are disarmed by the सन्ध्य worship of gods and by the chanting of the गायत्री by the Brahmanas. <F>1:  Br. II. २१. ११०; वा. ५०. १६३.</F>
(II)--the शूद्र caste of कुशद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ३८.
--the lake in the कैलास; the water in it is like curd; the Nandana is on its bank, and the मन्दाकिनी rises from it. M. १२१. 4-5.
(I)--a daughter of Maya. M. 6. २१; वा. ६८. २९.
(II)--a तीर्थ sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ४१.

--(काम); God of Love; <F>1:  M. ११८. १३.</F> on the third Parva of the Geyacakra; <F>2:  Br. IV. १९. ६७.</F> recreated by ललिता, who said he was her son; went to शिव's abode accompanied by his friend Vasanta. <F>3:  Ib. IV. ३०. ४६.</F> Got burnt by शिव and in effecting his revival मायवती (रती) deluded शम्बर by her charms; she brought up Pradyumna who was a part of the Love God. <F>4:  VI. V. २७. २८-30.</F> [पगे२-633+ २९]
--a goddess enshrined at हेमकूट. M. १३. ५०.
(I)--a name of a Rudra. भा. III. १२. १२.
(II)--the son of Vitatha (भरद्वाज); father of बृहद्क्षत्र and four other sons. भा. IX. २१. 1; Vi. IV. १९. २०, २१.
--the son of जाठराग्नि; see विद्वानग्नि. Br. II. १२. ३४; वा. २९. ३२.

--periods of Manus; seven in number and seven to come, of स्वायम्भुव, स्वारोचिष, Auttama, तामस, Raivata, चाक्षुष, सावर्णि (after Vaivasvata in म्। प्।), रौच्य (ब्र्। प्।); Vaivasvata present according to the म्। प्।) Ruci, Bhautya, मेरुसावर्णि, Rta, ऋतधामान् and विष्वक्सेन; the last seven are future Manus; <F>1:  Br. II. 6. 6, २०; ३६. 1-4; M. 2. २२; 9. 2-३६; वा. २१. ११, १४, १९, ३८, ४४; ५७. ३३-6; Vi. I. 3. १८.</F> one of the five characteristics of the पुराण; <F>2:  M. ५३. ६५; Br. I. 1. ३७; वा. 4. १०.</F> calculation of the duration of the epochs of Manus; <F>3:  M. १४२. ३०.</F> constitutes ७१ yugas at the end of which comes क्षय <F>4:  वा. १०. १२; ३२. ४१.</F> according to मानुष and Divyavat- sara. <F>5:  Ib. ६१. १३८-144; १५०. १७६.</F>
--the Gods of three worlds, sages, पितृस्, and people help him; but finding the diminished powers, go to Maharloka. वा. ६१. १४९-51. [पगे२-634+ ३७]

--the wife of the sage उशिज (Asija-वा। प्।), (Utathya वि। प्।) whose younger brother बृहस्पति wanted sexual union with her when she was pregnant eight months; he raped her, and cursed the baby in the womb which obstructed the completion of the act, to be ever in darkness, and hence the child was born blind, दीर्घतमस्; the result of the union was भरद्वाज; ममता, abandoned Bharad- वाज fearing divorce by her husband on account of the in- discret act of बृहस्पति (s.v.) see also दीर्घतमस्. भा. IX. २०. ३७-39; Br. III. ७४. ३६-7; M. ४८. ३२-41; ४९. १७, २६; वा. ९९. ३६-8; Vi. IV. १९ 16.

(I)--The architect of the Asuras of the other world, and a past master in the practice of माया। Served as calf for the मायिन्स् to derive माया from Earth. Built aerial cities, three in number, of gold, silver and iron for the pro- tection of the Asuras, and constructed the divine सभा। The cities were well equipped and furnished, with paintings and drawings of couples of नागस् and Asuras, pigeons, parrots and शारिकस्, interspersed by charming gardens of flowers and fruits with lakes of crystal waters. Being the Lord of Tripura which he built, he took part with Bali in the देवासुर war, and also fought with विश्वकर्- man; <F>1:  भा. I. १५. 8; II. 7. ३७; IV. १८. २०; V. २४. 9-१०; VII. १०. २२ and २९, ५१-60.</F> son of विश्वकर्मन्; सुरेणु was his sister; <F>2:  Br. III. ५९. २१; IV. १२. 3; २०. ४६; ३१. 7; वा. ८४. २०-1.</F> had an evil dream that a naked lady and a man of three eye burning the city: reported it to the सभा: was explained by नारद: precautions for defence: army stationed at respec- tive places of vantage; विद्युन्मालि was over-powered; Maya constructed a tank of medicinal waters to make the dead live and restored विद्युन्मालि. Knowing this immortalising fluid, ब्रह्मा and Hari drank the whole of it; fierce war; शिव directed his arrows against the three cities and killed the Asuras by destroying their cities. Maya's address to the Asuras for a bold stand. विद्युन्मालि and तारक were killed. Maya was let off and asked to live in a special house [पगे२-635+ ३२] after burning the city. In the तारकामय it is said he rode on a golden chariot with arms and weapons. <F>3:  M. ch. १२९; १३१. २५-30; १३४. 9-३०; chh. १३५-140. १७३. 2-१३; १७७. 3-6.</F>

(II)--the Asura architect and a contemporary of कृष्ण. His son enslaved the gopas and hid them in a cave. कृष्ण recovered them; <F>1:  भा. II. 7. ३१.</F> freed from the forest fire of काण्- डव by Arjuna, he erected a सभा for the use of the पाण्- डवस्. Once Duryodhana (s.v.) mistook a floor of this for a sheet of water and had a nasty fall; <F>2:  Ib. X. ५५. २१; ७१. ४५; ५८. २७; ७५. ३४ and ३७.</F> Supplied a magic car to शाल्व under orders of शिव. <F>3:  Ib. X. ७६. 7; ७७. २८.</F>

(III)--an Asura; Lord of तलातल region, won the grace of शिव and attained मोक्ष by सत्सन्ग। A follower of वृत्र in his battle with Indra; <F>1:  भा. V. २४. २८; XI. १२. 5; VI. १०. ३१.</F> wife रम्भा and father of six sons; <F>2:  Br. III. 6. 5 and २८; वा. ६८. २८-9.</F> had daughters like उपदानवी. <F>3:  M. 6. २१.</F>
(IV)--father of माया. Br. II. 9. ६४.
(V)--an author on architecture. M. २५२. 2.
--a शक्ति created from the heart of नृसिम्ह. M. १७९. ६४.

(I)--the riding animal of कार्त्तिकेय; several on the हिमालयस्; <F>1:  Br. II. २५. १६, २७; III. १०. ४७. M. १६०. २१. वा. ३६. 2; ५४. १९.</F> a banner of Skanda presented to वायु. <F>2:  Ib. ७२. ४६.</F> [पगे२-636+ ३९]
(II)--a peak on the वराह hill. वा. ४२. ७०.
--बाण with the peacock standard; the breaking of the flag was a sign of impending war. Vi. V. ३३. 3.
--of the Agastya family. M. २०२. 2.
--a son of Bhavya of शकद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ६०.
--a प्रजापति; husband of अदिती and father of the आदित्यस्. वा. ३०. ७२; ५०. १६८; ५२. ९५; ६७. ४३; १००. २०; १०१. ३५ and ४९.

(I)--a mind-born son of ब्रह्मा born with नारद at the beginning of creation; <F>1:  भा. I. 6. ३१; III. १२. २२; IX. 1. १०; Br. II. ३२. ९६; III. 1. २१, ४३-4; M. 3. 6; 4. २६; १९५. 9.</F> married कला a daughter of Kardama; <F>2:  भा. III. २४. २२; IV. 1. १३.</F> father of कश्यप; <F>3:  Ib. III. १४. 7; २०. १०.</F> came with ब्रह्मा to see Kapila born to Kardama; <F>4:  Ib. III. २४. 9.</F> was present in दक्ष's यज्ञ; <F>5:  Ib. IV. 7. ४३; २९. ४३.</F> directed the अश्वमेध of Indra; <F>6:  Ib. VI. १३. २१.</F> came to see the Trivikrama अवतार् of the Lord; <F>7:  Ib. VIII. २१. 1.</F> did not comprehend Hari's माय। <F>8:  Ib. IX. 4. ५८.</F> The chief sage of Vena's reign responsible for punishing him. A sage in दारुवन; <F>9:  Br. II. २१. ११५; २७. १०४; ३६. १३३; III. १०. ५२; M. १४५. ९०; १५४. ३५२; १७१. २७.</F> one of the seven sages of स्वायम्भुव epoch: instructed by ब्रह्मा on the eighteen पुराणस्; praised शिव, out to destroy Tripuram; <F>१०:  Ib. 9. 4; ५३. १२; १०२. १९; १२७. २४; १३३. ६७.</F> had a daughter सुरूपा, whom Angiras got married. <F>११:  Ib. १९६. 1; २४५. ८६; २५०. 4.</F> [पगे२-637+ ३१]
(II)--a son of सम्राट् and उत्कला. Father of बिन्दुमती. भा. V. १५. १५.

(III)--His wife was ऊर्णा; had six sons in the first antara; then Gods laughed at ब्रह्मा seeking connec- tion with his daughter; these were born of हिरण्यकशिपु as Asuras, but were taken away by योगमाया; then they were born of देवकी and killed by Kamsa. भा. X. ८५. ४७-49.
(IV)--created from the eyes; one of the Nine ब्राह्मणस् alluded to in the पुराणस्। Br. I. 5; II. 9. १८ and २२; ११. १०; १३. ५४.

(V)--a sage of the स्वायम्भुव epoch; <F>1:  वा. 3. 2; ३१. १६; ६२. ११३; ६५. ४४.</F> son-in- law of दक्ष; <F>2:  Ib. ३०. ४८.</F> married सम्भूती; <F>3:  Br. II. 9. ५५; वा. २८. 8; Vi. I. १०. 6; ११. ४३.</F> advised Dhruva to pray to विष्णु. <F>4:  Ib. I. १२. 6.</F>

(VI)--a son of ब्रह्मा married धर्मव्रता, the daughter of Dharma whom he cursed for dereliction of duty, to become a stone; got one hundred sons through her; in turn cursed by her for the unjust curse. वा. १०७. 7, २६; ११२. ३६.
(VII)--a mind-born son of ब्रह्मा; married सन्नती. Vi. I. 7. 5, 7, ३७.
(I)--the gods of the ninth Manvantara; a गण of १२ gods. भा. VIII. १३. १९; Br. IV. 1. ५५, ५८-9; Vi. III. 2. २१. [पगे२-638+ २३]
(II)--the world of हविष्मन्त Pitr2s in the मार्ताण्डमण्डलम्. M. १५. १६.
(III)--the world of उपहूत Pitr2s; belonging to क्षत्रियगण. वा. ७३. ३८-9.
(IV)--sons of Meru सावर्णि. वा. १००. ५९.
--do severe austerities at Benares. M. १८३. ३१.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४४.
--one of Danu's sons. वा. ६८. 5.
--a daughter of trees given by Soma as wife of Pracetasa for the generation of दक्ष. वा. ६३. ३३-7.
(I)--the name of a desert; <F>1:  भा. I. १०. ३५.</F> water in, due to ignorance. <F>2:  वा. १०४. ३९.</F>

(II)--the son of शिघ्रराज and father of प्रश्रुत (प्रसुश्रक-वि। प्।); having attained perfection in योग: he [पगे२-639+ २६] resides in कलापग्राम (still rooted in Yoga-वि। प्।): would revive the solar race at the end of Kali. भा. IX. १२. 5-7; Br. III. ६३. २१०-11. Vi. IV. 4. १०८-11.
(III)--a son of हर्यश्व and father of प्रतीपक (Pratyambaka ब्र्। प्।; Pratitvaka-वा। प्।). भा. IX. १३. १५-6; Br. III. ६४. ११. वा. ८९. ११.
(IV)--on the way from द्वारका to हास्तिन- pura. भा. X. ७१. २१.
(V)--of the इक्ष्वाकु line, living in कलापग्राम and endowed with Yoga. भा. XII. 2. ३७.
(VI)--a son of the III सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ८१.
(VII)--the place sacred to ललिता. Br. IV. ४४. ९८.
--१३ Kings of this line ruled for २०० years with वृषलस्. वा. ९९. ३६०, ३६३.
(I)--a son of Karandhama; he had no son and regarded दुष्यन्त of Puru's family as his son. भा. IX. २३. १७.
(III)--Mitrajyoti was his daughter. Br. III. ६८. 1, 4. [पगे२-640+ ४५]

(I)--fortynine in number, born of Diti and कश्यप; seven in each of the seven वातस्कन्धस्; brothers of Indra and participators in sacrifices; <F>1:  भा. VI. १८. १९, २३-77: VIII. १३. 4: Br. III. 5. ७९, ९०, ९९, १०४: M. 6. ४७; १६३. २२-3.</F> when Diti conceived a son to be the slayer of Indra, the latter began to serve her throughout her pregnancy. Once finding that she did not keep to her vows he entered her womb and cut the foetus into ४९ pieces, when they cried. He said to them मा रुद and hence मारुत: being divine, were born as ४९ sons: at the request of their mother Indra made them a देवगण, called मरुत्गण. <F>2:  M. Ch. 7.</F> Gods of the Vaivasvata epoch, Indra being their over- lord: requested Soma to give up तारा to बृहस्पति. <F>3:  Ib. 8. 4: 9. २९: २३. ३५: ३६. 1.</F> Fought with निवातकवचस् in the देवासुर war: mounted guards in Marutta's यज्ञस्: nourished भरद्वाज abandoned by ममता and gave him to Bharata as his son; <F>4:  भा. VI. १०. १७: IX. 2. २८; २०. ३५-9: M. ४९. १५, २५-30: ५८. ३३.</F> helped Indra in the heavy downpour on Nandavraja: went with the gods to द्वारका to request कृष्ण to go back to वैकुण्ठ; <F>5:  भा. X. २५. 7: XI. 6. 2.</F> Fathers of शोभवत्य group of Apsarasas; presiding deity of कालोपनत मूर्छन; line in Bhuvar- loka and लोकालोक: perform श्राद्ध; <F>6:  Br. III. 7. २०: ६१. ४६: IV. 2. २७, १९७: III. १०. ११०.</F> are worshipped for lasting strength (ओजस्)। <F>7:  भा. II. 3. 8.</F> Their service in the battle of Tripuram: Shaken by हिरण्यकशिपु; glad at Hari's attack on the Asuras; <F>8:  M. ५८. ३३: १३२. 3; १३७. १८; १७२. १४-44; १७४. ३२.</F> attain- ed सिद्धि at सिद्देश्वरम्; <F>9:  Ib. १९१. ११७; २४६. ६०.</F> companions of those who are devoted to their brothers; <F>१०:  भा. VI. 5. ३१.</F> brought up भरद्वाज, son of बृहस्पति. <F>११:  वा. ९९. १३९-51.</F>
(II)--one of the Marut गणस्. वा. ६७. १२८. [पगे२-641+ ३९]

(I)--the seven pieces of Diti's गर्भ be- came seven गणस् in the वायु मार्ग; each originated seven <F>1:  वा. ३०. ९९: ६४. 2: Vi. I. 9. ६४ and ७०: २१. ४०.</F> गणस् in turn and thus ४९ Marut गणस् are distinguished; they partake in यज्ञस् especially गरुड शयन यज्ञ; <F>2:  वा. ६७. ११०, १२३-29.</F> residents of Bhuvarloka; <F>3:  Ib. १०१. २९.</F> part of विष्णु; <F>4:  Vi. V. 1. १७.</F> see शक्र.

(I)--the son of अविक्षित्, a cakravarti and father of Dama; helped by Samvarta, he performed sacrifices; his यज्ञस् were of a high order; Indra was much pleased with सोम, and the Brahmanas with दक्षिणा; Maruts were the guards and विश्वेदेवस् were members of the सभा; <F>1:  भा. IX. 2. २६-9.</F> still is sung the glory of his sacrifice in which everything was of gold; father of नरिष्यन्त. <F>2:  Vi. IV. 1. ३१-4. Br. III. ६१. 7; 8. ३५.</F>

(II)--a son of Karamdhama (Karamdana- वि। प्।): issueless, adopted दुष्कन्त of the Paurava line and thus Purvasu family got merged in the Paurava line. It was a result of ययाति's curse. Br. III. ७४. 2-4; वा. ९९. 2-4: Vi. IV. १६. 3-6.
(III)--a son of उशनस्, a great warrior and राजऋषि; father of Kambalabarhis. Br. III. ७०. २५: M. ४४. २४: वा. ९५. २४.

--a mind-born daughter of ब्रह्मा (a daughter of दक्ष, भा। प्। and वि। प्।) and one of the ten wives of Dharma; mother of the Maruts among whom were मरुत्वान् and Jayanta; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. 4 and 8: Br. III. 3. 2 and ३२: M. 5. १५. १७: १७१. ३२, ५१, ५५; २०३. 9. वा. ६६. 2: Vi. I. १५. १०५.</F> other names of the Maruts. <F>2:  M. १७१. ५२-5.</F>

--sons of मरुत्वती and Dharma; <F>1:  M. 5. १७; ३६. 1; १३२. 3; १७१. ५१; Br. III. 3. ३२; भा. VI. 6. 8; Vi. I. १५. १०५.</F> for names of the गणस् of the Maruts. <F>2:  M. १७१. ५२; २०३. 9.</F> [पगे२-642+ ३३]

--a sacrifice performed by Bharata anxious to have a son; <F>1:  भा. IX. २०. ३५: Br. III. ६८. 2: M. ४९. २८. वा. ९९. १५३; Vi. IV. १९. 6.</F> performed by Marutta for ६० years to please the Maruts and get inexhaustible अन्नम् from them. <F>2:  वा. ९३. 2-3.</F>
--a son of सुप्रतीक (सुप्रतीप-म्।प्।) and father of सुनक्षत्र. भा. IX. १२. १२: M. २७१. 8; Vi. IV. २२. 4.

--also Marudhanva; arid tract <F>1:  वा. ८६. ५१.</F> where सम्ज्ञा roamed in the guise of a mare; <F>2:  भा. I. १०. ३५. M. ११. २६. वा. 8. ९७; ८८. ३५.</F> heaven became like a desert by the havoc of तारक. <F>3:  M. १५४. ३४.</F> (See Maru).
--a R in भारत- वर्ष. भा. V. १९. १८.

--(शण्ड) an Asura; one of the four sons of शुक्र and a tutor of प्रह्लाद; <F>1:  भा. VII. 5. 1-2, ४८-50; Br. III. 1. ७८; ७२. ७२, ८७; ७३. ६३-4; M. ४७. ४१; वा. ६५. ७७.</F> seen by the Gods at the sacrifice; <F>2:  M. ४७. ५४.</F> one of the two disciples the other being शण्ड of शुक्र sent to help the Asuras; but he joined the camp of the Devas, the latter offering him a place in sacrifices. <F>3:  Ib. ४७. २२४-31; वा. ९७. ७२ and ८६; ९८. ६३; १०८. ६०.</F>
--sacred to मुकुटेश्वरी. M. १३. ३३.
--war musical instruments. M. १४०. ४३; वा. ५४. ३७. [पगे२-643+ २७]

(I)--thousands of mountains on all direc- tions of मेरुमूल, full of lofty buildings; boundary limits; <F>1:  वा. ३५. 3; ४०. 1; ४२. ७२. वा. १०१. १५७.</F> transgression of, punished. <F>2:  M. २२७. १८४.</F>

(II)--conventions of society for the welfare of the world introduced after those of वार्ता; establishment of, by kings; for breaking them, a king goes to hell. Br. II. 7. १५३; २९. ८९; ३६. १३३; IV. 2. १५९; M. २२५. १०; Vi. I. 6. ३२.
--another name for सहस्वान्. वा. ८८. २११.
--belonging to the कौशिक gotra. Br. III. ६६. ७०; वा. ९१. ९८.
(I)--was the Asura who entered heaven, snatched away the nectar vessel from Dhanvantari: मोहिनी helped the gods in the scuffle that ensued and Malaka fled to पातालम्. Br. IV. 9. ३८. १०. 2, २३.
(II)--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८५.
--was attacked by उन्मत्तभैरवी. Br. IV. २८. ४०.
--a Vindhyan tribe; an eastern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ५३ and ६३.
(I)--one of the ten wives of Atri. Br. III. 8. ७५. [पगे२-644+ ३१]
(II)--a daughter of भद्राश्व and घृताची. वा. ७०. ६८.
--a R. sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ६३.
(I)--a son of ऋषभ and Jayanti. भा. V. 4. १०.

(II)--a Mt. (Kulaparvata वा। प्।) in भारत- वर्ष; <F>1:  भा. V. १९. १६; Br. II. १६. १८; वा. ४५. ८९, १०५; Vi. II. 3. 3.</F> noted for sandal; <F>2:  भा. I. 8. ३२.</F> sacred to Hari; <F>3:  Ib. VII. १४. ३२.</F> the residence of Agastya; <F>4:  Ib. VI. 3. ३५; X. ७९. १७; XII. 8. १६; M. ६१. ३७.</F> visited by बलराम; <F>5:  भा. X. ७९. १६.</F> Manu performed तपस् at. <F>6:  M. 1. १२.</F>
--a प्रदेश of जम्बुद्वीप of the म्लेच्- छस्; here is महामलय hill called second Mandaram as also Agastya's आश्रम and लन्का. वा. ४८. १४, २०-30.

--the पाण्ड्य who married the daughter of the Vidarbha King राजसिम्ह and became the father of a daughter and seven sons; a राजऋषि; divided his kingdom among his sons and with his mind set on कृष्ण retired to कुलाचल followed by his queen; after a period of strenuous तपस् he died and the queen wailed. भा. IV. २८. २९-30, ३३-34, ३६-50.
--sacred to Goddess रम्भा; <F>1:  M. १३. २९.</F> rich with तमाल trees. <F>2:  Ib. ११४. १७, ३०; १६३. ७१.</F> [पगे२-645+ २५]
--sacred to कल्याणी. M. १३. ३६.
--an eastern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ५३.
--a son of Trasu, a ब्रह्मवादिन्. वा. ९९. १३२.
(I)--Candraketu, a son of लक्ष्मण styled thus or his country? वा. ८८. १८८.
(II)--the Lord of राजगृह, vanquished by कृष्ण. Br. III. ७३. १००.
--a tribe and an eastern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ५५; M. १६३. ६७.
--wrestling matches in ancient मथुरा in which all the people from the peasant to the king took part; described. भा. X. ३६. २४; ४२. ३२-38; ४४. 2-5.
--a son of Dyutiman after whom came the kingdom of Mallagam. Vi. II. 4. ४८.
--killed by कृष्ण. वा. ९८. १०१.
--Ink bottles. Br. IV. ३७. ८९.
--watered by R. चक्षु. Br. II. १८. ४६.
--lentils unfit for श्राद्ध. Vi. I. 6. २१; III. १६. 7.
--a Pravara sage. M. १९९. १७.
(I)--a son of भरताग्नि. वा. २९. 8.
(II)--one of the twenty अमिताभ gods. Br. IV. 1. १७; वा. १००. १६.

(III)--(Maharloka) the fourth of the seven worlds; <F>1:  Br. II. १९. १५५; M. ६०. 2; ६१. 1; १८४. २३; वा. १०१. १७.</F> Manus went to it after तपस् at Meru; Manus retire to this place when the periods of their duties are over; Gods like Ajitas, याम gan2as and आयुष्मन्तस् besides शुक्र, चाक्- षुष and others live in Maharloka; <F>2:  Br. II. २१. २२; ३५. १७९, १९७; IV. 1. २५, ३३, १२२. वा. १०१. ४१, ५२, २०८; १०९. ४८.</F> the space between Dhruva and Jana; the residents of this loka possess mental powers to create any desired thing; even gods sacrifice to each other; <F>3:  Br. IV. 2. 2, २१, ४०, ४२-3; वा. १०१. ४४.</F> created from व्याहृति. <F>4:  Br. IV. 2. 2, २१; वा. १०१. २३.</F>

(I)--a तत्व or principle; <F>1:  भा. I. 3. 1; II. 1. ३५; M. 3. १७.</F> identified with ब्रह्मा; <F>2:  भा. III. 6. २६; XI. १४. १४; १६. ३७-8; २४. २५-26; २८. १६.</F> a name of Rudra; <F>3:  Ib. III. १२. १२.</F> absorbs the अहन्कार <F>4:  Ib. XII. 4. १७.</F> covered by प्रधान. <F>5:  Br. II. २१. २७; ३२. ७६; IV. 3. 6 and २१.</F> Ten times greater than भूतादि; the order [पगे२-647+ ३६] of evolution of the universe according to सान्ख्य; <F>6:  M. १२३. ५२-61.</F> evolu- tion of प्रकृति in its विकारस्। <F>7:  Ib. 3. १७-26; वा. १००. २४३.</F>
(II)--(a Rudra), son of भूत and सरूपा. भा. VI. 6. १८.
(I)--a R. from ऋष्यवान् in भारतवर्ष. M. ११४. २३; वा. ४५. ९७.
(II)--a R. of the कुशद्वीप. M. १२२. ७४.
--of the family of सार्व- bhauma. वा. ९९. १८७.

--the neck of the पुरुष; <F>1:  भा. II. 1. २८.</F> due to fire of San- कर्षण sages leave this to Janaloka; <F>2:  Ib. VIII. २०. ३४.</F> the goal of yogins <F>3:  Ib. XI. २४. १४.</F> (see Mahat) above the Pole Star; the residence of Kalpa people; at a distance of two crores of yojanas is Janaloka; becomes devoid of all beings at the end of the kalpa but not extinguished; <F>4:  Vi. II. 7. १३.</F> burnt in the Pralaya. <F>5:  Ib. VI. 3. २८-9.</F>

--mind-born sons of ब्रह्मा, seven in num- ber, like भृगु, मरीचि, and Angiras; <F>1:  Br. II. ३२. ८९, ९७; M. १४५. ८५; २४७. १०.</F> ety. from root ऋषि गतौ--meaning knowledge; great ज्ञानिन्स्; <F>2:  Br. II. 6. ७१; वा. 7. ७४; ५९. ८२ and ८९.</F> their role in creation. <F>3:  Ib. 7. ७५-6.</F>
--a son of अमर्षण and father of विश्व- साह्वन्. भा. IX. १२. 7.
(I)--a काद्रवेय Na1ga. Br. III. 7. ३४; वा. ६९. ७१.
(II)--a sage. M. २००. 7.
--a Pravara (Angiras). M. १९६. १४.
--a son of भण्ड. Br. IV. २६. ४७.
(I)--a son of गुहावस, the अवतार् of the १७थ् dva1para. वा. २३. १७७.

(II)--a गणेश्वर; an attendant of शिव; with महाकालि engaged in the service of ललिता as one of her guardsmen; he is served by servants like कालमृत्यु; in charge of the first entrance to श्रीपुरम्; other शक्तिस् attach- ed to him are महासन्ध्य and महानिशा in the त्रिकोण and five शक्तिस् on the पञ्चकोण as also those on the षोडश पत्र and नाग पत्र; his seat is कालचक्र. Br. III. ४१. २६; M. १८३. ६४; १९२. 6; २६६. ४२; Br. III. ३२. २३; IV. ३०. ७५; ३२. 2, ४०; ३४. ८९.
(III)--sacred to महेश्वरी. M. १३. ४१.
--a place sacred to शिव. M. १८१. २६. [पगे२-649+ २५]
--attained by बाण. M. 6. १३.
--a garden in the country of अवन्ती. M. १७९. 5.
(I)--a वर्ण s4akti. Br. IV. ४४. ५७; ३२. 4.
(II)--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १४; Vi. II. १३. ४९.
(III)--came out from the wrath of शिव. वा. १०१. २९८.
--a sacred hill <F>1:  Br. III. १३. ५८.</F> fit for श्राद्ध. <F>2:  वा. ७७. ५७.</F>
--a Janapada of the भद्रा country. वा. ४३. २०.
--one of the sons of Danu. वा. ६८. 5.
--a city in the हिमालयस्. M. १५४. ४६९.
--he, who imparts ब्रह्मोपदेश. Br. IV. 8. 4. [पगे२-650+ २५]
--a kinnara गण; horse-faced. वा. ६९. ३२.
--a R. from the Vindhyas. Br. II. १६. ३३; M. ११४. २८; वा. ४५. १०३.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २४.
--a R. of भद्रा country. वा. ४३. २५.
--a कश्यप gotraka1ra. M. १९९. 5.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २६.
--a राक्षस in Sutalam. Br. II. २०. २१; वा. ५०. २०.
--a son of मणिवर. वा. ६९. १५९.

--a hell for several offences detailed; such as sexual intercourse with daughters and daughters-in-law, selling or censuring the Vedas, insulting or assaulting the आचार्यस्. Br. IV. 2. १४७, १५१, १५६-7; वा. १०१. १४६, १५५; Vi. II. 6. 2 and १२. [पगे२-651+ ४०]
--a Janapada of the केतुमाला country. वा. ४४. १४.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८९.

--the ankle of the creator; <F>1:  भा. II. 1. २६; 5. ४१.</F> an underworld, where a गण of नागस् by name क्रोधवश live; <F>2:  Ib. V. २४. 7, २९.</F> of gravel colour where are the cities of Virocana, the Asura chief and eight others. <F>3:  वा. ५०. १२, ३४-7.</F>
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १८. १४.
--a नाग in वैदूर्य s4a1la1 of ललिता. Br. IV. ३३. ३६.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८६.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३६.
--a son of Havya after whom the महा- druma वर्ष. Br. II. १४. १७. २१.

--an attribute of शिव; <F>1:  Br. II. २६. 1; M. ४७. ७५; Vi. I. 8. 6.</F> presiding deity of the moon; <F>2:  M. २४६. ६१; २६५. ४२.</F> in one of his previous births was कृष्ण; <F>3:  Ib. ४७. 1.</F> of the Kai- लास hill; <F>4:  Ib. ५४. 2.</F> drinks soma; <F>5:  Br. IV. २८. ८९.</F> worshipped by लवण Asura; <F>6:  Ib. III. 3. ७०; 7. ९१-2.</F> wor- shipped by the followers of भण्ड; <F>7:  Ib. III. १०. १७; २१. ७६; २५. १४; ६०. २८; ७२. 3, १०८, ११६. IV. १०. २९; ११. ३२; १२. १६.</F> claimed भृगु as his son; <F>8:  Ib. III. 1. ३८.</F> made the mind-born creatures of दक्ष not to grow; blessed सुरभी with eleven sons, Rudras; <F>9:  Ib. III. 2. 4.</F> शुक्र went to, [पगे२-652+ ३४] for learning नीती; <F>१०:  M. ४७. ७५.</F> roamed about in the महाकालवन with पार्वती; <F>११:  Ib. १७९. 3.</F> in his name गार्ग्य performed penance for a son. <F>१२:  Vi. V. २३. 3.</F> अवतार्स् of, were in Kali and not in the previous yugas; <F>१३:  वा. २६. 2.</F> his मानसीतनु, Candra; <F>१४:  Ib. २७. १६.</F> wife रोहिणी and son Budha. <F>१५:  Ib. २७. ४७, ५६.</F>
--from the anointment of महादेव to the birth of परीक्षित् 1050 years lapsed; परीक्षित् to महा- padma, ८३६? महापद्म to Andhras ८३६? वा. ९९. ४१५.
--a daughter of देवका and Vasudeva. वा. ९६. १३०.

--a mother Goddess; a name of ललिता, as ori- ginating from अग्निकुण्ड of Indra and gods who propitiated देवी to get rid of भण्ड. <F>1:  Br. IV. 6. 3; १२. ७४; १३. २९; १४. २६; १५. 3; १८. १५; ३६. 4; M. १७९. ३१.</F> The goddess enshrined at शाल- ग्राम. <F>2:  Ib. १३. ३३.</F>
--a यक्ष, and a son of पुण्यजनी. Br. III. 7. १२४.
(I)--(च्) a kingdom of शाकद्वीप adjoin- ing केशव(ra-वा। प्।) hill. Br. II. १४. २१; १९. ९३; वा. ४९. ८७.
(II)--a continent around the विभ्राज hill. M. १२२. २५. [पगे२-653+ २९]
(III)--a son of Havya. वा. ३३. १६.
(IV)--a Kinnara with human face. वा. ६९. ३५.
(V)--a son of Bhavya of शाकद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ६०.
--a वर्ष called after महाद्रुम. वा. ३३. २०.
--a son of Vibudha, and father of कीर्तिरात. Br. III. ६४. १२.
--a son of विस्तृउत (Vibudha-वि। प्।, Vis- ruta, Burnouf) and father of कृतिरात. भा. IX. १३. १६-17; Vi. IV. 5. २७.
(II)--one of the twenty अमिताभ gods. Br. IV. 1. १७; वा. १००. १६.
(III)--a son of शतरूपा. M. 4. २५.

(IV)--manas (mind); came out of प्रकृति (सूक्ष्म s4ari1ram); out of this mahas came other things; मति or wisdom is ब्रह्मा; buddhi is भू; ख्याति is ईश्वर; प्रज्ञ citti; स्मृति, samvid; ety of; its two वृत्तिस् sankalpa and अध्यवसाय; <F>1:  वा. 4. २४-30, ४६; १०२. २९-21.</F> attains विरार during Pralaya; <F>2:  Ib. १०२. 6 and १२.</F> a प्र- धान तत्व। <F>3:  Vi. I. 2. ३४-6, ५४.</F> [पगे२-654+ २६]
--a R. from the र्क्ष hill. Br. II. १६. २९.
(I)--a R. from the पारियात्र hill; in द्रविड. भा. V. 8. 1; १९. १८; XI. 5. ४०; Br. II. १६. २८.
(II)--a R. of the भद्रा continent. वा. ४३. २९.

--the son of Nandivardhana, the last of the ten शिशुनागस् (शिशुनाभस्) who ruled for a total period of ३६२ years; had a son, महापद्म by a शूद्र woman; ruled for ४३ years, १०५० years after परीक्षित्. The latter ruined the क्षत्रिय families; contemporaneous with them were the ऐक्ष्वाकस् 24, पाञ्चालस् 25, कालकस् 24, Haihayas २४, Kalin- gas ३२, शाकस् 25, Kuravas ३६, Maithilas २८, सूरसेनस् 23, वीतिहोत्रस् 20. भा. XII. 1. 7-9; Br. III. ७४. २२७; M. २७२. १२-18. वा. ९९. ३२०-25; Vi. IV. २४. १८-19.
--a boundary hill of शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २६.
(I)--an Asura residing in Tatvalam. Br. II. २०. १६.
(II)--a name of विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ६७.
--a तीर्थ sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ५३.
--a mother goddess. M. १७९. ३१. [पगे२-655+ २७]
(I)--a son of हिरण्याक्ष; <F>1:  भा. VII. 2. १८; M. 6. १४; वा. ६७. ६८; Vi. I. २१. 3.</F> followed वृत्र in his battle with Indra. <F>2:  भा. VI. १०. [२०]; Br. III. 5. ३१.</F>
(II)--in हरिकूट hill. वा. ३९. ५८.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २१.
--a Janapada of the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. १३.
--a शक्ती attached to महाकाल. Br. IV. ३२. 9.
(II)--(Mt.) a Parvata to the east of Aru- णोद; <F>1:  वा. ३६. १९.</F> contains fifteen cities of the Kinnaras. <F>2:  Ib. ३९. ३२; ४२. ६८.</F>
--a विद्याधर in the वेणुमन्त hill. वा. ३९. ३८.
(I)--a Janapada of the भद्रा country. वा. ४३. २१.
(II)--a Kinnara गण, horse-faced. वा. ६९. ३२.
--grand trunk roads as frequented by पिशाचस्. Br. III. 7. ४०५; ४९. १४.
(II)--an elephant. Br. III. 7. ३४६.

(III)--the son of महानन्दि by a शूद्र woman; he was the universal emperor and brought the earth under his umbrella; ruled for ८८ (२८ वि। प्।) years; from him all kings became unrighteous; he was a scourge of the क्षत्रियस्, and just like परशुराम rooted out their families; he had eight sons, सुमाल्य (सुमाती वि। प्।, Sukalpa म्। प्।) and others, all of whom ruled altogether for १०० (१२ म्। प्।) years; then a Brahmana कौटल्य म्। प्।) brought about their fall; <F>1:  भा. XII. 1. 9-१२; Br. III. ७४. १३९-42, २२८; M. २७२. १८-22; वा. ९९. ३२६-31; Vi. IV. २४. २०-3 and २६.</F> from परीक्षित् to महापद्म is १०५० years; from महापद्म to Puloma Andhra is ८३६ years. <F>2:  M. २७३. ३६-37.</F>
--one of the eight निधिस् of Kubera. वा. ४१. १०.
--in the शृन्गार s4a1la1 of श्रीपुरम्; detailed. Br. IV. ३५. ६४, ६९-80, १०५.
--a R. in मुक्ताफलशाला of श्रीपुरम्. Br. IV. ३३. ५२. [पगे२-657+ २७]

--the murder of a Brahmana, taking of liquor, theft and intercourse with preceptor's wife, for all of which death is the punishment; the Brahmana culprits were however, banished with different signs marked on their faces. M. २२७. १६१-165.
--a son of विश्रवस् and पुष्पोत्कटा. वा. ७०. ४९.
(I)--a son of पुष्पोत्कोटा. Br. III. 8. ५५.
(II)--an Asura in the सभा of हिरण्य- कशिपु. M. १६१. ८०.
--also बिन्दुपीठ. Br. IV. ३७. ४७.
--in the family of सार्व- bhauma. M. ४९. ७२.
--a consort of मार्ताण्ड bhairava. Br. IV. ३५. ४७.
--the great deluge with darkness per- vading all round. M. 2. २५.
--a नाग in the वैदूर्यशाला of श्रीपुरम्. Br. IV. ३३. ३६.
(I)--an attendant on Hari. भा. XI. २७. २८. [पगे२-658+ २४]
(II)--a son of Danu. M. 6. १६; वा. ६८. 7.
(III)--one of the ten sons of हृदीक. M. ४४. ८२.
(IV)--an Asura in the सभा of हिरण्य- कशिपु. M. १६१. ८०.
(V)--a Kinnara गण, horse-faced. वा. ६९. ३२.
(I)--a son of Danu. M. 6. १९.
(II)--a son of हिरण्याक्ष. Vi. I. २१. 3.
--a तीर्थ sacred to the पिट्र्स्. M. २२. ३३.
--a prayer to the अश्वत्थ tree as the king of trees, representing the Trinity. वा. १११. २६.
--a lake in the north (in इलावृत वि। प्।). वा. ३६. १६. Vi. II. 2. २६.
--a son of देवभाग. Br. III. ७१. १८८.
--a Goddess enshrined at महालय. M. १३. ४४. [पगे२-659+ २७]
--compiled by व्यास Kr2s2n2advaipa1yana; <F>1:  Vi. III. 4. 5.</F> the moon of, arose from व्यास. <F>2:  वा. 1. १८, ४५.</F>
--the name of Santanu in a previous life. भा. IX. २२. १२; वा. ९९. २३७.
--of Bali at the hands of भृगु; <F>1:  भा. VIII. १५. 4;</F> its विधि observed by अम्बरीष. <F>2:  Ib. IX. 4. ३१.</F>
--five in number. वा. १०१. ३४५.
