--the gift of a golden pitcher with gems set; the giver is absolved of the cycle of births and deaths and enjoys the world of विष्णु. M. २७४. १०; २८९. 1-१७.
--a place sacred to शिव. M. १८१. २९.
--the great snake which is the Lord's bed on the dark waters. वा. २४. ११.
(I)--a son of सात्वत; a righteous King and the originator of the Bhoja tribe: a महारथ who killed Satrajit, and gave Syamantaka to अक्रूर. भा. IX. २४. 7, ११; Br. III. ७१. 2, १७-71; Vi. IV. १३. 1, 7.
--a Janapada of the भद्रा country. वा. ४३. २२.
--a forest. वा. ४२. ४६.
--born of सवितृ. भा. VI. १८. 1.

--the worthy son of Janamejaya (महा- शाला वि। प्।, म्। प्।, and वा। प्।); according to ब्र्। प्। his father was पुरञ्जय; his sons were उशीनर and तितीक्षु: an emperor; lord of seven worlds, and a cakravarti. भा. IX. २३. 2; Br. III. ७४. १५-17; M. ४८. १४-15; वा. ९९. १६-8; Vi. IV. १८. 7-8.
--a Mt. in मलयद्वीपम्. वा. ४८. २२.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८६.

--Kamsa addressed the हस्तिप thus; <F>1:  भा. X. ३६. २४ [1-4] and २५;</F> there was more than one महामात्र in charge of the elephant, कुवलयापीड; all of them were killed by कृष्ण. <F>2:  Ib. X. ४३. १२ and १४; Br. III. ३८. २४.</F>
--a पारावत god. Br. II. ३६. १४.
--a दानव and a commander of भण्ड. Br. III. 6. 5; IV. २१. ८१. [पगे२-661+ २६]
--a विद्या taught to Pradyumna by माया- वती to vanquish शम्बर; it was an अस्त्र and one which could dispel all माया। भा. X. ५५. १६, २२.
--a यक्ष King in कैलास. वा. ४१. २५.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २१, २४.
--a यक्ष, son of देवजनी. Br. III. 7. १२८.
--served by a number of Rudras: the presiding deity of the चक्र। Br. IV. ४२. 2.
--a Mt. south of the मानस. वा. ३६. २४.
--a राक्षस having his city in the fifth talam (महातलम्, वा। प्।). Br. II. २०. ३७; वा. ५०. ३६.

--five in number: could be done by शूद्रस् without मन्त्रस्; fruitful in several ways; one failing to do them becomes indebted; the oblation to be offered in the North-east; first the offering of पिण्ड and then the [पगे२-662+ २९] feeding of guests; Dharmic guests not to be sent away and useless ones fed. Br. III. १२. १६-20; वा. ७६. १७, २६, ३०.
--a son of सम्कृति; married सत्कृती and had two sons, Gurudhi and Rantideva. M. ४९. ३६-7.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १३.
--a title earned by the five sons of कार्त- वीर्यार्जुन; <F>1:  Br. III. ६९. ४९; वा. ९२. ७०.</F> an epithet of a राक्षस in the army of भण्ड. <F>2:  Br. IV. २९. २१.</F>
--Veda personified as. वा. १०४. ८५.
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १८. १४; २५. १०८.
--a southern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ५७; वा. ४५. १२५.
--a मन्त्र: sacred to the पिट्र्स्: an epithet of शिव. M. २२. ३४; Br. IV. ३३. ८४; ३४. 1, ५०-1.
--a son of कृतिरात (कीर्तिराज वा। and वि। प्।) and father of स्वर्णरोमन्. भा. IX. १३. १७; Br. III. ६४. १३-14; वा. ८९. १३; Vi. IV. 5. २७.

--one of the २८ hells (seven hells below the earth वा। प्।); the place where a class of Rurus called क्रश्यादस् torment one, who had been selfish all along. भा. V. २६. 7, १२; वा. १०१. १७७; Vi. I. 6. ४१. [पगे२-663+ २८]

--कामाक्षी; <F>1:  Br. IV. १९. 8.</F> mother of ब्रह्मा, विष्णु and ईश; <F>2:  Ib. IV. ३६. ५८; ३९. २१, १११; ४०. 5; वा. १०९. २३.</F> is त्रीपुराम्बिका; <F>3:  Br. IV. ४१. 3; ४४. १११; ४३. ८५.</F> the goddess enshrined at Kara- वीर. <F>4:  M. १३. ४१.</F>
--sacred to ललितापीठम्. Br. IV. ४४. ९९.
(I)--sacred to महाभागा. M. १३. ४४.
(II)--a son of गुहावास of the १७थ् dva1para. वा. २३. १७७.
(I)--a place sacred to शिव. M. १८१. २९.
(II)--a name for the सिद्धक्षेत्रम्, the residence of महेश्वर; a visit to the place relieves one of his debts to ten generations above and below as well as his own self. वा. २३. १७५, १७९.
--a तीर्थ sacred to Kapila; sacred to the पिट्र्स्. M. १३. ३३; २२. ३४.
--an अक्षरादेवी: killed केकिवाहन, a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. १९. ५८; २५. ९६; ३७. ३४. [पगे२-664+ २६]
--an account of, in the वराह पुराण। M. ५३. ३९.
--a देवी; is ललिता. Br. IV. २९. ८९.
--a name of ललिता; <F>1:  Br. IV. १८. १६.</F> symbolical of देवी. <F>2:  Vi. I. 9. १२०.</F>
--one of the sons of Danu. वा. ६८. 4.
--the son of Savana and King of the महावीत Kingdom. Br. II. १४. १४-15; वा. ३३. १४.
--a Kingdom of पुष्करद्वीप; after महा- वीत, son of Savana; adjoining the मानस Mt. Br. II. १९. ११७, १२५; वा. ३३. १५; ४९. ११३, १२१.
--a son of Priyavrata, remained a bachelor all through life engaged in आत्मविद्या। भा. V. 1. २५-6.
(I)--a son of बृहद्रथ, a bold warrior. (Brhaduccha, वा। प्।); father of सुधृत्. भा. IX. १३. १५; वा. ६१. ४४; ८९. 9.
(II)--a son of Manyu (Bhuvamanyu वा। प्।, and म्। प्।) and father of दुरितक्षय. (दुरुक्षय Vi. P.). भा. IX. २१. 1, १९; M. ४९. ३६; वा. ९९. १५९; Vi. IV. १९. २१, २४.
(III)--a son of विराट्. Br. II. १४. ६९. [पगे२-665+ २५]
(IV)--a son of Raivata Manu. Br. II. ३६. ६३.
(V)--the son of बृहदुक्त, and father of दृतिमन् (सुधृति वि। प्।). Br. III. ६४. 9; Vi. IV. 5. २५.
(VI)--a son of Savana of पुष्करद्वीप; the kingdom bore his name. Vi. II. 4. ७३.
--Mohini got the name from ब्रह्मा; also सावित्री. वा. २५. ५०.
--the performance of this vow leads one to the world of गौरी. M. १०१. ५३.
(महीश)--a son of मित्रविन्दा. भा. X. ६१. १६.
--a son of माद्री. भा. X. ६१. १५.
--a chief नाग of पाताल; a thousand hood- ed snake; presiding over the month, सह। भा. V. २४. ३१; XII. ११. ४१; M. 6. ४०.
--an Asura friend of Kamsa. भा. X. 2. 1.
--a son of Janamejaya; a king equal to Indra in fame; father of महामनस्. M. ४८. १३; वा. ९९. १५-6; Vi. IV. १८. 6-7.
--a R. sacred to the पिट्र्स्. M. २२. ४२.
--sacred to the पिट्र्स्. M. २२. ३४.
--originated from the वीर्य dropped by शिव in his embrace of मोहिणी--विष्णु. Br. IV. १०. ७५; १४. 7; ३९. ५७.
--a mother goddess. Br. IV. 7. ७२.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८८.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८८.
--a son of Janamejaya and father of महा- manas. भा. IX. २३. 2.
--a god of the प्रसूत group. Br. II. ३६. ७१.
--a शक्ति attached to महाकाल. Br. IV. ३२. 9. [पगे२-667+ २२]
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३३.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २२.
--Mt. a hill. M. १६३. ८०.
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १७. १९.
--a Janapada of the भद्रा continent. वा. ४३. २०.
(I)--a son and commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८१; २६. ४७.
(II)--a son of रोहिणी and आनकदुन्दुभि. M. ४६. १२.
(III)--a follower of Bali. M. २४५. ३१.
--a son of शतजित्. भा. IX. २३. 21
--the other name for the कालसूत्र hell. वा. १०१. १७८.
(II)--one of the eight योगैश्वर्यस्; the third Yoga. वा. १३. 3, १३.
(I)--a son of Bhaga and सिद्धी. भा. VI. १८. 2.
(II)--a son of आयु Agni; also शावन्. वा. २९. ३७.
(I)--a son of अनुह्राद and सूर्म्या: fought with विभावसु in the देवासुर war. भा. VI. १८. १६; VIII. १०. ३२.
(II)--the son of आयु and father of Sahasa. Br. II. १२. ४०.
(III)--a Mt. of कुशद्वीप (शाल्मलिद्वीपम् ब्र्।, वा।, and वि। प्।); here lives a fire called महिष, and born of waters. Br. II. १९. ४०-41. M. १२२. ५९-60; वा. ४९. ३७. Vi. II. 4. २७.
(IV)--the name of a water-born fire in the महिष hill of the शाल्मलिद्वीप. Br. II. १९. ४१; वा. ४९. ३७.

(V)--an Asura residing in रसातलम्; <F>1:  Br. II. २०. ३९.</F> was pre- sent at तारक's coronation; a commander of तारक's force and had a chariot drawn by camels; <F>2:  M. १४७. २८; १४८. ४२, ५०.</F> threw सावित्रम् अस्त्रम् against Kubera; defeated both नृऋति and वरुण and releas- ed Kujambha from the noose; सोमास्त्रम् and वायव्यास्त्रम् throwing out snow and wind, were sent to disable the Asuras, [पगे२-669+ ३३] when कालनेमि created a glowing fire by माया and removed the snow and wind etc; <F>3:  Ib. १५०. ११३, १३५; १५१. १३.</F> found Mathana vanquished by जनार्दन and sent his शूल against जनार्दन and शक्ति against गरुड when जनार्दन repelled him and said: “You are to be killed by a woman; get away; <F>4:  Ib. १५२. १७-24.</F> killed by दुर्गा. <F>5:  Br. IV. २९. ७५ and ८८.</F>
(VI)--a son of Maya. Br. III. 6. २९; वा. ६८. २८.
(VII)--the kingdom of, to be ruled over by Guha. Br. III. ७४. १९८.
(VIII)--born of सुरभी; Buffalo as the riding animal of Yama; as also of वाराही; <F>1:  M. 6. ४४; २६१. १३, ३०.</F> its flesh for श्राद्ध. <F>2:  Ib. १७. ३३.</F>
(IX)--an Asura of श्रीतलम्. वा. ५०. ३८.
(I)--a Vindhyan tribe: पुष्पमित्र was a king; <F>1:  Br. III. ७४. १८७.</F> born of Hamsa कालि; <F>2:  Ib. III. 3. ७५.</F> the kingdom of. <F>3:  वा. ९९. ३८६.</F>
(II)--a Janapada of the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. १२.
--a tribe of the south; <F>1:  M. ११४. ४७.</F> a kingdom of. <F>2:  Br. II. १६. ५७.</F>
--a R. of the केतुमाला country. वा. ४४. २२. [पगे२-670+ ३०]
(I)--the son of सोहञ्जि and father of Bhadra- senaka. भा. IX. २३. २२.
(II)--a son of Samjaya and father of the powerful Bhadrasena. Br. III. ६९. 5; वा. ९४. 5.
(III)--a son of Samhata. M. ४३. १०.
--the capital of कार्तवीर्यार्जुन. वा. ९४. २६.

(II)--माधवी, (वसुन्धरा); <F>1:  Vi. I. 4. 7, २५-28.</F> rescued by the Lord in वाराह disguise from पाताल; earth addressed the Lord in words of praise of his greatness; <F>2:  Ib. I. 4. १२-24.</F> addressed by Sananda and other sages; the earth was rescued with mountains; and was divided into seven islands and created the four; भू and other worlds; <F>3:  Ib. I. 4. २७-44.</F> see भूमी. <F>4:  Ib. V. 1. ५७.</F>
(III)--with विकेशी: a स्थान of Rudra; <F>1:  Vi. I. 8. 7.</F> his son was लोहितान्ग. <F>2:  Ib. I. 8. ११.</F>
--one of six kinds of fortresses. M. २१७. 6.
--an epithet of विष्णु. Vi. V. 5. २१. [पगे२-671+ ३६]
--a son of Dyumatsena, ruled for ३३ years. M. २७१. २८.

(II)--a Mt. a Kulaparvata of the भारत- वर्ष; <F>1:  भा. V. १९. १६; VII. १४. ३२; Br. II. १६. १८; M. ११४. १७, ३१; १२४. २१; वा. ४५. ८९; Vi. II. 3. 3.</F> sacred to Indra and Hari and fit for श्राद्ध; <F>2:  Br. III. १३. १७.</F> परशु- राम's penance here for १२ years, twice; <F>3:  Ib. III. ४४. ३६; ४६. २९; भा. X. ७९. १२; IX. १६. २६.</F> अश्वमेध at; <F>4:  Br. III. ४७. ३९, ४५; ५६. २३; ५७. 1; ५८. 3; IV. २१. 2; ३१. १७; ४४. ९९.</F> during the war with भण्ड, the देवी enclosed M. all round by a wall of fire; <F>5:  Ib. IV. २६. १७-32.</F> rivers taking their origin from. <F>6:  वा. ४५. १०६.</F>
--the people of a Janapada. वा. ९९. ३८६; Br. III. ७४. १९८.
--a sacred place for श्राद्ध; resorted to by Indra; noted for a बिल्वत्रेए, the making of offerings under which gives good eye-sight. वा. ७७. १७-18.
--hill regions of Mahendra under the Guhas. Vi. IV. २४. ६५.
--a तीर्थ sacred to the पिट्र्स्. M. २२. ४४.
--the place where Vaivasvata Manu performed austerities after retirement from rulership of the world. M. ११. ४२. [पगे२-672+ ४४]

(I)--(शिव): cursed the seven sages to be born in every epoch; <F>1:  Br. II. २७. ४७; III. 1. 9.</F> got वृष (bull) from सुरभी for his standard; <F>2:  Ib. III. 3. ७८-79.</F> lived long in his father-in-law's house after marriage; Meru insulted him as poor and useless when उमा insisted on her husband to go to his house; he went to Benares after which it became Avimukta; <F>3:  Ib. III. ३१. ३५. ६७. ३२, ६०.</F> also ब्रह्मा; <F>4:  Ib. IV. 1. २०३; 2. २२१, २५७; 4. ३५, ७३; 7. ४९; १४. १८.</F> Stambha; कापालि on earth for having removed one face of ब्रह्मा; to get rid of this brahmicide शिव's service to कामाक्षी at काञ्ची; blessed for his समाधि; bathed in पञ्- casaras and found himself at काशि, from there to काञ्ची; Jyo- तिर्मयिभिक्ष given; the कपाल dropped out and he was relieved; <F>5:  Ib. IV. ४०. ५२-59.</F> blessed Kubera to be the lord of the यक्षस् for his penance at the confluence of the नर्मदा and the कावेरी. <F>6:  M. १८१. 3-5; १८५. १२; १८९. १०.</F> Praise of, by काव्य. <F>7:  वा. ९७, १६२-202.</F>

(II)--as cosmos; hence अचिन्त्यात्म but the source of all beings; Brahmanas from face, क्षत्रियस्, from breast, वैश्यस् from the thighs and शूद्रस् from the feet; <F>1:  वा. 9. १२२.</F> created the world, men, devas, asuras, constellation, night, day, Vedas, etc.; <F>2:  Br. I. 5. ९५.</F> the smallest atom among the प्रकृतिस्, never failing, absolute; formless, and of form; the darkness becomes illumination by the contact of तेजस्; <F>3:  वा. १०१. २२६.</F> the six angas of; all wise, all satiating, ever arousing, all free, eternally powerful, and of undiminished strength; <F>4:  Ib. १२. ३१-3.</F> a महायोगि; <F>5:  Ib. २१. ३६.</F> लोकेश, worshipped in different ways. <F>6:  Ib. ४९. १७१.</F>

--the Goddess enshrined at महाकाल; <F>1:  M. १३. ४१.</F> a name of ललिता; <F>2:  Br. IV. १०. 7; १४. 3; २८. ८९; २९. १०२; ४०. 2.</F> गा and विरूपा dropped out of the face of [पगे२-673+ २८] महेश्वर; also रुद्राणी and महादेवी; was Mati, स्मृति, and Buddhi; asked by महादेव to bring the world under control by Yoga. <F>3:  वा. २३. 5.</F>
--a son of Praheti, the राक्षस. Br. III. 7. ९१.
--a Goddess enshrined at कमलाक्ष. M. १३. ३४.
--a son of Auttama Manu. Br. II. ३६. ३९; वा. ६२. ३४.
--a दानव. Br. III. 6. १०.
--the सभा of the Lord of the नक्षत्रस्, the seats and altars of pure beryl. वा. ३४. ९०.
(I)--a son of पुष्पोत्कटा and विश्रवस्; <F>1:  Br. III. 8. ५५; वा. ७०. ४९.</F> a दानव. <F>2:  Ib. ६८. १०.</F>

(II)--a leader of शिव Gan2a ordered by शिव to fetch परशुराम to help the Devas in their war against the Asuras; <F>1:  Br. III. २४. ५०, ५७; २५. ४६.</F> especially to fight शूर. <F>2:  Ib. III. ४६. ११.</F>
--a mother goddess. M. १७९. ३१.
--a राक्षस residing in Sutalam. Br. II. २०. २३; वा. ५०. २२.
(I)--a तुषित god. Br. II. ३६. ११.
(II)--a son of भद्रा and Vasudeva. वा. ९६. १७१; Br. III. ७१. १७३.
(I)--जरासन्ध who was vanquished by कृष्ण, see Magadha (s.v.). भा. III. 3. १०; X. 2. 2; ८३. २३.

(II)--born of पृथु's sacrifice with सूत; panegyrised पृथु and got मागध country as gift; <F>1:  भा. IV. १५. २०; X. 5. 5; ५०. ३७; ५३. ४३; ७०. २०; ७१. २९; ८४. ४६; Br. II. ३६. ११३, १५९-160, १७२; वा. ६२. ९५, १३७; Vi. I. १३. ५२. ६४.</F> at कृष्ण's जातकर्म; <F>2:  Br. III. २८. 1 and 4; २७. १३; ४९. २१; ५५. 9 and १४; IV. २६. ६२</F> in the royal household. <F>3:  M. २१२. १४; वा. ६२. १४७-148.</F>
(III)--(Paulastya)--a sage of the १४थ् epoch of Bhautya Manu. भा. VIII. १३. ३४; Br. IV. 1. ११२; वा. १००. ११६; Vi. III. 2. ४४.
(IV)--a Gandharva. वा. ६९. २६.
(V)--for श्रुतश्रवस्, son of सोमाधि. वा. ९९. २२८. [पगे२-675+ ३०]

(I)--the people of the Magadha country (eastern country म्। प्।); a Kingdom of मध्यदेश; <F>1:  भा. X. 2. 2; Br. II. १६. ४२; M. ११४. ४५; १२१. ५०; १६३. ६६.</F> क्षत्रिय caste of शाकद्वीप. <F>2:  Vi. ११. 4. ६९.</F>
(II)--the royal line from बृअहद्रथ to श्रुतश्रवस्. M. ५०. २७-34.
--a kind of measure. Vi. VI. 3. 8.

(I)--considered as the first of months; <F>1:  Br. II. २४. १४१.</F> gift of ब्रह्मवैवर्त पुराण in this month leads one to Brahma- loka; <F>2:  M. ५३. ३६.</F> Mahesvara to be worshipped in this month. <F>3:  Ib. ५६. 2; ६०. ३६; वा. ५०. १२२; ५३. ११३.</F>
(II)--(पञ्चदशि): a युगादि for श्राद्ध; (saptami) a मन्वन्तरादि for श्राद्ध. M. १७. 4, 7.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २२.
--(also Mangali) a pupil of पौष्यञ्जि, and who learnt a hundred साम Samhitas. भा. XII. 6. ७९.
--the sacred cord or तालि worn by a married woman. Br. IV. ३९. ८७.
(II)--the sacred forest in the Vindhyas fit for श्राद्ध. Br. III. १३. ३३; वा. ७७. ३३.
--कश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 2.
--a यक्ष, devoted to ललिता. Br. IV. ३३. ७८.
--a Goddess enshrined at माण्डव्य. M. १३. ४२.
(I)--a तीर्थ sacred to माण्डवी. M. १३. ४२.
(II)--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. <F>1:  M. १९५. २१.</F> The sage who cursed Yama to be born as Vidura. <F>2:  भा. III. 5. २०; Br. II. २७. २५.</F>
--a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५१.
--a श्रुतऋषि; a pupil of Indrapramati in charge of a part of the ऋग् Veda. Br. II. ३३. 3; ३४. २८.
--the sage-poet who was instructed in the ऋग् Samhita1 by Indrapramati; his pupil was Devamitra. भा. XII. 6. ५६; Vi. III. 4. १९. [पगे२-677+ ३२]
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २१.
--a ऋत्विक् at the यज्ञ of ब्रह्मा. वा. १०६. ३५.
(I)--a son of खश and a राक्षस. Br. III. 7. १३४; वा. ६९. १६५; १११. ५३.
(II)--a son of Matanga, and a sage; his wife सिद्धिमती gave birth to लघुश्यामा or मातन्गी. Br. IV. ३१. ८९, ९१-106.
--कश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. १०.
--a mind-born mother; is लघुश्यामा. Br. IV. १९. ८०; ३१. १०४; M. १७९. २७.

--Mother Goddesses present in वरुण's sacri- fice; nine in number; लक्ष्मी, सरस्वती, गौरी, चण्डिका, त्रिपुराम्बिका, भैरवा, काली, महाशास्त्रि; use of liquor in the worship of the deities; <F>1:  Br. III. 1. २८; IV. 7. ७२; १४. 6; २०. ४६; ४४. १११-12.</F> consorts of; <F>2:  Ib. II. २५. ६९.</F> मात्रस्: also कीर्ति (fame), लक्ष्मी (riches), धृती (courage), मेधा (wis- dom), पुष्टि (strength), श्रद्ध (faith), क्रिया (action), मति (Knowledge), बुद्धि (intelligence), लज्जा (mo- desty), वपु (body), शान्ति (peace), तुष्टि (contentment) and कान्ति (beauty) invoked in गृअहबलि. <F>3:  M. ९३. ५३.</F> A list of मातरस् created by Rudra to vanquish the Andhaka Asuras; the mother-goddess felt hungry and thirsty and asked शिव for food; the pangs of hunger were so keen that they ate of the worldly beings; शिव then thought of नृसिम्ह and praised Him; he created a number of mother-goddesses to overpower them; then all of them [पगे२-678+ ३४] were blessed to be divine beings and help people to tide over difficulties when they would remember and pray to them; seven mothers. <F>4:  Ib. १७९. 9-३२, ४१-89.</F>

--is वायु; heard the बृअह्माण्ड पुराण from the Creator and narrated it to उशनस्; <F>1: Br. IV. 2. ११२, ११४, २५९; 4. ५८.</F> related the story in sweet words as seen and in logical order. <F>2:  वा. 1. ४७; ५९. १११; १०१. 7 and ११२, ११४, ३२३; १०३. ५८.</F>
--resident Gods of Bhuvarloka. वा. १०१. २९.

--the charioteer of Indra; <F>1:  M. १४८. ८१.</F> attacked by Jambha in the देवासुर war; attacked by पाक; in chariot, surround- ed by all the Devas against तारक on the other side; wounded by three darts of तारक; his मुद्गर thrown on the chariot, went to pieces. मातलि did not die; <F>2:  भा. VIII. ११. १६-18, २२; M. १५३. १६१, १८१, १९३; १७४. १०.</F> acted as the charioteer of राम in his war with रावण. <F>3:  भा. IX. १०. २१.</F>
(I)--is ललिता; the goddess enshrined at Siddha- pura, and at कायारोहण. Br. IV. २९. ४४, १४२; M. १३. ४६, ४८.
(II)--the daughter of ऋषा; gave birth to Grahas, अनुज्येष्टकस्, निष्कस्, and शिशुमारस्; <F>1:  वा. ६९. २९१.</F> different fishes; (the word reads मीना by mistake.) <F>2:  Ib. ६९. २९३.</F>
--the portion of a man's body, which he derives from his mother; this part of Vena's body gave rise to the म्लेच्छस्। M. १०. 8. [पगे२-679+ २८]
--the आश्रम of बृहस्पति. वा. ३८. ४२-4.
--marrying in maternal uncle's family. ययाति cursed his son Yadu to bring forth refrac- tory sons by such relationship. M. ३३. 8.
--a Deva गण; <F>1:  वा. ७२. ५०.</F> fought with Utkala in the देवा- sura war, but were put to flight by कृष्ण. <F>2:  भा. II. १०. ३८; VI. 8. २५; VIII. १०. ३३; X. ६३. ११.</F>
--a मन्त्रन्यास in दीक्ष. Br. IV. ४३. ११.
--the wife of Aryama and mother of चर्षणिस्. भा. VI. 6. ४२.
--evil spirits (see मातृस्). भा. X. 6. २८.
--a तीर्थ sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ७६.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १२.
--the राक्षसस् who cause fear to children. वा. ६९. १९०. [पगे२-680+ २७]
--the shortest period of time. Vi. VI. 3. 6.
--a son of Vasu. Vi. IV. १९. ८१.
--the small fish being eaten by big fish; the rule of might. M. २२५. 9.

--originally told by गदाधर; <F>1:  M. 1. १०.</F> told by जनार्दन in the guise of a fish to Manu consisting of a description of Narasimha and an account of the seven kalpas and consisting of १४,000 verses; he who gives it along with a golden fish and a cow on the first day of the Caitra month gets the benefit of the gift of the whole world. <F>2:  Ib. ५३. ५०-2; वा. १०४. 3.</F>
--(Matsya अवतार्) of विष्णु, being the tenth अवतार् during the deluge in the epoch of चाक्षुष man- vantara for the protection of Vaivasvata Manu. भा. I. 3. १५.
--a tribe; ended their lives by killing their own men. भा. X. 1. २७; XI. ३०. १८.
--one of the seven sons of Vidyoparicara. a Vasu and Girika. वा. ९९. २२२. [पगे२-681+ २७]

--(माद्री) one of the two wives of पाण्डु, gave birth to two twins, Nakula and Sahadeva by the grace of अश्विन्स्. भा. IX. २२. २८; Br. III. ७१. १५५; M. ४६. १०; ५०. ४८; वा. ९६. १५४; ९९. २४३; वा. ९९. २४३; Vi. IV. १४. ३७-8; २०-40.
--a विश्वेदेव. Br. III. 3. ३१.
--the country of. Vi. II. 3. १८.
--a Tripravara. M. १९६. ३३.
(II)--one of the wives of दृष्टि; her sons were युधाजित्, मिधराम्स, Animitra and शिनी. Br. III. ७१. १८-19.
(III)--the second wife of वृष्णि; gave birth to five sons, युधाजित् (देवमिढुष), Anamitra, etc. M. ४५. 1-2; वा. ९६. १७-9.
(IV)--a queen of कृष्ण; mother of वृक and other sons. M. ४७. १४; वा. ९६. २३४; Vi. V. ३२. 4.
(V)--the mother of Suhotra by Sahadeva, the पाण्डव. M. ५०. ५५. [पगे२-682+ २५]
--a kingdom of मध्यदेश. Br. II. १६. ४०.
(II)--the month sacred to Aryaman; <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ३४.</F> (Tamil वैकाशि); with the month of Madhu forms a ऋतु। <F>2:  Br. II. १३. 9; वा. ५२. 5.</F>
(III)--a son of Auttama Manu. M. 9. १२.
(IV)--with वटेश्वर in प्रयागा; <F>1:  M. २२. 9;</F> forming a part of the figure, शिवनारायण; <F>2:  Ib. २४९. ४८; २६०. २२.</F> in the middle of the विश्- vacakra. <F>3:  Ib. २८५. १६.</F>
(V)--an Asura killed by शत्रुघ्न. वा. ८८. १८५; ११२. ४०.
--a tribe deriving its name from Madhu. भा. IX. २३. ३०.
--sacred to सुगन्धा. M. १३. ३७.
--a queen of Vasanta ऋतु। Br. IV. ३२. २३, ४६. [पगे२-683+ २३]
--an Apsarasa sent by Indra to destroy विष्णु's तपस्। M. ६१. २२.
(I)--a name of योगमाया. भा. X. 2. १२.
(II)--name of सुभद्रा. भा. X. ८४. 1.
(III)--a R. in the Kuru country. Br. II. १८. ७३.
(IV)--a वर्ण s4akti. Br. IV. ४४. ६१.
(V)--a Goddess enshrined at श्रीशैल. M. १३. ३१.
(VI)--a R. from the जया lake. वा. ४७. ७१.
(VII)--see मही. Vi. I. 4. २०.
--a स्तोत्र in praise of कृष्ण. M. २४८. ५८.
--learnt the वाजसेनि यजुस्। भा. XII. 6. ७४. [पगे२-684+ २३]
--a son of युधाजित्. वा. ९६. १०१.
--पृथु was this, to those who were pitiful. भा. IV. १६. १६.
(I)--a कला of the moon. Br. IV. ३५. ९२.
--four kinds of; सौर, सौम्य, नक्षत्र and सावन; a measurement. वा. ५०. १८८. Br. II. २१. १३७.
--a daughter of भद्राश्व and घृताची. वा. ७०. ६९.
(II)--the २०थ् kalpa. M. २९०. 8.
(I)--a Mt. of पुष्करद्वीप; the limit of पृथु's dominion; west of the city of वसवी. Br. II. १९. ११२-14, ११७; M. १२३. १६; वा. ४९. १०८; Vi. II. 8. 7-8.
(II)--a son of वपुष्मान् and the founder of the मानस kingdom. Br. II. १४. ३२, ३४; वा. ३३. २८, ३०; Vi. II. 4, २३, २९. [पगे२-685+ ४१]
(III)--a वम्शवर्तिन् god. Br. II. ३६. २९.
(IV)--a यक्ष; a son of देवजनी and मणि- vara. Br. III. 7. १३०.

(V)--one of the four lakes in Meru; surrounds all the sides of the Meru over which is established the capital of the लोकपालस्; at the foot of the वैद्यूत hill from which the R. Sarayu rises; <F>1:  M. ११३. ४६; १२१. १६; १६३. ८६; १८३. 2; १९४. 8; Br. II. १८. १५; २१. २९-33; वा. ४७. १४; ५०. ८७-90; १११. 4.</F> north of the Ganges; <F>2:  Br. I. 1. ७६; M. ७०. २०; १०७. 2; वा. ३६. १६; ४२. २७; ७७. ११०-11.</F> a तीर्थ sacred to Kumuda and the पितृस्; <F>3:  M. १३. २७; २२. २३.</F> fit for श्राद्ध; contains a shrine on its banks; <F>4:  Br. III. १३, ५८, ११५-6; IV. 2. २५-6.</F> in इलावृत. <F>5:  Vi. II. 2. २६.</F> Kardama went there with his wife; <F>6:  भा. I. 5. १०; III. २३. ४०.</F> a reference to two हम्सस् of the lake; one of them who took to household life was पुरञ्जन; hearing from the other हम्स he remem- bered his old place and became calm; <F>7:  Ib. V. २८. ५४ and ६३.</F> Indra spent 1,००० years in the lotus stalks of the lake; <F>8:  Ib. VI. १३. १४-5.</F> here was the third rebirth of कौशिक's seven sons as चक्रवाक birds and their final salvation after becoming Siddhas. <F>9:  M. २०. १७; २१. ३५.</F> ऊर्वशी sported with पुरूरवस् in. <F>१०:  Vi. IV. 6. ४८.</F>
(VI)--Father of रिष्यन्त, belonging to the commencement of the द्वापर in the ११थ् Manvantara. वा. ७०. ३०.
(I)--the पितृस् as sons of वसिष्ठ, with forms, live in ज्योति worlds; their mind-born daughter is Gau, wife of शुक्र. M. १५. १२-15. [पगे२-686+ २५]
(II)--the वैश्य caste of शाकद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ६९.
--the region of शाल्मलिद्वीप adjoining the महिष hill. Br. II. १९. ४५; वा. ४९. ४०.
--the world above ब्रह्माण्ड where live the Somapa पितृस्; <F>1:  M. १५. २५.</F> the country of पितृस्--सुकालस्. <F>2:  Br. III. १०. ९७; वा. ७३. ४७.</F>
--five characteristics of; Devas resident in Maharloka possessed of this power, perform sacrifices. वा. १०१. ४४-5.

--a hill of पुष्करद्वीप to the east of Meru; देवधानि, the city of Indra and other cities are there; like the wheel of an oil mill the wheel of सूर्य's chariot is said to rotate on the hill as its axis; resorted to by the Devas and Daityas. ^1 भा. V. २०. ३०; २१. 7 & १३; Vi. II. 4. ७४. ^2 Vi. II. 4. ८०.
--a मन्त्र for ग्रहहोम। M. २३९. 9.
--the seventh sarga with hitherward cur- rent (अर्वाक् srota). वा. 6. ६४. [पगे२-687+ ३८]
--a R. of the केतुमाला country. वा. ४४. २२.
--one of the Marut गणस्. वा. ६७. १२९.

--a son of युवनाश्व, was born of him by splitting open the right side of his stomach; to the crying child Indra gave his first finger to suckle and called him Trasadasyu (s.v.) as he was a terror to the Dasyus; celebrated as a great emperor by the पौराणिकस्, having lust for more territory; married (Bindu- मती-भा and वि। प्।) चैत्ररथी, daughter of शशबिन्दु, (Satabindu-वि। प्।); had three sons, Purukusta, अम्बरीष, and Mucukunda besides fifty daughters, all of whom were married to Saubhari; <F>1:  भा. IX. 6. ३०-38; 7. 1; X. ५१. १४; XII. 3. 9; वा. ९९. १३०; Vi. IV. 2. ६१-112; Br. III. ६३. ६८-72; M. १२. ३४; ४९. 8.</F> he built for them crystal palaces; gave them all comforts and himself lived constantly with each of them by his yogic powers; they gave birth to १५० sons and मान्धात visited them after a long time and found them happy; was blessed by the sage and returned home; a क्षत्रोपेतद्विज; <F>2:  Br. III. ६६. ८६.</F> an incarnation of विष्णु as human being with Uthathya, in the १५थ् Treta (with Uttankapurohita in the १५थ् Treta1yuga-म्। प्।); <F>3:  Ib. III. ७३. ९०; M. ४७. २४३; वा. ९८. ९०.</F> an Angirasa and मन्त्रकृत्; <F>4:  Br. II. ३२. १०८; M. १४५. १०२; वा. ५९. ९९.</F> wor- shipped Hari as यज्ञ, knew the yoga power of Hari and got over his माया; <F>5:  भा. II. 7. ४४.</F> a great conquering monarch; a popular king, a यज्व, of good character; <F>6:  वा. ८८. ६६-70.</F> became a Brahmana; <F>7:  Ib. ९१. ११५.</F> Tattya was his purohita. <F>8:  Ib. ९९. १३०.</F> [पगे२-688+ २९]
--the Purohita of Bharata. भा. IX. २०. २५.
--flesh offered to Goddess काली. Vi. V. 1. ८६.
taught to Pradyumna by माया- वती. Vi. V. २७. १४.
--a वानर ja1ti. Br. III. 7. ३१९.

(I)--created by the Lord with a view to creating the world; <F>1:  भा. I. 2. ३०; III. 5. २५.</F> Role of: source of bondage; <F>2:  भा. XI. ११. 1-3; वा. ९४. १५.</F> four characteristics of: its influence on ज्ञान: means to get rid of. <F>3:  भा. XI. 3. 1-३३.</F>
(II)--a daughter of Adharma. भा. IV. 8. 2.

(III)--is योगमाया; a mind-born mother; <F>1:  भा. X. 2. १२; M. १७९. २१.</F> from the heart of Narasimha; <F>2:  Ib. १७९. ६४.</F> a शक्ति. <F>3:  Br. II. २६. 9, २९; IV. 6. ५३; १२. २१ & ४९; ४४. ६२; वा. २४. ८६.</F>
(IV)--a daughter of Maya; <F>1:  Br. II. 9. ६४.</F> wife of Bhayam and mother of मृत्यु; <F>2:  वा. १०. ४०.</F> helpmate of वाराहविष्णु. <F>3:  Br. I. 5. १९.</F> [पगे२-689+ २७]
(V)--the essence milked by the Asuras from the cow-earth. M. १०. २१.
(VI)--one of the kingly उपायस्। M. २२२. 2.
(VII)--(वैष्णवी): Atimohini and त्रिगुणात्- maka. Vi. V. २१. 1; ३०. १४-9.
(VIII)--represents the lips of the Vedas, <F>1:  वा. १०४. ७५.</F> makes different varieties of and varied गुणस् with शीलस्। <F>2:  Ib. १०४. ४१.</F>
--reference to शिव as a divine Hunter. भा. III. 1. ३८.
--worshipped by a seeker of fortune. भा. II. 3. 3.
--also माया, one of the seven great cities; <F>1:  Br. IV. ४०. ९१.</F> sacred to कुमारी and to पितृस्. <F>2:  M. १३. ३४; २२. १०.</F>
--the atom of ईश्वर; शान्ख्यस् style प्रकृति for माया. वा. १०१. २१८.

--the form which विष्णु took to vanquish the Asuras under ह्राद who defeated the Gods; he ap- proached the Asuras as a naked mendicant, clean shaven and with a bunch of peacock feathers, performing austeri- [पगे२-690+ २९] ties in the नर्मदा and led them from the path of the Vedas by calling them Arhats; they left the trodden path and abandoned vedic practices and rites, and decried vedic sacrifices. Vi. III. १७. १४-45; १८. 1-३२.

--Rati in her former birth: when her hus- band was burnt by शिव, she was reborn as the superinten- dent of शम्बर's kitchen. Hearing from नारद that Pradyumna was काम and that he was thrown into sea by शम्बर and swallowed by a fish and was brought to her kitchen, she nursed him lovingly and when he came of age, she spoke the truth and taught him महामाया विद्या with which he killed शम्बर: She took him by air to कृष्ण and was rejoiced to become the daughter-in-law of कृष्ण and रुक्मिणी. भा. X. ५५. 6-३८; Vi. V. २७. 7-१६, २७-30.
--are the Daityas, दानवस् and काद्र- veyas; enjoy life to the utmost; only afraid of Hari's चक्र। भा. V. २४. 8. ११-15.
--a son of Maya and रम्भा. Br. III. 6. २९; वा. ६८. २८.
--belonging to the line of क्रोधवश. Br. III. 8. ७०.

--next to मुक्ताशाला of ललिता--Palmyra juice is used here: nearby in a grove lives the creator: Fourteen विद्यस्, उपविद्यस् ६४ कलस् all reside here: a little away is विष्णुलोक with a १००० pillars: beyond that is शिव- loka. Br. IV. ३४. ५४. [पगे२-691+ २६]
--a southern country. Br. II. १६. ५९.
--a daughter of a Bhoja king; wife of देवमीढ and mother of Vasudeva and others. भा. IX. २४. २७; Br. III. ७१. १४५.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १५.
(I)--a son of Sunda and ताडक; set up by रावण to take the form of a golden deer in order to secure सीता: killed by राम. भा. IX. १०. 5, १०; Br. III. 5. ३५-6; वा. ६२. ७२; Vi. IV. 4. ८९.
(II)--the author of a पुराण: married पुलोमा and कालका, daughters of वैश्वानर: These had १००० sons besides the fourteen who lived in हिरण्यपुर. Br. II. ३८. 5; III. 6. २६; 7. ४६४; ४७. ६०.

(III)--(मारीचकश्यप): a son of अन्तर्धान and grandson of पृथु; <F>1:  M. 4. ४५.</F> his wife Vasu abandoned him for Soma; <F>2:  Ib. २३. २५.</F> his sons are said to reside in the Somapatha worlds of the पितृस्. <F>3:  Ib. १४. 1.</F>
(I)--a देवगण. Br. III. 1. ५०.
(II)--कश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 9. [पगे२-692+ ३१]

--the world created with moveables and immoveables in the epoch of; he stood in waters and performed penance for ७००० years and got Surucirditi who in turn got अरिष्टनेमि; then कश्यप to whom दक्ष, gave his daughter in marriage. वा. ६५. १०९, ११८.

--a son of Danu; father of many sons number- ing ६०००, Paulomas and कालकेयस्, all residents of हिरण्य- pura and could not be killed even by the Devas, because of a special boon from ब्रह्मा; Arjuna slew them; <F>1:  Br. III. 6. 5; M. 6. १८, २३-35.</F> his wives, पुलोमा and कालका, the daughters of वैश्वानर. <F>2:  Vi. I. २१. 8-9.</F>
(I)--the wife of Parjanya. Br. II. ११. १९; वा. २८. १६.
(II)--an Apsarasa. Br. III. 7. 6; वा. ६९. 5.

(I)--a daughter of कण्डु and Pramloca (of Soma म्। प्।) (of plants and trees, शाखिन् ब्र्। प्।) brought up by trees and married to Pracetasas who were the ten sons of प्राचीनबर्हिस; mother of दक्ष: gave birth to trees, plants, and (R. चन्द्रवती (म्। प्।) In the previous birth, she was the queen of a king who died young. She became a widow with no son; prayed to the Lord who blessed her with ten righteous husbands. These were the Pracetasas and had a number of sons; she herself had a miraculous birth. भा. IV. ३०. १३ and ४७-9; Br. I. 1. १०७; II. १३. ७०; ३७. ३२-8; M. 4. ४९-50. Vi. I. १५. 8-9, ४६-50, ६१-71.
(II)--the wife of शूर and mother of Vasudeva and others. Vi. IV. १४. २६-7. [पगे२-693+ ३४]

(I)--the Wind God, <F>: a) Br. II. १०. ४३; वा. १०१. १९४; १०६. ५९.</F> appointed father of भीम; <F>1:  Br. III. ७१. १५४; M. ५०. ४९; वा. ९६. १५३.</F> with Agni appointed to destroy the Asuras; Soma escaped to the ocean; Indra ordered them to dry up the ocean and they refused to incure this sin; hence were cursed to be born on the earth; did so in one body as Agastya; <F>2:  M. ६१. 3-१९.</F> the lord of गन्धस् or scents. <F>3:  वा. ७०. ११.</F>
(II)--a Pravara of the भार्गवस्. M. १९५. ३१; १९६. १९.
--the वायु पुराण equal to the Vedas. वा. 4. १२.
--of Kings whose spies enter every- where as the wind enters everything unnoticed. M. २२६. १२.
--a तीर्थ on the नर्मदा; bath in it takes one to the वायुलोक in a heavenly chariot. M. १९१. ८६-8.
--is हनुमान्, of superior भक्ति। Br. III. ३४. ३९.
--is वायु; consorts are इडा, पिङ्गला and सुषुम्णा; <F>1:  Br. IV. ३३. ६९-70.</F> a पीथ sacred to ललिता. <F>2:  Ib. IV. ४४. ९६.</F>
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २०; १९६. ४५.

(I)--a Siddha not lost in deluge; <F>1:  भा. VI. १५. १२; M. 2. १३; १८६-3.</F> son of मृकण्ड; <F>2:  भा. IV. 1. ४५.</F> his firm and non-parallelled तपस् and vow of [पगे२-694+ ३९] celibacy; saw the पुरुष sleeping on a leaf of the वटवृक्स; his आश्रम near the हिमालयस् on a शिल-citra; Indra sent the God of Love, Apsaras and others to disturb him, but in vain; the महात्मा, seeing Hari in Nara-नारायण form praised him; pleased with him as one who would be ever meditating on his feet Hari showed him what a प्रलय was; पार्वती and शिव. saw him, and were praised; when शिव offered to grant him anything he wanted, he expressed his wish to be ever devoted to him and Hari; pleased with him शिव went away with पार्वती; this worthy son of the भृगु race having earned Yogic vision and absolutely devoted to Hari even now goes about the world; <F>3:  Ib. XII. Chh. 8, 9 and १०.</F> an authority on राम's story. <F>4:  Ib. VII. 1. ४४.</F>

(II)--a contemporary of दत्तात्रेय; Purohita, the fourth incarnation of दात्तात्रेय, born to help him; <F>1:  Br. II. ३३. ११; III. ७३. ८९; M. ४७. २४२; ५३. २६; वा. ९८. ८९; १०९. २४; ११२. ३४.</F> narrated the मार्कण्डेय पुराण; <F>2:  M. ४७. २४२; ५३. २६.</F> acted as ब्रह्मा in परशुराम's sacrifice. <F>3:  Br. III. ४७. ४६; IV. ३९. ५५.</F>
(III)--speaks of the greatness of the नर्मदा to युधिष्ठिर; <F>1:  M. १९०. 1; १९१. ८१; १९२. 6; १९३. ६६; १९४. ४८.</F> came to स्यमन्तपान्चक to see कृष्ण. <F>2:  भा. X. ८४. 4.</F>
(IV)--a son of मनस्विनी and मृकण्डु; <F>1:  वा. २८. 5; Vi. I. १०. 4.</F> wife धूम्रपत्नी and son वेदशिरस्; <F>2:  Br. II. ११. 7.</F> present at राम's अभिषेक. <F>3:  Vi. IV. 4. ९९.</F>
(V)--a disciple of Indra Pramati entrusted with a सम्हिता; his son and grandson were respectively सत्यश्रवस् and Satyahita who traditionally handed it down. वा. ६०. २७-28. [पगे२-695+ २६]
--the sages, descendants and sons of पीवरी and वेदशिरस्. वा. २८. 6.

--a महा Pura1n2a told by मार्कण्डेय; containing ९००० s4lokas; he who copies it and makes a gift of it in the month of कार्त्तिक attains the fruits of पुण्ड- रीक यज्ञ। भा. XII. 7. २४; १३. 5; वा. १०४. 4; Vi. III. 6. २१; M. ५३. २६-7.
--the wife of रक्ष (Rajas वा। प्।) her son was केतुमान्. Br. II. ११. ४२; वा. २८. ३७.
--an आर्षेयप्रवर. (Angiras). M. १९६. २२.

--highways and byways; दिशामार्ग, ग्राम- मार्ग, राजपथ, साखरथ्यस्, गृहरथ्यस्, uparathyas, घण्टापथ, ग्रहान्तरम्, वृत्तिमार्ग and प्राग्वम्श with their respective measurements. Avaskaram and परीवाहम् are other dispositions of open spaces. <F>1:  वा. 7. ११८-22.</F> 1. dik--२० dhanus in breadth. 2. ग्राम 20 dhanus in breadth. 3. सीम 10 dhanus in breadth. 4. राजपथ 10 dhanus in breadth. 5. शाखारत्यस् or streets 4 dhanus. 6. Rathyoparathyas 3 dhanus. 7. उपारथ्य rathas 2 dhanus. [पगे२-696+ २७] 8. जन्घापथ 4 feet 9. गृहान्तरम् (lanes) 3 feet. १०. धृतिमार्ग 6 feet and more. ११. अवस्कारपरीवार 1 ft. all round. <F>2:  Br. II. 7. ११२-16.</F>
--a Goddess enshrined at केदार. M. १३. ३०.
--month of, good for the gift of the अग्नि पुराण; <F>1:  M. ५३. २९.</F> best for military expedition. <F>2:  Ib. ५६. 2; ६०. ३५; २४०. 5.</F>
--a ब्रह्मवादिन्. Br. II. ३३. १९.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २०.
(I)--a वानर ja1ti; born of Hari and Pulaha. Br. III. 7. १७७. ३०५, ३१९; ५१. ११.
(II)--a son of जाम्बवान्. Br. III. 7. ३०३.
--a son of Sahadeva and father of श्रुतश्रवस्. भा. IX. २२. ४६.

(I)--the Sun God; ब्रह्मा placed the तेजस् of the अण्डम् in the गर्भ of अदिती and when everything became stunted, the God removed it from the गर्भ mak- [पगे२-697+ ३३] ing it into two pieces; finding the weakness of the गर्भ ब्रह्मा caused it to be placed in the lap of the Sun God; hence the name; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. २७५-288; M. 2. ३५.</F> another ety.:--when कश्यप found the universe divided into two, he was in distress and said you be मर्ताण्ड or विवस्वान्, son of कश्यप and दाक्षायनी; had seven sons; सावर्णि and शनैश्चर are the last; <F>2:  वा. ८४. २५.</F> R. यमुना, the daughter of; <F>3:  Br. III. १३. ७२.</F> नासत्य and Dasra, sons of; <F>4:  Ib. III. ५९. २५; IV. ३८. २३.</F> golden image of, for gift; <F>5:  M. 9. 3; २८०. 6.</F> मण्डलम् of. <F>6:  Br. I. 1. ११५.</F>
(II)--handing over the Yajus to यज्ञवल्क्य, Brahmarateya. वा. ६१. २१.
--the solar line. M. २९०. २४.
--here is located the world of मरीचिगर्भ where live the हविष्मन्त Pitr2s. M. १५. १६.
--Bhojas called as after the city, मृत्ति- कावर. Vi. IV. १३. 7.
--the mother of दक्ष in the चाक्षुष epoch. वा. ३०. ६१. ७४.
--a Pravara (Angiras). M. १९६. १८.
--a Janapada of the East. वा. ४५. १२३.
--(also मालवी) the queen of अश्वपति and mother of सावित्री, the पतिव्रत; <F>1:  M. २०८. १०.</F> her sons are called the मालवस् of pure क्षत्रिय stock. <F>2:  Ib. २१३. १६.</F>
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २६.
(I) (माल्व)--sacred to ललिता. Br. IV. ४४. ९५.
(II)--(च्) द्विजस् of; became व्रात्यस् after the days of पुरञ्जय. भा. XII. 1. ३८; Vi. II. 3. १७.
--a क्षत्रिय tribe of the Vindhyas; sons of अश्वपति and मालवी; <F>1:  M. ११४. ४४. ५२; १६३. ६७; २१३. १६; वा. ४५. १३२.</F> enlisted by जरासन्ध against the Yadus. <F>2:  भा. X. [५० (V) 2].</F>
--same as मालती. M. २१३. १६.
--Kubera's wedding present to कामेश्वर. Br. IV. १५. २२.
--the flower seller who offered कृष्ण and राम flowers liked by them and was blessed with wealth and long life to him, to his generations of his successors. Vi. V. १९. १७-28. [पगे२-699+ २७]

--the father of कैकसी and father-in-law of Visravas; a follower of वृत्र in his battle with Indra; a राक्षस in the fifth talam; slain by Hari in the देवासुर war. भा. VI. १०. २१; VIII. १०. ५७; Br. II. २०. ३७; III. 8. ४०. वा. ७०. ३४.
(I)--a शक्ति; a mind-born mother. Br. IV. ३६. ७६, ९६; M. १७९. 9.
(II)--the ancient name of the city of चम्पा; also known as चम्पावती. M. ४८. ९७; वा. ९९. १०५.

(I)--Mt. a mountain range to the east of Meru, south of नील, north of निषाध and west of इलाव्रत and a boundary limit of केतुमाला, a thousand yojanas in extent; the stream चक्षुस् descends from its summits; <F>1:  भा. V. १६. १०; १७. 7; M. ११३. ३५; वा. ३४. ३३-4; ४२. १९ and ४२; Vi. II. 2. २७, ३९.</F> at its top is अमरकण्टक in Kalinga. <F>2:  Br. II. १५. ३८; १७. १८; III. १३. 7 and १३.</F>
(II)--a son of राक्षस, Prahati; slain by Hari in the देवासुर war; his daughters were पुष्पोत्कटा and वाका; father-in-law of विश्रवस्. भा. VIII. १०. ५७; Br. III. 7. ९०; 8. ३९. वा. ७०. ३४.
(III)--(वर्षम्) a kingdom of भद्राश्व. Br. II. १४. ५१; वा. ३३. ४४; ४३. 5.
--a tribe; <F>1:  M. ११४. ५२.</F> a kind of grain. <F>2:  Ib. २१७. ३८.</F>

--weight in gold; fine for failure to feed Brah- manas when there is occasion for it and for mentioning one man to a prostitute and taking her to another; in silver for causing injury to animals and insects and for other offences. M. २२७. 7, ८९, १०८, १४६.
--a small coin; fine of, for removing the rope, pot, etc., from a well; <F>1:  M. २२७. ९८.</F> a weight. <F>2:  Vi. VI. 3. 8.</F>

--३० days and nights; two पक्षस्; two months equal to a ऋतु; six months constitute an अयण and two अयणस् make one year; the twelve names of months Tapa, Tapasya, etc. are mentioned. Br. II. 7. २०; १३. १४ and ११४; वा. 3. १४; ३०. १६ and १७८; ३१. २६; वा. ६५. ५८; Vi. I. 3. 9-१०; II. 8. ८१; VI. 3. १०.
--a Sutapa god. Br. IV. 1. १४.
--the feeding of मनुष्य Pitr2s or Lauki- kas. Br. II. २८. ६७, ७८. M. १४१. ६५. वा. ८३. 3-१०.
--the region under the Guhas. Vi. IV. २४. ६५.
--a royal dynasty. वा. ९९. ३७४. [पगे२-701+ ३३]
--the people of the दक्षिणापथ. वा. ४५. १२५.
--a degraded क्षत्रिय clan. Br. III. ६३. १४०.

--the capital of the Haihayas, on the रेवा (नर्मदा). Entered by परशुराम who put to sword all the क्षत्रियस् to avenge his father's death; visited by Bala- राम; <F>1:  भा. IX. १५. २२; १६. १७; X. ७९. २१.</F> originally a नाग capital with कर्कोटक sabha1; <F>2:  Br. III. ३८. 2; ४६. ११; ६९. २६.</F> the place where कार्तवीर्य defeated कर्कोटक's son; <F>3:  M. ४३. २९.</F> the place where रावण was imprisoned by कार्तवीर्यार्जुन; <F>4:  Ib. ४३. ३८.</F> found- ed by माहिष्मान् and capital of कार्तवीर्यार्जुन. <F>5:  Vi. IV. ११. 9, १९.</F>
--a son of Sahajit, founded the city of माहिष्- मती; father of भद्रश्रेणिय. Vi. IV. ११. 9-१०.
--a राक्षस of the Atalam. वा. ५०. १८.
(I)--see अमरावती. Br. II. २१. ३०.
(I)--the २९थ् Kalpa in which Tripuram was burnt. M. २९०. १०.
(II)--born of प्रधान and पुरुष; father of world creation; <F>1:  वा. १०३. ३६.</F> the universe as limbs of. <F>2:  Ib. १०३. ७१-3.</F> [पगे२-702+ २९]
--created by शिव to attack कृष्ण; unable to stand the वैष्णव jvara, it bowed and vanished. भा. X. ६३. २२-30.
--in the स्कान्द पुराण; <F>1:  M. ५३. ४२.</F> Nandi gave out to नारद the माहेश्वर dharmas and vratam. <F>2:  Ib. ९५. 3, 4.</F>
--sacred to स्वाहा. M. १३. ४२.
--the महायोगम् of शिव; the origin of Linga. Br. II. २६. ६५.

--(शिवचतुर्दशि): revealed by Nandi to नारद; to be begun on the १३थ् day of the bright half of मार्गशीर्ष in honour of शङ्कर; details of the wor- ship on the next day; a gold cow and calf to be offered as present to a सामग or other श्रोत्रिय; ladies who perform this with permission from husband go to the world of पिनाकिनि. M. ९५. 5-३८.
(I)--a शक्ति and a mother goddess; <F>1:  Br. IV. १९. 7; ३६. ५८; ४४. १११.</F> Images after the manner of माहेश्वर. <F>2:  M. १७९. 9; २६१. २५; २८६. १०.</F>

(II)--created out of दक्षिणाग्नि for the use of the काशि King's son to avenge his father's death at the hands of कृष्ण; unable to bear the सुदर्शन of कृष्ण she fled to काशी. Vi. V. ३४. ३९. [पगे२-703+ ३२]
--is मृतसम्जीवनीविद्या (S. V.) that came out of the face of महेश्वर. M. २४९. 6.

--a Yoga; the five धर्मस् originally given by Rudra; other धर्मस् promulgated by आदित्यस्, Vasus, साध्यस्, अश्विन्स्, Maruts, भृगुस्, Yama, शुक्र and other agents and पितृकालान्तकस्; the five धर्मस् are प्राणायाम, ध्यानम्, प्रत्याहार, धारण and स्मरण of the माहेश्वर Yoga. वा. १०. ७०-74; २३. १५३, २२४.
(I)--a Marut of the 5th गण. Br. III. 5. ९६.
(II)--a सुधर्माण god. Br. IV. 1. ६०.
--a son of Dharmadhvaja and father of खाण्डिक्य. भा. IX. १३. १९-20.
--a deva of the स्वायम्भुव epoch. Br. II. १३. ९५.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३९.
(I)--a ब्रह्मऋषि, and one of the seven sons of वसिष्ठ. भा. IV. 1. ४१.

(II)--a son of अदिती; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ३९.</F> an आदित्य; a name used for the sun; <F>2:  Ib. I. १३. ३०; M. 6. 4; Br. II. २३. 5, १०४; २४. ३३, ३९; III. 3. ६७; IV. २०. ४८; वा. ६६. ६६; Vi. I. १५. १३१.</F> Bhaga to see through the eye of; <F>3:  भा. IV. 7. 3.</F> acted as milkman of the Devas to milk the cow-earth when Indra was calf; the [पगे२-704+ ३४] milk was of vigorous strength and the vessel was of gold; <F>4:  M. १०. १७.</F> loved ऊर्वशी and finding her thinking of वरुण, cursed her to be born on the earth; performed austerities at बदरी, saw ऊर्वशी and let flow his रेतस्, which was collected by ऊर्वशी in a pot and from which came Agastya and वसिष्ठ; <F>5:  Ib. ६१. २७, ३१; १२६. 6; १७१. ५६; २०१. २३-9.</F> fought with Praheti in the देवासुर war; <F>6:  भा. VIII. १०. २८.</F> was offered sacri- fice by वसिष्ठ on behalf of श्राद्धदेव; <F>7:  Ib. IX. 1. १३.</F> worshipped by युधिष्ठिर and अक्रूर; <F>8:  Ib. X. ३९. ३२.</F> to be worshipped in house-build- ing; also in palace building; <F>9:  M. २५३. ४३; २६८. २२.</F> in the sun's chariot in the months of शुचि and ज्येष्ठ। <F>१०:  Vi. II. १०. 7.</F>
(III)--His wife was रेवती. Utsarga and others were her sons. भा. VI. १८. 6.
(IV)--the name of the sun in the month of शुक्र (ज्येष्ठ)। भा. XII. ११. ३५; वा. ५२. 6.
(V)--a son of Vasudeva and मदीरा. Br. III. ७१. १७१; वा. ९६. १६९.
(VI)--a Marut गण. M. १७१. ५२.
(VII)--of three kinds to a King; the hereditary- ally, the enemy of the enemies and the कृत्रिम (acquired) ally. M. २२०. १७-18.
(VIII)--a son of मणिभद्र. वा. ६९. १५६. [पगे२-705+ २४]
(IX)--a वासिष्ठ branch. वा. ७०. ९०.
--a तपस्वि and a son of the अवतार् of the २८थ् dva1para. वा. २३. २२३.
--a daughter of Maruta (Marutta- वा। प्।). Br. III. ६८. 5; वा. ९३. 5.
--a daughter of Devaka and one of the seven wives of Vasudeva. M. ४४. ७३.
--a तीर्थ in केदार; sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ११.
(I)--a son of नाग्न्जिति and कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. २५२; M. ४७. १९; वा. ९६. २४३.
(II)--a son of the 4th (ऋतु-Sa1varn2a-वा। प्।). सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ९५; वा. १००. ९९.
(I)--a son of the IV (ऋतु-Sa1varn2a-वा। प्।) सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ९४; वा. १००. ९९.
(II)--a son of मित्रविन्दा and कृष्ण. M. ४७. १९.
--a son of मित्रविन्दा and कृष्ण. M. ४७. १९. [पगे२-706+ २५]
(I)--a R. in कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १५.

(II)--daughter of कृष्ण's aunt in अवन्ती. Discomfiting Vinda and Anuvinda, कृष्ण married her; her sons; <F>1:  भा. X. ५८. ३१; ६१. १६; M. ४७. १४; वा. ९६, २३४; Vi. V. २८. 3.</F> welcomed by द्रौपदी to हास्तिनपुर, she explained how she was married to कृष्ण. <F>2:  भा. X. ७१. ४३; ८३. १५-6.</F>
--a son of ऋतु Sa1varn2a Manu. वा. १००. ९९.
--see सौदास--also कल्माषपाद. भा. IX. 9. १८; Br. III. ६३. १७६; वा. ८८. १७६.
--a son of the IV (ऋतु वा। प्।) सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ९४; Vi. १००. ९९.
--mother of Maitreya and (मैत्रेयी--भा। प्।). Her son was seen by Vidura on the banks of the Ganges. भा. III. 4. ३६.
(II)--a son of दिवोदास and a ब्रह्मिष्ठ; after him Maitreyas belonging to the side of भार्गवस्. Father of Cyavana. M. ५०. १३; वा. ९९. २०६; Vi. IV. १९. ६९-70.
(III)--a pupil of रोमहर्षण. Vi. III. 6. १७. [पगे२-707+ ३१]

(I)--the scrotum of the Supreme Being; <F>1:  भा. II. 1. ३२.</F> father of Agastya and वसिष्ठ by dropping semon in a jar at the sight of ऊर्वशी <F>2:  Ib. VI. १८. 5-6; IX. १३. 6.</F> cursed ऊर्वशी to be born a human being; <F>3:  Ib. IX. १४. १७.</F> in the course of a ritual in their honour done by Manu was born इला. <F>4:  Br. III. 8. ९९; ६०. 5 & 8.</F>
(II)--a वासिष्ठ Brahmava1din. M. १४५. ११०.
(III)--one of the १६ R2tviks for यज्ञ; issued from the back of नारायण. M. १६७. 8.

(IV)--the two Vedic deities in whose honour प्रजापति made a sacrifice out of which came इडा; <F>1:  वा. ८५. 6-7.</F> into their तेजस् the soul of वसिष्ठ entered, cursed by Nimi; they met ऊर्वशी and वसिष्ठ took another body from her. <F>2:  Vi. IV. 5. ११-12.</F>
--a यज्ञ performed by Manu for the birth of a son. Vi. IV. 1. 8.
(I)--(मित्रायु)--a son of दिवोदास and father of Cyavana. भा. IX. २२. 1.
(II)--a branch of the भार्गवस्. Br. III. 1. १००. [पगे२-708+ २४]
--a son of Ni (e) mi, born out of the churning of अरणि; see Janaka: founded the city of मिथिला. Br. III. ६४. 4; वा. ८९. 4-6; Vi. IV. 5. २३.

--founded by Janaka-Vaideha: capital of the Videhas whose king was Janaka: here शतधन्वन् lost his horse and ran on foot afraid of कृष्ण: बलराम visited it and lived there for some time. भा. IX. १३. १३; X. ५७. २०-26; Br. III. ६४. 6; ७१. ८०; वा. ९६. ७४; ९९. ३२४.
--शतधनु was killed by कृष्ण in. Vi. IV. १३. ९३.
--also Maithila--King of मिथिला. Br. III. ३९. 2, 8.
--Here कृष्ण vanquished Bhoja. Br. III. ७१. ७६.
--on the नर्मदा. Br. III. ७०. ३२.
--an Apsaras and wife of Vatsaka; in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु. भा. IX. २४. ४३; Br. III. 7. 6; M. १६१. ७५; वा. ६९. 5.
--a son of माद्री. Br. III. ७१. १९.
--a son of Indra. भा. VI. १८. 7. [पगे२-709+ २८]
--a name of शिव. भा. IV. 7. 6.
(I)--a son of दक्ष, and father of कूर्च (पूर्व ब्र्। प्।). भा. IX. 2. १९.
(II)--a name of शिव. भा. III. १४. ३४; Br. III. २४. २७.
--the Tamil month of Panguni: सूर्य in the month of. वा. १०५. ४६.
--a daughter of ऋषा; gave birth to fishes--मकर, पाठिन, and तिमिरोहित। Br. III. 7. ४१४-5; वा. ६९. २९१-2.

--a philosophical system issuing from ब्रह्मा's mouth; <F>1:  M. 3. 4; ५३. 6; Vi. III. 6. २७; V. 1. ३८.</F> read by the Asuras; <F>2:  Br. II. ३५. ८७; IV. १२. १७.</F> an अन्ग of the Vedas. <F>3:  वा. ६१. ७८.</F>
(I)--a तीर्थ sacred to सत्यवादिनी. M. १३. ५०.
(II)--a hill, west of the शितोद; <F>1:  वा. ३६. २८.</F> residence of the Pannagas. <F>2:  Ib. ३९. ६२; ४२. ५२.</F>
--a Goddess enshrined at मर्कोट. M. १३. ३३.
(II)--Mt. in शाल्मलिद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १०.
(I)--(Paulaha)--a sage of the epoch of Bhautya Manu. Br. IV. 1. ११३.
(II)--one released from सम्सार knows his own self and assumes the shape foreign to the everyday world. वा. १६. २१-2; १०२. ७६-7, १०५.
--a main stream of शाल्मलिद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. २८.
--of ललिता. Br. IV. ३४. ५३.
--a R. in श्रीनगर् in मुक्ताफलशाला. Br. IV. ३३. ५२.
(I)--an Uttama siddhi. Br. IV. 5. २३; ३६. ५१.
(II)--one of the two Gods forming a boat to cross the ocean of सम्सार; <F>1:  वा. १०८. ३७.</F> four-fold of which गया is best. <F>2:  Ib. १०५. १६.</F> [पगे२-711+ २५]
--a mother goddess. M. १७९. ३०.
--Mt. near ऋक्सवन्त. Br. III. ७०. ३२.
--the head of the शिव Gan2as. Br. III. ४१. २८.
--one of the three गणस्; <F>1:  वा. १००. १३.</F> २० branches of them mentioned. <F>2:  Ib. १००. १८-19.</F>
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १२.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २१.
--the gods of सावर्णि epoch. Vi. III. 2. १५.
--in the left foot of the शिला at गया. वा. १०८. ४०.

--the fifth entrance on the east of the city of Puramjana. Through this Puramjana went to the king- doms of आपण and बहूदन with his companions रसज्ञ and विपण; allegorically the mouth. भा. IV. २५. ४९; २९. ११. [पगे२-712+ २८]

(I)--a son of मान्धात of the इक्ष्वाकु line, and a yogin; knew the yoga power of Hari. <F>1:  भा. IX. 6. ३८; II. 7. ४४; M. १२. ३५; वा. ८८. ७२.</F> Devoted to Brahman and truth. After his encounter with the Asuras on behalf of Indra, he wanted rest and the celestials allowed him to sleep undisturbed, adding that whoever dis- turbed him, would be burnt to death. So he slept in a cave where कृष्ण led his Yavana foe (कालयवन) who disturbing Mucukunda's sleep was burnt to death. Soon कृष्ण appeared before him and informed him of his अवतार् and its purpose. Mucukunda's praise of कृष्ण and request of union with Him. कृष्ण replied that he had to undergo still one more birth as a धर्मिच् Brahmana and then reach Him. Taking leave of the Lord, he saw the advent of Kali and entered गन्धमादन. He worshipped Hari in the बदरी a1s4rama by तपस्। <F>2:  भा. X. ५१ (whole); ५२. 1-4; Br. III. ३६. २६; Vi. V. २३. १८-47; २४. 1-5.</F>
(II)--a Daitya in the पाताल or 7th tala. Br. II. २०. ४४; वा. ५०. ४२.
--a राक्षस in the fourth tala or Gabhastalam. Br. II. २०. ३३; वा. ५०. ३२.
--a disciple of Saindhava. वा. ६१. ५४.
--a sage. Br. II. ३५. ६१.
--the peak in the अरुण hill. Br. II. १८. २०. [पगे२-713+ २४]
--a pupil of Saindhava, rearranged the Atharva Veda again into three parts and included नक्षत्र कल्प। Vi. III. 6. १३.
--an Asura killed by the देवी. Br. IV. २९. ७५.
(II)--a Janapada of the East. वा. ४५. १२३.
(III)--Shavelings in the guise of Sanyasins in Kaliyuga. वा. ५८. ५९.
(IV)--a dynasty of kings; thirteen in number. Vi. IV. २४. ५३.
--one of Danu's sons. वा. ६८. 8.

--the place where महादेव perform- ed penance; protected by poisonous reptiles; fit for श्राद्ध; to the east of it is the तीर्थ of Kanakanandi; a mere plunge into the waters relieves one of his three debts; <F>1:  Br. III. १३. ११०; वा. ७७. १०२-7.</F> in गया. <F>2:  Ib. १०९. ४५ and ५२; १११. ४५ and ७४.</F> [पगे२-714+ २४]
--the शिला on the back of the गयाश्म, leading the पितृस् to Brahmaloka.
(I)--a heretic; not fit for श्राद्ध. Br. III. १४. ४०; १५. ४२, ६२.
(II)--a name of विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ७०.
(III)--one of the four sons of the ३३र्द् kalpa. वा. २३. ५९.
--the अवतार् of the Lord in the २५थ् dva1para. वा. २३. २०९.
--born of Dharma and तुष्टी. भा. IV. 1. ५१.
--one of the १४ Apsara-गणस्, born of वायु. Br. III. 7. १९.
--a R. of the प्लक्षद्वीप. वा. ४९. १७.

(I)--a son of भर्म्याश्व. From him sprang the Brahmana family Maudgalyas. Father of twins; Divo- दास and अहल्या. A pupil of शाकल्य; <F>1:  भा. IX. २१. ३१-34; XII. 6. ५७; Br. II. ३२. १०९; ३५. 2. वा. ६०. ६०, ६४; Vi. III. 4. २२.</F> a मन्त्रकृत्। <F>2:  वा. ६५. १०७.</F> [पगे२-715+ २४]
(II)--a son of भद्राश्व; <F>1:  M. ५०. 3.</F> a मन्त्रकृत्; <F>2:  Ib. १४५. १०३.</F> a त्रयार्षेय, not to marry with Angiras or Matsyadagdhas. <F>3:  Ib. १९६. ४१.</F>
(III)--a son of Bheda; after him Maudgalyas, the क्षत्र-Brahmanas. वा. ९९. १९६, १९८.
(V)--a son of हर्यश्व and father of हर्यश्व; after him came the Maudgalyas, the क्षत्रिय Brahmanas. Vi. IV. १९. ५९-61.
(I)--an आत्रेय clan. Br. III. 8. ८५; वा. ७०. ७८.
(II)--a branch of Angiras. वा. ६५. १०७.
--a ब्रह्मवादिनी. Br. II. ३३. १८.
--an eastern country. Br. II. १६. ५३.
--आवाहिनि, महामुद्रा, त्रिखण्ड, सम्क्षो- bhini मुद्रा, विदाविनी, आकर्षिणी, उन्मादिनी, महाम्कुश, Khecari, भीजमुद्रा, and योनिमुद्रा: detailed. Br. IV. ३६. ६२; ४२. 1-१९. [पगे२-716+ २६]
--a guardian deity of the Binducakra. Br. IV. ३६. ७८-81.
--also प्रकट s4aktis: ten in number occupy a place above the अष्टशक्तिस् in the 9th parvan of चक्रराजरथ. Br. IV. १९. १०.
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १७. ३४; ३१. ९१.
--an Ajitadeva. वा. ६७. ३४.

(I)--a daughter of दक्ष and one of the १३ wives of कश्यप; a mother goddess; mother of groups of munis and sages, Apsaras and Gandharvas; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. २६-7; Br. III. 3. ५६; M. 6. 2, ४५; १४६. १९; १७१. २९, ६०; वा. ६६. ५५.</F> given to Gandha शीला. <F>2:  Br. III. 7. ४६६.</F>
(II)--a son of द्युतिमान्, after whom came the मौनिदेशम् in क्रौन्चद्वीप. Br. II. १४. २३, २६; वा. ३३. २१, २३. Vi. II. 4. ४८.
(III)--a god of प्रसूत group. Br. II. ३६. ७१.
(IV)--a son of Vaidya. Br. III. ५९. 7. वा. ८४. 7.
(V)--a son of Pradyumna and father of ऊर्ज- vaha. Br. III. ६४. २०; वा. ८९. १९. [पगे२-717+ २९]
(VI)--one of the twenty अमिताभ gods. Br. IV. 1. १७; वा. १००. १७.
(VII)--a sage of the Raivata epoch; <F>1:  M. 9. 9.</F> a विश्वेदेव. <F>2:  Ib. २०३. १३; Br. III. 3. ३०.</F>
(VIII)--one of the wives of कश्यप; gave birth to Apsarasas. Vi. I. १५. १२५; २१. २५.

--those who delight in the आत्मन्, after many births, and renounce even the region of ब्रह्मा; realise the Supreme Spirit by shaking off the three dreamy stages-- भावाद्वैत, क्रियाद्वैत, and द्रव्याद्वैत। भा. III. २७. २७; VII. १५. ६२-5; X. 2. २५.
--the minister of Ripumjaya; killed his king, Vitahotra and enthroned his son Pradyota on the throne. वा. ९९. ३१०; Vi. IV. २४. 1-2.
--a kingdom in the क्रौञ्च- द्वीप. Br. II. १४. २६; १९. ७३; M. १२२. ८६; वा. ४९. ६७.

--an Asura of five heads; got up from sleep under waters on hearing the sound of पाञ्चजन्य (s.v): His head was cut off by कृष्ण. His seven sons rose with पीठ, their commander, and were put to death by गरुड in charge of the outskirts of the city of प्राग्ज्योतिष; father of ७००० sons. भा. X. ५९. 6-१९; ३७. १६; III. 3. ११; IV. २६. २४; Vi. V. २९. १७-18.
--an Asura in the disguise of विष्णु. Br. IV. २९. १२५. [पगे२-718+ ३१]
--a son of भृगु. वा. ६५. ८७.
--a country under Kanakas (Wilson's sug- gested identification with the pirate coast of the Konkan). Vi. IV. २४. ६७.

--an Asura friend (wrestler-वि। प्।) of Kamsa. Invited by Kamsa, he got ready for a wrestling match with कृष्ण and बलराम. Took his seat in the enclosure; chal- lenged by राम, fought according to rules, and courted death. (Balabhadra,-वि। प्।) भा. X. 2. 1; ३६. २१-24; ३७. १५; ४२. ३७; ४३. ४०; ४४. 1, १९, and २४-25; Br. IV. २९. १२३. Vi. V. १५. 7 and १६; २०. १८, ६५. ७८.
(I)--Diti not to sit on, in her pregnancy. M. 7. ३८.

(II)--a weapon of शेष; <F>1:  Vi. II. 5. १८; V. ३६, १३, १८; ३७. 9.</F> to exterminate all the यादवस् by the curse of sages; came out of साम्ब's womb which was powdered and thrown into the sea; a piece was devoured by a fish, and a hunter who got it, shot it against कृष्ण sitting, little knowing that he was the Lord; it was the cause of the Lord departing to heaven; other pieces became कुश grass which became in the hands of the यादवस् iron sticks with which they struck one another and died. <F>2:  Ib. V. ३७. ११-16; ४४-5; ३३. ३०.</F>
--is Baladeva. Vi. V. ३५. ३१.

--a measurement of time; thirty कलस् mak- ing a day and a night, a मुहूर्त; १५ for day and १५ for night on an equinoctial day; ४५ कलस् one मुहूर्त; १५ muhu1rtas [पगे२-719+ ३१] make a day exactly in विषुवत्; division of day into units of three मुहूर्तस्; <F>1:  भा. III. ११. 8; Br. II. १३. १६; २१. ९५, ११६-22; २४. ५६; २९. 6; IV. 1. ७६, २१३, २१६; ३२. १४; M. १२४. ८६-91; १४२. 4; २०३. १०; वा. ३०. १३; १००. २१५, २१८; Vi. I. 3. 9; II. 8. ५९-61; VI. 3. 9.</F> those of the afternoon are Raudra, सार्प, Maitra, पितृय, वासव, आप्य, वैश्वदेव and ब्राह्म; those of the day are प्राजापत्य, Indra, इन्द्राग्नि, निरृति, वा- रुण, Aryamana, and Bhaga; these are to be calculated ac- cording to the shadow cast by a gnomon; the मुहूर्तस् of the night are the Ajaikapad, Ahirbudhnya, पूषाश्वि, Yama, आग्नेय, प्राजापत्य, Saumya, आदित्य, बार्हस्पत्य, वैष्णव, सावित्र, त्वाष्ट्र, वायव्य and Samgraha; time reckoned by the movement of the moon. <F>2:  Br. III. 3. ३२, ३९-45; वा. ६६. ३३.</F> कृष्ण born in the Vijayamu- हूर्त; <F>3:  Br. III. ७१. २०६; ७२. ३०.</F> the eighth मुहूर्त said to be kutapa, auspicious for beginning any activity; the sun becomes मन्द or inactive then. <F>4:  M. २२. ८४-5.</F>
(I)--the periods of ३० kala1s. Br. II. 7. १९; वा. ५७. 6.
(II)--sons of मुहूर्ता and Dharma. M. 5. १८. Vi. I. १५. १०६.
--a daughter of दक्ष and one of Dharma's ten wives; begot मुहूर्तक gan2a. भा. VI. 6. 4 and 9; Br. III. 3. 3 and ३२; M. 5. १६, १८; २०३. १०; वा. ६६. ३३; Vi. I. १५. १०५-6.
--a son of ह्राद killed by सव्य्साचि (Arjuna) in कैरात. Br. III. 5. ३४, ३६; वा. ६७. ७२, ७३. [पगे२-720+ २५]
--a tribe of the मध्यदेश. M. ११४. ३६.
--clouds of the आग्नेय class which rain under the influence of wind, आवह। Br. II. २२. २४; वा. ५१. २८, ३२.
--a hell of urine, where fall false people and those who cry aloud (प्राक्रोशक). Br. IV. 2. १४८, १७०-71; वा. १०१. १६८.
--a son of कुश. भा. IX. १५. 4.
(I)--a sage of the epoch of the Tenth Manu. भा. VIII. १३. २२.
(II)--a son of वसिष्ठ and a प्रजापति of the स्वारोचिष epoch. M. 9. 9.
--the priests of a temple; learned and of noble families; they may be ३२ or १६ or 8 according to require- ments of different ages. M. २६५. 1-6, ४२; २६६. ५४.
--a daughter of दक्ष, and a wife of Dharma; mother of Nara and नारायण. भा. IX. 4. 6; II. 7. 6; IV. 1. ५० and ५२.
--formed by वासुदेव, सन्कर्षन, Pra- dyumna and Aniruddha. भा. XII. ११. २१. [पगे२-721+ २५]
--the wife of मार्कण्डेय. वा. २८. 6.
--a son of भृगु. M. १९५. १३.
--(also मूलम्) a नक्षत्र; sacred to the wor- ship of पिट्र्स्. भा. V. २३. 6; Br. II. २१. ७६; III. १८. १०; वा. ५०. १३०; ६६. ५१; ८२. १०.

--a son of अश्मक; when the क्षत्रियस् were rooted out of the earth, he was protected by naked women; hence he was known as नारिकवच. The originator of the new क्षत्रिय race after its ruin by परशुराम; father of दशरथ. भा. IX. 9. ४०-1; Br. III. ६३. १७८; Vi. IV. 4. ७३-5; वा. ८८. १७८-9.
--a दानव. Br. III. 6. 9.
--a disciple of लोकाक्षी. वा. ६१. ३७.
--a तीर्थ sacred to the पिट्र्स्. M. २२. ३३.
--an आर्षेय pravara (Angiras). M. १९६. 9.
--the root cause or माया is लक्ष्मी and the पुरुष is वासुदेव. Br. IV. 8. २८. [पगे२-722+ २३]
--the hereditary force. M. २४०. 3.
--four authors--काश्यप, सावर्णि, शाम्- शपायन, and याज्ञवल्क्य. Br. II. ३५. ६६-68.
--a pravara (Angiras). M. १९६. १६.
--a R. from the Mahendra hill. M. ११४. ३१.
(I)--a पारासर branch. वा. ७०. ८७.
(II)--medicinal plants; many of them named. M. २१८. २३-35.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८७.
--a name of विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ६९.
--breeding of too many rats forebodes famine. M. २३७. 9.
--a southern country. Br. II. १६. ५६.
--a tribe of the दक्षिणापथ. वा. ४५. १२५. [पगे२-723+ २७]

--a son of धात्रि (विधाता,-वि। प्।) and नियती; married मनस्विनी; father of the sage मार्कण्डेय; <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ४४-5; XII. 8. 2; Br. II. ११. 6; वा. २८. 5; ४१. ४४; Vi. I. १०. 4.</F> visited परशुराम in penance. <F>2:  Br. III. २३ 4.</F>
(I)--one of the ten horses of the moon's chariot; <F>1:  Br. II. २३. ५७; वा. ५२. ५३.</F> a riding vehicle of a शक्ति. <F>2:  Br. IV. २९. ४१.</F>
(II)--a daughter of Abhramu the elephant, the vehicle of Agni; mother of 8 sons. Br. III. 7. ३३०-32. वा. ६९. २१४, २१६.
(III)--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २०.
(IV)--to be worshipped before house and palace building. M. २५३. २५; २६८. १४.
(V) (मृगराज)--a palace with चन्द्रशाला and six भूमिकस्; the तोरण is of १२ हस्तस्। M. २६९. ४०, ५०.
(VI)--the son of मृगा and उशीनर: also the capital of the Yaudheyas. वा. ९९. २०-1.
--a R. rising from Uttara मानस. (श्वेत hill-वा। प्।). M. १२१. ६९; वा. ४७. ६८. [पगे२-724+ २४]
--a R. from the सरयू. Br. II. १८. ७१.
--a son of Aniruddha. M. ४७. २३.
--a Pravara sage. M. १९९. १७.
--a daughter of क्रोधवशा (Krodha- वा। प्।) and wife of Pulaha; gave birth to camels, pigs, bul- locks, etc. Br. III. 7. १७२; वा. ६९. २०५, २०७.
--कश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 3.
--a son of जाम्बवन्. Br. III. 7. ३०२.
--one of the १४ Apsarasa गणस्, born of earth. Br. III. 7. १९.
--in the दक्षिण ma1rga; ज्येष्ठ, विशाख and Maitram are the नक्षत्रस्। M. १२४. ५९.
--a Rudra; an attribute of शिव. M. १७१ 39; Br. III. ७२. १७३; Vi. I. १५. १२३. [पगे२-725+ २४]
--one of the wives of उशीनर. वा. ९९. १९.
--a Goddess enshrined at यमुना. M. १३. ४०.
--a daughter of क्रोधवश and wife of Pulaha; deer and other animals like hare were born of her. Br. III. 7. १७२-73; वा. ६९. २०५, २०६.
--of the Andhra line; the son of King स्कन्दस्वाति, ruled for three years. M. २७३. 8.
--a constellation; मृगशीर्ष. M. ५४. १८; ५५. १३.
--a R. rising from Uttara मानस. M. १२१. ६९.
--a name of शिव. भा. IV. 2. 8.
--a medicinal plant capable of restoring the dead to life; found in द्रोण hill of शाल्मलिद्वीप. Br. II. १९. ३९.

--the science of restoring the dead back to life; learnt from महेश्वर; discovered by शुक्र (ब्र्। प्।) and learnt by भृगु; practised by शुक्र for the [पगे२-726+ २६] benefit of the Asuras in the देवासुर war; <F>1:  Br. III. ३०. ५३; M. २४९. 4-6.</F> जामदग्नि restored to life with that. <F>2:  Br. III. ३०. ५८.</F>
--death-pollution for १० days for Brah- manas, १२ for क्षत्रियस्, १५ for वैश्यस् and one month for शुद्रस्. वा. ७९. २२-3.
--untouchables, pollution of. Br. III. १४. ८८.
--a R. धेनुका of the साकद्वीप. वा. ४९. ९४.
--a god of the Rohita गण. Br. IV. 1. ८५.
--the city of the Bhojas. Vi. IV. १३. 7.
(I)--Her origin: a daughter of Kali: अम्श of अधर्म: her attributes. भा. I. १६. 8; II. १०. २८; IV. 8. 4; १३. ३९; VII. १२. २७.

(II)--the sixth व्यास in the sixth द्वापर: अवतार् of the Lord लोकाक्षि; father of सुनीथा, given to Anga; <F>1:  Br. II. ३५. ११८; ३६. १२७; वा. २३. १३३; Vi. III. 3. १२.</F> Heard the पुराण from the Sun god and narrated it to Indra. <F>2:  Br. IV. 4. ६०; Vi. I. १३. ११; वा. १०३. ६०.</F> [पगे२-727+ २५]
(III)--a कला of Rudra. Br. IV. ३५. ९६.
(IV)--one of the eleven Rudras born of सुरभी and कश्यप. वा. ६६. ७०; Br. III. 3. ७१.
(V)--the originator of Bhairava clan of Apsa- rasas. Va. ६९. ५७; Br. III. 7. २४.

(VI)--the son of माया and Bhaya: father of व्याधि, जरा, शोक, Krodha, and असूय; all giving pain and having the characteristics of adharma and having no wives or sons; belong to the तामस sarga. Br. II. 9. ६५-66; वा. १०. ४०-2.

(VII)--the Lord of Death; born out of the eyes of ब्रह्मा; <F>1:  M. 3. ११; २१३. 4.</F> had an ugly daughter सुनीथा married to Anga- प्रजापति; <F>2:  Ib. १०. 3.</F> an assistant to Yama. <F>3:  Ib. २१३. १८.</F>
(VIII)--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १५.
--is शिव. Br. IV. ३६. १९.
--a musical instrument. वा. ४५. ४०. [पगे२-728+ २३]
--a son of Upamadgu. Vi. IV. १४. 9.
--a ऋत्विक् at ब्रह्मा's यज्ञ। वा. १०६. ३४.
(I)--a son of श्वफल्क. भा. IX. २४. १६.
(II)--a son of गान्दिनी. वा. ९६. ११०.
--a son of श्वफल्क. भा. IX. २४. १६.
--the wife of Adharma, mother of Dambha and माया, who were adopted by निरृति. भा. IV. 8. 2.
--the capital of the पुष्पमित्रस्; <F>1:  Br. III. ७४. १८८.</F> rule of seven kings from. <F>2:  वा. ९९. ३७५.</F>
--a Vindhyan tribe. Br. II. १६. ६३; M. ११४. ५२.
(II)--the shrine of शार्ङ्गधर in Megha- kara. M. २२. ४१.
(I)--a राक्षस in Sutalam. Br. II. २०. २२; वा. ५०. २२.
(II)--formed out of the shell of ब्रह्मा's egg, cosmology of clouds and rain; waters taken in by the rays of the sun and let out as showers; served by the wind. M. 2. ३३; १२५. १६-35.
(III)--a commander of तारक's force; his chariot drawn by elephants. M. १४८. ४२, ५१.
(I)--a group of gods to be worshipped in श्राद्ध. Br. III. १०. ११०.
(II)--Nine नैषध Kings who ruled from Kosala (कोमला वा। प्।). Br. III. ७४. १८९; वा. ९९. ३७६.
(III)--ety. three origins: from fire, ब्रह्मजा and पक्षज clouds. वा. ५१. २७-28.
--a तीर्थ sacred to the पिट्र्स्; here विष्णु lived in मेखला. M. २२. ४०. [पगे२-730+ २४]
--a son of नहुष. M. २४. ५०.
--took part in the देवासुर war between Bali and Indra. भा. VIII. १०. २१.
(I)--a younger brother of चन्द्रहास, killed by लक्ष्मण. Br. IV. २९. ११३, ११६.
(II)--a name of विग्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ७०.
(III)--a गण, got a higher status at मेघनाद ks2etra. M. १९०. 4.
--a तीर्थ on the नर्मदा. M. १९०. 4.
--the name of one of the four horses of कृष्ण's chariot. भा. X. ५३. 5; ८९. ४९.
--a son of मणिभद्र. वा. ६९. १५६.
--a son of घृतपृष्ठ. भा. V. २०. २१.
--Mt. a boundary hill in प्लक्षद्वीप. भा. V. २०. 4. [पगे२-731+ २४]
--a queen of वर्ष r2tu. Br. IV. ३२. २९.
--a son of Danu. M. 6. १८.
--a यक्ष: a son of पुण्यजनी and मणि- bhadra. Br. III. 7. १२४.
--an Asura in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु. M. १६१. ८१.
--the twenty-second kalpa where विष्णु became मेघी. वा. २१. ५०.
--a Mt. north of the महाभद्र. वा. ३६. ३२.
(I)--a son of Cibilaka (Vikala ब्र्। प्।, Pikala, वि। प्।), and father of अटमान (पटुमन् वि। प्।). भा. XII. 1. २४; Vi. IV. २४. ४५.
(II)--an Andhra King a son of आपीतक; ruled for १८ years. M. २७३. 5.
--a R. of the भद्रा country. वा. ४३. २६. [पगे२-732+ २८]
--the guise of विष्णु in the २२न्द् Kalpa, bore कृत्तिवास for a thousand divine years; on account of the heavy weight breathed hard when काल came from the mouth. वा. २१. ५०.
--compared to Dhruva among the luminaries. भा. IV. १२. ३९.
--a son of पुरीमन्, and father of शिवस्- kandha. भा. XII. 1. २७.
--a son of पौरुषेय, a राक्सस. Br. III. 7. ९४.
--the earth; deluge foretold by the fish; <F>1:  M. 1. २४-9.</F> of seven द्वीपस्; <F>2:  वा. 1. ८९.</F> surrounded by seas; filled with मेदस् of Madhu and कैटभ. <F>3:  Ib. ६३. 1 and 2.</F>
(I)--one of the ten sons of स्वायम्भुव Manu. Br. II. १३. १०४; M. 9. 5; वा. ३१. १७; ३३. 9.
(II)--one of the ten sons of Kardama. Br. II. १४. 9.
(III)--a god of the Sumedhasa group. Br. II. ३६. ५८.
(IV)--a son of Priyavrata: given to Yoga as he had no inclination for kingship. Vi. II. 1. 7 and 9. [पगे२-733+ २७]
(V)--a pupil of देवदर्श. Vi. III. 6. १०.
--a god of the Sumedhasa group. Br. II. ३६. ६०.
--a god of the Sumedhasa group. Br. II. ३६. ६०.
(I)--a daughter of दक्ष and a wife of Dharma: Mother of स्मृति [श्रुत वा। and वि। प्।]. भा. IV. 1. ५०-52; Br. II. 9. ४९, ५९; वा. १०. २५. ३४; ५५. ४३; Vi. I. 7. २३. २९.
(II)--a कला of ब्रह्मा. Br. II. २६. ४५; IV. ३५. ९४.
(III)--a शक्ति; <F>1:  Br. IV. ४४. ७२.</F> the goddess enshrined at काश्मीरमण्डल. <F>2:  M. १३. ४७; २४६. ६२.</F>
(I)--a sage who came to see परिक्षित् prac- tising प्रायोपवेश। भा. I. १९. १०.
(II)--a son of Priyavrata, and appointed lord of the शाकद्वीप (प्लक्षद्वीप-वि। प्।). He divided it among his seven sons and retired to a hermitage. भा. V. 1. २५ and ३३; २०. २५; Vi. II. 1. 7, १२.
(III)--a son of कण्व. From him came प्रस्कण्व and other Brahmanas; ancestor of the काण्वायन द्विजस्। भा. IX. २०. 7; M. ४९. ४७; Vi. IV. १९. 6-7, ३१-2. [पगे२-734+ २९]

(IV)--one of the ten sons of स्वायम्भुव Manu; attained heaven by तपस्; <F>1:  Br. II. १३. १०४; M. 9. 5; १४३. ३८; वा. ३१. १७.</F> consecrated for प्लक्ष- द्वीप; <F>2:  Ib. ३३. 9.</F> a राजऋषि. <F>3:  Ib. ५७. १२२.</F>

(V)--one of the ten sons of Kardama and king of प्लक्षद्वीप. <F>1:  Br. II. १४. 9, ११, ३५-7, ४०-41.</F> His sons, शान्तभय, शिशिर, Sukho- daya, Nanda, शिव, क्षेमक and Dhruva. These ruled the वर्षस् of the same names in the epoch of स्वायम्भुव Manu; attained heaven by तपस्। ^2 Ib. II. ३०. ३९.
(VI)--a god of Sumedhasa group. Br. II. ३६. ५८.
(VII)--(Paulastya) a sage of the Rohita group. Br. IV. 1. ६२.
(VIII)--a son of कण्ठ; from him काण्ठा- yana Brahmanas; married the daughter of Anupama and had a number of sons. वा. ९९. १३१.
(IX)--a son of अजमीढ and केशिनी. वा. ९९. १६९.
(X)--a sage of the IX epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. २३.
(I)--a son of Sunaya, and father of नृपम्- jaya (Ripumjaya-वि। प्।). भा. IX. २२. ४२; वा. ९९. २७६; Vi. IV. २१. १२-13. [पगे२-735+ २८]
(II)--a son of सुतपा. M. ५०. ८४.
--the snow-making rays of the sun. वा. ५३. २१.
--the father of मेनका. Br. III. 7. १७; वा. ६९. ५२.
(I)--the mother of शकुन्तला; she abandoned the child in the forest and went away. भा. IX. २०. १३.

(II)--the Apsaras presiding over the month of शुक्र and शुचि; coupled with सहजन्या; <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ३५; Br. II. २३. 6; III. 7. १४; IV. ३३. १८; वा. ६९. ४९; Vi. II. १०. 7.</F> with the sun in the summer. <F>2:  वा. ५२. 7.</F>
(III)--one, who was asked to dance along with ऊर्वशी and रम्भा; <F>1:  M. २४. २८.</F> in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु. <F>2:  Ib. १२६. 7; १६१. ७५.</F>
(IV)--the Apsaras wife of विन्ध्याश्व (बध्यश्व वा। प्।): gave birth to twins, दिवोदास and अहल्या. M. ५०. 7; वा. ९९. २००.
(V)--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २०.

(I)--a पितृकन्या; mind-born daughter of अग्निष्- वात्त Pitr2s; queen of हिमवान्; had two sons मैनाक and क्रौञ्च (son of मैनाक-वा। प्।) and three daughters, उमा, [पगे२-736+ ३५] (एकपाटला-वा। प्।) एकपर्णा and अपर्णा who married res- pectively Rudra, Asita and जैगीषव्य (Devara-वा। प्।); the second took to the nyagrodha and पाटल trees; the first performed तपस् for thousands of years, whom the mother said “So-मा”, and hence उमा; on the eve of her giving birth to उमा, the goddess of Night entered her eyes; persuaded by the seven sages मेना and हिमवान् gave उमा in marriage to शिव; and their son was the warrior God; <F>1:  भा. IV. 7. ५८; Br. III. 9. 2; १०. 6-२०; M. १३. 7; १५४. ८६-93, ४१३; वा. ३०. २८-9, ३१-2; ७१. 3; ९२. ३१; Vi. I. 8. १४; Br. II. १३. ३० ff. ७७.</F> spoke to उमा of her poverty-stricken husband, महेश्वर living in their house after marriage. <F>2:  Ib. III. ६७. ३४.</F>
(II)--a daughter of स्वधा and पितृस्. A Brah- मवादिनी. Vi. I. १०. १९.

(I)--(Mt.) the hill that stands in the middle of इलावृत, equal in height to the length of जम्बूद्वीप, sur- rounded on four sides by Mandara, Merumandara, सुपार्श्व and Kumuda. In these four ranges are four great trees-- Mango, Jambu, कडम्ब and Banyan; four pools of milk, honey, sugarcane and fresh water; four celestial gardens-- Nandana, Caitraratha, वैभ्राजक, and Sarvatobhadra. Encircling the base of Meru, stand two hills. On the east are जठर and देवकूट; on the west Pavana and पारि- यात्र; on the south कैलास and करवीर, and on the north त्रिशृन्ग and Makara. In the central part of its summit is ब्रह्मा's square city of gold. Surrounding the outskirts of that city, are the eight cities of the eight guardians. <F>1:  भा. V. १६ (whole); २०. 2; VIII. 5. १८; Br. I. 1. ६९; 4. २८.</F> There is a forest at its foot where Rudra sports with पार्वती; भागवन् identified with; <F>2:  भा. IX. 1. २५.</F> one of the six वर्षपर्वतस् of जम्बूद्वीप occupying the middle portion. The dwelling- [पगे२-737+ ३६] place of Deva गणस्; on its four sides are four countries, भा- द्राश्व, Bharata, केतुमाला, and Uttarakuru. <F>4:  Ib. II. १५. १६, ४२-51; १७. १९, ३४, ८४; २१, १४, २८-34; III. 7. १९४, २५८; ६१. २४; ६३. ३६; ६६. 7; IV. 1. २४; 9. १७; Vi. II. 1. २०-22; 2. ३९-41; 8. १९; V. 1. १२, ६६; ३८. ७२.</F> The relation of Dhruva to. <F>5:  Br. II. २३. १०८.</F> Here the sages met to consider a certain question and it was announced that he, who did not arrive in time would have to submit himself to the प्रायस्चित्त of brahmicide. वैशम्पायन unable to go, undertook to do so. <F>6:  Ib. II. २५. ९६; ३५, १५-18.</F> Acted as milkman of hills in milking the cow-earth. <F>7:  M. 2. ३३; १०. २६; Br. II. ३६. २२३.</F> सावर्णि Manu's penance at. <F>8:  M. ११. ३८.</F> North of it were ruling १५ sons of विकुक्षि and south of it ११४ sons of इक्ष्वाकु of whom ककुश्थ was the eldest. <F>9:  Ib. १२. २६-8; ११३. १२ff; १२४. १३; १६३. ८३; १८२. २१; १८३. 1; १८४. १८; २४९. १२.</F> ^3 Ib. XI. १६. २१; Br. II. १३. ३२ and ३६.
(II)--a temple with १०० beautiful towers, four gates, sixteen storeys and many fine turrets; the तोरण of Meru is ५० हस्तस्। M. २६९. २८, ३१, ४७.
(III)--a दानव with मनुष्य धर्म। वा. ६८. १५.
(IV)--the mother of Niyati and आयति. Vi. I. १०. 3.
--entered by योगात्मा अवतार् of शिव along with ब्रह्मा and विष्णु to become नकुली. वा. २३. २२१.
--ten-fold, corns, salt, jaggery, gold, seasa- mum, cotton, ghee, precious stones, silver and sugar. M. ८३. 2-6. [पगे२-738+ ३१]

--wife of नाभि of हिमाह्व kingdom and a daughter of Meru; son ऋषभ; <F>1:  भा. I. 3. १३; V. 2. २३; वा. ३३. ५०; Vi. II. 1. २७.</F> took part in the यज्ञ con- ducted by her husband desirous of a son and the Lord was pleased to be born to her. Followed her husband to विशाला (बदरी) and attained मुक्ति there with him. <F>2:  भा. V. 3. 1 and १९ and २०; 4. 5; Br. II. १४. ५९.</F>
--(Mt.) on one side of Meru. भा. V. १६. ११.
--(कर्णिकामूलम्); ७०,000 yojanas in height and ४८,000 yojanas in circumference. वा. ३५. 1-2.

(I)--the first of the four sons of ब्रह्मा, grandson of दक्ष and son of his daughter क्रिया; engaged in austerities on the slopes of the Meru; went to Maharloka and was reborn in the epoch of चाक्षुष; the other three names are परा, मरीचिगर्भ, and सुधर्माण; all of them sons of Rohita प्रजापति; <F>1:  Br. IV. 1. २३, ५३.</F> the eleventh Manu of the future. <F>2:  M. 9. ३६.</F>
(II)--Manu, son of दक्ष; had three sons, मरीचिगर्भस्, सुशर्मन् and सम्भूत--in the Vaivasvata epoch. वा. १००. ५९.
(I)--sheep born of सुग्रीवी; <F>1:  M. 6. ३३.</F> Indra took the guise of, to disturb the तपस् of वज्रान्ग's wife. <F>2:  Ib. १४६. ६४.</F>
(II)--सूर्य in, the month of Citra. वा. १०५. ४६. [पगे२-739+ २९]
--कश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 2.
--कश्यप-gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 7.
--equinox, end of. वा. ५०. १९५.
--one of the 8 मुहूर्तस् of the afternoon. Br. III. 3. ३९; वा. ६६. ४०.
(also मित्रवर)--a पञ्चार्षेय. M. १९६. ५०.
--a son of दिवोदास; his descendents became भार्गव Brahmanas. M. ५०. १३.
--a resident of ब्रह्मक्षेत्र; a वासिष्ठ and a sage; <F>1:  वा. ५९. १०६; Br. II. ३२. ११६.</F> Purohita of इक्ष्वाकु. <F>2:  M. १२. 4-5.</F>
--a daughter of दक्ष and a wife of Dharma; mother of प्रसाद. भा. IV. 1. ४९-50.

(I)--(also कौषारव); a son of मित्रा; a siddha; himself a पुराण of information; <F>1:  भा. III. 4. ३६; VI. १५. [१४]; III. 7. ४२.</F> went with कृष्ण to मिथिला; met कृष्ण on the eve of his departure to Heaven, and was ordered to be the preceptor to Vidura; the latter met him on the Ganges and after describing the creation of the world, answered Vidura's questions. <F>2:  Ib. X. ८६. १८; III. 4. 9 and २६; 5. 1 and २२-36; 8. 1ff.</F> Taught him आत्म [पगे२-७४०+ २८] विद्या and told him that the goal was Hari; <F>3:  Ib. I. १३. 1; १९. १०; II. १०. ४९.</F> was invited for the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर. <F>4:  Ib. X. ७४. 7; XII. १२. 8.</F>
(II)--a name of मैत्रायणवर. M. ५०. १३.
(III)--a pupil of पराशर; enquired of him as to the origin of the world. Vi. I. 1. १०.
--आर्षेयप्रवरस्; (भार्गवस्). M. १९५. ४०.
(I)--is Janaka; went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse. भा. X. ८२. २६.
(II)--the son of the Mithila king, शतधन्व. वा. ९६. ७८.
--a dynasty of २८ kings, contemporaneous with the १० S4ais4una1gas. Br. III. ६४. २४; ७४. १३७; M. २७२. १६.
--(गण) springs from मीना, a daughter of ऋषा. Br. III. 7. ४१५.

--(Mt.) in भारतवर्ष; son of हिमवान् and मेना; father of क्रौञ्च hill; sacred for श्राद्ध and to पितृस्; of Indra; famous for medicinal herbs. भा. V. १९. १६; Br. II. १३. ३४-5; १६. २१; III. 9. 3; १०. 7; १३. ७०; M. १३. 7; १२१. ७२; १६२. ३०; वा. ३०. ३२; ४५. ९०; ४७. ७५; ७१. 4; ७२. 5; ७७. ६८. [पगे२-741+ ३०]
--the continent about the आम्बिकेय hill. M. १२२. २५.
--a brother of वानर Dvivida (s.v.); father- in-law of Angada. भा. X. ६७. 2; Br. III. 7. २२० and २३८.
--a kind of wine; <F>1:  M. १२०. २६.</F> flows in some rivers of the Uttarakuru region. <F>2:  वा. ४५. २७.</F>

--no bondage; three-fold मोक्ष; renunciation by knowledge, diminution of राग and loss of तृष्णा; <F>1:  Br. IV. 3. ५५; वा. २३. ८१; १०२. ७६, ७८, ८०, ९३.</F> dharma of; <F>2:  Br. III. १०. ११६.</F> is yogasiddhi; <F>3:  Ib. IV. ३६. ५२; ४४. १०८.</F> salvation, attained at the sacred Benares; <F>4:  M. १८०. ५२; १८३. ३६-37; १८५. १५; १९३. ४०.</F> oneness with Brahmam. <F>5:  वा. १०४. ९४.</F>
--unfit for श्राद्ध. वा. ७९. ६७.
(I)--a pupil of देवदर्श. Br. II. ३५. ५७.
(II)--a disciple of वेदस्पर्श. वा. ६१. ५१.
--a Janapada of the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. १५. [पगे२-742+ २८]
--a son of Havya after whom came मोदाक- वर्ष. Br. II. १४. १७. २०.
--a kingdom of शाकद्वीप adjoining the आम्- bikeya hill named after मोदाक. Br. II. १४. २०; १९. ९३; वा. ३३. १९; ४९. ८७.
--a devi. Br. IV. ३७. 4.
--a pupil of वेददर्श. भा. XII. 7. 2.
--born from the बुद्धि of ब्रह्मा. M. 3. ११.
--in the गयाशिला. वा. १०८. ४८.
--an arrow of the God of Love, sent against शिव. M. १५४. २४४; १६२. २१, २४.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २५.

--the thirteenth अवतार् of विष्णु (नारायण) to delude the Asuras from having any share of the अमृत and distribute it to the Devas; reappeared in that form before शिव at his request and शिव who got enamoured of her, ran after her letting his seed fall down; <F>1:  भा. I. 3. १७; VIII. 8. ४१-46; Chh. 9 and १२ (whole) M. २५१. 7; वा. २५. ४८.</F> a शक्ति. <F>2:  Br. IV. १०. २७. ३४; १९. ६५ and ७४; २०. 6, ३८ and ५७; ४४. ७२ and १४१.</F> [पगे२-743+ २६]
--आर्षेय Pravara (भार्गवस्). M. १९५. ३७.
--an आत्रेय-gotraka1ra. M. १९७. 7.
--a Pravara (Angiras). M. १९६. १८.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २२.

--कन्ठ Mudgalas- वा। प्।) from Mudgala, son of भद्राश्व; Brahmanas with क्षत्रिय profession; belonging to the Angirasa line; <F>1:  भा. IX. २१. ३३; M. ५०. 5; वा. ९९. १९८; Vi. IV. १९. ६०.</F> no marriage alliance with ताण्डि or Angiras. <F>2:  M. १९६. ४३.</F>

--eleven of them ruled as kings, (१८ kings- वा। प्।); for three centuries, while the total reign of आभीरस्, Gardabhins, Kankas, Yavanas, तुरुष्कस् and गुरुण्डस् amounted to १०९९ (१००९ वि। प्।) years. Thereafter came the Maunas. भा. XII. 1. ३०-32; Br. III. ७४. १७३-7; वा. ९९. ३६०; Vi. IV. २४. ५३-54.
--a kingdom after Muni. Br. II. १४. २६.
--Devagandharvas; १६ in number; (२४ वा। प्।) Apsarasas were their younger sisters; had six daughters. Br. III. 7. 1-2; वा. ६९. 1, 4, १०.

--(Maurvyas-वि। प्।) succeeded the Nandas. The पुराण speaks of ten kings ruling for १३७ (१७३ वि। प्।) years. Only nine kings are mentioned from Candragupta to बृहद्रथ; were succeeded by the शुन्गस्. <F>1:  भा. XII. 1. १२ and १५; Br. III. ७४. १४९; वा. ९९. ३३६; Vi. IV. २४. २७, ३२-3.</F> म्।प्। men- tions शतधन्व, बृहद्रथ, शक and his grandson दश- ratha and his son; the first four are missing. <F>2:  M. २७२. २२, २६.</F>
(I)--a Tripravara. M. १९६. ३३.
(II)--a son of मणिभद्र. वा. ६९. १५६.
--a southern country. Br. II. १६. ५८.
--the battle with clubs after the महाभारत war. M. ७०. ११.

--the गति of the sun; when the sun is in माघ it moves past southward; returning from the south [पगे२-745+ ३७] it goes to विषु rising in the north of the milky ocean; when the sun is in श्रवण नक्षत्र it goes to the north and rises in the north end of शाकद्वीपम्. वा. ५०. १२१-7.
--a गण born of मुहूर्ता and Dharma. These regulate the timely results of the actions of Beings. भा. VI. 6. 9.

(I)--born out of the left side of Vena's body when the latter's body was churned; <F>1:  M. १०. 7;</F> begin with Anu, son of ययाति; ruled by दक्ष; ruled by Turvasu; ruled by the hundred sons of Pracetas of Druhyu family in the east; the rule of the kings; <F>2:  Ib. ३४. ३०; 4. ५४; ३३. १४; ४८. 9; ५०. ७६; भा. IX. २३. १६.</F> not to be seen in कुशद्वीप; शकस् (परादस्-वि। प्।), Pallavas (Paplava-वि। प्।) and काम्बोजस्, all Mlecchas; (आभिरस्-वि। प्।) गुरुण्दस् and वृषलस्, also belonged to this group; <F>3:  Br. II. १६. १२; १९. ६०; ३१. ७९, ८४ and ९०; III. २०. 5; ४८. ४८-9; ६८. ४४; ७३. १०९; ७४. ११-12, २०३-6, २१५; M. २७३. २२; Vi. IV. 3. ४८; १७. 5; २४. ६९; V. ३८. २८.</F> kingdoms of, found in the lotus coming out of the naval of the Lord; <F>4:  M. १६९. ११;</F> their kingdoms side by side with those of the आर्यस्; <F>5:  Ib. २७३. २५.</F> people who live in their countries are ineligible for पार्वन s4ra1ddha; <F>6:  Ib. १६. १६.</F> attain salva- tion at Benares; <F>7:  Ib. १८१. १९.</F> do not molest the women of their enemies; <F>8:  Ib. १८८. ५१.</F> to be conquered by Kalki; <F>9:  Br. II. १८. ४३.</F> put down by Pramati god. <F>१०:  M. ११४. ११-12; १२१. ४३; १४४. ५३.</F>

(II)--these were the elder Madhucchandasas, who were cursed by विश्वामित्र to become Mlecchas; defeated by Bharata; these were the Mlecchas of the north; <F>2:  भा. IX. १६. ३३; २०. ३०; २३. १६; XII. 1. ४०-43.</F> [पगे२-746+ ११] worship progenitors; <F>3:  वा. ९३. ४४.</F> eleven kings ruled for ३०० years. <F>4:  Ib. ९९. ३६४.</F> Then Kolikilas followed; <F>5:  वा. ९९. ३६४.</F> their धर्म described. <F>6:  Ib. ९९. ३९२-400.</F> ^1 वा. ४५. ८२; ४७. ४१; ४८. १५, २१, ३६; ५८. ७८; ८३. ११२; ९९. १२, २६८; ९८. १०९.
