--foreign tribes on the हिमालयन् slopes. वा. ४१. ४६. [पगे२-747+ 8]

(I)--a राक्षस and a son of खशा. As he wanted to eat his own mother, he got the name of यक्ष; of four hands and four feet, a fearful figure wandering in the night in search of prey; took the form of Vasuruci and lived with the apsaras क्रथुस्थला in Nandana; she bore him a son रजतनाभ; went home in the हिमालयस् with the son, when क्रथुस्थला came to know of his birth as a राक्षस. Br. III. 7. ६०, १००-17; २२. १४; ४१. ३०; ७१. १११; वा. ६९. १६०, १६७.
(II)--a son of गान्दिनी. वा. ९६. ११०.

--a semi-celestial group, usually of the class of demons; born of विश्वा and कश्यप; <F>1:  भा. II. 6. १३; VI. 8. २४; X. 6. २७; ६२. १९; ८५. ४१; Br. II. ३२. 1-2; ३५. १९१; ३६. ११८; M. 6. ४६.</F> followers of Rudra (शिव), their overlord; their lord, Kubera; <F>2:  भा. IV. १०. 5; XI. १६. १६; २३. २४; M. 8. 5.</F> milked the cow- earth, with वैश्रवण as the calf and आम as the vessel; <F>3:  Ib. १०. २२.</F> worship the बर्हिषद् manes; <F>4:  Ib. १५. 4.</F> helped वृत्र against Indra and went with सती to दक्ष's sacrifice; <F>5:  भा. VI. १०. २०; IV. 4. 4, ३४.</F> sport of; <F>6:  Ib. X. ९०. 9.</F> got मोक्ष meditating on Hari; <F>7:  Ib. VII. 7. ५०.</F> usurped the आनर्त kingdom of Kakudmi when he was absent at ब्रह्मा's court; <F>8:  Ib. IX. 3. ३६.</F> came with the gods to see कृष्ण and saw कृष्ण retiring to his own region; <F>9:  Ib. VII. 8. ३८; XI. ३१. 2.</F> (see पुण्यजनस्); vanquished by रावण; <F>१०:  Br. III. 7. २५५.</F> worship the पितृस् and ruin the श्राद्ध; <F>११:  Ib. III. १०. ३८, १११; ११. ८१; IV. 2. २६; १४. 4; २०. ५०; ३०. 9; ३३. ७५.</F> their kingdom; <F>१२:  M. २३. ३९; १२१. ४८.</F> their loka; <F>१३:  Br. IV. ३९. ५६.</F> the nails of वामन when he grew. <F>१४:  M. २४६. ५४.</F> [पगे३-002+ २७]
--chiefly four, Loheyas, Bharateyas, कृशाङ्- geyas, and विशालेयस् after the four daughters of सुयशा (स्।व्।). वा. ६९. १५-6.
--the tribe born to Kapila, the यक्ष and केशिनी--inferior to Gandharvas by three steps. Br. III. 7. १४६-167; IV. 4. 2; वा. ६९. १७८.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३५.
--women of the यक्षस्. भा. X. ९०. 9.

--a शक्ति; <F>1:  Br. IV. २०. १५.</F> an image of; surrounded by the Devas, दानवस् and the नागस्; hoods and two tongues to be carved above the head; also the spirits of the air and the evil spirits encircle her. <F>2:   M. २६१. ४७-50.</F>
--one of the ten पीठस् for images with three मेखलस्; this gives one plenty of cows. M. २६२. 6, 8, १७.
--is Kubera (स्।व्।); <F>1:  Br. IV. २०. ५०.</F> a follower of शिव in battle; helped वामदेव S4iva in his war with Soma. <F>2:  M. २३. ३८.</F>
--Phthisis which afflicted Soma as a result of दक्ष's curse. भा. VI. 6. २३. [पगे३-003+ ३७]
--the wife of शुक्र; mother of देवयानी. वा. ६५. ८४.
--the man who installs a new image, becomes part of the deity; the presiding deity is Ugra. M. २६५. ३८, ४१.

(I)--imparted to वैशम्पायन <F>1:  भा. I. 4. २१; IV. 4. ३२; X. 7. १४; ५३. १२.</F> its history; <F>2:  Ib. XII. 6. ६४-65.</F> सूर्य celebrated in; <F>3:  Ib. XII. ११. ४७.</F> fruits of its repetition; <F>4:  Ib. XII. १२. ६२.</F> arranged by व्यास; learnt by the Asuras; <F>5:  Br. II. ३३. ३७; ३५. ७३; IV. १२. १७.</F> rearranged by वैशम्पायन into four. It is Yajus by the action of यजनम्। It is चतुर्- होत्रम्, divided into four parts, hence यज्ञ; three versions --northern with स्यामायनि, middle country with आसुरि, and eastern with ८६ Samhitas अलम्बी; <F>6:  Ib. II. ३४. १४-22; ३५. ११; वा. ६०. १४, १७, २२; ६१. 5-8.</F> personified as present in वरुण's sacrifice; <F>7:  Br. III. 1. २४; वा. ६५. २५.</F> with वृत्ताध्य, face in the shape of ॐ and with सूक्त, ब्राह्मण and mantra; served as horse of त्रिपुरारि's chariot; <F>8:  M. ९३. १२९; १३३. ३१.</F> length of, including शुक्रियस् and याज्ञवल्क्य portions; <F>9:  वा. ३१. ३३; ३२. 2; १०१. ३४६.</F> two मात्रस्, ईकाराक्षर। <F>१०:  Ib. २६. २०.</F>
(II)--one of the ten horses of the moon's chariot. Br. II. २३. ५६.
(III)--the fifth son of Caidyoparicara, the Vasu and गिरिका. M. ५०. २८.
(IV)--one of the मरुत्गणस्. वा. ६७. १२९.
--a son of पर्वश. Br. II. ११. १६.
--interpreters of the Yajur Veda. They are लोमहर्षणिकस्, काश्यपिकस् and सावर्- णिकस्. वा. ६१. ६०.

--see Yajus; <F>1:  Br. II. ३४. १४-18: M. ९३. १२९; १३३. ३१. वा. २६. २०. ६०. १४, १७, २२; ६१. 5-8; ६५. २५.</F> divided into four parts from which originated यज्ञ, performed by four orders of priests --अध्वर्यु to recite यजुस्, होत, the र्क्स्, and उद्गात, the सामन्, and ब्रह्मा, the अथर्वमन्त्रस्, <F>2:  Vi. III. 4. 8-१२.</F> its शाखस् are २७; arranged by वैशम्पायन, pupil of व्यास, and taught to his disciples including याज्ञवल्क्य; the latter was made to vomit for his behaviour, all the texts, which the other disciples digested, in the form of partridges and hence this portion came to be known as तैत्तिरीय; but याज्ञवल्क्य prayed to the Sun-god who initiated him into the other por- tions of the Yajus in the form of a horse and hence called वाजसेनेय; <F>3:  Ib. III. ch. 5 (whole).</F> part of विष्णु. <F>4:  Ib. V. 1. ३७.</F>
--from the right (south वि। प्।) face of Brah- मा; <F>1:  Br. II. 8. ५१ and ५५; Vi. I. 5. ५४.</F> one learned in, becomes an expert in यज्ञस्। <F>2:  वा. ७९. ९५.</F>

(I)--the seventh अवतार् of विष्णु; born with दक्षिणा as twins to अकूती and Ruci. Adopted as his son by his grandfather स्वायम्भुव Manu. <F>1:  भा. I. 3. १२; III. १९. १३; IV. 1. 4-5; VI. 8. १५; VIII. 1. 6.</F> Followed by the याम gods, slew the Asuras and यातुधानस् who attacked and sought to devour स्वायम्भुव Manu engaged in con- templation of Hari, and ruled the celestial kingdom; <F>2:  Ib. VIII. 1. १७-18; X. 6. २२.</F> wor- shipped for attaining celebrity; <F>3:  Ib. II. 3. 7; Br. II. ३४. 7.</F> to यज्ञ and दक्षिणा were born twelve sons who were known as यामस् in the period of स्वायम्भुव; यज्ञ also याम; <F>4:  वा. १०. १९-20; Br. II. 9. ४४ff.</F> constitutes धर्म and [पगे३-005+ ४४] मन्त्र; the Yajva goes to heaven; <F>5:  वा. ३२. १६.</F> a soma yajus of पशु, द्रव्य, हविस्, ऋत्विक्स्, दक्षिण। <F>6:  Ib. ५७. १०७; ५९. ४२.</F>

(III)--origin of, in Treta and dispute on its nature, whether हिम्सा or not; <F>1:  वा. ५७. ८६-125.</F> trees fit for; समान, प्लक्ष, nyagrodha, अश्वत्थ, udumbara, vikarika, bilva, चन्दण, sarala, देवदारु, शाल, khadira; unfit are: श्लेष्मातक, nak- तमाल, kapittha, शाल्मलि, नीप, विभीतक and those which are enveloped by creepers and are the residence of birds; <F>2:  Ib. ७५. ७१-76.</F> of शूद्रस् by Brahmanas for livelihood (वृत्ति); <F>3:  Ib. ९९. ४२६; १०१. २९६; ११२. 1 and १४.</F> performance of, pleases the gods who give rain; <F>4:  Vi. I. 6. 8.</F> personified as God with wife दक्षिणा and twelve sons, generally known as यामस्; <F>5:  Ib. I. 7. २१.</F> born of विष्णु and आकूती in the स्वायम्भुव epoch; of तुषिता in स्वारोचिष, of सत्या in Uttama, of Havya in तामस and सम्भूति in Raivata; <F>6:  Ib. III. 1. ३६-40.</F> duty of all. <F>7:  Ib. III. 8. २२</F>

(IV)--(Japa) for Brahmanas; <F>1:  Br. II. २९. ५५.</F> introduced by Indra in त्रेतायुग; questioned by the sages as to हिम्सा of animals. Vasu, son of उत्तानपाद who was appointed arbi- trator said that यज्ञ pleases the gods and तपस्, वैराज leading to Kaivalya. Not favoured in Kaliyuga; <F>2:  Ib. II. ३०. 4-४२; ३१. ६४; ३२. ४७; ३४. 6; M. Ch. १४३ (whole).</F> prohibited by Vena, but reintroduced by Vainya in the Vaivasvata epoch; <F>3:  Br. II. ३६. १३०; III. ७२. 2; ७३. ७२; IV. 6. ५५, ७३.</F> Sruca clan of apsaras born of; <F>4:  Br. III. 4. २४; 7. २२.</F> the five to be done by householders daily, chanting of the Vedas, homas, श्राद्- dha for पितृस्, gifts of rice, etc. to भूतस् and balikarma; <F>5:  M. १०. ३४; ५२. १४-15.</F> per- formed by the Asuras. <F>6:  Ib. ८३. 3, 8; १३०. १९.</F> [पगे३-006+ २४]
(V)--the son of Brahmadhana. वा. ६७. २८; ६९. १३२.
--resented शाम्ब's action in seizing लक्ष्- मणा. (s.v.). भा. X. ६८. 5.
--are Graha यज्ञम्, लक्षहोम and कोटि homa. M. २३९. ४०.
--यूप, samit, sruk, sruva, pavitram and paridhi. वा. ९७. २८.
(I)--an आर्षेय pravara; (भार्गव). M. १९५. ४३.
(II)--विष्णु; <F>1:  M. २४६. १०; Vi. I. ११. ४७.</F> method of meditating on, pre- scribed by the sages to Dhruva. <F>2:  Ib. I. ११. ५२-5.</F>
--(wives of sacrificers) attain salvation by सत्सन्ग। भा. XI. १२. 6.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २३.
--a son of Priyavrata, appointed lord of शाल्- मलिद्वीप. He divided it among his seven sons after whose names the countries came to be known. भा. V. 1. २५ and ३३; २०. 9.
--a मण्डप with forty pillars. M. २७०. 4, ११.
--the four sons of आप, one of the eight Vasus. M. 5. २२.
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १३. 7.

--an अवतार् in गोमती तीर्थ; <F>1:  M. २२. १३; २४८. ७७.</F> वाराहम् रूपम्; the boar described; the Vedas are the feet, upa, teeth; यज्ञ, breast; citi, mouth; fire, tongue; कुश grass, hair; ब्रह्मा, head; day and night, eyes; Vedangas and श्रुतिस्, jewels; ghee, nose; sruva, face; सामघोष, the speech, embodiment of satya and dharma, ऊर्ध्वगात्र, nerves; homa, linga; the residence, ocean; Vedi, the inner body; mantras, the hinder part, soma, blood; Veda, skandha; havi, the smell and pride; havya-kavya fast running; प्राग्वम्श pra1yas4citta, the terrible chariot; the body, दक्स्हिण heart; उपाकर्मेष्ठि, the pleasant form, pravargya materials, orna- ments; different metres footpath, उपनिषद् the seat; छाया wife and tall as मणिसृङ्ग. <F>2:  वा. 6. ११-23.</F>
--the hall of sacrifice in नैमिष; all built of gold. वा. 2. १८.
--a son of Parvasa. वा. २८. १३. [पगे३-008+ २४]
--symbolical of देवी. Vi. I. 9. १२०.
--(सान्ति karnika) son of शिवस्कन्ध, and father of Vijaya; (द्वियज्ञ-वि। प्।) ruled for १९ years (२९?- म्।प्।). भा. XII. 1. २७; Br. III. ७४. १६८; M. २७३. १४. वा. ९९. ३५५; Vi. IV. २४. ४८.
--the former birth of the twelve याम devas. वा. ३१. 3, 6-7.
--the पाञ्चाल, who invited कृष्ण to Drau- padi's स्वयम्वर। भा. X. ५७. १०. [1].
--a name of द्रौपदी. भा. X. ८४. 1.
(I)--a son of वृष (विष). Br. III. 6. ३४; वा. ६८. ३३.
(II)--a son of ब्रह्मधान (Brahma- danu, वा। प्।). Br. III. 7. ९८; वा. ६९. १३२.
--a son of Uttama Manu. भा. VIII. 1. २३.
--a son of ब्रह्मधान. Br. III. 7. ९८. [पगे३-009+ २९]
--a भार्गव gotrakara. M. १९५. २४.
--the sacred thread; <F>1:  वा. २३. 3, २६.</F> of शिव, skin of व्याल. <F>2:   Ib. ५५. ५५.</F>
--a राक्षस with the शिसिर sun; resides in the sun's chariot in the month of फाल्गुन (वि। प्।) Br. II. २३. २२; Vi. II. १०. १८.
--a पारावत god. Br. II. ३६. १५.
(I)--a son of ब्रह्मा, who remained a celibate. भा. IV. 8. 1.

(II)--the eldest son of नहुष who did not like to be king and who devoted himself to the realisation of आत्मन्; became a वैखानस yogi even as a boy; <F>1:  भा. IX. १८. 1-2; M. २४. ५०; Vi. IV. १०. 1-2.</F> married गा, daughter of काकुस्थ. <F>2:  Br. III. ६८. १२; वा. ९३. १३-14.</F>

(III)--feeding of, in a श्राद्ध pleases ब्रह्मा; duties of; <F>1:  Br. II. 7. १६९; ३२. २५; III. १५. १६-30; ६८. 6; वा. ५९. २४.</F> प्रायश्चित्तस्, for commissions and omissions; <F>2:  Ib. १८. 1-२२.</F> शूद्र Yatis with bald heads and red robes at the end of Kali. <F>3:  Ib. ५८. ५० and ५९; ९३. 6; १०४. २३.</F>
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३६.

(I)--originator of the यादव race; the eldest son of ययाति and देवयानी. Father of Sahasrajit and other sons. <F>1:  भा. IX. १८. ३३; २३. २०-1; M. 4. २२; २४. ५३; वा. 1. १५५; Vi. IV. ११. 1-5.</F> His line glorified by the birth of कृष्ण, as the Malaya hill by the sandal tree; became overlord of the southern part of the kingdom. Refused to part with his youth to his father and hence was cursed to become the father of refractory sons and was also refused a share in the kingdom; father of five sons; debarred by his father to succeed him; was placed in charge of the southern territory; <F>2:  भा. I. 8. ३२; IX. १९. २२; १८. ३४-40; chh. २३ and २४ (whole); M. ३३. 1-8; ३४. १६-20, ३०; ४३. 6; वा. ९३. १६, ३०-40; Vi. IV. १०. १२.</F> his descendants; <F>3:  Br. I. 1. १६६; III. ६८. (whole); ६९. 1-5; ७३. १२५; वा. ९३. ८९; Vi. IV. १०. ३१.</F> had a discourse on detachment and reali- sation of आत्मन् from an अवधूत sannyasin, when the ascetic spoke of his twenty-four gurus; earth, air, sky, waters, fire, moon, sun, kapota (pigeon), boaconstrictor, sea, moth, bee, elephant, honey-gatherer, deer, fish, पिङ्गल, Kurara, child, girl, blacksmith, serpent, spider and wasp. From the exemplary ways of each of them, the ascetic learnt his lessons which are elaborated. Hearing this Yadu became free from all attachments and looked on all things as equal; <F>4:  भा. XI. 7. 9; X. 1. 2.</F> equal to Indra. <F>5:  M. ३२. 9.</F>
(II)--a याम deva. Br. II. १३. ९२; वा. ३१. 6.

--(also Yadu kula and Yadu वम्श); members and descendants innumerable; one hundred and one families recognised. <F>1:  भा. X. ९०. ४०-4.</F> Their king was Ugrasena. Ill-treated by Kamsa, they migrated to different countries like Kuru and पाञ्चाल, and became delighted at Kamsa's death. Their Purohita was Garga. <F>2:  Ib. X. 1. ६९; 2. 2-3; ४५. १५; 8. 1.</F> Krsna born among them; <F>3:  M. २४६, ९०.</F> cursed by [पगे३-011+ ३१] ययाति, his successors could not be kings; unacceptable to good men according to शिशुपाल; <F>4:  भा. X. ४५. १३; ७४. ३६.</F> took part in the marriage festivities of कृष्ण and रुक्मिनी, and attended the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर; turned into a caste by Puramjaya; <F>5:  Ib. X. ५४. ५८; ७५. १२; XII. 1. ३६.</F> destroyed by कृष्ण before he left the earth, under the pretext of the Brahmanas' curse; the rest lost their reason after कृष्ण's departure to Heaven, drank wine and killed one another. Four or five alone left alive. Attained योग through the grace of Datta; became defunct after the महाभारत war. <F>6:  Ib. XI. 1. 4-5; ३१. १६; I. १५. २२-6; II. 7. 4; M. ७०. १२.</F>
--a Janapada of मणिधान्य; <F>1:  वा. ९९. ३८४.</F> the kingdom of. <F>2:  Br. III. ७४. १९६.</F>
--the Yadu public. Vi. IV. १३. ३५.
--a name of कृष्ण. Br. III. ३६. २९.
--a mechanical contrivance used by त्वष्टा to diminish the तेजस् of the sun; the surplus तेजस् became विष्णु's cakra, Rudra's trident and Indra's thunder bolt. M. ११. २७-9.
--an attendant on ललिता. Br. IV. १७. ४६.
--a तीर्थ on the north bank of the Nar- मदा; a bath there secures the company of Gods for ५००० years. M. १९०. 1-2. [पगे३-012+ ६१]

(I)--(Vaivasvata) the Lord of पितृस्; punishes men after death according to their actions, sinful or other- wise. <F>1:  भा. V. २६. 6; M. 8. 5; वा. ६२. १८६; ६५. ५२; ७०. 8; Vi. I. २२. 5.</F> A son of Vivasvat (सूर्य)  and सम्ज्ञा; explains the nature of धर्म and the glory of Hari to his messen- gers (यमदूतस्, s.v.). Appeared in the form of a child before the queen and the subjects of सुयज्ञ weeping over his dead body and showed the truth that no amount of wail- ing would bring the dead back to life; <F>2:  भा. VI. 6. ४०; VIII. १३. 9; VI. 3. १२-34; VII. 2. ३६-58;</F> welcomed राम and कृष्ण and fulfilled their desire by restoring सान्दिपानि's son; presented पृठु with a rod of justice. Punished नृग to be a lizard for having given a cow of a ब्रह्मण as a gift to another, and as the owner refused to accept the apologies and compensation offered by नृग; <F>3:  Ib. X. ४५. ४२-6; IV. १५. १५; III. ३०. २३; X. ६४. १६-24.</F> fought with कालनाभ in the देवासुर war; rode on buffalo to help Indra against कृष्ण taking away पारिजात, but discomfited, ran away in fear; <F>4:  Ib. VIII. १०. २९; X. [६५ (v) ४१]; [६६ (v) ३३-5]; Vi. V. ३०. ६०; VI. 5. ४४.</F> his authority set aside in the case of अजामिल. Dhruva is said to have set his foot on his head; was a शुद्र for a hundred years owing to a curse; <F>5:  भा. VI. 3. 2; IV. १२. ३०; I. १३. १५.</F> His penance at गोकर्ण and शिव made him लोकपाल; his city being Samyamana; represents the planet शनैश्चर; served as calf for पितृस् milk- ing the earth; धर्मराज; Lord of three deva गणस्-- Amarttas, अप्रकाशस्, and ज्योतिष्मन्तस्; <F>6:  Br. II. २१. ३१; २४. ४९; २९. ६५; ३६. २०८; III. 1. ५२; 7. २५३ and ३३०; १३. ७२; M. ९३. १४; २६६. २१ and ६३; वा. ५०. ८८; ६९. २१५; Vi. II. 8. 9; III. 7. १९, ३५.</F> narrated to शश- bindu varieties of श्राद्ध; protested against the ill-treat- ment by his stepmother छाया and was cursed by her to lose his legs. [Cursed his legs to be sores and worms. His father gave him a cock to eat them. म्।प्।]. The father assured their restoration after a temporary loss; overlord of पितृस्. <F>7:  Br. III. १८. 1; २४. 4; ५९. २३, ५२-80; M. ११. 4-२०.</F> in charge of hells; <F>8:  Br. IV. 2. १५१; 7. ५४.</F> buffalo, his riding animal; <F>9:  M. ६७. ११.</F> his ac- tive part in Tripuram, defeated by कालनेमि; <F>१०:  Ib. १३३. ६३; १३७. ३२; १३८. २५; १७७. ५०.</F> burnt with काम and attained godhood again by pleasing शन्कर by तपस्; <F>११:  Ib. १९१. ११२-4.</F> dialogue of, with his servant about those who could not be taken to his region. <F>१२:  Vi. II. 6. 6; III. 7. 5, १३-20.</F> acted as calf when Antaka milked the cow-earth; other names of; world of; <F>१३:  M. १०. १९; ३१. १२; ९३. १४; १०२. २२-3; १२४. २२; १४६. ७७.</F> in the war against तारक: war with Grasana and the latter's suc- cess. <F>१४:  Ib. १४८. ७९-81; १५०. 1-४९; Vi. III. 2. 2.</F> सम्वाद with सावित्री; the latter's praise of; <F>१५:  M. २११. १४-28 and ch. २१३ (whole).</F> काल and मृत्यु are assistants; god to be worshipped in house building. <F>१६:  Ib. २५०. ४६; २५३. २५.</F>  Image of, with Citragupta by the side; gift of [पगे३-013+ २८] buffalo pleasing to; <F>१७:  Ib. २६१. १२; २६८. १३.</F> (धर्मराज): a golden image of him standing on a copper plate to be given to guru in सप्तमी- svapana; <F>१८:  Ib. ६८. २०.</F> weapon of दण्ड, used by, in the battle of Tri- puram; <F>१९:  Ib. १३५. ७७.</F> seen by सावित्री while taking the life of her hus- band; blessed her with three requests of hers and finally the life of her husband; <F>२०:  Ib. २१०. 5, chh. २११-14.</F> meting out justice impartially; <F>२१:  Ib. २१३. 3.</F> father of two daughters उपदानवी and हिमा. <F>२२:  वा. ६८. २३; ६९. ६१; ७५. ५६; ८२. 1; १०१. १५०, २८६; १०६, ४६; १०८. 4 and ३१; ११० 10 and ३८.</F>
(II)--a याज्ञिय god. Br. II. ३६. ३३.
(III)--a मुहूर्त of the night. Br. III. 3. ४२.
(IV)--a Sukha god. Br. IV. 1. १८.
(V)--a son of हविर्धान. M. 4. ४५.
(VI)--an आदित्य. M. 6. 4.
(VII)--the father of इलिना, (s.v.). M. ४९. 9. [पगे३-014+ २६]
(VIII)--a Vasu; a son of Dharma and सुदेवी. M. १७१. ४७.
(IX)--the agent of a class of devas. वा. १०. ७२.

(X)--the son of सुरेणु and Vivasvan; ill-treated by stepmother छाया, was about to kick her when she cursed him that he would lose his leg; he became Dharma- राज, lord of पितृस् and Protector of the world. वा. ८४. २२, ५६-61.
(XI)--a mukhya गण. वा. १००. १८.
--prescriptions. वा. १०४. १४.
--an eastern tribe. M. ११४. ४४.
--servants of Yama. वा. ११०. ४५.
--a Bhairava god. Br. IV. २०. ८२.

--met विष्णु du1tas at the death of अजामिल, and argued that punishment depended on the character of one's action, and that अजामिल a Brahmana deserved punish- ment for having forsaken his स्वधर्म and led an evil life with a दासि। Overpowered by Hari's दूतस्, they reported [पगे३-015+ २६] to Yama (s.v.) and wanted to know the truth of the matter. Instructed by Yama as knower of Dharma and ordained by Hari, his messengers cherished Hari's glory, and did not go near his devotees. भा. VI. 1. २०, ४०. ६८; 3. १०-34.
--a region of the जम्बुद्वीप; here is Dutimat, a Mt. वा. ४८. १४, १९.
--the kingdom of Dharma. वा. १०६. २०; १०८. 3; Vi. V. २१. ३०.
--(किण्कर): a servant of Yama with a noose. Vi. III. 7. १३, १९.
--the offering to शिव at the प्रभास hill. वा. १०८. २३; ११०. ३८.
--of कौशिक gotra. वा. ९१. ९८.
--a दानव king. Br. IV. २९. १२४.
--a name of कृष्ण. Br. III. ३६. २८.
--also known as Anuparvatam, west of the लौहिती and the Sindhu. वा. ६९. २४१.
--of kings; to punish impartially. M. २२६. 4. [पगे३-016+ ४४]
taken to the abode of Yama in two or three मुहूर्तस् covering about ९९००० yoja- nas; tortures in. भा. III. ३०. २०-28.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८२.
--a daughter of Vivasvan (सूर्य-वि। प्।) and सम्ज्ञा; also यमुना. भा. VI. 6. ४०: VIII. १३. 9: Br. III. ५९. ३८; Vi. III. 2. 2.

(I)--(कालिन्दी) (R.) in भारतवर्ष from the हिमालयस्; a divine stream. <F>1:  भा. V. १९. १८; वा. ४५. ९५.</F> A महानदी. <F>2:  Ib. १०४. ५०.</F> Here Vidura met Uddhava; <F>3:  भा. III. 1. २४; 2. २७; IV. 2. ३५.</F> the co-wives who administered poison to Citraketu's son, had a purificatory bath in; Citraketu, who was initiated into the विद्या by नारद had his preli- minary bath in this river. <F>4:  Ib. VI. १६. १४ and १६.</F> On its banks Vaivasvata Manu performed तपस् for progeny, and Bharata celebrated his horse sacrifice. On its banks stands Madhuvana near बृण्दावन. कृष्ण, his brother, and others played there and once defeated the Asura Vatsa. Gopi girls bathed there as part of the कात्ययनी व्रतम्। Nanda used to bathe here. <F>5:  Ib. IX, 2. 1; 4. ३०; २०. २५; X. ११. ३६-43; २२. 2, 6, ३६; २८. 1.</F> Immersed in its waters Saubhari performed penance. Poisoned by the कालीय; कृष्ण sent away the reptile to the sea and made its waters drinkable; unapproachable to गरुड by a curse of Saubhari. <F>6:  Ib. IX. 6. ३९; X. १५. ४७-8; १६. 4, ६०-7; १७. 8-११.</F> अक्रूर who took कृष्ण and राम to मथुरा, had his bath on the way in this river. Inside the waters he saw both कृष्ण and राम; also saw Hari on the शेष. Here कृष्ण killed Hamsa. <F>7:  Ib. X. ३९. ३८-46; ७६. 2 [8]; ७८. [1).</F> On its bank जरासन्ध encamped to besiege मथुरा. Here कृष्ण had his अवभृत after the horse sacrifice. Here again कृष्ण and अर्जुण met कालिन्दी. <F>8:  Ib. X. [५० (v) 6 and १४]; ८९. ६३ [4]; ५८. १६-7.</F> During his pilgrimage [पगे३-017+ ४३] बलराम visited this. <F>9:  Ib. X. ७८. २०.</F> Was in floods when Vasudeva crossed it for Gokula with the new born babe, कृष्ण. <F>१०:  Ib. X. 3. ५०.</F> Sacred for श्राद्ध; sometimes too hot and sometimes too cold; daughter of मार्ताण्ड and सम्ज्ञा and sister of Yama; got changed into a sacred river. On its northern bank is प्रयागा (प्रतिष्ठान). <F>११:  Br. II. १६. २५; III. १३. ७१-2; ५९. २३ and ८३; ६६. २१; ७३. ११७; IV. १५. २३; M. ११. 4, ३९; १०४. १९; १०८. २२; वा. ७७. ६९-70.</F> Sacred to मृगावती; sacred to the पितृस्; <F>१२:  M. १३. ४०.</F> a boundary of the kingdom of पितृस्; <F>१३:  Ib. २२. २०.</F> in the chariot of त्रिपुरारि; <F>१४:  Ib. ११०. 5; ११४. २१; १३३. २३; १६३. ६१; २३९. १८.</F> one of the १६ wives of हव्यवाहन (fire) <F>१५:  Ib. ५१. १३; वा. २९. १३.</F> forms the left side of the Veda; <F>१६:  Ib. १०४. ७७; १०८. ७९.</F> daughter of सुरेणु and सूर्य; <F>१७:  Ib. ५८. ८८; ८४. २२.</F> a sacred river. <F>१८:  Br. II. १२. १४; वा. ९८. ११७; Vi. III. १४. १८; V. 3. १८; 7. 7ff; १८. ३३.</F>

(II)--(personified) sister of Yama. Once बलराम invited her for watersports, and got enraged at her delay. Hence he dragged her by means of his plough through बृण्दावन्. This changed her course; then she prayed for mercy which was granted. She presented राम with clothes and jewels. Even now the change in the course is noticeable. भा. X. 3. ५०; Ib. ch. ६५ (whole); Vi. V. २५. 8-११, VI. 8. ३१.
--twins--Nakula and Sahadeva. भा. I. १०. 9; Vi. V. ३५. २८; ३८. ९१.

--the middle son of नहुष and विरजा, the mind- born daughter of Ajyapas: married शर्मिष्ठा, daughter of वृषपर्वन्, <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ३२; Br. III. १०. ९५; ६८. १२-4; M. १५. २३; वा. 1. १४३; ७३. ४६.</F> and had three sons by her; pleased with him Indra gave him a golden chariot yoked with swift horses and which became the ratha of the Paurava kings. <F>2:  Ib. ९३. १६-20.</F> Became king after his father: desire for more territory; placed his [पगे३-018+ ४४] younger brothers in charge of the four quarters of the king- dom; nature of his good rule described; in the course of a hunting expedition, he heard the cry of a girl coming out of a well and going near it found a girl inside standing help- less and naked; he gave her his upper cloth to wear and lifted her up. She was देवयानी, the daughter of शुक्र and she became his wife and bore him two sons, Yadu and Turvasu. शुक्र in offering his daughter to the king asked him not to share his bed with शर्मिष्ठा. In a weak moment, forgetting his promise, he yielded to the entreaties of शर्मिष्ठा and on this देवयानी departed to शुक्र's place. ययाति followed her and was cursed by शुक्र to become old; but शुक्र said that he could take the youth of somebody by exchanging it for his old age. He enquired of all his sons and all except पूरु refused to comply with his request. With पूरु's youth he enjoyed for long the company of देवयानी; narrated to her an old story of an ewe found in a well, loving a ram, who was not faithful at first but who spent ultimately a long time of enjoyment with her. He compared himself to that ram and said that he should thereafter bestow his thought on Hari. So he returned his youth to पूरु and led a life of penance at भृगुतुन्ग after anointing पूरु on the throne and appoint- ing his other sons in different parts of the kingdom; dis- courses of, to पूरु on gentleness and friendliness to all; was devoted to Hari. परीक्षित् compared to ययाति for his धर्म। <F>3:  भा. IX. ch. १८ (whole); १९. 1-२५; XII. 3. १०; X. ६०. ४१; I. १२. २४; Br. III. ६८. १४-105; M. २४. ५०, ६६; २७. १४-22; chh. ३०-35; ३४. 4-7; ३६. 6-१३; वा. ९३. १३-16 and २०-76.</F> Cursed that Yadu and his line be debarred from succeeding to the throne, though five dynasties of his sons are distinguished like the sun's rays. <F>4:  भा. X. ४५. १३; ७४. ३६; Br. III. ७१. २०२; ७४. २७५; वा. ९३. ७६-102.</F> Tenth in genera- tion from प्रजापति. <F>5:  M. २५. 4.</F> Went to heaven but Indra sent him back; one version is that he stands in the अन्तरिक्ष and the other is that he went back to heaven; met Indra and narrated पूरु's coronation: Indra told him of the completion of his righteousness and hence birth on the earth. <F>6:  Ib. ३५. 4-5; chh. ३६-37.</F> Falling down, met अष्टक and the other grandsons, who cleared him of his doubts regarding the course of fate and man's helpless- ress, the fruits of karma, the worlds enjoyed by him, the [पगे३-019+ २६] bhauma naraka, the means to get सम्ज्ञा, and the duties of four आश्रमस् and munis. <F>7:  Ib. chh. ३८-40.</F> These with Pratardana, Vasuman and शिबि offered a part of their punyam to make ययाति enjoy heaven. शिबि leading ययाति to heaven in a golden chariot as a result of their good deeds and truthfulness. <F>8:  Ib. ४२. १३-28; २७३. ८०.</F>
(II)--a याम deva. Br. II. १३. ९२.
--शौनक's narration to शतानीक. M. Chh. २५-43.
--a horse of the moon's chariot. वा. ५२. ५३.
--the hairs of the Veda. वा. १०४. ७३.
(II)--a measurement, eight times the यूका (s.v.) M. २५८. १८.
--on the नर्मदा, no rebirth after a bath there. M. १९१. ८८-89.

--an asura who, induced by नारद besieged मथुरा with three crores of म्लेच्छस्; saw कृष्ण and ran [पगे३-020+ ३७] towards him when he fled to a cave. Yavana followed him and in the cave saw somebody sleeping; thought it was कृष्ण and kicked him, when he woke up and burnt the asura to ashes by his energy. The sleeping person was Mucukunda (s.v.). <F>1:  भा. X. ५०. ४४; ५१. 1-२३, ४२.</F> Thus he was vanquished by कृष्ण. <F>2:  Ib. II. 7. ३४; X. ३७. १६; Br. III. ७३. १०२; वा. ९८. १०२.</F>

--a tribe on the west of India; a northern king- dom west of भारतवर्ष noted for horses; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. १२ and ४७; १८. ४४; ३१. ८३; IV. १६. १७; २९. १३१. M. ११४. ११. ४१; १२१. ४३; १४४. ५७; वा. ८८. १२२; ४५. ८२, ११६; ४७. ४२; ५८. ८२; ९८. १०७; Vi. II. 3. 8.</F> attacked बाहु and was defeated by Sagara; escaped with their moustaches (heads वि। प्।) shaved and lived in hills and caves; van- quished by Bharata; unsympathetic false and unrighteous; no right for अभिषेक; eight kings ruled for eighty years (वा। प्।) (eighty seven म्। प्।); <F>2:  भा. IX. 8. 5; २०. ३०; Br. III. ४८. २३-6, ४४-9; ६३. १२०-134.</F> after the शकस्; <F>3:  भा. XII. 1. ३०; Br. III. ७४. १७२-5, २००; M. २७३. १९-20, २५; वा. ९९. २६८, ३६०, ३६२, ३८८; Vi. IV. 3. ४२, ४७-8.</F> purified of sin by devotion to Hari; <F>4:  भा. II. 4. १८; IV. २७. २७; २८. 4-5; Vi. IV. २४. ५३.</F> originated from Turvasu a son of ययाति. <F>5:  M. ३४. ३०; ५०. ७६.</F>
--had no son, and hence appointed गार्ग्य to bless him with one; this son was कालयवन. Vi. V. २३. 4-5.
(I)--(यशस्य) one of the seven divisions of प्लक्षद्वीप. भा. V. २०. 3.
(II)--a son of सावर्णि Manu. M. 9. ३३.
--a शुक्र deva. वा. ३१. 8.
(I)--the son of द्विमीढ, and father of कृतिमान्. भा. IX. २१. २७; वा. ९९. १८४.
(II)--a son of भर्म्याश्व (हर्यश्व-वि। प्।) भा. IX. २१. ३२; Vi. IV. १९. ५९.
(III)--a son of अजमीढ and धूमिनी M. ४९. ७०.
(IV)--the son of द्विजामीढ and father of धृतिमान्. Vi. IV. १९. ४८-9.
--a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५३; वा. ६१. ४६.
--a पारावत god. Br. II. ३६. १४.
(III)--one of the twenty Sutapa गणस्. वा. १००. १५; Br. IV. 1. १५.
--the goddess enshrined at कार्तिकेय. M. १३. ४५. [पगे३-022+ ४०]
--a Pratardana god. Br. II. ३६. ३१.

--a दुर्गा and विश्वरूपिनी who got शूल from शिव, cakra from विष्णु, शन्ख from वरुण, शक्ति from Agni, bow and arrow from Marut, Vajra from Indra, चषक from Kubera, दण्ड and पाश from Yama, कुण्टिक from ब्रह्मा, खड्ग and केट from मृत्यु, jewels from विश्व- karman. Br. IV. २९. ८०-8; ४४. ९०.

(I)--the wife of Nanda (gopa); <F>1:  भा. I. 8. ३१; X. 2. 9; M. ४७. 7; Vi. IV. १५. ३१.</F> gave birth to a female child who was योगमाया incarnate. Without her knowledge, Vasudeva placed कृष्ण born on the same day in her bed and removed the girl to his residence. This was known to नारद. <F>2:  Bha. X. 3. ४७-53; ३६. १७; वा. ९६. २०६-9.</F> Regarded कृष्ण as her own child; per- formed रक्षा to कृष्ण after his killing पूतना; her concern at कृष्ण's kicking the cart (शकटासुर) upside down, and शान्ति arranged; distressed at कृष्ण being carried away by the whirlwind (तृणावर्त); glad to see him alive; her con- cern at कृष्ण's eating mud, and wonder when he revealed his true form and the whole universe in his mouth; binding of कृष्ण with a rope for breaking the pot and stealing butter; took home कृष्ण playing on the river-bank; intense love to कृष्ण; joy at his escape from कालीय; surprise at कृष्ण holding Govardhana; recalled his exploits at Uddhava's visit, and gave him a hearty welcome. <F>3:  भा. X. 6. १९-29; Chh. 7-9 (whole); ११. १४-20; १५. ४४; १७. १५; २५. ३०; ४६. २८-9.</F> Went to Syamanta- पञ्चक and was embraced with affection by रोहिणी and देवकी; <F>4:  Ib. X. ८२. ३६-9.</F> represents the Mother Earth; <F>5:  Br. III. ७१. २१२-3, २३६ and २३९.</F> remedy of, against बालदोष; <F>6:  Vi. V. 1. ७७; 2, 3; 3. २०.</F> prayer of, to शकट; <F>7:  Ib. V. 5. १२.</F> rope round the belly of कृष्ण for mischief. <F>8:  Ib. V. 6. 7, १४; 7. २०.</F> [पगे३-023+ २४]
(II)--the mind-born daughter of उपहूत Pitr2s; wife of विश्वमहत्; mother of खट्वान्ग. Br. III. १०. ९०; वा. ७३. ४०-41.
(III)--a mind-born daughter of the हविष्मन्त- पितृस्, wife of अम्शुमान्, daughter-in-law of पञ्चजन, mother of दिलीप, and grandmother of भगीरथ. M. १५. १८-19.
--is कृष्ण. Br. III. ३३. २०.
--is कृष्ण. Br. III. ३६. २२.
--a queen of Brhanmanas and mother of Jaya- dratha. M. ४८. १०५; वा. ९९. ११५.
(I)--the wife कनकपीठ. Br. II. ११. ३५.
(II)--a daughter of Virocana and wife of त्वष्टा. Br. III. १८७.
(III)--a daughter of Devaka and one of the seven wives of Vasudeva. M. ४४. ७३.
--a brother of शिशुनन्दि; ruled from Kili- किला. भा. XII. 1. ३२-3.
--a god of the Sumedhasa group. Br. II. ३६. ५९.
--the सभा of इशान in the eighth slope of Meru; bright with lustrous gold. वा. ३४. ९१.
--staves and cudgels, used by the barbarians against the enemies; <F>1:  Vi. V. ३८. १७.</F> used by the आभिरस् against Arjuna. <F>2:  Ib. V. ३८. ५२.</F>
--a son of अर्काग्नि. Br. II. १२. ४३.
--an आर्षेय pravara (भार्गव). M. १९५. ३६.
--a भार्गव branch. Br. III. 1. १००.
--the name of a मूर्छन। वा. ८६. ५९.

(I)--a pupil of बाष्कल(i); taught the त्रयी, to शतानीक; <F>1:  भा. XII. 6. ५५; IX. २२. ३८; Vi. III. 4. १८; IV. २१. 4.</F> was given the fourth शाख of the ऋग् Veda by his master. <F>2:  वा. ६०. २६.</F> [पगे३-025+ ३२]

(II)--a pupil of वैशम्पायन and son of देवरात (ब्रह्मरात वि। प्।) quarrelled with his guru and vomited the यजुस् (s.v.) he learnt; propitiated the Sun god to get छन्दस् unknown to his guru. Pleased with him the Sun god instructed him in वाजसेन्यस्तस् (Yajus अयातयाम, वि। प्।); in the form of a horse; <F>1:  भा. XII. 6. ६२-74; Br. II. ३५. 9-३०; Vi. III. Ch. 5 whole; वा. ६१. १७-19, २१.</F> a श्रुतऋषि; one of the madhya- माध्वर्युस्; in charge of a शाखा in the ऋग् Veda; recipient of Janaka's present in a contest for great learning; <F>2:  Br. II. ३२. 3 and १६, ३४. २७, ४५-68.</F> an एकार्षेय. <F>3:  M. १९८. 4; २००. 6.</F>
(III)--(कौशल्य) learnt yoga from हिरण्यनाभ; siddha; disciple of पौष्यञ्जि. भा. IX. १२. 4; VI. १५. १३; Br. III. ६३. २०८; Vi. IV. 4. १०७.
(IV)--a sage who came to see कृष्ण at स्यमन्तपञ्चक. भा. X. ८४. 5.
(V)--as a contemporary of Kalki; <F>1:  Br. III. ७३. १०५.</F> will precede Kalki. <F>2:  M. ४७. २४९; १९२. १०.</F>
(VI)--a son of ब्रह्मवाह, who won the prize for learning in Janaka's (s.v). hall of sacrifice. वा. ६०. ४१.
(VII)--disqualified; <F>1:  वा. ६१. 1, 6.</F> learnt the yoga of वसिष्ठ; <F>2:  Ib. ८८. २०८.</F> purohita of Kalki. <F>3:  Ib. ९८. १०४.</F> [पगे३-026+ ३४]
--the portion of the Samhita composed by याज्ञवल्क्य. Br. II. ३५. ७७; वा. ६१. ६८.
--belong to कौशिक gotra. Br. III. ६६. ७०; वा. ९१. ९८.
--a daughter of Bhaya and मृत्यु. भा. IV. 8. 4.
--the father of जन्तुधान; had ten sons, all राक्षसस्, and followers of the शुन् god. Br. III. 7. ८६-90; 8. ६१; वा. ६९. १२८; ७५. ४५.

--evil spirits hurting children; <F>1:  भा. II. १०. ३९; VI. 8. २५; X. 6. २७; वा. ४७. १६; ५२. 5; ६६. ११८.</F> rushed to devour Manu engaged in meditation; <F>2:  भा. VIII. 1. १७.</F> put to flight by कृष्ण; <F>3:  Ib. X. ६३. १०.</F> freedom by association with the wise; <F>4:  Ib. XI. १२. 3.</F> one of the three राक्षस clans moving about in the day time and ruin- ing the श्राद्ध. <F>5:  Br. III. 3. ९७; 8. ६१; ११. ८१.</F>

--If a king finds his enemy troubled by his neighbour or in other ways, if he feels strong in his hereditary army, if his neighbour is an ally, he can under- take the march in the month of Citra, मार्गशीर्ष and when the planets are in his favour; he must engage after consult- ing the place and time; if rainy season there must be much of infantry and elephants; if spring or winter, chariots and horse; if summer camels or mules, and in other seasons, the fourfold army; the way must be such that yavasa (food) and fuel are available all along; after consultation with ministers and at an auspicious hour he must start; much importance is attached to the शकुनम् (good omens) and [पगे३-027+ ३९] dreams; <F>1:  M. Ch. २४०.</F> methods of counteracting them; <F>2:  Ib. Ch. २४१.</F> details of the aus- picious things to look at and hear. <F>3:  Ib. Ch. २४३.</F>
--a name of कृष्ण. वा. ९६. ४०; Br. III. ७१. ४१.

(I)--descendants of Yadu also called माध- vas and वृष्णिस्; a tribe who had कृष्ण and बलराम as their lords; <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. ३०; X. ६७. २५; XI. ३०. ११; Br. III. ७१. २१६; M. २७१. 2.</F> the maternal uncle line of Sagara with capital at मथुरा; Kakudmin was their king for some time; <F>2:  Br. III. ४९. 6; ६१. २२.</F> inhabit- ants of द्वारवती; three crores strong; formerly Asuras who were killed in the देवासुर wars, and were born as men; of them ६००,000 were warriors; eleven कुलस् or clans dis- tinguished among them; all वैष्णवस्. <F>3:  वा. ८६. २७; ९६. २१५ and २५२-5.</F>

(II)--the family of Yadu; <F>1:  Vi. IV. ११. ३०.</F> unlimited in num- bers; had ३८ millions of teachers of army; <F>2:  Ib. IV. १५. ४५-6.</F> consisted of १०१ families over whom विष्णु was ruler and teacher; <F>3:  Ib. IV. १५. ४८-9.</F> consisted of Kukuras, वृष्णिस् and Andhakas; <F>4:  Ib. V. ३५. १६; ३७. ३९.</F> to deprive them of all their possessions was the plan of Kamsa; <F>5:  Ib. V. १५. २०.</F> on कृष्ण's advice and in fulfilment of the curse of sages to die of the iron club born to साम्ब, left द्वारका for प्रभास; having drunk they attacked one another and finally took hold of rushes grown out of the iron pieces of musala and killed them- selves. <F>6:  Ib. V. ३७. ३८-47.</F>

--of the family of the यादव tribe; यादवस् from Yadu, son of ययाति; <F>1:  M. 4. १७.</F> begged excuse from वासुदेव for suspecting him from killing Prasena; <F>2:  Ib. ३४. ३०; ४५. १८.</F> १०१ families are distinguished of whom विष्णु is the Lord; origi- nally Asuras killed in the देवासुर war, became incarnate as यादवस्. <F>3:  Ib. ४७. 6; २५. 9.</F>
--(Yadukula समाजम्); the popular assembly of the यादवस् to whom कृष्ण explained his adventure and recovery of the jewel Syamantaka. Vi. IV. १३. ६१-2, १३७, १४६.
--the wife of बाहु and mother of Sagara (s.v.) Br. III. ६३. १३०; वा. ८८. १३१.
--a शक्ति. Br. IV. ३७. 6.
--one of the names in the fourth Marut गण. वा. ६७. १२७.

--the twelve devas born of यज्ञ and दक्षिणा and waited on हरियज्ञ; <F>1:  भा. I. 3. १२; VIII. 1. १८.</F> they are Yadu, ययाति, Vivadha, स्रासत, Mati, विभास, Kratu, प्रयाति, विश्रुत, Dyuti, वायव्य and Samyama, <F>2:  Br. II. 9. ४५; १३. ८९-90; वा. १०. २०; ३१. 3, 6-7.</F> born in the epoch of स्वायम्- bhuva Manu. <F>3:  M. 9. 3; ५१. ४०; Vi. I. 7. २१; १२. १२.</F> [पगे३-029+ २४]
--belong to कौशिक gotra. Br. III. ६६. ७२; वा. ९१. १००.
--residents of Maharloka; by turns go to Janaloka; born of प्रजापति. Br. IV. 2. ५१-55.
--one of the wives of तार्क्ष्य and mother of locusts (शलभस्); <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. २१.</F> a शक्ति. <F>2:  Br. IV. ४४. ७५.</F>
--one of the ten wives of Dharma and mother of नागवीथि. M. 5. १५; वा. ६६. 2.
--a tribe. भा. I. १०. ३४.
--on its north bank was situated प्रतिष्ठान Va1. ९१. ५०.
--a कश्यप and a त्रयार्षेय. M. १९९. १३.
--a group of नाडिस् emitting dew from the sun. Br. II. २४. २८.
--a class of deities. Br. IV. ३९. ५७. [पगे३-030+ ३३]
(II)--a son of Raivata Manu. M. 9. २१.
(III)--a sage of the XIV epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. ४४.

--the intervening time between one yuga-san- ध्यपूर्व and सन्ध्याम्श; four in number; कृत, Treta, द्वापर and Kali. The extent is of १२,000 years of celestial measure; the duration of the yugas includes sandhya, १२,000 divine years, 1,००० caturyugas make a day of ब्रह्मा. <F>1:  भा. II. 8. १७; III. ११. १८; XII. Ch. 4 (whole) ; वा. 7. २२; २३. ८३; २४. 1; ३१. २१; Vi. I. 3. ११-15.</F> A yugam of five years, commencing with श्रवण and ending with धनिष्ठा नक्षत्र--the five years are respectively Agni, सूर्य, Soma, वायु and Rudra; consists of Samvat- sara, Parivatsara, Idvatsara, Anuvatsara and Vatsara; revolves like the wheel owing to the movement of the Sun. <F>2:  Br. II. १३. ११५, १४७; २१. १३१; २४. ५७ and १४४; २८. २२; वा. ३१. २८, ४९; ३२. ५७-65; ५०. १८२; ५३. ११६; ५६. २१; Vi. II. 8. ७२.</F> Social conditions in; <F>3:  M. Ch. १६५.</F> of शप्तऋषिस्. <F>4:  वा. ९९. ४१९.</F>
--a son of Brahmadatta. M. ४९. ५८.
(I)--a son of कुणि; with him the शैनेय line. भा. IX. २४. १४; Vi. IV. १४. 3-4.
(II)--son of भूति--also Bhautya. Br. III. ७१. १०१; वा. ९६. १००.
(III)--a son of Dyumni and शैन्य. M. ४५. २४. [पगे३-031+ २४]
--a Mauneya. वा. ६९. 2.
--a measurement equal to four hastas or dha- nus; equal to a धनुर्दण्ड. Br. II. 7. १००; वा. 8. १०६; १०१. १२५.
--description of terrible state of, towards the end of a yuga. M. १४४. ६५-87.
--(युधाजित् ब्र्। प्। and म्। प्।) son of माद्री and वृष्णि and father of शिनि. भा. IX. २४. १२; Br. III. ७१. १९; M. ४५. 2.
--(युद्धमुष्टि, म्। प्।) a son of Ugrasena. वा. ९६. १३२; Br. III. ७१. १३३; Vi. IV. १४. २०; M. ४४. ७५.
(II)--a son of माद्रि and वृष्णि. Br. III. ७१. १९; M. ४५. 2; वा. ९६. १८; Vi. IV. १३. 8.
--a son of Anamitra. M. ४५. २५.

--a partisan of जरासन्ध stationed by him at the western gate of मथुरा during its siege, and on the southern gate of Gomanta during its siege; went to Sya- मन्तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse. भा. X. ५०. ११[5]; ५२. ११[9]; ८२. २६. [पगे३-032+ ४७]

--a son of कुन्ती and पाण्डु born of Dharma, and father of Prativindhya and Sudhanu. Devaka was another son by पौरवी; descendants of अजमीढ; <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. २७-30; I. १५. १३; Br. III. ७१. १५४ and २५९; M. ४६. 9; ५०. ४९; १०३. 2; १८९. 1; वा. ९६. १५३; ९९. २४४; ११२. ४४; Vi. IV. १४. ३५.</F> was defeated in a game of dice and was banished to the forest with his brothers and their wife. Was met and consoled by कृष्ण and सत्यभामा. कृष्ण's respects to: heard from नारद that कृष्ण was the Supreme Hari and was much pleased. Enquired of Him when he met him at the city of the पाञ्चालस्. He and his four brothers were met by कृत- varman. <F>2:  भा. X. ६४. 4-१०; ५८. 4 and ११; VII. १५. ७९; X. ५२. [५६ (v) 5-8]; ५७. १०[4].</F> His desire to perform the राजसूय; joy at कृष्ण's visit: provided suitable lodgings for कृष्ण and his family. Addressing of the assembly on his desire to perform the राजसूय, कृष्ण asked him to get ready by defeating all the kings and bringing thus all the earth under his control: sent out his brothers in the four directions who defeated kings and brought much wealth. Was glad of जरासन्ध's death at the hands of his brothers: Sent for Purohitas for the sacrifice and invited all his kith and kin. The यज्ञ comparable to that of वरुण; attended by all gods. For doing honour to the सदस्यस् there was some doubt about the first place, and Sahadeva's suggestion of कृष्ण's name was accepted by all except शिशुपाल who insulted him in the public assembly. कृष्ण's silence. The पाण्डवस् with the Matsyas and others unsheathed their swords, and कृष्ण sent his चक्र which cut off his head. After अवभृत, युधिष्ठिर shone like Indra. All took leave of him in joy except Duryodhana, who became jealous of the success of the राजसूय and of द्रौपदी, and of कृष्ण. Heard of Duryodhana's fall in the सभा and sent कृष्ण with dress and ornaments to him, which he rejected. <F>3:  Ib. X. ७०. ४१; ७१. २३-6 and ४४; ७२. 1-१४; ७३. ३५; Chh. ७४ and ७५ (whole); ७६. 2[3]; ७७. 7.</F> On the occasion of the राजसूय, asked नारद how Caidya, शिशुपाल and Dantavaktra, haters of Hari became merged with him after their death, as also about सनातन धर्म; <F>4:  Ib. VII. 1. १२-20 and ३०; ११. 1.</F> was met by उपप्लाव्य, by कृष्ण and the other Yadus; <F>5:  Ib. X. ७८[95 (v) 2-5]; Ch. ७८ whole; ७९. २४; ८० [5-6], [१६].</F> went to कुरुक्षेत्र for war. On his side were विराट, Drupada, शीखण्डि, धृष्टद्युम्न, सात्यकि, Kekayas, Saibya and others. Killed शाल्व in the field. Welcomed बलराम after [पगे३-033+ ३५] the war, and left for हास्तिनपुर and was anointed king: rule of righteousness. <F>5:  Ib. X. ७८[95 (v) 2-5]; Ch. ७८ whole; ७९. २४; ८० [5-6], [१६].</F> Felt aggrieved over the slaughter of his kith and kin: agreed with द्रौपदी regarding the release of अश्वत्थाम, went with his brothers to see भीष्म in his death-bed, like Kubera with the यक्षस्. Requested भीष्म to give him the truth of मोक्ष धर्म। Did the funeral rites to him, and after returning to the capital, ruled righteously with the approval of धृतराष्ट्र and कृष्ण: three अश्व- मेधस् were performed by him at the suggestion of कृष्ण: Missed seeing धृतराष्ट्र and गान्धारी, and learnt of their life in the हिमालयस्. The rule was characterised by plenty of rains and crops and by absence of diseases and difficul- ties; <F>6:  Ib. I. 7. ४९; 8. ४७; Ch. 9. whole; १२. 4-6, ३४; १३. ३०-57; XI. १९. ११-12; III. 3. १८; M. ११२. 3.</F> learnt the अन्गारव्रत from the sage, पिप्पलाद; <F>7:  Ib. ७२. 1.</F> went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse and there met कृष्ण and other friends; was taken leave of by the sages: left it for his capital. <F>8:  भा. X. ८२. २७; ८३. 1-4; ८४. २७, ६९[3].</F> Felt the advent of Kali everywhere: Installed his grandson परीक्षित् on the throne and Vajra at मथुरा: Prepared to go to स्वर्ग: Clad in bark, fasting, and silent, he went towards north with a view to attaining heaven: was followed by his brothers: Attained Hari through friendship. <F>9:  Ib. I. १५. ३२-48; VII. 1. ३०; Vi. IV. २०. ४०; २४. ११०-1; V. १२. २४; ३५. २८.</F>
--survived the कुरुक्षेत्र war: grieved at कृष्ण's departure from हास्तिनपुर: received Vidura in joy. भा. I. १०. 9; १३. 3; X. ८०.[4].
--a son of Vasvananta, and father of सुभा- षण. भा. IX. १३. २५. [पगे३-034+ ३४]

--(see सात्यकि) the grandson of शिनि, and son of Satyaka, and father of Jaya. <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. १४; Br. II. ७१. १०१; M. ४५. २३; वा. ९६. १००; Vi. IV. १४. 2.</F> Learnt the धनुर्वेद from Arjuna. Approved of द्रौपदी's suggestion to release अश्वत्थमन्: accompanied कृष्ण to हास्तिनपुर; <F>2:  भा. I. 7. ५०; III. 1. ३१; X. ५८. 1; ६३. 3.</F> took active part in the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर: was sent to द्वारका for defence; <F>3:  Ib. X. ७५. 6; ७६. 7[5].</F> went with the sacrificial horse of कृष्ण. <F>4:  Ib. X. ८९. २२[2].</F>
--one of the १४ gan2as of apsaras born of the sun's rays. Br. III. 7. १९.
--a god of the Lekha group. Br. II. ३६. ७६.
(I)--a son of Candra, (Indu) and father of श्राव. भा. IX. 6. २०-21; M. १२. २९.

(II)--a righteous king and a son of (Pra) सेनाजित्: Issueless though he had a hundred wives of whom गौरी was one; went to the forest, where he got up the Aindra इष्टि, a sacrifice in honour of Indra. One night he felt thirsty and drank the consecrated water from the sacri- ficial pot. In due time a son was born splitting open the right side of his stomach. He lived for some time and went to Heaven. This son was the great मान्धात (s.v.). भा. IX. 6. २५-32; 7. 1; Br. III. ६३. ६६; वा. ८८. ६५; Vi. IV. 2. ४८-63.
(III)--An Angirasa and मन्त्रकृत्. By his curse half the Ganges came out. Br. II. ३२. १०८; III. ६६. २९; वा. ५९. ९९. [पगे३-035+ २८]
(IV)--a son of Andhra. Br. III. ६३. २७; वा. ८८. २६.
(V)--the son of अम्बरीष, wife नर्मदा, and son सम्भूत (Harita-वा। प्। and वि। प्।). Br. III. ६३. ७३; वा. ८८. ७३; Vi. IV. 3. 2-3.
(VI)--during his यज्ञ, there were differen- ces as to the division of पशु। ब्रह्मा interfered and appeased while शक्ति got angry. Br. IV. 6. ५९.
(VII)--a son of रणाश्व and father of मन्धात; a मन्त्रकृत्. M. १२. ३४; १४५. १०२.
(VIII)--a son of शूलि of the २४थ् dva1para. वा. २३. २०७.

--the Crown Prince; <F>1:  वा. ९६. २१९.</F> his initiation against a King, an instance of अन्तह्कोप; <F>2:  M. २२३. 8.</F> the residence of, to consist of five wings as that of the Kings. <F>3:  Ib. २५४. १७.</F>
--the son of शन्खण and father of विश्व- saha. Vi. IV. 4. १०६.
--a measurement; eight times the लिख्या (स्।व्।), (लिक्षा). Br. IV. 2. १२१; M. २५८. १८; वा. १०१. १२१.

--a sacrificial post; <F>1:  वा. ३०. १४८; ९४. १७; ९७. २८; १०६. ४३.</F> circumambulation of the, leads to the fruit of वाजपेय; <F>2:  Ib. १११. ३१-2.</F> in the Gaura hill on the banks of the Ganges where Indra made many sacrifices; <F>3:  Br. II. १८. २८.</F> near ब्रह्मतीर्थ where ब्रह्मा performed sacrifice and planted a यूप. <F>4:  वा. १११. ३१.</F>

(I)--practices of: <F>1:  भा. I. 2. २८; II. 1. 6; 2. २३; M. 1. १२.</F> eight-fold: its characteristics. <F>2:  भा. III. Ch. २८.</F> Bhaktiyoga: <F>3:  Ib. III. Ch. २९.</F> born of Kriya, क्रियायोग: <F>4:  Ib. IV. 1. ५१; वा. ७१. ६४.</F> the course of: fol- lowed by नारद and others in their worship of नारायण: <F>5:  भा. V. १४. ४५; १९. १०; VII. 3. 9; ११. 3.</F> System of. <F>6:  Ib. IX. १२. 4; X. 8. ४५; Ch. २९ (whole) ; XI. १४. २०.</F> Also three-fold ज्ञान, भक्ति and कर्म: of this भक्ति is important. <F>7:  Ib. XI. २०. 6-8.</F> Spoiled by bad association, especially association of women; <F>8:  Ib. XI. २६. 3 and २४.</F> is an ऐश्वर्य, and possible through kriya and gurupriya: of २४ truths: त्रयी is its limb; <F>9:  Br. II. ३४. ६५; III. 3. ८९; 9. ६२ and ६६; १०. 4 and ११५; १९. २९ and ६२; IV. 3. ५५.</F> other limbs, यम, नियम, <F>१०:  M. १३. 5; १८३. ४४ and ५०; १९३. ३८; २४७. 9; २४८. १७.</F> यज्ञ, दान, वेदाभ्यास, and धारण; philosophy of; <F>११:  Ib. 2. १६; वा. ६६. ११०.</F> the strength of the पितृस्, out of which soma grows; from ज्ञान; <F>१२:  Ib. ७१. ६६; १०१. ७५, २११, ३५०.</F> methods of: control of the senses and the mind by fasting; a means to fructify austeri- ties, then knowledge sprouts; <F>१३:  Ib. ७७, १२४-35.</F> praise of; <F>१४:  Br. I. 6. ४०; वा. १८. 5-6.</F> of नक्षत्र and ऋषि; <F>१५:  Ib. ९९. ४२२.</F> as a result of स्वाध्याय or study and vice-versa; <F>१६:  Vi. VI. 6. 2.</F> explanation of the nature of yoga by केशिध्वज to खाण्डिक्य. <F>१७:  Ib. VI. 7. २६-92.</F>
(II)--a name of शिव. वा. ९७. १७५.
--authorship attributed to विष्वक्सेन. भा. IX. २१. २६. [पगे३-037+ ३४]

--the first of all धर्मस्; <F>1:  वा. ८३. ६०.</F> hidden by कश्यप in a cave and discovered and published by Sanat- कुमार for the benefit of humanity; <F>2:  Ib. ८३. ८३-4.</F> not to be discussed with Yogins; but implicit obedience to it leads to heaven, and non- conformity would lead to hell. <F>3:  Ib. ८३. ९१-94; १०४. १४.</F>
--of विष्णु on the waters: His primordial form; <F>1:  भा. I. 3. 2-5.</F> his sleep at प्रयागा; <F>2:  M. २२. 9.</F> left it for churning the ocean. <F>3:  Ib. १५०. २१२; २४९. ४५.</F>
--the signs in the body of; when the Yogi feels himself and the earth full of tejas, then siddhi is attain- ed; <F>1:  वा. ११. ६२-63.</F> क्रियायोग. <F>2:  Ib. ७१. ६४.</F>

--Ordered by Hari to transfer the धाम of His in the womb of देवकी to that of रोहिणी; she was to take birth as the daughter of यशोदा and Nanda, at the same time he became कृष्ण. She would be worshipped by all as दुर्गा, भद्रकाली, अम्बिका. She did as was commanded. Born of यशोदा: taken to prison by Vasudeva leaving देवकी's babe at यशोदा's bed. Dashed against a rock by Kamsa, she predicted that soon a baby born already would kill him (See विष्णुमाया). भा. X. 2. 6-१५; 3. ४५[1]-५३; 4. 7-१३, २९.
--works on Yoga. Br. IV. ३७. २७.
--the sister of बृहस्पति and wife of Pra- भास, the eighth of the Vasus; son, विश्वकर्म, author of the सील्पशास्त्र. वा. ८४. १५-16. [पगे३-038+ ३६]
--a son of Brahmadatta. वा. ९९. १८०.
--by his quality of lordship, God assumes this shape in the world. वा. १०१. २१७.
--Lord नारायण. M. १७१. 3.
--the अवतार् of the Lord in the २८थ् dva1para with a bachelor's body; entered the Meru cave with ब्रह्मा and विष्णु and took the name of Nakuli. वा. २३. २१९-21.

--(Siddha) he who has practised brahmacarya, ahimsa, satya, non-stealing, and a parigraha and cultivated a sense of detachment; <F>1:  वा. ७६. २८; Vi. VI. 7. ३६.</F> is superior to all for he performs तपस् for a hundred years standing on one foot and living on air; <F>2:  वा. ७१. ७३.</F> धर्मशासनम् of: ahimsaka; walking on good roads, drinking clean and filtered water and speaking truthful words; after serving his guru for a year goes about begging alms; <F>3:  Ib. १६. 8-१७.</F> gets the धारण and tries to avoid the उपसर्गस्; must understand the seven सूक्ष्मस्; महिसूक्ष्म, आप, तेजस्, वायु, व्योम, मनस् and बुद्धि सूक्ष्म, and the condition of these before these elements attain the स्थूलभाव; all of them inter-dependent; <F>4:  Ib. १२. 9, १७.</F> always intent on प्राणायाम be- comes one with the great being; <F>5:  Ib. १०. ९४.</F> the best to be fed on the occasion of the श्राद्ध; superior to the feeding of a thousand householders, a hundred वानप्रस्थस् and a thousand ब्रह्मचारिन्स्. <F>6:  M. १३. 5; १६. १०; वा. ७१. ६७; Vi. III. १५. 2 and २४.</F> [पगे३-039+ २५]
(I)--a वर्ण s4akti: an attendant on शिव. Br. IV. ४४. ५९ and १०५; III. ४१. ३०.
(II)--the goddess who stands in Kanakhala- तीर्थ and dances with शिव. M. १९३. ७०.
--a manifestation of Hari in the epoch of XIII Manu: a friend of Indra Divaspati. भा. VIII. १३. ३२.
--image of, with hanging tongue, knotted hair on the top of the head and a garland of skulls and bones, etc. M. २६१. ३३-6.
--the mind-born daughter of काव्य Pitr2s. Br. III. १०. ८६.
--a place sacred to वासुदेव; bath in the तीर्थ here rids one of his Brahmahatti दोष. M. १९१. १००.
--कश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 5.
(I)--same as धूतपापा: a river in कुशद्वीप. M. १२२. ७१.
(II)--the sacrificial fire-place, a वितस्ति in measure- ment and in appearance like the lips of an elephant. M. २६५. ३४. [पगे३-040+ २३]
(III)--from प्रकृति. वा. १०१. २२८.
--a sacred river of शल्मलिद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. २८.
--the symbol pertaining to देवी; description of. Br. IV. ४२. १८; ४४. ११.
--contact with women, condemned. भा. III. ३१. ३४-42.
--a son of युधिष्ठिर by देवकी. M. ५०. ५६.
--the capital of नृग (मृग-वा। प्।). Br. III. ७४. २१; वा. ९९. २१.
--a queen of युधिष्ठिर and mother of Devaka. Vi. IV. २०. ४४.
(I)--a son of अम्बरीष, and father of हारित; <F>1:  भा. IX. 7. 1.</F> killed in a battle lasting for १४ months and more Aruddha and Ripu. <F>2:  Br. III. ७४. 8; वा. ९९. 8.</F>
(II)--a grandson of कावेरी. वा. ९१. ५८. [पगे३-041+ २२]

--the thirtieth Kalpa; ब्रह्मा got a son red in colour, dress and eyes; finding him to be महादेव, ब्रह्मा bowed to him and contemplated upon वामदेव; शर्व appeared to him and made अट्टहास when were born four sons beginning with Viraja. वा. २२. २१-30.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २६.
--an Asura killed by दुर्गा. Br. IV. २९. ७६.
--one of the six charioteers of ललिता. Br. IV. २०. ९२.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १२.
--an attendant on शिव. Br. III. ४१. २६.
(I)--a son of वसिष्ठ and ऊर्जा. Br. II. ११. ४१. [पगे३-042+ २७]
(II)--the son of खश: A fearful figure of three heads, three hands and three feet: roamed in the night in search of prey of men and animals. Br. III. 7. ६१-77.
(III)--meaning पालन or protection from राक्षसस्. वा. ६९. १०१.
(IV)--resides in the sun's chariot during the month of शुची; <F>1:  Vi. II. १०. 7.</F> फाल्गुन. <F>2:  Ib. II. १०. १८.</F>
--(also राक्षसस्) evil spirits. भा. X. 6. २७.
--born of विश्वा and कश्यप; <F>1:  M. 5. 1; 6. २९, ४६.</F> worship बर्हिषद् manes. <F>2:  Ib. १५. 4.</F>
(I)--the sister of ऋक्ष; wife of प्रजापति and mother of जाम्बवन्. Br. III. 7. २९९-300.
(II)--the use of amulets to protect children and others from evils. Vi. V. 5. १३.
--one of २८ hells for the sin of पुरुषमेध. भा. V. २६. 7 and ३१.
--cited on the श्राद्ध day to keep off the राक्षसस्. Vi. III. १५. ३१.
--to be uttered in founding a new temple; <F>1:  M. २६५. २५.</F> to be uttered in palace building; <F>2:  Ib. २६८. ३४.</F> of the सामवेदिन्स्, recited in tank ritual. <F>3:  Ib. ५८. ३७.</F>
--a son of अर्काग्नि. Br. II. १२. ४३; वा. २९. ४०.

(I)--a son of दीर्घबाहु, and a man of ever- lasting glory. His son was Aja. Lust after more territory: knew the power of विष्णु's योगमाया. भा. IX. १०. 1; XII. 3. 9; II. 7. ४४; Br. III. ६३. १८३; वा. ८८. १८३; Vi. IV. 4. ८४-5.
(II)--a son of Nighna. M. १२. ४७.
--an epithet of विष्णु. M. ५४. १८.

--the wrestling place where separate seats were arranged for judges, nobles, women, cowherds, etc. Women of the palace and the city attended such matches; these women recalled कृष्ण's former exploits. Vi. V. २०. २३-29, ४३, ४५-7. [पगे३-044+ २३]
--professional actors. वा. १०१. १६४.
--a Daitya lady and queen of त्वष्ट. भा. VI. 6. ४४.
(I)--son of Viraja and father of Ketuman (शत- jit, वि। प्।). Br. II. १४. ७०; III. 8. १९; Vi. II. 1. ४०.
(II)--son of Dhara. Br. III. 3. २२.
(III)--is राजसीवृत्ति: Leads to duhkha and तृष. Br. IV. 3. ३२-41.
(IV)--one of the seven sons of वसिष्ठ and ऊर्जा; wife मार्कण्डेयी and son Ketuman. वा. २८. ३६-37; Vi. I. १०. १३.
(V)--the quality present both in तमस् and सत्व as oil in the oil-seed and ghee in milk; it is the result of agitation in the प्रधान। वा. 3. 2; 5. १०, १२.
(VI)--son of Arija; a राजऋषि and tapassiddha. वा. ३३. ६०; ५७. १२२.
(VII)--one of the ten branches of the Rohita clan of devas. वा. १००. ९०. [पगे३-045+ ३०]

--a washerman; <F>1:  M. १९२. २०.</F> शुक्लतीर्थम्, compared to, in washing sins; to be fined a माष of gold by the king for not properly washing. <F>2:  Ib. २२७. १५५.</F> the washerman of Kamsa was killed on his refusing cloths to कृष्ण and राम. <F>3:  Vi. V. १९. १४-17.</F>
--son of Varatri. Br. III. 1. ७९.
(I)--the milkman of the यक्षस् on the earth and father of मणिधर. Born of यक्ष and apsaras क्रतुस्थला. Br. II. ३६. २१६; III. 7. १११.
(II)--the grandfather of the यक्षस्, mar- ried भद्रा, the daughter of अनुह्राद, the Daitya; father of मणिभद्र and मणिवर; wives of these two become the aunts of सम्सिद्धकरण. वा. ६९. १५१-2.
--silver, came out of शिव's eyes; hence dear to पितृस्; but inauspicious and to be avoided in देवकार्यस्. M. १७. २२-3.
--a R. in शाल्मलिद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १०.

--son of आयु and father of five hundred (hundred म्।प्।) sons known as Rajeyas; a devotee of नारायण; was invested with conquering powers; fearing प्रह्लाद and other enemies, Indra gave his kingdom to Raji; once when the देवासुर (कोलाहल) war broke out between प्रह्लाद and Indra extending for ३०० years both parties invoked his assistance; he joined the Devas who unlike the Asuras [पगे३-046+ २९] accepted him as their Lord and he vanquished the Asuras; Indra became thus his adopted son to whom he gave back his kingdom and returned to forest for penance. Indra, however, returned the kingdom to Raji; after Raji's death his sons appropriated the kingdom and refused to give it to Indra; the latter therefore killed all of them with the help of बृहस्पति. <F>1:  भा. IX. १७. 1-१६; Br. III. ६७. 2, ७९-105; ७२. ८६; M. २४. ३५-42; वा. ९७. ८६; Vi. IV. 8. 3, २१; 9. 1-२३.</F> It is said where Raji is, there लक्ष्मी finds her abode; where लक्ष्मी is there धृति lives; where धृति resides, धाम lives; where धाम lives, there is Jaya. <F>2:  वा. ९२. ७४-99.</F>
--one of the ten sons of रौद्राश्व. वा. ९९. १२४.
--son of वरूत्रि. वा. ६५. ७८.
--son of क्षुद्रक, and father of Suratha. भा. IX. १२. १५.
--born of Pulaha. Br. III. 7. १७८.
(I)--a son of कृतञ्(m)jaya, and father of सम्जाय; of the बृहद्बल (बार्हद्बलायन-भा। प्।) dynasty. भा. IX. १२. १३; Vi. IV. २२. 7-8.
(II)--a son of व्रात. वा. ९९. २८७.
--a son of सम्हताश्व. M. १२. ३४.
--a son of कृतम्जय, the इक्ष्वाकु king. M. २७१. ११.
(I)--a name of शतरूपा; wife of स्वायम्भुव Manu. Br. II. 9. ३८; वा. १०. १३.

(II)--the consort of काम. Hearing that he was burnt by शिव, she clad herself in sorrowful clothes. श्या- मला restored him back to life, and in her presence both were married again; <F>1:  Br. IV. ३०. ३७-51; M. 7. १३; १००. ३२; १५४. २१९, २७२-3;</F> a शक्ति; <F>2:  Br. IV. १९. ६४-71; ४४; ७२.</F> mother of हर्ष; <F>3:  वा. १०. ३८.</F> प्रीति became her co-wife; after the burning of काम, was माया- वती in शम्बर's house and brought up Pradyumna (an incarnation of काम); <F>4:  Vi. I. 7. ३१; V. २७. ३०.</F> Image of, with swan. <F>5:  M. २६१. ५५.</F>
(III)--a कला of the moon. Br. IV. ३५. ९२.
(IV)--a son of शतरूपा. M. 4. २५.
--the goddess enshrined at गन्गाद्वार. M. १३. ३७.
(I)--the wife of Vibhu and mother of पृथुसेन. भा. V. १५. 6.
(I)--one of Atri's wives. Br. III. 8. ७६.
(II)--a daughter of भद्राश्व and घृताची. वा. ७०. ६९.
--the tenth daughter of रौद्राश्व. वा. ९९. १२६.
--a Mt. south of मानस; <F>1:  वा. ३६. २३.</F> residence of the seven sages. <F>2:  Ib. ३८. २७; ३९. ४५.</F>

--the gift of a cow with precious gems set in every part of its body takes one to the world of विष्णु and makes him attain the place of शम्भु; <F>1:  M. २७४. १०; २८८. 1-१७.</F> Gudadhenu, fit for gift on the विशोकद्वादशि day. <F>2:  Ib. ८२. 2.</F>
--of ललिता described. Br. IV. ch. ३३ (whole).

(I)--(रत्नाचलम्): of thousand pearls is the best; then of ५०० and ३००; with २५० pearls विष्कम्भपर्- vatas to be made around the principal one; the giver is relieved from Brahmahatti and other sins. M. ८३. 6; ९०. 1.
(II)--a chief hill of क्रौञ्चद्वीप like वडवामुख. Vi. II. 4. ५०.
--a daughter of शैब्य, queen of अक्रूर and mother of eleven heroic sons. M. ४५. २८. [पगे३-049+ २७]
--ocean personified. Br. IV. १५. २१.
(I)--of kings; are seven in number; cakra, ratha, मणि, queen, nidhi, horses and elephants. Br. II. २९. ७४-5; M. २१७. ३७; वा. ५७. ६८.
(II)--the essence got by mountains by milk- ing the cow-earth; <F>1:  M. १०. २५.</F> seven gems in the epoch of स्वायम्- bhuva; generally gems. <F>2:  Vi. III. १२. 2.</F>
--a measurement of २१ angula parvas. Br. II. 7. ९८; IV. 2. १२२. M. १६. २५; ५८. 7. वा. १०१. १२२.
--of the moon, description of; sprang out of waters with ten horses, charioteer, etc., has three wheels. वा. ५२. ५०-4.
--a ग्रामणि with the sun in spring. वा. ५२. 4.
(I)--the यक्ष presiding over the month of Madhu. भा. XII. ११. ३३; Br. II. २३. 3.
(II)--one of the seven प्रानिन्स् of the king. वा. ५७. ७०, Br. II. २९. ७६.
(I)--with the sun in the months of शुचि and शुक्र (in the month of आषाढ वि। प्।). Br. II. २३. 7; Vi. II. १०. 8.
(II)--a ग्रामणि with the sun in summer. वा. ५२. 7. [पगे३-050+ २९]
--a यक्ष, who resides in the sun's chariot during the month of माधव. Vi. II. १०. 5.
--a जयादेव and son of ब्रह्मा; a man- त्रशरीर. Br. III. 3. 6; वा. ६६. 6; ६७. 5.
--an account of, in the ब्रह्मवै- वर्त पुराण; <F>1:  M. ५३. ३४; ६९. 1, 5.</F> king पुष्पवाहन belonged to this aeon. <F>2:  Ib. १००. 1.</F>

(I)--the साम sung by Bhauvana; ele- phants, Kapila and पुण्डरीक born of; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. ३२४ and ३३५; वा. 9. ४८; २२. 8; ३०. ११९; ६९. २०९.</F> to be heard on the श्राद्ध day; <F>2:  M १७. ३८.</F> to be uttered while installing a new image; <F>3:  Ib. ५८. ३७; २६५. २७.</F> from the first face of ब्रह्मा. <F>4:  Br. II. 8. ५०; III. 4. 2. Vi. I. 5. ५३.</F>
(II)--(सूर्यमण्डलम्) ८८,000 yojanas in measurement. वा. २१. ७५ and ७९.
--a यक्ष who resides in the sun's chariot in the months of Caitra and Madhu. Vi. II. १०. 3.
--a wife of Vasudeva. M. ४६. २१.
--a son of भीमरथ, and father of Nava- ratha; <F>1:  Br. III. ७०. ४२.</F> adhered to dharma and satya. <F>2:  वा. ९५. ४१-2.</F>
--the Saptami of the month of माघ when the sun turns his chariot; fit for making gifts and per- forming श्राद्ध to please पितृस्. M. १७. 9-१०.
(I)--the यक्ष presiding over the month of शुक्र (in the sun's chariot during the month of शुचि- वि। प्।). भा. XII. ११. ३५; Br. II. २३. 7; Vi. II. १०. 7.
(II)--a ग्रामणि with the sun in the summer. वा. ५२. 7.
--a kingdom of कुशद्वीप. Br. II. १४. २९; १९. ५८.
(I)--a क्षत्रोपेत dvija. Br. III. ६६. ८८.
(II)--a disciple of सत्यश्रिय; a शाख प्र- वर्तक, शाखपूर्णरथीतर (?). वा. ६०. २९, ६५.
(III)--an elephant. वा. ६९. २१९.
--a military title below महारथ <F>1:  वा. ९९. २४९.</F> earned by ययाति and कार्तवीर्यार्जुन. <F>2:  Br. III. ६८. २०; ६९. २१.</F>

(I)--a son of पृषदश्व; had no issue and at his desire, Angiras blessed him with sons. Their descend- ants became Angirasas and क्षत्रोपेत dvijas. भा. IX. 6. 1-3; Br. III. ६३. 6-7; वा. ८८ 6-7. Vi. IV. 2. 9-१०.

(II)--a pupil of सत्यशृण्ग--also शाखवैण; author of three सम्हितस् given to four pupils Paila and others; also author of Nirukta--a त्रयार्षेय, with Angiras and विरूप; <F>1:   Br. II. ३४. ३२. ३५. 3; M. १९६. ३८; वा. ६१. 2.</F> had four disciples, Ketava, Dalaki, Dhama- शर्म and देवशर्म; all of them became murderers of Brahmanas on the death of their master; they approached the creator for light who advised them to make a visit to वालुकेस्वरम् to get redeemed of their sins by bath and prayer; on the completion of the pilgrimage they reached सूर्यमण्डलम्. <F>2:  Ib. ६०. ६५-72.</F>
(III)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३४.
(IV)--a राजऋषि who became a Brahmana and attained siddhi. वा. ९१. ११७.
--a branch of the Angirasas. वा. ६५. १०६.
--a Pratardana god. Br. II. ३६. ३१. [पगे३-053+ २५]
--a यक्ष with the sun in the months of Madhu and माधव. Br. II. २३. 3.
(I)--a son of Nandana. Br. III. ७१. १९२.
(II)--a son of Riveyu, his wife was सरस्वती. वा. ९९. १२८, १२९.

(I)--a son of सम्कृति: attained permanent fame. He performed a sacrifice when he gave up all he had and suffered with his family having nothing to eat for fortyeight days. When he had something to eat, there came a Brahmana guest and a वृषल, and another guest with dogs around him; they all shared it. When he had some- thing to drink, there came a Pulkasa and asked for the drink and got it. To such a high soul, the gods showed दर्शन्. All his followers became Yogins, himself having realised the योगमाया of विष्णु. <F>1:  भा. IX. २१. 2-१८; X. ७२. २१; II. 7. ४४; Vi. IV. १९. २२.</F> परीक्षित् compared to him for his generosity. <F>2:  भा. I. १२. २४; Br. III. ३४. ३८.</F>
(II)--a son of महायशस्. M. ४९. ३७.
--a son of Nandana. Br. III. ७१. १९२. [पगे३-054+ २८]
--a son of ऋतेयु, and father of Sumati and two other sons. भा. IX. २०. 6.
--a kingdom of the West watered by the Sindhu. Br. II. १८. ४८.
--a son of Rambha, and father of गम्भीर. भा. IX. १७. १०.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २६.
--a son of Dhara. M. 5. २४.

(I)--An उपद्वीप to जम्बूद्वीप: a terri- torial division of शाल्मलिद्वीप: <F>1:  भा. V. १९. ३०; २०. 9.</F> The island where कालीय originally lived. Here the serpents agreed to give बलि every fortnight to गरुड, except कालीय. <F>2:  Ib. X. १६. ६३; १७. 1-4.</F> South of श्वेत and north of नील. People live here for thousands of years (१०१५० years वा। प्।) by drinking the juice of the fruit of the banyan tree, रोहण in the island; people living there, pleasant to look at, devoid of disease and difficulties. <F>3:  Br. II. १५ 62-5; M. ११३. ६१; वा. ४५. 2-5.</F>
(II)--son of वीतिहोत्र of पुष्करद्वीप. भा. V. २०. ३१.
--the Goddess enshrined at रामतीर्थ. M. १३. ४०. [पगे३-055+ २८]
--आर्षेयप्रवरस् (भार्गवस्). M. १९५. ३९.
--a daughter of the वालेयस्; originator of the कम्बलेयगण. वा. ६९. २१.
(I)--a son of विविम्शति, and father of Khani- netra. भा. IX. 2. २५.
(II)--a son of आयु, and father of Rabhasa: known for his valour; <F>1:  भा. IX. १७. 1 and १०; Br. III. ६७. 2.</F> had no son. <F>2:  Vi. IV. 8. 3; 9. २४.</F>
(III)--the fifth Kalpa. वा. २१. ३०.
--with the sun in the months of शुचि and शुक्र. Br. II. २३. 8.

(I)--the Apsaras presiding over the month of शुचि; <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ३६.</F> wife of Maya; <F>2:  Br. III. 6. २८; 7. 7.</F> presiding over the month of ऊर्ज. <F>3:  Ib. II. २३. २२; IV. ३३. १८; भा. XII. ११. ४४.</F>
(II)--the goddess enshrined at Malaya hills: a mother goddess. M. १३. २९; १७९. २०. [पगे३-056+ ३३]

(III)--An Apsaras versed in dancing; <F>1:  M. २४. २८; वा. ६९. 6.</F> created by ब्रह्मा; <F>2:  M. १३६. ११.</F> going with the sun sometime; <F>3:  Ib. १२६. २३.</F> seized by the Asuras; <F>4:  Ib. १२६. 7; १३३. 9.</F> in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु. <F>5:  Ib. १६१. ७५.</F>
(IV)--a snake with the sun in summer. वा. ५२. 6.
(V)--with the sun during फाल्गुन month; शुक्र or आषाढ; <F>1:  Vi. II. १०. १८.</F> along with other Apsaras cursed by अष्तावक्र. <F>2:  Ib. V. ३८. ७३. ७७.</F>
(I)--son of आग्नीध्र, and Lord of नीलम् (नीलवर्ष-वा। प्।); <F>1:  Br. II. १४. ४६-50; वा. ३३. ३९, ४२.</F> placed in charge of the kingdom bordering on नीलाचल. <F>2:  Vi. II. 1. १७ and २०.</F>
(II)--(केशरि s.v.) Mt. in शाकद्वीपम्. वा. ४९. ८४.
(I)--son of आग्नीध्र. भा. V. 2. १९.
(II)--(नीलवर्ष) a continent bounded by नील on one side: Here विष्णु in the form of Matsya is worshipped by Manu. भा. V. १६. 8; १८. २४-28. M. ११३. ३०; वा. ३४. ३०. Vi. II. 2. १४.
--a daughter of Meru, and wife of Ramyaka. भा. V. 2. २३.
--son of पुरूरवस् and ऊर्वशी. Father of Eka. भा. IX. १५. 1-2. [पगे३-057+ ३४]
--disciple of लोकाक्षि, an अवतार् of the lord. वा. २३. १३४.
--son of Dharma (Vasu). Vi. I. १५. ११३.
--their lord is विष्णु. M. 8. 4.

(I)--from अव् to protect--see सूर्य; <F>1:  Br. II. २१. 4; २३. २६; २४. ३५; III. ५९. ३७; IV. 1. १३८; वा. ५०. ६०; Vi. II. 8. ११-12.</F> got a place among श्राद्धदेवस्; <F>2:  M. १३. 1.</F> the श्राद्धदेव; <F>3:  Ib. १५. ४३.</F> an आदित्य; <F>4:  Ib. १७१. ५६.</F> in three forms, गयादित्य, उत्तरार्क, and दक्षिणार्क; <F>5:  वा. १०६. ५७.</F> movements of the sun, detailed; मण्डल measurement of; rise at Samy- amana, mid-day at अमरावती, mid-night at सुषा, setting at विभावरी; other similar calculations; the movement in a मुहूर्त; movement for a day and a night; movement in दक्षिणायनम्; chariot of, limbs of the year; the seven horses are च्छन्दस्, गायत्री, त्रिष्टुब्, जगती, अनुष्टुब्, पङ्क्ती, बृहती and उष्णिक्; gives a list of sages, Gandharvas, Apsaras, नागस्, ग्रामणि and राक्षसस् with the sun in the six seasons; these go with the sun in his own wheel; <F>6:  M. chh. १२४-6; वा. १००. २२२.</F> a marut- गण; <F>7:  M. १७१. ५२.</F> standard of नाग in the तारकामय. <F>8:  Ib. १७३. 9.</F>
(II)--son of स्वारोचिष Manu. Br. II. ३६. १९; वा. ६२. १९.
--the path of devas. वा. 8. १९८.
--a name of Manu. M. 1. ११ and २२. [पगे३-058+ २५]
--four, representing the four Yugas. वा. १०८. ३६.
--a son of स्वाहा and father of Citraratha; the best among givers; performed many sacrifices. वा. ९५. १६-17.
--one of the २० Sutapa गणस्. वा. १००. १५.
(I)--a तुषित god. Br. III. 3. १९.
(II)--the गुण of waters becomes absorbed in ज्योतिस् or तेजस् and consequently waters reach the verge of destruction. वा. १०१. ४२. १०२. 9.

--a व्रत to be performed on the third day of the माघ month; sacred to ललिता; this is continued every month preceded by fasting and followed by gifts to Brahmanas; the person who does this enjoys in the world of गौरी. It is equal to performing १००० यज्ञस्। M. ch. ६३ (whole)
--a companion of Puramjana, allegorically the organ of taste. See मुख्या. भा. IV. २५. ४९; २९. ११.
--fit for gift during the विशोकद्वादशि व्रत। M. ८२. १९.
--a son of the राक्षस Vidyuta. Br. III. 7. ९५.
--son of Kuthumi. वा. ६१. ३८.
--one of the eight सौभाग्यम्स्. M. ६०. 8, २८.
--is a yoga siddhi. Br. IV. ३६. ५२; ४४. १०८.

--(also पातालम्) the underworld of rocky soil. Here live पणिस्, नागस्, निवातकवचस् and कालेयस्; all दानवस् of great strength and enterprising spirit and afraid of Hari and Sarama, the messenger of Indra. <F>1:  भा. V. २४. 7 and ३०; Br. II. १९. १७१; २०. १० and १२, ३९-40; ३०. ३१; M. ४७. ६३; वा. ४९. १६३; ९७. ९५; १००. १५७; Vi. IV. 3. 4 and 8; V. 1. २८.</F> Visited by Arjuna in search of the dead child of the द्वारका Brahmana; <F>2:  भा. X. ८९. ४४.</F> burnt by Pralaya; <F>3:  Br. III. ५३. 1; ७२. ९६. ७३. ४६ and ४८; IV. 1. १५३.</F> the Asuras entered it help- less; <F>4:  M. ४७. २१२-13, २३३.</F> Vasu, cursed by the sages to live there, for his decision against the killing of पशु in sacrifices; <F>5:  Ib. १४३. २४-25; १६६. 3; २४८, 4, ११, ५३, ६७ff; वा. ५७. ११०.</F> of १०,000 Yojanas in extent; other talams are Atala, Sutala, Vitala, Gabhastala, महातल, Sritala, and पताल with the characteristics of black, white, पीतम्, chunam, rocky and gold they are in groups of earth, water and space. <F>6:  Ib. 6. २५; ५०. 9-१४.</F> [पगे३-060+ २८]
--the months of Madhu and माधव. Br. II. १३. 9; वा. ३०. 8.
--a son of सम्पाति. M. ४९. 4.
--a group of deities. Br. IV. १९. ४६.

--the king of Sindhu--सौवीर kingdom: employed जड-Bharata as his palanquin bearer, and found fault with him for not bearing it properly: He understood that he was a Brahmana, felt remorse and enquired who he was. Heard precepts on आत्मविद्या from Bharata and became devoted to Hari in a spirit of detachment. भा. V. १०. 1-२५; १३. २५.
(I)--a daughter of Angiras and स्म्र्ती; wife of धात्रि, and mother of प्रातस्; <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ३४; VI. १८. 3; वा. २८. १५; Vi. I. १०. 7.</F> a शक्ति. <F>2:  Br. IV. ३२. १२.</F>
(II)--a R. in शाल्मलिद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १०.

(III)--the full moon shining resplendent and much pleasing to the eye; <F>1:  Br. II. ११. १८; २८. ३८, ४६ and ६०; वा. ५०. २०१; ५६. ३५, ४१ and ५५.</F> a day fit for giving gifts; <F>2:  Vi. II. 8. ८०.</F> ety. of. <F>3:  वा. ५६. ४१.</F>
(IV)--Two lavas of the afternoon of Pratipada. M. १३३. ३६; १४१. ३३, ४१, ५१. [पगे३-061+ ३७]
--a form of marriage by which कृष्ण married रुक्मिणी. But Rukmi objected to this form of marriage. भा. X. ५२. १८ and ४१; ५४. १८; Vi. III. १०. २४.

(I)--see रक्षस्: semi-divine beings; <F>1:  भा. VI. 8. २४; Br. II. ३२. 1 and 2; ३५. १९१.</F> different clans--देवराक्षसस् like नैरृतस्, भूमिराक्षसस्, Guhya- राक्षसस् Daityara1ks2asas like कापिलेयस्; Another classifica- tion is दीवाचरस् (यज्ञमुखस्) (यातुधान, Brahma- धान, and वार्त्त) and निशाचरस् (Paulastya, नैरृत, आगस्त्य, and विश्वामीत्र) who ruin the श्राद्ध, but wor- ship पितृस्; <F>2:  Ib. III. 7. १३२- १६७; 8. ६०-65; १०. १११; ११. ८१; IV. 1. १५५; 2. २६; २०. ४७; वा. ७०. ५४-7.</F> of sharp teeth, reside in Bhaumanarakam; <F>3:  M. ३९. 8-9.</F> sons of यातुधान; <F>4:  वा. ६९. १२८.</F> description of their forms and features; <F>5:  Ib. ७०. ५४-63.</F> mother, स्वसा; <F>6:  Vi. I. २१. २५.</F> both दानवस् and Daityas live in पाताल. <F>7:  Ib. II. 5-4.</F>

(II)--एत्य्: (see also यक्ष, निशाचर). When out of hunger the first created beings began to swallow water, the राक्षसस् tried to protect the waters; then the hairs of प्रजापति stood on end with anger; out of this came snakes of all sorts; <F>1:  Br. II. 8. ३२; वा. 9. ३०-5; Vi. I. 5. ४३.</F> occupy Vajraka hill. <F>2:  वा. ३०. ९०; ३१. १२; ३४. ५५; ३९. ३६; १००. १५९; १०१. 3, २८.</F>
--a son of जाम्बवन्. Br. III. 7. ३०३.
--eight in number: perhaps the seven daughters of खश and नीला; create fear and disease among children (human beings- वा। प्।). Br. III. 7. १५६-61; वा. ६९. १८८.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १६. [पगे३-062+ ३३]
--when no ceremonies are to be performed; the first three मुहूर्तस् or नालिकस् of the morning, सङ्घव (8-३० to ११ A.M.) of noon, afternoon and evening. M. २२. ८२-83.
--a chief doorkeeper in Geyacakraratha. Br. IV. १९. ८८.
--carries away भूत; leads to सम्सार and its ills; विषयराग, reason for re-birth. वा. १०२. ६७, ६९.
--see राम (s.v.); <F>1:  Br. III. 5. ३६.</F> killed ताडका; <F>2:  वा. ६७. ७३.</F> his consort was सीता; <F>3:  Vi. I. 9. १४४.</F> an अवतार् of विष्णु to kill रावण. <F>4:  Ib. IV. १४. ४९.</F>
--a तीर्थ sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ६६.
(I)--one of the ten branches of the Rohita clan of devas. Br. IV. 1. ८६; वा. १००. ९०.

(II)--(see also राजन्) qualifications of: should not retreat from the battle-field; should protect Brahmanas, the poor and the helpless; insist on svadharma of his sub- jects, aid tapasvins, befriend the truthful and avoid the vakras; <F>1:  M. २१५. ५६-99; २३८. १२.</F> precautions to be observed; befriend enemy's sub- jects and provide them with jobs; use spies in administra- tion; <F>2:  Ib. २२०. 8-४७.</F> prescriptions for personal conduct and successful rule of a king; some व्रतम्स् like the आग्नेय, पार्थिव, etc. <F>3:  Ib. २२३. 7f.</F> Avoid the two kinds of discontent,--अन्तह्कोप and बहिह्- कोप; the former brings more ruin it being towards the mem- [पगे३-063+ ३२] bers of the royal household; the latter towards सामन्तस्. <F>4:  Ib. २२६. 3-१२.</F> Collect taxes through faithful servants annually. <F>5:  Ib. २१५. ५७.</F> Earn the title of राजऋषि like ययाति; <F>6:  Ib. १३. ६२; ४३. २३; ४६. २८.</F> ety. of. <F>7:  वा 62. १३४; १०९. ५४.</F>

--a title of पुरूरवस्, ययाति and कार्तवीर्य; <F>1:  M. १३. ६२; ४३. २३; वा. ९६. १९०.</F> attained by शमिक. <F>2:  M. ४६. २८.</F> For some more names see वा। प्। <F>3:  वा. ३२, ३८, ५४; ६१. ८०, ८६-88; ९९. १५, १२७.</F>
--son of विशाखयूप, and father of Nandivar- dhana, the Magadha king. भा. XII. 1. 3-4.
--to punish evil doers and to protect the law abiding. M. २११. 9.
--the capital of Malla whom कृष्ण van- quished; the palace of. Br. III. ७३. १००; IV. १४. ११.
--a sacred place in कीकट. वा. १०८. ७३.

--a दान; also रौप्याचलम्; the best gift is of १०,000 palams of silver; the giver goes to the world of the moon; then of 5,००० and then 2,५०० palams; anything above २० palams. M. ८३. 6; ९१. 1ff. [पगे३-064+ ३३]
--the silver vessel used by पितृस् in milking the cow-earth; <F>1:  M. १०. १८.</F> out of शिव's eye; <F>2:  Ib. १५. ३१; १७. २०. २३.</F> best for use in श्राद्ध. <F>3:  वा. ७३. ५१; ७४. 1.</F>
--also क्षत्रधर्म; no sin to kill one in war. M. १०३. २२.

--ety. दण्डधारिन्; crimes escaping his notice are dealt with by Yama. In Kali the king is mostly of the fourth caste and takes the profession of robbery rather than protection. Earth loses its fertility. The wealth and wives of others are coveted; म्लेच्छस् are patronised. Duties-- salutation to cows and Brahmanas, sandhya worship and gifts to the deserving; not to deprive forcibly a Brahmana of his property; <F>1:  Br. II. २९. ६३-64; ३१. ४१-156; ३६. १५६; III. २८. १०-74.</F> renowned kings get the title of राजऋषि, gene- rally of the family of Manu, Aila, इक्ष्वाकु. <F>2:  Ib. II. ३५. ९०, ९६-102; III. ७१. १९४.</F>
--six-fold; learnt by राम and कृष्ण. भा. X. ४५. ३४.
--१० dhanus broad; permits of easy move- ment for men, horses, chariots and elephants. वा. 8. ११९.
(I)--a name of Budha, the son of राजसोम and the originator of the science of elephantology. M. २४. 3.

(II)--prince; special teachers are to be appointed to teach him Dharma, Artha and काम s4a1stras, to train him in elephant riding, chariot riding, and in arts and crafts; he must have his bodyguard so that he may not mix with the undesirables and may control his senses; he [पगे३-065+ ३५] must live in a private residence, for an ill-disciplined prince will root out the family. <F>1:  M. २२०. 1-6</F> A possible internal enemy of the king. <F>2:  Ib. २२३. 9.</F>
--a work on elephantology by the sage राजपुत्र, identified with Budha. M. २४. 3.
--police officials; <F>1:  वा. १०१. १५४.</F> go to hell. <F>2:  Br. IV. 2. १५५.</F>

(also राजपथस्)--royal roads as fre- quented by पिशाचस्; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. ४०४; २७. ११.</F> in the city of श्रीपुरम्; <F>2:  M. १३०. 3.</F> in the city of मथुरा; <F>3:  Vi. V. १९. १२.</F> lighted by lamps during nights; <F>4:  M. १३९. १९.</F> persons commit- ting nuisance in public roads were visited by fines and required to clean them. <F>5:  Ib. २२७. १७५.</F>
--unfit for श्राद्ध. Vi. III. १६. 7.
--smitten by this, Soma was relieved by his father, Atri. Br. III. ६५. ४६-8.
--to be worshipped in house-building. M. २५३. ३०, ४२; २६८. २३.

--devices for the protection of the king's person; different kinds of mixtures of medicines used for १५ days, one month, etc.; remedies to avert houses being consumed by fire; against snakes by burning their coating; examination of cooked food by giving it to birds or throw- ing it into the fire and then examining the change in colour; [पगे३-066+ २७] flies would not sit on the poisoned food; its effect on birds and beasts; the same is applicable to drinking water; such protection needed since he is the root of the tree of the people. M. २१९. 1-३४.
--the abode of Kubera. M. ८३. ४५.
--the giver of gift; kalpa tree becomes so in the next birth; <F>1:  M. १०१. ३०, ५४, ७१; २७७. २१.</F> for the gift of gosahasra. <F>2:  Ib. २७८. २५.</F>
--the special title awarded by ब्रह्मा to Soma. Br. III. ६५. २०; वा. ९०. २०.
--a कश्यप and a त्रयार्षेय. M. १९९. १२.
--son of Dama, and father of Suvrddhi. Vi. IV. 1. ३६-7.
--son of Dyutimat. Vi. I. १०. 5.
--followed by robbers as the kings themselves begin to rob in the Kali age. वा. ५८. ४२.
--sacred to ललितापीठ. Br. IV. ४४. ९६.
--for wrong entry in, punished with uttama दण्ड. M. २२७. २०२. [पगे३-067+ ३४]
--otherwise known as केतुमान्, a लोकपाल; <F>1:  Br. II. २१. १५७; M. १२४. ९५.</F> attained heaven by तपस्। <F>2:  Ib. १४३. ३८.</F>
--a king of Vidarbha. His daughter was married to Malayadhvaja पाण्ड्य. भा. IV. २८. २८-29.
--also प्रजाकरी; this quality possessed by मरीचि Kas4yapa. वा. ६६. ८७, १०४, १०५.
--intervening both satva and tama; leads to karma and rebirth and hence duhkha or misery due to ear, eye, tongue, body and smell. वा. १०२. ५४, ६२.

(I)--the conqueror of cardinal points was fit to perform this: युधिष्ठीर on this, to कृष्ण: Done by Soma who conquered the three worlds; <F>1:  भा. X. ७१. 2[1]; ७२-3; IX. १४. 4; वा. ९०. २२.</F> युधिष्ठिर's desire to be a पारमेष्ठी. So ऋत्विक्स् were sent for, including भीष्म, Vidura. Even शूद्रस् were invited. After the sacrifice, on the suggestion of Sahadeva, the first honour was given to कृष्ण. शिशुपाल's protest and vilification of कृष्ण who had his head cut off. In the sacrifice each brother was assigned specific functions--Duryodhana in charge of treasury, भीम cooking, Nakula the supply of provisions, etc. The अवभृत bath at गन्गा accompanied by divine music. Every visitor duly honoured, returned back. Jealousy of Duryodhana at the success of the sacrifice. <F>2:  भा. VII. 1. १३;; X. ७०. ४१; Chh. ७४-75.</F> The consecration ceremony of a king done by पृथु, वालि and others. <F>3:  Br. II. ३६. ११३; III. 7. २६८; 8. २५; ६३. ११६; ७२. २८; वा. ६२. ९५; ७०. २१.</F> [पगे३-068+ ३४]
(III)--the fifth गान्धार gra1mika. वा. ८६. ४२.

--the gift of ब्रह्माण्ड पुराण equal to the performance of १००० sacrifices. <F>1:  M. ५३. ५७.</F> The fruits of this यज्ञ are equal to fasting and praying to विष्णु on the अक्षयतृतीय day; <F>2:  Ib. ६५. 7.</F> a plunge in the प्रयागा is equal to this यज्ञ। <F>3:  Ib. १०६. २१.</F> Sacrifice performed by Soma when विष्णु was ब्रह्मा, शिव, the protector, Atri, the hota, भृगु, the अध्वर्यु, ब्रह्मा, the उद्गात, Sanaka and others were the Sadasyas, ten विश्वेदेवस् Camasa1dhvaryavas, and the three worlds दक्षिण; after this sacrifice the nine देवीस्, लक्ष्मी, सिनिवाली, कीर्ती, Vasu, धृती and others left their husbands and sported with Soma who acted as their consort; <F>4:  Ib. २३. १९-27; ५८. ५४; २३९. ३७; Vi. IV. 6. 8.</F> the title of Soma after the राजसूय. <F>5:  वा. ९०. २६.</F>
--a son of शम्भु. Br. III. 5. ४०.
--a son of विदूरथ and a hero; had two sons शोणाश्व and श्वेतवाहन equal to gods. M. ४४. ७७-8.

--a वीरमाता; a sister of Vasudeva; a daughter of शूर and Bhoja and queen of Jayasena, king of अवन्ती; <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. ३१ and ३९; Br. III. ७१. १५१; M. ४६. 4; Vi.
