IV. १४. ३१.</F> paternal aunt of कृष्ण and queen of अवन्ती. Her daughter मित्रविन्दा loved by कृष्ण who took her away by force and married her, as her brothers wanted to bestow [पगे३-069+ ३२] her on Duryodhana; <F>2:  भा. X. ५८. ३१.</F> according to the भागवत had two sons Vinda and Anuvinda; <F>3:  वा. ९६. १४९.</F> mother of two sons. <F>4:  Vi. IV. १४. ४३.</F>
--the first kings of the earth were Priyavrata and उत्तानपाद, sons of Manu; wielders of दण्ड; ety. of. वा. ५७. ५८.
--a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५१; Vi. ६१. ४४.
--a Janapada of the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. १४.
--a horse of the moon's chariot. वा. ५२. ५३.

--the collective name for the hundred sons of Raji; the latter won over the Asuras and finally established Indra on the throne and retired for penance; his sons deprived Indra of his power when the latter appealed to बृहस्पति; he increased Indra's strength by rituals and made the राजेयस् adopt the जीनधर्म and hence got outside the pale of the Veda, when Indra easily overcame them and got back his kingdom; beginning of जीन dharma and hetu- वाद. M. २४. ३५-49.

--a kingdom; if a king has no legitimate suc- cessor, it changes hands; ruled by ministry in the king's absence; is concerned with two main things (बाह्य) or foreign affairs and (abhyantara) or home policy; <F>1:  Br. III. ५०. २९-51; वा. ८८. ९४; ११२. १४. ४६.</F> of पृथु, described. <F>2:  M. 1. ११; १०. १०-35.</F> [पगे३-070+ २८]
--son of Dama, and father of सुधृति. भा. IX. 2. २९; Br. III. 8. ३५.
--son of भजमान. वा. ९६. १३५.
--one of the three wives of विवस्वान्; she was the daughter of Raivata and had a son Revata. M. ११. 2-3.
--a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५१.
--a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५१.
--a composer of साम Veda; <F>1:  Br. II. ३५. ४४.</F> a Kauthuka and a disciple of लोकाक्षि. <F>2:  वा. ६१. ३७-39.</F>
(II)--a शक्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ७५.
(III)--पारमेश्वर; pralaya or destruction at the end of which recurs the creation of the universe. वा. 5. 2 and 6.

(IV)--when the Asuras were born to प्रजापति night came into being; ety.; three यामस् of the night are full of darkness--त्रियामिका; then प्रजापति took another guise and created the devas; आसुरि of tamas quality; <F>1:  वा. 9. 6-१५; Br. II. १३. १४.</F> no [पगे३-071+ ३०] night for the region to the north of Meru and south of लोका- loka as the sun is far removed and the earth is surrounded by the lekha; <F>2:  वा. ५०. १०८.</F>  for the पितृस् is सुक्लपक्ष; <F>3:  Ib. ५१. ११; ५७. 9.</F> enters water in the morning. <F>4:  Ib. ५३. १४.</F>
--a मन्त्र of the ऋग् Vedins to be recited in tank ritual. M. ५८. ३४; ९३. १३१.
--the 4th kalpa. M. २९०. 3.

(I)--came with कृष्ण to mediate between परशुराम and विनायक; spoke on the non-differentiation of शिव and विष्णु; गणेश was a वैष्णव and परशुराम S4aiva. Br. III. ४२. २१, ४७-8; ४३. २१ and २९; ४४. २९; वा. १०४. ५२.
(II)--the goddess enshrined at वृन्दावन. M. १३. ३८.
--is कृष्ण. Br. III. ३६. ५६.
--son of Jayasena, and father of Ayuta. भा. IX. २२. १०.

(I)--Balabhadra of the यादव race and lord of द्वारका. (बलराम): brother of कृष्ण and सुभद्रा; See Baladeva; eldest son of Vasudeva by रोहिनी; father of two sons; welcomed कृष्ण to द्वारका; asked by कृष्ण to take one of the two heavenly chariots and get ready to fight जरासन्ध. राम blew his conch and began fighting [पगे३-072+ ४४] under his palmyra ensign; defeated the enemies on all sides. Fastened जरासन्ध with ropes but कृष्ण set him free; when जरासन्ध encamped on the यमुना, was consulted by कृष्ण; fought successfully जरासन्ध a third time and defeated बाण's army; when about to give a death-blow to जरासन्ध, a voice from the welkin said “do not kill जरासन्ध; go back.” Thus जरासन्ध was allowed to go back to his city. <F>1:  भा. I. ११. १६; X. ५०. १२-32; [५० (v)  8]; [५१ (v)  ३८-58]; [५२ (v) 1-6]; Br. III. ६१. २५; ७१. १६४-8; M. ४६. ११; वा. ८६. ३०; ९६. १६२; Vi. V. 6. 9; १३. १६.</F> Honoured by the याधव sabha, went with कृष्ण to the Gomanta hill; on the way met and bowed to परशुराम; helped कृष्ण in killing शृगाल Vas4udeva and was welcomed by the citizens of करवीरपुर. Stayed in this city for four months and returned to मथुरा with his brother. Attacked by जरासन्ध's army, fled with कृष्ण to Gomanta, pursued by जरासन्ध; reached द्वारका safe. <F>2:  भा. X. [५२ (v)  १३-41]; [५३(v) 1-२२]; ५२. 5-6 [5-7]; 7. १४ [1 and 2].</F> Married रेवती before the advent of Kali and hence very tall in appearance; with his plough he brought down her height to his level. <F>3:  Ib. X. ५२. १५ [११-12].</F> Heard of कृष्ण going alone to कुण्डिन and of the pre- parations of Caidya to fight him; went with his army to कुण्डिन and was welcomed by its king: Attacked Caidya's party pursuing कृष्ण and रुक्मिणी on that account. <F>4:  Ib. X. ५३. २०-21 and ३२; Ch. ५४ (whole).</F> Went to हास्तिनपुर with कृष्ण after the reported burning of the पाण्डवस् and कुन्ती: Pursued शतधन्वन् with कृष्ण and finding he had not the स्यमन्त in his person, sent कृष्ण back to द्वारका and himself to मिथिला as Janaka's guest; taught the use of the गदा (mace) to Duryodhana. Did not agree with कृष्ण in returning the jewel to अक्रूर. Left for Videha after Satadhanvan's death. <F>5:  Ib. X. ५७ (whole) ; ५८. 9 [4 and 5]; ६७ (v) ४२.</F> Attended Aniruddha's marriage at भोजकट where induced by Kalinga and other friends, Rukmin invited राम for a game of dice: in it, राम sometimes lost and sometimes gained. At his loss Kalinga laughed showing his teeth. When Rukmin played false it was referred to [पगे३-073+ ३८] a mediator who was unfortunately Kalinga and who there- fore maintained that Rukmi was in the right. A voice from the air said: “Rukmi tells an untruth”. Without heeding to this Rukmi insulted राम as a forester and herdsman and new to the art of dice. राम got enraged, took the mace and vanquished Rukmi: next he pulled out the teeth of Kalinga making fun of him all the time: others fled in fear; returned to द्वारका. <F>6:  Ib. X. ६१. २६-40.</F> His picture was among those drawn by चित्रालेखा: In- vaded बाण's city, fought with कुम्भाण्ड and कूप- कर्ण. Once drove to Vraja and spent two months there. During nights he sported and sang with Gopis on the यमुना drinking वारुणी and playing in the waters: changed the course of the river by his plough: <F>7:  Ib. X. ६२. २०; ६३. 3-8.</F> यमुना (s.v.) presented him with clothes, and ornaments with which he shone brighter than ever. <F>8:  Ib. X. Ch. ६५ (whole).</F> Desire for more territory. <F>9:  Ib. XII. 3. 9.</F> Wanted to give सुभद्रा in marriage to Duryodhana but कृष्ण was for her marriage with Arjuna. The latter went to द्वारका as an ascetic when राम one day invited him for भिक्ष। It was an opportunity for Arjuna and सुभद्रा to see each other. Arjuna carried her away on a festive occasion with कृष्ण's consent. राम's wrath was pacified by कृष्ण. Then he approved of the marriage and sent him presents. <F>१०:  Ib. X. ८६. 1-१२, १८.</F> Unable to recover the dead son of the द्वा- रका Bra1hman2a. <F>११:  Ib. X. ८९, ३१ and ४१.</F> Founded the city of Govardhana on the upper regions of the गोदावरी in the northern part of the Sahya mountain. <F>१२:  Br. II. १६. ४४.</F> The God of Love cursed to be born as the brother of कृष्ण at द्वारका. <F>१३:  M. 4. १७-21.</F> [पगे३-074+ ४७]

(II)--a son of दशरथ known for his righteous- ness and truth: परिक्षित् compared to him: An अवतार् of Hari born in the इक्ष्वाकु line; killed रावण; His fame equalled that of पृथु. <F>1:  भा. I. १२. १९; II. 7. २३-25; IV. २२. ६३; IX. १०. 3; M. १२. ५०-51.</F> King of the कोशल country and brother of लक्ष्मण, Bharata, and शत्रुघ्न: Disfigured सूर्पणका; killed मारीच (सुबाहु?) and other राक्षसस् in the यज्ञ of विश्वामित्र, bent and broke the bow of शिव and married सीता, put down the pride of परशुराम, spent a forest life with his wife in obedience to his father's command, killed Khara, त्रिशिरस् and १४,000 राक्षसस्; performed the funeral rites to जटायु, and Kabandha, killed वालि for the sake of सुग्रीव, put up a bridge across the sea, welcomed by the Lord of the seas; killed रावण and कुम्भकर्ण in their capital, ordered विभीषण to perform funeral rites to his dead kith and kin; recovered सीता; enthroned विभी- षण; left in an aerial chariot to अयोध्या, embraced Bharata, paid respects to Brahmanas, Gurus, elders and was crowned by वसिष्ठ just like Indra. In his period which was the त्रेतायुग, it looked like कृतयुग; sons, कुश and Lava; ruled for १०१० years; <F>2:  भा. V. १९. 1; VII. 1. ४४; १०. ३६; IX. १०. 3-५२; X. ४०. २०; XI. 4. २१; Br. III. 7. २०३; 8. ५४; ३७. ३०; ६३. १८५-193; ६४. १६; ७३. ९१; वा. ८८. १९२-4; Vi. IV. 4. ८७-102, १०४.</F> led an exemplary household life, by his loyalty to his wedded wife; performed sacrifices by giv- ing all his kingdom as दक्षिण, retaining only the ornaments and dress, and for सीता, her सौमान्गल्य। The Brahmanas returned the kingdom as they had no use for it and praised him. <F>3:  भा. IX. १०. ५३-6; ११. 1-7; वा. ७०. ४८; ८८, १८४, १९१-7.</F> One night he went about to know what people talked of his rule. He heard a person saying that राम was mad after सीता, taking her back though she was at another's house for long. Next day he abandoned her and left her at वाल्- मीकि's abode. Here were born his two sons--कुश and Lava. When सीता entered the bowels of the earth, राम led a life of celibacy for १३,000 years giving joy and happiness to the people of कोशल. Sent his brothers on दिग्विजय and him- self resided at the capital. <F>4:  भा. IX. ११. 8-३५.</F> Hearing of the रामचरित of वाल्- मीकि, rids one of कर्मबन्धस्; <F>5:  Ib. IX. ११. २३; M. १२. ५०-51.</F> resided on the banks of the कदली river; <F>6:  Ib. २२. ५३.</F> the २४थ् in the त्रेतायुग; 7th incarnation [पगे३-075+ ४१] with वसिष्ठ as Purohita; <F>7:  Ib. ४७. २४५; ११४. ३८; वा. ९८. ९२; १०८. १६, २४-5.</F> image of, generally ten तलस् in measurement; <F>8:  M. २५९. 1.</F> an earthly paradise created by राम in the upper regions of गोदावरी in Govardhana; <F>9:  वा. ४५. ११३.</F> performed श्राद्- dha at Rudrapada and दशरथ took the पिण्ड and went to Rudraloka blessing his son to go to विष्णुलोक; <F>१०:  Ib. १११, ६४.</F> an incarna- tion of नारायण. <F>११:  Vi. IV. १३. ५३.</F>

(III) (परशुराम)--a son of Jamadagni and रेणुका; an अम्श of Hari. Heard from his father that Arjuna-Haihaya had taken कामधेनु against his wish, and getting angry went to Haihaya's capital, cut off the king's head and took back the cow. In order to get rid of the sin of killing a king, he went on तीर्थयात्र for a year. <F>1:  भा. IX. १५. १३ to the end. Br. III. 1. ९८; ६६. ६३; ६९. ४८; M. ४३. ४०; २८५. 7.</F> In obedience to his father's command he killed his mother and brothers. This pleased the father and by his boon to his son, they all came back to life. During his absence, the sons of Haihaya killed his father, and on his return, found his mother crying over the death of Jamadagni. He took his axe, ran to माहिष्मती, rooted out all the क्षत्रियस् by defeating them twenty-one times; with their blood he made nine pools at स्यमन्तपञ्चक, where he worshipped his father's dead body and distributed the various regions to the priests; ended it with अवभृत in the सरस्वती। <F>2:  भा. IX. १६. 1-२३; M. २७३. ६६.</F> He would be a great sage in the forthcoming मन्वन्तर। A sage of the 8th मन्वन्तर। Even today resides in Mahen- dra contemplating on Hari; <F>3:  भा. VIII. १३. १५; IX. १६. २५-7.</F> was invited for the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर and came to see कृष्ण at स्यमन्तपञ्चक. <F>4:  Ib. X. ७४. 9; ८४. 4.</F> In his early years, with the leave of his parents, he visited his grand parents ऋचीक and सत्यवती; and after some stay there, called on his great grandfather भृगु, who advised [पगे३-076+ ३४] him to do तपस् in the हिमालयस् in honour of शिव. Engaged in तपस् by standing in water in the winter and on the fire in summer, by means of पद्मासन; शिव in hunter's guise visited him and asked him to quit his place. Suspecting him to be god, राम, appealed to him when शिव showed his true form. Instructed by शिव, he went round the earth on a pilgrimage tour. Helped the Devas in routing the Asuras; continued his तपस् by worshipping शिव as मृग- व्याध. Pleased, the Lord instructed him in the अस्त्र- ग्राम in its four aspects; went to ब्रह्मा for advice before he started on his crusade against the क्षत्रियस्. Advised to meet शिव and to get initiated into कृष्णमन्त्र कवचम्; शिव instructed him with त्रैलोक्य विजयम् मन्त्रम्। On his way back he stayed at पुष्कर and heard a male deer narrating the story of परशुराम and अकृतव्रण to the female deer, adding that his was not the उत्तम भक्ति but the मध्यम। He took the hint from that conversation that he would achieve his end by Agastya's grace. राम repaired to the hermitage of Agastya, followed by the deer. <F>5:  Br. III. Chh. २१-35.</F> मूलक afraid of; <F>6:  Ib. III. ६३. १७९; ७४. २६२.</F> a ब्राह्मण; <F>7:  वा. ९४. ४६; ९९. ४४९.</F> a slayer of the क्षत्रियस्; versed in Dhanurveda; <F>8:  Ib. ९१. ९१.</F> equal in prowess to Indra resplend- ent and a mixture of Brahma and क्षत्र; <F>9:  Ib. ६५. ९४.</F> consort धरनी. <F>१०:  Vi. I. 9. १४३.</F>
(IV)--a son of शिवदत्त. Br. III. ३५. १२.
(V)--a sage of the सावर्णि epoch. (eighth epoch वि। प्।). M. 9. ३२; Vi. III. 2. १७. [पगे३-077+ ३१]
(VI)--son of सेनाजित्. वा. ९९. १७३.
--son of Puramjaya; and father of Dhar- मवर्मा. Vi. IV. २४. ५६.
--a son of सारण. वा. ९६. १६५.
--the nineteenth अवतार् of Hari born among the वृष्णिस्. भा. I. 3. २३.
--a northern tribe. M. ११४. ४२.

--a R.; the महानदी touching the hill of प्रभास where राम bathed with his wife; all sins com- mitted in a hundred generations vanish as a result of a bath in this तीर्थ; <F>1:  वा. १०८. १६-18.</F> the मन्त्र for bathing in; <F>2:  Ib. १०८. २०.</F> sacred to रमना and the पितृस् <F>3:  M. १३. ४०; २२. ७०.</F> in अयोध्या. <F>4:  Ib. १९१. ९३.</F>
--is कृष्ण. Br. III. ३३. १२.
--a तीर्थ sacred to पितृस्; one visiting it after bath at गया has no rebirth. वा. १०८. २७.
--narrated by वाल्मीकि; originally nar- rated by ब्रह्मा in a hundred crore of verses to नारद who gave it to वाल्मीकि. M. ५३. ७१-2. [पगे३-078+ ४१]

--a son of विश्रवस् and केशिनी; <F>1:  भा. VII. 1. ४३; IV. 1. ३७; Br. III. 8. ४७; वा. ७०. ४१-8.</F> pleased शिव by his praises; <F>2:  भा. X. ८८. १६.</F> afraid of मान्धात; <F>3:  Ib. IX. 6. ३३.</F> heard of शीता's beauty and set up मारीच to display himself as a golden deer and entice राम away; <F>4:  Ib. IX. १०. १०</F> resented Arjuna-Haihaya's action in ruining his camp by blocking a river and was overpowered by him in the presence of women and imprisoned in his capital माहिष्मती; <F>5:  Ib. IX. १५. २१-2; Br. III. ३२. ५०; ६९. ३५-7.</F> pursued by the king of kites, compared to Indra being pursued by वीर; <F>6:  भा. IV. १९. १६-17.</F> killed by राम; <F>7:  Ib. VII. 1. ४४; १०. ३६; X. ४०. २०; Br. III. 8. ५४; M. १२. ५०; ४७. २४५; वा. ८८. १९७; ९४. ३५; ९८. ९२.</F> lost his king- dom through pride of power; desire for more territory. <F>8:  भा. X. ७३. २०; XII. 3. ११.</F> Vanquished by वालि at पुष्कर, agreed to be his ally. <F>9:  Br. III. 7. २४८-67.</F> A description of: <F>१०:  Ib. III. 8. ४८-50.</F> Killed अनरण्य; <F>११:  Ib. III. ६३. ७४; वा. ८८. ७५; Vi. IV. 3. १७; १५. 1.</F> also दशग्रीव; defeated by कार्तवीर्य and released at the request of Pulastya. <F>१२:  M. ४३. ३७-9.</F>
--a तीर्थ on the नर्मदा. M. १९१. २६.
--three-fold, as ब्रह्मा, Rudra and विष्णु; (four- fold, according to another reading; see Wilson's translation). Vi. VI. 8. 7.
--son of काशि (काशेय वि। प्।) and father of दीर्- ghatamas (tapas वि। प्।). भा. IX. १७. 4; Vi. IV. 8. 7.
--one of the nine sons of Ugrasena. भा. IX. २४. २४; Br. III. ७१. १३३; M. ४४. ७५; वा. ९६. १३२; Vi. IV. १४. २०. [पगे३-079+ २८]
--a daughter of Ugrasena, and wife of सृञ्जय. भा. IX. २४. २५ and ४२; Br. III. ७१. १३४; M. ४४. ७६; वा. ९६. १३३; Vi. IV. १४. २१.
--an आर्षेयप्रवर (अङ्गिरस्). M. १९६. २१.
--a son of Bharata. भा. V. 7. 3.
--son of Dama. Br. III. ६१. 8.

(also रासगोष्ठि)--in this was seen the same कृष्ण between every two गोपीस्, his hands over the shoulder of each गोपी engaged in dancing and singing, until all of them were tired. भा. X. Ch. २९ (whole); ३३. 2-२२; ३९. २९; ४७. ४३ and ६०, ६२.
--created by ब्रह्मा from his feet. Vi. I. 5. ४९.
--is कृष्ण. Br. III. ३३. २१.
--a clan belonging to Rohita प्रजापति. वा. १००. ६१.

(I)--(also स्वर्भानु); an Asura and the eldest of the १४ sons of Vipracitti and सिम्हिका; a servant of हिरण्यकशिपु; attained the status of a planet and immorta- lity by drinking अमृत in the disguise of a deva, and when detected and reported by the sun and the moon, the Lord threw his चक्र which cut off his head; hence he became the enemy of the sun and [पगे३-080+ ३६] the moon. <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ३७; १८. १३-14; VIII. 9. २४-26; Br. III. 5. १३; 6. २०; M. २५१. १२; वा. ५२. ८१; ६७. ६०; ६८. २०; १११. 5; Vi. I. १९. ५२; II. १२. २२.</F> Asked by Bali to refrain from battle; position on the शिशुमार about the neck; with Soma in the देवासुर war; <F>2:  भा. V. २३. 7; VIII. १०. ३१; २१. १९.</F> his daughter, was the wife of आयु. <F>3:  Vi. IV. 8. 1.</F> one of the nine planets; black in colour; it is said that the sun and the moon interrupt him and therefore both are attacked on new moon or full moon days; it is सुदर्शन that makes राहु withdraw himself; such occurrences are said to be eclipses; below the region of राहु is the abode of the Siddhas, चारणस् and विद्याधरस्; <F>4:  भा. V. २४. 1-4; Br. II. २३. ८९; २४. १३६; III. १४. 3; M. ९३. १०.</F> राहु leaving the moon is compared to getting rid of all sins by a bath in प्रयागा; <F>5:  Ib. १०६. २६.</F> attains Soma in Parvas and then आदित्यस्; <F>6:  Ib. १०७. १२; १२७. १०.</F> swal- lowing of the moon is a bad omen; <F>7:  Ib. १६३. ४२.</F> with sun or moon fit for gifts in अमरकण्टक; <F>8:  Ib. १८८. ८७.</F> rise of, must lead to the perform- ance of श्राद्ध. <F>9:  वा. ७८. 3.</F>
(II)--a परा god. Br. IV. 1. ५७.
--an आर्षेय pravara (अङ्गिरस्). M. १९६. 7.
--son of शुद्धोदन, and father of Prasenajit. वा. ९९. २८९; Vi. IV. २२. 8.
--son of स्वातिवर्ण (आन्ध्र) ruled for २५ years. M. २७३. 9.
--a head of a शिव gan2a. Br. III. ४१. २८.
--one of the २० Sutapa गणस्. वा. १००. १४.
--one of the २० Amita1bha गणस्. वा. १००. १६.
(I)--a son of Yadu. भा. IX. २३. २०.
(II)--son of वरान्गी and Divamjaya; married बृहती; father of चाक्षुष. Br. II. ३६. १०१; वा. ६२. ८७.
(III)--a son of Babhru; <F>1:  Br. III. ७४. 7.</F> killed by यौवनाश्व in a battle which lasted for १४ months. <F>2:  वा. ९९. 7-8.</F>
(IV)--(also वैरी). Even though insignificant, not to be neglected. It was भूत that slew हिरण्यकशिपु, and a woman चण्डिका that killed निशुम्भ, शुम्भ and महिष. Br. IV. २१. ४३ and ५५.
(V)--a son of शिष्टि(i1) and सुच्छाया, wife बृहती; his son चाक्षुष. M. 4. ३९; Vi. I. १३. 2.
(I)--the son of सुवीर (सुधीर वि। प्।) and father of Bahuratha. भा. IX. २१. २९-30; Vi. IV. १९. ५५. [पगे३-082+ २६]

(II)--a son of विश्वजित्--last link of the line; <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. ४९.</F> with him ends the बृहद्रथ line after ruling for १००० years; <F>2:  Vi. IV. २३. १२.</F> his minister Munika murdered him and enthroned his own son Pradyota. <F>3:  Ib. IV. २४. 1-2.</F> Ruled for thirty-five years. <F>4:  Br. III. ७४. ११४.</F>
(III)--a son of Acala, ruled for ५० years. M. २७१. २९.
(IV)--a son of वराङ्गी and Divamjaya. वा. ६२. ८७.
(V)--a son of मेधावि and father of Urva. Vi. IV. २१. १३.
(VI)--a son of शिष्टि and सुच्छाया. Vi. I. १३. 2.
--a son of अनादृष्ट; a राजऋषि; ज्वलना, daughter of दक्ष was his consort. वा. ९९. १२७-8.
--an apsaras; mother of the वेगवती group. Br. III. 7. १२ and २१.
--(bell metal) a gift of, pleases वायु. M. २६६. ६४.
--a son of Rucaka. भा. IX. २३. ३५.

(I)--a son of Kambalabarhis; father of रुक्मेषु and four other sons. Learned and wealthy; con- quered the whole earth by killing of कवचिनस् (soldiers in armour) with sharp arms and performed अश्वमेध; Ruk- मेषु became king and another पृथुरुक्म helped him; two other sons, Parigha and Hari were appointed over Videha; banished by them the other son ज्यामघ performed penance. <F>2:  M. ४४. २५-30; Va. ९५. २५-26.</F> ^1 Br. III. ७०. २६-9.
(II)--the father of परवृत्. Vi. IV. १२. १०.
--a son of भीष्मक. भा. X. ५२. २२.
--the lord of stars, trees, plants, etc. M. 8. 3.

--in गया where शन्कर sported with पार्वती and to which मरीचि went to gather fruits and flowers; interrupted in his enjoyment शिव cursed him, but the latter praised him in prayer; शिव promised him release from the curse if he would visit गया; the blackman became changed into white colour. वा. ११२. ३५-39. [पगे३-084+ ३४]
--a son of भीष्मक. भा. X. ५२. २२.
--a son of भीष्मक. भा. X. ५२. २२.
(I)--a son of भीष्मक. भा. X. ५२. ३२.
(II)--a son of महापौरव (nandana). M. ४९. ७३; वा. ९९. १८७.
--see प्रविष्ट Agni; son of अर्काग्नि. Br. II. १२. ४३; वा. २९. ४०.
--a daughter of Rukmi, and wife of Pra- dyumna; mother of Aniruddha. भा. X. ६१. १८ and २३ [9]; Vi. IV. १५. ३८-9.

--first son of the Vidarbha king, भीष्मक; brother of रुक्मिणी, and enemy of कृष्ण; capital भोजकट; wanted to give his sister रुक्मिणी to Caidya, though his brothers were for कृष्ण. <F>1:  भा. X. ५२. २२; ६०. १८; Vi. V. २८. 9; Br. IV. २९. १२२.</F> Followed कृष्ण running with his sister and near the नर्मदा fought with him. On an appeal from रुक्मिणी to spare his life, Rukmi was put to shame by the removal of his locks of hair and moustache and tied to his chariot; could not reconcile himself with कृष्ण's action and resolved to kill कृष्ण and then enter कुण्डिन. Released by बलराम, he built and lived in भोजकट with- out going back to कुण्डिन. <F>2:  भा. X. ५२. २५; ५३. 2; ५४. १८-36, ५२; Vi. V. २६ (whole).</F> Was met by शाल्व at कुण्डिन; was stationed by जरासन्ध at the western gate of मथुरा and on the eastern side during the siege of Gomanta. <F>3:  भा. X. ७६. 2 [9]; ७८ [5]; ५०. ११ [5]; ५२. ११ [6].</F> Gave his daughter to Pradyumna in marriage to please his sister, but continued to hate कृष्ण; prayed to शिव who gave him a bow saying that it would not harm Hari; went back to [पगे३-085+ ३८] भोजकट, afraid of meeting कृष्ण. <F>4:  Ib. X. ६१. १९-23 [1-7]; Vi. V. २८. 6.</F> Gave his grand- daughter to Aniruddha in marriage. When he invited राम for a game of dice on the occasion, he played falsely and insulted बलराम (s.v.) as a cowherd and forester at which he was struck dead. कृष्ण passed no comments on his death out of consideration for his brother and रुक्मिणी. <F>5:  भा. X. ६१. २५-39; II. 7. ३४; Vi. V. २८. ११-26.</F>

(I)--a daughter of भीष्मक and known as वैदर्भी. Married to कृष्ण according to गान्धर्व? (राक्षस) form; <F>1:  भा. III. 3. 3; X. ५२. १६-18; Br. III. ७१. २४२-6; Vi. I. 9. १४४; V. २६ (whole).</F> when she came to know of the proposal of her eldest brother Rukmi (s.v.) to give her in marriage to Caidya, she sent a letter through a ब्राह्मण to कृष्ण show- ing her unflinching devotion to him and requesting that she might be carried off when she would be on her way to the देवी temple on the day prior to the wedding as was the custom. That day she had her bath and decked herself with two clothes and many jewels. Her anxiety at not having heard from कृष्ण, when the ब्राह्मण came to tell her that कृष्ण would do the needful. Citizens were also for her marriage with कृष्ण. Well guarded and accom- panied by singing and dancing, रुक्मिणी entered the temple and prayed for कृष्ण's hand. After worshipping इन्द्राणी nearby she returned when कृष्ण carried her away in his chariot. Seeing the party of Caidya pursuing him, रुक्मिणी became nervous when कृष्ण consoled her. When Caidya was about to be killed by कृष्ण she appealed to the Lord to spare him; राम consoled her. The regular marriage and festivities followed. <F>2:  भा. X. Chh. ५२-54.</F> Mother of ११ sons and a daughter; gave birth to Pradyumna who was stolen by शम्बर and thrown into the sea. Recovered and taken back by माया- वती alias रती; रुक्मिणी remembered her lost son and won- dered at his exact resemblance. At that time came कृष्ण and नारद who explained the history of Pradyumna to [पगे३-086+ ३६] her great joy; <F>3:  Ib. III. 1. २८; X. ५५ (whole) ; M. ४७. १३, १५-16; वा. ९६. २३३; Vi. V. २७. 3, २७; २८. 1-2; ३०. ३५; ३२. 1.</F> was the chief queen of कृष्ण and more attached; would not like to be away from कृष्ण; when she was once fanning him gently कृष्ण cut a joke that his status was poor and that she could even then get married to a rich prince and enjoy luxuries. रुक्मिणी wept in deep distress and spoke words reiterating her full devotion to him. कृष्ण consoled her assuring her of his loyalty. <F>4:  भा. X. ६० (whole) ; ७०. 3; ९०. ३०.</F> Grave concern at कृष्ण not returning from the cave of जाम्बवन् for a long time. Her daughter चारुमती was married to the son of कृतवर्मन्. <F>5:  Ib. X. ५६. ३४; ६१. २४.</F> Attended the marriage of Aniruddha and रोचना at भोजकट; out of regard for her and बलराम, कृष्ण said nothing on Rukmi's death. <F>6:  Ib. X. ६१. २६-39.</F> Explained to Drau- पदी how she became married to कृष्ण; welcomed to हास्ति- napura by कुन्ती and द्रौपदी; served Kucela, a friend and classmate of कृष्ण. <F>7:  Ib. X. ७१. ४२; ७६. 2; ८०. २३; ८३. 8.</F> Entered fire on कृष्ण's decease; <F>8:  Ib. XI. ३१. २०. Vi. V. ३८. 1-2.</F> is लक्ष्मी. <F>9:  Ib. IV. १५. ३५.</F>
(II)--the goddess at द्वारवती. M. १३. ३८.
--in front of the वट in गया. वा. १०८. ५७.
(I)--a son of परवृत्. Vi. IV. १२. ११.

(II)--(ब्रह्मेषु) son of Rucaka (Rukma- kavaca ब्र्। प्। and म्। प्।) and brother of पृथुरुक्म; suc- ceeded his father with पृथुरुक्म as his lieutenant. भा. IX. २३. ३५; Br. III. ७०. २९; M. ४४, २८-9; वा. ९५. २८-9. [पगे३-087+ ३३]
(I)--one of the १४ clans of Apsaras, born of Vidyut or lightning. Br. III. 7. १९; वा. ६९. ५७.
(II)--son of सुतीर्थ. वा. ९९. २७४.
(I)--a Mt. at the base of Meru; <F>1:  भा. V. १६. २६.</F> south of Meru (वि। प्।); <F>2:  Vi. II. 2. २८.</F> East of अरुणोद. <F>3:  वा. ३६. १९; ४२. २९.</F>
(II)--a son of उशनस् and father of Purujit and four other sons. भा. IX. २३. ३४-35.
(III)--a यक्ष--son of पुण्यजनी and मणि- bhadra. Br. III. 7. १२३.

(I)--father of यज्ञ; a progenitor (प्रजापति- वा। प्।) a son of ब्रह्मा, married आकूती, a daughter of स्वा- yambhuva Manu and had a son, Hari-यज्ञ and a daughter दक्षिणा; <F>1:  भा. I. 3. १२; II. 7. 2; III. १२. ५६; २१. 5; IV. 1. 2-5; वा. 1. ६७. 3. 3; 9. १००; Vi. I. 7. १९, २०.</F> father of Raucya; <F>2:  Br. IV. 1. ५०, १०१; M. 9. ३५.</F> one of the five created to make one's taste intensified; through आकूती twins born, यज्ञ and दक्षिणा; they married and became parents of १२ sons called यामस्; <F>3:  Br. I. 1. ५८; II. 9. 1, 7, ४३.</F> groups of celestials each of ३३; Divaspati is Indra; the seven sages are Nirmoha and others; would have a num- ber of sons. <F>4:  Vi. III. 2. ३७-41.</F>
(II)--the father of Ajita devas. वा. ६७. ३३. [पगे३-088+ ४०]
--a son of Jayatsena. M. ५०. ३६.
(I)--wife of सूर्य. वा. ३०. ७३.
(II)--wife of आत्मवान्. वा. ६५. ९१.
--a daughter of दमघोष and श्रुतश्- रवा. वा. ९६. १५९.

(I)--born of anger of ब्रह्मा; name explained; ‘the weapon’: places assigned to him; his women; asked to procreate and be a प्रजापति; created beings which would burn the universe; persuaded by ब्रह्मा to stop this, and proceed to तपस्; expression of the तमस्। <F>1:  भा. III. १२, 7-२०; XI. 4. 5, ३०. ३८.</F> Claimed the remaining wealth of the Angirasa sacrificers as his own, which नाभाग thought was his. When नाभाग gave it to Rudra, the worshipful god presented him that wealth and disappeared; presented पृथु with a sword दशचन्द्र। <F>2:  Ib. IX. 4. 6-११; IV. १५. १७.</F> Taught क्रिया yoga to उमा; ब्रह्मा fled in fear from; <F>3:  Ib. XI. २७, 3; I. 7. १८.</F> came with the gods to द्वारका to ask कृष्ण to go back to वैकुण्ठ, and glorified Hari. <F>4:  Ib. IV. ch. २४ (whole) ; XI. 6. 1; 7. 1. VI. १७. २६-39.</F> No offerings by दक्ष in his sacrifice, and सती's voluntary death. Rudra created वीरभद्र to cause दक्ष's death. ब्रह्मा pacified Rudra and revived दक्ष and others. <F>5:  Ib. IV. chh. 4-7.</F> Rudra to bear the गन्गा; <F>6:  Ib. IX. 9. 7-9; X. 7. २९; ३९. ५३.</F> addressed कृष्ण as Hari; <F>7:  Ib. X. ६३. ३४-45.</F> worship of, leads to wealth and pleasure. Conferred a boon on वृकासुर and came to grief. <F>8:  Ib. X. ch. ८८ (whole).</F> [पगे३-089+ ४५] The presiding deity of the planet शनैश्चर. कालो- Rudra is शिव; at the end of a Kalpa he assumes the form of a Samvarttaka sun and burns down all the worlds. His own messengers of death; worshipped by काम with शत- रुद्रीय. <F>9:  Br. II. २४. ४९; III. 3. १०२ and १०९; २३. ६४; ६५. ३२; IV. 6. ७०; 7. ३८; १०. ८७; ११. ३३; १५. २४; ३०. 8; ३६. १६; ४०. १३ and २७.</F> Enshrined in गोकर्ण. <F>१०:  Ib. III. १३. २०.</F> Destroyed the god of Love and married उमा on the advice of the seven sages; marriage rites described. <F>११:  M. 4. १२, २२; ११. २९; १३. 9. and १४; १३८. २६; १५४. १९४-245, ४३९-83.</F> उमा's transfer as गौरी. <F>१२:  Ib. ch. १५५.</F> आडि, son of Andhaka, who attacked him was killed. <F>१३:  Ib. ch. १५६.</F> Agni's entrance into the harem when शिव made him drink his वीर। This was God सुब्रह्मण्य nursed by कृत्तिकस्; <F>१४:  Ib. ch. १५८.</F> blessed बाणासुर. <F>१५:  Ib. ch. १८८; २२५. १३; २५३. ४२.</F> Icon of; in the form of a १६ year old boy; worshipped before buildings; different postures detailed. <F>१६:  Ib. २५९. 3-२६; २६५. ४१; २६६. ४३; २६८. २२.</F>
(II)--born of Ananta from between the agitat- ed brows: Exhibited in eleven forms with शूल and three eyes. His name is सन्कर्षण. भा. V. २५. 3; XII. 5. 1-3.
(III)--a Mt. west of the शितोद. वा. ३६. २७.

(I)--(hundred?) Eleven in number, heads of गणस्: born of भूत and भूता: gods of the Vaivasvata epoch: <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. १७; VIII. १३. 4; M. 5. ३०-2; Vi. III. 1. ३१.</F> Fought with क्रोधवशस् in a देवासुर battle; <F>2:  भा. VIII. १०. ३४.</F> came with the other gods to द्वारका to invite कृष्ण back to वैकुण्ठ; <F>3:  Ib. XI. 6. 2.</F> worshipped for prowess. <F>4:  Ib. II. 3. 3.</F> Wait upon Indra. नीललोहित, a chief Rudra. <F>5:  Ib. VI. 7. 2; १०. १७; XI. १६. १३.</F> According to the ब्र्। प्। sons of सुरभी and कश्यप. These are अन्गारक, Sarpa, निऋऋति, Sadasaspati, अजैकपात्, Ahirbudhnya, ऊर्ध्वकेतु, Jvara, [पगे३-090+ ३२] Bhuvana, ईश्वर, मृत्यु, and कपालि. Their sisters were रोहिणी and गान्धर्वी: Their overlord was वृषध्वज. Live in शिवपुरम्: <F>6:  Br. III. 1. ६१; 3. ७२; 8. 6; ३२. २२; IV. 2. २७ and २५७; २० 47; ३०. 8.</F> Vanquished by रावण; <F>7:  Ib. III. 7. २५४; वा. ६६. ६८-70.</F> part of विष्णु; <F>8:  Vi. V. 1. १७ and ५८.</F> Rudras as different from महारुद्र, and as his attendants. For different names of Rudras see the text; <F>9:  Br. IV. ३३. ८४-96; ३४. 4-५२.</F> one of the seven देवगणस् of the Vaivasvata epoch: पितामहस् considered as; <F>१०:  M. 6. ४४; 9. २९; १९. 3.</F> their part in देवासुर wars. <F>११:  Ib. १५३. १६-21; १५४. २४; १७१. ३८-40; २४७. १०; २४८. २२; २८५. 8.</F>
--a place sacred to शिव. M. १८१. २५.
--a lake in the Kuru country, established by Bhava. Br. II. १८. ७२; वा. ४७. ६८-9.
--sacred to रुद्राणी; <F>1:  M. १३. ३२.</F> surrounds the hill अमरकण्ट in Kalinga; he who bathes at the place goes to Rudraloka and enjoys heavenly bliss. <F>2:  Ib. १८१. २५; १८६. १६-7.</F>
--in connection with warding off evils to the state indicated by omens; <F>1:  M. २३२. १४.</F> generally offered by four Yajurvedins on the occasion of भीम dva1das4i. <F>2:  Ib. ६९. ४४.</F>
--a Kinnara with a human face. वा. ६९. ३५.
--superiority of. वा. २०. ३५.
--the whole universe explained by शिव as. वा. २५. २१-6.
--in गया; <F>1:  वा 109. १८; ११०. ४८ and ५६.</F> performance of श्राद्ध at, by राम. <F>2:  Ib. ११०. ६४.</F>
--XII Manu; ऋतुधाम is Indra; Harita, Rohita and others are Gods. Tapasvi, Sutapa and others are seven sages; देववान् and others are his sons. Vi. III. 2. ३३,-6.
--to be recited on the occasion of founding a temple. M. २६५. २६.
--the place of the अवतार् of सहिष्णु. वा. २३. २१२.
--in honour of Rudra; <F>1:  M. १०१. 4, ७६.</F> leads one to गौरीलोक. <F>2:  Ib. १०१. ४३.</F>
--a son of महिष्मान्; had his capital at वारानसी. M. ४३. १०-11.
--the सूक्त of the सामवेद, to be recit- ed in tank ritual. M. ५८. ३६.
--a तीर्थ sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. २३.
--the identity of, with शिव. वा. १०१. ३५३.
--see under Manu.
--a Mother Goddess. M. १७९. ३१.
--one of the ten daughters of रुद्राश्व. वा. ९९. १२५.
(I)--a name of उमा: <F>1:  Br. III. १०. २२.</F> the world of. <F>2:  M. ६४. २६.</F> [पगे३-093+ २५]
(II)--the Goddess enshrined at रुद्रकोटि. M. १३. ३२.
(III)--in ३१स्त् Kalpa. वा. २३. १०.
--given by नारद to शीलवती, the wood- cutter's wife to redeem her husband, by reciting it after a ceremonial bath. Br. IV. 7. ५१.
--(त्रिपुरायतनम्) the temple of Rudra, the God of the Asuras. M. १३०. 4; १३१. १३.
--is Rudraloka. Br. IV. ३४. 3.
--a Mother Goddess. M. १७९. ३१.
--a son of पौरुषेय Ra1ks2asa. Br. III. 7. ९३.

--a hell: chiefly dealers in sheep, and cattle, Cakradhvaji, ब्राह्मण gambler, begger in the village, prisoner, washermen, sellers of soma, drinker of wine, meat eaters, killer of cattle, dealer in buffaloes, un- grateful friends, one who eats from bastard (कुण्डु) oil- monger, hunter of animals, iron seller and tale bearer go to this hell. See रुधिराम्भ. Br. IV. 2. १४८-69; वा. १०१. १४७ and १६३-66. [पगे३-094+ २७]

--(see रुधिरान्ध) a hell into which are thrown ब्राह्मण actors, fishermen, prisoners, informers, those living by their wives' immoral earnings, those attend- ing to secular affairs on Parvas, incendiaries, ungrateful companions, sooth-sayers, magic performers and sellers of the juice of trees. Vi. II. 3. २२-3.
--a राजऋषि becoming a ब्राह्मण Va1. ९१. ११७.
--a son of Vidyut; a राक्षस by conduct. वा. ६९. १२९.
--a queen of सुग्रीव, and daughter of Panasa; mother of three sons. Br. III. 7. २२१.
(I)--a Bhairava. Br. IV. १९. ७८.
(II)--a son of चाक्षुष Manu. M. 9. २५.
(III)--a son of अहीनक and father of पारियात्रक. Vi. IV. 4. १०६.
--a son of Vijaya; a righteous king; father of धृतक. Br. III. ६३. ११९; वा. ८८. १२१; Vi. IV. 3. २५.
--some animals, more cruel than serpents give the name of Raurava to a hell. क्रव्यादस् form a sub- division of this class. भा. V. २६. 1-१२. [पगे३-095+ २४]
--a son of स्वाति, and father of Citraratha. Vi. IV. १२. 2.
--a son of तितीक्षु, and father of Hema. भा. IX. २३. 4; Vi. IV. १८. ११-12.
--a son of स्वाहि and father of Citraratha, born at the performance of a great यग्ञ। भा. IX. २३. ३१; Br. III. ७०. १६-17.
--a son of स्वाह. M. ४४. १६.
(I)--a consort of सूर्य. Br. II. १३. ८०.
(II)--a R. of the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. २२; ४७. ४३.
--a queen of हिरण्याक्ष. भा. VII. 2. १९.
--son of the अवतार् of the २८थ् dva1para. वा. २३. २२३.
--a western country. Br. II. १६. ६०.
--from this came Rasa. वा. 4. ५३-4.
--a daughter of काश्यप and Diti; given by the father of ब्रह्मा. Mother of विश्वरूप. Br. IV. 9. 3. [पगे३-096+ २२]
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३२.
--a southern tribe. M. ११४. ४९; वा. ४५. १२९.
--one of the पञ्चार्षेयस् (भार्गवस्). M. १९५. ३४.
--a वर्ण s4akti. Br. IV. ४४. ५९ and ११८.
--fit for श्राद्ध. M. २२. ८६.
--a branch of कौशिक gotra. वा. ९१. ९९.
(I)--the father of रेणुका; a कौशिक and a sage. भा. IX. १५. १२; Br. II. ३२. ११८.
(II)--a branch of कौशिक gotra. Br. III. ६६. ७१. [पगे३-097+ ३१]
(I)--an इक्ष्वाकु king; his daughter कमली became the wife of Jamadagni. Br. III. ६६. ६०-2.

--a daughter of रेणु (सुवेणु-वा। प्।) and wife of Jamadagni; mother of परशुराम; <F>1:  भा. I. 9. 6; IX. १५. १२; वा. ६५. ९४; ९१. ८९-91; Vi. IV. 7. ३५-6.</F> went once to the Ganges for a pot of water for होम purposes, saw the Gandharva king Citraratha play- ing with the Apsaras and forgot the time for return- ing home. Jamadagni understood her mind and in a rage asked his sons to kill her. All refused but परशु- राम did it. Later as the result of the boon to his son who had pleased him by the act she came back to life. During the absence of राम, the sons of Arjuna (Haihaya) killed Jamadagni in spite of रेणुका's earnest protests. <F>2:  भा. IX. १६. 2-१३.</F> On राम returning, she cried out beating २१ times on her breast; liked to die on the funeral pyre when she heard from the air that her husband would soon be alive. Though she desisted from it, she died unable to bear her husband's death. <F>3:  Br. III. 1. ९७; ch. ३० (whole) ; ४५. ११.</F>
--one of the queens of Nakula; mother of Niramitra. Vi. IV. २०. ४८.
--a son of वत्सार; after him came the Raibhya गण. Br. III. 8. ३०.
(II)--a son of रोचमान. M. १२. २३.

(I)--a son of आनर्त्त; built the city of द्वारका (कुशस्थली) in the sea and was the lord of आनर्त्तस् and others. Father of a hundred sons of whom Kakudmi was the eldest. भा. IX. 3. २७-29; Vi. IV. 1. ६३-5.
(II)--a son of Kapotaroma. वा. ९६. ११६.
(I)--wife of Mitra. भा. VI. १८. 6.

(II)--a daugter of Kakudmin (Kakudmi: म्।प्।). Raivata: taken by her father to ब्रह्मा for a suitable bride- groom and stayed there for a long time; at his suggestion she was married to बलराम (Baladeva); being born before the advent of Kali, she was very tall, and बलराम con- trived to shorten her height with the end of his plough- share; came to see कृष्ण and सत्यभामा returning from Indra's abode; <F>1:  भा. IX. 3. २९-36; X. ५२. १५ [2 and १२]; [६७ (v)  ५०]. Br. III. ६१. २४; M. १२. २४; Vi. IV. 1. ६६, ९५-6.</F> mother of निशित and Ulmuka; <F>2:  Ib. V. २५. १९.</F> embraced the corpse of राम and entered fire. <F>3:  Ib. V. ३६. ११; ३८. 3.</F>
(III)--an evil spirit. भा. X. 6. २८.
(IV)--wife of Vidhama. Br. III. ५९. १२; वा. ८४. १२. [पगे३-099+ २५]
(V)--a वर्ण s4akti. Br. IV. ४४. ६१.
(VI)--a Mind-born mother. M. १७९. १३.
(VII)--see शुष्करेवती. M. १७९. ७३.
(VIII)--a constellation <F>1:  वा. ४९. ८१; ५३. १०९; ६६. ५२; ८२. १४.</F> that stops always in Raivataka (s.v.); sacred to शनैश्चर. <F>2:  Br. II. १९. ८७; २४. १३४.</F>
--born of सम्ज्ञ as a mare of the Sun god. Vi. III. 2. 7.
--a R. near the माहिष्मती in the भारत vars2a. भा. X. ७९. २१; V. १९. १८.
(I)--a son of Sumati, and father of दुष्यन्त. भा. IX. २०. 7.
(II)--a son of वत्सार; his children, Raibhyas. वा. ७०. २५-6.
(III)--a son of Rebhya and a ब्रह्मवादिन्. Br. II. ३२. ११२; III. 8. ३०; वा. ५९. १०३.
--one of the three belonging to कश्यप group. Br. III. 8. ३३.
(I)--a Rudra and a son of भूत and सरूपा. भा. VI. 6. १७; M. 5. २९; VI. I. १५. १२२. [पगे३-100+ २९]

(II)--a son of Reva (known also as Kakud- min); king of आनर्त्तस्; had a daughter रेवती (s.v.) whom he took to ब्रह्मा to consult him as to a suitable bride- groom. The music of हाह and हूहु was going on, and when it was finished, there was a different कल्प in the earth; was advised to give her to बलराम, and so he did. भा. X. ५२. १५ [1-११]; Br. III. ६१. २०; M. १२. २३; वा. ८६. २५.

(III)--the fifth Manu; during his epoch were देवबाहु and six other sages, Gods named आभूतर- jasas. <F>1:  M. 9. १९-22; वा. ६२. 3.</F> Vibhu was Indra; अमिताभ and other three गणस् of gods each १४ in number; हिरण्यरोम and other six formed the सप्तऋषिस्; Balabandhu and others were his sons; of the Priyavrata line. <F>2:  Vi. III. 1. 6, २०-4.</F>
(IV)--a class of reptiles, as arrows of Tripu- रारि. M. १३३. २५.
(V)--a king and father-in-law of Baladeva. Vi. V. २५. १९.
(VI)--a प्रसूत god. वा. ६२. ६०.
(I)--Mt. in शाकद्वीप. Here रेवती nak- षत्र stops always, and hence sacred to it. Br. II. १९. ८७; वा. ४९. ८१; Vi. II. 4. ६२.
(II)--(Mt.) in भारतवर्ष; <F>1:  वा. ४५. ९२; भा. V. १९. १६; Br. II. १६. २२.</F> here Dvivida met राम and provoked him to a battle and in it was killed. <F>2:  भा. X. ६७. 8-२५.</F> [पगे३-101+ २५]
--a तीर्थ sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ७४.
--a Pravara of the भार्गवस्. M. १९५. ३९.
--a tribe of the Vindhyas. वा. ४५. १३२.
--to be worshipped in housebuilding and palace building. M. २५३. २६; २६८. १७.
(I)--a son of दक्षिणा and a तुषित god. भा. IV. 1. 7-8.
(II)--the name of Indra of the स्वारोचिष epoch. भा. VIII. 1. २०.
(III)--a son of Vasudeva. Br. III. ७१. १८२.
(IV)--a son of उपदेवा. वा. ९६. १७९.
(I)--one of Vasudeva's wives, and mother of Hasta and other sons. भा. IX. २४. ४५ and ४९.
(II)--grand daughter of Rukmi, married to Aniruddha. भा. X. ६१. २५.
(III)--a Mind-born mother. M. १७९. २३. [पगे३-102+ २६]
(II)--a son of आनर्त्त and father of Reva. M. १२. २२-23.
(III)--a son of उपदेवी and Vasudeva. M. ४६. १७.
--a son of उषा and विभावसु. भा. VI. 6. १६.
--a son of स्वारोचिष Manu. भा. VIII. 1. १९.
--the two mothers of the world (Heaven and Earth) worshipped for security of place. भा. II. 3. 5.
--a kind of hell; here fall slayers of cows, of phoetus murderers and those who set fire to cities. वा. १०१. १४६, १५२; Vi. II. 6. 2 and 8.
--a R. in भारत vars2a. भा. V. १९. १८.
(I)--see Citraratha. भा. IX. २३. 7; Vi. IV. १८. १६.
(II)--the famous son of Vidarbha and father of Babhru; attained wisdom from नारद. भा. IX. २४. 1-2; Vi. IV. १२. ३८-9.
--fourteen गणस् of gods; live in मह, तप and जन lokas. वा. २४. 2. [पगे३-103+ ३४]
(I)--a siddha. भा. VI. १५. १४.
(II)--a विद्याधर chief in वेणुमन्त hill. वा. ३९. ३८.

--a pupil of व्यास in charge of इतिहास- पुराण, and father of सूत. Himself a sage and सूत. Adopted as ब्रह्मा by the sages in their यज्ञ at नैमिष; also लोमहर्षण (s.v.); killed by बलराम for his failure to honour him by rising from his seat. <F>1:  भा. I. 4. २२; X. ७८. २२-30, ३६; Br. I. 1. १८. II. १६. 3; २२. 2; २४. 1; वा. ६७. 2-3; Vi. III. 4. १०.</F> His was the मूल- सम्हिता; adept in आख्यान narrated royal genealogies. <F>2:  Br. I. 1. १४; II. ३४. १३-16; ३५. ६८; III. ५९. 3; IV. 4. 8.</F> Had six disciples. <F>3:  Vi. III. 6. १६.</F>
--the पुराण (मूल) सम्हिता compiled by रोमहर्षण. Vi. III. 6. १८.
--a kingdom of the West watered by Sindhu. Br. II. १८. ४८; वा. ४७. ४६.
(I)--same as Rohita. M. १२२. ९७.
(II)--the banyan tree in the रमणक vars2a. वा. ४५. 4.

(I)--a daughter of वाल्मीकि; one of Vasudeva's wives, and mother of Gada, बलराम and five other sons besides a daughter, चित्रा. <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. ४५-6; X. 1. 8; Br. III. ७१. १६१-5; वा. ९६. १६०-3; Vi. V. 1. ७४-6; 2. 2; 5. 5; 6. ११; IV. १५. १८-9.</F> Had her residence at Nanda- gokula. Hari ordered योगमाया to transfer his धाम in the womb of देवकी to that of रोहिणी. This was the future बलराम Sankars2ana. नारद spoke about this to Kamsa. <F>2:  भा. X. 2. 7-8, १५.</F> [पगे३-104+ ३४] Her joy at the birth of कृष्ण, and helped यशोदा in her रक्ष ritual to कृष्ण; joy at his escape from कालीय; intensely attached to राम; surprised at कृष्ण holding the Govardhana; came to see him taking पारिजात from Indra's abode. कृष्ण's respects to; <F>3:  Ib. X 5. १७; 6. १९; ११. १२; १५. ४४; १७. १५; २५. ३०; ३६. १७; [६७ (v) ४७-8].</F> went to Syamanta- पञ्चक for the solar eclipse, met यशोदा there and embraced her. Lamented the decease of कृष्ण and राम. <F>4:  Ib. X. ८२. ३७; XI. ३१. १८.</F> Entered fire after their deceuse; <F>5:  Vi. V. ३८. 4.</F> also known as पौरवी. <F>6:  M. ४६. ११.</F>
(II)--one of कृष्ण's wives; a देवी; mother of दीप्तिमत्, ताम्रपक्ष and other sons. भा. X, ६१. १८; Br. III. ७१. २४२; वा. ९६. २३३. Vi. V. २८. 4; ३२. 2.
(III)--a wife of महादेव-Candramatanu of शिव; mother of Budha. Br. I. 2. 9; II. १०. ८४; M. ५५. १२; १३९. २५; वा. २७. ५६; ६६. २२. Vi. I. 8. 8.
(IV)--a daughter of सुरभी and कश्यप; a sister of the Rudras; mother of four daughters--सुरूपा, हम्सकाली (कीला), भद्रा and कामदु(a)घा. Br. III. 3. ७३-5; वा. ६६. ७१-72.
(V)--a constellation important for श्राद्ध per- formance; <F>1:  Br. III. १८. 3; M. १७. 3; ५४. 9; वा. ८२. 3.</F> the worship of, in गो सहस्र दानम्। <F>2:  M. १६३. ४१; १७१. ३२; २७८. १४.</F>
(VI)--had Saumya as her son. वा. 2. 9.

--with which नारायण is wor- shipped with the names of the moon; to be observed on the full moon day when रोहिणी is the नक्षत्र or Monday being [पगे३-105+ २८] a शुक्लपञ्चमि; even शूद्रस् can observe it; a list of flowers given for worship; it lasts for a year; at the end a furnished bed with looking glass, etc., to be given to a learned श्रोत्रिय; the giver attains the world of Candra; even women may observe it. M. ५७. 3-२७.

(I)--a son of हरिश्चन्द्र; knowing that he would be sacrificed, went out of his kingdom. Having heard of the decease of his father, he wanted to return but was prevented by Indra. At the end of the sixth year, he pur- chased सुनश्शेप and returned home. Father of Harita. भा. IX. 7. 9-२१; 8. 1; Br. III. ६३. ११७; M. १२. ३८; वा. ८८. ११९.
(II)--a son of वपुष्मती, after whom came the kingdom of Rohita. Br. II. १४. ३२-3; वा. ३३. २८-29; Vi. II. 4. २३, २९.
(III)--a son of सत्यभामा and कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. २४७; M. ४७. १७; वा. ९६. २३८.
(IV)--a progenitor and a son of दक्ष; परा, मरीचि, and सुधर्मान gan2as, all of १२ gods each are from him. Br. IV. 1. ५६-61; वा. १००. ६०.
(V)--a Mt. a hill of शाल्मलिद्वीप. M. १२२. ९६.

--one of the five deva गणस् of the 4th ऋतु Sa1varn2a Manu; of ten gods; mind-born sons of Budha with ten branches; <F>1:  Br. IV. 1. ८३-6; वा. १००. ८७.</F> of the XII epoch of Manu. <F>2:  Vi. III. 2. ३४.</F> [पगे३-106+ २७]
(I)--a son of शठ. Br. III. ७१. १७०.
(II)--of the रोहिणि family. वा. ९६. १६८.
(III)--son of हरिश्चन्द्र and father of Harita. Vi. IV. 3. २५.
--an आर्षेय pravara (भार्गव). M. १९५. ४१.
(I)--see Manu (s.v.). Br. II. ३६. 4; IV. 1. ९५.
(II)--a son of Ruci, a प्रजापति of the Vaivas- vata epoch; <F>1:  Br. IV. 1. ५०.</F> the ninth Manu. <F>2:  M. 9. ३५; वा. १००. ५४.</F>
(I)--a मुहूर्त of the afternoon. Br. III. 3. ३९; वा. ६६. ४०.
(II)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३३.
--a मन्त्र of the ऋग् Vedins, to be recited in tank ritual; <F>1:  M. ५८. ३४.</F> a सूक्त of the Yajur Vedins to be recited in tank ritual. <F>2:  M. ५८. ३५; ९३. १०२ and १३१.</F>
--the गणेश्वरस् who sprang from the hair roots of the angry वीरभद्र. वा. ३०. १४२. [पगे३-107+ ३१]
--a son of अहम्याति (सम्जाति-वा। प्।) and father of ऋक्यु(s2u). Nine other sons through the Apsaras, घृटाची. भा. IX. २०. 3-5; वा. ९९. १२३. Vi. IV. १९. 1-2.
--a कला of Rudra and a शक्ति. Br. IV. १९. ७३; ३५. ९६.
--the kingdom of the; the Ganges flows through this. M. १२१. ४३.
--a कश्यप and a त्रयार्षेय. M. १९९. १२.
--was the milkman of the Pretas and राक्षसस् for milking the cow-earth; the essence was blood; सुमालि acted as the calf. M. १०. २३.
--son of रोमहर्षण; name of सूत- पौराणिक. भा. I. 2. 1.

(I)--one of the २८ hells ever burning and under the earth; he who is self-centred and accumulates wealth at the cost of others suffers here; especially from animals, called Rurus (s.v) more cruel than serpents. <F>1:  भा. III. ३०. २८; V. २६. 7-११.</F> False witnesses, men who are partial and speak untruth, people guilty of infanticide and of incendiarism go to this; also महारौरव; <F>2:  Br. I. 1. १४१; IV. 2. १४६, १५१-3, १८०; 7. ७६; ३३. ६०; Vi. I. 6. ४१; II. 6. 2, 7.</F> those who perform rituals with joy and wrath also go here; below this is the तप। <F>3:  Br. II. 9. ६५; वा. १०१. १४६, १५१-2, १७७, १८०, २०५; ११०. ४२.</F> [पगे३-108+ २४]
(II)--the flesh of the Ruru antelope for श्राद्ध. M. १७. ३४.
(III)--the fifth kalpa. M. २९०. 4.
--a सूक्त of the साम samhita1 recited in tank ritual. M. ५८. ३७.
--a kingdom of the West, watered by the Sindhu. Br. II. १८. ४७.
--a मुहूर्त fit for दानस्. M. १७. 3.
--a branch of सामन् for recitation at श्राद्ध. M. १७. ३८.
--(बलराम); reminded कृष्ण of his divi- nity and mission on earth when he had been overpowered by कालीय. Vi. V. 7. ३३-42.
--an आर्षेय pravara (Angiras). M. १९६. 9.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. १९. [पगे३-109+ २९]

--one of the three forms of गृअहबलि; in addition to the procedure in the अयुतहोम, गरुड worship is added; fulfils all desires; if no specific benefits are wanted, it grants Brahmapada. M. ९३. 5, ८४-118; २३९. 1-१६.

(I)--a son of दशरथ and younger bro- ther of राम; <F>1:  भा. IX. १०. 3; V. १९. 1 and 6.</F> took part in the लन्का expedition; respected the ब्रह्मणस् and elders; present at राम's coronation; father of Angada and Citraketu, <F>2:  Ib. IX. १०. १९, ४१-7; ११. १२; Br. III. ३७. ३१; ६३. १८५; वा. ८८. १८४, १८७; १०८. २५; Vi. IV. 4. ८७, १०४.</F> whose cities were Kora- यण and Candracakra, near the हिमालयस्; created with राम by ललिता, he killed मेघनाद in भण्डासुर war. <F>3:  Br. IV. २९. ११४.</F>

(I)--a daughter of the king of the Madras; heard of कृष्ण's glory from नारद and set her mind on [पगे३-110+ ४३] him. It was arranged that in a स्वयम्वर he, who hit a target (fish) correctly by looking at its reflection in the water below was to wed her. All tried in vain but कृष्ण succeeded and married her; when she was taken in a chariot, other kings attacked कृष्ण; he vanquished all of them, and reached द्वारका. Addressed द्रौपदी at length on her marriage; <F>1:  भा. X. ५८. ५७; ८३. 6, १७-39; M. ४७. १३; वा. ९६. २३४; Vi. V. २८. 5.</F> sons, गात्रवत् and others. <F>2:  Ib. V. ३२. 4.</F>

(II)--a daughter of Duryodhana married by साम्ब in a स्वयम्वर। For this the Kurus like कर्ण and Duryodhana took him captive after a severe fight and threw him into prison. Afraid of बलराम's prowess, Duryodhana agreed to her marriage with साम्ब and sent a rich dowry. भा. X. ६८. 1-१२, ४३-51.
(III)--an Apsaras. Br. III. 7. 7.

(I)--also रमा and श्री--born out of the churning of the ocean; seeing her unequalled beauty, the sages anointed her amidst divine music and dancing. Every god presented her with something or other. She desired to be a partner of Hari, and the latter assigned her a place in his chest. Presented Prthu with inexhaustible wealth; <F>1:  भा. VIII. 8. 8-२९; IV. १५. १६.</F> a कला of ब्रह्मा; a देवी attending on Soma; a वर्ण s4akti; <F>2:  Br. III. ६५. २६; IV. १९. ७४; ३५. ९४; ४४. ६२.</F> a mind-born daughter of ब्रह्मा; <F>3:  M. १७१. ३२.</F> consort of विष्णु; <F>4:  Ib. १८७. ४५.</F> brought forth काम by Dharma; <F>5:  Ib. १७१. ४२.</F> left नारायण and loved Soma along with eight other देवीस्; <F>6:  Ib. २३. २४.</F> wealth; <F>7:  Ib. २२१. १२; २४६. ६२; २४७. ३०; २८५. २०.</F> residing in the lotus in श्री सर; <F>8:  वा. ३७. 8.</F> with the appellation of सिता in गया. <F>9:  Ib. १०६. ५८; ११२. ६४.</F> [पगे३-111+ ३०]

I. 7. २३, २८; 8-२१.</F> a mother goddess as मूल- प्रकृति or माया; <F>3:  Br. IV. 7. ७२.</F> abode of, in the Meru. <F>4:  Vi. II. 2. ४७.</F>
(III)--a daughter of भृगु and ख्याती and sister of धाता and विधाता; <F>1:  Vi. I. १०. 2.</F> gave Baladeva an ear-ring and a lotus garland at वृन्दावन. <F>2:  Ib. V. २५. १६.</F>
--in the कूर्म पुराण; <F>1:  M. ५३. ४८.</F> the २३र्द् kalpa. <F>2:  Ib. २९०. 8.</F>

--one of the five sons of Yadu. Br. III. ६९. 2; M. ४३. 7; वा. ९४. 2.

--a daughter of मातन्ग and hence मातन्गी. Br. IV. २८. ४०; ३१. १०३-4.

--an उपद्वीप to जम्बूद्वीप; a great city in Tri- कूट; was besieged by राम and his वानर hosts and made desolate by रावण's indiscretion; विभीषण as king of; जाम्बवती alluded to this incident in praising कृष्ण; <F>1:  भा. V. १९. ३०; IX. १०. १६-33; X. ५६. २८; वा. ४८. २८.</F> capital of रावण; <F>2:  Br. III. 7. २६६; ६९. ३५; M. ४३. ३७.</F> conquered by Arjuna; one of the places for residence of Agastya. <F>3:  Ib. ६१. ५१.</F>
--a ऋत्विक् at ब्रह्मा's यज्ञ। वा. १०६. ३६.

--a daughter of दक्ष, wife of Dharma and mother of घोष. Vi. I. १५. १०५, १०७.

(III)--a daughter of दक्ष; <F>1:  वा. १०. २५; Vi. I. 7. २३.</F> married Dharma; <F>2:  Br. II. 9. ५०, ६१.</F> mother of Vinaya. <F>3:  वा. १०. ३६; ५५. ४३; Vi. I. 7. ३०.</F>
--a son and commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८३; २६. ४८.
(I)--a daughter of Meru and wife of इलावृत. भा. V. 2. २३.

--a mother Goddess. M. १७९. २८.
(I)--a daughter of दक्ष and one of the १० wives of Dharma. Mother of Vidyota and घोष. भा. VI. 6. 4. 5; Br. III. 3. 2 and ३२; M. 5. १५, १८; २०३. 8; वा. ६६. 2, ३३.

(III)--a son of शान्तिकर्णि (शतकर्णि- वि। प्।), ruled for १८ years; father of Pilaka. M. २७३. 4; Vi. IV. २४. ४५.

--the dissolution pertaining to प्रकृति; a state in which there is no rain for a century, famine rages and the fire of deluge consumes all spaces, accompanied by violent winds and so on. It is of four kinds; नित्य, नैमित्तिक, प्रा- कृतिक, and आत्यन्तिक; deluge, when the universe merges when the गुणस् are in a balanced state. भा. XII. 4. (whole); M. 1. ३३; वा. 5. 9. [पगे३-116+ ३६]
--the seven clouds (named) which cause Pralaya. They take their origin from the steam caused by fire and cause the several oceans to become one. M. 2. 8-9.

(I)--उपाख्यान of; narrated to Agastya by हयग्रीव-Vis2n2u; different names like शक्ति, पराशक्ति, भगवती are given. <F>1:  Br. IV. 5. (whole) ; Chh. १७-18.</F> Originally mind-born daughter of ब्रह्मा, named प्रकृति. then as Mohini in the churning of the milk ocean; originator of all gods and creatures. The third was the form of ललिता when she killed भण्ड, in consequence of the penance done in her honour by Indra, and out of his offer- ings. All gods call on Her and praise Her. Finding her reigning alone, ब्रह्मा remembered a form of शन्कर, as कामेश्वर, who was married to the देवी, the sister of Hari; rejoicing and presents on the occasion. ललिता came to be known as कामेश्वरी. War with भण्ड assuming the office of श्रीदण्डनाथा; sovereignty of; <F>2:  Ib. IV. Chh. 6, 8, १०, १२-16.</F> description of the nine parvas of चक्रराजरथ and seven parvas of Geya- cakraratha sacred to ललिता. She rode on the Cakraratha with the साम्राज्य umbrella amidst war-music. भण्ड treated it as a woman's march and with contempt. Night attacks and deceitful attacks by भण्ड's soldiers; assisted by मन्त्रिणी and दण्डनाथा, ललिता's march. गणनाथ's aid in encouraging the fallen शक्तिस् and vanquishing the asuras. For this the honour of first worship was awarded. Burning of the city शून्यकम् along with non-combatants. भण्ड's death and ललिता's victory; created काम and consoled Rati. Glad at the birth of कुमार and his marriage with Deva- सेना. Went back to her city, श्रीपुरम्. <F>3:  Ib. IV. Chh. १९, २०, and २१; २६, २७, २९, ३०; ३७. ८४.</F> पञ्चदशाक्षरी and other मन्त्रस् sacred to ललिता; meditation of. <F>4:  Ib. IV. ३८. 8-३१.</F> [पगे३-117+ २८]
(II)--the Goddess at प्रयागा. M. १३. २६.
(III)--a Goddess enshrined at सन्तान. M. १३. ३४.
(IV)--a name of सती, wife of शिव. M. ६०. ११.
--one of the seven sons of Vidyoparicara. वा. ९९. २२२.

(I)--a son of राम, born and brought up in वाल्- मीकि's आश्रम; <F>1:  भा. IX. ११. ११; M. १२. ५१; वा. ८८. १९८.</F> ruled over Uttara कोशल with श्रावस्ति as capital. <F>2:  Br. III. ६३. १९८; वा. ८८. २००.</F>
(II)--a measurement of five क्षणस्। Br. II. 7. १९; वा. १००. २१४.
(I)--a son of राक्षस Madhu, killed by शत्- rughna in Madhuvana. भा. IX. ११. १४; Br. III. ६३. १८६; वा. ८८. १८५; Vi. I. १२. 4; IV. 4. १०१.
(II)--a son of ज्योतिष्मत्, after whom लवण- वर्ष took the name. Br. II. १४. २७-9; वा. ३३. २४.
(III)--a son of Mahogra, prayed to शिव. Br. III. 7. ९१.

(I)--one of the eight सौभाग्यस्. M. ६०. 9.
(II)--a kingdom of कुशद्वीप after लवण. Br. II. १४. २९; १९. ५८; वा. ३३. २५; ४९. ५३.
(III)--also लवण sindhu, लवणाम्बुधि-- an ocean of salt; <F>1:  Br. III. ५२. ४२; IV. ३१. १८; वा. ३४. १२.</F> origin from waters of the अण्डम्; <F>2:  M. 2. ३४.</F> jalam. <F>3:  Ib. २५१. ३४.</F>

--Origin of; came out of a ball of ever-burning fire and grew and grew; विष्णु and ब्रह्मा undertook to find out its beginning and the end. It was all effulgence. They found it impossible and prayed to शिव who initiated them into माहेश्वरम् बलम्। <F>1:  Br. II. २६. २१ to the end; २७. ३०-101; वा. ५५. २१-61.</F> Establishment of the cult in the presence of शिव and the sages; is जीव, mahat; leads to kaivalya; <F>2:  Br. IV. 3. २२, ५६-9, ७९.</F> found in गोदावरी; <F>3:  M. २२. ५७.</F> worship of at Benares relieves one of rebirth; <F>4:  Ib. १५४. ३५०; १८५. ५७.</F> its size for installation in the palace depends on the measurement of the palace; nine varieties are distinguished. The technique of the making of a [पगे३-122+ २३] Linga is furnished in detail. It may be of gems, स्पटिक, of stone, earth, or wood. <F>5:  Ib. २६३. 1, ११, २५.</F>
--गदाधर became turned to Linga in Kaliyuga; a प्रपितामह. वा. १११. ८४.
--a sacred place on the नर्मदा. M. १९१. ५१-2.
--ineligible for श्राद्ध. M. १६. १७.
--story and praise of. वा. Ch. ५५.
--a Svara शक्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ५७.
--the courtesan who had faith in शिव and who did the दान of लवणाचल and gained heaven. M. ९२. २३.
--the observer of this व्रत attains the विष्णुलोक. M. १०१. 5.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. १९. [पगे३-123+ २९]
--a companion of Puramjana; allegorically पायु। भा. IV. २५. ५३; २९. १५.

(I)--eight groups of Gods of the चाक्षुष epoch; <F>1:  Br. II. ३६. ६७, ७६; M. 9. २३; Vi. III. 1. २७.</F> Manojava, प्रघास, Pracetas, वात, ध्रुवक्षिति, Adbhuta, Avana and बृहस्पति. <F>2:  वा. ६२. ६३-4.</F>
(II)--a class of पितृस् propitiated on every New Moon day. वा. ५६. २१.
--a scribe who is an expert in all languages and who is versed in all शास्त्रस्; characteristics of writing; a scribe must be able to reproduce in a few sentences much that is spoken. M. २१५. २६-8.
(I)--the sun standing above this, results in the end of the five year Yuga. M. १२४. ६४; १४१. ३५.
(II)--of the earth; on account of this the sun is seen above though at a height of १००० Yojanas. वा. ५०. ११०.
--the Goddess from the back part of नृसिम्ह; follower of वागीशि. M. १७९. ६८.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १८.

--the पुराण of ११,000 verses; narrated by महेश्वर in the midst of अग्निलिङ्ग, a treatise on the four means (Trivarga and मोक्ष) at the end of the आग्नेयकल्प; he who makes a gift of it with cow and sesame in फाल्गुणि attains oneness with शिव. M. ५३. ३७-38.
--an आत्रेय gotraka1ra. M. १९७. 3.
--an आर्षेय pravara (Angiras). M. १९६. २१.

--seven in number, one above the other like several umbrellas spread over. To the usual seven are added वैकुण्ठ and Golokam; <F>1:  Br. II. १९. १५५-6; २१. १९. २१; III. ४१. ५४-5.</F> the fourteen sthalas or places of which seven are कृत and seven are अकृत; भूः and other six are कृतस्; the अकृतस् are प्राकृतस्; पृथ्वी, अन्तरिक्ष, दिव्य and महर्लोकस् are known as अर्णवकस् or which stand until आभूतसम्प्लव; जन, तप and सब्य are ज्ञानलोकस्; व्यक्तलोकस् are भूः, भुवः, स्वः, मह, जन, तप and सत्य (Brahma); their residents are given, those attaining Brahmaloka (सत्य) do not have rebirth. <F>2:  वा. १०१. १०-39; Vi. I. २२. ८०; V. 2. १६.</F>

--the world of सान्तानिकस् and आदिदेवस् of seven गुणस्; above and below them are another seven गुणस्; after which come the devas and earth; from them are rains which invigorate the world. वा. ७१. ५७. [पगे३-125+ ३७]

--eight in number, each with a city of his own situated in the eight cardinal points, surrounding the outskirts of ब्रह्मा's city; <F>1:  भा. V. १६. २९.</F> stand in the midst of लोकालोक, on the four sides of Meru in their respective towns: East- India in वस्वौकसार: South-Yama in Samyamana: West- वरुण in Sukha and North-Candra in विभावरि. These are stationed round the मानस lake for the protection of Dharma and progress of the world; <F>2:  Br. II. २१. २८-34, १५६; III. 3. १०२; M. १२४. ९४; वा. ५०. ८६, ९१; १११. २५.</F> an अम्श of the Supreme Lord; <F>3:  M. ५२. २१.</F> served तारक as servants; beaten by तारक; <F>4:  Ib. १४८. २७; १५३. १८३.</F> served in the battle of Tripura; <F>5:  Ib. २४. 5; १३८. 1.</F> requested Soma to restore तारा back to बृहस्पति; <F>6:  Ib. २३. ३५.</F> oblations to, in rituals of digging tanks and planting gardens; <F>7:  Ib. ५८. ३३; ५९. १०.</F> invoked in making the १६ gifts; <F>8:  Ib. २७४. ४१f; २८५. 9; २९१. 3.</F> function until the Pralaya. <F>9:  वा. ५०. १५५ and २०५.</F>
--the lordship of a quarter of the world; Yama became a लोकपाल by pleasing शिव. M. ११. २०.
--a son of Dhruva. वा. ६६. २१.
--the mother goddesses being the १४ daughters of दक्ष, married to कश्यप. Br. III. 3. ५५-6; 7. ४६९. [पगे३-126+ २८]
--south of नागवीथि and north of लोका- loka. Br. II. २१. १०३.
--a Yoga siddhi. Br. IV. ३६. ५२.
(I)--the अवतार् of the Lord in the sixth द्वा- para with four learned disciples, all yogins. वा. २३. १३३.
(II)--one of the four disciples of पौष्यञ्जि Va1. ६१. ३६-7; Vi. III. 6. 6.

--Soma takes away the water drunk by the sun through नाडिस् and thus sets in motion the ज्योतिष cakram. The clouds drink from Soma and pour in as rain for six months by the heaviness of the wind; thus the waters are not wasted; once taken they are returned; from the sun comes heat, and from the moon शीतलम्। वा. ५१. १४-16.

--ईश्वर, the bridge among bridges, the holy among the holies, the Vedya among the Vedic scholars, the Prabhu among Lords, सोमभूत for beings, अग्निभूत for promoting the effulgence of Agni, मनोभूते for men, तपोभूत for tapasvins, vinaya for police men, tejas among tejasvins, vigraha among idols, and the place for journey men. Va. ९७. ४०-43.

(II)--(Mt.) a chain of hills beyond the स्वा- दूदक, between the Loka where the sun shines and Aloka where he does not. The regions lighted by the sun are said to cover ५० crores of yojanas. The chain of the लोका- loka is said to occupy a fourth of the area of the globe. In the Aloka योगेश्वर-Kr2s2n2a travels. <F>1:  भा. V. २०. ३४-42; M. १२३. ४७; १२४. ३८, ८१.</F> Crossed by Arjuna and कृष्ण on their way to वैकुण्ठ in search of the dead child of the ब्राह्मण of द्वारका. A. mythical mountainous belt in the south separating the visible world from the world of darkness. <F>3:  Br. II. १५. 3; १९. १५०; २१. ५१, १०१ and १०६, १५५; III. 7. २९४; IV. 2. १९४.</F> १०,000 yoja- nas in height and breadth; protected by four guardians, सुधामन् and others on the four directions. <F>4:  Vi. II. 4. ९४; 8. ८२-3.</F> ^2 भा. X. ८९. ४८.
(I)--consort of Agastya; a ब्रह्मवादिनी. Br. II. ३३. १९; IV. १०. ७८; वा. १०८. ५५.
--is Agastya. Br. IV. ३१. २७; M. ६१. ५२.
(I)--born of ब्रह्मा's lower lip. भा. III. १२. २६; M. 3. १०.
(II)--born of Lambha and माया. भा. IV. 8. 3.
--a pupil of लान्गल. Br. II. ३५. ४८; वा. ६१. ४२.
(I)--a son of Vidarbha, and father of Babhru (Vastu-वा। प्।) the righteous; got war elephants from the devas. Br. III. ७०. ३८; M. ४४. ३६; वा. ९५. ३७.
(II)--alias दशरथ, son of Satyaratha; (Citraratha-वा। प्।); had a daughter शान्ता, and son, Catu- ranga. M. ४८. ९५; वा. ९९. १०३.
(III)--an elephant. Br. III. 7. ३४९.
--the सूत; performed tapas with success in the मुण्डपृष्ट hill of गया; called to that place all the महा- नदीस् of India--शरावदी to चर्मवती. वा. २६. 5; १०८. ७७-81.
(I)--see रोमहर्षण: asked by Munis to reveal the भविष्य agreed to do so. M. ५०. ६८, ७३-74.

(II)--a sage; <F>1:  वा. ४५. ७०.</F> one who would make the hairs of his hearers stand with joy; (एत्य्।); the disciple of व्यास and well known for his supreme knowledge in all the three worlds; <F>2:  Ib. 1. १६-17, २९.</F> spoke logically; <F>3:  Ib. १०३. 8.</F> सूत; <F>4:  Ib. ५३. 1.</F> was entrusted with the इतिहास, पुराण and known as पुराणार्थ विशारद। <F>5:  Ib. ४६. 1; ६०. १३, २१.</F> [पगे३-129+ २५]
(III)--performed tapas in the मुण्ड- पृष्ट hill of गया; called the many rivers named there. वा. १०८. ७७-82.
--the Goddess enshrined at उत्पलावस्तक. M. १३. ४५.
--one of the भार्गव gotraka1ras. M. १९५. २७.
--a शक्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ५५ and ७५.
--a तीर्थ at Benares. M. १८५. ६८.
--the sixth hell under the earth. Br. IV. 2. १५०, १८२-5; वा. १०१. १४९.

the wicked king troubled by Janamejaya; a राजऋषि abandoned by पौरास् and जानपदस्; deep in distress fell at the feet of sage Indrota; performed अश्वमेध; spent the rest of his life with the sage. Br. III. ६८. २३-6; वा. ९३. २२.
--also Loha (s.v.) the sixth hell, known also as tama; below the earth, up the hill and with people. वा. १०१. १४९ and १७९, १८२. [पगे३-130+ २४]
--the loadstone attracting iron, illustrative of the supreme spirit attracting one who meditates on it. Vi. VI. 7. ३०.
--flesh of red goat for श्राद्ध. M. १५. ३५.
--a वानर tribe. Br. III. 7. ३१९.
--a wife of बान. Br. III. 5. ४५.
(also लोहिन्जस्)--belong to कौशिक gotra. Br. III. ६६. ७१; वा. ९१. ९९.
(I)--Mt. next to Candraprabha lake. यक्ष- मणिधर's residence. Br. II. १८. १०-12.
(II)--अन्गारक above शुक्र in the graha- मण्डल. Br. II. २४. ७०; IV. 2. १३२; वा. १०१. १३२.
(III)--a कौशिक and a sage; a ब्रह्मिष्ठ. Br. II. ३२. ११८; M. १४५. ११२.
(IV)--a त्रयार्षेय; not to marry with विश्वा- mitra, अष्टक, etc. M. १९८. १५.
(VI)--a son of Agni; of nine rays; born of पूर्- वाषाढ. वा. ५३. ८२, ८६ and १०८.
(I)--a lake in the Lohita hill at the foot of हेमशृङ्ग from which rises the R. लौहित्या; on its banks is the garden of विशोक. Br. II. १८. ११; M. १२१. १२; वा. ४७. १०.
(II)--a वर्ष of शाल्मलिद्वीप, adjoining the Uttama (Unnata-वा। प्।) hill. Br. II. १९. ४४; वा. ४९. ३९.
(III)--the place of Lohita in the मण्डलम्. वा. ५३. ५९.
--sons of Kallolaha. Br. III. 7. ४४२.
--after the colour, गायत्री was named गौः; the lord was known as वामदेव. वा. २३. ६८-70.
--a R. from the हिमालयस्. Br. II. १६. २७.
--the राक्षस residing in Tatvalam (Atalam- वा। प्।). Br. II. २०. १८; वा. ५०. १७.
--the son of the Earth, मही. Vi. I. 8. ११.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २३. [पगे३-132+ २८]
--a son of घृतपृष्ठ. भा. V. २०. २१.
--a daughter of सुयश. वा. ६९. १४.
--a मध्यमाध्वर्यु. Br. II. ३३. १४.

--a class of मनुष्य Pitr2s, as distinguished from Deva पितृस्; fed in monthly ceremonies; attain this status after duly performing the seven-fold karma; <F>1:  Br. II. २८. ६९-78.</F> their path cannot be known even by तपस्, much less seen with mortal eyes; how they benefit by श्राद्ध in a wide sense; how those who get no श्राद्ध suffer. <F>2:  वा. ५६. ६३-5, ६८-79.</F>

अंकुशा: लौकिकमानम्--काष्ठ, निमेष, कला, मुहूर्त, अहस्, रात्रि,
etc., one १०० Laukika years equal to 3 years of पितृस्; one year (लौकिकमानम्) equals one day for Devas.-- उत्तरायनम् is the day time and दक्षिणायनम् the night of gods, ३०३० years equal to one सप्तऋषि vatsara. Br. II. २९. 5-१७.
--the first son of ब्रह्मा; <F>1:  वा. २९. 7.</F> father of Brah- मोदनाग्नि, well-known as Bharata; also अथर्वा. <F>2:  Br. II. १२. 7, 9.</F>
--an Apsaras. वा. ६९. 8.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २५.
--a pupil of पौष्यञ्जि; a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३३. 8; ३५. ४०.
--a son of लोमहर्षण. M. ११४. ५८; १२५. 1.
--one of the भार्गव gotraka1ras. M. १९५. २७.
--a son of अष्टक. Br. III. ६६. ७५.
--a R. having its source in the हिमालयस्. M. ११४. २२; १२१. १२; १६३. ६५.
(I)--a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३३. 5.
(II)--a son of बाण. वा. ६७. ८५.
(III)--a R. rising from lake Lohita; noted for Padma class of elephants and place fit for श्राद्ध offerings. Br. II. १८. ११; III. 7. ३५८; १३. १०३; वा. ४७. ११.
--the tenth face of fourteen-faced deva; सावर्णिक Manu came from it. वा. २६. ४२ [पगे३-134+ २५]
--a son of दारुक an अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १९६.
--a R. of the केतुमाला. वा. ४४. १७.
--a Janapada of the केतुमाला. वा. ४४. १५.
--a name of विनायक. Br. III. ४२. 8 and ४०; IV. ४४. ६९.
--a दानव in the तारकामय; <F>1:  M. १७७. 8.</F> a son of Vipracitti. <F>2:  Vi. I. २१. १२.</F>
--a R. in the भद्रा continent. वा. ४३. २५.
--a son of खशा and a राक्षस. Br. III. 7. १३५.
(I)--a name of अन्गारक. Br. II. २४. ११०.
(II)--one of the twelve mountains which enter- ed the sea for fear of Indra. वा. ४७. ७५.
--a group of पिशाचस्; able to take any form they desired. Br. III. 7. ३८८; वा. ६९. २६९.
--a group of पिशाचस्. Br. III. 7. ३८१.
--one of the १६ classes of पिशाचस्, with crooked hands and feet. Br. III. 7. ३७६ and ३८८.

(I)--born of दीर्घतमस् and Bali's wife; <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. 5.</F> Hence a son of Bali, after whom came the Vanga country. <F>2:  Br. III. ७४. २७ and ८७; वा. ९९. ८५; Vi. IV. १८. १३-14.</F> A क्षेत्रज son of Bali. <F>3:  M. ४८. २५; वा. ९९. २८.</F>
(II)--a son of Dharmavarman and father of Nandana. Vi. IV. २४. ५६.

(I)--enlisted by जरासन्ध against the Yadus; <F>1:  भा. X. [५० (v)  3].</F> an eastern country; <F>2:  Br. II. १६. ५१; १८. ५१; III. ७४. २१३.</F> kingdom of the. <F>3:  M. ११४. ४४; १२१. ५०; १६३. ७२.</F>
(II)--a Janapada of the केतुमाला country; <F>1:  वा. ४४. १४.</F> a tribe. <F>2:  Ib. ४७. ४९; ९९. ४०२.</F>
(III)--the ब्राह्मण caste of शाकद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ६९. [पगे३-136+ ३३]
--a Janapada of the केतुमाला country. वा. ४४. १५.
--the successor of भूतनन्द; ruled from किलिकिला. भा. XII. 1. ३२.
--the son of Devala and father of Utka. Vi. IV. 4. १०६.
--१९०० R2k गणस् and four-fold ब्राह्- मणस्. वा. ६१. ६७; ९९. २५४.

(I)--Indra's thunderbolt; a weapon shaped out of दधीचि's limbs by विश्वकर्मन् for the use of Indra; with this Indra was able to break the back of the mountains. By this वृत्र was slain. But it was of no use against Namuci; the embodiment of Brahmanical energy; <F>1:  भा. VI. १०. १३; VIII. ११. ३३-36; M. 7. ५५; वा. ३०. २३५; ६७. १०३; ७८. ५३; Vi. V. २०. ४१.</F> from the तेजस् of the sun; <F>2:  Br. III. 5. ६९; IV. १९. ७६ and ८५; ३७. १७. M. ११. २९.</F> a weapon of war; <F>3:  Ib. १३५. ३७, ५४; १६०. 9; १६२. ३१; १७४. ४२; १७७. १३.</F> in the battle with कृष्ण. <F>4:  Vi. V. ३०. ६९; ३१. 4.</F>

(II)--a son of Aniruddha and सुभद्रा, and father of प्रतिबाहु: Installed king of शूरसेनस् at मथुरा by युधिष्ठिर after Arjuna crowned him at Indraprastha after the decease of कृष्ण. भा. X. ९०. ३७-38; I. १५. ३९; XI. ३१. २५; Vi. IV. १५. ४१-2; V. ३२. 6; ३७. ६३-65.

(III)--a thief of काञ्ची stole bit by bit from the city and stored the riches in a secret place in the neighbour- ing woods. A certain किरात gathering fuel for sale observed this once and took a portion of the property home. His wife, charitably disposed, wanted to utilise it for digging [पगे३-137+ २९] wells and ponds. So a pond was constructed but before it was completed, all money had been spent. He got more of the thief's wealth and completed the embankment; built temples of शिव and विष्णु, besides giving gifts to ब्राह्मणस् who were pleased and renamed him and his wife as Dvijavarma and शीलावती: He also built a town and named it after his Purohita, देवरात. At his death, as he built all out of stolen wealth नारद ruled that he should wander in air for १२ years, while his wife went to Brahmaloka. As she refused, she was advised to recite शतरुद्र and get her husband released from the sin of theft. When Vajra died he got half of Dvijavarman's virtue. Dvijavarman attained कैलास. Br. IV. 7. १०-61.
(IV)--a son of Upasanga. M. ४७. २२.
(V)--a son of अश्वसुत and Sutanu. वा. ९६. २५१; १०९. 3.
--शाल्मलि--one of the twenty-eight hells. Here the punishment is by piercing one with शाल्मलि thorns for beastliness. भा. V. २६. 7 and २१.

(II)--a son, and a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८१; २६. ४७.

--an Asura who took part in the देवा- sura war between Bali and Indra; <F>1:   भा. VIII. १०. २०.</F> helped in the churning of the ocean. <F>2:  M. २४९. ६७.</F>
(I)--a son of Balasthala; was made of a portion of the sun. His son was Khagana. भा. IX. १२. 2-3.

(III)--a son of Danu. M. 6. १९.
(IV)--a son of Aunka. वा. ८८. २०५.
(I)--a son of घोष(vasu) and father of भागवत; <F>1:  भा. XII. 1. १७-18; Vi. IV. २४. ३५.</F> a शुन्ग ruler, ruled for seven years. <F>2:  Br. III. ७४. १५४.</F> [पगे३-139+ २७]
(II)--a son of Pulindaka. M. २७२. ३०.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ७७; २३. ४७.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ७७.

(II)--a R. sacred to ललिता. Br. IV. ३३. २९-33.
--a son of Danu. M. 6. १९.

--a son of Diti after her penance and father of Asura तारक who gave trouble to the devas; while a boy, under the orders of his mother, had Indra bound and placed before Diti; ब्रह्मा and कश्यप medi- ated and set him free; ब्रह्मा gave him for wife a mind- born daughter, वराङ्गी, with whom he went to penance; when वराङ्गी was engaged in तपस् Indra threatened her with several guises of the monkey, serpent, jackal, etc., which made her weep in sorrow and fear; meanwhile Vaj- राङ्ग's penance had ended and ब्रह्मा had blessed him. He came in search of his wife whom he found crying in fear. [पगे३-140+ ३३] She spoke of the insult offered by Indra and asked for a son, तारक, able to vanquish Indra. Then again he entered into a terrible vow when ब्रह्मा blessed him with the son desired by his spouse. तारक was born and great festivities were held in his honour. Soon he was crowned king of the Asura world. M. १४६. 5, ४१ ff; १४७. 1-२९.
--a son of उपासन्ग (उपान्ग-वा। प्।). Br. III. ७१. २५८; वा. ९६. २४९.
--a name of Indra. Br. III. 5. ७२; M. २४. २७; वा. ६७. १०५.
--one of the ten पीठस् for images; with 3 to 6 मेखलस्; this gives one long life. M. २६२. 7, १०, १८.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २७.
--a R. from the Sahya hills of the दक्षिणा- patha. M. ११४. २९; वा. ४५. १०४.

--a sacred tree in प्रयागा, protected by शूलपाणि; <F>1:  M. १०४. १०; वा. १०८. ५७.</F> he who dies underneath the tree goes to Rudraloka; <F>2:  M. १०६. ११.</F> the residence of the १२ A1dityas at; <F>3:  Ib. १०६. १२.</F> वट itself is महेश्वर. <F>4:  Ib. १११. १०; वा. १११. ८८-82.</F> [पगे३-141+ ३०]

(III)--a pupil of शाकल्य, and a वैश्य man- त्रकृत्. Br. II. ३२. १२१; ३५. 2.

(VII)--a son of सोमशर्म, an अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. २१६.
(VIII)--a member of the भार्गव gotra. वा. ६५. ९६.
(IX)--a son of गार्ग्य. वा. ९२. ७३.

(I)--a branch of the भार्गवस्. Br. III. 1. १००.

(I)--a son of देवमीढ and मारिषा; married Apsaras मिश्रकेशि; father of वृक and other sons. भा. IX. २४. २९ and ४३.

--a wife of वेश. वा. ६५. ११२.

--a forest region, description of; trees with flowers like किम्शुक, कर्णिकार, मञ्जौ, and with birds like the cuckoo, crow, कपिञ्जल, कलविङ्ग, parrot, swans, चक्रवाक, etc., and with animals like the cub of a lion, a pair of tigers, elephants, monkeys, cats, hares, snakes, boar, buffaloes, deer of different kinds, goats; all male and female enjoying sexual bliss. M. २०९. 3.
(I)--a son of Ghrtaprstha. भा. V. २०. २१ [पगे३-147+ २८]

(II)--born of लता; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. ४६०; ५०. ३९.</F> a king of trees; <F>2:  वा. ४९. ८८.</F> three योनीस् of, गायत्री, त्रिष्टुब् and जगती; <F>3:  Br. II. १३. १४५.</F> for homa and श्राद्ध. <F>4:  M. 8. 8; १७. १९; ३९. ११; ५९. १०; १६३. ४९.</F>

(I)--a son of T(D)urvasu, and father of Bharga. <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. १६; वा. ९९. 1; Vi. IV. १६. 3.</F> (Father of गोभानु--ब्र्। प्।). <F>2:  Br. III. ७४. 1.</F>
