--a R. on the banks of which is the forest सुरभी. M. १२१. ६१.
--crows, to eat the पिण्ड in स्राद्ध. M. १६. ५३; ३९. 6; Vi. I. 5. ४७.
--a name of Hari. भा. VII. १२. २६.
--a सूक्तम् of the साम, recited in tank ritual. M. ५८. ३७.
--a son of धिषणा, and कृशाश्व. भा. VI. 6. २०.
--a daughter of स्वधा, married पितृस्. भा. IV. 1. ६४.
(I)--a Vasu, son of Dharma and सुदेवी. M. १७१. ४६.
(II)--a son of विरक्ष. वा. ६८. ३३.

--a son of शुक्र, and father of Rajata, पृथु- with flowers like किम्शुक, कर्णिकार, मञ्जौ, and with रश्मि, Vidvat, and बृहम्गिर, all sacrificial priests for Daityas; approached Manu with a view to ruin his sacrifice and when they approached the वेदि, they were burnt. Br. III. 1. ७८ and ८४.
--a name of विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ६९. [पगे३-152+ २५]
--R. one of the seven rivers in शिवपुरम्. वा. १०१. २४३.
--R. one of the seven rivers in शिवपुरम्. वा. १०१. २४३.
--R. one of the seven rivers in शिवपुरम्. वा. १०१. २४३.
--these are उर्वीश, अतिथीश Can2d2i1s4a, Anu- ग्रकेश्वर, and अक्रूर. Br. IV. ४४. ५०.
--the expert in the art of dancing (नाट्य- वेद) acted as milkman for the Gandharvas to milk the cow- earth. M. १०. २५.
--R. one of the seven rivers in शिवपुरम्. वा. १०१. २४३.
--a sister of बृहस्पति; wife of प्रभास (s.v.). वा. ६६. २७-28.
--a town sacred to ललितापीथ. Br. IV. ४४. ९४.
--of the दक्षिणापथ. वा. ४५. १२६.
--R. one of the seven rivers in शिवपुरम्. वा. १०१. २४३.
--a son of Manivara. वा. ६९. १६१. [पगे३-153+ ३२]
--a daughter of the Gandharvas. वा. ६९. १०.
--a daughter of Ugrasena. वा. ९६. १३३.
(I)--a wife of Divamjaya. Br. II. ३६. १०१.

(II)--a mind-born daughter of ब्रह्मा given to वज्राङ्ग, son of Diti and कश्यप; she performed penance with her husband when Indra disturbed her by assuming different fearful disguises. She represented this to her husband at the end of his penance, and was blessed with a son, तारक. When he vanquished Indra, she became pleased. M. १४६. ५८; Ch. १४७ (whole).
--an Apsaras. Br. III. 7. 5.
--the goddess enshrined at सोमेश्वर. M. १३. ४३.
--R. one of the seven rivers in शिवपुरम्. वा. १०१. २४३.

(I) (also वाराह)--an incarnation of Hari; born out of ब्रह्मा's nostrils; roaring, he entered the waters and rescued the earth above, after vanquishing the Asura who attacked him. Prayer to, by the sages. <F>1:  भा. III. १३. १८-45; X. 2. ४०; Vi. V. 5. १५.</F> Slew Hira- ण्याक्ष in the Sumana hill of प्लक्षद्वीप. <F>2:  Br. II. १९. १३; III. ३६. ११; ७२. ७३-8.</F> The third अवतार्। <F>3:  M. ४७. ४३.</F> Killed हिरण्याक्ष by cutting the ocean into two by his teeth; <F>4:  Ib. ४७. ४७.</F> mother-earth taken to रसातलम्, appealed to [पगे३-154+ ३४] विष्णु for protection; he took up the वराह अवतार् and released the earth above the waters by raising her with his teeth; <F>5:  Ib. Chh. २४७ and २४८; १०२. ११.</F> his next अवतार् was वामन; <F>6:  Ib. १२२. १६; २४४. 6.</F> Icon of. <F>7:  Ib. २५९. 2; २६०. २८-9; २८५. 6.</F>
(II)--Mt. in वराहद्वीपम्; <F>1:  वा. ४८. ३८.</F> a hill that entered the sea for fear of Indra. <F>2:  Br. II. १८. ७७; वा. ४२. ७०; ४७. ७४.</F>

(III)--the name of the १२थ् Kalpa when सण्ड and Marka were slain. <F>1:  Br. III. ७२. ७२; वा. ९७. ७२.</F> According to the वा। प्। it is seventh Kalpa where avyakta became turned into vyakta; <F>2:  Ib. २३. ११४; १०९. ३५.</F> the present aeon? <F>3:  Br. I. 4. ३३; 6. 6; वा. 5. ४९; २१. १२, २३-4.</F>
(IV)--the boar's flesh for श्राद्ध. M. १७. ३३.
(V)--a दानव in the तारकामय. M. १७३. १६; १७७. 6.
--Here विष्णु as वराह worshipped शिव; bath on the १२थ् day of the dark or bright half of the month leads to विष्णुलोकम्. M. १९३. ७३-74.
--a प्रदेश in जम्बूद्वीप; <F>1:  वा. ४८. १४.</F> of different म्लेच्छस्; here is वराह Mt. from which the R. वाराही flows; sacred to विष्णु who took the boar अवतार्। <F>2:  Ib. ४८. ३६-40.</F>
--an Apsaras; brought forth eight children. वा. ६९. ४८.
--a son of Pulaha and गती. भा. IV. 1. ३८.
--a son of सावर्णि Manu. M. 9. ३३.

(I)--(see मीत्रावरुण) King of the Asuras; when called upon to fight by हिरण्यकशिपु, he said that his passion was in a subdued state, and asked him to meet Hari in battle; <F>1:  भा. II. 1. ३२; 7. ३१; III. १७. २७-30.</F> Once वरुण is said to have conquered all the world and performed the राजसूय compared to Yudhi- ष्ठिर's. Presented पृथु with a white umbrella: noted for much wealth. Protected क्रौञ्चद्वीप. Bali was bound with his noose; <F>2:  Ib. III. १७. २८; X. ७४. १३; IV. १५. १४; २२. ५९; V. २०. १९; २४. २३.</F> A son of Aditi: his wife was चर्षणी <F>3:  Ib. VI. 6. ३९; १८. 4; M. 6. 4; १७१. ५६; वा. ६६. ६६; ८४. 6.</F> (सुनादेवी- वा। प्।) propitiated by हरिश्चन्द्र, वरुण gave him a son on condition that he offered him in a sacrifice to him. Though reminded a number of times, हरिश्चन्द्र evaded fulfilling his promise and consequently got the disease, महोदर। But his son Rohita purchased सुनश्शेप as his substitute. वरुण was pleased and relieved him of his disease. <F>4:  भा. IX. 7. 8-२२.</F> Helped ऋचीक in securing a thousand white horses with black ears for his शुल्क। <F>5:  Ib. IX. १५. 7.</F> ऋतुमत् in the त्रिकूट hill was his pleasure garden. <F>6:  Ib. VIII. 2. 9.</F> Fought with हेती in the देवासुर war. In the तारकामय, when Indra lost his fortune, वरुण conferred with the gods and ब्रह्मा how to restore it. <F>7:  Ib. VIII. 5. १७; १०. २८; ११. ४२; M. १५३. १७९-83; १५४. ४८७; १७४. १५; १७५. २२; १७७. ४९.</F> Offered sacrifice by वसिष्ठ on behalf of श्राद्ध deva; a लोकपाल. Description of the sacrifice. <F>8:  भा. IX. 1. १३; १३. 6; १४. १७; III. 6. १३; Br. III. 1. १६; 3. ६७; M. २६६. २३.</F> When Nanda took bath once at आसुरीवेऌअ, an asura took him to वरुण. Welcomed कृष्ण, apologised for the capture of Nanda, and released him. Presented कृष्ण, horses for his new city. Got back his umbrella taken by Naraka, from कृष्ण who killed him; <F>9:  भा. X. २८. 2-१०; ५०. ५६; ५९. २२ [2 and 3]; Vi. V. २९. १०, ३४; ३०. 1.</F> was sent against कृष्ण taking पारि- [पगे३-156+ ४२] जात from Indra's place but beaten by गरुड, went back; supplied बलराम at Vraja with वारुणी. His city सुखा on the west of Meru was visited by Arjuna who sojourned in search of the dead child of the द्वारका Bra1hmana. <F>११:  भा. X. ८९. ४४; Br. II. २१. ३२.</F> Identified with Hari. <F>१२:  भा. XI. १६. १७.</F> Lord of waters, an आदित्य, and a face of शिव. <F>१३:  Br. II. २३. 5, १०३; २४. ३३ and ३७; २६. ४१. III. 7. २५४; २४. 4; ५७. ३५; M. 8. 3; ३१. १२; वा. ३४. ८९; १०८. ३१, ३३; Vi. I. १५. १३१; २२. 3.</F> Vanquished by रावण; finding him unwilling to give audience, परशुराम took up शिव's bow when वरुण appeared and begged to be excused; gave up गोकर्ण. <F>१४:  Br. III. 8. 7; ५७. ३५-74; ५८. 8-३१.</F> Wife स्तुता or सुरा; gave नागपाश as wedding present to कामेश्वर; world of. <F>१५:  Ib. III. ५९. 6; IV. १५. २०; २०. ४९; ३३. ६४-5.</F> Performed सौभाग्य- शयनम्; made overtures of love to ऊर्वशी, already engaged to Mitra. She was cursed; became father of Agastya by letting fall रेतस् collected in a pitcher. <F>१६:  M. ६० 49; ६१. २८-31; २०१. २३-9.</F> Makara as his rid- ing animal; worship of in गृहबलि and before commence- ment of palace building; chariot of; <F>१७:  Ib. ६७. १३; ९३. २२; १२४. २३; १२५. ४१; १२६. 6; १२७. २३; १३७. ३२; १५०. १२७; २६८. १६.</F> penance at बदरी; services of; in churning the ocean whence he received the umbrella; <F>१८:  Ib. २०१. २३; २४९. १४; २५१. 4.</F> a लोकपाल in the city of सुखा; <F>१९:  वा. ५०. ८९; Vi. II. 8. 9.</F> worshipped with अवभृताग्नि; <F>२०:  Br. II. १२. ३३.</F> Icon of; gift of pearl oysters pleases वरुण. <F>२१:  M. २६१. १७; २६६. ६४; २८९. 6.</F> ^१० Bha1. X. [६५ (V) ४३]; [६६ (V) २१-26]; ६५. १९; Vi. V. २५. 2.
(II)--the name of the sun in the month of शुची (आषाढ). भा. XII. ११. ३६; वा. ५२. 6; Vi. II. १०. 8; १२. ३२; V. 1. ५८.
(III)--a Marut of the third गण. Br. III. 5. ९५. [पगे३-157+ २७]
(IV)--a Mauneya Gandharva. Br. III. 7. 1.
(V)--the hill on the west of the कैलास. M. १२१. १९.
(VI)--one of the eleven वासिष्ठ branches. वा. ७०. ९०.
(VII)--his wife was शुनादेवी, the daughter of Samudra; his sons were Kali and Vaidya, and daughter सुरसुन्दरी (see वरुण). वा. ८४. 6.
--the status of वरुण attained by Udaka, son of अरण्य. Br. II. ३६. १०४.
--leads to the world of वरुण. M. १०१. ७४.
--a तीर्थ of the नर्मदा. M. १९१. 6.

--one of the four sons of शुक्र and father of four sons; all fit to partake of the sacrifices of the devas; approached Manu to destroy the यज्ञस्; Indra interceded and told Manu that he could turn them to offerings; but they were adamant and hence were killed by Indra. वा. ६५. ७७-8, ८२.
--an Apsaras. Br. III. 7. ११.
--another name for शिव. Br. II. २५. ७४.
--a name of विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ७०.
(I)--an Apsaras. Br. III. 7. ११.
(II)--R. one of the seven rivers in शिवपुरम्. वा. १०१. २४३.
--a son of गान्दिनि. वा. ९६. १११.
(I)--the राक्षस presiding over the month of Tapasya. भा. XII. ११. ४०.
(II)--a son of Soma by रोहिणी, a Vasava. Br. III. 3. २३; M. 5. २३; २०३. 6. वा. ६६. २२; Vi. I. १५. ११२.
(III)--a god of the Rohita गण. Br. IV. 1. ८५.
(I)--a god of सुतार group. Br. IV. 1. ८९.
(II)--one of the ten branches of सुपार devas. वा. १००. ९४. [पगे३-159+ ३२]
--a Satya god. Br. II. ३६. ३५.
--a lake on the slopes of the हेमकूट. Br. II. १८. ६६.
--a son of अश्विनी and अक्रूर. M. ४५. ३३.
--a सुधर्मान god. Br. IV. 1. ६०.

--the origin of, from the limbs of नारायण; <F>1:  वा. 6. ७७.</F> of Music; four-fold of गीतक; स्थायिवर्ण, प्रसम्चारि, अव- रोहणम्, आरोहणम्; every वर्ण has one of four अलम्कारस्- स्थापनि, क्रमरेजिन, प्रमाद and अप्रमाद। <F>2:  Ib. ८७. 6, 8-9.</F>

--of the four वर्णस्; could take to other professions in extreme cases. The आश्रम dharma; specific duties of the वानप्रस्थ and सन्न्यास. <F>1:  भा. VII. ११. १४-24; XI. १७. १३-58; ch. १८ (whole) . वा. 8. १६८-75.</F> First introduced in the स्वायम्भुव epoch in five द्वीपस् of concentric islands of Hindu cosmos--प्लक्ष, शाल्मलि, कुश, क्रौञ्च and शाकद्वीपस्; its observance in Tretayuga, languishing in द्वापर, completely ruined in the Kaliyuga; based on श्रौत and स्मार्त dharma. <F>2:  Br. II. १४. ४१; २९. ४६; ३०. 4; ३१. २७-8. १०७; ३२. ३३-44; ३५. १९५; III. 7. ४०७-8; १३. १३२; ५०. 4. IV. 3. ५०; ४३. ५८.</F> Aurva narrates to Sagara the duties of all castes. <F>3:  Vi. III. 8. २०-40.</F>
--a kulaparvata of भद्रश्व. वा. ४३. १४.
--the mixture of castes; ययाति marry- ing देवयानी; wants exemption from शुक्र who grants it. M. ३०. ३३-4.
--a R. from पारियात्र hills in भारतवर्ष. Br. II. १६. २८; वा. ४५. ९७.

--social polity; <F>1:  M. 2. २३; वा. ६१. ९७.</F> truth, charity and self- control are equal to तीर्थस् for homekeepers; <F>2:  Br. II. १४. ४१-2. M. २२. ८०.</F> ययाति speaks of four वर्णस् born of one body and their respective duties of whom the ब्राह्मण is superior; <F>3:  Ib. ३०. २०.</F> lost in a period of anar- chy; <F>4:  Ib. ४७. २५७.</F> in the शाकद्वीप; <F>5:  Ib. १२२. ३८.</F> said by Manu; <F>6:  Ib. १२३. २३; १४२. ४२.</F> restrictions get loosened in द्वापर; <F>7:  Ib. १४२. ५३; १४३. 4; १४४. 6 and २६.</F> disappearance of, in Kali; <F>8:  Ib. १४४. ९६; २१५. ६३; २७३. ३२ and ४६. Vi. VI. 1. १०, ३२-3.</F> (see वर्ण dharma). In त्रेता Ks2atriyas followed the ब्राह्मणस्, the वैश्यस् the क्षत्रियस् and the शूद्रस् the वैश्यस्; there was thus peace everywhere and everything bore fruit; <F>9:  वा. ३०. २९४; ४९. ११७; ५७. ५२.</F> leads to enjoyment in heaven; <F>१०:  Ib. ५९. २२ and ३६; ९९. ४२५; १०१. 6. १३७ and १७४; १०२, ७० and ९६; १०४. २१.</F> no such system in कृतयुग. <F>११:  Br. II. 7. ५५.</F>
--वेदव्यास of the १४थ् Dva1para. Vi. III. 3. १४.
--king, ruled for twenty years. वा. ९९. ३१३.
--a Svara शक्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ५५.
--a son of कृष्ण and मित्रविन्दा. भा. X. ६१. १६. [पगे३-161+ २३]
(I)--a Mt. of क्रौञ्चद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २१.
(II)--a son of उपदेवी and Vasudeva. M. ४६. १७; वा. ९६. १७९.
(I)--a यक्ष, a son of देवयानी. Br. III. 7. १२९.
(II)--a son of Vasudeva. Br. III. ७१. १८२.
(III)--a Kulaparvata in केतुमाला country. वा. ४४. 4.
(IV)--a son of मणिवर. वा. ६९. १६०.
(I)--an appellation for क्षत्रिय. Vi. III. १०. 8-9.
(II)--a son of उशीनर. Vi. IV. १८. 9.

--a वैष्णवी vidya1, taught by विश्वरूप to Indra. Here the various manifestations of Hari [पगे३-162+ २५] including that of the Buddha are recalled. Once a certain कौशिकन् practised this and gave up his life in a desert. When a Gandharva crossed the bones of this dead man, he fell down on the earth. Instructed by वालखिल्यस्, he collected the bones, and after throwing them into the सरस्वती, and bathing there, returned to his place. Taught originally to त्वष्ट्रि by Dadhyanga; त्वष्ट्रि taught it to विश्वरूप. भा. VI. 8 (whole); 9. ५३.
--a son of Citraka. Br. III. ७१. ११५.
--the राक्षस presiding over the month of Nabha. भा. XII. ११. ३७.
(I)--a god of सुतार group. Br. IV. 1. ८९.
(II)--the mind-born son of ब्रह्मा in the १६थ् kalpa. वा. २१. ३५.
(III)--one of the ten branches of सुपार devas. वा. १००. ९४.

--six in जम्बूद्वीप; हिमवान्, Hema- कूट, Nisadha, Meru, नील, and शृङ्गवान्; served by Siddhas and चारणस्; the inner विष्कम्भ is ९०००. <F>1:  M. ११३. १०; वा. ३४. १३, २१.</F> in कुशद्वीप. <F>2:  Ib. ४९. ५२-3.</F> [पगे३-163+ २३]
--see शर्मिष्ठा. Vi. IV. १०. 4.
--a queen of वर्ष r2tu. Br. IV. ३२. २९.
--of the Dhruva मण्डल. वा. ५१. ११.
--heard the वायु पुराण from अन्तरिक्ष. वा. १०३. ६३.
--one of the १४ Gan2as of Apsarasas born of कुशवती. Br. III. 7. १९.
--the round arch of a temple where the images of गौरी and विनायक are enshrined. M. २६९. ३५, ५४-6.
--a son of परावृत्. Vi. IV. १२. ११.
--a class of Gandharvas originating from Vik- रान्त; famous for valour and liberality; had three daughters, each an originator of a गण. वा. ६९. १८. २०. २२.
--due to his curse लक्ष्मी (wealth) is not stationary. Br. IV. 7. १९. [पगे३-164+ २३]
--a group of gods of the epoch of Uttama Manu, १२ in number; also वम्शवर्तिन्स्. Br. II. ३६. २६-30; Vi. III. 1. १४.
--a Siddhi देवी. Br. IV. १९. 4; ४४. १४०.
--one of the eight attributes of yoga; controls all creatures; whatever he desires results. वा. १३. 4, १६.
--a son of कृति; with him the मिथिला line came to an end. भा. IX. १३. २६-27.
--a Rahasya Yogini देवी. Br. IV. १९. ४८; ३७. 3.
--a ऋषिक who became a sage by truth (satya). Br. II. ३२. १०२.
(II)--sacrifices (Vedic); neglect of, before पृथु's advent (see वषट्क्रिया); <F>1:  M. १०. ११.</F> call to gods. <F>2:  वा. ६५. २३.</F>
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २०. [पगे३-165+ २६]
--a Vedic rite; not observed in Vena's reign (see वषट्कार). Br. II. २८. ४२-53; ३६. १३०; M. १४१. ४७; वा. ५६. ४८ and ५२.
--a tribe to be conquered by Kalki. Br. III. ७३. १०८.
--a मुद्रा Devi1. Br. IV. ४४. ११४.
--(c) a kingdom of the west, watered by the Sindhu. Br. II. १८. ४८.
(I)--(personified) a friend of Manmatha. Br. IV. ३०. ६८; ३२. २१-58.
(II)--a mind-born son of ब्रह्मा in the १६थ् kalpa. वा. २१. ३५.

(III)--the spring season of Citra and वैकाशि; the Saptakas who reside in the sun are धात and अर्यमा, Pulastya and Pulaha, वासुकि and सम्कीर्णार snakes, Tum- buru and नारद Gandharvas, क्रतस्तालि and पुञ्जिकस्थल Apsarasas, रथकृछ्र and ऊर्ज Gra1man2is, Heti and Praheti राक्षसस्. वा. ५०. १७७ and १९३; ५२. 6; ५३. २५.
--तृतीय of the bright half recommended for commencing सौभाग्यशयनम्; then सती married शिव. M. ६०. १४-15. [पगे३-166+ ३७]
(I)--(वासिष्ठ) a sage of the Rohita epoch. Br. IV. 1. ६३.
(II)--(known also as Cyavana) a son of भृगु and Paulomi. वा. ६५. ८८.

(I)--a sage who called on भीष्म lying on his death-bed; also called on परिक्षित् practising प्रायोप- वेश; <F>1:  भा. I. 9. 7; १९. 9.</F> was invited for युधिष्ठिर's राजसूय; <F>2:  Ib. X. ७४. 7.</F> came to see कृष्ण at स्यमन्तपञ्चक; <F>3:  Ib. X. ८४. 4.</F> one of the sages who left for पिण्डारक. <F>4:  Ib. XI. 1. १२.</F>

(II)--a son of ब्रह्मा, born of his breath; married Kardama's daughter, अरुन्धती. Father of seven sons, all ब्रह्मऋषिस्; cursed the fires पावक, पवमान and शुचि who were born sons of विजिताश्व; <F>1:  भा. III. १२. २२-3; २४. २३; IV. 1. ४०; २४. 4; २९. ४३; Br. II. ३२. ९६ and ११५; III. 8, ८२; M. १८७. ४५.</F> when invited to be Nimi's ऋत्विक्, he went away to Indra's यज्ञ to which he had been called earlier and asked Nimi to wait till his return. On Nimi continuing his sacrifice with the help of other ऋत्विक्स्, वसिष्ठ cursed him and was in turn cursed to be born of ऊर्वशी and मित्रावरुण. <F>2:  भा. VI. १८. 5; IX. १३. 1-6.</F> A sage of the कृतयुग: Heard the नीलकण्ठ legend from कार्तिकेय; present at Rati's marriage; <F>3:  Br. II. २५. १५; २७. १०३; IV. ४०. ४८; M. २०१. 1, १४-6.</F> suggested to Diti the observance of the मदनद्वादशीव्रतम्। <F>4:  M. 3. 7 and ३४; 7. 5, 9.</F>

(III)--a siddha; <F>1:  भा. VI. १५. १३.</F> the आचार्य of श्राद्ध deva. Finding no issue to him. वसिष्ठ offered a sacrifice to Mitra and वरुण. At this time श्राद्धा, [पगे३-167+ ३४] the king's wife desired to have a daughter and expressed it to the होता who uttered the मन्त्र in such a way as to get a daughter. इला was born; but श्राद्धदेव was not pleased. So वसिष्ठ converted इला into a male by name Sudyumna; <F>2:  Ib. IX. 1. १३-22, ३६-7; M. २४५. ८६.</F> was present at अम्बरीष's अस्वमेध; <F>3:  भा. IX. 4. २२.</F> the ideal पुरोहीत. <F>4:  Ib. XI. १६. २२.</F>

(IV)--a sage of the Vaivasvata epoch; his sons मानस pitr2s; fought in the form of a bird for years a battle with विश्वामित्र concerning हरिश्चन्द्र; acted as सामग in his पुरुषमेध; <F>2:  भा. IX. 7. and २३.</F> cursed सौदास to become a राक्षस; with the king's assent, वसिष्ठ begot अश्मक on मदयन्ती. <F>3:  Ib. IX. 9. १८-23, ३८.</F> ^1 भा. VIII. १३. 5; 1. २४; M. 9. २७; १२. 4-5; १५. १२; Vi. III. 1. ३२.
(V)--the sage presiding over the months of शुचि (आषाढ) and शुक्र; <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ३६; Br. II. २३. 6.</F> in the विश्वचक्र. <F>2:  M. २८५. 6.</F>

(VI)--the eighth Veda व्यास. Heard the ब्रह्माण्ड पुराण from Indra and narrated it to सारस्- vata; <F>1:  Br. II. ३५. ११८; IV. 2. ४७; 4. ६०.</F> आश्रम of, on the ऊर्ज्जन्त hill. <F>2:  Ib. III. १३. ५३ and ७४.</F>
(VII)--born in the वारुणि-यज्ञ from the centre of Vasu (sacrificial fire), and hence Vasumat; pro- genitor of पितृस्, सुकातस्. Br. III. 1. २१ and ४६; १०. ९६; M. १९५. ११; २००. 1.
(VIII)--cursed Haihaya to be ruined; of madhyama bhakti; <F>1:  Br. III. ३०. ७०; ३४. ४०.</F> a महऋषि and a ब्रह्मवादिन्. <F>2:  M. १४५. ९० and १०९; १७१. २७.</F>  [पगे३-168+ ३५]

(IX)--a contemporary of Sagara; the kula- guru of the इक्ष्वाकुस्; narrated परशुराम's story to Sagara; blessed Sagara who enjoyed rule after world conquest; con- soled him on the death of सागरस्; agreed to anointing अम्शुमत् as युवराज. <F>1:  Br. III. ३१. 1; ४७. ९९; ४८. २९; ४९. 1 and ३८; ५४. २०-22.</F> Gave प्रथिष्ठान to Sudyumna. <F>2:  Ib. III. ६०. २१.</F> Took इक्ष्वाकु to task for getting hare's flesh already tasted by विकुक्षि; was in charge of the kingdom when त्रय्या- रुणि went to the forest; met कल्माषपाद's queen for अश्मक's birth; <F>3:  Ib. III. ६३. १५, ८२-93, १७७; ६४. 4; ७३. ९१.</F> Purohita of दशरथ and राम. <F>4:  Ib. IV. १५. ४०; २०. १०३; ४०. ४८ and ८९; M. ४७. २४५; Vi. IV. 4. ९९.</F> Observed आदित्यशयनव्रतम्। <F>5:  M. ५५. ३२.</F>
(X)--another name for आपव sage. Br. III. ६९. ४४.
(XI)--(द्वैपायन) a sage of the first epoch of सावर्ण Manu; <F>1:  Br. IV. 1. ११.</F> father's father of पराशर; on the evils of anger. <F>2:  Vi. I. 1. १२-16.</F>
(XII)--the younger brother of Agastya cursed Nimi to become bodyless, a purohita of Nimi. M. ६१. १९, ३२-33; २०१. १४-16.
(XIII) the purohita of धर्ममूर्ति of बृहत्- kalpa; <F>1:  M. ९२. २१; १०२. १९; १२६. 7.</F> praised शिव out to burn Tripuram <F>2:  Ib. १३३. ६७.</F>
(XIV)--a master of the science of architecture. M. २५२. 2.
(XV)--a son of वालि the अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १६०. [पगे३-169+ २१]
(XVI)--a resident of ब्रह्मक्षेत्र. वा. ५९. १०५.
(XVII)--(हिरण्यनाभ Kaus4alya). a disciple of Jaimini who taught him ५०० सम्हितस्; he in his turn taught them to याज्ञवल्क्य. वा. ८८. २०७; ९८. ९२.
--sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ६८.
--see वासिष्ठस्; to them the Pravara is एकार्- षेय. M. २००. 2.
(I)--a son of Vastara and स्वर्वीथि. भा. IV. १३. १२.
(II)--a son of हिरण्यरेतस्; also the name of a territorial division of कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १४.
(III) (वास्तु-ब्र्। प्।)--a Vasu, wife अन्गिरसी, and son विश्वकर्मन्. भा. VI. 6. ११ and १५. [पगे३-170+ २४]
(IV)--the son of भूतज्योतिस्, and father of प्रतीक. भा. IX. 2. १७-18.
(V)--a daughter of दक्ष and one of the ten wives of Dharma; gave birth to eight Vasus. भा. VI. 6. 4, १०-11; Br. II. 9. ५०, ६१; III. 3. 2 and २०. M. 5. १५: Vi. I. १५. १०५; वा. ६६. 2.
(VI)--one of the four sons of कुश. भा. IX. १५. 4; Br. III. ६६. ३२; वा. ९१. ६२; Vi. IV. 7. 8.
(VII)--a son of Mura (s.v.). भा. X. ५९. १२.
(VIII)--a son of कृष्ण and साम्बा. भा. X. ६१. १३.
(IX) (also वसुधाम)--another name for Brah- majyoti Agni. Br. II. १२. ४३; वा. २९. २१.
(X)--one of the ten sons of Kardama; attained heaven by तपस्। Br. II. १४. 9; ३०. ३९.
(XI)--is Soma. Br. II. २४. ८८.

(XII)--a son of उत्तानपाद: Asked to arbitrate in the dispute involving animal sacrifice; said that यज्ञ involved हिम्स and justified Vasu's action: cursed therefor [पगे३-171+ २६] by sages to live in रसातल (पाताल-म्।प्।): attained heaven by तपस्; <F>1:  Br. II. ३०. २३-32, ३९ and ४७; ३६. ८९; M. १४३. १८-25. वा. 1. १११; ५७. १०१-11; ६२. ७६.</F> his daughter अच्छोदामत्स्यगन्धि married परा- शर and gave birth to व्यास; <F>2:  M. १४. १४.</F> a राजऋषि. <F>3:  वा. ५७. १२२.</F>
(XIII)--a Pratardana god. Br. II. ३६. ३०.
(XIV)--a god of आद्य group. Br. II. ३६. ६९.
(XV)--a यक्ष: a son of पुण्यजनी and मणि- bhadra. Br. III. 7. १२३. वा. ६९. १५४.

(XVI)--the great grand-son of पृथु and son of कृमि and equal to Indra: Cedipati; <F>1:  Br. III. 8. ९८; ६८. २७; M. ५०. २५-6; वा. ९३. २६.</F> father of Upamanyu from whom the Upamanyava clan sprang. <F>2:  Ib. ७०. ८९.</F>
(XVII)--a देवी attending on Soma. Br. III. ६५. २६.
(XVIII)--a son of देवरक्षिता and Vasudeva, killed by Kamsa. Br. III. ७१. १८१; वा. ९६. १७८.
(XIX)--(काश्यप), a sage of the Rohita epoch. Br. IV. 1. ६२; Vi. III. 2. २३. [पगे३-172+ ४०]
(XX)--a son of पुरूरवस् and ऊर्वशी. M. २४. ३३.
(XXI)--one of the ten sons of स्वायम्भुव Manu; <F>1:  M. 9. 5; Br. II. १३. १०४; वा. ३१. १७.</F> attained heaven by तपस्। <F>2:  M. १४३. ३८.</F>
(XXII)--a son of सावर्णि Manu. M. 9. ३३.
(XXIII)--left her consort, मारीचकश्यप for Soma. M. २३. २५.
(XXIV)--a son of भृगु; one of the ten विश्वेदेवस्. M. १९५. १३; २०३. १३.

--eight in number, and sons of Dharma and Vasu; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. १०; 7. 2; १०. १७; Br. II. ३८. 2; IV. १५. २४.</F> worshipped for wealth; <F>2:  भा. II. 3. 3; IX. २४. ५३; Vi. III. 1. ३१.</F> fought with कालेयस् in a देवासुर war; gods of the Vaivasvata epoch, who wait on Hari; <F>3:  भा. VIII. १०. ३४; १३. 4; IX. २४. ५२; X. ३९. ५४.</F> came with other gods to द्वारका to ask कृष्ण to go to वैकुण्ठ. <F>4:  Ib. XI. 6. 2; १६. १३.</F> Brothers of साध्यस् and cursed to experi- ence birth by sexual union; vanquished by रावण; their overlord was Agni; <F>5:  Br. II. २७. २४; III. 3. २० and ८०; 7. २५४; 8. 5; M. 8. 4; Vi. I. २२. 3; V. 1. १७; 4. 5.</F> also ज्योतिष्मन्तस् and व्यापकस्; <F>6:  M. 5. १७; Vi. I. 9. ६४ and ७०; १५. १०५.</F> one of the seven classes of deities of the Vaivasvata epoch; <F>7:  M. 9. २९.</F> eight in number considered as अम्शा of वासुदेव; <F>8:  Ib. 5. २०-21; २५. ४३; ३६. 1; ५२. २१; वा. १०. ७१; ३९, ४९; ३०. ८३, ९९; ६४. 2; ६६. १९; ६९. ४४; १०६. ५९; १०९. २२; Vi. I. १५. १०९-10.</F> पितृस् said to be Vasus; <F>9:  M. १९. 3.</F> Somapas. <F>१०:  Ib. ६९. ६२; १३२. 3; २०३. 3; २४६. ६०; २४७. ११.</F> [पगे३-173+ २४]
--a son of पुष्यमित्र, ruled for seven years. M. २७२. २८.
(I)--a son of भृगु; a deva. Br. III. 1. ८९; M. १९५. १३.
(II)--a son of Purukutsa and Lord of नर्मदा. M. १२. ३६.
(I)--a son of हिरण्यरेतस् of कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १४; वा. ६२. २९.
(II)--a शिव god. Br. II. ३६. ३२.
--a son of बृहद्रथ. M. ५०. ८५.
--a son of बृहद्रथ. Vi. IV. २१. १३.

(I)--of the family of ययाति; a son of Deva- मीढ (also शूर) and मारिषा. He had a surname आनक- dundubhi because at his birth anakas and dundubhis were sounded as a sign of receiving Hari's grace. Married the seven daughters of Devaka; six other wives of: <F>1:  भा. IX. २४., २३-45; Br. III. ६१. २३; ७१. १४६, १६०-1, १७४; M. ४४. ७२; वा. ८६. २८; ९६. १४४, १५९-161, १९८; ९८. ९४; Vi. IV. १४. १९.</F> Father of कृष्ण by देवकी; when marrying her he promised Kamsa, who drove the chariot and who heard a voice [पगे३-174+ ४८] from air that her eighth son would kill him, to give him all sons born of देवकी to be killed by him. Took her first son to Kamsa who spared him; was thrown in prison with देवकी by Kamsa. Vasudeva's prayer to the new born कृष्ण; took the babe to Nandagopa's house and exchanged him for the daughter, born to यशोद at that time, without anybody knowing it. Released by Kamsa; <F>2:  भा. I. 1. १२; 2. 7; 8. ३३; III. 2. २५; X. २६. १७; 1. २३ to the end; ch. 3 (whole); 4. १४ and २४; Br. III. ७१. २१०-35; M. ४६. 1-2; ४७. 2-6; Vi. V. 1. 5; 3. १५-23.</F> met Nanda who went to the capital for paying annual tribute and after enquiring of his welfare advised him to return home as he expected some trouble at the Vraja. Requested Garga to go to Vraja and perform सम्स्कारस् to his sons. <F>3:  भा. X. 5. २०-31; 8. 1.</F> Visited by नारद. Vasu- deva enquired of भागवत धर्म; listened to the tradi- tional account of the talk between the nine sons of ऋषभ and Nimi and was pleased along with देवकी; <F>4:  Ib. XI. 2. 3; ३१. १५-22.</F> met by कृष्ण at सुधर्मा sabha1 painted by चित्रलेखा; <F>5:  Ib. X. [६७ (v)  ४२, ४७]; ६२. २०.</F> joined the Yadus in defeating पौण्ड्रक Ma1ya1. Vasudeva cut off साल्व before कृष्ण in battle. Welcomed कृष्ण after the Kuru- क्षेत्र war; went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse; here he met the sages and asked them how to get rid of karma by karma. नारद's praise of. The sages induced him to undertake a sacrifice; requested by Vasudeva to be his ऋत्विक्स् for the यज्ञ they agreed. At the end of the sacrifice, he had his अवभृत with all his eighteen wives to the great satisfaction of राम and कृष्ण, when all castes and even animals were fed; others were honoured with presents. At leave-taking Vasudeva took hold of Nanda's hands and showed that the tie of friendship was the greatest of all ties and wept in joy. Gave Nanda presents; praise of कृष्ण and राम and his joy. <F>6:  Ib. X. ६६. [2]; ७७. २५-9; ८०. [१३]; ८२. 5; chh. ८४. and ८५ (whole).</F> Kamsa who heard from नारद that Vasudeva had kept his sons राम and कृष्ण under the safe custody of Nanda wanted to kill him. When he was persuaded not to do so, Kamsa imprisoned Vasudeva until कृष्ण released him; celebrated his उपनयन। <F>7:  Ib. X. ३६. १७-24, [२९ and ३१]; ४४. ३३ and ५१; ४५. 2-9, २६-9.</F> Stationed to defend the eastern gate of मथुरा; consulted by कृष्ण on the eve of attack on जरासन्ध. His part in the third campaign of जरा; came with देवकी and कृष्ण [पगे३-175+ ३३] to रुक्मिणी's residence where Pradyumna and मायावती had already arrived. His concern at कृष्ण not returning for a long time from the cave of जाम्बवती. <F>8:  Ib. X. ५०. २० [2]; [५० (v)  8]; [५१ (v) २६]; ५५. ३५; ५६. २४.</F> In previous births Sutapa and कश्यप (see देवकी). Heard of कृष्ण's decease and also of all the वृष्णिस् <F>9:  Ib. XI. ३१. १५ and १८.</F> and wept; gave his sons सौमी and कौशिक in adoption to his brother, वृक; <F>१०:  Br. III. ७१. १९२, ७३. ९४.</F> nine brothers and four sisters; <F>११:  Vi. IV. १४. २७-31.</F> chastised by Kamsa in the यादव assembly; <F>१२:  Ib. V. १५. 4-5, १८.</F> praise of कृष्ण by Vasudeva; <F>१३:  Ib. V. १५. २०-28.</F> entered fire after कृष्ण's death. <F>१४:  Ib. V. ३८. 4.</F>

(II)--a कण्व and a minister of the शुन्ग king देवभूति; (म्। and ब्र्। प्।-देवभूमि); killed his master and became king. Father of भूमित्र; ruled for five years; began the line of काण्वायनस्. भा. XII. 1. १९-20; Br. II. ७४. १५६; M. २७२. ३२; Vi. IV. २४. ३९-40.
(III)--a son of Cancu. Vi. IV. 3. २५.
--a daughter of गादिनी. वा. ९६. १११.
(II)--the deity to be remembered in install- ing a new image; the presiding deity is शर्व. M. २६५. ३८, ४०. [पगे३-176+ २३]
--a Mt. where there are eight temples to the Vasus. वा. ३८. २३; ३९. ४४; ४२. ३०.
--from which the whole world springs and ends. वा. ६२. १९३.
--a class of people in शाल्मलिद्वीप. भा. V. २०. ११.
--a तीर्थ sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ७२.
--one of the seven sons of वसिष्ठ. भा. IV. 1. ४१.
--a son of हर्यश्व and दृषद्वती. वा. ८८. ७६.
(I)--R. a river of the भद्रा country. वा. ४३. २७.

(IV)--a son of कृष्ण and जाम्बवती. भा. X. ६१. १२.

(VI)--with अष्टक, Pratardana and शिबि, all grandsons of ययाति by his daughter, performed a sacrifice and in that hall ययाति fallen from heaven, spoke with them and went back to heaven; <F>1:  M. ३५. 5.</F> discourse of, with ययाति on differ- ent things of heaven; <F>2:  Ib. ३८. २२; ४१. १८; ४२. 1f.</F> went to heaven with the above. <F>3:  Ib. ४२. १४, २६ and २८.</F>
--a son of सुज्येष्ठ (वसुज्येष्ठ-म्। प्।) and father of Bhadraka (Udanka-वि। प्।); ruled for ten years. भा. XII. 1. १७; Br. III. ७४. १५२; M. २७२. २८; वा. ९९. ३३९; Vi. IV. २४. ३५.
--a son of Havya. वा. ३३. १६.
--a वर्ष after his name. वा. ३३. १९. [पगे३-178+ २०]
--a place of Rukmavat Agni. वा. २९. ४०.
(I)--the milk-man of the Gandharvas on the earth; in his guise, यक्ष enjoyed क्रतुस्थला. Br. II. ३६. २२१; III. 7. १०६; वा. ६९. १४०.
(II)--an Apsaras. Br. III. 7. ११.
--an Andhaka. Br. III. ७१. १४३.
--one of the five deities to be propitiated in installing a new image; the presiding deity is पशुप. M. २६५. ३८, ४०.
--another name for Brahmajyoti Agni. Br. II. १२. २५.
--a son of जैगीसव्य, an अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १३९.
--a son of श्रीदेवा and Vasudeva. भा. IX. २४. ५१.
--a wife of Agni, a Vasu. Bha. VI. 6. १३.
--being sonless, adopted the sons of कृष्ण. वा. ९६. १८९.
--a son of लोमपाद. वा. ९५. ३७.
--a place sacred to शिव. M. १८१. २५.
--a son of Upagupta, and father of Yuyudha. भा. IX. १३. २५.
--the city of Indra on the top of the मानस to the east of Meru; (see वस्वौकसारा). वा. ५०. ८७.
--a R. On its bank is the forest Surabhi. Br. II. १८. ६२.
--the golden city of Indra, on the east of Meru (see वस्वोकसारा). Br. II. २१. ३०.
(I)--a son of Durdamana (शतानीक-भ। प्।) and father of दण्डपाणि. भा. IX. २२. ४३.
(II)--son of Udayana. M. ५०. ८६.
--the place of eternal cosmic fire between सुवक्ष and शिखि Mts. to the west. वा. ३८. ३६-41. [पगे३-180+ २५]

--issued from ब्रह्मा's mouth; loved by her own father. भा. III. १२. २६; IV. २५. २८.
--a daughter of माल्यवान्; one of the four wives of विश्रवस्; mother of त्रिशिरस्, दूषन and Vidyu(t)jjihva; अनुपालिका (असलिका-वा। प्।) was her daughter. Br. III. 8. ३९-56; वा. ७०. ३४, ५०.
--a पारा god. Br. IV. 1. ५७.
(I)--a Satya god. Br. II. ३६. ३४.

--a yoga siddhi. Br. IV. ३६. ५३.

(III)--one of the nine sons of सावर्णि. वा. १००. २२.

--a मरीचि god. Br. IV. 1. ५८.
--the incarnation of हयग्रीव who restored the Angas, Vedas, पुराणस्, धर्मशास्त्रस्, न्याय and मीमाम्स when all the universe was burnt. M. ५३. 5.
--see हयग्रीव. Br. IV. १८. १३.
--a southern tribe. M. ११४. ४७.
--a horse of the Moon's chariot. M. १२६. ५२. [पगे३-185+ २५]
--a northern kingdom, a tribe. Br. II. १६. ४६; M. ११४. ४०; वा. ४५. ११५.
--a Marut गण. M. १७१. ५४.

--a class of gods performing श्राद्ध. Br. III. १०. ११०; वा. ७३. ६२.

--There are seven वातस्कन्धस् each with a Marut गण of seven. In the first the seven are शक्र- jyoti, Satya, Satyajyoti, Citrajyoti, ज्योतिष्मान्, Sutapas and Caitya; ऋतजित्, Satyajit, सुषेण, Senajit, Sutamitra, Amitra and Suramitra are in the second; in the third धातु, Dhanada, Ugra, भीम, वरुण, अभियुक्ताक्षिक and साह्वय; in the fourth, the names of the गण are omitted in the text; in the fifth ईदृक्, अन्यादृक्, ससरिद्द्रुमवृक्षकस्, Mita and Samita; in the sixth, ईदृक् Purus2a, नान्यादृक्, Sama- cetana, Sammita, समवृत्ति, and Pratiharta; in the seventh, the names not clear. Br. III. 5. ७८-80, ९०-96. [पगे३-187+ २९]

--Paths of वायु through which the Marut गणस् travel. Seven of them are said to have their stations in पृथ्वी (earth), भास्कर (sun), Soma (moon) Constellation group, Planets, सप्तऋषिमण्डल and Dhruva, with their respective chiefs: आवह, Pravaha, Udvaha, Samvaha, Vivaha, Anuvaha and Parivaha. Br. III. 5. ७८-80; वा. ६७. ११०-12.

--a name of Agastya. Br. IV. ३७. 9 and १९: ४१. ८३; ४२. 9.
--the Taijasa प्रकृति as a result of the सब्द गुण of आकाश commingling with the स्पर्श गुन of वायु. वा. 2. ४४.
--श्याम Para1s4ara. M. २०१. ३७.
(I)--a pupil of (Vedamitra) शाकल्य. भा. XII. 6. ५७; Vi. III. 4. २२.
(IV)--a son of गार्ग्य. वा. ९२. ७३.
--आर्षेय pravara (Angiras). M. १९६. २१.
--sages offered prayers to नागराज for obtaining ज्ञान। Br. III. ३६. 6.
--काश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 6.
--a Tripravara. M. १९६. ३३.
--an अमिताभ god. Br. II. ३६. ५४.
--a son of पृथु. Vi. I. १४. 1.
--a mountain to the left of शिल, where विद्या- dharas dance and sing with the Gandharvas and Apsarasas. वा. १०८. ४५.
--names of musical instruments mentioned. Br. IV. १६. 3-6; M. 7. १४; १०५. 6.
--sons of क्रौञ्च. Br. III. 7. ४५६.

(I)--a साधु: fit for श्राद्ध feeding; <F>1:  Br. II. ३२. २६; III. 7. ३१७; 9. ७०; १५. १६ and ३५.</F> duties of: living on fruits and roots; clothing with skins and barks of trees; bathing morning and evening; performance of homa; life in forest; <F>2:  वा. 8. १७६; Vi. III. 9. १८-23. M. २२५. 3.</F> the third order of life. <F>3:  Vi. II. 1. ३०.</F>

(II)--the third आश्रम; <F>1:  वा. ५९. २५; १०४. २३.</F> adopted by ययाति after पूरु's coronation; living on fruits and roots and always in peace, having conquered his mind and anger, was engaged for 1,००० years in offering oblations to पितृस् and Devas and in fire rites and entertaining guests; performed penance feeding on water alone for 3 years, on air for a year, in the midst of fire for another year and standing on one leg for six months; reached heaven. <F>2:  M. ३५. 1-2, १३-17; ४०. 1, 4 and 7.</F>

--(also Haris)--born of हरी and Pulaha: eleven groups distinguished: द्वीपिन्स्, शरभस्, Simhas व्याघ्रस्, नीलस्, Salyakas, ऋक्षस्, मार्जारस्, लोहासस्, वान- ras, and मायवस्. वालि was their Lord: Belong to the line of क्रोधवश; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. १७६ and ३२०: 8. ७१.</F> should not see the श्राद्ध food. <F>2:  Vi. III. १६. १२.</F>
--a R. from the Vindhyas. Br. II. १६. ३३.
(I)--the construction of small ponds at the auspicious time; the same prescription for excavating तडागस् (tanks). M. ५८. 1, ५१.
(II)--one of the ten पीठस् for images with two mekhalas. M. २६२. 6, 8. [पगे३-190+ ३५]
(I)--a name of शिव. भा. IV. 3. 8.
(II)--a son of भूत and सरूपा: a Rudra. भा. VI. 6. १७.
(III)--a son of कृष्ण and भद्रा. भा. X. ६१. १७.
--a southern tribe. M. १६३. ७३.

(I)--a name of शिव; immortal; <F>1:  भा. II. 6. ३६; III. १२. १२; Br. II. २६. ३३; III. ७२. १८२.</F> with the trident created Brahmans from his face; क्षत्रियस् from his arms, वैश्यस् from his thigh and शूद्रस् from his feet; <F>2:  M. 4. २७-30.</F> was not allowed to proceed with the creation of beings and hence got the name स्थाणु; <F>3:  Ib. 4. ३१.</F> five faced शिव grew angry at Soma's refusal to send back तारा to बृहस्पति and waged war with him. <F>4:  Ib. २३. ३६.</F>
(II)--a mountain of शाल्मलिद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १०.
(III)--a son of हीरण्यरेतस् of कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १४.

(IV)--a sage who was invited for युधिष्- ठिर's राजसूय. Went with कृष्ण to मिथिला, and came to स्यमन्तपञ्चक to see him. One of the sages who left for पिण्डारक; <F>1:  भा. X. ७४. 8; ८४. 5; ८६. १८; XI. 1-१२.</F> a sage by तपस्: an Angirasa and मन्त्रकृत्; <F>2:  Br. II. ३२. ९९ and ११०; M. १४५. ९३, १०४; वा. ५९. ९०, १०१.</F> a son of सुरूपा and a गोत्रकार; <F>3:  M. १९६. 4.</F> a Tripravara, not to marry with Angiras and बृहदुक्तस्. <F>4:  Ib. १९६. ३५-36.</F> [पगे३-191+ ३६]

(V)--a son of Atharvan Angiras: visited परशुराम in penance; <F>1:  Br. III. 1. १०५; २३. 4; IV. ३९. ५६.</F> a ऋषि by तपस्; <F>2:  M. १४५. ९३.</F> father of Asija and बृहदुत्थ. <F>3:  वा. ६५. १००-2.</F>
(VI)--the third Kalpa. M. २९०. 3.
(VII)--the contemplated being in the ३०थ् Kalpa; also शर्व; वाम I1s4vara leads to Rudralokam. वा. २२. २५, ३२ and ३४.
(VIII)--the name of the Lord of the Lohita Kalpa. वा. २३. ७०-3.
(IX)--a son of गुहावास of the १७थ् dva1para. वा. २३. १७७.
--a branch of Angiras. वा. ६५. १०६.
--a सूक्त of the साम सम्हित recited in tank ritual; <F>1:  M. ५८. ३७.</F> to be uttered in installing a new image. <F>2:  Ib. २६५. २७.</F>

(I)--(also वामनक): the fifteenth incarna- tion of Hari to do good to Indra. Second of the अवतार्स् (म्।प्।)। <F>1:  भा. I. 3. १९; II. 7. १७-18; V. २४. १८ and २३; X. ४०. १९; XI. 4. २०. M. ४७. ४२-46; Vi. III. 1. ४२-3; V. 5. १७.</F> Son of Aditi and कश्यप: wife was कीर्ती and son बृहत्श्लोक: Born on the Vijaya द्वादशि of भाद्रपद (bright) fortnight under the star श्रवण at the अभिजित् hour. After manifesting his true form to ब्रह्मा and Aditi, he changed it to a ब्राह्मण Brahmaca1rin. At his initiation ceremony all the gods were present and gave him presents; <F>2:  भा. VIII. १३. 6; X. 3. ४२; VI. १८. 8-9; VIII. १८. 5-१७.</F> went to the sacrificial hall of Bali; after welcoming him, [पगे३-192+ ३७] Bali wanted to know what his desire was. He asked for three feet of ground, and commended him as a worthy descendant of प्रह्लाद. Notwithstanding शुक्र dissuading him, Bali made the desired gift when वामन assumed the विश्वरूप form, and measured the earth with one foot and the स्वर्ग with the other. The Gods washed the uplifted foot of Hari and celebrated a great festivity. This brought joy to जाम्बवान्. The Asuras began to attack but were roughly handled by Hari's attendants. Finding Bali unable to keep his word, वामन said that he should go to hell; <F>3:  Ib. VIII. १८. २०-32; chh. १९-21 (whole) ; X. ६२. 2; M. ४७. ७२.</F> Praised by Bali, by प्रह्लाद, विन्द्यावलि, and ब्रह्मा: blessed Bali and assured प्रह्लाद of future bliss: asked शुक to complete the sacrifice started by Bali and bestowed the kingdom on his brother Indra: anointed Lord of all the worlds and became known as Upendra. Taken to Heaven in a celestial car when the universe was given to Indra; <F>4:  Ib. VIII. chh. २२ and २३. (whole); वा. ६६. १३७. ९७. ७३, १०३; ९८. ७४-87.</F> According to ब्र्। प्। this is the second अवतार्; <F>5:  Br. III. ३७. 5; ७२. ७३, ७७ and १०५; ७३. ७७; IV. ३४. ७९.</F> Details of the अवतार्; <F>6:  M. chh. २४४-6; २५९. 2.</F> Icon of: temple of, in कुरुक्षेत्र. <F>7:  Ib. २४४. 2-3; २८५. 6.</F>
(II)--an elephant at one of the four cardinal points to maintain the balance of the worlds; <F>1:  भा. V. २०. ३९; वा. ६९. ६९.</F> son of इरावती. <F>2:  Br. III. 7. २९२, ३२८ and ३९.</F>
(III)--a दानव; <F>1:  Br. III. 6. 5.</F> a son of Danu. <F>2:  M. 6. १७.</F>
(IV)--a १००० hooded snake. M. 6. ४१.
(V)--a son of Bhadra, the elephant. वा. ६९. २१३. [पगे३-193+ २७]
(VI)--a son of वामदेव; his wife was अन्गदा; two sons; अञ्जनश्याम and साम्न who were good looking animals fit for riding by men. वा. ६९. २२३-4; Br. III. 7. ३३९.
--a mountain in क्रौञ्चद्वीप. Br. II. १९. ६७; वा. ४९. ६१; Vi. II. 4. ५०.
--a mountain sacred to ललितापीठ. Br. IV. ४४. ९९.
--sacred for श्राद्ध. Br. III. १३. ९२; वा. ७७. ८२.
--a महापुराण comprising ten thousand श्लोकस् (a lac of श्लोकस् वा। प्।) (see वामनम्). भा. XII. 7. २४; १३. 7; वा. १०४. 6; Vi. III. 6. २३.
--the पुराण of १०००० verses, with the माहात्म्य of Trivikrama and dealing with Trivarga in the कूर्म Kalpa; he who gives it in the विषु of शरद् attains वैष्णवहोओद् (see वामनपुराण). M. ५३. ४५-6.
--on the west is the Utkala and on the east the country of the आवेदिन्स्; belongs to the son of एकभू. वा. ६९. २४०.
--one of Danu's sons. वा. ६८. 5.
--आत्रेय gotraka1ras; पुत्रिकापुत्रस् of Atri. M. १९७. 3 and 9. [पगे३-194+ २५]
--a horse of the moon's chariot; <F>1:  वा. ५२. ५३.</F> sons of Kratu. <F>2:  Ib. ६२. 9.</F>
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १३. 2.
--a R. of the भद्रा continent. वा. ४३. ३०.
--a branch of Angiras. वा. ६५. १०७.
--a वर्ण S4akti. Br. IV. ४४. ६१.

--a पुराण narrated by वायु including the माहात्म्यम् of Rudra dealing with श्वेतकल्प; of २४००० s4lokas; he who copies this and makes a gift of it on the श्रावण day of the श्रावण month attains the kingdom of शिव: is वायु पुराण। M. ५३. १८.
(II)--a मुहूर्त of the night. Br. III. 3. ४३; वा. ६६. ४४.
(I)--the region of वायु. भा. X. ८९. ४४. [पगे३-195+ ४७]
(II)--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १०.

(I)--to be fed with स्राद्ध पिण्ड for long life; <F>1:  Br. III. १२. ३३; IV. 2. १७४.</F> the crow as belonging to Indra, वरुण, Yama and निरृति; <F>2:  वा. १०१. १७१; १०८. ३१; १११. ४०.</F> one of copper, as gift for the ceremonial connected with tank construction. <F>3:  M. ५८. १९.</F>
(II)--(see वायव्य): a यामदेव. वा. ३१. 7.

(I)--a God and father of इला; <F>1:  भा. IV. १०. 2; १४. २६.</F> and मुदा clan of Apsarasas: presented पृथु with चामरस्: worshipped through प्राणायम in शाकद्वीप; <F>2:  Ib. V. १५. १५; २०. २७.</F> A लोकपाल and father of भीम. Took part in the देवासुर wars and killed the Asuras. Deprived of his force by the Asuras; <F>3:  Ib. VIII. 5. १९; १०. २६; ११. 1 and ४२; IX. २२. २७. M. ३१. १२; ४६. 9. २६६. २४; वा. ९९. २४४.</F> set out on a black antelope against कृष्ण taking पारिजात, but returned afraid of him; <F>4:  भा. X. [६५ (v)  ४४]: [६६ (v)  २७-32]; M. १४८. ६०-61.</F> his city was visited by Arjuna in search of the dead child of a द्वारका Bra1hman2a; <F>5:  Ib. X. ८९. ४४; Br. IV. ३३. ६७.</F> Born of आकाश: the wind-god loved अञ्जना and gave birth to हनुमान्: overlord of the winds, formless creatures and of time. Presiding deity of Bhuvarloka and hence Bhuvas- pati (also मातरिश्व). Addressed by the sages engaged in sacrifice to speak on लोकालोक; <F>6:  Ib. II. २०. 1 and 7; २५. 5-१४; III. 7. २३, २२४-5, २९६; 8. १२; IV. 2. २०; १९५-7, २१२, २४५-6.</F> narrates the fourth पाद of the ब्रह्माण्ड पुराण, <F>7:  Ib. IV. 1. २२७; 4. ४४.</F> reported to उमा in penance of a lady in her chamber little knowing her to be आदि in disguise; <F>8:  M. १५६. ३९.</F> worship of; <F>9:  Ib. २३६, 5; २५३. २४; २६५. ३९ and ४१. २६८. १२.</F> Icon of, mounted on a black deer, <F>१०:  Ib. २६१. १९; २८९. 6.</F> a स्थान of Rudra; <F>११:  Vi. I. 8. 7.</F> father of Manojava and भीम; <F>१२:  Ib. I. 8. ११; IV. २०. ४०.</F> कृष्ण's messenger to Indra. <F>१३:  Ib. V. २१. १४-17; ३७. १६-28.</F> [पगे३-196+ ३३]

(II)--is a transformation of आकाश with the two qualities of शब्द and स्पर्श। Its subtle element is स्पर्श from which came तेजस्; <F>1:  M. 3. २४.</F> it is प्राण, अपान and समान; <F>2:  Ib. १६६. 5.</F> role of, in sustaining life. <F>3:  वा. ३१. ४१-5.</F>
(III)--a Vasu: a son of Dharma and सुदेवी. M. १७१. ४७.

(IV)--a son of अनुह्राद; <F>1:  वा. ६३. १२; ६७. ७५.</F> the lord of सब्द, आकाश and बल, <F>2:  Ib. ७०. १२.</F> the appointed father of वृकोदर; <F>3:  Ib. ९९. २४४.</F> present- ed Skanda with the banners of the cuckoo and hen. <F>4:  Ib. ७२. ४५.</F>
(V)--a तिर्थ sacred to, in the सरस्वती. भा. III. 1. २२.

--contents of; originally narrated by ब्रह्मा; or पाशुपत Yoga, origin of Linga, glorification of नीलकण्ठ; one who does not know this पुराण, though learned in all the Vedas and other branches, will not be a man of culture; the whole पुराण is full of the greatness of महेश्वर; <F>1:  वा. 1. ४८-205.</F> narrator वायु; <F>2:  Ib. २६. 5.</F> (see वायवीयम्) .
--burnt by the Pralaya fire. Br. IV. 1. १५३.
--the residence of Marut गणस्. वा. 1. १३४.
--the heavenly animal which came down for Haryanga's help. M. ४८. ९८. [पगे३-197+ ४०]
--शिव in काञ्ची. Br. IV. 5. 7.

--the city of हस्तिनापुर; सत्यभामा goes there to complain to कृष्ण often about the death of her father by शतधन्वा; <F>1:  वा. ९६. ६१.</F> here कृष्ण went to perform the last obsequies to the पाण्डवस् who were reported to have been burnt down. <F>2:  Br. III. ७१. ६३; Vi. IV. १३. ७०.</F>

--काशी: sacred to Hari; <F>1:  भा. VII. १४. ३१; X. ६६. ४०.</F> fit for श्राद्ध offer- ing, and sacred to ललिता; <F>2:  Br. III. १३. १०१; IV. ४४. ९३.</F> the capital of दिवोदास devastated by the राक्षस Ks2emaka, resulting in the change of capital to गोमती. The abode of शिव and उमा after their marriage, and hence the name Avimuktam क्षेत्रम्; <F>3:  Ib. III. ६७. २६-62.</F> the goddess enshrined here is विशालाक्षी: a place of pilgrimage; <F>4:  M. १३. २६; २२. 7.</F> capital of रुद्रशृएण्य of the Yadu race: city where मार्कण्डेय lived. <F>5:  Ib. ४३. ११; १०३. १३.</F> Lord became क्षेत्रपाल: the यक्ष Harikes4a per- formed penance here; <F>6:  Ib. १८०. 1-5, १५ and ५४.</F> the place of Yogis and Siddhas: death here is release from rebirth; <F>7:  Ib. १८०. ७२-79.</F> a siddha क्षेत्र where शिव and His consort live all the three yugas and make Avi- muktam गृहम् in Kaliyuga; <F>8:  वा. ७७. ९३; ९२. २७, ५८-59; ९९. ३१५.</F> अवतार् of लान्गलि at, in the २२न्द् dva1para; <F>9:  Ib. २३. १९८.</F> cursed by Nikumbha to become deserted for 1,००० years; <F>१०:  ९२. २३-28.</F> burnt down by कृष्ण. <F>११:  Vi. V. ३४. 3, ३९-41.</F>

--शिव addresses पार्वती on, in taking her out and showing the grandeur and majesty of the forest and garden round about काशी; the place of विद्या- [पगे३-198+ ४१] dharas, Siddhas and चारणस्. Here भगवान् Pin3gala became गणेश्वर and क्षेत्रपाल and distributor of food to the residents in the city. He was originally a यक्ष, son of पूर्णभद्र. He devoted himself to severe austerities and was blessed by शिव to be a गणपति. <F>1:  M. ch. १८०.</F> It is अविमुक्त तीर्थ for here शिव is omnipresent and is never absent from there. All sinners who die here become Rudras in time. शिव stands here like a pillar, motionless till the deluge. Every part of the city is holy. <F>2:  Ib. ch. १८१.</F> He who remains here for a month gets the benefit of observ- ing the पाशुपत vow. By living permanently one gets true emancipation. By giving up life at the मणिकर्णिका ghat one secures the desired goal. Perpetual life in काशी leads one to union with शिव. <F>3:  Ib. ch. १८२.</F> काशी's importance on account of its sacred stream, the Ganges; survives all deluge; शिव addresses पार्- वती on the great glory of the क्षेत्रम् in terms of Parama- yoga, Paramagati and परममोक्ष. It is a place where people of all वर्णस् attain immortality. Gifts of cow and other things in this city are always beneficial. <F>4:  Ib. ch. १८३.</F> It is the place where शिव got rid of the curse of ब्रह्मा to roam about with a skull for having cut off the fifth head of the creator. Through the grace of Hari, the skull fell down in काशी and broke into a thousand pieces. <F>5:  Ib. ch. १८४.</F> It is the burial ground of all the gods, the ground being the Avimukta temple. It is the seat of ब्रह्मा. But it deludes non- devotees. Here वेदव्यास resided for १२ years observing the vow of silence. At the end of the vow he felt hungry and asked for alms. None was able to feed him. When he was about to curse the city, शिव and पार्वती took the human form and entertained him to his satisfaction. Then व्यास knew of his guests who remarked that a man of choleric temper like himself should not live in that city. But he was permitted to visit it twice a fortnight on अष्टमि and चतुर्दशी days. <F>6:  Ib. ch. १८५.</F> [पगे३-199+ ३०]

(I)--(विष्णु). An अवतार् of Hari who raised the earth from the waters, see वराह, the form which विष्णु takes in the श्वेतकल्प with four feet, four hands, etc., becomes Samvatsara and assumes the form of यज्ञ; the four yugas are four feet, the क्रतुस् are अङ्गस् or limbs, the four Vedas are the hands ऋतु, सन्धिमुखस्, two अयनस् are the faces and eyes, three पर्वस् are the heads, etc., <F>1:  भा. XI. 4. १८; वा. २३. १०३-7; ४८. ४०; ४९. ११; Vi. I. 4. 8, २६.</F> appro- priate to water sports; description of; <F>2:  Br. I. 5. ११, ff.</F> helped by माया, wife (छाया-वा। प्।) out of the recovered earth came mountains and seven worlds; creation of human beings; <F>3:  Ib. I. 5. १९.</F> where ब्रह्मा is said to assume this form. <F>4:  Ib. II. 7. 7-9.</F>
(II)--a Mt. afraid of हिरण्यकशिपु's arms. M. १६३. ८१.
(III)--the २६थ् kalpa. M. २९०. 9.
(IV)--the present kalpa; fourteen Manus be- ginning with स्वायम्भुव; name and features explained. वा. २१. १२, २३, २६ f. Vi. I. 3. २८; II. 1. ४३.
--a Janapada of the भद्रा continent. वा. ४३. २२.
--in this aeon, Hari took the incarnation of a boar; see वराह. भा. III. ११. ३६.

--a महापुराण, comprising २४,000 श्लोकस्; <F>1:  भा. XII. 7. २४; १३. 7; Vi. III. 6. २३.</F> narrated by विष्णु to क्षोणि containing the माहात्म्य of [पगे३-200+ २६] महावाराह; he who gives it with a golden eagle on the Full Moon day of Madhu reaches oneness with विष्णु. <F>2:  M. ५३. ३९-41.</F>
--a Pravara (Angiras). M. १९६. १२, १३.
(I)--a surname of ललिता. Br. IV. १७. १९.
(II)--a शक्ति; a mind-born mother. <F>1:  Br. IV. १९. 7; २०. ३७; M. १७९. ११.</F> Icon of, with buffalo mount. <F>2:  Ib. २६१. ३०.</F>
(III)--a R. of the वराहद्वीपम्. वा. ४८. ३९.
--a transformation of तेजस् or fire; has four quali- ties, sound, touch, form and taste (रस)। M. 3. २५.
--a Mt. in भारत vars2a. भा. V. १९. १६.
--a queen of वर्ष R2tu. Br. IV. ३२. २९.
--a class of deities of the चाक्षुष epoch. M. 9. २४.
--a son of अक्रूर. M. ४५. २९. [पगे३-201+ ३०] वारिषेण--a Kinnara with human face. वा. ६९. ३५.
--a son of Candragupta Maurya and father of अशोकवर्धन. भा. XII. 1. १३.
(I)--one of the nine divisions of भारत vars2a. Br. II. १६. 9; M. ११४. 8; वा. ४५. ७९. Vi. II. 3. 7.
(II)--a मुहूर्त of the day; <F>1:  Br. III. 3. ४०; वा. ६६. ४१.</F> offer of पिण्ड in the श्राद्ध. <F>2:  Ib. १११. ४०.</F>

--ब्रह्मा took the वारुणि body and offer- ed his शुक्र (semon) to Agni to beget sons; hence eight sons who are ऋषिस्; भृगु, Angiras, मरीचि, Pulastya, Pulaha, Kratu, Atri, and वसिष्ठ; all devas and यज्ञङ्गस् in the shape of human forms were present; also Vedas as well as लक्षण, svara, sthopa, nirukta, devakanyas, deva-patnis, देवमातरस्, all in human form. वा. ६५. १८-30.
--fit for श्राद्ध offering. वा. ८२. १३. Br. III. १८. १२.
--descendants of भृगु adopted by वरुण from यज्ञ. वा. ६५. ३९.
--used for ceremonials of digging tanks; <F>1:  M. ५८. २५.</F> for planting trees and shrubs; <F>2:  Ib. ५९. १२.</F> to ward off the evils of the state. <F>3:  Ib. २३४. 6.</F> [पगे३-202+ २९]
--the region of God वरुण, attained by one who gives the विष्णु पुराण in आषाढ; <F>1:  M. ५३. १७.</F> attained by one who performs the दृढव्रत. <F>2:  Ib. १०१. ४४.</F>
--of kings; to punish sinners. M. २२६. 5.
--in the course of the gift of Sapta सागर. M. २८७. १०.
(I)--a siddha. भा. VI. १५. [१४].
(II)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३४.

(I)--came out of the churning of the क्षीरोद and was appropriated by the Asuras; <F>1:  भा. VIII. 8. ३०; Vi. I. 9. ९४.</F> Devas che- rished her and became suras; <F>2:  Br. IV. 9. ६७-8.</F> the goddess attending on शेष. <F>3:  Vi. II. 5. १८.</F> presented liquor to Baladeva in the ब्रिन्दावन. <F>4:  Ib. V. २५. 2.</F>

(II)--drunk by बलराम and गोपीस्, being sent by वरुण; <F>1:  भा. X. ६५. १९.</F> drunk by the Yadus who became intoxicated and killed one another. Stupefied by it, all the यादव tribes fought with one another and killed them- selves; <F>2:  Ib. I. १५. २३; III. 4. 1-2.</F> came out of the churning of the ocean. <F>3:  M. २४९. ६१.</F> [पगे३-203+ ३०]
(III)--the region sacred to वरुण. भा. X. ८९. ४४.
(IV)--(also known as पुष्करिणी) a daughter of अरण्य Praja1pati; a wife of चक्षुष, and mother of चाक्- षुष Manu; sister of Udaka who attained वरुणहोओद्. Br. II. ३६. १०२-4; वा. ६२. ८९.
(V)--a वर्ण S4akti. Br. IV. ४४. ६१.
(VI)--a mind-born mother; on the fish with the serpent with पाश or noose. M. १७९. १०; २८६. 9.
--composed mostly of water; ब्रह्मा took it in वारुणि kratu; <F>1:  वा. ६५. २६.</F> celebrated at the first त्रेतायुग. <F>2:  Br. II. १३. ८४.</F>
--one of the six kinds of forts. M. २१७. 7.
--the daughter of trees, given in marriage to the ten Pracetas as. दक्ष was their son. भा. VI. 4. १५-17.

--produced by ब्रह्मा; according to प्रह्लाद, should be a means to realise Hari; profession of वैश्यस्. Fourfold--कृषि, वाणिज्यम्, गो-रक्ष, and कुसीद (usury). <F>1:  भा. III. १२. ४४; VII. 6. २६; ११. १६; X. २४. २१. Br. I. 1. ९२; वा. ४९. ११७; ५७. ८९; ५८. २५; ५९. ३६; ६१. १६० and १६६.</F> Began in the त्रेतायुग and disappears towards the close of the Kali; not known in पुष्करद्वीप. <F>2:  Br. II. १९. १२१. ३०. 3 and 8; ३२. ४०; ३५. १८७ and १९५; III. ७४. २१०-2. Vi. II. 4. ८३.</F> Origin of com- merce; came into being after the beginning of the त्रेतायुग [पगे३-204+ २९] when the ग्रामारण्य corns were not enough and when people wanted something more to live on; with वार्ता came मर्यादा and conventions of society; <F>3:  वा. 8. १५९, २०२; Br. II. 7. १५१. Vi. I. 6. २० and २२.</F> symbolical of देवी; <F>4:  Ib. I. 9. १२१.</F> a विद्या. <F>5:  Ib. V. १०. २७-28.</F>
--brinjal, not fit for श्राद्ध. वा. ७८. ४८.
--a name of ललिता; a शक्ति. Br. IV. १७. १९; २०. ३४ and ३७.
--one of the three राक्षस clans, moving about in day time as opposed to निशाचरस्. Br. III. 8. ६१.
--the name of the tenth battle between the Devas and Asuras (वार्त-वा। प्।). Br. III. ७२. ७५; वा. ९७. ७६.
--a money-lender, unfit for पन्क्ति feeding and for श्राद्ध. Br. III. १५. ५३; १९. ३०.
(II)--a daughter of स्वर्भानु. Vi. I. २१. 7.
--leads to the world of शिव; consists of dedication of a bull in the month of कार्तिक. M. १०१. ६५. [पगे३-205+ ३६]
--(धार्ष्टक) the line of धृष्ट. Vi. IV. 2. 4.
--धूम्र Para1s4aras. M. २०१. ३८.
--the name of a सम्हिता imparted by बाष्- kali to बालायनि and others. भा. XII. 6. ५९.

--a class of seers, ६०,000 in number, born of Kratu: <F>1:  भा. III. १२. ४३; IV. 1. ३९; V. २१. १७; Br. I. 2. २७; Vi. I. १०. ११; II. १०. २२.</F> advised Citraratha, who fell to the ground to gather कौशिक's bones to throw them into the सरस्वती and get redemption; <F>2:  भा. VI. 8. ४०.</F> They go in front of the Sun from his rise to his setting, singing his glory; <F>3:  Ib. XII. ११. ४९; Br. II. ११. ३७; २१. ११५; २३. २८ and ४९, M. १२६. २८; वा. 2. २७; २३. १५९; २८. ३१; ५०. १६८; ५२. २६ and ४९; ५४. 8; ५५. ४१; ५९. ९१.</F> live on air; sages by तपस्; authors of certain सम्हितस्; live in Brahmaloka; <F>4:  Br. II. २५. 4; २६. ४३; ३२. ९९; ३५. ७१ and ९४; III. 1. ५५; १५. १६; IV. 2. २१६.</F> ऋषिस् by तपस्। <F>5:  M. १२६. ४५; १४५. ९३; २००. 8.</F> Of the category of सावर्न; <F>6:  वा. ६१. ६२, ८४.</F> were born out of कुश grass and endowed with all powers in वारुणि यज्ञ; <F>7:  Ib. ६५. ५५; १०१-213.</F> पुण्या and सुमती are younger sisters of. <F>8:  Ib. २८. ३३.</F>
--a R. from the Vindhyas. Br. II. १६. ३३.
--eight times the measurement of Trasa- रेणु (s.v.). M. २५८. १७. [पगे३-206+ ३२]

(I)--a son of विरजा (the daughter of ऋक्ष) and Mahendra. Crowned king of किष्किन्द and ruled with सुग्रीव; wife तारा and son Angada: crossed the seas, van- quished रावण at पुष्कर, and agreed to be his ally on his request; performed Vedic यज्ञस्, learned in the Vedic lore; applauded by नारद; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. २१४-48.</F> killed by राम. <F>2:  भा. IX. १०. १२; Vi. IV. 4. ९६.</F>
(II)--an Asura in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु. M. १६१. ८१.
(III)--an अवतार् of the Lord in the १३थ् dva1para in the वालखिल्याश्रम of the गन्धमादन with तपस्विन् sons. वा. २३. १५९.
--a name of शिव. वा. ६०. ६९.
--a R. of the भारत vars2a. वा. ४५. १००.
--noted for horses. Br. IV. १६. १७.

(I)--originally born out of an ant-hill, born again of चर्षणी and वरुण. In his आश्रम, शीता was left when pregnant. There she gave birth to two sons whom the sage brought up; <F>1:  भा. VI. १८. 5; IX. ११. १०-11, १५; Br. III. ३६. 6.</F> author of राम's story; of the family of भार्गव; <F>2:  M. १२. ५१.</F> heard it from नारद who got it from ब्रह्मा. <F>3:  Ib. ५३. ७१-2.</F> वेदव्यास of the २६थ् dva1para; <F>4:  Vi. III. 3. १८.</F> present at राम's अभिषेक। <F>5:  Ib. IV. 4. १००.</F> [पगे३-207+ ३०]
(II)--the father of रोहिणि and पनवी. वा. ९६. १६१.
--R. a महानदी sacred to पितृस्. वा. १०८. ७९.
--a Mother Goddess. M. १७९. २८.
--a wife of Arka, a Vasu. भा. VI. 6. १३.

(I)--is Indra (s.v.) protects gems in the Kakud- मान् hill in शाल्मलिद्वीप: draws water for rain from जलधार mountain in शाकद्वीप; <F>1:  Br. II. १८. ४४; १९. ४२ and ८६; M. ३७. 2. and 7; Vi. I. २२. 6; V. ३०. ४६.</F> overlord of the Maruts: killed the pupils of Sukarman for learning the सम्हिता on forbidden days: set up वायु to lead off Sagara's horse to रसातल; <F>2:  Br. II. ३५. ३६; III. 8. 5; २८. ७२; ५३. 1; IV. 9. 5 and १९; १३. ३०; २०. ४९; वा. ७०. 5.</F> son of Aditi, protects प्रयागा; <F>3:  M. १०४. 9; १३४. 6; २४४. ३८.</F> gave by a वर two good disciples to Sukarma (s.v.) to pacify his anger at the loss of his pupils. <F>4:  वा. ६१. ३२.</F>
(II)--a मुहूर्त of the after-noon; <F>1:  Br. III. 3. ३९.</F> a deva of the Auttama Manu. <F>2:  वा. ६२. ३२; ६६. ४०.</F>
--(सत्यवती): the mind-born daughter of पितृस्; became Matsyayoni; wife of पराशर; from her was born व्यास as fire from अरणि. भा. I. 4. १४; 6. ३८; वा. 1. ४०. [पगे३-208+ ३५]
--the city of वासव on the east of the मानसोत्तर hill, south of Yama, west of वरुण and north of Soma--also वस्वौकसारा. Vi. II. 8. 8-9.
--a वैश्य mantrakr2t. M. १४५. ११६.
--an expert in divine music. वा. ६९. ४६.
(I)--a deva गण of eleven groups. Br. II. ३५. ६४; III. 1. ५०; 8. १००; IV. ३९. ५५.

(II)--had seven sons by उर्जा: they are Raja, Putra, अर्धबाहु, Savana, आधन, Sutapa and शुक्ल; also daughter पुण्डरीका; according to the ब्र्। प्। the seven are रक्ष, Garta, उर्ध्वबाहु, Savana, Pavana, Sutapa and शम्कु. वा. २८. ३४-6; Br. II. ११. ४१-2.

(I)--a son of Kadru: a chieftain of the नाग- loka. He was used as the rope in the अमृतमथन। Identi- fied with Hari. <F>1:  भा. V. २४. ३१; VIII. 6. २२ and ch. 7 (whole); XI. १६. १८; Br. III. 7. ३२ and ४४४; 8. १३; ३६. १५; IV. 9. ५१, ५६-9; M. 6. ३९; 8. 7; Vi. I. 9. ७७ and ८४; २१. २१.</F> A friend of Indra: the milkman of the नागस् for milking the earth: moving with the sun for two months; <F>2:  Br. II. १७. ३४; २०. ४१; २३. 3; ३६. २१३; Vi. II. १०. 3.</F> in the वैडूर्य s4a1la1 of ललिता; <F>3:  Br. IV. २०. ५३; ३३. ३६.</F> his aid to त्रिपुरारि; <F>4:  M. ११४. ८३; १२६. 3; १३३. २५ and ४२.</F> an ear ornament of शिव; shaken by हिरण्यकशिपु: sports in अमरकण्टक; <F>5:  Ib. १५४. ४४४; १६३. ५६; १८८. ९२; १९३. ३५; २४९. ६४.</F> heard the विष्णु पुराण from धृतराष्ट्र the नाग and narrated it to Vatsa. <F>6:  Vi. VI. 8. ४६.</F> [पगे३-209+ ४२]
(II)--the नाग presiding over the month of Madhu. भा. XII. ११. ३३.
(III)--a son of सुरसा and कश्यप and a King of the नागस्; the hundred headed snake in Sutalam; <F>1:  वा. ५०. ३९; ७०. १२.</F> with the sun in the spring. <F>2:  Ib. ५२. 3.</F>
(IV)--a नाग living in the निषध hill. वा. ४६. ३४; ६२. १८०; ६९. ६९.
--a place near प्रयागा; nearby are Kambala, अश्वतर and बहुमूलक reptiles. M. १०४. 5.

(I)--another name for कृष्ण (s.v.) equal to नारायण in qualities; value of भक्ति towards: His immanence in the Universe: worshipped in the Kaliyuga by the righteous; <F>1:  भा. X. 8. १४ and १९; I. 2. 7-३४; XII. 2. २२ and ३८. Br. I. 2. ३७; वा. 1. १४८; २३. २१८; Vi. II. १२. ४४-7; १५. ३५; IV. १३. १०५; V. १७. १५; १८. ५८; ३७. २८; ३८. 9. VI. 3. ४१; 5. ७६, ८०.</F> Manu takes the fish to be; <F>2:  M. 1. २६; 2. १६; ४५. १८; ५२. २०-22; ६९. 7; Vi. --the eldest of the १०० sons of इक्ष्वाकु; Asked by his father to secure some माम्स for his अष्टक ritual, he went to the forest, secured some by killing a thousand animals, and feeling hungry, he ate of a portion of the hare's flesh. When this was found out the father abandoned him. He wandered about the land as शशाद. But on his father's demise, he was enthroned at अयोध्या and came to be known as शशाद. He pleased Hari by sacrifices. Father of Puramjaya: <F>1:  भा. IX. 6. 6-१२; वा. 1. १४१; ८८. 9-२०; ८९. 1. Vi. --the mother of the gods called the वैकुण्- ठस्; <F>1:  Br. III. 4. ३१.</F> mother of वैकुण्ठ, the great god in the चाक्षुष <F>2:  Vi. III. 1. ४१.</F> epoch.

(II)--one of the sixteen wives of हव्यवाहन; <F>1:  M. ५१. १३; वा. २९. १३.</F> in the chariot of त्रिपुरारि. <F>2:  M. १३३. २३.</F>
--a measurement by the little finger, १२ an3gulas; <F>1:  M. ५८. 8; वा. 8. १०४; १०१. १२२; Br. II. 7. ९८.</F> in connection with गृहबलिकुण्डम्. <F>2:  M. ९३. 7.</F>
--the mother of बृहद्भानु. भा. VIII. १३. ३५.
(I)--a R. of the शाल्मलिद्वीप. वा. ४९. ४२; Vi. II. 4. २८.
(II)--same as the R. पवित्रा. M. १२२. ७२.
(I)--a pupil of कुशुमि. Br. II. ३५. ४३.
(II)--a Pratardana god. Br. II. ३६. ३१.
(III)--a Sukha god. Br. IV. 1. १८. [पगे३-225+ २९]
(IV)--a mukhya गण. वा. १००. १८.
--wealth is wealth to the extent it is useful; to be divided among five: dharma, celebrity, productive pur- poses, pleasure, and relatives. भा. VIII. १९. २७ and ३७.
--a son of Raivata Manu. M. 9. २१.
--a जयादेव god: <F>1:  Br. III. 3. 6;</F> son of ब्रह्मा with मन्त्र- शरीर। <F>2:  वा. ६७. 6.</F>
(I)--a मन्त्रकृत्--a मध्य माध्वर्यु। Br. II. ३२. १०५; वा. ५९. ९६.
(II)--a mukhya गण. वा. १००. १८.
--a भार्गव branch. Br. III. 1. १००.

(I) (च्)--a kingdom to which the Yadus migrated. <F>1:  भा. IV. २८. २८; X. 2. 3; Br. III. ४९. 1.</F> Its capital कुण्डिन, visited by कृष्ण. <F>2:  भा. X. ५३. 6-7; Vi. V. २६. 1</F> Its king went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse. <F>3:  भा. X. ८२. १३.</F>
(II)--a son of ऋषभ. भा. V. 4. १०.

(III)--(वैश) son of ज्यामघ and शैब्या: married the young Bhoja girl (स्नुषा-वा। प्।) got in war and [पगे३-226+ २८] already appointed as his wife before his birth by his parents. Father of three sons of whom रोमपाद (लोमपाद-म्। प्।) was the most famous; the others were Krathu and कौशिक. all of them warriors. भा. IX. २३. ३९; २४. 1; Br. III. ७०. ३६-8. M. ४४. ३६; वा. ९५. ३५; Vi. IV. १२. ३५-38.
(IV)--an ally of कार्तवीर्य, killed by परशु- राम. Br. III. ३९. 2.
(V)--the wife of, taken away by Satyavrata. वा. ८८. ७८, १५५.
--the people of Vidarbha: these took part in the festivities connected with the marriage of रुक्मिणी and कृष्ण. भा. X. ५४. ५८; ८४. ५५.

--the place where श्राद्ध is performed; generally south west; three holes to be made and three pieces of खादिर (अचचिअ चतेछु) measuring the length of a cubit (अरत्नि) to be placed; then is the शोधन or purifi- cation of अग्नि by milk and ghee. वा. ७४. 7-११.

--a particular locality between the Cakra (Candra-वा। प्।) and मैनाक hills towards the south. Here is Samvartaka fire swallowing waters as also Aurva and वडवामुख. Br. II. १८. ७९. वा. ४७. ७५-6. [पगे३-227+ ३८]
(I)--R. from the परियात्र hill in भारतवर्ष. Br. II. १६. २८; वा. ४५. ९८.
(II)--a city. Vi. III. १८. ६५.
--a caste equal to the वैश्यस् in प्लक्षद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. १७.

--a क्षेत्रज son of विचित्रवीर्य (through the female servants of the queens of विचित्रवीर्य-वि। प्।); a son of कृष्णद्वैपायन (व्यास) and a brother of धृतराष्ट्र. युधिष्ठिर narrated the services done by Vidura to the पाण्डवस् from the beginning and asked about the welfare of कृष्ण and others when Vidura spent some- time at हास्तिनपुर. Persuaded धृतराष्ट्र to leave the capital secretly to the हिमालयस् for penance, गान्धारी following him. <F>1:  M. ५०. ४७; भा. IX. २२. २५; I. १३. 8-२९. वा. ९९. २४२;</F> Insulted by Duryodhana, कर्ण, and शकुनि and ordered to be banished. Left हास्तिनपुर and wander- ed through the holy places and reaching प्रभासा, heard of the establishment of rule by युधिष्ठिर. Hearing of the death of his kinsmen he went back to the सरस्वती and performed ablutions at eleven different places sacred to Trita, उशनस्, etc. Passing through the flourishing सुराष्ट्र, सौवीर and other countries, he reached the यमुना and met Uddhava. Asked him about the welfare of his kinsmen in- cluding Ugrasena and sons of कृष्ण. Entertained by him and having heard of the last days of कृष्ण and the यादवस् and of the fact that Maitreya had been ordered by कृष्ण to be his preceptor, Vidura left यमुना for the Ganges where he met Maitreya. <F>2:  भा. III. 1. (whole) chh. 2 and 3; 4. ३३-6; 5. 1.</F> Being addressed, Maitreya said that Vidura was god Yama incarnate, and gave him a brief description of the creations and of the knowledge of one god, and that Hari was the goal. Listened to the story of उत्तान- पाद and his line, and the discourse on आत्मन्. <F>3:  Ib. III. chh. 5 and 7 (whole); I. १३. 1-7; II. १०. ४८-50; IV. ३१. ३०.</F> Left for हास्तिनपुर; having abandoned his relatives came back to [पगे३-228+ ३२] them. Welcomed by युधिष्ठिर and others. Invited for युधिष्ठिर's राजसूय in which he took an active part, and approved of the anointment of युधिष्ठिर. Went to Syaman- तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse, and left it after it was over. <F>4:  Ib. १३. 1-7; X. ७४. १०; ७५. 6; ८०. [5]; ८२. २४; ८४. ६९[1]; XII. १२. 8.</F> Seen by अक्रूर, met by कृतवर्मन्, राम and कृष्ण. <F>5:  Ib. X. ४९. 1 and 6; ५२. [५६ (v) 4 and १२]; ५७. 2.</F> After the death of धृतराष्ट्र and his wife, Vidura went on a pilgrimage and cast off his body at प्रभासा. Had realised the Yoga power of Hari. <F>6:  Ib. I. १३. ५७-58; १५. ४९; II. 7. ४५.</F>
--a son of घृत. M. ४८. 8.
--a R. from ऋष्यवान्. M. ११४. २४.
(I)--a son of Suratha, and father of सार्व- bhauma. भा. IX. २२. १०; वा. ९९. २३०; Vi. IV. २०. 3-4.
(II)--a son of चीत्ररथ, and of वृष्णि tribe. Father of शूर. भा. IX. २४. १८ and २६; Vi. IV. १४. २३.

(III)--a brother of Dantavaktra: Heard of his brother's death and attacked कृष्ण who cut off his head. <F>1:  भा. X. ७८. ११-12; II. 7. ३४.</F> Stationed by जरासन्ध on the eastern gate of मथुरा: arrived at कुण्डिन. <F>2:  Ib. X. ५०. ११[2]; ५३. १७.</F>
(IV)--(विदूर-वा। प्।)--a son of Bhaja- मान, a skilled charioteer. Br. III. ७१. १३६; वा. ९६. १३५. [पगे३-229+ २८]
(V)--a son of the IV. ऋतु (वा। प्।) सावर्णि Manu. Br. IV. 1. ९४; वा. १००. ९८.
(VI)--a son of निर्वृति and father of दशार्ह. M. ४४. ४०.
--(वैदूरपतिस्)--contemporaries of seven Andhras and seven कौशलस्. भा. XII. 1. ३५.
--a यक्ष gan2a. वा. ६९. ३९.

(I)--(च्) kingdom to which the Yadus migrated. Its king was stationed by जरासन्ध on the western gate during the siege of Gomanta. The capital went by the same name, and here lived a prostitute पिङ्गला (s.v.) by name. <F>1:  भा. X. 2. 3; ५२. ११ [११]; ५७. २४; ८६. १४; XI. 8. २२; वा. ४५. १२३.</F> An eastern country; <F>2:  Br. II. १६. ५४; M. ११४. ४५.</F> Parigha and Hari viceroys over. <F>3:  वा. ९५. २८.</F>
(II)--a name of Janaka. He had realised the Yoga power of Hari. भा. XI. 2. १४; II. 7. ४४.
(III)--a name of Nimi. Vi. IV. 5. 8.
--an eastern tribe; <F>1:  M. १६३. ६७.</F> the kingdom of Janaka. <F>2:  Vi. III. १८. ९०.</F>
--the capital of King Janaka; बलराम spent sometime there teaching mace warfare to Duryodhana. Vi. IV. १३. १०२, १०६.

(I)--leads to happiness: Role of teacher and pupil. A means to attain final beatitude; <F>1:  भा. XI. १०. १२; ११. 4-7; VI. १६. २७.</F> of १८ groups--also १४ groups; <F>2:  Br. III. ३५. ८८-9; III. १५. २९; IV. १२. ५७; १८. ४६; ३४. ६९.</F> survive अन्तर्क्षय. <F>3:  M. 2. १३.</F>
(I)--not to have marital alliances with विश्वा- mitras, Khili Khilis, etc. M. १९८. २१.

(II)--१४ including मिमाम्स, न्याय, पुराण, धर्मशास्त्र,--१८ in number,--also includes आयुर्वेद. Dhanurveda, गान्धर्व, and अर्थशास्त्र; <F>1:  Vi. III. 6. २७-8;</F> four अन्वीक्षिकी. त्रयी, वार्त and दण्डनीति; <F>2:  Ib. V. १०. २७.</F> another division--परा and अपरा. <F>3:  Ib. V. 1. ३५.</F>
--a son of Sudaridra (s.v.) a poor Brahman of पाञ्चलदेश. M. २१. 3.
--identified with भगवान्. भा. VIII. २०. ३१.

--semi celestial beings: their creation; <F>1:  भा. II. 1. ३६. 6. १४; III. २०. ४४; Br. III. १०. ३८; ३१. २३; IV. २०. ४९; ३९. ५६.</F> adore Indra; <F>2:  भा. VI. 7. 4.</F> चीत्रकेतु (Citraratha-म्। प्।) their chief; <F>3:  Ib. VI. १७. 1 and 3; VII. 8. ३७; X. 3. 6; ३४. 9; ६२. १९; ८५. 4; M. 4. २०; 8. 6; ८०. १३.</F> came to द्वारका to see कृष्ण; <F>4:  भा. XI. 6. 3; १२. 4; १४. 5; ३१. 2.</F> सुदर्शन, a chief of; <F>5:  Ib. XI. १६. २९.</F> [पगे३-231+ २७] country of, watered by नलिनी; <F>6:  Br. II. १८. ६०; M. १२१. ४८; वा. ४७. ४७.</F> the path of. <F>7:  Br. IV. 6. १३. and २२.</F> The performer of सौभाग्यशयनम् is born as a विद्याधर. <F>8:  M. ६०. ४८.</F>
--three: शैवेयस्, विक्रान्तस् and Saumanasas. वा. ३०. ८८; ३८. 5; ६९. २९.
--the city of the विद्याधरस्; in the region between the ताम्रवर्ण lake and the Patanga hills; there dwells पुलोमा, king of the विद्याधरस्. M. ६६. १८; ७८. ११; वा. ३८. 8-१६.
--a title got by Citraketu when he mastered the विद्या imparted to him by नारद. भा. VI. १६. २७-8.
--the over-lordship of the विद्या- dharas to be attained by काम. M. 4. २०.
--a वनचारिणी. Vi. I. 9. 3.
--the women of the विद्याधरस्. भा. III. २३. ३७-8; Br. III. ५०. ४०.
--sacred to ललिता. Br. IV. ३७. ४७. [पगे३-232+ २८]
--employed by सुनीथा in protecting the corpse of her son. भा. IV. १४. ३५.
--a daughter of the Gandharvas. वा. ६९. १०.
--a R. from कुशद्वीप. Br. II. १९. ६२.
--the राक्षस presiding over the month. Saha. भा. XII. ११. ४१.
(I)--a राक्षस of the fifth tala or महा- tala: a son of वाका having his city in अर्वाक्तलम्. वा. ५०. ३५; ७०. ५०; Br. II. २०. ३६; III. 8. ५६;
(II)--a राक्षस; son of खशा. वा. ६९. १९५.
(I)--a son of यातुधान: father of Rasana. Br. III. 7. ८९ and ९५.
(II)--a R. of the कुशद्वीप. M. १२२. ७३.
(III)--a राक्षस, residing in the मार्गशीर्ष in the sun's chariot. Vi. II. १०. १३.
--a unit of time; also Vidyuti (वा। प्।) Br. II. २१. १२६; वा. ५०. १८०.
--one of the seven Pralaya clouds. M. 2. 8.
--an Apsaras. Br. III. 7. 6. [पगे३-233+ २३]
--a राक्षस with the Hemanta sun. Br. II. २३. १९.
--a R. of कुशद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ४३.
--an Apsaras. वा. ६९. 5.
(I)--one of भण्ड's eight councillors. Br. IV. १२. १२.

(II)--the Asura of great penance who took a glorious part in the तारकामय war; <F>1:  M. १२९. 5.</F> on the side of Maya; he received a deadly wound from Nandi and fell dead; restored to life by Maya with the medicinal waters of the tank; <F>2:  Ib. १३१. २२.</F> his battle with Nandi and death. <F>3:  Ib. १३६. १६ f; १३८. ४७; १४०. १८-36.</F>
--a son of लम्बा and Dharma. Father of Stanayitnus (clouds). भा. VI. 6. 5. [पगे३-234+ २३]
--a Vasu: a son of कृत, the learned friend of Indra, and a warrior. वा. ९९. २२०.
--a son of Danu. M. 6. १८.
--a मुद्रा devi1. Br. IV. ४२. 5.
--a Mt. of कुशद्वीप. Br. II. १९. ५४; Vi. II. 4. ४१.
(I)--a वैकुण्ठ god. Br. II. ३६. ५७.
(II)--बृहन्गिरस् and a son of वरूत्रि. Br. III. 1. ७९; वा. ६५. ७८.
--(मन्युमान्): a son of हृच्छय and जाठराग्नि and father of Samvartaka. Br. II. १२. ३४; वा. २९. ३२.
--a son of Kali, with one leg: wife रेवती; father of a number of sons; a cannibal. Br. III. ५९. १०; वा. ८४. ११-12.
(II)--one of the names in the third Marut गण. वा. ६७. १२६.
(I)--a son of ख्याती and भृगु, married नियती, (आयती-वा। प्।) a daughter of Meru. His place in the सिशुमार; father of पाण्डु. भा. IV. 1. ४३-4; V. २३. 5; Br. II. १३. ३७; ११. 6; वा. २८. 1; ३०. ३४.
(II)--a son of Aditi. भा. VI. 6. ३९.
(IV)--a son of मृकण्डु. Vi. I. 8. १५; १०. 2, 3.
(I)--a सुखा god. Br. IV. 1. १९.
(III)--a mukhya गण. वा. १००. १९.
--one of the names in the third Marut गण. वा. ६७. १२६.
(I)--a god of the ten branches of the Rohita गण. Br. IV. 1. ८६; वा. १००. ९१. [पगे३-236+ २४]
(II)--a name of ब्रह्मा. Br. IV. २८. ८९.
(III)--Prescriptions in the शास्त्रस्; they are two- fold, one with मन्त्र, and the other without मन्त्र। M. १८३. ४४.
(IV)--(एत्य्) one of the ten लक्षणस् of the ब्राह्मण। वा. ५९. १३६.
(V)--an Ajitadeva. वा. ६७. ३४.
(VI)--the अरणि from which to get sacred fire. वा. ११२. ५०.
--a skilled interpreter of injunc- tions, eligible for पार्वण s4ra1ddha. M. १६. 8.
--a son of क्षेत्रज्ञ, and the father of अजात- शत्रु: ruled for ३८ years. भा. XII. 1. 6; Br. III. ७४. १३०; Vi. IV. २४. १३-14.
--a name of the moon; shone in ten directions having got the over-lordship of the seven worlds by तपस्। M. २३. २८-31.
--a class of celestials born with विष्णु in the वैकुण्ठ. Br. III. 3. ११७. [पगे३-237+ २४]
(I)--the father of वैधृतिस्, a group of gods. भा. VIII. 1. २९.
(II)--a son of खगण, and father of हिरण्य- नाभ. भा. IX. १२. 3.
(III)--a god of आभूतरय group. Br. II. ३६. ५५.
(IV)--a name of सत्यवती. वा. ९१. ६८.
--a ब्रह्मिष्ठ. Br. II. ३२. ११९.
--a राक्षस with the sun in Hemanta. वा. ५२. १९.
(I)--a वानर chief and son of श्वेत. Br. III. 7. १८०.
(II)--a son of Sudyumna: Lord of Western Kingdom. Br. III. ६०. १८.

(I)--a daughter of दक्ष and one of the wives of तैक्ष्य, (कश्यप-म्। प्।, वा। प्।, वि। प्।), begot गरुड and अरुण (see also सुपर्णा); <F>1:  Br. III. 3. ५६; 7. २९ and ४६८; ६१. ४२; भा. III. १५. ४०; VI. 6. २१-2; M. 6. 2, ३३-4; १४६. १८ and २२; १७१. २९ and ६२; वा. ६६. ५४; Vi. I. १५. १२५.</F> known for flying in the air; <F>2:  वा. ६९. ८३.</F> had [पगे३-238+ २२] two sons and thirtysix daughters; they comprised the गायत्री and other छन्दस् and birds like सुपर्णा; <F>3:  Ib. ६९. ६६-7.</F>
(II)--a mother goddess. M. १७९. १९.
--a son of Sudyumna, became the lord of western territories. वा. ८५. १९.
(I)--a son of लज्जा. Br. II. 9. ६१; वा. १०. ३६.
(II)--a son of Cancu. Br. III. ६३. ११८.

(III)--the discipline of mind and body important to a king; ill-disciplined kings have lost their empires; while disciplined kings leading a forest life attained kingdom through vinaya; <F>1:  M. २१५. ५२.</F> of a Prince. <F>2:  Ib. २२०. 4-7; २२५. 7.</F>
--कश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 2.
(I)--another name of कुरुक्षेत्र. भा. I. 9. 1. [पगे३-239+ ४३]
(II)--the place where the सरस्वती dis- appears: on the way from द्वारका to हास्तिनपुर. भा. X. ७१. २१; ७९. २३.

(I)--a name of विघ्नेश्वर or विघ्नेश (s.v.) <F>1:  भा. XI. २७. २९.</F> in charge of कैलास hill <F>2:  Br. II. २५. ३०.</F> a graha. <F>3:  Ib. III. 7. १६१.</F> Asked परशु- राम not to enter शिव's abode as he was with उमा. When he forced entry, विनायक made him wander all the seven worlds. परशुराम knocked his teeth with his axe to the enragement of पार्वती. शिव thought of कृष्ण who appeared on the scene with राधा. कृष्ण said that विनायक should be remembered on all auspicious and other occasions to bring out the desired results. The शैव Gan2es4a became वैष्णव: <F>4:  Ib. III. ४१. १७-32, ch. ४२, ४४. २३.</F> wor- shipped in all ceremonials as preliminary, in the भीष्म dva1- दशि, in grahabali; <F>5:  M. ५८. २६. ६९. २७; ९३. १६.</F> when उमा made out of earth an elephant- faced doll and threw it in the Ganges, it became a huge figure, adopted as son both by उमा and गन्गा; came to be known as गान्गेय and गजानन; invested with overlord- ship of all विनायकस्. <F>6:  Ib. १५४. ५०५; २३०. 8.</F> Icon of, with मूषिक mount ऋद्धि and Buddhi on either side; worship of; <F>7:  Ib. २६०. १९, ५२-5: २६१. ३८: २६६, ४२; २६९. ५६; २७४; १५; २८९. 7.</F> elephant shaped. <F>8:  वा. ३०. ३११; ५४. ३५; १०६. ५७; १०९. २३.</F>
(II)--a तीर्थ sacred to उमा. M. १३. ४१.
(I)--a variety of evil spirits; <F>1:  भा. II. १०. ३८; VI. 8. २४; X. 2. ३३; 6. २७.</F> a group of भूतस्, followers of शिव <F>2:  Br. II. २५. ११४; III. १०. ५२.</F>
(II)--different गणस् like कूष्माण्ड, गजतुण्ड and Jayanta; described as having faces of lion and tiger, short and crooked, etc. <F>1:  M. १८३. ६३-4.</F> a देवगण. <F>2:  वा. ७२. ५०.</F> [पगे३-240+ ४१]
(I)--a son of Uttama Manu. Br. II. ३६. ४०.
(II)--the third son of प्रीती and Pulastya. वा. २८. २२.
--a son of भद्राश्व. M. ४९. 5.

--a prince of Avanti, a son of राजाधिदेवी and brother of Anuvinda; <F>1:  वा. ९६. १५७; Vi. IV. १४. ४३.</F> under the influence of Duryodhana (as also Anuvinda) the brothers wanted to give their sister in marriage to Duryodhana, and not to कृष्ण whom she loved: stationed by जरासन्ध at the southern gate of मथुरा and Gomanta during their respective sieges. <F>2:  भा. X. ५८. ३०; ५०. ११[3]; ५२. ११[9]; Br. III. ७१. १५८.</F>
--sacred to राधा. M. १३. ३८.

(I)--a Mt. (Kulaparvata-वा। प्।) in भारत vars2a. Here दक्ष performed tapas; <F>1:  भा. V. १९. १६; VI. 4. २०; Vi. II. 3. 3.</F> a Kulaparvata sacred for श्राद्ध offerings. <F>2:  Br. II, १६. १९; III. 7. ३५६; १३. ३४; M. ११४. १८; वा. ४५. ८९; ५८. ८१; ६९. २३९; ७७. ३४; ८८. १९९; ९६. ३८.</F> Here Haihaya came for hunting: कृष्ण went there in search of Prasena; <F>3:  Br. III. २६. २५; ७१. ३९.</F> sacred to विन्द्याधि- वासिनी and the पितृस्; <F>4:  M. १३. ३९; २२. ६६.</F> caused by Agastya to bow down and not to rise in height; <F>5:  Ib. ६१. ५१.</F> joining with the Ganges is more sacred than कुरुक्षेत्र; <F>6:  Ib. १०६. ४९.</F> rivers originating from; <F>7:  Ib. ११४. २७-8; वा. ४५. १०३.</F> obstructed by it the गङ्गा enters the sea; <F>8:  M. १२१. ५१; वा. ४७. ५०.</F> Goddess of night was asked to seek shelter in the Vindhyas after she left उमा's body. <F>9:  M. १५७, १७, १९.</F>
(II)--a son of Raivata Manu. भा. VIII. 5. 2. [पगे३-241+ २७]
--the tribes of the Vindhya region. Br. III. ७४. १८६; M. ११४. ५१ and ५४.
--(च्) a northern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ४८.
and (मर्दन)--is Agastya. Br. IV. १०. ७६; ३२. २८ and ४८.
--of the दक्षिणापथ. वा. ४५. १२६.
--(च्) a southern country. Br. II. १६. ५८.
--a son of Kilakila (कैङ्किल Yavana- वि। प्।) succeeded by वैदिशक kings; <F>1:  Br. III. ७४. १७८.</F> ruled for ९६ years; <F>2:  वा. ९९. ३६५.</F> father of पुरञ्जय. <F>3:  Vi. IV. २४. ५६.</F>
--a son of क्षेमजित्, ruled for २८ years. M. २७२. 8.
--the Goddess enshrined in the Vindhyas. M. १३. ३९.
--a tribe on the border of the Vindhyas. वा. ६२. १२४.
--(च्) people bordering the Vindhyas on the western side. Br. III. ७३. १०७; वा. ९८. १०६. [पगे३-242+ २७]
--one of the sixteen शक्तिस् of ललिता. Br. IV. ३५. ९९.

--the queen of Bali, who participated in his gift to वामन. Seeing Bali bound with cords, she appealed to Hari; <F>1:  भा. VIII. २०. १७; २२. १९-20.</F> mother-in-law of अनौपम्या wife of बाण; had a daughter called कुम्भीनसी; both of them ill-treated बाण's wife. <F>2:  M. १८७. ४०.</F>
--a son of Indrasena and father of twins by मेनका. M. ५०. 6-7.
--a मरीचि god. Br. IV. 1. ५८.
--a companion of Puramjana, allegorically the organ of speech (see मुख्या). भा. IV. २५. ४९; २९. ११.
--Devendra of स्वारोचिष epoch. Vi. III. 1. १०.
--a god of the ten branches of the सुकर्माण group of devas. Br. IV. 1. ८८; वा. १००. ९२.
--a दानव. Br. III. 6. 4.
--a class of पिशाचस्: nude and drinkers of blood in the field of battle. Br. III. 7. ३७७ and ३९९. [पगे३-243+ ३१]
--a पिशाच gan2a, drink the blood shed in wars. Br. III. 7. ३८२ and ३९९; वा. ६९. २६३.
--a group of पिशाचस्. Br. III. 7. ३७७.
--a son of आयु. M. २४. ३५.

(I)--visited by बलराम; <F>1:  भा. X. ७९. ११.</F> R. of the प्लक्षद्वीप, <F>2:  Br. II. १९. १९; Vi. II. 4. ११; III. १४. १८.</F> from the हिमालयस्, <F>3:  Br. II. १६. २५.</F> in भारतवर्ष; <F>4:  Ib. II. १२. १५; वा. ४५. ९६, ९९.</F> sacred to अमोघाक्षी and the पितृस्. <F>5:  M. १३. ३५; २२. २३.</F>
(II)--one of the १६ wives of हव्यवाहन; <F>1:  M. ५१. १४; वा. २९. १४.</F> in the chariot of त्रिपुरारि. <F>2:  M. १३३. २३.</F>
--ety. one who is void of द्वन्द्व, happiness and misery, cold and heat, etc. वा. 4. २८.
(I)--a son of Vasudeva and रोहिणी. भा. IX. २४. ४६.
(II)--a Mt. sacred to विपुला; a विष्कम्भपर्- vata, <F>1:  M. १३. ३६; वा. ३५. १६.</F> to the west of इलावृत. <F>2:  Vi. II. 2. १८.</F>
(I)--the Goddess enshrined at Vipula. M. १३. ३६.

(II)--the सभा of Kubera; description of; here is पुष्पक, the विमान; around are the ten cities of the Gandharvas in the east, thirty cities of the यक्षस् in the west, and a hundred cities of the Kinnaras in the south. वा. ४१. 5-११, २०, २४, २७-8.

(I)--a son of Citraka; <F>1:  Br. III. ७१. ११४; वा. ९६. ११३; Vi. IV. १४. ११.</F> stationed by कृष्ण at the northern gate of मथुरा for defence against जरासन्- dha; was on the right detachment of कृष्ण's army; <F>2:  भा. X. ५०. २० [3]; [५० (v) १२].</F> killed in the यादव contest at प्रभासा. <F>3:  Vi. V. ३७. ४६.</F>
(II)--a son of अश्विनी and अक्रूर. M. ४५. ३२.
--a son of Vasudeva and धृतदेवा. भा. IX. २४. ५०.
(I)--a son of सृतंजय, and father of शुचि. भा. IX. २२. ४७; Vi. IV. २३. 5.
(II)--a son of शिष्टि and सुच्छाया. Vi. I. १३. 2.

--chief among the १०० sons of Danu, married सिम्हिका who bore one hundred and one sons col- lectively called Simhikeyas. Father of राहु; a follower of वृत्र in his battle with Indra. Took part in the देवासुर [पगे३-245+ २९] war between Bali and Indra, but was asked by Bali to refrain from battle; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ३१ and ३७; १८. १३; १०. १९ and ३१; VII. 2. 5; VIII. १०. १९; २१. १९; M. 6. १६, २५; Vi. I. 9. १०७; १५. १४१; २१. 6, १०-12.</F> in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु; <F>2:  M. १६१. ७९.</F> in the churn- ing of the ocean; <F>3:  Ib. २४५. ३१; २४९. ६७.</F> in the guise of a standard killed by Mahen- dra in कोलाहला war: <F>4:  Ib. ४७. ५२.</F> the overlord of the दानवस्; the brother of Dhvaja who was killed by Indra; had his aim in the ध्वज or standard. <F>5:  Br. III. 5. १३; 6. 1 and १८; 8. 7: ७२. ८५; वा. ६७. ६०; ७०. 7; ९७. ८५.</F>
(I)--an Apsaras with the sun in Hemanta. वा. ५२. १८.
(II)--a servant of हिरण्यकशिपु. Vi. I. १९. ५२.
--a son of देवमीढ (ठ, वा। प्।); father of महाधृति. Br. III. ६४. १२; वा. ८९. १२; Vi. IV. 5. २७.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३२.

(I)--the city of वरुण, entered by Hira- ण्यकशिपु; <F>1:  भा. III. १७. २६.</F> sun sets here when it is mid-day in अमरावती, and rises when it is mid-day in Saumyakam. <F>2:  Br. II. २१. ३३-9.</F> [पगे३-246+ २९]
(II)--the city of Soma in the मानस on the north of Meru. भा. V. २१. 7; Br. II. २१. ३३; वा. ५०. ९०; Vi. II. 8. 9; M. १२४. २४.
(III)--same as पुण्ड्र; a R. of कुशद्वीप. M. १२२. ७३.

(IV)--the Goddess of Night: invoked by ब्रह्मा to enter into उमा's body until she should be able to beget Guha. By so doing, the Night could get an अम्श of the देवी and will be praised as देवी.
