She went to मेना, entered her eyes when the latter gave birth to उमा early in the morning; then entered उमा after her penance; hence dark in colour; ब्रह्मा asked the goddess to go with the lion to the Vindhyas and reside there. M. १५४. ५७-96; ४२६-588: chh. १५५-6.

(I)--a Vasu worshipped for tejas; <F>1:  भा. II. 3. 3; XI. २६. 3.</F> wife उषा who bore three sons, व्युष्ठ, रोचिष and आतप; <F>2:  Ib. VI. 6. ११ and १६.</F> fought with महिष in the देवासुर war. <F>3:  Ib. VIII. १०. ३२.</F>
(II)--a son of Danu; a follower of वृत्र in his battle with Indra. भा. VI. 6. ३०; १० [२०].
(III)--a son of Mura (s.v.). भा. X. ५९. १२.
(IV)--a name of सूर्य. Br. II. २१. ८३.
(V)--a Pratardana god. Br. II. ३६. ३०. [पगे३-247+ २९]
(VI)--was abandoned by his wife द्युती for Soma; <F>1:  M. २३. २४.</F> ययाति of कुरुवम्श compared to. <F>2:  Ib. ३५. 8.</F>
(VII)--the king of elephants. वा. ६९. २३७.
(II)--a वम्शवर्तिन् god. Br. II. ३६. ३०.
(III)--one of the twenty अमिताभ gan2as. Br. IV. 1. १६; वा. १००. १६.
(I)--one of भण्ड's eight councillors. Br. IV. १२. १२.

(II)--a son of विश्रवस् and कैकशी, and a friend of राम. On the advice of राम, performed funeral rites to his kith and kin, according to established conventions. Was made king of लन्का by राम. Held the चामर when Bharata carried पादुका of राम; <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ३७; IX. १०. १६, २९ and ४३.</F> knew the yoga power of Hari and attained salvation by सत्सन्ग; of superior bhakti; <F>2:  Ib. II. 7. ४५; XI. १२. 5; Br. III. ३४. ३९.</F> a brother of रावण; <F>3:  Ib. III. 8. ४७.</F> was present at राम's अभिषेक। <F>4:  Vi. IV. 4. ९९.</F>
(I)--a name of Hari. भा. III. 9. १६.
(II)--a son of दक्षिणा and a तुषित god. भा. IV. 1. 7-8. [पगे३-248+ २४]
(III)--a name of शिव. भा. IV. 4. 9.
(IV)--a son of प्रस्ताव (i); wife रती, and son पृथुसेन. भा. V. १५. 6; Br. II. १४. ६७.
(V)--a son of Bhaga and Siddhi. भा. VI. १८. 2.
(VI)--a son of वेदशिरस् and तुषिता. From him ८८,000 sages learnt celibate life. भा. VIII. 1. २१-22.
(VII)--the Indra of the Raivata epoch. भा. VIII. 5. 3; Br. II. ३६. ६१; Vi. III. 1. २०.
(VIII)--a name of ब्रह्मा. भा. IX. 3. २९; X. 1. १८.
(XI)--a साध्य god. Br. III. 3. १७; वा. ६६. १६.
(XII)--the son of Satyaketu; father of Suvibhu. Br. III. ६७. ७५; वा. ९२. ७१. Vi. IV. 8. २०.
(XIII)--one of the twenty अमिताभ gods. Br. IV. 1. १६; वा. १००. १६. [पगे३-249+ २९]
(XIV)--a son of प्रत्यूष, a Vasava; <F>1:  M. 5. २७.</F> a साध्य. <F>2:  Ib. २०३. १२.</F>
(XV)--a son of श्रुतम्जय, ruled for २८ years. M. २७१. २४.
(XVI)--(Vasu) a grandson of स्वायम्भुव. वा. ३१. १७; ३३. 9.
(XVII)--a son of प्रतावी (प्रास्तावी-वि। प्।). वा. ३३. ५७; Vi. II. 1. ३७.
--a name of श्री (लक्ष्मी). Her abode in the chest of the Lord; wife of Hari. भा. I. १८. २०; III. १६. २०; २८. २६; V. २०. ४०; VI. १६. २५; १९. 8.
--is शिव with the sacred ash smeared all over his body. Br. III. ३२. १३; वा. ५५. ४५.

--in honour of विष्णु; in the months of कार्तिक, Caitra, वैशाख, मार्गशीर्ष, फाल्गुण and आषा- ढ; gift of a gold fish recommended; the end of the year must close with लवन पर्वत दान; the ten अवतार्स् of Hari with दत्तात्रेय and व्यास to be worshipped; <F>1:  M. ९९. 1-२१.</F> was observed by the courtesan अनन्गवती who became the queen of God of Love; <F>2:  Ib. १००. १८-32.</F> doing it on the banks of the Ganges gives one निर्वाण। <F>3:  Ib. १००. ३३.</F>
--of Hari; Indra among gods, विष्णु among आदित्यस्, भृगु among ब्रह्मऋषिस् and so on. भा. XI. १६. 9-४०; वा. १०१. ३२९. [पगे३-250+ २५]
(I)--a son of स्वारोचिष Manu. Br. II. ३६. १९.
(II)--a god of सुकर्माण group. Br. IV. 1. ८८.
(I)--the father of Brahmadatta, the king of पाञ्चाल; his name was Anagha; he had no son and so he per- formed austerities; and was blessed by नारायण with Brah- madatta. M. २०. २३; २१. ११-16.
(II)--the son of सुकृत (ti-वा। प्।), and father of अणुह. M. ४९. ५६; वा. ९९. १७८; Vi. IV. १९. ४२-3.
(III)--the hill of साकद्वीप; here there is resplendent fire. M. १२२. १७-8.
--the पितृस् in the बर्हिषद worlds. M. १५. 1.
--the kingdom to which Puramjana went through the gates, Khadyota and आविर्मुखि, with his friend Dyumat; allegorically bright colour. भा. IV. २५. ४७; २९. १०.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३८. [पगे३-251+ २८]
--an Apsaras. Br. III. 7. 5.
(I)--a son of Sudyumna and a Lord of दक्षि- णापथ. भा. IX. 1. ४१.
(II)--a son of देवयानी and a यक्ष. Br. III. 7. १२८.
(III)--the son of जीमूत and father of भीम- ratha. M. ४४. ४१.
(I)--a रहस्ययोगिनी Devi1. Br. IV. १९. ४८.
(II)--the goddess enshrined at पुरुषोत्तम M. १३. ३५.
(III)--a R. from ऋष्यवान्. M. ११४. २६.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४३.

--a तीर्थ on the नर्मदा sacred to the पितृस्; <F>1:  M. २२. 8.</F> Lord विमलेश्वर is enshrined here; <F>2:  Ib. १९०. १४.</F> here a देवशिला was established by Rudra and death on it takes one to Rudraloka. <F>3:  Ib. १९४. ३९.</F>
--a temple with eight floors and a number of towers; the तोरण is of ३४ हस्तस्। M. २६९. २८, ३२, ४७. [पगे३-252+ २८]
--Indra took दिती and the Maruts in it to  heaven; <F>1:  M. 7. ६४.</F> विवस्वान् took सम्ज्ञा with him. <F>2:  Ib. ११. ३७.</F>
--R. a main stream of साल्मलिद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. २८; वा. ४९. ४२; Br. II. १९. ४६.
--(Vimocana-वा। प्।) the name of a hell. He who transgresses boundary limits goes to this as also thieves. Br. IV. 2. १४७ and १५९; वा. १०१. १४६, १५७.
(I) (विविम्श)--the father of a son कल्याण by name. वा. ८६. 6.
(II)--a son of चक्षुष and father of विविम्शक. Vi. IV. 1. २६.
--the fourth king of विदिश. वा. ९९. ३६८.
--a son of नहुष. भा. IX. १८. 1; Br. III. ६८. १२; Vi. IV. १०. 1.
--a son of दनायुष and father of two sons कालक and Vara. वा. ६८. ३०, ३३.
(II)--one of the seven sons of वसिष्ठ--sage of the चाक्षुष epoch; <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ४१; Br. II. ३६. ७७; M. 9. २२.</F> attained heaven by tapas. <F>2:  Ib. १४३. ३८.</F>

(III)--a son of त्वष्ट्रि, wife विषूचि: father of a hundred sons--शतजित् and others, besides a daughter; raised the status of Priyavrata line as Hari did for the greatness of gods. भा. V. १५. १५-16; Br. II. १४. ७०; Vi. II. 1. ४०.
(IV)--a pupil of जातूकर्ण्य. भा. XII. 6. ५८.

(V)--a प्रजापति who offered his daughter विरजा to ऋक्ष; father of Sudhanvan and वैराजस्--पितृस् liv- ing by yoga; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. २१२; 8. १७; १०. 4.</F> father of नड्वला, the queen of चाक्षुष Manu; a राजऋषि and a tapassiddha. <F>2:  Ib. II. ३०. ४०; ३६. १०५; वा. ५७. १२२.</F>
(VI)--a son of सृञ्जय, brother of Vasudeva. Br. III. ७१. १९३.
(VII)--one of the four sons in the ३०थ् kalpa of शर्व--red in colour, attire, etc. वा. २२. ३०.
(VIII)--a disciple of लोकाक्षि, an अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १३५.
(IX)--a son of वालि, the अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १६०.
(X)--a son of पूर्णमास and सरस्वती; his wife was गौरी; son सुधामा. Br. II. ११. १३; वा. २८. १०-12; Vi. I. १०. 6. [पगे३-254+ २८]
(XI)--the name of a Lekha. वा. ६२. ६६.
(XII)--the adopted son of वस्तावन. वा. ९६. १९०.
(XIII)--a son of सावर्णि Manu. Vi. III. 2. १९.
--a son of Manu सावर्णि. भा. VIII. १३. ११.
(I)--a daughter of progenitor, Viraja; wife of ऋक्ष; loved by Mahendra, became mother of वालि; loved by सूर्य, became mother of सुग्रीव. Br. III. 7. २१२-15.
(II)--the mind-born daughter of आज्यप pitr2s; queen of नहुष and mother of ययाति; belonging to the वैश्य gan2a. Br. III. १०. ९५; वा. ७३. ४५; ९३. १२.
(III)--a svara शक्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ५५ and ९६.
(IV)--a sacred place near नाभिकूप in गया; <F>1:  वा. १०६. ८५.</F> no fasting or shaving here. <F>2:  Ib. १०५. २५.</F>
--the gods of the सावर्णि epoch; <F>1:  भा. VIII. १३. १२.</F> अग्निष्वात्त-- पितृस्. <F>2:  Br. III. १०. ७५-6; IV. 1. २२.</F>
--introduced पशु हिम्स in sacrifices. Br. II. ३०. २१. [पगे३-255+ ३१]
--a son of नृपम्जय. M. ४९. ७९.
--a son of वात. वा. ६९. १३०.

--the form of the Lord during the period of creation, just emerged from अण्ड. <F>1:  भा. II. 1. २५; III. 6. 6-३४; 7. २२-25; २६. ५१.</F> To rouse him to activity gods were created; but he was not roused until the क्षेत्रज्ञ along with citta entered the heart and roused the पुरुष from waters; <F>2:  Ib. III. ३६. ५४-70; X. 3. १५; XI. 3. ११-12; १७. १३.</F> is Hari who is described as महा- पुरुष; <F>3:  Ib. XII. ११. 5-२६.</F> son of Nara; <F>4:  Br. II. १४. ६८.</F> अन्तरिक्ष so called. <F>5:  Ib. II. १६. १७; III. ४३. 9.</F>
(I)--a son of शमीक. M. ४६. २७.
(II)--a Marut गण. M. १७१. ५३.

(III)--(विराट्पुरुष; also सम्रात् and Manu) <F>1:  वा. १०. १५.</F> married शतरूपा; sons Priyavrata and उत्तानपाद and two daughters, आकूती and प्रसूती; the latter was given to दक्ष and the former to Ruci to whom twins, यज्ञ and दक्षिण were born. <F>2:  Br. II. 9. ३९.</F>
(IV)--a Mt. north of the महाभद्र lake. वा. ३६. ३३.
(I)--a Sutapa god. Br. IV. 1. १४.
(II)--is a name of स्वायम्भुव Manu. M. 3. ४५.
(III)--the son of Nara; <F>1:  वा. ३०. २६०; ३३. ५८; Vi. II. 1. ३८.</F> a Pratardana god. <F>2:  वा. ६२. २६.</F>
(IV)--one of the twenty Sutapa गणस्. वा. १००. १५.

--the father of उत्तरा: the Matsya king; as a friend of जरासन्ध, besieged the southern gate of मथुरा, and the eastern gate of Gomanta. <F>1:  भा. I. 8. १४; १०. 9; X. ५०. ११ [3]; ५२. ११ [7].</F> But he joined the पाण्डवस् against the Kurus, and went to Syamanta- पञ्चक for the solar eclipse; <F>2:  Ib. X. ७८ [९५ (v) 9]; ८२. २५.</F> in charge of दक्षिणापथ. <F>3:  Br. III. ६३. ११.</F>
--विराज created by ब्रह्मा; वैराज Manu, his son by शतरूपा. वा. १०. १५; Br. II. 9. ३९.
--a राक्षस of the Vitalam. वा. ५०. २८.
--(विरञ्च्य-भा। प्।); also विरिञ्चि, a name of ब्रह्मा. भा. X. 9. २०; M. १५४. १७-54.
--the abode of ब्रह्मा. Br. III. ५२. 9; ५८. 9; IV. ३९. ६६.
--the gods of the epoch of the Tenth Manu; <F>1:  भा. VIII. १३. २२.</F> a गण of the Second सावर्ण Manu. <F>2:  Br. IV. 1. ६७.</F>
(I)--a son of अम्बरीष, and father of पृषदश्व. भा. IX. 6. 1; Br. III. ६३. 6; वा. ८८. 6. Vi. IV. 2. 7-8.
(II)--a son of कृष्ण. भा. X. ९०. ३४.
(III)--a मन्त्रकृत् of the Angirasa branch. M. १४५. १०३; वा. ५९. १००.
(IV)--not to have matrimonial connections with Angiras and रथीतरस्. M. १९६. ३८.
(V)--the formless form attained by a मुक्त। वा. १०२. ७७.

--the leader of the राक्षस clan--नैरृतस्, followers of Trayambaka: married विकचा, daughter of नील: their issues were the awkward, disfigured and short figures known as भूमिराक्षसस्. Br. III. 7. १४३; वा. ६९. १७४. [पगे३-258+ ३०]
--came out of the face of महादेव. वा. २३. 5.
(I)--a son of Danu, and a follower of वृत्र in his battle with Indra. भा. VI. १०. [२०]; Br. III. 6. ११; वा. ६८. ११.
(II)--another name for शिव having the sun, moon and fire for eyes. Br. II. २५. ६४.
(III)--a शिव gan2a. Br. III. ४१. २७.
(V)--a भार्गव gotrakarta1. M. १९५. १९.
(VI)--the lord of the south-west direction. वा. ३४. ८७.
--an Angirasa and मन्त्रकृत्। Br. II. ३२. १०९.

(I)--a son of प्रह्लाद, and father of Bali. Took part in the देवासुर war between Bali and Indra, and fought with सविता; <F>1:  भा. V. २४. १८; VI. १८. १६; VIII. १०. २० and २९; M. 6. १०; Vi. I. २१. 1.</F> the Daitya king residing in the fifth talam: served as calf for the Asuras to milk the earth: killed by Indra in the तारकामय war. <F>2:  Br. II. २०. ३५; ३६. २१०; III. 5. ४१; ७२. ७९ and १०५; M. १०. २१; ४७. ४८ and ७२; १७२. १४; १७८. ६७: २४५. १२ and ४५.</F> Laughed at by शुक्र: in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु. <F>3:  Ib. ६१. 4-5; ७२. 6-१०; १६१. ७८.</F> [पगे३-259+ २४]
(II)--an Asura of the महातलम्. वा. ५०. ३४.
--the family of Bali sent to पाताल by वामन. वा. ९८. ८६.
--the queen of त्वष्ट्रि, and mother of Viraja. भा. V. १५. १५; वा. ८४. १९.
(I)--a son of वात, the राक्षस. Br. III. 7. ९६.
(II)--a son of बाष्कल. वा. ६७. ७९.
--a son of Vanhi, and father of Kapotaroman. (ब्र्। and वि। प्। make him a son of Kapotaroman). भा. IX. २४. १९-20; Br. III. ७१. ११७; Vi. IV. १४. १३.
(I)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४३.
(II)--one of the ११ Rudras. M. १५३. १९.
(III)--the second son of खशा (s.v.) with three heads, three feet, three hands, black eyes, etc. वा. ६९. ७६, ८०-3.
(IV)--a hell, to which go the thieves and those who transgress established rules. Vi. II. 6. 2 and १४. [पगे३-260+ ३०]
--a son of अधिसोमकृष्ण; when नागसाह्वय was washed away by floods, he made कौशाम्बी his capital; father of eight powerful sons. M. ५०. ७८-9.
--a kingdom of the east watered by ह्लादिनी. Br. II. १८. ५५; वा. ४७. ५२.
(II)--the name of the sun in the month of Nabhasya (भाद्रपद). भा. XII. ११. ३८; Br. II. २३. 9; Vi. II. १०. १०. M. १२६. १०.

(III)--a son of Aditi: आदित्य of the month श्रावण: a प्रजापति: born of कश्यप and दाक्षायणी--see सूर्य; <F>1:  Br. II. २४. ३४, ८८, १२९; III. 1. 6 and ५४; 3. ६८; ७१. २३; M. 6. 4; ११. 2-8; वा. ५२. ९१. ६५. ५३.</F> worship in buildings; <F>2:  M. २५३. ४३; २६८. २१.</F> father of Manu. <F>3:  Vi. IV. 1. 6.</F>
(IV)--a sage of the चाक्षुष Manu. M. 9. २३.
--the chief of the fifth वातस्कन्ध, situated between the नक्षत्रस् (ऋक्ष-वा। प्।) and the planets; <F>1:  Br. III. 5. ८६; वा. ६७. ११८.</F> one of the seven Maruts. <F>2:  M. १६३. ३२.</F>
--one of the four sons in the ३०थ् Kalpa of शर्व, red in colour, attire, etc. वा. २२. ३०. [पगे३-261+ २७]

--eight-fold: ब्राह्म, Daiva, आर्ष, प्राजापत्य, आसुर, Saindhava, राक्षस, and पैशाच; <F>1:  Vi. III. १०. २४;</F> कृष्ण married रुक्मिणी by the राक्षस form; <F>2:  Ib. V. २६. ११.</F> the marriage day fit for meru- दान: गृहबलि recommended in. <F>3:  M. ८३. 8; ९३. ८३.</F>
--(विविक्तनामन्-भा। प्।)--a son of हिरण्य- retas of कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १४.
--(Vividha-ब्र्। प्।): a son of Adbhuta Agni. वा. २९. ३९.
--a जयादेव. Br. III. 3. 6.
--a दानव. Br. III. 6. 6.
--(Vivici-वा। प्।): son of Adbhuta Agni, tutelary deity of expiatory penances (प्रायश्चित्त): Father of Arka. Br. II. १२. ४१; वा. २९. ३९.
--a son of विम्शपुत्र (विम्श-वि। प्।) and father of Khaninetra. वा. ८६. 6; Vi. IV. 1. २७.
--a son of चाक्षुष, and father of Rambha. भा. IX. 2. २४-25.
--by the passage of time क्षेत्रज्ञ becomes विवृत्त by a single reason; it is likened to a light of Khadyota in extreme darkness; he returns from अव्यक्त; he is a शरीरि and a महान्। वा. ५९. ७०-2.
--see वैश्य. भा. VIII. 5. ४१.
--a son of रेवती and Baladeva. Vi. IV. १५. २०.
--a son of Jayadratha, and father of Senajit. भा. IX. २१. २३.
--a hell, intended for makers of काण्ड, carpenters, potters, and robbers of gold, physicians, those that burn gardens. Br. IV. 2. १४७ and १६२; वा. १०१. १४७ and १६०.
--a medicinal herb in द्रोण hill of शाल्मलिद्वीप; has the power to bring the dead back to life. Br. II. १९. ३९; M. १२२. ५६; वा. ४९. ३५.
--R. in कलिन्गदेश near the Amara- कण्टक hills also विशल्य, <F>1:  Br. III. १३. १२; वा. ७७. १२.</F> a great and holy river serving the नर्मदा. <F>2:  M. १८६. ४३.</F> [पगे३-263+ ३०]
--in the दण्डक forest. Br. III. १३. १०७.
--one of the twenty-eight hells--a slaughter house for hypocritical sacrificers of animals; makers of lances, swords and other implements. भा. V. २६. 7 and २५; Vi. II. 6. 2 and १७.

(I)--a son (brother वा। प्।, वि। प्।) of Skanda: an अम्श of Skanda-वा। प्। [a son of Agni (ब्र्। and म्। प्।)]; <F>1:  Br. III. 3. २५; M. 5. २६. वा. ५३. १०४; ६६. २४; १०१. २८०. Vi. I. १५. ११५.</F> from him originated the planet सूर्य; <F>2:  Br. II. २४. १२९.</F> an epithet of कुमार; <F>3:  M. १५९. 3.</F> commander. <F>4:  Ib. २३०. 7.</F>
(II)--a Mt. on the south of the मानस; <F>1:  वा. ३६. २३;</F> tem- ple of Guha at. <F>2:  Ib. ३९. ५५.</F>
(III)--when the sun is in विशाख, fourth अम्श, the moon is then at the head of कृत्तिका. वा. ५०. १९६; Br. II. २१. १४५; Vi. II. 8. ७६-7.
(IV)--is Skanda. भा. VI. 6. १४.
(I)--a son of पालक and father of राजक: ruled for ५० years (५३ years म्। प्।). भा. XII. 1. 3; Br. III. ७४. १२५; M. २७२. 4; वा. ९९. ३१२.
(II)--a son of बलाक and father of Janaka. Vi. IV. २४. 4-5. [पगे३-264+ २८]
--a constellation: श्राद्ध performance on that day leads to birth of sons. Br. III. १८. 8; वा. ६६. ५०; ८२. 9.
--a son of Damana, an अवतार् of the lord in the third द्वापर. वा. २३. १२४.
(I)--a son of तृणबिङ्दु and father of Hema- candra. Founder of वैशालि. भा. IX. 2. ३३-34; Br. III. ६१. १२.
(II)--a playmate of कृष्ण. भा. X. २२. ३१.
(III)--a तीर्थ visited by बलराम. भा. X. ७८. १९.
(IV)--A Kulaparvata of केतुमाला. वा. ४४. 4.
(V)--a नाग of the Vitalam. वा. ५०. २९.

(VI)--a very righteous king, a son of विश्रवस् (तृणबिङ्दु-वि। प्।) and आलम्बुष, the Apsaras; father of He- macandra; built the city of विशाला; <F>1:  वा. ८६. १६-7; Vi. IV. 1. ४९-50.</F> having no sons, consulted the Brahmans who advised him to give पिण्ड in गया; he did so and got a son; once he saw three men white, red and black in colour in the clouds and asked them who they were; the white man said that he was his father coming from Indra- loka, the red was his father who had slain Brahmans and the black was his grand-father who had slain a number of sages; the latter two were in अवीचिनरक and now got [पगे३-265+ २६] released by the गयापिण्ड of विशाल; then blessed him with a long life of prosperous reign, sacrifices and attainment of विष्णुलोक <F>2:  वा. ११२. 7-१४.</F> in the end.
--a मण्टप with ३८ pillars. M. २७०. 4, ११.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १७.
(I)--(बदरिकाश्रम). To this Dhruva went for meditation in the evening of his life. Similarly नाभि and मेरुदेवी spent their last years here. भा. IV. १२. १६; V. 4. 5; XI. २९. ४७.
(II)--a R. from the ऋक्ष hill. Br. II. १६. ३१.
(III)--(विशालया) city founded by विशाल, son of तृणबिन्दु; <F>1:  Br. III. ६१. १२; वा. ८६. १७; ११२. 7; Vi. IV. 1. ४९.</F> no shaving or उपवास, at. <F>2:  वा. १०५. २५.</F>
(IV)--the wife of उरुक्षव (ya): had three sons. M. ४९. ३९; वा. ९९. १६२.
(V)--a R. issuing from the हिमालयस्. M. ११४. २१.
(VI)--a R. of the केतुमाला country. वा. ४४. २१.
(VII)--a daughter of सुयशा: the most beautiful. वा. ६९. १४. [पगे३-266+ २२]
(I)--the king of मिथिला: went to Syamanta- पञ्चक for the solar eclipse. भा. X. ८२. २६.
(II)--a नाग in the third Talam. Br. II. २०. ३०.
(III)--the name of a शिव gan2a. Br. III. ४१. २७.
(IV)--a Mt. the abode of the नागस्. M. १६३. ७९.
(V)--one of the १८ authors on architecture. M. २५२. 2.
--the Goddess at Benares. M. १३. २६; १८५. ३८.
--a son of शुकी and गरुड. Br. III. 7. ४५०.

--a younger brother of भण्ड spoke of Devas as पामरस् (uncivilised) and of the invasion of a woman. <F>1:  Br. IV. १०. ८०; २१. २५.</F> His battle with the शक्तिस्. <F>2:  Ib. IV. २७. १०-56; २८. 3-१०६.</F> [पगे३-267+ २७]
--a special राग; presiding deity, Gandharva. वा. ८६. ६५-6.
--a group of gods of the X epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. २५.
--Mahat and others; from them came the अण्ड or universe; all water; from this came the fish (पुरुष) with body. हिरण्यगर्भ with four faces. वा. 4. ७५-8.
(I)--a son of त्रिवक्रा by कृष्ण, and devoted to him; the author of सात्वत Tantra for the good women, शूद्रस् and slaves. A disciple of नारद. भा. X. ९०. ३४ [1-2].
(II)--one of the four sons in the ३०थ् kalpa of शर्व, red in colour, attire, etc. वा. २२. ३०.
(III)--a son of Damana, an अवतार् of the Lord in the 3rd द्वापर. वा. २३. १२४.

--removes one's difficulties and prepares the way for the final bliss; performed in honour of केशव or लक्ष्मी in the month of आश्वयुज: gift of bed with गुडधेनु after the पूज and other observances in the prescribed manner; the gift of गुड-dhenu on the beginning day of the ayana or days of विषु or eclipse, attended by music and dancing; the gift of a sugar cow. M. chh. ८१ and ८२. [पगे३-268+ ३१]
--a divine forest in the Lohita hill; a garden of the gods. Br. II. १८. १२; III. 7, १०२.
--to be observed on the sixth day of the white half of माघ month. M. ७४. 2; ७५. 1-2.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २५.

(I)--a son of Pulastya and इडिविला and of great तपस्। Father of Kubera through इडविडा (इडिविला) one of his four wives. By another wife he had sons--रावण, कुम्भकर्ण and विभीषण. चेडविडा was the name of one of his wives. <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ३६-37; VII. 1. ४३; IX. 2. ३२; १०. १५.</F> Son of इलविला (इडविडा, इडिविला) and a sage by तपस्। Married बृहस्पति's daughter. <F>2:  Br. II. ३२. ९९; III. 8. ३८; ६१. ११; M. १४५. ९३.</F> Wives of: देववर्णनी, पुष्पोत्कटा, वाका and कैकसी; the first brought वैश्रवण whom the father named Kubera; कैकसी gave birth to रावण, कुम्भकर्ण, शूर्पनखा and विभीषण; पुष्- पोत्कट's sons--Mahodara, Prahasta, महापाम्शु, Khara; daughter, कुम्भीणसी; वाका's sons त्रिशिरस्, दूषण, Vidh- yutjihva; daughter असलिका. <F>3:  वा. ७०. ३२-35, ४१, ४९, ५०.</F>
(III)--a son of द्रविडा; had a son विशाल. वा. ८६. १६.
(IV)--the father of two गणस्, शिव and Sumanas. वा. ६९. २८. [पगे३-269+ २६]
--a son of विश्वेशा. M. १७१. ५०.
(II)--one of the twenty अमिताभ gan2as. वा. १००. १७.
--a son of Sahasvat, and father of बृहद्- bala; a king. Br. III. ६३. २१२; वा. ८८. २१२.
(I)--a name of Hari. भा. XII. ११. २२.
(II)--the Gandharva presiding over the month, Tapasya. भा. XII. ११. ४०.
(III)--a branch of the भार्गव gotra. वा. ६५. ९६.
(IV)--a son of Upamadgu. Vi. IV. १४. 9.
(V)--a Satya god. Br. II. ३६. ३४.

(I)--a प्रजापति. His daughter बर्हिष्- मती was the wife of Priyavrata. <F>1:  भा. V. 1. २४.</F> A son of वास्तु and आन्- गिरसी; wife was कृति (अकृति-भा। प्।). Father of Manu चाक्- षुष. <F>2:  Ib. VI. 6. १५.</F> The divine architect skilled in making weapons. [पगे३-270+ ३७] Made vajra of दधीचि's body and built Indra's abode and erected Sutalam. <F>3:  Ib. VI. 9. ५४: १०. १३. VII. 4. 8; VIII. १५. १५; २२. ३२. M. 5. २७-8; ५८. ३३.</F> Fought with Maya in देवासुर war. Two more daughters of his were सम्ज्ञा and छाया who were married to the Sun god. <F>4:  भा. VIII. १०. २९; १३. 8. Vi. III. 2. 2, 8, १०-12.</F> Was ordered by कृष्ण to build a city for the पाण्डवस्; <F>5:  भा. X. ५८. २४.</F> built गरुड's abode; <F>6:  M. १६३. ६८: २०३. 7.</F> an author on architecture; <F>7:  Ib. २५२. 2; Br. IV. ३१. 6-7.</F> father of four sons; originator of all शिल्पस्, arts and crafts; <F>8:  Vi. I. १५. ११९-20; III. 2. ११.</F> presented श्री with jewels. <F>9:  Ib. I. 9. १०४; Br. IV. 9. ८१; १४. 4; १५. २०; २०. ४६; २९. ८४.</F>
(II)--a son of त्वष्टा and यशोधरा; father of Maya, and his daughter was सुरेणु; originator of arts and crafts. Br. I. 2. १९; 5. २७. III. 1. ८७. 7. १९५; ३२. 7: ५९. १७-21: वा. ६५. ८५.

(III)--divided the earth into seven islands, oceans and hills, भूः and other worlds; created the people as in the previous kalpas; but the whole was clouded in smoke, in five forms like a light enveloped by a pot; finding no light and all in their place (न्यास) was pondering over when a cross current passed that way and resulted in a second universe. वा. 6. ३३-45. १०९. 4.
(IV)--one of the seven important rays of the sun on the south; helps the growth of the Budha planet. Br. II. २४. ६६-69.
(V)--a वम्शवर्तिन् god; a son of Pra- भात and भुवना; Lord of प्रजापतिस्. Br. II. ३६. २९; III. 3. २९. [पगे३-271+ २८]
--the goddess enshrined at अम्बरा. M. १३. २७.
--the first of the १०० sons of शतजित्. Vi. II. 1. ४१.
(I)--a son of पूर्णिमन्. भा. IV. 1. १४.
(II)--a son of पृथु and grandson of Suyo- dana. M. १२. २९.

--a gift; a wheel of the world in gold (२० palas to १०००) with जलशायि Vis2n2u and His अवतार्स्, the sages, the four Vedas, the पञ्च Bhuta1s, the Rudras and the लोकपालास् placed thereon; to be given as a gift on an auspi- cious day; daily worship of the चक्र yields one plenty of wealth and long life. M. २७४. 9: २८५. 1-२३.
(I)--a sacrifice performed by Bali with the aid of भृगु Bra1hman2as. भा. VIII. १५. 4.
(II)--a son of Satyajit, and father of Ripum- jaya; a link in the line. <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. ४९; Vi. IV. २३. ११-12.</F> A बृहद्रथ king who ruled for २५ years. <F>2:  Br. III. ७४. १२०.</F>
(III)--one of Danu's sons. वा. ६८. 6.
(IV)--Janamejaya: a son of दृढरथ. वा. ९९. १११. [पगे३-272+ २३]
(V)--a son of बृहद्रथ. वा. ९९. १७२.
(VI)--a son of Jayadratha; father of Senajit. Vi. IV. १९. ३४-5.
(II)--the Agni at ब्रह्मस्थानम्. वा. २९. २८.
--a वम्शवर्तिन् god. Br. II. ३६. २९; वा. ६२. २६.
--a son of मेधातिथि of शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २५.
--a disciple of ब्रह्मा. वा. २२. १६.
--sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ३५.
--a son of सहस्वान् and father of बृहद्- bala. Vi. IV. 4. १११-12. [पगे३-273+ २४]
--one of the four sons in the ३०थ् kalpa of शर्व, red in colour, attire, etc. वा. २२. ३०.
--Indra of शुक्र devas whose cognates are Asuras. वा. ३१. ११; ५७. ९१ and १०२.
--a group of नाडिस् of the sun pouring out heat. Br. II. २४. २९; वा. ५३. २२.
--false; like a serpent in rope, and water in the desert, etc. वा. १०४. ३९.
--a son of कृतशर्म. वा. ८८. १८१.
--a son of विश्वशर्म; his wife, यसोदा, the मानसी कन्या of the पितृस्. वा. ७३. ४०.
--a R. from the Vindhyas. M. ११४. २७.
--the Goddess enshrined at जालन्धर. M. १३. ४६.
--the form which विष्णु assumed, and embraced by शिव, resulting in the birth of महाशास्त. Br. IV. १०. ७७. [पगे३-274+ ३३]
--the earth which covers the whole uni- verse, etc. Its manifestations are धृति, Sthiti, क्षमा, क्षोणी, पृथ्वी, वसुमती and रसा. M. २८४. १६.
--an Apsaras. Br. II. ३३. १८.
--another name for विश्वामित्र. Br. III. ६६. ६५; वा. ९१. ९३.
--(विष्वगन्धि)--son of पृथु and father of Candra. भा. IX. 6. २०.

(I)--a son of त्वष्ट्रि and रोचना (यशो- धरा-ब्र्। प्।) adopted by सुरगणस् when their guru Angiras left them. At first he did not agree as Paurodhasa was not a coveted profession. Finally he accepted and initiated Indra into a मन्त्र known as वर्म नारायणात्- मकम्; with this Indra enjoyed once more the Trailokya- लक्ष्मी: Father of पञ्चजनी. <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ४४-5; ch. 7-8 (whole); V. 7. 1; Br. III. 1. ८६.</F> विश्वरूप had three heads सोमपीठ्२अ, सुरापीठ्२अ, and अन्नाद. Finding the आचार्य giving a part of his sacrificial offerings to Asuras, Indra cut off his heads which became कपिञ्जल, Kalavinka and Tittiri birds. His वध, <F>2:  भा. VI. 9. 1-5; १३. 5.</F> in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु. <F>3:  M. १६१. ८०.</F>
(II)--a शुक्रदेव (ajita). Br. II. १३. ९४; वा. ३१. 7.

(III)--a son of रूपवती, and devoted to नारायण: elected Purohita in the absence of बृहस्पति who went to the earth due to a curse by sages: Indra quarrelled with him, and the latter repaired to spend his life in penance. Sages cursed Indra for this. Br. IV. 9. 4-8. [पगे३-275+ २५]
(IV)--a name of त्रिशिरस्, a son of त्वष्ट. वा. ६५. ८५.

(I)--in the ३३र्द् Kalpa सरस्वती became विश्वरूपा with four hands, four feet, four teeth, four eyes, etc. ब्रह्मा prayed to विश्वेश who explained the nature of सरस्वती as प्रकृति and made अट्टहास when Jati, मुण्डि and other sons came; after performing austerities for १००० years they attained Rudrahood. वा. २३. ३६-61.
(II)--wife of Dharma and mother of Dhar- मव्रता. वा. १०७. 2.
--the agni in ब्रह्मस्थान. Br. II. १२. २४.
--performer of, becomes ब्रह्माण्डाधि- pati. M. १०१. ८३.
--the father of विश्वमहत्. वा. ७३. ४०.
--one of the seven important rays of the Sun; helps the growth of the planet, शुक्र. Br. II. २४. ६६; वा. ५३. ४५, ४८.
(I)--a son of ऐडविड (Ilivila-वि। प्।) and father of खट्वान्ग. भा. IX. 9. ४१; Vi. IV. 4. ७५-6. [पगे३-276+ २३]
(II)--a son of व्युषिताश्व, (युषिताश्व-वि। प्।), (ध्युषिताश्व-वा। प्।), and father of हिरण्यनाभ Kaus4alya: a king. Br. III. ६३. २०६-7; वा. ८८. २०६; Vi. IV. 4. १०६-7.
--His daughter married इडविड. Br. III. ६३. १८१.
--a son of Mahasvat and father of Prasena- jit. भा. IX. १२. 7-8.
--another name for विश्वकर्मा. भा. X. ७५. ३२.
--the sacrifice of creation; continued for thousands of years in the नैमिष region (see for a description Yajurveda ब्राह्मण). वा. 2. 5-7.
--the sacrifice of the प्रजापतिस्. Here दक्ष insulted शिव. The sacrifice lasted for a thousand years. The अवभृत was at the confluence of the गन्गा and the यमुना. भा. IV. ch. 2 (whole); 3. २४.
--the king of Magadha who introduced new वर्णस् for क्षत्रियस् and also kingship. Vi. IV. २४. ६१. [पगे३-277+ ३०]

--a मागध king equal to Hari in battle: cut at the root of the क्षत्रिय order and established his own castes: viz. Kaivartas, Madrakas, Pulindas, ब्राह्मणस्, and पञ्चकस्; said to be an enuch; offerings of, to devas, पितृस्, and Brahmans; died on the banks of the Ganges as an ascetic and went to Indraloka. Br. III. ७४. १९०-3. वा. ९९. ३७७-82.
--a king of Magadha. भा. XII. 1. ३६.
--the place of Samudra agni. वा. २९. २२.
(I)--a R. in भारतवर्ष. भा. V. १९. १८.

(II)--a daughter of दक्ष and one of the ten wives of Dharma married by ब्राह्म form; her sons were विश्वेदेवस्. भा. VI. 6. 4. and 7; Br. III. 3. 3 and ३०. M. 5. १६-17; २०३. १२; वा. ६६. 3, ३१; ७६. 3; Vi. I. १५. १०५.
(III)--one of the १३ wives of कश्यप; mother of यक्षस् and राक्षसस्. M. 6. 2; १४६. १८.
(IV)--the Goddess enshrined at विश्वेश्वर. M. १३. २९.

--an Apsaras, coupled with पूर्वचिति: with her ययाति enjoyed in वैभ्राज nandana: Danced at the appearance of श्री from the milk-ocean; went with माया to counteract भण्ड's imperialism; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. १५; ६८. ७०; IV. 9. ७८; १२. २५; ३३. १९; वा. ६९. ४९. ९३. ६९. Vi. IV. १०. २०.</F> with the शरत् sun; <F>2:  Br. II. २३. १३.</F> in [पगे३-278+ ४५] the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु; <F>3:  M. १६१. ७४.</F> resides in the sun's chariot in कार्तिक. <F>4:  Vi. II. १०. १२.</F>

(I)--A sage of the Vaivasvata epoch; <F>1:  भा. VIII. १३. 5. M. 9. २७.</F> was invited for the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर; <F>2:  भा. X. ७४. 8.</F> came to see कृष्ण at स्यमन्तपञ्चक <F>3:  Ib. X. ८४. 3;</F> and परिक्षित् practising प्रायोपवेश। <F>4:  Ib. I. १९. 9.</F> Acted as Purohita at कृष्ण's sacrifice in Kuruk- षेत्र, left द्वारका for पिण्डारक; <F>5:  Ib. XI. 1. १२; X. ९०. ४६ [2].</F> Purohita of Jamadagni; the 6th incarnation of विष्णु to do away with the क्षत्रियस्; became a ब्राह्मण by tapas. <F>6:  M. ४७. २४४; १९८. 2 and 3.</F>

(II)--(विश्वरथ-वा। प्।): a son of गाधि and कुशिक (Kucika gotra-वा। प्।). Though born a क्षत्रिय, by his tapas he obtained brahmanhood. He had १०१ sons. The middle one was known Madhucchandas and hence all sons bore that common name. He asked his sons to regard सुनश्शेप as their eldest brother. The first fifty refused and were cursed to become mlecchas. Madhucchan- das and the younger fifty agreed to adopt शुनश्शेप. विस्वा- mitra blessed them. He had eight other sons like अष्टक. Owing to divisions among his sons, the कौशिक family be- came different from the विश्वामित्रस्. There was a change of pravara since adoption was introduced. Father of शकुन्- तला through ऊर्वशी. <F>1:  भा. IX. १६. २८-37; Br. I. 2. ११; II. ३२. ११७; ३८. २६. III. ६६. ५८; वा. 1. १७७; ६४. २५; ९१. ८७, ९३, ९५-6.</F> Helped त्रिशन्कु to go to heaven with the mortal body and secured for him a place in the sky. Fought वसिष्ठ in the guise of a bird concerning हरिश्- candra, son of त्रिशन्कु. Acted as होत्रि to हरिश्चन्द्र and was pleased with the fervour of the king and his queen; <F>2:  भा. IX. 7. 5-२६.</F> when he performed a यज्ञ, राम, son of दशरथ killed राक्षसस् who disturbed it; <F>3:  Ib. IX. १०. 5.</F> officiated as होत in परशुराम's अश्वमेध; <F>4:  Br. III. ४७. ४६; ७३. ९१.</F> a क्षत्रियद्विज--sons and family of. <F>5:  Ib. III. ६६. ८६; ६३. ८५-90.</F> Performed तपस् near the sea; his wife had her son bound [पगे३-279+ ३१] to her neck and sold him for a hundred cows; Satyavrata released the son to earn the goodwill of विश्वामित्र: Helped by Satyavrata--त्रिशन्कु during the १२ years famine, he took him bodily to heaven for it; <F>6:  वा. ८८. ८६-8; Br. III. ६३. ११२.</F> in दारुवन; <F>7:  Ib. I. 1. १४९; II. २७. १०३.</F> a ब्रह्मिष्ट. <F>8:  M. १४५. १११.</F>
(III)--the sage presiding over the month of ऊर्ज; <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ४४.</F> with the शिशिर Sun; <F>2:  Br. II. २३-20.</F> with the sun in फाल्गुन. <F>3:  Vi. II. १०. १८.</F>
--(also कौशिकस्): ब्रह्मराक्षसस्; one of the four clans moving about in the night; <F>1:  Br. III. 8. ५९-61; वा. ६९. १९५.</F> against Vedas and यज्ञस्. <F>2:  Ib. ७०. ५३.</F>
--see विश्वेदेवस्. भा. II. 3. 4.
(I)--a वम्शवर्तिन् god. Br. II. ३६. २९.
(II)--one of the six sons of पुरूरवस्. वा. ९१. ५२.

(I)--a Gandharva got infatuated at the sight of देवहूति playing on the terrace of her house: served as calf for Gandharvas and Apsarasas to milk Gandharva- Madhu from earth; <F>1:  भा. III. २०. ३९; २२. १७; IV. १८. १७. Br. III. 7. १२. IV. १४. 4.</F> praised हीरण्यकशिपु, the over lord of all worlds: sang the glory of Indra defeating Namuci. <F>2:  भा. VII. 4. १४; VIII. ११. ४१; XI. १६. ३३.</F> [पगे३-280+ ३२]

(II)--the Gandharva presiding over the month of Nabha; in the sun's chariot, with the sun in आवणि and पुरट्टाशि, (शरत् season); <F>2:  वा. ५२. १०, १३; ६२. १८८.</F> in the sun's chariot during the month of कार्तिक. <F>3:  Vi. II. १०. १२.</F> ^1 भा. XII. ११. ३७; Br. II. २३. १०; Vi. II. १०. 9.
(III)--a son of क्रोधा and a Deva- gandharva. Br. III. 6. ३९.
(IV)--a son of पुरूरवस् and ऊर्वशी; <F>1:  Br. III. ६६. २३; IV. २०. ४८ and १०१; Vi. IV. 7. 1.</F> the Gandharva who brought back ऊर्वशी to heaven from earth. <F>2:  Br. III. ६६. १६.</F>
(VI)--a Vasu, a son of Dharma and सुदेवी. M. १७१. ४६.
(VII)--a Gandharva and the best of speakers; deprived ऊर्वशी and पुरूरवस् of the two sheep. वा. ९१. १६-22; Vi. I. 9. १०२; IV. 6. ५१.
(VIII)--a Gandharva; <F>1:  वा. ३०. ८६.</F> an expert in divine music. <F>2:  Ib. ६९. ४७.</F>
--a class of musicians who sang the साम Veda. Br. III. 1. २५.
(I)--the sons of चाक्षुष Manu. भा. VI. 6. १५.

(II)--the ten sons of Dharma and विश्वा. As a result of their penance in the हिमालयस्, they were blessed to enjoy a part of the श्राद्ध offerings: Their duty was to protect the श्राद्ध and be its guests. (see विश्वा). Br. III. 3. ८०; १२. 3-१४.
(III)--residents of Bhuvarloka. वा. ६४. 2; ७३. ६१; १०१. ३०.

--Dharmaputras: (see विश्वान्देवस्). Ten sons of विश्वा and Dharma: these are childless gods: wait on Indra; worshipped for gain of a kingdom. <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. 7; 7. 3; १०. १७; II. 3. 4; M. १७१. ४८; २१७. ४८; २४६. ५४; २४७. १०; 5. १७; वा. २१. २३; ६६. ३१, ३२; Vi. I. १५. १०५; Br. II. ३८. 2-3; III. 3. ३०; 8. 4; १०. १०९; १५. ३५.</F> Fought with Paulomas in देवासुर war: gods of Vaivasvata epoch. <F>2:  भा. VIII. १०. ३४; १३. 4; M. 9. २९.</F> Formed the सदस् of Marutta's यज्ञस्: blessed ज्यामघ with a son: सूक्तस् sacred to; <F>3:  भा. IX. 2. २८; २३. ३९. 4. 4.</F> came with other gods to द्वारका to ask कृष्ण to go back to वैकुण्ठ; <F>4:  Ib. XI. 6. 2.</F> Kratu, दक्ष, श्रव, Satya, काल, काम, Muni, पुरूरवस्, आर्द्र- vasa, and रोचमान are their names, live in Bhuvarloka; <F>5:  Br. IV. 2. २८; २०. ४६.</F> see विश्वस्, ten in number, were चमसाध्वर्यवस् for Soma's राजसूय; <F>6:  M. १७. १४ and ५२; २३. २२; २०३. १२.</F> performed austerities in the हिमालयस्, and पितृस् pleased with them blessed them; ब्रह्मा gave them the first place of honour in the श्राद्ध and the second to devas. <F>7:  वा. ७६. 3, १२-14; १०६. ५९.</F>
--description of: निरिन्द्रिय, अलिन्गि, निर्गुण, चेतन, etc. Cf. गीता. वा. १४. 6-११, १३.
(I)--a mind-born daughter of ब्रह्मा. M. १७१. ३२. [पगे३-282+ २४]
(II)--her sons by Dharma. M. १७१. ४८ and ५१.
--Benares. M. १८५. ६८.
(I)--sacred to Goddess विश्वा. M. १३. २९.
(II)--the God enshrined at Benares. M. १८४. ६९.
(III)--a name of Hari. भा. II. 2. १४; Br. III. ४१. ४२.
--is ललिता. Br. IV. १३. २८.
--the sons of चाक्षुष Manu (s.v.). भा. VI. 6. १५.
(I)--a शिव god. Br. II. ३६. ३२.
(II)--an Asura, attacked by Nakuli देवी. Br. IV. २८. ३९.
(III)--a son of दनायुष; father of four sons all bent on doing cruelty. वा. ६८. ३०, ३३.
--details of preparations of antedotes to poisons to ward off evils in the palace. M. २१८. 1-३८. [पगे३-283+ ३२]

--a younger brother of भण्ड well read in नीति treatises, advised that even a woman should not be neg- lected and war to be embarked upon after proper consulta- tion. <F>1:  Br. IV. २०. ३०; २१. २५; २७. १०; २८. 3 and ३७.</F> His fight; took to कूटयुद्ध and fled for life. <F>2:  Ib. IV. २८. १०६ and ११४; २५. १४ and ३३, १०४.</F>
--a Mt. south of the मानस. वा. ३६. २३.
--produced by the churning of the ocean by the Devas and Asuras. वा. ५४. ४९; ६२. १८०.
--a kingdom in general; qualities of a good one; <F>1:  M. २१७. 1-5.</F> gift of. <F>2:  Ib. २७५. २५.</F>
--विषय is ब्रह्मा and अविषय is क्षेत्र. वा. १०२. ३६.
attained through सुषुम्ना situ- ated between इड and पिङ्गल. भा. II. 2. २४[2]

--see Vaivasvatagati; equinox, distance of; fit time for making gifts; <F>1:  Br. II. २१. ६८, ७२-3; M. १२४. ९३; १८७. ३७; २७४. १९; वा. ५०. १२५; Vi. II. 8. ७४ and ७८.</F> occurs between the spring and winter. <F>2:  M. १७. 2; ८२. २५; ८३. 7; ९८. 2. १२४. ४७.</F>
--queen of Viraja, and mother of a hundred sons and one daughter. <F>1:  भा. V. १५. १५.</F> Mother of विष्वक्सेन. <F>2:  Ib. VIII. १३. २३.</F> [पगे३-284+ ३२]
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८४.
--a son of विश्वेशा. M. १७१. ५०.
--hills round about Meru; these are Mandara, गन्धमाधन, तिलाचल, (Vipula) and सुपार्श्व. M. ८३. ११, १९, ३६; ११३. ४५.
--a son of पृथु; and father of चान्द्र-yuva- नाश्व. Vi. IV. 2. ३५-6.
--also विड्भुक्--a hell. Br. IV. 2. १४८ and १७०.
(I)--a daughter of विवस्वान् and छाया; became काल of cruel deeds. M. ११. 9, ३९.
(II)--a युगादि for श्राद्ध. M. १७. 3.

(I)--the name of the sun in the month of ऊर्ज (कार्तिक); <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ४४; Br. II. २३. २०; वा. ६६. ६१, ६६.</F> an आदित्य and Lord of आदित्यस्; <F>2:  Br. II. २४. ३४; III. 3. ६८; M. 6. 4; १७१. ५६. Vi. I. १५. १३०.</F> in the sun's chariot in फाल्गुन. <F>3:  Ib. I. २२. 3; II. १०. १८.</F>
(II)--a god of आभूतरय group. Br. II. ३६. ५६.

(III)--(उत्तमश्लोक) worshipped for dharma. His abode above the position of seven sages, where is found the great Dhruva with others; <F>1:  भा. II. 3. २२; III. ch. १३ (whole); V. २२. १७; २३. 1.</F> different forms of; as Trivik- rama broke अण्डकटाह and let the Ganges in; as Sankar- [पगे३-285+ ५०] षण, worshipped by शिव in इलावृत; as हयग्रीव in Bha- द्राश्व country; as नृसिम्ह in हरिवर्ष; as कामदेव in केतुमाला; as Matsya in Ramyaka; as कूर्म in हिरण्मय; also सान्ख्यनिदर्शन; as वराह in Uttara Kuru country; also in the form of both यज्ञ and Kratu; as सीताराम in Kim- पुरुष; as नरनारायण in भारतवर्ष; as सूर्य in Plak- षद्वीप; as Soma in शाल्मलि; as Agni in कुशद्वीप; as a form of water in क्रौञ्चद्वीप; as वायु in शाकद्वीप; as ब्रह्मा in पुष्करद्वीप. <F>2:  Ib. V. १७. 1 and १६; chh. १८-20 (whole);</F> Propitiated by दक्ष after his reconciliation with शिव, विष्णु came to receive offerings in person in the form of यज्ञ and was praised by all present including ब्रह्मा and शिव. He told दक्ष that he was not different from शिव or ब्रह्मा. <F>3:  Ib. IV. 7. १८-54; १४. २६.</F> presented पृथु with सुदर्शन and addressed him to befriend Indra, to be devoted to Him and to conduct himself righteously. <F>4:  Ib. IV. १५. १६; २०. 2-१६, ३१ [1-2].</F> His residence near क्षीरोद where he sleeps in yoga: vanquisher of Bali; saw a लिन्ग of efful- gence and with ब्रह्मा went down and up to know its origin and end, but could not get at that. शिव's remark that his right and left arms were ब्रह्मा and विष्णु. This is महा- यागम् and माहेश्वरम् balam; <F>5:  Br. II. २६. 2; २७. २२.</F> cursed by भृगु to take १० (7 म्। प्।) incarnations on the earth; called पुरुष and यज्ञ. <F>6:  Ib. III. 3. ८५-106; ७२. 3-१७; M. ४७. ९९-103.</F> In स्वायम्भुव epoch was born of आकूती, in स्वारोचिष, born of तुषिता as Ajita, in Uttama epoch, born of सत्या as Satya, in तामस born of हरिणी as Hari, in Vaivasvata, born of कश्यप and अदिती with the name वैकुण्ठ. <F>7:  Br. III. १०७-122.</F> Overlord of आदित्यस्; gave peacock and fowl to कुमार. <F>8:  Ib. III. १०. ४६; २४. 6; ३३. १५; ४२. ४८; ७१. १७६ and २६२. M. 6. 4; १७१. ५६.</F> Killed Daityas in तारकामय and especially कालनेमि. Aided Indra against Asuras. Introduced यज्ञ and other rites, divisions of time, three castes, three Vedas, three गुणस् and so on. <F>9:  Br. III. ७२. १८-64, १३३. १४२; M. ch. १७२.</F> Got Indra redeemed of the sin of hitting his Purohita विश्- वरूप, by distributing it among the women, trees and earth. When दुर्वास cursed Indra for refusing to accept देवी's garland, the Asuras destroyed the Devas and entered heaven. Then Hari suggested churning of the ocean and distributed as मोहिनी nectar to Devas making them invincible. <F>१०:  Br. IV. 9. २३-81; १०. 4-5; १४. 2.</F> Gave his sister देवी in marriage to शिव with wedding presents. <F>११:  Ib. IV. १५. १५-23; २८. ८९; ३०. 8; ३१. 6; ३४. ७१-2;</F> [पगे३-286+ ५५] Fond of soma drink. Got विष्णुत्वम् by meditating upon ललितामन्त्र। <F>१२:  Ib. IV. ३८. ३९.</F> Reflections of कालनेमि on his eternal enmity to Asuras. Killed कालनेमि after a fierce fight, described; re-establishes order and goes back to his abode. <F>१३:  M. १७८. 5-८०; ८७. 1.</F> Lord of Ravis; as Kapila destroyed the Sagaras. <F>१४:  Ib. 8. 4; १२. ४१-3; १७. 1.</F> Born in the family of क्रोष्ठु, helped the वृष्णिस्; <F>१५:  Ib. ४४. १५; ४७. २९, ३३.</F> helped Indra by killing काव्य's mother; <F>१६:  Ib. ४७. ९९.</F> worship of, in the विभूति dva1das4i- vratam; <F>१७:  Ib. १७४. ५१; २२५. १४; २४६. ४१, ६९. २४८. ४०.</F> Icon of, with different postures described; <F>१८:  Ib. २५८. 4-१५; २६६. ४२.</F> विष्णु (जनार्दन); <F>१९:  Ib. 7. २०; १५४. ३५१.</F> blessed वैभ्राज of पाञ्चाल with a son, Brahmadatta; <F>२०:  Ib. 9. 1; २१. ११-6.</F> in नारसिम्ह form; <F>२१:  Ib. २२. १७.</F> in मेघकर तीर्थम्; <F>२२:  Ib. २२. ४०.</F> blessed Soma with fulfilment of all his desires; <F>२३:  Ib. २३. १७-19.</F> regained the jewel Syamantaka from the bear and gave it to सत्राजित्; <F>२४:  Ib. ४५. १६-17.</F> spoke of आदिसर्ग and Pratisarga; <F>२५:  Ib. ५२. 2.</F> worshipped by पुरूरवस् when he was a Brahman in previous birth; <F>२६:  Ib. ६५. 7; ११५. १२.</F> came out of the arrow of त्रिपुरारि and drank of the medi- cinal tank of Tripuram; <F>२७:  Ib. १३६. ५८.</F> overwhelmed by Asuras on all sides broke the chariot of कालनेमि who escaped; <F>२८:  Ib. १३६. ६५; १५०. २२२.</F> cut off Grasana's neck by the cakra; <F>२९:  Ib. १५०. २४३; १५१. ३४.</F> disabled in fight with other राक्षसस् especially Jambha and Nimi, fled with गरुड; <F>३०:  Ib. ch. १५२.</F> Indra met him and praised his past exploits and promised to help himself with ११ Rudras; with Indra's army जनार्- dana went to war once more; <F>३१:  Ib. १५३. 1-4.</F> vanquished the Asuras at भार्गवेश; <F>३२:  Ib. १९२. 1-2.</F> residence of, in the Mandara hill; <F>३३:  Ib. २०६. १८; २४५. 9; २४६. २४, ३०f; २४९. ३२.</F> meditation of; <F>३४:  Ib. २६६. ३५.</F> spoke of the १६ gifts to Manu; <F>३५:  Ib. २७४. १६.</F> fish form of. <F>३६:  Ib. २९०. २३.</F> [पगे३-287+ ३३]
(IV)--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २०.
(V)--one of the nine sons of सावर्णि. वा. १००. २२.
--of योधनीपुरम्; where the Asuras were slain by वासुदेव in large numbers; <F>1:  M. १९१. ९९-101.</F> more efficacious than the Ganges. <F>2:  वा. १११. ४१. 2.</F>

--met यमदूतस् at the death of अजामिल and argued that the uttering of Hari's name before his death was an expiation for all sins committed. Yama's tri- bute to them as objects of worship for they go about protect- ing the votaries of Hari. <F>1:  भा. VI. 1. २०; 2. 2-३९; 3. १७-18.</F> Residents of विष्णुलोक. <F>2:  Br. IV. 7. ३८.</F>
(I)--a lake in the निषध hill; <F>1:  Br. II. १८. ६७; III. ४३. १४; M. १२१. ६६; वा. ४७. ६४.</F> sacred to पितृस्; <F>2:  M. २२. २५.</F> the place where Dhruva is located. <F>3:  वा. ५०. २२२.</F>

(II)--the path where Dharma, Dhruva and others take their stand above the seven sages; the region between the seven ऋषिस् and Dhruva where live ascetics and yogis of a high order; the source of rain and the stay of the three worlds; from this proceeds the गन्गा; issuing from the nail of the great toe of विष्नु's left foot; <F>1:  Br. II. २१. १७६; Vi. II. 8. ९८-109;</F> the third division of the celestial region. <F>2:  Ib. II. 8. १२२.</F>
(III)--a Mt. in गया; a hill where Dhar- maratha performed a sacrifice. M. ४८. ९३; वा. ९९. १०२; १०५. २६; १०९. १८; १११. ४६-7 and ५६. [पगे३-288+ ३०]
--a R. of the भद्रा country. वा. ४३. २९.
--the celestial regions where Dhruva holds the भगवत्पदी on his head with intense devotion; <F>1:  भा. V. १७. 1-2.</F> sacred for गन्गा. <F>2:  Br. III. १३. ११८.</F>
--sacred to विष्णु; attained by Heti after having been killed by विष्नु. वा. १०९. २५; २७४. ७६.
--one among the eighteen पुराणस्; com- prises २३,000 श्लोकस्. भा. XII. 7. २३. १३. 4.
--incarnation of, at the time of कृष्ण's birth. See योगमाया. भा. X. 1. २५.
--another name of Kalki to be born to a Brahman of शम्भलग्राम. भा. I. 3. २५; XII. 2. १८; Vi. IV. २४. ९८. Br. III. ७३. १०४; वा. ९८. १०४.
--a name of परिक्षित्. भा. I. १२. १७.

--the abode of विष्णु <F>1:  वा. १०८. १९; १११. ६७; Vi. V. ३८. ९४.</F> in पाण्डवेशम्; at- tained by one who bathes in चक्रतीर्थम्; <F>2:  M. १९१. २१, ६२.</F> he who does तुलापुरुष goes to विष्णुलोकम्. <F>3:  Ib. १९३. ७४.</F>
(I)--क्षत्रियस् who became द्विजस्। Br. III. ६६. ८८; वा. ९१. ११७. [पगे३-289+ ३०]
(II)--the descendants of विष्णुवृद्ध, cognates of Angiras; Brahmans with क्षत्रिय dharma. वा. ६५. १०७; ८८. ७९.
--in honour of विष्णु, leads to Parama- pada. M. १०१. ३७, ६४.

--three-fold; ability to perceive the abso- lute truth, ability to perceive the nature of the embodied soul and thirdly inability to know one's nature; the technical terms used are परा, क्षेत्रज्ञा or अपरा and अविद्या कर्म- सम्ज्ञा। Vi. VI. 7. ६०-1.
--here गन्गा was born and here are the footprints of वामन. Br. III. ३७. 4.
--once asked of it by Sagara the sage Aurva narrated it to him; was repeated by पराशर to Maitreya. Vi. III. 8. 3-5.

(I)--is विष्णु; <F>1:  भा. I. 2. 8; III. १३. 3.</F> a son of Brahmadatta and Go; author of योगतन्त्र under the guidance of जैगीषव्य; the concrete form of the पाञ्चरात्र and other तन्त्रस्। Father of Udaksvana; <F>2:  Ib. IX. २१. २५-26;</F> worship of; <F>3:  Ib. XI. २७. २९; XII. ११. २०. M. २१. ३५; Vi. IV. १९. ४६.</F> Brahmadatta anointed him king and left for yoga practice. [पगे३-290+ २४]
(II)--forms one of the retinue of the Lord on the लोकालोक mountain. भा. V. २०. ४०.
(III)--born of विषूची; to be friendly to शम्- bhu, the Indra of the Tenth Manu; attacked Asura followers of Bali. भा. VIII. १३. २३; २१. १६.
(IV)--an attribute of Hari, वासुदेव, Ma- धुसूदन and जनार्दन. Br. III. ७१. ५० and २४५; वा. ९६. ४८, २३६; १०६. ५०; भा. VI. 8. २९.
(V)--the future Manu, and the last (१४थ्) in number. M. 9. ३६.
(VI)--a son of Yugadatta; was born again as विभ्राज on account of his good deeds. M. ४९. ५८.
(VII)--a son of गवेष्ठि. वा. ६७. ७७.
(VIII)--a son of योगसूनु. वा. ९९. १८०.
(IX)--a name of कृष्ण. Vi. V. ३८. २०.
--a mother goddess. M. १७९. २८.
--a Yadu tribe; ended their lives by killing their kinsmen. भा. XI. ३०. १८.
--a kingdom of the west watered by the Sindhu. Br. II. १८. ४८.
--a son of देवमीढ and father of महाधृति. भा. IX. १३. १६.
--a son of खशा and राक्षस. Br. III. 7. १३४.
--an Apsaras with the sun in the शरत्. वा. ५२. १३.
(I)--the gods of the epoch of the eleventh Manu. भा. VIII. १३. २५; Vi. III. 2. ३०.
(II)--(Laukika) (1/१०००) of the watery creatures. वा. १०१. २००. [पगे३-292+ २६]
--eight kinds of Agni. वा. २९. २५.
--a Janapada of the केतुमाला. वा. ४४. ११.
--a son of Udayana and father of दण्डपाणि. Vi. IV. २१. १५.
--the name of a hell. Br. IV. 2. १५०.
--a name of a hell. वा. १०१. १४९.

--Lute; <F>1:  वा. ५४. ३५.</F> presented by सरस्वती to Skanda; <F>2:  Ib. ७२. ४६.</F> in the garland of उमेश, figures of apsaras with वीणास् <F>3:  M. २६०. २०.</F> in पातालम् <F>4:  Vi. II. 5. ११.</F> in राम's अभिषेक. <F>5:  Ib. IV. 4. १००.</F>
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १७. ३४.
(I)--a son of शुनक (Sunaya-ब्र्। & वा। प्।) and father of धृति. भा. IX. १३. २६; Br. III. ६४. २३; वा. ८९. २२; Vi. IV. 5. ३१.
--the family of. वा. ९९. ३०९.
--a साध्य. Br. III. 3. १७.
--a भार्गव gotrakr2t; an आर्षेय pravara. M. १९५. १८, ३६.
(I)--a son of Priyavrata: appointed Lord of पुष्करद्वीप. Father of रमणक and धातकी. After dividing the kingdom among his sons he became religiously devoted. भा. V. 1. २५ and ३३; २०. ३१.
(II)--a son of Indrasena and father of Satya- श्रवस्. भा. IX. 2. २०.
(III)--a son of सुकुमार and father of Bharga. भा. IX. १७. 9.
(IV)--the eldest son of तालजन्घ; father of Ananta; escaped to हिमालयस् from परशुराम's attack. भा. IX. २३. २९; Br. III. ४६. २६; ४७. ६७; ६९. ५३; M. ४३. ४९; Vi. IV. ११. २४.
(V)--invited for युधिष्ठिर's राजसूय. भा. X. ७४. 9.
(VI)--a son of दृष्टकेतु and father of भार्ग. Vi. IV. 8. २०. [पगे३-294+ २७]

--a Vindhya tribe: one of the five गणस् of the Haihayas; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ६५; III. ६९. ५२; ७४. १३८; M. ४३. ४८; ११४. ५४; वा. ४५. १३४.</F> twenty kings of these, contemporaneous with ten of शिशुनागस्, ruled from Avanti. <F>2:  M. २७२. 1, १७.</F>
(I)--a son of भजमान and father of राजा- dhideva. M. ४४. ७७.
(II)--a son of Suratha. M. ५०. ३५.
(III)--the king and ally of भीष्मक and जरासन्ध. Vi. V. २६. 7.
--Mt. a kulaparvata in the south of भा- rata वर्ष. वा. ४८. 3.
(I)--a son of पृथु; pursued Indra at the instance of Atri when Indra walked away with पृथु's sacrificial horse. भा. IV. १९. १७; २०. २१.
(II)--a son of कृष्ण and सत्या. भा. X. ६१. १३-14.
(III)--a son of Satrajit. Br. III. ७१. ५५.
(IV)--a name. of विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ६८. [पगे३-295+ २५]
(I)--the gods of तामस epoch. भा. VIII. 1. २८.
(II)--a class of पिशाचस्. Br. III. 7. ३७८.
(I)--(विराक-भा। प्।) a sage of the चाक्षुष epoch. भा. VIII. 5. 8.
(II)--the head of a शिव gan2a. Br. III. ४१. २८.

(III)--the door-keeper of शिव, with the cane in hand; directed the Devas to their proper seats in the marriage of उमा and शिव; adopted as son by उमा who brought him up tenderly, played with विद्याधरस्; appointed to guard the harem by उमा when she went for penance; when he allowed आडि in the guise of a woman to enter, he was curs- ed to be born as man and join the गण afterwards. M. १५४. २३०, ३८३, ४४५-54, ४६५-577; chh. १५५-158.
--(also Kambalabarhis)--son of Marutta and father of Rukmakavaca. Br. III. ७०. २५.
--a mind-born daughter of आज्यप pitr2s; married नहुष and became the mother of ययाति. M. १५. २३.
--a sage of the चाक्षुष epoch. Vi. III. 1. २८. [पगे३-296+ ३१]
--a progenitor; father of असिक्नी and father-in- law of दक्ष (चाक्षुष-वि। प्।); <F>1:  Br. III. 2. 5; वा. ६५. १२८; Vi. I. १३. 3.</F> his daughter वीरिणी married चक्षुस्. <F>2:  M. 4. ४०.</F>
--the name of the wood-cutter who became Dvijavarma. Br. IV. 7. ३२.
--the city in whose grove निदाघ engaged himself in austerities for a १००० divine years. Vi. II. १५. 6-7.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४१.

(I)--created out of anger of शिव on his hearing of सती's self-sacrifice to destroy दक्ष's यज्ञ; seized दक्ष, cut off his head and offered it to दक्षिणाग्नि, and then set out for कैलास. After reconciliation with शिव, विष्णु was propitiated with पुरोडाश to get rid of pollution due to वीरभद्र's interference in the यज्ञ; <F>1:  भा. IV. ch. 5 (whole); 7. १७; वा. ३०. १३०-160; १०१. २९९.</F> after destroying the sacrifice was about to destroy the world; शिव stopped him and blessed him to be the first of all ग्रहस् by name अङ्गा- raka; <F>2:  M. ७२. १३-6; १९२. 6.</F> hearing that he came out of the wrath of पशुपति Daks2a appeased him by prayers. शिव rose from the fire altar and granted him his request that his sacrifice be fruit- ful when दक्ष praised him with १००८ names. <F>3:  वा. ३०. १६१-180.</F> [पगे३-297+ २६]
(II)--one of the शिव's attendants; the head of a शिव gan2a. Br. III. ३२. २३; ४१. २८; IV. १४. 8.
--the kingdom of. M. १२१. ४५.
--a son of नृपम्जय. वा. ९९. १९३.
--the wife of सत्राजित्; mother of भन्गकार, सत्यभामा and others. Br. III. ७१. ५६.
--one of the nine mind-born sons of सावर्णि. वा. १००. २१.
--a son of Madhu and Sumanas; wife भोजा; Father of Manthu and Pramanthu. भा. V. १५. १५.
--in honour of शिव; here a golden lion is offered as present. M. १०१. २८.
(I)--a Brahman sage who was invited for the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर. भा. X. ७४. 9.
(II)--a son of ऋतुपर्ण, and father of सुदास. Br. III. ६३. १७४.
(III)--his son Nala, to be distinguished from the friend of the इक्ष्वाकुस्. वा. ८८. १७५. [पगे३-298+ २५]
--the sin of killing क्षत्रियस्. Br. III. ४७. २६.
--succeeded the बृहद्रथ kings. शुनक killed the reigning king and anointed his son, Pradyota. Br. III. ७४. १२२.
--a Haihaya clan beginning with वीरहोत्र. वा. ९४. ५२.
--the posture in which पृषध्र sat and pro- tected the cattle of his preceptor during nights. भा. IX. 2. 3.
--a tribe. Br. III. ७४. २६८.
(I)--a वर्ण S4akti. Br. IV. ४४. ५९.
(II)--a wife of दक्ष, and mother of Suvrata. Br. IV. 1. ३९.
(III)--from her the धर्मसर्ग of कश्यप originated. वा. 1. १३१.
(IV)--a daughter of वीरसेन; grand-daughter of ब्रह्मा and wife of चक्षुस्. M. 4. ३९.
--a daughter of इरा and mother of creepers and bushes. Br. III. 7. ४६०-2. [पगे३-299+ २६]
--Icon of; seated on the bull, with plaited tuft, and trident and वीणा in his hands; generally in the pre- sence of मातृगण images. M. २६१. ३९.
--a son of अक्रूर. M. ४५. २९.
--a class of people in शाल्मलिद्वीप. भा. V. २०. ११.
--a Deva gandharva. वा. ६८. ३८.
--a son of बृहद्राज. M. २७१. १०.
--prize of Valour in स्वयम्वर। भा. I. १०. २९.
--the क्षत्रिय Brahmans of Angirasa line. वा. ९९. १६४.
--a याम deva. Br. II. १३. ९२.
(I)--a son of पृथु and Arcis: was entrusted with the western part of the kingdom by his elder brother. भा. IV. २२. ५४; २४. 2.
(II)--an Asura who followed वृत्र against Indra; a son of हिरण्याक्ष. भा. VI. १०. [२०]; VII. 2. १८. [पगे३-300+ २६]
(III)--a son of Bharuka and father of बाहुक. भा. IX. 8. 2.
(IV)--a son of देवमीढ and मारिषा; married दुर्वार्क्षी and had तक्ष and other sons. भा. IX. २४. २९ and ४३.
(V)--a son of Vatsaka and मिश्रकेशी. भा. IX. २४. ४३.
(VI)--a son of कृष्ण and मित्रविन्दा. भा. X. ६१. १६.

(VII)--a son of शकुनि and an Asura; met नारद who advised him to perform tapas in honour of शिव. He did so by cutting his own flesh for six days and on the seventh was about to cut off his head when शिव appeared and blessed that whosesoever head he touched that person should die. He attempted it on शिव who ran to वैकुण्ठ. Hari in the form of a ब्रह्मचारिन् asked him to try the boon on him- self. The wicked Asura did so and met with his death. भा. X. ८८. १३-36.
(VIII)--a son of कृष्ण and सत्या (माद्री-वि। प्।). भा. X. ९०. ३३; Br. III. ७१. २५२; Vi. V. ३२. 4.
(IX)--sonless, adopted Saumi and कौशिक. Br. II. ७१. १९२.
(X)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४२; ५१. ११.
(XI)--a son of Ruruka and father of बाहु. Br. III. ६३. ११९; Vi. IV. 3. २५-6. [पगे३-301+ २५]
(XII)--a son of शूर. Br. III. ७१. १४९.
(XIII)--a son of शिष्ट. M. 4. ३९.
(XIV)--a son of Rohita. M. १२. ३८.
(XV)--a son of छाया and पुष्टि (सृष्ति-ब्र्। प्।). वा. ६२. ८३; Br. II. ३६. ९८.
(XVI)--one of the sons of नागनजित्. वा. ९६. २४३.
--a son of कृष्ण and सत्या. Br. III. ७१. २५२.
--a son of शिष्ट (i) and सुच्छाया. M. 4. ३९; Vi. I. १३. 2.
--one of the seven daughters of Devaka; married Vasudeva. वा. ९६. १३०; Vi. IV. १४. १८.
--one of the wives of Vasudeva and mother of अगावह (अवगाह, म्। प्।) and Nandaka. Br. III. ७१. १८०; M. ४६. १८; वा. ९६. १८०.
(I)--a राक्षस living in Atalam. Br. II. २०. ३३.
(II)--an Asura of the fourth tala or gabhastala. वा. ५०. ३२.
--a son of कृष्ण and सत्या. Br. III. ७१. २५२; वा. ९६, २४३.
--a Janapada. वा. ४५. १११.

--a name of भीमसेन; <F>1:  भा. I. 7. १३; Br. III. ७१. १५४.</F> son of वायु and पृथा; <F>2:  M. ४६. 9; वा. ९६. १५३; ९९. २४४.</F> भीम, son of वायु through the God Marut; <F>3:  M. ५०. ४९.</F> fire called वृक, in his stomach. <F>4:  Ib. ६९. १४.</F>
--milked the earth in पलाशपात्र. वा. ६२. १९१.

--sacred as houses for the primitive man and supplied him with honey, fruits and clothing; Gandharvas live in them; these कल्पवृक्षास् deteriorated and man who took to caves began to build houses on the model furnished by the trees with the upward, downward and crosswise trees; <F>1:  Br. II. 7. ७५-91, ११७-20.</F> milked the cow-earth; the essence was tender leaves; the vessel was of पालाश wood and the प्लक्ष tree acted as the calf. <F>2:  M. १०. २७.</F>
--(पादपोद्यापन): festivities connected with the planting of trees and the laying out of gardens. M. ५९. १७.
--a son of हविर्धान. Vi. I. १४. 2.
(I)--a daughter of कृष्ण and सत्या. Br. III. ७१. २५२.
(II)--a daughter of नाग्नजित्. वा. ९६. २४३.
--a son of क्रोष्टु, and father of स्वाहि. भा. IX. २३. ३१; Br. III. ७०. १५-16; M. ४४. १५; वा. ९५. १५.
--a son of शिष्ट. M. 4. ३९.
--a daughter of ऋषा; mother of Tortoise, शन्ख, etc. Br. III. 7. ४१४-17; वा. ६९. २९१-92.
(I)--means of living by ऋत, अमृत, मृत प्रमृत and सत्यामृत or सत्यानृत; never by श्ववृत्ति। भा. VII. ११. १८-20.
(II)--transformation of जयादेवस् in the seven epochs of Manu. Br. III. 4. १२, ३७.
--a R. of क्रौञ्चद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २१.

(I)--a son of त्वष्ट्रि, created out of a sacrificial offering with an ugly appearance to avenge Indra, the mur- derer of विश्वरूप. Hari advised Indra on the means to end वृत्र. In the battle वृत्र encouraged his soldiers and uttered words of heroism. Ran towards Indra as कैटभ against Hari and had one hand cut off. But in the contest the Vajra of Indra slipped and वृक asked him to take up the weapon and fight. He had his other arm cut off. But वृक swallowed Indra into his stomach from which Indra escaped and cut off his head. वृत्र attained Aloka due to his faith in Hari having been born as Citraketu (s.v.) in his previous birth. <F>1:  भा. VI. chh. 9-१२ (whole); ch. १४ (whole); १७. ३८-39; X. ७७. ३६; Br. III. ७२. ८३.</F> Attained release by सत्सन्ग। His greed for more territory. <F>2:  भा. XI. १२. 5; XII. 3. ११.</F> Killed by हालाफल अवतार्। An account of the death in the भागवत; an Asura of कृतयुग. <F>3:  M. ४७. ५१; ५३. २०; २४९. ६७.</F> Brought forth sons from his terrible breathing during his fight with Indra in thousands. All followers of Mahendra, those who have realised ब्रह्मा, are happy, dharmic and live in small bodies. <F>4:  वा. ६८. ३४-6.</F>
(II)--a son of अनायुष. Father of Bakas in hun- dreds who followed Mahendra. Br. III. 6. ३१.
--the ninth of the twelve incarnations of विष्णु. M. ४७. ४४.
--a R. from the पारियात्र hill; from ऋष्यवान्; in भारतवर्ष. Br. II. १६. २७; M. ११४. २३; वा. ४५. ९७ [पगे३-305+ ३१]
--an epithet of Indra. Vi. V. 1. ५८.
--is Indra; <F>1:  Br. III. १०. २३.</F> got frightened at the prolonged love of उमा and शन्कर and asked Agni to disturb their sport. <F>2:  वा. ७२. २१.</F>
--taught Atri the consequences of dis- astrous signs in a state. M. २२९. 2.
--a contemporary of Mucukunda; told the latter that towards the end of द्वापर he would have the दर्शन् of कृष्ण Vis2n2u. Vi. V. २३. २५८.
--of कारूष line, married श्रुत- देवा, sister of Vasudeva. She gave birth to Dantavaktra; <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. ३७; Br. III. ७१. १५६; वा. ९६. १५५; Vi. IV. १४. ३९.</F> son of आयु. <F>2:  M. २४. ३४.</F>
--a queen of सुमती and mother of Deva- ताजित्. भा. V. १५. 2.
--the goddess following भवमालिनी. M. १७९. ७१.

--done prior to मङ्गल occasions such as festivals, sacrifices, marriages, etc.; here prayers offered first to मातृस्, then to पितृस्, maternal grandfather, and विश्- vedevas; in it yava is used for tila and prefaced by नान्दि s4abda; <F>1:  M. १७. ६५ 9; वा. ११०. १७.</F> a house-holder is eligible to perform it after the सपिण्डि करणम् of the deceased. <F>2:  M. १८. १६.</F> [पगे३-306+ २६]
(I)--a son of शृन्जय and राष्ट्रपालि. भा. IX. २४. ४२.
(II)--a son of कृष्ण and सत्या. भा. X. ६१. १३.
(III)--a son of कृष्ण and कालिन्दी. भा. X. ६१. १४.
(IV)--one of the ten horses of the moon's chariot. Br. II. २३. ५६; M. १२६. ५२; वा. ५२. ५३.
(V)--a वैकुण्ठ god. Br. II. ३६. ५७.

(VI)--the milk-white humped bull born of सुरभी and the standard of शिव; <F>1:  Br. III. 3. ७८-79; ७४. ४८-51; IV. १४. 2.</F> taught Godharma to दीर्घतमस्; <F>2:  Ib. III. ७४. ४७;</F> gift of, in a श्राद्ध. <F>3:  Ib. III. १९. १५.</F>
(VII)--a son of अनायुषा: Father of श्राद्धाद, यज्नहा, ब्रह्महा and पशुहा, all cruel minded. Br. III. 6. ३१.
(VIII)--the sacred well in देविका. Here is the जातवेदशिला. Br. III. १३. ४१; वा. ७७. ४१-4.
(IX)--the Vedic lore rooted in Brahmacarya. Br. III. १४. ३६-7. [पगे३-307+ २२]
(X)--a son of कार्तवीर्य who escaped परशु- राम: a महारथ. Br. III. ४१. १३; ६९. ५०; वा. ९४. ४९.
(XI)--the Indra of the epoch of the III सावर्ण. Br. IV. 1. ७७; १८. 8.
(XII)--a महेश्वर Gan2a. M. २६६. ४२.
(XIII)--a palace in the form of a bull M. २६९. ३६, ४५.
(XIV)--Dharma; <F>1:  वा. ७८. २७; Br. III. १४. ३६.</F> a son of Maya. <F>2:  वा. ६८. २८.</F>
(XV)--a son of पार. वा. ९९. १७७.
(XVI)--a son of Bharata and father of Madhu. Vi. IV. ११. २५-6.
--a son of छाया and पुष्टि. वा. ६२. ८३.
--a Pravara sage. M. १९९. १७.
--a name of विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ७०. [पगे३-308+ ३०]
--a son of सुरभी and कश्यप with a jewelled necklace given by mother for the use of महेश्- vara as ध्वज। वा. ६६. ७५-6.
--a son of शिबि, after whom came the Jana- pada वृषदर्भ. Br. III. ७४. २३; वा. ९९. २३.
(I)--a follower of वृत्र in his battle with Indra. भा. VI. १०. [२०].
(II)--शिव as overlord of the Rudras; <F>1:  Br. III. 8. 6; M. १८०. ८९-90; १८९. १४.</F> prayer to. <F>2:  Ib. २६६. ४७.</F>
(III)--is विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ६६.

--a son of Danu. Father of शर्मिष्ठा whom ययाती married. सुदरी and चन्द्रा were his other daughters. Helped वृत्र against Indra, and fought with अश्विन्स् in the देवासुर war. <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ३१-2; १०. २०; VIII. १०. ३०; Vi. I. २१. 5; वा. ६८. 8; ९३. १६; Br. III. 6. 8, २३; ६८. १५; M. 6. २०-22; २४. ५२; २५. 6.</F> Heard of शुक्र's anger on account of the offence given by his daughter to देवयानी and requested शुक्र to stay on, promising to make his daughter a servant of देवयानी. <F>2:  भा. IX. १८. 4 and 6, २६-28; XI. १२. 5; M. chh. २७ and २९.</F> Attained salvation by सत्सन्ग।
--not to marry with अङ्गिरस् and विरूपस्. M. १९६. ४०. [पगे३-309+ २४]
(I)--a son of कार्तवीर्यार्जुन. भा. IX. २३. २७.
(II)--a playmate of कृष्ण. Being a victor in a game was carried on his back by Bhadrasena. भा. X. १८. २३-24.
(III)--a son of सृष्टि and छाया. Br. II. ३६. ९८.
(IV)--the Asura vanquished by कृष्ण. Br. III. ३६. ३७; ७३. १००; वा. ९८. १००.
(V)--a god of the सुकर्माण group. Br. IV. 1. ८८; वा. १००. ९२.
(VI)--a son of Anamitra, married Jayanti the daughter of the काशिराज. M. ४५. २५-6.
(VII)--a son of कुशाग्र and father of Punya- वान् (पुस्पवान्-वि। प्।). M. ५०. २९; Vi. IV. १९. ८२.
(VIII)--the Lord of cattle: dedication of a dark वृष is equal to going to गया for श्राद्ध. M. 8. 8; २२. 6.
(IX)--the Mt. Sumana in प्लक्ष; to the east of अरुणोद; <F>1:  वा. ३६. १८.</F> north of the महाभद्र lake. <F>2:  Ib. ३६. २०.</F> [पगे३-310+ ३३]

--शिव with the standard of the bull; also वृषवाहन; <F>1:  M. 1. 8; १३३. १३; वा. ३०. १८०, २६१; Vi. V. ३३. ५०; ३४. ३५.</F> prayed to by काम and others; <F>2:  M. १४०. ८५; १९१. ११५; १९२. २७; २०६. २७ and २८.</F> see वृषध्वज the Lord of Rudras. <F>3:  वा. ७०. 6.</F>
--see शूद्र; <F>1:  Br. II. ३१. ८९; III. १४. ३८.</F> unfit for Pankti feeding. <F>2:  Ib. III. १९. ३१; IV. 8. १९; वा. ७८. २९.</F>

--rule with गुरुण्डस् (मरुण्डस्-वा। प्।); both Mlecchas; <F>1:  Br. III. ७४. १७७; वा. ५८. ८८; ९९. ३६३.</F> joined with the Mlecchas; <F>2:  M. २७३. २२.</F> to be put down by future Kalki. <F>3:  Ib. ४७. २५२; वा. ९८. ११४.</F>
--the chieftain of the वृषलस्: offered human sacrifice to काली for getting a son. भा. V. 9. १२.
--the capital of कृश. M. ४८. २१.
(I)--a son of कर्ण; with him comes to an end the Anga line. भा. IX. २३. १४; M. ४८. १०२.
(II)--a son of the II सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ७२.
(III)--a son of कार्तवीर्यार्जुन. Vi. IV. ११. २१.
(I)--a Rudra, and a son of भूत and सरूपा: Fought with Jambha in the देवासुर war. भा. VI. 6. १७; VIII. १०. ३२; Vi. I. १५. १२२. [पगे३-311+ २८]
(II)--a name of Indra. भा. VI. १३. १०.
(III)--a name of Hari. भा. X. 1. २०.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४२.
--a name of शिव. भा. VIII. 8. 1; M. १५४. १९६.
--a son of शिबि; <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. 3.</F> an Angirasa and मन्त्र- कृट्। <F>2:  Br. II. ३२. १०९.</F>
--a line of kings in विदिश. वा. ९९. ३६६.
--a son of कार्तवीर्य who escaped परशुराम: a महारथ. Br. III. ४१. १३; ६९. ५०.

--rules for the dedication of a bull; the characteristics and adornments of the bull intended for gift and of the cow, its mother; intended for all castes; different coloured bulls and their significance; gift of नील bull best for पितृस्; <F>1:  M. १८. १४; २०७. 1-४१; वा. ८३. १२, ४५-6.</F> at गया. <F>2:  Ib. ११२. ५८.</F>
--(धृष्ट): his line was वार्ष्टक. Vi. IV. 2. 4.
(I)--a son of सावर्णि Manu. M. 9. ३३. [पगे३-312+ ३१]
(II)--a son of Kakuda. वा. ९६. ११६.
--a son of अश्विनी and अक्रूर. M. ४५. ३३.
--a son of Kaviratha, and father of सुषेण. भा. IX. २२. ४१.
--a daughter of मरीचि. Br. II. ११. १२.
--one of the sons of कार्तवीर्य and a महा- ratha. वा. ९४. ४९.
(I)--the eldest of Madhu's hundred sons. After him the line became famous, a gotra name. भा. IX. २३. २९; Vi. IV. ११. २७-8.

(II)--a son of सात्वत and father of Sumitra and युजाजित्; <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. 6 and १२.</F> darling of the Yadus; had two wives, गान्धारी and माद्री; the former bore Sumitra and the latter, five children; <F>2:  M. ४४. ४८; ४५. 1-2.</F> suspected कृष्ण of having appropriated the syamantaka gem from which he honourably redeemed himself; <F>3:  Br. III. ७१. 1, ३६, १०२.</F> belonged to the कृओष्ठु line; <F>4:  Ib. III. ७०. १५; ७३. ९१.</F> originator of the वृष्णि kula. <F>5:  वा. ९५. १४.</F>
(III)--a son of Anamitra (a member of that family, वि। प्।) and father of श्वफल्क and चीत्ररथ. भा. IX. २४. १५. Vi. IV. १४. 5.
(V)--a son of Kukura and father of Kapotaroman and धृति. Br. III. ७१. ११७; M. ४४. ६२.
(VI)--the best of the Yadus and a son of कौसल्या. वा. ९६. 2.
(VII)--a son of बाह्यक--two queens गान्धारी and माद्री. वा. ९६. 4, १७.
(VIII)--a son of Satvata; had two sons सुमीत्र and युधाजित्. Vi. IV. १३. 1, 8.

--the community of द्वारवती in which Bala- राम and कृष्ण were born; <F>1:  भा. I. 3. २३; ११. ११; १४. २५; Br. III. ६१. २३; ७१. ८५; वा. 1. १४५; ९६. ८४, १७५; ८६. २८.</F> कुन्ती was attached to these people while Kamsa devised means to vanquish them. Were relieved at Kamsa's death. <F>2:  भा. I. 8. ४१; X. ३६. ३३; ३९. २५; ४५. १५;</F> Its name derived from वृष्णि. <F>3:  Ib. IX. २३. ३०.</F> They praised the heroic deeds of कृष्ण who was their Lord and who lived with them. But they did not recognise in Him the Almighty Lord; <F>4:  Ib. I. 9. १८; II. 4. २०; IX. २४. ६३; X. 1. ११ and ६२; ९०. ४६.</F> ended their lives by fighting their kinsmen at प्रभासा. Attained Hari through relationship. <F>5:  Ib. XI. ३०. १८; VII. 1. ३०.</F>
--its old fame was raised by the birth of Lord विष्णु. M. ४४. १५; ४७. १२ and ३३; ६९. १०.
--a son of शुचिद्रव (शुचिरथ-वि। प्।) and father of सुषेण. M. ५०. ८०; Vi. IV. २१. १२. [पगे३-314+ २६]
(I)--a son of Bandhumat and father of Bandhu. (Budha-वि। प्।). भा. IX. 2. ३०; Br. III. 8. ३६; ६१. १०; Vi. IV. 1. ४४-5.
(II)--a son of नाग्नजित्. भा. X. ६१. १३.
(III)--the father of a son Budha. वा. ८६. १४-5.
--one of the १४ gan2as of Apsaras, born of ऋइष्ता. Br. III. 7. १८.
--an Apsara गण from वरिष्ट or अरिष्ट. वा. ६९. ५४.
--a शक्ति on the द्राविणिका Mudra1. Br. IV. ३६. ७६.
--(च्) a kingdom through which ऋषभ passed. Its king was Arhat. भा. V. 6. 7 and 9.
--a Mt. in भारतवर्ष: visited by बलराम. Its sages visited द्वारका. भा. V. १९. १६; X. ७९. १३; ९०. २८[3].
(I)--a तीर्थ sacred to अमृत; <F>1:  M. १३. ४९.</F> sacred to the पितृस्. <F>2:  Ib. २२. ३४.</F> [पगे३-315+ २७]
(II)--a R. from the Vindhyas; visited by बलराम. M. ११४. २७. भा. X. ७९. १२.
--a R. in भारतवर्ष, from the Vindhyas. भा. V. १९. १८; Br. II. १६. ३३.
--an ally of जरासन्ध: attacked the eastern gate of मथुरा and the northern gate of Gomanta during their siege by जरासन्ध. भा. X. ५०. ११[2]; ५२. ११[14].
--(च्) a kingdom of कुशद्वीप after वेणुमत्. Br. II. १४. २८; १९. ५७; वा. ३३. २५; ४९. ५२.
(I)--a son of ज्योतिष्मत् after whom वेणु- मण्डलम् took its name. Br. II. १४. २७-8; वा. ३३. २४; Vi. II. 4. ३६.
(II)--a Mt. to the east of अरुणोद; <F>1:  वा. ३६. १९.</F> the cities of विद्याधरस् in. <F>2:  Ib. ३७. 3, २६.</F>
--a R. rising from the पारियात्र hills. M. २२. २०. [पगे३-316+ २७]
--one of the three sons of शतजित्. भा. IX. २३. २१; Br. III. ६९. 4; M. ४३. 8; वा. ९४. 4; Vi. IV. ११. 7.
--a son of धृष्टकेतु. Br. III. ६७. ७७; वा. ९२. ७२.
--a R. originating from the Vindhyas. वा. ४५. १०२.

--(also बेतालस्) a class of spirits, a गण, largely followers of शिव; <F>1:  भा. II. १०. ३९; VII. 8. ३८; X. ६३. १०; Br. III. ४१. २९; IV. १४. १०; २४. ५५; M. 8. 5; २३. ३९.</F> Vampires: dance and feast on flesh and blood on the field of battle; <F>2:  Ib. १४९. १६.</F> images of, attending on शिव. <F>3:  Ib. २५९. २४.</F>
--a R. of the भद्रा. वा. ४३. ३०.
(I)--a R. from the पारियात्र hill. Br. II. १६. २८; वा. ४५. ९८.
(II)--a R. from the mountain ऋष्यवान्; <F>1:  M. ११४. २३.</F> sacred to the पितृस्. <F>2:  Ib. २२. २०. १६३. ६३.</F>
(III)--a R., a महानदी summoned to गया by लोमेश. वा. १०८. ७८.
--the kingdom of the; the R. पावनी flows through. M. १२१. ५६; Br. II. १८. ५७. [पगे३-317+ ३९]
(I)--the science of Dharma together with the आचार of those who know it. M. ५२. 7; १६४. १६.

--First came नाद from the Supreme Brahman, then ओम्कार and then मन्त्रोपनिषद्। ब्रह्मा created अक्षरस्, and out of his four mouths appeared the four Vedas, which were taught to his sons. This was handed down by tradition through the ages. <F>1:  भा. XII. 6. ३६-46; III. १२. ३६-37; IV. २४. ६२; M. 2. १३; 3. 2; 4. 7; २८५. 8.</F> Originally one, rearranged by व्यास into four सम्हितास्--ऋग्, Yajus, सामन् and Atharvan: distribution among his pupils done by कृष्णद्वैपायन with the help of Paila, Jaimini, Sumantu, and वैशम्पायन: growth of शाखास्. Lost in a deluge. Then Hari. taught them to ब्रह्मा who taught in his turn to his sons. A three fold division of the Vedas conveys the truth of Brahman and आत्मन्. In these Hari manifests himself: its metres are गायत्री, उष्णिक् and so on. <F>2:  भा. I. 4. १९-23; XI. १४. 3-6; २१. ३५-43; XII. 6. ४९-50; Vi. III. 3. २०; 4. 7-9.</F> Symbolised by गरुड: do not shine in Kali. <F>3:  भा. XII. ११. १९; X. २०. 8.</F> Personified: These with Upavedas came to see the Trivikrama form of Hari. <F>4:  Ib. VIII. २१. 2; IX. २२. ३७.</F> Learnt by बलराम and कृष्ण. <F>5:  Ib. X. ४५. ३३.</F> Twenty-eight वेदव्यासस् rearranged them in the २८ periods: compiled into four by पराशर's son, originally one; <F>6:  Br. II. ३४. 2, १२-30; ३५. ११६-26; III. १०. ६९; IV. 1. ३०; 6. ६४; M. १४. १६.</F> served as vessel for बृहस्पति to milk the cow-earth; <F>7:  Ib. १०. १७.</F> restored by Matsya after deluge. <F>8:  Ib. ५३. 5; ८३. 3; १७२. ५०.</F>
--a ऋत्विक् at ब्रह्मा's यज्ञ। वा. १०६. ३४.
--those that have not understood the Vedas as Vedavits do. वा. ८३. १००. [पगे३-318+ २३]
--learnt the Atharva सम्हिता from a pupil of Sumantu. शौक्लायनि and others were his disciples. भा. XII. 7. 1-2.
--married Raurava Naraka; son born of वेदना and माया was Duhkham. वा. १०. ४०-1; Br. II. 9. ६४.
(I)--a son of कृष्ण. भा. X. ९०. ३४.
(II)--a sage of the Raivata epoch. Vi. III. 1. २२; वा. ६२. ५३.
--शाकल्य learnt the सम्हिता entrusted by Indrapramati to his son and re-arranged it into five with his pupils. Vi. III. 4. २१.
--is ललिता. Br. IV. १३. २८.
(I)--a R. from the पारियात्र hill. Br. II. १६. २७; वा. ४५. ९७.
(II)--an Apsaras (सुरनारी); from the vedi- tala of ब्रह्मा. वा. ६९. ६०.
--a तीर्थ sacred to गायत्रि. M. १३. ५१. [पगे३-319+ ३५]

--one who knows the Veda and understands it for yoga; understands it in the right direction as pre- scribed; distinct from Vedacintaka; <F>1:  वा. ८३. ९९, १००.</F> eligible for पार्वण s4ra1ddha. <F>2:  M. १६. 8.</F>
--one fully versed in the Vedas and वेदान्गस्. वा. ३४. ९४; १०९. ५४.

(I)--(व्यास) a sage; twenty-eight Veda- व्यासस् for twenty-eight द्वापरस् of the Vaivasvata epoch; Svayambhuva, वेदव्यास, उशना, बृहस्पति, सविता, मृत्यु, Indra, वसिष्ठ, सारस्वत, अन्तरिक्ष, Dharma, त्रैयारुणि, धनञ्जय, कृतम्जय, ऋजीष, भरद्वाज, Gautama, Uttama, Haryavana, Vena, वाजश्रव, अर्वाक्, सोममुख्या- yana, तृणबिन्दु, Tataja, शक्ति, पराशर, जातूकर्ण, and द्वैपायन; in the future द्वापरद्रोणि (more names are given); <F>1:  Br. II. ३३. ३३; ३५. ११७-125.</F> son of पराशर born in the २८थ् dva1para; eighth human incarnation of विष्णु with जातूकर्णि (ja) as purodha (purohita). <F>2:  Ib. III. ७३. ९३; M. ४७. २४६; वा. ९८. ९३.</F>

(II)--कृष्णद्वैपायन; he who split the one Veda into four parts; <F>1:  वा. 1. १७, १७९.</F> different वेदव्यासस् are said to be compilers of the Veda in different Yugas. <F>2:  Ib. ५८. ११; ६१. १०४.</F>
--with the aid of which महेश्वर created the universe. वा. 9. ६३.
--१० Pura1n2a variations; ४००० verses each except शाम्शपायिकस्; each in four parts and all conveying the one meaning. वा. ६१. ५८, ५९; ११०. 7. [पगे३-320+ २७]
--a तीर्थ sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ७१.
(I)--a son of प्राण. भा. IV. 1. ४५.
(II)--a son of कृशाश्व and धिषणा. भा. VI. 6. २०.
(III)--a sage and a siddha. His wife was तुषिता. Father of Vibhu, a manifestation of Hari. भा. VI. १५. १४; VIII. 1. २१.
(IV)--a sage of the Raivata epoch. भा. VIII. 5. 3.
(V)--the अवतार् of the lord in the १५थ् dva1para; the name of a weapon sacred to परमेश्वर in the hill of वेदशीर्ष on the slopes of the हिमालयस्. वा. २३. १६६-68.
(VI)--a son of मार्कण्डेय and मूर्धनि (धूम्रपत्नि-ब्र्। प्।); married पीवरी; his sons मार्कण्- डेयस्. वा. २८. 6; Br. II. ११. 7.
(VII)--heard from the नागस् at पातालम् the विष्णु पुराण; he communicated it to Pramati. Vi. VI. 8. ४८.
--a Mt. on the slope of the हिमालयस् near the Sarasvati hills. वा. २३. १६८.
--a भार्गव and a sage of the Raivata epoch. Br. II. ३६. ६२; Vi. III. 1. २२.
--the gods of the Uttama epoch. भा. VIII. 1. २४.
--a disciple of Kabandha divided the portion received of Atharva into four parts. वा. ६१. ५०.
--a R. in भारतवर्ष from the पारियात्र hill (from the mountain ऋस्यवान्-म्। प्।). भा. V. १९. १८; Br. II. १६. २७; M. ११४. २३; वा. ४५. ९७; Vi. II. 3. १०.
--the वेदान्त to be loved by the गृहस्थस्: वेदान्तदर्शनम् being the end of a student's life. Br. IV. 2. ८५; 8. 4; M. ५२. २६; वा. १०१. ८७-91; १०४. ४२.
(I)--a R. served by the Siddhas. Br. III. १३. ८१.
(II)--one of the ten पीठस् for images, oblong; unfit for installing lingas; this gives abundant riches. M. २६२. 6, १७.
(III)--(also Veditalam) the place of the fire altar in the sacrifice. वा. ६९. ६०; ९७. २५.
--in जम्बूद्वीप, south of Meru; <F>1:  Br. II. १५. ३६; वा. ३४. २३.</F> three वर्षस् to the south of it, and three to its north. <F>2:  Ib. ३४. ३२.</F> [पगे३-322+ २९]
(I)--a name of Hari. भा. I. 5. ३१.
(II)--a measure of time. भा. III. ११. 6.

(III)--a name of ब्रह्मा <F>1:  भा. VIII. 5. २४; Br. III. २१. ५९.</F> (s.v.). He created a daughter शतरूपा (सावित्री); she was so charming that he himself fell in love with her; her brothers like वसिष्ठ and she herself deplored the absurdity of a father marrying his daughter; the creator turned a deaf ear and all his attention became centred on her; to see her wherever she was he created more eyes on all his five faces; after order- ing his sons to take up the work of creation, he lived with शतरूपा for years in the midst of the lotus flower unseen by others, like an ordinary human being. To him was born Manu स्वायम्भुव also known as विराट् and आदिपुरुष; from him were born the वैराज devas and others; <F>2:  M. 3. २९ to the end.</F> grand- father of all the worlds. <F>3:  वा. १०६. ४०; १०८. ४२; १०९. २६.</F>
(IV)--a name of बृहस्पति. वा. ९८. २३.
--a hell for the maker of arrows. Vi. II. 6. १६.
--a मन्त्रकृत् and of Angira branch. M. १४५. ९९; वा. ५९. ९८.

--a son of Anga, of cruel and wrong beha- viour; fell dead due to the curse of sages who churned his right arm out of which came पृथु; born after अश्वमेध [पगे३-323+ ४०] of his father. The twenty-third वेदव्यास. <F>1:  भा. IV. १३. १८-20; ३५. ३८; Br. II. ३५. १२२; M. 4. ४४.</F> Brought up in the house of his grandfather who was an अम्श of मृत्यु (adharma) Vena acquired bad conduct, killed his playmates like animals and became a source of vexation to his father who left the kingdom in disgust and distress. Vena was crowned. Blinded by pride he proclaimed that there should be no more यज्ञस् or gifts in his kingdom. Lost it through pride of power. He did not listen to the words of sages and asserted he was the highest of all gods. Seeing him perverse and vile, the sages slew him; सुनीथा protected his body by मन्त्र। To avoid anarchy and to preserve the line of Anga, the sages churned the thigh of the dead prince and there came a black dwarfish man, the ancestor of the निषाध race. <F>2:  भा. IV. १३. ३९, ४२ and ४७; ch. १४ (whole).</F> They continued to churn the two arms out of which came a male and female child, being the अम्श of विष्णु and लक्ष्मी. <F>3:  Ib. IV. १५. 1-3; १६. ११; X. ७३. २०.</F> Thrown into hell by ब्राह्मणस्, was saved from hell by पृथु. <F>4:  Ib. II. 7. 9; VII. 1. १६; Br. II. ३६. १०८-12, १२१-27, १५०.</F> पृथु was the father's part of Vena's body; from the mother's part of his body came the Mlecchas. <F>5:  M. १०. 4-१०.</F> Another version: A son of the daughter of काल; took to काम and covetousness; founded an adharma स्थापन, gave up Veda शास्त्रस्; subjects of, did not learn Vedas or performed ceremonials or यज्ञस्; made himself the object of sacrifice and worship; enraged by the ऋषिस् led by मरीचि who advised him to take up the right path; ridiculed them and said he was a महात्मा and could burn the whole world or flood it; hence the sages held him down and had his left hand churned by force; there came out a short black figure who stood trem- bling; the sages said निषीद, the forerunner of the निषाद- वम्श; then they churned his right hand and पृथु was born; Vena died; पृथु crowned by all; a good king; his rule and achievements, including the milking of the earth by all beings. <F>6:  वा. ६२. १०८-193.</F> [पगे३-324+ ३०]
--a R. of the शाकद्वीप. M. १२२. ३३. Br. II. १९. ९६; Vi. II. 4. ६५.

(I)--a daughter of Meru and धारणि; married सागर and brought forth a daughter. सवर्णा; <F>1:  वा. ३०. ३५.</F> she was married to प्राचीनबर्हिस् to whom were born ten sons collec- tively known as Pracetas versed in Dhanur Veda. <F>2:  Br. II. १३, ३७, ३९-40.</F>
(II)--a daughter of भद्राश्व and घृताचि. वा. ७०. ६९.
--married Nadhi; father of मरीच-Kas4yapa. वा. ६५. ११२.

--the life and duties of a dancing girl; ऊर्वशी suffered for adopting it; <F>1:  M. 6. 1. ३१.</F> to serve as courtesans in the palace, temples and also those who are prepared to spend money on them. They in turn were to give gifts in days of festivals; <F>2:  Ib. ७०. १९, २८-33.</F> residence of, plan for. <F>3:  Ib. २५४. २३.</F>
--a sage by garbha. वा. ५९. ९४.
--a Mt. on the base (east) of Meru; <F>1:  भा. V. १६. २६; Vi. II. 2. २७.</F> residence of सुग्रीव, son of गरुड. <F>2:  वा. ३७. १६; ३९. ३९-41; ४२. १९.</F>
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २४.
--काश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 9. [पगे३-325+ ३०]
--the Sun and the son of ब्रह्मा with रजो- गुण। वा. ३१. ३६.
--a group of ten devas, born of वैकारिक, called generally digdevatas. भा. II. 5. ३०; वा. 4. ६१.
--explains the five बुद्धि and the five कर्म senses and मनस् the eleventh. वा. 4. ६०.
(I)--a name of Hari. भा. I. १५. ४६.

(II)--the abode of विष्णु, established by Him at the request of श्री in his manifestation as वैकुण्ठ: Famous for नैश्रेयस vana, filled with different trees and birds. It had seven enclosures into which sin had no free entrance. On the seventh were stationed two guardian deities. These once prevented लक्ष्मी from entering in during the योगनिद्रा of Hari; <F>1:  भा. III. १५. १३-27; १६. २७-30; VIII. 5. 5.</F> happiness (सौभाग्य) of beings retired to, during the burning of the worlds. <F>2:  M. ६०. 2; २४५. ३४; २८५. १९.</F>

(III)--a manifestation of Hari born of Vai- कुण्ठा and शुभ्र in चाक्षुष epoch. At the request of his spouse श्री, वैकुण्ठ (Heaven) came into existence in the Vaivasvata epoch, to the right of शिवलोक. भा. VIII. 5. 4-6; Br. III. 3. ११७; ३२. 3; IV. २९. १३६; ४०. 9; Vi. III. 1. ४१; V. 5. २१.
(V)--in the Cyavana आश्रम of गया; <F>1:  वा. १०८. ७४.</F> the abode of विष्णु. <F>2:  Ib. २४. २०; १०९. १६.</F>

--a class of gods, <F>1:  भा. VIII. 5. 4; Vi. III. 1. २१.</F> जयादेवस्, fourteen in number in the epochs of Raivata Manu and स्वायम्भुव. <F>2:  Br. II. ३६. ५१ and ५८; III. 3. 9, ५८ and ६७; 4. ३१; वा. ६६. 9; ६७. ४०-41.</F>
--sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ७५.
--the mother of वैकुण्ठ devas. वा. ६७. ४०.
--a Mt. noted for श्राद्ध offerings. Br. III. १३. २८; वा. ७७. २८.
--five: Mukhya sarga, Tiryak yoni sarga, Deva Sarga, मानुष sarga, and Anugraha sarga; three प्रा- कृत sargas; these are the conscious creations of the spirit (ब्रह्मा). वा. 6. ६५. 6.
--of the वासिष्ठ gotra. M. २००. 2.
--one of the four tongues of the Veda. वा. १०४. ७४. [पगे३-327+ ३०]
(I)--a वैष्णव of the ardent type. Br. IV. 8. 44
(II)--practices for a ब्रह्मचारिन् before becoming a full fledged mendicant. Vi. III. १०. १५; IV. 2. १३०.

--a class of seers, born on व्यपोहिनि rite on ashes. पृथु became a वैखानस in the evening of his life; a son of नहुष; <F>2:  M. २४. ५१.</F> Agastya followed the system; <F>3:  Ib. ६१. ३७.</F> tapas in the forests. <F>4:  Ib. १४५. २४; वा. 2. २७; ५९. २४.</F> ^1 भा. III. १२. ४३; IV. २३. 4; Br. I. 2. २७; II: ३२. २५; III. 1. ५७; वा. ६५: ५६.
--a भार्गव gotrakr2t. M. १९५. १८.

--the garland worn by Arjuna (Haihaya) and by Ananta; <F>1:  भा. IX. १५. २०; V. २५. 7.</F> presented by sages to बलराम after he killed Balavala. <F>2:  Ib. X. ७९. 8.</F> The garland of हरी. <F>3:  Vi. I. २२. ७२.</F>
--a hill range on the west of Meru. Vi. II. 2. २९.
--of the Sahya hills in the दक्षिणापथ. वा. ४५. १०४.
--is ललिता. Br. IV. १७. ३४.
--a pupil of याज्ञवल्क्य. Br. II. ३५. २९. [पगे३-328+ २७]
--a son of आप. Vi. I. १५. १११.
--a son of आयु (आप-वा। प्।). Br. III. 3. २४; वा. ६६. २३.
