(I)--(वैतरणम्) one of twenty-eight hells. Intended for the mad, and for those fallen from character and conduct, those that spoil मख or devastate villages. भा. V. २६. 7; Br. II. २८. ८३; IV. 2. १४९-171; M. १४१. ६९; वा. ५६. ७८; १०१. १४८, १६९; Vi. II. 6. 3 and २४.
(II)--a R. in hell. For transgressing law and convention one gets drowned in this river of refuse and urine, etc. भा. II. 2. 7; V. २६. २२; VII. 9. ४३.

(III)--a R. from the Vindhyas; fit for श्राद्- dha offerings; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ३३; III. १३. १०३; M. ११४. २७; वा. ४५. १०२; ७७. ९५.</F> a deva नदी; gift of a cow here secures release for twenty-one generations. <F>2:  वा. १०५. ४४; १०८. ८०; १०९. १७; ११२. २६.</F>
--a name of पुरूरवस्. भा. XI. २६. ३५.
--a portion of Atharva सम्हिता. Br. II. ३५. ६१; वा. ६१. ५३.
--the name of planets in the Vaivasvata epoch. Br. II. २४. ८७, १११.
(I)--a pupil of जातूकर्ण्य. भा. XII. 6. ५८. [पगे३-329+ २४]
(II)--evil spirits. M. २१८. ३६.
--a pupil of शाकपूर्ण. Vi. III. 4. २४.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १८.
--a southern country; a tribe; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ५८; M. ११४. ४७; वा. ४५. १२६.</F> on the other side of the Vindhyas. <F>2:  Ib. ४५. १३३.</F>
--a R. sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ६४.
--a name of रुक्मिणी. भा. X. ५२. १६-17.
--on the other side of the Vindhyas. वा. ४५. १३३.
--the sacred tradition. M. १९. 3.
--the capital of भूतिनन्द ? Br. III. ७४. १८२.
--the kings after विन्ध्यशक्ति. Br. III. ७४. १७९; वा. ९९. ३६६.
--a Vindhyan tribe. Br. II. १६. ६४; M. ११४. ५३. [पगे३-330+ २६]
--the city of विदिशा where पुष्पवाहन met अनन्गवती in his previous birth. M. १००. १४.
--the नीति discourse of Vidura to धृत- राष्ट्र. भा. III. 1. १०-13.
(I)--a Mt. on the base of Meru, and west of शितोद. भा. V. १६. २६; वा. ३६. २७; ४२. ५०.
(II)--an Asura of the महातलम्. वा. ५०. ३५.
--see Janaka. Vi. IV. 5. २३.
--सुबाहु and शूरसेन, son of शत्रुघ्न. वा. ८८. १८६.
(I)--a son of वरुण and सुनादेवी; father of घृणि and Muni, both of whom ate each other and died. Br. III. ५९. 6; वा. ८४. 6-8.
(II)--a Sukha god. Br. IV. 1. १८.
(III)--the king's physician skilled in अष्टाङ्ग; <F>1:  M. २१५. ३४.</F> residence of. <F>2:  Ib. २५४. २६.</F> [पगे३-331+ २५]
(IV)--a mukhya गण. वा. १००. १८.
--an Angirasa and मन्त्रकृत्। Br. II. ३२. १०७.
--a तीर्थ sacred to Aroga and the पितृस्. M. १३. ४१; २२. २४.
(I)--a king of fire originating in waters, and hence cannot be quenched by waters. (पावक Agni); a son of ब्रह्मा. Br. II. १२. 2; २४; ११; वा. २९. 7; ५१. २६; ५३. 8.
(II)--a son of वपुष्मत् after whom came the kingdom Vaidyuta. Br. II. १४. ३२-4; ३३. २९-30; Vi. II. 4. २३, १२९.
(IV)--Mt. near कैलास, noted for lake मानस. It has the stream सरयू and forest वैभ्राज. Here lives Prahati's son, being a follower of Kubera. Br. II. १८. १४-16.
(V)--a Daitya in the fifth talam. Br. II. २०. ३६.
(VI)--a son of सहिष्णु, an अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. २१३.
(VII)--a hill near Kakudman. M. १२१. १६; वा. ४७. १४. [पगे३-332+ २६]
--a region of शाल्मलिद्वीप adjoining the hill Kanka. Br. II. १९. ४५; वा. ४९. ४०.
--one of the three मात्रस् of ओम्। वा. २०. 2.
--Indra of the eleventh epoch of Manu. भा. VIII. १३. २५.
--the wife of आर्यक, and mother of Dharma- setu. भा. VIII. १३. २६.
--sons of विधृति. These were gods who trea- sured up the Vedas in their minds. भा. VIII. 1. २९.
--a युगादि for श्राद्ध; fit for sixteen kinds of gifts. M. १७. 3; २७४. २०.
--a pupil of याज्ञवल्क्य. वा. ६१. २४; Br. II. ३५. २८.
--a pupil of लन्गाक्षी. Br. II. ३५. ४१, ४५.

--the गरुड; <F>1:  M. १५०. २१४; Br. I. 1. ११६; वा. 1. १३७.</F> abode of, as tall as the कैलास hills; <F>2:  M. १६३. ६७-8.</F> city of, in the fourth talam or gabhastalam. <F>3:  Br. II. २०. ३४; III. 7. २२९; वा. ५०. ३३.</F> [पगे३-333+ ३०]
the पुराण of १९,000 stanzas. वा. १०४. 8.
(I)--a तीर्थ sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ३२.
(II)--the व्रत in honour of विनायक; gift of a golden elephant on Caturthi. M. १०१. ६१.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १८.
(I)--see पृथु; a मन्त्रकृत्; <F>1:  M. १४५. १००; वा. 1. ३३; ५९. ९७.</F> introduced यज्ञ in Vaivasvata epoch when ब्रह्मा was Purohita. <F>2:  Br. III. ७३. ७२-73.</F>
(II)--a son of Vena (s.v.), got by ऋषिस् from his arms; <F>1:  वा. ६२. ९४.</F> story of, narrated in detail; <F>2:  Ib. ६२. १०३-193.</F> milking of the earth by. <F>3:  Br. I. 1. १०५.</F>
--a branch of the भार्गवस्. Br. III. 1. १००.
(I)--a pleasure garden of gods; <F>1:  भा. V. १६. १४; Br. II. १८. १६; वा. ३६. ११.</F> here ययाति enjoyed with विश्वाची. <F>2:  Br. III. 7. १०१; वा. ४७. १६.</F>
(II)--a Mt. of प्लक्षद्वीप, the residence of भ्राजिष्णु; <F>1:  Br. II. १९. १३; Vi. II. 4. 7.</F> shining like quartzite (स्फातिक). <F>2:  वा. ४९. १२.</F> [पगे३-334+ २९]
(III)--a forest in the केतुमाला continent (on the west of इलावृत). M. ८३. ३३; १३१. ४८; Vi. II. 2. २५.
(IV)--a forest on the shore of the सरयू river. M. १२१. १७; वा. ४७. १५.

--gods like आदित्यस्, Visvedevas, साध्यस्, पितृस्, sages like Angiras and so on at the beginning of दाहकल; <F>1:  Br. IV. 2. २९; वा. 7. १५.</F> residents of तार and गृहस्; <F>2:  वा. १०१. ३१.</F> at the commence- ment of Pralaya spring forth these gods, with planets and stars, with no social restrictions of caste or orders; went to Maharloka, Janaloka and lastly to Brahmaloka never to come back; appointed by the creator in different stations. <F>3:  Br. II. 6. १६, २१.</F>
--a दानव. Br. III. 6. ११.
--a son of ज्योतिष्मत् after whom came the रथाकार kingdom (a part of the कुशद्वीप). Br. II. १४. २७; Vi. II. 4. ३६.
--a R. sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ६४.
--detachment and devotion to ज्ञानम्; leads to purification of body and mind. One such person becomes a निर्मम। Br. III. 4. १०; IV. 3. ४५, ६०; वा. ५७. ११७; १०२. ६६, ८२; १०४. १५. [पगे३-335+ ३१]
(I)--father of Ajita Hari; <F>1:  भा. VIII. 5. 9.</F> a लोकपाल. <F>2:  Br. II. २१. १५७; वा. ५०. २०६.</F>
(II)--a प्रजापति, whose पितृस् are formless. M. १३. 3.

(III)--same as सुधामन्; <F>1:  M. १२४. ९५; Br. II. ११. १४.</F> a son of Viraja, the lord of प्राचिदिक्; a लोकपाल; <F>2:  वा. २८. ११.</F> married शतरूपा whose sons were Priyavrata and उत्तानपाद and whose daughters were आकूती and प्रसूती; <F>3:  Br. II. 9. ३९.</F> grandfather of चाक्षुष Manu. <F>4:  वा. ६२. ९०.</F>
(IV)--the २७थ् kalpa;^1 (१९थ् kalpa-वा। प्।); the period of वैराज Manu, son of the Creator. M. २९०. १०; वा. २१. ४०-2; Br. IV. 2. ६५.
(VI)--father of नद्वला; a progenitor and father-in-law of sixth Manu. Vi. I. १३. 4.
(VII)--also a वीरपुरुष from whom was born शतरूपा and two sons Priyavrata and उत्तानपाद as also two daughters आकूती and प्रसूती. वा. १०. १५-7.
(II)--the abode of ब्रह्मा. M. १६१. १७. [पगे३-336+ ३२]
(III)--a metre, creation of. वा. 9. ५२.
--is ब्रह्मा. Br. IV. 1. ४०.

(I)--the first gods created by ब्रह्मा to occupy the first worlds by name सम्तानकस्; among them seven groups are distinguished, three formless and four with form; then earth, rains, food, worship of moon for rice; the formless attain absolution through yoga power; <F>1:  Br. III. 9. ५२-62; वा. ७१. ५२.</F> the three formless groups are पितृस् engaged in yoga; <F>2:  Br. III. १०. 4.</F> ऋभु and Sanat- कुमार come under this class; they attained Brahmaloka or siddhi. <F>3:  Ib. IV. 2. ३५, ७० ff.</F>

(II)--a class of formless पितृस्: Fallen from Yoga, they attain eternal worlds (लोकान् sana1tana1n) and are reborn as ब्रह्मवादिन्स् at the end of a day of ब्रह्मा: they then gain their old memory and by सान्ख्य and yoga they attain final release. Their mind-born daughter मेना is the wife of हिमवान्. M. १३. 3-6.
(III)--the Brahmans living in the Virajasa world; this is said to be the first Kalpa of the वैराजास्. वा. ७२. 4; १०१. ६१-4.

--(see वैराजास्): performers of austerities; stand ten times until आभूतसम्प्लव, after Pralaya, enter- ing प्रणव aimed at Brahmaloka through Yogadharma and attained the आनन्द of ब्रह्मा; six characteristics of; deprived of three भावस् (body, mind and speech) do not regard द्वन्द्व (sukha duhkha, etc.); reach बुद्धावस्था. वा. १०१. ३७, ७१, ८०, ८१, १४०. [पगे३-337+ २५]
--a सूक्तम् of the साम Samhita1 to be recit- ed in the ritual associated with the digging of a tank. M. ५८. ३६.
--the daughter of दक्ष so-called. Br. I. 1. ११२.
--one of the wives of दक्ष, mother of १००० sons and ६० daughters. M. 5. 8; १४६. १५.
--created from the west face of ब्रह्मा. Vi. I. 5. ५५.
--a साम; <F>1:  वा. 9. ५१.</F> from the face of ब्रह्मा, <F>2:  Br. II. 8. ५२.</F> helped सुप्रतीक elephant to get सारूप्यम्। <F>3:  Ib. III. 7. ३४१.</F>
--a wife of त्वष्ट. वा. ६५. ८५.
--a crest on the Mahendra hill. Br. III. १३. १८.
--said to be the cause of निवृत्ति। वा. २४. ८३.
--काश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 8.
--a Pravara of the भार्गवस्. M. १९५. ३९. [पगे३-338+ ४१]

(I)--Seventh Manu, see under Manu; epoch of; <F>1:  भा. I. 1. १०९; 3. १५; Br. II. १३. ६७; वा. २१. १५; ६२. 4; ६४. 1-2; ९८. ७१.</F> a son of ब्रह्मा from the seventh face; <F>2:  वा. 1. १२७; २३. ११४.</F> from ऋकार Svara--the 7th face of the १४ faced god; <F>3:  Ib. २१. ३९; २६. ३९; ३१. १५.</F> eight देवगणस् born of मारीच and कश्यप; <F>4:  Br. I. 1. १०९; वा. ६४. 1-2.</F> sons of, nine. <F>5:  Ib. ६४. २९-30.</F> The great श्राद्- dhadeva. <F>6:  Vi. III. 1. ३०-33.</F>

(II)--the epoch of Vaivasvata Manu in the वाराह Kalpa; the seventh Manu; Atri and six others are sages who re-establish dharma and reach the final beatitude; here are seven देवगणस्, साध्यस्, विश्वस्, Rud- रास्, Maruts, Vasus, अश्विन्स् and आदित्यस्. इक्ष्वाकु and 9 others are the sons of Vaivasvata Manu; the reference is to the present manvantara by the term साम्प्रतम्; <F>1:  M. 4. १७; 6. 3; 8. १२; 9. २६-30; ६९. 6; १२४. २२.</F> having ap- pointed इला, his eldest son, he went to Mahendravana for penance; <F>2:  Ib. ११. ४०-42.</F> heard from the Matsya the end of kalpa and ruled his territory; he belonged to the solar race; this is the current epoch. <F>3:  Ib. २४६. ७२; २९०. २४; Vi. III. 1. 7. 8.</F>

(III)--Yama, the God of death; overlord of the पितृस्; <F>1:  M. १७४. ४९; २१३. 7; वा. ७०. 8; Vi. V. २१. ३०.</F> offering of पिण्डस् in श्राद्ध to; <F>2:  Br. III. 8. 8; ११. ९४; १२. ३९; Vi. III. १५. २८.</F> resident of Sam- yamana. <F>3:  वा. ५०. ८८; १०८. ३०; १११. ३९.</F>
(IV)--temple of, in सुपक्ष hill. वा. ३९. ६३.
(V)--the planet शनैश्चर with प्रकृति of Rudra. वा. ५३. ३२.

(VI)--a son of सम्ज्ञ; learned and great; antara of, constituting २८ yugas when राजऋषिस् rule at the end [पगे३-339+ ३०] of which a period of ४० yugas set in; <F>1:  वा. १००. ५६; ९९. ४३५, ४५७-60; Vi. III. 2. 2.</F> offered the kingdom of earth after the epoch of चाक्षुष Manu; the first Manu had nine sons; finding at first that he could not create beings he caused a sacrifice in honour of Mitra and वरुण out of which came इडा or इला. <F>2:  वा. ८५. 1-7.</F>
--also Vidarbha; the son of सैव्या and ज्यामघ after the former's severe austerities; married स्नुषा; got two sons and a third लोमपाद. वा. ९५. ३६.

(I)--a pupil of व्यास in charge of the यजुस्; was taught Nigada (Yajurveda). His pupils were Ca- रकाध्वर्युस्. याज्ञवल्क्य was one of the pupils; was also a पौराणिक. <F>1:  भा. I. 4. २१; XII. 6. ५२ and ६१; XII. 7. 5. वा. ६०. १३; ६१. 5.</F> A श्रुतऋषि, divided the Yajur Veda into ८६ parts and distributed them among his ८६ pupils; <F>2:  Br. II. 1. १३; ३३. 5; ३४. १३; ३५. 8-9, २०-22.</F> did not attend the Meru conference and ordered his pupils to take to Brahma विद्या. <F>3:  वा. ६१. १४-16.</F>
(II)--a sage who was invited for the राजसूय of युधिष्ठीर. भा. X. ७४. 8.
(III)--the sage who cursed king Jana- mejaya; questioned by शौनक for light on rituals condu- cive to realisation of one's desires. M. ५०. ५८; ९३. 1; वा. ९९. २५१.
--the kingdom to which Puramjana went with his companion Lubdhaka; allegorically Naraka. भा. IV. २५. ५३; २९. १५; V. २६. २५.
--the full moon day of the वैशाख month; good for gift of the ब्राह्म पुराण। M. ५३. १३.
--the १२थ् day of the bright half of वैशाख, the day on which उषा dreamt of her future husband. Vi. V. ३२. १४.
--one of the १३ wives of Vasudeva, the son of कौशिक. वा. ९६. १६०, १७२.
--a pupil of पराशर Kauthuma. Br. II. ३५. ४६.
(I)--founded by king विशाल. भा. IX. 2. ३३; वा. ६१. ४६.
(II)--one of Vasudeva's queens and mother of कौशिक. Br. III. ७१. १७४; Vi. IV. १५. २५.
(III)--an आर्षेय pravara. M. १९६. 8.
--represents द्वापरयुग. वा. ७८. ३६. [पगे३-341+ ३९]

--created from the thighs of ब्रह्मा; the less powerful, but are engaged in agriculture and commerce; <F>1:  वा. ३०. २३२; ३४. १७; ४५. ८३ and ११७; ५४. १११; ५७. ५२; ७८. २९; ९३. ६६; १००. २४६; १०१. 5 and ३५२; १०४. १३; Vi. I. 6. 6, ३५.</F> for doing their svadharma they go to the abode of वायु. <F>2:  Br. I. 5. १०८; 7. १५७, १६६; Vi. III. 8. ३०-31, ३९.</F> pro- pitiate आज्यप Pitr2s; <F>3:  Br. III. १०. ९४; M. १५. २१.</F> selling and buying, their duties; <F>4:  Br. III. १५. ५१.</F> pro- tected by ययाति; <F>5:  Ib. III. ६८. ६७.</F> for the sake of १०० Vais4yas one Brahman may be killed; <F>6:  Ib. IV. 6. ४३.</F> profession originated in the time of पृथु; <F>7:  Ib. II. ३७. १०.</F> meditate on देवी's १०८ names; <F>8:  M. १३. ६३.</F> observe १५ days' pollution for father's death; <F>9:  Ib. १८. 2.</F> to be much in numbers in a State. <F>१०:  Ib. ११४. १२; २१७. 2.</F>
--a wife of Vasudeva. M. ४६. २०.
--a pleasure garden to which Kardama and देवहूति went. भा. III. २३. ४०.
(I)--a ऋषिक and a king who became sage by satya. Br. II. ३२. १०२; M. १४५. ९६; वा. ५९. ९४.

(II)--served as calf when the यक्षस् milked the earth; <F>1:  Br. II. ३६. २१६; M. १०. २२.</F> overlord of the यक्षस् and the राक्षसस्; the first son of विश्रवस् and दववर्णिनी; seeing the राक्षस form and asura prowess he got the name Kubera; <F>2:  Br. III. 8. 7, ४०-46; M. 8. 3; १५४. ३३८.</F> defeated by कालनेमि. <F>3:  Ib. १७४. ४९; १७७. ४९.</F>

(IV)--(Kubera: कुशरीरम् beram); the first son of विश्रवस् and देववर्णिनी; in form a राक्षस and in strength an Asura; description of; three feet, big head, eight teeth, yellow moustache, ears like शन्कु, short hands; full of the knowledge of Vaivarta; and in the guise of विश्व- रूप or various forms; <F>1:  वा. ७०. ३५-40; Vi. I. २२. 3.</F> the king of यक्षस्. <F>2:  वा. ३०. ८४-5; ४१. २६; ६२. १८२; ७०. 7.</F>
--a तीर्थ sacred to Nidhi. M. १३. ५१.
(I)--Agni also known as ब्राह्मण chamsi. Br. II. १२. २९; वा. ६२. १३७.
(II)--a मुहूर्त of the afternoon. Br. III. 3. ३९; वा. ६६. ४०.

(III)--is a homa, generally before the prin- cipal meals of the day; <F>1:  Br. III. १४. 5; M. १६. ५५; १७. ६१; Vi. II. १५. 9; III. ११. ४७-57.</F> food to वास्तु follows this; <F>2:  M. २५२. १७;</F> done in evenings also. <F>3:  Vi. III. ११. १०५; १५. १६ and ५०.</F>
--the eighth day in the dark half of माघ. वा. ८१. 3.
(I)--a name of Agni; <F>1:  भा. II. 2. २४.</F> to be propitiated by eight oblations or वैश्वदेव and five others. प्राण, अपान, समान, उदान and व्यान। <F>2:  वा. १५. 3-8.</F> [पगे३-343+ २५]
(II)--a son of Danu, and father of four daughters, उपदानवी and others. भा. VI. 6. ३३; Br. III. 6. 7; वा. ६८. 7.
(III)--father of two daughters, पुलोमा and काल (li) का who were married to मारिच; from them ७४,000 दानवस्; lived in हिरण्यपुर; slain by Arjuna. M. 6. २२; वा. ६८. २३-27.
(IV)--resides in सोमपानम् तीर्थम्। M. २२. ६२.
(V)--a son of भरताग्नि. वा. २९. 8; Br. II. १२. 8.
--outside it was पितृयान. Vi. II. 8. ८५; Br. II. २१. १०३, १५९; M. १२४. ८०.
--the दक्षिणस्थानम्, which has three roads or वीथिस्. Br. I. 2. २८; वा. ४५. ९१; ५०. १५६; ६६. ४७, ५२.
--leads to the world of ब्रह्मा. M. १०१. ५७.
(I)--of भार्गव gotra. M. १९५. १९.
(III)--in दक्षिण ma1rga; मूलम् and पूर्वोत्तराषाढस् are the नक्षत्रस्. M. १२४. ५९; वा. ६६. ५२. [पगे३-344+ ३१]

--vernal equinox; <F>1:  Vi. II. 8. २९.</F> day and night equal; this विषुवम् takes place during the spring and autumn when the sun enters the signs of Aries (तुलाम्) and Libra (मेष). <F>2:  Ib. II. 8. ६५-7.</F>
--the place of अन्गारि Agni. Br. II. १२. ३०.
--a मुहूर्त of the night. Br. III. 3. ४३; वा. ६६. ४४.
--eligible for पार्वण s4ra1ddha. M. १६. 9.
(I)--the पुराण of २३,000 श्लोकस् compiled by पराशर; he who copies this and makes a gift of it on the आषाढ full moon day reaches the world of वरुण; gives an account of वराह kalpa. M. ५३. १६-17.
(II)--one of the six दर्शनस्; <F>1:  वा. १०४. १६.</F> the heart of the personified Veda. <F>2:  Ib. १०४. ८२.</F>
--is वैकुण्ठ. Br. III. ३६. ६१.
--vanquished माहेश्वर jvara. भा. X. ६३. २३-4.

(I)--a name of योगमाया; <F>1:  भा. X. 2. ११.</F> सात्विकी s4akti; <F>2:  Br. IV. १९. 7; ३६. ५८; ४४. १११; Vi. II. ११. १४.</F> a mind-born mother; <F>3:  M. १७९. ११.</F> makes the sun shine radiant. <F>4:  Vi. II. ११. २०.</F> [पगे३-345+ ३१]
(II)--a goddess among the मातृस्; Icon of, after the manner of विष्णु; गरुड is the riding animal; four hands in the वरद पोसे। M. १३. ५२; २६१. २८.
--an aerial car constructed by Maya. भा. VIII. १०. १६.
--a R. in भारत vars2a. भा. V. १९. १८.
--a Mt. in भारत vars2a. Br. II. १६. २०; वा. ४५. ९०.
--of भार्गव gotra. M. १९५. १९.
(II)--a son of ब्रह्मा. वा. १०१. ३३८.
--the second form of Parabrahmam. Vi. I. 2. १५, १८.

--the absolute, developed out of avyakta; <F>1:  वा. १०१. २११.</F> swallowed by avyakta in the stage of प्रत्याहर; <F>2:  Ib. १०२. 2.</F> of five characteristics; <F>3:  Ib. ३४. ३७.</F> seen by tarka and yoga as also by प्रत्या- hara, ध्यान and tapas. <F>4:  Br. IV. 2. ११५, २१३; 3. १०७-8; 4. ७१.</F> [पगे३-346+ २९]
--a son of भृगु. वा. ६५. ८७.

--(of full moon) when the sun and moon look at each other; when they stand equally at one point it is व्यतीपात day; it is reckoned to be वषट्क्रियाकाल; <F>1:  Br. II. २८. ४०-44; वा. ५६. ३७-8.</F> a युगादि fit for श्राद्ध; <F>2:  M. १७. 3; ८२. २५.</F> inauspicious for building houses. <F>3:  Ib. ८३. 7; १४१. ३५; २५३. 7.</F>
--a special rite in the sacrifice. वा. ६५. ५६.
--a nephew of हिरण्यकशिपु. M. 6. २६.
--(ety.) one of the ten लक्षणस् of the ब्राह्मणस्. वा. ५९. १३८.
--a son of Vapu. वा. १०. ३६; Br. II. 9. ६१.
--a son of भृगु. वा. ६५. ८७.
--individuality as opposed to समष्टि or Brahmam. वा. 3. १०.
--the difficulties and dangers of a kingdom; the king must avert them. M. २२०. २५.
--the place where sages expound the Vedic lore. Br. III. २१. ५२.
(I)--a son of यातुधान and father of निरा- nanda. Br. III. 7. ८९ and ९६.
(II)--one of the five sons of ऊर्द्ध्वदृष्टि and father of शरभ. Br. III. 7. २०५.
(III)--the tiger, said to have eaten Garga's cow; <F>1:  M. २०. १०.</F> its skin, the dress of शिव. <F>2:  Ib. २१७. 5; २५९. 6.</F>
(IV)--a snake with the sun in आवणि and पुरट्टाशि. वा. ५२. ११.
(VI)--the राक्षस residing in the sun's chariot in the भाद्रपद month. Vi. II. १०. १०.
(VII)--the राक्षस presiding over the month of Nabhasya. भा. XII. ११. ३८; Br. II. २३. ११.
--born of Hari and Pulaha; a वानरजाति and son of जाम्बवान्; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. १७६, ३०४, ३१९; ५१. 9.</F> could be killed as wild animals. <F>2:  Ib. IV. 6. ५०; २९. ४१.</F> [पगे३-348+ २४]
--wife of जाम्बवत्; mother of जाम्बवती. Br. III. 7. ३०१.
--a son of भृगु; a deva. Br. III. 1. ८९.
--a hunter who attained permanent fame. भा. X. ७२. २१.
--of भार्गवगोत्र. M. १९५. २७.
--a son of मृत्यु. वा. १०. ४१.
(II)--a mind-born son of ब्रह्मा in the २१स्त् Kalpa. वा. २१. ४७; ३१. ४१.
--all pervadingness from apavarga; from that comes पुरुष. वा. १३. २३.
--a god of सुतार group. Br. IV. 1. ९०.
--one of the ten branches of the सुपार group of devas. वा. १००. ९४.

--from the hairs of the head of प्रजापति. ety. ahi, the vilest of creatures; Pannaga. ety. creeping on the ground; sarpa, from escaping or fleeting nature; all have their abode in the earth under the sun and moon; out of anger came विष or poison; then airy beings were created; चूटस्, पिशाचस् from eating flesh, Gandharvas sucking cows. वा. 9. ३४-40.
--is शिव. Br. II. २७. ९९.

(I)--an अम्शावतार of विष्णु; also known as Dvai- पायन and कृष्ण; son of पराशर and वासवी (सत्यवती) in द्वापर yuga. Father of शुक; appointed by his mother, he begot three sons on his brother's wife being childless- धृतराष्ट्र, पाण्डु and Vidura. <F>1:  भा. I. 2. 4; 4. १४-15; IX. २२. २२-25; XII. 6. ३६; III. 5. १९-20; M. १५. 8; १८०. ६४; Br. III. १०. ७९-80; १३. ७७.</F> Rearranged the Vedas into four parts, and taught each of them to four respective pupils--Paila, वैशम्पायन, Jaimini and Sumantu. Re- arranged इतिहास-Pura1n2as also; composed the भारत for स्त्रीशूद्र-dvijabandhus; composed also the भागवत and taught it to his son शुक, having heard it from नारद. <F>2:  भा. XII. 6. ४९-53; I. 4. १६-25; 7. 1-8; II. 9. ४४; III. 5. १० and १२; XII. 4. ४२; १३. १९; Br. I. 1. २५; II. ३१. २८; ३३. ३२-3; ३४. ११-12; III. १७. २९५.</F>  When he felt a mental dissatisfaction, नारद met him and was praised. Asked as to the reason for his uneasiness, नारद emphasised devotion to Hari as the means of release and proceeded to narrate the story of his previous birth. When the sage left व्यास retired to his hermitage शम्या- प्रास on the सरस्वती and meditated on the Lord who appeared before him with माया depending on him. Learnt [पगे३-350+ ३७] devotion as the means of ending सम्सार। <F>3:  भा. I. 4. ३०-33; chh. 5 and 6 (whole); 7. 1-4;</F> One of युधिष्- ठिर's party on a visit to भीष्म; was a Purohita at कृष्ण's sacrifice at कुरुक्षेत्र; told the history of Citraketu to शुक who bowed to him. <F>4:  Ib. I. 8. ४६; 9. 2; X. ९०. ४६[2]; VI. १४. 9; VII. 1. 5.</F> Heard श्रुतिगीता from नारायण. Faith in क्रियायोग; a siddha. <F>5:  Ib. X. ८७. ४७-8; XI. २७. 2; VI. १५. १२.</F> Taught लोमहर्षण about the future of the world and its history. <F>6:  M. ५०. ७२.</F> An incarnation of the Lord in every द्वापर; <F>7:  Ib. ५३. 9.</F> took a vow of silence and fasting for १२ years after which he wandered for food but could not get any in Benares; when he was about to curse the city, शिव and उमा took the guise of householders and offered him rich food. So he blessed it. <F>8:  Ib. १८५. १७-38.</F> A तीर्थ in his honour. <F>9:  Ib. १९१. ४१; २०३. १४.</F>
(II)--a sage of the eighth manvantara. भा. VIII. १३. १५; Vi. III. 2. १७.
--near दृषद्वति; <F>1:  Br. III. १३. ६९, ८०.</F> in दीपेश्वर, a तीर्थम् of the नर्मदा sacred to व्यास. <F>2:  M. १९१. ३८-42.</F>
--the sacred lake near शिव lake. Br. III. १३. ५२; वा. ७७. ५१.
--daughters of सविता; <F>1:  भा. VI. १८. 1; III. १२. ४४.</F> three in number. <F>2:  वा. ६४. १९.</F>
--complete extermination be- tween one kalpa and the next one, while the sandhis or con- nections between the manvantaras or yugas is not broken (avyucchinna sandhi). वा. 7. 8-9. [पगे३-351+ २८]
--a son of शन्खण and father of विश्व- saha. Br. III. ६३. २०६.
(I)--a son of दोषा and पुष्पार्ण; wife पुष्क- रिणी and son Sarvatejas. भा. IV. १३. १४.
(II)--a son of विभावसु, and a Vasu. भा. VI. 6. १६.
--one of the ten branches of the Rohita clan of devas. वा. १००. ९१.
--the knowledge of व्यूह. M. २१५. १०.
(I)--a son of दशार्ह, and father of जीमूत. भा. IX. २४. 3-4; Br. III. ७०. ४१; M. ४४. ४०; वा. ९५. ४०; Vi. IV. १२. ४१.

(II)--a son of Maya and follower of Kamsa, came to Vraja in the guise of a Gopa, and mixed in a game with Gopas. Removed a good number of them to a cave near- by. Finding the numbers reduced, कृष्ण spotted out the mischievous foe and killed him on the spot. भा. X. ३७. २८-32.
(III)--one of the ten horses of the moon's chariot. Br. II. २३. ५७.
(IV)--the intervening space between heaven and earth. M. 2. ३२. [पगे३-352+ ३१]
--the goddess from the back portion of नृसिम्ह; follower of वागिशी. M. १७९. ६८.
--a horse of the moon's chariot. M. १२६. ५२.
--a horse of the moon's chariot. वा. ५२. ५३.
(I)--a son of हविर्धान. वा. ६३. २३.

(II)--(Gokulam) the residence of cowherds. <F>1:  Vi. V. 5. ११.</F> Here lived रोहिणी, Nanda and others. केशिन् was killed in this place. Visit of अक्रूर to. Nanda's return to Vraja after Kamsa's death. Visited by Uddhava at कृष्ण's request. Visited by बलराम. <F>2:  भा. IX. २४. ६६; X. 1. 9; 2. 7; 5. 6 and १८; ३७. 1 [1]; ३८. 1 and २४, २८; ४५. २५; ४६. 3 and 7; ४७. 9 and ५५; ६५. 1.</F> Deserted by the cowherds after their supposed ill omens, the boy sports of कृष्ण. <F>3:  Vi. V. 6. २७; 7. 8.</F>
--a Janapada of the भद्रा continent. वा. ४३. १९.
--a सुधर्मान god. Br. IV. 1. ६०.
--is कृष्ण. Br. III. ३७. ११.
--sons of ऊरु and आग्नेयी. Br. II. ३६. १०८.
(I)--a son of चाक्षुष Manu. भा. IV. १३. १६. [पगे३-353+ २८]
(II)--a god of the आभूतरय group. Br. II. ३६. ५६.
--vows enumerated. M. Ch. १०१ (whole).
--a wife of भन्गकार (s.v.). M. ४५. २०.
--a daughter of भन्गकार and queen of कृष्ण. M. ४५. २१.
--a sham heretic. Br. III. १४. ४१.
--a son of रौद्राश्व. भा. IX. २०. 4.
--a son of कृतम्जय. वा. ९९. २८७.
--a son of शक्रजित् and a great warrior. वा. ९६. ५३.
--a second daughter of भन्गकार given to कृष्ण in marriage. वा. ९६. ५५.
--a stage devoid of वर्ण and आश्रम conduct; <F>1:  Br. III. ४८. ४७.</F> the rule of, in the south and north. <F>2:  Vi. IV. २४. ६८-69.</F>
--the Gopas immigrated to this forest region from Vraja to avoid omens that threatened that place. Vi. V. 6. २४ ff; १६. 1.
(I)--a northern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ४८.
(II)--the tree after which the शाकद्वीप takes its name. Br. II. १९. ९४, १४०.
(III)--a son of बृहद्रथ Maurya, ruled for ३६ years; his grandson ruled for १७ years. (?) M. २७२. २४.

(I)--a hill tribe; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ६७; III. ४८. २३, ४४ and ४९; वा. ८८. १२२; ९८. १०७.</F> were defeated by परशुराम, Sagara and Bharata; punished with half shaving; <F>2:  भा. IX. 8. 5; २०. ३०; III. ४१. ३९; Vi. IV. 3. ४२;</F> were denied the Vedic study and sacrifice and hence reduced to Mlecchahood. <F>3:  Ib. IV. 3. ४८.</F>

(II)--the १८ kings (ten-वा। प्।) of, ruled for ३८० years; <F>1:  M. ५०. ७६; २७३. १८; वा. ९९. २६८, ३२४, ३५९, ३६१.</F> kingdom of; <F>2:  M. ११४. ४१; १२१. ४५; १४४. ५७.</F> contemporaries of the शिशुनागस्, and after Gardabins; to be conquered by Kalki. <F>3:  Br. III. ६३. १२०, १३४; ७३. १०८; ७४. १३७. १७२ and १७५; Vi. IV. 3. ४७.</F>

--(cart) upturned by कृष्ण as a baby. (Taken generally to be an Asura) <F>1:  भा. X. 7. 7-१०; Br. IV. २९. १२४.</F> of Nanda, apparently his waggon or cart, which was then a means of transport. <F>2:  Vi. V. 5. 1 and 6: 5. २२; 6. 1 and २३ ff; १५. 2.</F> [पगे३-355+ २५]
--of the Agastya family. M. २०२. 1.
--is कृष्ण. Br. III. ३६. २४.
--a son of शिशुनाक; ruled for ३६ years; con- quered Girivraja. वा. ९९. ३१५, ३१६.
(I)--an Asura follower of हिरण्यकशिपु, and a son of हिरण्याक्ष. भा. VII. 2. 5 and १८; Br. III. 5. ३०; M. 6. १४; वा. ६७. ६७; Vi. I. २१. 3.
(II)--a पृथुक god. Br. II. ३६. ७३.
--the science of birds, etc; <F>1:  M. २१५. 9;</F> in connec- tion with founding temples. <F>2:  Ib. २४०. १५; २६४. 9.</F>

(I)--(सौबल) a prince of गान्धार and an evil adviser to Duryodhana; joined him in insulting Vidura; attacked the northern gate of मथुरा, and the eastern gate of Gomanta when they were besieged by जरासन्ध. भा. III. 1. १४; 3. १३; VII. 2. १८; X. ५०. ११ [7]; ५२. ११. [6].
(II)--father of Asura वृक; took part in the देवासुर war between Bali and Indra. भा. VIII. १०. २०; X. ८८. १४. [पगे३-356+ २२]
(III)--a son of (एका) दशरथ and father of Karambhi (aka). भा. IX. २४. 4-5; Br. III. ७०. ४४; वा. ९५. ४३; Vi. IV. १२. ४१.
(IV)--a son of विकुक्षि. Br. III. ६३. 9.
(V)--a son of सनद्वाज; father of स्वागत. Br. III. ६४. २०.
(VI)--a son of Danu M. 6. १७.
(VII)--a son of दृढरथ and father of Karambha. M. ४४. ४२.
(VIII)--had ५०० brothers who were rulers of उत्तरापथदेश; of these ४८ had sovereignty over the south; all sons of इक्ष्वाकु. वा. ८८. 9.
(IX)--a son of सुतद्वाज. वा. ८९. २०.
(I)--a daughter of Bali. Br. III. 5. ४३; वा. ६७. ८४.
(III)--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १२.

--the daughter of विश्वामित्र and मेनका; was brought up in कण्व's आश्रम with नीवार food; दुष्- yanta who came there was entertained and was accepted as her Lord by गान्धर्व vidhi. Gave birth to the future Bharata and came to the king's palace with the child; was refused admission by the king who had forgotten her. A voice in the air urged the king to accept her and he did so; <F>1:  भा. IX. २०. 8-२२ [1-2]; M. ४९. ११; चा. ९९. १३४.</F> a queen of दुष्यन्त and mother of Bharata. <F>2:  Vi. IV. १९. १२-13.</F>
--a देवगण, mind-born sons of ब्रह्मा, in the स्वायम्भुव epoch. Br. II. १३. ९०.

(I)--(शक्त्रि-ब्र्। प्।) the eldest of the १०० sons of वसिष्ठ and अरुन्धती. Father of पराशर through अदृ- श्यन्ति; <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ४१; Br. I. 1. 9; III. 8. ९१; ३६. 6; M. २०१. ३०; वा. 1. १७४; ७०. ८३.</F> a sage by tapas; a वेदव्यास. Heard the वायु पुराण from दक्ष and narrated it to पराशर in embryo; <F>2:  Br. II. ३२; ९९ and ११५; ३५. १२४; IV. 4. ६५; M. १९६. २६; वा. १०३. ६५.</F> a resident of ब्रह्मक्षेत्र; <F>3:  वा. ५९. ९१, १०५.</F> cursed king कल्माषपाद in नैमिष. <F>4:  Ib. 2. १०-11.</F>
(II)--the principle identified with शिव; <F>1:  भा. IV. 6. ४३.</F> urges creation by ब्रह्मा. <F>2:  Vi. I. 5. ४७.</F>
(III)--as a daughter of वसिष्ठ and अरुन्धती. Br. I. 2. १०. [पगे३-358+ ३५]

(IV)--(पराशक्ति): the Goddess as potency in all creatures; by worshipping her in any manner one gets sal- vation; <F>1:  M. १३. ५३.</F> by worshipping her शिव became अर्धनारीश्वर; as also other Gods like ब्रह्मा; known as त्रिपुरा; <F>2:  Br. IV. 5. २९.</F> mind-born daughter of ब्रह्मा by name प्रकृति; was born during the course of the churning of the ocean; known also as भगवती and माया; angry at not getting a share in the यज्ञ of युवनाश्व but appeased by ब्रह्मा that she may be propitiated with पशु offer- ings. <F>3:  Ib. IV. 6. 6, ५३, ६७.</F> A number of शक्तिस् mounted on cuckoos, swans, mungooses followed ललिता's army. <F>4:  Ib. IV. १७. २३.</F>
(V)--the तुल or balance of scale, addressed as. M. २७४. ५९.
(VI)--the name of व्यास in the २५थ् (२७थ्-वि। प्।) द्वापर; मुण्डीश्वर अवतार् of the lord. वा. २३. २०८; Vi. III. 3. १८.
(VII)--a resident of ब्रह्मक्षेत्र. वा. ५९. १०५.
(VIII)--an Ajitadeva. वा. ६७. ३४.
(IX)--the wife of Gods generally. वा. १०६. ५९.

(X)--of विष्णु; is प्रधान purus2a1tmaka; this energy separates at the deluge and unites at the time of creation; <F>1:  Vi. II. 7. ३१-2.</F> something like fire in wood or oil in sesamum; from प्रधान germinate intellect and rudiments of things and from them Asuras; <F>2:  Ib. II. 7. ३३-9.</F> प्रधान compared to a tree; विष्णु is मूल-prakr2ti or the primary nature in whom all beings [पगे३-359+ २७] exist and all finally immerse; <F>3:  Ib. II. 7. ४२-3.</F> is three-fold made up of the three energies of Hari. <F>4:  Ib. VI. 8. 7.</F>
(XI)--of Guha, created by विश्वकर्म from the वैष्णव effulgence of सूर्य. Vi. III. 2-१२.
--leads all to prosperity and heaven irres- pective of caste or sex. Br. IV. ४३. ७९-81.
--a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३३. 8.
--(शक्ति); a sage by tapas; a Brahma- वादिन्. M. १४५. ९३, १०९.
--a son of Nighna. M. ४५. 3.
--a king of माहिषस्. वा. ९९. ३७४.

(I)--(शतक्रतु) a son of Aditi, and surname of Indra (s.v.); his brother Upendra; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ३९; १०. १८; Br. II. 6. ११; वा. ३०. ९५, १०९; ६१. ३०; ९६. १९६; ९७. २३.</F> deceived राजि accepting him to be his son in the first instance and finally contrived to oust him from Indrahood. <F>2:  वा. ९२. ८८.</F> [पगे३-360+ ३२]
(II)--a son of शोणाश्व. M. ४४. ७९.
(III)--a son of शूर. वा. ९६. १३७.
(IV)--an आदित्य. Vi. I. १५. १३०.

(V)--Indra; <F>1:  Vi. V. ११. 1; २९. 1; ३०. 4 and २६; ३४. 1.</F> attended on Diti and cut the embryo in seven parts and later into forty-nine pieces; these are the Maruts; <F>2:  Ib. I. २१. ३३, ४०.</F> city of वशन्कसार; <F>3:  Ib. II. 8. 9.</F> joined बृहस्पति in the तार- कामय; <F>4:  Ib. IV. 6. १६.</F> father of Arjuna. <F>5:  Ib. IV. २०. ४०.</F>
--a सुधर्माण god. Br. IV. 1. ६०.
--a distance equal to १००० yojanas. Br. IV. 2. १२७; वा. १०१. १२७.

(I)--a son of Nighna; to him the sun was a great companion; once he visited him and wanted to see his form; for this the sun handed over Syamantaka the best of gems wearing which he saw his form distinctly; it was so beautiful that he desired to keep the gem himself to which the sun agreed; then he returned to his city with the jewel; he shone like the sun himself and entered the harem to the wonderment of his people. <F>1:  वा. ९६. २०-9.</F> शक्रजित् received back the मणि from वासुदेव; he had १०० sons by his ten wives; of these three were famous, भन्गकार, Vratapati and अपस्वान्. <F>2:  वा. ९६. ५०, ५३.</F> [पगे३-361+ २९]
(II)--a son of शूर. वा. ९६. १३७.
--on the southern bank of the नर्मदा; sacred to the पितृस्. M. १९१. २०; २२. ७३.
--is Indraprastha. भा. X. ७१. २२.
--(शक्रपूज) a festival in honour of Indra; <F>1:  Vi. V. १०. १८ and २५.</F> being the Lord of rains he was expected to shower seasonal rains. <F>2:  Ib. V. १०. २३.</F>
--of कश्यपगोत्र. M. १९९. 4.
--a son of प्रवीर, the King of the महिषस्. Br. III. ७४. १८७.

(I)--a name of शिव; four कलास् of; <F>1:  भा. II. 4. १९; Br. II. 9. ९०; १३. ६२; IV. ३५. ९७; वा. २१. १०; २४. ६२. ४३. ३८; ५४. ४८; ११२. ३५; Vi. I. 9. 2; V. ३४. २९.</F> also शम्- bhu, उमापति, सूलपाणि, वृषभध्वज and Hara; fight of, with कृष्ण for बाण; bound by जृम्बास्त्र he became dis- abled; asked कृष्ण to spare the life of बाण. <F>2:  Ib. V. ३२. 8; ३३. २१.</F> Also (शं- kara)--an epithet of महादेव; <F>3:  M. १५४. २३५.</F> the आश्रम of; <F>4:  Ib. १५४. ३८१.</F> approached [पगे३-362+ २१] वासुदेव to aid him to put down the Asura Andhakas; <F>5:  Ib. १५४. ४३७, ५१४; १७९. ३५.</F> remembered नृसिम्ह to vanquish the मातृगण. <F>6:  Ib. १७९. ५४; १८०. २०.</F>
(II)--a son of Danu. Vi. I. २१. 4.
--same as शिवपुरम्. M. २८३. १७.
--a शिव temple. Br. IV. 7. २९.
--the देवी; became twins in the २६थ् kalpa. वा. २१. ५९.
(I)--a son of Ugrasena; <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. २४; Br. III. ७१. ३३; M. ४४. ७४; Vi. IV. १४. २०.</F> a follower of Bali. <F>2:  M. २४५. ३१.</F>
(II)--a son of कृष्ण and सत्या. भा. X. ६१. १३.
(III)--a son of ऊर्जा and वसिष्ठ. Br. II. ११. ४२.
(IV)--one hundred thousand crores. वा. १०१. ९७. [पगे३-363+ २५]
(I)--the Asura in Tatvalam (Atalam- वा। प्।); <F>1:  Br. II. २०. १६; III. 6. 4; वा. ५०. १६.</F> one of Danu's sons. <F>2:  Ib. ६८. 4.</F>
(II)--(विघ्नेश्वर); informed महेश्- vara of the medicinal tank of waters created by Maya. Br. IV. ४४. ६६; M. १३६. ४८, ५१.
--created by दक्ष. M. 4. ५२.
--a place sacred to शिव. M. १८१. २७.
--a mother goddess. M. १७९. ३१.
--(शन्खकूट) a Mt. north of the महा- bhadra lake. वा. ३६. ३१; ४२. ६५.
one of Danu's sons. वा. ६८. 4.
--a दानव. Br. III. 6. 4.
--a thousand-hooded snake. M. 6. ४१.
--a son of Danu; a follower of वृत्र in his battle with Indra; joined Bali in the देवासुर battle. भा. VI. 6. ३०; १०. १९; VIII. १०. २१; Vi. I. २१. 4. [पगे३-364+ २९]
--a son of Danu. M. 6. १७.
--a तीर्थ sacred to Dhvani and the पितृस्. M. १३. ४८; २२. ६९.
(I)--a mountain on the base of Meru. भा. V. १६. २६.
(II)--an eminent नाग of पाताल; <F>1:  भा. V. २४. ३१; वा. ६९. ७०.</F> a काद्रवेय na1ga; <F>2:  Br. III. 7. ३४.</F> a thousand-hooded snake. <F>3:  M. 6. ३९.</F>
(III)--to be killed by कृष्ण. भा. X. ३७. १६.
(IV)--a mind-born son of जैगीषव्य and Eka- पाटला; attained heaven by tapas. Br. II. ३०. ४०; वा. ७२. १९.
(V)--a यक्ष; a son of पुण्यजनी and मणि- bhadra. Br. III. 7. १२३.
(VI)--one of the eight निधिस् of Kubera. वा. ४१. १०.

(VII)--the conch of विष्णु; <F>1:  Vi. IV. १५. 3.</F> in राम's abhi- षेक; <F>2:  Ib. IV. 4. १००.</F> sounded by कृष्ण on the eve of his battle with Indra. <F>3:  Ib. V. ३०. ५६.</F> Was invoked to protect the baby कृष्ण. <F>4:  भा. X. 6. २३.</F> Blowing of it indi- [पगे३-365+ २९] cated कृष्ण's arrival in आनर्त; was a sign of auspiciousness; <F>5:  Ib. I. ११. 1 and १८.</F> one of the gifts to please the planet moon; <F>6:  M. ५७. २१; ९३. ६०.</F> war music in the तारकामय war; <F>7:  Ib. १३५. ८३; १३६. ५३; १३८. 3; १४९. 2; १७४. १६; १७७. २४; १९२. २८.</F> discovered at the confluence of the ताम्- रपर्णी and the ocean with pearls. <F>8:  वा. ७७. २५.</F>
--Mt. a hill range on the north of Meru. Vi. II. 2. ३०.
--in शन्खद्वीपम्. वा. ४८. ३२.
(I)--a chief नाग of पाताल. भा. V. २४. ३१; Br. IV. ३३. ३६.
(II)--a follower of Kubera. He seized certain gopis whom कृष्ण recovered. He was pursued and his head cut off. His चूडामणि was presented to बलराम. भा. X. ३४. २५-32.
--a son of वज्रनाभ and father of व्युषि- ताश्व. Br. III. ६३. २०५-6; वा. ८८. २०५.

--a region of जम्बुद्वीप; here is Eka- राज्यम् or rule by one, of Mlecchas; here is the hill शन्ख- giri from which flows the शन्खनागा river; the residence of शन्खमुख, the king of नागस्. वा. ४८. १४, ३१-3.

--a son of Kardama प्रजापति and श्रुति anointed king of the south; <F>1:  Br. III. 8. १९; वा. २८. १९; Vi. I. २२. १२.</F> lord of the south direction; <F>2:  M. 8. १०; वा. २८. २७-29; Br. II. ११. २२ and ३३.</F> attained heaven by tapas; <F>3:  M. १४३. ३८.</F> a ऋषिक who became ऋषि by satya. <F>4:  Ib. १४५. ९६.</F>
--Royal symbols in the arms of a cakra- vartin. Br. II. २९. ८६; वा. ५७. ७९.
(I)--a disciple of लोकाक्षि, an अवतार् of the Lord; <F>1:  वा. २३. १३५.</F> a राजऋषि. <F>2:  Ib. ५७. १२२.</F>
(II)--a son of Kardama, and लोकपाल of the लोकालोक hill. Vi. II. 8. ८३.

--the नाग presiding over the month of Nabhasya; <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ३८; Br. II. २३. 9; IV. २०. ५४.</F> a १००० hooded snake; lives with the sun for a part of a year; <F>2:  M. 6. ४०; १२६. १०.</F> with the sun in आवणि and पुरट्टाशि; <F>3:  वा. ५२. १०.</F> with the sun in the भाद्रपद month. <F>4:  Vi. II. १०. १०.</F>
--a sage by garbha. वा. ५९. ९४.
--the king of the नागस् in शन्खद्वीप. वा. ४८. ३३.
--a reptile; (काद्रवेय). Vi. I. २१. २१.
--the city of the second talam. वा. ५०. २१. [पगे३-367+ २९]
--a daitya in Sutalam. Br. II. २०. २२.
--a Janapada of the भद्रा continent. वा. ४३. २२.
--a शक्ति on the fourth parvan of the Kiri- cakra. Br. IV. २०. १५; ४४. ६०; M. २८६. १०.
--the Goddess from the back portion of नृसिम्ह; follower of वागीशी. M. १७९. २३. ६८.
--a sage of the epoch of Auttama Manu M. 9. १४.
--a daughter of Puloma, consort of Indra and mother of Jayanta. Br. II. १३. ७९; III 6. २३; M. 6. २१; वा. ६८. २२, २४.
--represent Brahmam. Br. IV. ४३. ७५.
--Indra; <F>1:  Vi. I. 9. 7; V. २१. १६; ३४. २४.</F> adhidevata for शुक्रग्रहम्; <F>2:  Br. III. ६७. ९५; M. ९३. १४; २५१. 4.</F> see Indra.
--a दानव. Br. III. 6. 9.

--went with कृष्ण to उपप्लाव्य to see the पाण्- डवस्; <F>1:  भा. X. ७८. [९५ (V) 3].</F> a son of Vasudeva and रोहिणी; father of several sons. <F>2:  Br. III. ७१. १६४, १६९-70; Vi. IV. १५ 19.</F> [पगे३-368+ २७]

(I)--a son of शुक्र and a tutor of प्रह्लाद; reported with Marka to हिरण्यकशिपु of their inability to bring the boy to his way of thinking and advised him to keep him in custody until शुक्र's arrival. भा. VII. 5. 1-2, ४८-50; Br. III. 1. ७८; वा. ६५. ७७.
(II)--a कूष्माण्ड Pis4a1ca, one of the two sons of Kapi; father of ब्रह्मधामा. Br. III. 7. ७४-84.

(III)--an Asura; seen in the bathing ceremony of the sacrifice of the gods; <F>1:  M. ४७. ४१, ५४.</F> one of the disciples of शुक्र given to the Asuras to guide them; but he was bought off by the gods by giving him a place in sacrifices. <F>2:  Ib. ४७. २२४-36.</F>
--a son of Jambha. वा. ६७. ७८.
--a boundary hill of शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २६.
(I)--a name of Indra; <F>1:  भा. IV. १९. 2; Br. II. २४. ३८; वा. ९१. ६३; Vi. I. 9. १३४; V. १०. १९.</F> killed the pupils of Sukarma for adhyaya during anadhyaya. <F>2:  वा. ६१. २९.</F> [पगे३-369+ २७]
(II)--the name of व्यास in the 7th द्वापर; his original name, Vibhu; the अवतार् of the lord जैगिषव्य. वा. २३. १३५.
(III)--Nara, a brother of आदित्यस्. वा. ६६. ६१.
--a son of जटायु. M. 6. ३६.
--a saimhikeya. वा. ६८. १८.
--a son of क्रोधा and a devagandharva. Br. III. 6. ३९.
--a दानव. Br. III. 6. ११.
--a son of Upamadgu. Vi. IV. १४. 9.
(I)--one of the hundred sons of Viraja. भा. V. १५. १५.

(II)--a son of Sahasrajit (Sahasraji-म्। प्।, Saha- rajit-वा। प्।) and father of महाहय and two other sons, (three famous sons, Haihaya, Haya and वेणुहय, वि। प्। and म्। प्।); <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. २१; M. ४३. 7-8; वा. ९४. 3-4; Vi. IV. ११. 6-7.</F> a king. <F>2:  Br. III. ६९. 3.</F>
(III)--a son of कृष्ण and जाम्बवती (सुदेवी ?); <F>1:  भा. X. ६१. ११; Br. III. ७१. २५.</F> got killed in प्रभासा. <F>2:  भा. XI. ३०. १७.</F> [पगे३-370+ २६]
(IV)--the यक्ष presiding over the month of इष. भा. XII. ११. ४३.

(V)--a son of Rajas; had a hundred sons, all kings and responsible for world's progress; <F>1:  Br. II. १४. ७०-72; वा. ३३. ६०; Vi. II. 1. ४०.</F> विष्वग्ज्योति, the chief among them, held the whole of भारतवर्ष with credit and success; his descendants continued to the वाराह kalpa. <F>2:  Ib. II. 1. ४१-3.</F>
(VI)--a son of उपवात्यक. Br. III. ७१. 5.
(VII)--one of the two sons of सुदेवी and विष्- vaksena. वा. ९६. २४२.
(VIII)--a son of भजमान. Vi. IV. १३. 2.
--the name of व्यास in the १२थ् dva1para; अवतार् of the Lord as Atri. वा. २३. १५४.
--a son of खशा and a राक्षस. Br. III. 7. १३५; वा. ६९. १६७.
(I)--a son of बाष्कल. Br. III. 5. ३८-9.
(II)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३२. [पगे३-371+ २६]
--Indra of १००० eyes; adopts योगनिद्रा as his sister. Vi. V. 1. ८१.
(I)--a son of भानुमत् and father of शुची. भा. IX. १३. २१-22; Vi. IV. 5. ३०.
(II)--a son of चाक्षुष Manu and नाड्वला. Br. II. ३६. ७९, १०६; M. 4. ४१; वा. ६२. ९१; Vi. I. १३. 5; III. 1. २९.
--a R. in भारतवर्ष, flows from the हिमा- layas. भा. V. १९. १८; Br. II. १२. १५; १६. २५; वा. ४५. ९५; Vi. II. 3. १०; III. १४. १८.
--in the chariot of त्रिपुरारि. M. ११४. २१; १३३. २३.
--a queen of बर्हिषत्; Agni fell in love with her. भा. IV. २४. ११.
--(शतद्रु): a तीर्थ sacred to पितृस्; one of the sixteen rivers married to हव्यवाहन. M. २२. १२; ५१. १४.
--a wife of हव्यवाहन. वा. २९. १४.
(I)--a son of हृदीक. भा. IX. २४. २७; Vi. IV. १४. २४.
(II)--a son of Devavarman Maurya. Br. III. ७४. १४८. [पगे३-372+ ३५]

(III)--a king of yore; his wife शैव्या, a woman of piety; both worshipped जनार्धन; after fasting on the कार्त्तिक full moon day and bath in the भागीरथी, they met a heretic, a friend of the king's military preceptor; he talk- ed to him but she looked at the sun; soon the king died and she ascended the funeral pyre; for the sin of talking to a heretic he was born as a dog in विदिश and his wife as a daughter of the king of काशी; she had a knowledge of her former birth and accepted the dog for her husband; when the dog remem- bered his former condition, he fell dead in a forest and was born as a jackal in the कोलाहल hill; the daughter of the king of काशी repaired to the mountain when he remembered his previous birth and was born as a wolf; again the daughter of the king of काशी met him; remembering his former state he was born as a vulture, crow and a peacock; when she bathed him during the sacrificial bath of Janaka he was born as the son of Janaka. Then a svayamvara was held, she married him, lived as his queen and attained heaven. See शैव्या. Vi. III. १८. ५३-95.

(I)--the wicked; of the race of Bhojas, and king of मिथिला; set up अक्रूर and कृतवर्मन् who were displeased with सत्राजित for not giving his daughter in marriage to them; शतधन्वन् killed सत्राजित while asleep, and walked away with the jewel; when कृष्ण heard of this from सत्यभामा, he came back to द्वारका from हास्तिन- pura to kill शतधन्वन्. Knowing this, the latter requested कृतवर्मन् and अक्रूर for help and they refused; placing the jewel under अक्रूर's custody he rode one hundred yojanas and on reaching मिथिला, his horse fell tired. Then he ran on foot pursued by कृष्ण. कृष्ण got his head cut off but found no jewel. His death was known in द्वारका; knew the yoga power of Hari. भा. X. ch. ५७ (whole); ५८. 9 [4]; II. 7. ४४; वा. ९६. ५६-74; Vi. IV. १३. ६७-100. [पगे३-373+ २७]
(II)--the son of सोमशर्मन् and father of बृहद्रथ. भा. XII. 1. १५; Vi. IV. २४. ३०-1.
(III)--the fifth son of हृदीक; <F>1:  Br. III. ७१. १४०; वा. ९६. १३९.</F> the middle (second ?) among the ten sons of हृदीक; <F>2:  M. ४४. ८१.</F> performed sau- भाग्यशयनम्. <F>3:  Ib. ६०. ४९.</F>
(IV)--a Maurya king, ruled for six years. M. २७२. २३.
(V)--a son of Pracetas; overlord of nume- rous Mlecchas of the north. Vi. IV. १७. 5.
--a son of Devavarma, ruled for eight years. वा. ९९. ३३५.
(I)--a name of Indra. भा. IX. १०. ३४.
(II)--a name of ब्रह्मा. भा. XI. 4. 5.
(I)--of दाशार्णस्; was stationed by जरा- sandha on the west of Gomanta fort during its siege. भा. X. ५२. ११[12].
(II)--a son of ऊर्ज and father of कृति. Vi. IV. 5. ३१.
--is Indra. Br. III. 5. ६९; वा. ६७. १०३.
--a daughter of शारण. Br. III. ७१. १६९; वा. ९६. १६७.
--a pupil of रथीतर. Br. II. ३५. 4.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३५.
--an Asura. भा. VII. 2. 4.
--a constellation. वा. ६६. ५१.
--a constellation. भा. V. २३. 6.
--a name of Indra. भा. I. 8. 6.
--a class of Rudras fit to receive oblations at sacrifices. वा. १०. ५९; ३०. २४४.

--a portion of the Vedic (Yajus) litera- ture except which the त्रयी exists until the pralaya; <F>1:  वा. ५९. ५७.</F> here the Rudras partake of the offerings; <F>2:  Br. II. 9. ८४.</F> sacred to पितृस्; <F>3:  M. २२. ३५.</F> Citra- karma, the गणेश्वर taught this to Madana; <F>4:  Br. II. ३२. ६३; IV. 7. ४९; ११. ३०-33; ३४. ५२.</F> japa at Benares leads one to eternal beatitude; <F>5:  M. १८४. ५६.</F> identified with शिव. <F>6:  वा. ३०. २४४.</F>
--a son of सुतार, the lord of the II द्वापर. वा. २३. १२१.

(I)--the female half of ब्रह्मा's body--spread over all the worlds; performed austerities for a lakh of years and became queen of स्वायम्भुव Manu as Rati; gave mar- riage presents to her daughter देवहूती; mother of three daughters, <F>1:  भा. III. १२. ५४; २१. २६; २२. २३; IV. 1. 1; 8. 7; VIII. 1. 7; XI. १६. २५; वा. १०. 8-१३; ५७. ५७; Br. II. 9. १५ and ३३.</F> and of sons Priyavrata and उत्तानपाद; <F>2:  Ib. II. 1. ५७; II. २९. ६२-3.</F> a tapas- विनी. <F>3:  Vi I. 7. १७.</F>
(II)--daughter of ब्रह्मा whom the father married and brought forth स्वायम्भुव Manu; other sons, seven in number. M. 3. ३१, ४३; 4. २४-5.
--the mythical banyan tree on the mount Kumuda. From its joints flow rivers capable of fulfilling all desires in इलावृत. भा. V. १६. २४-25. [पगे३-376+ २५]
--the father of जैगीषव्य who married एकपाटल. Br. III. १०. २०; वा. ७२. १८.
--a Mt. in शाल्मलिद्वीप; <F>1:  भा. V. २०. १०; Br. III. 7. ४५३.</F> north of the महा- bhadra, has १०० cities. <F>2:  वा. ३६. ३२; ३९. ५४; ४२. ६९.</F>
--a group of gods of the X epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. २५.
--a son of शान्तसेन. भा. X. ९०. ३८.
--a son of Danu. M. 6. १८.
--a R. of the भद्रा continent. वा. ४३. २६.
--a son of भजमान. भा. IX. २४. 8.
(I)--a son of अहल्या and Gautama, (शरद्- वान्-म्। प्।). Father of सत्यधृति. भा. IX. २१. ३४-35; M. ५०. 8; Vi. IV. १९. ६३.
(II)--came to see कृष्ण at Syamanta- पञ्चक. भा. X. ८४. 3.
(III)--a sage of the period of सावर्णि. M. 9. ३२. [पगे३-377+ २८]
(IV)--a son of शारद्वत, a great seer. वा. ९९. २०२.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. ११.
(I)--a son of Nakula and द्रौपदी. भा. IX. २२. २९; M. ५०. ५३.

(II)--a son of Janamejaya, versed in त्रयी, and a pupil of याज्ञवल्क्य, and also of शौनक; learnt the science of arms from कृप; father of सहस्रानीक (अश्वमे- dhadatta-वि। प्।); <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. ३८-39.</F> performed अश्वमेध; <F>2:  M. ५०. ६५-6.</F> asked शौनक about ययाति and his reply; <F>3:  Ib. २५. 3.</F> anointed by Brahmans; <F>4:  वा. ९९. २५६.</F> realis- ed आत्मज्ञान from शौनक and attained निर्वाण. <F>5:  Vi. IV. २१. 3-5.</F>
(III)--a son of सुदास and father of Durda- mana. भा. IX. २२. ४३.
(IV)--a son of the second सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ७२.
(V)--a son of वसुदाम. M. ५०. ८६.
(VI)--a son of बृहद्रथ. Vi. IV. २१. १४.
--a daughter of Ugrasena. वा. ९६. १३३. [पगे३-378+ २५]
(I)--a राक्षस with the Hemanta sun. Br. II. २३. १९.
(II)--one of the six sons of पुरूरवस् and ऊर्वशी. M. २४. ३४; वा. ९१. ५२; Vi. IV. 7. 1
--a तीर्थ sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ३५.
--a दानव. Br. III. 6. 6.

(I)--a son of दशरथ; bore the bow and quivers when Bharata carried the पादुका. Father of सुबाहु and श्रुतसेन (सूरसेन-वि। प्।); killed the राक्ष- sas माधव and लवण; seized Madhuvana and founded the city, मथुरा. भा. IX. १०. 3 and ४४; ११. १३-14; Br. III. ६३. १८५; ७१. १११; वा. ८८. १८४-5; Vi. I. १२. 4; IV. 4. ८७. १०१, १०४.
(II)--a son of श्वफल्क. भा. IX. २४. १७.
(III)--a son of भन्गकार and नरा; killed by अक्रूर. Br. III. ७१. ८६-8; वा. ९६. ८५.
(IV)--a son of अक्रूर. M. ४५. २९.
(V)--a son of ऐक्ष्वाकी and अनाधृष्टि. M. ४६. २४. [पगे३-379+ २५]
(VI)--a son of गान्दिनी. वा. ९६. ११०.
(VII)--the great-grandson of सात्वत, killed by the Bhojas. Vi. IV. १३. १११.
(I)--see Dyumat. भा. IX. १७. 6.
(II)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३७.
(III)--a son of शूर. Br. III, ७१. १३८.
(IV)--a son of मान्धाता. M. १२. ३५.
(V)--a son of शोणाश्व. M. ४४. ७९.
(VI)--a name of Pratardana. Vi. IV. 8. १२.
--a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५३.
--a son of Vivasvat and छाया; attained the status of a planet by penance; see शनैश्चर. M. ११. 9 and ३८.

(I)--(Saturn) श्रुतकर्म, traverses each sign of the zodiac in thirty months--generally an evil planet. <F>1:  भा. V. २२. १६.</F> A son of छाया and Vivasvat (मार्ताण्ड-वि। प्।); <F>2:  Ib. VI. 6. ४१; VIII. १३. १०; Br. II. २४. ५०, ७१, ८३, etc; III. ५९. ३२, ४९, ८२; वा. ८४. ३१; Vi. I. 8. ११; III. 2. 4.</F> fought with Naraka in the देवासुर war; <F>3:  भा. VIII. १०. ३३.</F> fed by the स्वराट् ray of the sun; above the बृहस्पति planet; goes on in an iron chariot. <F>4:  Br. III. २३. ८७; IV. 2. १३३.</F> One of the nine grahas; <F>5:  M. ९३. ४४; वा. ८४. ८३.</F> found on the side of Soma; <F>6:  M. २३. ४०.</F> rise of, reddish in colour, a bad omen; <F>7:  Ib. १३३. २१.</F> stands above बृहस्- pati; <F>8:  वा. १०१. १३३.</F> in the chariot of त्रिपुरारी; <F>9:  M. १२७. 8; १२८. ४९; १३३. २१.</F> chariot of, drawn by horses. <F>१०:  वा. ५२. ७९; ५३. ३२; Vi. II. १२. २०.</F>
(II)--a son of Rudra and सुवर्चला. वा. २७. ४९; Br. II. १०. ७६; ११. २३.
(III)--an आत्रेय. वा. २८. २०.

--a son of प्रतीप and a brother of देवापी; was a great king learned and a specialist in medicine (महा- भिषक्); it is said that a touch of his hand cured people of any disease and made them youthful again; hence his name शम्तनु; married जाह्नवी; father of Devavrata (भीष्म); from the dark fisherwoman he got विचित्रवीर्य. Another son was चित्रान्गद; a Paurava with an अम्श of [पगे३-381+ २७] Samudra. <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. १२-21; XII. 2. ३७; Br. III. १०. ६९, ७०; M. १४, १७; ५०. ११, ३९. ४५; वा. ७३. १८; ९९. २३४, २३७-41; १११. ७०; Vi. IV. २०. 9. ३४.</F> Came upon the twins of सत्यधृति, in the course of a hunting, कृप and कृपि and took them by grace; greed for more territory. <F>2:  भा. IX. २१. ३६; XII. 3. १०; वा. 1. १५८; ९९. २०४; Vi. IV. १९. ६७-8.</F>
--the form taken by हरी. भा. VIII. २४. 9.
--an अमिताभ god. Br. II. ३६. ५४.

--an inferior class of people; <F>1:  भा. II. 7. ४६; M. ११४. ४७; वा. ७८. ६९; ९९. २६८.</F> on the हिमालयस्; their country unfit for श्राद्ध performance; to be conquered by Kalki; <F>2:  Br. III. १४. ८०; २२. २२; ७३. १०८; IV. २९. १३१.</F> kings of. <F>3:  M. ५०. ७६.</F>
(I)--a son of Sarama. Br. III. 7. ३१२.
(II)--a hell, reached by those who indulge in unrighteous sexual unions Br. IV. 2. १४७, १५८; वा. १०१. १४६, १५७.
(III)--one of the two dogs of the family of Vai- vasvata to whom Bali is to be offered at गया. वा. १०८. ३०; १११. ३९.
(I)--sons of Kallolaha. Br. III. 7. ४४२. [पगे३-382+ २६]
(II)--the १००० sons of दक्ष through वैरिणी who died in the attempt to get at the measurement of the earth by following their elder brothers. M. 5. 9.

--the second one thousand sons of असिक्नी and दक्ष. Advised by नारद they took to the path of ‘Not returning’, taken by their elder brothers; went to differ- ent parts of the world in search of their brothers, हर्यश्वस् and were lost. भा. VI. 5. २४; Br. III. 2. २४-5; वा. ६५. १५२-4; Vi. I. १५. ९७-100.

--the name of the Creator during ब्राह्म kalpa; possesses both vyakta and avyakta forms; two forms of spirit; the word and the supreme God; this is the inter- pretation of Manu, and also the Atharva Veda; the word is the Vedas as distinguished from and leading to Parabrah- man (Supreme). भा. III. ११. ३४; १२. ४८; वा. १०४. ९४, ११०; Vi. VI. 5. ६४-5.
--the गुण of आकाश; swallowed by भूत and others. वा. १०२. १७.
--from शब्द came स्पर्श. वा. 4. ५०-1.
--represent Brahman. Br. IV. ४३. ७६. [पगे३-383+ २३]
(I)--a son of धर्मसूत्र and father of Dyumat- sena. भा. IX. २२. ४८.
(II)--a son of क्रिया. Br. II. 9. ६०.
(III)--a son of आयु. Br. III. 3. २४.
(IV)--a Sukha god. Br. IV. 1. १९.
(V)--the regulation of senses on one's own account and on account of others. वा. ५९. ४७.
(VI)--a son of आप. वा. ६६. २३.
(VII)--a mukhya गण. वा. १००. १८.
--a kingdom of the west watered by the Sindhu. Br. II. १८. ४८.
--a son of Vadha. वा. ६९. १३०.
(II)--a son of शोणाश्व (शूर-ब्र्। प्।) and father of प्रतिक्षत्र. M. ४४. ७९-80; Br. III. ७१. १३८.
(III)--a son of the daughter of the काशि king and Satyaka. वा. ९६. ११५.
(IV)--a name of वासुदेव. वा. ९६. १७२.
(I)--a son of शूर, and father of प्रतिक्षत्र. वा. ९६. १३७; Vi. IV. १४. २३.
(II)--the principal tree of the Kali age. Vi. VI. 1. ५३.
(I)--a son of देवमीढ and मारिषा; queen सुदामिनी; father of Sumitra and other sons. भा. IX. २४. २९ and ४४.
(II)--a son of शूर and Bhoja, and father of four sons; became a राजऋषि. Br. III. ७१. १५०, १९४; M. ४६. 3, २७, २८.
(III)--a brother of वासुदेव. वा. ९६. १४८.
--a दानव with मनुष्य dharma. वा. ६८. १५. [पगे३-385+ ३३]
(I)--a son of Danu, and a follower of वृत्र in his battle with Indra. भा. VI. 6. ३०; १०. १९ [3]; M. 6. १७; २४९. ६७; वा. ६८. ११; ९८. ८१; Vi. I. १९. १४; २१. 4.

(II)--a son of हिरण्याक्ष; <F>1:  भा. VII. 2. 4 and १८; Br. III. 5. ३०.</F> a दानव king; taken to पाताल with Bali by वामन; <F>2:  Ib. III. 6. 4 and ११; IV. २९. १२३; ७३. ८१.</F> guiles of, towards प्रह्लाद at the instance of हिरण्यकशिपु. <F>3:  Vi. I. १५. १५३; १६. 9.</F>
(III)--a resident of Tripura; participated in the देवासुर war between Bali and Indra; fought with त्वष्ट्रि. भा. VIII. 6. ३१; १०. १९ and २९.

(IV)--a companion of Kamsa; walked away with child Pradyumna within ten days [six days (वि। प्।)] of its birth. He knew that the bady was his enemy but he threw it into the sea and went away. मायावती, the super- intendent of his kitchen discovered a child in a fish brought to the kitchen, and hearing from नारद that it was काम reborn, and that she herself was रती, she brought up the child and when he came of age, she told him the truth and asked him to fight शम्बर with the aid of महामाया vidya1. His head was cut off by Pradyumna. भा. X. ३६. ३६; ५५. 3. २४; II. 7. ३४; III. 3. ११; Vi. V. २६. १२; Ch. २७ (whole).
(V)--(शबर-भा। प्।); his greed for more territory. भा. XII. 3. ११.
--(शम्बल-भा। प्।); the birth place of Kalki-विष्णु. भा. XII. 2. १८; Vi. IV. २४. ९८. [पगे३-386+ २६]
(I)--the Indra of the epoch of the Tenth Manu, and a friend of विष्वक्सेन. भा. VIII. १३. २२-23.
(II)--a son of अम्बरीष. भा. IX. 6. 1.
(IV)--father of राजाज and Goma. Br. III. 5. ४०.
(VI)--one of the eleven Rudras; <F>1:  M. १५३. १९; १७१. ३८; Vi. I. १५. १२२.</F> had the Ganga in his plaited hair for more than १०० years. <F>2:  Ib. II. 8. ११५; V. ३२. ११; ३३. 4.</F>
(VII)--a son of Virocana; had six sons. वा. ६७. ७६, ८१.
(VIII)--a son of Bhavya. Vi. I. १३. 1.
--the hermitage of व्यास on the bank of the सरस्वती. भा. I. 7. 2-3.
--a son of बृहस्पति; asked his father as to the pros and cons of the श्राद्ध. Br. III. 9. ३८-44; वा. ७१. ३७. [पगे३-387+ २४]
--a ऋषिक who became a sage by satya. Br. II. ३२. १०२.
--one of the two sons of गार्हपत्य; also आह- वनीय and हव्यवाहन; father of two sons, Savya and Apasavya; married the १६ rivers for his wives; their sons were धिष्णिस्. Br. II. १२. १२; वा. २९. ११-12.
--bed; characteristics of a good one; <F>1:  Vi. III. ११. १११-12.</F> to sleep on, with head to the east or south to avoid disease. <F>2:  Ib. III. ११. ११३.</F>
--the act of falling at the feet of the देवी for protection, sixfold. Br. IV. ४१. ७४-81.
--a mind-born son of ब्रह्मा in the १६थ् kalpa. वा. २१. ३५.
--the guardian of मन्दारवाटिका; इषश्री and ऊर्जश्री his queens. Br. IV. ३२. ३३; वा. ५२. १२; ५३. २५.
(I)--a sage who came to see परीक्षित् practis- ing प्रायोपवेश। भा. I. १९. 9. [पगे३-388+ २८]
(II)--a son of सत्यधृति, born at the sight of ऊर्वशी. भा. IX. २१. ३५.
(III)--a ऋषिक who became a sage by satya. Br. II. ३२. १०१.
(IV)--a son of Setu. M. ४८. 6.

(V)--(also शुरद्वत्) a sage by garbha; <F>1:  वा. ५९. ९३.</F> heard the वायु पुराण from त्रिधामा and narrated it to त्रिविष्ठ; <F>2:  Br. II. ३८. २८; III. ७४. ६०; IV. 4. ६१; वा. १०३. ६१.</F> see Gautama.
--a son of शूलि of the २४थ् dva1para. वा. २३. २०७.

(I)--a sage by garbha of the सावर्णि epoch; <F>1:  M. 9. ३२; वा. 1. १८६; ५९. ९३.</F> husband of अहल्या and father of शतानन्द; <F>2:  M. ५०. 8; Vi. IV. १९. ६३.</F> a ऋषिक and a मन्त्रकृत्। <F>3:  M. १४५. ९५, १०४.</F>
(II)--a son of Udathya and of Gautamagotra. वा. ६४. २६; ६५. १०१.
(II)--a वानरजाति born of Hari and Pulaha; hunted by Haihaya in the Vindhyas. Br. III. 7. १७४, ३१९; २६. ३०; ३५. २१; ५१. ११; IV. २९. ४१. [पगे३-389+ २५]
(III)--a son of व्याघ्र and father of शुक. Br. III. 7. २०७, २३३.
(IV)--a son of जाम्बवत्; after him came the शरभस्, a वानर ja1ti. Br. III. 7. ३०४, ३१९.
(V)--a son of रुक्मिणी and कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. २४५; वा. ९६. २३७.
--the pleasure garden of उमा and शिव in the हिमालयस्; <F>1:  M. ११. ४४; वा. ४१. ३७.</F> here Ila was converted into a female; <F>2:  M. १२. 1.</F> कुमार born in. <F>3:  वा. ७२. ३२.</F>
--a R. from the Mahendra hill. M. ११४. ३१.
--a pupil of Vedamitra शाकल्य. Vi. III. 4. २२.
--the earth of the fifth talam; अर्वाक् talam. Br. II. २०. १४, ३५.
--the best gift is 8 भारम्स् of sugar; then 4 and 2; even 1 or (1/2) allowed; the giver goes to heaven. M. ८३. 6; ९२. 1-१३.
--fit for gift during the विशोकद्वादशि. M. ८२. १९.
--a R. in भारतवर्ष. भा. V. १९. १८.

--on the seventh day of the white half of माधव (विशाख) month for meditating on सौरसूक्- tam and पुराणम्; next gifts are made and Brahmans are fed; this is to continue every month for a year; equal to the fruits of the performance of अश्वमेध. M. ७४. 3; ७७. 1-9.
--a common designation for a Brahman. Vi. III. १०. 8-9.

(I)--a daughter of वृषपर्वन् (hence वार्षपर्वणि-वि। प्।) and wife of ययाति. She once went with her attendants and देवयानी, and became engaged in water sports. शिव and पार्वती passed them when they put on their dress. In doing so शर्मिष्ठा put on देवयानी's dress by mistake and was taken to task by देवयानी who called [पगे३-391+ ३६] her a slave, arrogating superiority as a Brahmana girl. शर्मिष्ठा grew angry and stripping her of her clothes threw her into a well and returned home; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ३२; Br. III. 6. २३; ६८. १५; M. 6. २२; २४. ५२; Chh. २७-30; Vi. IV. १०, 4.</F> शुक्र resented the action of the princess and left the palace though the king begged his pardon. शुक्र agreed to stay on condition that शर्मिष्ठा would follow देवयानी wherever she went. It was agreed. She was given to ययाति when देवयानी was married to him. ययाति advised not to share his bed with शर्मिष्ठा. One day after her monthly period शर्मिष्ठा requested him to embrace her, which he did. She became mother of three sons--Druhya, Anu and पूरु. <F>2:  भा. IX. १८. 6-३३; M. Chh. ३१-32; वा. ६८. २३; ९३. १६.</F>
(II)--a daughter of स्वर्भानु. Vi. I. २१. 7.
--a Haihaya clan. M. ४३. ४८.

(I)--a son of Vaivasvata Manu. A saintly king who gave a discourse on the second day of अन्गिरश् Yajn5a. Father of twins आनर्त and शुकन्या: with the latter he went once to the आश्रम of Cyavana. In an ant-hill the girl saw two luminous objects and little knowing that they were the eyes of the sage, she pricked them by a thorn. There was an overflow of blood and this disabled all the attendants of the king from answering calls of nature. On enquiry the king found out the mistake committed by his daughter and persuaded the sage to excuse her, by offering her in marriage to him. Taking leave of them he returned to the city. <F>1:  भा. VIII. १३. 2; IX. 1. १२; 3. 1-9; M. ११. ४१; १२. २१; Br. III. ६०. 2; ६१. १८; वा. ६४. २९; ८५. 4; ८६. २३; Vi. III. 1. ३३; IV. 1. 7.</F> Desirous of performing a sacrifice, शर्याति called on the आश्रम of his son-in-law after some time and found a young man seated on his daughter's side little knowing that the [पगे३-392+ ३०] sage had changed his form due to the blessings of अश्विन्स्: the king admonished his daughter for her misbehaviour. But when he heard how Cyavana got back his youth, he was pleased and hugged his daughter. <F>2:  भा. IX. 3. १८. २७; XII. 3. १०.</F> Father of three sons: his greed for more territory.
(II)--a son of नहुष. M. २४. ५०.
(III)--a son of अश्विनी and अक्रूर. M. ४५. ३३.

--a name of शिव Rudra; <F>1:  भा. VI. १५. २८; Br. II. २५. २३; M. १८०. १९; Vi. I. 8. 6; १५. १२२; III. 2. ११; V. ३४. 1.</F> the presiding deity of the earth; <F>2:  M. २६५. ४०.</F> represents the earth and hence the earth should not be made impure or unclean; <F>3:  Br. (I)--children of यामिनी. भा. VI. 6. २१.

(I)--Appointed commander of the Kuru army after कर्ण's death, for half a day when युधिष्ठिर killed him. His army was defeated by Arjuna and कृष्ण. Went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for solar eclipse. भा. I. १५. १५; X. ७८. [९५ (V) ३८]: ८२. २५.
(II)--a son of Vipracitti. Vi. I. २१. ११.

--the line of शशबिन्दु; performed अश्वमेधस्. Br. III. ७४. २६९; M. २७३. ७३.

(I) (चित्ररथ)--a son of Citraratha; highly learned and a yogin; an emperor of glory; had ten thousand wives and thousands of sons of whom six were distinguished. Possessed fourteen excellent jewels. His daughter Bin- दुमती (चैत्ररथी) had १०० famous sons with names begin- ning with पृथु; <F>1:  भा. IX. २३. ३१-33; 6. ३८; Br. III. ७०. १९-22; M. ४४. १८-19; वा. ८८. ७०; ९५. १८-21.</F> father-in-law of मान्धाता; heard of the significance of श्राद्ध from Yama. <F>2:  Br. III. १८. 1 and १५; ६३. ७०.</F>
(II)--the moon. वा. ८२. 1.
--the Moon God; see Soma. M. १५०. ५३.
(I)--a son of Andhaka. M. ४४. ६१. [पगे३-396+ २९]

(II)--moon; <F>1:  M. ९३. १३.</F> chariot of, described; relation of, to the sun cosmology; his nectar and its use to gods, ऋषिस् and पितृस्; <F>2:  Ib. १२६. ४८-73.</F> his मण्डल twice that of the sun; <F>3:  Ib. १२४. 8.</F> van- quished by रावण. <F>4:  Br. II. २१. 8; २४. ६७; III. 7. २५४.</F>
--a कला of the moon. Br. IV. ३५. ९२.
--a son of Citraratha; lord of १४ maha1ratnas and cakravarti; had १००,000 wives and ten lakhs of sons, among whom the chief were पृथुश्रव, पृथुकर्म and four others; (see शशबिन्दु). Vi. IV. १२. 3-6.
--the region of the moon, १००,000 yoja- nas from that of the sun; above it is the नक्षत्र man2d2alam. Vi. II. 7. 5-6.
--is शाकद्वीप; the hill after which the द्वीप is named. <F>2:  M. १२३. ३६.</F> ^1 भा. V. I. ३२.
(II)--the tree in the midst of शाकद्वीपम्. वा. ४९. ८८; Vi. II. 4. ६३. [पगे३-397+ ३१]
--an आर्षेयप्रवर of (भार्गव gotra). M. १९५. ४०.
--a pravara of the भार्गवस्. M. १९५. ३१; १९६. ४५.

--thirty-two lakhs of योजनस् in extent and encircled by sea of curds (दधिमण्डोद) (क्षीरोद-वि। प्।) of equal dimension; takes its name from a great शाक tree; ruled by a son of Priyavrata, मेधातिथि who divided it among his seven sons and retired to forest; here वायु is wor- shipped by प्राणायाम; <F>1:  भा. V. २०. २४-28.</F> divided into seven kingdoms bear- ing the respective names of the seven sons of the first king Havya (Bhavya-वि। प्।), a grandson of स्वायम्भुव; con- tains seven streams, several towns and villages; people here follow svadharma and वर्णाश्रम dharma; <F>2:  Br. II. १४. १३; १९. २७, ८०-107; २१. ७३; वा. ३३. १३; ४९. ७४; ५०. १२७.</F> seven moun- tains; <F>3:  M. १२२. 1.</F> one of the seven continents, double the size of the क्रौञ्चद्वीप; the four castes in it; Vangas, Magadhas, मानसस् and Mandagas; विष्णु stands in the form of सूर्य. <F>4:  Vi. II. 1. १४; 2. 5; IV. ५८. ७१.</F>
--made a classification of the ऋक् Samhita1 into three parts together with Nirukta as the fourth; had four disciples to assist him. Vi. III. 4. २३-24.
--a Janapada of the भद्रा continent. वा. ४३. २१. [पगे३-398+ २७]
--the king of the Madras; see under अश्वपति. M. २०८. 5.

--a son of माण्डुकेय; divided the सम्हिता into five parts and transmitted them to five disciples --वात्स्य, Mudgala, शालीय, Gokhalya and सीसिर (Mudgala, Golka, खालिय, Matsya and शोशरेय-वा। प्।). <F>1:  भा. XII. 6. ५७; Br. II. ३५. 1; वा. ६०. ३२, ६४.</F> A pupil of सत्यश्रिय and a शाकप्रवर्तक. During the sacrifice of Janaka, there was a dispute as to who was the learned among those present. The prize was won by याज्ञवल्क्य but शाकल्य insulted him and was cursed. <F>2:  Br. II. ३४. ३२-67; वा. ६०. ३१, ६३.</F>
--a R. of the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. १९.
--see रथीतर Br. II. ३५. 3.
--a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३५. 3.
--a tribe ? M. २००. 9.
--the flesh of the parrot for श्राद्ध. M. १७. ३१. [पगे३-399+ २४]
--a शक्ति in Kiricakra. Br. IV. २०. १६.
(I)--one of the six दर्शनस्. वा. १०४. १६.
(II)--the tip of the tongue of the personified Veda. वा. १०४. ८२.
--a son of Sanjaya, and father of शुद्धोद (na). भा. IX. १२. १४; M. २७१. १२; वा. ९९. २८८; Vi. IV. २२. 8.

--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १०.
--a son of Agni and brother of कुमार, <F>1:  Br. III. 3. २५; M. 5. २६; वा. ६६. २४; Vi. I. १५. ११५.</F> an अम्श of Skanda. <F>2:  वा. १०१. २८०.</F>
--a R. of the भद्रा continent. वा. ४३. २६.
--parents of मारिषा, mother of दक्ष in चाक्षुष- antara. Br. II. १३. ७०; वा. ३०. ६१. [पगे३-400+ २२]
--a heretical sect. Br. III. १४. ३९.
--a gotrakara. M. १९७. 1.
--sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ४३.

--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १६.

--the sons of Devala. वा. ७०. २८.

(II)--a son of भात, ruled for ५६ years. वा. ९९. ३५०.
(III)--a son of Sundara and father of शिव- स्वाति. Vi. IV. २४. ४७.
(IV)--the son of पूर्णोत्सन्ग and father of Lambodara. Vi. IV. २४. ४५.
--the forest in the country of Uttarakurus where Samjana roamed as a mare. वा. ८४. ६८.
--the place of शनैश्चर above that of बृहस्पति. वा. ५३. ६०, ९७.
(I)--one of the seven divisions of प्लक्षद्वीप. भा. V. २०. 3.

(III)--a sage: His son went on a pilgrimage on his way to सालिग्राम, he wished to see गन्धमादन, बदरिकाश्रम and others: got frightened by a Gandharva in the form of a tiger which was killed by परशुराम. Him followed the sage. Br. III. २५. ६६-77
(I)--a son of पूर्णोत्सङ्ग, ruled for ५६ years. M. २७३. 4.
(II)--a son of कृष्ण and father of पूर्णोत्- सङ्ग. Vi. IV. २४. ४५.
(III)--a son of अहिमान् and father of शिवश्रित. Vi. IV. २४. ४८.
--a son of मेधातिथि and founder of the शान्तभ(ha)ya kingdom in प्लक्षद्वीप. Br. II. १४. ३६. 8; वा. ३३. ३२; Vi. II. 4. 3 and 5.
--the गोमेदवर्ष of प्लक्षद्वीप. वा. ४९. १३.
--a son of Trikakut (धमसारथि). He realised the आत्मन्. भा. IX. १७. १२. [पगे३-403+ २४]
--a son of सुबाहु, and father of शतसेन. भा. X. ९०. ३८.

(II)--a R. in the Kuru country. Br. II. १८. ७३.

(IV)--the mother of the sage भरद्वाज. वा. १११. ६०.
(I)--a daughter of Kardama, married to Athar- वण: दध्यञ्च was her son. यज्ञ was popularised in the world by her. भा. III. २४. २४; IV. 1. ४२.
(II)--a son of दक्षिणा, and a तुषित god. भा. IV. 1. 7-8.
(III)--a daughter of दक्ष, and a wife of Dharma, gave birth to Sukha (क्षेम-वा। प्।). भा. IV. 1. ४९ and ५१; Br. II. 9. ५०, ६१; वा. १०. २५. ३७; Vi. I. 7. २३, ३०.
(IV)--a son of नील, and father of सुशान्ति. भा. IX. २१. ३०-31; Vi. IV. १९. ५७. [पगे३-404+ २७]
(V)--a son of कृष्ण and कालिन्दी. भा. X. ६१. १४.
(VI)--(Kalpa) author of: a master of Atharva सम्हिता. भा. XII. 7. 4; Br. II. ३५. ६२.
(VII)--a R. in शाल्मलिद्वीप. Br. II. १९. ४६.
(VIII)--a son of तामस Manu. Br. II. ३६. ४९.
(IX)--the Indra of the gods--सुधामान and Viruddhas; <F>1:  Br. IV. 1. ६९.</F> Indra of the tenth epoch of Manu. <F>2:  Vi. III. 2. २६.</F>
(X)--a कला of Hari. Br. IV. ३५. ९५.
(XI)--a शक्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ७१.

(XII)--to avert impending evils; अभया to get rid of fear, सौम्या to get rid of disease, वैष्णवी against famine and fear from insects and robbers, रौद्री if beasts get sick and die, ब्राह्मी when hetrodoxy prevails, रौद्री for fear of other king's troubles, वायवी for diseases of wind, etc., वारुणी for famines and absence of rains, भार्गवी for fear of curse, etc., प्राजापत्या for miscarriages in delivery, त्वाष्ट्री for bad growth of vegetables, कौमारी for well being of children, आग्नेयी for fear of fire and disobedience, troubles from ser- vants, etc., गान्धर्वि for horses, आन्गिरसि for elephants, [पगे३-405+ २७] नैऋऋती for fear of ghosts and spirits, याम्या for bad dreams, कौबेरि for loss of wealth, पार्थिवी for loss of trees and lands. These are to be done at particular times of the day when certain नक्षत्रस् like Hasta, स्वाति are in the ascendant. M. २२८. 5-२७.
(XIII)--one of the four fruits of प्राणायाम, the ruin of all sins of the Pitrs and cognates. वा. ११. 6.
(XIV)--(Pracetas): Agni. वा. २९. २७.

--of कौशिक gotra. वा. ९१. १००.
--of elephants, horses and chariots. वा. ३०. २७९.

--आर्षेय pravara of भार्गव gotra. M. १९५. ४०. [पगे३-410+ २४]
--of कश्यप gotra. M. १९९. 3.
(I)--a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५३.
(II)--(शालेयतण्डुल): a kind of rice for श्राद्ध. M. १५. ३५; ५५. १८; ७०. ४३.
(III)--a sage. M. १९६. २७.
--a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५३.
--a pupil of शाकल्य. भा. XII. 6. ५७.
--in the 5th tala or महातल. वा. ५०. ३६.
--a Mauneya Gandharva. Br. III. 7. 3.
(II)--the son of Sanga(yu)ta (वि। प्।), and father of सोमशर्मन्. भा. XII. 1. १४; Vi. IV. २४. ३०.
(II)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३७.
(III)--a son of श्रीलि in the २४थ् dva1para. वा. २३. २०७.

--a devata. Br. III. ७२. 3.

(II)--the continent of, twice the extent of क्रौञ्चद्वीप; encircled by the ocean of curds; <F>1:  M. १२२. ९१-2.</F> twice the extent of प्लक्षद्वीप with seven hills, वर्षस् and rivers; in the midst is the शाल्मलि trees. <F>2:  वा. ४९. २९-45.</F>

(I)--one of the seven continents; वपुष्मान् the first king. Twice प्लक्ष in size, surrounded by suroda (sea of sura): distinguished for its tree शाल्मलि: the abode of गरुड: Soma is worshipped here. Its king was यज्ञबाहु, son of Priyavrata who divided the kingdom among his seven sons; <F>1:  भा. V. 1. ३२; २०. 7-१२; Br. II. १४. १२, ३१-4; १९. ३३-48, १३८; Vi. II. 1. १३; 2. 5; 4. २१-33.</F> after their names--श्वेतम्, Haritam, Vaidyutam, मानसम्, जिमूतम्, Rohitam, Suprabham, and शोभनम्; the four वर्णस् are Kapila, अरुण, पीत and कृष्ण; famous for seven hills and seven rivers: frequented by गरुड birds. <F>2:  Br. III. 7. ४५२.</F> [पगे३-412+ ३४]
(II)--the tree in the शाल्मलिद्वीप. Br. II. १९. ४९; III. ११. ११३; Vi. II. 4. ३२.
(III)--a svara शक्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ५५.
(IV)--the hill after which the द्वीप is named. M. १२३. ३८.
(V)--the kingdom where वपुष्मान्, a grand- son of स्वायम्भुव, was consecrated king. वा. ३३. १२; ४०. 4.

--a दानव king and friend of शिशुपाल and जरासन्ध; an enemy of कृष्ण; when Hamsa, his brother, was killed by कृष्ण he wanted to avenge his death and after meeting his friends at कुण्डिन, took a vow to wipe out the यादवस्; he performed tapas to propitiate शिव and got an aerial car to go to any place, given to him by Maya; hearing of शिशुपाल's death, he grew angry and at- tacked द्वारका. Pradyumna, सात्यकि and others offered resistance. His commander-in-chief was defeated. But his minister Dyumat hit Pradyumna in the chest when his cha- rioteer removed him from the field. After recovering, he attacked Dyumat and vanquished him. For twenty- seven days the battle went on, when कृष्ण arrived. He directed his attack towards शाल्व, who attacked him when his bow slipped from his hand. After a hot discussion and some more fight, शाल्व dis- appeared and sent to कृष्ण a माया messenger saying that Vasudeva had been taken prisoner by शाल्व. Then कृष्ण saw a scene where a माया Vasudeva was killed. कृष्ण knew that all this was due to illusory powers and kept cool. He broke his car and cut off his head. <F>1:  भा. X. ६०. १८; Chh. ७६-77 (whole); ७८. १३; II. 7. ३४; III. 3. १०; Vi. V. २६. 7.</F> Attained मोक्ष by hatred of कृष्ण. <F>2:  भा. XI. 5. ४८; Br. III. ७३. ९९; IV. २९. १२२.</F> [पगे३-413+ २७]
--a kingdom of मध्यदेश; <F>1:  भा. X. 2. 3; वा. ४५. १०९.</F> to this the Yadus migrated; <F>2:  Br. II. १६. ४०.</F> a tribe. <F>3:  M. ११४. ३४.</F>
(I)--a son of युवनाश्व and father of बृहदश्व; founded the city शावस्ती. भा. IX. 6. २१.
--a son of Candra युवनाश्व--built सावस्ति city; father of बृहदश्व. Vi. IV. 2. ३७-8.
--city founded by king शाव (शावस्त) son of चान्द्र-Yuvana1s4va. भा. IX. 6. २१; Vi. IV. 2. ३७.
--the name of महिमान् Agni. वा. २९. ३७.
--a son of शिखण्डि, an अवतार् of the १८थ् dva1- para. वा. २३. १८३.
--of the south. वा. ४५. १३०.
--a Tripravara. M. १९६. ३४.
--one of the eleven Rudras. M. १५३. १९. [पगे३-414+ २४]
(I)--a son of शिव and शक्ति, born of churning of ocean, see महाशास्त. Br. IV. 6. 9.
(II)--one of the eleven Rudras. M. १५३. १९.
--sciences of which पुराण is the first; recalled by ब्रह्मा. M. 3. 3; १८४. ४३; २४५. ८७; वा. ३०. 7; ५७-12.
--one of the four Vedic Brahman disciples of श्वेत. वा. २३. ११७.
(I)--joined the पाण्डवस् against the Kurus. भा. X. ७८. [९५ (V) १०].
(I)--the queen of विजिताश्व and mother of three sons. भा. IV. २४. 3.
(II)--(शिखण्डी-म्।प्।); the wife of Antar- धान, [Antardhi (Antardhana-वा। प्।), (Antarddhi-वि। प्।)] and mother of हविर्धान. Br. II. ३७. २३; M. 4. ४५; वा. ६३. २२; Vi. I. १४. 1.
(I)--one of the four sons of the ३३र्द् kalpa. वा. २३. ५९. [पगे३-415+ २४]
(II)--the अवतार् of the Lord of the १८थ् dva1- para in the शिखण्डी hill of सिद्धक्षेत्रम्. वा. २३. १८१.

--a ऋत्विक् at the sacrifice of ब्रह्मा. वा. १०६. ३९.
--in the नर्मदा. M. १९३. ८२-3.
--a R. of the केतुमाल continent. वा. ४४. १७.
--a hill range on the west of Meru. Vi. II. 2. २९.
--Skanda with the peacock as his vehicle. वा. ५४. २४; १०१. २८१. [पगे३-416+ २४]
--a Mt. west of the शितोद lake. वा. ३६. २७.
(I)--one of the gods worshipped in house- building. M. २५३. २४.
(II)--R. a chief river of प्लक्षद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ११.
--a Rudra on the षोडश cakra. Br. IV. ३४. ३०.
--a son of माद्री and father of Satyaka. Br. III. ७१. २०.
--a राजऋषी becoming a Brahman. वा. ९१. ११७.
--a son of उशनस्. Vi. IV. १२. 9.

--is शिव. Br. IV. ३४. २७.
--a R. originating from the Vindhyas. वा. ४५. १०२.
(I)--a son of Garga and father of गार्ग्य; hence गार्ग्यस् and षैन्यस् are क्षत्रोपेतद्विजास्. भा. IX. २१. १९; Vi. IV. १९. २३. [पगे३-417+ २९]
(II)--a son of युजाजित् and father of Anamitra. भा. IX. २४. १२.

(IV)--a son of भजमान and father of Svayam- bhoja. भा. IX. २४. २६.
(V)--an Angirasa and मन्त्रकृत्. Br. II. ३२. १०७.
(VI)--a son of शूर and भोजा. M. ४६. 3.
--(Samika: Wilson), heard the विष्णु Pura1n2a at the end of the Kali age from Maitreya. Vi. VI. 8. ५१.
--a son of गार्ग Va1. ९९. १६१.
--(शिनिवास-भा। प्।) a Mt. on the base of Meru. भा. V. १६. २६.
--a R. from the ऋष्यवन्. M. ११४. २४; वा. ४५. ९८.

(I)--a son of दृषद्वती and उशीनर known for his munificence; परीक्षित् compared to him. Knew the yoga power of Hari; <F>1:  भा. I. १२. २०; II. 7. ४५; Va. ९९. २१-23.</F> father of वृषादर्भ and three other sons (ten sons-म्। प्।); gave up life in service, and attained per- manent fame. <F>2:  भा. IX. २३. 3-4; VIII. २०. 7; X. ७२. २१; Vi. IV. १८. 9-१०; M. ४८. १९-20.</F> शिवपुरम् was his capital; <F>3:  Br. III. ७४. २०-23.</F> engaged in a [पगे३-418+ २७] sacrifice with Vasumat, अष्टक and Pratardana when his grandfather ययाति fell from heaven; <F>4:  M. ३५. 5; ३८. २२; ४२. २८; ४८. १८.</F> discoursed with ययाति about other worlds; <F>5:  Ib. ४२. 6-8.</F> went to heaven in a golden chariot; <F>6:  Ib. ४२. १४, २६.</F> gifts of, to attain heaven. <F>7:  Ib. ४२. १९.</F>
(II)--a son of चाक्षुष Manu. भा. IV. १३. १६.
(III)--the Indra of the epoch of तामस Manu. Br. II. ३६. ४६; वा. ६२. ४०; Vi. III. 1. १७.
(V)--a son of माद्री and वृष्णि. M. ४५. 2.
(VI)--a son of Garga. M. ४९. ३७.
(VII)--a son of Kuru and आग्नेयी. Vi. I. १३. 6.
(I)--a R. of the शाकद्वीप. M. १२२. ३२.
(II)--a palanquin; reference to that of king सौवीर; <F>1:  Vi. II. १३. ५३.</F> of Kubera, built by विश्वकर्मा from the वैष्णव effulgence. <F>2:  Ib. III. 2. ११; V. ३०. ६१.</F> [पगे३-419+ २९]
--a son of सर्वरी and दोष; an अम्श of Hari. भा. VI. 6. १४.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८१.
--of आत्रेय gotra. M. १९७. 7.
--one of Danu's sons. वा. ६८. 5.
(I)--a R. from the Vindhyas. M. ११४. २८.
(II)--the stone placed on the head of गयासुर under the orders of ब्रह्मा. वा. १०६. ४५.

(III)--धर्मव्रता, the daughter of Dharma and विश्वरूप married मरीचि; when she was once serving her husband in sleep ब्रह्मा came there and she honoured him leaving her husband; the latter awoke and cursed her to become a stone as she did not do the duty of a wife pro- perly; she became furious and cursed her husband and her- self performed severe austerities in the midst of a blazing fire; pleased with her, विष्णु asked her to take a few boons adding that her husband's curse could not be changed; she then requested that she might live in the shape of a stone at गया तीर्थ on which all Devas should reside; the request was granted. वा. १०७. (whole); १०८. 2; १०९. ३३, ४६, ५१; ११२. ३० and ४१. [पगे३-420+ २६]
--the earth in the 6th रसातलम्. Br. II. २०. १५ and ४२.
--of आत्रेय gotra. M. १९७. 6.
--a R. of the भद्रा continent. वा. ४३. २८.
--a hell. Br. II. २८. ८४.
--a Pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. १२.
--a R. in the अरुण hill, rising from the षैलोद lake. Br. II. १८. २१.

--Arts and Crafts; <F>1:  M. २२०. 3; वा. ८३. ६३.</F> not seen in पुष्करद्वीपम्; <F>2:  Br. II. १९. १२२.</F> one living by शिल्प, unfit for पङ्क्ति bhojana; <F>3:  Ib. III. १९. ३३.</F> teaching in; punishment for non-performance of. <F>4:  M. २२७. 6.</F>
--Craftsmen: unjust men are subjected to the influence of पिशाचश्: Icon of, in a temple. ^1 Br. III. 7. ४०७. ^2 M. 5. २७; २१७. २४; २५६, 7, १५; २५९. १६; २६४. २७.

(I)--(also Giritra): several names of the god are mentioned: master of all गणस् and भूतस्, and a god of wrath, worshipped for learning; <F>1:  भा. III. १२. १२; IV. २९. ४२; VIII. 5. ३९; II. 2. 7; IV. 2. ३२; 3. 7.</F> परीक्षित् compared to him for liberality in granting boons: awarded his own missile to Arjuna: a great Yogin. Resident of कैलास; worships San- कऋषण in इलावृत. <F>2:  भा. I. १२. २३; १५. १२; १८. १४; V. १७. १६-24.</F> Met by Pracatas and venerated by कृष्ण; knew वासु- deva's glory and the dharma ordained by Hari; <F>3:  Ib. IV. २४. १६; X. ४४. १३; I. 9. १९; VI. 3. २०.</F> pleased with बाण, guarded his city, and fought with कृष्ण. Insulted by दक्ष and भृगु in the sacrifice of प्रजापतिस्: warned सती against attending दक्ष's sacrifice where he was deprived of his share. Heard from नारद of सती's sacrifice and grew angry, out sprang वीरभद्र to ruin the sacrifice; cut off दक्ष's head; waited on by ब्रह्मा and consoled, agreed to attend and praised विष्णु, and felt obliged to him. <F>4:  Ib. VI. १८. १८; IV. Chh. 2-7 (whole); २१. २९; IX. १०. १०.</F> Appeared before the Pracetasas and initiated them into the रुद्रगीता in glory of Hari and left them; <F>5:  Ib. IV. २४. २५-68; २५. 1; २९. ४२.</F> praised Aditi and वामन's exploits and was present when he was anointed Upendra; <F>6:  Ib. VIII. २३. २०-27.</F> praised नृसिम्ह, and prayed to, by प्रह्लाद. His discomfiture at Maya who built three cities for the safety of the Asuras. Them he killed. But Maya brought back all of them to life by the immortalised waters which he discovered in a well. शिव was worried when ब्रह्मा and Hari drank the whole of the liquid. Induced by them he attacked Tripura with success. <F>7:  Ib. VII. 8. ४१; १०. ३२, ५१-68.</F> Accompanied ब्रह्मा and other gods when they went to meet Hari Ajita. Praised by प्रजापतिस् for consuming हालाहल that came out of अमृतमथन. His faces re- present five उपनिषद्स् from which thirty-eight मन्त्रस् evolved, Himself being the Highest Truth. The poison got [पगे३-422+ ४७] stuck in his throat and added beauty to his neck. Heard with wonder the मोहिनी form of Hari and came with पार्वती to see him. Requested Hari to show himself again as मोहिनी. Seeing the lovely form शिव became enamoured and ran after her when his seed dropped in several places which ultimately became shrines of images of gold and silver. Then he realis- ed his position and after taking leave of Hari, went to his abode; <F>8:  Ib. VIII. 6 and 7 (whole); १२. 1-४१.</F> embraced पार्वती sitting on his lap in the midst of his attendants. This was seen by the Vidyadhara Citraketu who laughed at it. So he was cursed by पार्वती to be born an Asura. When शिव appealed to her that Citraketu was Hari's friend, पार्वती became mild; <F>9:  Ib. VI. १७. 1-३६.</F> had a special park in which he sported with पार्वती. Waited upon by वसिष्ठ, he agreed to let Sudyumna be a male and female in alternate months; <F>१०:  Ib. IX. 1. २५ and २९, ३६-37.</F> did not comprehend Hari's माया and advised दुर्वासस् pursued by Cakra to go to Hari: prayed to by भगीरथ, offered to bear the waters of the Ganges descend- ing from Heaven after washing the feet of Hari. Joined the gods in the तारकामय war; <F>११:  Ib. IX. 4. ५७-62; 9. 8-9; १४. 6.</F> worshipped as पशुपति in अम्बिकावन: propitiated with goats in धनुर्याग, went to Hari with ब्रह्मा and attended on Him. <F>१२:  Ib. X. ३४. 2; ३६. २६; ३९. ५३; ४१. १५; X. 1. १९.</F> Easily pleased by devotees shows grace to them unlike Hari: backed by शक्ति and full of three गुणस्--वैकारिक, Taijasa and तामस, granted Asura वृक what he wanted for his tapas by cutting flesh from his body viz--that he on whose head he placed his hand should die. He wanted to experiment it on शिव himself who took to flight to वैकुण्ठ. Hari is निर्गुण and apart from प्रकृति.
