In the role of a young ब्रह्मचारिन्, Hari appeared before वृक and said that owing to curse of दक्ष his words would not come true. As a test he could try it on himself. The wicked Asura did so and died to the relief of शिव. शिव welcomed his brother भृगु but the latter did not appreciate it; <F>१३:  Ib. X. ८८ and ८९ (whole).</F> worshipped by सुदक्षिण, told him of a means to end the slayer of his father. Attended वरुण's sacrifice and युधिष्ठिर's; gave शाल्व an aerial car capable of creating illusion. <F>१४:  Ib. X. ६६. २८-31; ७४. १३; ७६. 4-7.</F> Arjuna blessed by [पगे३-423+ ५९] शिव when he called on Him at कैलास, during the battle. In answer to his prayer, शिव protected the delivery room of the द्वारका Brahman; <F>१५:  Ib. X. ७८. [९५ (V) ३२-33]; ८९. ३७.</F> worshipped by कृष्ण who was blessed with a son Pradyumna: burnt down काम who was reborn as Pradyumna. Pleased with tapas of Rukmi, he gave him a bow: Rode on his bull against कृष्ण taking पारिजात from Indra's abode but गरुड vanquished the bull and made शिव go back. <F>१६:  Ib. X. ५५. [1-3] 1-2; ५७. १४ [1]; ६१. २३ [1-5]; [६५ (V) ४६]; [६६ (V) ३७-49].</F> At बाण's city he produced महेश्वर ज्वर which was averted by वैष्णव ज्वर। Seeing कृष्ण chopping all the arms of बाण except four, शिव pleaded for his life to which कृष्ण agreed. On this शिव approved of the marriage of उषा with Aniruddha. Went with ब्रह्मा to encourage देवकी; <F>१७:  Ib. ६२. 1-११; ६३ (whole); 2. २५-42.</F> wondered at मार्कण्डेय's vrata and was pleased with his bhakti. <F>१८:  Ib. XII. 8. १२; १०. 3, १४-38.</F> श्रीशैल and गोकर्ण are shrines sacred to Him. <F>१९:  Ib. X. ७९. १३ and १९.</F> (See निलकण्ठ for the legend) of three eyes, riding on bull, holding पिनाक bow, equal to Nandi in strength, attended by यक्षस्, पिशाचस्, भूतस् and विनायकस्: holding the moon on the tuft. Four faces repre- senting Indra, Yama, वरुण and Moon: creator of आदित्यस्, Vasus, Rudras, Maruts, अश्विन्स्, साध्यस्, विध्या- dharas, नागस्, चारणस् and वालखिल्यस्. Decked with sacred ashes, tiger skin for sacred thread; <F>२०:  Br. II. २५. ६८-115; २६. ३१-50.</F> ज्योतिर्लिङ्ग is माहेश्व- ram balam, the महायोगम्; <F>२१:  Ib. II. २६. ५३.</F> cursed by sages of दारुवन for enticing their women-folk by his appearing naked, to become an ass and to lose his लिङ्गम्. Darkness overtook the world. ब्रह्मा advised sages to worship शिव in the form of a लिङ्ग. The establishment of लिङ्ग cult, शिव represents Agni and अम्बिका Moon. Bhasma the वीर्य of the Lord; <F>२२:  Ib. II. २७. ४१-113.</F> on the significance of पाशुपत yogam. <F>२३:  Ib. II. २७. ११६-17.</F> Appeared to परशु- राम doing penance in the guise of a hunter: blessed परशु- राम with an axe to aid Devas; <F>२४:  Ib. III. २३. 7-६२; २४. ५९-62; ३२. २०.</F> committed brahmicide by cutting off ब्रह्मा's head, taught astra and सास्त्र to him. Assumes Rudrahood at the end of Kalpa. <F>२५:  Ib. III. २५. २२-24.</F> A pose of five faces and ten hands. <F>२६:  Ib. III. ३४. ३८; ४२. २२; ४८. 9.; ७२. १६३-4.</F> ब्रह्मा's praise of: शुक्र's praise of Became अर्धनारीश्वर by worshipping शक्ति. <F>२७:  Ib. II. २५. ६४-76; IV. 5. १५ to ३०.</F> Praise by दक्ष. <F>२८:  वा. ३०. १८१- २८६.</F> Blessed भण्ड with an unrivalled rule of ६००० years. <F>२९:  Br. IV. 7. ४९.</F> As कामेश्वर, he married कामेश्वरी receving wed- [पगे३-424+ २४] ding presents from all gods present. <F>३०:  Ib. IV. १४. 2; १५. १७.</F> Married Gauri through the intervention of the seven sages and lived in ओषधिप्रस्थ city of his father-in-law. Wandered with her passing from one hill to the other. Once unable to hear his वीर्य Gauri, left it with Agni who placed it with कृत्तिकस् who offered it to गन्गा, who deposited it in the Saravana forest. <F>३१:  Ib. IV. ३०. ८३; ३६. १८; ३८. ३९.</F> A son of Atri; <F>३२:  Br. IV. ४३. ७०.</F> from his eyes came silver; <F>३३:  M. १७. २३; १९६. ४५.</F> constituting ब्रह्मा, विष्णु, Arka and Rudra and Vasus; this मूर्ति is वासुदेव. <F>३४:  Ib. ५२. १९; वा. २४. ६७; २७. 9, ५१; ४०. २६.</F>
(II)--one of the seven divisions of प्लक्ष with mountains and rivers. भा. V. २०. 3.
(III)--a son of मेधातिथि and founder of the Kingdom of शिव in प्लक्षद्वीप. Br. II. १४. ३७-9; वा. ३३. ३३; Vi. II. 4. 4 and 5.
(IV)--a lake near व्याससरस्. Br. III. १३. ५२.
(V)--a sage of the Auttama epoch. [पगे३-425+ २४]
(VI)--the name of a गण attributed to विश्रवस्. वा. ६९. २८.
(VII)--a महापुराण. Vi. III. 6. २१.
--a group of १२ gods of the epoch of Uttama Manu. Br. II. ३६. २७, ३३.
--a goddess enshrined at Acchoda. M. १३. ४९.
--sacred to शिवनन्द. M. १३. ३८.
--see महेश्वरव्रतम्. M. ९५. 5.

--the father of the मृग which met with मृगि Paras4ura1ma at पुष्कर: a Brahman of कौशिक gotra in the द्राविड country; his sons were converted into deer; after seeing Agastya, went to heaven. Br. III. ३५, ११-34.
--a तीर्थ sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ४९.
--an image of; on the left माधव and on the right शिव with शूल; dress and ornaments of. M. २६०. २१-7. [पगे३-426+ ३१]
(I)--the capital of शिबि; <F>1:  Br. III. ७४. २१.</F> the city sacred to शिव. <F>2:  M. १३. ५६; १०१. २२; २७८. २४.</F>
(II) or शिवम्--the city of शिव situated in front of Brahmaloka: residence of siddhas, described. Br. IV. 2. २३४, २५८.

--between Brahmaloka and down the अण्ड, the place for men who do not want rebirth; a lac of yojanas in circumference; parapet walls of gold and with lustre; four golden gates adorned with pearls and other pre- cious gems; ever-ringing bells and with pure आचारस्; no death or disease; sacred to शिव; sand and dust are precious stones; divine lotuses half red, half white, half black, in shape like an umbrella; with seven rivers containing padma, utpalam, and pure waters; in the midst १००० pillared palace adorned with स्फटिक, silver, इन्द्रनील, and तोरणस्; everyday festivities at; Trayambaka's house where live लक्ष्मी, Saras- वती, and others with all jewels bringing joy to the Lord with a troop of charming servant maids and Nandi and other गणस्. वा. ४७. ४५; १०१. २३१-292; १११. ४८.
--the kingdom of. M. १२१. ४७.
--one among the eighteen पुराणस्: com- prises २४००० s4lokas. sec. शिव. भा. XII. 7. २३; १३. 4.
--eligible for पार्वण S4ra1ddha. M. १६. 9.
--the region adjoining the Somaka hill in प्लक्ष. Br. II. १४. ३९; १९. १६; वा. ४९. १४. [पगे३-427+ ३२]
--sacred to जलप्रिया, <F>1:  M. १३. ३३.</F> the sun to be worship- ped in the form of. <F>2:  Ib. ५५. 5.</F>

--(शिवमन्दिरम्) Brahmalokam: the kingdom sacred to शिव; in distance a lac of yojanas from Brahmalokam; on the right was वैकुण्ठ and on the left, गौरीलोकम्; beyond was Dhruvalokam; here live पाशुपतस्; there are also the पारिजता and कामधेनु; विश्वकर्मा built it in a dream, set with golden gems; lion gate-way with two gate-keepers dressed in शिव garb; the सभा; शिव with five faces and ten hands surrounded by the Bhairavas and the Rudras besides the अष्टमूर्तिस्; <F>1:  Br. III. ३१. ३४-9; Ch. ३२ (whole); ३४. ३२; वा. १११. ५४.</F> attained by one who makes a gift of the वायु Pura1n2am; <F>2:  M. ५३. १९.</F> for observance of कृष्णाष्- टमि; <F>3:  Ib. ५६. ११.</F> for bath in ऋषितीर्थम्. <F>4:  Ib. ९२. २८; १९१. २२; १९२. ३८.</F>
--in honour of शिव; leads to the status of वैश्वानर. M. १०१. १२, ८२.
--a kingdom of the west watered by the Sindhu. Br. II. १८. ४८.
--a son of सान्तकर्णि, and father of शिवस्कन्द. Vi. IV. २४. ४८. [पगे३-428+ ३५]
--a son of Puloman ruled for 7 years. M. २७३. १३.
--sacred to पार्वती. M. १३. ५१.
--(शान्तिकर्ण): an आन्ध्र king. M. २७३. १४.
(I)--a son of मेदशिरस्, and father of यज्ञश्री. भा. XII. 1. २७.
(II)--a son of शिवश्रित and father of यज्ञश्री. Vi. IV. २४. ४८.

--by शुक्र; <F>1:  M. ४७. १२८-68.</F> by Gods before the war against Tripura; <F>2:  Ib. १३२. २१-28.</F> by Rati after Manmatha's death; <F>3:  Ib. १५४. २६०. ७०.</F> by Munis when they went to request him to marry पार्वती; <F>4:  Ib. १५४. ३९७. ४०४.</F> by बाण Asura; <F>5:  Ib. १८८. ६३, ७१.</F> by भृगु (करुणाभ्युदय); <F>6:  Ib. १९३. ३४-45.</F> by the Gods and Asuras at अमृतमथन (to swallow कालकूट), <F>7:  Ib. २५०. २८-40.</F> by नारायण and ब्रह्मा. <F>8:  वा. २४. ९०-165.</F>
(I)--a son of Anavama? (Bahava) and father of Arindama ruled for २८ years; an आन्ध्र. भा. XII. 1. २६; Br. III. ७४. १६७. M. २७३. १२.
(II)--a son of शातकर्णि and father of Gomati- putra. Vi. IV. २४. ४७.
(I)--a wife of ईशान, the son of Manojava. Br. II. १०. ७८; वा. २७. ५२.
(II)--a R. in कुशद्वीप. Br. II. १९. ६१; Vi. II. 4. ४३.
(III)--a daughter of Hari and (खशा-वा। प्।) the wife of Anila: (Anala-म्। प्।) a Vasu. Br. III. 3. २६. M. 5. २५; वा. ६६. २५; ६९. १७०.
(IV)--a daughter of खश and a राक्षसी; of शै- veya clan. Br. III. 7. १३८.
(VI)--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १०.
(VII)--a consort of वायु. Vi. I. 8. 8; १५. ११४.
--disturbed Dhruva's penance. Vi. I. १२. २६.
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १८. १६.
--the goddess enshrined at शिवकुण्ड. M. १३. ३८.
--fit for श्राद्ध. वा. ७७. ५१.
--see विघ्नेश. Br. IV. ४४. ६५.
--a grandson of नन्दियश; ruled at पूरिका. Br. III. ७४. १८३.
(I)--Mt. on the base of Meru, and on the south of the मानस. भा. V. १६. २६; Br. II. १४. ३८; १९. १५; वा. ३६. २२; ३८. 2; Vi. II. 2. २८.
(II)--a pupil of शाकल्य. भा. XII. 6. ५७.
(III)--a son of मेधातिथि and the founder of the शिशिरम् kingdom in प्लक्षद्वीप. Br. II. १४. ३६-8; वा. ३३. ३२; Vi. II. 4. 3, 5.
(IV)--a क्षत्रिय who became a dvija. Br. III. ६६. ८८.
(V)--son of अरिष्टिसेन. Br. III. ६७. 6.
(VI)--a son of Dhara. M. 5. २४.
(VII)--a कौशिक Brahmis2t2ha. M. १४५. ११३.
(VIII)--a mind-born son of ब्रह्मा in the १६थ् Kalpa. वा. २१. ३५. [पगे३-431+ २६]
(IX)--the winter; the first of ऋतुस्. वा. ५३. २६, ११३.
(X)--a son of Dharma (Vasu). Vi. I. १५. ११३.
--a daughter of वृकदेवी. वा. ९६. १८०.
--one of Vasudeva's wives and mother of four sons. Br. III. ७१. १८३.
(I)--a son of बलराम. Br. III. ७१. १६६.
(II)--a son of सारण. वा. ९६. १६४; Vi. IV. १५. २१.
--the आन्ध्र king who vanquished शुशर्मा, the कण्व: ruled for २३ years. M. २७३. 2.
--ruled from किलिकिला. भा. XII. 1. ३२.

--succeeded Nandivardhana eclipsing the fame of all his predecessors and became ruler of Girivraja; killed the Pradyotas and became king at वाराणसी; esta- blished his son at Benares; ruled for ४० years; suc- ceeded by काकवर्ण, क्षेमधर्मा, क्षेमजित्, Vin- dhyasena, भूमिपुत्र, अजातशत्रु, वम्शक, उदासि, Nandivardhana and महानन्दि; all of them ruled for ३६० years; their contemporaries are इक्ष्वाकुस्, पाञ्चलस्, [पगे३-432+ ३७] काशेयस्, Haihayas, Kalingas, अश्मकस्, Kurus, Maithilas, शूरसेनस् and वीतिहोत्रस्. M. २७२. 6-१७; वा. ९९. ३१४-15.
--the father of काकवर्ण; became ruler after rooting out the Pradyotas; ruled for ४० years at Benares. भा. XII. 1. 5; Br. III. ७४. १२७-8.

--ten in number commencing with शिशुनाग, and ending with महानन्दि; these ruled for ३६० years. <F>1:  भा. XII. 1. 7; Br. III. ७४. १२७-35.</F> These are क्षत्रबन्धुस् and contemporaries of इक्ष्वाकुस्, पाञ्चलस्, कालकस्, Haihayas, Ekalingas, शकस्, Kuravas, Maithilas, सूरसेनस्, वीतिहोत्रस्.^2 (See also शिशुनाक).
--the father of काकवर्ण. Vi. IV. २४. 9-१०.
--descendants of शिशुनाभ; rule of, for ३६२ years. Vi. IV. २४. १९.

--a son of श्रुतश्रवस् and दमघोष; in pre- vious births, हिरण्यकशिपु killed by Narasimha and रावण (दशग्रीव) killed by राम; a hater of Hari but was shown grace by कृष्ण; <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. ४०; VII. 1. १७; X. ६०. १८; २९. १३; Br. ७१. १५८-59; वा. ९६. १५७-58.</F> attacked the northern gate of मथुरा and Gomanta when they were besieged by जरासन्ध; <F>2:  भा. X. ५०. ११ [7]; ५२. ११ [१५].</F> engaged by भीष्मक for his daughter रुक्मिणी under the influence of Rukmin, his eldest son; defeated by कृष्ण who carried off रुक्मिणी; consoled by his friends that Time was not in his favour he returned to his city. <F>3:  Ib. X. ५३ (whole); ५४. 9-१७; Vi. V. २६. 3 and 7.</F> Protested against the place of honour being given to कृष्ण when ब्रह्मऋषिस् and राजऋषिस् were available. He vilified him as a cowherd given to drinking and not an observer of वर्णधर्म. While the पाण्डवस् drew their swords, कृष्ण cut off his head. <F>4:  Ib. X. ७४ (whole).</F> His [पगे३-433+ ३५] friend was शाल्व who summoned a conference at कुण्डिन to which शिशुपाल went. <F>5:  Ib. X. ५७. १९; ७६. 2 [१०]; ७८. [5]; Vi. IV. १४. ४५. ५२.</F> As he died remembering the Lord, he attained मोक्ष; <F>6:  भा. VII. १०. ३८; XI. 5. ४८; Br. IV. २९. १२२.</F> (see Caidya). Maitreya asked पराशर how it was that though he was killed by the Lords Nara- simha and राम, हिरण्यकशिपु did not attain salvation but was reborn as शिसुपाल, and how he attained it when killed by कृष्ण; पराशर replied that neither हिरण्यकशिपु nor रावण knew that Narasimha or राम were the अवतार्स् of विष्णु; शिशुपाल knew in his heart of hearts that कृष्ण was God विष्णु and welcomed death at his hands. Hence his salvation. <F>7:  Vi. IV. १५. 1-१५.</F>
(I)--a प्रजापति; father of Bhrami and father-in-law of Dhruva. भा. IV. १०. ११.

(II)--the form of the system of heavenly bodies supposed to be yoga power of Hari. At the end of the tail is Dhruva and on the tail are other gods like Indra, Agni, कश्यप; on its back lies the अजवीथि and on the stomach the Ganges. Similarly all constellations and planets are seen on the different limbs of its body; <F>1:  भा. II. 2. २४; V. २३. 4-8; VI. 6. १४; Br. I. 1. ८५. II. २३. ९९; M. १२५. 5-9; १२७. १९; वा. 1. १०१; Vi. II. १२. २९, ३४.</F> described. <F>2:  M. १२८. १९-25.</F>

(III)--is तारामय; the eternal deity; उत्ता- नपाद is the upper jaw, यज्ञ is the lower lip, Dharma is the head, heart is नारायण, साध्य and अश्विन्स् front feet, वरुण and Aryama is the hind feet, the samvatsara, child; Mitra is अपान; tail is Agni, Mahendra, मरीचि and कश्यप and Dhruva; all the planets are centred in Dhruva. वा. ५२. ९०-9; Vi. II. 9. २३-4. [पगे३-434+ २८]
--in the third tala or Vitala. वा. ५०. २६.
--an Asura with a city in the third Talam. Br. II. २०. २७.
--a son of Dhruva and धन्या; married सुच्छाया daughter of Agni. M. 4. ३८.

--also designated शन्त and साधुस्; those who have conquered the senses; साधु brahmaca1ri, साधु gr2hasta, साधु vaikha1nasa and साधु yati by yoga practice; followers of स्मार्त and श्रौत karmas; put in practice आचार which is eightfold; जितात्मन्स्। Br. II. ३२. १९-53; ३५. १९२.

--characteristics of; eight limbs are gifts, truth, tapas, non-covetousness, learning, sacrifice, honour and modesty (giving birth to a son and sympathy-वा। प्।). Prac- tised by seven sages; the features of the above eight limbs; the शिष्टस् are Manu and the seven sages who promulgate laws relating to त्रयी, वार्ता and दण्डनीति, इज्या and Var- णाश्रम; the आचारस् are besides the two-fold श्रौत and स्मार्त dharma. Br. II. ३२. ३६; ३५. १९२; IV. 3. ४९; M. १४५. ३३-34. ३७, ३९, ४२-52; वा. ५९. ३३-37; १०२. ७०.
--a son of Dhruva; wife सुच्छाया; Ripu and four other sons. Vi. I. १३. 1.
--a grandson of नन्दियश, ruled in पुरीका. वा. ९९. ३७०. [पगे३-435+ ३०]
--a part of विष्णु. Vi. V. 1. ३७.
(I)--the son of अग्निवर्ण and father of Maru. भा. IX. 2. 5; Br. III. ६३. २१०; वा. ८८. २१०; Vi. IV. 4. १०८.
(II)--a son of सम्पाति. M. 6. ३५.
--a hill range on the east of Meru. Vi. II. 2. २७.

--a son of Atri born of his tejas in tapas; fell down on the earth landed by the seven mind-born sons of प्रजापतिस्; ब्रह्मा supplied him with a chariot yoked with a thousand white horses; the lustre spread in २१ ways in the earth; the vegetation became ever green and the nourisher of men; anointed राजराट् by ब्रह्मा in the kingdom of seeds, vegetation, Brahmans and waters; the २७ daughters of दक्ष, known as नक्षत्रस् given in marriage to; performed राज- सूय; for this हिरण्यगर्भ was उद्गात, ब्रह्मा, ब्रह्मी and Sadasya was नारायण Hari; attended by सनत्कुमार and other sages; दक्षिण was three worlds; he was served by nine देवीस् Sini1, कूहू and others; got the title of राज- राजेन्द्र; in his pride seized forcibly the consort तारा of बृहस्पति to censure the sons of Angiras; in spite of request from the devas he did not yield; तारकामय battle helped by शुक्र and Rudra; ब्रह्मा intervened and तारा was re- turned to बृहस्पति; she was pregnant and brought forth a son named Budha; struck by consumption, invoked Atri's help, got rid of the disease and became resplendent and the originator of a great dynasty. वा. ९०. 1-४९. [पगे३-436+ २९]
--a Mt. to the east of अरुणोद. वा. ३६. १८; ३७. 1; ४२. १६.
--an attribute of the Moon; taken up from the milk ocean by महेश्वर. Vi. I. 9. ९७.
--a lake in the west. वा. ३६. १६.
--the wood cutter's wife earned this name on account of her charity. Br. IV. 7. ३५.
--gives शील and आरोग्य and leads to शिवपद. M. १०१. ३९.
--the holy lake in the valley between the moun- tains शीतान्त and with a महापद्म in the middle where श्री lives. वा. ३७. 5-8.

(I)--a son of व्यास and अरणी and a great yogin; superior to his father as a yogi; seeing him firm in renuncia- tion, व्यास taught him the भागवत; renounced worldly life before his upanayana. Wandered naked from place to place and reached the country of कुरुजान्गलस्. When at हास्तिनापुर he stopped for a few minutes at the threshold of householders to purify their abode. <F>1:  भा. I. 2. 2-3; 4. 2-8; 7. 8; M. १५. 8.</F> सूत's salutation to: called on परीक्षित् doing प्रायोपवेश and imparted know- ledge to him, addressed by the king as to the best way of spending his last moments for attaining मोक्ष। Enlightened [पगे३-437+ ३४] him by the भागवत episodes; <F>2:  Ib. I. १२. 3; १९. २५-39; 1. 3; XII. 6. 8.</F> went with कृष्ण to मिथिला, and to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse. Took part in defending द्वारका against शाल्व. <F>3:  Ib. X. ८६. १८; ७६. १४; ८२. 6.</F> On सौर गण as seven for each month. Heard the story of Citraketu from व्यास, नारद and Devala. <F>4:  Ib. XII. ११. २७; VI. १४. 9.</F> In the form of a Brahman; one of the twelve who knew the धर्म ordained by Hari. <F>5:  Ib. XII. १३. २१; VI. 3. २०.</F> A Madhya- माध्वर्यु; married पीवरी and got by her five sons all योगा- चार्यस् and a daughter कीर्तिमती, a योगिनी; of superior bhakti; (married पीवरी, the mind-born daughter of the बर्हिषद् Manes and had by her a daughter and four sons-म्। प्।) the sons were कृष्ण, Gama, Prabhu, शम्भु and भूरिश्रुत. <F>6:  Br. I. 1. १५०; II. ३३. १४; III. 8. ९२-4; १०. ८०-82; ३४. ३८; M. १५. 8; वा. ७०. ८४; ७३. २८; १०८. ४२ and ६०.</F>
(II)--a son of गार्हपत्य agni. Br. II. १२. १२.
(III)--a son of शरभ and father of ऋक्ष. Br. III. 7. २०७.
(IV)--the father-in-law of अणुह. M. ४९. ५७; वा. ९९. १७९.
--parrots, children of शुकि; <F>1:  M. 6. ३१.</F> cry in the presence of poisoned food; <F>2:  Ib. २१९. २०.</F> of the Tamra line. <F>3:  Vi. I. २१. १६.</F>
--a R. of the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. १८. [पगे३-438+ २६]
--a Janapada of the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. १३.
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १७. ३३ and ४४.
(I)--loved by अग्नी. भा. IV. २४. ११.

(II)--a daughter of ताम्रा and कश्यप; married Garutmat and had six sons त्रिशिर, Sumukha, Bala, पृष्ट, त्रिशन्कुनेत्र and Surasa who had in their turn a number of sons and grandsons; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. 8-9, ४४६; वा. ६९. ३२८-30.</F> brought forth parrots and owls; gave birth to parrots, owls, and crows (वि। प्।) <F>2:  M. 6. ३०-31; Vi. I. २१. १५-16.</F>
--heat making rays of the sun. वा. ५३. २२.
--(Kulaparvata) a hill in भारतवर्ष. भा. V. १९. १६; Br. II. १६. १८; वा. ४५. ८९, १०७; Vi. II. 3. 3.
--a R. from the ऋक्ष hill. Br. II. १६. ३१; वा. ४५. १०१.
--a R. from the ऋष्यवान्. M. ११४. २६.
--a kulaparvata. M. ११४. १७ and ३२.

(I)--(alias उशनस्) a son of Kavi (हविर्धान and दिव्या, hence काव्य); married ऊर्जस्वती, and father of [पगे३-439+ ४९] देवयानी through जयन्ती. <F>1:  भा. III. 1. २२; IV. 1. ४५; V. 1. ३५; VI. 7. १८; वा. ६३. २३; ६५. ७४; ९३. ८५; १०१. ३३; Vi. I, १४. 2.</F> The Purohita of हिरण्यकशिपु. Father of शण्ड and Marka, tutors of प्रह्लाद. Took part in प्रह्लाद's coronation. A ब्रह्मऋषि: Heard of the in- sult offered to his daughter by शर्मिष्ठा, the daughter of the ruler वृषपर्वन् and left the capital. The Purohita of वृषपर्वन्, the latter made him stay offering to make his daughter a slave of देवयाणी. In offering the latter to ययाति, he asked him not to share his bed with शर्मिष्ठा, cursed ययाति to become aged for having shared his bed with शर्मिष्ठा, and on an appeal mitigated it by saying that he could exchange his old age with youth of another if he found one to accept the exchange; <F>2:  भा. IX. Ch. १८ (whole); VII. 5. 1-2 १०. ३३; Br. III. ६८. १५; M. २५. 4, १६; २७. २६, ३७; ३०. ३०-36; ३२. २३, २६; ३३. 2 and २६.</F> joined Soma in तारकामय war: blessed the Asuras in this war: fought with बृहस्पति in a देवासुर battle. <F>3:  भा. IX. १४. 6; VIII. १०. ३३.</F> Brought back to life the unconscious Bali by सञ्जीविनी Vidya. Presented Bali with an unfading garland of flowers; knowing वामन to be Hari, warned Bali from agreeing to his request. Bali would not hear, and शुक्र cursed him to lose all श्री. At the bidding of Hari com- pleted the यज्ञ begun by Bali. <F>4:  Ib. VIII. ११. ४७-8; १५. 6; १९. ३०-43; २०. 1-१५; २३. १८; Br. III. ३०. ५४; ६५. ३१; M. १९२. १०; २४६. 1.</F> The third वेदव्यास. Heard the पुराण from वायु and told it to बृहस्पति; <F>5:  Br. III. 1. ७६ and ८६; १०. १८; II. ३५. ११७; IV. 4. ५९.</F> wor- shipped स्थानु with severe penance; born in तिष्यनक्षत्र: married mind-born daughter of पितृस् (Somapas) and father of 4 sons, त्वष्ट्रि, Varatri, शण्ड and Marka; <F>6:  Ib. I. 1. १२७-9; II. २४. ५०-51 and १३१; ३३. ३२; III. 1. ७५-8; १०. ८६-7; ६८. १५, ८६-7.</F> cursed the Asuras when they lost their empire, and यज्ञ came to the side of Devas. Asura's appeal and शुक्र's penance to शिव. Finding the Asuras having no आचार्य, the Devas attacked them who appealed to शुक्र's mother. विष्णु at the instance of Indra slew her, a woman and a wife of भृगु, for which विष्णु was cursed to be born on earth as man seven times. Indra then set up his daughter जयन्ती to serve शुक्र and earn his goodwill. Pleased with her service, शुक्र agreed to live with her as husband for ten years. After this period, बृहस्पति assumed his form and deluded the Asuras. शुक्र who grew angry cursed the Asuras at which बृहस्पति felt happy and threw off his disguise. They appealed to शुक्र for help once again or threatened to leave for रसातलम्. He managed to get back their kingdom in the epoch of सावर्णि [पगे३-440+ ४८] when Bali was emperor; <F>7:  Ib. III. ७२. ९३-195; ७३. 2, ५८; M. ४७. ८६-111, १७२-202.</F> lives in Bhuvarlokam; आश्रम of, located below the सहस्रशिखर and Kumuda hills; <F>8:  Br. IV. 2. ३०; वा. ३८. ६०-2;</F> consecrated भण्ड on the throne; <F>9:  Br. IV. १२ 2-6; १७. ५६.</F> revealed अन्गारकव्रत to विऋओचन; <F>१०:  M. ६२. 6, २७-40.</F> preached peace between the devas and asuras after seeing the destruction of twelve wars: wanted to excel बृहस्पति in मन्त्र by the grace of शिव and learnt नीति from शिव; <F>११:  Ib. ४७. ६१-84.</F> encouraged Asuras by giving them his pupils शण्ड and Marka for assistance. But his curse tells when the pupils desert them. Both were bought off by gods who offered them a status in sacrifices. This resulted in the helplessness of Asuras who entered रसातलम्; <F>१२:  Ib. ४७. २१०-233; ४८. ९३; ९३. १४.</F> appointed Purohita of the Asuras; expert in सञ्जीविनी vidya1, revived the dead back to life; <F>१३:  Ib. २५. 9.</F> taught Kaca, son of बृहस्पति; <F>१४:  Ib. २५. ४७.</F> has ruled that the son of the king who pleases his father best is entitled to the throne; <F>१५:  Ib. ३४. २४-5.</F> a ऋषि; <F>१६:  Ib. ४७. ६२ and ११४; १२६. ६९; १४५. ९२.</F> a मन्त्रकृत्; <F>१७:  Ib. १४५. १०३.</F> asked Bali to treat वामन with choice gift. ^१८ Ib. २४६. 3.

(II)--goes round Dhruva, and is believed to cause rain by his rapid marches, before or after or along with the sun; <F>1:  भा. IV. 9. २१; V. २२. १२.</F> the planet above Budha; <F>2:  Br. IV. 2. १३२; वा. १०१. १३२.</F> fed by the विश्वश्रव ray of the sun: of १६ rays of white watery region: 1/१६ in size to the moon; <F>3:  Ib. II. २४. ६९. ९५ and १०४.</F> to be worshipped when it begins to rise or is opposite or at the commencement or end of a journey; <F>4:  M. ७३. 1.</F> gifts to be given to a सामग; <F>5:  Ib. १६३. ३९.</F> on the left, a bad omen; an auspicious planet. <F>6:  Ib. १६४. 8.</F> car of, drawn by earth-born horses armed with arrows and adorned with pennon. <F>7:  वा. ५२. ७४-5; Vi. II. १२. १७.</F> [पगे३-441+ २५]
(III)--the month sacred to मीत्र. भा. XII. ११. ३५; Br. II. १३. 9; वा. ३०. 8.
(IV)--the नाग presiding over the month of शुचि. भा. XII. ११. ३६.
(V)--a son of ऊरु and आग्नेयी. Br. II. ३६. १०८.
(VI)--a name of शिव. Br. III. ७२. १८३.
(VII)--one of the twenty Sutapa गणस्. Br. IV. 1. १४; वा. १००. १४.
(VIII)--a son of ऊर्जा and वसिष्ठ: a sage of the epoch of Bhautya Manu; of the XIV epoch of Manu. Br. IV. 1. ११३; Vi. I. १०. १३; III. 2. ४४.
(IX)--a son of हविर्धान. M. 4. ४६.
(X)--a son of Auttama Manu; married गौट् the mind-born daughter of the मानस Pitr2s. M. 9. २०; १५. १५.
(XI)--a son of सावर्णि Manu; the hero. M. 9. ३३.
(XII)--a son of प्रजापति and overlord of Daityas; <F>1:  वा. १०. ७२; ३८. ६२; ५३. ३३.</F> mother of, brought back to life by भृगु. <F>2:  Ib. 1. १५०.</F> [पगे३-442+ २४]
(XIII)--the शुक्ल Paks2a. वा. ५२. ३७.
(XIV)--a son of Jala or waters. Vi. I. 8. ११.
(XV)--a son of Nandana. Vi. IV. २४. ५६.
--the mind-born sons of स्वायम्भुव Manu; १२ in number, all सोमपायिन्स्--a गण. Br. II. 9. ४६; १२. ४७; वा. ३१. 4. 8-9.
--the second son of गार्हपत्य. वा. २९. ११.
--on the south bank of the नर्मदा; sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. २९; १९१. २०-21.
--a queen of ग्रीष्म r2tu. Br. IV. ३२. २५.
--a portion of the Vedic literature, the Yajur Veda; <F>1:  Br. II. ३५; ७७; वा. ६१. ६८.</F> to be uttered in installing a new deity. <F>2:  M. २६५. २६.</F>
(I)--a name of Hari. भा. III. २१. ३५. [पगे३-443+ २८]
(II)--a son of हविर्धान. भा. IV. २४. 8; Br. II. ३७. २४.
(III)--a Mt. in क्रौञ्चद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २१.
(IV)--the first of पक्षस्; <F>1:  M. २३. १४; वा. ५३. ११४; ८३. ८०.</F> the night of the पितृस्; <F>2:  Ib. ५२. ५९; ५७. 9.</F> the ocean rises and falls in. <F>3:  Ib. ४९. २७.</F>
(V)--one of the seven sons of वसिष्ठ. वा. २८. ३६.
--the two ayanams. वा. ३१. ३०.
(I)--a son of बलराम. Br. III. ७१. १६७.
(II)--a son of सारण. वा. ९६. १६५.
--on account of the distance of the rising sun the reflection of agni and waters is white, and of earth dark and red when there is no ray; and hot owing to this reddishness. वा. ५०. ११०.

--sacred to शिव; merits of expounded to शिव to मार्कण्डेय; attached to the नर्मदा; here चाणक्य a राजऋषि attained siddhi; destroys the sin of brahmicide and infanticide; the lord lives here with उमा on the fourteenth day of the dark half of वैशाख and Caitra months. Prayers [पगे३-444+ २८] on the fourteenth day of the कृत्तिका month takes one to the abode of शिव. M. १९२. 3, १२-38.
--near Benares. M. १८३. ६२.
--a group of नाडीस् of the sun emitting heat. Br. II. २४. ३०.
(I)--a R. in क्रौञ्चद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २१.
(II)--same as Vidyut. M. १२२. ७३.
--the name of व्यास of the २२न्द् dva1para; लान्गलि, the अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १९८.

(I)--Kings ten in number, commencing with पुष्यमित्र: Ruled the earth for more than hundred years (११२ years, वा। प्।). (३०० years according to म्। प्।), in the म्। प्। eight of them are mentioned, प्रुष्यमित्र, वसुज्येष्ठ, Vasumitra, Antaka, Pulindaka, Vajramitra, समाभाग, and देवभूमि; ruled after the Mauryas. भा. XII. 1. १८; Br. III. ७४. १४९ and १५५; M. २७२. २६-32; वा. ९९. ३३६; Vi. IV. २४. ३३, ३७.
(II)--a tribe. M. १६३. ६६.
--the कण्वस् so called. M. २७२. ३५.
(I)--(शौर) a son of Agni and स्वाहा; of Asuras and Gandharvas; had १४ sons all यज्ञ agnis; father of हर्यवाहन and आयु. भा. IV. 1. ६०; वा. २९. 2, ३६, ४१; Br. II. १२. 3, ३८; Vi. I. १०. १५.
(II)--a son of विजिताश्व, and an Agni in previous birth; born thus because of वसिष्ठ's curse. भा. IV. २४. 4.
(III)--Indra of the epoch of the fourteenth Manu. भा. VIII. १३. ३४; Vi. III. 2. ४२.
(IV)--a sage of the epoch of the fourteenth Manu. भा. VIII. १३. ३४; Vi. III. 2. ४४.
(V)--a son of शतद्युम्न, and father of सनद्वाज (उर्जा-वि। प्।). भा. IX. १३. २२; Vi. IV. 5. ३०.
(VI)--a son of शुद्ध, and father of Trikakut. भा. IX. १७. ११.
(VII)--a son of Vipra, and father of क्षेम (क्षे- mya-वि। प्।). भा. IX. २२. ४७-48; Vi. IV. २३. 5-6.
(VIII)--a son of Andhaka. भा. IX. २४. १९; Vi. IV. १४. १२.
(IX)--the month sacred to वरुण. भा. XII. ११. ३६; Br. II. १३. 9; वा. ३०. 8.

(X)--the fire with the sun; has १००० na1d2is taking water from rivers, mountains and pools; of these ४०० pour [पगे३-446+ २४] out rain, ३०० dew, ३०० heat--all for the benefit of man and gods. Br. II. २४. ११, २४, ३३; वा. ५३, 7, १७, २०-21; ६२. १८८.
(XI)--a ऋषिक who became a sage by satya. Br. II. ३२. १०२.
(XII)--a सुधामान god. Br. II. ३६. २७.
(XIII)--a वैकुण्ठ god. Br. II. ३६. ५७.
(XIV)--a son of Raivata Manu. Br. II. ३६. ६३.
(XV)--a son of भृगु, and a deva. Br. III. 1. ८९.
(XVI)--a son of Satyaka. Br. III. ७१. ११६.
(XVII)--a बृहद्रथ; ruled for ५८ years. Br. III. ७४. ११५; वा. ९९. ३०२.
(XVIII)--(Angirasa) a son and sage of the १४थ् epoch of Bhautya Manu. Br. IV. 1. ११३-4; वा. १००. ११६.
(XIX)--a daughter of ताम्रा and कश्यप; mother of swans, cranes, ducks, etc.; <F>1:  M. 6. ३०; Vi. I. २१. १५, १७.</F> in the chariot of Tripura. <F>2:  M. १३३. २७.</F> [पगे३-447+ २२]
(XX)--a son of Auttama Manu. M. 9. १२.
(XXI)--a son of Vibhu, ruled for ६४ years. M. २७१. २४.
(XXII)--a Saimhikeya. वा. ६८. १९.
(XXIII)--a son of Manu and नड्वला. Vi. I. १३. 5.
--an Apsaras. Br. III. 7. 6.
--a son of Citraratha. वा. ९९. २७२.
--a son of Citraratha. M. ५०. ८०.
--a प्रजापति. Br. III. 1. ५४.
(I)--an ajita deva. Br. II. १३. ९३; वा. ३१. 7.
--a queen of ग्रीष्म r2tu. Br. IV. ३२. २५. [पगे३-448+ २६]
--a son of पुरूरवस् and ऊर्वशी. M. २४. ३४.
(I)--a son of Anenas, and father of शुचि. भा. IX. १७. ११.
(II)--a son of Bhautya Manu. Br. IV. 1. ११४.
(III)--a son of कौशिक in previous birth, born as चक्रवाह in मानस. M. २०. १८.
(IV)--a pure man is rid of his bondage by satva; from the state of निरञ्जन or separation, looks upon all equally. वा. १०२. ६६, ८०, ११८.
(V)--a sage of the epoch of the fourteenth Manu. भा. VIII. १३. ३४.
--the second stage of कामाक्षी, the first being चित्परा. Br. IV. ३९, १०.
--a particular मूर्छन having the 4th accent (music) coming out of मरुदेश; presiding deity, Gandharva. वा. ८६. ३८, ५३.
--a particular मूर्छन (music); the seventh in addition to षड्ज. वा. ८६. ४०. [पगे३-449+ २४]
--a Janapada of the भद्रा country. वा. ४३. १९.
--the goddess enshrined at कपालमोचन. M. १३. ४८.
(I)--the sea of fresh water. भा. V. 1. ३३.
(II)--a son of शाक्य, and father of लान्गल (राहुल-वि। प्।). भा. IX. १२. १४; वा. ९९. २८८; Vi. IV. २२. 8.
--a son of शाक्य. M. २७१. १२.
(I)--a son of ऋत, and father of वीतहव्य. भा. IX. १३. २६.
(II)--a son of गृतसमद, and father of शौ- naka. भा. IX. १७. 3; Br. III. ६७. 4; वा. ९२. 4.
(III)--the minister of Puramjaya; killed his king and placed his own son Pradyota on the throne. भा. XII. 1. 3; Br. III. ७४. १२३.
(IV)--a disciple of Pathya. भा. XII. 7. 2.
(V)--approached by केशिध्वज to give him a form of expiation. Vi. VI. 6. १६. [पगे३-450+ २७]

(I)--the second son of Ajigarta (Satyavati and ऋचीक) purchased by Rohita and used by हरिश्चन्द्र as a sacrificial animal in the place of his son. Adopted as son by विश्वामित्र. When his first fifty sons refused to recognise him as their brother, they were cursed to be Mlecchas. The younger fifty agreed to regard him as their brother and were blessed. He is शुन to भृगु family and देवरात to the गाधि line. His advent with the कौशिक family distin- guished it from the विश्वामित्रस्; compared to प्रह्लाद. भा. IX. 7. २१; १६. ३०-37; VII. 5. ४६; Br. III. ६६. ६६ and ७४; वा. ९१. ९२-6.
(II)--the second son of Jamadagni. Br. III. ६६. ६४.
--the last son of Jamadagni (सत्यवती and ऋचीक). Br. III. ६६. ६४; वा. ९१. ९२.
--the daughter of Samudra and wife of वरुण; two sons Kali and Vaidhya and a daughter, Sura- सुन्दरी. वा. ८४. 6.
--a kingdom of the west watered by the Sindhu. Br. II. १८. ४९; M. १२१. ४७; वा. ४७. ४६.
--a R. from the ऋष्यवान्. M. ११४. २६.
(I)--born of श्रद्धा. भा. IV. 1. ५०.
(II)--a god of सुतार group. Br. IV. 1. ९०.
(III)--a son of तामस Manu. Br. II. ३६. ४९.
(IV)--a son of हविर्धान. M. 4. ४५.
(V)--one of the ten branches of the सुपार group of devas. वा. १००. ९४.
--a class of Apsaras from the sacrificial altar. वा. ६९. ५६.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४१.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४०, २४३.
(I)--born of Pulaha. Br. III. 7. १७९.
(II)--(of horses) devasvastika, devapad- mam, देवमणि, फलशुक्ति, श्वेतशुक्ति, पुष्पगण्डिक, svas- tika शुक्ति, गडुर. Br. IV. १६. २१-22. [पगे३-452+ २६]
--the सभा of वरुण in the fifth slope of Meru; the lord of waters. वा. ३४. ८९.
--to be observed in the month of आश्व- yuja in honour of the sun god; he becomes one among the देवगणस् and lives as such upto the final dissolution of the world. M. ७४. 3; ८०. 1, ११.
(I)--a wife of Pulaha; mother of Hamsa and others. Br. III. 7. १७८.
(II)--a mother goddess. M. १७९. २९.
(III)--one of the ten daughters of रौद्राश्व. वा. ९९. १२५.
(I)--the father of वैकुण्ठ Hari. भा. VIII. 5. 4.
(II)--took part in देवासुर war between Bali and Indra. Fought with भद्रकाली. भा. VIII. १०. २१ and ३१.
(III)--a son of Vasudeva and रोहिणी. Br. III. ७१. १६५; वा. ९६. १६३.

(I)--a commander of तारक's force; had the sheep for his riding animal; <F>1:  M. १४८, ४३, ५५; १५१. 5.</F> threw darts on जनार्दन; a Citrayodhi against जनार्दन who threw भुसुण्डि at him [पगे३-453+ ३१] and his goat and said “you are to be killed by a girl; get away;” <F>2:  Ib. १५०. २२४; १५२. २५-52; २४५. ३२.</F> killed by दुर्गा; <F>3:  Br. IV. २९. ७६.</F> killed by योगनिद्रा. <F>4:  Vi. V. 1. ८२.</F>
(II)--a son of गनेष्ठि. वा. ६७. ७७.

--a price for marriage; कृष्ण was not prepared to pay any price for सत्या; <F>1:  भा. X. ५८. ४०.</F> one selling a daughter to be punished; <F>2:  M. २२७. २०.</F> a tax gathered by kings of Kali age. <F>3:  Vi. VI. 1. ३४.</F>
--a प्रजापति. Br. III. 1. ५३.
--a sage who waited on परशुराम with other sages for the reclamation of गोकर्ण and insisted that an established rule may be broken for the sake of धर्म। Br. III. ५७. 1, २३-4.

--created by वासुदेव for van- quishing the Asuras by name Andhakas at the request of Rudra; she drank their blood and destroyed the whole lot; aided नृसिम्ह in creating further mother goddesses to over- power the मातृ gan2a of Rudra; <F>1:  M. १७९. ३६. ६५.</F> will grant children if wor- shipped. <F>2:  Ib. १७९. ८५.</F>
--see शुष्करेवती. M. १७९. ८५.
--the क्षत्रिय caste of कुशद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ३८. [पगे३-454+ ४७]
--a deva गण. वा. १०. २१.
--a hell, intended for the five heinous offences. Br. IV. 2. १४६, १५४.

(I)--the members of the fourth वर्ण; <F>1:  भा. I. १३. १५; II. 1. ३७; 7. ३८ and ४६; VII. ११. २४.</F> their duty was service; <F>2:  Ib. VIII. 5. ४१; XI. १७. १९.</F> not fit for the study of the Vedas; <F>3:  Ib. X. २४. २०; ३८. 4.</F> invited for the राजसूय of युधिष्टिर; <F>4:  Ib. X. ७४. ११.</F> kings of Kali age, especially after Puramjaya; <F>5:  Ib. XI. 4. २२; 5. 4; १२. 4; २७. 4; XII. 1. 8 and ३८; 2. ३५.</F> receive gifts, become ascetics and expound dharma from high places in Kali; <F>6:  Ib. XII. 3. ३८.</F> duty was dharma परिचार yajn5a; take to ब्राह्मण dharma in Kali yuga; not fit for panktibhojanam. For the sake of 1,००० S4u1dras, one ब्राह्- मण may be killed; creation of: पृषध्र born a शूद्र by cow-slaughter; <F>7:  Br. II. २९. ५५; ३१. ३९४ and ३६७; III. १०. ९६; ११. ८७; १५. ४४; ६८. ६७; IV. 6. ४३.</F> meditate on देवी's १०८ names; perform श्राद्- dha with no mantras; <F>8:  M. 4. २८; १२. २५; १३. ६३; १७. ६४, ७०-71.</F> observe a month's pollution for father's death; ययाति's benevolence to; शूद्र kings rooted out by Kalki; <F>9:  Ib. १८. 3; ३४. 5; ४७. २५०. ५०. ७५; १४४. ३९-54.</F> may observe रोहिणिचन्द्र s4ayanam and अन्गारक vratam. <F>१०:  Ib. ५७. 6; ७२. २०-1; ११४. १२; २१७. 2.</F>

(II)--created out of the feet of the Lord; <F>1:  Vi. I. 6. 6.</F> गान्- dharvam स्थानम्; <F>2:  Ib. I. 6. ३५.</F> duties of; <F>3:  Ib. III. 8. ३३-4.</F> as kings from the time of Ma- हापद्म; <F>4:  Ib. IV. २४. २१ and ६८.</F> take to asceticism and become followers of here- tical sects; no regard for age, learning and family; <F>5:  वा. ५८. ४०-41; Vi. VI. 1. ३७.</F> fortunate, because they do not have to undergo the ordeals of perform- ing rituals and ceremonials incumbent on the twice born castes; not fettered by restrictions of any sort. <F>6:  Ib. VI. 2. २३. 4.</F>
--the vow for killing a शूद्र; for murder of a woman, for reaping fruits and flowers, for cut- ting trees for injuring bony and boneless animals. M. २२७. ३४, ३६.
(I)--(प्रभाकर, s.v.); a daughter of भद्राश्व and घ्२ऋताची; one of the ten wives of Atri. Br. III. 8. ७५; वा. ७०. ६८.
(II)--one of the ten daughters of रौद्राश्व. वा. ९९. १२५.

--the city of भण्ड on the banks of the महार्णव (sea?) near Mahendra hill: In extent १०० Yojanas: filled with चन्द्रशालस्, pleasure parks, सभा, tem- ples and so on: protected by कुटिलाक्ष on all sides when it was attacked by fifty अक्षौहिनिस् of soldiers; <F>1:  Br. IV. २१. 3-२०, ९६; २२. २२; २३. ९८; २६. २१.</F> burnt by ललिता with civil population. <F>2:  Ib. IV. २९. २१. १४३.</F>
--the Lord of the city of शून्यक. Br. IV. २२. १०८.
--a son of Kubera. भा. IX. 2. ३३.
(I)--the grand-father of the पाण्डवस् by mother's line; <F>1:  भा. I. १४. २६; III. 1. २६.</F> father of Vasudeva. <F>2:  Ib. X. 1. २९; 3. ४७ and ५१.</F>
(II)--a son of वीदूरथ and father of भजमान. (शमि, वि। प्।). <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. २६; Vi. IV. १४. २३.</F> A great king and father of eight sons. <F>2:  Br. III. ७१. १३७-9.</F> [पगे३-456+ ३०]
(IV)--a son of मदिरा and Vasudeva. भा. IX. २४. ४८.
(V)--a son of कृष्ण and भद्रा: His picture drawn by Citralekha. भा. X. ६१. १७; ६२. २०.
(VI)--a kingdom: Dvijas of this became व्रात्यस् after Puramjaya's days. भा. XII. 1. ३८.

(VII)--one of कार्तवीर्यार्जुन's five sons who escaped; <F>1:  Br. III. ४१. १३; M. ४३. ४६; वा. ९४. ७९; Vi. IV. ११. २१.</F> a महारथ; <F>2:  Br. III. ६९. ५०.</F> in the course of a hunt he entered the hermitage of Jamadagni with sword in hand and killed him; <F>3:  Ib. III. ४५. 1.</F> killed by परशुराम. <F>4:  Ib. III. ४६. १७, २३.</F>

(VIII)--a son of अश्मकि? (Devagarbha-वि। प्।): wife महिषा or भोजा (मारीषा-वि। प्।); Father of ten sons, the eldest being Vasudeva: also of 5 daughters; <F>1:  Br. III. ७१. १४४, १५१; Vi. IV. १४. २५-7.</F> had a friend कुन्ती who was childless; to him he gave his daughter पृथा in adoption; पाण्डु married her. <F>2:  Ib. IV. १४. ३२-4.</F>
(IX)--a son of अगावह. Br. III. ७१. २५७.
(X)--a name of वीग्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ६८. [पगे३-457+ ३०]
(XI)--a son of ऐक्ष्वाकि; married भोजा and had १० sons and 5 daughters. M. ४६. 1, 4.
(XII)--a son of भजमान; wife अस्मकी; had a number of sons, वात, निवात, etc. वा. ९६. १३५-6, १४३.
(XIII)--the country of the. Vi. II. 3. १६.
--a daughter of Ugrasena and wife of श्यामक. भा. IX. २४. २५ and ४२.
(I) (च्)--the kingdom of Citraketu. भा. VI. १४. १०; XI. ३०. १८.
(III)--the Lord of the Yadus and overlord of माथुरस् and शूरसेनस्. भा. X. 1. २७.
(IV)--a son of शत्रुघ्न: capital मथुरा. Br. III. ६३. १८७; वा. ८८. १८६; Vi. IV. 4. १०४.

--the people of शूरसेन territory. Fought with their kinsmen and ended their lives; <F>1:  भा. I. १०. ३४; १५. ३९; IX. २४. ६३; XI. ३०. १८; वा. ४५. ११०.</F> a kingdom of मध्यदेश; <F>2:  Br. II. १६. ४१; III. ७४; १३८.</F> the tribe with शूर as their chief: पञ्च- rathas: honoured Sagara and were killed by परशुराम; <F>3:  Ib. III. ४५. 1; ४६. १७; ४९. 5; M. ११४. ३५.</F> kings of the line, १७ in number. <F>4:  Ib. २७२. १७.</F> [पगे३-458+ ३२]
--a name of कृष्ण born to Devaki. M. ४६. १५.
--a name of विनायक. Br. III. ४२. ३७; IV. ४४. ६७.
--a daughter of विश्रवस् and कैकसी; sister of रावण; <F>2:  Br. III. 8. ४७.</F> disfigured by राम. <F>3:  भा. IX. १०. 4.</F> ^1 वा. ७०. ४१.
--the wind of a winnowing basket blowing upon a person, makes him lose his lustre. Vi. V. ३८. ४०.
--sages of this place visited द्वारका; visited by बलराम. भा. X. ९०. २८ [5]; ७९. २०.
--near गृध्रकूट hill in गया. वा. १०८. ६४.
--the राक्षष residing in Tatvalam (Atalam- वा। प्।). Br. II. २०. १७; वा. ५०. १७.

--(see शूलभृत् or शूलधर): a name of शिव; <F>1:  M. १०४. १०; १४०. ४८; १५४. ३९६; Vi. V. ३३. ४५.</F> admitted for share in sacrifice due to fear of दण्ड; <F>2:  M. २२५. १८.</F> approaches नारायण after ब्रह्मा issues from his belly; his approach is noticed by ब्रह्मा and reported to नारायण who explains his nature asking ब्रह्मा to join him in a praise of; dialogue between ब्रह्मा and नारायण on the greatness of; praise of by both; gives boons to ब्रह्मा who wants him as son or one equal to him; appreciates विष्णु and disappears. <F>3:  वा. २४. ३६-165; २५. 1-२७.</F> [पगे३-459+ ३३]
--one of the twenty-eight hells for those who allure innocents by magical and other practices. भा. V. २६. 7 and ३२.

--शूलपाणि, शूलधर, शूलि, शिव: living in the city of बाण; <F>1:  Br. II. १३. ६२; M. 6. १३.</F> lord of different classes of spirits; <F>2:  Ib. 8. 5.</F> blessed Yama son of विवस्वान् to be a लोकपाल and Lord of पितृस्; <F>3:  Ib. ११. १९.</F> married दाक्षायणी and was not invited to दक्ष's sacrifice; <F>4:  Ib. १३. १३.</F> with १८ hands, residing at Gomati; <F>5:  Ib. २२. १३.</F> acted as Protector for Soma's राजसूय. <F>6:  Ib. २३. १९; २५२. 5.</F>
--a तीर्थ on the नर्मदा; sacred to शिव. M. १९१. 3-4.
(I)--the trident, held by गन्गा in worshipping शिव in Meru. वा. ३०. ९२.
(II)--a stake, mounting on; a punishment in hell. Vi. VI. 5. ४७.
--is शिव, <F>1:  Br. IV. ११. २८; ३०. ७४.</F> the अवतार् of the Lord in the २४थ् dva1para in the नैमिष. <F>2:  वा. २३. २०६.</F>
--the kingdom of; a northern kingdom. Br. II. ३१. ८३; M. १२१. ४५; वा. ४७. ४४; ५८. ८३.
--chieftain of करवीरपुर resented कृष्ण and राम going to Gomanta and was killed by कृष्ण. His capital occupied by कृष्ण. भा. X. [५२ (V) २९-41]; [५३ (V) २२]; ५२. [५६ (V) 7]. [पगे३-460+ २७]
--a Mt. three hillocks of jewels, gems and gold. M. ११३. ६८-9.
(I) (च्)--a kingdom north of श्वेतम्, of Kuru. Br. II. १४. ५१; १५. ३४; वा. ३३. ४४.
(II)--a Mt. in जम्बूद्वीप, noted for gold and gems, abode of पितृस्, north of the श्वेत. Br. II. १५. २२, २८, ६९-70; १७. ३६. २१. १३८-41; M. ११३. २३; वा. ३४. २०, २५; ४५. 2; ११४. ८४.
(III)--a वर्ष, next to हिरण्मय. वा. ३४. ३०.
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १८. १७.

(II)--the country to its north formed a division of जम्बूद्वीप; <F>1:  Vi. II. 1. २२.</F> north of जम्बूद्वीप; <F>2:  Ib. II. 2. ११.</F> contains three peaks, resembling horns. <F>3:  Ib. II. 8. ७३.</F>
--a group of gods doing श्राद्ध. Br. III. १०. १०९.
(I)--a sage and author of सामवेद. Br. II. ३५. ४३.
(II)--a Kauthuma, composed three सम्- हितास्। वा. ६१. ३९, ४०. [पगे३-461+ ४०]
--a son of Bheda; <F>1:  वा. ९९. १९६.</F> His daughters married by बाह्यक. <F>2:  Ib. ९६. 3.</F>
--queen of भजमान. वा. ९६. 3.
--a son of गान्दिनि. वा. ९६. १११.
--a मन्त्रकृत् and of Angirasa branch. वा. ५९. ९८.

(I)--the अम्श of Hari: his bed; <F>1:  भा. VIII. 4. २०; III. 8. २३; V. २५. ११.</F> the force of Hari: personified; <F>2:  Ib. X. 2. 8; VI. १६. ३०.</F> not finished yet chanting the glories of विष्णु; <F>3:  Ib. II. 7. ४१.</F> a प्रजापति; <F>4:  Br. III. 1. ५३; वा. ६५. ५३.</F> a chief of १००० headed snakes, protected the chariot of त्रिपुरारि; <F>5:  M. 6. ३९.</F> bed of Brahmam, (विष्णु) son of Kadru and कश्यप; <F>6:  Ib. १३३. ६२; १३८. ३९; १४६. २२.</F> of the पाताल, shaken by हिरण्य- कशिपु; <F>7:  Ib. १६३. ५७.</F> the Lord identified with; <F>8:  Ib. १६७. ५३.</F> offerings to before house construction. <F>9:  Ib. २४९. १५; २६८. १७.</F>

(II)--(Ananta): a तामस form of विष्णु down below the पाताल regions; with १००० jewelled heads, purple garment, white necklace; in his hands are the plough and mace; worshipped by लक्ष्मी and वारुणी; when the deluge sets in, he vomits venomed fire devouring the three worlds; नाग maids adorn him with fragrant sandal paste; celestials and Asuras worship him; गन्गा worshipped him and learnt from him astronomy and astrology; supports the whole earth with his head; <F>1:  Vi. II. 5. १३-27.</F> the best of नागस्; <F>2:  Ib. III. 2. ५१.</F> is बलराम. <F>3:  Ib. V. २५. 1; ३५. 3.</F> [पगे३-462+ २९]
--a दानव. Br. III. 6. १६.
--a name of सात्यकी. भा. I. १३. १६[1].
--(शैनेयस्): beginning with शिनि and ending with Yugandhara. This is the line of Anamitra, a branch of the वृष्णिस्. (क्षेत्रोपेतद्विजस्). M. ४५. २४; Vi. IV. १४. 4; १९. २३.
(शैब्या-म्। प्।, वि। प्।), a wife of कृष्ण, and mother of सम्ग्रामजित् and other sons. Br. II. ७१. २४३; M. ४७, १३: Vi. V. ३२. 3.

(I)--the king of सुवीरस्: placed on the west during the siege of Gomanta by जरासन्ध; <F>1:  भा. X. ५२. ११ [१२].</F> joined the पाण्डवस् against the Kurus; <F>2:  Ib. X. ७८ [९५ (v) १३].</F> his daughter रत्ना, was mar- ried to अक्रूर. <F>3:  M. ४५. २८.</F>
(II)--the name of a horse of the chariot of कृष्ण. भा. X. ५३. 5; ८९. ४९.
--(शैव्या) wife of ज्यामघ: welcomed by द्रौपदी to हास्तिनपुर. भा. IX. २३. ३४; X. ७१. ४३; Vi. १२. १४. [पगे३-463+ २५]
--(Gargas): descendants of शिबि; the Brahmans with क्षत्रिय profession. M. ४९. ३८.
--the place where the R. पावनी ends. M. १२१. ५९.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १९.
--resides in ज्योतिष्क on Meru with शिव, and worshipped by all. वा. ३०. ८३.
--a Mt. on the south of the मानस lake. वा. ३६. २२.
--a Mt. in the गजाशिला. वा. १०८. ४८.
--a tribe. Br. IV. 7. १९.
--takes its source in the lake शैलोदम्; enters western sea between चक्षु and सीता. M. १२१. २३; वा. ४७. २१.
--lake, giving rise to R. सिलोदा in the अरुण hill; at the foot of the वरुण hill. Br. II. १८. २१. २२; M. १२१. २२; वा. ४७. २०. [पगे३-464+ २५]
--the sin of being of an ardent type. Br. IV. 8. ४४.
(I)--one day of शिव equals १०० years of ब्रह्मा. M. २९०. २१.
(II)--one of the six दर्शनस्. वा. १०४. १६.
(III)--in the सीमन्तसीम of the personified Veda. वा. १०४. ८१.
--a R. of the भद्रा continent. वा. ४३. २९.
--a राक्षस clan, following शिव. Br. III. 7. १४१; वा. ६९. १७२.
--one of the विद्याधर ganas. वा. ६९. २९.
--a देवी and wife of कृष्ण. वा. ९६. २३४.
--a सूक्तम् of the साम samhita1 to be recited in tank ritual. M. ५८. ३६.
(I)--a pravara. M. १९६. ५४.
(II)--a काश्यप and a त्रयार्षेय. M. १९९. १२. [पगे३-465+ २३]
--same as सुकुमार vars2am. M. १२२. १९.
(I)--a pupil of शाकल्य. Br. II. ३५. 2.
(II)--of द्वयामुष्यायन gotra. M. १९६. ५२.
--the kingdom of. Br. III. ७४. १९६.
--a Janapada of the मणिधान्य. वा. ९९. ३८४.
--the topmost region where Hari is the presiding deity--see शिशुमार. भा. II. 2. २४; Br. II. २२. 6.
(I)--a son of द्रोण and a Vasu. भा. VI. 6. ११.
(II)--a son of मृत्यु. वा. १०. ४१.
--a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३३. 4.
(I)--one of the 7 pralaya clouds. M. 2. 8.
--in the Cyavana आश्रम of गया. वा. १०८. ७४.
--a तीर्थ sacred to सुभद्रा. M. १३. ४५.
--a R. from the ऋक्ष hill in भारतवर्ष, visited by बलराम; <F>1:  भा. V. १९. १८; X. ७९. ११; Br. II. १६. २९.</F> sacred to पितृस्. <F>2:  M. २२. ३५.</F>
--a son of राजाधिदेव; had five sons, all heroic warriors. M. ४४. ७८-9.

--built by Maya at the command of भण्ड; a city of बाण; visit of जरासन्ध to: Aniruddha taken to; besieged by the वृष्णिस् when बाण had imprisoned Anirud- dha, and नारद reported it to them. बाण's army beaten back into the city. Br. IV. १२. 4; भा. X. [5. (v) 1], [२१ & ६५]; ६२. 4 and २३; ६३. 2-4; Vi. V. ३३. ११.
--a clan of Apsaras from काम. वा. ६९. ५८. [पगे३-467+ २५]
--one of the fourteen गणस् of apsaras born of काम. Br. III. 7. २०.
--an Apsarasa गण, daughters of Marut. Br. III. 7. १८.
--a disciple of शाकल्य. वा. ६०. ६४.
--to be worshipped in house-building. M. २५३. २६.
--a शक्ति on the Geya cakra. Br. IV. १९. ६५.
--of आत्रेय gotra. M. १९७. 2.
--the place of शुक्र in the मण्डलम्. वा. ५३. ६०.
--(सौल्कायनि-भा। प्।); a pupil of Veda- दर्श. भा. XII. 7. 2.
--a son of वज्रनाभ, and father of युषि- ताश्व. Vi. IV. 4. १०६.
--of द्व्यामुष्यायन gotra. M. १९६. ५२.

(I)--the vidhi in a श्राद्धम्; other aspects of शौच; touching dogs; human bones अशौच; pollution of [पगे३-468+ ३८] death to Brahmans १० days, क्षत्रियस् 12 days, वैश्यस् 15 days, and शूद्रस् one month; आचमनम् is शौचम्; dis- regard of, leads to mlecchahood; three kinds of. Br. III. १४. ६२-70.
(II)--both आरण्यम् and ग्राम्यम्. वा. ७९. ३०.

--characteristics of yogins; udaka or water important; then मान which is अमृत and अवमान which is poison; service to guru for one year with niyama and yama; then wandering about on clean roads, drinking filtered clean water and speaking truthful words and begging food especially from शालिन householders. वा. १६. 1-१४; ७८. ७६.
--the goldsmith artist in the service of the cour- tesan लीलावती; he helped her in making the लवणाचल da1na without wages and consequently was born as धर्ममूर्ति, king of बृहत्कल्प. M. ९२. २४.

(I)--a son of शुनक; a great sage of the ऋग् Veda school. A kulapati; addressed सूत as to the circum- stances of the composition of the भागवत पुराण; <F>1:  भा. IX. १७. 3; I. 1. 4; 4. 1-१३; M. 1. 5; वा. ९३. २४.</F> had his residence in नैमिषालय; taught knowledge of अस्त्र and क्रिया to शतानीक; <F>2:  भा. XII. 4. ४३; IX. २२. ३८; M. २५. 3; ४३. 1-2; वा. १०४. १९; १०६. ३९.</F> a pupil of Pathya; divided the Atharva सम्हिता between his two disciples Babhra and सैन्धवा- yana. <F>3:  Br. II. ३५. ५९-60; वा. ६१. ५२-3; Vi. III. 6. ११-12.</F> A क्षत्रोपेतद्विज; four castes were formed under him; <F>4:  Br. III. ६७. 4. ६६. ८८; वा. ९२. 4-5.</F> a मन्त्रकृत् and a मध्यमाध्वर्यु; <F>5:  Br. II. ३२. १०६; M. १४५. १००; २४४. 3.</F> asked Vai- शम्पायन for a शान्ति ritual; <F>6:  Ib. ९३. 1.</F> initiated शतानीक into आत्म- ज्ञान. <F>7:  Vi. IV. २१. 4.</F> [पगे३-469+ २५]
(II)--of भार्गव gotra. M. १९५. १८.
(III)--one of the eighteen teachers of the वास्तु शास्त्र। M. २५२. 3.
(IV)--a son of गृतसमद; a propagator of वर्ण dharma. Vi. IV. 8. 6.
--a branch of the भार्गवस्; क्षत्रोपेत dvijas. Br. III. 1. १००; ६७. 6; वा. ९२. 6.
--of आत्रेय gotra. M. १९७. 2.
--of भार्गव gotra. M. १९५. १८.
--a name for शुचि Agni. वा. २९. 2.
--a name of वासुदेव. M. ४६. १३.
--a sage of much तपस्। Br. II. ३५. ४३.
--a तीर्थ in फालमञ्जिर hill. Br. III. १३. ३७.
--a pupil of देवदर्श. Br. II. ३५. ५८ Vi. III. 6. ११. [पगे३-470+ २६]
--a disciple of वेदस्पर्श. वा. ६१. ५१.
--the burning ground; the name of Avi- mukta; those who regard Benares as such will be deluding themselves; those who die there attain release. M. १८४. 5, १९-21, ६३.
--an attribute of शिव. Br. II. २७. ७९.
--offer of prayers to. वा. ११२. ५८.
--a brother of Vasudeva. Vi. IV, १४. ३०.
--of कश्यप gotra. M. १९९. 7.
(I)--Mt. a hill of the शाकद्वीप; here people are of श्याम colour. Br. II. १९. ८८; M. १२२. १२; वा. ४९. ८२; Vi. II. 4. ६२.
(II)--a son of Sarama. Br. III. 7. ३१२.
(III)--a son of शूर and भोजा; had no son. Br. III. ७१. १५०, १९४; M. ४६. 3.
(IV)--a son of शमिक; had no issue; <F>1:  M. ४६. २७-8.</F> adopted as son the son of वस्तावन; went to the forest; became Bhoja and a राजऋषि. <F>2:  वा. ९६. १९०.</F> [पगे३-471+ २४]
(V)--a brother of Vasudeva. वा. ९६. १४८ Vi. IV. १४. ३०.
(VI)--one of the two dogs of the family of Vai- vasvata to whom bali is to be offered in यज्ञ. वा. १०८. ३०; १११. ३९.
--a son of देवमीढ and मारिषा; married शूरभू and had two sons, हरिकेश and हिरण्याक्ष. भा. IX. २४. २९ and ४२.
--a पराशर clan. Br. III. 8. ९५.
(I)--sons of Kallolaha. Br. III. 7. ४४२.
(II)--belonging to the दत्तात्रेय gotra. वा. ७०. ७७.
(III)--a पराशर branch. वा. ७०. ८७.
(I)--a daughter of Meru and wife of हिरण्- maya. भा. V. 2. २३.
(II)--a name of ललिता; appeared before the sage मातन्ग and agreed to be his daughter. Hence मातन्गी. Br. IV. १७. ८३; २८. ३७; ३१. ८४, ९३. [पगे३-472+ २४]
(III)--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १७.
(IV)--a R. of the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. १७.
--fit for श्राद्ध. M. १५. ३५.
--a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३३. 6.
(I)--the chief author of Yajurveda, of the northern recension. Br. II. ३५. १२.
(II)--आर्षेयप्रवर (Angiras). M. १९६. २३.
(III)--a chief of the उदीच्यस्. वा. ६१. 8.
--a मन्त्रकार and an आत्रेय. वा. ५९. १०४.
--of कश्यप gotra. M. १९९. 8.
--ridiculed Garga as impotent in an assembly of the यादवस्. Vi. V. २३. 1. [पगे३-473+ २५]
--of आत्रेय gotra and a sage. Br. II. ३२. ११३; M. १९७. 5.
--an आत्रेय clan. Br. III. 8. ८५.
--eagles, born of स्येनी; <F>1:  M. 6. ३१.</F> of the तामर line. <F>2:  Vi. I. २१. १६.</F>
--the सेनानि with the शरत् Sun. Br. II. २३. १४.
--a god of प्रसूत group. Br. II. ३६. ७०; वा. ६२. ६०.
--a R. of the ऋक्ष hill. Br. II. १६. ३०.
--intended to bring one under control, to root out the enemy, etc. M. ९३. १५२.
(I)--a daughter of ताम्रा and कश्यप; married गौतमान्; and mother of kururas, सारस cranes, hawks, etc. M. 6. ३०-31; Vi. I. २१. १५-16.
(II)--a R. from the ऋष्यवान्. M. ११४. २५.
(III)--the wife of अरुण and mother of Sam- पाति and जटायु. वा. ६९. ३२५-26. [पगे३-474+ २५]
(I)--a daughter of Kardama married to An- girasa. Mother of four daughters--सिनीवाली, कुहू, राका and अनुमती and sons Utathya and बृहस्पति. भा. III. २४. २२; IV. 1. ३४ and ३५.
(II)--a daughter of दक्ष and wife of Dharma; mother of शुभ and काम. भा. IV. 1. ४९-50; Br. II. 9. ४९ and ५८; वा. १०. २५, ३५; Vi. I. 7. २३ and २८.
(III)--a wife of श्राद्धदेव and mother of ten sons; observed पयोव्रत and wanted the birth of a daughter. इला was born. भा. IX. 1. ११, १४-16.
(IV)--one of the wives of Vasudeva and mother of गवेषवान्. M. ४६. २०.
(I)--a son of शान्तिदेव and Vasudeva. भा. IX. २४. ५०.
(II)--a son of आप. Vi. I. १५. १११.
--a sage; nine sons of ऋषभ became this. भा. V. 3. २०; XI. 2. २०.
--आर्षेयप्रवर of भार्गव gotra. M. १९५. ३८.
--a son of अश्विनी and अक्रूर. M. ४५. ३३. [पगे३-475+ २४]
(I)--the constellation; <F>1:  भा. IV. १२. ४८; वा. ५०. १२७; ५३. ११६; ६६. ५१; ८२. ११.</F> importance of श्राद्ध that day. <F>2:  Br. III. १८. ११.</F>
(II)--a son of Mura. भा. X. ५९. १२.
(III)--a son of अश्विनी and अक्रूर. M. ४५. ३३.
--a Janapada of the केतुमाला. वा. ४४. १५.
--a daughter of Citraka. Br. III. ७१. ११५; वा. ९६. ११४.
--a son of भृगु. वा. ६५. ८७.
--the best among the stars. Br. II. २४. १४०; वा. ५३. ११२, ११६.
--a son of Gautama, an अवतार् of the १४थ् dva1para. वा. २३. १६४. [पगे३-476+ ४२]
--a daughter of Citraka. Br. III. ७१. ११५; वा. ९६. ११४.
--a son of शत्रुघ्न, the son of अनाधृष्ठि. M. ४६. २४.

(I)--certain days considered good for the performance of; sumptuous feeding of many people on the day; no offering of or eating of flesh. <F>1:  भा. III. 7. ३३; VII. १४. १९-26; १५. 3-7.</F> Feeding of yogins recommended; presiding deity is Ravi. <F>2:  M. १३. 6; १५. ४३.</F>

(II)--a karma; <F>1:  Br. III. 4. २४.</F> the wherefrom and why of the ceremony is questioned for answer; ceremony for dis- liked पितृस् will be enjoyed by the राक्षसस् and दानवस्; tends to the growth of Soma who is the cause of the world growth; three पिण्डस् according to name and gotra; पितृस् give all including knowledge; at the तीर्थस् and rivers; बृहस्पति on श्राद्ध; once there was a thick haze of darkness in all worlds when ब्रह्मा engaged himself in yoga and created the worlds, सन्तानक and the first gods वैराजास्; the form- less groups of Gods attained absolution through yoga which is the strength of the पितृस्; and through this yoga Soma increases in power; hence feed thousands learned in the Vedic lore; feeding of a स्नातक equals that of many; atheists and the unrighteous should not be fed; <F>2:  Ib. III. 9. 4; M. २०. 6; २१. ३३.</F> to be performed with faith using silver or silver-coated vessels and the Purodha to be given स्वधा; health and wealth are the fruits; superior to deva worship; even gods propitiate the पितृस् as also sages and other semi-divine beings; for योगैश्वर्य or मोक्ष- dharma; <F>3:  Ib. III. १०. १००; M. १५. ३१.</F> details of the vedi and offerings during स्राद्धस्; पितृस् eat in the guise of वायु; offerings in Agni when it burns, otherwise it will lead to the blinding of eyes; <F>4:  Ib. III. ११. 6, ४९, १००.</F> the ruling of बृहस्पति that first offerings are to be made to पिण्ड and then feeding Brahmans; by offering once the पितृस् become pleased; <F>5:  Ib. III. १२. २६; १३. 1; M. १०. ३४.</F> the eclipse day good for; a list of articles to be used or discarded; women in their period unfit for [पगे३-477+ ४५] श्राद्ध; त्रिशङ्कु country, that of कारस्कर, कलिङ्ग and that of North of Sindhu unfit for श्राद्ध; naked persons must not be seen in a श्राद्ध; those who have no आश्रमस् are not fit for श्राद्ध; unfit to be seen then are dogs, fowls, hemophrodites, etc.; importance of शौचम् in a श्राद्ध; <F>6:  Ib. III. १४. 3-८६.</F> who are eligible to be fed and those who are not; Grahasta, वानप्रस्थ, Yati and वालखिल्य are eligible; those beyond the आश्रमस् are not eligible; the leavings of श्राद्धस् not to be given to women and शूद्रस् but to sons, <F>7:  Ib. III. १५. 3, ३८, ५९.</F> gifts of rice, कमण्डलु, fans, slippers, cloths and gems, silver and gold vessels, fuel, bed, silk, etc., made on the occasion will result in long life, health, wealth, children, cattle, conveyance, etc., <F>8:  Ib. III. १६. 1.</F> either it is काम्य or नैमित्तिक and अजस्र; to be done on all the १५ days of the dark half of the month including the अमावास्य and its effects; <F>9:  Ib. III. १७-1, १०-20.</F> the श्राद्ध performed under every नक्षत्र and its results as narrated by Yama to शशबिन्दु; <F>१०:  Br. १८. 2-१४.</F> हविस् of sesamum, rice, fruits and roots, flesh of animals and birds like fish, deer, hare, parrots, hog, छागल, gavya, aura- bhra, खड्ग, etc.; three Brahmans to be fed representing the trinity; not to feed those addicted to liquor, cattle rear- ing, and are messengers of villages, merchants; also one who picks up quarrels with parents, whose wife is in periods, a thief, one insulting friends, mad, hemophrodite, culpable of child murder, defiler of preceptor's bed, physician, adulterer, seller of Vedic Niyamas, dogs and brahmicides not to be seen in a श्राद्ध; the sprinkling of seasamum is to ward off Asuras and रक्षसस् from taking part; the time is the fore- noon of शुक्लपक्ष and afternoon of कृष्णपक्ष; <F>११:  Ib. III. १९. 2.</F> offering of पिण्डस्; thus said बृहस्पति to his son in the श्राद्ध कल्प; <F>१२:  २०. १०; IV. 4. ५३.</F> ordained for पितृस्; places for oblations in the absence of fire; articles fit and unfit for; <F>१३:  M. १५. ३०-38; २०४. 1.</F> kinds of, and details relat- ing to; <F>१४:  </F> साधारण श्राद्ध described; <F>१५:  Ib. ch. १७.</F> तीर्थस् for perform- ance of. <F>१६:  Ib. ch. २२.</F> [पगे३-478+ २६]
--the rituals prescribed as due to पितृस्. M. 2. २३.
--a son of वृष. Br. III. 6. ३४.
(I)--a तीर्थ on the सरस्वती. भा. III. 1. २२.
(II)--a son of निषादजर. Br. ७१. १२०.
(III)--(Manu: a son of Vivasvata and सम्ज्ञा: Seventh Manu (s.v.) Manu Vaivasvata. Satyavrata in previous birth. भा. VI. 6. ४०; VIII. १३. 1 and 9; २४. ११; Br. III. ६३. २१५; Vi. III. 1. ३०.
(IV)--Yama; the former birth of गवेषुण; a destroyer of Indra; father of Ekalavya. वा. ९६. १८२.
--one of Vasudeva's wives: mother of गनेष. Br. III. ७१. १८४.
--a son of विष. वा. ६८. ३३.

(I)--the name of the month and नक्षत्र; god for gift of the वायु पुराण; <F>1:  M. ५३. १९; ५६. 4; ५७. १७; ६०. ३४; १२४. ५०.</F> कृष्णाष्टमी of this month good for श्राद्ध. <F>2:  M. १७. 8.</F> [पगे३-479+ ३१]
(II)--a son of Gautama, an अवतार् of the १४थ् dva1para. वा. २३, १६४.
--a son of युवनाश्व and the founder of the city of श्रावस्ति; the father of ब्रह्मदश्व. Br. III. ६३. २७; M. १२. ३०; वा. ८८. २६-7.

--the city built by श्रावस्त of the इक्ष्वाकु line; capital of उत्तरकोशल where Lava ruled; <F>1:  Br. III. ६३. २८, २००; वा. ८८. २००.</F> in गौड- देश built by Vatsaka son of श्रावस्त. <F>2:  M. १२. ३०.</F>
--of श्वेत Para1s4ara clan. M. २०१. ३६.
--a वर्ष parvata north of the श्वेत of three tops of which one is इषुवतम् s4ringa; <F>1:  वा. 1. ८५; ५०. १८९.</F> residence of पितृस्. <F>2:  Ib. ४६. ३५.</F>

(I)--(खायाति), a daughter of भृगु and ख्याति devoted to भगवान्; <F>1:  भा. I. १०. २६; ११. २६ and ३३; IV. 1. ४३; २४. ४९.</F> requested by Devas to approach नृसिम्ह with a view to appease his wrath, she dared not go near him; <F>2:  Ib. VII. 9. 2; VIII. 4. २०; 5. ४०; २३. 6; IX. 4. ६०; X. 3. ५०; 9. २०; २९. ३७; ३१. १७; XI. १४. १५ & ३९; XII. ११. २०.</F> elder sister of धाता and विधाता; married नारा- यण and gave birth to Bala and उन्माद (उत्साह) besides mind-born sons; <F>3:  Br. II. ११. 2; १३. ७८; वा. २८. 2.</F> alias महालक्ष्मी or लक्ष्मी. <F>4:  Br. IV. ३९. ७०-71. ४४. ७१; वा. ३७. ३८.</F> [पगे३-480+ २५]
(II)--came out of the churning of the milk ocean, whom विष्णु placed on his breast: the dweller in the lotus: also श्रीदेवी. Br. IV. 9. ७६, ७९; ३३. ४६; ३६. २१, ३१ and ९०.
(III)--a Kala of the moon. Br. IV. ३५. ९२.
--is ललिता. Br. IV. १३. 4.
--a name for camphor. M. २८४. 9.
--sages of this Mt. visited द्वारका. भा. X. ९०. २८[3].
and गुरुपत्नी--represent Brahmam. Br. IV. ४३. 7.

--the mantra of: is महालक्ष्मी: worshipped by विष्णु, शिव and ब्रह्मा: propitiation of, makes one learned: Icon of: the mudras in connection with the worship of; दीक्ष and its methods. Br. IV. ४१. 3-5; chh. ४२-3.
--to be uttered in Devi's offering. Br. IV. ४३. १९. [पगे३-481+ ३१]
--of rocky earth; here are cities of Kesari, सुपर्वण, वासुकि, the king of the नागस्. वा. ५०. १२, ३८-40.

--the leader of ललिता's hosts against भण्ड; also पोत्रिनी; her march described; in Kiricakra- ratha: Her mount was the lion वज्रघोष; <F>1:  Br. IV. १६. ३१; १७. 8, २७; ch. २१.</F> hit कुटलाक्ष, the chief commander of भण्ड: consulted मन्त्रिनी: helped कुमारी in her expedition against sons of भण्ड: ascended Geyacakra and fought with विषन्ग: became happy at the end. <F>2:  Ib. IV. २६. 1-११३; २७. ४५ and ५८; २८. १४-20; ३४. ५५.</F>

--a playmate of कृष्ण in his हरिणाकाइडन sport. Expressed to कृष्ण the desire to rid the palmyra grove of Asura Dhenuka. Being victor in a game, he had the honour of being borne on the back by कृष्ण; <F>1:  भा. X. १५. २०; १८. २३-4; २२. ३१; Vi. V. 9. १३-14.</F> was placed by शिव on his lap as a token of affection. <F>2:  Br. III. ४२. ५५; ४३. २९.</F>
--a daughter of Devaka; a queen of Vasudeva and mother of six sons of whom Nandaka was one. भा. IX. २४. २३ & ५१; Br. III. ७१. १३१, १६२ and १८१; IV. २९. 2; वा. ९६. १३०; Vi. १४. १८.
--a name of विष्णु. वा. १११. २१.
--sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ७४. [पगे३-482+ २७]
--a R. sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ४९.
--Mt. a hill in India, fit for श्राद्ध offer- ings; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. २३; III. १३. २८, ३१; वा. ४५. ९२; ७७. २८.</F> sacred to शिव. <F>2:  M. १८१. २८.</F>
--superior to महादानस् and महा- यज्ञस्. Br. IV. ४३. ५७.
--foresters? ruled for ५२ years. M. २७३. २३.
--he who came out of the पाश of ललिता rode on a superior horse. Br. IV. १६. १४ and २९.

--(श्रीनगर) the city of ललिता: built by विश्वकर्मन् and Maya; in the षोडशक्षेत्र madhya: Of this nine were bhauma and the seven waters: It is called कामेश्वरीपुरी, भयमलीपुरि, Nityaklinnapuri: surround- ed by ब्रह्मा, विष्णु and शिव lokas: seven प्राकारस्, all of metal. Br. IV. ३०. १०६-7; ३१. 1, १०६; ३२. 1-१०.
--a देवी in चिन्तामणि gr2ha. Br. IV. ३६. २६.
--a son of कृष्ण and सत्यभामा. भा. X. ६१. ११. [पगे३-483+ २७]
--on the Geyacakra. Br. IV. १९. ७४.
--produced by the great sage व्यास; taught by him to शुक who narrated it to परीक्षित्, when सूत heard it. भा. I. 1. 2; 3. ४०-44.
--a son of कृष्ण, ruled for १० years. M. २७३. 3.
--in the चिन्तामणि gr2ha. Br. IV. ३६. २६.
(I)--the most celebrated among the नीपस्. M. ४९. ५३.
(II)--a son of आप, the Vasava. M. २०३. 6.
--the manifestation of Hari in the epoch of the tenth Manu: born of विश्वस्र्क्. भा. VIII. १३. २१[1].
--visited by बलराम; <F>1:  भा. X. ७९. १४.</F> sacred to पितृस्. <F>2:  M. २२. ४४.</F>
--the jewel of कृष्ण; <F>1:  वा. ९६. २०४.</F> of पौण्डरीक Va1sudeva. <F>2:  Vi. V. ३४. १७.</F>
--a bilvavanam east of श्(r)ईसरस्; served by the Gandharvas, Kinnaras, यक्षस्, Siddhas; the residence of श्री. वा. ३७. १३-15. [पगे३-484+ ३१]
--is ललिता. Br. IV. १३. 4.
--near the चीत्रकूट hill fit for श्राद्ध. <F>1:  Br. III. १३. ३८.</F> <F>2:  वा. ७७. ३८.</F>
--a palace; see Padmaka. M. २६९. ४४.
--a son of कृष्ण, and father of पौर्ण- मास: ruled for ५६ years. भा. XII. 1. २३; Br. III. ७४. १६२.
--in honour of श्री; <F>1:  Br. IV. 9. ७७; Vi. I. 9. १०१.</F> to be uttered when found- ing temples. <F>2:  M. २६५. २४.</F>

--a Mt in भारत vars2a, sacred to शिव. रुक्मी addressed himself to this god: visited by बलराम; <F>1:  भा. V. १९. १६; X. ६१. २३[1]; ७९. १३.</F> sacred to ललितापीठ; <F>2:  Br. IV. ४४. ९८.</F> sacred to Goddess महादेवी and the पितृस्; <F>3:  M. १३. ३१; २२. ४३.</F> a part of the burning Tripura fell there. <F>4:  Ib. १८८. ७९.</F>
--Candra (s.v.) arising out of Atri's eyes: २७ naks2atras being his शक्तिस्. Br. IV. ३५. ५४-5.
(I)--a son of Bhagiratha (Suhotra-वि। प्।) and father of नाभ(ga). भा. IX. 9. १६; Br. III. ६३. १६९; वा. ८८. १६०; Vi. IV. 4. ३६.
(II)--a son of सुभाषण, and father of Jaya. भा. IX. १३. २५. [पगे३-485+ २६]
(III)--a son of कृष्ण and कालिन्दी. भा. X. ६१. १४.
(IV)--a son of मेधा. Br. II. 9. ५९; वा. १०. ३५.
(V)--a son of स्वारोचिष Manu. Br. II. ३६. १९.
(VI)--a son of Suvarca. वा. ८९. २१.
--a learned पुराण reader. वा. ९९. ४१७.

--८००० in number, are born again and again and take up the arrangement of the शम्हितास्; <F>1:  Br. II. ३३. 2; ३५. १४६; M. १४५. ८८.</F> remembered ८८,000 सम्हितास् which return again and again. <F>2:  वा. ५९. ८६; ६१. १२२.</F>
(I)--a son of Sahadeva and द्रौपदी. भा. IX. २२. ३०; M. ५०. ५२; Vi. IV. २०. ४२.
(II)--a son of छाया and मार्ताण्ड (sun); became later शनैश्चर. Br. III. ५९. ४८; वा. ८४. ५०.
(I)--a son of Arjuna and द्रौपदी. भा. IX. २२. २९; M. ५०. ५२; Vi. IV. २०. ४२.

(II)--a daughter of Sura <F>1:  Br. III. ७१. १५० & ५७;</F> (शूर and भोजा- म्। प्।) and queen of धृष्टकेतु Kaikeya; a paternal aunt of कृष्ण, and mother of भद्रा, married to कृष्ण; also [पगे३-486+ २७] mother of Anuvrata (सन्तर्दना-वि। प्।) besides four other sons; a विरमाता. <F>2:  भा. IX. २४. ३० and ३८; X. ५८. ५६; M. ४६. 4-5; वा. ९६. १४९; १५६. 7; Vi. IV. १४. ३१, ४१-2.</F>

(I)--a Brahman follower of कृष्ण; knew his yoga power; lived as householder in मिथिला, earning bread for the day and contented; was visited by कृष्ण and was happy at the honour done to him. भा. I. १४. ३२; II. 7. ४५; X. ७८. [९५ (v) 1]; ८६. १३ to ५७.
(II)--a siddha; attacked the Asura followers of Bali. भा. VI. १५. १५; VIII. २१. १७; X. ८६. १३.
(III)--a son of कृष्ण. भा. X. ९०. ३४.

--a daughter of शूर; a sister of Vasudeva; wife of वृद्धशमन् Ka1ru1s2a (वृद्धधर्म, the कारूश king-वि। प्।) mother of Dantavaktra (the great Asura). भा. IV. २४. ३० and ३७; Br. III. ७१; १५० and १५६; वा. ९६. १४९, १५५; Vi. IV. १४. ३१, ३९, ४०.
--a daughter of Devaka and one of the seven wives of Vasudeva. M. ४४. ७३.
--the companion who followed Puramjana to Uttara and दक्षिण Pa1n5ca1la; allegorically, the hearing. भा. IV. २५. ५०-51; २९. १३.
--a class of people in शाल्मलिद्वीप. भा. V. २०. ११. [पगे३-487+ ३०]
(I)--a son of सत्यायु. भा. IX. १५. 2.
(II)--a बृहद्रथ; ruled for २४ years. Br. III. ७४. ११४.
(III)--ruled for ४० years. M. २७१. २३; वा. ९९. ३००.
--a minister of भण्ड. Br. IV. १२. ५३.
--a R. in कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १५.
(I)--a son of सोमापी; <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. 9.</F> ruled for ६७ years; <F>2:  Br. III. ७४. १११.</F> father of अयुतायु. <F>3:  Vi. IV. २३. 4.</F>
(II)--a son of मार्जारि, and father of Ayu- तायु. भा. IX. २२. ४६.

(III)--a daughter of शूर and भोजा; <F>1:  M. ४६. 4, 6.</F> a sister of Vasudeva and queen of दमघोष, the Cedi king; <F>2:  भा. IX. २४. ३० and ३९; Br. III. ७१. १५० and १५८; Vi. IV. १४. ३१, ४४-5.</F> mother of शिसुपाल; a वीरमाता. <F>3:  वा. ९६. १४९, १५७-8.</F>
(IV)--a son of छाया and the Sun god; was सावर्णि Manu. Br. III. ५९. ४८; वा. ८४. ५०.
(V)--a son of Somavit. M. ५०. ३४. [पगे३-488+ २४]

(VI)--(मागध) in the line of सोमाधि (तस्यान्वय) ruled for ६४ years; this gap between सोमाधि and श्रुतश्रवस् seems to account for the discrepancy be- tween the names given and the total No. ३२ of the kings. M. २७१. २०; वा. ९९. २२८, २९७.
(I)--a son of शत्रुघ्न. भा. IX. ११. १२.
(II)--a son of भीम and द्रौपदी. भा. IX. २२. २९; M. ५०. ५२; Vi. IV. २०. ४२.
(III)--a son of परीक्षित्. भा. IX. २२. ३५; Vi. IV. २०. 1; २१. 3.
--a daughter of शूर and भोजा, wife of कृत, and mother of सुग्रीव. M. ४६. 4-5.
--a son of Nakula by द्रौपदी. Vi. IV. २०. ४२.
(I)--a son of अरिष्टनेमि and father of सुपार्- श्व(ka). भा. IX. १३. २३; Vi. IV. 5. ३१.
(II)--a son of पुरूरवस् and ऊर्वशी. Father of Vasumat. भा. IX. १५. 1 and 2; Br. III. ६६. २३; Vi. IV. 7. 1.
(III)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३६. [पगे३-489+ ३०]
(IV)--a son of भानुश्चन्द्र, was slain in the भारत battle. M. १२. ५५.
--a son of जाम्बवान्. Br. III. 7. ३०३.

(I)--the Vedas: interpreted in two ways in the द्वापर; <F>1:  Br. II. ३१. 6, ७२; ३२, ३५; IV. 6. ६४; M. ५२. १२; १४४. 7; वा. ३४. ९५; ३९. ११; ४१. ९०; ५५. 7; ६१. ७५; ७६. 3; १००. ३३; १०१. 9, २२, ५७.</F> the same, ऋग्, Yajus, and साम in every manvan- tara though in different redactions; here are four stotras-- Dravyastotram, गुणस्तोत्रम्, Karmastotram, and Abhi- janastotram; above all these is Brahmastotram; mantras were originally five fold; <F>2:  M. १४५. ५८-63.</F> having learnt the श्रौत from their predecessors the seven sages repeated the same. <F>3:  वा. 3. 8; ३२. ४४; ५९. ३१.</F>
(II)--a son of Uttama Manu. Br. II. ३६. ४०.
(III)--a daughter of अनसूया and mother of शन्खपदा, wife of Kardama, Pulaha प्रजापति. वा. २८. १८, २७; Br. II. ११. २२.
--awaken the Lord sleeping after a pralaya, as bards the emperor from his bed. श्रुतिगीता on the greatness and glory of Lord. भा. V. ८७. 1, १२-41; XI. 5. 5.
--a ऋत्विक् at ब्रह्मा's sacrifice. वा. १०६. ३५.
--one of भण्ड's eight men. Br. IV. १२. १२. [पगे३-490+ २६]
--a deva. Br. II. १३. ९६.
--a son of Somapa; the last of the मागधस्. Vi. IV. १९. ८४-5.
--a Mt. range to the north of इलावृत; a boundary limit of Kuru; from it descends the stream भद्रा. भा. V. १६. 8; १७. 8.
--military republics; <F>1:  M. २७३. ६८.</F> treated with respect by पृथु; help kings. <F>2:  भा. IV. १७. 2; Br. III. 7. २६४.</F>
--leads to शिव, salvation. M. १०१. ७०.
--a सुधामान god. Br. II. ३६. २८.
--a R. of the भारतवर्ष. वा. ४५. १००.
--the यक्ष presiding over the month, Nabha. भा. XII. ११. ३७.
--a god of आद्य group. Br. II. ३६. ६९.
--the three गुणस्, satva, rajas and tamas revolve round and round among all worldly creatures. वा. १०२. ५६.
--guides the month of Nabhas. भा. XII. ११. ३७.
--eligible for पार्वण s4ra1ddha, as also his son. M. १६. 8; १०५. १७; Vi. III. १५. 2.
--from श्रवण--to hear or heard; principally of the sacrifice and Veda. वा. ५९. ३८.
--an आर्षेय Pravara of the भार्गवस्. M. १९५. ३८.

and स्मार्त--promulgated by the seven sages and Manu at the commencement of the त्रेता yuga; <F>1:  Br. II. २९. ४४-51; ३२. ३३-5.</F> two-fold, धाराग्निहोत्रसम्बन्धम् said in four days; hearing is श्रौत; <F>2:  Ib. II. ३२. ३३-5, ४३, ४४; III. २१. ४७.</F> lost in अराजक; <F>3:  Ib. II. ३१. ९५.</F> the श्रुत consists of mar- riage, agnihotra, and Vedic studies; this is according to the Sapta ऋषिस्. <F>4:  वा. ५७. ३९-40.</F>

--commences with त्रेतायुग; originally told by seven sages; <F>1:  M. १४२. ४०.</F> it is called ज्ञानधर्म; characteristics [पगे३-492+ ३२] of; the one deals with sacrifices and the other with Var- णाश्रम; <F>2:  Ib. १४४. ९६; १४५. २२, ३०-31, ४०.</F> is lost towards the close of Kali (in Kali). <F>3:  Ib. २७३. ४६; Vi. IV. २४. ९८.</F>
--a kind of hell. वा. १०१. १४९.

--चण्डालस्; with minds controlled and resign- ed to Hari are better than Brahmans not devoted to God; were honoured by कृष्ण; become pure by bhakti (also श्वाद s.v.); <F>1:  भा. I. ११. २२; VII. 9. १०; XI. १४. २१.</F> meat eaters with whom Satyavrata-त्रिशन्कु lived. <F>2:  Br. III. ६३. ८१; वा. ८८. ८२.</F>

--a son of वृष्णि; elder brother of Citraka; married गान्दिनी, daughter of a काशी king. अक्रूर was the foremost of his twelve sons. काशी, not visited by rains for long had a heavy shower just at his marriage, and during his stay at the invitation of the काशी king, whose daughter he married. A righteous king in whose kingdom there was neither famine nor disease. भा. III. 1. ३२; IX. २४. १५; X. ३८. २४; ५७. ३२; XI. १२. १०; Br. III. ७१, १०२; Vi. IV. १३. ११५-16; १५. 5-7.

--a hell; the abode of Vratins and Brahma- चारिन्स् with an uncontrolled body, taught and disciplined by sons, and ब्रह्मचारिस् that sleep during day time. Br. IV. 2. १४९, १७६; वा. १०१. १४८, १७३; Vi. II. 6. 5 and २९.
--the country of, watered by नलिनी. Br. II. १८. ६०.
--a दानव. Br. III. 6. १२.
--a nephew of हिरण्यकशिपु. M. 6. २७.
--unfit to be seen during a श्राद्ध; touching it is a sin. Br. III. १४. ४८; ७८, ८८; २७. १५; Vi. III. १६. १२.
--a sage of the epoch of Bhautya Manu. Br. IV. 1. ११४.
--a son of ब्रह्मधान. Br. III. 7. ९८.
--(also श्वपच)--see श्वपाकस्. भा. III ३३. 6 and 7.
--a Rudra on the षोडश cakra. Br. IV. ३४. २६.
--oblation to dogs; स्याम and शबल. वा. १११. ३९.
--the Asura whose city is in Tatvalam. Br. II. २०. १८.
--in the first tala of the Atalam. वा. ५०. १७.
--a son of वृजिनिवत, and father of रुशकु. भा. IX. २३. ३१. [पगे३-494+ ३०]

(I)--(वर्षपर्वत) a Mt. range to the north of इलावृत, and a boundary limit of हिरण्मय; residence of Daityas and दानवस्; centres round the Kumuda hill of शाल्मलिद्वीपम्; for Asuras. भा. V. १६. 8; Br. II. 1. ६९; II. १५. २२ and २८; १७. ३५; २०. ५२; III. 7. १९४; M. ११३. २३, ८४; १४४. ५७; वा. 1. ८५; ४२. ६८; ४५. 2; ४६. ३५. ४९. ३९; ५०. ५०.
(II)--a chief नाग of पाताल; <F>1:  भा. V. २४. ३१.</F> with the sun in आवणि and पुरट्टाशि. <F>2:  Br. II. २३. १०; वा. ५२. ११.</F>
(III)--a son of वपुष्मत् after whom came the श्वेतदेश. Br. II. १४. ३२-3; वा. ३३. २८; Vi. II. 4. २३, २९.
(IV)--a son of देवजनी and a यक्ष. Br. III. 7. १२८.
(VI)--a son of Vipracitta the दानव in the तार- कामय war. M. १७३. १९; १७७. 7.

(VII)--the form of a great seer which शिव as- sumes at the end of the four Yugas of the Kalpa; (वाराह) in the Chagala hillock of the हिमालयस्; <F>1:  वा. २३. ११५.</F> the अवतार् of the २३र्द् dva1para in the कलञ्जर hill. <F>2:  Ib. २३. २०३-4.</F>
(VIII)--one of the four Vedic disciples of श्वेत, an अवतार् of the Lord शिव. वा. २३. ११७. [पगे३-495+ ३०]
(IX)--a son of मणिवर. वा. ६९. १५९.
(X)--a ऋत्विक् at ब्रह्मा's sacrifice. वा. १०६. ३६.
(XI)--a division of जम्बूद्विप. Vi. II. 1. २१. 2. ११.

--the first kalpa; explained in the वायव्य पुराण; <F>1:  M. २९०. 3; ५३. १८.</F> धर्मवृता performed tapas in and became turned to a stone; <F>2:  वा. १०७. 6.</F> वाराह in; <F>3:  Ib. १०५. 7; १०६. ३२; १०९. ३५.</F> शिव takes the अवतार् of Sad- योजात, all white, when गायत्री also is born with him. <F>4:  Ib. २३. ६३.</F>
(I)--a मध्यमाध्वर्यु. Br. II. ३३. १६.
(II)--a son of लान्गलि, an अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. २००.
--a god of प्रसूत group. Br. II. ३६. ७०.
--sacred to Hari, visited by नारद. भा. VIII. 4. १८; X. 6. २४; ८७. १०; XI. १५. १८.
--burnt by शिव's anger and reattained divi- nity with Cupid. M. १९१. ११२.
--a region of शाल्मलिद्वीप adjoining the Kumuda hill; <F>1:  Br. II. १९. ४४.</F> the kingdom of हिरण्वान्. <F>2:  Ib. II. १४. ५०; १५. ३४; १९. ४४.</F> [पगे३-496+ २७]
--a son of हृदिक. Br. III. ७१. १४.
(I)--२९थ् kalpa; out of contemplation of ब्रह्मा came into being कुमार along with seers known as श्वेतस्, disciple of ब्रह्मा, Sunanda, etc., besides the great sage श्वेत. वा. २२. 9-२०.
(II)--a disciple of श्वेत अवतार् of शिव. वा. २३. ११७.
--a Kulaparvata of the भद्राश्व. वा. ४३. १४.
(II)--a son of राजाधिदेव. M. ४४. ७८.
(I)--a पराशर clan; a dynasty of kings. Br. III. 8. ९५; ७४. २६८; वा. ७०. ८९; ७३. ६२.
(II)--the sages who sprang out of the side of कुमार (देवेश) in the २९थ् Kalpa. वा. २२. १५.
(III)--a Janapada of the केतुमाला. वा. ४४. ११; ९९. ४५५.
(I)--a daughter of क्रोधवशा (क्रोधा-वा। प्।) and wife of Pulaha; mother of वानरस्; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. १७२, १८०-203; वा. ६९. २०५.</F> mother of four Diggajas. <F>2:  वा. ६९. २१४.</F> [पगे३-497+ ११]
(II)--a daughter of बृहति. Br. III. 7. २५६; वा. ९६. २४७.
--a Janapada of the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. ११.
--a class of gods doing श्राद्ध. Br. III. १०. १०९.
--one of the four learned Brahman disciples of श्वेत. वा. २३. ११७.
--a Mt. on the south of the मानस. वा. ३६. २३; ३९. ५६; ४२. ३०. [पगे३-498+ २६]
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८७.
--a Vindhya tribe. Br. II. १६. ६५.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८७.
--मरीचि, Kratu, Atri, Pulastya, Pulaha, and Vasumat or वसिष्ठ; these are known as प्रजापतिस् as they are concerned with the increase of सन्तान to the world. वा. ६५. ४३-48.
--on the other side of the Vindhyas. वा. ४५. १३३.
--the six limbs of the state including the king who must protect it with great care. M. २२०. २१; वा. ३०. २९३; ९९. ३९.
--one versed in the six supplementary sciences of the Vedas, fit for श्राद्ध. Vi. III. १५. 2.
--a king to be expert in. Br. IV. २१. ५३.
--born out of the left side of the belly of उमा; <F>1:  Br. IV. ३०. १०१; M. १५८. ४८-49; १६०. २३.</F> born at शरवण in कैलास. <F>2:  वा. ४१. ३७.</F> [पगे३-499+ ३१]
--the sixteenth kalpa; the sages, called षड्जनस्. वा. २१. ३४.
--a particular scale (music); <F>1:  वा. २१. ३७; ८६. ३९; ८७. २८.</F> fourteen kinds of. <F>2:  Ib. ८६. ४९; Vi. II. १४. ३२.</F>
--sages of the sixteenth kalpa; with these was born महेश्वर. वा. २१. ३४.
(I)--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८७.
(II)--an elephant. वा. ६९. २२१.
--ब्राह्मम्, शैवम्, वैष्णवम्, Sauram, शाक्तम् and आर्हतम्. वा. १०४. १६.

--the asura; also शण्ड, brother of Marka; one of the disciples of शुक्र. The Asuras were experts in the magic of warfare and hence Devas won them over by offer- ing a graha to them in the sacrifices; thus the Asuras were defeated. Br. III. ७२. ७२, ८७; ७३. ६३-4; वा. ९७. ७२ and ८६; ९८. ६३; १०८. ६०.

(I)--(कुमार); anecdotes of, in the स्कान्- दपुराण; <F>1:  Br. III. १०. ४२; M. ५३. ४२.</F> a leader in the battle of Tripuram; <F>2:  Ib. १३६. ६८; १३७. ३२; १५९. 3; १६०. ११ and २८.</F> all the wives [पगे३-500+ २८] of the seven seers except अरुन्धती served कुमार as mothers. Hence the six-faced. <F>3:  वा. ७२. ४०.</F>
(II)--a name of विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ६८.
--one-sixth of their merit the Brahmans give to righteous kings. भा. V. १५. ११.
--sacred to ललिता pi1t2ha. Br. IV. ४४. ९८.
--the six-fold policy of kings. M. २१५. १६.
--here were sixteen शक्तिस् beginning with दिनमिश्रा; another group of १६ s4aktis commencing with कला is also said to reside here; these were also attached to महाकाल. Br. IV. ३२. ११; १४-16, १९.
--a temple in different shapes; with shining towers. M. २६९. २९, ३४, ३९.
--by giving सर्पि in the श्राद्ध. वा. ७९. ११.
(I)--born from the eastern face of ब्रह्मा. भा. III. १२. ४०.
(II)--the waxing and waning of the moon. वा. ५२. ७०.
--of ललिता; with nine hills and seven seas. Br. IV. ३१. १०-19. [पगे३-501+ २९]
--gave birth to a class of पिशाचस् by name adho- mukhas--fearful, hairy, cannibals, etc. वा. ६९. २६६-7.
--one of the sons of Sagara that survived Kapila's tejas. वा. ८८. १४९.
--belonging to लोकाक्षी. वा. ६१. ३७.
--a pupil of लौगाक्षी. Br. II. ३५. ४१.
--the flour of grain not to be taken during nights. M. १३१. ४३.

--a son of बाहु, (Phalgutantra) born with गर (poison) administered to his mother by the co-wives of her husband and after 7 years' stay in his mother's womb; brought up by sage Aurva; केशिनी was one of his queens and सुमती was another. प्रभा, and भानुमती, mother of Asamanjasa were also his queens. Father of Asamanjasa who was abandoned by his father for misconduct. A Cakravarti. His sons ६०,000 in number by Sumati, excavated the sea and dug all over the earth in their search for the consecrated horse. Helped by Aurva, he propi- tiated Hari with sacrifices. Once Indra stole his sacrificial horse, and this was discovered near Kapila's hermitage in the N. E. by his sons who imputed the theft to the sage. The latter burnt them to ashes. But अम्शुमत्, son of Asaman- jasa got back the horse, and enabled his grandfather to com- plete the sacrifice. Anointed अम्शुमत् on the throne in the [पगे३-502+ ३८] presence of पौरजानपद and devoted himself to attaining salvation through the path prescribed by Aurva. Greed for more territory; conquered तालजन्घस्, Yavanas, शकस्, Haihayas and Barbaras. On the advice of his guru, वसिष्ठ, he spared their lives but punished them by disfiguring them-- some wholly shaven, and some half-shaven. They became ancestors of Mlecchas and व्रात्यस्. <F>1:  भा. IX. 8 (whole); X. ४१. १५: XII. 3. 9: Br. III. ५२. ३७ Chh. ५३ and ५४ (whole) ५५. २२: ५८. ३७. Vi. III. 8. 3: १७. 1: वी. IV. 3. ३५-41: 4. 1-२९, ३२. ६३. १२१-151: M. १२. ३९-43.</F> Realised the yoga power of Hari. <F>2:  भा. II. 7. ४४.</F> Addressed by him वसिष्ठ narrated the story of परशुराम. In the case of Haihayas, he conquered the king and burnt the city. When he invaded the Vidarbhas, its king sought alliance by offering his daughter in marriage; was honoured by शुरसेनस् and यादवस्. <F>3:  Br. III. ३१. 1: ४७. ९३-100: Chh. ४८ (whole).</F> During his rule, nowhere was heard राज s4abdha; ruled like Dharma himself, maintained castes and orders, earned the title of अष्टमण्डल्- आधिपति; had an erudite assembly. <F>4:  Ib. III. Chh. ४९-51.</F> The jewel of the solar race. सुमती brought forth a mass of flesh which ulti- mately through the blessings of Aurva was converted into ६०,000 sons.
