--the sons of Sagara who created eight extra countries (उपद्वीपस्) near जम्बूद्वीप, when they dug up the earth in search of their father's sacrificial horse; <F>1:  भा. V. १९-29-३०.</F> purified by the Ganges. <F>2:  Vi. II. 8. ११५.</F>
--the son of Kakubha and Dharma. Father of कीकट. भा. VI. 6. 6.

(I)--the fourth form of Hari worshipped by शिव in इलावृत; another name of Ananta; the ruler of अहम्कार. A god of one thousand heads presiding over भूतस्; by his fire was burnt the three worlds; his greatness; [पगे३-503+ ३५] मन्त्र in honour of; Lord of serpents. <F>1:  भा I. 5. ३७: V. १७. १६: २५. 1: IV. २४. ३५: III. २६. २५: १९. २९. V. २५ (whole) VI. १५. २७-8: १६. १८: M. 2. 5: ९३. ५१: २४८. ४७: २७६. 8.</F> कृष्ण, one of the वम्शवीरस्. <F>2:  Br. III. ३६. ५१: ७२. 1: वा 97. 1: १११. २१.</F>

(II)--बलराम and Balabhadra; <F>1:  भा X. 2. १३: 8. १२: १५. १०: ४०. २१: ४१. ३९: ५०. १२: ८९. ३१, ३३: Vi. IV. १५. २९: V. १८. ५८: ३७. २५.</F> the seventh conception of देवकी, transferred to रोःइणी; a por- tion of शेष, an अम्श of God विष्णु; a great hero, white in complexion, like a mountain in size. <F>2:  Ib. V. 1. ७३-6: भा. IX. २४. ५४, ६०:</F> killed Dhenuka; <F>3:  Vi. V. 8. 5.</F> killed Pralamba; <F>4:  Ib. V. 9. १६.</F> taught the भागवत to सनत्कुमार. <F>5:  भा. III. 8. 3.</F>
--a follower of माया. M. १७९. ६९.
(I)--a son of सम्कल्पा and Dharma; father of काम. भा. VI. 6. १०: Br. III. 3. ३३; M. 5. १९: २०३. १०: वा. ६६. ३४. Vi. I. १५. १०८.
(II)--created by ब्रह्मा. Br. II. 5. ७३.
(III)--one of the two वृत्तिस् of mahat. वा. 4. ४६.
--a daughter of दक्ष, and one of Dharma's ten wives; mother of Samkalpa or pious determination. भा. VI. 6. 4 and १०: Br. III. 3. 3 and ३३. M. 5. १६, १९: २०३. १०: वा. ६६. 3: Vi. I. १५. १०५, १०८.
--a son of Abhramu elephant, the vehicle of Yama; (also अञ्जन) a Diggaja; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. ३३०: वा. ६९. २१५.</F> a नाग with the sun in the spring. <F>2:  Ib. ५२. 3.</F> [पगे३-504+ २६]
--a वैश्य mantrakr2t. Br. II. ३२. १२१. M. १४५. ११६.
--a device to determine the time of the day. वा. ६६. ४२.
(I)--a son of Jayasena, and father of Jaya. भा. IX. १७. १८.
(II)--a son of Nara, (Nagara-वि। प्।) and father of two sons Guru (गुरुप्रीति-वि। प्।) Rantideva. भा. IX. २१. 1-2: M. ४९. ३६. Vi. IV. १९. २२.
(III)--an Angirasa and मन्त्रकृत्; a क्षत्रो- peta dvija. Br. II. ३२. १०७: III. ६६. ८६. M. १४५. १०१: वा. ९१. ११५.
(IV)--a son of जाम्बवत्. Br. III. 7. ३०२.
(V)--a son of Jayatsena and father of कृत dharman (क्षत्रधर्म-वि। प्।). Br. III. ६८. १०: वा. ९३. १०: Vi. IV. 9. २७.
(VI)--a Pravara; no marital relations with Angiras and गौरवीतिस्. M. १९६, ३०.
--is ललिता. Br. IV. १७. १८.
--in the ayana of विषु; worship of the sun; can be done every year and every month. M. ९८. 1-१५. [पगे३-505+ २५]
--a son of Upasanga. M. ४७. २२.
--a son of मणिभद्र. वा. ६९. १५५.
--experts in the calculations of the calendar. M. १४२. १५: वा. ७०. ४६: १०१. ९७, १२५.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३८.
--a son of सुयशस्, and father of शालिशूक. भा. XII. 1. १४.
--the period from six to twelve नालिकस् in the day. वा. ५६. ४६.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २१.
--a तीर्थ on the south bank of the नर्मदा. M. १९१. ५५, ७४.
--(also गीत yogini1); a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १७. ३३: १९. ६२.
--in the गयाशिला. वा. १०८. ४८.
--a muhurta of the night. Br. III. 3. ४३: वा. ६६. ४४.
--the most horrible war and तारकामय in the fifth अवतार्। वा. ९७. ७४.
(I)--a son of भद्रा; fought with Subha- dra at प्रभास. भा. X. ६१. १७: XI. ३०. १६.
(II)--a son of कृष्ण and सुदेवी, a daughter of king शैब्य. Br. III. ७१. २५१: Vi. V. ३२. 3.
(III)--one of the sons of सुदेवी and विष्- vaksena. वा. ९६. २४२.
--ministers, consulted by तारक before his war with the devas; <F>1:  M. १४८. ३१.</F> of a State. <F>2:  Ib. २१६. २५.</F>

--इन्द्राणी, took सत्यभामा as a human being and did not accord her due treatment; did not wish to part with पारिजात which Satya wanted; induced Indra to fight कृष्ण who was taking the पारिजात. Vi. V. ३०. २९ and ५२.
--see Indra; got कृष्ण's promise of protection to Arjuna. Vi. V. १२. १५; १२. १६-20, २४. [पगे३-507+ २९]
--आर्षेयप्रवर (Angiras). M. १९६. 8.
--one of the names in the first marut गण. वा. ६७. १२३.
(I)--also called सूत; addressed as गावल्गण by युधिष्ठिर, was not able to tell him where धृतराष्ट्र had gone; welcomed Vidura. भा. I. १३. 3, ३१-32.
(II)--the son of रणम्जय, and father of शाक्य. भा. IX. १२. १३-14.
(III)--a son of Prati, and father of Jaya. भा. IX. १७, १६.
(IV)--a son of भर्म्याश्व. भा. IX. २१. ३२.
(V)--a son of सात्यकि, and father of कुणि. Vi. IV. १४. 3.
--known to शुक्र. By this Bali was restored to life. भा. VIII. ११. ४७-48.
--a son of भद्राश्व. M. ४९. 6.
--a पृथुक god. Br. II. ३६. ७३.
--a son of ऊर्जवाह. वा. ८९. २०.

(I)--(ललिता) a daughter of दक्ष, and wife of Bhava or शिव; <F>1:  भा III. १४. ३५ Va1. 1. ७०: Vi. I. 7. २५-6:</F> see पार्वती; expressed a desire to attend her [पगे३-508+ ३३] father's sacrifice to which शिव was not invited. Permitted to go, she went home but was not welcomed by her father. Seeing the insult offered to her husband who was denied the share due to him, she cast off her body by yoga. Born as daughter of Mena. <F>2:  भा. IV. 1. ६५-66: 2. 1-3: 3. 5-२५; 4 (whole): 7. ५८ and ६२: M. १३. १४-16: वा. १०. २७: ३०. ४१-75:</F> Drank the सौभाग्य which came in a blaze from Hari's chest <F>3:  M. ६०. १०.</F> became उमा, daughter of the King of the हिमालयस् and married Rudra (Bhava). <F>4:  Ib. १५४. ६०, ६९: १५६. १५: वा. 9. ५२. ५४, ६९. ४५-77. ७१. 2; Vi. I. 8. १२-14.</F>
(II)--a wife of Angiras, and mother of Atharvan- giras; met by Citraketu. भा. VI. 6. १९: १७. १६.
(III)--same as सुकुमारी. M. १२२. ३१.
--a R. in भारतवर्ष. वा. ४५. ९७.
--a son of धृतव्रत, and father of Adhi- ratha. भा. IX. २३. १२.
--a wife of महायश. M. ४९. ३७.
--the father of बृहद्भानु. भा. VIII. १३. ३५.

(I)--(Brahmaloka) see Satyaloka, one of the heavenly worlds above it, नीरालोक; six crores of yojanas above Tapoloka; <F>1:  भा. II. 1. २८: M. १८४. २३: २४८. २०: वा. १००. १९१: १०१. १८. २७, ३९, १४१, २०८.</F> residents of, do not return. <F>2:  वा. १०१. २७.</F> [पगे३-509+ २४]
(II)--a son of हविर्धान. भा. IV. २४. 8.
(III)--a sage of the epoch of the Tenth Manu. भा. VIII. १३. २२: Vi. III. 2. २७.
(IV)--a सुधामान god; <F>1:  Br. II. ३६. २७.</F> the name of विष्णु born from सत्या in the Uttama epoch. <F>2:  Ib. III. 3. ११५.</F>
(V)--a तुषित in the स्वारोचिष and Nara in the चाक्षुष epochs. Br. III. 3. १५.
(VII)--a Marut of the first गण. Br. III. 5. ९१.
(VIII)--an अमीताभ god. Br. IV. 1. १७: वा 100. १७.
(IX)--a son of Angirasa. M. १९६. 2: वा. ६५. १०५.
(X)--a son of देवापि, king of Ailas; will restore क्षत्रिय supremacy in the future caturyuga. M. २७३. ५८.
(XI)--the name of व्यास in the second द्वापर. वा. २३. ११९. [पगे३-510+ २८]
(XII)--one of the names for the third marut गण. वा. ६७. १२६.
(XIII)--a राजऋषि becoming a Brahman. वा. ९१. ११६.
(XIV)--a sage of the IX epoch of Manu. Vi. III, 2. २३.
(XV)--a son of सारण. Vi. IV. १५. २१.
--a group of twelve Gods of the Uttama epoch; <F>1:  Vi. III. 1. १४.</F> also of तामस. <F>2:  Ib. III. 1. १६.</F>

(I)--a son of (Chi) शिनि, and father of Yuyu- धान or सात्यकि. <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. १३-14: वा. ९६. ९९: Vi. IV. १४. 2.</F> Married the daughter of the king of काशि and had four sons--Kukura, भजमान, Suci and Kambala- barhis. <F>2:  Br. III. ७१. १०० and ११६. वा. ९६. ११५.</F> Father of Satyaki. <F>3:  M. ४५. २२.</F>
(II)--a son of कृष्ण and भद्रा. भा. X. ६१. १७.
(III)--a son of Raivata Manu. Br. II. ३६. ६३: Vi. III. 1. २३.
--gods of तामस epoch. भा. VIII. 1. २८.
(II)--the son of धृतव्रत, and father of Atiratha. वा. ९९. ११७: Vi. IV. १८. २६-7.
(I)--a son of Dharmaketu, and father of धृष्टकेतु (Vibhu-ब्र्। प्। and वि। प्।); a महारथ. भा. IX. १७. 8-9: Br. III. ६७. ७५: वा. ९२. ७०: Vi. IV, 8. २०.
(II)--a sage of the X epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. २७.
(I)--the Indra of the Uttama epoch of Manu; aided Satyasena in getting rid of the wicked. भा. VIII. 1. २४ and २६.
(II)--son of Sunitha(ta), and father of विश्- vajit. भा. IX. २२. ४९: Vi. IV. २३. १०-11.
(III)--a son of आनक and कन्का. भा. IX. २४. ४१.
(IV)--the यक्ष presiding over the month of ऊर्ज; resides in the sun's chariot during the फाल्गुन (वि। प्।)। भा. XII. ११. ४४; Vi. II. १०. १८.
(V)--a Gandharva with the शिशिर sun. Br. II. २३. २३.
(VI)--a Marut of the second गण. Br. III. 5. ९३: वा. ६७. १२४.
(VII)--the ग्रामणि with the sun in माशि and Panguni. वा. ५२. २२. [पगे३-512+ २६]
(VIII)--ruled for ८३ years. वा. ९९. ३०७.
--a Marut of the first गण. Br. III. 5. ९१: वा. ६७. १२३.
--a son of Satyahita who taught him the ऋग् Samhita1 as he learnt from his father. Va. ६०. २९.
--a daughter of Devaka and one of the 7 wives of Vasudeva. M. ४४. ७३.
--a पृथुक god. Br. II. ३६. ७३.
--one of the ten sons of धर्मसावर्णि. भा. VIII. १३. २४.
(I)--the son of कृतिमत् (धृतिमत्), and father of धृढनेमी. भा. IX. २१. २७: M. ४९. ७० Va1. ९९. १८४: Vi. IV. १९. ४९.

(II)--a son of शतानन्द, versed in Dha- nurveda. Father of शरद्वान्; <F>1:  भा. IX. २१. ३५.</F> saw an apsaras and dropped his semen on the कुश bower; and it developed into twins--कृप and कृपि; king शन्तनु in his hunting expedi- tion saw them and brought them up. <F>2:  वा. ९९. २०२-04. Vi. IV. १९. ६४-8.</F>
(III)--a son of बलराम. Br. III. ७१. १६६. [पगे३-513+ ३६]
(IV)--a son of पुण्य. M. ५०. ३०.
--an आत्रेय and a sage of the Raivata epoch. Br. II. ११. २३: ३६. ६३: वा. २८. २०: ६२. ५४.

--(see सत्या) a daughter of सत्राजित् (भन्गकार-म्। प्।). The latter had mistakenly suspected कृष्ण of having murdered his brother, and to make amends, gave his daughter in marriage to कृष्ण though अक्रूर and others had sought her hand before. Mother of 6 sons and 4 daughters among whom were भानु and भौमरिका. Terrified at the murder of her father by <F>1:  भा. X. ५६. ३९-44: Br. III. ७१. ५७-80. वा. ९६. ५५-78, २३३: Vi. IV. १३. ७१. १५१, १५४. M. ४५-21: ४७-13-१९ Vi. IV, १३. ६४-6: ३२. 1.</F> शतधन्वन् (s.v.) she caused the dead body to be preserved in oil and went to हास्तिनपुरम् to inform कृष्ण. Saw Syamantaka with अक्रूर and coveted it. Welcomed to Indraprastha by द्रौपदी; <F>2:  भा. X. ५७. 7-8, ४१ [2]:</F> narrated to her the circumstances under which she married कृष्ण; <F>3:  Ib. X. ७१. ४२-3: ८३. 9, १४.</F> went with कृष्ण during his expedition to Naraka's city, and then to Indra's abode. Embraced and blessed by अदिती; complained to कृष्ण that इन्द्राणी did not accord her proper welcome and insisted on the पारिजात being taken to द्वारका. Defeated Kubera who attracted her husband and was praised by कृष्ण for her valour; <F>4:  Ib. X. ५९. 2; ३८-40 [६५ (v) 2, 9-१०], [२८-29], [६६ (v) ११-20]: Vi. IV. १५. ३५: V. २८. 5: २९. १४ and ३५, ३०. २६-7:</F> observed कल्याणिनि vratam; <F>5:  M. ६९. ६०.</F> took away the पारिजात; Indra fought for it but was defeated; सत्यभामा gave it back to him saying that she wanted to teach a lesson to इन्द्राणी; returned to द्वारका with the पारिजात presented by Indra. <F>6:  Vi. V. ३०. ३६ to end; ३१. ११.</F> [पगे३-514+ ३०]

(I)--one of the seven heavenly worlds; <F>1:  Br. II. १९. १५६: M. ६१. 1.</F> Brah- maloka, the 7th loka; equal to भूलोक in circumference; six crores of yojanas; in tapolokam; beyond is para and para at long distance; <F>2:  Br. IV. 2. १३, १६, २५, ३८, १४१, १४२-44.</F> those who go there do not return and are rid of the सम्सार wheel; <F>3:  Ib. IV. 2. ३७.</F> after residing for several years they get one with the deity नारायण. <F>4:  Ib. II. २१. २२: ३५. २०६-08.</F>
(II)--a god of आभूतरय group. Br. II. ३६. ५५.
--one of the names in the second Marut गण. वा. ६७. १२५.
--a god of the Sumedhasa group. Br. II. ३६. ५८.
--a R. in प्लक्षद्वीप. भा. V. २०. 4.
--the Kaikaya princess married to Satya(v)- rata. त्रिशन्कु son of हरिश्चन्द्र. Br. III. ६३. ११५: वा. ८८. ११७.
(I)--a son of Samaratha and father of Upa- guru. भा. IX. १३. २४.
(II)--a son of Citraratha. M. ४८. ९४.
(III)--a son Satyavrata. M. १२. ३७. [पगे३-515+ ३६]
--(Brahmaloka) the residence of ब्रह्मा see Satya; <F>1:  भा. II. 5. ३९: XI. २४. १४: वा. 7. ३०: ६१. १७७:</F> above Tapoloka. <F>2:  Vi. II. 7. १५.</F>

(I)--a wife of पराशर, and mother of व्यास; <F>1:  भा. II. 7. ३६: I. 3. २१: XII. 6. ४९: वा. 1. 2:</F> in her previous birth अच्छोदा the mind-born daugh- ter of the पितृस्; now born as a fisherwoman, of अद्रिका Matsya at the confluence of the गन्गा and the यमुना; <F>2:  Br. III. १०. ७३-4: M. १४. १९. वा. ७३. २१-2.</F> her son व्यास, compiled the १८ पुराणस् and the भारत। <F>3:  M. ५३. ७०.</F>

(II)--(see रूक) a daughter of गाधि and wife of sage ऋचीक. As the चरु intended for her was taken by her mother, she gave birth to an unrighteous son, and on her appeal the sage changed him to an unrighteous grandson. Mother of Jamadagni; she became converted into the river कौशिकी; other sons were शुनक्शेप and शुनह्पुच्छ; <F>1:  भा. IX. १५. 5-१२: Br. III. ६६. ३६-59: वा. ६५. ९३: ९१. ६६, ८५, ९२. Vi. IV. 7. १२, ३२, ३३-4.</F> com- pared to दक्षिणा in याग. <F>2:  Br. III. 1. ९६: २१. २२.</F>
(III)--a daughter of Kratu and daughter-in- law of पर्वश. Br. II. ११. ३८.

(IV)--the queen of शन्तनु and mother of विचित्रवीर्य and चित्रान्गद; <F>1:  Vi. IV. २०. ३४.</F> at her command कृष्णद्वै- पायन begot धृतराष्ट्र and पाण्डु on the widows of Vici- त्रवीर्य. <F>2:  Ib. IV. २०. ३८.</F>
--(Satyavat-भा। प्।) a son of Manu चाक्षुष. भा. IV. १३. १६.
--one of the nine sons of सावर्णि. वा. १००. २१.
--the goddess enshrined at मुकुट. M. १३. ५०.

(I)--a son of Dyumatsena and husband of सावित्री; went to the wood, fell unconscious with head-ache while cutting fuel; the God of Death appeared on the scene; सावित्री noticed him; see सावित्री. M. २०८. १२, २१०.
(II)--a son of Manu and नड्वला. Vi. I. १३. 5.

(I)--a राजऋषि of द्रविडदेश, born as the son of Vivasvat, the future Vaivasvata Manu; once when he was performing his ablutions a fish fell into his hands. He reared it in a jar and as it grew big it was left in a pond. It grew bigger and was taken to a number of lakes and rivers and finally to the sea. Addressed by the king the fish revealed his true form and warned him against the forth- coming deluge. During the floods Satyavrata, as directed by Matsya Hari, got with the sages, into the ark, creepers and plants and seeds and tied the ship to the horn of the fish. His praise of Hari; heard the मत्स्य पुराण सम्हिता from Hari and after the deluge became Vaivasvata Manu, (s.v.); <F>1:  भा. VIII. ch. २४ (whole): IX. 1. 2-3.</F> a महात्मा. <F>2:  Br. III. ११. ९२.</F>
(II)--a son of Tribandhana, celebrated as त्रिशन्कु (s.v.). भा. IX. 7. 5. [पगे३-517+ २९]

(III)--a son of त्रय्यारुणि (त्रय्यामुण- म्। प्।) who took to wife Vidarbha's queen; for this un- righteousness he was banished by his father to live with श्वापकस्; when his father went to the forest there was no shower for १२ years when Satyavrata performed austeri- ties and helped the sons and wives of विश्वामित्र in their livelihood; वसिष्ठ was in charge of the kingdom and did not invite him; enraged at this he killed his cow and fed विश्वामित्र's family; विश्वामित्र noticed three departures from dharma and called him त्रिशङ्कु; विश्वामित्र was pleased with his aid and took him to heaven with his earthly body to the wonder of even वसिष्ठ; his wife was Satya- व्रता and son हरिश्चन्द्र. Br. III. ६३, ७७-113: M. १२. ३७: वा. ८८. ७८-117. Vi. IV. 3. २१-4.
(I)--a class of people in शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २७.
(II)--sons of Dharma. भा. VIII. 1. २५.
(I)--a son of वीतिहोत्र and father of Uru- श्रवस्. भा. IX. 2. २०.
(II)--the eldest son of माण्डूकि, (Mar- कण्डेय-वा। प्।) initiated into the portion of the ऋग् Veda left to him by Indrapramati. Br. II. ३४. २९: वा. ६०. २८.
--a son of सत्यहिता (tara-वा। प्।); हद् three pupils शाकल्य, Rathitara and बाष्कलि (भरद्वाज); these in their turn hymned separate शाखस्। Br. II. ३४. ३०: वा. ६०. २९-31. [पगे३-518+ २७]
--the father of स्वधाम. भा. VIII. १३. २९.
--born of Dharma and सूनृता with the aid of Satyajit, he got rid of the wicked यक्षस्, राक्षसस् and others. भा. VIII. 1. २५-26.
--the अमात्य of Pramati. वा. ५८. ८९.
(I)--a son of ऋषभ, and father of पुष्पवान्. भा. IX. २२. 7.
(II)--a son of सत्यश्रवस् who taught him the ऋग् Samhita1 as he learnt it from his father. Br. II. ३४. २९: वा. ६०. २८.
(III)--a son of पुष्पवान् and father of Sudhanva. Vi. IV. १९. ८२.

--(जयादेवस्) the gods of the epoch of Uttama Manu; twelve in number; <F>1:  भा. VIII. 1. २४: Br. II. ३६. २७: III. 4. २९ and ३१८. वा. ६२, २४ and ३७: ६६. 8: ६७. ३७-8.</F> all sons of सत्या and Uttama. These are the यज्ञियस् of the तामस epoch. <F>2:  Br. II. ३६. ३६ and ४३.</F>
(I)--the mother of हृदीक-(भा। प्।)। भा. III. 1. ३५.
(II)--a queen of Manthu and the mother of Bhauvana. भा. V. १५. १५. [पगे३-519+ २५]
(III)--a daughter of Nagnajit (s.v.) and a queen of कृष्ण. भा. X. ५८. ३२-55: Br. III. ७१. २४२ and ५२: M. ४७. १३: Vi. V. २८. 3.
(IV)--the mother of Hari by name Satya (यज्ञ) in the Uttama epoch. Br. III. 3. ११५: Vi. III. 1. ३८.
(V)--a Svara शक्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ५७, ७३.
(VI)--a daughter of शैब्य, a queen of बृहन्- मना and mother of Vijaya. M. ४८. १०५: वा. ९९. ११५-16.
(VII)--a daughter of दक्ष and wife of शिव. वा. ६५. २०.
(VIII)--the mother of Satyas. वा. ६७. ३५.
--a class of people in प्लक्षद्वीप. भा. V. २०. 4.
--a son of रौद्राश्व. भा. IX. २०. 4.
--a son of पुरूरवस् and ऊर्वशी; father of श्रुतम्जय. भा. IX. १५. 1-2. [पगे३-520+ ३६]

(I)--a sacrifice in नैमिष extending over a thou- sand years; <F>1:  भा. I. 1. 4: वा. 2. १३-14: २३. १९: ५४. 2.</F> at कुरुक्षेत्र; <F>2:  Br. II. 1. १७.</F> by Indra for ५०० years. <F>3:  Vi. IV. 5. 1, 3.</F>
(II)--a son of स्वायम्भुव Manu. Br. II. १३. १०४.
(III)--one of the ten sons of Kardama. Br. II. १४. 9.

--(सत्राजित्-म्। प्।) a son of Nimna (Nighna- ब्र्। and वि। प्।) a friend of God आदित्य; afraid of कृष्ण, be- friended him by bestowing his daughter and the jewel Sya- mantaka on कृष्ण. This jewel was given to him as a present by the Sun god. Wearing it सत्राजित made the citizens of द्वारका blind by its splendour. It was placed in a seperate house to be worshipped as God; refused to part with it when कृष्ण demanded it for the Yadu king. His brother Pra- sena while out a hunting took it to the forest where a lion killed him. जाम्बवन् killed the lion and took the jewel and gave it to his daughter. सत्राजित suspected कृष्ण of killing his brother and depriving him of the jewel. कृष्ण went to the forest, tracked the steps which led to the cave of जाम्बवन्, and after defeating him took his daughter and the jewel to द्वारका. In a public assembly सत्राजित was sent for and the jewel was given to him by कृष्ण. सत्राजित's concern how to befriend कृष्ण. He offered his daughter and the jewel to him. He married the daughter सत्यभामा but returned the jewel to him; <F>1:  भा X. ch. ५६ (whole): IX. २४. १३; Br. III. ७१. २१-60; Vi. V. १३. १०, १४.</F> married the ten daughters of Kaikeya who gave birth to १०१ sons. the eldest of whom was भङ्गकार; <F>2:  M. ४५. १७, १९.</F> other members of the family, अक्रूर, शतधन्वा and others who wished to marry सत्यभामा became jealous and plotted to kill सत्राजित्; शतधन्वा mur- [पगे३-521+ २४] dered him while asleep; in order to avenge his death and also to take the jewel, कृष्ण pursued him and killed him. <F>3:  Vi. IV. १३. ६७-100.</F>
--a queen of कृष्ण. Vi. V. २८. 5.
(I)--a son of पुरूद्व(ha) and an ऐक्ष्वाकि; father of सात्वत. Br. III. ७०. ४८; वा. ९५. ४७.
(II)--a son of Raivata Manu. M. 9. २१.
--one of the names in the first Marut गण. वा. ६७. १२३.
--a son of अम्शु; the line of सात्वतस् came after him; <F>1:  Vi. IV. १२. ४३-4.</F> father of a number of reputed sons like भजमान. <F>2:  Ib. IV. १३. 1.</F>
--a son of Vasudeva and भद्रा. Br. III. ७१. १७३; वा. ९६. १७१.
--one of the three sons of Samara. वा. ९९. १७७.
--a Devagandharva. वा. ६८. ३८.
--the quality of ज्ञानम्. Br. IV. 3. ३२-3, ४५. [पगे३-522+ २४]
--Language of all living beings known to Brahmadatta by the grace of चक्रपाणि. M. २०. ३८; २१. 1, १५.
--a Devagandarva. वा. ६८. ३८.
--the need for and value of; कृष्ण's speech to Uddhava on its importance. भा. XI. १२. 2-7.
--the company of शिष्टस्. वा. ५९. ५१.
(I)--a son of Angirasa. M. १९६. 2.
(II)--one of Danu's sons. वा. ६८. 9.
(I)--a Satya god. Br. II. ३६. ३५.
(II)--a son of Samara. M. ४९. ५४: Vi. IV. १९. ४१.
--is ललिता. Br. IV. १५. 7.
--one of the ११ Rudras. वा. ६६. ६९.
--the father of उपदानवी. Br. III. 6. २३.

--for a sacrifice; members of a sacrificial meet- ing; Sanaka and other sages formed the Sadasyas for Soma's राजसूय; <F>1:  वा. 1. २१; ९७. २९.</F> in the army of the Devas at the तारकामय. <F>2:  M. २३. २१. Ib. १७४. 5: २४६. ४२.</F>
--not to marry with Angiras, Kutsas, etc. M. १९६. ३७.
--a मन्त्रकृत् and of Angirasa branch. वा. ५९. ९९.
(I)--the king after Bhoga. Br. III. ७१. १८१.
(II)--the first king of विदिश. वा. ९९. ३६७.
--a R. from the पारियात्र hill. Br. II. १६. २८.
--a son of अक्रूर. M. ४५. २९.
--is ललिता. Br. IV. १७. ३४.
(I)--the Lord at गोकर्णम् worshipped by भगीरथ. Br. III. ५६, १७, ३९; IV. 8. ३३; ३९. १२०.
(II)--a name of विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ६७; वा. ६२. ३२.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २२.
--the 9th kalpa. M. २९०. 5.
--a son of Kali and a cannibal; wife तामसी, also known as पूतना; had one hand. वा. ८४. १०-2.
--a daughter of प्रीती and Pulastya; wife of Bha- रताग्नि and mother of Parjanya. वा. ११. १९, २७; २८. १६.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २३२.
--a wife of Dharma; sons known as साध्यस्, participators in यज्ञ। वा. ६६. 2, १२.

(I)--a mind-born son of ब्रह्मा; went on a visit to वैकुण्ठ with his brothers; obstructed by Jaya and Vijaya, cursed them; and this was approved by कृष्ण. His joy to see Hari; the अवतार् of शिव; a son of Kanka; a celi- bate who waits on Hari; went with the latter to पृथु's sacri- fice; was taught the knowledge of yoga by Hari in the form [पगे३-525+ ४४] of a Hamsa and in the presence of ब्रह्मा; <F>2:  भा. IV. 8. 1: १९. 6. २९ 42; X. ३९. ५३; XI. १३. (whole).</F> entered उमा- vanam and seeing शिव sporting with उमा, returned. <F>3:  Br. III. ३६. 5 and ५२; ६०. २३; IV. १५. 8 and ४०; ३९. ५६; ४७. ६६.</F> He and others formed the Sadasyas for Soma's राजसूय; <F>4:  M. २३. २१; १०२. १७; २४५. ७७.</F> got मोक्ष through ज्ञानम्. <F>5:  वा. २४. ७९.</F> ^1 भा. III. १२. 4; १५. १२-13, ३० and ३४; १६. 1-4, २५-28; वा. 9. ७२; २३. १३१; १०१. ३३७; १०५. 2; Vi. VI. 4. 5.
(II)--आर्षेय Pravara, (भार्गवस्). M. १९५. ४४.
--a son of सन्नतिमान्. वा. ९९. १८९.

(I)--a son of ब्रह्मा and elder brother of शिव; met by पृथु, he taught him आत्मज्ञान; one of the twelve who knew of Hari's dharma; did not comprehend his माया; present at the anointing of वामन; praised the Lord and Aditi; <F>1:  भा. I. 3. 6; III. 8. 3; १२. 4; IV. १६. २५; १७. 5. २२. 6, १८-40; २३. 9 and ४१; VI. 3. २०; VIII. २३. २०, २६-7; IX. 4. ५७; XI. १६. २५; M. 4. २७.</F> with other sages serve the Ganges; <F>2:  Ib. १६०. १६.</F> भगवान् asked नन्दिकेश्वर about the shrines where महेश्वर stands pillar like (स्थाणु); <F>3:  Ib. १४१. ७७; १६२. १३; १८१. 2-4.</F> created first with ऋभु and Kratu; when born was called कुमार; <F>4:  वा. 9. ७२, १०६; Br. I. 5. ७९.</F> a son of Kanka, an अवतार् of शिव was under father's control; <F>5:  वा. २३. १३२; २४. ७९: २५. ९२; ३०. ८५; ३५. ४५; ५६. ८६.</F> one of the chief sages; <F>6:  Ib. 5. 4.</F> spoke to Aila on the श्राद्ध. <F>7:  Vi. III. १४. ११.</F>

(II)--a son of आयु; <F>1:  Br. III. 3. २४.</F> a वैराज god in Tapolokam; <F>2:  Ib. IV. 2. २१४, ३५.</F> spoke of मार्ताण्ड episode; <F>3:  Ib. III. 7. २९६.</F> in कुरुक्षेत्र; <F>4:  Ib. III: १०. ८७; १३. ६६.</F> present at Soma's राजसूय. <F>5:  Ib. III. १९. ५४; ६४. २४.</F> [पगे३-526+ ३३]
(I)--a son of शुचि, and father of ऊर्ध्व- ketu. भा. IX. १३. २२.
(II)--an Angirasa and मन्त्रकृत्; the १२थ् Vedavya1sa. Br. II. ३२. ११०; ३५, ११९.
(III)--a son of ऊर्जवह and father of शकुनि. Br. III. ६४. २०.
(I)--a mind-born son of ब्रह्मा; his visit to विष्णुलोक. भा. III. १२. 4; VII. 1. ३५.
(II)--a ब्रह्मऋषि; water oblation to, after bath. M. १०२. १७.

--a son of ब्रह्मा; fit to contemplate on the glory of Kapila; came to see Trivikrama अवतार् of विष्णु; honoured for the श्रुतिगीता <F>1:  भा. VIII. २१. 1; IX. 8. २४; X. ८७. १२-13, ४२; वा. 9. ७२; १०१. ३३७. Vi. II. 7. १३.</F> by the assembly members of ब्रह्मा; <F>1:  भा. VIII. २१. 1; IX. 8. २४; X. ८७. १२-13, ४२; वा. 9. ७२; १०१. ३३७. Vi. II. 7. १३.</F> a son of कङ्क an अवतार् of शिव; got मोक्ष by ज्ञानम्; <F>2:  वा. २३. १३१; २४. ७९; Vi. I. 4. २७, ३०; 7. 9; V. १८; ४२;</F> a perfect sage. <F>3:  Ib. VI. 7. ५०.</F>

(I)--a mind-born son of ब्रह्मा; <F>1:  भा. III. १२. 4; वा. 9. ७२; १०१. ३३७.</F> a son of कङ्क, an अवतार् of शिव; got मोक्ष by ज्ञानम्; <F>2:  Ib. २३. १३१; २४. ७९; ६१. १५५ and १६१.</F> a Brahma- ऋषि. <F>3:  M. १०२. १७.</F> [पगे३-527+ २६]
(II)--an epithet of विष्णु. M. २४८. ३७.

--the eternal dharma of all <F>1:  वा. ५७. ११६.</F> comprises being faithful, not being covetous, tapas, pity to creatures, control, celibacy, truth, अनुक्रोश, patience and courage. <F>2:  Br. II. ३०. ३७-38; M. १४३. ३२.</F>
--a son of भद्राश्व. M. ४९. 5.
--a R. from the ऋक्ष hills. Br. II. १६. ३१.
--a son of Alarka, and father of सुनीथ. भा. IX. १७. 8.
(I)--(see सन्नती); a daughter of दक्ष and wife of Kratu; <F>1:  Br. II. 9. ५६; वा. २८. ३१; Vi. I. 7. २५.</F> gave birth to वालखिल्यस्. <F>2:  Ib. I. १०. ११.</F>
(II)--a R. of कुशद्वीप. Br. II. १९. ६२.
--a son of रौद्राश्व. भा. IX. २०. 4.
--sacred to ललिता. M. १३. ३४.
--rescued the Gautamas, twin children of सत्यधृति. M. ५०. ११. [पगे३-528+ २८]
(I)--a son of ध्र्ष्टकेतु, and a Kekaya; a brother of भद्रा; took active part in the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर. भा. IX. २४. ३८; X. ५८. ५६; ७५. 6.
(II)--a son of Kaikaya and श्रुतकीर्ती. Br. III. ७१. १५७; वा. ९६. १५६; Vi. IV. १४. ४२.
(I)--a son of Ugra दीक्षित and दीक्षा. Br. II. १०. ८३; वा. २७. ५५.
(II)--a son of Brahman (दीक्षित). Vi. I. 8. ११.
--the first worlds created by ब्रह्मा from the gloomy mass. Here are पितृस्, sons of the progenitor विराजस्. Br. III. 9. ५२: १०. 3.
--appellation महाप्राञ्ज्ञ (very wise); honoured for story-telling. वा. १०३. 6.
--one of the days of sacrifice. वा. २९. १८ and २६; ६२. १३७; ६७. ५०.
(I)--a son of दक्षिणा, and a तुषित god. भा. IV. 1. 7-8.
(II)--a son of तुष्टि. Br. II. 9. ५९; वा. १०. ३४.

--one of the २८ hells, where theft is punished; visited by those who do not fulfill vows undertaken and others who do not perform rituals. भा. V. २६. 7; Br. IV. 2. १४९, १७३-6; वा. १०१. १४८. Vi. II. 6. 5, २८. [पगे३-529+ २९]
(I)--see Mitrasaha. Vi. IV. 4. ४५.
(II)--a son of सुदास and father of Saha- deva. Vi. IV. १९. ७१.
--a son of अण्डिर. M. ४८. 4.
(I)--a diplomatic means; alliance with enemies should be sought to gain one's object, even as the serpent with rat. भा. VIII. 6. २०.
(II)--a son of प्रसुश्रुत, and father of Amar- षण. भा. IX. १२. 7.

(I)--unfit for the procreative act. At this time शिव is said to move with his गणस् to different places; personified as woman; approached by Asuras lavishing praises on her; <F>1:  भा. III. १४. २३-24; २०. २९-37.</F> The time between उषा and व्युष्टि; the time for worship by means of गायत्री to relieve the sun from being attacked by Mandeha राक्षसस्, <F>2:  Br. II. २१. १०८-13; २२. ११; वा. ३०. १५; ५०. १६२; ५१. ११.</F> worship of, twice by householders. <F>3:  Vi. III. १२. 1.</F>
--a reckoning of time. भा. III. ११. २०. [पगे३-530+ ३१]
--a श्रुतऋषि. Br. II. ३३. 3.
--enjoined on the twice born, the object being to kill the Mandehas (s.v.); non-performance of सन्ध्या amounts to killing the sun. Vi. II. 8. ५७.
(I)--a son of Alarka and father of सुनीथ. Br. III. ६७. ६९; वा. ९२. ६६; Vi. IV. 8. १८-19.

(II)--a daughter of Devala and queen of Brah- madatta, the पाञ्चाल king; she was in one of her previous births the cow of Garga killed by the sons of कौशिक for food during famine. She had great attainments and was a ब्रह्मवादिनी; <F>1:  M. २०. २६.</F> once she went with the king to the pleasure garden where the latter broke into laughter at the love quarrel between two ants; the queen took it as an insult to her and threatened to leave him; the king after a penance came to recognise his previous birth by the grace of विष्णु and leaving the kingdom to his son retired from the world; the queen who caused all this fell, but ultimately got salva- tion due to her repentence. <F>2:  Ib. २१. १९-24, ३६-40.</F>

(III)--a daughter of दक्ष; wife of Kratu (मरीचि-वि। प्।) (see also Santati and Samtati); <F>1:  वा. १०. २८, ३१; Vi. I. 7. 7, २५.</F> sons, वाल- khilya sages, ६००० in number. <F>2:  Br. II. 9. ५२; ११. ३६.</F>
--a son of Sumati, and father of कृति(a). भा. IX. २१. २८: M. ४९. ७४; Vi. IV. १९. ४९-50.
--a son of रौद्राश्व. Vi. IV. १९. 2. [पगे३-531+ ३२]
--a son of त्वष्ट्रि and रचना. भा. VI. 6. ४४.
--giving up of karmas by. Br. II. ३२. ५८; M. १४५. ५४.
--a son of Sumati. वा. ९९. १८९.
--the ninth son of रौद्राश्व. वा. ९९. १२५.

--the ceremony usually done on the १२थ् day of one's death; after this the dead person becomes eligible for पार्वण and the गृहस्त becomes eligible for per- forming नान्दिश्राद्ध; in सपिण्डीकरण fresh invocation to the devas; <F>1:  M. १८. १५-17; Vi. III. १३. २६.</F> leads up to the cleansing of the pollution. <F>2:  M. १६. ५८.</F>

(I)--the sons of ब्रह्मा who bear the गङ्गा in their locks; with the constellations traversing Maghas, com- menced the Kali age; when they move to पूर्वाषाढ, there began the reign of Nanda; <F>1:  भा. V. १७. 3; XII. 2. २७-33.</F> separate for every epoch; cursed by महेश्वर were born in Janaloka, and born in चाक्षुष epoch during the वारुण sacrifice. <F>2:  Br. II. ३६. १८; २३. ३८; २६. ३०; III. 1. १३.</F> कुण्डम् of, near Agastya's hermitage; <F>3:  Ib. III. 5. ८०; १३. ६२; ३५. ४३.</F> look on the first प्रजापति emerging out of एकार्णव; <F>4:  Ib. I. 1. १८५.</F> residents of ब्रह्मक्षेत्र. <F>5:  वा: ५९: १०५-106.</F> [पगे३-532+ ३७]

(II)--the seven sages born on the earth in द्वापर; conquered death by foregoing desire for progeny; were followed in the path of ऊर्ध्वरेतसस् by ८८,000 others; all immortals decline after the deluge; <F>1:  M. १२४. १०६-11.</F> their permanent abode in front of Dhruva; <F>2:  Br. II. २१. १६८; २४. १२२; २९. १७, ४५; IV. 2. १३४. M. 4. ३७: १२८. ७४. Vi. II: 9. १०.</F> a lakh of yojanas above शनैश्चर; <F>3:  वा. ५३. ९७: १०१. १३४: Vi. II. 7. 9.</F> lived with Magha during the age of परीक्षित्; <F>4:  M. २७३. ३९, ४४.</F> their one year = ३०३० years of our reckoning; <F>5:  Ib. १४२. १३. वा. ५७. १८.</F> gave out श्रौतधर्म at the com- mencement of the त्रेतायुगम्; <F>6:  M. १४२. ४०-41; Br: II. ३२. ३४, ४२, ९१-4; ३५. १०३, १८४, १८९.</F> remembered by Indra they went to उमा and शिव and got their marriage celebrated; they tested उमा's firmness in her love in different ways and found her not wanting at all. <F>7:  M. १५४. ३११-41.</F>
--of the सूर्यमण्डल in different months. Vi. II. १०. 1-१८.
--a R. visited by बलराम; fit for श्राद्ध offerings. <F>2:  Br. III. १३. १९; M. २२. ७८; वा. ७७. १९.</F> ^1 भा. X. ७९. १२.
--a son of Danu. M. 6. १९.
--(शिल्प) the images of वाराह, नारसिम्ह and वामन. M. २५९. 2.
--an epithet of the sun. M. ५५. 8. [पगे३-533+ २६]
--a horse yoked to the moon's chariot. M. १२६. ५२.
--fit for श्राद्ध offering. Br. III. १३. ५८.
--a son of जाम्बवती. वा. ९६. २४१.
--a rite in marriage. Br. III. ६३. ९६.
--a व्रत taught by the Sun god to क्रितवीर्य of the Haihaya clan; sacred to Rudra; a प्रतिमा of धर्मराज given as gift to the guru is good for the children in a family. M. ६८. 3, १२-42.
--(of emperors); cakra, chariot, precious stones, consort, treasure, horses and elephants. वा. ५७. ६८.
--the sun; <F>1:  Br. III. 3. १०; IV. 1. १३४.</F> burns down the three worlds in the pralaya. <F>2:  वा. ६६. १२७.</F>
--the seven worlds. वा. १०९. १६.
--a son of बाह्लिक. वा. ९९. २३५.
--are ह्रीम्कार Pran2ava, गीत, Pras- ताव, Pratihotra, Upadravam and निधानम्. Br. II. ३३. ३९.
--the hermitage in the हिमालयस् where धृतराष्ट्र spent his last days. भा. I. १३. ५१.
--the Sun God with seven rays emitting fire before the deluge. M. 2. 4; ५५. 8.
--the seven births of जयादेवस् in different manvantaras having seven characteristics. वा. ६७. ४६-7.

--a gift; seven gold कुण्डस् (7 palas to 1,०००) with salt, milk, ghee, jaggery, curd, sugar and water with the respective deities, ब्रह्मा, केशव, महेश्- vara, भास्कर, निशाधिप, लक्ष्मी and पार्वती; the gift after वारुण homa; the giver attains शिवलोकम्. M. २७४. १०: २८७. 1-१५.
--the seven Suns, burning up the universe. वा. 7. ५२.
--of वायु where live the seven गणस्. वा. 2. ४०.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४४. [पगे३-535+ ३६]
--the seven limbs of a kingdom; स्वामि, अमात्य, janapada, durga, दण्ड, कोश and mitra. M. २२०. १९.
--mantra to be recited at the श्राद्ध; leads to overlordship; <F>1:  Br. III. ११. २२-33.</F> to be recited daily in honour of पितृस् and their seven गणस्; in nine verses. <F>2:  वा. ७४. २०-29.</F>
--a sage of the Raivata epoch. M. 9. २०.
--vanquished by कृष्ण. भा. II. 7. ३४.
--a Mt. to the east of अरुणोद. वा. ३६. १९.

--a Durbar; of the king, <F>1:  Br. II. २५. १०१: वा. ३०. २७९; ५४. १०५; ९६. ९२.</F> a description of Sagara's assembly; composed of Brahmans, क्षत्रियस्, पौरजानपद, relatives and friends; <F>2:  Br. III. ४९. ३१; ५०. १६, १७-20: ५४. २४: ५५. २०.</F> of कृष्ण where there were readings of sacred texts and the पुराणस्; <F>3:  M. ६९. १०-11.</F> public halls of Tripuram; <F>4:  Ib. १३०. 5.</F> of Maya; respective seats for members; the address of the chief; <F>5:  Ib. १३१. २०f.</F> of Indra; <F>6:  Ib. १४८. ६१: वा. 1. ९२.</F> of तारक; servants with canes illtreated the devas where the seasons served him as also Siddhas, Kin- naras and Gandharvas the latter by music; <F>7:  M. १५४. ३९.</F> of हिरण्य- कशिपु; here were all trees plants and birds, animals, Apsaras and other ladies, Asuras of distinction full of splendour and wealth, the equal of which has neither been heard of nor seen. <F>8:  Ib. १६१. ३८-89.</F> [पगे३-536+ २६]
--a son of Anu (4th son of ययाति) and father of कालनर (कालानल ब्र्। and वि। प्।). भा. IX. २३. 1: Br. III. ७४. १३. M. ४८. १०: वा. ९९. १३: Br. IV. १८. 1-2.
--members of the assembly; <F>1:  वा. १०१. २८३.</F> residence of. <F>2:  M. २१५. २५: २४६. ३८: २५४. २६.</F>
--a son of शम्स्य agni. वा. २९. १२.
--members of the assembly, punished for con- scious misdirection of justice. M. २२७. २११-3.
--in गया; श्राद्ध here leads to the fruit of ज्योतिष्टोम. वा. १११. ५१.
--one of the २० Amita1bha gods. Br. IV. 1. १७: वा. १००. १७.
--a Marut of the 6th गण. Br. III. 5-९७.
--under देवरक्षित. Vi. IV. २४. ६४.
--His wife was क्रिया. Father of Agnis called पुरीष्यस्. भा. VI. १८. 4. [पगे३-537+ २७]
--a lake of five ponds dug by Para- शुराम at कुरुक्षेत्र to propitiate his पितृस्. Br. III. ४७. ११-14.

--the eyes of the personified Veda. वा. १०४. ८२.
(II)--a son of क्रिया. वा. १०. ३५.
(III)--a deva. वा. ३१. 7.
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. ७७. १८.

(III)--a son of नील and lord of काम्पिल्य; father of three sons, पार and two others. Vi. IV. १९. ४०-1.
--a son of क्षेमाधि, and father of Satya- ratha. भा. IX. १३. २४.
--a Marut of the sixth गण. Br. III. 5. ९७.

--honourable or आर्यम्, explained by ययाति to अष्टक; <F>1:  M. ४१. 4: वा. १०४. २५.</F> भृगु in समाधि. <F>2:  M. १९३. २६.</F>
(II)--the १७थ् kalpa. M. २९०. 7.
(III)--the mind-born son of ब्रह्मा in the २१स्त् kalpa. वा. २१. ४७.

--Kalkaleya; a variety. वा. ७५. ७४.
--a marut of the fifth गण. Br. III. 5. ९६.
--one of the names in the मरुत्गण. वा. ६७. १२८.
--a वम्शवर्तिन् god. Br. II. ३६. २९.
(I)--one of the names in the fourth मरुत्गण. वा. ६७. १२७.
--an Apsaras in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु. M. १६१. ७४.
--one of the names in the Marut गण. वा. ६७. १२८.
(I)--a mountain kingdom. M. ११४. ५६.
(II)--१६ sided in the shape of a small box; on its sides are चन्द्रशालस् with two भूमिकस्. M. २६९. ३८. [पगे३-540+ ३०]
(I)--gave शन्ख to पृथु; the लवण samu- dra encircles जम्बूद्वीप. भा. IV. १५. १९: Br. II. १५. १३.
(II)--Agni at विश्वस्य (विश्वव्यच-ब्र्। प्।) located in ब्रह्मस्थान. वा. २९. २२: Br. II. १२. २४.

--the seven seas; source of the waters; <F>1:  M. 2. ३४. वा. २७. २६: ५६. ५७.</F> lord of rivers; <F>2:  M. 8. 6.</F> southern ocean sacred to पितृस्; <F>3:  Ib. २२. ३९.</F> rise as the moon waxes and go down as the moon wanes as also at moon rising and setting every day; the rise is estimated to be about ११५ inches in height; <F>4:  Ib. १२३. ३२-4.</F> the residence of the Lord. <F>5:  वा. ९७. २२.</F>
--a R. of the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. २०.
--one who has crossed the seas. वा. ८३. ६२.
--a Kinnara गण; horsefaced. वा. ६९. ३२.
--a Janapada of the केतुमाला con- tinent. वा. ४४. १०. [पगे३-541+ २६]
--a Mt. south of the मानस. वा. ३६. २३: ३८. २३: ४२. ३०.
(I)--a son of कोलाहल. M. ४८. ११.
(II)--a son of रणेजय (रणम्जय-वा। प्। and वि। प्।). M. २७१. ११: वा. ९९. २८८: Vi. IV. २२. 8.
(III)--the name of व्यास of the sixteenth द्वापर; गोकर्ण, the अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १७१.
(IV)--the father of Jaya. वा. ९३. 8.
--son of प्रतिक्षत्र. Vi. IV. 9. २६.
--a son of बुहुगवी. वा. ९९. १२२.

--a science which enables one to bring the dead back to life; known to शुक्राचार्य and not known to बृहस्पति; learnt as a disciple from शुक्र by Kaca son of बृहस्पति; revived Kaca done to death twice by the Asuras. M. २५. १३, ३६, ५४, ६५: २७. १९: २४९. 4.
--a son of कूति; father of महिष्मत्. वा. ९४. 5.

(I)--daughter of विश्वकर्मन् (त्वष्ट्(r)a-म्। and ब्र्। प्।); consort of सूर्य (Vivasvat-भा। प्।) gave birth to Manu, Yama and यमी; unable to bear the effulgence of [पगे३-542+ २९] her husband, she engaged छाया, her servant maid, to take her place, and left for penance; to छाया were born शनैश्- cara, Manu (सावर्णि), तपती; finding fault with Yama once the Sun god discovered छाया's identity and after a search found सम्ज्ञा doing penance as a mare in the plains of Utta- rakuru; <F>1:  भा. VIII. १३. 8-9: VI. 6. ४०: IX. 1. ११: M. ११. 2 and २४-37; वा 84. २१; १००. ३१.</F> he became a horse in turn and सम्ज्ञा as a mare gave birth to three more children; the two अश्विन्स् and Re- vanta; विश्वकर्म filed off the वैष्णव effulgence and out of this he crafted the discus of विष्णु, the trident of शिव, the पुष्पकविमान of Kubera the lance (शक्ति) of कार्तिकेय and others. <F>2:  Br. II. २४. ९०: III. ५९. २२-3; IV. 1. २८: Vi. III. 2. 2-१२.</F>
(II)--a शक्ति. Br. IV. ४४. ८७.
--a son of Kunti and father of महिष्मत्. Br. III. ६९. 5.
--a son of अरुण and गृध्रि; father of Vijaya and Prasaha. Br. III. 7. ४४७.
--managed the elephant corps in the war with भण्ड. Br. IV. १६. 7-१३: २२. ३७.
--offered fight to Durmada. Br. IV. २२. ३६-66.
--one of the seven important rays of the sun. Br. II. २४. ६६.
--in honour of लक्ष्मी. M. १०१. २०.
(I)--a son of सुप्रतीक elephant. Br. III. 7. ३४१.
(II)--a son of अरुण and श्येनि and father of Babhru and Sighraga; a fabulous bird and brother of जटायु. M. 6. ३५: वा. ६९. ३२७.
(III)--a son of Bahuvidha. M. ४९. 3.
--a son of Samara. M. ४९. ५४.
--a Pravara. M. १९६. ३०.
--the enlightened like ऋभु and Sanat- कुमार. वा. १०१. २१२.
--a son of युवनाश्व and नर्मदा; father of अनरण्य. Br. III. ६३. ७३.
--an elephant daughter of dig-नागस्. Br. III. 7. ३५४. [पगे३-544+ २३]
--a daughter of जाम्बवती and कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. २५०; वा. ९६. २४१.
--the goddess following रेवती. M. १७९. ७२.
(I)--a son of Sarva. M. ५०. ३१.
(II)--at the end of सम्हार; impossible to be told in detail; also nisarga. वा. ६१. १३६-7.
--a Janapada of the भद्रा continent. वा. ४३. २१.
--महेश्वर, father of creation. वा. १०३. ३७.
--a son of Raivata. Vi. III. 1. २३.
--a son of शुक. वा. ७०. ८५.
--a son of ट्रसदस्यु and father of Anaraya. वा. ८८. ७४-75.
--sons of Meru सावर्णि. वा. १००. ५९.
(I)--a wife of वैराज. भा. VIII. 5. 9. [पगे३-545+ २३]
(II)--a wife of Jayadratha. भा. IX. २३. १२.
(III)--a son of Vasuda. M. १२. ३६.
(IV) (सम्भृती)--a daughter of दक्ष and wife of (Pulaha) (वि। प्।) मरीचि; mother of पूर्णमास and four daughters. Vi. I. 7. 7, २५; Br. II. 9. ५२ and ५५; ११. ११; वा. १०. २७, ३०; २८. 9; Vi. I. १०. 6.
(V)--the mother of Hari in the Raivata epoch. Vi. III. 1. ४०.
नारायण, Narasimha and वामन; मनुष्य अवतार्स् seven due to भृगु's curse; Dat- तात्रेय, मान्धात, Jamadagni, राम, वेदव्यास, कृष्ण and Kalki. वा. ९८. ८८-104.
(I)--a गण in the service of Kubera. M. १८०. ९८.
(II)--a son of शतरूपा. M. 4. २५.
--a main stream of कुशद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ४३. [पगे३-546+ २६]
--the King of fish with a number of children and grandchildren, observed by sage Saubhari who turned to the life of a house-holder from that of penance. Vi. IV. 2. ७०.
--a son of Vasudeva and देवकी. भा. IX. २४. ५४.
--a Marut of the 6th गण. Br. III. 5. ९७.
--one of the best seven rays of the sun; the root of Agni. वा. ५३. ४५, ४८.

--the city of Yama, south of Meru; <F>1:  भा. V. २१. 7; VI. 3. 3; Br. II. २१: ३१; M. १२४. २२; वा. ५०. ८८.</F> reached by कृष्ण and बलराम to recover the dead son of सान्दीपनि; <F>2:  Vi. II. 8. 9; भा. (I)--a son of बहुगण (Bahugata-वि। प्।) and father of अहम्याती. भा. IX. २०. 3; Vi. IV. १९. 1. [पगे३-547+ ३२]
(II)--a son of नहुष; <F>1:  भा. IX. १८. 1; M. २४. ५०; Br. III. ६८. १२. Vi. IV. १०. 1.</F> became a muni to attain मोक्ष and ब्रह्माहोओद्. <F>2:  वा. ९३. १३-14.</F>
--a son of दशरथ and father of शालिशूक. Vi. IV. २४. ३०.
--a son of शूर and भोजा. M. ४६. 3.
--a sin of four kinds; the doer, the aid, cause of action and approver; each ten times greater than the other. Br. IV. 8. ३९-40.
--one of the names in the fourth Marut गण. वा. ६७. १२७.

(II)--वैराज Purus2a; got that name as having assumed the form of साम; also वैराज Manu (see वैराज). Br. II. 9. ३९; वा. १०. १५; ९४. २३.
(III)--the daughter of Kardama, the pro- genitor. Br. II. १४. 8.

(IV)--the title of a king who conquers all भा- रतवर्ष; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. १६; M. ११४. १५. वा. ४५. ८६;</F> the title of Hariscandra after his राजसूय, <F>2:  Ib. ८८. ११८.</F> of कार्तवीर्य. <F>3:  Br. III. १६. २३.</F> [पगे३-548+ ३०]
(V)--a daughter of Priyavrata. वा. ३३. 8; Vi. II. 1. 5.
--also कृशानु--one of the 8 Agnis wor- shipped by Brahmans. Br. II. १२. २१; वा. २९. १९.
(I)--a sage in the दरूवन. Br. II. २७. १०४.

(II)--a part of the five-year yuga; <F>1:  भा. III. ११. १४; V. २२. 7; Vi. II. 8. ७१-2.</F> a year, the first among years; is Agni; represented by काव्य pitr2s; <F>2:  Br. II. २१. १३१; २४. ५७, १४१; २८. १५; III. 8. १७; ७२. ३०.</F> of different kinds--दीव्यसम्वत्सर, Dhruvasamvatsara, पितृसम्वत्सर, and सप्तऋषिसम्वत्सर. <F>3:  Ib. II. २८. २१; २९. १०, १६ and १८.</F>
(III)--a शक्ति. Br. IV. ३२. १५.
(IV)--is Agni. M. १४१. १८.
(V)--वाराह Vis2n2u got the form of. वा. २३. १०४.
--a son of ऋक्ष; and husband of तपती, and father of Kuru. भा. VI. 6. ४१; VIII. १३. १०; IX. २२. 3-4. M. ५०. २०; वा. ९९. २१४; Vi. IV. १९. ७५-6.
(I)--a son of Angiras, and a yogin; helped Marutta in his यज्ञस्; <F>1:  भा. IX. 2. २६; वा. ६५. १०१.</F> enabled प्राम्शु's son to go to Heaven. <F>2:  Br. III. ६१. 5.</F> [पगे३-549+ ३०]
(II)--a son of स्वरूप and a गोत्रकार; <F>1:  M. १९६. 4.</F> attained salvation at Benares. <F>2:  Ib. १८०. ६३.</F>

(III)--a priest of Maruttacakravarti who went bodily to heaven with all his relations and Marutta taking यज्ञ with him; hence बृहस्पति got angry with him as he anticipated the destruction of the world. वा. ८६. 9, ११.
(I)--a group of clouds ordered by Indra to inundate Gokula; <F>1:  भा. X. २५. 2-7.</F> प्रलय clouds. <F>2:  M. 2. 8; वा. ७७. 7; १००. १५६.</F>

(II)--also Aurva and वडवामुख; <F>1:  Br. II. 7. 9; १२. ३५-6; २२. ४३; २५. ४५, ५५.</F> the fire that consumes waters; the प्रलय fire; <F>2:  Ib. IV. 1. १५२; 2. ५०. वा. 6. २९; ५४. ५७</F> son of Manyu- मान् Agni. <F>3:  Ib. २९. ३३.</F>
--a son of Pathya and अथर्वान्गिरस्. Br. III. 1. १०६.
--massive clouds like elephants and of different colours pouring down rain for १०० years during the period of dissolution. Vi. V. ११. 1; VI. 3. ३१.
--the chief of the fourth वातस्कन्ध. Br. III. 5. ८५; M. १६३. ३२.
--with बृहस्पति in राशि. Br. II. २३. ८७. [पगे३-550+ २८]
--a son of उन्माद and grandson of नारा- यण and श्री. Br. II. ११. 4.

--compared to an ocean; the evils of family life as explained by the king of mountains; the necessity of children, the difficulty and anxiety in procuring good hus- bands for daughters, etc; <F>1:  M. ५५. २७; १५४. १४५-174; वा. १०१. १९५-204.</F> the duhham of, explained. <F>2:  Vi. VI. 5. १०-56.</F>

--(तामस) of six kinds--man, animal (पशु), beast (मृग), bird (पक्षि), snake (सरीसृपु) and vegetation (स्थावर); सात्विकम्: ब्रह्मा and others; राजसम्--the intervening विष्टम्भक among the १४ stha1nas. वा. १४. ३५-41; १००. २०३.
--of fourteen kinds. वा. १५. 1.
--a तीर्थ sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ६७.
--a son of यक्ष and Kratusthali. वा. ६९. १४२.
--purificatory rites for house-holders; these do not help without the eight आत्मगुणस् (s.v. क्रिया yoga). M. ५२. १७, ३०. [पगे३-551+ ३२]
--a son of कुन्ती. M. ४३. 9.

(II)--the प्रलय at the end of Kaliyuga; first covering by waters, next by tejas, then by आकाश, then by भूतदि, then by महत्, and lastly by अव्यक्त; <F>1:  वा. २१. ११; १०२. 4, २७-31;</F> the period ending all manvantaras, each continuing for several yugas; <F>2:  वा. १००. ११८;</F> impossible to be told in detail. <F>3:  वा. ६१. १२६-27.</F>
--the fourth पाद of the पुराण; <F>1:  Br. IV. 1. 2-5, 3. 4.</F> of the वा। प्। of 1,००० s4lokas, represents the Kali yuga. <F>2:  वा. ३२. ६४; १००. 2 and 5.</F>
--Vedic texts; <F>1:  Br. II. २९. ५२; ३१. ११-13. M. २६४. २३; वा. ५८. १३; १०४. ८६.</F> three सम्हितास् composed by eight sages. <F>2:  Ib. ६१. 1-2, 4, १२१.</F>
--(सद्वती)? A wife of Agni and mother of Parjanya. वा. २८. १६.
--a मन्त्रकृत् of the Angirasa branch. वा. ५९. ९८. [पगे३-552+ ३४]

X. ३४. 2 and 4.</F> Here sages practised तपस्। At its source पृथु performed a hundred अश्वमेधस्। <F>5:  Ib. IV. १४. ३६; १६. २४.</F> Lies on the way from द्वारका to हास्तिनपुर. X. ८९. 1-2.</F> Here are eleven places sacred to त्रीत, उशनस्, Manu and others. Vidura had his ablu- tions in all of them. <F>8:  भा. III. 4. 3-8.</F> On its banks Kardama performed austeri- ties for १०,000 years. Its banks filled with hermitages, one was Kardama's. In it देवहूती bathed. <F>१०:  Ib. (II)--the order of creation; a form of Brahman known as पुरुष and क्षेत्रज्ञ with the aid of प्रधान originated mahat tatva out of which was born अहम्कार; engaged further in creation, the creator engendered the rudi- ment of sound (शब्दतन्मातृकम्) from which was pro- duced, आकाश or ether; it was invested with शब्द or sound; then was created वायु, invested with the rudiment of touch, fire invested with the rudiment of रूप or form, waters invested with the rudiment of taste; and lastly an aggregate of all this (earth) originates, of which smell is the property; those rudimental elements are designated अविशेषस् or devoid of qualities and this goes by the name of elemental creation; from अहम्कार are again produced the ten organs of sense and the ten divinities along with the eleventh, mind. These several elements could not by them- selves produce and therefore there was a blending; and the result of this compound was the formation of an egg-like अण्ड, where figures the Lord in vyakta रूप; its womb being Meru and its water being the oceans containing all worlds, Gods and men, surrounded outside by seven envelopes like elements of fire, water etc.; first was one of darkness of five Parvas: darkness, illusion, blindness, ignorance, and of no light; three प्राकृत sargas--महत, भूत, and ऐन्द्रि- यक; three वैकृत sargas--मुख्य सर्ग, तैर्यक्योनि, देव सर्ग अर्वाक्स्रोतस and अनुग्रह सर्ग; the ninth [पगे३-557+ २७] sarga was named कौमार; then came the creation of देवास्, asuras, पितृस् and men. Vi. I. 2-7, २९-60: 5. 4-5, १९-25; VI. 8. 2 and १३.
