--a son of चन्द्रविज्ञ. भा. XII. 1. २७.
(I)--a son of Priyavrata; remained a bachelor all life and learnt ब्रह्म विद्या; became lord of पुष्कर- द्वीप. भा. V. 1. २५-26; Vi. II. 1. 7, १५.
(II)--one of the seven sons of वसिष्ठ and ऊर्जा. Br. II. ११. ४१; वा. २८. ३६; २९. १८ and २६; Vi. I. १०. १३.
(III)--one of the ten sons of Kardama (स्वा- yambhuva Manu) and king of पुष्करद्वीप; father of महावीर and धातकी. Br. II. १३. १०४; १४, 9, १४-15; M. 9. 4; वा. ३१. १८; ३३. 9, १४.
(IV)--is सूर्य. Br. II. २४. ७६.
(V)--the Agni formed of पाकयज्ञस्. वा. २९. ३८. [पगे३-567+ ३४]
(VI)--a sacrifice, the roots of which are गायत्री, तृष्टुब् and जगती. <F>1:  वा. ३१. ४७.</F>
(VII)--a sage of the IX दक्षसावर्णि epoch. Vi. III. 2. २३.
(I)--a daughter of सागर and वेला; married by प्राचीनबर्हिस् and had ten sons called Pracetas. Br. II. १३. ३९.
--a manvantara when Asuras will regain lordship at the end of शुक्र's curse. वा. ९८. ५२.

(I)--a name of the sun; <F>1:  Br. II. १३. १२५.</F> garden of, in the north; <F>2:  वा. ३६. ११; १०३. ५९.</F> protects the यमुना; <F>3:  M. २५३. ३०, ४२.</F> has seven horses as वाहनस्; <F>4:  Ib. १०४. 8.</F> wor- shipped on the eve of palace building. <F>5:  Ib. १२८. ३६; २६८. २१.</F>

(II)--an आदित्य; <F>1:  M. 6. 4; Vi. I. १५. १३१.</F> मण्डल of; विष्णु S4akti; the place where reside the chief यक्षस्, Gandharvas, Uragas, राक्षसस्, sages, Apsaras, ग्रामणि by turn during twelve months in groups of seven causing snow, heat, rain, etc <F>2:  Ib. II. १०. १९-22.</F>
(III)--the name of व्यास in the 5th द्वापर; Kanka the अवतार् of the Lord fifth वेदव्यास. वा. २३. १२९. Vi. III. 3. १२.

(IV)--the विष्कम्ब of the sun; is 9,००० yojanas; thrice is the मण्डल in measurement; <F>1:  वा. ५३. ५४, ६१.</F> of वैशाख in the चाक्षुष epoch; the first planet of all; <F>2:  Ib. ५३. १०४.</F> brought forth with [पगे३-568+ ३०] श्रवण and placed in Dhruva; <F>3:  Ib. ५३. १११.</F> in the shape of a circle; the lord of the world. <F>4:  Ib. ५३. ११८.</F>

--a son of Aditi, married पृष्णि in the Vaivas- vata and became father of सावित्रि and others. Fought with Virocana in a देवासुर war; आदित्य of the month आषाढ; the fifth व्यास; milkman of gods on the earth; <F>2:  Br. II. २४. ३४ and ३९; ३५. ११८; ३६. २०६; III. २४. ७८; ५७. २२.</F> heard the पुराण from बृहस्पति and narrated it to मृत्यु. ^1 भा. VI. 6. ३९; १८. 1; VIII. १०. २९; X. ५८. २०; XII. 6. ६८: Br. II. २३. २४; २४. ७६ and ९९; III. 7. २८८ and ९३. वा. ५३. ७९. ^3 Br. IV. 4. ५९-60; २४. ५९.
--time reckoned by the sun's movement. Br. III. 3. ३८.
--a son of अक्रूर. M. ४५. २९.
--आत्रेय gotraka1ra. M. १९७. 4.
(I)--a son of Agnisamsya. Br. II. १२. १३.
(II)--a Saimhikeya asura. Br. III. 6. १९.

--Arjuna, in the disguise of a hunter killed मूक and three crores of मणिवर्तन country; <F>1:  Br. III. 5. ३६; 6. २८; वा. ६७. ७३.</F> slew the दानवस् known as Paulomas and कालकेयस्. <F>2:  Ib. ६८. २७.</F> [पगे३-569+ २६]
--a Saimhikeya asura. Br. III. 6. १९.
--a sage of the Auttama epoch. M. 9. १४.
(I)--a son of प्राण, and a Vasu. भा. VI. 6. १२.
(II)--a son of कृष्ण and माद्री. भा. X. ६१. १५.
(IV)--a god of the आभूतरय group. Br. II. ३६. ५६.
(V)--one of the ten sons of स्वायम्भुव Manu. M. 9. 4.
(VI)--the last and tenth son of Auttama Manu, generous and much reputed. M. 9. १३.
--the यक्ष presiding over the month, शुचि. भा. XII. ११. ३६.

--an Apsaras in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. १४; M. १६१. ७४; वा. ६९. ४९.</F> with the sun for two months, शुचि and शुक्र. <F>2:  Br. II. २३. 5; वा. ५२. 7. Vi. II. १०. 8.</F> [पगे३-570+ ३३]
--a वर्ण s4akti. Br. IV. ४४. ६१.
--a son of कुन्ती and father of महिष्मत्. Vi. IV. ११. 8-9.
--a pupil of लौगाक्षि. Br. II. ३५. ४१.
(I)--a son of दिवा(r)ka(ra) and a hero: father of बृहदश्व. भा. IX. १२. ११; M. २७१. 6; वा. ९९. २८३; Vi. IV. २२. 4.

(II)--a son of जरासन्ध of the मागध line; father of सोमापि(a) and मार्जास्पि; <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. 9 and ४६; M. ५०. ३३. Vi. IV. १९. ८४; २३. 4.</F> enthroned by कृष्ण; commanded by कृष्ण, he arranged for the bath, dress and meals of the released kings; honoured कृष्ण when he left the capital. <F>2:  भा. X. ७२. ४८; ७३. २४-6, and ३१; वा. ९९. २२७.</F> Killed in भारत battle; his son सोमापि (सोमाधि-म्। प्।) ruled for ५८ years, at Girivraja. The latter's son was श्रुतश्रवस्. <F>3:  Br. III. ७४. १०९-11. M. २७१. १८.</F>
(III)--a son of Havyavana, and father of हीन. भा. IX. १७. १७.
(IV)--a son of सुदास, (सन्दास-वि। प्।), and father of Somaka. भा. IX. २२. 1; वा. ९९. २०७; Vi. IV. १९. ७१.

(V)--a son of माद्री (माद्रवती-ब्र्। प्।), born through the grace of the अश्विन्स्. Father of श्रुतकर्मन्. His other son was Suhotra by विजया; <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. २८-31; Br. III. ७१. १५५; M. ४६. १०; ५०. ५०; वा. ९६. १५४; ९९. २४५. Vi. IV. १४. ३८; २०. ४०.</F> joy at कृष्ण's visit to Indraprastha; paid his respects to him; was consoled by [पगे३-571+ २४] कृष्ण when banished to the forest; <F>2:  भा. X. ७१. २७. ५८. 4; ६४. 9.</F> was sent to southern countries with सृञ्जयस्. <F>3:  Ib. X. ७२. १३; ७४. १८-25; ७५. 4.</F> His suggestion that कृष्ण should be accorded the first honour among the Sadasyas in the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर was accepted. Entertained guests in that sacrifice. Approved of द्रौपदी's desire to release अश्वत्थामन्. <F>4:  X. I. 7. ५०; १०. 9.</F>
(VI)--a son of सृञ्जय and father of कृशाश्व. Br. III. ६१. १५; वा. ८६. २०; Vi. IV. 1. ५४-5.
(VII)--a son of हव्यश्व; father of अहीन. Br. III. ६८. 9.
(VIII)--a son of तामरा and Sahadeva. M. ४६. १६.
(IX)--a son of Haryadvata, a great soldier. वा. ९३. 9.
(X)--a son of सुप्रतीत. वा. ९९. २८४.
(XI)--a son of Haryadhana and father of अदीन. Vi. IV. 9. २७.
(XII)--a son of Devaka. Vi. IV. १४. १७. [पगे३-572+ २४]
--a daughter of Devaka, and a queen of Vasu- deva; mother of eight sons, of whom भयासख was one. भा. IX. २४. २३ and ५२; Br. III. ७१. १३१, १६२ and १७९; वा. ९६. १७७; Vi. IV. १४. १८.
--a queen of Hemanta ऋतु. Br. IV. ३२. ३७.
--the tutelary deity of पाकयज्नस्; father of Adbhuta. Br. II. १२. ४०.
--of the south. वा. ४५. १३०.
--belonging to लोकाक्षि. वा. ६१. ३७.
--a queen of Hemanta ऋतु. Br. IV. ३२. ३७.
(I)--(सहस्रजिः-म्। प्।); the eldest of the five sons of Yadu and father of शतजित्. भा. IX. २३. २०. २१; Br. III. ६९. 2. M. ४३. 7; वा. ९४. 2; Vi. IV. ११. 5-6.
(II)--a son of जाम्बवती; got killed in Pra- भास. भा. X. ६१. ११; XI. ३०. १७.
(III)--a son of सुदेवी and कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. २५१. [पगे३-573+ २५]
(IV)--one of the sons of सुदेवी and विष्वक्- sena. वा. ९६. २४२.
(V)--a son of भजमान. Vi. IV. १३. 2.
--a वम्शवर्तिन् god. Br. II. ३६. २९; वा. ६२. २६.
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४०.
--a तीर्थ sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ६०.
--a Mt. for गरुड birds; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. ४५३.</F> west of the शितोद; <F>2:  वा. ३६. २८.</F> of Daityas. <F>3:  Ib. ३९. ६१; ४२. ५३.</F>
--a Mt. in शाल्मलीद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १०.
--a thousand pillared मण्टप with sculptured images of Hari. Br. IV. ३४. ८५.
--(Sahasrastuti-भा। प्।) a R. in शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २६.
--a boundary hill of शाकद्वीप. भा. V. २०. २६. [पगे३-574+ ३०]

(|)--an attribute of Indra; <F>1:  Br. III. 5. ७५, १०१ etc.; वा. ३९. १९; ६४. 7; Vi. I. 9. १९: V. १४. १४.</F> served his mother Diti (s.v.) during her penance to get a son to slay him; later he cut her phoetus into seven parts; they became Maruts. <F>2:  वा. ६७. ९५-6.</F>
(II)--the agni of the Asuras; <F>1:  वा. २९. ४१, 5 and ३४.</F> the son of पावक (वडवामुख-ब्र्। प्।) <F>2:  Br. १२. 5, and ३६.</F>
(III)--तीर्थ sacred to उत्पलाक्षी; <F>1:  M. १३. ३४.</F> sacred to पितृस्. <F>2:  Ib. २२. ५२.</F>
(I)--a son of भजमान. भा. IX. २४. 8.
(II)--a son of उपवाह्यका. Br. III. ७१. 5.
--is sun. Br. II. २१. १११.
--a son of शतानीक, and father of अश्व- medhaja. भा. IX. २२. ३९.
--a son of अहीनग. M. १२. ५४.

--a (मर्ष) son of Susandhi and father of विस्रुतवान्. Also called मर्ष. <F>1:  Br. III. ६३. २१२; वा. ८८. २११.</F> He is called the son of मर्ष and father of विश्वभव. <F>2:  Vi. IV. 4. १११.</F> [पगे३-575+ २९]
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४३.
--(महानन्दी?) ruled for ४३ years; father of महापद्म born of a शूद्र woman. Br. III. ७४. १३४.

--king's advisers and servants; a cammander- in-chief either a Brahman or a क्षत्रिय; प्रतीहार, दूत, रक्षिण्स् or bodyguards; a नारी or nurse; a साङ्धिविग्रहिक; देसरक्षित; a revenue minister; swordsmen and other soldiers; a charioteer; सूदाद्यक्ष; judges; members of assembly; Lekhaka; दौवारिक; धनाध्यक्ष; vaidya; आचार्य; गजाध्यक्ष; अश्वाध्यक्ष; दुर्गाध्यक्ष; sthapati; अस्त्राचार्य; पुराध्यक्ष; आयूधागाराध्यक्ष; mantrins; उपधास्; चारास्. M. ch. २१५.
--(Paulaha) a son of Pulaha and गती (क्षमा-वा। प्।); a sage of the चक्षुष epoch. भा. IV. 1. ३८; Br. II. ११. ३१; ३६. ७८; वा. २८. २६. ६२. ६६; Vi. I. १०. १०; III. 1. २८. M. 9. २२.
(II)--the अवतार् of the Lord of the २६थ् dva1- para in the holy रुद्रवट with four sons. वा. २३. २१२.
--a hilly country. वा. ४५. १३६.
--a southern country; <F>1:  Br. II. १६. ५७.</F> a tribe. <F>2:  M. ११४. ४७.</F>
--a Janapada of the केतुमाला. वा. ४४. १२. [पगे३-576+ २७]

--(also सह्याद्रि): a Kulaparvata; Mt. in भार्त- वर्ष; from this the कावेरी rises. Sages of this place visited द्वारका. <F>1:  भा. V. १९. १६; VII. १३. १२; X. ९०. २८ [4]; वा. ४५. ८९. १०४; Vi. II. 3. 3.</F> A Kulaparvata where sages performed penance; recovered from the sea with cities and villages. <F>2:  Br. II. १६. 8; III. ५६. २२ and ५७; ५७. २७; ५८. २४; M. ११४. १७, २९.</F>
--son of शतानन्द, expert in arms; he once saw an Apsaras and dropped semen in a lake; it took the shape of a mithuna who were rescued by शन्तनु and became Gautamas. M. ५०. 9-११.
--sacred to एकवीर; see Sahya. M. १३. ४०.
--an आत्रेयगोत्रकार. M. १९७. 3.
--is अयोध्या; sometime ruled by the नागस्. Br. III. ५४. ५४; ७४. १९५.
--a Janapada over which the Guptas ruled. वा. ९९. ३८३.
--witness; the Devas as witnesses to पिण्डदान. वा. ११०. ५९ and ६०.
--one of the names in the third मरुत्गण. वा. ६७. १२६.
(I)--(Sindhu): one of the principal क्षेत्रम्स्. M. ११०. 1. [पगे३-577+ ३१]
(II)--the lord of rivers; <F>1:  वा. ७०. 9.</F> married वेला, the daughter of Meru; <F>2:  Ib. ३०. ३५.</F> had a daughter सवर्णा married to प्राचिनबर्हिस्. <F>3:  Br. II. १३. ३८.</F>
(III)--a son of शक्ति. वा. ७०. ८३.

--(also Sagaras s.v.) were purified by the waters of the Ganges flowing from the foot of विष्णु. ६०,000 sons of सुमती who were unrighteous; sent by Sagara to seize the sacrificial horse; finding it near Kapila they treated him as thief but perished by the fire of his wrath; as they dug up the earth, the sea got enlarged and came to be known as सागर; ruled चम्पा. ^1 भा. X. ४१. १५; Br. III. chh. ५२-3; ५४. ११; ५६. 3. ^2 Ib. III. ७४. १९७.
--the capital of कुशध्वज; <F>1:  Br. III. ६४. १९.</F> also the name of the kingdom. <F>2:  Vi. IV. 5. २९.</F>
--of कौशिक gotra. वा. ९१. १००.
--the क्षेरोपेत Brahmans; of Angirasa line. वा. ९९. १६४.
--a son of Nara. वा. ९९. १६०.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra; a श्रुत r2s2i. Br. II. ३३. 2; M. १९५. २३. [पगे३-578+ ४९]

--Revealed by विष्णु: taught by Kapila to आसुरि. <F>1:  भा. I. 3. १०; II. 1. 6; V. १८. ३३; M. 3. २९; वा. ३०. २९३.</F> Here tattvas or first principles are taught. पुरुष the eternal, acts as agent to get things done by the गुणस् of प्रकृति. Its relation to Bhaktiyoga. <F>2:  भा. III. २४. १७; २५. ३१; ch. २६ (whole); २९ 2; वा. ६१. १११.</F> Its principles are differently enumerated as eleven, five, three and so on; ac- cording to one's युक्ती or reason. Creation of universe ac- cording to सान्ख्य, and the place of प्रकृति and पुरुष therein. <F>3:  भा. XI. २२. 1-२५; भा 24 (whole).</F> Followed by कृष्ण while ruling from द्वारका and by नारद in his worship of नरनारायण. <F>4:  ch. III. 3. १९; V. १९. १०; IX. 8. १४; X. 8. ४५; XI. १४. २०.</F> Practised by वैराजसस्; <F>5:  M. १३. 5.</F> is itself a kind of yoga; <F>6:  Ib. ५२. 3; ११०; १९; १८२. १८; १८३. ४४; वा. ६६. ११०.</F> born out of the creator. <F>7:  M. १८३. ५०; १८४. २४; २४५. ८७; २४७. 9; २४८. १७; २९१. 2.</F>
--sages of rigid vows: learnt the भाग- वत from कुमार and imparted it to पराशर and बृहस्पति. भा. III. 8. 7-8; M. २००. ११.

a son of Satyaka; <F>1:  भा. I. १०. १८; IX. २४. १३-14; M. ४५. २२; वा. ९६. ६३; Vi. IV. १४. 2.</F> followed कृष्ण to हास्तिनपुर and was welcomed. Returned back to द्वारका with him. Followed the वृष्णि host to the city of बाण and fought with कुम्भाण्ड, his minister; <F>2:  भा. I. १३. १६ [1]; X. ५८. 1 and 6, २८; ६३. 3 and 8; [५१ (v) ३०- ३१; ५९. ६३].</F> learnt the secrets of archery from Arjuna; <F>3:  Ib. III. 1. ३१ and ३५.</F> defend- ed the western gate of मथुरा, being on the right detach- ment of कृष्ण's army: pursued the retreating enemy to five yojanas and came out successful; <F>4:  Ib. X. ५०. २० [4]; [५० (V) १२], [३०]; [५१ (V) २५].</F> entered यादव sabha1 with कृष्ण and राम and was honoured. Defended द्वा- रका and expelled साल्व's army; <F>5:  IbX. [४२ (V) १३-14]; ५२ [५६ (V) 1]; ७६. १४; ७७. 4.</F> went to see the पाण्डवस् at उपप्लाव्य; was consulted by कृष्ण on the eve of his war with जरासन्ध. Joined Yadus in defeating पौण्ड्रक; <F>6:  IbX. ७८ [९५ (V) 2]; [५० (V) 8 and २८].</F> went with the sacrificial horse of कृष्ण; fought with Aniruddha [पगे३-579+ २९] at प्रभास; <F>7:  Ib. X. ८९. २२ [2]; XI. ३०. १६.</F> survived कुरुक्षेत्र war; <F>8:  Ib. X. ८०. [3].</F> was killed in यादव battle at प्रभास. <F>9:  Vi. V. ३७. ४६.</F>
--a sage and a त्रयार्षेय with हिरण्यस्- tambi and Mudgala. M. १९६. ४१.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २६.
--a देवी and wife of कृष्ण. वा. ९६. २३३.

--that which is above and divine; <F>1:  वा. १०२. ५४.</F> the mind becomes clean and the truth is open to him and leads to ज्ञानम् or knowledge; <F>2:  Ib. ७४. ७६.</F> of विष्णु. <F>3:  Ib. ६६. ८७, १०४-6.</F>
(I)--a son of आयु, and father of भजमान and six other sons. Attacked the Asura followers of Bali. भा. VIII. २१. १७; IX. २४. 6-7.
(II)--the son of Satva (Janhu म्। प्।); wife, कौसल्या; father of four sons, भजमान, Bhaji etc., who founded four different dynasties. Br. III. ७०. ४८; ७१. 1, 2; M. ४४. ४६-8; वा. ९५. ४७.

--a यादव tribe related to the पाण्डवस्. Their overlord was कृष्ण; <F>1:  भा. 1. 4. 7; १४. २५; II. 4. २०.</F> knew how to read [पगे३-580+ २८] others' minds and possessed high understanding and culture; <F>2:  Ib. III. 2. 9.</F> ended their lives by fighting their own relations; <F>3:  Ib. XI. ३०. १८.</F> are भाग- vatas; <F>4:  Ib. XII. 8. ४६.</F> a line of Kings from सात्वत. <F>5:  Vi. IV. १२. ४४.</F>

--(सात्वत s4a1stra) is पाञ्चरात्र? Propounded by विशोक, a means of obtaining mukti for women, शूद्रस् and slaves by the साम्प्रदाय given here; <F>1:  भा. X. ९०. ३४ [2]; VI. १६. ३३.</F> taught by नारद. <F>2:  Ib. I. 3. 8.</F>
the भागवतम् a means to bhakti (see सात्वति s4ruti). भा. I. 7. 6-7.
--the followers of सात्वततन्त्र. भा. V. २५. 1.
--is भागवत: a discourse between शुक and परीक्षित् at हास्तिनपुर. भा. I. 4. 7.
--a Pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. १६.
--दक्ष and other sons of ब्रह्मा live in a place two crores of Yojanas above Maharloka. वा. १०१. १३९. [पगे३-581+ ३०]
--सदसदात्मक in other worlds: the eternal being. वा. १०२. ३४, १३१.

--(ब्रह्मचारि): He who has the means of विद्या; a ब्रह्मचारिन् well disposed to a guru; (साधुग्र- hasta)--the means of doing the Karmas ordained (साधु vaikha1nasa)--by performing penance in the forest (साधु yati) by endeavouring to apply himself to yoga. वा. ५९. २३-4.

(I) (गण)--born of साध्या and Dharma: their son was Arthasiddhi; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. 7; Br. II. २४. २७; ३८. 3.</F> created by वामदेव; of the तामस epoch; <F>2:  M. 4. ३०; 5. १७; 9. १६.</F> one of the 7 गणस् of the Vaivasvata epoch. <F>3:  Ib. 9. २९; वा. १०. ७१; २१. २२; ३०. ९९.</F>
(II)--विष्णु, नारायण, lying in sleep in the vast mass of water. वा. २३. १०८.
(III)--a son of Atri, the अवतार् of the १२थ् dva1para. वा. २३. १५७.

(I)--the sons of Manu (चाक्षुष); <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. १५; 7. 3; १३. १७.</F> worshipped for control of subjects; <F>2:  Ib. II. 3. 5; III. २०. ४२; V. 1. 8.</F> came with other gods to द्वारका to ask कृष्ण to go back to वैकुण्ठ. <F>3:  Ib. XI. 6. 2.</F> [पगे३-582+ ३३]

(II)--the twelve sons of Dharma and साध्या; superior to Gods; first created as जयादेवस् from the face of ब्रह्मा, again born in स्वायम्भुव epoch as Jitas, in तामस epoch as Harayas, in Raivata epoch as वैकुण्ठस्, स्वारोचिष epoch as तुषितस्, in Uttama epoch as Satyas, in चाक्षुष epoch as छान्दजस्, and in the Vaivasvata epoch as साध्यस्; Vasus are their brothers; Gods of चाक्षुष and Vaivasvata epochs; their names are Mana, Anumanta, प्राण, Nara, अपान, वीर्यवान्, वीति, Naya, Haya, Hamsa, नारायण, Vibhu, and Prabhu; live in Bhuvarloka; नारा- यण, their overlord; <F>1:  Br. III. 3. 4-२०, ५८, ६७; 4. ३३. 8 6; १०. ८८; IV. 2. २८; १५. २४, २०. ४६; ३०. 8.; M. ३६. 1; १३२. 3; १७१. ४२; २०३. १०-12; २४६. ५४; २४७. १०; वा. ६६. 4-१२; १०१. ३०; Vi. I. 9. ६४ and ७०.</F> worship gau, the mind-born daughter of the मानस manes; <F>2:  M. १५. १५.</F> requested Soma to give up जारा to बृहस्पति; <F>3:  Ib. २३. ३५.</F> with Angirasa's sons spread themselves in the world of Marici Garbha. <F>4:  वा. ७३. ३८.</F> <F>5:  Ib. V. 1. १७.</F>
(I)--a daughter of दक्ष and one of the १० wives of Dharma: mother of साध्य gan2a. <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. 4 and 7; Br. III. 3. 3 and 8. M. 5. १६-17; १७१. ४२; २०३. १०; वा. ६६. 2; Vi. I. १५. १०५.</F>
(II)--one of the mind-born daughters of ब्रह्मा. M. १७१. ३२.
(III)--the mother of वैकुण्ठस्. वा. ६७. ४१.
--the musala or club of Hari. Vi. V. २२. 7. [पगे३-583+ २९]
--a son of सत्यभामा and कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. २४७; वा. ९६. २३८.
--the devas known as वैराजस् live in. वा. ७१. ५२.
--an expiation ceremony for ascetics guilty of sexual act. वा. १८. 8.

--(also सान्दीपन); of काशी, and a resident of Avanti; was the preceptor of कृष्ण and बलराम. Taught them all branches of learning in ६४ days; got back his dead son recovered from the world of Yama (from the sea वि। प्।) by his pupils as गुरुदक्षिण; acted as purohita in the यज्ञस् performed by कृष्ण at कुरुक्षेत्र; <F>1:  भा III. 3. 2; X. ४५. ३१-49; ९०. ४६. Vi. V. २१, १९-31. [2] वा. ९८. ९९.</F> his concern when कृष्ण and Kucela were caught once in storm and rain. <F>2:  भा X. ८०. ३९-40; Br. III. ७३-79.</F>
--one who has a knowledge of षाड्- गुण्य, knows the language of countries and is skilled in policy. M. २१५. १६.
--extends to several generations. M. १८. २९.
--a pupil of याञवल्क्य. Br. II. ३५. २८.

--one of the political expedients used by ऋषभ; <F>1:  भा. V. 4. १६.</F> two fold, the real and the unreal; the first to be applied to the साधुस् (good men); by this the righteous are brought [पगे३-584+ ३९] under control; <F>2:  M. २२२. 1-१०.</F> there is no use applying it to the un- righteous. One of the four limbs of नीति, the others being bheda, दान (उप्प्रदान-वि। प्।) and दण्ड (दण्ड pa1ta- वि। प्।). <F>3:  Ib. १४८. ६५-77; Vi. V. २२. १७; ३३. ४०.</F>

--eligible for पार्वण s4ra1ddha; <F>1:  Br. III. १५. ३०; M. १६. १२.</F> best for a gift; <F>2:  Ib ५४. २१.</F> to be sung in connection with the rituals in digging tanks, wells, etc. <F>3:  Ib ५८. ३७, ४३.</F>
--chanting of साम वेद identified with the voice of the वराह (अवतार्); <F>1:  M. २४८. ६९.</F> also सामघोष. <F>2:  वा. ६२. १३७.</F>
--see नागस्. Br. III. 7. ३५१.

--a Veda imparted to Jaimini, <F>1:  भा. I. 4. २१; IX. ११. 2; २१. २८; X. 7. १४; ५३. १२; XI. २७. ३१; XII. 6. ७६; ११. ४७; १२. ६२. वा. ३१. ३३; ६५. २६. Vi. III. 4. 9 and १३.</F> who arranged it under व्यास's guidance; present in वारुणि यज्ञ with विश्वावसुस् and Gandharvas; <F>2:  Br. II. ३४. १५; III. 1. २५.</F> gave birth to a number of elephants; <F>3:  Ib III. 7. ३३४, ३३९.</F> learnt by the Asuras; <F>4:  Ib IV. १२. १७.</F> taught by Jai- mini to his son Sumantu and his grandson सुतवान; the latter's son Sukarma composed सहस्र सम्हिता and taught to his pupils हिरण्यनाभ, Kausalya and पौष्पिञ्जि; ५०० pupils of the latter were the northern chanters of the साम; हिरण्यनाभ's disciples the eastern chanters of the साम; one of his pupils, कृत, taught to his disciples २४ branches [पगे३-585+ ३५] of the सम्हिता; <F>5:  M. ४९. ७६; वा. ९९. १३०. Vi. III. 6. 1-7.</F> part of विष्णु; <F>6:  Ib V. 1. ३७.</F> served with other Vedas as a horse of the chariot of त्रिपुरारि. <F>7:  M. ८५. 5; १३३. ३१;</F>

--neighbouring chieftains; their irritation against the king is a case of internal dissension; <F>1:  Br. III. २७. १३, ३९; २८. १२; ३८. २०; ७४. १२४; M. २२३. 8.</F> they should behave like fire towards refractory सामन्तस्; <F>2:  Ib. २२६. 7.</F> residence of; <F>3:  Ib. २२७. १६८; २५४. २१.</F> followed Haihaya in his hunting expedition; <F>4:  Br. IV. १४. १०.</F> subordinate to the Kauravas. <F>5:  M. २७२. ३७.</F>
--a तीर्थ sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ४२.
--आर्षेयप्रवर of Angirasa. M. १९६. 7.
--in honour of शिव or केशव. M. १०१. २६.

--वैष्णव सामस् for भीमद्वादशि; <F>1:  M. ६९. ४४.</F> sung by Gandharvas; <F>2:  वा. 2. ३१.</F> Jaimini learnt them from व्यास; <F>3:  Ib 9. ५०; ६०. १५.</F> those learned in, know the ब्रह्मा. <F>4:  Ib ७९. ९५; १०१. ३४६.</F>
--a mother goddess. M. १७९. ३०.
--a portion of the पूर्वसम्हिता. वा. ६१. ५७. [पगे३-586+ ४३]
--see samudra. Br. II. १९. १२८, १३१-5.
--a wife of प्राचीनबर्हिष (सावर्णि-वा। प्।) (प्राचीनबर्हि-म्। प्।); mother of ten प्राचीनबर्हिषस्. Br. II. ३७. २७; M. 4. ४७; वा. ३०. ३६.
--वास्तु in house buildings. M. २५३. १५.

(I)--a son of कृष्ण and जाम्बवती; reincarna- tion of Guha; <F>1:  भा. I. १०. २९; ११. १७; १४. ३१; III. 1. ३०; X. ६१. ११; M. ४६. २७; ४७. १८; Vi. IV. १५. ३७; V. ३२. 2;</F> attended Aniruddha's marriage at भोजकट, went with the वृष्णि army to बाण's city and fought with the son of बाण; <F>2:  भा. X. ६१. २६; ६३. 3;</F> went out to play and saw a huge lizard in a well and reported it to कृष्ण; <F>3:  ६४. 1-4;</F> took लक्ष्मणा, daughter of Duryodhana in a svayamvara. The Kurus imprisoned him. Afraid of बलराम's prowess, was released by Duryo- dhana and was given dowry. Went to द्वारका after the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर and defended the city against शाल्व. <F>4:  Ib X ६८. 1-१२, ४३-52; ७५. २९; ७६. १४; ७७. 4. Vi. V. ३५. 4-5.</F> Went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse. <F>5:  भा. X. ८२. 6.</F> Went with कृष्ण's sacrificial horse. Fought with Pradyumna at Pra- भास. <F>6:  Ib X. ८९. २२ [2]: ९०. ३३; XI. ३०. १६.</F> Disguised as a pregnant lady by Yadu youths for fun, approached a sage and asked him whether she would deliver a male child. In anger the sage said that she would give birth to a मुसल (iron rod) which would be death to the Yadu kula. Divested of his attire, the मुसल was seen; causing distress to the Yadus. The king ordered that it must be powdered and thrown into the deep. A bit that was left unpowdered was swallowed by a fish which was caught by a fisherman. The latter fixed it at the tip of his arrow. The particles of the मुसल were thrown ashore and grew to be एरक grass. <F>7:  Ib XI. 1. १३-23; Vi. V. ३७. 7-१०.</F> Adopted by गण्डूष; had five sons, all warriors, through काशी; one of the five वम्शवीरस्; <F>8:  Br. III. ७१. १९१ and २६०; ७२ 1.</F> married कश्या, daughter of सुपार्श्व, and mother of पञ्चवीरस् and a number of sons, all with divine sparks; <F>9:  M. ४७. २४.</F> was looked upon with love by the १६००० [पगे३-587+ २५] women of कृष्ण and hence they were cursed by कृष्ण to be robbed and dishonoured by robbers. They were rid of the curse by observing अनङ्गदान व्रतम् as prescribed by दाल्भ्य, the sage. <F>१०:  Ib ७०. 5-१०, १७-19, ६२.</F> Got killed in the यादव struggle at Pra- भास. <F>११:  Vi. V. ३७. ४६.</F>
(II)--a son of Tarasvin. वा. ९६. २५२.
(III)--a वम्शवीर. वा. ९७. 1.
--the उपपुराण containing legends connected with साम्ब. M. ५३. ६२.
--a name of ललिता. Br. IV. १८. १५.
--the प्रलय fire remembered by those who witnessed the fight between Arjuna and अश्वत्थामन्. भा. I. 7. ३१.
--a son of प्रभा. भा. IV. १३. १३.
--a lake on the slopes of the हेमकूट hill. वा. ४७. ६३.
--an आर्षेय Pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. २१. [पगे३-588+ ३१]
--(Evening); born of धात्री and कुहू Bha1. VI. १८. 3; Br. II. २१. १२१.

(I)--a son of Vasudeva (आनकदुन्दुभि) and रोहिणी and father of सार्ष्ठि and others. <F>1:  भा. I. १४. २८; IX. २४. ४६. Br. II. ७१. १६४ and १६८, M. ४६. ११; वा. ९६. १६२;</F> Followed वृष्णिस् to बाण's city. Was consulted by कृष्ण on the eve of attack on जरासन्ध; being on the left detachment of कृष्ण's army, defended द्वारका against शाल्व. <F>2:  भा. X. ६३. 3; [५० (v) 8], [११]; ७६. १४;</F> Went to see the पाण्- डवस् at उपप्लाव्य, and to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse. <F>3:  Ib. X. ७८. [९५ (v) 3]; ८२. 6.</F>
(II)--a son of Devajani, an यक्ष. Br. III. 7. १३०.

--an expert in the science of elephants, horses and chariots; one possessing geographical knowledge of the country, able to calculate the strength or weakness of the army corps; loyal, etc. M. २१५. २०-21.
--a son of श्वफल्क. भा. IX. २४. १६.
--lineal descendants of सरमा's two sons. Br. III. 7. ३१३.
--one of the twenty-eight hells; contains ७२० hounds of adamantine teeth; setting fire, administering poison, plundering of villages or caravans are punished here. भा. V. २६. 7 and २७.
--a kind of bird born of जटायु. M. 6. ३६. [पगे३-589+ ३०]
--sons of श्येनि and गरुड, in the हिमालयन् lakes; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. ४५६; २२. ६५ etc.</F> cranes as born of शुचि. <F>2:  M. 6. ३२.</F>
--one of the six charioteers of ललिता. Br. IV. २०. ९२.

(I)--a son of Dadhici and सरस्वती; knew the yoga power of Hari; <F>1:  भा. II. 7. ४५; Br. II. ३२. १०५; वा. ६५. ९१.</F> a मन्त्रकृत् and a sage. The 9th वेदव्यास; अवतार् of the Lord ऋषभ; <F>2:  Br. II. ३५. ११९; III, 1. ९४; M. १४५. ९९; वा. २३. १४३; ५९. ९६.</F> heard the वायु पुराण from वसिष्ठ and narrated it to त्रिधामन्. <F>3:  Br. IV. 4. ६०-61 वा. १०३. ६०.</F>
(II)--the १२थ् kalpa; <F>1:  M. २९०. 5;</F> an account of it in the भागवत। <F>2:  Ib. ५३. २१.</F>
(III)--a son of जैगीषव्य, an अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १३९.
(IV)--heard the विष्णु पुराण from Puru- kutsa (दधिची) and narrated it to पराशर (भृगु). Vi. I. 2. 9. Vi. 8. ४४.
(V)--a वेदव्यास of the ninth द्वापर. Vi. III. 3. १३.
--a people; a western country. भा. I. १०. ३४; Br. II. १६. ६२; M. ११४. ५०.
--the best of mantras. Br. IV. ३८. 6. [पगे३-590+ २५]
--a तीर्थ sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ६३.
--near the अग्निधारा R. of गया, established by सरस्वती. Here are शुक्र, सण्डमर्क and others. वा. १०८. ५९-60.
--sacred to सरस्वती; worshipping of गायत्री on the fifth day of every पक्ष for १३ months, the performer attains Brahmaloka; he who listens to this reaches विद्याधरपुर. M. ६६. 3-१८; १०१. १८.
--the गोत्रकारस् of Atri family. M. १९७. 1.
--belonging to आर्षेय Pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. 6.
--one of the eight मुहूर्तस् of the afternoon. Br. III. 3. ३९.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २३.
--a particular period of the day. वा. ६६. ४०.
(I)--a manifestation of Hari in the सावर्णि epoch as the son of Devaguhya and सरस्वती. He deprived Purandara of Indrahood and made Bali Indra. भा. VIII. १३. १७. [पगे३-591+ २५]
(II)--a son of वीदूरथ, and father of Jayasena. (Jayatsena-वि। प्।). भा. IX. २२. १०; M. ५०. ३५; वा. ९९. २३१. Vi. IV. २०. 4.
(III)--a son of Sudha(va)rma; an एकराट्. M. ४९. ७१-2; वा. ९९. १८६.
--a son of सारण. Vi. IV. १५. २१.
--the place to which आग्नीध्र retired after dividing जम्बूद्वीप among his nine sons; <F>1:  Vi. II. 1. २४.</F> yoga practised by Bharata at. <F>2:  Ib. II. 1. ३४; १३. 4 and ३४.</F>
--a Devata. Br. III. ७२. 3.
--of कौशिक gotra. वा. ९१. १००.
--a Pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. १५.
--in भद्राश्व, where are mango trees; complexion of men here is white, and women kumuda; their age १०,000 years. वा. ४३. 6-9.
--of the city where were कपिशीर्षक houses. Br. IV. २२. २६. [पगे३-592+ ३०]
--with ओम् and its significance attained by a yogi. वा. २०. 8.

--(also शाल्व); in Duryodhana's army; was sta- tioned by जरासन्ध at the western gate of मथुरा, during one siege, and at the Eastern gate during the other. Attacked the south when Gomanta was besieged. <F>1:  भा. X. ७८ [९५ (v) १६]; ५०. ११ [5], [2]; ५२. ११ [8].</F> Was defeated and killed by कृष्ण in वैदर्भी svayamvara; arrived at कुण्डिन. <F>2:  Ib. X. ५२; १७ and १९; ४२ [1]; ५३. १७; वा. ९८. १००.</F>
--country of the. Vi. II. 3. १७.
--the truth of five-limbed भूतस्. An ऐश्- varya of yoga. वा. १३. 5.
--a son of प्रजापति; ११थ् period. वा. ६२. 4; १००. ८५.

--(first): three गणस् of seven ऋषिस् are distinguished, each of २०; he had nine mind-born sons; at the end of चाक्षुष and the beginning of Vaivasvata सावर्णि Manus come into being; sons of दक्ष through his daughter; son of सम्ज्ञ. सावर्ण Manus. वा. १००. 9, १९-29, ३१, ५३.
--१२ months of ३० days each; year of ३६० days. वा. १००. २२३.
--a kind of measurement. Br. II. २१. १३७; IV. 1. २२१. [पगे३-593+ ३०]

(I)--s.v. 8th Manu of the future; <F>1:  भा. V. १९. १०.</F> अश्वत्थामन् and others are sages; he would have ten sons like धृति, वरीयन् etc; <F>2:  M. 9. ३१.</F> a son of विवस्वान्; engaged in penance in Meru; <F>3:  Ib. ११. 9, ३८.</F> शुक्र Predicted Bali, a grandson of प्रह्लाद as king in सवर्णि's Kingdom. <F>4:  Ib. ४७. २१८; २४७. ७२;</F>
(II)--a son of मार्तण्ड and छाया; <F>1:  भा. VIII. १३. १०.</F> pupil of सूकि, became Manu प्रजापति; had his residence on the slopes of Meru. <F>2:  वा. ८४. ३१; १००. १९.</F>
(III)--a student of अथर्व सम्हीता। भा. XII. 7. 3.
(IV)--a पौराणिक: learnt the मूल सम्हिता from the disciple of व्यास. भा. XII. 7. 5 and 7; Br. II. ३५. ६४ and ६६.
(V)--one of the sages of the नैमिष; learned in श्रुति; an able speaker, addressed वायु; wife सामुद्री. वा. 1. १२३; २१. 1; ३०. ३६; ३४. ६२.
(VI)--of श्याम colour; represents ऋकार. वा. २६. ४०.
(VII)--a pupil of रोमहर्षण. Vi. III. 6. १७.
--१४थ् Manu from {#O#} of कार्बूर varn2a. वा. २६. ४६.
(I)--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. १९. [पगे३-594+ २५]
(II)--the tenth Manu. वा. २६. ४२.
--पौराणिकस्, versed in यजुर्वाक्यार्थ। वा. ६१. ६०.
(I)--a मुहूर्त of the night. Br. III. 3. ४३: वा. ६६. ४४.
(II)--one of the eleven Rudras. M. 5. ३०; २५३. ४२.
(III)--a mantra गण. M. १७१. ५२.
(VI)--the tenth Kalpa. वा. २१. ३१.
--the forest in the region of the Uttara- kurus. M. ८३. ३४.
(I)--a R. in प्लक्षद्वीप. भा. V. २०. 4.
(II)--the daughter of सवित्री: सती compared to her by दक्ष. भा. VI. १८. 1; IV. 2. ११.
(III)--the initiating मन्त्र: the study of; <F>1:  भा. VIII. १८. १४; III. १२. ४२; वा. ७७. २१.</F> the sole property of Brahmans. <F>2:  Ib. १०६. ५८; १०९. २१.</F> [पगे३-595+ ३४]

(IV)--ब्रह्मा contemplated her in his mind when engaged in creation; at that time a being half male and half female broke through his body and it was named शतरूपा; <F>1:  M. 3. ३०.</F> also called सरस्वती, गायत्री and ब्रह्माणी; <F>2:  Ib. 4. १०; १८७. ४५; २६०. ४४.</F> विश्वरूपा with two feet; came out by cutting through the head of ब्रह्मा. <F>3:  वा. २३. ७८, ९१.</F>
(V)--the Goddess worshipped by King अश्वपति. M. २०८. 6.

(VI)--the daughter of अश्वपति and मालती, mar- ried सत्यवान्. नारद spoke to her of his short life: Followed him to the forest knowing that his end was nearing. Enjoyed his company seeing the fauna and flora there: saw him un- conscious when cutting fuel, <F>1:  M. Chh. २०८-9.</F> saw the Lord of death and begged him on her knees to let him live. Yama granted her a boon which she would desire. Her first was that her father-in-law should get back his sight and his kingdom. Though granted, she pursued Yama to free her husband and praised the god's glory. She was asked to name another boon and that was to bless her father with a number of sons. It was granted. Yama asked her to get back. She did not feel weary and pursued him. Her third request was to grant her one hundred sons. Her continuous praise and earnest- ness pleased the god who restored her husband back to life. She returned to the place where the body of सत्यवान् lay, with him she went home, found Dyumatsena enjoying his regained eye-sight and people requesting him to take up the kingship again. Lived long and happy. <F>2:  Ib. Chh. २१०-4.</F>
(I)--in the नर्मदा. (गया-वा। प्।), auspicious for bath and the offering of मध्यान्ह sandhya or noon prayers. M. १९४. 6. वा. ११२, २२.
--belonging to आर्षेय pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. २३.
--Uttama and Madhyama. M. २२७. १६-21.
--a Marut of the third गण. Br. III. 5-९५.
--a class of gods performing श्राद्ध. Br. III. १०. १०९. वा. ७३. ६१.
--near the kingdom of विद्याधरस्: watered by the नलिनी. Br. II. १८. ६०.
(I)--a sage of the Auttama epoch. M. 9. १४.
(II)--married एकपर्णा, the daughter of मेना. M. १३. 9.
(III)--शुक्र; one of the nine grahas; colour white. M. ९३. १०.

--the thirty-second kalpa; ब्रह्मा's mind born is of कृष्ण colour; ब्रह्मा called him Aghora; he had from his side four sons, all black in colour, dress etc.; these [पगे३-597+ ३४] later worshipped the lord for १००० years and attained Rudrahood. वा. २३. २२-35.
--a saimhikeya. वा. ६८. १९.
--a sacred lake in Meru. M. ११३. ४६.
--a son of Krodha and a deva gandharva. Br. III. 6. ३८.

--Invisible celestials; <F>1:  भा. II. 6. १३; III. २०. ४४; V. 1. 8; VI. 2. ३२; 7. 3-4; VII. 8. ३७-8.</F> impart wisdom; <F>2:  Ib. VIII. १४. 8; २३. २६.</F> and sing in praise of Hari; <F>3:  Ib. X. 3. 6; 4. ११; १०. २८: २५. ३१: ३९. ४४; ६२. १९; ८५. ४१.</F> came to see कृष्ण; <F>4:  Ib. XI. 6. 3; १२. 3; १४. 5.</F> Kapila was the greatest of siddhas; <F>5:  Ib. XI. १६. १५; २४. १२; ३१. 2; XII. १२. 6.</F> vanquished by रावण in जम्बूद्वीप; <F>6:  Br. II. १५. १०; III. 7. २५५; IV. २०. ४६; ३०. 9; ३३, 3, ३९. ५६.</F> wander in this world in the guise of Brahmans; hence guests must be fed worthy of them; devas are योगेश्वरस् and move for the promotion of dharma in different guises. <F>7:  वा. २३. १९१; ३०. ८८, ३४. २१; ३८. ५८. ४७. ४६; ७१. ७४; ७२. ३५.</F>
(I)--on the banks of the Ganges. M. ११०. १२.
(II)--in the हिमालयस्; <F>1:  वा. २३. १७५, १८२.</F> where Yogins go with their very bodies or कायारोहणम्. <F>2:  Ib. २३. २२२.</F>
--the holy spot on the सरस्वती where देवभूति attained निर्वाण। भा. III. ३३. ३१. [पगे३-598+ २५]
--a तीर्थ sacred to माता. M. १३. ४६.
--in Geyacakra. Br. IV. १९. ८०.
--(Svarga) <F>1:  वा. ४१. ८१-2.</F> the permanent residence of नारद. <F>2:  भा. IV. २९. ८०.</F>
--a तीर्थ sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ५५.
(I)--the presiding deity of Sarvarohahara cakra. Br. IV. ३७. 9.
(II)--another name for कुमारी. वा. ४९. ९२.
(I)--a son of मणिभद्र and पुण्यजनी: an यक्ष. Br. III. 7. १२२; वा. ६९. १५४.
(II)--a son of Suddhodana. M. २७१. १२.
(I)--wife of Bhaga. भा. VI. १८. 2.
(II)--a daughter of दक्ष; married Dharma; mother of Sukha. Br. I. 9. ५०, ६१, ६२; वा. १०. २५, ३७; Vi. I. 7. २३ and ३१. [पगे३-599+ २९]
(III)--the wife of काम. Br. II. 9. ६२.
(IV)--a देवी in the चक्रराजरथ. Br. IV. १९. 4.
(V)--a कला of ब्रह्मा. Br. IV. ३५. ९४.
(VI)--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १८.

(VII)--of yoga; when one feels himself and the earth all of tejas becomes a siddha; <F>1:  वा. ११. ६४.</F> the state of attaining the desired thing by means of vaivastya from the शरीरिमहत्; <F>2:  Ib. ५९. ७५.</F> characteristics of: प्रतिभा, श्रवण, दर्शन् of devas and ब्रह्मावर्त; <F>3:  Ib. १२. 6 and 9.</F> eight fold. <F>4:  Vi. I. 6. १६.</F>

--eighteen in number of which ten are the principles of गुणस्, and eight depend on Hari. These are अणिमा, महिमा, लघिमा, प्राकाश्य, ईशित्व, वशित: other siddhis enumerated: All these are consequences of yoga. भा. XI. १५. 3-३४. Br. IV. १८. १८; ३८. ३८.
--in the अमरकण्टक hill. Br. III. १३. १४.
--the wife of Matanga and mother of लघुश्याम. Br. IV. ३१. १०३.
(I)--a daughter of Angiras and स्मृति, and wife of धात्रि: mother of दर्श. भा. IV. 1. ३४; VI. १८. 3; वा. २८. १५; Br. II. ११. १८. Vi. I. १०. 7;
(II)--a R. in शाल्मलिद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १०.

(III)--the goddess of the New Moon day; a शक्ति, the New Moon day which ends in the Prathama day; <F>1:  Br. II. ११. १८; २६. ४४; २८. १०, ५९; IV. ३२. १३; M. १३३. ३६; १४१. 9, ५०.</F> the moon enters the sun on the New Moon day; <F>2:  वा. ५०. २०१; ५५. ४२; ५६. 9, ५४.</F> a day for meritorious gifts. <F>3:  Vi. II. 8. ८०.</F>
(IV)--left her consort Kardama and loved Soma with 8 other Devis; a देवी attending on Soma. M. २३. ३४; Br. III. ६५, २६; वा. ९०. २५.
--a son of Anuhrada. वा. ६७. ७५.
--The seas which issue from the urethra of ब्रह्मा. भा. III. १२. २६.

(I)--a R. in भारत vars2a: The region round about fell into the hands of व्रात्यस् and others; <F>1:  भा. V. १९. १८; XII. 1. ३९; वा. ४५. ९७.</F> a महानदी: falls into the western ocean: fit for श्राद्ध. <F>2:  Ib. ४७. ३९; ६९. २४१; ७७. ५६, ११३; १०८. ७९.</F>
(II)--(च्)। Its king was Jayadratha, who was a contemporary of जरासन्ध: was stationed on the east of Gomanta during the siege. भा. X. ५२. ११ [6]. [पगे३-601+ ३२]
(III)--a क्षेत्रम् in प्रयागा. M. ११०. 1.

(IV)--one of the three branches of the गन्गा from the पारियात्र hill flowing to the north; <F>1:  M. ११४. २०; १२१. ४०; Br. II. १६. २४, २७.</F> in the chariot of त्रिपुरारि; <F>2:  M. १३३. २३; १६३. ६२.</F> flows through the kingdoms of Darada, काश्मीर, गान्धार and others: falls into the western ocean; <F>3:  Br. II. १८. ४१, ४६-7; III. १३. १२१.</F> noted for Padma elephants; <F>4:  Ib. III. 7. ३५८.</F> north and south of, unfit for श्राद्ध; <F>5:  Ib. III. १४. ३३ and ८१.</F> confluence of, with the sea holy. <F>6:  Ib. III. १३. ५७.</F>
--an आन्ध्र: overcame the कण्व Sus4arman (शुन्ग) and began the आन्ध्र line: ruled for २३ years. Br. III. ७४. १६१; वा. ९९. ३४८-9.
--the region of the Indus; ruled by Mlecchas. Vi. IV. २४. ६९.
--noted for war horses. Br. IV. १६. १६.
(I)--a son of नाभ, and father of अयुतायु. भा. IX. 9. १६.
(II)--a son of अम्बरीष, and father of अयुतायु. Br. III. ६३. १७०; M. १२. ४५; वा. ८८. १७१; Vi. IV. 4. ३६.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८२.
a northern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ४७. [पगे३-602+ ३०]
--a kind of measurement. Br. IV. ३१. ६६.
--the kingdom of. M. १२१. ४८.
the country over which रहूगण ruled. भा. V. १०. 1; M. ११४. ४१; वा. ४५. ११६.
(I)--a son of माद्री and कृष्ण. भा. X. ६१. १५.
(II)--a palace in the form of a lion; the तोरण is १६ hastas. M. २६९. ३६, ४९.

--born of Hari and Pulaha; as a son of जाम्- बवान्, a वानर जाति; <F>1:  Br. III. 7. १७६, ३०४, ३१९; २२. १९; २६. ३०; IV. 6. ५०.</F> a golden image of, as a gift for वीरव्रतम् of women; <F>2:  M. १०१. २८.</F> the riding animal of ललिता; <F>3:  Br. III. ३५. ३८; ५१. १०; IV. १७. 8; २९. ४१.</F> born out of the wrath of शिव and destroyed दक्ष's sacrifice. <F>4:  वा. १०१. २९५.</F>
--a son and commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८१; २६. ४८.
--the lion-gate in front of शिवलोक. Br. III. ३२. ११.
(also मेघनाद) a war cry; <F>1:  Br. IV. २९. २८;</F> made by कृष्ण on seeing the अरिष्ट bull; <F>2:  Vi. V. १४. 8.</F> before wrestling with चाणूर. <F>3:  Ib. V. २०. ३५.</F> [पगे३-603+ ३५]
--the chariot of lion of कार्त्तिकेय. वा. ४१. ३८.
--an उपद्वीप to जम्बूद्वीप; <F>1:  भा. V. १९. ३०.</F> the modern Ceylon: to be conquered by Kalki. <F>2:  Br. II. ३१. ८२; III. ७३. १०७; M. १४४. ५६.</F>
--When Guru is in Simha (this only once in every twelve years) गयाश्राद्धम् not to be omitted. वा. १०५. १९.

--the lion throne for kings; <F>1:  Br. III. २६. २१.</F> of देवी which was placed in the सभा; <F>2:  Ib. IV. १४. १२.</F> of the पाण्डवस्; मार्कण्डेय seated by युधिष्ठिर on; <F>3:  M. १०३. १८.</F> of तारक Asura. <F>4:  Ib. १४८. २९;</F>
--a palace with चन्द्रशालस्. M. २६९. ४६.

(I)--a daughter of Diti and कश्यप and sister of हिरण्यकशिपु: the wife of Vipracitti, and mother of one hundred and one sons of whom राहु was the eldest; <F>1:  भा. V. २४. 1; VI. 6. ३७; १८. १३; Br. II. २४. ९२; M. 6. २५; वा. ६७. ६०; १२८. ५०; Vi. I. १५. १४१.</F> mother of १४ Ra1ks2asas; <F>2:  Br. III. 5. १२; Vi. I. २१. १०-11;</F> mother of ग्रहस्। <F>3:  M. १७१. ६०.</F>
(II)--a daughter of दक्ष; <F>1:  M. १७१. २९.</F> a goddess enshrin- ed at कृतशौच. <F>2:  Ib. १३. ४५.</F> [पगे३-604+ ३३]
--a son of भण्ड. Br. IV. २६. ४८.
a western kingdom watered by the सीता. Br. II. १८. ४४.

(I)--a branch of the गन्गा issuing from the city of ब्रह्मा: descends Kesara and other hills, falls on the summits of गन्धमादन, and traversing the continent of भद्राश्व, falls into the Eastern Ocean; <F>1:  भा V. १७. 5-6; Br. II. १२. १६; १८. २२, ४१-5; २६. ४४; III. ५६. ५२; वा. ४२. १७-35; ४७. ३९, ४३; ५५. ४२; Vi. II. 2. ३४-5; 8. ११३.</F> rises out of the सितान्त slopes of the मुकुञ्ज hill, flows through सुमञ्जस, माल्यवत, Vaikanka, मणिपर्वतम्, ऋषभम्, जठर, देवकूट, and reaches through the गन्धमादन and takes the name of अलकनन्दा and enters the मानस lake.
(II)--The goddess enshrined at चित्रकूट. M. १३. ३९.
(III)--a R. of कुशद्वीप. M. १२२. ७१.
(IV)--wife of हव्यवाहन. वा. २९. १४.

(V)--the supernatural daughter of Janaka; <F>1:  Vi. IV. 4. ९२-3; 5. २८;</F> is लक्ष्मी; the wife of राम; <F>2:  वा. १०६. ५८; Vi. I. 9. १४४;</F> was discovered by सीरध्वज when ploughing the earth for a sacrifice. <F>3:  वा. ८८. १९५; ८९. १५; १०८. १९ and २५.</F> In her svayam- vara, राम broke the धनुस् of शिव. Ravished by her beauty रावण took her to लन्का and kept her under a शिम्शुप tree. Recovered by राम. Ever devoted to her lord, enjoyed his company at the capital. In the sacrifices she gave away all her things as gifts except सौमान्गल्य। [पगे३-605+ २७] Bore the water jar when Bharata carried the पादुका. <F>4:  भा. V. १९. 1-5; IX. १०. 3; १३. १८; XI. 4. २१; Br. III. ६३. १९६; भा. IX. १०. 6-३०. ४४ & ५६; ११. 4 and ३५; X. ७१. 9: ८३. १०;</F> Respect of, to Brahmanas and elders; was sent to वाल्मीकि's hermitage though pregnant as राम heard a citizen speak ill of her stay in रावण's palace; gave birth to कुश and Lava. After entrusting her sons to the care of the sage, she entered the bowels of the earth. <F>5:  IX. १०. ४१ and ४७: ११. १०-15.</F>
--sacred to Hari. भा VII. १४. ३२.
--a R. of the भारतवर्ष. वा. ४५. १०१.
--a R. of the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. २१.
--one of the सम्स्कारस् enjoined on a द्विज। Vi. III. १३. 6.

--a son of Hrasvaroman; when he was ploughing the earth for an यज्ञ, he discovered सीता, and hence her name. Father of कुशध्वज; (his brother, कुश- dhvaja and son भानुमत्-वि। प्।). भा IX. १३. १८-19; वा. ८९. १५-17; Vi. IV. 5. २७-30. [पगे३-606+ २८]
--(Baladeva); had the ploughshare as his weapon. Vi. IV. 1. ९४ and ९६.

(I)--A daughter of सयाति: when once she went with her father to the hermitage of Cyavana, she saw an anthill with two luminous objects in holes which she pricked with a thorn. This resulted in blood-flowing from the eyes of the sage Cyavana. The king asked the sage's pardon by giving his daughter in marriage. अश्विन्स् called on them and made Cyavana look young to the puzzle of सुकन्या. The अश्विन्स् revealed to her of Cyavana's rejuvena- tion. Once her father came and seeing her with a young man, he took him to be her paramour and scolded her. But when he heard the truth of the matter he was pleased. भा. IV. 3. 2-२३; Br. III. 1. ९३; 8. ३१; २५. ८०; ६१. १९; M. १२. २१; वा. ६५. ९०; ८६. २३. Vi. IV. 1. ६२.
(II)--mother of Sumedhas. वा. ७०. २६.
--a son of देवयनी, and an यक्ष. Br. III. 7. १२९.
(I)--a son of श्वफल्क. भा. IX. २४. १६; Br. III. ७१. ११२.

(II)--A son of सुन्वा(na): an illustrious pupil of Jaimini and author of the समन् with a thousand [पगे३-607+ २८] सम्हितस्। His pupils were हिरण्यनाभ and पौष्यञ्जि, besides an आवन्त्य: Had ५०० disciples from the north and a good number from the east. <F>1:  भा. XII. 6. ७६-78; वा. ६१. २७-32.</F> The story goes that as he taught the सम्हितस् on अनध्ययन days, Indra killed his pupils. At this the sage took to प्रायोपवेस, and Indra ap- peased him by saying that he would have two best pupils alive, and these were हिरण्यनाभ and पौष्यञ्जि. <F>2:  Br. II. ३५. ३२; Vi. III. 6. 2-3.</F>
--gods of the epoch of the १३थ् Manu. भा. VIII. १३. ३१.
(I)--a group of gods of the epoch of Raucya Manu: Gods of the fourth सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ८४ & ८८, ९७, १००; वा. १००. ८७.
(II)--one of the three देवगणस् of the १३थ् Manu; oblation given to them are curds and ghee. वा. १००. १०१, १०४; Vi. III. 2. ३८.
(III)--a group of Gods of the XII epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. ३४.
--one of the eight sons of महापद्म, all of whom ruled only for १२ years. M. २७२. २१.
--a Janapada of the भद्रा continent. वा. ४३. २०. [पगे३-608+ २६]

--the पितृस्, sons of वसिष्ठ--हिरण्य garbha, propitiated by शूद्रस् in ceremonies: मानस is their king- dom: The R. नर्मदा is their mind-born daughter (मानसि Kanya1 नर्मदा). Br. III. १०. ९६-7. वा. ७३. ४६-8.
--a class of पितृस्. M. १०२. २१.
--a sage of the second सावर्ण epoch. Br. IV. 1. ६९.
(I)--King: a son of धृष्टकेतु and father of वीतिहोत्र. भा. IX. १७. 9.
(II)--a son of Havya: after him सुकुमार vars2a. Br. II. १४. १७-19; वा. ३३. १६.
(III)--a son of Suvibhu and father of धृष्टकेतु. Br. III. ६७. ७६; वा. ९२. ७१; Vi. IV. 8. २०.
(IV)--a son of Bhavya of शाकद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ६०.
--a kingdom of शाकद्वीप down the Jalada hill; named after सुकुमार. Br. II. १४. १९; १९. ९१; M. १२२. २१; वा. ३३. १८. ४९. ८६.
(I)--a son of वसिष्ठ and a प्रजापति of the स्वारोचिष epoch. M. 9. 9.
(II)--a son of पृथु. M. ४९. ५५.
(III)--a sage of the X epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. २७.
(II)--a R. of the शाकद्वीप. M. १२२. ३३.
(I)--a sage of the epoch of the Tenth Manu. भा. VIII. १३. २२.
(III)--a son of पृथु and father of विभ्राज. Vi. IV. १९. ४२.
--a R. from ऋष्यवान्. M. ११४. २५.
--son of सुनीथ, and father Dharmaketu. भा. IX. १७. 8. [पगे३-610+ २४]
(I)--a son of Nandivardhana of Magadha, and father of देवरात; a bold and righteous king. भा. IX. १३. १४; Br. III. ६४. 7; वा. ८९. 7; Vi. IV. 5. २५. Br. III. ६४. 7.
(II)--a son of Uttama Manu. Br. II. ३६. ४०; वा. ६२. ३५.
(III)--a दानव. Br. III. 6. 6; वा. ६८. 6.
(IV)--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४३.
(V)--a son of Sagara. Br. III. ६३. १४७.
(VI)--a son of केतुमान्: father of Dharma- ketu. Br. III. ६७. ७४.
(VII)--a son of सुनीथ; a righteous monarch; father of Dharmaketu. वा. ९२. ६९-70; Vi. IV. 8. १९.
(I)--a sage in दारुवन. Br. II. २७. १०४.
--a daughter of Tumburu. Br. III. 7. १३; IV. ३३. १९; वा. ६९. ४९.
--a बृहद्रथ: ruled Magadha for ५६ years. Br. III. ७४. ११२.
(I)--a son of the second सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ७१.
(II)--a son of ब्रह्मसावर्णि Manu. Vi. III. 2. २८.
(I)--born of शान्ति. भा. IV. 1. ५१.
(II)--a son of Siddhi. Br. II. 9. ६१; वा. १०. ३७.
(III)--a son of शुकि and गरुड. Br. III. 7. ४५०.
--represent Brahmam. Br. IV. ४३. ७७.
--performer of the, becomes यक्षराज. M. १०१, ७३.
(I)--the city of वरुण to the west of Meru: on the मानस: midnight here when midday at अमरावती. Br. II. २१. ३२. ३८; वा. ५०. ८९; Vi. II. 8. 9. [पगे३-612+ २४]
(II)--one of the three देवगणस् of the first सावर्णि Manu: २० in number. Br. IV. 1. १२, १८-19.
(III)--ऋ. a महानदी between the नीला and कुमुञ्ज hills; on its shores is a तालवन। वा. ३७. २३.
--a R. in प्लक्षद्वीप. Br. II. १९. १९.
--a son of नृचक्षु and father of Pariplava. भा. IX. २२. ४१. 2.
--a son of नृचक्षु (त्रिचक्षु-वा। प्।), (नृप- चक्षु-वि। प्।) and father of पारिप्लव. M. ५०. ८२; वा. ९९. २७४; Vi. IV. २१. १२.
--a son of मेधातिथि and founder of the Sukhodayam kingdom (सुखानु kingdom in प्लक्षद्वीप). Br. II. १४. ३६-8; वा. ३३. ३२; Vi. II. 4. 4 and 5.
--a वर्ष adjoining the नारद hill of प्लक्ष; <F>1:  Br. II. १४. ३८; १९. १५; वा. ४९. १४;</F> same as the कौमारम्. <F>2:  M. १२२. २२.</F>
--a son of Gaya and गायन्ती. भा. V. १५. १४.
--leads to the world of Indra. M. १०१. ५६. [पगे३-613+ ३०]
--a son of देवजनी and an यक्ष. Br. III. 7. १३०.
(I)--(Sugandhi)--a servant maid of Vasu- deva: gave birth to पुन्डृअ and Kapila through Vasudeva. Br. III. ७१. १६३, १८५.
(II)--the Goddess enshrined at माधव- vana. M. १३. ३७.
(III)--an Apsaras. वा. ६९. 7.
--one of the १३ wives of Vasudeva; mother of पुण्ड्र. वा. ९६. १६१, १८३.

(I)--a friend of राम. Dvivida was one of his ministers. Helped राम in his expedition to लन्का. Held the chauri when Bharata carried the पादुका. Attained salvation by satsanga; <F>1:  भा. IX. १०. १६, १९ & ४३; X. ६७. 2; XI. १२. 6.</F> the son of Viraja and सूर्य: रुमा was his queen: younger brother of वालि; <F>2:  Br. III. 7. २१५, २२० & ७०.</F> present at राम's अभिषेक; <F>3:  Vi. IV. 4. १००.</F> to be worshipped before commencing the construc- tion of a palace. <F>4:  M. २६८. १५</F>
(II)--the name of a horse of the chariot of कृष्ण. भा. X. ५३. 5; ७०. १४; ८९. ४९.
(III)--a son of श्रुतदेवी and कृत. M. ४६. 5. [पगे३-614+ २६]
(IV)--the name of a son of गरुड on the Vaikanka hill. वा. ३९. ४०.
(V)--a king of Kinnaras; a गण, all of them horse-faced, and going after his name वा. ४१. ३०; ६९. ३२.
--a daughter of ताम्रा and कश्यप; mother of sheep, horses, camels and asses. M. 6. ३०, ३३; Vi. I. २१. १५, १७.
--a branch of the गन्गा. Br. III. ५६. ५२.
--ruled for २२ years. वा. ९९. ३०६.
(I)--went to स्यमन्तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse; <F>1:  भा. X. ८२. 6.</F> an Andhaka. <F>2:  Br. III. ७१. १४३.</F>
(II)--a son of क्रोधा and a Devagandharva; father of धूम्राश्व. Br. III. 6. ३९; वा. ६८. ३९; ८६. १८.
(III)--a son of देवजनी: an यक्ष. Br. III. 7. १२९.
(IV)--of the solar race: an ally of कार्तवीर्य: an able soldier: Attacking him, परशुराम remembered भद्रकाली and vanquished him: father of पुष्कराक्ष. Br. III. ३९. १८, ५०; ४०. 1. [पगे३-615+ २१]
(V)--a son of king Hemacandra. Br. III. ६१. १३.
(VI)--a son of कृष्ण given to the sonless करूष in adoption. M. ४६. २५.
(I)--a son of रुक्मिणी and कृष्ण. भा. X. ६१. 8; M. ४७. १६; Vi. V. २८. 2.
(II)--a son of प्रतिबाहु. वा. ९६. २५१; Vi. IV. १५. ४२.
--a जयादेव. Br. III. 4. 2.
--a शिव god. Br. II. ३६. ३३.
--a son of Vicitraratha and father of वृष्णिमत्. Vi. IV. २१. ११-12.
--a Mother Goddess. M. १७९. २९. [पगे३-616+ २२]
--a daughter of श्वफल्क. भा. IX. २४. १७.
--a daughter of Agni and wife of शिष्ट, (शिष्टि- वि। प्।). M. 4. ३८; Vi. I. १३. 1.
--the first of several sons of दत्तालि; all known as Paulastyas. वा. २८. २४.
--a wife of दानाग्नि: many sons all Paulastyas. Br. II. ११. २९.
--a son of भृगु. M. १९५. १२.
--a Bhavya god. Br. II. ३६. ७१.
--a वानर chief and a son of श्वेत. Br. III. 7, १८१.
--a ब्रह्मवादिनी. Br. II. ३३. १९.
--belonging to त्रयार्षेय. M. १९८. 7.
--a son of Agnimitra, and father of Vasu- mitra; <F>1:  भा. XII. १६. १७. Vi. IV. २४. ३५.</F> ruled for seven years. <F>2:  Br. III. ७४. १५१.</F>
--a son of Ugrasena. Br. III. ७१. १३३. वा. ९६. १३२.
(I)--a daughter of Ugrasena, the काशि king, and a wife of Vasudeva, mother of पौण्ड्रक. भा. X. ६६. [5]; Br. III. ७१. १३४; M. ४४. ७६; ४६. २१; Vi. IV. १४. २१.
(II)--a daughter of युधिष्ठिर; married अश्वसुत, son Vajra. वा. ९६. २५०.
(I)--the gods of the eighth manvantara: one of the three देवगणस् of the first सावर्णि Manu, twenty in number. भा. VIII. १३. १२; Br. IV. 1. १२, १४ & १५. वा. १००. १३-15.
(II)--a son of अन्तरिक्ष and father of Amitrajit. भा. IX. १२. १२.
(III)--a son of Hema, and father of Bali. भा. IX. २३. 4; Br. III. ७४. २५; Vi. IV. १८. १२.
(IV)--the progenitor and husband of पृश्नि of the स्वायम्भुव epoch. भा. X. 3. ३२.
(V)--one of the seven sons of वसिष्ठ, and ऊर्जा; <F>1:  Br. II. ११. ४२; वा. २८. ३६; Vi. I. १०. १३.</F> a sage of the Raucya epoch. <F>2:  Br. IV. 1. १०३.</F> [पगे३-618+ २३]
(VI)--a शिव god. Br. II. ३६. ३३.
(VII)--a Marut of the first गण. Br. III. 5-९२.
(VIII)--a वानर chieftain. Br. III. 7. २३६.
(IX)--(Paulapa) a sage of the Rohita epoch. Br. IV. 1. ६४.
(X)--(आत्रेय) a sage of the fourth सावर्ण Manu. Br. IV. 1. ९१. वा. १००. ९६.
(XI)--a son of Sena. M. ४८. २३.
(XII)--a son of परिष्णव or Pariplava. M. ५०. ८३.
(XIII)--Gods of the सावर्णि epoch. Vi. III. 2. १५.
(XIV)--a sage of the XII epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. ३५.
(XV)--a sage of the XIII epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. ४०.
--a Marut of the second गण. Br. III. 5. ९३.

(I)--an under world and the residence of Bali: represents the two knees of the Lord; <F>1:  भा. II. 1. २७; 5. ४०; V. २४. 7 & १८; VIII. १३. १४.</F> Built by विश्वकर्मन्. Bali was sent to this as punishment but was pleased with it: the great cave which Bali and प्रह्लाद entered; <F>2:  Ib. VIII. २२. ३२; २३. 3 & 9, ११-12.</F> reached by कृष्ण and राम to recover their brothers killed by Kamsa; Bali then as Indrasena welcomed them; <F>3:  Ib. X. ८५. ३४-38.</F> पातालम्, assigned to Bali by वामन. <F>4:  M. २४६, ६९, ७५-9; Vi. II. 5. 2-3.</F>
(II)--the second world of white soil: residence of Brahmanas; <F>1:  Br. II. २०. ११, १४, २५; वा. ५०. ११, and १३.</F> here is the town of महाजम्भ and other Asuras and नागस्. <F>2:  वा. ५०. २०-25.</F>
--a son of स्वर्भानु; had three sons काश, शल, and गृत्समद. वा. ९२. 2.
(I)--a daughter of देवकी and one of the seven wives of Vasudeva. M. ४४. ७३.
(II)--the अवतार् of the Lord in the second द्वापर. वा. २३. १२०.
(II) (सुतर)--a गण of the 4th सावर्ण Manu of १० gods. Br. IV. 1. ८४, ८९.
--a daughter of Upamadgu (Cal. एद्ण्. and Wilson-sister). Vi. IV. १४. 9.
--a ऋत्विक् at the याग of ब्रह्मा. वा. १०६. ३६.
--a son of Ugrasena. Vi. IV. १४. २०.
--a son of सुषेण. वा. ९९. २७३.

--a special ceremonial of the Soma sacrifice (of पृथु); the हविस् for बृहस्पति offered to Indra, and hence the सूत--बृहस्पति and Indra, master and disciple; the wrong offering led to सूत's वर्ण vaikr2ta. वा. 1. ३४; ६२. १३७.
--(सूत्रामण-वि। प्।) gods of the epoch of the thirteenth Manu, of the Raucya Manu (सुत्रामणस्). भा. VIII. १३. ३१; Br. IV. 1. ९७-99; Vi. III. 2. ३८.
--one of the three देवगणस् of the १३थ् Raucya manu; these devas drink ghee given in प्रयाज्य homas. वा. १००. १०१, १०४.
--the son and pupil of Sumantu: father of Sukarman. Br. II. ३५. ३१; वा. ६१. २६. [पगे३-621+ २७]
(I)--the name of the daityas. Br. III. 6. १४.
(II)--a grandson of Jaimini, taught by him one सम्हिता of the साम वेद; he taught his son Sukarma. Vi. III. 6. 2-3.
--an Ajita deva. Br. II. १३. ९४.

--the son of पौण्ड्रक: King of काम्भोजस्: attacked with जरासन्ध the western gate of मथुरा, and the eastern gate of Gomanta, performed funeral rites to his father. In order to take vengence on कृष्ण, he worshipped शिव who directed him to pray to दक्षिणाग्नि out of which would spring up an अभिचार fire which would kill कृष्ण. He did so but the Agni was not able to meet कृष्ण's cakra and returned only to kill सुदक्षिण himself. भा. X. ६६. २७-40; ५० 11[5]; ५२. ११ [7].
(I)--an Apsaras. Br. III. 7. 8.
(II)--(सद्वती) a daughter of प्रीती and Pulastya, mother of Parjanya and wife Agni. वा. २८. २३.
--an Apsaras. वा. ६९. 7.
(I)--a son of अजात and an Andhaka. M. ४४. ८४; वा. ९६. १४१.
(II)--the adopted son of Asamanjasa. वा. ९६. १४१. [पगे३-622+ ३२]

--an old poor Brahman of पाञ्चल des4a who had the four चक्रवाकस् (in previous birth sons of कौशिक) as his sons, all learned Brahmans. The sons left for yoga giving a verse (on their previous births) to their old father to show it to the king and get money and land. Thus he did and got much wealth including many villages. M. २१. 3-१०.
--a daughter of वृषपर्व. M. 6. २२.

(I)--a weapon of कृष्ण, known as Cakra; <F>1:  भा. I. 8. १३; III. १९. २२; VIII. 4. १९.</F> reached कृष्ण when मथुरा was besieged by जरासन्ध, and was used to kill शतधन्वा; <F>2:  Ib. X. ५० 11[2]; ५७. २१.</F> sent to the sun and moon to ward off राहु's attack; <F>3:  Ib. V. २४. 3.</F> presented to अम्बरीष; fell upon दुर्वास when he raised a spirit to attack अम्बरीष who begged to spare the sage and the Cakra did so; <F>4:  Ib. IX. 4. २८ & ४८; ५२. ११ & १२; XI. २७. २७; XII. ११. १४; Br. III. 5. २८. ४०. ६६.</F> a weapon of Hari, at काशी. <F>5:  M. V. २९. १७; ३०. ६७; ३३. ३५; ३४. ३७.</F>
(II)--a son of Bharata. भा. V. 7. 3.
(III)--the husband of ओघवती and a sage, called on the dying भीष्म. भा. IX. 2. १८; I. 9. 7.
(IV)--a son of Dhurvasandhi and father of Agni वर्ण (of कुश vams4a). भा. IX. १२. 5; Br. III. ६३. २०९; वा. ८८. २०९; Vi. IV. 4. १०८.

(V)--a विद्याधर who mocked at Angi- rasa's ugliness and was cursed to become a reptile until [पगे३-623+ २५] released by कृष्ण; when he seized Nanda, कृष्ण came to his rescue, and at his touch the serpent was transformed into the विद्याधर. He bowed to the Lord and went to his region. भा. X. ३४. १२-18; XI. १६. १९.
(VI)--a तीर्थ visited by बलराम. भा. X. ७८. १९.
(VII)--a son of पुण्यजनी and मणिभद्र; an यक्ष. Br. III. 7. १२५; वा. ६९. १५६.
--an Apsara गण from winds. वा. ६९. ५७.
--a शिव god. Br. II. ३६. ३२.
(I)--the florist of Kamsa: welcomed कृष्ण with राम and presented them with choice garlands; was blessed with long life and happiness. भा. X. ४१. ४३-52.
(II)--defended the northern gate of मथुरा when it was besieged. भा. X. ५०. २०[3]. [पगे३-624+ २४]
--wife of शमीक. भा. IX. २४. ४४.
(I)--a son of सर्वकाम, father of कल्माष- nemi (Mitrasaha-वि। प्।). भा. IX. 9. १८; Vi. IV. 4. ३९-40.
(II)--a son of Cyavana and father of Sahadeva (सन्दास-वि। प्।). भा. IX. २२. 1; वा. ९९. २०८; Vi. IV. १९. ७१.
(III)--a son of बृहद्रथ and father of शतानीक. भा. IX. २२. ४३.
(V)--a son of वीरसेन and father of कल्माष- पाद: a friend of Indra. Br. III. ६३. १७५.
(VI)--a son of Caidyavara. M. ५०. १५.
(VII)--a son of ऋतुपर्ण. वा. ८८. १७६.
(I)--a son of दक्षिणा and तुषित god. भा. IV. 1. 7-8.
(II)--a son of Campa and father of Vijaya. भा. IX. 8. 1. [पगे३-625+ २६]
(IV)--a son of Cancu. Br. III. ६३. ११८; वा. ८८. १२०.
(V)--a son of रुक्मिणी and कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. २४५.
(VI)--a son of मदिरा. वा. ९६. १७०.
(I)--the mother of ऋषभ. भा. II. 7. १०.
(II)--a देवी and consort of कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. २५१; वा. ९६. २३४.
(III)--wife of Dharma. M. १७१. ४८.
a Kingdom; <F>1:  Br. III. ६८. २०.</F> the country of Janamejaya. <F>2:  वा. ९३. २१.</F>
--a son of कृष्ण and रुक्मिणी: went with the sacrificial horse of his father. भा. X. ६१. 8; ८९. २२ [2]; M. ४७. १६; वा. ९६. २३७: Vi. २८. 1.

--the queen of Bali Vairocana, son of Sutapa; issueless Bali advised her to have intercourse with sage Dirghatamas; finding him old and blind she sent her slave girl (Nurse-वा। प्।) to whom were born कक्षीवान् and चक्षुष; the king found this out and persuaded the queen and sage once again; the sage agreed on condition that she [पगे३-626+ ३३] smeared all his body with curds and salt and licked the whole of it; she did so omitting the bottom portion; the sage cursed that her first son would be without buttocks; on her request he agreed that her first grandson would be born like that and not her son; she got five sons, Anga, Vanga, etc. Br. III. ७४. ३४-88; M. ४८. ६१-79; वा. ९९. ३४, ६८-86.
(I)--the son of चारुपद and father of Bahugava. भा. IX. २०. 3.
(II)--the son of Abhayada and father of Bahugata. Vi. IV. १९. 1.

(I)--one of the ten sons of चाक्षुष Manu; इला converted into a male: (किम्पुरुष); once when he rode into a forest on a saindhava horse, he came upon उमा's pleasure garden where he with his followers were trans- formed into females. This was due to a boon granted to पार्वती by शिव. In this womanly form Budha saw and embraced her. Aila पुरूरवस् was born of this union. Sudyumna wanted to regain his male form and prayed to वसिष्ठ. The latter waited on शिव who allowed Sudyumna to have male form and female form in alternate months. Returning to his kingdom he was not liked by his subjects. His three sons were in charge of दक्षिणापथ. In the ful- ness of time पुरूरवस् was placed in charge of प्रतिष्ठान, Sudyumna leaving for forest to perform penance; father of three sons, Utkala, Gaya and हरिताश्व (किरताश्व-वा। प्।); (Vinata-वि। प्।); being once a female had no share of the kingdom; however got प्रतिष्ठान, through वसिष्ठ's help; that was given to पुरूरवस्. भा. VIII. 5. 7; IX. 1 (whole); Br. II. ३६. ७९-106; III. ६०. १४-27; M. 4. ४२; १२. १६-17; वा. ६२. ९१; ८५. १५-19; २५. २८. Vi. I. १३. 5. IV. 1. १०-16. [पगे३-627+ २३]
(II)--a Mantra ब्राह्मण Ka1raka. वा. ५९. १३१; ६२. ६७.
(I)--a son of Kuru, and father of Suhotra. भा. IX. २२. 4 & 5; Vi. IV. १९. ७८-9.
(II)--a son of the daughter of युधिष्ठिर. Br. III. ७१. २५९.
(I)--a son of Virajasa प्रजापति and king of the East (West-वि। प्।). Br. III. 8. १८; Vi. I. २२. ११.
(II)--a son of Kuru. M. ५०. २३; वा. ९९. २१७.
(III)--a son of धिष्णु and father of ऋष- bha; a charioteer of the Devas. वा. ६५. १०२.
(IV)--a son of Satyahita विक्रान्त (Satya- hita-वि। प्।) and father of Jatu. वा. ९९. २२५; Vi. IV. १९. ८२.
(I)--a Pratardana god. Br. II. ३६. ३१.
(II)--a son of the III सावर्ण epoch. Br. IV. 1. ८०; वा. १००. ८४.
(III)--the guardian deity of the East. M. 8. 9. [पगे३-628+ ३०]
(IV)--a sage of the चाक्षुष epoch; attained heaven by tapas. M. 9. २२; १४३. ३८.
(V)--a son of अश्विनी and अक्रूर. M. ४५. ३३.
(VI)--a son of दृढनेमि. M. ४९. ७१.
(VII)--a son of धर्मसावर्णि. Vi. III. 2. ३२.

--the heavenly सभा sent by Indra and brought to द्वारका by कृष्ण, taken by वायु under orders of कृष्ण; in this कृष्ण seated himself. <F>1:  भा. I. १४. ३४-38; X. Ib. ६४ [1]; Br. IV. 9. 6; १०. २३.</F> It formed the council hall of द्वारका. Here कृष्ण met the elders. Entered by कृष्ण after the कुरुक्षेत्र war; <F>2:  Ib. X. [६७ (v) ४२]; ६८. ३५; ७०. १७; ८० [१२]; XI. ३०. 4.</F> went back to heaven after कृष्ण's departure to it. <F>3:  Vi. V. ३५. २४; ३८. 7.</F>
(I)--a group of १२ gods of the Raucya epoch; <F>1:  Br. IV. 1. ५५, ५९-60, ९७.</F> partake in उपयाज्य sacrifices. <F>2:  वा. १००. १०१-5.</F>
(II)--a group of gods of the IX Manu. Vi. III. 2. २१.
(III)--a group of Gods of XIII Manu. Vi. III. 2. ३८.
(II)--(see also वैराज): a son of Viraja and गौरी) a लोकपाल; father of Vairaja. Br. II. ११. १३; वा. २८. ११; ५०. २०६; ६२. ६६.
(III)--(also वैराज) a son of Kardama; a लोकपाल of लोकालोक hill; attained heaven by tapas. Br. II. २१. १५७; ३०. ४०; M. १२४. ९५. Vi. II. 8. ८३.
(IV)--a कश्यप and a sage of the चाक्षुष and Raivata epochs. Br. II. ३६. ६१, ७७.
(V)--a disciple of लोकाक्षि, an अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १३५.
(VI)--a son of वालि, an अवतार् of the Lord. वा. २३. १६०.
(VII)--an Ajita deva. वा. ६७. ३४.
(VIII)--a sage of the Raivata epoch. Vi. III. 1. २२.
--a group of १२ gods of the epoch of Uttama Manu and also of the II सावर्ण Manu. Br. II. ३६. २६, २८; IV. 1. ५५, ६७; Vi. III. 1. १४.
(I)--a group of gods of the X epoch. Vi. III. 2. २५.
(II)--a son of प्रजापति and lord of the Eastern direction. वा. ७०. १६. [पगे३-630+ २४]
--is मदिरासिन्धु. Br. IV. २८. ७९.
--months of इष and ऊर्ज. वा. ३०. 9.
--see अमृतवापिका. Br. IV. ३५. 6.
(I)--a group of gods of the तामस Manu. Br. II. ३६. ४३; वा. ६२. ३७.
(II)--a group of gods of the तामस epoch. Vi. III. 1. १६.
--the son of क्षेम्य, and father of रिपुञ्जय. Vi. IV. १९. ५५.
(I)--a son of राज्यवर्धन and father of Nara. भा. IX. 2. २९; Br. III. 8. ३५.
(II)--a son of राष्ट्रवर्धन. Br. III. ६१. 9.
(III)--the son of धृतिमत् and father of धृष्टकेतु. Br. III. ६४. 9; वा. ८९. 9.
(IV)--a son of विक्रान्त and father of Nara. वा. ८६. १३.
(V)--a son of Kevala and father of Nara. Vi. VI. 1. ३९-40. [पगे३-631+ २९]
