(VIII)--the wise, the son of Sudhanva. वा. ९९. २१८.
(IX)--a ऋत्विक् at ब्रह्मा's यज्ञ। वा. १०६. ३६.
(X)--a son of भगीरथ. Vi. IV. 4. ३६.
--the अवतार् of the Lord in the fourth द्वापर with four sons, Sumukha, Durmukha, etc. वा. २३. १२६.
(I)--born of दीर्घतमस् and Bali's wife. भा. IX. २३. 5.
(II)--a बालय Ks2atra (ब्रह्मा); a son of Bali. वा. ९९. २८.
--one of Danu's sons. वा. ६८. 6.
--a kind of hell; here fall the slayers of Brahmans, consumers of spirituous liquors, stealers of gold, etc. वा. १०१. १४६, १५२; Vi. II. 6. 2 and 9. [पगे३-679+ २५]
--one of the twenty-eight hells, intended for the king or his officials who punish the innocent, and Brahmans with corporal punishment. भा. V. २६. 7 and १६.
--relating to ब्रह्मा Vis2n2u, Arka, Rudra, Indra, Agni, Soma; to be recited at the श्राद्ध. M. १७. ३७; २४६. ६०.
--a third योगैश्वर्य and पञ्चभूताम्तक; indiriyas, manas, buddhi, and अहङ्कार. वा. १३. 5.
--seven in number; these with the भूत result in ऐश्वर्य and ऐश्वर्य results in its turn in राग or desire while ब्रह्मा is विराग or void of राग the सूक्ष्म भाव is प्रस्थूल bha1va. वा. १२. २७-32.
--the goddess following Bhava मालिनी. M. १७९. ७१.
(I)--one of twenty-eight hells, intended for the haughty and the miserly. भा. V. २६. 7 and ३६.
(II)--a commander of भण्ड: killed by तिरस्कर्णिका. Br. IV. २१. ७८; २४. 9, ४४, ९६.
(III)--a पिशाच clan. वा. ६९. २६५.
--a hell. Br. IV. ३३. ६१.
--the kingdom of सुवीर. वा. ९९. २४.

(I)--versed in पुराणस्, इतिहासस्, and धर्म- शास्त्रस्, and their expounder addressed by ऋषिस्, शौनक and others. Insulted by बलराम; <F>1:  भा. I. 1. 5-9; २२. 4. 2; X. ७८. २३; M. 1. 4; २३. 1.</F> रोमहर्षण, the pupil of व्यास narrated the पुराण to the sages assembled for the sacrifice at कुरुक्षेत्र; <F>2:  Br. II. 1. १५; १३. ४१; २४. 3; ३०. 5; III. 9. ३६; ६७. 2; IV. 1. 1; 2. ६९, 7.</F> addressed as Muni, Sattama, महा- buddhi and Brahmasuta. <F>3:  M. ११३. ५८; १२५. 3; १४६. 2; १८०. 3.</F>

(II)--The bard of पृथु born of his सोमयाग (अश्वमेध su1ti-वि। प्।) on the sautya day: a caste formed by the union of क्षत्रिय with a Brahman woman: to train horses and elephants and be in charge of chariots and act as physicians to them; <F>1:  Br. II. ३६. ११३, १५९-161, १७२; Vi. I. १३. ५१.</F> charioteer of कार्तवीर्य; <F>2:  Br. III. ३८. १९; ४१. २१; ५५. 9, १४; IV. 4. 8.</F> sang in praise of पृथु. <F>3:  Vi. I. १३. ६४.</F> [पगे३-681+ २६]
(III)--a name of Adhiratha, and son of Satya- कर्मा; the foster father of कर्ण. M. ४८. १०८: वा. ९९. ११७, ११८.
(IV)--an official in the royal household. M. २१२. १४.
--the son of सूत--शाम्शपायन; तत्वार्थ- दर्शिवान्। वा. ७१. 1, १४.
--a लौकीक्य Apsaras. Br. III. 7. १०.

--minstrels who panegyrised पृथु--praised कृष्ण's birth and celebrated his victory: present at रुक्मीणीस् marriage; <F>1:  भा. I. १५. २०; X. 5. 5; ५०. ३७; ५३. ४३; ७०. २०; ७१. २९; ८४. ४६.</F> woke up Haihaya. <F>2:  Br. III. २८. 1-2.</F>
--gra(ऋ)ham--Here bhasma forms amulet: pollution of; <F>1:  Br. II. २७. ११४; III. १४. ८८.</F> the place of confinement from which Prad- yumna was stolen away by शम्बर. <F>2:  Vi. V. २७. 3 and १०.</F>
--‘painful winds of Parturition’ (Wilson). Vi. VI. 5. १५.
--got war elephants from gods. Br. III. 7. ३४९. [पगे३-682+ २८]
--Brahmasuta establishing unity of जीव, इश्वर and भूत। वा. १०४. २२.
--definition of: few letters, free from doubt, terse, and universal. वा. ५९. १४२; १०४. १०८.
--the chief cook of the King; they should have their hair and nails cleanly cut. M. २१५. २२-3.
--the region of अधर्म and Kali. भा. I. १७. ३८.

--the five obstacles to the attainment of heaven by a house-holder: कण्डनि, पेषणी, चुल्ली, जलकुम्भी, प्रमार्जनी, sins (husking, grinding, fire place, water pots and cleaning). To get rid of these sins he performs the five यज्ञस्। M. ५२. १५-16.
--a काद्रवेय na1ga. Br. III. 7. ३५.
(I)--a wife of Dharma, and mother of Satyasena and others. भा. VIII. 1. २५.
(II)--mother of स्वधामा. भा. VIII. १३. २९.
(III)--a daughter of Dharma and लक्ष्मी, married उत्तानपाद; <F>1:  Br. II. ३६. ८७. M. 4. ३४-5.</F> mother of Dhruva. <F>2:  वा. ६२. ७५-6.</F> [पगे३-683+ ३०]
--the science of cookery. M. २१५. २२.
--praised the heroic exploits of Hari. भा. IX. २४. ६३.
--the last son of शिवदत्त. Br. III. ३५. १३.
--of the southern country. वा. ४५. १२८.
--a queen of अनुह्राद. भा. VI. १८. १६.

(I)--is मार्ताण्ड as he occupies the inanimate globe; is हिरण्यगर्भ being born of the Golden Egg. By his course are divided all the worlds: the Lord of all, animate and inanimate: His movement among the राशीस् in the sky. Traversing the signs of मेष and तुला (the Goat and Balance) he makes days and nights of equal length: travers- ing the five signs commencing with वृषभ (Bull) he makes days longer and nights shorter in a month by २४ minutes: traversing the five signs commencing with वृश्चिक, he reverses the process. Rides in a chariot of one wheel with अरुण as charioteer. Sixtythousand वालखिल्यस् go in front of him singing the Vedas: is also served by other sages, Gan- dharvas, Apsaras, नागस्, यक्षस्, यातुधानस्, and Gods; <F>1:  भा. V. २०. ४३-6; २१ (whole).</F> the sun moves with Meru and Dhruva on his right and marches towards the signs of the Zodiac. The twelve signs are the twelve months of a year. If he traverses one-sixth of the orbit, it is ऋतु, and if he completes one-half of his heavenly path it is ayana. Sometimes the velocity is slow, sometimes rapid and moderate: the name of the year differs accord- [पगे३-684+ ६०] ingly. <F>2:  Ib. २२. 1-7.</F> also known as Divaspati and दिवाकर; १०० thousand yojanas from the earth, and the same distance from moon; <F>3:  Br. IV. 2. २०, २९.</F> does not shine in इलावृतम्; <F>4:  Ib. II. १७. १०.</F> protects the earth and hence Ravi; <F>5:  Ib. II. २०. ५८; Ch. २१.</F> cosmology of; sunrise at Samyamana, midday at Ama- रावती; evening for विभा and midnight for सुखा. His rays enter fire during nights and come back during mornings; hence waters are warm during nights and cool during days; in a मुहूर्त सूर्य spreads over a lakh and ८१,000 yojanas; <F>6:  Ib. II. Ch. २२-3; M. Ch. १२८.</F> chariot of one wheel with vedic metres as horses; colour of the sun in six seasons different; parent of the worlds, all birth and devastation due to him. <F>7:  Br. II. Ch. २४.</F> Twelve-fold आत्म; instructed याज्ञवल्क्य in the form of a horse the यजुस्; <F>8:  Ib. II. ३५. २३-5.</F> father of the Yuvati class of Apsaras; a friend of king सत्राजित्. <F>9:  Ib. III. 7. २१, २१५; ७१. २१, २९.</F> Relative size of sun, moon, etc.; relative splendours, motions and qualities; different classes of rays named; <F>१०:  M. Ch. १२८. १३-74.</F> survives antara pralaya; came after ब्रह्मा in the order of creation; <F>११:  Ib. 2. १२ and ३१.</F> श्राद्ध deva; <F>१२:  Ib. १३. 1.</F> Sunday sacred to: <F>१३:  Ib. ७०. ३३.</F> fight with कालनेमि. <F>१४:  Ib. १५०. १५१-179; २६८. ११.</F>

(II)--a son of कश्यप and Aditi; wives सम्ज्ञा and छाया; father of Manu, श्राद्धदेव and Yama and Yami; see Vivasvan. <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ३९-41; IX. 1. १०-11.</F> Presented पृथु with arrows from h{??} rays; worship of: in प्लक्षद्वीप, <F>2:  Ib. V. १५. १८; २०. 4-5.</F> begot a son on पृथा, still a maiden; <F>3:  Ib. IX. २४. ३२. 5.</F> presented his friend सत्राजित with Syamantaka (s.v.); <F>4:  Ib. X. ५६. 3.</F> propitiated by याज्ञवल्क्य, imparted to him वाजस- म्यष्ट यजुस् in the form of a horse. <F>5:  Ib. XII. 6. ६६-74.</F> Pointed out with Soma, राहु in deva's disguise. Hence राहु chases him in parvas. Fought with बाण in देवासुर war; <F>6:  Ib. VIII. 9; २४-6; १० 30.</F> बडवा was another wife, and Tapati daughter; <F>7:  Ib. VIII. १३. 8-१०; IX. २२. 4.</F> is विभावसु ten Kalas of; <F>8:  Br. I. २१. ८३.</F> gives life to Agni. <F>9:  Ib. IV. ३५. ८१-3.</F> (आदित्य): came to कार्तवीर्य Arjuna in Brah- man's disguise and asked for a gift of all स्थावर for his food and offered in turn bows ever effulgent to help in burning [पगे३-685+ २७] down all स्थावरस्; <F>१०:  M. 2. ३१; ४४. 3-११.</F> माहात्म्य of, in the भविष्य; <F>११:  Ib. ५३. ३१.</F> the day sacred to the sun is the one when Hastam and Saptami fall on the same day; <F>१२:  Ib. 5. 4.</F> is राहु's abode; <F>१३:  Ib. १२७. १०.</F> knows what शिव did to पूष and Bhaga; <F>१४:  Ib. १५५. 7.</F> through सरस्वती, got his two sons (not named); <F>१५:  Ib. १७१. ५७-8.</F> worship of, by Brahmans. <F>१६:  Ib. १८४. ३१.</F>
(III)--a son of Bali; a दानव. M. 6. ११; Br. III. 6. 8.
--see आदित्यस्. Vi. V. 1. ५८.
--a Kulaparvata of the Uttara Kuru country. वा. ४५. २५.
--a son of मणिभद्र and पुण्यजनी; an यक्ष. Br. III. 7. १२२; वा. ६९. १५४.
--eligible for पार्वण s4ra1ddha. M. १६. 9. [पगे३-686+ २९]
--seen after १००० years in the २७थ् Kalpa; all yogas and mantras came out of this. वा. २१. ६५.

--the sun's chariot, made by ब्रह्मा out of the parts of the year with Vedic metres as horses; described; equal to those वरुण; his attendant गणस् in different parts of the year (one गण for every two months) and its motion detailed; has only one wheel. M. १२५. ३७-47; १२६. 1-४७; वा. ५१. ५४-67. ५२. ४२-8.
--to be revived by Manu at the end of Kali. भा. IX. १२. 6.

--the Gandharva presiding over the month of ऊर्ज; a Mauneya Gandharva; <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ४४; Br. III. 7. 2; २३. २१; वा. ६९. 2.</F> with the sun in the months of माशि and Panguni; <F>2:  Ib. ५२. २१.</F> in the sun's chariot during the फाल्- guna month. <F>3:  Vi. II. १०. १८.</F>
--in honour of the Sun god. M. १०१. ३६.
--a daughter of कालिन्दी. भा. X. ५८. २०.
--a western country. Br. II. १६. ६०.
--observed by कृष्ण and the other Yadus by bathing in स्यमन्तपञ्चक and fasting. भा. X. ८२. 1-११. [पगे३-687+ २७]
--a son of Dyutiman. वा. २८. 7.
(I)--a son of Uttama Manu. भा. VIII. 1. २३.
(II)--a son of कालनर(la) and father of Jana- mejaya; king vanquished by कृष्ण. भा. IX. २३. 1-2; II. 7. ३५; वा. ९९. १४.
(III)--a son of देवमीढ and मारिषा; wife राष्ट्रपाली and father of वृष and other sons; <F>1:  भा. IX. २४. २९ and ४२.</F> went to Sya- मन्तपञ्चक for the solar eclipse. <F>2:  Ib. X. ८२. १३ and २४.</F>
(IV)--a son of धूम्राश्व. Br. III. ६१. १४.
(V)--a son of प्रतिपक्ष and father of Jaya. Br. III. ६८. 8.
(VI)--a son of भजमान. Br. III. ७१. 3.
(VII)--a son of शूर and भोजा; father of Dhanu and Vajra. Br. III. ७१. १४९, १९३. M. ४६. 3.
(VIII)--a son of कालानल and father of Puran- jaya. Br. III. ७४. १४; Vi. IV. १८. 3-4.
(IX)--father of two daughters who became queens of भजमान. M. ४४. ४९. [पगे३-688+ २६]
(X)--a son of शमीक. M. ४६. २७.
(XI)--the son of धूम्राक्ष and the father of Sahadeva. वा. ८६. १९. Vi. IV. 1. ५३-4.
(XII)--the adopted son of वस्तावर. वा. ९६. १९०.
(XIII)--a brother of Vasudeva. Vi. IV. १४. ३०.
(XIV)--a son of हर्यश्व. Vi. IV. १९. ५९.

--praised the heroism of कृष्ण; <F>1:  भा. I. 7. १३; II. 7. ३५; IX. २४. ६३.</F> enlisted by जरासन्ध against the Yadus. Took part in the festivities con- nected with the marriage of रुक्मिणी and कृष्ण; <F>2:  Ib. X. [५० (v) 3]; ५४. ५८.</F> welcomed कृष्ण, followed Sahadeva in his conquest of southern coun- tries; took part in युधिष्ठिर's राजसूय; rose against शिसु- पाल. <F>3:  Ib. X. ७१. २९; ७२. १३; ७४. ४१; ७५. १२.</F>
--the son of Karmajit and father of Vipra. भा. IX. २२. ४७.
--a R. in the Vindhyas. Br. II. १६. ३२.
(I)--a son of Ugrasena. भा. IX. २४. २४. [पगे३-689+ ३०]

(II)--creation is of three kinds in primitive times --at will, at mere sight and at a simple touch. But after दक्ष's epoch creation by sexual union came into being; <F>1:  Br. I. 4. 3; II. ३७. ४८; M. 5. 2; वा. ६३. ४५.</F> (in the Vaivasvata epoch, came sexual union Br. P.); <F>1:  Br. I. 4. 3; II. ३७. ४८; M. 5. 2; वा. ६३. ४५.</F> crea- tion starting when the balance of the गुणस् is disturbed; <F>2:  Ib. 5. 9.</F> according to सान्ख्य. <F>3:  Ib. 4. ४६-90.</F>
(III)--a son of Dhruva; asked his own shadow to become a woman, and this was छाया, mother of five sons, प्राचीनगर्भ and others. Br. II. ३६. ९६-8.
(I)--a son of Babhru and father of आरब्ध. भा. IX. २३. १४-15; Vi. IV. १७. 2-3.
(II)--the name of the bridge built by राम to go to लन्का as testified by जाम्बवन्; sacred to Hari. Visited by बलराम who made a gift of cows to Brahmans here. भा. X. ५६. २८; VII. १४. ३६; X. ७९. १५-16.
(III)--a son of स्वारोचिष Manu. Br. II. ३६. १९.
(IV)--one of the two sons of Druhyu and father of Aruddha. Br. III. ७४. 7; M. ४८. 6; वा. ९९. 7.
--a southern country; a tribe. Br. II. १६. ५६; M. ११४. ४६; वा. ४५. १२५.
(I)--a son of कृशाश्व and father of युवनाश्व. भा. IX. 6. २५.
(II)--a son of विशद and father of रुचिराश्व and three other sons. भा. IX. २१. २३.
(III)--the Apsaras presiding over the month of Tapasya. भा. XII. ११. ४०.
(IV)--a Marut of the second गण. Br. III. 5. ९३; वा. ६७. १२४.
(V)--a बृहद्रथ, the reigning king when the पुराण was written by the term साम्प्रतम्। Br. III. ७४. ११३.
(VI)--a son of अश्वजित्; (विश्वजित्-वा। प्।); father of four famous sons. M. ४९. ४९-50; वा. ९९. १७२; Vi. IV. १९. ३५-6.
(VII)--a son of बृहद्कर्म ruled with Sam- प्रयात for ५० years (had just passed away when this account was written); <F>1:  M. २७१. २३.</F> father of श्रुतम्जय. <F>2:  Vi. IV. २३. 5.</F>
(VIII)--a ग्रामणि with the sun in शरत्. वा. ५२. १४.
(IX)--(साम्प्रतम्); a great and bold warrior, ruled for ३५ years. वा. ९९. ३००-1. [पगे३-691+ ३०]
(X)--an यक्ष, who resides in the sun's chariot during the कार्तिक month. Vi. II. १०. १२.

(I)--a commander-in-chief; <F>1:  Br. II. २९. ७६.</F> an epithet of Skanda; <F>2:  Ib. III. ४२. 9.</F> a number of them in भण्ड's army; also चामु- नाथ; <F>3:  Ib. IV. २१. ७६.</F> of तारक; <F>4:  M. १४८. ३८;</F> see सेनापति.
(II)--a name of विघ्नेश्वर. Br. IV. ४४. ६९.
(III)--a Rudra. M. १७१. ३९.
(IV)--one of the seven प्राणिन्स् of a king. वा. ५७. ७०.
--(सेनानि) qualifications of; may be a Brahman or क्षत्रिय; <F>1:  M. १४८. ७९; २१५. 8-१०.</F> residence of, with five courts (प्राकारस्). <F>2:  Ib. २२३. 8; २५४. १८.</F>
--R. sacred to पितृस्; the place of Indra's penance when he fell after killing Namuci. M. २२. ६०-61.
--a sage having no marriage alliances with बृहस्- pati, भरद्वाज, Garga, etc. M. १९६. २४.
--of कौशिक gotra. वा. ९१. १०२.

(I)--the king of Sindhu country could not defeat Arjuna supported by कृष्ण; <F>1:  भा. 1. १५. १६.</F> killed Abhimanyu during the कुरुक्षेत्र war but was slain by Arjuna; see Jayadratha. <F>2:  Ib. X. ७८ [९५ (v) ३०], ३५.</F>
(II)--the horse of the Sind on which Sud- yumna rode to the northern forests. भा. IX. 1. २३.
(III)--(च्) a kingdom watered by the Sin- dhu; noted for horses. Br. II. १८. ४८; IV. १७. २७; M. १२१. ४७.
(IV)--a disciple of शौनक; again divided the सम्हिता into two parts and gave to मुञ्जकेश. वा. ४७. ४६; ६१. ५३; Vi. III. 6. १२.
--were enlisted by जरासन्ध against the Yadus; <F>1:  भा. X. [५० (v) 3].</F> country of the. <F>2:  Vi. II. 3. १७.</F>
--read अथर्व सम्हिता with Babhru from शुनेक; a pupil of शौनक. भा. XII. 7. 3; Br. II. ३५. ६०.
--an army of four-fold forces and of six limbs; a nuisance to peace. Br. III. २६. ५२-3; २७. १२-13; ३८. १८; ४८. 7. [पगे३-693+ २६]
--a Pravara ऋषि. M. १९९. १५.
--a son of हिरण्यकशिपु. Vi. I. १५. १४२.
विष्णु in the body of a lion. वा. ९७. १७.
--is राहु who got a slap with the spoon of मोहिनी. Br. IV. १०. १९.

--the fourteen sons of (Asura) सिम्हिका and Vipracitti; however only १३ names are given; they had their own sons and grandsons forming groups in thousands (hundreds-वा। प्।); vanquished by भार्गव, son of Jamadagni; <F>1:  Br. III. 6. १८-22; M. 6. २५; २४९. ५१, ६७; वा. ६८. १७-22.</F> city of, in the northern slopes of मर्याद hill. <F>2:  Ib. ४०. ११.</F>
--a कश्यप and a त्रयार्षेय. M. १९९. १२.
--a Kulaparvata of भद्राश्व. वा. ४३. १४.
--a Janapada of the भद्रा country. वा. ४३. २१. [पगे३-694+ ३२]
(I)--wife of ज्यामघ. वा. ९५. ३२.
(II)--one of the wives of Vasudeva. वा. ९६. १८२.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २६.
--a Janapada of the भद्रा country. वा. ४३. २२.
--a Janapada of the भद्रा country. वा. ४३. २०.
--thirty-six of them lead to the cot of श्रीपीठ (named). Br. IV. ३७. ५७-61.

(I)--a son born of Atri's eyes; honoured at birth by शिव and उमा; borne for ३०० years by दिक्स् (directions) and when released became an अम्श of ब्रह्मा who took him in his Vedic chariot of १००० horses to his loka where ब्रह्मऋषिस् adored him as their king and was praised by मन्त्रस्; nourished the crying मारिषा in her babyhood with nectar; presented पृथु with undying horses. <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. १५ and ३३; १४. २६; ३०. १४; १५. १७; Br. III. ६५. 1-२०; M. 4. ४९; २३. 4-१५; १९८. 1;</F> Appealed to Pracetas not to destroy trees and offered their daughter वार्क्षी in marriage to him, married the twenty-seven daughters of दक्ष; कृत्तिका and other stars as his wives; cursed by दक्ष he had no issue and was struck with disease propitiated दक्ष and recovered. <F>2:  Ib. 2. १२; 5. १३; १४६. १६. भा. VI. 3. १४; 4. 6-१६; 6. 2, २३-24; VIII. 4. २१; 5. ३४.</F> Appointed by ब्रह्मा as Lord of Plants, Brahmans and stars; worshipped [पगे३-695+ ४६] for a life of enjoyments; also called राजा; father of Budha; <F>3:  भा. VIII. १८. १५; X. ८४. ४७; XI. १६. १६; II. 3. 9; IX. 1. ३५; Br. III. ६५. ४६. ४८; M. ११. ५३-4.</F> got rid of his consumption by bathing in the प्रभासा; wor- shipped largely in शाल्मलिद्वीप; <F>4:  भा. XI. 6. ३६; V. २०. ११-12.</F> conquered three worlds and took तारा, बृहस्पति's wife by force. तारा who was pregnant was given back to बृहस्पति through the intervention of ब्रह्मा. This was Budha. <F>5:  Ib. IX. १४. 2. १४; Br. III. ६५. २८-44.</F>

(II) (Candra s.v.)--a लोकपाल with his city विभावरी on the north of Meru; <F>1:  Br. II. २१. ३३; २२. १४. १५; M. २६६. २६.</F> Lord of stars, and one face of शिव: served as calf when sages and पृथु milked the earth-cow; <F>2:  Br. II. २४. ४६; २६. ४१; २७. ११२ ff.; M. १०. १६.</F> his rays gave rise to certain Apsara clans: कश्यप made him king of Brahmans; <F>3:  Br. III. 5. ८०; 7. २२; 8. 3. ७७. ३६. २०४. M. ११. ६३.</F> a श्राद्धदेव: Lord of पितृस्: (1/8) अम्श of शिव coming out of the धाम that issued along with tears of शिव: Nine women desired and enjoyed his company; <F>4:  Ib. २३-1, 8; ३१. १२.</F> one of the nine grahas with white colour; <F>5:  Ib. ९३. १०-17.</F> in the देवासुर wars, was vanquished by माया of कालनेमी, took part in the तारकामय, helped वरुण at the suggestion of Indra; <F>6:  Ib. १५०. १५३; १७४. २४; १७६. 1-३३.</F> the dot in him is the earth's shadow; <F>7:  Ib. १७६. 5.</F> propitiated in the installation of an image and in house building; <F>8:  Ib. २६५. ३९; २५३. २७.</F> born from the ocean of milk; <F>9:  Ib. २५०. 2; २६८. १८.</F> world of; <F>१०:  Ib. ९१. 1-१०.</F> nectar of, drunk by पितृस् and gods; <F>११:  Br. II. २३. ३९, ६९-73.</F> feeds rivers by causing rain. <F>१२:  वा. ५१. १४-21.</F>
(III)--a son of सावित्री and पृश्नि. भा. VI. १८. 1.
(V)--a Vasu: a son of Dharma and सुदेवी; had five sons Varca, Budha, Dhara, उर्मी and Kalila. Br. III. 3. २१; M. 5. २१, २३; १७१. ४६; २०३. 3.
(VI)--a सुखा god. Br. IV. 1, १८.
(VII)--the temple of, in the सुपक्ष hill. वा. ३९. ६३.
(VIII)--a mukhya गण. वा. १००. १८.
(IX)--a son of Atri and अनसूया. Vi. I. १०. 8.
(X)--a Vasu; the son of भगवान् Varca. Vi. I. १५. ११०, ११२.
(I)--a son of Sahadeva and father of Janhu and ९९ other sons of whom the youngest was पृषर्ट, in previous birth अजमीढ. भा. IX. २२. 1-2; वा. ९९. २०८; Vi. IV. १९. ७१-2.
(II)--a son of कृष्ण and कालिन्दी. भा. X. ६१. १४.

(III)--one of the seven mountains of प्लक्ष- द्वीप (शाकद्वीप-म्। प्।) which enters the sea; from it गरुड took अमृत for his mother. Br. II. १८. ७७; १९. ११-12; M. १२२. १५; वा. ४७. ७४; ४९. १०; Vi. II. 4. 7.
(IV)--a son of सुदास; अजमीढ was reborn when the line was delayed. M. ५०. १५. [पगे३-697+ २८]
--the १९थ् Kalpa. M. २९०. 7.
--belonging to the Pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. १५.
--near the यमुना; the best of all sacred spots. M. १०९. 2; १९१. ३० and ९४.

(I)--a son of कृशाश्व: performed १०० As4va- medhas and attained the goal of Yogins. Father of Sumati (Janamejaya-वि। प्।); <F>1:  भा. IX. 2. ३५-36; Vi. IV. 1. ५६-7.</F> a राजऋषि. <F>2:  Br. III. ६१. १६.</F>

(II)--a son of बाह्लिक and father of भूरि and two other sons. Attacked the northern gate of मथुरा, and the eastern gate of Gomanta when they were besieged by जरासन्ध. A Kaurava. भा. IX. २२. १८; X. ५०. ११[7]; ५२. ११ [6]; वा. ९९. २३५; Vi. IV. २०. ३१-2.
(III)--versed in the पुराणस्। Br. II. ३५. ६४; Vi. V. ३५. २८.
(IV)--an ally of कार्तवीर्य killed by परशु- राम. Br. III. ३९. 2-7.
(V)--a बालेय Gandharva; a राजऋषि and father of Janamejaya. वा. ६९. २०; ८६. २०.
(I)--a sage of the Raivata epoch. M. 9. १९. [पगे३-698+ २६]
(II)--a son of Sahadeva and father of श्रुतश्रवस्. Vi. IV. १९. ८४.
(I)--sacrificers of Soma enjoy the world of Moon. भा. III. ३२. 3.

(II)--पितृ (बर्हिषद्स्) who live in मानस worlds; their mind-born daughter is नर्मदा; they came out of स्वधा and are all yogins. Br. III. १०. ५३, ६६; M. १५. २६; १४१. २०, ५७; वा. ३०. १००. ५६. १६; ६२. १५; ११०. १०.
--the world of पितृस् where live the sons of मारीच. Br. III. १०. ५२-3; M. १४. 1.
--the worlds where मरीचि's descendants reside; here देवपितृस् by name अग्निष्वात्तस् live; mind-born daughter of R. अच्छोदा. वा. ७३. 1-2.
(I)--the मदिरासीन्धु of gods. Br. IV. २८. ८७.
(II)--तीर्थ sacred to the पितृस्; the resi- dence of वैश्वानर. M. २२. ६२.
--the Devas of the १३थ् epoch of Manu; thirty-three are distinguished among them. वा. ६२. ११; १००. १०२; १०१. ४३. [पगे३-699+ २७]
--those who perform sacrifices. वा. ३०. 7, ३०.
--२६थ् Vedavya1sa. Br. II. ३५. १२३.
--the chariot of the Moon. वा. ५२. ७६.
--compared to पृथु, see Soma (s.v.). भा. IV. २२. ५६; वा. ६१. ४४.
--a pupil of कृत. Br. II. ३५. ५२.
--a bath in the कठेश्वरम् तीर्थ and सोमतीर्थ leads to. M. १९१. ६५, ९७.
--the lunar line of Kings; <F>1:  भा. IX. १४. 1-2; M. ११. 1.</F> Ila common ancestor; <F>2:  Ib. १२. १४.</F> commences with the २९थ् Yuga. <F>3:  वा. ९९. ४३९.</F>
--a seller of Soma. वा. ८३. ६२; १०१. १६५.
--a son of Sahadeva. M. ५०. ३३.
--the performer becomes a राजराज. M. १०. 1. ८१.
--a son of शालिशूक and father of शत- dhanva. भा. XII. 1. १४-5; Vi. IV. २४. ३०. [पगे३-700+ २७]
--the अवतार् of the Lord of the २७थ् dva1para in the प्रभास तीर्थ with four sons, all tapasvins. वा. २३. २१५.
--in the परिजातशिला of the निषध hill where the moon descends. वा. ४१. ५७.
--the वेदव्यास of the २३र्द् dva1para. Vi. III. 3. १७.
--heard the पुराण from वाजश्रवस् and narrated it to तृणबिन्दु; <F>1:  Br. IV. 4. ६४.</F> heard the वायु पुराण from वाजश्रवस्. <F>2:  वा. १०३. ६४.</F>
--a kind of rituals for house-holders. Vi. III. ११. २४.
--to be uttered on the occasion of found- ing temples. M. २६५. २४.
--a son of Sahadeva ruled for ५८ years in Girivraja; a राजऋषि. M. २७१. १९; वा. ९९. २२८, २९६.
--a son of Sahadeva and father of श्रुतश्रवस्; <F>1:  भा. IX. २२. 9; Vi. IV. २३. २४.</F> reigned at Girivraja for ५८ years. <F>2:  Br. III. ७४. ११०-14.</F>
--a R. of the भद्रा country. वा. ४३. २६. [पगे३-701+ २५]
--sacred to वरारोहा; sacred to the पितृस्. M. १३. ४३; २२. २९.
--a son of Kunti and father of महिष्मान्. भा. IX. २३. २२.
--the second अवतार् of Hari (वाराह). भा. V. 3. 7.
--a forest in कैलास. भा. IV. 6. २३ and २८.
--a भार्गवगोत्रकार. M. १९५. २५.
--belonging to the Pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. १३.
--सूत addressed as. Br. IV. 4. 4.
--a special day in a sacrifice. Br. II. ३६. १५९; IV. 5. 4.
--a याग, the fruit of which is attained by one fasting oneself, and feeding a number of Brahmans at Benares. भा. X. २३. 8; M. १८३. ७५.
--the lightning of the sky, a daughter of विनता. M. 6. ३४.

--also called Mitrasaha and कल्माषान्घ्रि; (कल्माषपाद-वा। प्।) son of सुदास; wife of मदयन्ती, [पगे३-702+ २९] became a राक्षस through वसिष्ठ's curse. Once as he was hunting, he killed a demon. The latter's brother wanted to wreak vengeance on the king and in the guise of a cook, served human flesh to वसिष्ठ. The sage knew this and cursed him to be a demon for १२ years. The king wanted to curse the sage in return but was stopped by his wife. The consecrated waters fell on his feet and blackened them. Wandering in the forest, he saw a Brahman couple engaged in amorous sports. As a demon he seized the Brahman and ate his flesh despite the lady's protest. She cursed the demon to meet with death in the sexual act and joined her husband on his funeral pyre: after १२ years he returned and longed for union with his queen. She refused remembering the curse of the Brahmana lady. So he appointed वसिष्ठ to beget a son on his queen. As the child was seven years in pregnancy, वसिष्ठ hit her stomach with a stone and the child was born. This was अश्मक. भा. IX. 9. १८-39; वा. 1. १७५; ८८. १७६.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २२.
--a भार्गव gotra. वा. ६५. ९६.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १०.
--divine birds; sisters of अरुण and गरुड. वा. ६९. ६७.
--belonging to the आर्षेय Pravara, Angiras. M. १९६. 7. [पगे३-703+ २९]
--an आत्रेय gotraka1ra. M. १९७. 4.
--the magic car of iron obtained by tapas from शिव by शाल्व; made by Maya fitted with all illusory powers. भा. X. ७६. 1, 3-7; ७८. १३.
--a son of बृहत्श्लोक and the grandson of वामन. भा. VI. १८. 7-8.
--a son of Vasudeva. M. ४६. २२.

(I)--a ऋग् Vedic sage who got himself trans- formed into a youthful person and requested king मान्- धात्रि for his daughter's hand; when he was asked to select one from the harem, he went in, when all his fifty daughters wanted to have him as their husband. So he agreed; after enjoying worldly pleasure for long, he felt the urge for मुक्ति and retired to the forest, with his wives following and became a वैखानसभिक्षु; lived with them; father of १५० sons; when the sage was dead, all his wives burnt themselves on his funeral pyre; <F>1:  भा. IX. 6. ३८-55; Vi. IV. 2. ६९ to end.</F> before his marriage he was engaged in penance. Once immersed under the waters of the यमुना in contemplation of the Lord, he saw a fish in sexual union and felt a desire for home life; on another occasion he noticed गरुड consuming a fish, and cursed on behalf of [पगे३-704+ ३०] the sages that गरुड's visit to कालिन्दि would be his death. <F>2:  Ib. X. १७. 9-११.</F> Knew the yoga power of Hari. <F>3:  Ib. II. 7. ४५.</F>
(II)--a pupil of Devamitra. भा. XII. 6. ५६.
(III)--a son of सत्या and कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. २४७.
--a daughter of सत्यभामा. Br. III. ७१. २४८.

--when प्रलय went up to the mahar- lokam and when the whole world was overwhelmed by अहम्कार there was a dispute between ब्रह्मा and कृष्ण when out of the latter's chest a light in the shape of a Linga came out. It was drunk by दक्ष son of ब्रह्मा and the result was the birth of सती. The rest of रस became eight- fold, seven substances bringing fortune and salt. M. ६०. 6-१०.
--in honour of भवानी. M. १०१. १६.

--in honour of उमा; to be begun on Vasanta शुक्ल triti1ya1 and continued for a year every त्रितीया when सती married शिव; after purificatory baths, offer prayers to उमा and also to शिव in the midst of the eight सौभाग्यस् by flowers, incense, etc.; at the end a gift of a bed is prescribed; the performer gets desired things and ultimately reaches heaven; he who does it for १२ years, or 7 or 8 lives a happy long life. Madana, Sata- dhanva, कार्तवीर्य, वरुण and Nandi have done this. M. ६०. 1. ४६. [पगे३-705+ २५]
--sugar cane, रसराज, निष्पाव, जाजि, धान्यकम्, गोक्षीरम्, kurumbham and salt. M. ६०. 7-8, २८.
--a pupil of सूत. वा. ६१. ५६.
--a territorial division of शाल्मलिद्वीप. भा. V. २०. 9.
--the sacred thread worn by women after their wedlock. It is said that सीता retained this alone when giving away the other jewels as gifts. भा. IX. ११. 4.
--a Kauthuma. वा. ६१. ३९.
(I)--a composer of the साम वेद। Br. II. ३५. ४४.
(II)--लक्ष्मण, met his brother राम in the R. कदली. M. २२. ५३.
(I)--the town of Soma visited by Arjuna in search of the dead child of the द्वारका Brahman. भा. X. ८९. ४४. [पगे३-706+ २५]
(II)--one of the nine divisions of भारत- वर्ष. Br. II. १६. 9; M. ११४. 8; वा. ४५. ७९; Vi. II. 3. 7.
(III)--a मुहूर्त of the night. Br. III. 3. ४३; वा. ६६. ४४.
(IV)--a son of Purindrasena (आन्ध्र). M. २७३. १०.
(V)--Budha, the son of रोहिणी; born in Nai- मिष. वा. 2. 9.
(I)--(Sauram उचानम्)--solar measure- ments. Br. II. २१. १३७; वा. ५०. १८८.
(II)--सूक्त of the Yajurvedins; to be recited in tank rituals. M. ५८. ३५; ९३. १३२.
(IV)--the place of the moon in the मण्- डलम्. वा. ५३. ५९.
--in honour of शिव and केशव. M. १०१. १४.
(I)--a class of sacred fire. भा. IV. 1. ६३. [पगे३-707+ २९]

(II)--a class of पितृस् who drink Soma's स्व- ध; deities of ऋतुस् and hence ऋत्वस्; पितृस् born of Soma. Br. II. २३. ३९, ७५; २८. 4, १५, १८, ७०; M. १०२. २०; १२६. ६९; १४१. 4, १३, १६. वा. ५२. ६७; ५६. १३, १६, ६६; Vi. II. १२. १३.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १०.
(I)--the fire originating in waters; light and heat produced from; <F>1:  Br. II. २४. १२, १८; वा. ५३. 8, १३.</F> is शुचि agni; <F>2:  Br. II. १२. 3.</F> the Sun god. <F>3:  वा. 1. ९७.</F>
(II)--belonging to आर्षेय pravara of भार्गवस्. M. १९५. 38
(III)--शनैस्चर born of रेवती in चाक्षुष epoch; (3/4) of बृहस्पति in extent. वा. ५३. ६७, १०९.

--a group of seven in relation to सूर्य, changing every month. While the sage chants the वेदस् in his praise, the Gandharva sings, the Apsarasas dance, the नाग makes fast his chariot, the यक्ष makes his chariot and the राक्षस pushes it from behind. Preceding the chariot the वालखिल्यस् move praising his glory. भा. XII. ११. २७, ४६-49.
--the kingdom to which Puramjana went with his friend अवधूत; allegorically smell. भा. IV. २५. ४८; २९. ११.

--the bull from whom Asija learnt the गो- धर्म; one day it ate of the grass kept for ceremonial and was forcibly retained by दीर्घतमस् who on hearing the [पगे३-708+ २७] गोधर्म from it left it go; Surabhi got him rid of all curses including blindness and old age. वा. ९९. ४७, ८८.
(I)--the स्थानम् of the sun in the मण्डलम्. वा. ५३. ५९.
(II)--one of the six दर्शनस्. वा. १०४. १६.
--the solar region; १००,000 yojanas from the earth. Vi. II. 7. 5.
--see Saumya मानम्. Br. II. २१. १३७.
--leads to the world of the Sun. M. १०१. ६३.
--in praise of the Sun god; सूक्त of the Yajur Vedins; recited in tank ritual; of अथर्व वेद। M. ५८. ३५; ७७. 6; ९३. १३४.
--an Apsaras in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु. M. १६१. ७४.

the द्विजस् of, became व्रात्यस्, after Puramjaya's time; <F>1:  भा. XII. 1. ३८; M. ११४. ५१.</F> attacked परशुराम and were defeated; <F>2:  Br. III. ३९. ११.</F> ruled by a degraded caste. <F>3:  Vi. IV. २४. ६८.</F>
--the country of the. Vi. II. 3. १६. [पगे३-709+ २७]
(I)--is शनैश्चर (planet) २५०,000 yojanas above बृहस्पति; above are seven sages. Br. II. २४. १०५; Vi. II. 7. 9.
(II)--belonging to आर्षेय pravara of Angiras. M. १९५. ४३.
(III)--an adopted son of वस्तावन. वा. ९६. १८९.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. १०.
--a son of Vasudeva adopted by his brother वृक. Br. III. ७१. १९२.
--the earth of पातालम्. Br. II. २०. १५.
(I)--gold vessels for श्राद्ध. M. १७. २०; वा. ७४. 1.
(II)--a सूक्तम् of the साम सम्हिता; recited in tank ritual. M. ५८. ३६.

--a country after सुवीर son of शिबि, visited by Vidura; <F>1:  भा. I. १०. ३५; III. 1. २४; V. १०. 1; M. ४८. २०.</F> its people were enlisted by जरासन्ध against the Yadus; <F>2:  भा. X. ५०. V. 3.</F> lay between द्वारका and हास्तिनपुर. <F>3:  Ib. X. ७१. २१; XI. २१. 8.</F>
--a Janapada of the भद्रा country. वा. ४३. १९; Vi. II. 3. १७. [पगे३-710+ ३४]
--a northern kingdom. Br. II. १६. ४७.

--the gate-keeper of this king chose him for sacrifice to कालि, who knowing Bharata's spiritual eminence turned against the servant of the king; then engaged Bha- rata born as Brahman, as palanquin bearer; when he went to the hermitage of Kapila he did not bear it well, and when asked once and twice the Brahman burst out into high philo- sophy which the king learnt from him and renounced all kinds of distinction. Vi. II. १३. ४८ to end; chh. १४-16.
--belonging to the Pravara Angiras. M. १९६. १२.
a kingdom of मध्यदेश. Br. II. १६. ४१.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २६.

(I)--a son of Agni and कृत्तिकस्; father of निशा- kha and others; <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. १४; Vi. I. 8. ११.</F> the presiding deity for the अन्गारकग्रह; <F>2:  M. ९३. १३; Br. II. ७४. ४८; २६. ३३.</F> in the Tripuram battle; <F>3:  M. १३८. २४: १८१. ३२.</F> spoke in praise of Benares; <F>4:  Ib. १८२. 1; १८४. ७४.</F> in praise of; <F>5:  Ib. १८५. 2-4; १९२. 6.</F> a commander of gods; <F>6:  Ib. २३०. 7; २६६. ४५.</F> ety. <F>7:  Ib. १५९. 1-3.</F> also known कुमार, कार्ति- keya; <F>8:  Br. III. १०. ४३ and ५१; ३२. ५४, ५९, IV. १४. 8; ३०. १०५.</F> Lord of नैऋऋतस्. <F>9:  Ib. III. ४१. १७ and ५२; ५९. १४.</F> [पगे३-711+ २२]
(II)--a son of पशुपति and स्वाहा. Br. II. १०. ८१; वा. २७. ५३.
(III)--a son of आयु. Br. III. 3. २४.
(IV)--(पार्वतीय) a sage of the Rohita epoch. Br. IV. 1. ६२.
--an evil planet. Br. III. 7. १५९-60.
--राक्षसस्, fearful to children. वा. ६९. १९१.
--a R. of the भद्रा country. वा. ४३. ३०.
--a पिशाच gan2a, unclad and with hanging hairs; eat the leavings of others. वा. ६९. २६३, २७९.
--an आर्षेय Pravara belonging to Angiras. M. १९६. २३.
--an आन्ध्र king who ruled for seven years. M. २७३. 6. [पगे३-712+ २३]
--a class of पिशाचस्. Br. III. 7. ३८०.
--a class of पिशाचस्. Br. III. 7. ३८१. ४००.
--(Sagara's) camp. Br. III. ४९. 9.

--one among the eighteen पुराणस्; the महा-पुराण of ८१,000 verses dealing with महेश्वर dharmas and the anecdotes of षण्मुख; he who gives it with a golden शूल when the sun is in मीन attains शिवहोओद्. M. ५३. ४२-4; वा. १०४. १०; Vi. III. 6. २३. भा. XII. 7. २३; १३. 7.
--a mother goddess. M. १७९. २९.
--sons of Vidyota. भा. VI. 6. 5.
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २१.
--a कश्यप and one of the seven sages of स्वा- रोचिष epoch. Br. II. ३६. १७.
(I) (कश्यप)--a son of पर्वश. Br. II. ११. १६. [पगे३-713+ २७]
(II)--one of the seven sages of the स्वारोचिष epoch. Vi. III. 1. ११.
(III)--of श्याम Para1s4ara clan. M. २०१. ३७.

--the chief types of pillars are five; rucaka (square), vajra (octogonal), dvivajra (sixteen sided), प्रलीनक (thirty-two sided) and वृत्त (round); (वास्तु). If the measurements are incorrect there will be fear from kings, thieves and other troubles. The woods for the different sides of a house are वट, udumbara, pippala, प्लक्ष, etc. Other trees which can be grown around a building are पुन्नाग, अशोक, bakulu, शमी, शिलक, campaka, दाडिमी, पिप्पली, द्राक्ष, जम्बीरु, पूग, panasa, ketaki, जाति-saroja, शतपत्रिक, mallika, नारिकेल, कदली, पाटल, etc. These give auspiciousness to the house. ^1 M. २५५. 1-4, १६. ^2 Ib. २५५. २०-4.
--heard the विष्णु पुराण from भागिनि and narrated it to दधीच. Vi. VI. 8. ४४.
--a शक्ति in the Kiricakra, and a charioteer. Br. IV. २०. 6, २५, ३८, ५७.
--a Janapada of the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. १०.
--a wife of वरुण! her two sons were Kali and Vaidya and a daughter सुरसुन्दरी. Br. III. ५९. 6. [पगे३-714+ ३९]
--the wife of प्रतिहर्ता and mother of Aja and भूमन्. भा. V. १५. 5.
--a son of हिरण्यरेतस् of कुशद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १४.
--theft; one of the heinous sins; story of a thief Vajra of काञ्ची is told. <F>2:  Br. IV. 6. ३७; 7. 4, १०.</F> ^1 वा. १०५. १३.
--a playmate of कृष्ण; wanted to go to the palmyra grove then in possession of Dhenuka. भा. X. १५. २०; २२. ३१.
--four-fold, dravya, गुण, karma, and आभि- janikam. वा. ५९. ५८.

(I) <F>1:  M. ६१. ५०-3.</F>--of ब्रह्मा by Gods oppressed by तारक; <F>2:  Ib. १५४. 7-१५.</F> of पार्वती by वीरक; <F>3:  Ib. १५८. ११-20.</F> of षन्मुख before तारकावध; <F>4:  Ib. १५९. १३-17.</F> same by Siddhas and Bandies; <F>5:  Ib. १६९. ४०-3.</F> of Narasimha by Gods after the death of हिरण्यकशिपु; <F>6:  Ib. १६३. ९८-103.</F> of Narasimha by शन्कर; <F>7:  Ib. १७९. ५५-60.</F> of Hari by Aditi; <F>8:  Ib. २४४. १२-34.</F> of Hari by प्रह्लाद; <F>9:  Ib. २४५. १७-29.</F> of वामन by ब्रह्मा; <F>१०:  Ib. २४५. ६७-80.</F> of माधव by earth (माधवीय); <F>११:  Ib. २४८. १२. ५६.</F> of विष्णु by Gods for अमृथमथन. <F>१२:  Ib. २४९. ३७-44.</F> [पगे३-715+ ४६]

(II)--of विष्णु by प्रिथिवी; <F>1:  Vi. I. 4. १२-24.</F> by ब्रह्मा; <F>2:  Ib. I. 9. ४०. ५७.</F> by other Gods; <F>3:  Ib. I. 9. ६९-74.</F> by Dhruva; <F>4:  Ib. I. १२. ५१-74.</F> by Pracetasas; <F>5:  Ib. I. १५. 2{??}-४३.</F> by प्रह्लाद; <F>6:  Ib. I. १९. ६४-86; २०. 9-१३.</F> by Devas; <F>7:  Ib. III. १७. ११-34.</F> by ब्रह्मा; <F>8:  Ib. V. 1. ३५-51, ५५-9.</F> by कालिय's wives (कृष्ण); <F>9:  Ib. V. 7. ४८-59.</F> by कालिय; <F>१०:  Ib. V. 7. ६१-76.</F> by नारद; <F>११:  Ib. V. १६. १९-27.</F> by अक्रूर; <F>१२:  Ib. V. १७. 3-१७; १८. ४८-58.</F> by वासुदेव after Kamsa's fall; <F>१३:  Ib. V. २०. ९४-105.</F> by Mucukunda; <F>१४:  Ib. V. २३. २९-47.</F> by Aditi after getting her कुण्डल back. <F>१५:  Ib. V. ३०. 6-२३.</F>
(III)--of लक्ष्मी, by Indra. Vi. I. 9. ११६-33.
(IV)--of सूर्य, by याज्ञवल्क्य. Vi. III. 5. १६-25.

--svara variety of a साम; <F>1:  वा. 9. ४९.</F> सप्तदशम्, another variety; <F>2:  Ib. 9. ५०.</F> पञ्चदशम्, another variety; <F>3:  Br. II. 8. ५१. ५२.</F> पञ्चदशम्, from the south face of ब्रह्मा. <F>4:  Vi. I. 5. ५४.</F>
--a king who ruled for १३ years. Br. III. ७४. १८७.
--in the नर्मदा. M. १९४. ३१.

(I)--the region of adharma, and of Kali; <F>1:  भा. I. १७. ३८.</F> duties and behaviour of; to be avoided by a ब्रह्मचारिन्; <F>2:  Ib. VII. ११. २५. २९; १२. 7-9.</F> becomes केशशूल in Kali; more women than men; unfit for rule, if [पगे३-716+ ३४] there were no husband; <F>3:  Br. II. ३१. ५१ and ५४: IV. १४. १५.</F> killing a woman a heinous crime; Hari cursed to be born on earth for having slain भृगु's wife. <F>4:  Ib. II. ३६. १८१ and १८{??}; III. ७२. १३८-40.</F> No शील or व्रत; but fond of wine and meat in the Kali age; <F>5:  वा. ५८. ४३.</F> conditions making her unfit for intercourse; <F>6:  Vi. III. ११. ११५-17.</F> to be honoured and not to be fully confided. <F>7:  Ib. III. १२. ३०.</F>

(II)--in Kali age; personal charm in the possession of hair; deserts her husband for power; a wealthy man, con- sidered as husband; fickle, short of stature, and gluttonous, speaks lies, is indecent and immoral; child bearing at the age of 5 or 6; <F>1:  Vi. VI. १७-18, २८-31, ४१.</F> by honouring her husband she is elevated. <F>2:  Ib. VI. 2. २८-9.</F>
--a Janapada. वा. ९९. ३८७.
--under Kanaka. Br. III. ७४. १९९.

--a heinous offence; <F>1:  वा. ६२. १५५.</F> विष्णु slew शुक्र's mother and was cursed to be born as man on earth seven times for the progress of the world; <F>2:  M. ४७. १०३.</F> a rule in wars that the women of the enemy's side must not be molested; but बाण's women were molested by the fire of Tripura. <F>3:  Ib. १८८. ४९.</F>
--one of the १० Pi1t2has for images, square and with no मेखल; this leads to health, wealth and happiness. M. २६२. 6, 8, १६. [पगे३-717+ २४]
--one of the ten sons of रौद्राश्व. भा. IX. २०. 4; वा. ९९. १२४. Vi. IV. १९. 2.
--the state architect. M. २१५. ४०.
--in एकाशिलदेश between कृष्ण and पाण्डुर Mts; in the middle is न्यग्रोधा below which is anantasada, abode of विष्णु who is worshipped by यक्षस्, Gandharvas, etc. वा. ३८. ५१-9
--a भार्गव gotraka1ra. M. १९५. २१.
(I)--a son of भद्राश्व. M. ४९. 5.
(II)--the seventh son of रौद्राश्व. वा. ९९. १२४. Vi. IV. १९. 2.
--a place sacred to शिव. M. १८१. २७.
(I)--a शुख god. Br. IV. 1. १९.
(II)--a mukhya गण. वा. १००. १९.
--fourteen worlds of which seven were made and seven mind-born. भू to सत्य were created. Br. IV. 2. 8, १८, ३१. [पगे३-718+ ३१]
(I)--the name of वामदेव who was prevented from proceeding with the work of creation; <F>1:  M. 4. ३२.</F> praised by the Gods before the swallowing of कालकूट. <F>2:  Ib. २५०. ४१.</F>

(II)--ety. from स्था, to stand; after creating Rudras, Mahadeva stood as ऊर्द्व reta (ब्रह्मचारि's life) upto the pralaya; his ten qualities are knowledge, वैराग्य, ऐश्वर्य, tapas, satya, patience, courage, the quality of creation, knowledge of self and the quality of establishing; <F>1:  वा. १०. ६४-7; ४९. २८.</F> gave up protection work and hence स्थाणु. <F>2:  Br. I. 1. १२९; 9. ८८.</F>
--sacred to Goddess भवानी. M. १३. ३१.

--to be honoured with presents of golden beds in connection with rituals for cutting canals, etc; <F>1:  M. ५८. ४९.</F> to be honoured in founding new temples; <F>2:  Ib. २६४. ३१.</F> qualifications of; one who is versed in his art and science, has faith, is skilled and clever, an expert in वास्तुशास्त्र and is pure and clean-- performs homa at the topmost place of the deity to be installed. Worship and gifts to, after the installation of a deity. <F>3:  Ib. २६५. 1-4, ३०; २६७. ३१.</F>
--architectural science created by ब्रह्मा. भा. III. १२. ३८.
--a vessel of wood for श्राद्ध; of Udumbara tree. वा. ७५. ६७. [पगे३-719+ २३]
--a ritual comprising an offering of rice boiled in milk. M. २३०. ११.
--a son of Vasudeva and मदिरा. वा. ९६. १७०.
(I)--a कला of ब्रह्मा. Br. IV. ३५. ९४.
(II)--a कला of Hari Br. IV. ३५. ९५.
(III)--an Ajitadeva. वा. ६७. ३३.
--a god of Sumedhasa group. Br. II. ३६. ५९.
(I)--a son of देवजनी and an यक्ष. Br. III. 7. १२८.
(II)--a son of मणिवर. वा. ६९. १५९.
(I)--eligible for पार्वण s4ra1ddha; feeding one such, better than many a मन्त्रयज्ञ in the श्राद्ध. <F>2:  Br. III. 9. ६८; M. १६. 7.</F> ^1 वा. ८६. ६३.
--a कश्यप and a त्रयार्षेय. M. १९९. १२. [पगे३-720+ २७]
--bath for purity; worship of the earth as a preliminary; तर्पणम् after the bath; rules for rituals after. M. ch. १०२ (whole).
--one of the daughters of रोहिणी; had two sons. वा. ६६. ७२.
--the वैश्य caste of कुशद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ३८.
--the गुण of वायु devoured by आकाश when वायु cools down. वा. १०२. १५.
--from this came रूप-मात्रम्। वा. 4. ५३.
--a gupta शक्ति. Br. IV. १९. १८; ४४. १८.

--the राक्षस presiding over the month of पुष्य: a son of यातुधान and father of Nikumbha; <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ४२; Br. III. 7. ८९, ९५.</F> with the sun in the Hemanta; <F>2:  वा. ५२. १९.</F> with the sun during the पौष्य month. <F>3:  Vi. II. १०. १४.</F>
--a son of वसिष्ठ and a प्रजापति of the स्वारो- चिष epoch. M. 9. 9. [पगे३-721+ २९]
--born of पुष्टि. भा. IV. 1. ५१.
(I)--a son of देवकी killed by Kamsa: taken back to द्वारका: after embracing by mother goes to heaven with his five brothers. भा. X. ८५. ५१ and ५६.
(II)--is Manmatha. Br. IV. ३०. ६५; M. २३. ३० ch.

--promulgated by Manu at the beginning of त्रेतायुग; traditional dharma of the family and precepts of conduct constituting वर्णाश्रम and आचारलक्षण; deals with वर्णाश्रम, yama and niyama; remembrance is स्मार्त; <F>1:  Br. II. २९. ४४-60; ३२. ३३-44; III. २१. ४७. M. १४२. ४२; वा. ५७. ३९, ४१-45.</F> ety. introduced after the manvan- tara by remembering the old आचारस्; by once more calling to mind the practices of previous epochs principally of वर्नाश्रम. <F>2:  Ib. ५९. ३२, ३८.</F>
(I)--born of medha. भा. IV. 1. ५२.

(II)--Law books; distinguished from श्रुति in द्वापर and interpreted in two ways; <F>1:  M. ५२. १२; १४४. 7; वा. ५८. २४; २३. 8; ३२. ४४.</F> no more recognised as authority in Kali. <F>2:  Br. II. ३१. 6, ३४; IV. 1. ३०; 6. ६४; वा. ५८. ३४.</F>

(IV)--a daughter of दक्ष; wife of Angiras; a गोत्रकार; <F>1:  वा. १०. २७; २८. १४, ३०; Vi. I. 7. २५.</F> had two sons and four daughters--सिनीवालि, कूहु, राक, and अनुमती; sons भरताग्नि and कीर्तिमत्. <F>2:  Br. II. 9. ५२, ५५; ११. १७; Vi. I. १०. 7.</F>

--a jewel presented by the Sun god to सत्रा- jita (s.v.) to enable him to see his form distinctly without be- ing blinded by his hallow; had the quality of yielding eight loads of gold every day. कृष्ण thought that Ugrasena was worthy of having it; knowing this सत्राजित् gave it to his brother Prasena. He placed it in a room and hedged it with divinity. कृष्ण asked for it and was refused. It was taken to the forest by Prasena whom a lion killed. जाम्बवा killed the lion and got the jewel. कृष्ण fought with him and recover- ing the jewel, returned it to सत्राजित in a public assembly. सत्राजित offered his daughter in marriage to कृष्ण and made a gift of the jewel. कृष्ण returned it to सत्राजित. शतधन्वन् killed सत्राजित and took it, and placed it with अक्रूर for safe custody. This led to some misunderstand- ing between कृष्ण and राम, and at कृष्ण's request, अक्रूर made it public that it was in his possession. भा. X. ३७. १८; cch. ५६ and ५७ (whole); Br. III. ७१. २६, ५२, ८२, ९८. M. ४५. 4-१७; वा. ९६. २५-58. Vi. IV. 3. १४-62, १५१-161.

--a place of pilgrimage near Kuruk- षेत्र where the rival armies met in battle. A क्षेत्र sacred to परशुराम: Nine pools of blood were made here by परशुराम after killing all the क्षत्रियस् of the earth twenty-one times. Here came कृष्ण and the Yadus to observe solar eclipse. After fasting and bathing, Brahmans and other guests were fed. Thither came Nanda and the Gopas as well as भीष्म, द्रोण and other sages and kings. [पगे३-723+ २५] All of them exchanged greetings. द्रौपदी spent her time with कृष्ण's wives asking them about their marriages. Here कृष्ण and Vasudeva performed a sacrifice. A तीर्थ on the banks of the सरस्वती where दिती engaged herself in penance. भा. IX. १६. १९; X. ७८ [९५ (V) १९]; chh. ८२, ८३ and ८४ (whole). M. 7. 3.
--sages of, visited द्वारका. भा. X. ९०. २८ [4].
(I)--a daughter of Devaka and one of the seven wives of Vasudeva. M. ४४. ७३.
(II)--born of milk ocean; image of: in the form of a girl of nine years, youthful, with round neck, red lips and charming brows and holding the lotus श्रीफलम् in her hands. M. २५०. 3; २६१. ४०.
--a sacrificial utensil. वा. ६५. ३२.
--one of the १४ gan2as of Apsaras born of यज्ञ. Br. III. 7. १९.
--a sacrificial utensil. वा. ६५. ३२. [पगे३-724+ ३१]
--a राक्षस residing in the sun's chariot in the month of Nabha. Vi. II. १०. 9.

--the third loka; Sva was uttered and divaloka came of; where Gandharvas, Apsaras, यक्षस्, Guhyakas, and नागस् live; intervening between सूर्य and Dhruva. Br. II. १९. १५५; २१. २१; IV. 2. २६-7; वा. १०१. १७-41.
--a son of वृकदेवी and Vasudeva. वा. ९६. १८०.
--to be fed on festival days. भा. X. २४. २८.
--a lake in the चन्द्रप्रभा hill near कैलास. Br. II. १८. 6.
--a R. in the चन्द्रप्रभा hill. Br. II. १८. 6.
--a तीर्थ on the नर्मदा. M. १९१. 6.

--practised in शकद्वीप; <F>1:  Br. II. १९. १०६; वा. ४९. १०३.</F> परशुराम ac- cused by शिव as lacking in the practice of; <F>2:  Br. III. २३. ७१; ५०. 2.</F> to be insisted upon the subjects by the Kings; <F>3:  M. २१५. ६३; २२५. 5.</F> of castes; departure from, leads to hell; <F>4:  Vi. I. 6. 9, ४१-2.</F> Daityas routed for having departed from their dharma. <F>5:  Ib. III. १८. १२, ४८.</F>

(I)--a daughter of दक्ष and consort of अग्नीस्: (पितृस्-वा। प्।, and वि। प्।) gave birth to two daughters [पगे३-725+ २५] वयुना (मेना-वा। प्।) and धारिणी, who were Brahma- वदीन्स्. भा. IV. 1. ६३-4; वा. 1. ७७; १०. २८; ५२. ४०; ५५. ४३; Br. II. 9. ५७; १३. २९. Vi. I. 7. २५, २७; १०. १९.
(II)--a wife of Angiras--mother of पितृस्. भा. VI. 6. १९.
(III)--married Kavi Agni: her sons were काव्यस्: her daughter the source of पितृस् with forms. ^1 Br. I. 1. ६२; III. १०. ८५; वा. ७३. ३५; ७४. 3; ७५. ५६, ७७.
(IV)--a god of one of the ten branches of the Harita गण. Br. IV. 1. ८५; वा. १००. ८९.
(VI)--the essence milked by Antaka for पितृस्; <F>1:  M. १०. १९.</F> out of this came पितृस् <F>1:  M. १०. १९.</F> (Somapas). <F>2:  Ib. १५. २७, ३१; १६. ४४; १७. ५२; २२. ८८.</F>
--is शिव. Br. II. २६. ३४.
--the exclamation or benediction used in presenting oblation to departed ancestors. वा. ७३. ५२.
--a manifestation of Hari in the epoch of Manu रुद्रसावर्णि: born of Satyasaha and सूनृता. भा. VIII. १३. २९. [पगे३-726+ ३१]
--the nectar of the moon in the कृष्ण- पक्ष is स्वाध drunk by पितृस् and low class of deities and in the शुक्लपक्ष it is अमृत drunk by Gods. वा. ५२. ३८, ४०; ६२. १८५.
--a son of द्युतिमान्. Br. II. ११. 9.

--dreams, bad and good; ceremonies must be performed for bad ones; after a bad dream, one must try to sleep for sometime; after a good dream one must try to be awake lest it should be followed by a bad one for the latter will generally come true. Dream had in the first of the four divisions of the night will come true in a year; that had in the second will come true in six months; that had in the third, will come true in three months and that had early in the morning will come true in १० days. M. २४२. 1-१९.
--attacked Mangala the Daitya. Br. IV. २८. ४१; ३४. ६४.

--a son of पृश्नि--a righteous and great king; no disease or famine during his reign; when the काशि kingdom suffered from want of rain continuously for three years Svaphalka was invited to live there and there were rains; he then married काशिराज's daughter गान्दिनी who gave in gift, every day one cow for a Brahman; <F>1:  वा. ९६. १०१-105.</F> his daughter नरा, was the wife of भन्गकार. <F>2:  Ib. ९६. ८६.</F>
--an Asura in the सभा of हिरण्यकशिपु. M. १६१. ८०. [पगे३-727+ २७]
--a queen of वर्षऋतु. Br. IV. ३२. २८.
--a son of भृगु and a Deva. Br. III. 1. ८९.
--a Satya god. Br. II. ३६. ३५.

(I)--the one god in three forms: creating, protecting and destroying: only sectarians speak of each of these as separate: the one of the three गुणस्; <F>1:  Br. III. 3. ८२-131.</F> not created and the first. <F>2:  वा. 4. ४४.</F>
(II)--the वेदव्यास of the first द्वापर. Vi. III. 3. ११.
(I)--a son of Sini, and father of हृदीक. भा. IX. २४. ४६.
(II)--a son of प्रतिक्षत्र (प्रतिक्षिप्त- वा. P.) and father of हृदीक. Br. III. ७१. १३९; वा. ९६. १३८; Vi. IV. १४. २३.
--the गान्धर्व form of marriage. Br. IV. १५. 4.

--a form of marriage by which कृष्ण mar- ried a good number of women; <F>1:  Vi. III. १८. ८८; V. २८. 6; भा. I. १०. २९; X. ५२. १६.</F> of द्रौपदी; <F>2:  Ib. X. ५७. १० [1].</F> of लक्ष्मणा. ^3 Ib. X. ५८. ५७. [पगे३-728+ २४]
--नारद set his mind on विष्णु as revealed in Svara. भा. VI. 5. २२.
--a son of गायत्री and प्रजापति. वा. २१. ४२.
--seven (music); <F>1:  वा. ८६. ३६.</F> sixteen of the Vedas. ^2 Ib. ६५. २८; १०४. ७१.
--a son of शेष Na1gara1ja. वा. ९९. ३६६.
--seven svaras, three ग्रामास्, २१ mu1r- chanas and ४९ ta1nas (तालस्-वा। प्।). Br. III. ६१. २९; वा. ८६. ३६, ४९.
--named. Br. IV. ४४. ५५-7.
--Mt. in शाल्मलिद्वीप. भा. V. २०. १०.
--a queen of वर्षऋतु. Br. IV. ३२. २८.
(I)--a daughter of उत्तानपाद. Br. II. ३६. ९०; वा. ६२. ७७.
(II)--a daughter of Kardama and one of the wives of Atharva Angiras; son Gautama. Br. III. 1. १०२; वा. ६५. ९८. [पगे३-729+ ३०]
(III)--a daughter of क्रोधा. वा. ६९. २०५.
(I)--he, who conquers this world and the anta- रिक्ष. Br. II. १६. १७. M. ११४. १६.
(II)--one of the seven rays of the sun helping the planet शनैश्चर. Br. II. २४. ६७; वा. ५३. ४९.
--son of तुषित in the Uttama manvantara. वा. ६७. ३५.
(I)--a son of जामि and Dharma, father of Nandi. भा. VI. 6. 6.
(II)--a son of भीम and Diks. Br. II. १०. ८२; २७. ५४.

(III)--the heaven; <F>1:  वा. ३४. ९६; ४१. ८२; १०३. ४२; १०८. ७६ and ८४.</F> seven gates for; tapas, दान, साम, dama, ह्रीः, आर्जवम्, and sympathy for all creatures; <F>2:  M. ३९. २२.</F> all these possessed by शिबि; <F>3:  Ib. ४२. २०.</F> reached by ययाति with his four grandsons; <F>4:  Ib. ४२. २८.</F> for the worship of Agastya. <F>5:  Ib. ५५३. २९; ६१. ५५.</F>
--a son and commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८३; २६. ४९.
--a son and commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८३; २६. ४९. [पगे३-730+ २७]
--kingdom of the. M. १२१. ५४.
--a तीर्थ wherefrom the Sapta- ऋषिस् reached heaven; noted for Nandi's shrine. Br. III. १३. ६१.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८६.

--is Svarlokam as also divam; the space between the sun and Dhruva; residents of, feed on soma and आज्य; attacked by Malaka and other Asuras; Devas defeated them after refreshing themselves with nectar got by churn- ing of the ocean on the advice of विष्णु; see Svarga. Br. IV. 2. ३९; 9. ३८ ff; वा. ५७. ११५.
--a R. fit for श्राद्ध offering. Br. III. १३. १०३.
--a son and commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ८३; २६. ४९.
--seen by Angiras on the hills of the अमरकण्टक. वा. ७७. 9.
--a stealer of gold. वा. १०१. १५२.
--a R. in the विष्णुस्थानम्. Br. III. ३७. 9.
--a god of one of the ten branches of the Rohita गण. Br. IV. 1. ८६; वा. १००. ९०. [पगे३-731+ २८]
--an उपद्वीप attached to जम्बूद्वीप. भा. V. १९. ३०.
--a तीर्थ on the नर्मदा. M. १९४. १५.
--a son of Danus, and father of a daughter, प्रभा. M. 6. २०-21.
--c. watered by ह्लादिनी. Br. II. १८. ५५.
--a son of Mahasoman (महारोम्ण- वा। प्।) and father of Hrasvaroman. भा. IX. १३. १७; Br. III. ६४. १४; वा. ८९. १४. Vi. IV. 5. २७.
--a daughter of Samudra and wife of प्राचीन- barhis. वा. ६३. २५.
--ten times nyarbudam. वा. १०१. १०१.

(I)--a son of Danu, and father of सुप्रभा (प्रभा-वा। प्।); <F>1:  भा. VI. 6. ३० and ३२; वा. ६८. 8; Vi. I. २१. 5, 7.</F> a Daitya; <F>2:  वा. 1. १८८; ५३. ८३; ६८. १४.</F> (see राहु) routed सूर्य and caused him to fall on the earth when sage Atri saved him. <F>3:  Ib. ७०. ७१.</F>
(II)--a son of सत्यभामा. भा. X. ६१. १०.
(III)--a son of Soma, also known as Budha. Br. I. 1. ६३; II. २३. ८०-38. [पगे३-732+ ३४]
(IV)--a son of सिम्हिका and born in Bha- रणि; vanquished the sun; his daughter प्रभा was married to आयु. Br. II. २४. ८३-97, १३७; III. 6. 8, २३-4; 8. ७७; ६७. 1; वा. ९२. 1.

(V)--राहु, the planet; <F>1:  M. १२८. ५०.</F> has a dark chariot drawn by eight steeds; <F>2:  Ib. १२७. 9; वा. ५२. ७१.</F> in the army at तारकामय; <F>3:  M. १२८. ६२; १७३. २३.</F> महा- graha left unskilled with Virocana; <F>4:  Ib. १७७. 8; १७८. ६७.</F> comes out of the sun and enters the moon in Parvas; then from the moon to the sun; comes out from behind and crossing the shadow of the earth forms a circle itself; its place is बृहद्स्थानम् full of darkness; <F>5:  वा. ५२. ८०-81; ५३. ६३-65; Vi. II. १२. २१-22.</F> has only one ray. <F>6:  वा. ५३. ८८.</F>
(VI)--a son of Vipracitti. Vi. I. २१. १२.

burnt down by Pralaya fire; one of the seven created worlds; <F>1:  Br. IV. 1. १५६; 2. १५; वा. २३. ८४; ३०. ९८; ४९. १४८; १००. १६०; Vi. VI. 3. २६.</F> between the sun and the pole star. <F>2:  Ib. II. 7. १८.</F>

--a class of sages of Atreya fold; ten sons of Atri by his ten apsara wives; famous for their learning in the Vedas and knowledge of Brahman. Br. III. 8. ८१; वा. ७०. ७५.

(I)--the performance of श्राद्ध in this नक्षत्र, gives one profits in trade. Br. III. १८. 8; वा. ५०. १३०; ६६. ४९; ८२. 8. [पगे३-734+ ३७]

--(samudra) sea of fresh (sweet- म्। प्।) water surrounding पुष्करद्वीप; <F>1:  भा. V. २०. २९; Br. II. १९. ११५, १२६ and १४८; M. १२३. ४६; Vi. II. 4. ८६.</F> beyond it, the land of gold where no creatures live; beyond that लोकालोक; ten thousand yojanas in length and breadth; beyond is darkness encircled by अण्डकटह. <F>2:  Ib. --Vedic studies, neglect of, before पृथु's advent; <F>1:  M. १०. ११; १६. 9.</F> recitation of Veda on the occasion of the श्राद्ध. <F>2:  Ib. १७. ३७.</F>
--sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ६३.
(I)--a name of नारद. भा. I. 6. 3.

III. १२. ५३-4; वा. ६१. ११९; १०९. 5.</F> the Devas are यामस्, the sages are मरीचि and six others besides his ten sons; all engaged in Pratisarga and attained the final bliss; <F>2:  M. 9. 3-6.</F> पृथु milked the cow-earth with the help of स्वायम्भुव Manu in his hand; to his family belonged a प्रजापति An3ga; <F>3:  Ib. १०. 3, १५.</F> came out of the first face and of white colour; <F>4:  वा. २६. ३२; ६१. ११९; १०९. 5.</F> married शतरूपा. <F>5:  Br. II. 9. ३६; वा. १०. ११-12.</F> [पगे३-735+ ३१]

--(see Manu) second Manu; four sons, seven sages of whom Datta was the first; the Devas of the epoch were तुषितस्; then lived the seven sons of the sage वसिष्ठ, all प्रजापतिस्; आकाररूप। <F>2:  वा. २६. ३३; ६२. 3, 7, १८-19.</F> ^1 भा. VIII. 1. १९-20; M. 3. ४७.

--a son of वृजिनीवान्. M. ४४. १६.

(I)--a daughter of दक्ष and the mother of पावक, पवमान and शुची through पशुपति-Agni; from these three have sprung up forty-five agnis. All of them form a group of ४९ agnis. <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ६०-61; Br. I. 1. ६२; II. 9. ५२, ५६; १०. ८१. १२. 3; वा. 1. ७६; १०. २८, ३२; २७. ५३; २९. 1; Vi. I. 7. २५, २७; 8. 8; १०. १४-15.</F> Mode of offering in invoking devas while स्वधा for invoking पितृस्. <F>2:  Br. III. 3. २५; ११. १८ and ११६.</F>

(IV)--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २०.
(V)--for karmas associated with Devas and यज्ञस् like स्वधा for पितृस्. वा. ७५. ७७.
--a name of शिव. Br. II. २६. ३४.
--Agni and स्वाहा representing Brahman. Br. IV. ४३. ७५.
--a son of वृजिनीवान् and father of रुशेकु; the best of the performers of fire oblations. Br. III. ७०. १६; वा. ९५. १५.
--a वर्ष round the Kumuda hill in शाल्मलि- द्वीपम्. वा. ४९. ३९.
--a son of ज्योतिष्मन्. वा. ३३. २४.
--a वर्ष after Svairatha <F>1:  वा. ३३. २५.</F> of कुश- द्वीपम्. <F>2:  Ib. ४९. ५३.</F>

--a Tripravara. M. १९६. ३३.
--one of the five heinous sins; बृहस्पति nar- rates to Indra this to be the greatest sin; killing of the trusted to whatever community he belonged is the most heinous. Br. IV. 6. ३७; 7. 2ff.

(I)--a friend of राम; son of Marut and अञ्जना; took part in लन्का expedition; knew the yoga power of विष्णु and worshipped along with राम in the किम्पुरुष country; attained final release by सत्सन्ग। Had the white umbrella when Bharata took the पादुका. <F>1:  भा. IX. १०. १६ and १९; II. 7. ४५; V. १९. 1; XI. १२. 6; IX. १०. ४३.</F> The best, the wise, the learned ब्रह्मचारि, and warrior; <F>2:  Br. III. 7. २२५-26; IV. २९. ११८.</F> present at राम's अभिषेक. <F>3:  Vi. IV. 4. १००.</F>

--an अमिताभ God. Br. IV. 1. १६.
(I)--a son of ब्रह्मा; remained a celibate. भा. IV. 8. 1.
(II)--Mt. on the base (north-वि। प्।) of Meru. भा. V. १६. २६; Vi. II. 2. ३०. [पगे३-738+ २४]
(III)--an अवतार् of Hari in कृतयुग; taught yoga to शनक and other sages in the presence of ब्रह्मा; called himself यज्ञ. भा. X. 2. ४०; XI. 4. १७; 5. २३; १३. १९-41; १७. 3, ११.
(IV)--a son of Brahmadatta and brother of शाल्व; killed on the यमुना by कृष्ण. भा X. ७६. 2 [8]; ५२. [५६ (v) 8]; ५७. १४ [1].
(V)--the caste name of men in कृतयुग. भा. XI. १७. १०.

(VII)--a साध्य; <F>1:  Br. III. 3. १७; M. २०३. ११; वा. ६६. १६.</F> an expert in divine music. <F>2:  Ib. ६९. ४६.</F>
(VIII)--a Gandharva. Br. III. 7. ११.
(IX)--a sage. Br. III. ३६. 6.
(X)--a temple with a तोरण of १० hastas. M. २६९. ३० and ५१.
(I)--a class of ascetics. भा. III. १२. ४३.
(II)--a class of people in प्लक्षद्वीप. भा. V. २०. 4. [पगे३-739+ २७]

--a sacred hymn of दक्ष in praise of Hari. भा. VI. 4. २२.
--belonging to आर्षेयप्रवर of भार्गव; <F>1:  M. १९५. ४१.</F> a त्रयार्षेय. <F>2:  Ib. १९६. ४३.</F>
--a Mt. west of the महाभद्र lake. वा. ३६. ३०.
--a Laukikya Apsaras. Br. III. 7. १०.

--an Eastern Kingdom. Br. II. १६. ५१.
--a hilly country; <F>1:  वा. ४५. १२०, १३५; ४७. ५६.</F> watered by the नलिनी; <F>2:  Br. II. १८. ५९; M. १२१. ५८.</F> an eastern tribe. <F>3:  Br. II. १६. ६७; वा. ४५. १२०.</F>

--a शिव god. Br. II. ३६. ३२.
--a Laukikya Apsaras. Br. III. 7. १०.

--ब्रह्मा; comes out of the एकार्णव; the same as what the आरण्यकस् and the उपनिषद्स् say of पुरुषोयज्ञ; being a Vedamaya he introduces १६ R2tviks required for a यज्ञ from the different limbs of a body; मार्कण्डेय came out of his face and saw the world plunged in waters and wondered at it. Once again he entered the body of the Lord, and coming out again he saw a child sleep- ing on a branch of the banyan tree. He got afraid of his loneliness when the baby Lord asked him not to be afraid of him and told him that he was his father and हृषिकेश, etc; con- [पगे३-741+ ३०] versation between them; then he entered the bowels of the Lord; <F>1:  M. १६७ (whole).</F> after the stipulated period the Lord thought of the universe and then came वैश्वानर; then a thousand-leafed lotus issued from his navel in the shape of the earth. There appeared ब्रह्मा, the different hills, countries, Mlecchas, etc; from this originated पद्मवीधि in यज्ञस्; <F>2:  Ib. Chh. १६८, १६९.</F> there also came Madhu and कैटभ, two representatives of the qualities of rajas and tamas who invited the creator for war. Then they sought and got death from विष्णु. ब्रह्मा created a number of mind-born sons as Progenitors of the world. <F>3:  Ib. Chh. १७०, १७१.</F>
(I)--one of the ten horses of the moon's chariot. Br. II. २३. ५६; M. १२६. ५२; वा. ५२. ५३.
(III)--one of the three sons of शतजित् (शतजि- म्। प्।). Br. III. ६९. 4; M. ४३. 8; वा. ९४. 4.
(IV)--killed by कृष्ण. वा. ९८. १००.

(I)--(हयशीर्ष)--a manifestation of Hari worshipped as such by भद्रश्रवस्: Half-man and half- horse: got back to ब्रह्मा the Vedas seized by Asura Madhu of रसातल; <F>1:  भा. V. १८. 1-6; XI. 4. १७.</F> the form of विष्णु who appeared before Agastya [पगे३-742+ ३०] at कान्ची, having शन्ख, Cakra, अक्षवलय, and Pustaka (book) in his hand; <F>2:  Br. IV. 5. 9, ३५-40.</F> resides in Sutalam. <F>3:  Ib. II. २०. २१; वा. ५०. २०.</F>
(II)--a son of Danu: followed वृत्र in his battles with Indra: a follower of Bali. ^1 भा. VI. 6. ३०; १०. १९; VII. 2. 4; VIII. १०. २१; वा. ६८. १०.
(III)--the demon who carried off the Vedas during the pralaya: killed by Matsya Hari who recovered them. भा. VIII. २४. 8 and ५७.
(IV)--a दानव in the तारकामय. M. १७३. १५; १७७. 6.
(V)--an Asura killed by कृष्ण in प्राग्ज्योतिष. Vi. V. २९. १९.
--sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ६९.

--see अश्वमेध and वाजिमेध; <F>1:  Br. III. ४७. ४५, ४७.</F> of ब्रह्मा over the गयाशीला; विष्णु and other Gods promised to occupy the शिला for मोक्ष of the पितृ; <F>2:  वा. १०८. 9-१०.</F> of दक्ष, ruined; <F>3:  Ib. ३०. ७९, ११०.</F> of Vaivasvata Manu; <F>4:  Br. III. ६०. 4.</F> of Sagara. <F>5:  Vi. IV. 4. १६.</F>
(I)--a daughter of वैश्वानर and wife of Kratu. भा. VI. 6. ३३-34.
(II)--a sacred तीर्थ for श्राद्ध. Br. III. १३. ४६; वा. ७७. ४६.
(III)--a daughter of स्वर्भानु. Vi. I. २१. 7.
--an अवतार् of विष्णु, who appeared in the sacrifice of ब्रह्मा. भा. II. 7. ११.
--is हयग्रीव. Br. IV. 6. 1.
--the science of medicine relating to horses. M. १५. २०.
(II)--one of the eleven Rudras. M. 5. २९; Vi. I. १५. १२२.
(III)--शिव; <F>1:  Vi. I. 8. १४.</F> with १८ hands; <F>2:  M. २२. १४.</F> an ascetic according to Kamsa. <F>3:  Vi. V. 4. 4; २३. 3; ३३. २५.</F>
--a Saimhikeya Asura. Br. III. 6. २०; वा. ६८. १९.
--a mind-born mother. M. १७९. २७. [पगे३-744+ ७०]
--same as शिवपुरम्. M. १९१. ६८.
--an आत्रेय gotraka1ra. M. १९७. 3.
(I)--a group of gods called जयादेवस् of the epoch of तामस Manu. Br. II. ३६. ४३; III. 3. 9 and ६६; 4. ३०; वा. ६६. 9; Vi. III. 1. १६.
(II)--वानरस् born of हरी and Pulaha. Br. III. 7. १७५.

--a son of Raivata Manu. Br. II. ३६. ६३.

VIII. 1. 9-१६.</F> by Gajendra; <F>१८:  Ib. 3. 2-२९.</F> by ब्रह्मा; <F>१९:  Ib. 5. २६-50; 6. 8-१५; १७. २५-28.</F> by शिव; <F>२०:  Ib. १२. 4-१३.</F> by Aditi; <F>२१:  १७. 8-१०.</F> by Bali in bondage, by प्रह्लाद; <F>२३:  Ib. २३. 6-8.</F> and by Satyavrata; <F>२४:  Ib. २४. २९-30, ४६-53.</F> by त्रयी and उपनिषदिच् and Yoga literature; <F>२५:  Ib.
