[५३व् 14-१६].</F> by Mucukunda; <F>२७:  Ib. ५१. ४६-58.</F> by जाम्बवत्; <F>२८:  Ib. ५६. २६-8.</F> by कृतवर्मन्, and अक्रूर; <F>२९:  Ib. ४०. 1-३०; ५७. १२-17.</F> by भूमि, mother of Naraka; <F>३०:  Ib. ५९. २५-31.</F> by रुक्मिणी; <F>३१:  Ib. ६०. ३४-48.</F> by Indra; <F>३२:  [६७ (v) २४-30].</F> by नृग; <F>३३:  Ib. ६०. ४४; ६४. १०-29.</F> and by Rudra; <F>३४:  Ib. ६३. ३४-45.</F> his deeds recalled by the citizens of मथुरा; <F>३५:  Ib. X. ४३. २२-31.</F> praise of; nature of; much in evidence in द्रविड; <F>३६:  Ib. XI. 5. ३२-40.</F> by नारद; <F>३७:  Ib. X. ३७. 9-२३; ६९. १७-18; ७०. ३७-44.</F> by kings in जरासन्ध's prison, and after their [पगे३-745+ ३९] release; <F>३८:  Ib. ७०. २५-30; ७३. 8-१६.</F> by युधिष्टिर; <F>३९:  Ib. ७४. 2-5.</F> by ऋषिस्; <F>४०:  Ib. ८४. १६-26.</F> by Vasudeva, देवकी and Bali; <F>४१:  Ib. ८५. (whole).</F> by बहुलाश्व; <F>४२:  Ib. ८६. ३१-6.</F> by श्रुतदेव; <F>४३:  Ib. ८६. ४४-9.</F> by श्रुतिस् (श्रुतिगीति); <F>४४:  Ib. ८७. १४-41.</F> by gods; <F>४५:  Ib. XI. 6. 7-१९.</F> by ब्रह्मा; <F>४६:  Ib. 6. २१-7; X. १४. 1-४०.</F> by Uddhava; <F>४७:  Ib. ४२. ४९; 7. १४-18; ११. १३, ३४, ३६; २९. ३७-40.</F> by नलकूबर and मणिग्रीव; <F>४८:  Ib. X. १०. २९-38.</F> by कालिय and his wives; <F>४९:  Ib. १६. ३३-59.</F> by Gopis (गोपिगीता); <F>५०:  Ib. २१. 7-१९; ३१. 1-१९; ३५. 2-२५.</F> by Indra. <F>५१:  Ib. २७. 4-१३.</F> ^२२ Ib. २२. 2-११, २१-23.

(II)--a name given to विष्णु by स्वायम्भुव Manu for saving three worlds from affliction; <F>1:  भा. II. 7. 2.</F> acted as ब्रह्मा in Soma's राजसूय; <F>2:  M. २३. २१.</F> अधिदेवत for the planet Budha; <F>3:  Ib. ९३. १३; २४६. 4, ३४: २४७. १९; २४८. ३६.</F> does प्रणाम every day to शङ्कर. <F>4:  वा. २१. 7; ३५. १३.</F>
(III)--a son of ऋषभ and a भागवत: expound- ed to Nimi the nature of a भागवतोत्तम. भा. V. 4. ११; XI. 2. २१, ४५-55.
(IV)--an अवतार्: born as son of हरिणी and Hari- medhas: awarded मोक्ष to Gajendra. भा. VIII. 1. ३०.
(V)--son of Vasudeva and देवकी to put down adharma. भा. IX. २४. ५५-67. [पगे३-746+ ३२]
(VII)--(as horse) killed Madhu and कैटभ. भा. X. ४०. १७.
(VIII)--(कूर्म) bore Mandara. भा. X. ४०. १८.
(IX)--(वराह) raised the Earth. भा. X. ४०. १८; Br. 5. १५.
(X)--Narasimha. भा. X. ४०. १९.

(XI)--निर्गुण and apart from प्रकृति: makes his devotees the poorest so as to create in them a spirit of detachment: Blesses and curses: In the garb of a Brahma- चारिन् persuaded वृक to test शिव's boon on himself: भृगु kicked the sleeping Hari in his chest and helped him to get united with लक्ष्मी: भृगु's wonder at it; <F>1:  भा. X. Chh. ८८-89.</F> Has root in religious performances of Brahmanas and is himself यज्ञ and source of all Dharma: the २५थ् principle: Helped शिव in regaining his lost glory through Maya: took the form of a cow and with ब्रह्मा as calf drank the immortalising fluid of the well in Tripura; <F>2:  Ib. VII. 2. ११; 8. ५२; १०. ५१ and ६२; ११. 7.</F> विभूतिस् of; <F>3:  Ib. १६. 9-४०.</F> ब्रह्मा born of his grace and Rudra of his wrath. <F>4:  Ib. XII 5. 1.</F>
(XII)--अवतार्स् of: पुरुष as ब्रह्मा, विष्णु and Rudra, नरनारायण, Hamsa, Datta, कुमार, ऋषभ, हयग्रीव, Matsya, वराह, कूर्म, नृसिम्ह, वामन, परशुराम and राम. भा. XI. 4 (whole). [पगे३-747+ ३३]

(XIII)--in a group--form of वासुदेव, Sankar- षण, Pradyumna and Aniruddha: as the indwellers of सूर्य: spoken of in nine forms such as time, place and so on. In the form of time, for every month seven attendants lead him; <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. २१ and २८, ३१-44.</F> other attendants of. <F>2:  Ib. XI. २७. २७-9.</F>
(XIV)--a तुषित god in the स्वारोचिष and a साध्य in the चाक्षुष epoch. Br. III. 3. १५.
(XV)--a son of Rukmakavaca appointed over Videha with his brother Parigha. Br. III. ७०. २९; M. ४४. २८-9; वा. ९५. २८.
(XVI)--same as महिष. M. १२२. ५९.
(XVIII)--Mt. a chief hill of कुशद्वीप. Vi. II. ४४. ४१.
(XIX) a son of विश्वामित्र. Vi. IV. 7. ३८.
--the gods of the तामस epoch, see Haraya. भा. VIII. 1. २८.

--(also नारायण Katha1) sung in the सभास् of ब्रह्मा and शिव: sacred, never dull and always new; <F>1:  भा. X. ६०. ४४; ५२. २०.</F> one way of getting divine knowledge: leads to virtue, nectar itself: purifies men and women; <F>2:  Ib. VII. 1. 5 [3]; 7. ३१. X. 1. १३ and १६. XI. 3. 2.</F> fit to listen to, and fit to [पगे३-748+ ४०] be told and listened to: would never give satiety: by listening to it one gets proper vision and crosses the road of सम्सार. For instance hearing of the अवतार् of वामन leads one to bliss and that of Matsya to world's welfare; <F>3:  Ib. I. १५. ३६; १८. 9-१० and १४; V. १२. १६. VIII. २३. ३०; २४. 1-3; X. ९०. २१ [1], २४ and ५०. XI. १४. २६; १९. २०. XI. १४. २६; १९. २०.</F> purifies the worlds and destroys the sins of Kali; <F>4:  Ib. XI. ११. २३ and ३५; XII. 8. 6.</F> faith in the कथा im- portant; <F>5:  Ib. XI. २०. 8-9, २७; २६. २८-29; २७. ४४.</F> importance of, stated by नृसिम्ह to प्रह्लाद, and by नारद to युधिष्टिर; <F>6:  Ib. VII. १०. १२; १४. 3.</F> praise of; <F>7:  Ib. II. 1. 5, 2. ३६-37; 3. १४. २५; 4. 8. 2-6, १७; III. १९. ३३-8; २०. 6; ३२. १८-19; X. 1. 4-१६; 7. 1-3; १२. ४१-3; १३. 1. 2; १६. 2-3; ७८. [९६ (v) 2-4]; ८०. 1-4; XI. 5. 4.</F> परीक्षित्'s deep interest in, and नारद singing of; <F>8:  Ib. X. 1. १५; I. 5. २६ and २८; 6. ३३.</F> अरिष्तसेन hears it and narrates it to किम्पुरुष; <F>9:  Ib. V. १९. 2; VI. 2. २६; 3. ३१.</F> narrated by शुक; <F>१०:  Ib. VII. 1. 5.</F> by Gopis on the eve of कृष्ण's departure to मथुरा, and on hearing कृष्ण's message through Uddhava. <F>११:  Ib. X. ३९. १९. ३०; ४७. ३७-52.</F>
--in ब्रह्मक्षेत्रम्. वा. ५९. १२२.
--a Mt. and residence of Hari महानाभ. वा. ३९. ५८.
(I)--a son of श्यामक and शूरभू. भा. IX. २४. ४२.
(II)--one of the seven important rays of the sun, said to be the root of planets, and the first originator of stars. Br. II. २४. ६६; वा. ५३. ४७.

(III)--a son of पूर्णभद्र, the यक्ष; he became a devotee of शिव and gave up the svadharma of the यक्षस्. Hence the angry father banished him. He perform- [पगे३-749+ २७] ed austerities so severely at Benares for thousands of years that he was covered over with mud and eaten by ants till he was reduced to bones. शिव came to the spot with पार्वती and made him Dhanada, the गनेश्वर and क्षेत्रपाल; he was also made Annada. Two गणस् Udbhrama and Sambhrama were given for his service. Then शिव and पार्वती disappeared. M. १८०. 5-9, ८२. ९९; वा. ६९. १२.
(IV)--a Gandharva king in कैलास्. वा. ४१. २१.
--the wheel of विष्णु, fell to pieces at नैमिष. M. २२. १४.
--offered to शेष by नाग maids. Vi. II. 5. २५.
--a division of श्रिपुरम्. Br. IV. ३२. २५.
--see Haraya. Br. III. 7. १७९; २२. ४५.

--Boyish sport, in which boys are coupled with one another and go leaping away; the vanguard brings back the victor to the starting ground; Govinda was matched with श्रीदामन् and राम with Pralamba in the disguise of a Gopa. Vi. V. 9. १२-14. [पगे३-750+ २४]
--(music) coming out from हरिदेश; Indra is the presiding deity. वा. ८६. ३८, ५७.
--mother of Hari, in the तामस epoch. भा. VIII. 1. ३०; Br. III. 3. ११६.
--a son of Agnidhra; Kingdom उत्तरश्वेत. वा. ३३. ३९, ४२.
(I)--a grandson of हरिश्चन्द्र, and the son of Rohita, (रोहिताश्व-वि। प्।) and father of Campa (Cancu- वि। प्।). भा. X. 8. 1; Br. III. ६३. ११७; वा. ८८. ११९; Vi. IV. 3. २५.
(II)--a son of वपुष्मत्, after whom came the हारित vars2a. Br. II. 1. ३२-3; वा. ३३. २८, २९. Vi. II. 4. २३, २९.
(III)--born of Pulaha. Br. III. 7. १७९.
(IV)--a son of परवृत्. Vi. IV. १२. ११.
(I)--a group of ten gods of the epoch of the १२थ् Manu, <F>1:  भा. VIII. १३. २८; Vi. III. 2. ३४.</F> of the IV सावर्ण Manu. <F>2:  Br. IV. 1. ८३-4.</F>
(II)--a branch of Angiras. वा. ६५. १०७. [पगे३-751+ २६]
(III)--family of, famous warriors. वा. ८८. ७३.
(IV)--one of the five देवगणस् of the १२थ् period of Manu (ऋथुसावर्ण); mind-born son of ब्रह्मा with ten branches.
--belonging to Tripravara. M. १९६. ३३.
--a वर्ष round द्रोण. वा. ४९. ४०.
--the garden where ययाति's family and children used to take rest and engage in recreation; <F>1:  M. ३२. ११.</F> a region of शाल्मलिद्वीप. <F>2:  Br. II. १९. ४४.</F>
--a son of Ilasudyumna; the lord of the east including the Kurus. M. १२. १७-18.
--a R. of the भद्रा country. वा. ४३. २६.
(I)--see Uddhava. भा. X. ४७. ५३.
(II)--a वानर chieftain and son of श्वेत. Br. III. 7. १८१.
--the birthplace of हरिणाश्व mu1rchana. Br. III. ६१. ४४. वा. ८६. ५१. [पगे३-752+ २७]

--uttering the four lettered name of Hari, अजामिल expiated his sins. By hearing his name once even a पुल्कश got released from सम्सार; <F>1:  भा. VI. 2. 7. 9, १४, १८, ४६ and ५०; १६. ४४.</F> दुर्वास on. <F>2:  Ib. IX. 4. ६१-2.</F>
--a वानर chief. Br. III. 7. २४०.
--a Kulaparvata of the केतुमाला. वा. ४४. 4.
--the world of विष्णु. वा. १०६. १९; १०८. 3.
--a daughter of क्रोधवशा and Hari and a wife of Pulaha; sons, monkeys of different kinds; Kinnaras, किम्पुरुषस्, etc. Br. III. 7. १७२; वा. ६९. २०५, २०८.
--one of the names in the second मरुत्गण. वा. ६७. १२५.
--the father of Hari. भा. VIII. 1. ३०.
--born of Pulaha. Br. III. 7. १७९.
(I)--a son of अग्नीध्र, and Lord of निषध. भा. V. 2. १९; Br. II. १४. ४६-9; वा. ३३. ३९, ४३; Vi. II. 1. १६, १९.

(II)--(नैषध) a continent in जम्बुद्वीप. Here विष्णु revealed himself as नृसिम्ह and is wor- shipped by प्रह्लाद; <F>1:  भा. V. १६. 9; १८. 7-१४; Vi. II. 2. १३.</F> country, gold in colour; people of, white [पगे३-753+ ३४] in colour; drink sugar-cane juice and live for ११००० years; <F>2:  Br. II. १७. 1, 6-9; वा. ३४. २९; ४६. 8-१०.</F> belongs to निषध. <F>3:  M. ११३. २९; ११४. ५९, ६६ ff.</F>
--a son of Caidyoparicara. M. ५०. २७.

--son of त्रिशन्कु and सत्यरता. Concern- ing him there was a battle between वसिष्ठ and विश्वामित्र in the disguise of birds for many years. Issueless, and advised by नारद, he prayed to वरुण for a son, promising to offer him in sacrifice to the deity. The son was Rohita. वरुण reminded him often about the promised sacrifice, and the king evaded saying that he was not yet fit for it. Knowing this Rohita left for forests and the king had a disease maho- dara: when the boy returned to relieve his father, Indra pre- vented him from going home. Six years passed and Rohita purchased सुनश्शेप, the second son of Ajiganta and returned home. हरिश्चन्द्र proceeded to offer सुनश्शेप in sacrifice and was relieved of his disease. सुनश्शेप was sold as a sacrificial animal to Rohita. <F>1:  भा. IX. 7. 7-२७; १६. ३१; M. १२. ३८; वा. ८८. ११७-9; Vi. IV. 3. २५.</F> Attained permanent fame; <F>2:  भा. X. ७२. २१.</F> a सम्राट् by performing राजसूय <F>3:  Br. III. ६३. ११५; ६६. ६६; वा. ९१. ९४.</F>
--sacred to चन्द्रिका; sacred to पितृस्; <F>1:  M. १३. ४०; २२. ५२.</F> sacred to शिव. <F>2:  Ib. १८१. २८.</F>
--a son of हिरण्याक्ष. भा. VII. 2. १८.
--a Kinnara with a man's face. वा. ६९. ३५. [पगे३-754+ २६]
--a son of पृथु and Arcis; was entrusted with eastern kingdom by his elder brother. भा. IV. २२. ५४; २४. 2.
--a son of Campa in his sacrifice, the वारुण able to conquer enemies came from heaven; father of Bha- draratha. M. ४८. ९८-99; वा. ९९. १०७; Vi. IV. १८. २१-22.
--a son of Jaya. वा. ९३. 9.
--a son of कृत and father of Sahadeva. Vi. IV. 9. २७.
(I)--a son of कृत, and father of Sahadeva. भा. IX. १७. १७.
(II)--वेदव्यास XXII. Br. II. ३५. १२२.
(I)--a son of धृढाश्व, and father of Nikumbha. भा. IX. 6. २४; Br. III. ६३. ६३; वा. ८८. ६२; Vi. IV. 2. ४३.
(II)--a son of अनरण्य, and father of अरुण; wife दृषद्वती. भा. IX. 7. 4; Br. III. ६३. ७५.
(III)--a son of धृष्टकेतु and father of Manu. भा. IX. १३. १५; Br. III. ६४. १०; वा. ८९. १०; Vi. IV. 5. २७.
(IV)--a son of Pramoda. M. १२. ३३. [पगे३-755+ २८]
(V)--a son of त्रसदश्व; wife दृषद्वती; father of Vasumata. वा. ८८. ७६.
(VI)--a son of पृषदश्व and father of Hasta. Vi. IV. 3. १८-19.
(VII)--a son of ऋक्ष; father of five sons, the well-known पाञ्चालस्. Vi. IV. १९. ५८९.
(VIII)--a son of Mudgala; had twins, Divo- दास and अहल्या. Vi. IV. १९. ६१-2.

--the thousand (five thousand-वि। प्।) sons of दक्ष and Asi(a)क्नी; on the advice of नारद they took to the path of ‘Not returning’. Perished in the attempt to get a knowledge of the entire earth according to नारद's directions, <F>1:  भा. VI. 5. 1-२१; Br. III. 2. १५, २२-3; Vi. I. १५. ९०-96.</F> were put to shame and went to वायु, and became one with him and still wander there aimlessly. <F>2:  M. 5. 5. वा; ६५. १३९, १४६-50.</F>
--a son of Jaya and father of Sahadeva. Br. III. ६८. 9.
--belonging to नील (blue) पराशर group. M. २०१. ३४.
--the mother of Hari in the तामस epoch. Vi. III. 1. ३९.
--वेदव्यास of the २१स्त् dva1para. Vi. III. 3. १६. [पगे३-756+ २५]
(I)--a son of द्रोण and a Vasu. भा. VI. 6. ११.
(II)--a son of कृष्ण and मित्रविन्दा. भा. X. ६१. १६.
--gods in तामस manvantara. वा. ६७. ३९.
--a weapon peculiar to बलराम; reached him during the siege of मथुरा. भा. X. ५०. ११ [१५]; वा. २३. १९९; Vi. V. २२. 7.
--a दानव. Br. III. 6. ११.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ७९.
--one of Atri's ten wives. Br. III. 8. ७५.

(also लाङ्गलि and बलदेव)--बलराम, brother of कृष्ण; took कृष्ण to task for not getting syamantaka after killing Bhoja and went to मिथिला where he was honoured by its king; Duryodhana learnt गदा from him here; taken back to द्वारका by कृष्ण. Br. III. ७१. ६६. ८०. ८५; Vi. V. २८. ११. [पगे३-757+ २७]
--the kingdom of the. M. १४४. ५७.
(I)--a god of सुतारा group. Br. IV. 1. ९०.
(II)--a son of चाक्षुष Manu. M. 4. ४१.
(III)--an oblation; often comes with kavyam; a compound word, havyakavyam. M. 7. २५; २२. ५९.
(IV)--a deva of the Harita group. वा. १००. ८८.
(V)--one of the ten branches of सुपारा group of devas. वा. १००. ९४.

(II)--a son of विजिताश्व and नभस्वती. His queen was हविर्धानी who was the mother of बर्हिषद् and five other sons; <F>1:  भा. IV. २४. 5 and 8.</F> attained heaven by tapas; <F>2:  Br. II. ३०. ४०.</F> a राजऋषि and a tapassiddha. <F>3:  वा. ५७. १२२.</F>
(II)--a son of अन्तर्धान and शिखण्डिनि; wife, आग्नेयी-Dhis2an2a1; had six sons. Br. II ३७. २३-4; वा. ६३. २२, २३; Vi. I. १४. 1-2.
(III)--a son of पृथु married धिषणा and got a number of sons; attained heaven by tapas. M. 4. ४५; १४३. ३९. [पगे३-758+ २३]
--the queen of हविर्धान. भा. IV. २४. 8.
--is Agni. Br. IV. ३५. ८२.
--a daughter of Kardama married to Pulastya. Father of Agastya and विश्रवस्. भा. III. २४. २२; IV. 1. ३६.
--one of the ten branches of the सुपार group of devas. वा. १००. ९४.
--a son of Angirasa. वा. ६५. १०५.
(I)--a son of Angiras; a sage of the चाक्षुष epoch. भा. VIII. 5. 8; Br. II. ३६. ७७; वा. ६५. १०५.
(II)--a sage of the tenth epoch of Manu. भा. VIII. १३. २१-22; Vi. III. 2. २७.
(III)--a sage of the चाक्षुष epoch. Vi. III. 1. २८.
(IV)--a sage of the XI epoch of Manu. Vi. III. 2. 4. [पगे३-759+ २८]
--पितृस्, sons of Angiras who live in the world of मरीचिगर्भ; lords of those who perform तीर्थ s4ra1ddhas and of क्षत्रियस्; their mind-born daughter, यशोदा, wife of अम्शुमान्. M. १५. १६; १०२. २०.
--a sage of the second सावर्ण epoch. Br. IV. 1. ६९.
(II)--(काश्यप) a sage of the epoch of III सावर्ण. Br. IV. 1. ७८.
(III)--wife कुहू, abandoned him for Soma. M. २३. २५.
(IV)--a son of Angirasa. M. १९६. 2; वा. ६२. ६५.

(I)--one of the ten sons of कर्दमा and Sva- yambhu and king of शाकद्वीप and had seven sons, Jalada, कुमार, सुकुमार, Manivaha, Kurumottara, मोदाल्ल and महाद्रुम्ग, the founders respectively of seven kingdoms bearing their names; these are demons of the शाकद्वीप. Br. II. ११. २३; १३. १०४; १४. 9-२१; वा. ३१. १८; ३३. 9, १६, २०; M. 9. 5.
(II)--a god of आद्य group. Br. II. ३६. ६९.
(I)--a सुखा god. Br. IV. 1. १९.
(II)--a mukhya गण. वा. १००. १८.
--a son of Raivata Manu. M. 9. २१.
--सहरक्ष mantras in the यज्ञ to keep out Asuras; Havyas for devas. वा. ९७. २६.
(I)--a son of Suci Agni; the agni of devas. Br. II. १२. 5. वा. २९. 4, 5.
(II)--one of the ten kalas energising Agni. Br. IV. ३५. ८३.
--those charged with different directions. वा. ६९. ६७.

(I)--is Agni (होहीय) sent by Indra to disturb the love of उमा and शन्कर; <F>1:  Br. II. १२. २८. III. १०. २४; ११. ३७.</F> cursed by उमा to bear the burdens of maternity; <F>2:  वा. ७२. २१-8.</F> he in his turn requested गन्गा to share it.
(II)--(आत्रेय) a sage of the Rohita epoch. Br. IV. 1. ६३.
(III)--a son of Dhara, a Vasava. M. 5. २३. [पगे३-761+ २५]
(IV)--the name of the ninth kalpa. वा. २१. ३१; २४. १६२.
--another name for असम्सृष्ट located at what is known as शामित्र. वा. २९. २२.
--the charioteer of Geyacakra. Br. IV. २०. ९३.
(I)--a son of Rocana and Vasudeva. भा. IX. २४. ४९.
(II)--a son of सावर्ण Manu I. Br. IV. 1. ६४.
(III)--a measurement of २४ angulas. वा. 8. १०२, १०५; १०१. १२३.
(IV)--a son of हर्यश्व and father of Sumanas. Vi. IV. 3. १९-20.
--a constellation; <F>1:  वा. ६६. ४९; ८२. 7.</F> श्राद्धम् that day makes one important in an assembly. <F>2:  Br. III. १८. 7.</F>
--is नाग; a line of क्रोधावश. Br. III. 7. ३४९; 8. ७०.
--a काद्रवेय na1ga. Br. III. 7. ३३.
--काश्यप gotraka1ras. M. १९९. 5. [पगे३-762+ ३२]

(I)--a son of बृहद्क्षत्र, (Suhotra-वा। प्।). After him came हस्तिनापुर. <F>1:  भा. IX. २१. २०-21; वा. ९९. १६५; Vi. IV. १९. २८; M. ४९. ४२.</F> Father of अजामीढ and two other sons. <F>2:  Vi. IV. १९. २९.</F>
(II)--a son of वसिष्ठ and a प्रजापति of the स्वारोचिष epoch. M. 9. 9.
--is कुञ्जर cha1ya1. Br. III. १६. ४४.

--named after Hastin, son of Suhotra; see हास्तिनपुर; <F>1:  भा. IX. २१. २०; वा. ९९. १६५; Vi. IV. १९. २८.</F> sacred to ललीटा pi1t2ha; <F>2:  Br. IV. 4. ९७.</F> sacred to Jayanti; <F>3:  M. १०३. १४.</F> washed away by the Ganges floods. <F>4:  Vi. IV. २१. 8.</F>
--washed away by the गङ्गा. M. ५०. ७८.
--a son of Bhadra. वा. ६९. २१३.
--Budha caused the science of elephant to be made known. Hence Gajavaidyaka. M. २४. 2.
--science of elephants. M. २१५. 8, ३६.

--the Gandharva presiding over the month of शुक्र; <F>1:  भा. XII. ११. ३६; Br. III. 7. 8.</F> with the sun in summer; <F>2:  वा. ५२. 7.</F> expert in divine music. <F>3:  Ib. ६९. ४६.</F> [पगे३-763+ २२]
--a Gandharva with the sun in summer. वा. ५२. 7.
--a शक्ति in the Kiricakra. Br. IV. २०. १५; ४४. ९१.
(I)--a liquid by administering which a person feels rejuvenated; used in Atala. भा. V. २४. १६.
(II)--the gold found in Vitala. भा. V. २४. १७.
--R. in Vitala; the वीर्य of शिव (हाटकेश्वर and भवानी). भा. V. २४. १७.
--the name as the Lord enshrined in Vitala. भा. V. २४. १७.
--a Janapada of the भद्रा country. वा. ४३. २२.
--a Pravara of Angiras. M. १९६. १५.
--the flesh of the deer used for श्राद्ध. M. १७. ३१. [पगे३-764+ २४]
(I)--a son of युवनाश्व: after him came the well-known Angirasa हारितस्. भा. IX. 7. 1.
(II)--a son of विश्वामित्र. भा. IX. १६. ३६.
(III)--a पौराणिक. भा. XII. 7. 5.
(IV)--a ऋत्विक् at ब्रह्मा's याग. वा. १०६. ३४.
--the descendants of Harita, son of युवनाश्व, all able warriors; sons of Angiras and Brahmans with क्ष- triya dharma. वा. ८८. ७३; Vi. IV. 3. 3.
--the khila and upakhila portions of Vedas. Br. II. ३५. ७५; वा. ६१. ६५.
--a तीर्थ sacred to the पितृस्. M. २२. ६८.

--was sent with कृष्ण's sacrificial horse; took active part in the राजसूय of युधिष्ठिर, and being on the left detachment of कृष्ण's army to attack जरासन्ध; defended द्वारका against शाल्व; in Duryodhana's army. भा. X. ८९. २२ [2]; [५० (V) ११]; ७५. 6; ७६. १४; ७८ [९५ (V) १६].
(II)--an आन्ध्र king; ruled for five years (one year-ब्र्। प्। and वा। प्।); with him are twelve (पञ्चसप्तक) kings. M. २७३. 9; Br. III. ७४. १६५; वा. ९९. ३५२.

(I)--the poison that first issued from the अमृतमथन. शिव consumed it with पार्वति's permission. That which was split became poisonous scorpions, serpents, cobras and other plants; <F>1:  भा. VIII. 7. १८. ४६.</F> administered to प्रह्लाद. <F>2:  Vi. I. १५. १५४; १६. १०; १८. 3.</F>
(II)--the XI battle between the Gods and the Asuras. Br. III. ७२. ७५, ८६.
(III)--the eleventh of the twelve incarnations in वाराह kalpa; <F>1:  M. ४७. ४५; वा. ९७. ७६.</F> वृत्र killed by Mahendra. <F>2:  M. ४७. ५१.</F>
(IV)--a son of अरिष्टकर्मन्, and father of Palalaka. Vi. IV. २४. ४६-7.
--the community of अनुह्राद's sons. वा. ६७. ७५.
--a pupil of लान्गल. Br. II. ३५. ४८.
--a son of अरिष्टकर्मन्, and father of Talaka. भा. XII. 1. २५.
--a Mother Goddess. M. १७९. ३०. [पगे३-766+ ४४]

--(also हस्तिनापुर and गजाह्व); <F>1:  भा. I. 4. 6; 8. ४५. १०. 7; १३. 1;</F> visit- ed by कृष्ण often. Here कृष्ण spent some months after भीष्म's death and युधिष्ठिर's coronation. A Brahmana of this city informed कृष्ण of the banishment of the पाण्डवस् to forest; <F>2:  Ib. I. 9. ४८; X. ५८. 1; ६४; 2-4; ७१. २२; ७५. ३८ [2]; ८० [2]; ८० [5]; ८४. ६९ [3].</F> visited by अक्रूर, <F>3:  Ib. X. ४८. ३२; ४९. 1.</F> and by बलराम. The latter got offended at the remark of the Kurus about his king and threatened to lift up the city and throw it into the Ganges. <F>4:  Ib. X. ६८. (whole).</F> Return of the पाण्डवस् and others after visit to Syamanta पञ्चक; visited by कृतवर्मन् <F>5:  Ib. X. ५२ [५६ (v) 3] [१३].</F> and by सत्यभामा after her father's death; <F>6:  Ib. X. ५७. 8.</F> left by Vidura; <F>7:  Ib. III. 1. १७; IV. ३१. ३०.</F> when this city was washed away कौशाम्बी became capital; <F>8:  Ib. IX. ३२. ४०.</F> capital of the Kurus and परीक्षित्. <F>9:  Ib. I. १७. ४४; Vi. V. ३५. ३२.</F>
--a Gandharva singer who entertains ब्रह्मा with music; <F>1:  भा. X. ५२. १५[4]; Vi. IV. 1. ६८.</F> with the sun in the months of शुचि and शुक्र; <F>2:  Br. II. २३. 7; Vi. II. १०७:</F> see हाहा.
--Divine musicians. वा. १०८. ४८.
--a wife of भीम and mother of घटोत्कच. भा. IX. २२. ३०-31; वा. ९९. २४७; Vi. IV. २०. ४५.
--a Janapada of the केतुमाला continent. वा. ४४. १२.

(I)--(personified) as Mena's husband;^a acted as calf when the mountains milked the cow earth; <F>1:  भा. IV. 7. ५८; M. १०. २६.</F> wife was the mind-born daughter of the पितृस्; <F>2:  Ib. १३. 7.</F> क्रौञ्ज and मैनाक were sons; <F>3:  Ib. ११३. ११. ११४. २०-22;</F> rivers from; <F>4:  Ib. ११७. 1-२१.</F> beauty of. <F>5:  Ib. १५४. ५२; १६२. 6; १८३.</F> [पगे३-767+ ३९]

(II)--(also Himagiri): one of the six tra- versed by अलकनन्दा; <F>1:  भा. V. १६. 9; १७. 9; Br. II. १५. १५, २८; IV. ३१. १६, ९७; Vi. V. 9. ३०.</F> वर्षपर्वत of हिमाचल. King of mountains; overlord of all hills; <F>2:  Br. III. 8. 9; २२. 8; Vi. I. २२. 8; II. 2. ११.</F> noted for the sacred pool of सुषुम्ण; <F>3:  Br. III. १०. 7; १२. 5; १३. १२२-3.</F> a description of the forests, trees and the races inhabiting the mountain; water- falls and caves in; cool with snow; <F>4:  Ib. III. २२. 7-४४.</F> served as calf when the mountains milked the earth for medicinal plants and gems; <F>5:  Ib. II. ३६. २२३.</F> where परशुराम performed penance; <F>6:  Ib. III. २१. ७४; २२. 4.</F> people towards the end of Kaliyuga leave their homes and retire to forests and caves in the हिमालयन् slopes; <F>7:  Ib. III. ७४. २१४.</F> residence of राक्षसस्, पिशाचस् and यक्षस्; <F>8:  Ib. II. १७. ३३.</F> परीक्षित् compared to, in worthiness: धृत- राष्ट्र spent here his last days. <F>9:  भा. I. १२. ३३; १३. २९.</F>
--see हिमवान्: also हिमाद्रि. M. १५६. १९. Br. II. २५. ४९.
--snow making rays of the sun. वा. ५३. २१.
--the दक्षिण vars2a of जम्बूद्वीप with नाभी as first King. Br. II. १४. ४८.
--is हिमाख्यम्; <F>1:  Br. II. १८. ४२; III. 7. १९४.</F> the continent of जम्बूद्वीप. <F>2:  Vi. II. 1. १८, २७.</F>
(I)--born of Lobha and निकृति; <F>1:  भा. IV. 8. 3.</F> wife of Kali, of bad mind. <F>2:  Br. III. ५९. 9; वा. ८४. 9.</F> [पगे३-768+ २६]

(II)--one of the five heinous sins--narrated to Indra by बृहस्पति; it is a sin against men, women, animals, and creatures of all sorts. Exceptions are given. Any man of any caste or any animal attacking may be attacked and killed in self-defence; this applies to family members also; wild animals like lions and tigers may be killed by the King for the benefit of Gods and Brahmans, and not for self-enjoyment; भगवती Ma1ya1 created men and Gods and १४ kinds of ani- mals as also sacrifices and ordered the worship of Gods by sacrificing पशु to get oneself blessed with health and wealth; पशुस् may be killed for Gods, पितृस्, and for feeding great and respectable persons; in times of danger no sin in the eating of flesh by Brahmans; animals could be sacrificed in honour of शक्ति. Br. IV. 6. ३७-67.
(III)--gave birth to निकृति (daughter) and अनृत (son) by Adharma. वा. १०. ३९; Vi. I. 7. ३२.
--यज्ञ, as adharma. वा. ५७. ९८.
--one of the seven sons of कौशिक. M. २०. 3.
(I)--a son of आग्नीध्र. भा. V. 2. १९.

(II)--a continent bounded by श्वेत hills on one side. Here Aryaman and other पितृस् worship विष्णु in [पगे३-769+ ३७] the form of कूर्म, as the embodiment of the सान्ख्य system. भा. V. १६. 8; १८. २९-33.
--(श्वेतवर्ष); next to Ramya; <F>1:  वा. ३४. ३०.</F> of जम्बूद्वीप. <F>2:  Vi. II. 2. १४.</F>
--belonging to श्वेत. M. ११३. ३१.

(I)--a son of दिती and कश्यप: reduc- ed to subjection the three worlds with the लोकपालस्: secured heaven through his son प्रह्लाद. His queen was कयाधु; <F>1:  भा. III. १७. १८-19; IV. २१. ४७; VI. १८. ११-12; M. 6. 8, 9; Vi. I. १५. १४०.</F> wanted to avenge his brother हिरण्याक्ष's death; <F>2:  भा. VIII. १९. 7-9.</F> the six sons born of his Asura Yoni were carried off by योगमाया's effort. They were again born of देवकी and killed by Kamsa; <F>3:  Ib. X. ८५. ४६-49; Vi. V. 1. ७०.</F> lust after more territory; <F>4:  भा. XII. 3. ११.</F> in his previous birth an attendant of Hari. He was next born as रावण and after- wards Caidya. Destroyed the whole world by fire and by sword all friends of Hari for the killing of his brother, consol- ed his wife and sons pointing to the old saying that to die at the hands of an enemy leads one to heaven and cited the story of सुयज्ञ that it was no use to weep over the dead body. Then दिती set her mind on the truth; <F>5:  Ib. VII. 1. ३९-45; Ch. 2 (whole).</F> हिरण्यकशिपु began austere penance in the Mandara hill and the fire of his penance spread far and wide and created fear in the Devas. ब्रह्मा paid a visit and saw हिरण्यकशिपु covered by an ant hill. Sprinkling divine waters, he woke him up to see the Lord on the Swan, and he praised His glory. He asked that (1) he might not meet with death at the hands of any being [पगे३-770+ ४३] created by ब्रह्मा; (2) might not meet with death inside or outside, by day or night, by any weapon not on earth or in sky, by men or beasts, gods or asuras; (3) he was to be without an equal; (4) he should possess undiminishing power (5) and be the one ruler of all creatures. <F>6:  Ib. I. Ch. 3 (whole): M. Chh. १६१-3.</F> These were granted and हिरण्यकशिपु spread his sway on all the worlds and took up the seat of Indra. All gods except the Triad bowed to him; <F>7:  भा. VII. 4. 2, २८; M. ४७. ३५-59.</F> father of four sons, chief of whom was प्रह्लाद whom he hated as he was a devotee of Hari. शुक्र's sons शण्ड and Marka were appointed to be his tutors to get a knowledge of Trivarga. This only increased प्रह्लाद's devotion. हिरण्यकशिपु put it to some inborn defect of the boy. Means to kill the child by wild beasts, poison, fire and water were of no avail. He was bound by noose and imprisoned; <F>8:  भा. VII. 4. २९-43; Ch. 5. (whole); M. १४६. २१; १५३. 6; Vi. I. १५. १४२; १७. 2-२९.</F> when he was absent in Mandara hill Indra harassed his followers and captured his queen with प्रह्लाद. नारद asked him to release her, which he did. She was under the custody of the sage, praying to him for the birth of a good son; <F>9:  भा. VII. 7. 2-१६.</F> in the course of his father's (कश्यप's) अश्वमेध sacrifice, the child हिरण्यकशिपु sat on one of the golden seats reserved for होतृ, and hence the name. Ruled for nearly (1/4) of the manvantara, got और्विमाया from Aurva to dispel; <F>१०:  Br. III. 5. 4-२९, ३४.</F> तामशि- माया; <F>११:  M. १७५. २५, ६४-71; १७८. १० and १९.</F> rivers, mountains, worlds, etc. shaken by him; <F>१२:  Ib. १६३. ५६-92.</F> first of Daityas, killed by Narasimha whom he never considered as विष्णु; <F>१३:  Vi. IV. १४. ४६-7; १५. 1, 5.</F> taken out by action of योगनिद्रा under orders from विष्णु. <F>१४:  Ib. V. 1. ७२-3.</F>
(II)--father of दिव्या, wife of sage भृगु. Br. III. 1. ७४. [पगे३-771+ ३३]
--gift of a cow and a calf in gold (3 to १०० palas in weight) on an auspicious day with preliminary prayers to deities; the giver enjoys heaven. M. २७४. 8.
(II)--is वासुदेव; <F>1:  Vi. VI. 7. ५६.</F> as the author of योगशास्त्र. <F>2:  Ib. II. १३. ४४.</F>

--the gift of an image in gold of the creator of the form of a golden egg like a lotus on an auspicious day and with special prayers to deities. The donor entered the egg and sat like a child in womb when the cere- monies of conception and birth were gone through by priests. The gift was accompanied by sandals, umbrella, seats, vil- lages or districts. The giver would enjoy Brahmaloka. M. २७४. 7; २७५. 1-२९.
--sacred to विष्णु--a तीर्थम् of the नर्मदा. M. १९३. ६८-9.

(I)--of कोशल was a pupil of Sukarman and his pupil was कृत: a siddha; <F>1:  भा. XII. 6. ७६ and ८०; VI. १५. १५.</F> son of विधृति and pupil of Jaimini. From him याज्ञवल्क्य learnt the आत्मविद्या. Father of पुष्य (son of विश्वसह; got instructed in Yoga from याज्ञवल्क्य disciple of Jaimini-वि। प्।); <F>2:  Ib. IX. १२. 3-5; २१. २८; Vi. IV. 4. १०७. १०८.</F> a श्रुतऋषि: considered as the disciple of पौष्यञ्जि in the प्राच्यसाम. His disciples were Samagas of the East; <F>3:  Br. II. ३३. 8; III. ६३. २०७-8.</F> teacher of कृत who composed the सामसम्हिता in २४ parts known as प्राच्य- [पगे३-772+ ३२] सामस् sung by him and the कार्तसामगस्; <F>4:  M. ४९. ७५-6; Vi. III: 6: 5. IV. १९. ५१.</F> composed २४ samhita1s which he taught to as many pupils (named). <F>5:  वा. ६१. ४४-7.</F>
(II)--कौशल्य: वसिष्ठ: son of विश्व- saha; a pupil of Jaimini's पौत्र and guru of याज्ञवल्क्य in yoga. वा. ८८. २०७-8.
(III)--कौशिल्य: a King and one of the two disciples of Sukarma given by Indra; taught ५०० samhita1s to शिष्यस् known as Eastern सामगस्. वा. ६१. ३३-35.
(IV)--Kauthuma: composed सामसम्- हितास् in २४ parts. वा. ९९. १८९.
--a son of जतामालि of the १९थ् dva1para. वा. २३. १८७.

--a city of रसातल, the residence of नीवातकवचस्; <F>1:  भा. V. २४. ३०; X. ८९. ३४ [5].</F> residence of fourteen sons of मारीच (दानवस्); <F>2:  Br. III. 6. २७; ४४. ९९.</F> the residence of the Paulomas and the काल- keyas; <F>3:  M. 6. २४.</F> residence of the sons and grandsons, etc. of the two daughters of वैश्वनर. <F>4:  वा. ६८. २६.</F>
--a Pravara sage. M. १९९. १६.
--cash in gold; the best gift. M. ३४. ११; ५५. १९; Vi. IV. १०. २४. [पगे३-773+ २४]
--a son of Priyavrata, and king of कुशद्- वीप. Divided it among his seven sons. भा. V. 1. २५, ३३; २०. १४.
(I)--an Angirasa: a sage of the Raivata epoch. भा. VIII. 5. 3; Br. II. ३६. ६२; M. 9. २०; Vi. III. 1. २२.

(II)--also Parjanya, a लोकपाल; son of पर्जन्यप्रजापति and मारीचि; lord of the northern direction (guardian of the Eastern quarter-वि। प्।). Br. II. ११. १९; २१. १५७; III. 8. २०; M. 8. ११; १२४. ९५; वा. २८. १६.
(III)--a Gandharva. वा. ६२. ५४; ६९. २६.
(IV)--a लोकपाल of लोकालोक. Vi. II. 8. ८३.
--a son of आग्नीध्र; placed in charge of the Kingdom north of श्वेत. Vi. II. 1. १७ and २१.
--a R. of the भद्रा country. वा. ४३. ३०.
--a powerful follower of Kubera, lives in Surabhi; forbidden to take part in sacrifices. M. १२१. ६१-62. [पगे३-774+ ३४]
--a Mt. (boundary hill) in प्लक्ष. भा. V. २०. 4.

(I)--a son of कश्यप and दिती and an आदी- daitya who died in fight with विष्णु; a brother of हिरण्य- कशिपु. Sought fight in heaven, entered the ocean and called upon वरुण to fight. Entered रसातल in search of Hari and seeing वराह--Hari remarked that it was a forest beast. A mad fight ensued when he put an end to him. It was sandhya with abhijit yoga, unfavourable to the enemy; <F>1:  भा. III. १७. १८-31; Chh. १८ and १९ (whole); III. १४. 2-3; VI. १८. ११; M. 6. 8; Vi. I. १५. १४०; वा. ६७. ५९, ६७.</F> lust of, for more territory; <F>2:  भा. XII. 3. ११.</F> married उपदानवी; <F>3:  Ib. VI. 6. ३४.</F> in the next birth he was कुम्भकर्ण, and in the succeeding one Danta- vaktra. A person of much valour and heroism, defeated by Hari with difficulty; <F>4:  Ib. VII. 1. ३९-45; १९. 5-6.</F> father of शम्बर, शकुनि, कालनाभ, महानाभ, उलूक and भूतसन्तापन; <F>5:  Br. II. १९. १३; २०. ३६; III. 5. 4-5, १२-32; ७२. ७७; M. 6. १४.</F> killed by वराह- विष्णु at the Sumana hill of the शकद्वीप. <F>6:  Ib. ४७. ४७; १२२. १६; १५३. 6; २५०. ५७.</F>
(II)--a son of शूरभूमी and स्यामक. भा. IX. २४. ४२.
(III)--a son of देवजानी an यक्ष. Br. III. 7. १३०.
(IV)--a son of मणिवर, killed by the boar. वा. ४९. ११; ६९. १६१; ९७. ७८.
(V)--an Asura of the V tala or महातल. वा. ५०. ३५.
--a तीर्थ sacred to पितृस्. M. २२. ५२.
--the gift of a golden horse in an auspicious hour leads one to the world of the sun. M. २७४. 8; २८०. 1-१५.
--a gift of a chariot with 7 or 8 horses in gold on an auspicious day keeps one away from hell and takes him to the abode of शिव. M. २७४. 8; २८१. 1-१६.

--north of श्वेत and south of शृन्ग- साह्व; here is हैरन्वतीनदी; age of the people ११,000 years; there is a tree Lakuca whose juice endows the people with long life; three peaks of jewels, gold and precious stones; full of splendid houses. M. ११३. ६४; वा. ४५. 6-१०.
--a son of आग्नीध्र and lord of श्वेत. Br. II. १४. ४६, ५०.
--(अहीन)--a son of Sahadeva and father of Jayasena. भा. IX. १७. १७.
--of द्वयामुष्यायन gotra. M. १९६. ५२.
(I)--a Sukha god. Br. IV. 1. १९. [पगे३-776+ ३२]
(II)--a mukhya गण. वा. १००. १८.
--a son of Dhara (Dharma-वि। प्।) Br. III. 3. २२; वा. ६६. २१; Vi. I. १५. ११३.
(I)--as विष्णु and स्वाहा as श्री. Vi. I. 8. २२; 9. ३४.

(II)--Agni with मारुत (wind) ordered by Indra to destroy the Asuras; when some of them escaped to the ocean and हुताशन and मारुत refused to dry up the oceans as per his orders Indra caused them to be born on the earth with one body; <F>1:  M. ६१. 3-१६; Br. II. ११. १००, ११२.</F> riding animal of, sheep; his arm was शक्ति; appointed a commander of Indra's host to attack तारक; <F>2:  M. १४८. ८३; २८९. 6.</F> father of all the Apsarasa ladies; <F>3:  Ib. ७०. २१.</F> entered the harem of शिव and उमा in the form of a parrot and drank of His वीर्य; <F>4:  Ib. १५८. ३२.</F> burnt with काम and reattained godhood. <F>5:  Ib. १९१. ११२.</F>
--(also Humbeka) a commander to aid वीषन्ग; killed by भेरुण्ड. Br. IV. २५. २८, ९५.
--a commander of भण्ड. Br. IV. २१. ७९.
--Hulumallaka--a commander to aid वीषन्ग; killed by भेरुण्ड. Br. IV. २५. २८, ९५.
--resides in the sun's chariot during the month of आषाढ. Vi. II. १०. 8. [पगे३-777+ ३२]

--a tribe defeated by Bharata; purified of their sin by the worship of Hari; <F>1:  भा. IX. २०. ३०; II. 4. १८.</F> specially created in the war of ललिता with भण्ड; <F>2:  Br. IV. २९. १३१.</F> nineteen in number; <F>3:  M. २७३. १९.</F> the country of the. <F>4:  वा. ४५. १३६; Vi. II. 3. १७.</F>
--an eastern country. Br. II. १६. ५२.
--a Mother goddess. M. १७९. ३१.
--a Marut गण. M. १७१. ५४.
--a hill tribe. Br. II. १६. ६७; वा. ४७. ५६.

--a Gandharva in Brahmaloka who entertains ब्रह्मा with music; <F>1:  Vi. IV. 1. ६८.</F> cursed by sage Devala to become a cro- codile; caught hold of Gajendra and was released from his curse; <F>2:  भा. X. ५२. १५[4]; VIII. 4. 3-5.</F> with the sun in the months of शुचि and शुक्र. <F>3:  Ib. XII. ११. ३६; Br. II. २३. 7; III. 7. 8; वा. ६९. ४६.</F>
--a son of अवभृत; agni or पावक; located at the जठर of men or जठराग्नि; son मृत्युमान्. Br. १२. ३४; वा. २९. ३१.
--the horse of Bhoja which would go at a stretch १०० yojanas. Br. III. ७१. ७१-2.

--a son of Svayambhoja and the father of कृत- varman and nine other sons, and a votary of कृष्ण. भा. I. १४. २८; IX. २४. २६-7; X. ५२ [५६ (v) 5] [१०]; III. 1. ३५; Br. III. ७१. १३९-42; M. ४४. ८०-1; वा. ९६. १३८; Vi. IV. १४. २३-4.
--a deity in the Angadevyantaram. Br. IV. ३७. ४२.

--an epithet of विष्णु; <F>1:  Vi. I. १५. ६७; २२. ७५; V. 5. २१; ३०. 1.</F> God विष्णु who appeared in the dream of Brahmadatta and got him released from worldly life to one of Siddhas; <F>2:  Br. IV. ३४. ८०; M. २१. २५; १००. १९; १६७. ४२.</F> in the तारकामय; <F>3:  M. १७४. ३५; २४५. ८१, ८५; २४६. ३५; २४७. २७.</F> ety. from हृषीक (Indriya) and ईश; <F>4:  M. २४८. ४४-45.</F> in भद्राश्व. <F>5:  वा. ३५. २३.</F>
--a son of भद्राश्व. M. ४९. 5.
--those censuring the eternal principle. वा. १००. ११५.
(I)--a राक्षस and a son of यातुधान; follower of वृत्र against Indra; took part in a देवासुर war between Bali and Indra. <F>1:  भा. VI. १०. २०; VIII. १०. २० and २८.</F>
(II)--the राक्षस presiding over the month of Madhu. भा. XII. ११. ३३; Br. II. २३. 4; III. 7. ८९.

(III)--a राक्षस, and a son of ब्रह्मा; performed severe austerities for a hundred thousand divine years by living on air and dried leaf with face and hands turned upwards and the little finger of foot planted on earth; got a [पगे३-779+ ३०] boon that he must not be killed by implements, or gods or men; Heti defeated the gods and became Indra himself; the gods gave the गदा to विष्णु to kill Heti and hence आदिगदा- dhara; Heti was killed and taken to heaven; <F>1:  वा. १०९. 5-१२, २५; १११. ७५.</F> with the sun in spring; <F>2:  Ib. ५२. 5.</F> in the sun's chariot in the months of Caitra and Madhu. <F>3:  Vi. II. १०. 3.</F>
--a पिशाच; had a son Lanku. वा. ६९. १२७, १२९.
--a Bhairava in the Kiricakra. Br. IV. २०. ८१; ३४. ६२.
--the शक्तिस् in the last parva of the Kiricakra; best of Bhairavas. Br. IV. २०. ७८.
--special to the Jains; <F>1:  M. २४. ४८.</F> a शास्त्र of द्वापर. <F>2:  Ib. १४४. २२; वा. ५८. २३.</F>
--a son of रुशद्रथ (उशद्रथ-वा। प्।) and father of Sutapas. भा. IX. २३. 4; Br. III. ७४. २५; वा. ९९. २५; Vi. IV. १८. १२.
--a नाग in the third Talam or Vitalam (वा। प्।) Br. II. २०. २९; वा. ५०. २८.
--a Mt. and residence of the Gandharvas and others. वा. ३६. ३६; ३९. ५१.

(I)--Mt. to the south of इलाव्रत, and a boundary hill of किम्पुरुष. From it falls अलकनन्दा; <F>1:  भा. V. १६. 9; १७. 9; M. ११३. २३; ११४. ८२; वा. ४७. ६३.</F> a [पगे३-780+ २९] वर्षपर्वत; residence of Gandharvas and Apsaras; <F>2:  Br. II. १५. १५ and २८. १७. ३३; IV. ३१. १६; Vi. II. 2. ४१; वा. 1. ८५; ३४. १४ and २५; ४२. ३१; Vi. II. 1. १९.</F> a hill of the south where is the पुण्ड्र city; <F>3:  वा. ५१. ४७; Br. I. 1. ६८.</F> a division of जम्बू- द्वीप. <F>4:  Vi. II. 2. ११.</F>
(II)--a तीर्थ sacred to Manmatha. M. १३. ५०.
--a son of विशाल and father of Sucandra (Candra-वि। प्।). भा. IX. 2. ३४; Br. III. ६१. १३; वा. ८६. १७-8; Vi. IV. 1. ५०. ५१.
--a city in the त्रिशृङ्ग hill; temples of नारायण (East), ब्रह्मा (middle) and शङ्कर (West). वा. ४१. ६२. 3.
(I)--a mind-born son of ब्रह्मा in the १६थ् kalpa. वा. २१. ३५.
(II)--cold season; <F>1:  वा. ५३. २६; ८८. ११६.</F> constitutes the months of Satra and Sahasya; <F>2:  Ib. ५२. १९.</F> Parjanya and diggajas snow freely during the period. <F>3:  Ib. ५१. ४५.</F>
--queens were सहश्री and सहस्यश्री. Br. IV. ३२. ३५. [पगे३-781+ २५]
--the residence of आपव sage, burnt down by कार्तवीर्यार्जुन for which he was cursed. M. ४३. ४१.
(II)--same as Unnata. M. १२२. ५४; १२५. २२.
--the best is to give १००० palams in weight in gold; if not ५०० or २५०; even one palam of gold is commended. The giver goes to Brahma- lokam. M. ८३. 5; ८६. 1.
--a measurement of १६ inches equal to one नालिकोच्चय. Br. IV. 1. २१९.
--a son of मणिवर. वा. ६९. १५८.
--a वर्षपर्वत in जम्बूद्वीप. M. ११३. ११.
--Mt. lustrous as the sun, on the south of the कैलास; <F>1:  M. १२१. ११.</F> residence of ब्रह्मा. <F>2:  वा. ३९. ४६; ४२. ३१, ६८; ४७. १०.</F>
--Mt. a chief hill of कुशद्वीप. Vi. II. 4. ४१. [पगे३-782+ २५]
--the gift of a chariot with elephants in gold on an auspicious day with prayers to all deities takes one to the abode of शिव. M. २७४. 8; २८२. 1-१६.
--an Apsaras; daughter of Yama, of golden mien and excellent eyes. वा. ६९. 7, ६१.
--a son of रोचना and Vasudeva. भा. IX. २४. ४९.
--a name of विनायक. Br. III. ४२. 8.
--a group of seven crores of divinities with महागणपति as their lord. Br. IV. २७. ८२.
--a son of शतजित्. Vi. IV. ११. 7.
--mother of घटोत्कच by भी- masena. M. ५०. ५४.
--the forest of Atri. वा. २३. १५५. [पगे३-783+ ३३]
--a Janapada of the Bhadra country. वा. ४३. २२.
--is भारतवर्ष; <F>1:  Br. II. १५. ३१.</F> भारतम् in जम्बूद्वीप. <F>2:  वा. ३४. २८.</F>
--a wife of अक्षयाश्र. वा. ८८. ६४.
--a kingdom to the south of the शृङ्ग- वान् and north of the श्वेत hills, people rolling in wealth and living for thousands of years; noted for the tree Lakuca. Br. II. १५. ६६-9.
--a R. in the kingdom of हैरण्वत. Br. II. १५. ६६; M. ११३. ६४; वा. ४५. 6.
(I)--one of the three sons of शतजित् (Sataji- म्। प्।) and father of Dharma. (Dharmanetra-म्। प्।). (Dharmatantra-वा। प्।). भा. IX. २३. २१, २२; Br. III. ६९. 4. M. ४३. 8-9; वा. ९४. 4; Vi. IV. ११. 7-8.
(II)--(Arjuna s.v.); lost his kingdom through pride of power. भा. X. ७३. २०.

(I)--attained योग through the grace of Datta; were defeated by Sagara and destroyed by परशुराम; <F>1:  भा. II. 7. 4; IX. 8. 5; १५. १४.</F> their king was कार्तवीर्य and then his grandson तालजन्घ. Five groups among them are distinguished; वीतिहोत्रस्, Bhojas, Avantis, तुण्डिकरस् and तालजन्घस्; <F>2:  Br. III. ४८. १३ and २२; ६३. १२०; ६९. ५२.</F> २४ kings contempo- raneous with ten शिशुनागस्; <F>3:  Ib. III. ७४. १३६.</F> २८ in number; <F>4:  M. २७२. १५.</F> तालजन्घस् of [पगे३-784+ ३२] whom five clans are distinguished; these are वीतिहोत्रस्, शर्यातस्, Bhojas, Avantis and कुण्डिकेरस्; <F>5:  Ib. ४३. ४८.</F> country of, watered by नलिनी. <F>6:  Br. II. १८. ५९.</F>

(II)--१०० kings after the Prativindhyas: धार्तराष्ट्र, ५१-100. Janamejayas, ५१-80. Brahmadattas, -१००. वीर्यिणस्, -१००. Paulas, ५२-100. काशिकुश,-१००. शसबिन्दवस्, -१००० all अश्वमेधिन्स्. Br. III. ७४. २६१-71; वा. ३२. ५०.

--a ऋत्विक् for यज्ञ; <F>1:  M. १६७. 7; २४६. १२; Br. III. 5. १०.</F> Atri, for Soma's राजसूय; <F>2:  M. २३. २०.</F> eight in connection with the ceremonials for constructing ponds. <F>3:  Ib. ५८. ११.</F>
--a पारावत god. Br. II. ३९. १५.
--a son of काञ्चन and father of Janhu. भा. IX. १५. 3.
--from the ऋक्; <F>1:  वा. ६०. १८.</F> the ऋक् formulae uttered by the होता in an यज्ञ. <F>2:  Vi. III. 4. १२.</F> [पगे३-785+ २५]
--is Agni. Br. II. १२. २८.
(I)--a Sukha god. Br. IV. 1. १९.
(II)--a mukhya गण. वा. १००. १८.
--a son of हिरण्यकशिपु; sons ह्राद and Nisunda. वा. ६७. ७०, ७१.
--the जयादेवस् became converted into. वा. ६७. ३२.
--a group of नाडिस् giving out dew from the sun (fire). Br. II. २४. २८.
--a son of स्वर्णरोमन् and father of सीरध्वज (Sariddhaja). भा. IX. १३. १७-18; Br. III. ६४. १४; वा. ८९. १४; Vi. IV. 5. २७.
(I)--a son of हिरण्यकशिपु; wife Dhamani, and sons वातापि and Ilvala; other sons were Sunda, Nisunda and मूक. भा. VI. १८. १३ and १५; Br. III. 5. ३४-5.
(II)--a son of Hrada. वा. ६७. ७१. [पगे३-786+ २८]
(III)--the leader of Asuras in देवासुर war. Vi. III. १७. 9.
--R. from ऋष्यवान्; <F>1:  M. ११४. २६.</F> (आप्लादिनी) a branch of the Ganges, flows through countries of the hunters and others. <F>2:  वा. ४७. ३८, ५१-53.</F>
--a wife of हव्यवाहन. वा. २९. १४.
--a daughter of दक्ष and a wife of Dharma; mother of प्रश्रय; <F>1:  भा. IV. 1. ५० and ५२.</F> a शक्ति. <F>2:  Br. IV. ४४. ७१.</F>
--a son of हिरण्यकशिपु. Vi. I. १५. १४२.
(I)--a R.; wife of हव्यवाहन. Br. II. १२. १६.

(II)--one of the three streams of the गङ्गा flowing through the countries of निषध, Trigartas, धी- vara, ऋषिकम्, नीलमुख, Kakara, ओष्टकर्ण, किरात, Kalodara, विवर्ण, कुमार and स्वर्णभूमिक; goes to the east through the countries of Upaka, निषाद and enters the sea. Br. II. १८. ४०, ५३-5; M. १२१. ४०, ५२-4.
(III)--a R. of कुशद्वीप. M. १२२. ७२.
(IV)--a कला of Hari. Br. IV. ३५. ९५. [पगे३-787+ 8]
